reviews.review: Coogee Beach to Bondi Beach Coast walk - even nice in the rain!. On a gray Sunday we parked at Coogee and headed towards Bondi on what is mostly a paved path right along the coastline. Sky & water views were spectacular as bursts of sunlight snuck through the clouds. A walk through Waverley Cemetery was most interesting. About half way along were 2 wild Macaws resting patiently on a fence post while eager walkers took photos. Out in the water were some whales. We got to Bondi and had brunch, then headed back. A third of the way the heavens opened and we were drenched! Still a great day out, and a great feeling to have walked it! Eager to do it again when Sculptures of the Sea is on!

Stunning beaches with the bonus of sculptures. Went on this walk today. it was bright but not very warm, brilliant walk, not that far and very beautiful. Today (until 5/11) there is an event called Sculptures at the Sea, this was fantastic, i am not sure if it was busier because of this event but well worth going to. Take a picnic. To get there go to Bondi Junction then get the bus to the North of Bondi. To get back from Coogee you can get a bus direct to the centre of Sydney, i think if i do this again i would go by bus to Coogee, much quicker and avoided the queue for the shuttle bus. I suspect this walk is fantastic in all weathers.

Beautiful views. We had a lovely walk along the coast. There are several beaches where you can stop for a swim or get something to eat. There are a lot of steps, sometimes quite steep but saying this there were quite a few people with push chairs. We were lucky enough to do this walk when the sculptures were there. They are well worth a look. We ended our walk at Iceburgs got a drink. You do need to fill in a form to get in as it members only but it only took a few minutes to do.
Sculpture galore today. It was packed with people on the walk today to see all the fantastic sculptures. Worth getting out here before they go!

Gorgeous views. It was a beautiful sunny day with temps in the mid 70s and a light breeze. The walk is quite easy with a well paved path. The views along the way are absolutely gorgeous. We walked only in one direction and took an uber back when reached the end. Highly recommend if you have a couple of hours and are fit enough for a hike.

Loved it!. Loved the bondi to coogee walk especially on a nice day. There is around 6 beaches you pass and they are all lovely.If you start at bondi and end in coogee they have BBQs just off of the beach which is nice way to end the walk.
Absolutely gorgeous walk !. But avoid week ends if you can !!! Very very busy walk, which can be fun if you want to take your time, don't try to go for a run or a power walk there on a Sunday !!

Beautiful walk, possible with buggy. We took bus from Sydney to Coogee and walked to Bondi with our son in the buggy. The walk itself is absolutely stunning - incredible views. We made a stop in Bronte for a cold drink and some snacks - there were lots of places to sit with tables and benches or of course the beach. The walk has hilly parts and quite a few steps. The path on the whole is paved and very smooth so buggy friendly. Some steps can be a little uneven or a bit steeper than others but as long as you go knowing you will have to carry buggy, it is totally possible. We did it the day after we arrived in Sydney so our son was confused over time change but being able to walk with him in the buggy, stop when we needed and get him lots of fresh air, he napped when he needed. I think this was better for all of us than trying to get straight on to seeing the sights in busy parts of the city. There were loads of runners on the route - it would make a lovely run if it is easy enough for you to get to from where you were staying. Anyway- just stunning.
Beautiful views. Comfortable walk for most people, but will take some time for those who don't walk much. Lots of places to stop and enjoy the views and rest if needed, definitely worth it.
Great walk but I did not walk back up. Was picked up by car at the other end. Wonderful walk and scenery. Plenty of fellow walkers. Good to have a companion with you. Take plenty of photos

always great no matter when. Great walk and if you are new to Sydney, it is a must do. You can grab it from Bondi Beach or Coogee, or anywhere in between. Lots of cafes/beaches/water stops along the way
Lovely views. Great walk with stunning views. Be prepared and wear comfortable & light clothes, it's not a short walk. Would do it again.

Great walk. This is quite a walk. I walked from Coogee to Bondi and the first 1km had a lot of uphill & downhill trails. After that it was quite easy. Very picturesque. There are water fountains & wash rooms on the way.
Only issue is that many people take their unleashed dogs on the frail

Great for a morning jog but don't go out of your way. This is a very pleasant walk - great for a family stroll or morning jog. However, the coastline will strike the seasoned traveler as unremarkable. Better to head to one of the beach bars at Bondi or grab a board if you are on a limited time schedule.

One of the first exercise paths. I used to live at Tamarama back in the 80's. The path originally went from Bondi to Bronte and had exercise stations along the way. I used to run it a few times a day. I moved away then had to return for a funeral, so decided to do the run. The crowd was like a City to Surf run, 5 wide, had to run on the road! Very dangerous. Pick your time to do the walk, I'd say mid morning to mid afternoon, when everyone else is at work.

Iconic and beautifil beach but Manly is brtter.. Beautiful beach in crowded area offers beach gear rentals and a large changing facility with restaurants and snack vendors on the boardwalk. Surfers and attractive males, females and families abound, but top less is rare and modest.

A Sydney must do "sculptures by the sea". We often walk the Coogee Bondi walk, but today was beautiful to say the least.Me a local for 50 odd years and it still has the WOW effect.0745 start crowds minimal for a blue sky first few days of the display. But disappointing to still have the Waverley cemetery walkway section still not open due to storm damage but the walk through the cemetery is still well worth doing, see the resting places of the rich and famous, very elaborate headstones set with the most spectacular sea views.Tamarama beach looking pristine with the many pieces on display, a rhino in the sand and more.Marks park at the top of the hill with The Grounds cafe looking and feeling the goods a great spot to sit have a bite and a coffee to watch the world pass by. It's a must do in fact...excellent!Then Finnish off the walk over to the surf club the Icebergs to see the big handbag and more.The walk back to Coogee is the same path, beautiful, enjoy and just do it!

Absolutely stunning - and free!. One of my favourite days to Sydney - take the bus to Bondi Beach and walk along the coastal paths. It's absolutely stunning scenery and not a difficult to walk. Take some lunch and stop at one of the bays and then take the bus back from Coogee. Definitely worth an afternoon.

We really enjoyed with the bonus of art. We went on this walk today and had an awesome time. We added this to watson's bay.We had the added feature of sculptures lining the path. Part of the walk had a detour through a cemetery which was really interesting.Take a day and enjoy the walk.
Bondi -Coogee Walk. Great walk particularly when Sculptures by the Sea is on mid October each year. You need to get there for sunrise for great photos & before the crowds get there mid morning
an wonderful experience. Enjoy the beauty on bondy beach with your friends or family. It's a must do thing in Sydney! have pleasing day in your on sydney :)

STORM CLOSURES. I was disappointed when walking the start of daylighsaving in October, the warm weather was great in the mornings BUT due to the story parts of it are closed, making it a very boring street walk.
Beautiful walk next to beach. It was quite nice over there, our family enjoyed the walk, after a very delicious meal near by. It was a little windy on the day, but we still like it
very popular!. this coastal walk is a must when visiting Sydney. coast is quite long but with friends and family and the beautiful view, you won't even feel it.

Good views and plenty of places to pause along the way. We only walked from Bondi to Bronte Beach given it was a very warm day. The views along the cliff tops are worth the effort of climbing the steps involved. Just make sure to remember the sunscreen as there isn't much shade along the way. There are however quite a few bays and little beaches where you can find surf clubs selling ice creams and drinks if you get hungry or thirsty.Getting to Bondi Beach is easy. Just catch the 333 bus from Circular Quay - just don't get off at Bondi Junction by mistake. On your return why not catch the 380 to Watson's Bay and take the ferry back to Circular Quay. Just remember to get yourself an Opal card for quick, easy and relatively cheap transport around Sydney on the buses, trains and ferries.

Six kilometers of beautiful views.. We got the local bus from Sydney harbour to Coogee and then walked to Bondi and returned by bus. There are several bays along the way, Bronte Bay possibly,the nicest along the walk. Each one had different but excellent facilities for the walkers. It was a very pleasant day with a refreshing sea breeze when we did it, there is a fair amount of uo hill and stairs so could be taxing on hot days.

Awesome walk . I was staying in South Coogee and went for a walk with the intent of heading to Coogee for breakfast. I ended up walking to Bondi Beach and back! Not for the feint hearted, this is about 20kms round trip, with some pretty steep sections. The views along the way are awesome!

Lovely walk with amazing scenery . Did this walk on a whim after disliking the overcrowded beaches of Coogee. The walk is so pretty and did not feel like 6km as the scenery makes it easy to forget how far you have walked! There are some steeper sections and some uneven paths and steps but overall a nice few hours walk which takes you through some pretty inlets and beaches that are far nicer than Bondi and Coogee! Thoroughly recommend.
Must do when in Sydney. Must do for those visiting Sydney. Suggest you start from Coogee and then end up in Bondi for a bite to eat.

Enjoy the salt, sun and sea. This is one of those Sydney things you must just do, take the dog, go when the whales are migrating, saw a mother and her baby metres from the rocks just resting and feeding - magical! A bonus if you go when Sculpture by the Sea is on.

Epic Vistas. I've done coastal paths before, namely the Isle of Wight in GB which was 70+ miles so I didn't expect a lot from this short trek. WRONG ME! Wow, the views from this walk are truly epic. I've visited many coastlines and must say, this was beautiful step after step. There was so much to see! The ever changing surf crashing on the rocks OR purposely crashing into a swimming pool and yes, the swimmers were having a great time with it. And the surfers! They were a show unto themselves as they tackled those waves. There are ample places to rest, safety bars to keep you on track, exits if you don't want to walk the entire way, and stops along the way for restrooms or a bite to eat. We also enjoyed seeing the lovely (sometimes quirky) homes that overlook the coast as well as the native habitats that AUS is hoping to preserve. We dressed in layers and that's probably best for any time of the year in Australia! Happy trekking!

Best Views Along The Coast..... Best views of the coast that delight at every twist and turn... and wonderful exercise at a relaxed pace..Grab a drink in the Beer Garden of the local Coogee Bay Hotel to Celebrate..and uber or cab it back to your hotel.

Amazing walk. The views are spectacular. The walk is fairly flat and easy. There are side walks you can do to make it challenging like Tama stairs. You can stop for a coffee or a swim along the way. There are also occasional exercise stations to work out on.

Breathtaking Coastal Views. A breathtaking view along this coastal path. Especially Sculpture By The Sea Time. Which is now. Beautiful Sculptures dotted along the path. With the sun shinning this is extremely hard to beat.

Spectacular!. Must be one of the most spectacular coastal walks in the world. Very well maintained paths and walkways, some steep steps so not suitable for those with mobility issues. Stopped at the cafe about halfway which was very pleasant and then caught the bus back from Bondi to Coogee as we didn't have the time to walk back unfortunately.

Sensational. My husband and I did this beautiful walk yesterday and it was superb. 6km from Bondi beach along some of Australia's most beautiful coastline, pods of dolphins swimming with surfers and a majestic bright blue ocean. Finished our walk with a icy cold beer at Coogee bay hotel. Moderate difficulty only because of a few lots of steep stairs, but wonderful.

Lovely Walk. This walk is great on a day with nice weather. Every year between the end of October and half way through November you can see Sculpture by the Sea in the area between Bondi and Turramurra beach. It's a free art exhibit and is very interesting. However it can get crowded on the walking path on weekends and the every last day of the exhibit. At Turramurra, you can catch a bus back to Bondi if you don't wish to walk back. Nice views all along, interesting cliff and rock formations. Very much recommended!

amazing coastal walk!. loved walking along the cliffs and beaches, it was a great experience, even though it was a little windy. Not such a difficult walk either, so would highly recommend for any age group!

One of the best things to do in Sydney!. It is a beautiful easy walk! I would recommend anyone do it! On a clear day, it is even better! It is about 6km, the beaches on the way are beautiful and the cemetery is stunning. A great Sydney attraction and free! Remember though, the hottest part of the day is around 12pm-3pm, so if walking at this time, sun cream and water are a must! Enjoy!

Bondi to Bronte coastal walk. One of the many great walks from one Beach to another. Seeing the lovely ocean views as you walk around the cliff area from one beach to another is fantastic, it has to be one of the best walks by far on the coastline.

Beautiful Coastal Walk. It was recommended my family do this beautiful coastal walk as there is nowhere else is Sydney like it. The views are amazing and it's a good walk over to Bondi from Bronte. We were amazed with the beauty of the beaches along the way and the Bondi Beach area. We spent time browsing around the shops at Bondi Beach and had an ice cream before walking back again. Even though is was dusk it was still an area of Sydney I had wanted to go to and my family thoroughly enjoyed it.

Stunning walk along beautiful coastline. If you love the ocean and beach, don't miss this walk. As a lifelong swimmer, I was delighted by the ocean pool that sits on a rocky, cliff with the ocean waves lapping over it.

Must do. Find it. Do it! Some steep steps at some parts. Can be windy also at some sections. Dress appropriately and wear sunblock. Make it pass the cemetery before dark. Take a break at the Coogee Beach Hotel.
Incredible!. Unbelievable views. I wanted to stop and spend time at every beach. The walk was well maintained and easy. There are many bathroom/water/food stops along the way.
Sculptures by the Sea 20 October – 6 November 2016.. This is a very scenic walk. I recommend you go between these dates as then you will also see the sculptures around the Tamarama area.

Sunday stroll around the coast with snorkelling. Nice 5k walk for Sunday mornings. Be prepared for crowds of people walking in both directions as this is quite famous Sunday activity. Take camera, water bottle and swimmers with you. The part around Waverley cemetery is still closed do to the storm damage in June 2016, but there i s a small detour through the cemetery. Nice walk, perfect for picnics or just some morning workout. You can actually snorkel in Clovelly bay, or swim at Coogee or Bondi.

Great day out that doesn't bore them to death.. Don't miss the Scluptures by the sea. 2klms of the 6 klm walk with breathtaking views and the sea breeze in the spring. Make it a digital detox day and turn off your phones. Best day out.

Sculpture by the sea. The walk from bondi south to coogee is a most invigorating and awe inspiring trip .the clean fresh air and beautiful views over the coastline are brilliant. I find the best time to do it is during the sculpture by the sea exhibition .this year it runs from 20th October to 6th November and starts at the southern end of bondi beach near icebergs and ends at tamarama beach.during the exhibition car parking is at a premium so I would recommend using public transport.
Perfect walk. Somehow crowed - so you need to be careful - yet it is Perfect for a happy walk solo or with friends

Great walk with an awesome view!. Commenced the stunning coastal walk from Coogee to Bondi which took an easy 90 minutes along safe designated paths for most of the route. Passed through native flora and saw amazing beaches, cliffs and views. Recharged with lunch at Icebergs bar for the return journey to Coogee! What an unforgettable day!!

One of Sydney's best attractions - for free!. Whenever I have overseas friends visiting my home town, I'll always advise them that the top two "must experience" highlights are for from expensive our require signing up for a tour. The Bondi to Coogee coast walk is number one - totally free, it show aces one of the most beautiful coastal strips of our city.It's an easy walk along coastal cliffs and past some of our best beaches and is suitable for all ages and fitness levels. Number two is to just simply catch a commuter ferry - but that's a different review of its own.
Great walk, great views, good workout.. Loved the walk, great views along the coast. Plenty of seats to sit, rest and admire the view from. Could be better sign posted for first time visitors.

Bronte to Bondi coastal walk. 'This walk takes at a moderate pace about an hour and a half. You can take a break at Clevelley or Bronty for a coffee or to use the toilets. Breath taking views of the coast and surrounding areas a must do if you are visiting Sydney. You can catch a bus from Circular Key in the city to Coogee Beach and begin the walk from there and catch a bus back to the city from Bondi.

A must. This has to be the best walk in Sydney visiting great beaches that are minutes from the city - those Europeans don't know the meaning of the word beach. the walk does require negotiating a few hundred steps along the way. Every day is pure magic on this stunning walk an depending on the season there can be whale watching opportunities and the annual Sculptures by the Sea exhibition which is featured along the path and on Tamarama beach (late October to early November). Check out the great houses along the path too especially those south of Coogee beach. I live nearby and still get a buzz each time, even though it is in my backyard - I wish!. You can dial up the distance depending on how much time you have and bail out and catch a bus/taxi/uber. There are also plenty of cafes along the way at each of the bigger beaches to choose from.

Stunning location. Highly recommended, I regularly take this walk on weekends. It is one of the most stunning and picturesque seaside walks I've discovered. Breathtaking views and plenty of awesome photo opportunities!! A great way to spend a Sunny afternoon
Beautiful Walk along the Pacific. We did this walk on a sunny day in October 2016. A great afternoon. Lovely scenery and a well worn path with places to stop and enjoy a rest.

Always beautiful and the natural cliffs a sculpture created by nature . Ban joggers during sculpture by the sea...... Take your time and just enjoy,maybe a whale will surprise you !Walk both ways to get a different perspective .

If you live or are a visitor to Sydney this is a must do on a good sunny day!. We have walked this route on many occasions & it does not lose its gloss in any way. The reverse walk i.e. Coogee to Bondi results in you being right outside the Bondi Icebergs/Club which has great food at reasonable prices with a wonderful view of Bondi Beach & surrounds. Thoroughly recommended for locals or tourists.

Brian Pollard . Love this coastal walk. A cross section of beautiful people, local and tourists getting out and enjoying a winding part through some of Sydney's most sparkling water views. Look inland and you see prime Bondi real estate.
Just beautiful!. Stunning walk along beautiful coastline, take your swimmers for a relaxing dip in the beach at the end :-)

A MUST DO walk around Sydney. An easy walk grade path yet most interesting and scenic along the entire pathway. On a wavy day, the combination of sound and sight of waves rushing against the coast line is a truly refreshing experience that will surely emptying your mind of everything else.
Beautiful . This is a lovely walk - highly recommended for families. The views are breathtaking and it is a relaxing walk.

Must do walk, in Sydney. The walk from Bondi to Coogee if you have the time, is an absolute delight. Make sure you have good comfortable walking shoes, and be prepared to go up and down a lot of steps along the way. But the views and scenery are fantastic. Might get bit crowded on a good day though, but worth taking the chance.

Great day with the kids. We did this as a family walk at a leisurely pace.
The kids had their swimmers on, and plunged in whenever the opportuniyty arose.
There were places to stop along the way for coffe, lunch or icecream.
It was a nice day overall and can recommend it as a family activity.
Breathtaking view. Bonding to Coogee Coastal Walk is an easy walking path, and full of wonderful views along the path. In addition, both Bonding and Coogee beaches are nice to see.

Beautiful and crowded. Great urban walk with amazing views. Along the cliffs. Great place to watch whales during their migration. Go early and during weekdays if you want to avoid crowds. Easy enough to get a bus to/from either end.

Enjoy absolutely stunning views while you exercise. Enjoy post card perfect views of Australia's most famous beaches as you get some exercise on the Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk. You can enjoy a meal at the famous Bondi Icebergs & walk the whole or part of the route, it's your choice, but you as you take in the views from cliff top vantage points. Enjoy a swim in the surf or any of the nearby beaches or just soak up the sun after your walk.

Sydney's "Cinque Spiaggia" - The Five Beach Walk. This is a wonderful walk from/to One of Sydney's Iconic Internationally renowned beaches, Bondi, past spectacular ocean cliffs, sandy beaches and rocky coves. There a plenty of places to stop for food and beverages, one of the most quaint is the Clovelly Bowling Club, set on the cliff's edge between Bronte and Clovelly.The sounds of many languages can be heard along the way attesting to this walks growing international recognition.
Great walk with the dogs. Love this walk along the coastline. The dogs love the walk with us. Great coastline views with a beautiful view of Bondi Beach.

Best Walk in Sydney. We did this walk around mid morning from Coogee to Bondi. Wow some of the most beautiful beaches in the world for sure. You hug the coastline and have plenty of opportunities for some great photos. We timed our arrival at Bondi for lunch and drinks at the famous beach. It made our break in Sydney the best.

Whale of a time between the B and the C. This couldn't have been more perfect if it were scripted. Alighting from a public bus caught in the city we set off with a lot of other people. The benefit of the foot traffic is that it is easy to spot the trail.We had two additional bonuses in go along with the world famous views and perfect weather. Artists and council workers were installing the latest work for the sculpture trail walk and there was a pod of whales traveling down the coast in the same direction. It is not an easy walk if you are really unfit or have knee problems. But the wildlife, water and a stop at the Coogee Pavilion more than make it worth the effort.

An Absolute "Must Do". This coastal walk is one of Sydney's best attractions. Every bend reveals unparalleled views. Pick a clear sunny day (quite frequent in Sydney), make sure you have camera & good walking shoes, and head out from Bondi Beach to Coogee (or vice versa). You will not be disappointed!Total distance takes approximately 1 1/2 hours at a relaxed pace, but not including time for photographs or just view-gazing. Broken down, walking times are: Bondi Beach to Tamarama Beach 15 min; Tamarama to Bronte 20-25 min; Bronte to Clovelly 20-25 min and Clovelly to Coogee 30-35 min.The coastal walk goes along the road in two places, but mostly it runs along the cliff high above the ocean. At numerous points, one can leave the walk and catch a bus back to your starting point.Be warned, there are a lot of steps in some sections, particularly Clovelly to Coogee. There are fountains of filtered water along the way, for pets too! When you arrive in Coogee (or Bondi Beach if doing it in reverse), there are numerous cafes where you can rest & enjoy a cool drink or casual meal.All in all, an extremely pleasant half-day excursion!
GREAT COASTAL VIEWS. Good walk, well serviced by public transport. There are a number of coffee stops possible along the way. Can get busy on weekends.

A very "Sydney" thing to do!!!. This walk can be broken up into different stages so depending on your level of fitness you can do the sections to suit! Such a lovely way to see the coastline and iconic beaches in the eastern Suburbs. There are some great cafes and coffee stops along the way that makes the walk just that much more pleasant!! A must do whether visiting or living in Sydney.

Picturesque coastal scenery while getting a workout. Most amazing coastal walk from Bondi to Coogee. Difficulty gradient is easy to medium on well maintained walkways throughout. The only challenge may be the hilly areas on that walk. However, when walking at an easy and steady pace you don't even realize what a long walk you just did. The breathtaking scenery of this coastal walk will take up all your attention while you get guided through little coastal settlements girt by the sea. Would do anytime again. Don't forget to bring your camera. You will get some stunning photos to send home and for keepsake. Love Sydney xxx

Frequent Walk. Being lucky enough to live less than 2 kms from this walk, my family and I do the walk a couple of times a week.When feeling full of energy we can do a minimum 15km round trip.Early morning or at dusk is the best time, Anytime on a Sunday past 10am its too busy. Middle of winter perfect. It is always beautiful. Make sure you wear comfy walking shoes and a hat in summer.The cemetary can be very eeiree on a windy day.

Breeath taking beauty so close to the city!. Coastal Scenery at its best with great beaches, cafes and surf at either end. Go when Sculpture by the sea is on but best to go when it is not on and avoid the crowds! Natural beautty abounds and can't be improved upon!!
Needs a couple of hours. It is a lovely walk, it can take a couple of hours. Joggers can dominate and it does get crowded during weekends. The best time is during the Sculptures By The Sea month.

The walk to show overseas visitors what Sydney has to offer. We always take our overseas guests on a walk in Sydney to get them up close and personal with what Sydney is about. The great outdoors, sunshine, exercise, great views and great beaches. You can drive to one end and catch a bus back to pick up the car and dont forget to reward yourself from the exhilarating walk with fish and chips on the beach at the end.

Impressive coastal walk. My son and I walked from Coogee to Bondi via the magnificent coastline including through an old cemetery. At every turn there were beautiful beaches, seascapes and views. Not too exhausting but did take nearly 2 hours. Suggest do it early in the day, cooler and less crowded.
A must do experience. Gorgeous walk along Sydney's coast! Make sure you allow time for relaxing on the beach and lunch at the The Bucket List right on the beach

Stunning cliff top coastal walk. We caught the bus from Circular Quay in Sydney to Bondi which took about 45 minutes. From there we easily hooked onto the coastal trail and despite a few detours along the way (storm damage earlier in the year) it is an exhilarating walk interspersed by pristine beaches to relax and rest weary feet. It would seem there is a beach for all occasions and tastes along the way, each has its own unique character. We particularly liked Bronte and Coogee beach as they had a more laid back family feel to them and are less touristy than Bondi, and less choppy waters. It was then a case of catching the bus back from Coogee (you'll see everyone hanging around in the bus shelter next to the public toilets).

This place is Surreal. I can tell you I have seen a lot of beaches and Bondi is different than most. It was not over crowded by any means. It also had some great social spots and restaurants. The natural wildlife was great to observe as we sat and relaxed.
Great walk. Amazing walk , great exercise, can get a little crowded but lovely getting fresh air and sun . Got to be careful in areas especially with young kids who can't wander close to the edge

Stunning walk that is easy to do. This was is such a stunning coastal walk that combines beautiful beaches, stunning cliffs, and spectacular waters. It's an easy walk with plenty of stops along the way for either views of refreshments. Bondi has more food and drink options so plan your trip around where you want to eat and drink.

Don't leave Sydney without it!. We decided to walk from Bondi to Coogee. The views are just amazing. The path contains inclines and some steps. Definitely doable, even if not in the best shape. With that said, there are several staircases, so not handicap accessible and would be difficult with a stroller. I say "doable" because as a 43 yo not in good shape, I was able to do it. We walked to Bronte and were caught by the rain. This is about 2 miles of the most beautiful beaches, sandstone cliffs and amazing waves I've ever seen. We saw a few surfers, but it was extremely windy with the incoming storm. It's free and well maintained. There are several parks, water fountains and many benches for rests or even just a stop to enjoy the views. There are cafes along the way if you wanted to stop for coffee or lunch. It certainly didn't seem like 2 miles because I was too busy admiring the view. My only regret is that we didn't make it all the way to Coogee due to the weather. Don't leave Sydney without walking at least part of the coastal path!

Fabulous Walk. This walk is about 7km and totally worth it. You pass 5+ beautiful beaches on your walk with gorgeous sites. It isn't overall hilly and therefore easily accessible by anyone. I would recommend going coogee to bondi so you can venture around bondi after you get there - there is also more frequent buses back to the city making it easier to end your walk
One of my favorite walks. Great walk along the cliffs and beaches. Best done on a warm day in the morning or afternoon. Bring your swimmers because you'll need to cool off in the water afterwards

The best ocean views. During my visit to Sydney, had the walk from Bondi beach to Coogee beach.Its around 10k walk trail in front of the great ocean view.Take a full day for this walk. Start at the north Bondi beach and just head south until you reach Coogee.The views, the smell of the ocean - worths the long trail.
Breathtaking . The coastal walk is breathtaking the entire way. The views are amazing! It's a must do if you want to catch all the touristy attractions in the city.

Nippers are back. Saturday morning early down CoogeeNo where to park but a great dayNippers are back the beach is full off the future life guardsGood to seeWe had a great walk all the to lurline bayA lot of people getting ready for summerWe love Coogee and we love the walkNo whales yet but soon we will be seeing themReally wakes you up the beach air

The only experience that come FREE and is awesome !!. Amazing views all the way starting from Bondi .. walking your way to Coogee... even if you are not able to walk all the way to Coogee... it is worth your time in Sydney... you can enjoy the scenery as you walk by and I'm sure you'll have many spots to stop to be captured in frame ....

refresh your soul. this walk is stunning no matter what the weather if you are an outdoorsy person . It is a chance to feel and enjoy nature and possibly catch sight of whales or dolphins or take a dip .

beautiful walk. I liked the part from Bondi to Bronte beach the best, afterwards the path is currently being repaired so you have to take a small detour which leads right through a cemetery. In total it it took me about an hour from Bondi to Coogee, however the wind was quite strong so I walked faster than if it was a sunny day.
Must do Sydney experience . Lovely coastal walk - made even more enjoyable by starting or finishing off with a meal at the Coogee Pavilion
Amazing views. What a views! Walk from Bondi and take the coast walk. You will pass by beautiful rock formations and beaches!
beyond beautiful. Great hike but the first few times you are forced to stop and admire views because it is so gorgeous
A Must Do!. It takes around 3 hours round trip but it totally worth it. Be prepared to take amazing pictures along the way.

Spectacular vistas. We chose to walk from Coogee to Bondi because we heard the sites were more spectacular from this direction. The ocean was turquoise to dark blue to green. We saw....spectacular sandstone cliffs carved by the elements, surfers poised to catch a wave, people on the lovely sandy beaches enjoying the sun plus active volleyball games in the sand. We were lucky to see whales not too far off in the ocean breaching and spouting water. What a great way to spend time taking in the ocean environment.

An Iconic Walk. This walk encompasses some of the best views in Sydney. Requiring an average level of fitness, the walk can be done in easy stages or all at once. A great sunny day activity, but you will need sunglasses, hats and sunscreen.

Iconic Walk. This is one of if not the most iconic walk if visiting Sydney. Starting at Bondi and strolling past Tamarama Beach, Bronte Beach, Clovelly Beach and then arriving at Coogee in time for a refreshment at the Pavilion. What could be better?
A great way to spend half a day in Sydney. Had a great time doing a leisurely walk from Coogee to Bondi. Better to do it in this direction. Awesome views and also got to see some nice birds.

Scenic coast walk with lots of swimming, coffee or lunch stop opportunities . If you stay in the city just take the train to Bondi Junction and transfer to a Bus to Bondi Beach. You can take bus 333 or 380 with final stop North Bondi and get off as soon as you spot the beach. The walk starts after the iconic Bondi icebergs, which is a open door swimming pool. It's if you are at the beach and look out to the ocean just keep right along the coast and you can't miss it.My suggestion is to leave early. Otherwise you share it with the crowds. You walking past the headland and your first small bay will be cute Tamarama Beach. You have a kiosk there or if you bring your own food also barbecue stations and benches to eat. Then you keep going along the walkway and your next beach will be Bronte beach. Perfect for a dip in the ocean or a ice cream. You will find toilets at every beach and plenty of great photo opportunities. You keep walking along the cliffs and you will see the street carved into the rocks. This was the look for the former Bronte tram who winded her way down to Bronte back in the days. Keep going and you walk thou the majestic Waverley cemetery with impressive rock art. Keep going and you pass the Clovelly bowls club then the Clovelly rugby field. If you are lucky you can spot some sweaty hotties training there. Then you get to Clovelly beach probably the safest swimming beach in Sydney. Because the rocks break the waves making it safe to swim and for kids to play. There is also a nice coffee shop next to the lifeguard club. From here you could catch busses back to the city if you had enough at this point. Roughly 1 hour to 1.5 hour walk but I would suggest you to continue to Coogee another 30 min to one hour walk so all together depending on speed you can walk it in 1.5- 2 hours. But no rush. Take your time and enjoy the view. Once you arrive in Coogee you can chill on the beach barbecue, eat or drink. It's a bustling little seaside suburb. From here you can catch busses to the city or to Bondi junction. Enjoy your day. I am sometimes also running this walk early in the morning or in the evening. It's a great workout. Enjoy.

Stunning views, bays and history. Did this walk on a sunny Sunday so it was very busy. Nevertheless, the walk is stunning with so many lovely bays, awesome views and history to see. Plenty of stops along the way if you want a coffee or more. Some more sinage and interpretive materials would have been good - perhaps there is something online?

Unmissable . I'm a local. I live close to this walk. I do it often. Bronte to Bondi, Bondi to Bronte, Bronte to Coogee, sometimes the whole thing. I never tire of it. It's spectacularly beautiful at any time of the day. There's something different to see each time I do it - the light, the colour of the sea, the sky, the waves. Don't miss this experience if you're ever in Sydney.
Must do hike. Did the hike twice, once in summer and once in spring and both times were great. Great views, some nice beaches and pools to swim.If you are in Sydney, you must do this hike!

Brilliant views on Sydney's Best Coastal Walk. This has to be one of the finest suburban walks in the world! The views are stunning and whilst there are some sections like Bondi to Bronte that are a little challenging (because of the stairs) it is well worth the effort. My favourite part is the new Maroubra to Malabar section. You don't have to do it all in one go, like all great walks it can be taken as sections.

Amazing!!!. The walk is fantastic! I would recommend this for everyone. You start at Bondi with a swim, feed and making your way down the walk. The views are breathtaking. Try and get here when sculpture by the sea is on but avoid weekends with the masses of people and crowds.

Beautiful coastal walk. This is one of the "must" things to do in Sydney. Gorgeous views. There are quite a few steps, it's an easy walk. In the weekend it's really busy. If you can go on a weekday do it. Cafes at start or finish.
Do this. Amazing coastline! If you have a spare hour or 2 one morning, do this walk. Something magical about being in a major city but being able to look out to the ocean as far as the eye can see!

Very nice!. Very nice coastal walk with a lot of beautiful lookouts! You need about 1,5/2 hours for do the walk, depends of how fast you are walking. I clearly recommend to do this walk if you stay some days in Sydney
Relaxing walk , great views. Just the tonic for a Sunday morning walk , only problem is thousands of other tourists have the same idea , but that doesn't distract from the amazing view

Favourite coastal walk. This walk is roughly 6km in distance. I prefer to walk it from South (Coogee) to North (Bondi). You can catch the 373 and 372 bus from the city to Coogee. The walk is best done early in the morning or late in afternoon if you are walking in Spring or Summer, as it can get very hot during the middle of the day. Magnificent views for most of the walk.

A must do for all tourists to Sydney!. Most relaxing walk, around 5 km, I did it barefoot as it made it easier to walk on the sand that is in parts of the journey. It offers some great views from the cliffs, beaches, some stairs, a small beautiful curvy road, a walk through a peaceful serene cemetery as well. Beautiful rocks, seagulls, beaches and October was just the perfect weather - this is a must do on a travellers list who loves to walk or to enjoy some breathtaking landscapes. Both ends are well connected by transport so you can carry on with the journey post the walk very comfortably. There are restaurants and numerous water points en route so the coastal walk is well planned by the government. Superb Experience!

Oh the views!. What a fabulous walk! We did the walk in both directions and because the whole way you are going up and down hills, it is equally easy/hard in both directions. I am not exactly sure where we walked from or to but the walk just keeps on going. We ended up doing a return trip of about 11 km. There were a surprising number of people on the path doing the same walk. On the day we did the walk the weather was gorgeous, and we ended up at the beach. Lovely.

Great coastal walk. It was quite an easy place to get to. A bus from Circular Quay to Coogee Beach. The return trip from Bondi Beach to Bondi Junction Train Station by bus and train from Bondi Junction To Sydney Central were very straightforward. The views along the coast were spectacular. Quite a few people were on the track enjoying the warm sunny day. Beautiful seas and surf. Quite a few places along the track to stop for a drink or bite to eat as well as toilet facilities. Worth spending Half a day visiting the area and walking the track.

A bit challenging but so worth it!. Walked from Bondi to Coogee and it was a bit longer/more strenuous then I thought it was going to be, but still worth it! The views are unmatched. Plus it's a Sydney must!
A must!. That was one of the best things we did in Sydney. Totally worth it. The view on the whole way it is just so impressive. Loved it!

Great urban walk. A great urban walk which starts at Sydney's iconic Bondi Beach and winds around clifftops to several beaches including Tamarama, Bronte and Coogee. We were lucky to spot several dolphins and a whale en route.My GPS indicated a distance of about 8km, most of which is quite straightforward despite one or two sections of stairs.There were a couple of deviations in place at the time of our visit owing to storm damage earlier in 2016, one of which is through a cemetery!Conditions were quite warm even in late Winter (23 deg C) and some sections are fairly exposed, so on a warm sunny day a hat and sunscreen would be essential. Fortunately several places en route sell lunches and refreshments.Access to Bondi is via train to Bondi Junction thence bus to Bondi Beach; the bus terminal is in the station complex. At Coogee, there are plenty of eateries and a good pub to finish off the day. The row of bus stops for transport back to the City are readily visible next to the waterfront at the end of the walk.

Gorgeous walk. Been wanting to do this for a long time and it didn't disappoint. Stunning views and plenty of places to stop and take it all in. Do it! (Just avoid it on a public holiday if you can as it can get quite busy).
Stroll from Bondi to Cogee. The view was exhilarating the endless blue and the relaxing sound of the waves that hit the cliffs while you walk through this path is itself an amazing experience.

Adventure!. When I planned for this trip the walk was one of the first experiences for me to have when in Sydney. I have visited Sydney before. So 2nd time around one starts to explore other places. What an amazing walk. Sealed paths along the way, views gallore and all spectacular in their own view then you reach Bondi and is breathtaking from the last lookout.

Picturesque. I have done this walk several times and it is worth the effort. It takes about 2 hours I think), but I recommend you stop at Bronte for coffee or lunch to break up the walk. There are some steep steps to negotiate, but only average fitness is required. There are several beaches you can stop for a swim at. The views are breathtaking and you do pass one of Sydney's oldest cemeteries with a view to die for :-)

A must while in Sydney. When my friend first told me about this walk I was hesitant, I was on vacation and didn't think walking 6KM was my idea of fun. However, once we started it was so beautiful! You walk by many beaches along the way (often quiet ones with clear blue water) and the paths are well maintained. Definitely bring walking shoes, hydration, and a backpack with towel & your swimmies in case you want to stop for a dip in the water. This was definitely a highlight for my trip to Sydney
Brilliant. Great day out- Fab views all the way- is a must!Take water and refill your bottle along the way at the water stops- takes approx 3 hours or you can make it last all day!
Bit f exercise with some fabulous scenery. Walked from Coogee to Bondi at dusk, enjoyable bit of exercise with nice scenery. Then went for food and a few drinks in Bondi.
Best two hour walk. This was great. We took local transit to get to Coogee beach, on bus that was simple. The walk has great sites and many restaurants enjoy

Awesome!. This coastal walk surprised the hell out of me in a fantastic way. The walk takes you from beach to beach, each separated by large cliffs. Most of the beaches have good surf and also pools for swimming with ocean water flowing into them. Favorite place we visited in Sydney
Feel good walk..... I highly recommend this walk, soup for the soul! Make sure you're hydrated and don't forget to stop and take in the beautiful views!

LadyLinda. Walked from Bondi beach & along the cliff walk, it has beautiful views, interesting information boards & well maintained paths, it's popular with joggers & has keep fit stations along the way, I could have carried on walking but didn't really know where or how far it went to be able to rejoin onto the bus route, there is no tourist information in Bondi I could see.

Bondi-Bronte walk. We started at Bondi beach and it was such a buzz seeing it in person rather than on Bondi Rescue. Very busy beach - even on a cool Spring day. We commenced our walk around the bays, stopping for a picnic lunch at Tamarama, then on to Bronte.All of the beaches were designated not safe for swimming, which hadn't stopped people. Surf lifesaving were on patrol. I get the feeling that these beaches often have strong currents and wavey conditions.We only made it as far as the Waverley Cemetary : which was interesting to walk around. But we were tuckered out then so returned back to Bronte to catch the 440 bus

This is Sydney!. More sick packs that in Australia Day, but of the ones that you have to sweat to get. Bodybuilders, surfers, positive thinkers, yogis, runners, babes, bros, forever young.We were at Bondi at 7.30am and were rewarded with some of the best people watching in Oz, without the tourists.The views and the beaches are nice, but the Sydneysiders and their façades -including the brick & mortar ones- are the main attractions.Past Bronte Beach, the display of characters ceases and the stroll gets a much more mundane vibe. However, if you walk all the way to Coogee, you will wander past Gordon's Bay, one of the prettiest and photogenic coves in Greater Sydney.
Must do. If you haven't done it before, first time to Sydney or looking for a great exercise track. You must do it!

Wonderful walk with stunning views. We took the walk from Coogee Beach to Bondi Beach returning via taxi to our car in Coogee. We were a family with an 8 & 6 year old plus a 70 year old. Wonderful day with a strong wind blowing us along the route. We saw whales broaching as we walked and the 6.5KMs took us 1:40 with the children. There are plenty of stairs to climb and descend so bewareThis is a well worthwhile walk with plenty of stunning views. If you walk this in the height of the summer you must take plenty of water, hats and sun cream

The best way to see the best part of Sydney. Was blown away the first time I saw this walk, now I live 10 minutes from it and I'm still in love with it. The best, most breathtaking views. Would recommend making a day of it and booking a green at the Clovelly Bowling club for some barefoot bowls and reasonably priced beers!
Great trail walk . Really enjoyed it, carry a lot of water and sunscreen, about hot hours. The view are breathtaking, I enjoyed sitting at Tamar beach

Wonderful if a bit crowded. Always loved this walk that's now updated and modernized with handrails and wider paths.It's not handicapfriendly, and there are lot of steps throughout.It is however, also absoluteöy spectacular and will take you along some of the nicest beaches anywhere!You might want to have a great lunch at Bondi Icebergs, or stop for coffee at Tamarama beach, or why not watch dogs swim off the rocks?The surfscene in Bondi is still worth watching, as well as the cliffs along the walk!Remember water, sunscreen and a hat!
GORGEOUS!. Wonderful scenery, great views at every turn (literally), a great, sometimes challenging walk -- but worth it.

Beautiful Views. This coastal walk took us just under 2 hours and the views were spectacular. If you are unable to walk for the full 2 hours, there are plenty of other beaches that you can stop at on the way. It is quite hilly, so remember to wear some walking shoes.

Beautiful coastal walk with coffee options all the way. . A fantastic walk punctuated by numerous coffee shops and restaurants. A fair few steps involved but if you are moderately fit all good. If you're not fit you soon could be if you do this a few times.

Beautiful!!. It was easy to catch a bus from the city centre to Bondi and even easier to catch the bus back to the city. This was a great walk even though it was extremely windy. There was basically no one on Bondi Beach which apparently is rare so it felt like a treat to get to experience Bondi Beach with few around.
Excellent Beach. Very neat and clean beach. Can find many surfers and trainee surfers trying their hand at surfing. Good place for a lazy walk.

Stunning views . We set off from Bondi towards Coogee. Great walk. Some inclines and steps but if you are reasonably fit shouldn't be a problem. Lots of places to stop for a swim if you wished. 6km each way.

Great walk on a sunny day. My husband and I were recommended to do this walk, having done the Spit Bridge to Manly one previously. We hopped on a bus from CQ to Bondi, bought some water (it was hot and sunny) and after having looked at the beach from the start of the walkway, we headed off. It is admittedly heaving with walkers, dogs and joggers but maybe it was busier with it being a Saturday. We had to do a detour through Waverly cemetery although that in itself was quite interesting to meander through, and boy, talk about having the best view for a cemetery! We stopped off for a coffee in one of the beachside towns, can't recall which one, but it was just before Coogee. All in, perhaps it took us 2 hours? but there was a lot of stopping to take in the views and taking photos. it's a much easier walk than the Manly/Spit Bridge one so perhaps opt for this if you are less energetic/fit and shorter on time.

Coogee to Bondi and back . I love doing this walk along the coast line. I generally do it solo and walk from south Coogee dog park all the way to Bondi beach and return!! It's around 22.5km round trip but totally worth it!! You can't get a better view as well!!
Amazing. Amazing walk. Sooo many stunning views. We did this on a sunny day. Defo need to be kept hydrated doing this walk. Plenty of spots to stop and relax or to fill up the water bottle

Great peaceful walk. A great walk to take in some of the more beautiful beaches in Sydney. Bondi Beach is one of the most overrated beaches in the world, but go down the path to the other beaches and you'll find much more beautiful beaches X
Breathtaking. What a wonderful way to spend a few hours. A must who ant to check out the coastal area with fabulous views and great eateries at the beginning of the walk and at the end at Coogee.

check for ongoing work. What little we could so was glorious. Sweeping views of the Bay and also good views of the homes that are attracted to the same views to which you can cast envious glances. We had heard that it was possible to do much of this with a wheelchair with just the odd diversion however in early September they were still repairing winter storm damage and this caused diversions for all. However what we were able to do was well worth the trouble

Beautiful coastal walk. This is one of the best coastal walks in the world. Not overly strenuous and follows the coast the whole way. take your swim gear and take a dip if you get hot - there are plenty of place to swim.

A Must. You can park at Clovelly Surf Club for a gold coin donation ( free mid week) and walk the coastal walk to Bondi. Stop at the Bondi Icebergs' for a drink and something to eat then either walk back or get a cab back to Clovelly. Then have a swim at the best and safest spot on the coast. Top day out. Highly recommended
Relaxed and easy walk with gorgeous views. Took a visitor from overseas out for lunch at the end of this lovely walk, an absolute highlight of her visit.

Great way to see this part of Sydney. We were lucky to have a glorious day for the walk. We used public transport from Sydney city to Coogee and walked back to Bondi for lunch. Every stop was a gorgeous scene. Highly recommended.

Amazing Walk. This was our favorite walk while in Sydney. The scenery wasspectacular, all the way along the coast. There was a few detours, due to storm damage, and this made the walk a bit longerthan usual. There is a coffee shop along the way, very welcome stop, as it is a long hike, well over two hours, but it was amazing and well worth it

Great Activity. If you have the spirit to go out for a walk, see some of Sydneys best beaches, and grab a bite along the way, this could be an activity you might enjoy. You have to be lucky and catch a nice weather day though, but if you are, don´t think twice, its really enjoyable.

Perfect for couples, friends or families. You get to see the best of Sydney, and you also get the chance to hop in and swim, or just enjoy the view. Mornings, middays or sunsets. It's beautiful whenever you choose to go. It's for free, it's beautiful, and you choose your own speed. There are lots of places to sit down and either go to the toilet or have a drink or food. And it's defined worth the trip/walk!
Best way to see Sydney's beaches. Excellent walk along the ocean, can be quite crowded at peak times of the year. Easy walk for all levels

Free and fabulous. If you are in Sydney make the time to visit and walk/run this track. You don't have to do the whole thing or you can and use public transport for the trip back to the starting point if needed. Pack the camera because the scenery is spectacular and well worth it! Plenty of cafe's and venues to stop at after to refuel.

An absolute must-do!. We did this walk and couldn't take enough photos of the gorgeous scenery. The whitest sand beaches and turquoise, clear water was incredible. We started the day at Beach Burrito, fueled up and then started our trek. About 6 KM and it took us 2-3 hours, but we made frequent stops to relax and take it all in. So jealous of the people who live in Bondi or Cogee who get to wake up to these views everyday.

Like No Other!. Have visited Sydney many times since 1st time in 2002 & have done this hike everytime. It's amazingly beautiful & normally not crowded. There's even a great restaurant @ the end of hike @ Coogee for beautiful views, great food & adult beverages. If in Sydney have to do the walk! (& it's not that strenuous)
A must do when visiting Sydney. Awesome and breathtaking, take the public bus from C Quay very easy to do. Return via Rose Bay for spectacular views across the harbour..

Fabulous Scenic Walk. Great walk with the kids, a few steps and winding (paved) path. I guess a reasonable level of fitness would be required, I did see some people struggling a bit. It can get busy and hot, so take water and be prepared for slow going at some points, but the view is worth it, as is closer inspection of the interesting rocks. Very enjoyable way to spend an afternoon, just be aware of the tour busses dropping huge floods of tourists off at certain points along the way, you will get pushed aside!

Stunning View. One of my favourite runs, this is a must on a clear day to really appreciate the beauty of the coast line in the Eastern Suburbs. The coastal path does have stairs along the way so it's not completely wheelchair accessible, but there are a lot of areas along the path that can be accessed by foot or wheels, so no one misses out. Take good shoes, water and your camera if you want to capture the view. Whales can be seen during the right time of year and Sculptures By the Sea is also a great attraction to check out when it's on (Google for dates).
Beautiful. This walks takes you past some stunning beaches which for me made Bondi not that impressiveStopped part way round for lunch.Very enjoyable
A lovely walk. Did this walk Coogee Beach to Bondi direction great views along the way and plenty of stopping off points. Better done weekdays does get busy during the weekend.

Must do. A stunning walk with some stairs but relatively easy-medium (not sure about immobility access). I did this today, 3 weeks after ACL reconstruction and was good for the quads and hammis. I did stop at Bronte Beach tho, and then Bus to our next destination. Will definitely do this again, all the way to Cogee when I'm back here in July next year with hubby

Wonderful. This is one of the all time walks I have been on. Strolling along a most beautiful picturesque part of our amazing coastline. Give yourself a couple of hours and make sure to have your camera handy. We stopped at the closely Bowls Club for light refreshments and ended up at Coogee to catch a bus back to Circular Quay. Really is a must do if in Sydney. just remember to take a water bottle with you. Enjoy !

Great even in the rain. Easy to train and transfer to bus. Bondi is low key, great to watch surfers and check out beautiful graffiti on walls. Saw a whale breach along our walk. Wished for strong umbrellas and rain jackets due to rain but wouldn't miss this experience.
Lovely walk. Lovely coastal walk, great for something to do in the Bondi area. At the end of the walk there's a lookout but unfortunately we needed to head back before we got to see it.

Breathtaking. Stunning views makes this a really enjoyable walk. We're so lucky in Sydney to have such an amazingly beautiful coastline. This is a must for anyone visiting Sydney or even locals that just want to have a lovely walk with great views. Sometimes the best things in life ARE free....this is one of them
Nice!. Beautiful walk, ups and downs, lots of stairs, but it is really worth the 6 km walk, the view is stunning.

Great scenic coastwalk. Starting in Bondi Beach we walked the 5-kilometre-long pathway in about two hours taking some rests on the way to Coogee Beach.Defenitely a must-do attratction in Sydney, if you want to enjoy great views on rocks, the Pacific, many beaches and Sydney's suburbs.Of course there are ameneties and drinking water spots on the way, you can reach both Coogee and Bondi with busses stopping at Circular Quay.Just don't forget to bring your camera with you...
It's a decent hike but well worth it. Sensible attire, sunscreen and water. Camara with plenty of gigabytes and you're laughing. Beautiful and cultured walk.
Interesting walk. A great way to spend a morning. Awesome Cliftop walk, lovely bays. Plenty of Cafes along the way. Good access for public transport.

Nice walk, bit crowded.... We did part of this walk today, about half way and back. It was a sunny September afternoon and the views across the bays were wonderful. Lots of uneven steps up and down so not for the physically challenged. It was very crowded, mostly with Lycra- wearing young men and women either fast walking or jogging their way back and forth, trying, I assume, to get that Bondi look. So a nice walk, but not a peaceful one!
Super packed on the weekends. Would recommend this walk, although it's a bit frustrating on weekends - I'd go during the week, or early morning if possible

Brilliant views!. This is a walk that everyone should do. Unfortunately parts of the trail are closed for repair so there are some detours for about 1 km or so. There are many water refill stations along the way which came in handy.

A thousand steps to Paradise. Seriously, this was a beautiful walk, with spectacular views and I felt very safe walking on my own; there were many other people along the route. You have to be quite fit physically however, because (although my son forgot to tell me this) there feels like there is a thousand and one steps to climb and they are very steep in some places and quite tiring after a few hours walking. Did this spoil my experience ? not at all as I accepted the fact it would be good for my butt and legs and quite honestly seeing the surfers, spotting a cockatoo en-route and coming across one of the most beautiful cemeteries that I have ever seen (what a place to end your days) was worth the effort. If you are not too tired by the end and can catch the sunset on Coogee Beach your day will feel awesome. Nature at its best be assured.

Must do. If you're in Sydney this is a must-do. You can start at either end. Public transport connections are great. Bring some swimming trunks and a towel. Plenty of great cafes along the way. I find that this walk is best done on a brisk, sunny, winter Sunday morning. If you're heading from Coogee to Bondi you can finish with a swim at Bondi Icebergs. A great Sunday morning activity.
Amazing beach!!! . This beach and walk has it all!! Restaurants shops and the beach!! The hop on hop off bus stops here as well, you should get off!!
Beautiful walk with shrubs and mixture of locals and visitors. Grassy slopes are the scenario for this coastal walk. A mixture of ocean and shrubs. Showers avaiable and super clean bathrooms.

AMAZING walk. Its a beautiful place to visit. My favourite onece is Bronte beach and Clovelly beach (you can go snorkeling there). There are a lot of stairs on this walk and you will walk up and down the hill. Be aware it will take some time to finish this whole walk, but you can always get a bus to bondi junction from any beach. Dont forget to bring sunscreen and a hat!

Great walk - needs to be done backwards. We walked from Coogee to Bondi and had a delightful lunch at the Trio café in Bondi. The beaches and overlooks that we passed were beautiful and interesting. There was even a huge old cemetery that we had to walk through. Parts were under repair and required detours which weren't as nice as the actual trail.

Stunning early morning/evening. A terrific walk even if you're a Sydney sider. Breath-taking views, moderate walk on sealed track and good coffee at either end. I'd miss weekends and public holidays when its jam packed, there's nowhere to park and runners/walkers tend to push past you and be quite rude. Better experience in a quiet of the early morning.

Everlasting blue. The sight of the natural, infinity pool was breathtaking. Wish we could've jumped in there too; too bad it was chilly.A part of the Bondi-Coogee walk was closed down due to the typhoon damage, so had to take a detour. Once back on the track, it was miles and miles of beaches and blue; such a relaxing sight! A little difficult to get back to Bondi (we only walked till Tamarama, and headed back)

Best beach experience in Sydney. We loved walking from Bondi to Coogee because of the views, the beaches, the facilities and the atmosphere. It's the place to be if you're young and free in Sydney. Great people-watching, food, amazing beaches and a beautiful cemetery cascading into the ocean... simply breathtaking. It's a must-see in Australia.
A Beautiful Walk. its is such a beautiful walk, a must and when your finished stop in the Bondi Ice Burgs for a nice lunch

Pack a lunch and eat it cliff side . We did the beach walk like everyone recommended and it was fabulous! We packed a picnic and enjoyed it along the walk on a park of the cliff that protruded out off the busy path. It was the best decision we could have made! We had an unobstructed view of Bondi beach and the ocean all while having a small peaceful picnic. Catching the bus back to the train station was very easy, we stopped at bronde beach because the bus stop was right there on the path. It was an easy walk and we did most of it in flip flops!

Mesmerizing every time - a Sydney must do. Over 6 years ago when I first landed in Sydney this was one of the very first walks I did - middle of winter, dark grey skies, bitter cross winds and light drizzle throughout my 1 hour "trek" . And that was when I fell in love with Sydney! Each and every time I do the Coogee to Bondi walk I find something new to be amazed at, whether it be my first pod of dolphins; new flower growth, another bazillonaires palace coming out of the steep hills with views far into the distance. Last weekend was my first time in about 3 months and the new development at Tamarama beach is going to make i ta hot contender of most viable location along the walk over the summer. My advice for anyone doing the walk for the first time - leave the camera down!! Take your time, take in all the views with your eyes, not your camera :)
Nice . A nice well patrond walk and a great view. It worth a vist for a single or all the family. Good place to take tourists.

Excellent Views. A great walk with amazing views. Some areas are a little more difficult with hills and stairs, but great exercise with nice views in all directions. Resting areas, restrooms, and eateries along the way.

Amazing View!. We started our walk at Bondi Beach. Very lucky we had a beautiful sunny day, so a hat, sunscreen and water is a must. The view of the Pacific Ocean meeting the amazing coast line is fantastic. The ocean pools are great! We had to make a detour through Waverly Cemetey, fsciniating to read how far they date. We reach Coogee Beach for a rest and something to eat. Many Cafes on the main street to choose from. Frequent buses at the beach front to head back to Sydney CBD.

Great walk, but watch the signposts on the way back . As of August 2016 part of this walk (close to Bondi) is on diversion due to storm damage. Don't let that put you off, it's only a short stretch of the walk perhaps 5 minutes long that's diverted off the coast.Walk passes several pretty coves, very scenic.Signposts on the way there are great and the path isn't too steep. Signposts on the way back are less clear.
Fantastic views. Bondi beach is the wonderful place to relax and look to waves of the blue water,if you going to costal walk you see great view of city in different angel and all beauty of ocean.
real tides and great view. fantastic view and great tides, its a place you want to surf daily.not for non swimmer, but friendly environment allows every one.
Great spring day walk. Decided to park and walk up to Bondi for lunch. The weather and views were excellent. We even saw a pod of dolphins. Had hoped for a whale or two but not today.

Sun, sea and sweat. We walked this on quite a warm day which made for beautiful sunny views over Bondi and the neighboring beaches. Part of the walk (near the cemetery) was closed off due to weather damage. A must see walk, but wear appropriate footwear and be prepared for numerous hills along the way.

Great walk. This was was super fun with great views. It is very long, so make sure you wear sneakers and bring sunscreen and a bathing suit to jump in the water at one of the beaches along the way. It is definitely worth it! Make sure you stop at Coogee pavilion afterwards for a bite to eat.

Amazing views. Don't go to Sydney without doing this walk. Just as you would expect, the scenery is stunning. The walk itself is fine - not too strenuous - if it gets too hard, stop and admire the views, or rest in one of the beautiful bays along the way.

Active living with beautiful views. On a beautiful summer day this is an ideal outdoorsy thing to do! The views you get is absolutely amazing. The water is as clear as a tropical paradise ocean and you can see very far in the distance on a cloudless day. I would suggest going early as the crowds flock to this area. The gem is Bronte beach, quiet, private, and just beautiful. Take your back pack with goodies and do the walk and then relax with a bbq at Bronte.

Amazing views, perfect walk for a sunny day! . On a cold sunny Saturday in September, this walk was the best we could ask for. Beautiful scenery along the way with some great beaches to soak your feet in and some nice lookouts. Be sure to wear comfortable shoes and short clothing. Also, plenty of stairs so I wouldn't recommend strollers or elderly people...
Best walk in Sydney. If you haven't done this walk, you're missing out! The best, most scenic walk in Sydney. It's quite long though so not for the 'un-fit'...

Breathtaking. Truly a breath of fresh air. A wonderful way to see some of the costal beaches while enjoying the great outdoors. I found it to be an easy to moderate walk with places to stop and rest along the way. Remember to bring some water :).
Wet but wonderful. A lovely walk even in the rain. Worth doing. Stopped and ate at a little cafe in Bronte. Loved the sandstone cliffs.
Amazingly beautiful....highly recommend!!!. We had a beautiful day for the walk. I never get tired of this walk....Ever. If you do nothing else in Sydney, do this walk!!!

Don't miss this!. This is one of my favorite experiences in Sydney/Bondi. It's beautiful beyond belief, and the path is well marked and maintained. And then there are the views...We stopped at the Clovelly Bowling Club for a break, sitting outside with an Aussie beer and watching spirited old members bowl on the club's lawn while overlooking the sapphire-blue sea. Waverly Cemetery is somber and beautiful, and Coogee is lively and fun. I'll never forget this experience. Don't miss it!

Go Early or Late. This is a guaranteed 5 star experience. The views early morning or late afternoon are just gorgeous. It's an easy walk to Tamarama then onto Bronte....you can go further to Coogee if you wish or have the time. There are so many photo ops that the walk will take twice as long as expected. Watch out for the super fit Bondians who run past you not admiring the beauty to behold.Bronte has lots of coffee pitstops for those in need of sustenance. PS why not stop at Icebergs on the way back for a drink and dessert?? Cheaper than a whole meal here!

Swim in this amazing place and relax on the beach. If you like swimming like I do, take some time at this fantastic pool that receives ocean water and is really amazing for training (50m length pool). I visited this place, the water was 17 degrees but could not avoid to taste the experience of swimming in such a different place for training.

Very nice walk , and beautipul sea. We took the free tour of " wake up hostel". The gide was nice and took us to walk near the six beutipul beaches ) he told us that there are 152 beaches in sydny). We walk 3 hours , and like it very much

Tired of excursions - take his nature walk. Great walk and great views. Certain times of year great for on-shore whale & dolphin watching. Many comfort stops along the way and nearby to shops and restaurants. Pack a swimsuit!

Million dollar views. It hard to fault this walk - the views are amazing We were luck to get a picture perfect day as you can see from the photos - for a bit of fun we deviated off into the surrounding suburbs to checkout the real estate - some special places - call in at Icebergs - hard to take a bad photo of this!!

Great!. If you want to do something nice and you have a free day, you must do it!It is a great walk, not difficult and you can do it with flip flops if you want to stop in every beach. The view is amazing!!! And when you finish at Bondi, you can drink and eat anything you want, because there are so many bars and restaurants!

Must do when visiting Sydney!. Beautiful scenic walk that you must do when visiting Sydney. Whenever I have friends visiting I always include this walk.Enjoy the views and the exercise. You won't regret it!

Always a touch of paradise to welcome in the day. Bondi to Bronte never disappoints, while it can get a little busy a 6am ensures you had your vitamin SEA for the day. Spiritually uplifting with the sea air rolling over you a well paced walk ideal for average levels of fitness.One of Sydney's natural treasures, great for tourists , lovers and locals.Kids and dogs more of a challenge as there are runners who get impatient.

Beautiful but don't rush it! . This is a wonderful walk that I would highly recommend if you're in the area (and if not it's well worth travelling to). I did the walk on a beautiful and warm spring day. There are clear signs to keep you on track and large numbers of people doing the walk, although it doesn't feel crowded at all as there's so much room between walkers.I recommend taking a packed lunch/picnic and making a day of it. There are around 8 beaches and swimming pools on the route that are all worth checking out. If you don't take food there are plenty of options en route and also at the wonderful bondi beach.

Kind of disappointing - did not live up to the hype. This isn't a hike for the faint of heart, there are inclines and downhills and many steps. The views are great, but the paths are narrow, so coming up to people going in the opposite direction sometimes required moving off the path to let them pass. Views were cool for the first few days of our trip, but we easily saw much better ones as we continued to travel up the coast (Shoal Bay, for example). It's probably a cool little trek for someone local, but personally, we feel we could have skipped it and not missed much.

great coastal walk. We bused from central Sydney on a Saturday afternoon (333), very busy! Recommend buying an opal card as bus drivers really don't like people paying cash for ticket (plus there is an opal only bus) Busy walk, but views to die for, don't forget camera. Gym gear not obligatory, water bottle important and sun screen. Toilet stops at the different bays on the way. $4.40 each way on bus to Sydney (bargain as you get to see the burbs) Really enjoyed, but it was an overcast day so not too hot. Bus can be full queing to get on in Coogee and Bondi so be careful as buses don't allow more than there legal requirement.

Beautiful nature all around. We enjoyed this walk although is was a long one. So we cheated a bit and finished off by bus. But got to the end just when the sunset started and that was very romantic. Beaches all around are full of surfing people enjoying the waves as much as they can! You can spot lots of parrots and other animals on your way (especially dogs walking with their owners)

Fabulous - what can I say???. Such a beautiful walk, why wouldnt you do it? easy walk for kids and adults and even my dear old mum would want to walk it. Lots of stops along the way for photos & a few cafes and wonderful shops to buy that little trinket that you cant do without..placemats are my thing...wonderful.

Very average. I feel very un-Australian writing this review but this walk is overrated. The cliffside views I had envisioned were underwhelming and the walk was packed full of joggers in both directions. Jogging isn't a bad thing, but the footpaths and stairways just aren't wide enough to comfortably accommodate it. The highlight for me was the cliffside cemetery overlooking the ocean. I never thought I would comment on a cemetery, but it is stunning. It can be a bit off putting that people will step all over the graves though.
Paradise. You will see beaches you never imaginé. The sightseeing of this walk should be done for those who love unforgettable moments
This is such a beautiful walk. On a summers day, this walk just takes you back to nature and makes you feel great. Some spectacular houses along the way to aspire to.
Great walk. So privileged to see Dolphins playing in one of the bay's. Watched for about 20mins. Nice walk but only one shop on way so take water sunscreen and hat. Don't forget the camera

Very pleasant walk. I was fortunate to be blessed with beautiful weather when I did this walk. I arrived at 5:30AM just in time to be ready for sunrise, which I recommend if you love taking photographs. I picked the Bondi Icebergs club as my sunrise spot, and a section of the walk not far off.A small section of the walk was closed off due to some damages by the storm but it was just a small section, although unfortunate. I spent the entire day admiring the views and it was capped off by beautiful sunset.
I take all my visitors here. Whenever a friend or family member from overseas is visiting me, this is on the to-do list. Every corner you turn gives you another amazing vieuw. LOVE IT

stunning views, empty beaches. Part of the walk was obstructed by construction work after last June's storm. The rocks are beautifully shaped by the sea and winds. This was a cloudy and cold day but the bus service is amazing: cost hardly anything and brings you anywhere to where you want to be

Did it again with joy!. This time we went from Bondi to Coogee. It was just as good as going the other way, but was it my imagination, or even more chockers with everybody and their granny out walking! Fantastic to see it!

Great walk, beautiful scenery. This is an amazing walk with beautiful scenery and great views. We took the walk on an overcast day with some rain spitting out of the sky every now and again and it was still a terrific walk. We made it more a stroll and there were many others out but it never felt crowded.

Spectacular! Must do . This coastal walk reminded me of Pacific Coast Highway only on foot. Stop by the Bucket list restaurant before you start for a pint. Selection of beer good. Good selection of food to start your journey. Take lots of pictures
Terry. Great location.Easy for public transportation.Enjoyed our visit.Nice views with a feeling of real history.Many places to have a meal at great value .Great place to bring the family.

Nice walk by the beach. I was told by my friend this is one of the most popular beach in Sydney. We have a nice walk along the coastal area before going to Bondi icebergs for fish and chips with coffee. Place has a excellent view so don't miss it but you have to bring all your id to enter.
Very beautiful walk. When we lived in Sydney we used to do this walk its very nice and free so 10/10, A brilliant way to spend a Sunday

Wonderful!. This walk is very popular and for good reason! It is a great way to get a workout while enjoying the most beautiful views. It starts in Bondi to end in Coogee. We bought our drinks in Bondi, if you want you can also get ice cream from Ben and Jerrys and off you go. There are several places to stop along the way and some less busy beaches to rest in between, the walk is not strenuous in itself, stairs but still manageable. At the end of the walk we stopped at Maloneys to get some food and stayed there to watch the sunset. Truly one of the most beautiful places to do so in Sydney!
