A Wonderful Way to Walk Off Lunch. A beautiful spring afternoon combined with a scrumptious lunch at Bondi led us to head off on the coastal walk to Coogee. What a great decision!Plenty of other people had the same idea, but it never felt like we were being bustled along as we made our way along the walk. Of course the scenery is breathtaking and we stopped to admire the view and catch our breath on more than one occasion.The ground and steps are uneven in places, so wear sensible footwear and watch your step! Part of the walk takes your through a cemetery and we needed to follow signs as there was work being done to the normal path that everyone follows.There was a sea breeze but that's no surprise. We stopped for a refreshing drink at the end. This was strictly a one way proposition for us! I highly recommend it!

Great!. We actually walked a bit further, starting at Maroubra Beach to the south and going north through Coogee Beach to Bondi. The route is a gorgeous combination of beaches and cliff views. Some steps and hills in parts. A helpful website is bonditocoogeewalk dot com, which breaks the walk into segments that might be helpful in deciding how far you want to walk based on fitness and interest levels. We walked from Maroubra to Bondi in about 4.5 hours, which is longer than most sources say it should take but we stopped MANY times to enjoy the scenery and watch the surfers. This coastal walk has postcard views at every turn. Highly, highly recommended!

Beautiful coastal walk, enjoy dinner at the end in Coogee. It was a beautiful walk with many different coastline views and perspectives. Several parts were unfortunately under construction, so check to see if those are complete if you want to maximize every part of the walk. If you do the walk and don't have a vehicle, the bus routes from Coogee back into central Sydney are easier and less congested than Bondi. If you do an afternoon walk, end it with a dinner in Coogee beach area. On a separate trip, we had dinner at Barzura and enjoyed delicious kangaroo!

A surprise around every corner. On a recent business trip to Sydney, I took the bus from the central business district out to Coogee to walk the coastline to Bondi. The bus took about 30 min from downtown, less with an express bus on the return trip. Definitely take public transit there, it's easy to find and its nice to see the neighborhoods as you drive through.Starting at Coogee, I hadn't read much about the walk and was surprised to find so much to look at and discover on the walk. There is literally a beautiful beach around every corner, some with incredible beachside pools, and it was interesting to observe the occasional surfer or fisherman, as well as tourists getting too close to edge of the cliffs while taking selfies.The path is mostly well marked even though there were some detours due to reconstruction after storms. You can easily walk right down to each beach and explore as you pass by. Best to walk from Coogee to Bondi direction as it's is easy to catch a bus from Bondi. Waverley cemetery was the absolute highlight of the walk.

Gorgeous. Absolutely beautiful and a wonderful way to spend the day however the full walk took MUCH longer than anticipated, which was hard considering how jetlagged I was! By the end I was starving and tired but it was well worth it.

A bit windy - it was still great. I love walking about and exploring so this was great. If you need a break from walking, just relax on one of the beaches near by. Nice bathrooms that one can use for free along the way as well.

Great walk during the day. Highly recommended walk, would suggest comfortable pair of shoes and light clothing with a jacket in case the wind is too cool. No worries about heat during September which I believe is the best time to visit.

Lovely walk. We walked from Bondi to coogee last Sunday whilst on a visit to Sydney. Absolutely lovely walk with beautiful views along the way. We were lucky to have gorgeous sunny weather which made everything look even better. You need to have a reasonable level of fitness as there are numerous hills and steps along the way. Would definitely recommend if you're out at Bondi.
Walk with a view. Highly recommend this walk to vistors from anywhereOne of the best ways to stay fit finish the walk with breakfast at the Pavillion @ Coogee
Must do activity for everyone visiting sydney. The bondi to coogee walk is a must do for everyone visiting sydney.. the views of the coastline are amazing ...

Scenic, a must do. I love the ocean, and this walk winds its way along cliffs overlooking the ocean. The walk passes along some of the well known Sydney suburbs and is worth doing for both its scenic and exercise value
Spectacular. An easy walk with spectacular views. Use public transport to and from. Take your bathers and camera.

amazing coastline. A cliff top coastal walk, the Bondi to Coogee walk extends for six km in Sydney's eastern suburbs. The Bondi to Coogee walk features stunning views, beaches, parks, cliffs, bays and rock pools. The beaches and parks offer a place to rest, swim or a chance to eat at one of the cafes, hotels, restaurants or takeaways.

Wow coastline. I always have a weak spot for large bodies of water, there is something majestic about watching in this case the Pacific. (Which we did at a park just before the immediate Tamarama beach) so of course this was getting a good review. There should however be stricter rules on dog control in that park- some crazy owners were there failing to manage vast herds of non compliant dogs, which I was tempted to boot into the ocean and which cut short the length of time we were able to spend enjoyably there.Due to the storms of June the route now has some diversions (I think it usually does not cut through the cemetery which some may find unnecessarily macabre!) but overall it is a nice scenic route to walk-or indeed run; a considerate etiquette is followed on narrower stretches enabling people to keep up a good pace.
Choose a nice cool day as it is a long walk. Everyone should do this walk if able. I am not a spring chicken and it took a while to complete but what a day.

Spectacular Sydney coastal walk. This is a favourite spot for locals walking their dogs or catching up with friends & family. Also a popular spot for tourists enjoying views over the ocean & beaches. A walk that can get very crowded on weekend mornings. Unfortunately the bit between Bronte & Coogee has been closed since big storms in June undermined part of the walkway- there is a detour through Waverley cemetery but hopefully the council will fix this soon.

Great views. This is easy to get to - bus to Bondi beach, then you have a great walk for a couple of hours along a fabulous coast, you end up in Coogee Beach where you can eat and drink if you want and then an easy bus back to the city. All in all, a great day out.

Bronte to Bondi Section. My girlfriend and I drove to Bronte and walked to Bondi and back. This was a much easier option than finding and paying for parking in Bondi. The walk is very easy and only takes about 20 mins each way at normal pace, obviously with a stop off in Bondi for a look around.Bondi was average, the beach looks nice but all the stores are very overpriced. It only takes about 20 minutes to walk around the main streets, I wouldn't bother eating here as prices are exorbitant. Bronte is a nicer beach and has a large green park which was filled with groups and families enjoying the weather, there were bbq's provided and lots of seating and room for ball sports. We did not continue to Coogee, but will at some other point.

A must for all visitors to Sydney. This is a great walk, and takes about 1 hour return. It does have some challenging steps along the way, so you need to be reasonably fit.At certain times of the year, whales can be viewed on their migration.

Great walk. We took the a bus from Circular Quay to Bondi beach and then did the walk to Coogee beach- was a very nice walk past several beaches... Coogee Pavillion at the end was fantastic -great place to have lunch or a drink (we had a drink on the top of the Pavillion with nice view of the beach- it is a pavilion with multiple food stations- dessert, fish, everything you could think of as well as a games area and roof top bar... great idea! Easy to get a bus back to Circular Quay after the walk.

Walkathon Fundraiser. My partner and I made the mistake of taking our 2-year-old on the walk without a buggy or carrier! We reasoned that he wouldn't be comfortable in the carrier for the long walk (too small for him) and we didn't want to struggle with the stroller across the rocky terrain and up and down steep steps.It all started off fine - a beautiful sunny day and the little guy was keen to walk - but what we didn't count on was the fast and furious Sunday cliff-walk traffic and so, with fast scary dogs and even scarier joggers coming from the other direction on this narrow 2-way stretch, we had to carry little guy most of the way - or he was going to be sent flying. And wow, what a long way to carry a 2-year-old when it is hot and crowded! All in all little guy seemed to love the walk and the stunning scenery (probably more than us since we were more focused more on not tripping whilst carrying him!). Fortunately there were two of us to share the load, but personally I would not advise taking a toddler on this walk. Wait until they can walk it competently and until then - save those mesmerising views for yourself!!Be sure to wear really comfy walking shoes and bring loads of sunscreen and water. You will need it!!

Great Walk Beautiful Views. This has to be one of the most picturesque walks you will do. Added to the fact that the path is well maintained, clean and suitable to all levels of fitness.Do it alone or do it with a friend... it's worth it & you'll be exercising without realising!

Stunning views. Took this walk on our last day of our holiday. The walk was pleasant, challenging at times. But it offered great views. My only comment was I would like to have seen more benches along the way to sit and just listen to the ocean.

Outstanding, do not miss this one. I've got to be honest, I piked out on the bit from Bronti to Coogee. I did however walk from Bondi Junction to Bondi and walked the length of Bondi up and back and then walked to Bronti. Bondi Junction is a fair walk away from Bondi itself but there are some very interesting shops and buildings to see on the way. Bondi itself is full of the usual cafes and seaside attractions. Bondi beach is a spectacle in itself best viewed from the lookout which you arrive at as walk the path from Bondi to Bronti. This walk is not difficult and on a sunny day is really fantastic. I've done this walk a number of times and I'll be back to do it again, highly reccomended.

Wish we'd found this earlier!. Coogee to Bondi is a long walk but well worth it, make sure you bring water and sun cream you, there are water fountains along the way and benches to take a break. If you struggle with long walks you can park at Clovelly or Bronte and walk either way, both are just breathtaking, enjoy!

The best city walk in the world!. I run this walk every week and it never fails to to be spectacular: rain hail or shine! Last month I just had to stop for a while and watch the wales that were frolicking a few meters off the coastline!

Beautiful way to spend your day walking along world-famous Bondi Beach!. Sydney has some of the best climates in the world, in my humble opinion. It doesn't matter which season, the Bondi to Coogee coastal walk is a fabulous way to experience the Eastern beaches in Sydney, especially the world-famous Bondi Beach! It takes a good 2hours or so one-way, leisurely walking. This is great for couples on dates, friends catching up, or even solo. Listen to the ocean waves, watch surfers in action, take in the salty air, get those legs moving and camera snapping! Plenty of cafes at either end and in between Bondi and Coogee, whenever you're ready to take a break ;) Even on a rainy day, the scenery is quite amazing. Storms out at sea, crazy waves, you might even get treated to a lightning show! In Summer there's also Sculptures by the Sea that takes place along here :)

Sea spray and sunshine...... A really lovely walk to do at any time of day or time of year.... (although if you are not a sun-lover perhaps not midday on a Summer's day). I did this walk early September and the photo's I have taken along the walk are magical reminders of how beautiful Sydney is and, in particular, along our coastal areas. Start the walk at the car park on Bondi Beach (the walk is signposted so you can't miss it). Although you may be tempted to stop off at Icebergs, save that visit for later. Walk past Icebergs and you are on your way. It takes about an hour or so (depending how long you stop to take amazing photo's) and the walk does involve some stairs (therefore, difficult if you have a pram or wheelchair). It is dog friendly (you will pass many dog walkers along the way) and in some areas a steep couple of patches, however, I did not find the walk difficult at all. There are taps along the way to fill your drink bottle if you need also. As you are directly on the coast the entire walk, the sea breeze will keep you cool, however, as there is no shade, wear sunscreen at all times. Finish you walk with a visit to a café, restaurant or pub to reminisce about the gorgeous scenes you just witnessed. You can either take the return walk (if you car is in the car park and you need to return to Bondi), or you will find many buses at Coogee to take you to where you need to head. You will thoroughly enjoy this beautiful and free activity (and feel all the more healthy for doing it too).

Spectacular views, a Sydney classic. The Bondi to Coogee walk is one of the most spectacular cliff walks in Sydney. It takes in Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly and Gordons Bay. It is approximately 11km. It is relatively easy walk with a couple of flights of steps. There are wonder cafes along the walk. Watching the people is just as interesting as looking at the views.

Idyllic coastline. The Coogee to Bondi walk or vice versa will take about 1hr 10mins pending how many stops you do to take pics or drop ins to the local cafes along the coastlines. An absolute must see if your visiting Sydney. Stunning views & coastline not to be missed, if your lucky you may see pods of dolphins or Whales along the coastline.

Beautiful scenery and in for a dip. We started with a pre workout breakfast at a wonderful cafe. Take some water and sun cover then go off on a great day out. There are a few steps but it is mostly easy walking. Then you arrive at Coogee ready for a swim. Magic.

Sculpture by the sea on a blue skied golden sunshine day. This is the walk if you love great sea views with a chaser of great sculptural works. Artist install their work all along the walkway, so you have the artistry of Mother Nature providing a masterpiece of sea, sky and sand as a backdrop to these artworks. If it is one of Sydney's warm golden days and cloudless blue sky, you are in for a treat as well as improving your cardiovascular system.

Pick a beach...any beach!. What a great way to spend the day! Early morning start required if you want to do the full walk (approx 3 hours!), then grab some brekkie or brunch in Bondi. The walk itself is spectacular, with gorgeous sea views from all angles, this is a photographer's dream! Bring a water bottle and a towel! Stop at any of the numerous beach spots along the way there or back. There is also a gorgeous and reasonably priced cafe at Tamarama Beach that serves to best Rueben sandwiches and chicken burgers! It's not an easy walk in some spots - stairs and lots of people and dogs! - but its worth the effort. Do all of the walk, or choose a section of it. You won't be disappointed.

"Aussie Aussie Aussie, Oi, Oi, Oi". Take in the awesome Aussie beach views throughout the journey as you sweep the edges of the ocean breathing in the ocean spray! There will always be some nice eye candy along the way too as you see some hot and hard shirtless bods pound the pavement! Therefore not for the faint hearted :) There are quite a few sections with narrow and steep stairs(railings all the way though) but you can stop and take a break to the side if you need. If Coogee is too far just walk from Bronte to Bondi, this takes about 1hr doing a solid pace(1.20hr) if you stroll more. There are bubblers along the route but its a good idea to have a water bottle or light weight water belt etc. Once you reach the Bondi promenade the path to walk is much wider and you can stop off for some lunch etc before heading back.
The graveyard!. Fantastic Ocean views! Great exercise and a good sense of the historical aspects of the region.The end-point at Coogee is truly breathtaking!

What a view!. We walked from Bondi and loved it. There was quite a lot of damage to the walk, from storms in early 2016 and the council has closed some areas at the start of the walk, so that you have to detour around. Very steep hills and quite a lot of steps at the start, as a result. Once passed that, the walking is much easier. Lots and lots of people do this walk/run on the weekends.

Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal walk. Breathtaking views of the most beautiful coastline. You are in for a treat experiencing this walk. Not for the faint hearted but definitely worth each step. Nature's candy for the eye.

Coastal Walking. If you love long walks along the beach then you will love this walk, it consists of beautiful scenery of the eastern beaches, a spectacular coast line and some pretty cool places to eat. Whether you start from Coogee and finish at Bondi or vice versa both places have some neat eateries where you can snag a coffee and a bite to eat after your leisurely walk. Set aside 3-4hours if you would like to walk both ways.
Must-do. The walk from Cogee to Bondi and back is a very nice walk, stunning views! Do the walk and relax on the beach afterwards with a swim in the sea!
beautiful scenery, great walk. What a great refreshing walk it is! the views are fantastic! I wouldn't do it with young kids - but it is a great day out for adults!

Beautiful and fun way to experience Sydney's Beaches and life. This is a must-do with friends and family when they visit Sydney. Nice to do with kids but use a backpack to carry them - you can't do this with a stroller.

Amazingly beautiful walk.. The 6km walk from Bondi to Coogee is one of the most beautiful walks in Sydney & on a fine day it is just spectacular. The walkway is always somewhat busy (especially in early November when the Sculpture by the Sea exhibition is on) , but it is still quite easy to run, jog or just meander along nodding to other walkers & taking in the scenery. Be aware that this is a cliff top walk and there are quite a few steps and slopes to walk up and down, but there are plenty of beautiful spots along the way to swim, rest & take in the amazing views. The walk takes about 2 hours at a leisurely pace and passes the historic Waverly cemetery and the beaches of Tamarama, Bronte and Coogee.
Awesome!. Beautiful scenery, have enjoyed every single time. Bear in mind it is busy during holidays and weekends, and takes a while. Few cafes on the way with toilet facilities available.

An special essence of Sydney. This dramatic walk shows you a side of where the true spirit of Sydney comes from. I would start from Coogee or Bronte, if not up for the full walk, and head north to end up in iconic Bondi. Maybe stop for a drink or meal at Icebergs overlooking Bondi beach.It is an easy, flat path walk around the magnificent sandstone cliffs and foreshore with the Pacific crashing below. If you are in Sydney when "Sculptures by the Sea" is on this is a must, but is very busy weekends and evenings.
Great walk. Try to go early can get crowds go to Gordon's bay with snorkel gear! Don't forget water and check water for jelly fish they can sting. Pde local
Great walk. Such a great walk to do as a couple or with friends and family, beautiful scenery and swimming spots along the way, not to difficult to walk and then can grab something to eat in Bondi.

The views are aamzing and well worth a look. My wife and I have done this walk several times and it was a regular Sunday for some time. Amazing views and very good surface for walking. Is a bit challenging in parts but gets the pulse rate up. We will be taking some friends from Scotland on this walk in October

Great coastal walk . This walk is lovely. It's crowded so I wouldn't recommend it for running but it's nice for walking with friends and a gorgeous view. If you aren't a Sydney local I would advise getting transport in as parking is extremely limited. It's a lovely casual stroll and is recommended eating in Bondi then walking back to burn it off!

MUST DO WALK for every tourist to Sydney. The Bondi to Coogee walk is a must do experience for every visitor to Sydney. The walk takes in 6 beaches from Coogee to Bondi and there are some amazing views to be seen. The walk takes 2 hours and is a great way to see the Eastern Suburbs coastline. My favourite parts are secluded Gordon's Bay and Waverley Cemetery. I think walking from Coogee to Bondi is the easier route. You don't have to be super fit to do it either and you can take as long as you like. My TIP is to do only do the walk on a SUNNY day to get the most out of it.
Breathtaking views!. One of the best walks in Sydney! Beautiful vistas across the beaches of Bondi, Tamarama and Bronte. Enjoy a coffee down at the kiosk at Tamarama Beach.

A must do for any visitors a great Sunday or sunrise walk. This is always a stunning walk in fine sunny weather or watching the clouds and crashing waves in inclement weather. Some parts of the walk took a battering during the storms earlier this year.

One of our favorite memories in Sydney . You simply have to take this walk in if it's your first visit to Sydney. It's gorgeous and well worth the effort. There are a few inclines and some stairs to go up but it was good to get the heart rate up and work off some of the indulged eating I've been doing on vacation. The views are spectacular and the beaches are incredibly beautiful. We would do this walk multiple times a week if I could. The beer and food at the Coogee Pavilion were a welcome reward after a long warm walk.

Bondi beach. Advised to visit just to say I had been there , which is exactly what my wife and I did , after a cheap bus ride from Sydney harbour . There is not much else to say except that i couldn't wait to get back on the bus to Sydney harbour and the rocks area .

Must see. This is a tough walk but really worth it . It's quite challenging in the heat to do all of this walk but the views make it worthwhile. Its a great way to spend a day or two in Bondi and the beaches are just amazing.
The other way.... We took the bus to Coogee and went on the trail for Bondi. Gorgeous views and nice little places to stop with the kids.

Beautiful Walk. Put your walking shoes on and do this must- do adventure. It's an easy walk but a few miles so good for exercise! We took the advice of someone and did Coogee to Bondi since they said Bondi had more places to eat. Not sure if it matters which way you go.When we went a portion of the walk was closed due to storm damage. This part happens to be right by a cemetery. We saw some people going through the gate anyway and right through walking over grave sites. Thought that was weird. We stayed on the actual detour on the pathway.The sites are gorgeous! Plan several hours so you can stop and take lots of pictures and enjoy the scenery.
Best city/beach walk anywhere. I've done this several times and is a must for every visit to Sydney.Fantastic views and really easy and interesting walk.

Wow! Do it!. The Bondi Beach to Coogee Beach Coastal Walk is about a four mile walk past beautiful beaches, rock formations, stunning coastline, and wildlife. I started the walk at Bondi Beach and took it all the way to Coogee Beach. There are lots of hills and steep stairs to climb. You definitely get your work out in. Starting in Bondi Beach will take you through Bondi Park, MacKenzies Bay, Tamarama Beach, Bronte Park, Waverley Cemetery, Burrows Park, Bundock Park Clovelly Beach, Gordons Bay, Dunningham Reserve, Dunningham Park, and ending at Coogee Beach.There are a few detours due to damage from a June 2016 storm (according to signs). The detour signs were clearly marked. I did not give this attraction a perfect score because there were various points where it was not clearly marked and you were not sure which way to go. A world famous coastal walk like this should have adequate signage throughout. However, do not let that last statement deter you. I HIGHLY recommend you do this walk!

Astonish Coastal Walk. I was pleasantly enchanted by this walk... I don't had more words to describe that they were moments that leave me speechless with their beautiful pools and cliffs. Highly recommended!

Under construction due to storm damage.. Probably great after they get it openned up again. They did post signs for an alternate route but it was back up a hill. Wish they had the signs up at the top.

One of the best things to do in Sydney. I just did a Saturday morning run along the coast walk between Bondi to just past Coogee. The coastal view is beyond stunning, and is possibly the most iconic Sydney thing to do away from the harbour. The cliffs, beaches and coves are breathtaking. We had cockatoos and kookaburras calling out, Bondi Rescue lifeguards patrolling the beaches around us. The terrain is very undulating - with quite a lot of steps. Some sections of the walk are closed due to recent storm activity but this pushes you into the most scenic cemetery for something different. Possibly go earlier as can get quite busy and is narrow in some sections. A stop for Breakie at the Coogee Pavilion is a must!!!
Amazing short walk!. What a gorgeous scene for a walk. The walk is very easy (we did it with two young children) and there is even a playground along the way with gorgeous views of the ocean.

Awesome . The views alone takes your mind off the fact that this is a 6km walk. The Sydney coastline is a scenic must-do. The walk takes in Bronte & Tamarama beaches, Clovelly, Waverley Cemetery and Gordon's Bay with plenty of swimming opportunities, places to sit and relax and plaques explaining the history of the various stops. Give yourself a full day to enjoy this awesome walk and take in the views. We went from Coogee to Bondi and to me that was better. Bondi was bigger and more food options to end your walk.
must do for tourists. The walk doesn't take long, but showcases some of the best views of Sydney. There are quite a few steps, so keep that in mind.

Lovely walk!. This was one of the highlights of my stay at Sydney. I was there for work and had only one free morning - so i decided to go for this walk. And i don't regret it!!!I went in November 2015 so there was the addition highlight of the art sculptures along the walk. But even without that, the walk itself is wonderful!The scenery is lovely and it keeps on changing. The sea breeze was refreshing.Do look at my photos!Highly recommended.

Lovely walk . Time estimate 1.5 hours. Stopped for a snack and drink still made it in that time. Currently repairs being undertaken throughout some of the walk diversion takes you through a grave yard. still panoramic views. String crashing waves to calm beaches. A popular walking route.
Dont miss this for anything!. This scenic 6km long coastal walk is a must do for every east coast itinerary. Offers spectacular scenic views of bright blue ocean with lots of photo opportunities....

Beautiful Sydney walk. The walk goes from Bondi to coogee. Although you can extend it and walk to maraoubra.. Although you will need to detour a little onto the road. Still great. The walk is fairly easy. Although there are hills and steps to deal with. Difficult with a pram. Stop at clovelly for an amazing snorkel, at one of the lovely bronte cafes for a bite to eat or power on to Bondi ice bergs and grab a bite and be sure to sit on the balcony for a breath taking view.

Great walk – not suited for everyone. The views are indeed absolutely breathtaking and the walk very enjoyable. With warm weather, you can do a pit stop at multiple beaches and hop in for some cooling down. Note, however, that there are rather steep parts. Therefore, be aware that parts of the walk can be strenuous. If you are staying either at Bondi or Coogee, the walk is a definite must.
iconic walk. this would have to be one of the most iconic walks in sydney, and a good distance to get your daily exercise in. you can finish up with a swim! recommend you do this...
Breathtaking. I live by Bronte beach and never in the world can one feel so amazed by how beautiful it all really is, unless you do this walk! It is easy for all fitness groups and ages.

A wee bit of fat burning. Love this walk as we done it last year as well and we had a great day for it warm yet a cool breeze.This walk can be quite challenging and has parts that are not for the faint hearted, many steps and steep walkways prove o be quite tuff for the less active. Amazing ocean and cliff views and some great photo opportunities not to be missed.And you can get a snack and a coffee at Tamara beach on the way.

Great Walk. This was the reason we added a day to our trip before flying home from Sydney - and so worth it. Had never been to Bondi or Coogee before and were absolutely blown away by the natural beauty of this area, a world away from the Sydney CBD where we usually stay. We scored perfect weather in May, warm enough for swimming. Set off on the walk early - quite a lot of walkers. Shade a bit scarce in some areas. Just so surprised at the clarity and beauty of the water in the multitude of little bays. And the locals in Coogee were so friendly. Can't wait until we plan another trip and we'll definitely stay again in Coogee and walk further in the other direction.

A must do while in Sydney.. the walk is not for the light hearted. the total walk will take 2 hours to complete. plenty of stop off points like Tamarama and Bronte beaches. amazing views and very natural.

Breathtaking scenery. If you have a spare few hours make sure u do this walk. It is only a few kilometres and there are plenty of places to stop and grab a coffee along the way. The view of the beach and cliffs is worth the walk.

Beautiful walk. I really enjoyd my walk along this coastline, it was beautiful. It was so cool to see the outdoor swimming pools "in" the ocean, that refill with every other wave (withthe ocean water). As you walk along the rugged coast you get to see some lovely small towns. Also watching the Surfers is much fun.I'd bring a raincoat I was so glad that I did as it rained on us off and on for an hour.
Awesome coastal walk. We enjoyed joining the locals as we took our leisurely walk. being near the water is very refreshing.

One of the most gorgeous coastal walks anywhere.... Stunning cliff-faces, icy blue water, surfers and coastal vegetation - whichever way you looks it's exciting, stimulating, and very Aussie! You'll see lots of people walking, running, talking - doing what Sydneysiders love to do - showing off their city or just enjoying its beauty and tranquillity. Whenever Sculpture by the Sea is on (this year 20 October to 6 November 2016) there are additional thousands of people clambering over the hillsides admiring or trying to make sense of the huge outdoor sculpture exhibition 'n competition. Spot the items in the water, on the rock faces, up the garden slopes... some serious, brilliantly attuned to the natural environment, some witty, some not much to speak of, but as a whole always always interesting and engaging as you walk from Bondi to Tamarama or vice versa. At either end of the walk there are places to eat 'n drink - I always recommend the pub (not the fancy restaurant) at Bondi Icebergs as you hit the road at Bondi with the beach in the distance. Have fish 'n chips or a burger, grab a beer or coke, and sit overlooking the churning ocean all around, the idyllic pool below, the balancing surfers nearby, the omnipresent swimmers braving the cold water. Can't be beaten - a visual feast second to none...

The great tourist bargain of Australia!. This is a free trail that starts at Bondi and ends at Coogee. There are spectacular views. A few notes. There are elevation changes, so being in a modestly good shape would be helpful. Sensible shoes goes without saying. Do not pass on the public bathrooms, and there are many fine places to eat at Bronte Beach. This is the number one thing that I would recommend to do in Sydney, at it only costs you mass transit fares to do it. You can take a bus back to the Sydney city center at Coogee (pronounced Kuch che as I was told.)
Great walk. very beautiful and peaceful walk. You can stop in several places to take pictures or relax.It was a perfect spring Sunday.

Excellent walk and excellent View. The Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal Walk is a delight and easy 3 hours walk. The path is well marked, and the boardwalk is well constructed. There are regular toilet stops and refreshment stops along the way. It is not a jungle walk, it is a very safe, pleasant, civilized walk. Very good ocean view, and nice beach along the way.

One of The Most Beautiful Walks Ever. Perfect weather helped, but the views are out of this world! Expect to stop many times to capture pictures. A part of the walk is closed due to damage from the storm in June 2016, but this should not affect the fun and beauty of the overall walk.

Fantastic walk, park for free near the Cemetery at Bronte. We went and parked at Bronte at the huge Cemetery on the South side - heaps of free parking. Then walked North to Bondi & back to the car. You could then do a Southern loop to Coogee if you liked. An amazing walk so scenic on a lovely sunny day. Great exercise to stretch the legs for visitors to Sydney.

Great activity to do for free!. A beautiful coastal walk illustrated by the coastline of one of Australia's most famous beaches. A perfect free activity to do on a Sunday. Something that keeps you fit and provides infinite opportunities for photography.

Certainly not for the mild walker but you'll be treated to the most magnificent coastline. There are certainly parts of this walk that are mobility unfriendly however if you can navigate the trickier parts you won't be disappointed. There is nothing more spectacular than the coastline between Bondi and Coogee regardless of the weather. This area is Mother Nature at her best. I consider myself very lucky to be able to call this country my home. We are truly blessed. Take your time. Ignore the runners. They are probably out there every day. Just enjoy at your own pace and you'll be very happy you did. Plenty of Cafes either end to enjoy a meal or just a coffee before your return walk.

Sydneyvisit. A wonderful walk whichever way you go - either Coogee to bondi or bondi to Coogee. Lovely scenery. There are some cafes along the way but better to takes one water with you. You can get a bus to Coogee and walk to Bondi or bus to bondi and walk to Coogee. Quite busy at times but you can go as fast or slow as suits. Seats in some places if needed. Varied terrain - flat,hilly, steps in places etc.

Nice Walk. Amazing views along the walk. I'm not a very active person but found this walk very capable of doing. Repair works really impacted the work and signage was poor of the detour. Would recommend though.

Two pleasures at once. For years I lived within walking distance to Bondi Beach, and that time I did this walk several times. Early morning hours I had preferred, since that time the walk wasn’t overcrowded, mostly runners were around me. Now, when I live in a different part of the city, still try to make this beautiful walk time to time. Parking a car there is nearly impossible, and very expensive, so its better to use public transport.From Circular Quay the bus 333 goes to Bondi Beach, and from Bondi Junction Interchange, use the 380. On the way back from Coogee you also can use the 380, or the 378.Don’t worry; this walk is worth every effort. If you’re lucky enough to be in Sydney that time I suggest to go and see „The Sculptures by the Sea” exhibition (20 October – 6 November 2016). It is always wonderful and stretches from Bondi Beach to Tamarama Beach. All that you have to do just continue walking till Coogee Beach. To see all the sculptures and do the walk as well, probably will occupy an average person nearly the whole day. It depends on how much time one needs to spend to examine the sculptures and how long to adore the beauties made by nature.

Absolutely Stunning walk. The walk from Bondi to Coogee is one of my favourite walks anywhere in sydney. The views are to die for, the ocean sooo blue, dolphins everywhere, walkers, joggers, prams you name it you will find them on this walk. Its an easy walk which takes about an hour maybe a bit more depending on how you walk. I just love it and if I lived in Bondi I would do it every day

Worth the walk . Although the path was narrow, and crowded on a sunny day- it was worth the effort to walk the whole path. I had lunch at the Coogee Beach Pavilion after and enjoyed a beverage and snack. Good way to end a hike.

Must do. It's a long and delightful walk kissing the beaches en-route. The entire stretch would take about 3 hours and in case your are running short of time you can take cut it short. But there is no way in which you would want to give it a miss.

Spectacular views. You don't need a guided tour for this one. I started at Bondi and stopped for a coffee in Tamarama, which took about 20 mins. Then onto Coogee which was a further 75 mins taking in some beautiful coastal scenery.

nice walk with clear water. It is a very nice walk although when we were there, many places were blocked due to construction and we had to walk through a cemetery. The view was wonderful, however and the water was exceptionally clear. It is definitely a great place to walk. I gave it 4 stars because of the ongoing construction. Otherwise, it would be 5 stars.

Get Ready For A Jog. I would prefer that you kit yourself up for a jog and join the locals as you wind your way from Bondi to Coogee. You get to see a lot of the sea and sand, and if that's not your cup of tea, be prepared to be blown away by the houses along the coast. Imagining yourself as one of the inhabitants there would take your mind off any stress.If at any time you wish to end the walk, just stray off the path and find the nearest bus stop.

Beautiful views and interesting walk. Our family of 2 adults and 2 teens all enjoyed the walk and stopped at various points to watch surfers, dolphins and whales! We were lucky enough to do it on a fairly quiet day when the sun was shining and the temperature around 20 degrees. Due to a couple of diversions (which I'm assuming are temporary) there are some uphill sections which may prove difficult for some walkers.We all loved the view from Bondi Iceburgs Club and the old boat ramps at Gordon's Bay. The walk was finished off perfectly with a light lunch at the Coogee Pavilion.

Excellent Beach. Bondi beach in Sydney is one of the best beach I have seen ever.Nice ocean view, nice beach.Very well connected to city by bus, train, cab, sea.Lots of cafes, bistros, restaurants.Must visit when you are in Sydney.
Nice walk. Its a nice walk. In July some parts were blocked, so we had to detour a little. Along the way there is an odd place, an old cemetery.... But overall was good...

A beautiful walk.. It's a wonderful coastal walk. So many gorgeous beaches along the way! Lots of little stops along the way for those who need a rest, if it's hot make sure you take water with you and wear good walking shoes.
Great views. Be carefull cause there are some parts closed due to damage caused by storms. Avoid going on sunday, too crowded!!
Don't expect to be lonely. Nothing for rainy days. When the sun shines, the walk is packed with people. But it worth to do it. The views are beautiful.
Wonderful walk with stunning view. If you come to Bondi Beach you must do this walk! Perfect for an afternoon. Bring a little bit om picnic to one one of the spots overlooking the ocean. Enjoy!
make way we are coming through. great walk but had to watch and step aside as the number of people out walking, running made the walk a challege

Beautiful views, rehab from June storms. We were only able to do half the walk both because of time and being with young children. Bondi is beautiful and the walk is very picturesque. If we hadnt been there w/ children we probably could have gotten good exercise out of it. there is some rerouting due to the June or July 2016 storms that they were actively fixing. You will find all sorts of interesting birds around as well

A walk that everyone will enjoy. We've walked from Bondi to Coogee a number of times while visiting Sydney and the views never get old. This time the waves were higher (it's winter) and more exciting. Don't forget to visit the Coogee Pavilion at the end of your walk for a welcome drink or meal. Lovely setting!
My favourite coastal walk in all of Aus. Whenever we visit Sydney this walk is a must, it's absolutely gorgeous and a great way to start the day or unwind!
Vastly over-rated. Compared to other Australian beaches this is nothing special. In fact it's crowded, rather shabby and inundated with litter.

Super walk . If your time in Sydney is limited you really should try and do this walk. A great view of Bondi followed by bays and beaches and ending with the delight of Coogie Beach. The walk is tough in some areas with alot of ups and downs.

Girls weekend . Wanted to do this walk for several years and finally had the opportunity. Parts damaged by recent weather events but still enjoyed the stroll. Busier than expected but was a sunny winters day. Finished up with a lunch at icebergs which a local friend was keen to try. Recommend both.
One free , one not so free!

Must do when visiting Sydney. The walk is very easy, within minutes you get from one small beach to another admiring the views, but also the waves and the surfers. You climb up and go down. Every little beach is different and very pretty. You can stop for a bite and rest on the beaches you pass - a fun, fun activity for 1/2 or even all day when visiting Sydney.

Watch out for the joggers!. It's a long walk with stunning views. Wear a hat and take some water. The worst part are the runners, there are too many which spoil it for the casual walkers. Worse still are those who run with their dogs following off lead and they don't clean up their dog's poo which makes it very unpleasant for everyone.

Go Coogee to Bondi. Beautiful long walk along the cliffs, with amazing scenery, places to stop along the way and great photo opportunities. We walked Bondi to Coogee early morning, there were a few detours due to cliff renovations which probably made the walk slightly longer, but in my opinion a little more interesting as we got to go places we wouldn't otherwise have known about. There are plenty of water fountains on the route which is a great touch so make sure you take a refillable bottle, however there are also a couple of cafes and shops on the route so if you feel like a pit-stop there is lots of choice. I really liked the information boards which gave you an insight into the area. If we were to do this walk again we would start at Coogee and walk back to Bondi, purely because we wanted to have lunch at Bondi and spend a little more time on the famous beach, but there was no bus service back there from Coogee (that we could find anyway!) so we would have had to go back to Bondi Junction to swap.

Amazing views . This walk was amazing to do by yourself or with company. Amazing views, take your time but be aware that there are alot of areas closed off. That was the only disappointment. Make sure you have the right walking shoes, hat, sunnies and water.

Stunning walk with the stunning views. The great beach walk in Sydney. The view is absolutely fabulous. Make sure you wear the comfortable shoes & a small bottle of water or refreshment drink. There're a lot of cafes & restaurant along the way.

Good workout if you want it to be. I had only a few short hours on my last day in Sydney so I took this at a bit of a run, and even though it was winter, I worked up quite a sweat and even got in a short nap on Bronte Beach. A big storm in June 2016 caused damage through August 2016, so there was a detour through an old (~1900) cemetary, which was beautiful.

Coogee Lover. This walk is as beautiful as anywhere in the world.Plenty of interesting cafes at both the Coogee and Bondi ends.Watch the whales swim by, and enjoy the scenery.This is the home of * Sculptures by the Sea*

Invigorating!. What a pleasant walk, so close to a major city, but a world away. I was there in winter on a weekday morning and it wasn't crowded at all. Lovely views of beaches with clear water, pools, and cliffs. I was amazed to see swimmers in the middle of winter. It took two hours from Coogee to Bondi. I rewarded myself with a smoothie at a cafe in Bondi when I finished.
The iconic of Australia. this is a great must to walk where famous actors and actresses have stood filmed and walked and swam

Beautiful and healthy at the same time. This walk has amazing views as you walk from beach to beach. There are nice stops to relax along the way and great little cafes. Take the time to relax and enjoy the view. Great for photographers as well.
Best walk in Sydney. This is a must-do activity in Sydney. The walk follows the coast and offers some great scenery, and at some times of the year, a display of sculpture. Well worth the effort.

Great walk. Beautiful scenery, great people watching including volleyball players on the beaches, great cafes to stop for coffees/ teas/ milkshakes. Short detour area for works but otherwise along the coast and just lovely.

Awesome hike!. This was my favorite part of our trip to Sydney. I read about this walk in our Lonely Planet guide. I am so glad we did this walk b/c it was gorgeous but I think the guide should have advised people better that this is a pretty strenuous hike! You are up and down stairs and steep roads all the time. But totally worth it if you are fit for the hike (or just do a smaller portion if the whole thing is too much) and wearing good shoes. Getting to Bondi by bus from Circular Quay was really easy. We explored Bondi a little, loaded up with a snack from Sadhana Kitchen, then made our way down to Coogee. A storm came through in June that wiped out some big sections of the walk, but there were lots of signs directing you on detours. There were a lot of people on the walk closer to Bondi but it thinned out more as we headed south. The whole walk was so pretty, alternating between cliff tops and then down on little beach coves. We ended in Coogee with a coffee at the Coogee Pavilion and then caught a bus all the way back to Circular Quay.The only downside on this walk is that we started out trying to find the cliff paintings north of Bondi. This was a total failure and we ended up hiking around these super steep streets not knowing where we were going.

Good!. From the reviews I expected something extraordinary and stunning. Well, let's say it was really nice, but didn't match my expectations as I was comparing it with Big Sur in California. So, overall, the walk was good, the scenery was great, the walkways are well maintained, the views are good. So, overall, I can totally recommend it, but I'd say don't have too high expectations because the really great spots of this walk are only a few and otherwise it's simply a walkway.

Nice. I'd loved the costal walk! But you need time to do it since it's quite long! I've enjoyed the great views over the ocean and sunbathed in 3 different beaches! For a break, have some of the local fish and chips... delicious!

Wonderful coastal views. A wonderful way to spend a few hours exercise and perhaps walk off some of the great Sydney food. Very picturesque coastal views and easy to follow path. You don't need to be so fit - although the runners put the rest of us to shame - but there are some parts with quite steep climbs. Plenty of options to walk as far as you want. Bondi and Coogee are well served by local bus services to/from Sydney city centre and Circular Quay.

Nice walk with great views. It is a nice walk. Has excellent views. Most of the walk has nice railings and paved paths. You have nice beaches on the way you can probably stop at any beach and go back to Bondi. You can catch a bus or uber back to bondi from any of the beaches. It's quite popular with lot of tourists and locals going back and back and forth all the time.We went with a pram and children it's probably not suitable to go with the pram because it's under construction at the moment and it has quite a few steps.Maybe after the construction the steps will be less but I think it still advisable to just go without the prams.

Incredible walk along the coast. One of the highlight daytime activities I would recommend. My friends and I did the walk and ended up at Coogee Pavilion on the roof overlooking the beach. Get location to finish the walk and have a beer while thinking about the great scenery you've experienced on the way there.

Super easy and worth exercise!!. If you live here or your a tourist you have to walk to Bondi and see the sites. The food around this area is great but a bit pricy, to be expected its Bondi! Shops for bathing suits, surfing, more food, sun glasses and markets all around the area to walk and visit. The water is cold so be prepared. Watch the weather and surf conditions before visiting. Again it's Bondi so there is always something to do!

My favorite when staying at the Crowne Plaza, Cooge Beach. I love walking the path from Coogee Beach to Bondi. The path takes a left when facing the beach, across the park and up and down the coast line with numerous scenic points and many stairs steps. Depending on the season, you find local and tourists, alike; Some are walking, some are jogging. The trail is well marked and can be great exercise. The water is usually rough ... swim at your own risks.

Breath taking veiws a stunning walk. Have done this walk on a couple of occastions and always enjoyed it. Aviod the weekend as it's crowded. We took the bus and walked back so as not to repeat the event but have done each way as the veiws change.

Breathtaking natural beauty . You can't beat nature and this walk just proves it. Pick a nice day that's not too windy and do the walk. If not all the way then just to Bronte where a great array of very good Cafes await you.

Beautiful walk. We enjoyed this coastal walk. Part of it was under construction so had to take little detours. Steps were involved. Beautiful scenery. We stopped at Bronte for lunch which was a cute little town.

Nice views. The day that I did the walk was a rainy day, nevertheless It is a nice walk to do, There are several spots along the walk that you can just "sit and enjoy the view"... Currently there is a detour at some point but after about 300 mts. you get back to the trail.. The walk has some areas of "up hill" I did the walk with a 9yr. old and she was fine with that, so is not something to worry about unless you have mobility problems.

Astounding views. Visited Bondi for the day and went on the coastal walk.Fantastic views with great photo opportunities, walk as little or as long as you like, each turn of the corner was a different amazing view, would highly recommend this walk.

Best day in Sydney. If in Sydney catch the bus 371 from near Museum St Station to Coogee (about 25 mins) and then do the walk to Bondi. Fantastic views ... Many places to stop and not too many tourists. Coogee is MUCH nicer beach than Bondi!

What a wonderful place to run. The walk is so beautiful and well maintained. It is used by thousands of people daily and the scenery is spectacular. Great place to stay and relax and only 30 minutes from the CBD

Amazing walk. Love this walk. It's spectacular scenery, well maintained path and the coffee at the other end. Great for all ages and there are many interesting places to swim or grab a snack along the way
Lovely views!. Have done the Sculptures by the Sea walk & very interesting artwork & wonderful views along the way.

Well worth doing.. This walk takes about 2 and a half hours and it's certainly worth it. Personally I would recommend doing it backwards fromCoogee to bondi which we did as you then arrive at the large famous bondi with a lot in the area, and spoilt for choice for drinks and food after a long walk.Great scenery and beaches along the way!!
Bondi Beach Craze. It is good for surfer and beach lovers. It has great place for food, shopping and sight seeing. Once you reach over there you will not want to go back.

A must do if visiting Sydney. It is a gorgeous coastal walk of about 8-10km although one can continue for a little longer towards Malabar. You pass beaches (each with its won character), the Waverly cemetery, the Clovelly lawn Bowling club; go up an down, gently undulating with fantastic views of the ocean and the various beaches passing by beautiful Gordon Bay which is excellent for snorkeling and scuba diving. They all have nice cafes for a stop. I recommend starting at Bondi and finishing at the Coogee. The Coogee Bay Pavillion for a meal at the end. They have great pizzas, mezze, grills, steaks and other bar food. On the weekend as well as early morning and late afternoon it can get rather crowded with runners, dog walkers and many local walkers but it is still wroth it. Sometimes you see whales or dolphins and you always see surfers.
Coastal Walk. Walking right on the edge of the coastline and looking at the vast amazing sea. Absolutely spectacular especially watching the sun rise.
Don't miss it. Lovely walk between the two beaches. Great views, beautiful coves and if it was warmer, great swimming. It was windy and cloudy today and we loved it!

Favorite walk in Sydney!. I recommend this to everyone who comes to Sydney for a visit, if you get one day with nice weather definitely do this! If you're up to it - try and do a sunrise run! Its spectacular! But just a walk is wonderful too, the views are unreal, and it's only 8km and time flies so quickly when you're doing it because you've got a new beach around each corner and so many great photo opportunities! Go with friends, or go alone you will still love it!

Stunningly Beatiful. Being a California man myself, I am used to beaches. This coastal walk though, was definitely something special. The water and cliffs we passed by were a wonder to behold. The water was so clean, and had a very beautiful color to it. We even observed some whales out in the distance! If you are in Sydney and you want to stretch your legs a little, I would highly recommend this walk.

Fresh air, blue sky, blue sea.... Take this walk if you are in Sydney! It is one of our famous and memorable experiences. You can walk slowly and keep stopping to marvel at each new turn and view, or you can head off for a power walk, but please do pause to enjoy the natural beauty from time to time. From balmy Bronte with its coffee shops, pool and mini train, on to twinkling Tamarama and finishing up in brash Bondi, drop in for a gelato and even head further north up the hill towards Dover Heights. I have done this walk so often over the decades and love it every time. You will feel impressed, energised, in touch with nature and inspired!

Beautiful walk. This is a stunning walk, about 6k altogether. I went during the day mid week and it was quite busy. Most tourists only complete the Bondi to Bronte section, so if you're looking for a more peaceful walk I suggest you keep going to coogee. Keep an eye for the beautiful Gordon's Bay. Sections of the walk are closed due to the storms in June. The diverts aren't very long but be warned they are steep.

specially for couples go on a rainy day the best view. the Bondi to coogee walk is the best to try at Bondi beach specially for couples and try to go on a rainy day the best view .in the middle of the walk you ll be standing on the east most point of the Australian continent and the view is specular .it’s a once in a life time walk which u ll be experiencing in Australia …it’s the best part on Bondi beech ………..………….

Great views in all directions from this lovely walk. Easy to follow the signs. Connects several beaches and parks. Wouldn't recommend going further when the path leaves the beachside owing to private property in the way. We ended up scrambling over large rocks when we got back down to the sea.
such a wicked walk love this place. take your time and take your swimmers so many little hidden beaches and bays to go a dip. great views and leisurely walks
Fantastic walk. Beautiful walk around coast a few of the paths are closed due to the big winter storms but an excellent way to spend a few hours. A lesuirely stroll took us 2. Hours
Beautiful view. Lovely walk with beautiful ocean view but the path is quite narrow with a lot of walker on the weekend
Great walk but windy. Beautifull scenery and just worth the walk! U can take long passage or take shortcuts, the pools in the ocean are so great!

Great Experience. Did the walk whilst in Sydney for the weekend.
The walk was scenic and a good workout. In particular I loved Bronte beach
It was just great!

Fantasic walk, highlight of our Sydney trip!. Beautiful walk, with a few lovely surf and bowls clubs to stop and have a refresher whilst looking over the ocean. We saw whales breaching and were welcomed most warmly at the clubs. A great undulating walk on a beautiful day!

Lovely walk . This is a lovely beach walk although some of it is closed off at the moment for work to be done but this wasn't an issue as we managed to see the whales jumping from the cliff tops. Ensure your footwear is up for it as my fiancee struggled half way round lol mind you gave us an excuse to stop for food and drink at Gordon's bay the burger and chips were lovely it's the first cafe on the right as you look at the shops from across the street sorry I can't remember the name. All in all on a lovely day it is worth the time and effort.

Just beautiful. One of the best walks/runs you will ever do!!! Most of the journey is paved now and you get to walk along some of Sydneys most beautiful headland. You will see at least 5 beaches on the walk and a couple of bays as well. Water views are abound along the whole walk as well. Cafes if you need are located at Bondi, Bronte, Clovelly and Coogee. There is also a fantastic lawn bowls club just on the northern side of Clovelly Beach. Great little sandstone building overlooking the ocean. Gorgeus!!
coast beauty. A glorious walk, whether sunny or windy. Beautiful vistas round every turn. Good eateries at either end.

Stunning!. Part of the walk was closed off when we visited, but we were able to navigate around it from the street. The walk takes you through several gorgeous beaches and affords many places for a spectacular view of the surrounding city, ocean, and beaches all in one. At the beginning and end of the walk there are lots of nice places to eat and shop. The beaches weren't too crowded because of the winter season, but I heard from our Australian friend that they can be packed out when the weather is nice! The day was quite cloudy when we went, but the views were still amazing and characteristic of Sydney's winter weather. It's great activity for all ages but the paths are not good for strollers. And don't forget the camera - you will want to take pictures!
Great walk. It is a very long walk but is well worth the effort. We usually have a rest in Bronte though it gets very busy over weekends.

Breathtaking views. You forget you are exercising when you do this breathtaking walk! My girlfriend and I were also lucky enough to see a variety of artworks and sculptures in display this particular weekend.Highly recommended.

Just do it !. A fantastic 45 minute walk along the coastline . Can be crowded on a sunny weekend, and if you don't like stairs or ups and downs - try sitting on the beach in stead. Best thing is you pass several little coves and beaches like Tamaramma where you can stop, have a swim, grab an ice cream or just people watch. If you get tired or it starts raining there are lots of places you can shelter and grab a cab the rest of the way.Yoyu will see:WhalesBirdsWavesRocks of all shapes and sizesBeautiful peopleUgly peopleSeals SurfersBikini BabesKidsYachtsIts great - you have to do it at least once.
BEST OF WALK OF THE WORLD. Anyone who has the chance to visit Sydney has to take the time to complete this magnificent walk. Stunning views

The Best Walk Ever !!. Have been walking the coogee-Clovelly-Tamarama-Bronte -Bondi Beach loop for countless time. This coastal walk is still stunning and most enjoyable. The best ever !!Never really check the distance but I think it could be a bit over 10-12 km return. I am not a physically fit fit person. Not a walk walk fanatic one either. But this clifftop coastal walk is still my most favourite thing to do in Sydney. All you need is just a good pair of walking shoes, sunglasses, towel and a bottle of water ( don't worry. There are refill spots along the route. Clean and convenient) Easy walk along Coogee Beach, ups and downs n stairs/ steps followed by boardwalk along Clovelly, easy walk along Tamarama, Bronte and Bondi. You will be just a few meters to Pacific Ocean all the way.... It's a wow...wow...wow...in every turns...Beaches, cliffs, parks, bays, rock pools...icecream and cafes!!The views are breathtaking, trust me! Highlights are to the right of Coogee Beach, the board walk part at Clovelly, the Bronte approaching Bondi part. Love it !! If you don't have time, just walk to the right of Coogee Beach till the end. It's an easy relaxing 20 min walk with the ocean on your left. Spectacular!!If you are driving, there are plenty of free parkings at Coogee and Clovelly. Crowded on weekends. So, weekdays r much better.Happy walking,!!
Overrated. Long boring walk totally overrated I fail to see what all the fuss is about. It's a beach walk nothing more nothing less.
gorgeous. Absolutely the best thing to do in Sydney! and be rewarded by the gorgeous scenery and a cold beer at the end- either icebergs or coogee pavilion.

Take your camera. I had fun walking this trail. It was a bit confusing finding the start via the public bus. The bus driver was very helpful though. I took a lot of photos and had to choose which ones to hang on the wall.

Fantastic Sydney experience . If you enjoy walking and have the time, this has to be one of the best walks showcasing the beauty of Sydney! Couldn't be beaten on a clear winter day (make sure you have a jacket!). Wear suitable footwear for the walk, it is not all paved. It is slightly strenuous, anyone of average fitness will find it fine with a little puffing.

Beautiful Coastline. This walk is well worth the effort for Sydney locals and tourists alike. A visit to Bondi beach is great but the walk to Coogee from Bondi gives you a more fulsome taste of our beautiful coastline. The trail meanders around the coast on well worn paths, there are a few uphill parts but this is not a difficult walk. You pass through many other lesser known beaches which are much quieter for a swim than Bondi itself and passing through the old Waverley Cemetery is a real treat. Its residents have great ocean views and interesting head stones. (Great for photos)Take a picnic lunch and stop somewhere on the way or eat in the many places Coogee has to offer once you get there. The bowling club, three quarters of the way along, is somewhere to stop if you need a cleansing ale to cool you down on a hot day too. Summer or winter it is a great walk and if you love walking is quite doable there and back in a day.
Beautiful. This place is wonderful, amazingly beautiful. better to go on a sunny day. love it!!a must go,do! can go even without a rental car, easily accessible by public transport
Must do walk for any visitor to Sydney. If you have out of town visitors or just want to get away from it all. Must do walk for any visitor to Sydney
Good exercise, great view. Did this once and found it excellent ,certainly not easy but well worth it .It enables you to see a lot of that coastline from a different perspective

Beautiful coastal walk. A very pleasant coastal beach walk, easy to go by train and bus from the city. Amazing views, beaches different one from the others. Many good cafes, eateries. A short detour on the way due to storm damage on june.

Great way to exercise and see the ocean surf on the rocks and beach. This is a six kilometer walk that is just above the open beaches. Views of the surf, the surfers, the ocean rocks, the homes along the beach and the wide open spaces. We were staying in the CBD so we took the bus from Circular Quay, had a good tour thru the city and arrived within thirty minutes. There is a boardwalk around this coastal walk so the walking is even but there are lots and lots of steps. It is also windy around the beach peninsulas. It was also somewhat crowded on a warm Sunday holiday weekend afternoon. As a 60 something couple we completed the walk from Bondi to Coogee in less than two hours.
Walking . Excellent easy walking beautiful scenery with lots to see. Plenty of places to eat and drink and enjoy the views.

Lovely beach. Went to Bondi beach for the day, really easy to get to using train and bus.Really clean, lots of shops good facilities. Not to crowdedWould recommend a visit but probably very busy in their summer months

Coogee to Bondi Beach Coastal Walk. I've experienced this stretch of legs a couple of times...took longer 2nd time than my memory recalled lol. The outstanding views/places/stopping points take the edge off the exercise that doesn't come easy to me (looks in awe at the bods jogging past...!) Many great photo opportunities - just take a light camera and water. A chance to catch the sun, take some exercise, escape for a day of low cost activity that reveals a new scene around every corner. A cold glass of something alcoholic at the RSL Bondi is a lovely reward after paddling through the surf from one end of Bondi beach to the North end :)
Bondi to Bronte. A fantastic walk, relatively easy with just a few flights of stairs. Amazing views of the beaches as you walk along the edge of the coadt

My favourite walk. . This is my favourite walk to do! The view is stunning. Be careful on weekends as this is very busy especially Saturday and Sunday morning. As a matter of courtesy it's best to stick to the left so that runners can pass by you. It's everyone's path some use it for leisure others for exercise. I saw the whale migration earlier in the year while walking here but I walk here all year round because it's stunning.

Beach to Beach. One of the iconic places of Sydney is Bondi Beach although parking is a bit tight. From the right looking at the beach walk along the shoreline along the cliff face (not really that high) although is uneven and with stairs. Pass a another beach or two as you go and see the waves washing up against the rock. Pick a fine oreven overcast day - not so much fun when it is raining.

Must do while you are in Sydney. This is a beautiful walk, about 6 km but you won't notice it because there is so much to see along the coastline. Beautiful views wherever you look and an outdoor gym along the way if you feel like extra exercise. Great jogging track and whats not to like of clean fresh ocean air!
Stunning. I'm doing this walk with all my visitors in Sydney and everyone loves it. Take enough time and water, don't underestimate the distance.
Scenic Sydney. A fantastic way to take in a small slice of Sydney's eastern coastline. Relaxing and easy walking at no cost.

Beautiful scenic walk. I absolutely recommend this magnificent walk! Starting at either Coogee or Bondi, it's around 1.5 hours. We walked from Coogee, stopped for a well earned lunch in Bondi and caught a taxi back. The scenery is wonderful and I suggest carrying a bottle of water.

Gorgeous walk, dont forget your swimmers tho n swim half way. On my walks I would have a mid-stop by swimming in the tidal pool in Bronte on the way, and dont forget to stop by and say hi to the dead people with the million dollar views in the cemetary :)

Stunning scenery. Spent last weekend in Bondi Junction - walked down and did this - beautiful walk, not too challenging. Part of it still being reconstructed after being damaged in a storm. Finished it up with a lovely breakfast at Bondi Beach . Would consider living here just to be able to do this regularly

A great couple of hours in Sydney. The Bondi to Coogee walk takes you along the cliff tops of a wonderfully rugged coastline, at its best when the sun is shining and the sky is blue. The sea will then be a mesmerising greedy-blue. There are wonderful sections that have a wooden walkway which gives you excellent views and photo opportunities. The coastline includes a number of excellent beaches, with Bronte perhaps my favourite. There are great places to eat at this delightful little beach, as there are at either end of the journey, although I prefer Bondi for swimming. If you think a shorter trip would suit, then get down to Clovelly beach and walk to Bronte from there. It takes you on the walkway, past an amazing old cemetery on the top of the cliff and there are stunning views back for miles along the coast. There are buses from the city to Clovelly and back from Bronte, as there are at Coogee and Bondi. Stop on the longer walk to spend time at Tamarama, which has an excellent cafe on the lawn immediately above the sand line. The Harbor is a real attraction, but for many locals, the Coogee to Bondi coastline is one of the great things to enjoy about Sydney.

A wonderful walk. This is a walk I have been doing for sixty years. We generally take public transport to either Bondi or Coogee (depending on where you want to finish). I love walking through the historic Waverly Cemetery, reading the old headstones. During the Summer Sydney has "Sculptures by the Sea" which is between Bondi and Bronte well worth a visit. There are numerous cafes along the way and of course the glorious beaches where you can cool off or just admire the view. Good public transport available.

A lovely walk on a sunny day. This walk took us oldies (in our late 60's) a couple of hours, with a stop or two here and there to catch our breath, as there are some steep sections and long sets of stairs here and there. There has also been quite a lot of damage to sections of the walk caused by the last East Coast Low, which have yet to be repaired. This necessitates detours around certain sections which can be a little tiresome, but the walk is well worth the effort, affording lovely views of the coastline, and beaches like Closely, Tamara and Bronte along the way.
Great walk. Excellent views , good exercise takes about one and a half hours if you walk from Coogee have lunch at Icebergs ! You won't regret it

An absolute must, Sydney beaches at their best!!. Having lived in Clovelly for many years, this walk is something locals and tourists alike love and use on a daily basis (even if a little rainy!)... Make sure you stop off in Tamarama, Bronte or Clovelly for a juice or coffee on the way to Coogee - plenty of places to refresh yourselves along the way as far as swims go also. Try some barefoot bowls at the top of the cliff at the Clovelly Bowls Club too. Coogee has lots of cafes, eateries, boutiques, bars, etc. Enjoy!!
Worthy Walk. One of the best coastal, beach walks you are going to do. Scenery and views are amazing and the beaches are vastly different.
Stunning sea views. Best coastal walk - a lovely way to spend a morning walking, and wonderful options at either end for breakfast, brunch or lunch.
Amazing Walk. A lovely walk on a sunny day, especially during the Sculpture by the Sea festival. If you are lucky you may see a pod of dolphins cavorting in the sea.

Amazing views the whole way. This is a gorgeous coastal walk which takes you past Tamarama, Bronte and Clovelly. You can stop at Bronte for a great meal along the way. This is a very popular walk with tourists and locals. There are some stairs involved. There are a few playgrounds along this route.

A walk to meditate and relax. I have completed this walk many times in my life - have not been there for quite awhile. My father and I walked it from when I was about 7 years old for years, quite often once a month. We lived close by. When I was around 12 I started walking with friends or on my own. The walk has magnificent views and is very calming. It's also beautiful in the middle of winter watching the waves go against the rocks and watching Bronte Beach disappear when the walk has a corner to go round. I used to go in the City to Surf (I was living in Coogee then and my parents still lived in their house in Bronte). After the City to Surf I would then head off on the walk from Bondi to Bronte, call in at my parents' place then walk home to Coogee. It's really a wonderful, pleasant scenic walk. Also, I used to take my grand-children and my dog on the 'Coogee walk' and walk up those 500 stairs regularly.When there are not many people around, the walk and surrounds are so much more relaxing.

Breathtaking views and great for all ages. The walk is absolutely fantastic and you can make a day of it as you are walking through some of the loveliest beaches around Sydney! All have swimming area and toilets as well as food and other facilities. You can take a picnic but for the length of the walk I would recommend just have something on the way or at the end.Bondi to Coogee seems a bit easier but Bondi beach is much more GRAND to finish at. Both have great public transport access with Bondi being closer to the city.

Saw whales and dolphins. Also beautiful Sunrises and Sunsets.. We lived in Clovelly and 4 times a week we did this beautiful walk for nearly 3 years. It is so refreshing to walk alongside the sea and smell the beautiful fresh salt air on our walks we saw Dolphins, whales and also the Beautiful sculptures by the Sea, which is held every year with sculptures and fantastic artistic creations.Recommend this walk for everyone. Afterwards you can stop in and have a beautiful breakfast, lunch or dinner at the many beautiful restuarants in Bondi and Coogee.

Get fit with scenic view. The Bondi to Coogee coastal path is a great way to enjoy the scenery and get fit. Go with friends or jog along it to take in the amazing vista which can be a challenging yet rewarding 6km. On a summer's day, go early in the morning or later in the evening but dress according to weather conditions and take a drink bottle to stay hydrated.
Good little walk. Enjoyable walk of around 6km. We did Coogee to Bondi to avoid the parking issues, stopped for a nice bite to eat, then did the return trip
Great Walk. Lots to see. True taste of Sydney. I felt very lucky to do this walk. You can not beat the natural beauty of Sydney's coast line

Easy walk, nice ocean view and beautiful rock features. This coastal walk suitable for everyone. It is an easy walk with very nice ocean view and the rock features along the way are amazing. The best time to get there is October/November when the Sculpture by the Sea exhibition is on and all the spring flowers blooming. It is good to start the walk after having breakfast or lunch in one of the nice café at Bondi beach.

One of the greatest coastal walk in Sydney. All visitors should do this walk when in Sydney! It is a lovely walk and every beach you see is wonderful. Bondi to cooge beach is about 5.5 km of walk. So, if you are not used to walk, be prepared - there are lots of up and down. Bring your hat, sunglass and water! It is very hot in sunny days and lots of parts without shadow. If you are tired during the walk, you can skip and take a bus.
Not to be missed!!!. A spectacular and unique to Sydney, beautiful walk along the coast that is not to be missed!Can't recommend it highly enough!
Wonderful coastal walk. What a very beautiful walk this is. I've walked it a couple of times, and it's just gorgeous in any weather. And dog friendly, too. Definitely one of the best in Sydney.

A Walk Not Wasted. This is a walk not to be missed except on a wet day. Bondi to Coogee is an elevated coastal walk along the sandstone cliffs of South Sydney taking in the cities most beautiful beaches along the way. Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly & Coogee. It is also the location of Sculpture By The Sea if you get you're timing right. And a great location to see migrating whales. There is also the Bronte Cemetery which has the best plots in Sydney, views to Eternity. The walk is not too strenuous but a good pair of walking shoes is recommended. It will take about 1 hr 30 minutes depending on your fitness. And at the end treat yourself to a coffee at the refurbished Coogee Pavilion, that is after your swim at Coogee Beach of course.

Water's Edge Walk. Stunning views on the very edge of the coastline cliffs. Well worth the walk (even if you only do a part of it). There are some steps involved, but mostly it is an easy to medium walk. It can be busy with other walkers or joggers, but this is seldom a major problem unless you are walking there during the "Sculptures by the Sea" exhibition in November, when I would recommend you get there as early as possible (and preferably on a weekday) to try and avoid the hoards.

A perfect afternoon stroll even in winter especially on a sunny day.. Perfect walk to have a stroll after Brunch/lunch and show visitors our beautiful coastline. loads of things to see for all ages and interests.
Beautiful walk, best on a weekday. It's a beautiful walk but is always super busy of a weekend. If you have the chance to do it during the week it's much better.
Lovely coastal walk. We walked this beautiful scenic route on a sunny winters morning after a lovely breakfast at Speedos cafe in Bondi. I would highly recommend both.

Everlasting coastal memories. Whether for a Sydney sider or a visitor, taking in this breathtaking walk is a must. From the iconic beaches to the cliffs and the seas crashing into the shoreline, it all creates a beautiful everlasting memory. Also a great way to earn yourself a big breakfast at either end of the quite hilly walk. If you can do it on a weekday all the better as there is quite a bit of weekend traffic.

An Amazing Coastal Walk. I've been on this walk a few times and every time it has been amazing. I would suggest going when the weather is cool but the sun is out. What to bring: Grab a light coat with you but one you can wrap around the waste, some sunnies and enough sunscreen (because that Australian sun is killer).I'd recommend walking along and discovering the little nooks and caves that are off the beaten path and don't rush the experience. Sit down on the cliffs and watch the ocean waves--you might even spot a whale if it's in the right season.

incredible way to get some fresh sea air and exercise too.
