This walk can be as long or as short as you want...great exercise with hills and stairs at various points....stunning scenery, over the pacific ocean and stunning beaches to stroll past...there are kiosks to buy a drink or snack to sit on the beach, or the numerous chairs and watch the waves roll in.

Great views and enjoyable exercise. This coastal walk is so easy and enjoyable. There are paths all the way and you get to walk along with the ocean at your side. There are also cafes along the way if you need to pause and have a coffee or drink or you can just stop and watch the surfers. Sandy beaches and clifftop viewing are all there. And seats located right at the best views! If you're lucky, and it's the right time of year, you may see whales making their way along the coast. At the end of the walk you can feel good about the effortless exercise and either stop and have a coffee in Coogee or catch a convenient bus back to Bondi.
Fantastic experience. Caugh the bus from Central to Bondi beach and walked to Coogee then got the bus back - amazing walk if the weather's good!
Sydney at its Best. Just one of the better ways to see the sights of Sydney. Plenty of stairs and other people but still a pleasant way to spend a few hours. A must for any Sydney visitor.

Best walk in Sydney. I must do in Sydney if you have a spare couple of hours. If you're lucky you will see whales (winter months), super models (both sexes), dogs of all sorts, sculptures (October - Bondi to Tamarama stretch), surfing and a mismatch of humans from all over. At present, the Bondi to marks park stretch is closed (due to the big storm in June) but the detour is well sign posted.

Great Coastal walk. Very easy walk of about 60-90 mins. duration The view is fantastic along this paved coastal path and at this time of the year, it is not too hot but just refreshing. It can be a bit windy, so warm clothing may be necessary. Half way between Coogee and Bondi Beach is Bronte beach where you can have a short coffee or lunch break. Admire the wind swept vegetation along the way.
What a walk!. If you like to walk and enjoy beautiful views of the beach and the sea, and still make a great exercise, here is the best track!

Great Walk for a nice Afternoon. This is a great walk for a nice Sunday afternoon, in summer with plenty opportunities for a swim. Easy to reach via public transport and the return can be done with public transport as well.
Perfect Beach Day. It was a great walk, with mesmerizing scenery and great beaches. We would walk and stop whenever a beach looks good of a swim and a cool down. The best part was Bondi rock pools.

Well worth the walk. We had a free afternoon and it was great weather! The coastal walk is so nice its very beautiful with great views every direction you look. It is a bit hilly and quite few steps so not recommended for those who have trouble walking far or quite unfit. There are a lot of runners and your constantly moving left to right or right to left but luckily we did ours on a week day and around 2pm so wasn't full of tourists and had free space to move. I would recommend to do it because it is lovely and nice way to spend your afternoon with great views.

Sydney adventure!. This stunning 6km walk along the Sydney coastline is a scenic must-do and great exercise to boot (look out for the jogging Sydneysiders). The walk takes in Bronte & Tamarama beaches, Clovelly, Waverley Cemetery and Gordon's Bay with plenty of swimming opportunities, places to sit and relax and plaques explaining the history of the various stops. Give yourself a full day to enjoy this awesome walk and take in the views.

Stunning. I was afraid we would not be able to do this walk because a month ago a storm had hit and taken part of the trail out, but they had it well marked detour back to the path.My son and loved the view and stopped in many places to just watch the ocean! My son also made the comment that it was a great place to propose to ur girlfriend. At times u felt like you were the only ones on the trail.

Incredible Coast Line!. Strongly recommend doing the Coogee to Bondi Walk - it's an easy walk (took us a little over an hour with many photo stops!) and the views are incredible!! I do this walk each time I'm in Sydney, it doesn't get old!

Lovely views . We completed this walk in winter and started at Coogee to arrive in Bondi in time for sun at midday. The walk was pleasant with lots of opportunities for photos and spots to stop. A lovely way to spend a morning.

Beautiful views!. We were lucky enough to have a beautiful day in Sydney considering it's their winter season. We took full advantage of the day. The walk is quite easy even for kids and there are plenty of points to stop and just take in the view. One of our favorite spot was at the Icebergs Bistro for drinks and food. Find a seat on the balcony with views of the ocean and their pool. You can either visit before or after your walk. Just Uber it back. It's one of our most memorable moment of our trip.

Beautiful coastal walk.. Although partially closed, the walk we did was a gorgeous view of the beach, the town and the beautiful Coral Sea. Although it was Australia's winter, there were still people swimming, most with wet suits and stinger suits. I was especially intrigued by the Icebergs pool, pictured here. Would love to return for Australia's summer as I'm sure it is an amazing, fun town and beach then.

Coogee to Bondi walk. My friend & I did the Coogee to Bondi walk, it was so worth it. We woke-up early (early for us anyway) at about 6:30am & set off. Couldn't believe how many people were already out & about & exercising. The walk one way took us about 1hr & 15mins but we stopped along the way & took photos. Really glad we did it, the coastline is beautiful.

Beautiful coast line. This is a great place for a little walk or a long one if you do the whole route. Take a picnic enjoy a few beers and watch the beautiful coastline rolling in a few breakers. great place.

Love this walk. Even though parts of the path had been damaged by June storms (Waverley cemetry and the last part going into Bondi), it was still a fantastic walk. The bays are beautiful ans we enjoyed it as a family for a couple of hours before going in the sea at Bondi. We even saw a whale out at sea (worth taking a little pair of binoculars in your pocket at this time of year).Go do it!

Great walk . We did the bondi to coogee in July and the views of the cost were amazing!There had been some damage to the coastal path but it didn't hinder our progress toward coogee were we had a fantastic meal.

Stunning! . What a fantastic walk this is!The views are incredible with a photo opportunity around every corner! If you don't walk very well or have little ones this might be a bit difficult in places. It's a fair distance, longer than I thought, which was great. The best spot is up on the cliff edge, next to a kids park. The views across the bay and ocean are stunning! If you visit a Bondi you MUST walk this path! :D

Great way to spend a morning. Beautiful coastal walk ticking off some spectacular beaches and views along the way. Plenty of places to stop for a juice or a beer too.A must for anyone visiting this part of Sydney, especially in the summer months.

Beautiful relaxing walk. Did this over a weekend. I was amazed at how busy the walk was. This scenic route is amazing and caters for pedestrians. It's quite a distance though. Only negative is the part where you have to walk through the graveyard because they are still fixing the walkway there.

Amazing Views. What an awesomely amazing walk. 6kms along some of the most beautiful coastline ever. Make sure to take a camera so you can get some of Sydney's iconic beach shots. Best to do early in the morning and watch a sunrise come up over the ocean. Not so amazing on cloudy/overcast days.

Gorgeous day with amazing views!. I really enjoyed this walk. That said, I don't think that it's necessary to walk all the way to Coogee. The second half of the walk wasn't as scenic as the first half. We took about 3 hours to complete the walk (we stopped to take photos every now and then). It isn't a difficult walk at all, just a long one :)

Gorgeous Despite Damage. Do not let the small tropical storm-damaged portion of this walk discourage you. It is beautiful and had we not gotten there so late, we would have walked the whole way, but the sun set. The moon on the water was almost surreal. Also saw surfers in wetsuits, so that was fun to watch.

Bondi to Coogee walk in reverse. We used our Opal card for the train and bus from Sydney CBD and did this walk in reverse from Coogee Beach to Bondi. Coastal, cliff path very easy to navigate and doable even for families with children. Hard to believe this stretch is part of Sydney city because of the beautiful beaches and ocean. Impressed by volunteer surf rescue teams at every beach. Two delightful surprises along the way........Seascape Café at Coverley Beach and Waverly Cemetery. Don't forget your sunscreen, hat and water! If you're able, take a towel and dip in the ocean but watch the surf doesn't get you. In total there are 5 beaches along this walk and each of them with a different atmosphere. Along the way there are some stretches with wooden stairs along the cliff which I was still able to navigate with my arthritic knees.

Great exercise and beautiful views. This is an enjoyable and scenic walk which gives you a great workout in the process. There are water points along the route where you can have a drink or top up your water bottles. Bring along a picnic and enjoy a meal in the outdoors enroute.
Stroll along the beaches. The Bondi to Congee walk is an easy stroll along some of Sydney's beaches. Take a bus to Bondi and walk to Congee and back to get the view from both sides.
Relaxing and breathtaking . Nothing more to say: either you want to relax or having a good time walking with a friend, is always a special moment.

Natural and Beautiful. See Sydney Harbor AND the Ocean.from may viewpoints.On this walk much of the time you don't feel you are in the City.You are up and looking at all the MANY Harbors of Sydney and the Main Bay where it opens to the Ocean.

peaceful and beautiful. along with the coastal walk, we just felt relax and peaceful. people were jogging, walking pets, doing sunbath, swimming. the ocean view was picturesque. it's a good place for a weekend.

Fantastic walk. We walked all the way from Bondi to Coogee beach and really enjoyed it. The beaches, all of them, were gorgeous, each in its own way. Very clean waters, organized beaches, a place to grab something to eat in every beach and public toilets everywhere. It even had some extra exercise equipment along the way, for extra fairness. Just do it!

Amazing and a Must. If you are a local or a tourist this one of the country most enjoyable walks both for the scenery and the great exercise you also get. Also the cafe on the way that are a must try.
Lovely walk. We walked the opposite way - finishing at Bondi. Beautiful walk along the coastline. Can get busy with joggers though!

Amazing sceneries and beautiful beaches. Surely a must do if time permits. My walk ended at Bronte beach as I had limited time. Bondi to Bronte took around 90 minutes including stops to take pics and relax. Don't forget to take the steps down at Mckenzie point to the rocky beach. Some rennovations were being done on the trail so there was a slight detour enroute. Its winter now so the beaches weren't so crowded which makes it better as a tourist to take pics on the beautiful beaches all along the walk. Washrooms and eateries are available at all beaches.

Beautiful walk. Loved this walk. Magnificent views. Even my 10 and 11 yr old kids were able to do it with no problem. There are a few places you can stop to go to the bathroom. You can also stop and do lawn bowling along the way. Due to a recent storm there are a few detours during the walk which are very annoying because they make the walk considerably longer than it normally is. However one of the detours is through a cemetery that I never would have seen before but was really beautiful. I highly recommend the walk (even with the detours).
Beautiful walk. Lovely walk from Bondi to Coogee - not too hot in August so easy to do, but might be more tricky when temperatures are hotter. Well worth doing.

A great introduction to the beauties Sydney has to offer. This was easily managed from downtown Sydney through public transportation. We started at Bondi, where the view on the lead photo of this listing is taken, showing the Bondi Icebergs Pool. The beauty of the walk is that you can take it at your own pace, stopping to watch surfers, pet dogs, bird watch, or talk to some of the lovely people you meet along the way. It's easy to imagine, having done it, that if you lived here you'd want to head to the beach every day after work. Not too strenuous or too long, and if you decided not to walk the whole distance, you could quit early and still find public transportation home.
Nice little stroll. Little bits are washed away or closed, but you have to do it! Longer than you expect but a real nice walk and wish it was on my doorstep to do all the time!

Awesome. This is really a classic walk to do in Sydney with good transport links at both ends and lots of amazing views and places to eat. It's an easy walk with not too many ups and downs - we did it easily with a 2 and 5 year old, including carrying a stroller at times. No worries.The coast track is being repaired in a few places at the moment but the diversions are small and the whole experience is not really negatively impacted by those.Highly recommended for tourists and locals alike.
Excellent thing to do in Sydney. Take two hours and do the Coastal Walk, from Bondi beach to Cogee Beach. It's awesome. The walk is perfect, comfortable, and the views are amazing.

Walking the dog. Have done this walk many times and without a doubt it is one of those moments! If you have never done the walk you should go Coogie-Bondi and back just for the effect of seeing Bondi first from this point. Unfortunatly June storms have cut of bits of walk temporarily but diversions well marked and not that bad. This walk involves steep hills some steps, sometimes many runners, walkers and dog walkers which makes it better, trust me. For me a highlight is the Waverley grave yard on route...absolutely a bizarre moment first time.

Beautiful easy walk. . This is a easy picturesque stroll. Take it easy and it won't be to much, also if you go early or towards dusk it isn't too hot. Lots of beauty spots along the way and places to eat or drink. Well worth a trip.

Great Walking Experience - A 'must do'. I found this walk to be very uplifting and scenic. I had to keep stopping to take in the views of the sea. Lots of nice photo opportunities too. The sight of the lovely Coogee Beach is rewarding.

Amazing views!! . We did only half the walk as we felt it was a bit too long for us but couldn't fault the views!! When we did the walk, some of the path way was being renovated so we went off through some of the street area but it was well sign posted! Totally worth doing for the views of each beach!!

An absolute must do!. We got the bus out to Bondi from Hyde Park and walked to Coogee then got the bus back to Sydney Harbour. It's so easy to get to and only about $2.40 each way. The buses run very frequently. The walk is beautiful and well signed. Unfortunately some of the path was destroyed during the storms but the signage directs you along an alternative route before bringing you back on track. There are a number of beaches along the route and the views are stunning. We stopped for lunch at a beach restaurant not too far from Waverley Cemetery. It's an easy 6km walk and if we'd had more time we would have walked back to Bondi to catch the bus.
What a beautiful walk. We had such a great walk, the coastline is stunning & would recommend it to anyone! Low to moderate fitness level, plenty of water taps along the way.

Beautiful! A must-do!. We did this walk recently and absolutely loved it! It's quite easy to get to Bondi Beach by bus from Sydney, and I'd suggest that you do it during the week if possible because I've been told there are many people on the weekends. The views are gorgeous and you get up close to the sea at multiple occasions. Parts of the walk are closed now due to some damage from the storms in June, but the detours aren't too bothersome. One of them is through the cemetery, which sounds creepy but it's actually quite pretty.
Quite a walk. Beautiful scenery and well marked. Some hills but great views and you can stop and take the bus back to Sydney at any beach
Gorgeous kind of workout. This walk is best done in sneakers rather than thongs/flip flops but isn't too tough. It's a lovely way to exercise while admiring the gorgeous Sydney coastline.

Walked it in January 2013. Its was a new experience for me walking straight to the Ocean. The coastline is very high and the there is a well prepared cliff top coastal walk with beautiful scenarios. I took lots of time and did not harry up. There was Cafes and small restaurants and I was having my lunch at one of thees. There are many opportunities to have a swim along the walk as well as places to enjoy a coffee and ice cream. There are even places for barbecue. I toke the regular local bus from Sydney to Bondi Beach and returned also by local bus from Coogee to Sydney.
Dreamy. Take the time to do this walk. Favorite of my vacation to the Sydney area. Absolutely beautiful and not many places in the world like it.

Great walk with fabulous views. Lived in Sydney nearly 30 years never done this walk before , tooks some English relatives on the walk from Coogee to Bondi last Sunday. Not a bad winters day Coogee was busy but we found somewhere for lunch then started the walk. The views are great all the way along, the walk is different around every corner and its an easy walk. Take your time and take in the scenery. Bondi was busy when we arrived about 4pm for a beer in the pavillion before getting in a taxi back to Coogee where we parked the car. It was very busy on Sunday everyone was out with thier dogs enjoying the mild winters day. I will go back during the week with my dogs they will love it.

The Coastal walk is a must do!. The Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal Walk is one of the must do's in Sydney. The view over the coastal line and ocean is breathtaking. Don't forget to bring your camera. I would highly recommend to wear comfortable walking shoes, take enough water with you and use sunscreen.

One of the great walks around Sydney. This is a great way to spend a morning or afternoon. It is a relatively short walk (Approx 2 hours) and winds its way past a number of small beaches. There are many opportunities to have a swim along the walk as well as places to enjoy a coffee, ice cream or even a picnic. I would describe it as an intermediate walk as there is not an excessive amount of steps and I didn't find it too difficult and I am not a particularly fit person. This walk is very picturesque and finishes at Bondi Beach. You can catch the M50 from Park Street opposite Town Hall Woolworths, which will take you to Coogee Beach and the walk starts from here and there are many buses which connect to the city

Lovely walk but watch those joggers. This is s lovely walk along the coastline with beautiful views , but, watch the joggers they will knock you over especially between Tamarama and BondiThere is a number of steps up and down do its not disabled friendly at all . In Winter you might spot whales from one of the headlands November is sculptures by the sea as well which is free on the Bondi Tamarma sectionParking can be difficult so catch a bus out and back from Bondi Junction station
Must do walk. Most of way has walk ways and is well planned Cafes and coffee shops all a few metres off the walk and even places to stop for a meal. Beautiful scenery and relatively easy walk

A Must do in Sydney. An amazing walking along the coast. Make sure to have swimming clothes with you as you will definitely do not resit for a quick swim on the cristal waters of Clovelly beach channel.The best way is starting in Bondi and finishing with lunch on the great Coggee pavilion restaurant.

A great walk in the Australian sunshine. My wife and I are keen walkers especially on a warm sunny day, and Australia has more than its fair share. The walk is quite hilly but has plenty of stops on route where you can purchase food and drink. Plenty of toilets and even places where you can get chilled filtered water. The views are stunning, just beware of getting Sun burnt. Highly recommended.
A Great Walk. What can I say. Just do it !! The route next to the ocean with possible views of pods of dolphins is nothing more than refreshing. A must do.

Nice postcard picture stroll. Nice easy cliff walk from Bondi Beach along the coastline. Please note that at the time of this writing reparation work to the pathway is going on, so a 10/15 minutes of the coast detour is in place, which was a pity. Still, plenty of nice views and perfect picture moments left. You can take a bus back to Bondi Beach along the way.

Relaxing walk on the shoreline. The walk from Bondi beach to Coogee beach along the shoreline has some breathtaking views. I happened to go on a winter Saturday morning, weather was perfect. Beaches were not much crowded. There are only few restaurants on the way. We walked slowly, taking pictures along the way. hoping to spend more time next time on the beaches. We took around 1 hour 30 minutes to complete the walk, one way.
Bondi beach - a class. Visited Bondi beach in july 2016 . What a place, clear water, nice surfing, excellent cleanliness, good joints to enjoy evnings with wine n chicken. Superb

Incredible View!. My daughter and I walked the Coogee to Bondi Beach Coastal Walk on a beautiful day. It is somewhat taxing but quite doable. I loved the view, the people exercising, walking, touring, swimming, and surfing. It was absolutely incredible. I would do it again.

Well worth the effort. We caught the 333 bus from Sydney to Bondi where we started the walk , it's fairly easy going but there are some diversions at the moment as part of the path is closed due to damage from a large storm back in June (?)The weather was really good - but I am not sure I would want to do this in mid summer

Beautiful walk. A very nice walk along the beach side. The views are just fabulous and diverse. It is made of several short (~1km) sections, and one can do at one day any number of segments. The walk is easy and suitable to families. One problem is that the walk is not circular and if you come by come, at least one of the group members will have to make his/her way back to where you parked. There are parts where you can deviate from the path and go on the rocks on the water edge. There are some not-so-obvious things you can look for like aboriginal rock paintings, and I advise you to look on the web in advance in order to know where to expect those.

Great walk/running. Bondi is a iconic beach of Sydney, this running will show you the best of the Eastern beaches.. the view to the ocean is amazing specially if you walk cooge to bondi.. stop in one of the restaurants around the beaches to have some lunch to the ocean view.. it's amazing!

Breathtaking!. The best coastal walk I've ever done. Actually started at Coogee Beach and walked towards Bondi. Some of the path is currently under construction due to storm damage. However, a temporary path runs alongside the original path and still offers exceptional views. If you find yourself on Bondi for lunch grab fish and chips to go from Bondi Surf Seafood. This is a must do in Sydney.

Simply gorgeous! . We did this walk for Valentine's Day with my partner and another couple. It took quite a while as we stopped a lot along the way to take pictures. I should say that we didn't stop for a swim at Coogee Beach but rather a little before in Gordons Bay. The water is warmer and nicer and there aren't as many annoying groups of people with screaming children. Take tonnes of sunblock and a hat, and super cold water (freeze it if you have to, in summer it will melt). Great date idea (maybe not first date as you will work up a sweat) and lovely day outdoors.

Very nice views, look out for detours due to damage to the walkways.. While on vacation in Sydney we decided to do a one-way walk from Coogee to Bondi back in June. The weather was clear but a bit on the cool/windy side. Just take a light jacket and you will be fine. Great views of the ocean, beaches, cliffs, etc. Sections of the walkway were damaged so there were detours. Make sure to read the signs to show you where to walk - we got to the cemetery and walked too far around which added about 30 mins to the walk. Ended the walk at the Bondi Icebergs club - also worth stopping in for a snack/drink while you enjoy the views. The entire walk took us less than 2 hours with the detour. Definitely would do this again.

Some of the best views in the world while you get some exercise - and free of charge!. This is a must do for the active traveller. When I first visited I used to run the route and return. Nowadays I make it a leisurely walk with a long break for coffee. Great views, some of Australia's most iconic beaches and a few inclines to get your heart working. A must do in daylight hours in good weather.

Such a good walk/views. I would rate the beaches along this route over Bondi, I felt Bondi was very overrated expected something more impressive. Some much better beaches in Aus, including the west coast which is so underrated. The walk was really nice and some good places to stop along.
Beautiful walk. Make sure that you add this to your list of things to do in Sydney just amazing views and every part of the walk is different

Beautiful views, whatever the weather. I've walked this path so many times and it's a favourite spot to take visitors. I never tire of the views and love stopping off in Coogee or mid-way in Bronte for a coffee by the ocean.

Lovely Coastal Walk. Really lovely walk along the coast with some stunning views. We did it on a cloudy day which made it pleasant, must be harder in the heat. Very well maintained all along route with some hills and steps along the way

Chilled. Definitely a must-do when in Sydney. A gorgeous walk that shows you what Sydney has to offer in terms if nature: beautiful coastline, crystal waters, breathtaking sunsets and much more.
You'll find many kiosks and bars along the way, where you can stop, eat, drink and keep on walking.
Seriously, a must-do when in Sydney.

Coogie to Bondi Coastal Walk. Have done this walk about 6 times now and it never is the same twice. Always something new happening, weather different, people walking fun exhibitions and just awesome views. Loads of beaches , cliffs to walk along, start with breakfast or lunch at Coogie and end up with dinner or a few beers at Bondi a 3 - 5 hour walk depending on your fitness. If a photographer like me it could take all day. Enjoy.

Good afternoon little walk. . We arrived in Bondi on a really rainy day. We decided to carry on with the coastal walk anyway. Part of the path had been diverted due to storm damaged. It was very difficult to get a stroller/pram round the path without two people lifting it up lots of steps. I think that there are much more beautiful beaches in the world but the waves are great to look at and the surfers are like no other in the world.

Doing it a few times per year. If you love watching waves crashing on the rocks, stare far away to the horizon of the ocean, stop in a nice fancy coffee bar, and if the weather is warm enough have a swim in one or two incredible beaches, well then please offer yourself this beautiful walk. I have to do it every now and then, and early in the morning, ideally at down, I like to jog as well. It's true, it can get quite busy with tourists, but I think it still deserves to be discovered.

Gardens By the Bay. Very huge garden with interesting sculptures around the area creates by various artist around the world. So many variety of plants, flowers, trees... It can get too crowded, but go during off peak or weekends. It's an intersting place if u love flowers, plants, gardening stuff. Beautiful!

Curious geology along the way. I took this walk with my friend. The path is good, and there are benches occasionally to rest or just enjoy the sea views. I liked that the path is kept simple, and passes by interesting geological outcrops and faces along the way, which are carefully left alone. There's an almost English feel to the seaside bathing pool and the seaside towns we passed along the way which is a bit nostalgic.

Scenic!!. It is not the shortest walk and you don't want to be here on an extremely windy day, but!!! It is absolutely breathtaking! The water scenery is just amazing and while walking there will be plenty of little cafes where you can power-up ;)
Beautiful clifs. The walk from Bondi Beach to Coogee was beautiful as you walked along the cliffs for a good two or three miles one way. Some elevation changes, but a good hike for a few hours.

Was closed due to storm. Had read about how beautiful this coastal walk actually is, and was looking forward to walk the entire stretch. However, due to the storm (June 2016), the walk was closed. There was a helicop on patrol as well. We enjoyed watching the sea/waves from the Bondi beach park and admired the brave surfers. In such a situation, didn't know what to rate; definitely not 'terrible,' and therefore, rating as 'average.'

Beautiful easy shoreline hike. We were travelling in Sydney during winter, but the sun was out & the views were awesome! Loved the beautiful beaches, glorious ocean & scenic hilltop vistas as we hiked easily up & down the beach trail. Highly recommend this to anyone wanting to drink in the beach coastline!

Beautiful! . I recently stayed in Sydney and did the Bondi to Coogee Costal Walk. It was beautiful! The walk itself was 6 miles and there is no cost. It was a very peaceful scenic walk. The beach water was so colorful. There is a few detours due to past weather damage. But, it didn't bother us. There are quite a few stairs to climb along the way. It would be a challenge for someone who is not up to this.The weather for us was cool and breezy, but no rain. Make sure to bring a jacket if you will be taking the walk this month ( August). One of the highlights of my trip! A definite must see!
Coastal Walk. The walk is interrupted by works after a storm in June 2016. There is signage leading you up through a residential area and back down to continue. Beautiful views on a nice day.

One of Sydney's Finest. If you love a good walk with views this is the place to be. Whilst a local, it's a tourist must as it's an inspiring walk. Walking by Icebergs in Bondi gives exquisite views right from the start. I've walked this in overcast days and stunning days and both are beautiful.If you are quick, you can walk it return in 2 hours. Thought I would pass this along for parking information.

Maroubra to Bondi walk. We found this to be a very pleasant walk and one every tourist to Sydney should do. It covers all the major beaches south of Sydney harbour and although it is a long walk, there are ample resting places, benches, seats, cafe's, pubs & restaurants along the way. In the summer it would be a good idea to carry swimming gear for a splash in one of the many beaches along the way. There are shower and dressing room facilities on some beaches like Coogee & Bondi.
A stunning walk!. A beautiful walk along Australia's most famous coastline. Do allow some time for this walk as its not a slow one but it is well worth it in the end.
A walk to remember. I have done this walk multiple times and it never disappoints. It is perfect in all of the seasons (minus rains). Plenty of picturesque spots.

Must Walk in Sydney. If your in Sydney this is a compulsory walk.. From the Iconic Bondi Beach you walk the coast and hit Tamarama, then have breakfast or lunch at Bronte, head off for more via Clovelly which is divine.. Stop here if to much but the rest is worthwhile as well.. Whole walk there and back can be a all day trip.. The waves, the various beaches all have their own allure.. COMPULSORY.
Bondi Beach. We visited Bondi Beach today. The weather was however slightly not on our side. This did not stop us from running into the Pacific. This is a must see attraction in Sydney.
What an amaizng FREE thing to do!. Amazing on a nice day this is one highly recommended activity, fun for all the family. for lazy people like myself, its really not to long ;)

Very windy day, still very nice. We did the coastal walk from Bondi to Cogee. It was a very nice scenery. We had alot of wind that day and unfortunatly 2 parts of the walk were closed because of Damages after a storm in june. If these parts are repaired the walkway will be even better.

Great Walk but Portions Currently Washed Away. Great walk along the water. There are currently portions of the hike washed out due to a storm. Its a paved path a good portion of the way, so its easily accessible for people who cannot walk on uneven surfaces.

The Sydney Coastline at its Best. Whether you want to experience a short walk from Coogee to Clovelly or you're in it for the lond haul to Bondi, you will love the views this beautiful walk has to offer.Not only will you take in the familiar beaches that you know, or have heard so much about, you will discover the quaint out of the way cove of Gordon's Bay.You will share the path with those who stroll leisurely, fast pacers, dog walkers and runners.If the sun is out and there is an ocean breeze, you will not find a better place to get in some exercise whilst enjoying all that Sydney's coastline has to offer.
Coastal walk. Amazingly wonderful refreshing coastal walk.loved it from heart.its a bit long to walk but pacific views are beautiful.

Best walk in Sydney . If you love a nice walk get your trainers on and head on down there. there is a trail which is super easy to follow and it's drop dead gorgeous! Don't forget your camera as you walk all along the coast stop off and get a selfie at each beach you come across! Enjoy!!

Must-do Sydney Walk in the Famous Beach. I considered doing this walk through the organised tours, which ranges from $55-70. However my colleagues told me this was a walk I needed to enjoy and the group tour wouldn't let me experience the joy of being a local. So I ditched the tours and if you're adventurous like me get the bus and experience Bondi to Cover.Make sure you take the destination, Bondi Beach. The bus literally drops you at the beach. The journey from Darling Harbour or CBD is about 45-60mins. It's a scenic route so you get to take in the beauty and architecture of Sydney.It's winter but the beach is full of surfers--thisnisba lovely sight to behold.You must stop at the famous Bondi Iceberg pool where everyone takes a dip to prove they have been in Bondi. You must stop at the Waverly Cemetry and see the hundreds of graveyards dating the 18th century; a spectacular sight. And then you head for the Cogee beach where there are many restaurants. By the time you have done this stretch (7.5 km or 4.66 miles) you will be ready for a drink or a meal.If you're brave you can take the walk back and add another 7.5k to your distance . I really enjoyed it and of course noticed different things. If you feel you have had enough, then you can take a bus back to Bondi or the city. I would recommend stopping by in Bondi at one of the many cafés and slowly wind up.This was one of my best walks in Sydney.

Not recommended with Stroller. We made our way to there those days and it was quiet hard to get through the walk with a stroller. The views are amazing and it was worth the effort at the end. Our small also one enjoyed the well maintained playgrounds on the way.
Stunning!. Stunning view. Great place to do exercises or walk with family and friends. Nice beaches and restaurants around.
walk. easy walking taking in the sights, easy public transport from darling harbor worth a visit & a fine weather walk

Brilliant walk!. Have done this several times with friends and family. Each time we find something new (a new cliff cave or pool to visit). When the art installations are on, the walk becomes immensely crowded (especially on the weekends) but the art is normally well integrated into the walk. The walk is hilly with many steps, but it's not too bad. I did accidentally recommend the walk to someone who was 7 months pregnant (oops). I remembered the walk flatter than it actually is. There are a few remarkable open parks along the way that have an unobstructed view of the ocean. Spectacular. Start in Coogee w a meal at the pavilion and make it a day!
A must in Sydney. If you discover Sydney for the first time, that's definitely one of the few places to go. Sea, sea pools and surfers are at the menu...
3 hours coastal walk. It took us 3 hrs or little less to complete. I am a total beginner in hiking. The different oceans and rocks we see on the way are very relaxing and beautiful.

Great way to see beaches, rocks, people and more!. Excellent way to spend a few hours, got off the trail a bit to climb on the rocks too; was great! Ended up with a couple beers at Coogee Pavillion, great view and atmosphere. It was mid-winter, but the temperature was awesome (about 67F).

Great walk. I did this walk several times while I lived in Bondi and I loved it. It's any easy walk with great views.It can get busy at times, if that is something you'd like to avoid I would recommend going early morning or in the evening.If you fancy a longer and more 'off the beaten track' sort of walk, try carrying on to Marouba. Must do when in Sydney
Great day. Walked from Coogee to Bondi July 22nd great day weather was warm but not hot ,terrain was fair .A new section of path ment a little detour but only added to the pedometer

Whale watch. Why catch a boat when you can watch whales from the land for free? Fascinating walk around the headland with loads to see; whales and sharks offshore, surfers doing their tricks, the young and beautiful out for a jog, the other birdlife equally impressive. This walk is very busy but stop at the beautiful coves on route and enjoy a morning coffee or a spot of lunch.
Great costal walk. A very nice, scenic walk that isn't very difficult. We went the reverse direction so we could hang out at Bondi Beach afterwards.

What could be better than Bondi?. Bondi Beach is Australia's best-known beach. Bondi a favourite with international visitors, some of whom celebrate Christmas dinner there. The best way to see the beach and ocean is to take the walk along the ocean to Coogee Beach The walk is around 6 km ( (4 miles). The track has a few twists and turns. Waling time is around 2 and a half hours, not including breaks. You'll like it, there's nothing like being by the ocean.

BEAUTIFUL SYDNEY BEACHES WALK!. For a lovely day out for stunning ocean views you can't go past this iconic Sydney coastal walk. It's free and the scenery is to die for. Take your time or speed it up. I chose the lazy photo version with a lunch at Icebergs at the end of one way.

Glorious . At this time of writing this review, this coastal walk is partially closed with some detours due to some heavy storm damage. But you can still walk it, and is a stunning view of the ocean. We even saw whales!
Great Walk!. Wonderful scenery! Great beaches to stop at along the way. Did this walk with my family while on vacation and all of us enjoyed it!

A beautiful walk. We got a taxi from central Sydney and took about 2 and a half hours walking this lovely walk. The weather was perfect which helped and the waves were crashing dramatically against the rocks - so it is hard to fault. The path is clearly marked and we walked from Bondi to Congee which is about 6 Kms. Some parts were fairly long and steep but the views kept you going plus the drinking fountains supplied along the way. It really was stunning and good for the soul. There was a sense of community too along the way. We were moved by the Bali monument towards the end of the walk. We rewarded ourselves with a pie and a drink before setting back to Sydney.
A must do!. Especially if you're a hiker. If you aren't, then you can always go halfway to Bronte (and go back for the other half if you liked it)

Fantastic walk. This walk takes in about 5 beaches in total. It's a well used walkway and popular for joggers. A lot of the walk has amazing cliff views. Bondi is the end point which is quite commercial in comparison to the other beaches along the way. The route in total takes about an hour.

Breath-taking views. This is a lovely coastal walk and you need to allow enough time to take in all the wonders of this well known area. The seabirds are particularly interesting to view. There are many rocks etc to negotiate so make sure you wear the right kind of shoes for your walk. I was lucky because I had friends who lived locally to guide me through. Recommended.

Scenic and Tranquil. This route is a great way to spend part of the day, it can be as quick or slow as you make it and takes in some impressive coastal features. It is a great walk for photographers too!

My wife and I love to do this walk every time we stay in Coogee.. This is a pretty demanding walk with some hills and stairs to contend with , however it will be well rewarded with spectacular ocean views and some beautiful secluded beaches along the way.

One of Sydneys best walks. We do this walk several times a year and it never fails to impress. The scenery along the coast is amazing and we always finish with fish and chips to reward ourselves for the effort.
Cannot miss this on your trip!. We've been on holiday from the USA for over a week, and this walk has the views we've been dreaming of. Fabulous beaches and little stops along the way.
Great Exercise. A great walk, only spoiled because it starts in Bondi. Start at Icerbergs and ignore Bondi and enjoy Tama, Bronte, Cloe and Coogee.

A beautiful relaxing refreshing walk! Do it!. Wear sneakers don't rush it take time to soak up the sea air and the wonderful vistas and finish with a good sit down at whatever end you achieve. Enjoy the journey!

Undulating coastal path. Frequented by tourists and locals alike, this coastal path passes beside azure blue ocean and multi-million dollar houses. Its the perfect way to spend an afternoon and you can end it in one of Bondi / Coogee's fabulous bars and cafes as the sun goes down - dependent on which way you walk the path.

Probably most wonderful thing to do in Sydney. I chose this walk because my travel guide book strongly recommended it, and I was not in the least disappointed. Parts of the coastal walkway are closed due to weather damage, but the detours you have to take at the moment are small and well designated. The walk itself is overwhelmingly stunning. Everytime I turned a corner I was again mesmerized by the coast's beauty. It took me about five hours to complete the tour because I had to stop every other minute to take loads of pictures. Make sure to make a stop at the Three Blue Ducks (Macpherson St) for lunch. They are pretty good. Turn right right in front of Waverly Cementary and you get right to them. You can also take picnic stuff. There are several nice places to sit and you even find barbeque grills at one of the beaches along the way.If you are into geocaching, also bring your GPS! There are a handful nice boxes to find!

Bondi to Bronte walk. This coastal walk goes from Bondi to Coogee but most walk Bondi- Bronte and back, which is what I do.Weekends are too busy do head off on a weekday morning. I usually go mid morning then stop at Icebergs for lunch on the way back , just ensure you head downstairs to the club/bistro and not yo the upper level very expensive restaurant. Both have the same spectacular view over Bondi Beach. Its a regular for locals and a must for visitors.

Scenic walk. One of the most scenic walks in the world. Gets a bit busy on the weekends. The recent storms has caused parts of the cliff side footpaths to be closed however it the detours are adequately sign posted. Watch for the detour near Bondi as it has a lot of steps to take you back to the road.
Beautiful walk!. Start your walk with a breakfast at Icebergs in Bondi Beach. The walk itself takes you along the beautiful coastline.

A must do in Sydney. We were there on our last day in Sydney as we have some time before our flight home. Went for the short walk from Bondi. The view of the Ocean was spectacular and the walk second to none. We also saw some damages done recently due to the storm in Sydney. I am sure things will get back to normal soon. It's definitely a must do in Sydney. We love the walk.

A favourite with locals . Love this walk. This is easily one of the best ways to enjoy Sydney's sparkling coast line. And great for taking photographs. On a clear sunny day there's nothing like it. Start at either end, either Bondi beach heading south, or Coogee beach heading north and get great views of the surfing beaches in between as well, whilst you meander along the coastal walkway.The highlight time for this walk is when the annual Sculptures by the Sea exhibition is on, (Oct/Nov) but be warned... It's become so incredibly popular that most of Sydney and their dogs, kids, grannies, and out of towners visit in droves from sunrise to sundown and it's almost impossible to move!!!
Bondi to Coogee. Exhilarating walk! Quite a lot of stairs but the fresh ocean air and rugged coastline makes it worth the effort.
So beautiful!. I can't imagine the heat in Summer, but this was a fantastic Winter activity. Bondi itself still has lots of beach town character and the walk is unspoilt but any touristy junk.
Best on a weekday. Great 90 min walk - 3 hrs return or plenty of buses at each end. Not just for tourists but most non-joggers have imported accents.

super beautiful walk. I love this walk. It's best on a weekday when the weather is fine and not too windy. If you can't make it all the way to Coogee, you can turn around because it's just as beautiful on return. There are many places to get a snack or a full lunch--my favourite is Bar Zura at Coogee-- a reason to keep walking. But dozens at Bondi if you just want to go a little way.and more at Bronte.I do this walk many times a year. In winter you may see whales. I have see dolphins surfing several times.

Amazing one!. Must do if in Sydney especially in summer. Really nice walk along the coast where its possible to pick a place where stop to enjoy the beach. Really nice mix between naturaland urban environment

Beautiful walk. Did this walk slowly with some mates. It was hands down one of the best things we did in Sydney. The views of bondi are beautiful and the beaches you visit along the way are really nice. Definitely recommend

Great walk. A great walk to experience the beaches, inlets and cliffs. We walked from Coogee to Bondi but it would be good the other way also. Walked in February on cool day - would be good in almost any weather except summer heat (but you could stop for a few swims along the way). Buses at Bondi or Coogee to return you to your starting point (change at Bondi Junction).

A little damaged. A great walk at any time but you could be lucky between May and August and see humpback whales moving northward.Several sections of the walking track are closed at present due to erosional damage after recent storms, but detours are fairly well signposted. Toilets and refreshments are available at Tamarama Brach and at Bronte. It took this group of 65yr olds about 2 hours to complete the walk at a steady, relaxed pace ensuring they enjoyed a well-earned beer and lunch at the Coogee Bay hotel at the end of the walk.

Iconic Sydney walk. This walk is well loved by Sydney siders and visitors to Sydney alike. It is a walk for all age groups and levels of fitness as it is not long and whilst there are stairs in places it is not a hard climb. Careful when you go, in the morning there are many joggers and dog walkers. It is very busy during October when the Sculpture by the Sea exhibition is on but well worth a visit then, as it is full of quirky artworks that make you laugh out loud and some beautiful artworks, there is always one to remember. We took international visitors with young children on this cliff top walk with spectacular beach and ocean views, it was windy that day but stimulating there is a wonderful coffee or snack stop at Tamarama beach cafe we stopped there and returned but you can walk all the way around to Coogee. It gives you a brilliant feel for our Australian coastline and beach culture.

Love the walk. I live at Bronte and not far from the walk.The views are wonderful.Watch out for the cliff collapse at the southern end at the cemetery.Oh and while in the cemetery go pay a visit to poet's corner,There you will see the graves of Banjo Patterson and Henry Lawson amongst others of fame.The walk and the cemetery are icons of Australiana, lso see the Irish Monument

Absolute must if visiting Sydney. A bit crowded, especially on weekends, but a great way to get a feel for Sydney and its spectacular beauty and outdoor-loving people. Try to avoid weekends, and plan to be here during Sculpture By the Sea to squeeze in some art. If you like the views but would like to avoid the crowds, try some of the other lesser known coastal walks.

Cool walk.. Well worth the effort. If you get the chance to do this early, Sunrise take it! A beautiful coastal walk and good for all ages and capabilities. We saw Dolphins and seabirds as well as Sydney early morning fitness set. We have also walked it middle of the day and early evening.... changing light, changing sights. I recommend early morning best though... gets ya groove on for the day and Good coffee is available either end.

Great walk, with great views.. This is a lovely walk, suitable for all ages. There are lovely coffee shops along the way and also there are toilets. We had a swim at Tamarama, and also at Bronte where there are change rooms etc. the children enjoyed leaving the path at times and enjoyed the rocks exploring the rock pools etc. our family group ranged in age from 6 to 70+. We took a picnic lunch because of of some dietary requirements, great stop at Tamarama. Don't forget to take sunscreen and hats.
Walk. Walk was great. Beautiful views. Howver interrupted by detour as storm had damaged path. Very well used. Very cold windy day so rug up. Food expensive. Nice people.

Peak Hour Traffic. was most uncomfortable walk I have had . Very busy walk way with people and pets. constantly dodging runners from both direction, pets and trying to watch where ones foot goes as Animal Droppings littered all through the walk. No body seem to pick up after their pet . sorry was very uncomfortable walk . Couldn't relax. Scene was beautiful.

Great walk. This "Walk" is great for those who feel like getting some really fresh air while getting fit. It is a terrific means to an end. You can do it in a leisurely way or any way you wish. Along the route you are likely to meet plenty of others doing exactly the same thing, you can admire the fantastic ocean views, the beautiful harbour, and you can take a break or two, along the way, to have a cup of coffee and cake. Brilliant.

Nature at it's best. walk as short distance or all the way to Maroubra, Lots of places to stop along the way for a coffee , a drink or even lunch. Fantastic views and depending on the season enjoy the art, the whale watching or just the experience. Stop for a swim if you like. Anything is possible.

Amazing view.. Last Sunday my family went to Bronte beach. We saw the sign of coastal walk. So we decided to have a go. It was a beautiful day. The view is amazing along the coastal and we will definitely come back again. Good for a family day out.
Lovely. Its a really lovely walk on a beautiful day, if you love walking and love the beach do it!! You will love it!

one of the best Sydney metro walks.. For people who want to spend valuable time in nature but have not much time. In a couple of hours you can walk through several beautiful Sydney beaches and even have a swim on the way if got too hot. :)
Great , easy walk, classic Aussie beach scenery. A 'must do' if visiting or living in Sydney. Free and there's nothing better on a sunny day. Overlooking Sydney's most popular beaches.
Fabulous ocean front walking. My preference is to start the walk in Coogee and finish in Bondi. You have a great selection of restaurants and better public transportation from Bondi Beach.

Afternoon walk. Had a day off on a beautiful Sydney afternoon. From Bondi heading down the coast to Coogee was a great way to see a very different view of the rugged coastline and the beaches. Lots of spots to stop for a rest, a sun bake or a swim. A really worthwhile way to spend an afternoon.

Beautiful but recommend starting at Coogee. This is a beautiful scenic walk. However, I would recommend staying at Coogee as the scenery is more picturesque closer to Bondi. We started at Bondi and I feel that towards to range of the walk when you're getting tired the better scenery would have helped the motivation.

Beautiful Stretch of Ocean. Stunning, relaxing, perfect way to spend last day of school holidays. Love the new cafe at Tamarama which we could enjoy away from the crowds at Bondi & Bronte. Liked the improvements made to the storm damaged beach at Bronte.

Better do it early in the morning or on winter days. So you can enjoy it!. I did the coast walk in January at 40 degrees and we all got sunburned! In July (winter time in Sydney) it was much more comfortable! Sure, you couldn't swim but for a coast walk this was the best season! Everyone who comes to Sydney should do this. Next year I will show it to my boyfriend, a Sydney newbie. Everyone likes this walk, it's so close to nature and every 10 minutes you come to a different little beach!
One of the best training walk or run in the world. The beauty of the coastline the freedom, the people ,the coffee, and the minimum traffic makes the walk or run magnifique during spring or summer

Spectacular walk. Really straight forward walk with beautiful views all the way. Highly recommend starting at Coogee and ending at Bondi (much more transport options if you don't want to walk back haha)
best coastal view of eastern suburb beaches. If you are fit, love a walk and want to see the view then hop on a bus to Bondi Beach and do the coastal walk from Bond to Bronte and back.
Best thing to do in Sydney. I live here. As a local I love it. It gets very crowded on the weekends in summer. Go on a week day if you can.
Best of a city walks I remember. We did it every month while living in Sydney nearly seven year and it was always exiting as we did it 1st time.

Wonderful walk from Bondi to Coogee. Fantastic walk, but it can be a little crowded early in the morning or late afternoon. Try to go around 11 am to avoid crowds. Beautiful walk right beside the ocean. Well worth doing while in Sydney
Fabulous beach. Lovely walks all along the beach and cliffs. We saw a pod of Dolphins, Pelican, lot's of sea birds, a very interesting walk

easy iconic and memorable. this walk has invigorated possibly millions from many countries and all walks of life. Historic markers show how much of an attraction the area has been over the years,,,100 years before the Gold Coast, this was the place Australian went for Attractions... rollercoasters and the like....The walk is still there and the ghosts of the entrepreneurs and sideshow alley Bobs can still be heard...or imagined, ...though nature has won back its rugged beauty ... as these man made "marvels" have completely disappeared.... NATURE WINS..Walk it ..Australias most accessable look at our rugged coastline and iconic colours of the beaches....you will love it.
Bondi to COOGEE walk.. Superb views, cemetery worth a look.Walk isn't hard .Coffee at Tamarama beach is great. Lots of cafes at Bronte

The must do walk in Sydney. This walk is great anytime of year or weather but in winter dress for the conditions.My favourite times are sunrise or sunset.This is the home of Sculpture by the sea 20TH ANNIVERSARY BONDI EXHIBITION | 20 OCTOBER – 6 NOVEMBER 2016.Must visit but big crowds.The walk is popular with joggers and there is a small free outdoor gym.Take your camera and comfortable shoes so you can walk both ways which provides different views.I try to do this walk four times a year.The must do walk in Sydney

This should always be on your itinerary!. Where ever you start or end up, Bondi or Coogee you won't be disappointed.Start at Bondi at Speedos to grab your coffee and walk the path through Tamarama, Bronte up and across to Clovelly. Stop in Gordon's Bay for a quick paddle then start your ascent in Coogee. Finiah at the Pavillion for a well earned beverage or Barzhura for a late lunch.July- Nov is whale season and the chances are high you will see them. I've lived here for 5 years now and am never disappointed!All in all if you're taking your time, snorkelling etc this could take you half a day. If you're planning on getting your heart rate up then hour and a half max (time for a few selfies along the way).

Great part of Sydney. Views of Eastern Suburbs beaches, Sydney coastline and ocean. A bit crowded sometimes with joggers, etc, but very worthwhile. Close to city. Accessible by bus. Free. You don't need to do the whole walk (I haven't and I live in the area) but make it to Waverley Cemetery at least. If it's hot and you're thirsty then stop in at the superbly located Clovelly Lawn Bowls Club, located just past the cemetery. Order a beer or G&T and soak up a bit of Sydney nostalgia. Then head back to Bondi. Go mid/late mid morning. Finish by lunch. Best when sunny.

This is a must do for any visitor who has an average level of fitness and mobility. Do what the locals do, put on your walking shoes, pick up a water bottle and treat yourself to this coastal walk. Choose a day with a blue sky and a light coastal breeze (not difficult as we have plenty of those in Sydney) and you will be rewarded by absolutely stunning views, combined with opportunities for coffee stops if the need for caffeine becomes desperate. Yes the walk does involve a few steps and some slightly uphill bits, but the ocean breeze is exhilarating and did I mention those views?

Must see for all Sydney tourists. This is one of the best coastal walks in the world! You will not regret taking half a day to take in the view of Sydney's beautiful coastline and beaches. A testament to its appeal is that most of the walkers are locals!

Amazing views, fantastic walk.. We were lucky and managed to do this walk on a sunny winters day. The temperature was perfect. Walking from Cogee to Bondi, there are pathways all along the way and the views along the coastline as spectacular. Its something I definitely recommend that you do and I will most definitely be doing it again and again.
Awesome coastal line!. I've done this walk 4 times! The walk isn't too hard, with plenty of beautiful views. Highly recommended!

Beautiful Coastal Walk. when visiting Sydney this walk must be experienced. Terrific views up and down the coast. Only 4kms from CBD. Can walk either way. Bus to Bondi or Coogee and walk back. Lunch or dinner at either place and you wont be disappointed. The fish & chips @ Bronte along the way are good too.

Doing the walk will make you wish you lived here....... If you're a visitor to Sydney, this should be on your bucket hit list. Pick a sunny day, pack a hat, sunscreen, swim suit and water and away you go. Begin at Bondi or Coogee but I'd recommend the latter. In summer months avoid the weekend. It really is spectacular and between April and October you are highly likely to spot whales migrating and not far off shore. Plenty of places to stop and eat. Clovelly is the spot to dive in and if you have a mask and snorkel you will be treated to a festival of coloured fish and may even spot the local blue Groper. Not to be missed. Enjoy

clovelly walk. We went to Clovelly from Cronulla(via car) with the Dog to visit our daughter for lunch at her Clovelly apartment .After Lunch we walked around the pool to the dog area and climbed down the rocks so the Dog could explore the pools .Sea was up and there were a couple of guys (tourists ) who ran and jumped into Clovelly pool. I say tourists as it was freezing and middle of winter with snow falling up at Katoomba.Tourists! Plenty of walkers plenty of dogs all running with each other having a great time.Well worth the view and the walk .
Beautiful scenic walk. Pick a sunny not too windy winters day mid week and mid morning to miss the jogger.Take binoculars for a chance to see whales offshore. And enjoy.

Best walk with wonderful views.. What a lovely walk to take on a beautiful day, there are lots of places to stop and rest and take the lovely views of these beautiful City. It's not a hard walk to do so it's perfect for all fitness levels, just give your self plenty of time to enjoy it.

Coogee Beach to Bondi Beach. Decidedly one of the best walks in the world, sunset, sunrise mid arvo .. not recommended at night for it is all about the blue sea, the blue sky, the edge where the aggressive waves and boulders collide with the reigning civilization ... one view on one side isolates you and disconnects you to become one with the sinking sun and you turn around and are back exactly where you belong, posh cafes, tasteful eats, hot coffee or chocolate just right to encourage conversation and bond with your friends and loved ones. Every November it hosts the Sculptures by the Sea .. can get crowded at these times. What is more it is completely Free ...

My wife and I do the Bronte to Bondi walk every weekend. It's a great walk with spectacular coastal scenery. We always go to Papa Knows Best in Hall St for coffee too. A great place to relax at the halfway mark. This is a must for any Sydney tourist to experience. Walk near N Bondi is still cut off bit there is an alternative route.

Good to do on a cooler day. A nice walk along the different parts of coastline with refreshments along the way.There is also historical content along the path for those interested and lovely settings for great photo opportunities.

Essential sydney. Bondi beach is the essential 'to do' for a Sydney visit. plenty of cafes, juice bar, pharmacy, touristic boutiques. We spent a lovely picnic on the beach with the help of a nearby seafood shop who grill the fresh produce they sell. <3
A must do in good weather. This is a brilliant free activity to do in good weather. Be sure to jump in the pools along the walk, totally worth it.
OMG love bondi. Always wanted to visit oz and bondi was near the top of my list so did the full walking trip between as many of the beaches as we could and this was one of the best
Wonderful. It's a beautiful walk with a wonderful sight on the ocean! Unfortunately, a recent storm has destroyed part of the walk, so it's not feasible! PS: During winter is quite windy!
Invigorating sightseeing. Just a gorgeous walk - ocean, bays, cliffs and beaches, a great way to actually see the coastline, with options to stop and relax along the way..

Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal Walk. Great to do, even in wet weather, maybe not during gales but even when it is raining, the sea is spectacular. Take a bus to the start of the walk and a bus home from the end of the walk. Pack a picnic, stop for a coffee and if it's a hot, a swim. Weekends can be busy, other walkers aren't a problem but runners can be. Assist everybody by KEEPING TO THE LEFT! Happy walking.

wonderful experience!! . We walked from Coogee to Bondi on a cold but sunny day. The sun was out which made the day and the photos look amazing.I can imagine doing this walk again in summer and just going for a swim here and there. It took as around 2.5 hours to do it (6km) the views are magical. Housing around the area and so pretty and the bay's are so nice. Do not leave Sydney without doing this walk. You will end up visiting so many beaches including Tamarama, Bronte and of course Coogee and Bondi. We finished the walk in Bondi and went for lunch in a place called The Bucket List (good food and atmosphere).
Beautiful. Lovely walk along coast. Rugged in places. Well worth the walk, can be slightly tricky in a few places and there are steps in some sections
Perhaps the best city walk in the world!. Winter, summer or during Sculpture by the Sea in late October - early November this walk is invigorating and relaxing.

Fantastic introduction to Australia!. We arrived in Sydney for the start of our Australian adventure at 7am after traveling for over 20 hours. We immediately took to the streets and started our walk at Bondi Beach. What a beautiful way to get the day going. The walk is easy and the views are spectacular! Surfers around every corner, beautiful towns dotting the coastline and great places to stop for a drink along the way. I highly recommend doing this on a sunny day! We stopped and had lunch at the Coogie Pavilion which was delicious! Don't hesitate. This is a must do!

Great walk, but is not close. I started walking at 11 am from Coogee to Bondi, the walk takes you to many of the beaches and beach front homes, a cemetery and places to eat. Please be aware that this is not an easy walk as a lot of people will advise, it is 6-7 kms, but can take 2 hours. Take water (you can fill on way also) and something to eat also on the way.
View are stunning. The walk was excellent although it has eroded in parts so you need to take some detours.The power of the sea is awesome and this is a great place to see it

A beautiful walk on a beautiful day. To be honest we rushed this walk, my advice would be to take it easy and stroll along and take in the ever changing views. There are plenty places along the way to stop for a swim, a bite to eat or even just to sit and enjoy! The walking is easy on well defined pathways. No need for heavy walking shoes, training shoes are just fine. I'm sure we'all be back to walk it again, this time at a more leisurely pace

Beautiful walk. Beautiful walk on a clear day, I try to do some or all of this walk whenever I come to Sydney. If you come on a warm day don't forgot your swimming gear as you can pop in for a dip at beaches along the way. I recommend starting in Coogee and ending in Bondi so you can finish your walk off with a well deserved cocktail at Icebergs with a fantastic view over the pools and beach.

Great walk with phenomenal views and great local scenery. My wife and I went on this walk in the late morning and thoroughly enjoyed it, despite sections being closed for construction. This is a must-do if you enjoy the outdoors and coastlines.

Pretty but smelly.... Due to some recent storms there was a definite rotten fish smell in the air that you just couldn't escape. It did put a damper on our visit/walk. On the bright side there were a few gorgeous sulphur crested cockatoos and a man doing impressive handstands which made the scenery of more interest. We looked for a buzzing pub or eatery to take a break and passed since we didn't notice anything that caught our eye.

The Walk With a View . When you visit Sydney make sure you do this walk. Any direction is Fine. It is one of the most scenic walks I have done. If you have kids just do one way and take your time, enjoy the sights and get a taxi or bus back to where you started, if you have the time, Do the return. I've done this walk in summer and winter. In summer..... Take your swimmers and towel... In winter... Enjoy the view and hope your feeling hot enough to jump in the beautiful crystal clear waters. Once you complete your walk you have many cafes / restaurants and bars to choose from to enjoy a good rest and put your feet up.

Walking . Waverley Council state that walk closed till further notice. One wonders if the "council " will spend any money on local things instead of legal challenges. Sculpture by the Sea is soon and no activity on 70% of the coastsl walk that is closed

Changing Coastal Canvas. Take the trip from Bondi to Coogee stopping off along the way at the many local coastal spots of Bronte, Tamarama, Clovelly as you choose. If you manage the whole trip you will have covered the Eastern Suburbs beachside suburbs and the magnificent variety of beaches. The views are special and ever changing. This walk is best done early morning, or pre dusk.

Whale watching from the shore. One of the best coastal walks in the world! Great stopover points at cafes in Coogee, Bronte, Tamarana and Bondi. Whales sightings pretty frequent in season an lots of dolphins. Great public transport access at either end or at the various beaches. Not steep but some steps involved. Absolutely wonderful!

Don't miss out on this terrific walk. Started at Bondi and work our way round about 4 adjacent bays stopping off at cafes and bars to enjoy coffees, breads and beers.Amazing scenery and superb opportunity to catch some spectacular photos of your trip. Nowhere like it!

Gorgeous Coastal Walk. A great way to get from Coogee to Bondi, take in some of Sydney's most gorgeous beaches and at the end have a swim at Coogee and grab a coffee or some lunch at one of the many cafes
Nice walk. Good start to visiting Sydney! I did this walk on the first day I landed, really helped the jet lag and is a nice slow paced meander through some pretty coast line

Great views . The walk along the coastal cliffs is a great way to see the beaches and the coastline. It takes a couple of hours at a gentle pace whilst stopping to take pictures. Some parts of the path were closed due to storm damage but it was only a small amount of the pathway.
Excellent walk.
a good walk. took a leisure stroll and enjoyed the breathtaking view. the weather was kind and the walk was pleasant. a nice experience.

Spectacular scenery and an easy walk. The walk trail was well maintained and although there were parts of it closed due to storm damage the detours were well sign posted and easy to navigate. The scenery was magnificent.

Beautiful coastal walk. We enjoyed a wonderful sunny walk along the coast, with beautiful beach views. The boardwalk ensures easy & safe walking, without destroying the cliffs. I would recommend this walk to everyone who enjoys the sea air & classic golden sand beaches. There's also a cafe to enjoy a coffee while watching the surfers.

Best walk ever . This is my top list activity, bondi- coogee walk. Some day are packed, some day are nice and quiet but one thing that never change is the view. The view is super stunning! Always blue. Very relaxing. If you plan to walk to whole track I suggest you to take your bikini and towel. There are few nice beaches you can stop and chill out. There are cafes on the way as well.

Great costa walk. This is a great costal walk from Bondi. Get a view of some of the ocean topography. Some of the walk way was washed away however its a short detour. If you like to walk this is a good one.

Beautiful! A must do in Sydney. Such a lovely walk that shows Sydney at its best. Great to take visitors to or to go to as a tourist. End up in Bondi and go to Porch & Parlour or Jo & Willy's depot for coffee/brunch!

Glorious!. We started at Coogee Beach and made our way to Bondi, past breathtaking views and lovely seaside communities. It is a great way to see what makes Sydney such a unique place on earth. Bondi Beach is a great place to end your journey, as it has an active and interesting boardwalk as well as a picture perfect beach. This walk is a must-do!

Iconic Bondi Beach and pleasant coastal walk!. This is our all time favourite and we just enjoy coming to Bondi and the coastal walk to Bronte and Coogee in Autumn and Spring. You can watch the surfers or the skateboarders showing off their skills, the the awesome waves. Try the lunch at RSL North Bondi, a nice lunch stop overlooking the Bondi beach and the sea.

Great on a sunny Day. The walk is a must do if in Sydney, I have done it many times, but like doing it from Coogee end. When you reach either side the views are magnificent. Then a meal and a drink before heading off rounds out a lovely evening. A long walk, so ensure everyone has water and is fit for the walk.

Great walk and saw some whales. We did this walk from Coogee to Bondi Beach. Was an easy walk although littlest longer than we were lead to believe by our daughter haha. Easy manageable though, even in jeans. We saw some whales off the coast as well which was a bonus .

THE destination for any traveller to Sydney. I always recommend this walk when I get asked where to visit in Sydney. Beautiful views over stunning urban beaches. Swim at each one! Plenty of cafes in Bronte to recover at.

scenic, refreshing cliff top walk. loved this walk. beautiful way to see the beaches along this stretch of coast. its a little challenging, but you can take it at your own pace. finishing in bondi a bonus...and you can catch the bus back to the city. one of our recent sydney highlights

Fantastic easy scenery walk. This is a very popular walk. It is suitable for all ages, you could enjoy the beautiful scenery while you walk, take a break at one of the beaches in between. Coogee beach is beautiful as well. You could have a coffee or tea before you walk back or take a bus.

Pleasant Walk With Great Views. Alternates between beaches and points, with lots of rocks and interesting formations in between. Some of the route has been damaged, so there were detours -- one through a cemetery. Surprised and delighted by all the swimming pools built out into the ocean that get filled at high tide.
Superb views. Cannot beat the views from this walk. Recommend to take a refillable water bottle along with you to fill up along the way as the trek is long but well worth it!

Tourist or not, the walk is worth it. So the walk itself starts from Bondi (wherever you like along the beach, north end or south end) and you follow a well sign-posted walk heading south past the Bondi Icebergs pool and around the coast past the very pretty Tamarama Beach and onto Bronte Beach.We stopped at Bronte and turned around and walked back again, but I understand you can keep walking on to Coogee Beach.The walk is fairly easy (certainly not strenuous) and is along a pathway all the way, so its pretty easy going. One direction takes approx 45 mins, so an hour and a half or so, depending on exactly how fast you walk, there and back.On a nice sunny day you get a fair few people doing the walk, so try not to go during 'peak' time if you don't like some company!The walk itself is quite pretty, and well worth the effort - especially on a nice sunny day!Depending on where you're coming from; to get there we caught the train to Central, then changed and got the train to Bondi Junction. The 380 bus which leaves from the bus interchange at Bondi Junction station will drop you right opposite Bondi Beach.

Best thing we did in Sydney. Due to a recent storm, some parts are washed out - but I'm sure they will be repaired soon. This walk is absolutely stunning - not to be missed when going to Sydney. A bit challenging for kids and the elderly, but anyone in reasonably decent walking shape should be able to handle it.

Amazing panorama views. Such a beautiful easy walk to do with all ages. We started in Coogee and finished in Bondi. Along the way we also stopped for ice cream. There are many wee inlets to stop at on the way, it is quite a popular walk for many locals also.
Beautiful scenery. Beautiful scenery - lovely place for a spring/ autumn stroll. Walk takes around an hr - max 1.5 hrs - if stop frequently - good exercise path
Nice walk. This is one of the classic thing to do in Sydney. The walk is really nice, I really enjoyed it. Only bad point: could be crowded.

A beautiful walk. The Bondi to Coogee is beautiful and makes for great exercise. The walk is dotted with incredibly beautiful scenery and the bright blue ocean. Walking during the 'Sculptures By The Sea' is a real bonus.
A word of warning some of it is quite steep and may be difficult for those with a pram.

Beautiful views . With a hike this gorgeous, I'd expect it to be extremely crowded. I'm happy to say that this was not the case! Yes there were other people, but nothing crazy. The views were amazing, one of the best things I've done in Australia!

One of the most breathtaking walks. This walk is the best. The views are amazing. You walk around and among the rocks and cliff faces. Literally on the edge of the world looking out to sea at some points. A must do for any visitor to sydney. The only down side are the crowds. The weekends are packed with walkers joggers and dogs. If you don't mind a slow pace and lots of people doing the same thing then do it. The weekdays are much better.

Fantastic walk with beautiful coastal views!. This walk is not only great for exercise but you see so many beautiful sights. You get to look at expensive houses by the bright blue ocean water. We spotted some pretty birds and even got to see some whales from afar. Wear comfortable shoes!

Coogee to Bondi and Back. I am staying at a Airbnb apartment near the Coogee beach. This morning I decided to go for that famous walk that everyone seems to love. And I loved it so much that once I reached Bondi beach, I decided to sit at the beach for about 30 minutes and walk right back. Plan to do that tomorrow too. The best things in life are free.
Beautiful View. Beautiful beach for surfers. Wonderful board walk for tourists and people watching, shopping and restaurants.

Simply stunning. Everyone who's near the area should definitely do this walk! I walked from Coogee to Bondi (rather than Bondi to Coogee) and I would definitely recommend doing it this way because there are more shops and food places at Bondi to relax for an hour or two before heading back. It took me about 2 hours to walk each way, but I was stopping to take a lot of photos along the way. A small bit of the path has been washed away by the recent storms, but you could still go along the coastal walk, there was just one part which directed you through a cemetery rather than along the path. At Bondi there is currently an ice rink overlooking the beach, and also camel rides along the beach (costing about $25 for an adult). It was such a stunning walk and there were plenty of water fountains along the way as well as little cafes at each beach. All in all, a beautiful day and a great bit of exercise at the same time!

Beautiful!. Nice walk or run when sun goes down or really early morning when everyone is still sleeping. Cemetery on way is quite impressive. Lots of hidden spots! Can be quite busy during peak periods.

Beautiful views!. Did the walk in winter which made it far less crowded and quite pleasant as opposed to walking in the middle of summer. Easy walk with breathtaking views and great cafe options in both bondi and coogee for a pre or post walk meal

Beautiful . Gorgeous walk along the cliffs with great views of the coast and out to the Southern Ocean.We were staying in bondi junction so took a bus to coogee (about 15 mins away) then walked back from bondi at the other end.Some parts are a bit steep but im not particularly fit and managed it no problem.
