We took our time and stopped for plenty of photos and to see the beaches the walk passes, but all in it took us an afternoon.Highly recommended if youre bored of another day sat on the beach. You wont regret it.
Beautiful walk. Great walk for solo traveler or with friends. Beautiful sites and great bordering neighborhoods to visit when finished. Great views! A must do on your visit to sydney!

Absolutely delightful!!. My partner and I spent well over an hour walking from Coogee to Bondi, and we loved every moment. We stopped many times to take photos and appreciate the beauty of the coast. Lovely to see locals walking their dogs, people running and tourists all sharing the same experience. If you like walking and beautiful coastline, then this walk is for you. It's not very difficult, and stopping along the way to take photos makes it even easier.Enjoy!!

Great views to exercise with. For some exercise during our Australian holiday I managed to coax my 16 year old son to run the Bondi to Coogee Coastal Path with me. We had almost perfect running conditions at 17 degrees C in bright sunshine and a light breeze. Some of the Coastal Path suffered damage during the June storms and there are a couple of diversions in force; the integrity of the route remains pretty much the same with just a little additional distance. One of the diversions takes you through Wakerley Cemetery which I confess provided some additional interest picking out names on the graves. The route also takes you past the Bali Bombing Memorial which provides a poignant reminder of the 43 people from New South Wales who lost their lives.It's a great route for a run; great coastal views. A couple of cheeky hills and one longish set of steps got the pulse rate up. It's a downhill finish into Coogee to end the run on the beach and we rewarded ourselves with a well-deserved ice cream.

Amazing scenery. Amazing walk to see the coast. The local people were friendly and welcoming. The scenery is more than you can imagine - you are steps away from the water all the time. Would do this every day if I could.

Appetiser walk! . Spectacular, breathtaking walk.Beware of joggers early morning! On or of the rock platforms beside the path on the flat towards Tamarama keep eyes peeled to find the Aboriginal rock carving of a big whale and her calf. This is a great place to spot whales when they are migrating.

Unforgivable family moments!!. Describing such a moment i spent during the last hour of the sunset at Bondi beach is not easy without an artist to draw every beutiful details mixed together in one moment, beautiful and happily people smile and laugh every were around you , my kids were running forward and backward away from the great silver waves while seagull bards sharing food with people,with that moment I fall in love with this magical beach which indicate Absolute creativity of God in the creation of the universe.

A great hike. . Something to do with a group of people. This could be a tourist activity, but you see many locals doing the route too. On a sunny day, these cliffs look glorious and shows off Sydney in all its beauty. Loved it.

Gorgeous winters day. Always a lovely thing to do, no matter what the weather, the views are amazing. Need a little exercise and some fresh air? Nothing nicer than this walk, start with a coffee in one of bondi's great cafes and finish with lunch or just some shopping therapy...it's all there.

Must do this walk. Stunning, spectacular views from the headlands past little beaches from Bondi to Coogee. Unmissable. You cannot describe its beauty you have to do it. Put on runners or comfy shoes. Have a bite to eat by the sea . Sit and enjoy one of Sydney's most beautiful coastal walks. Enjoy!!
A walk for all seasons . A good work out, and fantastic views! Probably best in good weather, quite a good idea to take parents from out of town on this walk as it kills a few hours.

Sydney must do experience. I have done this walk many many times and it is just as beautiful. Perfect on a clear sunny day, summer or winter. Lots of restaurants and cafes at Bondi and Coogee and some places to stop at along the way. The best walk in Sydney!

This is a must see and do. One of the most beautiful walks I've ever been on, especially at sunrise and sunset. It is beautiful solo, with a partner, friends.. The ocean and beaches are magnetic and so good for the soul. Easy to medium walk.. Please make sure you walk all the way to the end!

Breakfast walk. One of Sydney's great pleasures. Get up early and watch the sun rising above the ocean , the surf rolling in and join in the enthusiasm for life which us Sydneysiders are so fortunate to enjoy . Reward yourself with a relaxed breakfast on the beach at Coogee and stroll back to the start . A relatively easy walk but plenty of steps. Can get busy later in the day over the weekends .

Enjoyable walk. Myself and a couple of friends did this walk was enjoyable to stroll along the coast line visiting parts that most people don't get to see I would advise anyone visiting Bondi to do this walk.

Amazing views!!. I think it is a must do in Sydney. The view of this coastal line is amazing! You will walk pass some very beautiful beaches and the walk is quite easy. There are some steps at the begining but afterwards it's mainly flat. It takes about 2 hours, depending on how breaks you take. I paused a few times to take picture and it took me 2 hours. Getting to bondi beach by public transport is also very easy. Lots of buses taking you to the beach from the train station. And there are nice cafes at Coogee beach so you can chill after the walk
Simply breathtaking!. The best thing I have ever done during my trip to Sydney. It is just simply amazing! Do not miss this when you visit to Sydney! I wish I could spend more time here!

A great walk, especially on a sunny day. We've done this walk multiple times and it never ceases to amaze us. The views are really stunning, especially when the weather is nice. You can see all the beaches that stretch from Bondi to Coogee and the cliff edges, all while seeing a panoramic view of the blue horizon. It's free, good exercise and great for families.
Beautiful coastal walk. Just do it! Some of the path was closed because of destruction after storm in june. But this is a must-do anyway, the rocks, the scenery...

A must in Sydney. This is a definite must-see to experience the true Australian lifestyle where outdoors relaxation and exercise come together. The cold does not stop the visitors from swimming, wearing bikinis and playing sports in summer wear.... the great outdoors. The walk is full of sights and sounds. After the famous Iceberg club, there were detours due to maintenance of sorts where the paths were directed around the housing / main road but other than that all was fun.

Easy walk for a nice Aussie Autumn day. It was a nice walk during a sunny Autumn day. Not too many people on it and the coastal views were really nice. Started at Bondi and worked our way down. Found our selvs at Waverley Cemetery and explored the site a little bit before heading to Bronte beach and chilled by the park. Ended at Coogee and picnicked by the grassed area. Over all the walk took no more than 3-4 hours with stops along the way. Take a look back every now and then to enjoy the views from each angle.
amazing. Great walk - peaceful and contemplative. An awesome way to see the force of Mother Nature up close. Slight detour in a couple of spots because of storm damage but no biggee

Unwind and just let go........ An amazing walk that reconnects you with nature. Amazing sea breezes, wonderful greenery and just a great way to energise taking in that sun wind and clean air. Sydney's coast WHAT A PLACE!
Nice. Walked the coast. Lots of nice views, beautiful beaches. See the surfers waiting for a wave or take a swim. Liked it

Australia with kids. Beautiful walk, a lot of stairs so it's quite difficult with a pram. Tamarama beach has some shade and a nice playground, Clovelly beach is very sheltered and has a playground as well.

Lovely walk on a summers day but watch out for the stairs. This is s great walk on a summers day, but do be aware that some of this walk contains some very steep stairs and I would not recommend this for someone who is not reasonably fit.

Nice And Windy Walk. We walked for more than 30 minutes along the coast. There are stairs up and down thus it's not a handicapped friendly walk path. Good for couple and family outing. The view along the walk is great. Will be back again.
A must-do for any visitor . A spectacular walk, amazing views, best enjoyed on a fine cool day. During sculptures by the sea it can get annoyingly busy though.
dramatic scenery. Great way to appreciate Sydney coastline. Accessible from Bondi Beach. A fairly easy walk if you don't mind the steps!

Fantastic way to spend a morning or afternoon. We did this in the middle of winter when the weather wasn't the best. Some rain and wind. Also, storms have damaged part of the trail walk. However, you have fantastic views of the ocean and go through some very interesting neighborhoods and areas. Definitely worth doing.

Bondi to bronte . We didn't do the entire Bondi to Coogee but we did Bondi to bronte. This took us about 50 minutes and well worth it. The view is spectacular and the walk is relatively easy, there is only a few parts where a little rocky but otherwise a great path but it is hilly at times. If we had more time I would have love to do the entire walk.

What a walk. I love this walk! I have done it many times and it never gets boring. Anyone who comes to visit this is the first thing we do and it really gives you a great perspective of why people flock to Sydney!

Beautiful . Living in sydney I try to do this walk as often as I can. It's an amazing walk along the coast with lovely small beaches and towns to go with it. It's easy to do. A few hills and steps but pretty tame. Absolutely love this walk!

Must do in Sydney . I always take visitors on this walk. Stunning coastal views with lots of pit stops. Suits everyone - Take it as fast or as leisurely as you wish. Even better if you visit during the annual Sculptures by the Sea. Tip: go very early or on weekdays for less crowds

Lovely walk with great views. I recommend walking from Coogee to Bondi as it's easier.You'll see some wonderful sites and stop often to take photos.Male sire you pack a bottle of water and ectra suncream (even on a cloudy day).

A must for walkers!. My wife did this picturesque walk with my grandfather and had nothing but praise - some of the route required a little ingenuity due to locked gates and problems from recent storms but nothing that was not easily overcome. A must for those good walkers amongst you.

What a pretty walk!. One of my favourite walks in Sydney! Amazing views! Every time I have a visitor - I bring them here for a nice stroll and they can't get over how gorgeous and beautiful the walk is! Must do if you visit Sydney!
bondi :]]]]. Beautiful spot even on a slightly cold day . beach is absolutly gorgeous . Popped into local cafe for a coffee and snack.

Amazing scenery and well worth the effort. We walked from Coogee to Bondi and back twice during our stay in Coogee in October. I lived in Sydney for 15 years and can't believe I hadn't done this before returning! Plenty to see and do along the way and you can always catch a bus one way if you don't want to walk back.

Great walk . Really is one of the best free attractions around Sydney. So much to take in. Migrating whales through winter months and great sunny days on beautiful beaches through the summer. Nice places to stop along the way for drinks or food. Well looked after and a must do in Sydney.

Great views and some good exercise, too!. We started at Bondi on a cool, windy and sunny afternoon. Waves were breaking over the Icebergs pool and a small part of the walk was closed due to recent storms. Plenty of people were walking in both directions and a few were jogging! The views were always great and we constantly stopped to take photos. We didn't complete the whole walk because we were a little cool and/or tired and finished up at Bronte where we caught a bus back to the city. It is a good way to finish off a tour around the southern suburbs/heads, bays etc.
Awesome views of the coast.. Easy to medium walk, fantastic in Spring and summer, not so pleasant in winter, during the Spring months there is also a Festival along the walk.

Good exercise when you've nothing to do. If you're trying to find something fun to do, go on the Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal Walk- see waves crash on the beaches and enormous ones rising to about 5 metres from the rocks. Wow, all this stuff is extremely astonishing! It is very good exercise for us and a great experience to be out and about in the fresh, sea breeze!
Beautiful costal walk. This was a gorgeous costal walk. Unfortunately some of the walk near Bondi and Waverley beaches had washed out during the storms in early June.

Great views. We ran this but in reverse, Congee to Bondi. Some of the path is shut because of the recent storms but there are diversions in place that take you briefly off and back onto the coastal path.Great vistas of the bay's and ocean.
The best walk ever!. This is the most beautiful coastal walk you could ever do! We took our time to do the walk taking in all the sights.

Average scenery. We took a bus either M333 or M380 from outside Museum train station to Bondi Beach. Bus ride was around 40mins. The coastal walk was ok. It wasn't mind blowing. Highlight was the iceberg pool by the beach. The rest of the scenery is your typical coastal line walk with ocean views and nice houses with sea view. That sums it up.
This is mind blowing!. Not to be missed in Sydney!! I loved the walk and the peace I found!I recommend everyone to take this hike at least ones!

Fantastic views!. So much to see and very romantic for couples. This is free, so definitely take advantage of the amazing photo opportunities here! Plenty of walking so make sure to wear comfortable clothes and shoes...
Most was closed for repairs . I don't recommend doing this on a rainy day. Plus several parts are closed for repairs due to the recent storms. So I guess we didn't get the most out of it.
Great for the more adventurous. It is worth taking the train / bus to Bondi Beach to do this walk - it is well paved and the views and fresh sea air makes it well worth the effort.

An absolute must-do for Sydney visitors. It's a marvelous walk, and it's been completely refurbished. Back in the day it could get a bit muddy here and there, but now there is a wooden walkway. Truly spectacular views.
Great walk. A great way to spend a sunny day, coffee shops along the way and great views , you can even break the walk up with a swim along the way if you want

Fantastic views. Went from Coogee to Bondi on a beautiful winters morning.
Fantastic views and the weather meant that we weren't the only ones!!
Regardless the walk is fabulous and highly recommended.
Moderate level of fitness required if doing the whole walk.

Beautiful and peaceful. Loved this walk! It was neat seeing the colors of the water change from beach to beach. The rock formations are impressive! Due to storm damage, you are rerouted to the street a couple of places but not hard to maneuver .

Stunning views, great walk!. We caught a bus to Bondi from Circular Quay and did the coastal walk from Bondi to Coogee beach. Parts of the coastal trail were closed due to recent storm damage, however the detour around local streets was easy to follow. The weather was perfect for walking and the views amazing. A nice lunch in Coogee before catching the bus back to Circular Quay made this a very nice half day activity whilst in Sydney,

Spectacular walk but recently damaged by storms. We did part of this walk from Bondi - taking some of the detours and going on part of the walk that was closed. Many parts of this walk were damaged by a "king tide/storm" on June 7th and many sections are closed. I recommend trying to do what you can - either by taking their recommended detours or scrambling over the damaged parts. It is truly spectacular coastline and vistas - Sydney is such a beautiful place. We were lucky to have a warm and sunny afternoon in Bondi. We loved the part of the walk that we did and loved Bondi beach/this coastal walk.

One of the must do walks in Sydney. This walk along the rocky coastline south of famous Bondi Beach is spectacular. It can be enjoyed any time of the year, although best in the mornings during the cooler months. Every time I do it, it brings something new to the experience, and the coffee or snacking options along the way at Tamarama or Bronte Beach are great. One of the nicest things to do in Sydney.

The views are amazing. Enjoy this walk along the cliff tops which takes anything from 3/4 hr to 1 & 1/2 hours depending on the number of people and how fast you walk. Passing though many lovely little beaches along the way it gives you a sample of what Sydney is all about. Cafes to sit and enjoy the view along the way and plenty of bus stations if you get too tired for the walk back.
Great easy walk. We took a taxi to Coogee and walked to Bondi which is closer to where we were staying but you can easily enter at any part and do part of the walk . Views are lovely

Great coastal walk. We set off from our hotel in central Sydney / Pitt St around 9am & walked tp Bondi - stopped there for an early lunch at the bucket list (I think that's what it was called) bar & then set off for Coogee. Great scenery but also plenty of people doing the same walk. I would reccomend doing it on a week day if possible & wearing decent sneakers & taking a bottle of water. Plenty of little bays to stop & rest in & shops / dairies by them though. We liked the plarks along the way with history info on them about the area. Got to Coogee & had intended to walk back to our hotel but we had a beer & were exausted so u would reccomend swiping your opal card & getting the bus back.
No need to pay for a tour. This walk is so easy and can be accessed by bus, cab or Uber. Beautiful scenery, take a dip in the ocean, take a picnic or have fish n chips by the sea.

Winter beauty. We walked the entire walk on the day we arrived (50, 15, 13), so it was a bit tiring. From Kings Cross it took about 3 hours for transportation and walking. Many photos taken along the way of the beautiful cliffs and rock structures as well as the beach areas. We arrived by public transportation (train then bus) and returned the same. All drivers and attendants were helpful--just buy an Opal card and travel with ease. Bring your camera and tennis shoes and if you are bold bring your swimsuit. Many surfers out on Bondi but the waves were not developed much yet. Be Warned--Some parts of the walkway are under construction July 2016, and although marked, people still proceeded. Looks like a landslide toward Bondi Beach makes it more challenging as some of the walkway is missing.
beautiful. Beautiful area...scenic views...perfect for running in the morning or a nice romantic walk in the evenings

Another day in Paradise!. One of the best coastal walks in Sydney where you can walk, swim, enjoy good coffee and food with spectacular views along the way. From your hotel catch the train to BondiJunction railway station with bus to Bondi Beach do the walk around to Coogee Beach and catch bus back to city.
Iconic Sydney Beach. Was the first time at Bondi on my third trip to Sydney...outstanding beach with lots of Cafe's - Restaurants and small stores in the vicinity
Wonderful way to exercise. Take water with you! Great on a fine (but not super hot day) as the views are spectacular but there is no shade. I have done this multiple times and will keep doing it.

First 2km were the most scenic. One of the things I loved most about Sydney was the city's love for fitness. That love was definitely very evident on the Bondi to Coogee Beach trail. It's a nice distance and perfect for runners. Slap on some runners and get a great workout while taking in the beautiful views. There are restrooms and cafes along way, so if you get tired, there are plenty of spots to catch a breather. Water fountains are plentiful too. For those who don't want to walk the full distance, I think the first 2km were the most scenic from Bondi to Coogee. Definitely recommended!

Amazing coastal walk. Must do activity. This is a must-do activity for anyone visiting Sydney. Although it is a really long walk, i did not feel any fatigue or boredom(despite doing it solo) since the whole walk is full of spectacular scenery. There is even a cemetery on the route. It is advisable to carry a water bottle. There are multiple taps on the way where you can fill the water for free.
A must to do. This walk takes about two hours of walking at a steady pace. The views of the ocean and cliffs make it worthwhile. Not too many stairs, but would need to be reasonably able-bodied.

Still a great walk (shame about the wild weather damage)!. We have previously visited Sydney and enjoyed the Bondi to Coogee coastal walk.Following the wild weather storms in recent months, we were uncertain whether parts of the walk may be blocked off.Nonetheless, we set off for our walk and, notwithstanding some areas being diverted, found the walk a terrific family activity.Even the detour through Waverley Cemetery was interesting, particularly reading some of the near century old headstones of past residents and getting snippets of lives past.Work appears to be underway to repair the storm damage.
Coast Walk. Spectacular views, cool cafes etc when you get to Bondi. Go in Summer and swim in the surf or the baths, or Sculpture by the Sea in October!
Another tick off the bucket list. Great walk with spectacular scenery not to be rushed kept stopping to take photos not just because wife and I are in our late seventies.

ok but .... we were really surprised by the fact that we thought that it will be amazing but in fact, it is nice to see that the sea water gets into the swimming pool while waves but the place, the building, the cafe is too old, not nice, it is a school of swimming pool actually. Wasn't happy of that place. But there is a walk to do overthere by the coast, nice but we say better. calm district, residensial district.

Heaven for Fitness Freaks and Walkers....... On our visit to Sydney we decided to go on this walk and the sight took our breath away.. Let me discuss in full length.1...The way to Bondai beach is quite convenient from CBD and buses ,trains run regularly.2...The beach is beautiful at any time of the year and has it own charm.3...The walk in total is 7 km plus and takes around three hours if you walk casually watching the dramatic changes of coastline.4...Both the ends Bondai and Coogee beach are very well connected with local transport.5...You can start your walk either from Bondai beach to Coogee which has more Cliff's and upwards coastal walk with a little stairs at some places, whereas walk from Coogee to Bondai is relatively easy as you have to walk down most of the time but sun facing.6... In between there is Tamarama beach, then Bronte beach, then Clovelly beach...If you have less time as a tourist you can cover a short distance to one or two beaches.7...In between there is a natural salty swimming pool and open gymnasium.8... In winters you should carry jackets as it is chilly and in summers hat, gogs and lots of sunscreen.9... Kids should not be left alone during walk as in some places proper fence is not there.10... In the month of June July whale can be spotted and in the month of October November.....sculptures at sea are displayed....11... Prefer going weekdays or in the mornings for tourists. For locals weekends is best..12....Lots of cafes serving beer and mouth watering dishes on the way and Surfers busy in surfing and swimming.

Lovely coastal walk. This is a superb coastal walk from Bondi Beach to Coogee Beach. Fabulous views and photo opportunities along the way, there are lots of bays to walk around where you can watch lots of surfers, there are places to stop for a relax and maybe a swim and there are a few restaurants to stop for food and a drink. Take your time and a bottle of water and enjoy the views.

lifestyle. breathtaking ocean views, moderate intensity workout with great local attractions on route Beginning at Bondi beach or ending at Bondi Beach visiting local cafes and restaurants Keen for a swim, then well protected coves like Clovelly and Bronte offer a refreshing stop.Gordon's Bay offers crystal clear water perfect for snorkeling or scuba diving. Obtain a fishing license and proper rock fishing safety gear like a mandatory life jacket for a spot of rock fishing.An annual feature of the walk is the 'sculpture by the sea' event that show cases amazing art for the local community artists. A must see for any age group.Enjoy a piece of Australia's scenic East coast the healthy way!
beach walks. Beautiful view, lots of lovely stops along the way. great for couples, friends or families! Coogee is one of my favourite places to go and it never disappoints!
Sydney must do. Choose a beautiful day and walk along the bondi coast just beautiful. Certainly my husbands highlight as he did not take too much to the shopping

Lived in Sydney for 47 years and hadn't done this - wish I had. We'll be back to do this again and again. Have lived in Sydney for 47 years and never done this walk. The scenery is amazing and the people watching is fun as well. We started at Clovelly where you can park on the headland for no cost, picked up a coffee at the café there and walked all the way to Bondi northern end. Ice cream there to refuel before the walk back. Was beautiful and will definitely be back again and again.

Beautiful walk anytime not just during Sculptures by the Sea. This is a wonderful walk along the cliffs looking out to the ocean. Very picturesque. It gets crowded during the Sculptures but it's worthwhile. Watch out for the local joggers who insist on using this path during the event, many have a big attitude problem, they consider it their own private area and resent all the 'blow ins' hindering their routine.

Beach walk for my birthday. We did the walk on my birthday. Just a shame that I presume that due to the recent storms part of the costal walk was closed and the detours where not very well signed especially when you got closer to bondi. But it was well worth the effort the views are great the beaches are great.
Loved it!. Start off by passing a huge salt water pool that fills from the sea. The cliff walk is amazing and offers great views and photo opportunities. Do not go mid day ...very hot.

Better (and cheaper) than a visit to a shrink!. We've done this walk many times. The views are stunning, great for families with kids of all ages. A must for visitors. Can get quite crowded on nice days and parking may be a giant pain in your derriere but otherwise, your camera will get an awesome day out. Make sure you bring a spare SD card. Some of the cafes at either ends are quite nice even though the food can be somewhat limited Make sure you bring some snacks for the little ones as the choices really are not that superlative. Also, don't forget swimmers and towels (or spare clothes) ... you know ... just in case. Just have fun, forget about your work troubles, stress and bills and just let the ocean do the work on your soul for a change. Oh, if you like this walk, make sure you do the northern part of this coastal walk. Either from Cremorne to Balmoral, from Clontarf to Manly and my secret favourite all the way to Barenjoy.

Amazing and breath taking!. This is such a wonderful and beautiful coastal walk. Anytime of year it is accessible and very enjoyable. Plenty of places to stop along the way for food, coffee, swims, drinks or to relax and take in the view. I highly recommend it to anyone and everyone!

A leisurely walk along a beautiful costline. This is a classic walk to enjoy with friends, family or as a couple.A great way to enjoy this is to park at either Coogee or Clovelly & walk to Bondi, have lunch in one of the many cafes, we went to the Bondi Icebergs & walk lunch off with the return. A highly recommended activity for a day, depending on your inclination this return trip, including lunch could take any where from 2-4 hours . Enjoy

Amazing. Every Sunday we did this walk, its truly lovely. Not only for the exercise , views are superb but the history as you walk around grave yards and pass old buildings. Not all of the walk is easy, there are narrow pathways, uneven and some parts pot holes need to be a little careful especially after rain.

Bondi Walk to Coogee Beach. A lovely walk, a must on a nice day . Allow time to take in the scenery. Some parts a little bit of an uneven surface and narrow in some places.This didn't distract us too much from the amazing scenery.

Fantastic walk. This is a superb coastal walk linking all the bays from Bondi to Coogee. A very popular walk for walkers and runners, it provides some great places to view the surfers at some of the bays. Note that in June 2016 some of this walk was out of action due to the damage done by a recent storm.

Beautiful walk on a spring or early summers day. This walk is across the headland where you get to see the beautiful pacific ocean. Along the way, you will also walk across Bronte and Tamarrama Beaches where you can sneak in and have a great coffee, pastry and adore the magnificent view. The landscape in undulating and magnificent. Cost you nothing to do it too
Beautiful View. A brilliant scenic walk with excellent path and an easy walk for all types of people. On a sunny day, just amazing.

Great walk along the Sydney beaches. The Bondi to Coogee coastal walk is relatively easy and a great outing for a weekend (or midweek) stroll with fine views and a brunch or lunch at a Coogee cafe. When 'Sculptures by the Sea' are on (watch newspapers for timing) it is an even more enjoyable - but generally more crowded - outing. Easy to use public transport to Bondi Junction then a bus to the beach and return.

Beautiful but hectic on the weekends!. This is a great leisurely walk perfect for pretty much all fitness levels - best mid-morning in the summer - weekends can be a bit hideous with so many people. You can break the walk up by starting at the southern end of Coogee, popping up for a coffee then come back to the walk then head on to Bondi Beach for lunch!

Enjoy, you would have to try hard not to!. This is a fabulous walk. In June and October you may see whales migrating barrel rolling and tail slapping, at other times of the year dolphins surfing the surf waves in the different bays. Yes there will be other people but unless its Sculpture by the Sea time, swathes of the coast could be your alone. A great way to feel alive

A wonderful walk along the waterfront. Walking from Bondi to Coogee is a most spectacular walk, offering great opportunities for photographers. You can make it as long or as short as you like, stop at Tamarama beach if you want, there are toilets and a great cafe there, or keep going. There are some steps, so take that into consideration, and it can be windy as you will be following the coast. But it is not a difficult walk, I do it regularly, especially in October when The annual Sculptures by the sea is on, and well worth seeing ! Do it !

Win Win. This walk takes about an hour or so (taking it easy) Take a hat, water and comfortable clothing. The cemetery alone is worth the walk ( Angels praying over the surf) .....it's also good exercise . Cute little bay just out of Coogee called Gordons Bay (known as 'Thommos' to locals, when all those fancy big houses used to be fibro shacks. How do I know? ....I lived in one as a young boy.... there a few steps around the Bondi endGreat walk....nice fresh sea air

Bondi to Coogee walk. What is good about this walk, is that the foreshore is NOT owned by the privileged and therefore EVERYONE gets the right to walk this beautiful walk and enjoy what it has to offer and that is spectacular views. The walk itself is a moderate walk and is well suited for all and wheelchairs also can negotiate this walk with only a slight amount of effort. When we lived in Sydney we did this walk several times and loved it. We would recommend it to everyone as it is a beautiful walk for all. Well done for those who proposed this walkway and for those who constructed it - beautiful and certainly a photographers delight.
Great Walk. Beautiful ocean views and a pleasant walk along the cliffs. Don't go when they are doing one of the shows though - too crowded.

Great exercise and great views - all within a city - who'd have thought it?. The Coogee to Bondi walk is one of those natural occasions which is never the same twice; I have lost count of how many times we have walked it, and everytime it is slightly (or dramatically) different. The weather obviously has the most impact, and it is dramatic on a stormy day, and calm and relaxing on a warm sunny still day. But everytime is a new experience. Can't recommend it enough! And whichever way you walk it, there's plenty of choices of cafes at either end to provide the mid-walk interlude :)PS I've had to say that it's a good rainy day attraction because personally I love walking in the rain, but that is a matter of choice, obviously :)

Wonderful Coastal Walk. One of the best Coastal Walk not to be missed. Enjoy Sensational scenery while walking. It could be a bit long distance for someone, but it's a unique place to experience. Drop by to some beautiful poppular beaches along the way. Good exercise with tireless of wonderful asmostphere.

Stunningly beautiful . Stunningly beautiful in all seasons, but perhaps best at this time of year in terms of avoiding summer crowds. Walking in either direction is great, make sure to include a coffee at Bronte on the au.
I do the walk often!. A must for visitors to Sydney! Wonderful view of the amazing coastline but lots of stairs if you are not completely mobile

A must-see for the short-time Sydney visitor. This walk never disappoints! It shows off the essence of the Sydney coast line: sandy beaches, rock pools, sandstone cliffs, coastal heath, the ocean in all its various hues and moods, and some great eating and drinking spots to boot. The track is paved all the way and requires only a very low level of fitness to complete at leisure.At its most enjoyable in calm, sunny weather of course, but can present spectacular displays of waves in and after stormy conditions; come dressed for the part! There's public transport at both ends, and the walk is free! For the time poor visitor to Sydney, this is a great experience to sample.

Exhilarating - fun with views and a breeze. Walking from Bondi to Coogee is exhilarating...It traverses beaches, headlands, inlets, rock platforms and a cemetery!!! The walk is a sealed path, but does include steps and some short spells of steep walking. We have walked this walk many times.....we leave North Bondi (where you have a better chance of getting a car park), have lunch at Coogee and walk back....Leave at 10:00am and be back by 4:00 with an hour for lunch at one of the many good restaurants at Coogee..... In season, it is common to spot wales.
Lovely walk. Beautiful however choose time of year as very windy and cold at times.Doesn't matter if you start at one and finish at the other- but nice to walk back to your car.
Sightseeing. One of the most beautiful parts of Sydney. Wherher just a casual walk of fitness, you cannot beat the views. Coming over the hill into South Bondi makes the trek truelly worth it

Serene. If you need to spend some time alone with nature ,Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal walk is for you. the breathtaking views and sea breeze will easily lift your spirit to another dimension of relaxation and calmness forgetting the worries of what tomorrow brings and easily overcoming the moments challenges

One of my favourite walks in Sydney. I have lived in Sydney my whole life and I still try to do the walk as often as possible. Only reason I didn't give it 5/5 is because some of the steps on the walk are very steep/uneven which make it unsafe and not easy for older people or those less able.
Best walk in sydney. Incredible views of Sydney. Takes a couple of hours as you find your self stopping for pictures. Very easy walk however wear comfortable shoes.

Coastline. Fantastic walk with breathtaking views, You can see the ocean for miles.Its a walk that we like to do in all weather as the view changes with the conditions.Great exercise on a safe path. Some stairs as well.

great walk. great views, enjoyable walk.things to bring: water, jacket, sunscreen, camerafamilies: keep the kids close as some sections of the walk is not fenced off (it is a coastal walk with cliffs), be mindful of others as some parts are narrow.weather: take a jacket (incase it gets windy or rainy)avoid: local impatient runners they do not reflect the rest of the general people who are out there to enjoy themselves.

The best weekend activity in Sydney . This has to be one of my favourite things to do in Sydney on a weekend. The walk itself is very picturesque and there are lots of stop off points to have a drink or a meal. A great way to take in the sights no matter what the weather.
busy walk. beautiful area, but a really busy walk.Always people doing it.Stunning views thou. So many places to stop and take in the views.
Views all the way. this walk has to be a highlight for any visitor whether national or international. The views are spectacular and you'll enjoy interest spots along the way. Don't miss it.

Breathtaking. What an incredible walk on a beautiful day. Ease of the walk has been enhanced by the upgrade of the walking paths and barriers.It is a real joy to walk this coastal pathway and offers a multitude of photo opportunities

Absolute Must Do! . Sydney is renowned for its stunning beaches- and the beaches of Bondi, Tamarama and Bronte are no exception. A really beautiful walk, fun for the whole family. Takes about 45 minutes and there are plenty of cafes, restaurants and little pop ups for a well deserved snack afterwards.

Beautiful scenery, easy walk for families with children. Love this walk. Great for families with children and gets even better when sculpture by the sea is on! And if you are lucky you may even see whales swimming by!
Waters edge walk. Loved this beautiful walk, great photo opportunities! We walked in the opposite direction, Coogee to Bondi & had a delicious lunch at the end. Great family day out!

Do as much or as little as you want!. Nice easy walk that is paved or pathed most of the way, there are a few digressions onto the actual streets and a few climbs. However, the scenery is beautiful and you can walk as much or as little as you want.

Peaceful walk with gorgeous view. Amazing coastal walk. You can do this walk in 1 hour if you do it fast, or 1,5 to 2 hours if you do it slowly and take breaks.Take some water and a snack with you so you can enjoy the beautiful scenery with some lovely food.
Good walk during the spring & summer. Very nice sea view and stroll along the beach. You may stop by the cafes and restaurants by the sea front to rest and relax

Storm damage has closed parts of walk. But you can still navigate the walk and see beautiful beaches, surfers and even whales.
Many cafes along the walk. Easy to hop in a bus if you don't want to walk all the way.
Great way to spend a couple of hours.

Wow would be an understatement!. I took the coastal walk from Bondi to Bronte and I just can't get my mind out of it!! Though the walk was slightly strenuous, the views were just breathtaking. Words might not be enough to describe the beauty of this place. I would HIGHLY recommend this to anyone going to Sydney. Even if you are not able to do the entire stretch of walk, try out the first part from Bondi to Tamarama and I can bet you wouldn't regret.Wish I had had time to cover the whole distance..but someday I am going back for sure.
Amazing views and walk. Long but easy walk to enjoy every Sydney beach, do sport. BBQ in every beach, showers, toilets and even a gym by the sea.

Do it!!. A beautiful, relatively easy walk along gorgeous seaside Sydney. Takes a little while to get to using public transportation, but it is so worth it. Taxi/uber is also an option. Multiple beaches open for swimming. Be sure to pack water, sunscreen, hat/sunglasses, and camera!

Wow. Although the recent storm did some damage this walk is magic!We did it yesterday for the second time. If I lived in Sydney I'd do it as often as I could. This is an absolute must for anyone coming to Sydney

great walk. Fabulous way to get some exercise Do this walk often and will definitely take visitors from overseas on this walk to show them our beautiful beaches Try to avoid the weekends mid day as it can get really crowded Best to do early morning or later in the afternoon

Great walk, great views, very busy. Have done this walk many times and it is always so busy. However, it is a beautiful walk and the views are so spectacular. There are quite a few steps so not ideal for prams or if you have trouble climbing stairs.

Always spectacular. I have walked this walk a few times over the years and regardless of the weather it is spectacular. Make sure you have the appropriate clothing though so it is enjoyable. I have mobility issues but the paths are established so that I can manage the entire walk. I just take the steps easily and let all of the joggers fly past!

A walk to be had for any visitor. The Bondi to Coogee walk or reverse is a must for any visitor to Sydney. The return walk will be approximately 7+ kms with easy terrain and some steps. To make things easier I would start from Clovelly and make it to Bondi taking in waverley cemetery, stopping at the cafes along the way and enjoying the beautiful cliffside scenery.

Beautiful. What a great walk. Start and finish where you want. Stop and get a coffee at any of
The cafes along the way and be amazed at the views you see.
The path is sealed all the way and you don't have to walk on the road except in a few tiny places which are Cudesacs anyway.

Energising experience. Over the years the Randwick and Waverley councils have made significant improvements to the walking surface. The walk between Coogee and Bronte seems to have the steepest inclines and declines but depending on your fitness level, this is all relative. There are plenty of spots to stop and take in the scenery and fresh sea air. Kiosks are located at each beach for food and drinks. In short, the coastal walk is an ideal opportunity to experience five Sydney beaches which all have their own unique look and feel.
Lovely!. A truly lovely coastal walk for eveyone. Be sure to bring a bottle of water and sunscreen! Very nice views!

Great walk. Showcasing the best of the Sydney and Australian coast line. This walk is a must for Sydney sightseeing or locals alike, bring your local and overseas friends and get some light or heavy exercise done with a stunning coastal view. Plenty of good beaches along the way too
lovely walk. great views, good easy walk, take your time and sit down and let yourself unwind somewhere during the walk
wonderfull!. Beautiful walk, landscaped roads and nice views!recommended!If you go by train to Bondi, you have to walk prox.3 km before start.

Beautiful views!. Really beautiful coastal walk with stunning beach, ocean and cliff views. The walk takes about 2.5 hours so would definitely recommend good runners instead of wearing thongs. You walk through a few smaller beaches along the way, so there is always a place to have a quick break. It was great to relax with some lunch and a drink at Coogee Beach afterwards before returning back to Bondi.
Beautiful coastal walk. This is a must do walk. However, I suggest walking from Coogee to Bondi as walking from Bondi to Coogee is uphill a lot of the way, so much easier on the way back!

Not to be missed !. We do this walk every time we visit Sydney and each time it is just as amazing. The views are stunning, the walk is fairly easy although there are some stairs. Did it 2 weeks ago and saw whales swimming past just near Bondi. Not to be missed !

Stunning scenery. Arrived in Bondi and made sure I went to the furthest away end as I wanted to enjoy walking around the bay of this famous beach. as the path wound its way away from Bondi a number of smaller and totally stunning bays are reached. The coastal scenery was amazing and there were plenty of surfers to spot along the way. Each bay had an area for refreshments and also toilets. Enjoyed the walk very very much and would highly recommend. Also enjoyed a well earned drink in the Coogee bay hotel on reaching the end where I sat gazing out at the beautiful bay. Perfect.

Awesome Coastal Walk. Although the walk was closed after Bronte due to storms, it is still a must do! Beautiful beach, ocean, cliff, and town views. I would definitely recommend wearing sneakers, as our feet were tired after a nice walk in our flip flops!!

Full moon walk! Fantastic view of the rising moon... Went there with a group from Sydney Bushwalking Group. We started the walk from Coogee Beach. The view of the moon rising from the ocean was simply breath taking as it ascended into partky clouded sky. The walk is fairly easy along bike/walking path although we took a detour via the Waverley cemetry as the usual route was blocked due to the recent Sydney storm. Had a 10 minutes break at Bondi before heading back to Coogee. Took us 2 hours for the return trip. Very enjoyable evening walk during winter.

Best walk in my life!! . I start in coogee and end up in bondi. Unbelievable stunning view! Nice beaches. Have a great picnic park. Nice track! They have refilll tap water in each spot. I even play in every beach i meet! Don't forget to put a lot of sunscreen and hat because soo hot!

Bracing and interesting stroll.... We did this walk regularly during our one month's stay in Bronte Beach. We walked several times from Bondi to Coogee beach (in several different weathers!!) Lots of different inlets and beaches to see, with opportunities to stop off for a coffee or ice cream. Lots of Sydneysiders and locals running, jogging and generally keeping fit along the way.

Marvelous. From my hotel at Clearance Street i walked to Town Hall Station about 5 - 10 minutes took train for 3.5 Aus$ to Bondi Junction from there took bus 333 to Bondi Beach for 2.1 Aus$.Walked all the way to Coogee Beach about 3 hours 7km lots of steps and uphill walk (not easy though veryyyyyy nice ).Wonderful views swimming pools and bowling courses on the ocean, beautiful ladies, volleyball , dog's parks , .... Took bus 373 all the way back 2.36 Aus$ and walked about 10 minutes to the hotel . All transportation by opal card.Went there on the 19th of May.

Completely magical walk. Definitely worth the time it takes and the energy expended to take this walk. It's right along the rocky coastline the entire way with views to the crashing waves, sailboats and freighters beyond. Bring a snack or stop at one of the convenient spots at Coogee beach for a bite. Very unique.

Bondi to Coogee - you CAN still walk it.... We saw the recent reviews that said that this walk was closed, so we asked our hotel concierge to check, and according to him, it was open. We took the bus to Bondi and headed south on foot. Parts of it WERE closed, but we were able to navigate a slightly different path. As we got south of Bondi, when parts of the coastal walk were closed, good detour signs were in place that made it easy to follow. We made it all the way to Coogee, where we took another bus back to Sydney. The walk was easy. There are stairs involved, so it's not for those in strollers or wheelchairs, but anyone else should be able to do it. The scenery was lovely and there are places to fill up your water bottle plus restrooms at each beach you hit along the way. We even got to watch a bowling tournament at a bowling green when we were almost to Coogee!

One of the best walks. Always a great walk & this time I rewarded myself with a late lunch at the fairly new Coogee Pavillion. Unfortunately the recent storms had damaged some of the walk but do not miss the opportunity.

Refreshing as usual and ever. I have been on this coastal walk many times. Every time it feels unique and the best to go for it. I love this walk with my camera, music in my ear and no mobile as usual. It will make you fall in love with Sydney every time you go.

Coastal Stroll. We did this coastal walk as a group and it was really fun. You get to see dramatic coast lines and soak up the Australian sun, as well as experience a bit more of the coastal beauty than just Bondi Beach. The walk is moderate - it is about 6-7km but there are frequent breaks in the track when you arrive at the next beach along which gives you a chance to re-fill water bottles or take a swim. The track is fairly easy with stairs on the steeper hills. Once you get to Coogee, there is access to public transport to get you back home again

Absolutely beautiful, typical Australian Coastline but not great if you can't climb stairs. This is a lovely walk, even more interesting during the sculptures by the sea exhibition (March each year). There are parts that are quite accessible for all but much of it involves old stairs, carved into the sandstone. It is not too hard and you can always walk one way and catch a bus from the other end back to the city or bondi junction. It is in fact better to go by public transport as parking can be tricky and expensive, and public transport gives you more options. It is not Sydney Harbour, it's the ocean, but you can sometimes see whales off the coast. It is a pleasant way to get a bit of exercise and take in the sea air and views

Walk completed at sunset. I completed the walk from Bronte to Bondi on a warm autumn afternoon during sunset. It was beautiful and amazing photos were captured from my phone. It is best to allow yourself a lot of time to complete the walk so you can wander along and stop frequently to sit on the rocks and various hills around and just look out at the ocean. I would love to go back with a book.

Fantastic coastal walk. Unfortunately we didn't get to Coogee, however our walk from Bondi was phenomenal. The views of the coast are absolutely stunning, and the walk takes you into some wonderful, quiet beaches along the way. Unfortunately the walk didn't really cater for a pram; bear that in mind when considering this with young children. Overall though, this is a worthwhile activity; one to really take in the views and just stroll leisurely along a beautiful coastline.

Great walk in nice weather!. The Bondi part of the walk is actually closed because of the damage during the recent high waves but many still cross the barricades. Have to be careful as some parts of the paths are really quite badly damaged. Hope the authorities fix them soon. But it was a great walk with beautiful views .. although we only made it to the next beach with young kids in tow.
Excellent . Awesome!!! Is a MUST do in Sydney, at the moment some parts of the pathway are closed but still you can walk with no problem, beautiful views, bathrooms in every beach, just amazing!
Great views. Super nice walk along the cliffs and beaches. Plenty of places to stop for a swim. Easy to do and good coastal scenery.

Must do walk. Did it so many times.It's a recommended walk.Great ocean views..nice places to stop over for coffee...get great shops from the top..bring your camera.Nice and cool sea breeze doesn't make you feel tired.
Best in sydney. Nice walk along the ocean between two beaches . It is not difficult , no major climbs . The view is wonderful.

One of the Best Coastal Walks in the World.. Whenever we have OS guests arriving in Sydney we always take them along this 2 km walk - One of the Best Coastal Walks in the World - as soon as they arrive. Even at night!

Worth the trip, but under repair. This is a really nice walk, but right now some sections of it our closed, so be prepared for detours that take you off the path. I suggest you walk from Bondi to Coogee, and not the other way around. In this way, the sun is not in your eyes. We took the bus from Sydney to Bondi, and the bus back from Coogee to Syndey - hassle free.You get some great views of the sea and cliffs, and you can play on beach and watch the surfers. The biggest challenge was the section through the grave yard. This is not baby stroller friendly. It actually took us 4 hours to do the walk; but that's because we stopped for frequent photos, lunch (which we bought from the Bondi Farmer's Market on Saturday morning), and running around on the beach with the kids.

Best in Sydney. We do a heap of walking and are always impressed by this walk. Our regular walk is Wanda to south to the end of the walk and return and this is spectacularly better. We love the fact that we can do the 5km from Coogee and lunch at Icebergs (wow check out their bistro for a view and the food is good too!) and then burn off lunch on the return walk.However its a coastal walk and is always subject to the elements so choose your weather well.

Lovely walk, a must do when visiting Sydney. Everyone recommended that we do this walk, our hotel, our friends, and all the guide books we read said we should not miss this. So we went on a lovely sunny day and enjoyed it very much. It is a gorgeous walk with beautiful views of the coastline.

Looks great, but closed due to storm damage. Took an agonizingly slow bus ride to here from Circular Quay. Beautiful location, but when we arrived, the walkway was posted as "Closed until further notice". Could see the damage to the walkway that the storm from the previous week unleashed on Sydney. Really sad. Will probably take months to fix. Lesson learned, check the status before you go!
One of the best romantic walk in the world. Take a leasure walk of about 2 kms with your loved one, along the sea shore and you can not forget it. The view and the setting is perfect.

Must do. Coogee and Bondi are great beaches and the walk between them is not different. The view is amazing and the you can find potable water throughout the way. You can also swim and relax on the small beaches on the way. If you are in Sydney, you cannot miss this walk
Closed. Yesterday I went to do the walk, unfortunately is closed until further advise. You could see from the distance that the walk suffered some kind of damage and need repair.

Wonderful. I have experienced this costal walk as i got a free tour from my BaseHostel. It was really awesome. really great view I have seen, the road is really peaceful to walk on and comfortable, nice route. Was a really nice place to stroll for few hours :)

Simply Beautiful. DISCLAIMER: I did not complete the walk, I walked from Bondi to Bronte and back.The views are amazing. If you like the sea, you will love the walk. The beaches are all so beautiful. If you are with a loved one, it's a simple pleasure to walk the different beaches hand in hand taking in the beauty and feeling the love.

the walk of a lifetime. This is a easy going walk, for all standards of fitness, past some of the most stunning beaches of all Australia. Both couples and families are encouraged to participate in this coastal walk past beautiful beaches, crystal clear water and rugged coastal cliffs. It is a must for all Australians, tourists and visitors to experience. Highly recommended.
Beautiful and worth doing !. Very beautiful, went on a stormy day which was still stormy! Went with my elderly grandparents who also enjoyed it! great for by yourself and with family.

One of the coolest pool you'll ever see. We started at the pool with has a beautiful view and genius concept - the pool has salt water, it's basically immersed in the ocean and the waves will crash in as you swim. It's beautiful! The day passes and very inexpensive.
Then, the coastal walk is just lovely. Gorgeous scenery, beautiful rock formation, easy and safe walk for all!
highlight of Sydney. NO matter how many times I do this walk - I will never tire of it. It's a wonderful thing to do with visitors and locals alike.
Great view. I visited this place today. Thankfully the weather forecast of rainy day didnt come true. Serene and beautiful.

Sea, Sky and (sometimes) Sculpture. It's really worth doing this walk. Fabulous scenery and some nice cafes at each end and on the way. There are a few flights of steps but these aren't too onerous. It's best to go on a weekday as there are a lot of people strolling or jogging at the weekend. Each year (usually late October / early November), Sculpture by the sea is not to be missed. Modern Art installations are scattered along the route – there are always interesting, eccentric and thought-provoking ones. Oh - did I mention beautiful, too?Buses run to each end of the walk from the city.
Coogee tot Bondi walk (reversed :) ). This is an amazing walk with stunning views :)! It can be very steep sometimes thus it requires some level of fitness :)

Spectacular scenery and a whale as well. Great location and scenery. Sadly the path was mostly closed due to the recent storms. Getting there is a bit of a hassle as you need to go via subway and then bus.

Swim swim swim. There are so many amazing spots to swim along the coastal walk to Coogee. Beachs, ocean pools and just generally jumping off some rocks into the crystal blue ocean. It's so worth it continuing on from Bronte. So many people finish the walk there but keep going the best is yet to come. It's a fantastic thing to do in Sydney and you get to see so many amazing little coastal hide always. there are loads of buses from Coogee to either get you back to Bondi or into the CBD.
Beautiful scenery. This is one of those things you can do for free! It is a good walk, not too intense, with amazing views.

An easy walk past ocean views and art infused landscape. My son lived in Manly for a time and when I visited, we did this walk. There are tide pools, metalwork sculptures and amazing scenery as you make your way to Coogee beach. Coogee beach is this amazing spot where there are a couple restaurants, people picnicking, diving and swimming. The beach is gorgeous.

Leisurely stroll. this walk has been storm damaged and the local council good do better with sign posting the detours/diversions. However it is a great wander taken at whatever pace over concrete paths (except for the diversions which are still easy). Lovely costal views and scenery.

Spectacular Views All Year Round. To avoid large crowds go weekdays but it's worth doing if your visiting Sydney. You stop by four beaches with dining options on a very leisurely walk. Throughout the year you will often see whales and dolphins. In winter the wind can be strong so bring a jacket and lip gloss.
Always amazing. It never seems to matter what time of year or what time of day. It is always great to spend time walking the coastal walk.
Fantastic walk. Did the walk from Coogee to Bondi.It was an easy walk.Great scenery,and we saw a few whales.The steps weren't a problem , its not really steep, so just about anyone can do it.
Excellent Walk. One of the best coastal walks in this country. Well formed and signposted. You cross about 6 beaches. Can do some optional rock hopping and swimming. Coffee is available at Clovelly.

One of the best, if not the best walking tour in Sydney. Bondi beach alone is a must see for travellers, but if you've got more time at this leg of the trip adding up the scenic walk would make your visit a more accomplished tick in your itinerary. We have done this walk starting around 10am but I would imagine it would be more enjoyable to do the walk in the early morning.I would prefer to start the walk at Coogee so you can spend more time relaxing with the Bondi beach as your view instead, but this is just me :)Sculpture by the sea would make the walk more enjoyable but a bit less relaxing as there are more people around. Make sure to check your calendar if the event happens to drop within your visit.

Beautiful coastal walk.. Easy coastal walk with beautiful views all year. At this time of the year (June) whales can be seen passing close in. This is so convenient to anyone visiting the Eastern Suburbs of Sydney. Bring your swimsuit, for a dip at any beach on route or the ocean pool at Bronte.

Top views of Sydney beaches. This walk has stunning views year round. It can get quite busy at times, but there is room to go at your own pace. You do need to be able to do stairs. After completeing the walk take time to take in the view and perhaps refreshments at Icebergs at Bondi (you will need to show ID although there is no age requirement).

If you like oceans, cliffs, beaches - do this walk.. This walk will be crowded on weekends, but still worth it if that's the only time you have. One of the best ways to see and take the time to appreciate the natural beauty of Sydney's coastline. You'll need a couple of hours to do this one-way, especially if it is your first time and you want to take it slow to enjoy the views. Even if you only make it halfway and return to where you started, it is totally worth the trip.

So much to do. If you love the sun and you don't mind a little walk or exercise then here is the perfect place, the views are unreal and if you like doing water sports then here is the place it can get very hot which is obvious so you will need to make sure you take a lot of fluids but it was a lovely day out

A great sunny day activity.... I actually did the walk from coogee beach to bondi beach. Take the bus 373 or 374 from the circular quay in Sydney CBD to coogee beach. ( u can catch it midway along the bus route also ) The walk aligns along the coast for the most part but some parts u take the paved road. The biggest issue with the whole walk is that there are no signs directing where to go. So you have to take a guess. Most times take the one closest to ocean. Some time taking the ocean route means a rugged terrain so be ready. Wear a pair of comfortable shoes. Preferably sporty. Be advised that some parts of the walk is closed because of the cave ins. These area are warded off but unfortunately the alternative path is also not clearly marked. But rest assured soon or later you will join the path again if you follow the paved road. Or simply follow other local walkers. Finally there is few food outlets actually along the path, all the outlets are along the main road path just a few mins away. Now for the good part, this is great 6-7 km walk ideal for a sunny day. When it's cold and windy it might get bit to chilly for the uninitiated. Bring a swim kit so u can swim in as many little coves of sea water you see along the way as you can. Bring picnic so u can enjoy a the view from atop the rock formations while enjoying a snack. This walk covers several sandy beach beach coves and rock formations and few hills. So enjoy this must do in Sydney. Whole walk takes roughly 2 hours with little stopping. Finally take the bus 333 from bondi beach back to circular quay or Sydney CBD.

Workout with a view!. Honestly have done this walk over a dozen times and never get sick of it. If you want to go when its quiter, i'd suggest avoiding the weekend. If thats not an option, opt for Saturday morning over Sunday as there's lots of strollers - prime family time. There are plenty of places to stop off and take in the view or a coffee. Highly recommended if you're in Sydney. You'll get great photos of our beautiful coast.

Great walk, especially on a sunny day. So much to see. Surfers, rocks, ocean, cafes to stop at along the way. A few steep steps but the rest easy. If you go when sculpture by the sea is on it's really worth seeing.

Great day out. Spectacular views . I have done this walk several times now and it never fails to disappoint. I usually start at coogee and walk to bondi so can end with a drink in icebergs. There are lots of outdoor gyms on the route so this makes it fun to have a mini workout on the way. There are also some amazing rock pools so make sure you take swimwear. It is about 6km I think so not too challenging. The views are stunning and definitely worth the walk
Nice walk. Walked Bondi to Coogee and thoroughly enjoyed it. Some steep terrain and lots of stairs at times but the views were absolutely amazing. Recommended it to anyone capable.

Beach. Coastal walking a long way , sightseeing & if you like to soak up the Sun and you can play water sports , surfboard or , swiming pool . Do you useualy the outside exercise jogging in the morning ...evening are there

Amazing views and Relaxing. We started around 2pm. We took 3 hours to complete the costal sceninc walk because we took photoes and coveted in a relaxing manner. Experience is wonderful. Amazing views. Well developed residential areas, clean and facility like drinking water available along the ways. My advice is to cover the route in 3 to 4 short walk. First Bondai to Tamarama beach. Then to Bronte beach. Then to Clovelly beach. Then Coogee. Take some rest and pics in these beaches. Toilet is available in these beaches. Not be missed attraction in Sydney. This is one of my best costal walk I have 3ver done.

A Must Do!. My husband and I took a bus from the CBD to Bondi Beach. (You can take the 333 or 380 from Oxford Street to Bondi Beach and the 373 from Coogee Beach to Oxford Street. Buy two one-way tickets per person at 7/11, the total bus fare is around $7.50 per person.) We spent some time at Bondi Beach and then began walking the 6 km trail. The trail includes some hills and a lot of steps, but we loved it! It was very scenic and one of the highlights of our stay in Sydney! I would definitely recommend walking/hiking this FREE trail!

Best walk in the world. If you do this Walk on the weekend, it can get busy but it's the best walk ever!Take your time, stop at Bronte and grab some breakfast, check out the cemetery, go for a swim in Tamarama, just take your time. On the weekend, there's heaps of celebrities that you can spot doing the walk.

Coastal walk between Coogee and Bondi Beaches/in Sydney. This is a MUST DO in Sydney for visitors (who are fit and healthy).It is a superb coastal walk along cliff tops with glorious sea and cliff views. It is quite safe walking, there are mostly paths, formed walks, street walking in parts. It can be quite crowded in summer and the warmer months.It is very popular for runners and walkers, both for visitors and locals who use it extensively.The walk is about 8 kms and is quite a physical effort so take water. There are shops along the way.You don't have to do the whole walk, you can stop at various beaches eg Bronte along the way and catch a bus back to the city or elsewhere.PS note parts of the walk have been damaged in the huge June 16 storms in Sydney. But you can bypass those easily.
Must do in Sydney . Try to do mid week as very busy weekends , a few stairs if you do the whole walk , bubblers and benches fairly common , really good views
Stunning!. Very enjoyable walk, it can really take the stress away and there are multiple areas you can stop and just rest along the way.
great walk and great views. parked at Coogee and walked North. Good stretch out for exercise and sweeping views of the sea and headlands. a must do.
A must do in Sydney. A gorgeous walk despite some of the path being closed after severe storms. 6 km in total with a few steps and hilly areas but quite manageable for most people

Queen's Birthday weekend. What a beautiful way to start your day! The trail-walk from Coogee to Bondi beach and back again was a challenge, but overally amazing too. The coastal views are absolutely breathtaking, and well worth the walk.
Great walk. Amazing walk around the beaches, very beautiful and peaceful ( maybe to avoid on a windy day, because it's freezing) but it really worth going there !

A good long walk with amazing views. Although Sydney was still cleaning up after a major storm we were able to walk on the path unless it was roped off so we would go around. Would recommend this walk.

Great walk and scenery.. Public transport is easy if you stay in the CBD and if you are a walker you will enjoy a great scenery of Bondi Beach, cliff formations and a great restaurant when you dine at Iceberg's.

It never gets old. I live in Bondi Beach and every time I do this walk I just have to take a photo - and no two photos are ever the same. Sunsets, whales, dolphins, sculptures by the sea, moody clouds, rough seas, rainbows, historic gravestones - even a few passengers from the Titanic are buried there. There is so much going on!I usually walk to Coogee Beach, have a nice big breakfast there then walk back again. It's a 14km walk there and back. If you're staying more than a few days you can't come to Sydney and not do this walk!

Stunning walk. Took the bus from Circular Quay to Coogee Beach, and the final stop is near the start/end of this paved trail . Some hills and steps, so it can be a decent workout if you want it to be. You can fill up your water bottle at fountains along the trail, and there are eateries at most of the beaches. The two times I did this walk over Easter weekend it was somewhat crowded, especially getting closer to Bondi, but not annoyingly so. That said, I was able to tune out the crowds by focusing on the amazing scenery of the rugged coast and lovely beaches. A wonderful public amenity not far from downtown.

A must when visiting Sydney. Don't just let tourist discover this most beautiful outing and it is free. If I lived locally it would be a weekly event. If you are looking for something to do, summer or winter...this is it, enjoy!
Stunning coastal walk. If you are in Sydney, you need to go there! I walked from Coogee to Bondi and it was spectacular! The nature, the coast, the ocean, the pools in corners! AWESOME!

Nice way to take in the coastline. Relatively easy walk, so popular with locals and tourists alike. We were dropped by friends at Clovelley and walked to Bondi. Its a classic walk. You walk past an assortment of coastal homes, a graveyard with one hell of a view, and some of Sydney's best beaches. Stop by and say hi to the Bondi Icebergs (surf club). Wear your sneakers, flats or thongs. It is a walk, not a hike. Lovely way to spend a couple of hours at a leisurely pace.

Cool Coastal Walk. This is one of the best walks in Sydney. Fantastic views, great beaches and bays, Australian flora and fauna, and some shops for a bite. It can be started from either end, and can even be extended beyond Coogee to Maroubra. If you do the walk around whale watching season (June-August) or during the Sculpture by the Sea exhibition (October-November) then you're in for an added bonus.

Great walk!. We took the train to Bondi Beach Station and then the bus to Bondi Beach which did not take much time at all. A great walk but be aware of many people who are running this coastal walk. There are plenty of places to take in the views if you wish to have a short break.

good walking tour along the beaches in Sydney city. It is such a good idea for a walking tour between Bondi and Coogee beach where you can enjoy the sea breeze and nice view . You also can drop by the local shopping for lunch , coffee and souvenirs. Don't miss this .

One of the best things to do in Sydney. About 5km of coastal walk. When we went, some paths were closed be cause of the damage made by a storm 2 days before. Even so we still found our way. A little tiring for some but the views are worth it.

Sculptures By The Sea. This is the most wonderful picturesque walk, especially when Sculptures By the Sea is held. Take the train to Sydney then bus to Bondi where Sculptures start and end up with your feet in the sand at Tamarama Beach or go the opposite direction and end up at Bondi have have a coffee or ice cream at Bondi. Wonderful.

Amazing walk. The cool weather of winter was perfect for walking all the way from Bondi to Coogee. The ocean view is breathtaking and the little breaks taken at local shops and cafes along the way added to the charm of the whole experience. Suitable for all levels of fitness since you set your own walking pace.
Fantastic experience . A really must see in Sydney. Nice view of ocean and cliffs during one hour walks, also lovely beaches on the way. It is highly recommended.
Fabulous views!. Enjoyable walk along the cliff tops overlooking the sea. Lots of steps so ensure you have good walking footwear.

A Must. There is always something going on along the walk whether it be a statue or food festival. The walk along is worth it with the amazing views and you exercise without realizing you are exercising which is the best type of exercising. I saw a whale off the coast by Brontee Beach. Do it. Do it often. Its amazing.
A coastal classic. We have done this before - what a neat way to wind down after a busy week. Bondi beach contrasts nicely with the more intimate Coogee. Spectacular.
Spectacular views.. It is a stiff walk so flipflops (Thongs) wont cut it and you will need sun slap, water and a hat on a hot day but if you are prepared then an enjoyable walk awaits you.

Fantastic view. This is one of the favourite things to do in Sydney. I have done a few times and it never me disappointed.
It takes me 2 hours and there are some up and down, so it's really good exercise. View is amazing and there are some nice cafes on the way too. Highly recommended!!

Amazing view!. I highly recommend going for the coastal walk between Bondi and Coogee. It has an amazing view of the ocean and the beaches around.
It is a free spectacle of the nature!
Great walk when the sun is out! Get your guns out!. Great walk along the cliffs all the way to Bronte. On a hot day it is a great way to get a tan! Highly recommended.

AS Iconic as The Bridge. Like Molly said "Do yourself a favour, when in Sydney, get out early in the morning to do this walk, the full to Coogee or the Half to Bronte, then breakfast then walk back or bus back into town, Sydney. Step by step is a vista, every bend a new view, take the camera , wear a smile, and enjoy this part of Sydney at its best. Scott
i miss it already. one of the best walk with a terrific view.I love this place and i hope i will be able to come back here soon

Do not miss this. This walk is spectacular and I would do it again and again as many of the locals do. There are lots of places to stop and fill your water bottle for free. There are also lots of places to stop and get a bite to eat or an ice cream. I would recommend Tamarama beach for food. The walk should only take a couple of hours at a gentle pace but there are so many lovely sights to stop off at, that it will probably take you longer. Take your "Swimmers" a.k.a swimming cosies because there are places where you can stop and go for a dip in the outdoor pools along the way. The best bit is Bondi to Clovelly as Clovelly to Coogee is not quite as good but if you do it, then Coogee Pavilion is a great place for food or drink and a nice town itself. Waverly cemetary is impressive, but the best bit is the view as you walk the route. It's one of the best things we did while in Sydney.

A great view!. Definitely a must, as a local we have done this walk/run in both directions, usually early on the weekend and finished with a swim and breakfast somewhere afterwards. It really shows off a couple of Sydney's best features, sandstone and the ocean...
almost 2 hrs walk and nice views , lots of eateries on way. good place if you have spare time and are a nature lover and like the sea , best past time for a ccouple or enjoying a family walk together

Get way to spend a few hours. This is such a wonderful walk. Six of us had a leisurely walk from Bondi and all enjoyed the wonderful views of our coastline along the way ending up with a nice lunch in a cafe in Bronte.

Water, walks, beaches, rocks. While my husband and kids were swimming at Icebergs I left to explore this walk- I set out not planning to go that far, but found it hard to turn around. Beaches, coves, rocks, and places to stop and eat - although I forgot my wallet- a nice shop owner gave me a cold water- thankfully!- and I continued onward. I really enjoyed some quiet and contemplation at the cemetery overlooking the water and drank in the warm sun and beautiful views. Don't forget your wallet, water and hat!

One of the best things I did in Sydney. This walk was a lot of fun and very scenic. It took me about an hour and a half with plenty of stops along the way. There are quite a few stairs and hills along the way.The highlight is probably the old swimming pool at coogee.

Must visit. Gorgeous area of sydney to a walk through.... just breathtaking. Nothing like the sound of the waves crashing and the smell of the sea in the air. It is a must do in Sydney. My favourite walk; each beach and area was beautiful and well maintained. Go on a nice sunny day and when it is not too windy.

Cliff Walk. This is a good cliff and beach walk even in the rain. Do not miss this, Take the bus to Coogee Beach and walk to Bondi Beach.Do NOT Stop at Bondi keep going on the walk from Bondi to Watsons Bay. The entire walk is well worth it.
Not to be missed. Take an evening stroll on this lovely route as the sun sets. Experience the transition from the dynamics of Bondibeach to the relative calm of Coogee. Superb experience.

What if you're not a beach person. I know the overwhelming consensus is that this is a fabulous walk. Well, it's certainly lovely scenery (though quite hot and sticky, even in April) and great exercise, but if you're not a beach person particularly or you've seen enough beaches in your life that a beach is a beach is a beach or you're from some place like California where you'll see much of the same thing along the coast ... you get the point. I'm not sorry I did it, but I wouldn't have missed anything much if I hadn't. Best parts: the Smoothies along the way and the Coogee Pavilion bar at the end!

Wonderful view. It is a great option. Take a day away from busy Sydney and relax on this coastal walk. Have lunch in Bondi Beach and, to finish the day, have a massage session. There are plenty of excellent places!
Nice walk. Get to bondi , park up and walk along the coast to see more secluded beaches . Can also see Dolphins . Nice few hours walk
Spectacular. Just a beautiful walk with fantastic views and lots of fresh air. We stopped off at Clovelly had coffee and cake, delicious.
Beautiful walk. If you have moderate fitness and don't mind steps you should do this walk! We had lunch at Sea Salt at Clovelly on the way which broke the walk up nicely.

Beautiful walk. Highly recommended as a 1/2 day trip.
If I were to do it again, I would bring a water bottle, gym clothes and run the path.
I also recommend doing so early in the morning or in the evening when there aren't so many tourists around.
The walk itself has incredible views. Great restaurants at Coogee when you are done.
Breath taking. Worth it to go. It´s about 1.5, 2 hour walk trough a path next to the clifs. Very well maintained and stunning views. Discover spots you never imagined before.
Beautiful views. Did this walk and enjoyed it fully. There are stairs up and down, so if that's a problem be aware. I'm not super fit and it was no problem for me

Spectacular views all along this walk.
