You can start this walk at either end, By starting at Coogee Beach you can finish at Bondi Beach and have a drink or meal at the famous Icebergs Club, which is located just above the spectacular coastal walkway. Be prepared for some step climbing by wearing comfortable shoes

Sculptures by the Sea. This is a stimulating walk along the cliff tops and around the beaches.Best done in sportswear and good joggers / walking shoes .A camera is a must and a water bottles is recommended.Option of hopping on a bus @ the Coogee end or walk both ways .

Fantastic walk. This is a very easy but really beautiful walk. From Sydney, we got the train and then the bus to Bondi Beach, and then walked all the way to Coogee Beach. It is an easy walking path so can be completed by all fitness levels, and there were multiple water fountains along the route which I thought was great.

views, views and more views. We did this walk in February and it was quite hot on the day we walked but, the views never stop. The one tip I might add if you are traveling by public bus as we did and plan to swim at Bondi, take the bus to Coogee and walk toward Bondi, same views but you end up at Bondi Beach for a nice swim and lunch.

Classic Sydney. A great walk along the coast that is good to do in any season. I usually start at Coogee or Clovelly beach as it is easier to park, and walk to Bondi for a meal or ice cream. Late October early November the Sculpture by the Sea exhibition is on which is fabulous, but there are a lot more people around. At all times of the year there are a lot of people running along the path so keep to the side, but it is a fairly easy walk with spectacular views.
Leisure Walk. Love the path to have a casual walk . The view is wonderful and absolutely easy for everyone to take a walk.

Most beautiful views. The walk is easy . It takes about two hours because you can not resist stopping every step and enjoy the view,take pictures and be amazed with the scenery.
A must DO activity while in Sydney from Bondi to Coogee.
Fun Day. Found out about this attraction online. Perfect location to chill and relax with friends for a Saturday afternoon. Recommend to visitors coming to Sydney!

Walking with my Aussie Grandson.. Although of a certain age and varying levels of fitness , walking from Coogee to Bondi is just wonderful . Stop to watch the bowlers at Clovelly, have lunch at the cafe overlooking the sea. Sit down on route to rest and admire the view. Pass the time of day with other walkers. Feel the fresh air on your face and breathe it into your lungs, stop and read the gravestones in the cemetery which overlooks the sea, very interesting. I could go on and on.

Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal Walk - Magnificent views, historic sites.. Spectacular scenery from clifftops. There are 6 beaches, bays and cliff walks to follow. Aboriginal carvings are easily seen on the walk around MacKenzies Bay and Australia's oldest cemetery is of great interest where many prominent, famous and infamous people have been laid to rest.Walking shoes and a camera are important along with swimmers and towel if you are planning on a swim.The amenities and change rooms provided are excellent for those wishing to shower and change after a swim.The walk can take from 1 hour to an entire day depending on your plans to stop and picnic or explore each beach. There are many cafes along the way where you can enjoy a meal or coffee.

One of the best walks I've ever done!. Be aware, it's a long one, but well worth it. The little hidden gems you find along the way are stunning, from clifftop lookouts to tiny beaches and swimming holes, there isn't a boring part of this walk. It can get chilly up there too, even in summer, and there is no shelter along the walk, so bring whatever you need to be prepared for different weather. This will easily take up half of your day.

Refreshing and spectacular. Without a doubt this is one of the best walks in the Country. We undertook this walk within 6 weeks of my knee surgery and found it to be comfortable with seating readily available for rest breaks. The scenery is brilliant from the populace of Bondi to the smaller but wild beaches of Tamarama and Bronte to the pleasant surrounds of Coogee. Wish we lived close enough to make this our daily trek.
"Stunning, every aspect was beautiful". An easy walk, with so much to stop and look at. So take your time! Start off with a cool ale at Bondi "Icebergs"

Excellent walk even in winter.. Beautiful, picturesque walk. Parking at Bondi is never easy, so if you can use public transport might be better. The walk is extremely busy on weekends so if you can go weekdays its better. Even in winter, on a sunny day with little wind it can be really pleasant.From memory it takes about 2 hrs leisurely pace.

symbolic walk for Sydney life style. I would take my friends to this walk, rather than a photo for three sisters or shopping malls.The view, the beach, the weather(most of the time), revealed the true Sydney and explained why property there is so expensive. :)tips: I walked from Coogee to Bondi because it is easier to find a parking loti Coogee and a good restaurant in Bondi to reward ourselves.
Breathtaking Ocean Views . Beautiful walk but can be crowded on the weekends. You really get a crisp taste of Sydney and can get right up to the edge of the cliffs. Very refreshing!
Great walk on a sunny day. Beautiful views and contrasting vistas. Some of the walk can be a little strenuous if you lack mobility
Magnificent. I walked here many times and make it a must when in Sydney in the summer , then have a surf at Bondi.

A Great Walk. An easy walk for all levels of fitness. Allow 2 hrs. You can walk it in either direction, busses will get you to and away to and from both start points. I personally would recommend Coogee to Bondi. Why ?, simple. You will finish your journey at the Bondi Iceburgs Club. This is a private members club where you can usually sign in as a visitor without problem. Entrance is at street level and not to be confused with the very upmarket restaurant which occupies the top level of the building. You will be able to get a well priced meal/grill and ample beverages whilst sitting on the sunny terrace overlooking the famous Bondi Beach. But wait, there's more !!. On the beach side of the building is a fabulous salt water pool for your use after paying a few dollars entrance. You can have a swim and a hot shower after your walk and then head upstairs to the club refreshed. Even in winter it's worth the plunge and a couple of quick laps.

Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk. This is a must do while in Sydney. The 7k easy walk takes you along another iconic part of Sydney's amazingly scenic coastline.The many beaches along the way are all gorgeous. Spend the day exploring them. Take your bathers and lots of photos.Refuel at the many cafes you'll find.I can't think of a better way to enjoy this part of Sydney.

The best activity to see/do in Sydney. When visiting Sydney I highly recommend you come to Bondi. Make it early in the day, and bring your swimmers for best results. Then head south along the beaches walk. Enjoy the views along the cliff tops...you might even see whales. You'll come to a very small beach at Tamarama where only the beautiful will sun bake. Continue on to Bronte where you might stop at one of the many cafes. As you continue south you'll pass through a cemetery...watch out for ghosts! You'll then come upon a very unique little bay, cemented on both sides with a tiny beach at the end. Did you bring your goggles? This is the perfect place to enjoy a dip and swim with the local menagerie of fish. The groupers are amazing to see! As you continue south you'll pass around Gordon's Bay, which is popular with scuba divers, until you crest the cliffs to arrive at Coogee. You might want to stop off here for a beer at the famous Coogee Bay Hotel. But it's not too far to go to Maroubra from here...you're almost there. And remember you can always bus it home if you choose not to make the return journey!

Quite simply stunning. Probably the first bucket list item you should tick off if coming to Sydney. Amazing scenery. Why not finish with a breakfast at Bondi or Coogee or even better start at Bondi and finish at lunch at the Pavillion in Coogee

Excellent walk. You may be lucky enough to whales as we were.Super views ,you do need to have a level of fitness as it does have some steep stairs .In summer there is always a cool breeze in winter you might need to rug up.Definitely worth doing.
Well worth doing if you are there. A nice general walk.fantastic views.Well worth doing if you are in the area especially if it is a nice sunny day.

Beach break from the city life?. Had enough of the city and a bit of quiet time needed? This walk is just perfect for that!! There weren't to many people about and that was on a Sunday morning when I expected it to be packed. We got to enjoy the stunning scenery and most beautiful lookouts on the most beautiful little bays

A 'must do'. A fantastic walk along the coastline with stunning scenery at every turn. There some steps involved but not too many & you may need to stop for a breather but not for long. Beautiful beaches along the route & look into the bushes & spot the spiderwebs with the biggest spiders I have ever seen. Don't worry they are not on the path. We finished our walk at the Coogee Pavillions with a nice glass of Chardonnay. Only sorry we couldn't have taken our collie on the walk whom we had left back in the UK. Enjoy!

Pleasant walk, nice views.. I started by having breakfast in Bondi, and just continued along the coast line. This is a fairly easy walk with some ups and downs. I found a lovely cafe in Clovelly for a break and would recommend that highly. From there only another 20 minutes to Coogee. Buses stop right off the beach and take you back to Bondi Junction. (313 and 314 are direct).

Best Sydney view of the ocean. Bondi coastal walk is a beautiful excursion along the rocks with fantastic views of the water. Plenty of places to stop and watch the surfers, or just listen to the crashing waves. This is not an activity recommended for those who have difficulty walking as there are a lot of ups and downs, steps, and uneven stone pathways. For everyone else, it's not to be missed!

Beautiful scenery. Not being the fittest of people we only did Bondi to the Clovelly Bowls Club where we enjoyed a nice cold beer sitting outside looking at the ocean. The walk was a little challenging with a few hills & a lot of stairs but the scenery made it all worth it.
Best walk. Just a beautiful walk, bondi beach one the most beautiful beaches in the world, walking to Coogee just amazing views over the eastern coast line.

Beautiful but more challenging than expected. Did the walk in the afternoon but would advise to go in the morning as that is when the sunlight is best utilised. The walk is a must do when visiting Sydney but be prepared to work up a sweat as there are plenty of steps and hills to challenge you. Wear comfortable shoes and your typical summer outfit - although we went late afternoon end of May and got quiet chilly so a jacket is highly recommended.

A must do. This walk is beautiful for locals and visitors alike. You walk past some of Sydneys best beaches. Bondi is a must for the visitors due to the game but the other beaches are more beautiful and more relaxed. My personal favourite is Clovelly, nice and chilled and a decent enough snorkel spot. Gordon's bay screams Instagram me. Bronte and Tamarama are full of locals. There are also a few pubs if you detour slightly. On a hot day there is nothing better than a drink in a Bondi icebergs, walk on to Clovelly beach hotel and finish on the rooftop of Coogee pavilion. Exercise, scenery and alcohol. Living the dream.

Not to be missed!. This walk was one of my favorite activities in Sydney. So many places to stop and take in the view, jump in the water, eat/drink. If time allows, leave a whole day open for this, you will not be disappointed.

Great costal walk. From the Circular Quays in Sydney take the 333 bus and 40 minutes later you are at Bondi Beach. Walk along the golden sand, paddle your feet or take a swim before starting your walk along the costal path to Coogee Bay. The walk is fairly easy with steps up and down, slopes up and down, all on a fairly clearly defined walk.

Relaxing and easy. I think the best time to do this walk is early in the morning, the views were great and the people along the way all friendly. I did this walk after arriving in Sydney on the night bus, leaving the hostel close by to go and do the walk and I was so glad I did. Best thing to shake an 11 hour journey! Coogee beach is a great place to relax and have a little snooze when you're done as well.

Great day out. Loved the coastal walk including beaches and options for a coffee stop along the way. Went on a Sunday so $2.50 included train to Bondi Junction, bus to Bondi beach, bus from Coogee back to the city and the train home. Quite a few stairs so be prepared.

Lovely walk. Great walk from the beach with fantastic views over the ocean with the surfers,quite a few steps but well worth taking the stroll and watch the Sydneysiders strutting their stuff along the path

A gorgeous walk. This is one of the 2 best walks in Sydney. The view of the ocean is with you for almost all of the walk. Always advisable to take swimming costumes to cool off at any one of the beautiful beaches you pass. A must for Sydney visitors and residents alike but try to avoid crowded weekends.

Great Exercise with amazing views!. This should be on everyones list of things to do while in Sydney. The beaches are amazing and the walk is long enough to count as a great work out for the day. Make sure and bring a water bottle (there are refill stations along the way). Plus a great place to walk your dog (we saw many people with their pets)! Go on a sunny day that isn't too hot and it is just perfect!
We did half. We walked from Bronte to Bondi and it was spectacular! Great views at Bronte. Easy walk with lots of areas to stop and take pics or access the beaches.

Great experience to do for FREE. This is a wonderful way to see Bondi Beach without even having to get in the water. Bond with the locals while they're exercising or just taking a great walk. Beautiful scenery!

nice walk with many opportunities to take nice pictures. nice walk with many opportunities to take nice pictures. Though is it worth to visit Bondi Beach just because of the walk (otherwise I would recommend Manly Beach)? ... I'm not sure. But if you have enough time, then do it.
Good scenic walk. Good walk along bondi beach,the full walk is about 6 km but you can do a part of it too.Very scenic with several small parks,beaches and fitness areas to take a break.
Breathtaking. Gorgeous views of the coasts and really nice to do on any given day. This walk can be made shorter if need be but the full thing is definitely worth it.

One of the Highlights of our Trip to Sydney. Excellent walk. However did in reverse - Coogee to Bondi. Caught bus from Circular Quay, Stand A to Coogee.Had breakfast at Little Jack Horner at Coogee.There was a nip in the air when we started the walk but had warmed up 30 minutes later. Excellent coastal views up to Bondi. We were told by a Sydney local that the walk is better going up to Bondi and less upwards climb. Having Bondi to look at on the way up was a good incentive, view wise. Stopped at Tamarama Beach cafe for an early morning tea. Did not find the steps exerting at all and enjoyed the views.
Beautiful walk . Stunning walk. Great path with plenty of bits to stop sit down and soak in the views. If you like planes great to watch planes coming in to Sydney if wind in correct direction.

Great Scenic walk . I did a 10k on this nice trail. There are a lot of spots to take pictures. There are a lot of people running or jogging along the walk. Get yourself ready get water, lots of water, sun glasses and a hat.

Awesome sights to see. The walk is 3.8 miles and you need to take a full morning or afternoon to do it. Great sights along the way, but lots of climbing up and down cliffs and stairs. So glad we did not miss out of this outing.
Amazing walk!. had a walk from bondi beach to coogee and it was awesome,had a really breathtaking view and a really nice stroll along the natural walls
Excellent views, very busy on weekends. Great views of the ocean, and beaches. Very safe walk with cafes along the way. However, very busy on weekends.

This is one of the top 10 Coastal Walks in the world!. It goes without saying that this is one of the top coastal walks in the world!We do this walk at least once every two months. It is always in the To-Do list with overseas friends and family. The walk takes about 1hr 30min and it is not physically difficult. We have done it even with baby on Babybjorn, toddlers and elderly parents and they all have enjoyed it.Make sure you do this if you are in Sydney during "Sculptures by the Sea" (20th Oct- 6th Nov 2016)
Awesome views. Best views in this coastal. Very romantic really and you can even see dolphins in some part of the year. Great view to Bondi beach and Tamarama beach.Bring your date here

Wonderful walk. Great views across the bays on the way and out to the ocean. Best part of our trip to Sydney. Lunch and a beer at the Coogee Bay Hotel was a great reward at the end of the walk. Our day started with ferry to Watson for a walk around South Head then a bus to Bondi Beach to start the walk. Fantastic day.
Breathtaking. Views.. We walked from Bondi to Clovelly. Sunny cool day, great way to experience the coastline. Very well kept up, many places to stop for coffee or a cold drink.

Excellent walk. Have done this walk many times very easy walk with some stairs but I think any age could do it, lovely ocean and beach views. When you get to Coogee nice places to eat or have a drink.

a pointless journey along a spectacular coastline. I was coerced into doing this, and although I marveled at the coastline the endless steps and scantily clad maidens in their gym pants skipping up countless steps which was a pleasant distraction overall it was a heart testing journey that one with a heart condition should not attempt, beautiful scenery, rugged sandstone but take your own water and glucose for there is little to purchase along the way, and when you get to the end the pain barrier reaches perilous heights as you need to walk back to your car and you traverse it again

Every Turn is jaw dropping views. The walk is not that hard, but the views are beyond amazing. Every turn yields new views that challenge your views you just past. Plenty of places along the way to stop, sit and admire or grab a coffee.Lots of cool breezes on hot days and locals around if you have a question.Well worth the walk and really amazing views.
Must do. If you have a couple of days in Sydney you should go.It's better during summer, and take your swim suit, there are some spots where you can dive and see some sea life

Scenic walk. Relaxing and easy to do with a variety of people including locals and tourists. It can be done as exercise eg a run or jog or just simply a stroll to take in the beautiful scenery. Easy to find but parking is metered and may be limited. A lot of public transport that is frequent and easily accessible from the city and bondi junction Westfield. Can go to the beach a long the way for a quick dip and have a bite to eat too.

Ocean love. It's a very nice place for just sunbathing or swimming, learning surfing (schools and instructors are available), picturesque views - ocean, waves, cliffs - if you have time - take the road along the beach and climb some small cliffes to enjoy sun and freedom.

Gorgeous afternoon stroll. This was recommended to me by a local. It's a good afternoon stroll and you get to beach hop as you go along. It's not a short walk though, so bring comfy walking shoes as well as flip flops

You have to do this if in Sydney. I was on my own as my husband had business meetings and decided to go to Bondi and do the walk. I am really glad that I did as it is really beautiful - and free and healthy! It's an easy walk, no need to put on special shoes. I saw people doing it in flip flops, which I wouldn't necessarily recommend due to some of the steps, but you certainly don't need athletic shoes etc. You can stop off and see the cemetery, grab a drink, take a seat and just enjoy along the way. I walked Bondi to Coogee but I know many prefer the other way as you come upon Bondi as a final reveal. I went on a Monday so it was quieter. There were some serious runners and I can imagine that when busy this could be quite a slow walk. I like to walk briskly so it was a good day for me to go.

The best Urban Beach walk (in my mind). On the edge of the continent lies this 2 meter strip of concrete which takes you to sweeping views and beautiful urban beaches. There is bus and public transport access at both ends of the walk, as well as at the middle beaches of Bronte and Clovelly. The snorkeling is excellent in Clovelly basin, or the bay just to the south. Keep an eye out for stingrays if you enter from the beach in Gordons Bay, I saw 3 while still wait deep in the water!

Great to enjoy with friends. We enjoyed this beautiful walk on a lovely day the views are fantastic you can do this walk as long as your healthy and no leg problems there are lots of steps we were all in our late 60s and had no problem go and enjoy it you wont regret it

One of the sea walks of the world . Ocean, cliffs, coves and beaches all the way. Places to stop for a coffee or breather. Choose a nice day and keep going to Maroubra to get the most out of the walk. Catch public transport back if you must but walking back as well adds to the joy of the day. It's not too far, we're in our 70's and still had leftover energy after the round trip walk. A must for your overseas visitors and out of town friends. Make sure you show them this best part of Sydney

Awesome Scenic Experience. The walk from Coogee Beach to Bondi beach is truly incredible. This is a walk that most people could complete with ease. At a leisurely pace you can complete this walk in 1-1/2 to 2 hours. Enjoy the various coves, wildlife, and people enjoying the beaches and water. Also remember your camera(you'll know what I mean when you experience this walk).This is one free thing to do that we will never forget. .....

Picturesque morning walk. Thi Walk filled a path rift along the coast, it is a great easy walk with lots of variations of stairs and small hills to keep it interesting. I took my 11 year old daughter who also found the walk enjoyable. Not recc for people with mobility problems or those with prams. It can get quite busy as it is a popular track for joggers.

was lucky to do it lots of times. This is the beutifull path that goes along the rocky cost, up and down. Windy, sunny, with smell of ocean and see breeze. If u want avoid crowds go on weekday during working hours. Join groups of joggers, runners or walkers is also interesting. Lots of point to watch surfers - specially those surfing south Bondi and Tamarama beach. take good comfy shouse, bathing costume and go ! it is a must

Great walk. This is a top of the notch walk. Extremely picturesque and breathtaking. Make sure you plan plenty of time to do the walk so you can stop and take everything in without feeling rushed. The walk can be busy from time to time

Time Just Flew By!. It was a sunny Autumn day in Sydney and I decided to take the taxi to Bondi and walk along the beach/cliff all the way to Coogee. Boy, what an awesome experience! The views were intensely beautiful. It took me over 3 hours to complete the walk but time just passed by. Very therapeutic. I'd do it again in a hearbeat!

VIEWS TDF. Love doing this walk and particularly when Sculpture by the Sea is on. The views are spectacular. It is a little bit up and down hill wise but worth the effort and of course there is always great coffee or lunch at the other end. Try not to pick a windy day unless of course that is your thing.

Not the best walk. The walk from Coogee Beach to Bondi was not what I expected. You have some beautiful parts but you also have parts that aren't that nice like walking along a cemetery, or on the side of the road ...

Go on a nice cool/ summer day. This is a great walk, i love it. I've done it where the rocks are, if you do decide to do that be cautious of where you step and go, it gets a lot harder in the middle. But i'd stick to the pathway

My favourite Sydney walk. You start this walk at beautiful Bondi beach .. Then walk by a coast to Coogee 6 km passing most beautiful beaches , tamarama beach , btonte , clowely beach , etc . Lists of rock pools too , cafes on the way where you can stop and rest . I love walking to coggee and then have a drink at coggee pavilions and then walk back . Together 12 km but you'll be fine as you won't feel the pain because you are at that magic place

A must do if you like the beach / beach views. To the left of Bondi beach you see many rocks you can scramble/ walk along. Go to the right to start the cliff walk which connects many beach coves together. There are a few different pools of ocean water pumped in that you can swim in for free which is a pretty unique experience. Tons of restaurants and souvenier shops across from Bondi as well. Easy bus routes to bondi from Sydney business area.

Bondi - Shaken not Stirred. First - It's pronounced Bond-eye not Bondy like I kept calling it. Although it looks Bondy-like as in a breathtaking destination scene from a James Bond movie. This beach is amazing, no picture can ever do this beach justice. It goes on forever. The sand is a soft cream-coloured powder and the water is a soothing turquoise. You can't help but just want to take it all in for hours. The walk is incredible, every corner and curve in the paved path introduces you to another incredible view of not just the beach but some of the strangest rock formations I have ever seen. It takes a lot of time to get through this trail simply due to the fact that you keep stopping to try to capture these images on camera. From a distance it looks like the mediterranian with it's hillside homes and beautiful sand. I understand why there is so much hype about this place. On Bondi beach itself there is a large grassy area free of sand where you can sit down and enjoy a meal from one of the great restaurants or cafes along the strip.Walking the path is very easy, there are plenty of places to stop and relax or take pictures as well as refill your water bottle with filtered water for free. Wash rooms are also available to the public. Ladies, even if you don't see any of the Hemsworth brothers, Hugh Jackman or any of the other Australian beefcakes on the beach, this is still an amazing place to see.
Gorgeous views. So much fun! But stick to the paths because Australians are protective of their wildlife and nature.

Bondi to Coogee Walk on a great sunny day. This is an amazing walk which many people do for fitness and I believe it can be done in 1.5 to 2 hours. However we took about 6 hours as we stopped at Tamarama for morning tea in the lovely cafe there. Then swam at Bronte Beach and had lunch at Clovelly at the cafe there as the Surf Club was booked for a function. It was such an interesting walk with lots of points of interest.

Well worth the journey. In all the years I've visited Sydney I've never done this walk. It takes about an hour or two depending on how slow you walk. My friend and I liked to stop off along the way and have lunch at the cafes and grab a coffee etc so we took our time. The beaches are all so beautiful.

Absolutely Stunning. I have done this walk a few times and it never fails to have me awe struck. It is breathtakingly beautiful and makes me appreciate being in this beautiful country so much! I walked from South Coogee to Bondi and back, it took a good few hours and I definitely felt it on those steps on the way back! I'm not sure why Bondi is so famous though, it is lovely but it has nothing on some of the beaches along the way in my opinion. Definitely do this if you get the chance.

A must do!. This is a great workout and beautiful way to see the beach. The Coogee part of the walk is more strenuous so it might be a good idea to do that part first so you're not doing that when you're tired at the end.

Beautiful (and free). A nice walk past numerous beaches with great ocean views. We had fun a bit off the path sitting on the rocks washing the waves break below us. Fun surfer watching and you can head back at any point on the walk via bus.
nice view. the coastal walk is nice as the weather was breezy and a little sunny. path was clean and easy to stroll along.

Great views, confusing at the end. Loved the walk, stopped of to paddle and feast on fish and chips, watch the surfers and the volleyball. Towards the last bit the signage disappeared and I wad unsure how much further I had to go (I was on a tight time scale and was wanting to head back to the city). Once i reached Coogee it was obvious I was in the right spot however and public transport was easy to use

I'm a local and it's still wonderful. Provided you're reasonably mobile all visitors to Sydney should spend an afternoon on the beautiful Eastern Beach's Coastal walk. It's one of the jewels in Sydney's crown and full of beauty with lots of beaches and cafe spots where you can stop and relax. A Sydney must-do!I'm an Eastern Beach's local and it's still a favourite thing to do when I have the time.
Easy walk, fantastic views.. A lovely easy walk with great views. See some of Sydney's best beaches. Lots of fantastic restaurants and cafes close by. Easy to reach and go home by public transport.

Wonderful way to see the beaches. This is a great way to spend a couple hours, walking from Bondi to Coogee along the coastal walk. I would not recommend doing this in flip flops - it's a long 6km walk that has some ups and downs, is exposed to the sun and has 6 beautiful beaches and coves to relax and enjoy. Don't forget your water and sun cream, maybe even a bathing suit to enjoy one of the beaches / pools that you pass along the way.We chose to walk the entire way and rewarded ourselves with pints at the Coogee Bay Hotel. Deserved!

Fantastic view of the coastline. Nice way to explore some of Sydney's beaches. A few steep climbs but worth it as the scenery is great. Be wary of joggers, some can be quite aggressive and won't hesitate to vent their frustrations if you get in the way of their marathon 1st place performances.

Stunning coastal beauty whilst talking with a friend. This was a walk I had never done in its entirety but it is well worth it. It is not a difficult walk, you can go your own pace, take your swimmers for a dip. My tip is to walk to Coogee and have lunch at the pavilion when you arrive. You will have worked up an appetite.

Stunning . Little you can say about this walk other than it's beautiful. Done it many times. Will take at least 2 hours so just be prepared for that.We took a 4 year old forgetting how far it was and felt awful at 10k mark when his little legs were falling off (bad parent alert!).Enjoy!

Lovely walk with amazing views. Every time we visit Sydney we set aside time to do the costal walk from Bondi to Coogee.The views are amazing with a photo op everywhere you look.Well worth the time if you've got a few hours spare
Long walk. very long walk but worth it for the views and the art work along the way very good path but some steps

The Best Coastal Walk in Sydney. If you have to take a coastal walk in Sydney, this would be it. The walk is slightly more than 6km and you need to spend 2-3 hours for a leisurely walk. You start from Bondi beach and you will be guided by lots of signs along the way. This is a fairly easy walk, though you may have to climb up and down some steps along the way. The views are beautiful and you will meet lots of fellow walkers along the way. You can even break up the walk and stop at Bronte beach before continuing to Coogee beach. Along the way, you will also see the beautiful waverly cemetery. Best to walk in the early morning or evening when it is cooler. Enjoy the breeze and sights along the way. Along the way, you can also refill your water bottle. Sydney has lots of watering stations all over the main public areas. If you wish to stop halfway, you can always take a bus back to Bondi junction and then catch the train. This walk is one of the best activity I have done in Sydney.

just do it!!!. This walk is amazing!! The scenery, the beaches, the experience is so worth the walk. We ended our walk at Coogee and loved our food and drink at the Pavillion. A treasure, just do it, you will not regret it!

Best beach and rocks - Nature at it's best. The best beach I have ever visited, the coogee walk from the Bindu beach through the rocks is a must do. Also, take the bus 389 to Watson's bay and take the ferry to Circular quay to finish your wonderful trip to Bondi .

Beautiful. What a great way to spend the day! Beautiful views of stunning oceanscapes. The walk is a bit of a workout if you want it to be but not difficult - we were in flip flops. Plenty of places to stop and take in all the amazing scenery.

Beautiful views and a nice walk. Started from Bondi Beach and easily followed the trail. Not very strenuous of a walk and there are places that you can stop and rest, have a coffee, etc. very strong ocean breeze, so you need to think about the temperature and consider bringing a light jacket.Took the bus from Sydney by the harbor and was very easy. Probably the easiest way to get there.

The walk gets more beautiful with every step. Great walk. Great views and a good way to exercise and people-watch at the same time! Have a drink and/or a pizza when you get to Coogee Pavillion to reward yourself! It's a great spot with the breeze from the sea and lots of amazing cocktails to choose from....

Awesome. What could i say, you walk the best beaches ever on a very nice and rough coast. There are waterstations everywhere and u have a lovely cemetry on the way. We start in Bondi beach and walk up to cogee.

Pristine beaches. This is a must do if you are visiting Sydney and love beaches. Started the walk from Bondi to Coogee around 1pm stopping at various beaches and clicking pictures. The walk was tiring by the end of it but it was great way of seeing all the beaches.

Amazing !! . If you are in Sydney I would recommend putting aside half a day (at least ) to explore the Bondi 'icebergs'. It's only a 30minute bus ride from the CDB but worth it.Great view and a great place to sit and relax. Take your bathers and a good set of shoes!!

Beautiful!!!. This walk is on my must do in Sydney list. Stunning cliffs, beaches. Every 100 steps I wanted to take a picture. The entire walk took my husband and I 2 hours - including all the stops for photos. Others say Bondi to Bronte is enough, but we started at Coogee and headed to Bondi for lunch. Glad we did the Coogee to Bronte part, so pretty. There are stairs in parts but the whole walk is designed for all abilities to enjoy. We went on a Sunday morning, as the morning progresses it got a bit busy with joggers and families. But there is lots of room and it never felt crowded. You won't regret using a half day of your Sydney vacation for this unforgettable sea side walk.
Feel the freedom. The walk is beautiful. Great place to see the day begin. Just remember to bring water. Only two ships along the walk to buy water.

Amazing and stunning. Beautiful view and refreshing walk passing many smaller beach along the way. The oath is good and often has stairs so not good for prams. It gets busy so stick to the left side .The bonus is you can always have a swim if you get too hot

Magnificent views. This is a easy walk but it's not wheelchair friendly. Must take a hat and water. You can go for a swim along the way. Not a lot of shade so advice to take an early morning walk or late afternoon in summer

Spectacular Views. This is a great walk with excellent views. The one downside was the narrow path and steps and with the huge crowds doing the walk it was not pleasant. I would suggest doing the walk during the week when it's probably less crowded.

This walk makes me regret not being motivated. Let's face it, I'm a couch potatoe. However when my wife manages to get me to undertake this spectacular walk I always regret not being motivated to walk this more frequently. Such breathtaking views, lovely cafe's along the way, views whilst the sun warms us, views with a refreshing breeze. Makes you glad to be alive. Did I mention the views.

Don't miss this ...it's easy and free !!!!!. You don't have to go on a tour. Just get to Bondi Beach and then at the southern end of the beach, you will see the concrete walkway. You would have to be blind not to see it. First, getting to Bondi Beach is easy. You can catch buses from the city or catch the train to Bondi Junction and then a bus ....just a few minutes further.The walk hugs the coast and is very easy ...you can't get lost and you can walk at your pace. Moreover, here are many points where bus routes are nearby so you can pull the pin whenever you want. The walk is generally flat some steps but again walk at your pace. Houses and parks on your right and spectacular views of the Sydney coastline to your left.This is an absolute must and can take you a few hours or all day .... Stopping for coffee etc at (say) Coogee Beach would be highly recommended and then just walk across the park and hop on a bus back to Bondi Junction where you can either shop or catch the train back into the Sydney CBD or do both. This would be a rather cheap day...just costs you time and a few dollars on what you want to spend.Truly, no need to join an organised your. I live in Sydney and when we can, take visitors on this walk. Each time, I see something different and often stop and just crave at the views.

Breathtaking views!. This is an incredible walk & highly recommended. You can stop off half way at Bronte for a bite to eat or coffee at one of the many little cafes (my favourite is Caffe Salina).Note: there are a few sections with stairs so difficult to take little ones especially in prams.

Lovely scenic water views. This is a beautiful relaxing walk. You can start from Clovelly where there is a cafe and salt water pool. Then walk along the coast to Bondi. From there it takes about 30 minutes at a reasonable pace. The best time to do this is when the Sculptures by the Sea exhibition is on in November. Expect crowds at that time, however the walk is enhanced with artwork. This starts from Tamarama and reaches Bondi. Really a lovely walk that is quite breathtaking!
Great activity. Did this walk on a blustery day with scattered showers but still fun. Caught a bus back to the city from Bondi.

Fill the soul while burning them calories. Relatively easy walk with all the paths marked fairly clearly although there were some parts that could have been better signed. About 2 hours n a bit if u stop to take in the scenery. Views are majestic, public transport awaiting at coogee (m50 takes u directly to central station), water fountains n toilets along the way.

Sydney Bucket List item. If you only have one day in Sydney and you want to swap the CBD for the beautiful Sydney coastline then this walk is for you.You don't have to do the entire walk to soak in the beauty of Sydney's pristine beaches, take a little bite and see how much you can do. Perfect for those working on their fitness to those hopeless romantics stilling along without a care in the world. Enjoy views of some of Sydney's most expensive real estate and beautiful marine parks as you stroll through a well laid path with plenty of amenities along the way.Give yourself plenty of time to really do this walk justice and don't forget your camera, you'll want memories of this place.
Skakavac. Nice views,beaches, and fun and food on Bondi is excellent .strongly recomending to All sorts of visitors. North Bondi rsl great view and good fish and chips.
Beautiful. Walked there by sunset. Looks at awesome beaches with good surfers. Easy to find and follow the track. And it is totally FREE

Excellent walk - well set up pathways. Surprisingly well maintained set of pathways. Good morning spent with the familyHave to say we were impressed that with the amount of people walking with there dogs we only had to dodge one pile on the path..Education and availability of bags along track are working wellViews are to die for..Only downer was the foul sewerage stench around Bondi surf club

A trip highlight. What a beautiful walk!We took a taxi from Circular Quay to Coogee Beach and began our walk in the direction of Bondi beach. On the Coogee side of the hike, there is little walker traffic on the path - just gorgeous views and beautiful homes. (I recommend this direction)We hadn't brought our suits to swim - wish we had! There are a number of pools to swim in along the way (they appear to be public pools except for Icebergs, which is undoubtedly private), in addition to wading into the ocean at any of the numerous beaches along the way.
A beautiful way to see the beaches! . The costal walk is a fun, easy and scenic way to see the famous beaches in Sydney! I recommend going in the morning and stopping for lunch afterwards!
A must see and do whilst at Bondi. See the best beaches in Australia, maybe even the world, take a leisurely walk along the coast, you can even visit the Waverley cementry on you way.

What a way to start the day!. Sydney put on wonderful weather and a perfectly still morning for my morning run his morning. 13kn return starting in Coogee and return was fun but hard with stairs and some hills but 100% worth it and recommended - plus you can walk and enjoy it even more.

Fantastic views. Beautiful, easy to follow route between the 2 famous beaches. Plenty of water stations and restrooms along the route. Great views, wonderful photo opportunities.....really enjoyed the hike. Took us about 3 hours at a very leisurely pace. Highly recommend.

Amazing Views - fairly easy walk and 100% worth the time investment. This is one of the highlights of Sydney - Take in the picturesque views and you can go at your own speed. While you can just "do the walk" it is a great way to slow down and smell the roses.

Perfect walk. This coastal walk is just perfect. It starts from Bondi Beach and ends to Coogee. It takes approximately 1 hour 30 to do.I would suggest to bring your swimsuit as you will cross at least 4-5 beaches that are pretty nice.It is a must to complete as you will enjoy the Sydney lifestyle : see surfers, people exercising, people walking their pets...

Gorgeous views, take your time. Talk about amazing views! This walk was simply gorgeous! Wear comfortable shoes, bring a water bottle (some snacks wouldn't hurt either) and take your time. The walk is about 4 miles. At a leisurely pace with stopping it took my friend and I about 3 hours to complete the walk. Be aware, it is not a straight, even path the entire way, there are hills and stairs, but also plenty of places to rest and admire the gorgeous views of both the Pacific and land around you. There are even a few water refill stations along the way. If I ever have the opportunity to go back to Sydney, I would do this walk again.

Beautiful views!. Great walk between Bondi and Coogee...the views are stunning and it's highly recommended! I think it's more difficult to find a park at the weekend - but still worthwhile. We did the return walk, instead of taking a bus or taxi back...either way, it's worth it!

Fantastic walk. We decided to do the walk from Bondi to Coogee as it had such great reviews. The walk itself is not strenuous at all. The views overlooking the ocean are spectacular. We took the bus from Sydney to Bondi and then started walking. There are some fantastic beaches along the way where you can stop for a swim or lunch. There were quite a lot of people doing the walk as well and I'm sure it would probably be quite crowded in high season.

Morning Walk. The coastal walk is absolutely stunning! Perfect for a morning walk on a nice day. It finishes at a beach, so before or after your walk or run you could go for a refreshing swim or grab some brunch after! Breathtaking views of Sydney's coast and beaches and good for all fitness types. Can walk for a short amount of time or run across a number of different beaches experiencing a Sydney sider's lifestyle

Mind detox. This incredible scenery walk is never to be missed when visiting Bondi beach.Living in Bondi beach means doing that scenery every time you need a little distraction and stretch. Chances are you could spot some dolphins or some whales!

Picturesque Walk. Not too arduous a walk with beautiful views around every corner. Lots of parks for family picnics and activities:- water sports, volleyball, etc. Fabulous restaurants for coffee or lunch, recommend Bronte as a good halfway point. Good public transport access available at most points if you weary! Waverley cemetery provides some interesting history.
Stunning views. Fabulous way to spend an afternoon took the bus to Bondi and hiked to cookies- Coogies Pavillion- the happening place on a Sunday
One of the mist beautiful walks in the world!. You'll pass beach after beautiful beach with places along the way for food and beverages.Many opportunities to swim in baths along the way.A must do!

Serene view. We just went there for a stroll and photo shooting. Lovely scenery and beautiful view. Wonderful place for relaxation and ease tension. If you can surf, you will certainly have a great time there. Great place for shopping and enjoy fish & chips too.

Some great views, but not too strenuous . This is an excellent walk. We've completed it on two occasions from Coogee to Bondi. There is plenty to see on the way including stops at Bronte Beach. Allow yourself at least a couple of hours. It's one of several coast walks in the Sydney area, but the most popular. Try the walk from Rose Bay for a different kind of experience.
Fantastic! . Definitely worth the constant complaints of my kids. Finish at the Coogee Pavilion and this alone makes this trip worthwhile. Must do when in Sydney.

Amazing views. Did this walk on a Saturday - having eaten in Bondi - and thoroughly enjoyed it. Through bays, beaches and built up areas, every turn and set of stairs brought an equally fabulous view compare to the last one. It is a popular route with lots of people walking & jogging it. There are a number of steps on this path and does have a range of elevations - but it is totally worth doing. Drinking fountains regularly along the route augmented our own supply and with a number of rest points you can certainly take your time. So many photo opps! (I took over 100 to edit down later). With this being only 5 miles as the crow flies from downtown Sydney it's easy to get to. Definitely have this in your itinerary when in NSW.

Beautiful stroll along the cliffs and beaches . Only walked about half way due to time constraints. Amazingly beautiful. Good cardio and leg workout - although after the Sydney Bridge Climb I didn't need much of the latter. The path is paved and climbs and winds around cliffs and beaches. Stunning ocean views and fun to watch the surfers cueing up for waves. Bring water and sunscreen.

You Have to Do this Walk!. We arrived from NY at 6:30am and we were on this walk by 2pm that afternoon. What a perfect cure to imminent jet lag. So incredibly gorgeous, new fabulous views at every turn. We took a cab as we were not oriented yet - and then uber'd back from Bondi. Bring a light backpack and one towel for the whole group. Take a quick swim at Bondi and use their changing rooms before heading back to your hotel. Our trip would not have been complete without this invigorating walk.

Beautiful but longer than I thought. Friends told my wife we had to do this so we took the bus to Bondi Beach, had lunch and set off on the walk. It is very picturesque and each beach area looks a bit different. It had more steep up and downs than I thought it would be,but the footing is easy. Took us about 3 hours, but that depends on how often you stop for pictures.

Not worth it. Pretty disappointed by this walk. If you have already seen some nice beaches in your life then i think your time would be more valuably spent elsewhere. Transport takes 40mins from the city centre and the walk took us about 2hours (average walking pace with a few short stops). It's nice, but it is not spectacular, and ultimately it felt too long/hard to walk in one go. I'm sure it would be better with the whole day, with time to hop from cafe to cafe and swim. If you are just interested in seeing the beaches and a few rocky cliffs, the bus might be a better option.P.S. Lots of runners rushing past us at 8 in the morning on fairly narrow paths, which really affects the experience.
wonderful walk. this is a nice walk and the views are lovely. On our walk we saw dolphins playing in the water off Bondi Beach so make sure you take a camera with you.

Factastic scenic walk. We did this trip in reverse from Coogee to Bondi. I think this way has less uphill sections. The walk is truly beautiful and took us about 2 hours including a few stops. It was a good way to spend an afternoon having a break from city sightseeing. The path is clearly marked and there's plenty of people doing the same walk so no risk of getting lost.To make it a full round trip from Sydney, we got a bus to Coogee, walked to Bondi, then the 380 bus to Watsons Bay to get the ferry back to circular quay.

Beautiful way to spend a morning. I have done this walk twice now, once in Summer and again in Winter. Both times it was a beautiful sunny day (one was of course a bit colder than the other though). It is a very easy walk and would be suitable for most.

Nice walk. Once you set off from Cooge you can't really get lost on your way to Bondi which is good..less time looking at a map means more time to take in the scenery. I went on a trip with my hostel which was good as we got a bit of the history of each beach but it's so easy to do alone a tour isn't necessary. Only small problem for me was that there weren't many places on the way to stop for food/drink but it may have just been that it's now low season so some places were closed. But all in all a lovely way to spend a day.

Beautiful. Beautiful views, easy walk. Easily the most beautiful beach we'd ever seen. Assessibility is easy with bus (if you want to save some bucks). The views along this trail was great. All in all, amazing experience.
Epic walk. One of the finest walks you can do in sydney. It gets busy but it was raining heavily so we had it to ourselves. Love the changing colours of the water as the light changes.

Awesome solo walk and amazing scenery. I made this walk in March 2016 and the only bad thing is that it's way too short! I loved everything about it, I got to see different beaches I haven't had a chance to visit before and finally, swimming in a rock pool in Coogee was a cherry on top of my lovely day. Definitely worth it!

Beautiful walk. The Bondi to Coogee Beach coastal walk is a must do when in Sydney.
Amazing views anytime of the day with lots of walkers and joggers enjoying the amazing ocean views.
HIGHLY OVER RATED. Lovely stretch of the beach,bay. Over built on one side. Shops and cafes are much to be desired. No basic facilities for the visitors unless you go into a pub?
Stunning walk. We were lucky enough to have a stunning day to do this walk. An easy walk for all ages - so worth it.

Stunning walk!. This is really a fabulous walk - not strenuous and breathtakingly beautiful. Be sure to do it on a still day though as when windy it can be less enjoyable. Definitely worth doing though, you will feel like you've really seen the Sydney coastline and at the end you can stop for a glass of wine overlooking the water.

Amazing but we only made it up to Bronte. We did this walk backwards but it was still incredible. Took the bus to Coogee to view the sunrise and started walking the trail. We made it up to Bronte before stopping for breakfast and taking the bus back. This is a beautiful morning walk. There were people on the trail early in the morning so we felt safe during the walk. It is a long walk, about 3.5 miles, and some portions are not shaded so it is best to bring a water bottle, hat, etc.

Awesome walk, magnificent scenery. Physically, mentally, spiritually this is a walk for all the senses, all seasons, rain or shine. More so when Sculptures by the Sea are 'on' although then it is busier. I come back year after year to do this walk plus this last time we saw whales out at sea. On top of everything else about this walk that was the bonus of all.

Beautiful day out. Love this walk. Catch the bus from the CBD to Bondi to commence the walk. Walk is not difficult and the scenery is fantastic. Finish with a coffee at Coogee before catching the bus back to the CBD.

Stunning scenery. I caught the bus to Bondi (which was very busy) then started the Bondi to Tamarama walk. The weather was incredibly warm, sky was blue and the coastal scenery is spectacular. I love Tamarama Beach - much calmer both in waves and people. It's not a long walk but as some steps are quite steep not for those with mobility issues. It was hotter for this time of year to what I had expected and I didn't have a hat on so didn't continue to Coogee and didn't want to go back to Bondi Beach so walked up the top and caught the bus back from Tamarama to Bondi Junction shopping centre (much quieter bus). Plenty of places to have lunch in Bondi Junction or back in Bondi.

Essential Sydney Experience. Bring your hat, sunnies, water and sunscreen and prepare for the most beautiful of walks. Some parts are more taxing than others for those of us with a bit of arthritis creeping into he knees and hips, but the experience is well worth it. The views are magnificent and you can stop along the way If walking from Walking from Coogee to Bondi, I recommend a stop at Clovelly to rest a while at the cafe and enjoy people watching - or grab a take away and sit on the rocky outcrop. At GOrdons Bay, pop on your bathers and have a refershing dip in the ocean. If, after a nice lunch at one of the many fantastic eating places in Bondi you feel energetic, walk back! Otherwise hop on a bus and head back.
Amazing walk. Best thing to do in Sydney! Bring your bathing suit and jump in at any of the beaches along the way. Then walk or ride to Rose Bay and take the ferry back.

Stunning views, nice walk. A beautiful coastal walk on an easy to follow route with defined, safe paths. Lots of places to stop on the way for food & drink. Got the bus to Bondi beach & walked back to Coogee. Highly recommended.

Fabulous easy walk with great views. Against all advice we did this in the middle of the day on a sunny Saturday. And it was fine! I quite like all the people running, walking and enjoying themselves - it feels like you are sharing in teh great Australian outdoors experience. Easy also to pick up a bus or taxi at the other end. And the views are simply astonishing on a good day.

The most scenic experience in Sydney. It is a beautiful walk going from Bondi to coogee or the other way.It is a long walk and once you are past Bronte there are not many stops until you hit coogee, so bring some water and a camera. You will want to take pictures!Do yourself the favour and walk from coogee to Bondi instead. Take the bus from Bondi junction to coogee beach. This way you walk towards more beautiful scenery and you end up in Bondi where the vast amount of cafe's and juicebars will be a welcome sight after the walk.

DIDN'T EXPERIENCE COOGEE, BUT BONDI TO BRONTE WAS ASTOUNDING. In January 2016 we left our hotel in Surry Hills, got bus to Bondi Junction then another bus to Bondi beach. All in all travelling time was around 40 mins. We then proceeded to the Icebergs restaurant for a tasty breakfast, overlooking the sublime outdoor pool that looked ready for the elite and taking no prisoners!Then we began our coastal walk, taking in the postcard scenery, and passing many local joggers and dog walkers on route. There are many decent photo opportunities to of been had, so don't worry about needing to turn back. Came to Tamarama Bay for chill out time, then continued our trek onto Bronte beach. Altogether the walk was about 1 hour, would of loved to of completed the journey to Coogee but we were on a time restriction. What a fantastic way for us to spend a couple of hours, whereas most locals probably do this everyday...

A must in your itinerary. This is a wonderful way to view the amazing coastline. Try to get there early as it is very popular for locals and visitors alike. There are some steep areas, but overall it is a good walk. There are many opportunities to stop and rest, or push yourself. Bring your lunch and enjoy a picnic. The scenery along the way is breathtaking. I had to stop at every corner and take tons of photos! And there are busses to use if you don't want to walk back to your starting point. A must do!

A beautiful and relaxing wonderful way to spend your afternoon. A beautiful and relaxing wonderful way to spend your afternoon.You can see the waves come in as you walk the trail and see the surfers down below trying to catch some waves, or watch some jets on final approach to SYD up above, or see and hear people from all parts of the globe as they walk the beachside trail.There are walkers, joggers and runners, pooches out for a stroll both by themselves and with their humans, photographers, food and drink stands to get some cold beverages and snacks, full fledged restaurants as you get to Bronte Beach, large and small grassy covered areas to relax and lay out and suntan or read, or you can go on the beach itself and sunbathe and go in the waves yourself for a cool down.You will see and hear squeaking seabirds, lizards, sandstone formations, pretty beaches, and there are TONS of photo ops along the way.Both bathrooms and park benches are along the way.
A lovely trail for a challenging run. I ran the path from Bondi and it was certainly a challenging run with lots of up hills and steps but the views were spectacular and really worth it.
Spectacular . A great 6 km walk along the coast. We did the walk from Coogee to Bondi. Lots of great rock formations and beaches. The walk isn't too crowded. A fun time.

A must do... Offering the chance to see five of Sydney's best beaches all in one walk, the coastal walk from Bondi Beach to Coogee Beach has been recommended to me by everyone I know who has visited Sydney. I had a perfect day walking along the coast for just over six kilometres past the beaches of Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly and Coogee. You don’t need to be super fit to do this. There are public restrooms at each of the beaches, and restaurants/cafes if you get hungry. Also there are a number of water fountains along the way so you can refill your water bottle. This is a must do – grab your camera, hat, sunglasses and go – you can do the complete walk or stop at any point along the way when you have had enough!!

Wonderful Relaxing Bus Ride to Bondi Beach and Lovely Walk. Last Saturday, my husband and I took a bus from Circular Quay to Bondi Beach. The water is clear as can be and all the shades of blue from navy to light azure. Breathtakingly beautiful. We ate lunch at a restaurant nearby and walked along the beach. Lovely afternoon! Glad we went!!!
Such a great experience!!!!. Such a great experience!!!! Through Coastal Walk you face many different stunning beaches!! Be prepared to walk a lot but its totally worth it!!!

Coogee to Bondi walk. Reserve one day of your Sydney long weekend to do the Coogee to Bondi coastal walk. It's an easy stroll with spectacular views of the metro coast in the Sydney precinct. All the beaches are a mere 10 metres walk down from the pathway and if you are taking a break from this 2 hour leisurely stroll, cafes, pubs and restaurants abound. If you have a limited time in Sydney and you want an outdoors break with plenty of fresh air and scenery, this walk is for you.

If you go to Bondi, be sure and do this walk!. We didn't even know about the coastal walk until we arrived on Bondi. A local told us about it, and so glad he did. The views are amazing and not to be missed!
Bondi to Coogee Beach walk. Loved the walk and the scenery was just beautiful to see. I would definitely go back and spend more time there.
Beautiful beaches and panoramas. The Coastal Walk is absolutely beautiful. Walking these few kilometres and seeing so many beaches and beautiful landscapes was a good idea.

My favourite way to start the day :). When I'm in Sydney I walk or run this most mornings...sometimes there are amazing distractions along the way when Sculptures By The Sea exhibition is on, but mostly it's just beautiful coastline. Start early though, by about 9am it's too full with tourists to really get a good workout in. Icebergs cafe terrace (the one on the top of the building at the end, away from the beach) is a great place to end up, for a coconut and some yummy brunch.
Must do!. Must do when in Sydney. It's a beautiful coastal walk, takes you between 1-2hs depending on how fast you go. Great to have a Picknick along the coast :)

Fabulous views on special coastline. We are in our 70's and 80's and did the walk in reverse so we ended at Bondi beach. It was a perfect day for a perfect coastal walk. I doubt if you could find a more special walk any where else in the world. The beaches are beautiful, the coastline awesome and the surrounding scenery breathtaking. A must for every visitor to Sydney and if you are a local and have not done this walk you are really missing something special. There were lots of drinking water fountains to refill water bottles along the way - a great facility. Sydney at its best!
Gets busy but worth it. Better to go on a weekday. There are dog walkers joggers, runners, tourists, but overall if you want to experience Sydney beaches this is a great thing to do.
Stunning views from start to finish. Start at Bondi icebergs and the views just get better as you walk down the coast toward Coogee passing a few beaches on the way
A must!. Beautiful Australian beaches with many good brekkie spots to be found along the way. If you haven't spend some time walking along Bondi, you haven't really been to Sydney!

Awesome walk. Oh this is just the best to do when you come to bondi. Awesome coastline walk with amazing views and sceneries.
I could do this walk every morning, maybe come for a run next time. Its abit long for the elderly though as its quite a few hours of walking.

A nice way to show off our beautiful city to visiting friends. A very enjoyable walk. Small kids and those with low level of fitness may find the steps challenging. However, the vista along the walk, the fresh air , swim stops are hard to get tired of even for those who have done this a few times.

Gorgeous. This was one of the first things I have done in Sydney. I was there on a cloudy day, but it was still hauntingly beautiful. You go along the walk you see how the water washes up the cliffs, lovely beaches and there is a cemetery on the way, just to remind you are not in heaven, yet :D. I highly recommend it to everyone. You do not need to pay a lot of money for guided tours, this is the perfect example of walk which is amazing even if there are no guides.

I could do this walk every morning!!. I've lived in Sydney on and off for 15 years and this is the best and most iconic walk in the city. Views, scenery and at times art are not to be missed. I always get a cab to bronte and get a quick breakfast/coffee and then walk it off as we walk along the track to Bondi. A great way to start your day and something I always ensure out overseas visitors get to experience. Not be missed!!!

Magnificent Autumn day for this walk . I am a local and have lived in Coogee my entire life but I still love doing this walk on a beautiful sunny day. Loads of cafes on the way for drinks, food and toilet stops. Also several water fountains along the route. Great day out with friends for a walk and talk with Sydney's best ocean views. We parked at Clovelly and walked to Bondi. But you can start as far south as Maroubra. Took about an hour from Clovelly to Bondi walking slowly. Had lunch at Bondi and walked around the farmer's market at Bondi public school and then walked back after enjoying lunch and a fabulous ice cream at Gelatissimo in Bondi road. Great day out. Definitely a must do when visiting Sydney or if you just enjoy nature and the ocean. So many great swimming and surfing spots along the way. Surfing spots are Bronte, Tamarama and Bondi. Clovelly and Gordon's Bay for snorkelling. There are also ocean pools at Clovelly, Bronte and Bondi. (Or Coogee if you start there). One cafe at Clovelly, one at Tamarama, many many restaurants and cafes at Bronte and 100s of places to eat in Bondi. On Sunday the farmer's market is replaced by markets selling clothes and jewellery.
A fun morning out . This walk is a great little adventure. There is some nice little historic information points along the way. Make sure to bring some water and comfortable shoes.

Lovely walk. This is a lovely walk to do,great views and plenty of places to stop and get some great photos,I wouldn't recommend it to older people who may have trouble walking there are steps to climb,but if you can manage it its worth the effort

A lovely coastal walk a short distance from the city. If you want to get out of the city take the train out to Bondi Junction and then a bus to Bondi Beach and complete this walk along the coast. On a sunny day this is a great way to spend a couple of hours strolling around several bays between Bondi beach and Coogee. After spending time at any of the beaches and in the restaurants of Coogee you can then return by bus to bondi Junction if you do not want to do the reverse walking route. A good day out.

Coastal walk!!. We started at Coogee and walked to Bondi, because parking in Bondi is difficult.I suggest wearing sneakers not thongs as its a long walk in thongs on a path about 7-8km walk from where we started to finishing up on the beach. It can get crowded as it is a top attraction around Sydney so be prepared. There is toilets and benches and other beaches along the way to take a break and etc.
Very pretty. Great place to go for a walk on a saturday morning, you have to go early though as it does get very busy

Aussie stroll. Fairly easy 6km [approx.] with the hardest part between Clovelly and Coogee. Superb rock formations and the view is incredible.Suggest popping in to Coogee Pavilion for a cold one after walk.

Brilliant. We had a fantastic walk on a Sunday morning. It started off fairly busy but we soon had stretches to ourselves. Wonderful views, cliff tops, beaches, places to get a drink and chill out. We had breakfast at the RSL at the far end of the beach before we started out walk - great views, brilliant place - eating like a local, they just sign you in as a guest. Breakfast was excellent. We used the Red Top bus as a way to get here which was excellent - gave us an insight into Sydney, the suburbs and super views of Sydney on the way back from the beach. We only got as far as Clovelly - took us about 1.5 hours each way with a stop for a well earned beer before the return trip!
Can be a little crowded and hectic.. On a beautiful day it is a special walk on the cliff face, but always a little crowded on the weekend.
Stunning!. This is an amazing and beautiful coastal walk on well maintained paths. It's not too strenuous by any stretch and was one of the many highlights of our stay in Sydney.
Breath Taking Views. Cant highly recommend this enough, a great walk wonderful, views take your bathing suits, lovely cafes just fantastic

Drop Dead Gorgeous Views. What a beautiful walk! So many breathtaking vistas. We were always excited to see what was around the next corner. Lots of places to stop too. Special mention to seasalt cafe at Clovelly along the way which was a great place to take a break and have something to eat. Also liked the cafe at Tamarama but unsure of its name. Its the one on the beach. Think the favourite part of the walk was the boardwalk between Bronte and Clovelly, but really its all pretty special. Can be a little crowded on the weekends so go mid week if you can

Take your camera . This is one of the Sydney must do. Nice easy walk, it takes you through all the typical NSW coastal landscapes: pools, tiny beaches, sandstone cliffs, oceanview cemetery, busy surfer's beaches. In October it hosts "sculptures by the sea" that would be amazing if it wasn't always chockers.Take your camera.
Stunning walk. My husband and I (50's, 60's) walked most of the way, and the coastline and rock formations were stunning. Many places one can sit on rocks and enjoy the scenery.

Bondi Beach. Truly a magnificent beach. Accessible from Sydney's circular Quay via bus 333 or 380 - about 20 min ride.
Just fabulous !
Beautiful Views. This walk is absolutely stunning! There are many beaches along the way you can stop at for a drink or dip in the water but the views from the cliffs are absolutely incredible!

Best Hike EVER !!. Put your walking shoes on and walk the coast of Sydney. It is a great trail and anyone can do it. there are some excellent elevations for awesome views, Great lookout and great to do as a couple or family

Beautiful walk. The Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal Walk is a good wy to spend some time in Sydney while enjoying the view. We get to Bondi by bus and then took the walk. You absolutely need sunscreen.The only downside is the presence of people walking their dogs: although there are plenty of signs proibiting this, we met many people with their dogs, unleashed. My sister is afraid of dogs, so the walk was not so pleasant as it could be due to this problem.The view is amazing, though.

Breathtaking Sights . What a great day we had starting in Bondi Beach! The beach is beautiful! There is lots of graffiti art on the board walk. Plenty of nice facilities. Lots of people! We took the Bondi to Bronte walk and it was amazing! The walk is carved into the cliffs and lots of places to stop and swim :) We absolutely loved it and have memories for a lifetime!

One of the best walks in the World.. We did this walk as a group of four and had lunch on the way and my three companions decided to get a taxi back to Clovelly as it looked like rain was on the way. I decided to walk back and despite the rain was inspired by the fabulous scenery and the tranquil sights and sounds of the waves crashing onto the rocks. The only hazard on the walk are all the joggers who think they own the place and will never be happy if they don't achieve a personal best because someone stops for a minute to enjoy the view.

Great either mid-week or early/late on Saturday & Sunday!. This walk is great, it goes around the coast from Bondi all the way to Coogee, although we often stop at Bronte for a drink then wander back to Bondi. We only do it early in the morning or late in the day on a Saturday or Sunday though as any other time on the weekend it's too busy and you feel like you're in a herd of animals or you're queuing all around the walk.The walk is relatively easy although there are quite a few gradients and steps to go up or down and not much seating on the way round either so anyone who struggles with either walking or with steps should air on the side of caution.It's a great walk with a great view though, I highly recommend it - at the right time of day! :)
Lovely walk & fantastic views!. Really lovely walk along and around all the beaches, we were new to Sydney so was a great way for us to see new places whilst enjoying all the views!!!

Beautiful walk. The Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk is a beautiful way to spend a morning (or afternoon). And after completing the walk, Coogee Pavilion is waiting with a refreshing drink and food to keep you going!

Beautiful walk, but bring a lots of sunscreen. The walk offers stunning views, the walkways are well maintained. It can get a bit busy during midday and be careful if its sunny. As it is a bit cooler due to the constant ocean breeze you can't feel getting sunburnt. But in the end it is totally worth it.

A good morning. Well worth the effort to take a train and bus to Bondi Beach. Breakfast overlooking the surf at Bondi and then a spectacular stroll along the walkway. Next time will bring the togs and cool off in the pools. No trouble seeing why this walk is constantly mentioned on Sydney's top 10.

Lovely and relaxing. We decided to start this walk after a morning of sunbathing on Bondi Beach. I probably shouldn't have been in flip flops, but the walk itself is beautiful! It took us about 1.5 hours, however there are ample places to stop for food, to sunbathe and relax and even go for a swim. Lot of lovely little beaches along the way. Would definitely recommend if you are in Sydney for a while and want a day out of the way of the city.

One off the bucket list!. Caught the bus to Bronte on a lovely sunny day and took the coastal path to Bondi. What a spectacular walk! No worries being alone as the track was busy with traffic heading both ways. Out at sea the surf was up and it was great to take some of the many vantage points along the cliffs and sit in the sun to watch the action. Varied vistas- small bays, rolling surf, rocky headlands, sandstone cliff sculptured by wind and rain. Loved every minute.
A Must do while in Sydney. Great walk with incredible views. A must do on your trip to Sydney!! Would recommend to all new comers to Sydney

Must do - Absolutely lovely and memorable walk. One should do this coastal walk from Bondi till the end to Coogee. You will experience one of the finest views across. Try and do this early morning if in summers. When we went it was super lovely weather and was drizzling which further added to the beauty of this place. Please do it till the end as Bronte to Clovelly walk features the Waverley Cemetery and a cliff top board walk. This walk has some great views and you are likely to observe the way of life of people living in those remote sections. Definitely recommended
Great coastal walk. This is a great walk and not too strenuous and well worth the time. There's plenty of place to stop and have a rest or a drink. The scenery is wonderful. So glad we did it.

Stunning views. I was in Sydney for business and wanted to see the local area and take in some exercise. It's an easy walk, can be busy at peak times but, stunning views, great sea air and the sunshine was perfect.Plenty of toilets and placed to stop on the way.Well worth a visit.

Lovely walk. Nice 6 km walk which you can finish in 1.5 hours. Very easy and enjoyable walk. Scenery is lovely, combination of nice beaches, parks, water pools, rocks. If you are in Sydney for few days, this walk should be on your list.

A well designed, Dramatic Walk.. The path is very well maintained and easy to follow and complete. (just a hint to get on the path--it's near where the busses drop you off or the OPPOSITE side of North Bondi. The walk is extremely dramatic with the cliff sides, the splashing waves against the rocks and the fresh air. ANYONE CAN DO. Just don't rush it and enjoy the peace. Even if many people walking this, you will always find some alone space.
must do. Stunning views, its around 1.5 hours , very worth it, you can go for a swim on the way and get a coffee or brunch upon arrival

Great trek . Make a day of it , Go Bondi to Coogee . Only had two days in Sydney and this was one of the things we had planned . Only wish we had more time as Coogee looked a lovely place to spend a full day in on its own.  The path it's self follows the cost line and is not too difficult a walk , it has magnificent views around every turn . Beautiful beaches and wild flowers most of the way . Done this walk one day in the second week of April, the weather started off fine then turned a bit wet , but still warm . And if you do walk the route you must visit the Clovelly Bowling club . A bit of serendipity regards our walk as we wandered around a bend to be met by what must be the best view from any clubhouse in the world. Made more than welcome at the door and a good chat with the barman a couple of drinks and an hour later we were on our way.

One of the best Coastal walks with great views.. The walk from Bondi to Coogee is amazing with awesome views of Bondi, the beaches and coves between and the rock formations along the coast line. The walk is a concrete path the whole way and easily marked as you just walk along the coastline.This is a busy path with the locals walking, walking their dogs, Jogging and running. We started from Bondi walked the whole way turned around at Coogee and walked back. We were not disappointed. The views down into the surf are beautiful. Tips: Don't take up too much path, if in groups be wary of walking more then 2 abreast as you may block the joggers and others on the track, move aside and let other through, if you see someone running towards you make an obvious decision as to where you are walking (usually on the left side). Bring a bottle of water and some sunscreen on the sunny days. Wear decent shoes if you are walking the full length and back. Take a camera to capture some awesome shots of Bondi and rock formations along the way. Take your time and enjoy the scenery. Watch out for dog poo. Occasionally someone may forget to pick up after there pup and you may end up on the receiving end. There are some stairs along the track noting to strenuous.
Great walk!. Excellent picturesque walk taking in the beaches. Not difficult. Have a welcome lunch at the Coogee Pavillion of a beer & great tapas.

Spectacular views. Put your lazy self on the shelf and get out of bed and do this walk nice and early in the morning. It is spectacular very early in the morning before it becomes overly crowded with other fellow walkers. There are cafes along the way at Tamarama, Bronte and Clovelly. I would recommend a camera/phone camera, water and sunscreen. I have spotted a few lizards on the track and the scenery changes quite a lot from rock pools to cliff faces to a cemetery. Worth the walk.
Gorgeous. Sadly I could only do a part of this walk, due to limited mobility. I would recommend it though as it is breathtaking.

Glorious way to spend a day. The sun was shining, the surfers surfing, it was 25 degrees, the walk offered a solid workout, people were smiling, and there was Gelato at the end of the walk. Pretty much a perfect day.

Best walk in Sydney . Gorgeous costal walk with a variety of food options at either end or along the way. Highly recommended, 5kilometre walk so good for all ages and abilities. Particularly good if the sculpture festival is on in October.

Wonderful Coastline - Great Walk!. I thoroughly enjoy this walk the sites are fabulous – I mean you are in Sydney you take a but to Bondi for practically nothing and you are on a great beach! The walk isn’t bad in hiking terms maybe a 1.5 (there are some steep steps). It is fun to people watch – lots of people are on the beach others taking the walk some surfing.
