My husband and I took the #333 bus from Circular Quay (it goes there without changing buses) and it drops you right off at the beach. We went in the morning did the walk both ways and had lunch. It was a Sat so the #333 ran every 30 minutes we took the bus back.
Picturesque 5km walk along the coastal walk. Worth doing to see the stunning coastline. Great to stop on the way at one of the bays for a swim. Had lunch at another bay.
Must do. Easy walk and some of the best sites along the coast. We walked Coogee to Bondi and bussed back downtown. Try Mancellera for lunch in Bondi, you won't be disappointed.

Great way to see the coast. The three of us took a cab to Coogee and walked to Bondi. It was a beautiful walk along the coast with terrific views of the ocean. There are 2 beaches in between and we observed swimmers and surfers. The entire walk at a leisurely pace was perhaps 2 hours. There are a few shops along the way where drinks and snacks can be purchased and drinking fountains on the beaches, too. Tip: We walked in April in the morning, and the sun was in our eyes for the entire walk. Starting at Bondi would have made the walk more enjoyable in that regard. On the other hand, ending at Bondi gave us several options for lunch and relaxing with a cold drink.

A must do walk along the coast!! . I've done this walk a couple of times now and it is amazing!! The views of the coast are spectacular weather it's raining or sunny. If you walk slowly I'd guess it would take around 1 & 1/2 to 2 hours but it only took my girlfriend and I just over 1 hour. We walked quite fast and stopped a few times for pics. We've walked both ways, but starting at Coogee and finishing at Bondi is my favourite direction. If it's cold and windy take a jumper and umbrella. If it's sunny wear plenty of sunscreen and take some water. A few water drink fountains along the way. Approximately 6kms from Coogee beach to Bondi beach. If you're feeling fit you could run it as the paths are very well maintained. A beautiful part of Australia!!
Fabulous walk. This walk is unbelievable. The views never get old Crowded on the weekends so watch out at peak timesDuring the week and early mornings the best times
Nice pleasurable walk. Great free attraction , nice and scenic ,with plenty of places to stop and get a drink to cool down :-)

Best walk ever. This walk has a brilliant view and is very safe (except if you are stupid to go off the walkway, stand on the cliff edge with your flipflops!) Great to have a swim either in Bondi or the beautiful little beach in Coogee. Well worth the walk which could take over an hour. Should not go to Sydney without trying this walk if you are able

Great vistas and goals. Incredible views as you depart Bondi, and the coves en route Coogee and so picturesque. Food at the waterside, not so good, but go up into Bronte village for good eats and shops.

Lovely Walk. This is a must do thing if you are going to Sydney. We caught the bus from near our hotel which took about 25 minutes to get to Bondi Beach. We did the walk to Coogee beach. Some beautiful sights and lots of different beaches along the way. Walk is not too strenuous and takes about 1 1/2 hours. (About 2 hours if you stop taking photos all the time like we did).

Excellent views. One of the free of cost things you can do in Sydney!. We took an early morning bus from Hyde park to Bondi beach and then did the coastal walk to Coogee beach. There are beautiful coastal views almost the entire way. We would not recommend this for people who have special mobility needs as there are sections of climbs and a lot of stairs to go up and down. Things to carry on this walk: Camera, sunscreen and a small water bottle. (There are several water refill points on the way and toilets are available too). We covered this walk in about 2.5 to 3 hours and took a bus from Coogee to Circular Quay.

A great day out!. It's one of my favourite things about Sydney. It's a walk which is not too tough and can take a day if you space it out. I love to find a new spot to read or relax every time I go on the walk. Bronte beach is fantastic and has a free pool by the ocean and there is picnic areas as well as a good selection of cafés nearby.It's worth your time and is a fun way to get some exercise too.
What a view . something incredible. ..must do it!!!Great coastal walk from bondi to coogee through tamarama and the lovely bronte beach with different cafe to have breakfast or lunch
Wonderful Picnic Spot. Drove along from Bondi to Bronte Coastal Walk to Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal. There is a very good picnic spot for family near this area. Good view and refreshing.

Awesome!. Magnificent views. Beautiful walk. Must for any bucket list. Lots of cafes on the way to stop and revive too. We walked on the hottest day in Sydney and a quick dip in the ocean was extremely refreshing.

Beautiful walk . My wife and I really enjoyed walking along the coastal path from Coogee to Bondi Beach. It is not a difficult walk but there are a few steps in each direction so may be difficult with a push chair. There are plenty of bars and cafes to stop at on the way and ample photo opportunities. We did the walk in April so the temperature wasn't too high - can imagine it's more challenging in the summer!
Beautiful walk. Great half day outing. Along the way we recommend a break at Salina's in Bronte Beach. The salt and pepper calamari is thick, tender and juicy - some of the best we have ever had.

Fantastic walk. Well done to those who put this together. A great walk taking in some amazing locations. Plenty of opportunities to stop and admire the view as well as places to stop for morning tea, lunch or just a cuppa.
Another excellent for this walk. You wouldn't expect a simple walk in a city to be so interesting, divers and with a lot of stunning views.

Great experience. Even if you are not a keen walker/rambler you will really enjoy this walk.The views you encounter are breath taking and moving through different terrains such as cliffs, lagoons and beaches is so uplifting.There ere many joggers,fast paced walkers and people just strolling smelling the roses on the way. what ever your pace this is really enjoyable and highly recommended.

A lovely (busy) walk. One of the top things to do from Bondi. A reasonably easy walk with steps and steep slopes at points. A fabulous view on almost every stage of the walk. It is very popular with walkers and runners so constantly busy.
Up hill and down daler. lovely walk, terrific scenery along the way but beware quite a lot of steps and the coastal path rises and fall

Beautiful coastal walk. This is one of the most beautiful walks in Sydney. Pick your days if you must, but anytime you get some lovely views as you walk along the coastal path between Bondi and Coogee. Their are some areas where you need to climb or descend steps so that is worth keeping in mind. Around late October this walk is enhanced by the Sculptures by the Sea experience. It becomes quite congested during that 1 or 2 week period.

One of the best things if you like beautiful landscapes and walking. try this when sculptures by the sea is on, you will see the same landscapes but full of art and interesting things. breathtaking seascapes and beautiful walk

Thoroughly enjoyable walk. This is a thoroughly enjoyable walk. We did it on what turned out to be the hottest recorded April day in Sydney and while it was hot and we hadn't taken water with us, there are plenty of free drinking water bubbler taps along the way. The walk would be easy enough for most, and there is something interesting around almost every twist and turn (my 9 year old was excited to come across the Tamarama life saving club as featured in the Dulux ad!). Follow the signs and you'll have no problem.If you are staying in Coogee as we were, you can walk in the other direction as well towards Maroubra Beach - which is a shorter walk (just less than 3km). The walk diverts at one point on to residential streets and we got a bit confused momentarily, but if you keep heading in the same direction you won't get lost. Might be best to google bonditocoogeewalk for more detailed instructions before you set off.

Relaxing. So beautiful, so relaxing, so attractive … We just walk along the coast, yet lots of energetic guys jogging along. The sea wind blew gently and softly that made you feel so enjoyable. It's really a good place to walk along.
Wonderful walk. I did not do the whole walk but the coastal path is wonderful and a pleasure to walk along. Bondi beach and most of the bays are stunning.
A good mid week or mid morning/afternoon walk. If you'd like a sense of a section of the sydney coastline this walk is recommended. Stop for lunch or a coffee at bondi bronte to tamarana beaches

Just do it!. I was fortunate that when I did this the sun wasn't shining all the way. not sure I would have made it if it had been, but with the overcast skies I thoroughly enjoyed every inch of this walk. the varying beaches and scenery along the way were extremely interesting. Would go back and do it again!

Nice walk. One of the less popular items in Sydney, but worth a look. You get to see the smaller communities in greater Sydney while doing the walk. Pretty views and interesting rocks that have been worn away through the years by wind/sand/salt erosion. If you don't get the chance to see beaches often, go for the walk. If you're from Queensland and see beaches all the time, this won't impress you. Not too strenuous, some stairs involved, but the quality of the path is excellent with only a few spots that aren't like walking in the city.
Start of a great romance. Caught up with a friend of 25 years Did the walk we talked stopped for a drink confessed our love and the rest is romantic history

Perfect day for a stroll. We had a lovely calamari lunch at the Bondi Pavillion and went for a stroll afterwards along the coastal walk. We only went as far as Tamarama as we were stretched for time but beautiful views were around every corner, a must do!

Bonte to Bodi is fantastic. We did not do the entire walk to Coogee beach but wish we had. We took a bus to Bronte Beach whichis a great place to have a snack and watch the passing scene, then walked to Bondi---the views were awesome. The walk is not difficult---many runners and hikers passed us by as we stopped to admire the scenery. It was a wonderful morning.

Absolute must do. This is one of the most scenic walks in the world. Beautiful beaches, nice path that's easy to walk. There are bathrooms and water fountains along the way. I recommend taking the bus to coogee and walking to bondi where there are plenty of great cafes to relax at. It's about 2.5 miles each way.

Get ready! Beautiful views ahead!. Bondi to Coogee walk has amazing ocean and cliff views. Pass trough iconic Icebergs Club Bondi, Tamarama Beach, Bronte Beach, go through the cliffs, take amazing pictures, enjoy the views. You won't regret the 4 miles walk, I myself didn t even fell it, so amazed I was by the scenery.!

Loved it!. Unfortunately, we didn't have time to walk all the way to Coogee, but I wish I can come back to do so! For a walk, or a jog, or just to sit down and look at the view, the coastal walk would please everyone. I personally consider it a must to see in Sydney. Even though it was a bit rainy, my friends and I were very impressed by the view.

Easy walking beautiful Views. This is a great way to see some of Sydney's stunning coastlines. Start in the morning with coffee and breakfast at Bondi or if you start later in the day, stop for a drink at Icebergs. The sandstone cliffs along the walk are magnificent. Try to avoid week ends.
Busy with locals getting exercise, stunning views. An easy walk for the averagely fit person, wonderful views. Great place to see the ocean and rugged coastline

Great day out. The coastal walk between these two famous beaches is an excellent way to spend a day exploring a number of the coastal suburbs of Sydney. Would thoroughly recommend to anyone visiting the area.

Great Walk for a Sunny Day. This walk took much shorter than advertised but it is a must do if you are coming to Sydney. Great views of the landmark Bondi Beach along with opportunities to hangout at smaller beaches on the way.

A walk by the coastal cliffs and beaches. Having beaches and coastal areas right on your city doorstep is a huge plus and this walk showcases it all, big cliffs, private beaches, hidden alcoves and of course Coogee Bay and Bondi beaches.Simply Beatiful

Great day out! . Bondi to coogee costal walk is a fab day out for all depending on physical fitness as it is a long walk with steep steps very rewarding when you reach coogee which has cute little restaurants and bars Perfect weekend activityAmazing views to see and pit stops on the way

A must-see for all tourists to Sydney.. I do this walk (or part of it) almost weekly and it is one of my favourite places. Always full of locals and tourists and it boasts some of the best coastline views Sydney has to offer. Suitable for anyone with a medium level of fitness, there are however some steep steps along the way.

Excellent walk!. Loved doing the Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk. Most definitely need sunblock and a hat! Take swimmers in the summertime, you can swim at Tamarama beach as a pit stop. It's not too long so great to do in the morning and then go to Coogee Pavilion for lunch! Highly recommended it!!

Simply stunning. What a fabulous place. Clean, friendly, busting with life. Great facilities, great cafes and food. Safe for kids to swim and some small consistent waves for the novice surfer. Lots to see and do and only a short bus or taxi ride from the city centre.

Active wear + coast. If you are looking for a stroll with a view or a heart-starter with some stairs, undulations, and want to show off your new active wear with the latest asics, the Bondi to Coogee coast walk is for you. Recommended early morning best - it can get quite crammed on a good day. But even with a bit of inclement weather about, it's still a fun walk. A couple of good cafes for a coffee or breakfast too (Tamarama or Bronte). Also one for four-legged friends. There are water refill stations along the way and some benches when you just want to take in the view and grab some nice pics. I've never run the length, but a good 90 min walk for most. Highly recommended for out of towners!
HEAVEN IN THE EASTERN SUBURBS. If you love the sea and observing beach life you can't do better than this. And it's not just one beach !
VERY GOOD. Quite good view and good for a break after a long journey. Prefer doing this walk in winter time and late afternoon in summer.

Stunning walk!. Starting at Bondi, the walker is exposed to magnificent ocean cliff and beach views. At the time of the Full Moon the Moon can be viewed as it rises above the horizon in the early evening (take a torch). If there is a heavy surf running, the cliffs at Tamarama are great for viewing the brave and masterful surfers doing their thing. Walkers should walk on the left so that joggers can whiz by on your right. Tamarama is known as Glamourama so there are beautiful sights on the beach. At Bronte you can stop for coffee or take a Bus back to the city. The walk continuing from Bronte has a short section cantilevered off the cliff face over the ocean, then past the Clovelly ocean pool and onwards to Coogee, where there are buses to the city.
Scenic walkway.. This is the best way to see the fabulous Sydney coastline. Joggers, walkers, dogs, surfers, coffee etc.
Spectacular scenery. Very easy going, enjoyable walk along Sydney's premier coastline. It can get a little busy on the weekends so try to find a peaceful morning or late afternoon during the week.
Stunning views, easy walk.. A must do for anyone, visitor, local. The best way to soak of the glorious scenery and get some gentle exercise.

Dazzling and invigorating brisk walk along the coast.. A must for visitors and residents specially on a sunny day. However it is brisk and wonderful on a windy day as well. The view across the blue ocean is beautiful, the never-ending views across the shore and into the horizon make you feel good to be alive and enjoying life!!

Bondi to Coogee Best Coastal walk in Sydney. One of my favorite walks of all time. Been there 4x but every visit is like a first time. Safe to walk even with young kids and oldies. View is spectacular. The Waverley cemetery is a must to see, boasting it's beauty and serenity. Most of the stop offered drinking fountain and warm down equipment for the tired feet. The view from above the coast is heart stopping. Make sure to bring camera because there's so much to photograph. The last we visited the place was really good because they are holding the Sculpture by the Sea event showcasing beautiful art works and sculpture by the great artist.

A beautiful view of eastern suburbs beaches.. I have completed the Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk on a number of occasions. It is best to do the walk on a weekday as it is quite crowded on weekends. Any time of year is good although not pleasant on windy days.It is an easy walk but does have a number of steps in various parts.There are many spots to stop and rest and enjoy the views. Leisurely walking would take an hour or more.
A Walk with Fabulously Stunning Views!. A must do while in Bondi. Natural Beauty all around you as you walk along the paths that take you from Bondi to Coogee Beach. Loved every step of it!

great beach. you need to take the hop on hop off bus and stop here... great to see surfers and there is plenty of shopping --- BUT, you really need to get off the next stop of Bondi Beach and walk across the street to the tide pools; you cross over the tide pools after looking at all the animals there and go up the hill. what a sight! you see Bondi Beach and mermaid rock. Not sure many people get off here, we were the only ones -- and I am so glad we did! it was fantastic!

Beautiful walk. It is sucha a beautiful place to walk along the coast, it is a good idea to go with no rush at all so you can stop and enjoys the beaches along the way. Just beautiful and doens't matter how fit your are, everybody can do it . Although for the older and little ones can be a bit trick as there is lots os steps.

Thumbs Up!. I have to say this is the highlight of my Sydney visit. I love the rock formation, the cliff, the blue ocean, the surfers, basically everything because just watching the awesome sceneries did not tire me at all. There are actually bus stops along the way if you can't go the full length. You will find a beautiful cemetery and some have said you might be lucky to witness some whales (not me). I even did this walk the second time 2 days later as I was addicted to the place =)

Great views, lots of places to take photos.. Enjoyed the approx 5 km walk. Mostly well laid out paths and steps. We actually started at Coogee and walked to Bondi. Lots of other people out too. Great beaches to stop at if you want too. We took 3 hours but only because we kept stopping to take photos, it could be done in a shorter time.

Walks. A beautiful walk, stunning scenery. Make sure you wear a hat and sunscreen as nowhere to get out of sun. Some stairs quite steep. If you do Coogee to Bondi the Icebergs is a great place for a refreshing drink.

Comments from someone who lives in Sydney. The Bondi to Coogee walk is well worthwhile but is quite a long walk. The best alternative is to walk from Bondi to Bronte, have a coffee etc and walk back to Bondi.

Must do to see the coastal beauty of Sydney. This is a must do for any visitors to Sydney especially if the weather is sunny. There is so much to see on the walk and if you wear your swimmers you can take a dip at the many beaches you pass on the way - or go at the beginning or end of the walk. The path is easy to navigate and paved the whole way. This walk showcases what is go beautiful about living in Sydney - gorgeous beaches this close to the city.
Beautiful Coastal Walk. The Bondi to Bronte walk is great way to see some of Sydney's best beaches and get some exercise at the same time! Great for everyone young and not so young.

Worthwhile walk. Well worth doing this walk stretches along the coastal beaches and is absolutely breath-taking! Make sure you pack the sunscreen and be prepared for a busy walkway by lunch time! We walked form bondi to Coogee and back and finished up with lunch at Bondi then a swim in the beach... A great day!

Love this walk.... It's always great walk, ensure you wear comfortable shoes. Should take around 2h if you go enjoying your views. Take a camera and a jacket because it's always windy! I enjoy the Bondi to Coogee direction as you can finish at The pavilion with a nice drink.
breathtaking. Such a beautiful view. The gorgeous sandy beaches are amazing. A must do with family and friends when in sydney
Bondi walk. Spectacular views! Lots of stairs, but well worth it! Achievable by our 5 year old and her 65 year old grandmother. Recommended to everyone.

Great way to spend a morning / afternoon. Great way to see the coast of Sydney. The walk is stunning, but beware there are some stairs, although good for any fitness level. Start at either end, take tour bathers and have a swim along the way. There are lots of places to wat at Bondi and Cogee, but my favourite is to stop at Bronte for breakfast - all the cafes are good, just see where you can get a table (I like to sit outside). The Clovelly Hotel is also a good option along the way for lunch or a drink along the way. The walk can get very busy, but absolutely worth doing whilst in Sydney - if you don't have time for the whole walk, start at Bondi and get to Bronte which is about half an hour, and another 15mins to Clovelly on the ocean walkway platform,

Sunday walk. Love this walk. It can be split into 2 walks if your not feeling up to the whole walk. We love parking at Bronte, walking up to Bondi and return to a great morning tea at Bronte We've also walked from Bronte to Coogee and return. Paths and views are great. Even a good walk for the dogs

Fabulous views - go on a fine morning.. Like other great cliff-top walks such as the Newport Rhode Island Mansions cliff-top walk this is a magical walk, particularly on a calm sunny morning. Even better if you can catch it when the Sculpture by the Sea Annual Exhibition is on. The sculpture is so good I was happy to do it in very wet conditions last year and I loved it just as much!It is an easy paved walk all the way, but I warn if you are the parents of young children you will need body slings not prams as there are some steps involved but no so many a walking stick aided person could not achieve the walk (and definitely not nearly as calamitous as doing the complete Newport walk since Hurricane Sandy struck).
Great Walk and View!. Travelled with 3 young kids - hiking through the coastal walk was a fun experience.the view was stunning!
Great wa;l. Walk from beautiful Bondi to Coogee Beach, awesome scenery, one of the amazing walks around eastern Sydney.
Breathtaking. The views are absolutely magnificent in any weather! Well-worth to spend a couple of hours on this walk when you're in Sydney.

Amazing views. As a Sydneysider, I've been on the walk numerous times, the most recent being in February with a couple of friends from overseas.We walked from Bronte to Bondi, ending with a lunch at Bondi Icebergs leagues bar and restaurant. The views along the way were gorgeous and the weather was perfect, slightly cloudy and not too hot. We took it easy, slow stroll so that we could chat and take photos, so we took more than an hour to complete the walk. Lunch views were perfect too, as we sat on the balcony overlooking the salt pools below!
Try walking Bondi to Bronte at sunrise. Fabulous walk from Bondi to Bronte. Relaxing, fresh and always a great vibe & energy! Best time is sunrise but any time is a good time.

Freshen Up. Try starting this walk from Coogee if u r driving as you can usually find a parking spot on the southern end of the beach beyond the Life Saving Club. Bondi has great eateries/coffee shops to enjoy before your return walk. Can be windy as parts of the walk are along the cliffs.
Great sea side walk. A great walk/run/jog - do it at your own pace, breathe in the sea air. Nothing beats this walk on a beautiful sunny day.

Stunning coastal walk. Being a local eastern suburbs girl I love the Coogee to Bondi coastal walk. Enjoy going solo or with a friend, either walk or run, whatever you fancy! Incorporating steps and hills you can make this path a great work out. With many cafes along the way you can turn this outing in to great day. Be mindful the path can get quite busy on a beatiful sunny day so I like to go early and enjoy big breakfast afterwards at ine of the many cafes to try in Coogee.
A Sydney necessity. Anyone living in or visiting should do this walk, fantastic coastal views as you walk along boardwalks or beaches.
wonderful coastal views. The 3 weeks of Sculptures By The Sea are just a wonderful opportunity to enjoy this fabulous walk - although getting onto it from the Bondi end can be a little taxing.

Amazing Coastal Walk. It's unbelievable of coastal walk along Bronte to Bondi Beach. I love this place with good view of the beach. Short walking, jogging and you heart is open and all your stress are gone.
One of the great Sydney walks. Only one problem was the numbers of people on the walk who did not keep to the left. Who were not attired to walk and were slow.
Can't be beat. I don't know if you could get a better coastal walk anywhere in the world. Absolutely stunning. Walk or run any pace and you will see people of all ages and fitness levels.

Stunning coastal view. one of the most amazing beachwalk anywhere. stop at Bronte on the way for brunch. you dont have to go all the way to Coogee, just to Tamarama and back is stunning. pick a clear sunny day, you wont be disappointed.

Not to be missed. This is what Sydney is all about. Beautiful beaches, an easy walking path with a pub at the end of it and good transport connection. Stunning scenery all the way and if you go in March there'll be a bit of culture as well during Sculpture by the sea, which is supposedly the largest free sculpture exhibition in the world, so there's usually some of it which is really outstanding.

Great way to spend a day outdoors. Soak in the sunshine and enjoy the sea breeze away from the crowded Bondi Beach. A fairly mild 2 hour walk on a nice dedicated path along the coast and best enjoyed with a cup of coffee 'to go' or a cup of gelato!

Stunning easy walk. This is quite an easy walk, good pathways and magnificent scenery of the beaches. There are a couple of steep stairs in places but mostly flat walking. There are nice cafe's on the way to stop and have a rest and take in the beautiful scenery. Can get busy at times on the weekends but well worth the walk.
Exercise and views - what more can you want??. Whether you do the full walk, or go half way and turn back, you will never tire of the views and scenery.

Great exercise and amazing natural views. If you are looking for a fun way to experience Sydney's best beaches, walking the Bondi to Coogee path is a great way to get fit, check out the eye candy, and take in four iconic but uniquely different Eastern Suburbs beaches in a day. The best place to start is North Bondi and enjoy the idyllic view of kids frolicking in the wading pool. Make your way past the calisthenics and outdoor work out areas where the perv factor is quite high, especially after 5 pm when the locals come to train. Cruise past the Bondi Icebergs club and sea pool and follow the path. It will lead you through some beautiful cliff views of the sea along limestone rock faces that in themselves tell a weathered story. If sea-spray is not your desired product for your tresses, wear a baseball cap, especially on a windy day.You walk around the secluded but no less colorful Tamarama beach, (nicknamed Glamorama by the locals for the quality of its inhabitants), and eventually you'll arrive at Bronte. Bronte beach is a local favourite with a stunning beach, park, and swimming pool, as well as access to good coffee and is a popular spot with young families and locals alike. Finally, you'll wind up at Coogee. Coogee is a family beach with ample parking, and is bordered by some terrific restaurants including the Coogee Palace. If you've made it this far, reward yourself with a libation and a swim. You would have spent about three hours walking and earned it!

Stunning Sydney. The best way to experience Sydney, beautiful waterfront walk with historic beach atmosphere. All my overseas visitors have raved at this walk so close to the city centre. A walk for everyone as you can stop and catch a bus back to Bondi or city along the way.

Explore Sydney's Fabulous Coastline. This is a stunningly beautiful walk along Sydney's best coastline including Bondi Beach, Tamaramma, Bronte, Clovelly, Gordon's Bay and Coogee Beach. In the winter months (May thru August) you can be lucky enough to see migrating whales near the shore, and less frequently dolphins and seals can be seen. There's a few steep sections that need a moderate level of fitness and steps in several places make it difficult to travel with a baby stroller or pram. There isn't a better way to enjoy Sydney's outdoors.
Walk to Heaven. Stairway to Heaven - Bondi to Coogee - amazing sights and many delights, a must do as part of your Bondi discovery.

A Sydney highlight. As a local, I still think this is walk is one of Sydney's best attractions. Completely free of charge and a beautiful way to spend an afternoon or morning. Take your swimmers so you can go for a dip on the way and money for coffee and ice cream!
Put this on your Sydney list. Fantastic views of the coastline. We went by car and parking can be difficult on weekends. We opted to park near Bronte Beach and walked North to Bondi and back.

A Walk for All. A lovely walk for all levels of ability. Great stop off points along the way whether it be for views, rest , food, games or for enjoying picnics in a park. You are also able to leave the walk at various points. Parking is available on a number of streets close to access points on the walk
Best walk in Sydney by far. Best walk in Sydney, most Amazing Views. You can make it a quick 1 h walk or half day trip (for less fit people or photo maniacs) Not suitable with a pram though.

Hangout. A lovely spot to hangout for the morning and go for a walk. You can catch a train from town to Bondi junction and then grab a bus to the beach. We had a tasty brekky right on the beach and a nice coffee. We walked the length of the Beach and back the south end to the ice bergs pool and along the cliff walk. It's a great place for people watching.

Bondi to Coogee walk. I find it is actually better to start at Coogee (catch a bus to here) and finish at Bondi Beach where you can always find something to eat and drink. Magnificent scenery and walk is suitable for most people. Quite a few stairs in some spots and sometimes a bit steep but can be done slowly and with minimal assistance. Enjoy the wonderful views and see the old cemetery on your way.With friends we have done this walk several times and enjoyed it each time. A great time of year is when Sculptures By the Sea is on

More than plain ole Bondi Beach!. Personally, I think Bondi beach is pretty ordinary compared to other beaches Iv'e been to. But this coastal walk turns ordinary into fabulous, A lovely hours stroll with grat scenery and just watching people enjoying themselves swimming, surfing and beach volley ball for just a few examples.

this is an excellent scenic energetic walk - nice brekky in Bronte half way. this is a lovely walk for tourists and Sydneysiders, good to do on not to hot a day or if you do take your swimmers so you can have a dip at Bronte or Coogee or even Bondi beach

Stunning views. Gorgeous views and clean fresh sea air. This is one of my favourite walks - great for exercise and for calming the mind as the ocean is so healing. The only drawback is that it gets too crowded on the weekends

Great way to spend a morning or an afternoon - lovely walk and nice cafes. The Bondi to Coogee walk is one of my favourite walks in the eastern suburbs of Sydney. Start with breakfast at the Bondi end, then head towards the Bondi Icebergers pool and keep going along the coast until you get to Coogee. If its a hot day, take your swimmers and a towel and some sun screen and you can have a swim at one of the many beaches along the way. Along the way stop for a coffee or refreshment at one of the beach side cafes. The walk back, far from being a repeat, gives you whole new sights and views from a different perspective. Enjoy a cold bier when you get back to Bondi and go see the Pavillion.

Spectacular coastal walk. Walk the whole walk and see four beaches, or just do part of the walk, depending on your level of fitness. It is completely free, unless you want to stop at one of the cafes along the way. Great views, very invigorating. Catch the 333 express bus from the city.
glorious. in the afternoon, when the sun shines golden on the houses on the other side of the beach, it so reminds me of the Amalfi Coast. Heaven.

Beautiful walk. Beautiful walk , I have done it twice at diffrent times of the year , once during the bondi sculputre walk which was impressive but unsuprising made it very busy . Amaing views from start to finish and plenty of oppotunites to stop admire the view and dip your feet in the sea as you go, great oppotunitys to stop for a picini half way through. Easy walk unless you stuggle with stairs there is a few sets along the way one steep one towards the end ehich drops down in to a beutiful old shipping bay well worth the effort.

Easy coastal walk with breathtaking views. This is a lovely, gentle walk with plenty of different, stunning views including dramatic cliffs. Early morning on weekdays ensures minimal traffic and more parking (though there are joggers). Sculptures by the Sea is an annual highlight, again I would recommend setting out just pre-dawn to avoid traffic and watch the sun rise. You can take a dog on a lead (though dogs cannot walk onto the beach or swim). Suitable for most people, you don't need to be particularly fit to do this walk.

Coogee to Bondi Beach coastal walk. Unbeatable!. Everywhere seemed to recommend this walk, and as we were on our way to Bondi Beach we got instead on a bus to Coogee ( about 15 minutes from Oxford Street area in Sydney ) and did the walk '"in reverse." Stunning views the whole way; photo opportunity after photo opportunity, plenty of resting places if you need them, and enough liquid refreshment establishments to keep us happy. And then we ended up at Bondi Beach for the obligatory swim and even more obligatory lunch and cocktails.

The best tourist experience in Sydney. Well, maybe not the all time best, but it's popular, not far from the City, gives you an idea of the ocean lifestyle of Sydney's Eastern Suburbs and in October it has the ever inspiring Sculptures by the Sea.between Bonid and Bronte.

A spectacular walk. This coastal walk is one of the best in any urban Sydney, or Australian, location. It offers spectacular views from Bondi Beach, to Tamarama and Coogee.Make sure you pick a cooler, but sunny autumn, spring or winter day for this walk as in summer, or on any warmer day, it can be a hot and sweaty adventure.You will also need comfortable walking shoes to navigate the hills and stairs along the way, but you will be rewarded with some amazing ocean and coastal views.Once a year in late October, early November the walk comes alive with the largest outdoor sculpture exhibition in the world, Sculpture by the Sea.
Surfer's Paradise. fantastic beach, not for the weak swimmers ideal for all the surfers.Good food served local eating house.

Very nice walk. This is a short 20-25min walk that is absolutely worth your time. As you walk up from Bondi beach, you get a fantastic lookout view of the area. The path keeps going up on a slow but steady incline and from there you can get more great views of the coastline and the water below. Manly beach is also a nice break from Bondi since it tends to be a little quieter.

Brilliant scenery and easy walking. Without too much fitness most people will find this walk easy. There are some steep stairs in a couple of places but otherwise just undulating pathways. The scenery of not just the coastline and beaches but also the amazing houses you pass along the way make this one of the best short coastal walks I have done in a while. Including sightseeing it really doesn't take more than about 45min each way for a brisk walker, the main thing slowing you down is all the other people. Put this on your list of things to to in Sydney

Stunning water color and rock formations.. The cliff walk and view at Bondi beach are stunning. The fairly flat path has incredible views of the rocks,and water. There are a few places tp grab a drink, but they can be busy. Worth the ferry ride and walk through the town.

A must do.. Skip Bondi Beach (go to Manly instead!) but do explore the Bondi to Coogee walk. There's so much to see and places to explore. In late spring/summer/early autumn, bring your swimsuit and a picnic. A must do for the itinerary.
Lovely walk. Lovely walk from Bondi. Some great sites worth seeing. Great views and photo spots along the way. If you have the time it is worth it.

Wonderful walk. This walk is highly recommended. Views are absolutely stunning. The walk follows the coastline. One goes through several 'villages' on the way that offer plenty of spots for coffee and stops.

The great outdoors in the heart of the city. The Bondi to Coogee walk is a beautiful way to explore the coastal beauty of Sydney. It will take you up to
2 hours to complete, and it is definitely worth the effort!

Lovely walk. Walked from bondi beach to cooge... it was a lovely walk with beautiful views and beaches on the way. Can be done at a steady pace with children. Some steep steps and path near the end but worth it.

Great morning walk . I do this walk very regularly especially when is nice and sunny weather. You do need to be fit if you want to do it all the way without stopping which would take 45 minutes but I guess if you stop by in different beaches and take your time and enjoy the ocean, nature during your walk any one can do it. I would suggest stop by in Clovelly and Gordon bay. Just be careful in Gordon bay because there are no life guards so you are on your own. Great snorkelling spot but make sure you are with someone all the time. Never had any problems but ocean is a mysterious place haha. When you arrive at Bondi beach make sure you visit the iceberg restaurant because the views of Bondi beach are magnificent. They do require Identification on the entrance of the restaurant. It's a casual dining on level 2 so dress code can be casual. If you are doing this walk on Sunday I would suggest also visit Bondi Markets where local and Sydney designers sell their clothes so I am sure you will find something trendy.
Best walk in Sydney!!. Early morning is the best time to do it! Beat the crowds.Bronte is great to stop in at for breaky and coffee is you are hungry.

Recommended walk. Our friend who lives in Coogee recommended that we did this walk and we enjoyed it very much. We took it very slowly and went for a swim in both coogee and bondi and it took us the whole afternoon, approx 4 hours. Bondi was beautiful at sunset. The walk is very easy and can be done by anyone.
Scenic Walk. Its a nice long walk if you are fit enough to do it. Lovely views and picturesque. cafe`s along the way
Stunning Views!. This was a very romantic walk - beautiful scenery. We walked at a very slow pace and completed it in a couple of hours. Wait to eat in Coogee at The Pavillion.

Simply Stunning. Gorgeous cliff side walk with sculptures and other works of art along the way, watch out for rogue waves on the sand at Bondi ,as I walked around I saw many people with wet clothes and I thought to myself..wow poor people they weren't paying attention to the waves..and don't cha know we were running away and it came with such a force we were lucky we weren't swept up off our feet and we were high up on the sand too! So BE CAREFUL!

Perfect for soaking in the sun, seeing the surf and sweating it all out.. On a sunny autumn's day we walked from Coogee to Bondi with a couple of local family friends and it was absolutely beautiful. Given it was our first time, we were pleased to learn that despite coming across many people on the track, according to our friends it was not packed out like a typical weekend Sat or Sun. This walk is a must do. It can be taken in a touristy leisurely way or at a jogging pace to work up all the body muscles. There are a variety of steep hills and stairs along the path. The views and sea breezes just breathtaking.

A beautiful location for a long walk.. This walk is in such a wonderful location. The path varies from flat to stepped and can be commenced at many places along the coastal. The view along the walk is gorgeous, both looking toward the sea and also at the many houses along the route. The best time to do the walk is when 'sculptures by the sea' is on, but beware it is also very busy at this time too.
Walking with great views. Great walks with lots of steps to get your heart pumping! Plenty of places to eat and beautiful beaches with Ocean pools.
Long walk but worth it. The walk is quite long but the view is worth it. The pools are great they are really nice and refreshing. If it is not a super sunny day take a coat it is very windy.

Must do! . What a beautiful walk! Every time we turned a corner there was a new and spectacular view. We even saw dolphins swimming close to shore. Each beach encounter is different. April is fall so it is somewhat off season. We enjoyed the lack of people. There are many places to stop along the way. We moseyed along so the walk took us about five hours! Take time to sit and enjoy the view along the way. Don't rush! Very accessible from downtown Sydney and an easy ride back too.

So hard to believe this is my local walk. I am fortunate enough to reside in Bondi, which means if I ever opt for an outdoor workout, this stunning walk is my go to.Despite how frequently I venture upon the coastal walk, I feel like I constantly need to pinch myself and make sure that this is my reality. Around so many bends I find myself comparing the crystal clear waters and their beautiful colours to those of the Greek Islands. This walk is honestly good for your soul, it has cured many a bad mood for me. I recommend going early afternoon and also avoiding weekends if you're a brisk walker like myself with a low tolerance for those climbing up/down the wrong side of the steps and those walking with absolutely no sense of urgency.

A Great Walk. Once you are in Sydney , there is no way that one should not do /or miss this 6 km Bondi to Coogee coastal walk. With its winding and up and down walking track, beautiful ocean views and parks along the way ,and a cafe stop for latte , is a wonderful experience to see the panorama of the nature.

Did Coogee to Bondi walk (easier way). I did the walk from coogee to bondi as it was an easier walk (mostly downhill) and to come in to bondi beach looking down on the water and beach itself is pretty amazing.Really enjoyable walk and there are water fonts along the way, so no need to worry about hydration! You pass a number of beaches along this walk, the smallest being Gordon's Bay.All in all a must do for Sydney! :)(:

A Walk with The Breeze.. We took the train from the centre of the city to Bondi Junction. The bus station is part of the train station. The bus to the beach is a short bus ride. On arriving at Bondi Beach, face the sea turn, right and follow the coastal path. We stopped at Clovelly. There is a bus stop on the route, just past the Bowls Club and Sports field with a bus shelter. From there the bus takes you straight back to Bondi Junction.This section is about 5 kms in distance with two or three places to stop for drinks and the loos.Beautiful scenary and several places to swim.....we forgot the bathers....and cool off.

Peaceful easy coastal stroll.. We love a good walk and what a perfect part of Australia's coastline to see. This is a feel good, easy walk, paths marked with some steep steps and coffee/ food stops along the way. Seems to be popular with the local runners too. In a couple of the alcove beaches there was couples volleyball in action. We only went as far as Bronte beach (about 3.4 klm) as we ran out of time. Bronte to Coogee is on the list for next time. Public transport makes this an easy attraction to get to and well worth the effort.
Gorgeus views. Fabulous walk with great views.hard going in the heat so bring plenty of water and some snacks.took us 1hour 40 mins to walk.few steep uphills and steps

How long to do?. We took the bus out to Bondi from "Elizabeth Sr" as no trains were running out to Bondi Junction. Bondi doesn't live up to the hype and there's a lot of work being done to the front.The guides all say 1.5 hours to reach Coogee, don't be fooled. On a hot day a young fit person might achieve this n on-stop if you're 50+ take it easy allow 3'5 hours to enjoy the views and eat drink on the way.Don't worry that path sighns only show route to Bronte, when you reach Bronte signs for Coogee appear. The beach at the end is worth the walk.Bus journey allow upto 40minutes for each leg.
Fantastic views and very scenic. This was am enjoyable walk in high temperatures from coogee to Bondi. The walk took me around 1hour 30. Highly recommended.
Clifftop walk. Spent a couple of hours doing this very enjoyable walk. Passed two swimming pools, interesting rock formations, a graveyard, people scuba diving, up and down steps. Very scenic.

A beautiful walk. This walk is a lovely way to see the southern beach area. The track is well kept with beautiful scenery along the way. There are a couple of flights of stairs which justify a stop at the pavilion at the end of the walk. Delightful

Romantic Summer Walk. Wow! If you like coastal scenery and the sea breeze in your hair, try this one! A very pleasant walk, with the chance to stop halfway for a coffee at "Glamarama" Beach! (Otherwise known as Tamarama Beach!) A place to see and be seen!!

The best things in life are free!. Having lived along the Eastern beaches of Sydney for the last few years, The Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk is close to my heart. I can't express just how infinitely lucky I am to call this walk my backyard. The sheer beauty and dramatic views from headland to headland never cease to inspire awe and relaxation in me. Blissful at sunrise, magic at sunset, this walk is simply one of the most beautiful coastal walks in Australia. Perfect for a morning exercise route, or an easy, evening stroll with a friend or lover. Take it slow to inhale the best of the ocean views and salty air. Best times are at dawn or dusk before the crowds settle in, but perfect all year round. Number one recommendation for showcasing the best of Sydney to international friends and guests. The Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk is the million dollar trail that costs nothing.

Walk with a view. The sun shining perfectly down at you with the slight breeze hitting you as you walk down this path. The sound of the waves reaching your ears while you wander. Sounds like a walk to remember? Indeed it was. The combination of the picturesque view and the sound of the sea makes the whole experience unmatchable and unlike any other.

Perfect for a sunset stroll. A very popular walk. Stunning scenery and you can stop for a swim and a coffee at Tamarama Beach along the way. Nicer in the evening or a weeknight than the tourist heavy midday on weekends. Watch out for joggers and people with their eyes on the incredible sandstone cliffs, they may wander into you.
One of the best free things in Sydney. This is now a Sydney icon. Stop at Clovelly for a snack. Gordon's bay is a highlight. Finish with a feed at Coogee.

One of our favorite things to do. No matter where you start. There are lots of pretty good looking bodies, cafes, swimming areas and views. We normally start first thing in the morning, swim at Bronte, Coffee at one of the cafes overlooking the ocean and brunch at a restaurant either in Coogee or Bondi. Then catch the public transport back to starting point of simply walk back. Great experience for all ages and fitness levels.

Pleasant walk. Very pleasant and easy stroll along coastline. Access via bus system was great. We timed our walk to have lunch at Bronte in one of the cafes there - took us a bit over an hour from Bondi southern end to Bronte then about another hour and a half to Coogee. Nowhere to get out of the sun so pick your day. If you are interested the cemetary at Bronte is evidently fascinating so friends tell me.

Beautiful Route. Can be very busy, which is why i prefer going during the sunrise where there are less people (even though some days there are still lots at this time), plus it allows you to see the sunrise.
if you have time. it is actually a really nice walk to take your time and watch the sea and stroll it could be rather peaceful if you are there early enough

Best coastal walk in Sydney. Bondi has been one of the must visit beach in Sydney. It is very crowded somehow. I love peace, serenity where I usually try to avoid to many people.this coastal walk located abit behind of bondi but in some certain time, it is a bit quiet. Walk further down to tamarama or coogee.it will be a great place to enjoy the shore line

I would live at Coogie just for this walk. We walked from Coogie to Bondi every day of our stay at Coogie and we thought it was spectacular. Not sure but this section is about six kilometres. There is no bus service back by the way so factor this into your plans, Nothing else to add that hasn't already been said

Beautiful, scenic and wild. This is a walk you could do every day and never get bored.. The scenery on this walk is nature and the ocean delivering its finest. You could walk this every day - and plenty do - and never tire of the view. What is more, the ocean will deliver up something new and different every day. This is a must do if you are visiting Bondi Beach.

Well maintained and a wonderful view. A really lovely walk or run. The paths are well maintained and the views are lovely. The walkway is often busy but everyone is having a good time and enjoying it. There are many places to stop along the way including Tamarama, Bronte and Gordon's Bay. Bring your swimmers, your camera and some decent shoes. There are some areas with a fair few steps but overall it is not to strenuous. The coastal path also continues along to Maroubra if you felt like continuing on for a little longer. Both Bondi and Coogee have some great places to eat lunch or get a sweet treat after the walk.

Stunning Scenery. This walk is my favourite in Sydney. I start at beautiful Bondi Beach. You can easily catch the 380 or 333 bus to get there from the city or Bondi Junction. The walk hugs the coastline and takes in several beaches where you can swim. I recommend a swim in Bronte Beach ocean pool. There are also lots of small cafes at Bronte if you need a break and a coffee. The walk then takes you past a cemetery which is also interesting to explore. As the walk continues you pass some lovely bays and another ocean pool at Clovelly. Finally you reach Coogee after a good 1 hour and a bit with no stops. I recommend the Coogee Pavilion for a drink and a bite to eat. There are plenty of other cafes or get some takeaway and sit on the grass and enjoy the view of the beach! There is also many buses that will take you back to the city or bondi junction. You can easily do the walk in the opposite direction and enjoy the Ice bergs club or the Bucket list at the end of your walk.A must do if you are in the Easteen suburbs of Sydney.
Great little hike. Very nice walk from Bondi to Coogee. A photographers dream with all the beach scenery, sandstone cliffs and wildlife.

Best coastal walk in Sydney. I've done this walk more times than I can remember, however, each time I get something different from it. Several visiting family and friends have been taken there - all have been blown away, plus it acts as a reminder of how lucky I am to live here. The added bonus is that its not too strenuous.

Beautiful scenery. My husband and I have done this walk numerous times and it always is stunning and spectacular  I would recommend going on a weekday is possible and not on the Sunday as it can get very crowded on a Sunday

Best views in Sydney. This walk is my favourite. Stunning views with great beaches to have a dip along the way or if not swimming weather you can stop for a coffee. If your doing the return trip I recommend leaving excess baggage in a Coker at Bondi and having lunch at the Coogee hotel before walking back.

Perfect scenic walk for adults and chilren. Spectacular cliff and beach walk. Approx 1.5 hours. Suitable for kids too, not too taxing. Enjoy a cool drink at the Coogee bay hotel at the end. Bliss! Buses or taxis available to easily rake you back to your car in Bondi.

Great for a scenic walk. I walk with a friend every second week so we try to look for new places. We usually walk in the Northern Beaches but this was a nice change. It's well signposted with dedicated walking paths (not on the road) and winds through different beaches which is nice. It means you can walk the full length or just to one beach or another. Plenty of drinking water stations, bathrooms, cafes etc along the way. We went in Autumn and it was a little bit drizzly but was still nice - not muddy or anything

Good exercise awesome views. This is a great walk through Tamarama and Bronte with plenty of opportunities to stop and take in the ever changing view of the ocean. ,cliffs ,beaches and small wildlife on the way. Plenty of places in between to eat enjoy a coffee or chill. Plenty of stairs for the exercise buffs. If you start at Bondi ,walk to Coogee which takes approx leisurely hour and decide you've had enough you can catch the bus back. Pick a nice day with a cool breeze and you wont regret it.

Lovely Coastal Walk. This is a lovely walk along the cliff face between Bondi Beach and Coogee. If you wish you can stop at an earlier Beach such as Tamarama. A very good time to do this walk is in October November during the Sculpture by the Sea festival. A myriad of Artworks are displayed along the route some of them very clever and imaginative often embedded into the landscape itself such as large sculptures on Tamarama Beach. I quite like doing the walk in Reverse order so ending at Bondi. Walk up to 99 Hall Street Bondi which is on the corner of Curlewis Street there you will find a shop called Glicks. They sell the best bagels in Sydney but of course are closed on Saturdays for Jewish Sabbath. the coffee is good here to as it is also at the coffee shop next door to Glicks on the left.

The best sydney has to offer. This is an excellent walk that gives you wonderful sea vista with the backdrop of astounding cliffs. With small coves along the way its an unmissable stop if you want to touch on the beach part of aussie culture.

Great local walk. Definitely include this in your Sydney highlights. It is a must for locals and tourists. Be aware of steps and some very steep parts of the walk. End with a coffee in Bronte if it's too difficult.

Lovely walk and pizza. A lovely walk, ideally to do just before lunch with friends. We then stopped at the end for pizza and fizz before returning to Sydney harbour for the ferry back to our holiday accommodation. Idyllic.

amazing view and beautiful beaches. amazing walk and you can see a few of the best beaches in the world. at the end when you arrived To te world best beach in the world (BONDI) the view is zoo beautiful and you just want to go for a swim (always between the flags). If you have enough time you should really do this walk it change from the city.

Great stroll for the excercise and Sydney Scenery. Always a good walk especially if there is a good surf running, beware there are multiple stairs to negotiate and the walk is always busy, well worth the effort.

A fantastic walk for the fit. Bondi Beach was all we expected with it's waves, surfers, coat guards restaurants and general beach life. I didn't dear to swim there being an over the middle aged lady, but enjoyed even more the pool on one end of the beach. After the swim we took the walk between Bondi and Coogee beach, but came only half way due to lack of time. We had to take the bus back. Luckily I might add. Half of our company, who started walking earlier, made the whole stretch and told us later that although half our age, it was difficult at times. But definitely worth it! So I would recommend it for the fit.

Excellent beaches and easy walk. Today we have been for this coastal walk. Thanks to trip advisor for the suggestion and also thanks to all visitors who gave their reviews on this ( really helpful) . the beaches were fantastic. We started our walk from coogee Beach to bondi Beach. It is a 4.8 km walk but feels like 7 km.. I would like to suggest to start in morning only and travellers should carry swim wears also as you feel like go in water when you see beautiful clean water and clean beaches..but we missed it as we did not take extra cloth with us. Still the journey was fantastic....

Beautiful but nothing extraordinary. I suppose because I'm from Michigan, aka the Fresh Water Coast, I'm spoiled with scenic cliffs and coves... This walk is lovely, but it's also quite crowded and has very little reprieve from the sun. The best part, for me, was watching the surfers!!

Very fun!. A friend and I completed the walk starting from Coogee, and walked to Pompei's at Bondi as our destination. There were lots of people on the walk with us, so it was a lovely buzzing atmosphere the whole walk. The only thing I will say about this is to PLEASE put on lots and lots of sunscreen, because when the weather is beautiful and sunny.. the chances of you getting burnt and tanned is very high!!!!

A wonderful walk on a well-made path. This walk is a must for any visitor who enjoys the outdoors and spectacular scenery. The walk is popular for walkers and joggers. The walk passes along headlands and beaches. Most larger beaches have a bus service so it is possible to finish at several locations along the stretch of the walk. We stopped at Coogee which is about two hours into the walk.
Stunning!. amazing ocean views, on a fabulous walk, easy to follow and enjoy, good for both walking and jogging.
Great Walk!. This walk can be quite challenging at times due to the hills but I loved every minute of it - and I'm not good with exercise! Lovely, scenic views!

fantastic walk around bays. Have walked this hundreds of times over the last 30 years, can never tire of it, starting at Bondi Beach and then traversing several bays to Coogee beach, its popular, the views are often breath-taking, and you should stop to enjoy the views. People watching is also fun, as they're people from all over the world doing this too. you can wander down into the beaches, waters are nice, or stop for a coffee or ice-pole along the way. Kids love it !
breath taking, good family walk. About 3 hours long, this walk gets you through breathtaking sights, beaches, inlets and groomed parks. An absolute must!!!

Beautiful walk! . We actually did Coogee to Bondi walk passing Bronte beach and then bus back from Bondi. Either way, it's a walk not to be missed because of how beautiful it is. Luckily we caught it on a nice sunny day in the morning before it started raining. We woke up at 430am to drive down to Coogee to catch some photos when the sun was rising which is very nice. There was also a man made water pool that's connected to the ocean that is super cool. Overall, a great walk and highly recommended!

Be Sure Not to Miss This and Wear Good Walking, Hiking or Running Shoes. Strenuous walk along some of the most pristine shorelines on the Planet! $10 million+ homes line this spectacular ocean space. Don't miss Sculptures by the Sea in November!

Worth it!. Worth the walk especially if you have a guide who can tell you about the walk and the beaches as you reach them. Can take up the whole day and half the afternoon depends on how far / fast you take and how long you stay at the beaches.

A must activity for every trip we make to Sydney. Every time we holiday in Sydney (staying in Coogee) we do the Bondi-Coogee Beach coastal walk, it is the must-do activity. On our most recent trip due to limited time and drizzling rain we chose to do only part of the walk going from Coogee to Clovelly and return. It is a very pleasant walk which you can do at your own pace. No need to run like some people! Gordon's Bay is very picturesque and you can often see scuba divers in the water. At Clovelly Beach there is a cafe and kiosk so it is a perfect spot to stop for a drink and something to eat. The views from the footpath high above the ocean are spectacular particularly when the sea is rough.I would highly recommend this walk to visitors to Sydney. Take your time and enjoy the views, it is well worth it. There are spots where it is not an easy walk and in some sections there are steps so it is not really suitable for families with children in prams unless they are prepared to carry them up thirty or more steps at a time. Obviously also it is not suitable for anyone in a wheelchair or with impaired mobility.
refreshing activity. one of the great things to do in Sydney. nice view, easy walk. people of all ages would enjoy this activity

Perfect for a local or a visitor... This walk can be done in segments and really does not disappoint. Cracking views and an easy stroll around the point the Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly and then Coogee.Take your camera, some water and make sure you look at the weather before setting off. It can change quite quickly and you don't want to be caught out.If you have an asthmatic in the family please make sure you take their medication. Whilst it is a lovely walk, my son (9YO) needed some ventolin about half way.

A great Sydney walk. This is a great walk for both the exercise and the views of the coast and beaches. There's usually a breeze on a hot day but the Bondi to Tamarama section can be crowded, with walkers and joggers. This section is also home to the wonderful Sculpture by the Sea exhibition in October/ November each year. This is worth visiting for the huge variety of works set in the cliffs and parks along the way. Others have mentioned the great cafés, which include the. Bondi Icebergs and Seasalt cafe and kiosk at Clovelly beach. This is a nice spot for a swim and it's also lovely snorkelling here. You can visit the old. Waverly cemetery on the way.

No pool on Thursday!!. Unfortunately, I visited on the wrong day. Thursday is the pool cleaning day. Therefore I couldn't get nice photo. Wanted to chill inside the cafe. But I was too upset. So I left, but walking by the beach is really beautiful. I spent almost 2 hours walking and exploring

Terrific way to start your trip. We took this walk after landing early morning in Sydney off a flight from LA. Our hotel room wasn't going to be ready for a few hours and it gave us a great first impression of the city while allowing us to stretch our legs from a long flight. We started in Coogee and ended in Bondi where we had lunch at a nice sidewalk cafe. Truly a gorgeous walk.

Best walks in Sydney. This walk is way superior to any other walk in Sydney. With a large diversity of parks, houses,animal santuaries & cafes including of course Sydneys beautiful beaches. This walk is great right through the year and dog friendly (leashed). You can also continue this walk all the way to Maroubra Beach which is next to Coogee Beach.
Great walk. No matter if you're walking, running, stopping to chill in a well located bench or stopping to do push ups and work out, this coastal walk is perfect.

A wonderful, easy walk (or jog). This cliff top walk has to be one of the most scenic inner-city coastal walks in the world. Dramatic cliffs, surf swept rocks between gorgeous golden sandy beaches. You can perve on the how the ultra rich live. You can enjoy the Australian beach culture. As a jog it would be easy (and the sea breeze would be wonderfully cooling). As a walk it is a pleasant couple of hours of escape. I try and go every time I've got a few free hours whilst in Sydney.
Great appreciation of Sydney coastline. Just do it and will appreciate this aspect of Sydney's beauty. Wonderful views of the coastline. Great cafes in between

Beaut way to start the day. Easy walk with spectacular views, either there and back or just get the bus one way. I would look to end the walk in Bondi . Loads of breakfast spots at either end, Coogee Pavillon is over rated for breakfast

Stunning!. We caught a bus from central Sydney to Coogee and walked back to Bondi. It's an easy 6 kilometre walk even though there are stairs in various sections. It took us 1 hour and 10 minutes and that included stopping occasionally to look at the magnificent views before us. There are cafes along the way at some of the beaches if you want to take your time and stop for refreshments. Don't forget your hat & sunscreen!

Do This!. We stumbled across this walk by accident. Our bus driver on the public bus we road asked if we were going to take the hike. We weren't planning to but took a local advice and were rewarded with an awesome 2 hours.Easily accessible via public bus. Tickets were cheap, around $3 AU. It rained on and off during our hike and the waves were huge adding to the fun.

Easy walk great views. This is a lovely walk for any ability. You have the opportunity to stop at as many places as you like along the way, and you don't have to do the whole walk. Food is available at tge beginning , end and along the way, so you don't need to bring your lunch, but if you do, definitely recommend stopping along the walk to eat, as the views are spectacular!! Take plenty of water if its hot. Suitable for ages <0 - 100>!!

An easy walk for all. This is a great way to explore the coast of Sydney. Takes only an hour or two, depending on your pace but take your time, bring lunch and enjoy. restaurants are availble either end so BYO food is not necessary.

Coast and more. My wife and I caught a bus from the CBD to Bronte and did the (reduced) walk from there to Bondi. We followed this with a bus to Watson's Bay for lunch and ended with a ferry ride back to Circular Quay. We then bussed it back to the CBD and a short walk to our hotel. The local transport was frequent and easy to catch. Opal card was great. It was a beautiful walk and a great day overall.

Spectacular. We started at Clovelly beach on a cool, cloudy day which gave the views another dimension. It was about 6 ks walk but who knew! it was so amazingly beautiful that I didn't really notice. The little bays surrounded by stunning cliffs, the old cemetery to potter through, just enough toilet stops for us oldies. It was a morning to remember.

Amazing views. The coastal walk can be done either casually or for the purpose of training! its great to take kids, pets and people from overseas on the walk to show them how truly beautiful our coastline is

Beautiful view long walk. The Coogee coastal walk is beautiful. Take camera, water, sunglasses, hat and use sunscreen. The walk is well maintained. At night you need a torch.There are playgrounds at various places along the walk so the kids will be happy. Not idea for prams.
Fabulous walk!!. Great view of each of the beaches along the path. In April, wildflowers everywhere, watching surfers exciting. Good hike to get over jet lag!
Must do in Sydney!! . Such a beautiful walk! Easy to catch the bus from CBD to Bondi or Coogee. It's free and you get to see two of the main beaches in Sydney.

I'm jealous!!. Caught the bus from Sydney and had a quick brunch at Harry's Cafe (lovely food and service) in Bondi and then started the trek to Coogee. Luckily had a lovely day, 36 degrees but with a beautiful sea breeze and clear skies. Have to say i'm very jealous of the lucky folk who live on this part of the coast - very spectacular scenery and beautiful secluded coves and beaches along the way. Well signposted, plenty of spots to sit and have a cool drink and take in the views, congratulate the local councils for making it a very tourist friendly and informative walk. Another 'must do' if you are visiting Sydney.

A classic walk..a must see. Do yourself a favour and do it.We started at Clovelly Beach car park and got as far as South Bondi.Fantastic views all the way...take your cameraSeveral great beaches to stop at along the way.The walk has the bonus of a bus route alongside it if one gets a bit weary.I'm waited years to do this,hope I don't have to wait so long before my next visit.Plenty of international tourist enjoying one of Sydney's great attractions....and its free

Beautiful coastal walk in the city. A great cliff top walk through some the eastern suburbs most beautiful beaches and headlands. Walk directly between Bondi and Coogee or break up the walk with a swim at one of the amazing beaches or ocean pools. Great cafes for a bite to eat, coffee or juice, easily accessible by public transport. A must-see on any trip to Sydney!

Breathtaking view on a sunny day.. I must say this is my most favourite activity while in Sydney. 6 kilos walk along the breathraking coastal line on a sunny day was something really amazing to do. You can stop on each beaches you pass. Fill yourself with food and drinks before continuing. The transportation system is also making things easy.

Beached As!. When you decide it’s time to escape the hustle and bustle of Sydney’s city and surrounds, the eastern coast is the perfect place for some ocean spray and time in the sun.Not a morning person myself, I committed to an early rise with my partner, sister and her partner and we all made our way out to Bondi beach. One beautiful thing about daylight savings is that the sun rises a little later (than what we’re used to in Queensland) and so despite creeping close to 7am we were able to catch the sun sleepily peak up over the ocean and slowly light up the coastline, burning beautiful pinks and orange.Having only ever visited Bondi during the day, Australia’s most famous beach is usually over run with locals and tourists alike! The iconic beach has something for just about everyone with sun, surf and sand along with a long strip of restaurants, bars and retail stores together with a farmers market, boutique street stalls and scenic running tracks. It was nice to be able to see it in a different light of day, much calmer and quieter than it is normally.We walked as far as Bronte Beach (4km round trip) and stopped at a nearby café for breakfast. It's a gorgeous walk and a must do for those that are in need of a sea breeze and love ocean views.

Morning walks, views and beach. One of the best walks in Sydney. Not difficult and stretches along the coastline. Be sure to stop at one of the many cafes in Congee or Bondi at the end of your walk. Plenty of locals here too!
Great walk, beautiful views . Possibly the most beautiful walk in my life. Some more signs around would have been wonderful. We didn't take any tours or guides...just did it on our own.

6km stroll from Bondi to Coogee. This is a leisurely walk along the Sydney coastline, you get to see several beaches/ocean pools which you can stop at for a swim. The ones beyond the Iceberg are free. There are also some parks and a war cemetery.Its a good walk with some steep parts, great for keeping fit.Make sure to bring water and if you're fitness fanatic (as many Australians seem to be) you can walk, power walk, run or crawl back alternatively get the bus or a uber from Coogee.
Sweet. Great coastal walk. Nice beach. Lovely shops.Quiet busy but to be expected. Easy to get tooNice food all over. Not cheap though
Great coastal walk. A very good walk that takes in the coast from Bondi to Coogee. It is not demanding and offers the opportunity for coffee on the way and at the end.

Stunning scenery. I was a little apprehensive if I'd be up to completing the entire walk, but I'm so glad we did! The views are stunning. What a beautiful coastline. There a lots of steps in parts, but not too steep. The cemetery on the hillside is beautiful.

Beautiful walk!. We spent a couple hours at Bondi Beach walking along the shore over to Tamarama Beach. It is absolutely beautiful. We would highly recommend going there while in Sydney. The views are fantastic!

Great morning walk. We took the bus from Sydney to Bondi and walked it. It was a beautiful weather day to spend walking and viewing the scenes. The beaches are awesome and the walkways looked fairly new. I can see why it's a very popular place.

Amazing walk. We took a walk from Bondi beach to Coogee beach..it's wonderful experience with spectacular views and lovely stop over..We could take a dip at two places fully supported by free shower,restroom facilities..there are also cafe on the way..one should not hurry and spend a leisurely five to six hours..beautifilly maintained by city council with informative signages..generally travel agencies don't include this as part of the itinerary but I consider this as must for any traveller to Sydney..I strongly recommend this for all,young and old..

Stunning scenery. I had been told that this walk was the best cliff walk in Australia, and I have to admit.......it's pretty dame close! Beautiful scenery, friendly nature of everyone using the path from singles, families, students etc. very interesting with steps, benches for rest and lookouts, toilets, cliff top overhangs with waterfalls, bottlebrush bushes, native plants, swimming pools and rock pools etc. stunning.

Stunning! Just Do It. So glad we did this. The climb is NOT easy. However if you can do the steps, then go for it. The views make the work more than worth it. The path is paved or cobbled and has steps. However, the steps are very uneven and worn in places. The climb is steep and the steps are high. If you have mobility issues (or a stroller!) then just stick to the top road and enjoy the lookouts there.

Feels surreal walking along the coast. This is one of the most amazing walks I've ever done. If I lived in the city I would probably do this every week. Coogee beach is so beautiful, the views along the coast are honestly breathtaking. Sitting on the cliffs felt so surreal. I loved it.

Stunning. This is a really lovely walk, with stunning views and beaches. Easily reached by public transport, we went by bus to Coogee then left Bondi the same way. Lots of different things to see - sweeping ocean views, lovely golden beaches, sports clubs, a cemetery, an open-to-the-ocean swimming pool. Don't know if I'd recommend it in high summer, as it would be very hot and there is little shade. There are water fountains at frequent intervals though. Just over 5km, there are quite a few steps and hills so you would need moderate fitness. One of my favourite Sydney walks!

Beautiful walk. We did the walk on a cloudy day. It was breathtaking gorgeous. It is a long walk with lots of hill and steps but was worth every minute. Beautiful coastline, beaches. Most of the beaches have a place to get a cup of coffee and take a rest if needed

Truly BEAUTIFUL!. Loved the beach and the walk to Coogee was fabulous. Wondered how we would get back to the subway, but it worked out easiest to just take a taxi to the subway. A friendly owner of a small restaurant helped us call a taxi.

Very nice walk. Lovely coastline and a fairly simple walk to take in the views. Signage in places was a little poor and I found myself back tracking once or twice to find the route but if you want to see the Sydney coastline, this has to be a good way to do it

Highly recommended. It was a fantastic walk, even if the weather was not the best one (some showers on the way). Very beautiful landscapes with rocks facing an ocean on the way. Also the cemetary on the way is very beautiful, so do it!
A Must do In Sydney. Choose a day when the walk won't be crowded, and you will be able to go at your own pace, and enjoy the scenery without interruptions.

Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal Walk. This is a spectacular walk along a foot pathed coastline. Early mornings attracts many joggers and there are stairs along parts of the walk. Evenings capture the sunset and the water is an endless changing image.
Make sure to walk all the way to Coogee. Bondi was great but Coogee was better. The walk was beautiful and we lunched at the Coogee pavillion.

More ideal walking. The geographical beauty and the thought out walking path are a perfect combination. You can swim at various locations and there are several choices of places to eat and drink. Wear sun screen
Beautiful work!. Great work definitely worth doing. Just wear comfy shoes! You can stop off plenty of places for a drink or for the toilet.
Coast Walk. We do the Coogee Beach to Bondi Beach Coast Wall every year as part of our visit with family living in Coogee. It is beautiful and well designed. It also is good exercise.

Killer on the legs. Ah, the 14km return journey has its ups and downs (literally!).It feels magnificent in the beginning but at the end of my first excursion onto this walk and for a few days afterwards - oh man those muscles were sore.Great views but busy on a Sunday morning soon you spend more time watching the path and other walkers. Oh it's a spectators game!
Walking in the sun. Beautiful walk with picturesque views along the coast. The only downfall is how busy it can get. Many steps so it may be difficult for people who are not so mobile.
Awesome. The best walk ever The atmosphere is friendly and the walk is a memorable one with of course beautiful views and friendly people

Excellent walk with great views and visiting lovely beaches.. This is along a well laid path so can easily be done in sandals. There are quite a few steep steps but generally very accessible. Well worth doing.

easy to moderate stunning walk and views . . a MUST!. I enjoy walking, but am by no means athletic. This walk was comfortable with only a few steps and inclines. Wear comfortable shoes and your bathing suit under walking clothes. You walk by gorgeous beaches, historical points of interest and an awesome cemetery right on a cliff overlooking the ocean. There are lots of places to stop if you need a break or a drink as well as pools you can swim in if you don't want to swim in the ocean (rip tides and sharks). The beaches are well supervised with life guards.

a unique setting. The Bondi to Coogee Beach is quite unique. I think not many places in the world have these pools in the sea. The views are breathtaking and great on a nice sunny day to walk around. Many places to seat and enjoy the view, take photos, etc.

Coastal walk. We did this walk along a spectacular coastline in about 1.40 minutes . It started at Bondi beach which is awesome and ended at Coogee beach . The whole walk gives you stunning views of the coastline with the option to stop for drinks or swimming along the way . We caught the metro train from Sydney town hall stop to Bondi beach and then bus back to Sydney central . Well worth the effort of walking in hot weather .
