Lovely day!. Guidebooks suggest this 6 km walk takes 2-3 hours, but we did it over 5-6 hours with a lot of people watching and beach admiring stops. While it was very popular, it didn't feel overly crowded. There were some stretches closer to Coogee Beach that were great for bird watching. We got a good picture of a kookaburra! We bought an Opal card at Woolworth's and were able to use buses to get there and back quite easily. Would recommend this in s sunny, not too hot day. Delightful!
Even part way will do!. Just from Bondi beach as far as Icebergs bar and restaurant will give you Kodak moments and excellent refreshments.
Beautiful walk. A lovely walk along the coast line, so many beautiful beaches. Make sure you wear comfortable footwear!

Beautiful & pleasant walk. I spend half my day here at the coastal walk. Took a bus from central and started the walk. The view was breathtaking. I am somewhat lucky I got the view the sculpture by the sea - an annual event there at Bondi.Great walk, great walk, great sweat too! Would love to repeat.

Oh hell! worst walk way in the world. *Badly design, walk way are too steep in some area*dirty, rubbish all the place, badly managed*Places where it shares road, the selfish Sydneysider parked all over you simply can't walk*Hard to get to, badly managed public transport

lovely to walk along costal walk. A wonderful way to spend some time during your visit to sydney. easy to reach. can go with the paid explorer bus, or go on tram with opal card. on sundays, get unlimited travel on bues , ferries , and trams for au$2.50
Beautiful!. Make sure you have a decent amount of energy if you're planning to do the whole walk, but it's beautiful! I walked it twice during my visit in Sydney. Highly recommend!

Pleasant walk . Really pleasant walk along the coast, with a good footpath the whole way. I did it in flip flops without any difficulties. Plenty of cafes along on the way in the various coves.We did it on a cloudy day and it was really windy in places. I wouldn't describe this as "must not miss" but it was a nice walk nonetheless.There is probably not a lot of shade on a hot summer day (not a problem for us on a 22C April day with clouds).

Stunning coastal walk.... I walked the Bondi to Bronte leg of this breathtaking coastal walk as a group of 8 ladies. We walked leisurely but would also be great to step it out for a cardio work out. Take water, hat & sunscreen especially in warmer months. Definitely recommend this activity to anyone visiting Sydney...

Beautiful view. We took Bus 333 to Bondi Beach from Sydney CBD.
Even though it was raining, my hubby & i enjoyed the view.
We strolled along the beach & shops in front of Bondi Beach & took a quick lunch there.

Glorious views. On this occasion we took the walk from Coogee to Bondi - the weather was perfect and so the ocean and coast looked spectacular.There has been a lot of work done with boardwalk and stairs removing almost any hint of uneven surface - albeit there are of course plenty of the latter as you follow the coastline. Took us about 2 hours each way at an easy stroll. Water fountains are scattered along the route .... If you are staying in the city and only want to do it 'one way' buses are cheap and regular from Circular Quay. Well worth doing!

Easy, Pleasant Walk.. This is well worth a visit and much less hustle and bustle than Bondi Beach. Coogee Beach is beautiful. This is a very pleasant way to sightsee. A good stroll, a brisk walk, or even a sprint depending on your level of fitness. This is a beautiful area and not to be missed. Highly recommended.
Breath taking views. I will forever hold in my mind the views and scenery on this walk ...make sure to stop for a swim on route in the one of the coastal pools

Suit all fitness levels - my first walk. I was concerned I would not be able to do this walk as I am not fit and it was my first time. I came well prepared and dressed appropriately. The views are awesome and if you do need to take a break, there are plenty of places to stop such as lookouts, the old cemetery or anywhere in the beach.I was able to complete the walk without issue. Thankfully it wasnt a hot day when i went. People need to remembered to keep to the left though. It seems the sea is so mesmerizing that people step out and arent considerate of others. Glad we went on a day where there were no events and its wasnt too packed.There are also plenty of toilets along the way so dont worry.

World class views with exercise!. On a sunny day, this coastal walk is truly awe-inspiring! Take a drink and a comfortable pair of shoes and prepare to be blown away by the fantastic viewing experiences on offer. Public transport available at both ends of the journey.

Iconic Sydney coastal walk with beautiful sea views!. This was my second walk along this busy and popular coastal walk from Bondi to Bronte! This time we did it in reverse with a timely coffee stop at Tamarama Beach to watch the waves roll in and view the iconic Tamarama SLSC in the distance, a truely Aussie experience. While a slightly a breezy day it didn't detract from the beauty of the coastal views, the wild waves rolling in and the most bluest sea and sky you could imagine! The Bondi end was as usual lively and bustling with people and activities along the beach and the shopping/cafe strip. This is a 'must do' activity when in Sydney on a warm and sunny day and a great way to get some pleasurable exercise in!

Costal Walk from Bondi Beach. I absolutely loved this walk! It was a beautiful sunny day with a breeze on a Saturday morning, if I done it again, would do it during the week. Bondi Beach Pavilion was overly crowded, but it did thin out once we got on the coastal walkway path, but still lots of people. The path is well marked, mostly level but there are several flights of stairs to climb and a couple is really steep, lots of resting benches and water fountains along the way. The coastline view is amazing, well worth the walk. We stopped off in one of the little towns for lunch. Don't forget your sunscreen!
Great views of an Iconic Australian area. This is one of those walks that you have to do at least once. Take the time to do it at an easy pace so you don't miss the view.

Do It On A Sunny Day!!!. We were not lucky back in April (2015) when we were at the Bondi Beach. It was sunny but the wind was too strong and cold (Australian Fall). We did spend only a few minutes and then sought shelter at a nearby McDonald's. That was last year. This year in mid-January we were there again. Even though it was a weekday it was very busy at Bondi (local school holiday for their summer) it was warm but windy and very overcast. But we still did the walk to Tamarama and then to Bronte beaches. At some point the wind was blowing sand to our faces. But since we could not wait for another time we did the walk with a lunch break at Bronte and walked back to Bondi.. It was still worthwhile and interesting. If you are luck enough to be there on a sunny and warm day then it would be a superb experience. Recommended!

The rain didn't stop us. It didn't look like it was going to rain in the morning before we took the bus to Bondi Beach but it started raining as soon as we got there. There was a swim center by the beach that had cover so waited it out until the rain slowed. While everything was wet we did take the entire walk and even ventured out onto some of the rock areas, but they can be slippery so be careful. It rained a couple of more times on and off while on our trek but there we places along the way to take cover. There are some pretty big up and down hills but it is worth taking the walk as you get some very good views of the coastline.

Beatiful walk, regardless of weather.. We went for this walk on a gray and a bit rainy day, it was still breathtaking. The view of the ocean with its strength and waves hitting the shore is quite inspiring. Nice for a day spent in Sydney's CBD, relaxing.

Absolutely beautiful! Don’t miss it.. We did this walk in the beginning of March from Bondi to Coogee. It was hot. There are not so many places with shade. It took us 2.5 to 3hrs with many stops for picture taking. Bring sunblock and water. In the end we went for a swim at Coogee Beach and after had lunch Coogee Pavilion on the top floor with beautiful view, where they serve Mediterranean cuisine. We liked it.Absolutely loved the walk! Beautiful scenery! I am looking at our pictures now and could not believe how beautiful it was. Don’t miss it.

Views to die for. This really is a must do,pick a sunny day and take a break at the beaches you choose.Bronte was lovely although a bit rough on the day we visited.The views really are spectacular with kiosks and toilets along the way.Enjoy a swim at Coogee and a cold beer before catching the bus back to sydney.

A must do if visiting Bondi. This is a well path walk that takes in the great coastal scenery in that area. Starting with a bit to eat at Bondi the walk meanders down to the water and then back up the coast several times. Path is well set out and journey is an easy walk - worth the time to take in the coast and the beautiful sea air.
Fab walk. Amazing cliff walk with great views of the cliffs and surf with lovely cafes and shade to rest at on route
Awesome walk, must do. Amazing walk. One of the best things we did in Sydney. Stopped at a few nice beaches on the way. Finished at Coogee pavilion for a drink

If Bondi to Coogee is too long, try Bronte to Bondi. We did this walk (family with teens) as a last minute, unplanned activity so we had a late start close to sunset. So instead of the usual Bondi to Coogee walk, we went the opposite direction and started in the middle: Bronte to Bondi. There are more transport and dinner options in Bondi so ending instead of starting the walk there proved to be a great choice for us.

This walk epitomises what is best about Sydney. Set aside a few hours on a clear day for the coastal awlk. Bring your runners and be ready to tackle a few steps on the way, but (trust me) you don't need to be fit to complete and enjoy this walk. (For those who are fit, maybe join the impressive bods who run the trail).You'll encounter sculptural sandstone cliffs, surf beaches, ocean pools, long open vistas bristling with mid height apartments and super pads from all eras, 4 Surf Life saving Clubs, folk of all shapes and sizes and hear just about every language along the way as everyone from around the world takes this in.You can take it either direction. Maybe plan a mid-walk stop for a dip at Bronte if its warm - its a pretty beach with a calm pool and a good point break if you're into that and its less crowded and less treacherous than Bondi. Depending on your timing you might be better finishing at Bondi for Lunch - there's more options and generally better fare available there ranging from sushi rolls and smoothies through burger joints and cafes to a couple of reasonable eateries behind Campbell Pde.Or better yet from Bondi you might also think about catching the 323 bus or uber to Watsons Bay Hotel ( 5 or 6 ks) and eating there - right on the southern head of the harbour.  If you're driving detour on the way there (left off Old South Head Road almost anywhere along the way) and meander through Vaucluse and check out the mansions of the uber wealthy around Point Piper. When you get to Watsons bay go to Military Rd and the park there. Eating at the Watsons Bay pub right on the water front or at Doyles next door - each of which boast great seafood for reasonable prices - is highly recommended. The soft shell crab sliders at the pub go very well with a cold beer!Or maybe grab a prawn roll for $10 from Doyle's kiosk and sit under the majestic Moreton Bay figs in the park and watch the boats bob and the ferries come and go. Or Climb the stairs on the headland and check out the notorious Gap - a lethal fall sadly quite often frequented by desperate locals - and the view across to Manly.Then catch the ferry back to Circular Quay ( if you're not driving). You can get a single trip ticket at the terminus for about $6. But make sure you don't jump on the Manly ferry by mistake - then again, there are worse mistakes to make.Just Go

All seasons in one day! . We caught the bus here from Sydney central and the weather was great, however half way along the walk, the heavens opened and we experienced the hardest hailstones I've ever felt! We still enjoyed the coastal walk though. Its a relatively easy walk and you get sucked in to the scenery and don't realise how far it is.

Great little hike. A pretty easy hike, but be sure to do it on a day that's not too hot as there is very little shade or trail cover on this path. The vistas are delightful and the color of the water is exceptional. Highly recommended!

Love this little adventure. Didn't have time to do the entire walk but I would have loved to. The views are amazing. Bondi beach is beautiful. The path is nicely paved so it's nice a smooth. Bring water and your camera.

Great walk but.... Okay this is a fantastic, brilliant, scenic walk! But man does it get busy and there are lots of narrow points where you might have to wait or push past people. Still... do this walk if you visit Sydney (early or late in the day)

The best coastal walk in Sydney. Moderately difficult.. Out of the Ten Best Coastal Walks in Sydney I would rate this walk as the best of them all. Getting to Bondi can be a bit of a mission thanks to the Bondi residents of yor whose insular selfishness has meant that there is no train to Bondi, only to the junction and then a tedious bus ride down one of the worst examples of urban infrastructure known to man. Leave early before this road becomes one long car park.Eventually you arrive at Bondi Beach, along with half of West Sydney if the weather is nice. However you can escape the bogan hoards by heading south past Icebergs Swimming Club and along this moderately taxing but very pleasant walk which takes in a number of great little beaches along the way as well as spectacular cliff top views. And there are some good watering holes at the end and a surprisingly short bus ride or Uber back to the city.Highly recommended Sydney experience. Better than the ridiculously expensive and massively underwhelming Sydney Harbour Bridge climb IMHO.Caveat: this walk has some quite steep sections and also a fair few steps. Also it can get very hot on a mid-Summer day and Sydney can surprise overseas visitors by just how hot it can get. Stay hydrated, apply sunblock, and don't attempt this walk if you can't manage a moderately arduous 5km walk.

A must do while in Sydney! . We absolutely loved this walk. We were lucky to have a beautiful sunny day with a breeze. It took us about 2 hours, the views were breathtaking and the path was very easy to follow. We finished up having lunch in Coogee before getting the bus directly back to Circular Quay.

Early sunday walk. Best time to start is early before the crowds arrive. Walkers and runners enjoy the sights from the path. There was one or two water stations to fill your bottle also. Lovely views and each beach has a different appeal.
Beautiful, Scenic walk. Awesome two-hour walk with great views and interesting plant life and animals. Great way to see the gorgeous Australia coastline.

Amazing. You can't come to Sydney and not do this walk - was the best part of my visit!There's not much shade on the path so be sure to bring suncream - there are water refill stations along the way so bring a water bottle!

Lovely walk to explore less known beaches. Easy path to follow, with a number of bus options at Coogee beach for a return to Sydney CBD. This is a great way to get slightly off the beaten path and find quieter beaches

Must do atlleast once. Took around 3-4 hours for this walk. This was the first thing I did alone without any friends in my 1st month after reaching Sydney and I really enjoyed it. Lots of people are doing it and you just follow the crowd. You get to see beautiful sceneries around.
Always breathtaking. Great walk with spectacular view, especially weekdays, when it's less people. A Must do while in Sydney :)

20 minutes if you're jogging, 40 minutes if you're taking your time.. I asked someone about how far the walk would be. I was told 20 minutes. After walking 20 minutes, I definitely know she was talking about jogging the path, which was a mix of stairs, curves, turns, and stops to take in the view.I visited during the start of a Cyclone, so the wind was intense. There are some points jutting out away from the protection of the rock walls, and you can really feel the strength of nature. Water was churning far below, crashing into the rocks, pulling everything it could reach into the oceans with the waves.There are some areas to sit, take a break and view the ocean--many times, that's about all you can see. There is enough room for jogging, which so many people did as they passed me on the walkway back and forth. There is even a little exercise area to do some sit-ups and pull-ups, etc. I even found the sometimes endless water trickling down from residential and planted areas to be interesting, because all sorts of interesting vegetation was growing there.Also along the path, you'll find stops, like Icebergs with their ocean pools, Mackenzies Bay and Tamarama, ending at Bronte Beach. Tamarama seemed to draw the most surfing crowd, and people were practicing capoeira on the grassy area. More families were at Bronte beach when I arrived.I will note, unless you're walking back where you started, there are some buses near Bronte Beach, like 360, 361, and 440. Just keep an eye on the time, as certain buses stop running after a certain time. It's not far to the other bus stop, but the 360s and 440s don't really overlap. It's a pretty long walk back to the Bondi Junction, just not impossible. So keep an eye on your time. Otherwise, walking back to Bondi beach, might give you more bus options.
☺. Great walk,amazing views!!!!!!!i must do when your in Sydney on holiday and its a beautiful day outside
Best walk in the world!. Have been coming on this walk for years and never tire of the beauty of this place. Great at any time of day and in any weather conditions.

Well worth your time to do this beautiful walk!. We did this coastal walk in about 3 hours. It wasn't the greatest day with a bit of wind and rain, but was definitely worth the time to do it. Stunning coastline and beautiful rocks and cliffs to see. Great picture places and we really enjoyed the wonderful sights. It's well worth your time to make this a part of your day when visiting Bondi Beach.
stunning. The walk along the coast is very dramatic and is a great way to spend some time taking in the views, watching the surfers.

Stunning. Went to visit Bondi Beach and ended up doing to Bondi to Coogee Beach walk. It was stunning. Bondi was so beautiful but full of tourists as would be expected but along this walk you get to see a number of other beaches a lot more untouched and just as stunning as Bondi! There are some great photo opportunities along the way and it was just very chilled, free (which is always a plus) and memorable. Its a long walk so I recommend you make sure you have the right shoes but its completely worth it. A number of the beaches along the way have cafes, toilets and other amenities so nothing is hard to find. A must when in Sydney!

Easter break. Just had a short break in Sydney over Easter. Even though we've been to Sydney before, we hadnt been to Bondi so made the short trip from Darling Harbour by Uber (my new favourite toy). The beach is amazing and crowded with locals and lots of tourists but has a great buzz about it. The bay is surrounded by Art Deco buildings and the walks are full of great views. Easy enough for people with limited fitness

Superb!. Excellent journey from end to end! Wish we had more time to spend and stop at all the sections to swim! The sights were breathtaking! I wish we had our dog with us on the trail! You must do the entire path from Bondi to Coogee!!
So beautiful!. This is a must if you are in Sydney! Its such an Icon of Sydney now and I do it regularly just for pleasure. try to do it on a week day when its not to busy.

A ''must do' in Sydney. I went to Bondi on the explorer hop on hop off bus aware that I would need to get back to Bondi to hop back on. The walk was really easy to follow, not too busy and had plenty of places to stop and rest and enjoy the stunning views and also a number of places to get drinks or food if you want. You'll take in a huge cemetry along the way too.What I hadn't banked on was the lack of a direct bus back to Bondi beach but the bus drivers are all very helpful and easily solved.

Beautiful and free. The Bondi to Coogee beach walk was very beautiful and quite stunning. We took a bus from Circular Quay to Bondi. The walk is a well marked paved trail that goes along the top of the cliffs and then drops down to beach level as you approach each beach. Although the walk is not long in miles, the up and down takes a certain level of conditioning. Its very invigorating and if your a walker it is well worth it. You can catch a bus from Coogee back to Circular Quay. I would highly recommend this tour as a nice day at the beach.
Beautiful views. Lots of tourists and stairs. It is a beautiful view. The water was cold. Took some beautiful photos. Bring a drink as there is nowhere to stop in the middle for a drink.

Long walk but worthy!. If you have all day at Bondi you must do the Coastal walk, it takes you through breath taking views of the coast line at the same time you pass by several other beaches where you can take a quick rest or a snack. There are even some water fountains available. And if for any reason you get tired half way through and do not want to do the full walk, there are plenty of bus stops along the way so you can catch one to go back to Bondi Beach or straight to Bondi Juction.
Loved this walk. A bit busy but a great walk taking in all the coastal scenery. Amazing at night although can be cold in the winter. Nice places to swim along the way.

Nice scenic walk and great exercise. Took the bus from Sydney and started in Bondi. Took about 4 hours including a stop for lunch to get to Coogee. The views were awesome and the trail is easy to follow. The Coogee pavilion was very cool and a good place to stop for a beer at the end of the hike. A great way to spend a day in the sunshine and see Sydney.

Spectacular. I had half a day to spare so enjoyed this spectacular walk. Great tracks, well signposted and I found good parking at the huge and interesting cemetery.Managed to pick up a few geocaches too!

Breath taking views!. It's a wonderful setup, this walk.Lovely views. Plenty of spots to take same beautiful photographs.Do take your own snorkel and glasses if you looking to take a plunge in any of the beaches around.

Lovely way to spend an evening. This is a really good activity for people on a budget and who want to explore the different beaches between Bondi to Coogee. Good alternative to the pub for an after work activity during the summer.
Wow. The best coastal walk! It is not very hard to do, lots of nice views and places where you can stop. Don't forget you swimsuit cause you really want to take a dive at all those nice beaches.

Perfect coastal walk. Amazing views. A little hilly with some slopes and stairs but it is all broken up nicely to suit all levels of fitness.
Some amazing photo opportunities all the way along and plenty of water fountains to top up your bottle. Would recommend to all.

Take your own time as long as can and you would not regret it. It's not the course that you just keep walking to say "I have been there and done that" as you can learn history of each area only if you wish. I am not quite sure that if you can still walk through the cemetery close to Coogee now, but this is the spot that I would recommend any of you to take a time to be there to feel something about long deserted cemetery and ironically (in a sense but quite understandable) to enjoy the amazing coastal view.

Oh boy . We have been on wonderful beach walks across the US and Europe but this one is special. We walked for a couple of miles and even had a meal in the cafe next to the sand volleyball courts. There are lots of people around walking and running.

Lovely walk with beautiful views!. I take all of my guests on this lovely walk with jaw dropping views. It can be used as exercise or just a meander through the beautiful towns and beaches along the way. It can be a race or you can stop and have a drink or a bite to eat along the way. A must for anyone visiting Sydney!

Amazing. Must see views! Need to wear tennis shoes. Highlight of trip. I thought we could reach Bondi by ferry, but was mistaken. Took bus from Circular Quay direct to Bondi beach using opal card. The bus stop is at the beginning of the walk. Enjoyed watching the surfers too.
Bondi to Coogee walk. Beautiful and easy walk to take. Stop any time to soak up the rays. Be sure to pass the cemetery to make it all the way to Coogee. Bus service is cheap and frequent.

Beautiful. A good change of pace when visiting Sydney. We are in good shape but still felt like a long walk. Along beautiful rocky coastline. After the walk we ate at Iceburg restaurant. How ever there is no decent place to shower before dinner. We made the mistake of taking a shower at the adjacent pool. Not so fabulous.
Tough walk but worth it. This walk is quite challenging in the heat and is quite far but the views make it worthwhile. Its a great way to spend a day in Bondi.

Wonderful wievs!. Took the walk on a rainy day. Didn't bother at all. The wievs are amazing. But you need to have good shoes and be in good condition to do the walk. Lots of ups and downs and steps. And a lot of people.

Beautiful . Would recommend this walk even if you only have s few days in Sydney. One beautiful beach or cliff after another. If you're staying in Sydney make sure you have return bus ticket and schedule as there are scarce places to buy tickets in beach towns and scheduled buses are far between later in day.

Fabulous coastal walk. This walk allows you to see many of Sydney's famous beaches from above, smaller coves and walk by fabulous homes all from the cliff edge with spectacular views out to sea. It can get crowded in the weekends so pick your time either earlier or later. Iconic Australia.
Great walk. Great walk from Bondi. Cliffs, rocks, bays and spectacular lookouts. Perfect view. Great place for a picnic. Highly recommended.

A must for every beach lover. While I have been to Sydney many times, this was the first time I discovered the walk and it will be a feature of any future trips. The walk has a few ups and downs, but nothing too difficult and takes you past a number of different beaches all with their own characteristics. Lunch at the Coogee Pavilion is a must.

The views are the best. Easy walk but not suitable for walking frames etc. Lots of people take their dogs on this walk. Nice cafes at Coogee to make the return walk that much nicer. The views are just brilliant.
Nice walk. If you like to walk under the sun, and enjoy a nice view while you are walking, this could be a good option
Spectacular walk. Gorgeous board walk that is mainly flat and easy going. The path takes you to lots of little beaches - stunning swimming spots. Excellent way to spend a day in Sydney.

Beautiful Coastal Views. Perfect coastal walk to see waves crashing in over the fallen rocks, crystal blue waters. Lots of opportunities to stop and take a rest in the little coves you come across. Very popular walk - take your camera!

Awesome walk . Really should do this walk. I know the thought of walking away from Bondi doesn't sound appealing but I tell you, this is a great walk. Probably the best I've ever been on. And it leads you to other beaches that are just more amazing than Bondi. Just don't forget the sunblock and some water!

Walk the coast. Be sure and take the iconic walk along the coast, there are some fantastic photo opportunities along the way, plus you will see guys surfing, fishing, BBQ there is also a gym as you walk along to keep you fit....

Easy and beautiful walk. Doing a costal walk is a must for any visitor to Sydney, and starting with the historic Bondi Beach is the way to go. A paved, easy pathway the whole distance, with beautiful views. No shade, so be sure to wear plenty of sunscreen, sunglasses and a hat.

A must do ... stunning beaches on one of the most beautiful stretches of coast in the world. I can't think of many better ways to spend a couple of hours on one of the most stunning coasts on out planet. We started at Coogee and was to Bondi via Bronte, Clovelly and Tamarama beaches. We took in a swim at each stop off on a walk that takes in five of the most beautiful beaches in the world. Bars, cafes and kiosks provide for plenty of refreshment on route and the coastal path provides you with views to die for with another and another around each twist and bend of the coast.A must do that I'll certainly do again and again....

Coastal Walk from Bondi Beach. Enjoyable walk along a nice trail with incredible views. It was overcast when we started,but then it cleared and got quite hot. Can be strenuous in spots due to steep ups and downs. Public beaches along the way have restrooms, picnic areas, and water fountains. Take a towel in case you decide to go in the water to cool your feet.
We expected more!. We took the bus to Bondi (using our Opal Cards) and were a little disappointed. Once you reach Bondi, other than the beach and sea front walk, there is not much there.

Breathtaking - literally and figuratively. We exercise regularly and it took 3 hrs return from Bondi, walking. The views are spectacular and the sea pools / baths seem to be part of the local culture.Start walking early on a weekend, maybe 7-9am. It does get busy. Take water and proper waking shoes. There's many bathrooms and water stations along the way. There are steps and inclines/declines in the path. Its a challenge but no complaints here. If you have less time you'll still experience the coastline and views by doing just Bondi to Bronte beach or go as far down as you like and return. Buses at different towns will bring you back to Bondi but have your travel card pre payed now. We wish we could do this every Saturday morning but don't live in NSW.

Spectacular heart palpitating walk . I love love love this costal walk. Can't get enough of it and wish I did it more often! Hands free is the best way to enjoy and absorb this tourist attraction. When you are finished grab a coconut water in its shell to ultimately hydrate you.

A must for a great cheap day out. This is a lovely walk next to the ocean and plenty of great spots to take photos. Always great to do when sculptures by the sea is on display. Would recommend this walk for every visitor to do when in Sydney.
A walk with a view. Very picturesque strall connecting the two beaches. Popular so you will meet many others. Easy to do and a pleasant experience.

Spectacular views. We started our day with brunch on the main drag at Bondi and then we did the walk. It was a picture perfect day making it ideal for both walking and taking in the wonderful views including the iconic Bondi Beach. En-route we took a pit-stop at Tamarama and had a drink at the cafe.This walk is a must-do if you are visiting Sydney.

Amazing scenery as far as the eye can see.. Be aware that there are plenty of steep steps so if you have bad knees take precautions.There is also a tendency for runners and dog walkers to be a bit pushy but don,t let it spoil what is however a magnificent vista.
Gorgeous!. We spend our first morning in Sydney on this walk and were not disappointed. Great views, many pictures spots, fun stops along the way and a healthy walk if you want to make it such.
Great way to see the wonderful Sydney coast. Best to do when the Sculptures by the Sea is on, but excellent anytime - even on an overcast winters day. But hot summer days are great too.
Impressive!. One of the best landscapes I have ever seen and that I will never forget. Bondi Beach is lovely and you must go if you are around Sydney

Worth every step!. If you only have time for one hike while you are in the Sydney area, this is the one! There is true beauty around every corner. We turned around in Bronte as rain was threatening, but we still saw plenty of picture worthy areas. If you can, avoid the peak hours so you can have a more tranquil visit, but this coastal walk is delightful at any time of day!

7.5km of spectacular coast with a workout!. Wonderful coastal cliffwalk with spectacular views of surf and sand and rocks, surfers and swimmers. Lots of steep steps up and down and some steeper slopes. Popular with fitness folks so you will encounter some of Sydney''s "beautiful bodies" on your walk. Finish up in Bondi with fish and chips at The Traditional Chip Shop. Walking time is about 2-2.5 hours with lots of gawking or much less if you are on a mission!

Magical walk/run - a must do.. Sydney at its best, a must do walk for locals and tourists. Breathtaking cliffs, ocean crashing onto beautiful beaches including Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly and the very special Gordon's Bay (wonderful spot for snorkelling). Recommended breakfast spots before you take off or on your journey - Brown Sugar (Bondi) Three Blue Ducks (Bronte) Seasalt (Clovelly), X74 (Coogee).

fantastic walk with some stunning views of the coast and limestone rock walls.... the day we did the walk was sunny and windy.... so no beaches were open... didn't faze us aw we just wanted to do the walk... just watch the fitness fanatics... they seem to think that they have right of way which ever way they are running.... great views.,, and some great beaches to have a swim at if the conditions allow..we had lunch at Bronte beach and then walked back.... recommend this walk

Stunning scenery. A great opportunity to see the way the coastline has been formed over the years by nature. Everyone flocks to Bondi beach based on its history but here you get to see some arguably better beaches along the way.

Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk. Must do when visiting Sydney is take a day and hike the Caostal Walk from Bondi- one of the most beautiful beaches I have ever scene- to Coogee Beach- a wonderful beach in a fun hip area. All the beaches along the walk have their own personality and each is worth its own visit.

Beautiful spot even in the rain. Started our morning with a delicious breakfast overlooking the bay and beach activities. Although the walk was short lived due to the weather the people we meant on the way and beautiful surrounding was worth it.

An amazing walk.... The best thing i did when in Sydney. The scenery is sublime, the walk isn't that demanding and many beaches are excellent. You don't have to do it all with buses running from many places along the way. Bronte is especially nice with the views over Waverley cemetery.

Sea air and exercise. The Coastal Walkway Track is well laid out, easy to follow, and used by plenty!The walkway connects Coogee, Gordon's Bay, Clovelly, Bronte, Tamarama and Bondi beaches. You can easily access any of these beaches directly from the walkway. The walkway hugs the cliff-face between Clovelly and Bronte as you head North with brilliant views. If you're lucky you will see whales and/or dolphin (I saw a pod of over 20 on one occasion).Watch out for the joggers! Be walkway savvy and keep left, and if in a group, don't walk 3 or 4 abreast across the pathway!Turn around after a coffee at Bondi and walk back to Coogee. Its about 10 km return.

Go for a slow walk. Sydney is so lucky to have so many amazing sights to see. This walk is one of them. There are steps and uneven surface to navigate to need to take care - not way suitable for wheelchairs. From the stunning Bondi beach meandering past a few lesser known beaches (not to the locals). If you are really lucky you might be there for the annual Sculptures by the Sea exhibition.

Easy walk along active coastline. An easy walk along the coastline on well established route. Lots of activity at all the beaches along the way, and lots of people on the walk. Bus connections back to start, or wherever, are convenient.

Enjoy the amazing coastline of Sydney!. This is a great walk with spectacular views and photos. I was in awe of the beauty of the coast. Be sure to bring lots of sunscreen and sun protection if it's a sunny day!

If you are enough lucky and it is a sunny day don't forget your camera and take it easy !. I don't pratice it during the weekend but on a wenesday, it 's amazing, so beautiful rock along the walk and the beaches are so beautiful !!!
Glorious views. Beautiful walk along the coastal path, occasional benches to sit and enjoy the views or other beaches to dip down on to and cafes/bars along the way.

Inspiring. Wether you're looking for a scenic walk or a bit of exercise you'll love this walk. The views are spectacular even in the dead of winter. You will find cafes at either end that you can refuel at or just enjoy the day. A highlight is when the Sculptures by the Sea exhibition is on (usually early summer) but it does get busy so go early. It's even better at sunrise if you can awaken that early.

The people, the sights, sounds and the fresh air - pure love. The lovely sea breeze and the sound of the waves are a joy to behold on this walk. I could do it every day of the year for the rest of my life and never get bored...

A Must For Visitors. One thing I miss after moving to the North Shore of Sydney is my coastal walk from Bondi.Would urge any visitor to do this walk and top it off with a nice coffee at one of the many coffee houses at Coogee Beach 10/10.

Great views over 2 hours. This is great short walk in Sydney. There are plenty of beaches to stop at and have a swim. Plenty of change rooms so take your swimmers and allow a bit longer for your walk and swim. I find it best to start at Coogee. If you are an early bird get there pre dawn and watch the sunrise at the beach. Plenty of stops for coffee or drinks. This walk is iconic and is a must do if in Sydney. Path is well marked.
Perfect way to relax. Spend an afternoon walking the relaxing Bondi to Coogee walk taking in the sights and smells along the way. Have a bite to eat in Coogee and relax on the beach. Perfect.

Worthy of the Hype. From reading reviews on here, I knew this was something I had to do during my visit to Sydney. My expectations were somewhat different from what I actually found upon trying this.Much has been mentioned in prior reviews of how physically demanding (or easy) this walk is, so allow me to first comment on that aspect. I'm far from the most fit twenty-something, but I'm certainly not the most out of shape, either. I didn't have much a problem with most of this walk, but there were times I took advantage of the benches along the walk to cool down for a few minutes and enjoy the scenery. Expect to break a sweat, particularly if you go during the summer months. I might've enjoyed it a bit more if I'd done it in a brisk fall or spring month. Aside from that, this is absolutely worth the effort. Start at Bondi, and walk up to Coogee. Stop along the way at Bronte. I liked Bondi and Coogee, but Bronte seemed to have the smallest crowds and the biggest waves, which was enjoyable to sit and watch. I wished I had gone earlier in the morning (I arrived around 7:30am), because the trail was VERY congested with morning runners and dog walkers. So if you plan to walk at a leisurely pace and enjoy the scenery (as I did), be prepared to feel like you're in the way of the local runners, particularly on the narrower bits of trail. Bondi to Coogee at a leisurely pace will probably take around 3 hours to complete, from my experience. If you're fast-walking and not stopping to take pictures or enjoy the breathtaking views, it can probably be done in much less time.My tip? Go around 5am just before dawn and finish at Coogee around 8am. And definitely go on a weekday, if possible.

Beautiful sunrise walk. We caught the bus super early so we could watch the sunrise at Bondi before we started the walk. Well worth it. So picturesque! Need your camera. Exercisers start early, so you have to be wary and keep to one side. Only one set of public toilets on the walk though, that I could see. Definitely recommend breakfast at Coogee Pavilion afterwards.

Incredible views!. This was just a spectacular walk. It is for all ages and fitness abilities. The sandstone rock formations along the way are stunning. Every time you turn a corner, there is another formation that is more incredible that the last. Wish I had the time to do it again another day.
what a lovely walk. I took this walk twice and enjoyed every moment of it. Every time u see something else. the color of the water are changing. The sea and the beach are incredible

Amazing views, MUST do in Sydney.. We lived in Sydney for a year and we had a lot of family from Chile came to visit, so we always took them here, yes, it is very popular among locals and tourists, but it's only because its very worth it. My favorite beach along this way is Bronte, we use to swim on it's ocean pool at least once a week, it's an amazing place, please go and swim there.
Lovely Walk. There are a lot of wonderful views during this walk and you come across 6 different beaches. Give yourself a few hours if you want to stop at beaches and view points along the way.

Bondi & Coogee Beaches. Travelled by taxi to Coogee Beach for lunch by the beach.A beautiful beach to visit with nice views.Went to Bondi for lunch and travelled on the Hop on Hop off bus which is really great for tourists as has a commentary of the history of suburbs that you go through. Again great views from the beach!! Including the lifesavers!!! :)

Must do!. If you're a tourist visiting Sydney, this is a must- do! Start at Bondi, and walk through the amazing views at Icebergs, and then continue on to Coogee Beach. You won't be disappointed!! Make sure you have a camera available for lots of photos!

Beautiful Coastline. This is about an hour long walk and it ends in an cemetery that is also very beautiful. There are places along the way where you can sneak thru the fence and sit on the rocks on top of the water. Very beautiful.

3 hours of splendid views. We did it on a cloudy day with showers but it was worth it. Less than 3 hour leisurely walk if you are a walker. Half a day if you want to take it easy. The path is safe, mostly concrete so no struggle. You can always stop at one of the beaches for a swim.
Brilliant coastline scenery. Great for active people, but I'm in my 70s & completed the walk with no trouble. It is also easy to do in short stages if short of time.Can be done in either direction.

Really nice walk. We did this walk a couple of times (from Coogee to Bondi). The walk from Coogee to Clovelly isnt that great but once you get passed Clovelly, it turns out to be a fantastic coastal walk. Would recommend it!

Absolutely stunning. Pretty straightforward in its execution- you start at Bondi and head south on a nice trail, following the twists and turns of the coast. The views of the sea, the rugged cliffs, and the secluded beach coves will stir even the most boring of souls. It's a fairly long walk between Bondi and Coogee owing to the many twists and turns of the path, but you can take a break and grab some refreshments at Bronte Beach/Park along the way.If walking is not really your thing, be aware that there are some steep spots here and there as the trail winds up and over the taller bluffs along the shore. Once you get to Coogee, either head back the way you came or catch a bus in the pretty park behind the beach that will take you back to either Bondi Beach or Bondi Junction.
Excellent. Every one should do this walk , the view is so great and I know quite populare for local people .Good exercise

Gorgeous walk. One of the loveliest things to do in Sydney, with breathtaking views and a satisfying mix of up and down. Do stop at Bronte for breakfast on the way and roam through the cemetery contemplating the ephemeral nature of life.

Let's walk. It is a very long walk and lots of ups and downs if you decide to do the whole thing, but beautiful scenery along the way. I would say the best part is in between Bondi and shortly after the Bronte beach where the wooden path and the cemetery. Everything after that is not that exciting. Be sure to wear sun lotion if it is a sunny day. There is no place to hide, you are in the open the whole time.

What a view!. Living in Bondi for a while this became my morning exercise route and to be frank it was worth exercising for!Between the views over the coast, the amazing beaches you get to see along the ways and the lovely spots to stop for meals, drinks or just a photo or two. You could make a day of this walk, plus if you get out early the sunrise over the cliffs at Bondi is worth seeing!

Walk of a lifetime . Simply one of the most beautiful walks we have been on in our travels. Be prepared for the distance but if you love to walk be prepared for utter beauty and breathtaking pictures!

Beautiful walk. Had planned to walk to Bronte from Bondi but the weather was wet and I was hesitant, but hey! I thought, I am Brit and we do rain no problem! :) So, armed with a suitable plastic bag poncho I set off... The sun shone and walk was amazing! Some wonderful views, met some great people, runners, joggers, walkers and surfers to name a few and even sheltered under a "cave" at one point with a lucky holiday winner who won a short break to Bondi in a competition. Looking back at my photos I can only say "What a wonderful experience". Highly recommended.

Enjoy great coastal views and get some exercise as well!. This is a most beautiful walk. Starting a Bondi after a good breakfast at the Pavillion, it is a days walk if you want to make it that. it is a gentle climb up over the famous Bondi surf club and restaurant at the south end of Bondi Beach walking round to Tamarama beach, watching the surfers below.You will be passed by energetic joggers and runners, but don't let them rush you....you can stop at Tamarama beach for a coffee, or sustenance if needed, then push on , gently, to Bronte Beach..wander along the front, stop for lunch if needed, then on towards Coogee Beach, where you can have dinner! Why not make a day of it!!Many people will do it in half or a quarter of the time... but it depends on you....

Just the most amazing walk - take your time. Grab a bus to Bondi - chill a bit, Then walk the path to Coogee via the bays and coves along the way. Plenty of places to stop and take in the beautiful, beautiful views. MUST SEE. You can do it in 2 hrs easy. Take your time and enjoy.

Easy walk, spectacular views. Perfect way to see the coast and the beautiful beaches one after another. We went about 9:00 on a Sunday morning and it was already popular with walkers, runners and people taking selfies. The sea-water pool at Bondi has clean changing rooms, hot showers and is marvellous for swimming, but you do have to pay a small fee to get in. Check if the Bondi Icebergs are swimming because they take up more than half the lanes. Other beaches later in the walk also have sea-water pools and and there are plenty of places to swim for nothing. Many of them also have changing facilities or toilets. Take advantage of the free filtered water on offer at the drinking fountains, as you may get warm in he sun!

Weekend morning walk. I used to got for this 6km coogee bondi walk on Saturday mornings .. This is a fantastic place for a walk and vies ... There Are plenty of restaurants to have breakfast once you finish the wake .. You can see Peale doing all sore of activities along the coastal walk... Dif walking , beach volley ball, exercise, swimming Etc
A really nice walk. Fantastic walk to do early in the morning, you walk for about 1 and a half hour and you see the different beaches and landscapes.
Fabulous views for entire 90 minute walk.. Not too strenuous but depending on weather can tire you out after the 90 minutes; it's a small trade for great views for every step of the walk.

reverse it. We had wanted to swim at Bondi so we should have taken a bus to Coogee and walked in only one direction, it was summer and quite hot , the views are beautiful and the walk very nice. I'm 65 and not in the best of shape so if your like me and want to spend time at Bondi beach then do the walk in reverse order.

Great way to start the New Year. We visited friends in Sydney over New Years and spent Dec 31 preparing for the big night on this coastal walk which is aerobic but easy to accomplish. We stopped at one of the interior beaches for a great, cold refreshing swim and ended in Coogee at a fun new open bar and restaurant in the Coogee Pavillion. You can easily spend most of a day taking this walk one back at a time. We had hoped to start at the Icebergs in Bondi but it is closed on Thursday's for cleaning.
Beautifull Beach. If you want to make a BBQ front of the sea, You will go. Coogee is the perfect beach with nice people and pretty restaurants

Lovely walk!. You can do this walk both way! From Bondi to Coogee and from Coogee to Bondi. I suggest you do it from Bondi to Coogee and later in the afternoon because coogee is such a wonderful place to have dinner! Heaps of restaurants and bars that offer a ton of different food. We ate at churrasco which is a wonderful Brazilian BBQ.
A Worthwhile Walk On The Beach. A little bit of a hike but well worth it. The path is paved and well marked. You see many different views of the area and coast line.Very pretty.

Coastal walk with great views. We walked along from Bondi Beach to Coogee Beach on a gorgeous sunny day. This is an easy walk and we stopped lots to take photos as it's so scenic as it winds through several beaches. Wear your swimsuit under your shorts to take a dip at one of the beaches along the way. We stopped at Clovelly Beach for a swim which also has a seaside swimming pool. Good wide footpaths. Moderate level of fitness required for this beautifully scenic walk. Well recommended.

Beautiful views. We went for a relaxing walk along this trail and it offered us beautiful views the whole way. You pass several beaches which were all packed when we were there, I'm guessing some people stop for a deserved swim along the way.

Bondi and its famous beach. Bondi is the most famous beach in Australia. You can walk from Bondi to another famous beach, Coogee (pronounced coog- ee) along the coastal walk. Coogee is a good place for a dip, take your togs, as they say in Sydney.

Do it in reverse. We did this walk in reverse, starting in Coogee then walking to Bondi. This walk was one of my favorite things we did during the trip. There are plenty of opportunities to step off the bath to grab a snack and a beer, but I would recommend some water and sunscreen before setting out.

Must do walk. A must do when visiting Sydney. If you are active and enjoy a walk and want a change from the city, this is really worth doing. The views are spectacular with the contrast of the cliffs and rocky outcrops right on the walk against the housing and amazing views of the sea with the waves pounding in and surfers catching rides. The track and sections of boardwalk are really well maintained. We walked both ways. Took about 1:15hr each way with a stop in Coogee for lunch. A great afternoon. You can walk one way and catch the bus back. Give it a go!

Glorious Walk. Bondi Beach is great and the walk is really invigorating. The view from the walk is sensational. I was there the end of summer and the weather was mild. (Only in the 90s) a slight breeze was blowing. The path is rigorous in areas. Amazing to have in a major metropolitan city.

Nice walk along the coast. This is a really nice way to get a walk, see the great south coast beaches of sydney and get a feel for what it's like to be a local in this area.Be prepared to be overtaken by numerous tanned locals in amazing shape... Not a very difficult walk but not suitable for those wishing to avoid steps or slopes.
Runners dream. I went for a lovely run along the coast. It was stunning, the views were amazing and made me feel so calm and happy.If you're not a runner a walk is also beautiful.

Great Walk with beautiful views. You can walk from Bondi to Coogee in either direction or walk the shorter sections to Bronte or Clovelly.Yes, this walk is quieter on weekdays.Take your camera and a water bottle.Buses are available to and from Bondi, Bronte, Clovelly and Coogee.Easy to start and stop at any point.This is a great walk that can be done numerous times in different seasons.
Gorgeous!. Every time i visit NSW i make sure i get this walk in. Stop by in Bronte at Three Blue Ducks for a delicious breakfast or have a dip in the rockpool. Beautiful part of the coast.

This is a nice and wonderful walk. So this is a breath taking walk. Going from one beach to the other, you have wonderful views, amazing experiences (such as crossing a cemetery with a sea view), natural pools on the way and so.Put your swimming clothes and make this amazing walk. Every beach have a shower and a restroom, so you can enjoy every beach, take a shower and continue the walk.

Great walk. We did not complete the whole walk and we started from Coogee going to Bondi. The portion we did complete we enjoyed, but consider your stamina and would recommend going from Bondi to Coogee as the sun will be more behind you rather than in your face as we did it. We ran out of steam and caught a bus half way along. Great views from many places along th walk.
Eastern Beaches Coastal Walk. Spectacular views and great beaches - awesome.Many people around on sunny weekends, so take the walk during the week

Fabulous coastal views. The walk along the coast is superb and well worth the effort. The view of Wedding Cake Rock from Clovelly and the opportunity to stop at so many different places for brekkie, brunch or just for a coffee are very welcome. This walk is very popular and can be crowded at weekends.

Worth the walk and enjoy a smoothie at the end while overlooking the blue water!. Bondi beach was beautiful blue but I wouldn't say it's a super beautiful beach. I'm comparing it to Hawaii, Coronado and Florida that are part of top 10. Bondi beach is iconic and we went for that reason and the coastal walk. Definitely do the walk to see the blue water, take a break or jump in the water of the other beaches on the way. If you get too tired you can always hop a bus at any of them. Coogee beach is just as beautiful as Bondi beach and has a better lookout, more space and is "newer". They also have food, cafes, smoothies and ice cream. We thought it was worth the walk to it. Plenty of areas for pictures or just sitting on the cliff along the waters edge to take in the sound of the waves or do some tanning.

Out in the Sun on the Coast. Stunning wildlife meanders amongst the trees, while you dawdle past on the paved track. Many different walkers/runners go past as you breathe the fresh air and wonder at the sealife as well. Crabs scuttling around, limpets hanging onto the rocks and you can snorkile if you want to get closer. Cafes abound and are good for a break.Love it!

great walk. A great part of the world, easy walk and lots to see on the way. Take your swimmers, camera and a visa card for drinks at the Bondi end. We started at Coogee and headed north. Fantastic on a great Aussie summer day, walk swim and a drink at Bondi

Early morning walks or daytime tourist adventure. I've set myself up at the beginning of the walk and waited for the summer sun to rise for some photography and I've done the full walk during the day and both are exhilarating experiences.

Best Sydney Walk. The Bondi to Coogee Coastal walk is easily accessable, with fantastic views of our iconic
beaches.Take your swimming costume and take your time.
Lovely walk. This is a great walk, but bring a bit of money and some water as well as swim suits so you can stop along the way.

The most beautiful beaches you must go for a walk.. Good exercise for this wise walk and you and enjoy the sea breeze, local living and the beauty of beaches. & hills. Luckily, Sydney has many nice beaches for you to visit.

AN ABSOLUTE MUST. An absolute MUST for anyone visiting Sydney or anyone who lives in Sydney, go early or late as it can get busy, or go to wander and not rush. Stop in he beach cafes, sit barefoot in the sand, get your feet wet, and breathe in the warm sea air.

WITNESSING BEAUTY. I have walked from Coogee Bay to Bondi Beach several times along the awe inspiring coastline. I highly recommend this activity if you like a walk with some challenges. The coastline is exquisite, the terrain has hills, stairs and wide open areas, always new and interesting along the cliffs, leading down to Gordens Bay, Clovelly Beach, Bronte Beach, Tamarramma and the iconic Bondi Beach. Each Beach is very different from the other. The walk provides the opportunity for a great workout or it can be taken at a leisurely pace to absorb all the gifts it has to offer, it is certainly art for the eyes. Depending on the time of year and day you choose to walk be aware of hats and sun protection, take water!

Do this for sure!. We did Coogie to Bondi so that we could hang out in Bondi. I would do it to end in Coogie with a family. The vibe was a little more relaxed in Coogie beach. The views were amazing and the walk felt great. Fairly easy to do. Easy to get bus there from CBD as well.

Everyone Must Do This . Sydney has a couple of big ticket tourist sights and this is definitely one of them. It's hard to imagine any city having a more spectacular walk than the path between Bondi and Coogee. It is absolutely jaw dropping. The path is all sealed so you don't need any special footware but it's about 5km and there are plenty of steps, so you should be prepared to work up a sweat on warm days. Don't leave Sydney without doing some, or all of this path.

Plan on doing half if you are not in shape. What a wonderful walk. I started from Coogee Beach and made it to the cemetery, which is half way. I am 65 and not in shape but it is a walk you do not want to miss. The problem is each cove you come to you desend down to the beach and than back up to the tops of the cliffs. No reason not to do it two different days for just sit aside more time to do the walk. If you walk every day and are shape than no matter your age it will not be a problem. Of our month gone from Iowa this was one of the most beautiful sites that we experienced.
Worth wgile. Nice, easy walk. Took about 1.5 hours. Pretty sights. Recommend to do at dusk to see sunset....gorgeous! Enjoy!!
Beautiful views. Walked and ran this on numerous occasions. It is especially beautiful for those early morning cardio sessions! Can't recommend enough.

Beach to beach!. Instead of baking in the sun on the beach, take this coastal track! There is so much to see and experience on the walk! The views are so breathtaking and it is a good way to see so much nature. I especially enjoyed looking at the colorful sandstone formations. I got great photos and it was time well spent along the coast.

Outstanding walk. Walking along the cliff tops from Bondi to Coogee is one of the must do things to do when you visit Sydney. It is a relatively easy walk and you can break it if it becomes a bit long or you are running out of time. You can park your car at one end and catch a bus back via Edgecliff shops . There are a number of food options along the walk should you like to have a break and enjoy the view with something to eat and drink

Cogee to Bondi works, too. Not a tranquil walk on the beach - far too many people are enjoying the fine views. Several possibilities to shorten the walk or to stop for refreshments.Still bring water and sun screen, as there are not many shady places. Plan plenty of time as frequent photo opportunities will keep your pace down.

WALK the WALK. The path will get the heart rate up, there are stairs & clear walk ways as well. The coastal walk was quite busy but the views were amazing. Try it out for yourself, I am sure you'll be back again.

Stunning views - and a glimpse of Sydney life. This is a beautiful walk along the clifftops and beaches of the Eastern Suburbs of Sydney. You can also do just sections of it - e.g. Bondi to Tamarama, Bronte to Coogee etc... There is public transport from most of the beaches.This walk is hilly - there are uphill and downhill bits, and when we've done it with less fit people they have been puffed. There are seats and viewing platforms along the walk, so you can pause to catch you breath if needs be. On the weekend it can be quite crowded with locals powerwalking and jogging along. Food and toilets - at most of the beaches there are cafes or a kiosk and toilets. Plan a swim if the weather is good at the end!

Great walk!. Stunning views and easy walking, always something interesting around the corner. Start and finish close to the bus stops for a regular bus back to circular quay area. Always a little breeze to keep you cool and amenities are regular along the way.
Ocean Walk. The view is , well you can't describe it . it is so beautiful. For the seniors a little hilly, plenty of places to stop & have a rest
Sydney's spectacular coastline. Great way to experience the coastline of Sydneys beach suburbs. Takes you through a number of different beaches/ coves that Sydney siders have frequent

Nice walk. I wanted to do this walk, but we chose a very hot day, unfortunately. The beaches were nice, but nothing spectacular if you are from California. There is a nice walkway, though. It was a good outing.

An amazing experience. Never realised how beautiful our coastline is. Whether you take the walk as a leisurely stroll or make it a workout - a great experience. Lots to see along the way - people flying kites - families with the kids. Don't miss it.

Postcard views. Great walk with amazing views. The walk really shouldn't take that long, 1,5 hours, but it's hard to do it that fast when you're constantly stopping for pictures. You can also spot some really good surfers along the way which will make the duration of the walk even longer. Don't do it on peak times like Sunday or during the holidays if you don't want to walk in a line-
Coastal walk. I lived on this coastal track for several years and always take my guests and visitors to see and enjoy this walk. It's a lovely day out if the weather is kind.

A fantastic walk with amazing scenary. We did this walk last year when the weather was cooler with some friends.. It takes a couple of hours but the views and scenary are worth it and local fish and chips at the end is the reward.
Great way to see urban beaches. Great walk but you don't need to go all the way Coogee. From Bondi to Bronte is great for a shorter walk.

Scenic ocean walk. A walk that passes several smaller beaches and picnic areas. It doesn't matter which end you start at, there's plenty of public transport either end. Possibly more from the Bondi end and is definitely closer to a major train line. Advise leaving an hour or two to allow yourself time to stop and admire the views off the cliffs; the boat storage; ocean pools at Bondi and (I think) Tamarama Beach; the cemetery and the cliff hugging boardwalk; at various times of the year, there is sculptures by the sea or ice rinks or movie festivals or Bowl-a-rama. A note of warning though, there are a few steep sections and stairs, so not good for prams or bad knees. If you want to run the route, there is a lot of congestion around late afternoon making it difficult. There are a few gym stations along the way and distance markers. Possibly earlier morning will have more like minded exercisers who won't hinder your run. It's a great walk and I always enjoy following the water.

Evasive horisons, gorgeous cliff top views. I live near, so i do this walk all the time, but it never gets old ☺️ Unless you go at about 9-10AM on a weekend, then it's a bit more crowded so it's harder to lose yourself in the scenery. My favorite time is early morning, but if you can't make that don't worry it's still good exercise infront of a great view. Enjoy! During May or October you will see heaps of whales as well!!
A must walk with a sea breeze. Refresh your lungs with the right envigorating sea air ... Ideal for an early morning walk and breakfast or brunch in local cafe by the sea.

We live in Sydney and its one of the walks we always try to do when friends visit.. A great 2 hours walking along the edge of the sea watching waves break and enjoying nature. Surfers surfing. Runners running. Tourists touring. Good food in Bondi, Bronte, Coogee. Catch a bus to and from. Walk in either direction.

What a great way to enjoy the ocean but from the cliffs of the Bondi to Bronty walk. We left after lunch for one of the most famous walk in SydneyThe day was hot and humid so the wLk was a way to cool down by the oceAnBeen a Sunday it was somewhat busy but still very enjoyable The views are spectacular and everyone walking enjoying every moment Off course it would have been better to do the walk when the modern art wxcebitions is onLocal artist cresting all sorts of object and are placed along the walk and what a jolly fun thing to doBeware of a the strong cold winds in winterSo tourist or local enjoy the walk I know we do every times

Great coastal walk. Although it's been some time since we did this walk it's an amazing experience to see cliffs ocean residential area of Sydney's dramatic coastline . Having plenty of amenities along the walk,easy to do.

Sculpture by the Sea. Best time to see this annual event is mid week, the crowds are murder on the weekend. If you have trouble with stairs don't attempt it. Sculptures range from super clever to "art".

Beautiful nature. Great to be so close to natural coastline the experience of being able to read the history of forefathers as you walk pass the cemetry gives a perspective of the foundation of this country. Exhilarating!
Stunning views . Unlike other coastal walks that we tried, this one had an uninterrupted path all the way. The views were amazing with plenty of viewing platforms and benches along the way.

Stunning Coastal Walk. Beaches, parks, cemetery, cliffs, architecture this is a wonderful day out. Park at Coogee and walk to Bondi for lunch with a cold beer or visa versa. Catch the bus back or just redo the picturesque walk the other way. Don't forget to take a water bottle and your swimmers for a dip along the way or at your destination....make a day of it. A must do when the "Sculpture by the Sea" so on in October/November.

Great way to get some exercise and fantastic views. This is a great walk! Fantastic views, great beaches along the way, cute cafes to stop along the way. A lovely way to experience Sydney's lovely coast.

My Sydney gymnasium. Is there anything better than this 10 km run via the rugged coast, checking out the dangerous Pacific, running through cemetaries, past million $ mansions.................WOW!!!!!!
Crowd escape. Great walk a lot of people on weekends escape the crowds and walk down to the rocks and in the middle of Waverley cemetery. A bit tricky and unofficial
Amazing Walk. This is an amazing way to see some of this beautiful coast. plenty of places to sit and rest, grab a bite to eat and just take in the scenery

Enjoy Summer walk and dip, Spring view Sculpture by the sea. Great walk that takes in beautiful iconic views of Bondi beach and many other beautiful beaches along the way to Coogee which are just as awesome. Great time to go on this walk is when you can take a dip in every beach. Another good time is during Sculpture by the Sea in October-November. So you have the pleasure of the views and the sculptures.

Nice walk. This pathway hugs the coast passing 4 beaches, namely Clovelly Beach, Bronte Beach, Tamarama Beach then arriving at Bondi. Time taken is about an hour plus to close to two hours depending on how easy you take it. I walked the opposite way, starting from Clovelly beach which is suitable for families with young children, then ending at Bondi. As the path/road walk hugs the coast, its windy and cooling. The only thing you need to think about before starting the walk is how you wanna make your way to the start/end point. It makes a difference if you drive because you cannot walk and have your car followed you to the end point which happens in my case. If you stay out too late, the bus services do not wait for you.

Evocative walk with inspirational sea views. The Coogee to Bondi Coastal walk is one of the most accessible scenic walks traversing a variety of cliff top views and some of Sydney's most picturesque beaches. In the last few years the actual route has been improved with decking along the Southern part from Coogee section going North namking easy to do. If doing the walk in the early morning or late afternoon beware of the joggers and dogs walkers as they are in large numbers!

It's a bit crowded . The walk has a perfect view but to be honest, especially once you get to Bronte on the Bronte to Bondi leg it is really, really crowded and the so called 'locals', whom someone like me would call a "blow-in" can be especially rude if you are in their way. I wouldn't even consider it on a weekend or between 5.30am - 8.00am with the impatient morning runners on the particularly narrow path. If you are on holidays definitely do it but in the middle of the day Monday-Friday. You will love it, on your own. And, if you dont want to do it all, just do Coogee to Bronte "God's Country".

beautiful views. This is a beautiful walk along the shoreline overlooking the beach. If you walk in the opposite direction ie Coogee to Bondi, you can enjoy a cold beer & lunch at Icebergs at the end for you hard work up and down stairs along the walk. Also fantastic when the sculptures by the sea are on!

A good solid walk with amazing views. One of my favourite places to take time out in Sydney. Beautiful any time of the year, able to get a good solid 10k walk or run. In the winter time you may be lucky enough to see whales, at any time you may see Dolphins. There are swimming, surfing and snorkelling spots. The coast is a great time to spend time out.
Most do in Sydney!!. Great coastal walk and awesome view! If you are in Sydney, do it! What I liked the most was the Sculpture by the Sea Bondi (event for a few weeks only each year), great art work!

Beautiful Walk. Spectacular views of the coast and the unique topography of the cliffs. You can stop half way for a swim at Tamara Beach or hold it till you get to Bronte (about 2-3k I guess) where you can swim and choose from a line of cafes for relaxing lunch before the walk back.I live in Sydney - I've done this walk many times & always enjoyed

Coastal Walking in Sydney. As an avid local coastal walker the Bondi to Coogee Walk is rated a 10 out of 10. Whether you are a power walker or a social walker this is for you! And when you get to Coogee I highly recommend the Coogee Bay Hotel for a delicious lunch and glass of bubbles or whatever takes your fancy! If you are visiting Sydney or a local this walk is a must and remember to take your camera - great photo opportunities!

lovely view but very busy. The view is lovely but it is so busy with tourists and even tour groups stopping every minute or walking way too slow. Best time is early around 6am and you will really enjoy it and can stop for coffee on the way.

Walk it or run it, it's hard to beat. It used to be a regular run until my knees said it is time to change to cycling. It is a spectacular walk or run particularly first thing in the morning. Enjoy. It is hard to beat!

Sensationally scenic way to see the suburbs and sea!. Whether you start at Bondi Beach and finish at Bronte Beach (about half way) or Coogee Beach, or do the walk in the opposite direction, this coastal walk offers unrivalled scenery all the way. There are well-maintained facilities en route, so you can take as long as you like to complete the walk, stopping for a coffee & cake, something more substantial, or just rest on one of the benches dotted along the path to take in the sights. Depending on the time of year, you may spot pods of dolphins or the annual 'Sculptures By The Sea' display. And at Bondi, Bronte & Coogee Beaches there are scrumptious food options catering for a variety of budgets, as well as public transport to take you to Bondi Junction or into the City. You'll pass by tourists and locals alike along this much loved iconic Sydney walk.
One of my favourite coastal walks. Whenever I get the chance I go on that walk - although it's a little busy on the weekends. It is beautiful from one beach to the next with stunning views.
Amazing walk from Bondi to Coogee. A must do for all visitors. The scenery is amazing, and it is the best way to view some of Sydney's most popular beaches.

'Sculptures by the Sea' exhibition.. Lots of steps / stairs, but worth the walk / stroll for the views,
Reccommend during the 'Sculptures by the Sea'

walk on the wild side.. I used to live in this area and did this walk regularly.It is beautiful in all weathers - windy, cloudy, rainy, sunny.Each shows the scenery in a different mood.You are close to the ocean and can smell and see it all the way.The path travels over rocks, sand, parkland.You also can observe interesting housing on the other side of some parts of the path.The gradient varies as it follows the terrain and is a little hilly.It is a beautiful and invigorating walk. You can have a swim or eat in any of the cafes at either end.It is wonderful to be able to be so close nature so close to the CBD.

A seaside stroll. it is a very pleasant walk best done not too early or too late as recently it has gained great popularity with determined joggers. Coming from Bondi past the Icebergs you climb down to almost sea level before rising up to a magnificent vantage point looking across from south Bondi. Along the way you will see a variety of sand wind sculpted beautiful Sydney sandstone natural sculptures and two delightful bays. The 2nd, Tamarama is famed for its white sand and often heavy surf with a big rip so don't go too far in unless you are a reasonably strong swimmer. There are a couple of steep flights of steps coming from Bondi and to a lesser extent when you come down to Tamarama but easily surmounted for even the unfit. Its best of all when the Sydney seaside sculpture exhibition is on
Great walk. It's a great walk, some stairs to battle but the walk itself is great especially when Sculptures by the sea is on

An everyday walk is a tourists dream. When international visitors come to Sydney they are acutely aware of all the spots: The Opera House, The Sydney Harbour Bridge, Manly and of course Bondi.Bondi and the eastern suburbs beaches have many bright spots. Lots of places to eat and drink and all have access to great views and a beach lifestyle that is the envy of the world.To me, the walk from Bondi to Coogee is spectacular. No matter what time of the day you tackle it, the light is always different and there's always something new to discover. I like early mornings and late afternoons for my walks, as long as its not raining!. I often take a camera and over summer will always include a quick refreshing swim in the safe and clean waters of Clovelly Bay, as well as a cleansing ale at the Clovelly Hotel.A detour through the cemetery is a beautiful and humbling reminder of a forgotten age that should not be missed.For some, the bright lights and the action at Bondi will prove to be too much to leave, but for the others, the walk and a refreshing swim and ale at Clovelly is a little slice of heaven that your international guests and friends wont forget in a hurry!

lovely walk. Breathtaking views and a good walk on well maintained pathways. Water fountains available in two or three places and toilets in Bondi, Bronte and Clovelly along the way.Enjoyed stopping for a swim in Clovelly.

Beautiful Attraction and it only costs you time.. Really good walk with variety of elevation and views. Good for all ages. Avoid those early mornings though as the fitness types tend to think they have right of way and can be quite rude. Stopped off for a nice well deserved drink at the Pavilion in Coogee.

Worth getting up early to enjoy!. A fantastic and busy coastal walk between two Sydney icons. Paths can be irregular and narrow but views are sublime. Take your swimsuit and sunscreen and camera! Watch your step as paths can be narrow and damp. Start early to watch the sun rise! Not great to do the whole walk with kids as it is a long way. If you move quickly you can do the walk in an hour but give it 3-4 hours to really enjoy the views.

Stunning and breathtaking.. I have done this walk many times and it never fails to impress me. The magnificence of our ocean and the beauty of the beaches from Bondi to Coogee. Anyone who misses this walk misses something very special.

WOW!. As someone who lives in the country and enjoys a daily hour's walk this is just incredible. At times with so many doing this walk it can be a little like Pitt St. but what a fantastic walk...simply breath taking views. In all likelihood local;s take it for granted but if you are a visitor put this at the top of your list.

Lovely healthy walk beautiful scenery. Lovely walk from Bondi to tamarama then bronte and then Coogee . Pretty tiring take a break at each beach stop . See many people walking some running . Views breath taking can walk both ways or catch a bus one way
Fresh. Great aura and nice looking fit people running around n fresh air and heaps of water fountain around area

breathtaking ocean walk. Since I live on a cliff above this walk, I have done it many, many times, but every time is different and stunningly beautiful. Right on the ocean, which constantly changes. Sandstone cliffs and lovely beaches. A sense of the wild and yet in Sydney's most densely populated area. The relatively new boardwalk off the cliff below the cemetery is fabulous, but the cemetery itself is worth walking through. Avoid Sundays; weekdays best. You don't have to do the whole length of the walk, obviously, so it depends on how much time you want to spend. eg Bondi to Bronte return would take an hour (not including coffee or swim on the way).
Great way to see the coast and some iconic beaches. Its very Sydney to be out walking the coast and seeing the beaches and having a swim - its a great walk and a refreshmant spot is never far away

Coastal trail. It can be extended from a cul-de-sac north of Maroubra beach to include lovely coastline south of Coogee-about 2 hrs in total. This section less crowded.Its a walk for all seasons!Not to be avoided _ do it you wont regret it!

priceless. Can do shorter versions, such as Bondi to Bronte, or just keep walking and take in the million $ views. Can be very busy at times with walkers and runners having to share at time narrow paths. A bit of care and common sense, easy to be distracted by the views!
Best Coastal walk in the World. It doesn't get any better than this. Views to die for ,great for sightseeing, a great run if your up to it,and all the BEAUTIFUL PEOPLE do it.
