Best Walk in Sydney. This is quite the walk and is a well known attraction for locals and visitors alike. My tip is actually to extend the walk by starting in Maroubra and ending in Bondi. It makes it a bit longer but totally worth it. This can be done for relaxation or exercise alike

beautiful walk. Lots to see on this lovely walk.
We started at Coogee and headed north through the day. Stopped at both Gordon's bay and clovelly for a snorkel. Had lunch at Bronte and a dip in the surf at Bondi before a beer and bus back to Coogee.

Bondi to Coogee walk. Beautiful, cliffs are breathtaking, little coves, beaches, parks, there is also a small cemetery with some graves dating back to the 1800 hundred lots of history.And small coffee shops to take a break enjoy good coffee a snack or light meal and enjoy the views. you can do all or part of the walk. Occasionally you can spot dolphins,and if you are lucky during end of May, June you can catch a glimpse of whales on their way North for the summer.

Million dollar views for free. This is one of the key natural highlights of a Sydney visit. You just can't go past the beauty of this coastal walk. It's our local walk, summer or winter. If you're lucky you'll see whales or dolphins from the point between Bondi and Tamarama. Stop at Tama or Bronte for a dip in warmer weather. Great breakfast or lunch spots at Bondi Beach to fuel up for the walk. Plenty of steps tho, so be prepared. Also some pretty territorial joggers use this path, especially the bit to Tamarama, so be prepared to jump out of their way!
Fantastic way to see part of Sydney!. Walked this both ways, starting and finishing at Bondi, on a hot hot day!Lots of people out on the walk which was almost as interesting as the scenery.

Great walk with sweeping views. Walked one late January morning with friends from overseas. Started from Bondi Beach at about 9 am as we were expecting thunderstorms shortly after 1 pm. The weather was great, visibility excellent and my friends adored the sweeping views. Stopped by Bronte to take a dip then walked all the way to the cemetery . The walking track was in excellent condition, tidy, with the usual water stations to refill water.We were back for lunch in Bondi by 1230 pm and as we drove away after 1 pm, the clear blue skies darkened with clouds and a heavy downpour with thunder started .I always recommend walking this trail , esp in October when Sculptures by the Sea is held . And that is another story to tell.
Must do.. There's no shade so don't go in the middle of the day when it's hot.  I prefer the south to north route.

Picturesque and easy. Beautiful walk, along Bondi, Bronte and Tamarama, ending at Coogee. A. Bit crowded on the weekends...best on a weekday. Can have lunch at Icebergs in Bondi or at Coogee....beautiful coastline...and stunning views the entire walk.

Iconic Coastline. I have walked this coastal track many times and never failed to be taken in by its beauty, variety and interest. It is at its busiest when the annual Scupltures by the Sea exhibition is open. But in any season , or at any time , it is a fascinating vista of one of Sydney's iconic beach and cliff coastlines. It is easily accessible by public transport from Sydney's CBD, either Central Railway or Circular Quay. It can be walked in either direction and at both Coogee and Bondi there is a great selection of cafes and coffee shops
Worth a look. Walk North Bondi to Bronte, Clovelly, Coogee and beyond for breathtaking views. It's a little strenuous and don't forget the water, sunscreen and hat!
Breathtaking coastline!. The walk isNot only do you see the beautiful coastline but along the way, you can admire all the beautiful houses that dots the cliffside.

Crowded, Ordinary Views.. If you like walking and constantly dodging other walkers/Runners then you will love this walkway.
The views are nothing special, Just the sea and ugly eastern suburbs houses and flats on the land side of walkway.
If your from a crowded country like China or India you might find this nice .

Beautiful but too crowded on the weekend. If you can, do this beach walk on a weekday when it is still busy but not overcrowded. You get a real feeling of the power of the sea. A must-do for visitors to Sydney!
Beautiful views. This walk provides the visitor with a look at Sydney's best beaches. It's a relatively easy walk with some steps.
Great Views, wonderful beaches. Great Walk!! Great Beaches. Cafes at Bronte Beach to stop at along the way. The Waverley Cemetery is worth a walk around too.

A must do on our visit to Sydney!. Start at either Coogee or Bondi. Stop for breakfast or lunch at Bronte and end at a hotel for a glass of something cold to reward yourself. Spectacular on a sunny day.

A beautiful way to see some of Sydney's best beaches. I love this walk, great exercise, absolutely stunning sights. A bit of a shame it is so poorly signposted, I took a few wrong turns that made the walk longer than it should have been. Apart from that I cant fault it :)
Must Do in Sydney. If you are travelling to Sydney then Bondi to Coogee walk is must. You will walk through one of the Best beaches Sydney has to offer with pristine views.

Beautiful walk to enjoy with your family. We parked nearby and walked in the early morning to Coogee where we had an excellent breakfast overlooking the beach. We then walked back and did not feel guilty about the bacon and eggs.

Nature and Nature Back to back. Starting at the Ice Berg Club at Bondi trecking along the winding paths toward the cliffs and beaches of Coogee is a great experience. A healthy way to checkout the local indiginouos species and rock scapes. Also a great way to keep healthy.
Nice walk, a bit too long. Pleasant walk, along cliffs and little beaches, some of them are cute. Diversified landscape but a bit long at the end.

Most Beautiful Coastal Walk in the World. Easy relax walk with a breath taken view
Walk throughout Bondi Tamarama Bronte Clovelly to Coogee Beach
Beautiful beaches with different vibes

Amazing walk makes you forget your even exercising . The views on this walk and the fact it is healthy and Free make this a MUST DO.There are some amazing views , excellent photo ops and you can incorporate brunch or coffee along the way as well if you like Depending on which end you start at or for an energy buff , do the return journey as well and finish off with a swim after or swim at several places along the way.Take some gold coins in a zip pocket so you don't have to worry about leaving belongings on the beach if you want to get a drink or a bite along the walk .If you're a visitor and find the hotels at Bondi a bit pricey , you could always book a room at the Crowne plaza at Coogee beach and this is on the walk and right opposite the ocean with amazing Cafes as well as a supermarket within walking distance For people on a tight budget or backpacking , there is also a backpackers at Coogee as well as Bondi and there are bbq facilities that are free along the walk , although I did here that may be changing to a gold coin to run the Bbq, still a heap day out though A must do if coming to Sydney

Fabulous views and facilities along the way. We actually walked the opposite way by catching the bus from Bondi Central to Coogee and commencing the walk back towards Bondi. It was a busy walk, lots of people out doing the same thing. The path is easy to navigate and takes you through many little coves, each with a beach and plenty of cafes, toilets and water fountains along the way. The views were fantastic and we really enjoyed this walk.

Beautiful, manageable and breathtaking.. This is a lovely walk with plenty of variety along the way. Bondi is a sight in itself, and the smaller coves around the headland are accessed via green-lined walkways that almost everyone should be able to manage. Being on top of the cliffs, the views are incredible, but turn the other way and you will often also see beautiful rock formations carved out of this towering edifice. There are plenty of benches along the way if you want to absorb the view or rest for a while.
Lovely walk. A very nice walk, that goes up and then down, but the view is fantastic. Done it twice, diffrent years, first time saw some dolphins also.

Worth the effort. We took around an hour and 40 minutes to walk from Coogee to Bondi at a leisurely pace. If you leave Coogee in the late morning you can beat the heat with a dip at Bondi Beach, which makes the walk feel even more rewarding. Great views and one of the best walks you could take.

Favourite coastal walk. I'm a local and love this walk! Such a nice way to spend a day walking either way from Coogee/Bondi or Bondi/Coogee. It ends up being a good workout. If you don't take water with you there are a few water fountains along the way. If you're lucky, you will be able to spot some whales as well. Once you're finished, enjoy drinks/meals at Bondi Icebergs/any of the Coogee/Bronte/Clovelly/Bondi restaurants/cafes.

You must do this!. This was one of our best days in Sydney. A great way to explore the beaches and the scenery is incredible. Make sure to put your swim gear in!Would recomend travelling Coogee to Bondo then you are walking in to the sun so easier to avoid burnt necks!

Well worth it. Catch the bus to Bondi Beach. After a look around there, head to the Bondi Icebergs Club at the southern end and then start the pretty walk. It is fairly long but easy travelling and there are lots of places at Coogee for food and refreshment.

A Long Walk. As the title suggests it is a long walk and not recommended for the faint hearted. It has steep hills and stairs but for those with the energy very worthwhile. The views are superb and the walking surfaces excellent. The various eateries along the way allow frequent stops if required.
Wonderful walk. A one hour walk on the coast on a very easy path. On some parts it is easy to go closer to the sea on the rocks and look the waves closer.

Coastal stroll. This is a really nice walk.I did it with my wife and niece,late afternoon,to arrive in Bondi for an early evening dinner at Icebergs.The walk is a little undulating,but easy,and follows the coast from Coogee to Bondi.It took us about an hour and a half at a strolling pace.The only slight downside is how busy it is.We did go after my niece finished work ,so perhaps earlier in the day may be quieter.It is good to see a facility like this being used,but you have to keep and eye out for those enthusiastic joggers!

This one ranks with the best. Great rock formations, overhangs and waves breaking along the rocks. Had never seen "baths" before. They are swimming pool facilities down at wave level so that waves periodically break into the pools. The wide paved path with stairs in some places wound along the cliffs past beach areas and were busy with walkers and some joggers. It was a hot day so we ended early at Bronte Beach. Easy to reach by buses from the Bondi Junction train station. Make sure to have an Opal card to use the buses and trains. Can't remember experiencing a better cliff walk than this one.
Nice View. Excellent access via train, and then bus from Central Station. Water was cold. Nice view from top. Good restroom (toilet) for a beach.

A breathtaking walk...... We took the metro from Kingcross Road to Bondi where we made arrangements to go surfing next day and did this fabulous walk all the way to Bondi's Iceberg Club for beer, oyster (not so goofd) and lunch...and our walk continued for several hours along the most spectacular coast line I have ever seen...all the way to probably the next town...it was dark when we headed to our hotel.I didn't do the surf next day but my friend who did said it was excellent ...I took, instead, the double deck bus for sightseeing...and walked for hours back to our lovely hotel, the Larmont.Buy the Opal card for transportation at the metro station....you have several rides on the card and it is cheaper.Sydney is gorgeous...Best,

Great walk, great exercise and fantastic views. The Coogee to Bondi coastal walk is invigorating, peaceful and a bit strenuous. Not only great for exercise, but it's a great way to reconnect with nature and a bit of mental therapy.

A must-do, absolutely!. We started from Coogee beach and walked our way up towards Bondi. Lined with lovely beaches along the way, the walking trail offers unparalleled views all the way. Need to wear comfortable shoes, though. If you take time to really take in the sights, you need to give it a couple of hours cover the whole trail.

A walking meditation. Six fabulous beaches from Bondi to Coogee. Sun shining, blue ocean, sand. Take water this is a long walk (15k from our hotel) take your suit and swim in the pools along side the ocean. Trails are well marked and well used.

Beautiful Oceanside and Clifftop walk. Amazing coastal walk. Well signposted with places to top up water bottle. Fantastic views. Check local bus times for return if you are planning a linear walk. I got a bus 339 from Clovelly Beach back to Circular Quay.

Well worth a short bus ride for this walk. Picturesque and easy walk along the coast and worth the trip to Bondi alone. Fairly quiet at this time of year. Thoroughly enjoyed it until Clovelly when the rain came and soaked us fairly thoroughly! It would be beautiful in better weather - though suspect very busy.

Beautiful and Free!. Absolutely amazing views from the walk. We stayed at a hotel in Sydney CBD, bused to Bondi Beach on the 333 bus, and bused/Train home from Cogee. Really easy to work out the public transportation with a map or Google Maps.We ate at Bondi and then walked to Cogee beach. The walk is very scenic. You pass a couple other beaches along the way which is cool to see. The beach sand is nice and soft. They are very busy beaches, but always seems to have a place to sit. We also did this on Saturday, so it might be less busy during the weekdays. Best of all its something free to do in Sydney!! Took longer to do the walk then expected.
Good walk by the beach. It was good to stop and have a drink and see inside all the shops and check all the prices the ice cream was delicious and the best of all very one spoke English.

Bouldering Bondi to Coogee. While in Sydney have to boulder this route-amazingly beautiful! Just bring shoes w/wet surface traction & plan to do lunch/dinner @ restaurants @ end of Coogee beach. Bus it to Bondi & back from Coogee.
Lovely walk!. A fantastic walk! You see two of the big beaches in sydney! Coogee a beach more for locals and bondi a beach for tourists!

One of the best walks in the world. If you have visitors coming to Sydney take them on this walk, they just love it because it is so magnificent. Stop at Bronte and have breakfast, brunch, lunch or whatever. Fabulous for photos and brilliant when Sculpture by the Sea is on.

Amazing and Beautiful. During my recent visit to Australia I had the opportunity to visit this amazing and beautiful place. If you enjoy walking, the ocean, and beauty this is the place for you!! This is not a place if you have trouble walking hills or long distances, but if you can handle it you must visit!!

Great Way to Experience the Coast. The walk from Bondi to Congee is close to 7K, but it is the most beautiful long beach walk I have ever experienced! It would be easy to make a day of it if you stopped to frolic in the water at each of the beaches, 4 - 5 total.
A great Sydney Experience. Beautiful walk that takes in some of Sydney's amazing beaches. Lovely to do Coogee to Bondi and finish with an icecream while taking in the view at Bondi.

An unforgettable day. We used the hop on/off bus from the city to Bondi. Plenty of restaurants/cafes. Walked along the most stunningly beautiful coastline to Coogee. Plenty of amenities along the way. We cooled off at Tamarama beach before walking back to Bondi and caught the bus to complete the loop back to the city. A truly amazing day which was beyond all expectations.

A Must do Walk for anyone. This would be one of the most picturesque walks in Australia. Beautiful coastline, amazingly beautiful and its all free! The beaches and hidden bays are superb and enticing. Everyone so happy and it helps you leave the everyday stresses.Beautifully clean & no rubbish. Everyone was so friendly and family orientated.

Great walk in the sun. catch a bus to Bondi and then walk the coastal path to Coogee. You have to do it because it's Bondi for god's sake. The boardwalk takes you past Waverley cemetery and that's a really interesting place, right on the edge and the place to end up in if you want a postmortem sea view. Catch a bus back to the harbor from Coogee and you can do the whole thing in three hours. The walk itself isn't too strenuous and for us Brits straight from a wet and windy February, it was a delicious taste of summer.

Super walk with great sea viws. My family and I walked from Bondi to Coogee and throuroughly enjoyed the beautiful weather and the chance to appreciate some beautiful coastal views. I would highly recommend this but be prepared to find the walk very busy, although this was during the day during holiday season
Bondi - Coogee dream. Got to do this walk if you get to Bondi - about 2.5 hours but just so worth it - fantastic - you MUST start at Iceburg restaurant overlooking Bondi - Am - Az - Zing !!!!
Beach Walk. If you love sea and walking, this is one of must do in Sydney, you can enjoy the walk any time during the day depending on your choice.

Fabulous views. About 6 km up hill and down dale along the coastal path is worth the effort as on a hot day it is more than a stroll. A bus from Circular Bay to Coogee takes yo to the start of the walk to Bondi, we chose to do it that way round as we wanted to go to Watsons Bay from Bondai, another bus. The views along the coast are spectacular with surf, crashing waves on the rocks and azure blue sea. Make the effort take the walk.

A must see. Swimming, Surfing, Paddle Boarding, and lots of activity on and off the beach. Great shopping and restaurants. Trails to walk. Allow plenty of time to get back to the train station as buss are usually full and will pass by stops so you may have to wait a bit.
Do it! . If visiting or living in Sydney this is a must. With sweeping ocean views and places to stop and admire, it's excellent. Good for fitness nuts too.
Great Way to Spend a Day. Fantastic views, stunning beaches. Relaxing walk. Good little stops along the way. Highly recommend for anyone visiting Sydney.

Beautiful view and beaches. You pass by multiple beaches on the walk and they're all beautiful and very clean and nice. I didn't look around much at bondi, but coogee had some great places to eat and was a very cute little town! Highly recommend it!

Excellent views and relaxing walk . Beautiful and unique stone formations along the beaches. Loved the weather, the scenery and the atmosphere. It's a pity we only walked from Bronte to Bondi because we didn't have much time.
Awesome. Can not believe this place awesome does not even cut it the views are spectacular and the vibe of Bondi is great we will be back!

Seaside walking at its finest. Start your brisk walk or slow meander at the southern end of Bondi Beach (Notts Avenue). This is not a particularly difficult or strenuous walk and is regularly enjoyed by families and joggers alike. However there are quite a few stairs, so this is not suitable for prams, strollers or wheelchairs. Follow the well sign-posted cliff-hugging path around the magnificent sandstone headland and enjoy impressive views up and down Sydney’s east coast. From mid-October to early November you may encounter especially large crowds, between the Bondi and Tamarama stretch, with thousands gathering for the annual Sculpture By The Sea. This brilliant exhibition has been running for many years and should not be missed. No matter when you take your walk, be sure to wear a hat and sunscreen, and take a bottle of water – particularly in the warmer months. Consider a dawn visit – and watch the sun come up over the majestic Pacific Ocean…and head to Bondi Icebergs Club for a hearty breakfast. If later in the day is more your style then you can finish the journey back at the glamorous Icebergs Dining Room and Bar. At Bronte, beach side occupy a strip on Bronte Road (at the southern end of the beach, beyond the park), where you can enjoy coffee or more.

fantastic views. This walk is a must to anyone who visits Sydney. The walk can take as long as you want it to. You can stop at a number of view points on this picturesque walk or atop at a number of bars and restaurants along the way.

Gorgeous Walk. My friend and I walked from Bondi to Bronte beach and it was absolutely stunning. Bondi to Tamarama has lots of interesting cliffs to look out over and is quite steep in places. It flatens out towards the end and has more inland and beach vistas. Tamarama to Bronte is about five minutes walk. The track itself can be busy and the start at Bondi is filled with tourists taking photos so just be wary of that. Also it's a hot walk - basically no shade the whole way but plenty of places to stop, take a break and look out over the ocean. I got sunburn even on a mild, sunny day (and I should have known better) so be careful and wear a hat and sunscreen.

Lovely walk with fabulous views. This is a great walk to do. It is not too hard and has great views of the ocean, the cliffs and the interesting rock formations make great photos. Well worth doing and nice on a hot day as there was a lovely cool breeze blowing.
Beautiful!. What a gorgeous hike along the coastline! It had small areas along the way to increase your workout with advice and apparatus. The beauty is what we loved!

Quick visit. Was not too impressed. The water was cold to me and there were cigarette butts all over in the sand. I was not too interested in the shops around the beach area. The plus was the bath house for changing with lockers.
LONG HOT WALK. We decided to do this walk from Bondi, but due to humidity and heat we gave up at Clovelly beach and caught the bus back to Bondi. Great scenery and worth the walk.

A very busy coastal walk. My family and I did this walk on a Saturday which was not a good idea as it is so busy at the weekends. It is a good strip, good surfaces and some great views. Has an amazing cemetery on one headleand which would be a great place to RIP. Lots of public toilets and eating places on the route. Beaches were equally busy and there was lots to watch. Some good BBQ places and playgrounds along the route. Would suggest you do this during a week if you are on holiday and have that option.
Always a very enjoyable walk. We go Coogee to Bondi and have a nice cold sauv blanc at the surf club and a plate of seafood as a reward.
A Great Walk. We also do this walk when we come to Sydney and never tire of it whichever way we go - great views along the way

Wonderful walk. I enjoyed this walk very much. There are few fantastic beaches along the way, and plenty of stops to rest. It was so beautifull I needed to take pictures every five minutes! I recommend this walk to everyone just be carefull you don't get sun burnt!
Wonderful views. A strenuous walk, about 2 hours, up and down, steps, etc, but great views. Worth it! Several smallish bays along the way, some with ocean pools.

Beautiful scenery. Bondi beach is smaller than you think, but clean, plenty of amenities and the sand is so soft! We walked only as far as Bronte beach I think. It was a baking hot day and we'd underestimated how long the whole walk would take. Fantastic scenery and rock formations on the way. Because the walk dips into all the bays on the way to Coogee, there's rest stops round each headland and you can also cut the walk short and get a bus back.

Beautiful walk! . Stunning piece of coastline, plenty of benches and info plaques along the way. We took the whole day for the walk and speed in a few places for coffee, lunch and just to take some photos. The walk was relatively quiet even on a Saturday, the paths and walkways are well maintained there are a few steep bits and steps and you walk over the rocks very briefly at one point. We loved it.

New Year's Day! Wonderful weather!. All of Sydney seemed to be at the beach! Wow! The walk was crowded, but afforded beautiful views of the many beaches, rock outcroppings, the cemetary, the surfers and the throngs on the beaches. It was and excellent walk and the Coogee Pavilion at the end provided the needed liquid refreshment.

Long walk. Make sure you have sensible footwear as its a very long walk takes over an hour and in the hot weather it's tough going lots of hilly bits here and there. But the views make it all worth while

Beautiful coastal scenery. Took bus from town centre, which took us right to start of Bondi beach. Had to visit as its so iconic but I was expecting it to be a lot bigger than it was. However, we walked along the sand and had a paddle. I'd got my swim stuff with me but decided just to have a 'paddle' here and wait until I got to a quieter beach along the walk. The walk was beautiful and well laid out with views of the sea virtually all the way. Stopped at Bronte beach for a 'swim', which was really just dashing in and out of the waves trying not to fall in, which I did! Good fun though and there were changing rooms and showers by the beach. After showering carried on walking and found another beach which might have been a bit calmer for swimming, seemed very popular but not too overcrowded. I think this was Clovelly beach.The walk itself took about two and half hours at very leisurely pace and there are drinking water taps along the way to refill your bottle.Take hat, sun cream and water.
Beautiful!. I love this walk--it is one of my favorite things to do in Sydney. It can be pretty crowded, but that's because it's great!

Scenic walk. Beautiful views of the water, rocks and beaches! Lots of people since its summer now. Beautiful soft sands and clear waters. Really regretted not packing my bathing suit to sneak in a swim at one of the beaches or bath. It's not a strenuous walk except for the hot summer sun. Plenty of toilet facilities and water refill points at each beach. There's shelters for you to take a breather along the way too. If you're tired, you can take a bus from Clovelly beach too. So, it's easy to break up the walks into smaller segments.
Cant Miss this!. Being from Boston, we always think we have the BEST! Well, I think we found the best...The Laremont hotel recommended this walk and they were right. It was one of our favorites.
Nice Walk. Nice walk with many steps and hills to climb. Must be somewhat fit to do this. It was a hot and humid day adding to the challenge.

A must. Fantastic walk and longer and harder than most reviews state, but still a must for all people plenty of rest stations and water bottle top up stations, well worth it for the beautiful scenery and stunning ocean views
Seaside Walk. Such beautiful coastline. The air is surprisingly fresh for the population. The children were excited to see the tower from where Bondi Rescue is filmed. The walk was stunning.
A must when visiting Sydney!. Fabulous walk, taking you past the beautiful Eastern Suburb beaches. Would definitely recommend at sunrise :)

Stunning vistas . You can walk this costal path without a tour guide but I decided to try one and am glad I did. Because others who booked their tour canceled at the last minute we had the guide to ourselves which made for great, informal and humorous conversation for over three hours. The history of the area, including aboriginal art in obscure locations, was a highlight, along with great recommendations on where to eat and swim when we were done. Don't walk this path alone!

Been There...Done That.... This place is unusual in that there is a pool right in the ocean. That likely means a good wave or two rolls from the ocean into the pool from the ocean. It is a nice area to go for a walk. Just bring a mountain of sunscreen if you are like me as pale as a ghost.

A Great and Scenic Walk!. The Bondi to Coogee coastal walk is one of my favorite walks! the well built path hugs the coastline and gives a great view of the ocean from the cliffs and stops at every beach along the way! there are amenities such as toilets and take-away food places along the way. Perfect for a sunny day walk and very popular with tourists and locals alike!

A Must. This walk is a must experience if you are travelling around Sydney.As you walk along Bondi to Coogee, you will be left inspired by the breathtaking views.Make sure if you can to check out this walk during Sculpture By Sea season if you are into art and creativity.

Absolute beauty free of charge. The coastal walk is a must do for Sydney residents and visitors. I take all of my guests on this. You pass 6 different beaches, bays and coves so there are plenty of options to stop along the way. The scenery is beautiful. Cliff top views are breathtaking. Can be busy on the weekend so recommend doing a week day if you have the option. Takes about 90 mins from Coogee to Bondi without stopping. You'll want to allow more time for lots of picture taking. :) Not a strenuous walk (few inclines) so most ppl could do it.

Great scenic walk. It is definately worth a trip. But you should be fit. Otherwise the wall will be very long and exhausting. The landscape and the views are impressive. Make sure to stop by at Bondi Icebergs to cool off in the nice pool.

Gets better & better.....! . This was probably my fourth costal walk from Bondi to Coogee as I wanted to show my partner the picturesque surroundings. We passed tamarama beach which you will see Mackenzie’s Point. Tamarama is my favourite of the Beaches along the costal walk but all are fantastic in their own right. Bronte was next where it has the Bronte baths, there was a lot of families here. Clovelly beach is also great & you can swim & snorkel here. There is a board walk where u can see the cemetery ( the most scenic one), coogee is great for BBQs & beers. Everyone is relaxed & enjoying themselves. It is really a great scenic walk & has to be done when visiting Sydney.
Stairs are not my cup of tea. I just don't like stairs. And there are a lot of them there. But the scenery is amazing. Definitely go there! Don't be lazy :)
Lovely!. An ocean side walk that is truly beautiful! If you have spare time in Sydney I highly recommend going on this walk!
Stunning views. A great place to spend a sunny summer afternoon. Clean beaches, lovely people, great food along the way.

One of the Greatest Walk of my Life. Have you heard how many beaches are there in Sydney? This is a great walk that really shows you amazing places from the wavy Bondai Beach to very relaxing still waters (almost still as a pool) getting through rocks, history, nature and beautiful landscapes. It's a great walk you'll never forget. I would also recommend to get a towel on your bag and a bathing suit ready to soak this experience in every beach (Tamara, Bronte and others right in the middle). And end up your walk with traditional Fish and Chips at Coogee.

Best (and free) thing to do on a beautiful day. We live in Coogee, so have done this walk many times over the years. Avoid the weekend crowds if you can and start early to enjoy the sunrise. If you finish at lunchtime in Bondi, see the Bavarian for a beer and a sausage or pretzel ;)

Amazing walk. If you get a chance you really should take the opportunity to take this walk. The views are amazing and on either side there are opportunities to visit some really nice Cafes for breakfast lunch or dinner. The walk is easy but don't take a pram if you have little kids as there are stairs along the way and it gets annoying quickly.

Sunrise walk . This is a great walk with Beautiful views and plenty of place for amazing photos. We walked from Bondie beach to watch the sunrise. Bring comfortable shoes and water because there is some elevation and stairs.

Ocean, walking, sand and sun - what's not to love. We completed the walk in February, it was lovely. Tackling the walk at midday was probably not the smartest decision but there were plenty of beaches to stop at and have a dip to cool off. The Clovelly Bowling Club is also a good watering hole - ice cold beer and drinks readily available. Don't forget your camera, there are some amazing views out to see and all the beaches.
picturesque walk. its a must do walk in sydney. I have done it a couple of times now and it just feels different in each season.
A must. We really enjoyed the Bondi Walk. Its an easy walk but very very beautiful. I must have taken 100s of pictures
Bronte to Coogee walk. Fresh air, ocean views, exercise and a great pick-me-up. We do this walk as often as we can. Great rain or sunshine
Lovely walk.. A lovely coastal walk,reasonable number of steps but worth it for the views and a well earned beer in The Coogie Pavilion upstairs overlooking the Bay.

Loved it!. What spectacular views!
You need comfortable shoes, sunscreen, and a hat. The sun is very strong in Australia.
Most people are in bathing suits and shorts. Lots of stairs up and down.
The entire thing is beautiful. Great location for pictures, a swim, and people watching.

Absolutely beautiful!!!. This was a stunning walk through about 4 little beach towns. The walk isn't that difficult although there isn't a ton of shade and we did it on a really hot day and were dying! all the more reason to stop in the different towns and grab a drink! have your cameras ready there is beautiful scenery at every turn. Some of the walk is a little challenging if you are not in shape but not overly difficult at all. There are a lot of stairs as well so just something to keep in mind. All in all it was a great day and such a feeling of accomplishment when we were done! Took us probably about 3 hours to do but we stopped along the way to take pictures and relax.
This is a must. If visiting Sydney, take the bus to Coogee and do this coastal walk! It takes about 4hours but it's should be on the list "top things to do before you die" Great scenery!
beauty!. Beauty there is beyobd breath taking , too good , not to be missed . Wind there is amazing and good for nature lover!

723637 selfies. So someone told me the walk was like 40 minutes but it was actually like almost 3 hours, probably since I was taking so many selfies along the way! The weather was absolutely perfect! The wind was blowing, it was not crazy hot! It was actually beyond perfect! I did the walk by myself, I kind of wish that I had friends with me, but it was a pleasant walk still! I stopped every second to either take a picture or just to enjoy the view! I would definitely do the walk again but with friends this time! The walk is pretty long and tiring so don't think that it's super easy! Anyways do the walk, it's a great form of exercise, definitely snack before and bring along a water bottle!

Beautiful relaxing walk. Great walk from Bondi to Coogee, just follow the beach from Bondi South and you'll come to the path. There are water fountains on the way. Once you reach the end you can enjoy a great fruit smoothie at one of the many smoothie bars in Coogee.

nice but too crowded. was allright, however damn busy with runners - especially between bondi and bronte.
one information I didn't find before hand: with all the stairs this walk is not for strollers or any wheel based movement...

Beautiful. The guide book said 6km but this is definitely at least an 8km walk. It is an undulating path with some steep inclines and quite a few steps but manageable for most. The panoramic views are worth the effort and we stopped off to swim and to have refreshments so based on that, I would say to allow 2 or 3 hours. We decided to take the bus back to Bondi which was an adventure in itself. Although tired, we were glad to have done this walk and would recommend.

Excellent views!. The Bondi to Coogee walk is a picturesque 30 to 40 min walk with excellent views of the sea at left, you will see wonderfull beaches during the walk. It is the best walk in Sydney hope you enjoy as much as I did!
very pleasant walk, pretty views. we did the walk in 4 hours as we were stopping for a swim at the various beaches along the way. it is quite a pleasant walk with a lot of great views
Memorable coastal run. I had a pleasure of running on this very picturesque walk. The scenery is breathtaking and the run quite challenging. Cannot miss this spot, whether you run or not.

Beutiful!!. Certainly a highlight of our trip to Sydney. No visit there could be considered complete without including this walk. Easy get there and back by bus. It was the best thing we did all week and only cost bus fare!!

Sunning Views and walk to Coogee. The views are simply breathtaking. So peaceful and invigorating. The walk has many elevations and stairs so be prepared. Lots of joggers on the trail. Aussie's are in great shape. Views from the top are beyond stunning. Definitely an adventure.

Amazing views and easy walk. This walk was of medium intensity with a few sets of stairs and lots of twists and turns. We walked at around 6pm at night and there were plenty of people running by or walking with a friend so we felt very safe. Would highly recommend to anyone as the views are amazing and it was one of the highlights of my trip to Sydney.

Fabulous coastal walk with spectacular views . If you are visiting Sydney then this walk is a must. Having grown up in suburbia it's hard to believe that the suburbs of any town could be as beautiful as this. An easy walk to while away a few hours surrounded by some of the most spectacular scenery anywhere. Blue seas, golden sands, beach pools, and places for refreshments along the way. If going in the heat of the day take plenty of water (there are loads of toilets en route!) and don't forget the sunscreen, hat and sunglasses. Don't miss it.
Sydney seaside. An ocean walk with amazing beaches . Walk there in January with the hot summer sun is something the will remain in my mind for many years

Fantastic walk!. What a beautiful walk alone the sea front, took myself and my girlfriend about 2 hours to complete the walk after a few drink stops (you will need them) if you do not want to complete the whole walk then I would suggest turning back around at the second beach! Have fun!!!!!

Enjoyable walk with beautiful scenary. I started the walk from Bondi to Coogee. The walk is easy to follow with stunning views. The walk takes in several bays where you can nip for a swim or stop for a drink. I thought the best part of the walk was from Bondi to Bronte so if you are short on time then complete this section. Fabulous way to take in the coast and spend an afternoon.

Burnt, bothered and beguiled!. Attempted this walked in scorching heat with a disgruntled, fair skinned , moaning teenager. This walk is wonderful, eye catching, leisurely and a great form of light aerobic work.The paths meandering, rolling nature always keeps your interest. There are plenty of photo opportunities and little inlets to have a picnic. If you were organised to have one.Just long enough to slightly tax you and leave you a sense of accomplishment. A warning thought leave all moaning teenagers at home or lose them.!
Nice view. Nice walk along the coast line. Gorgeous view of bondi beach and the ocean. Make sure to wear sunscreen as there is absolutely no shade along the way.

Why would you not?. A great way to shake away any of the cobwebs in your legs along with the opportunity to get some fresh air and great views. The earlier in the day you do the walk the better off it will be as it can become congested. Stop along the way in Bronte for breakfast or lunch.

Lovely walk - bring the sun scream...and the trainners!. Have done this walk a few times on visits to Sydney. This time we were there in Jan 2016 and we started at Bondi and finished up at Coogee. Was a nice enough day - not too hot- but remember the sunscreen!Two outdoor pools along the way so bring the swimming stuff! And the walk is totally worth it when you stop off at the nearest restaurant when you finish the walk in Coogee. Best fish in chips in town! (Massive portions!) Buses from the city to both Bondi/Cogee no matter which way you want to do the walk!

A must do in Sydney, up to Coogee!. Don't stop at Bronte, make it completely - from more crowded in the beginning to a little more "wild" and calm between Bronte and Coogee. A little park to spot in Bronte with small waterfalls too.Nice beaches and little bays (Gordon's Bay near Coogee especially!) on the way.Take it easy, take your time and enjoy!As well (of course) barbecues spots on the way, and some fitness spots too. But don't expect buying BBQ food on the way.

Best thing you can do! . It is the best thing you can do while in Sydney ! Walk is so refreshing and sitting along and enjoying the waves making roaring noise is something I can recollect as I close my eyes even after a year of visiting this place . It's away from harbour bridge but buying a day pass to use public transport makes this easy access and this place is well connected with public transport ! Soak in as much as you can while you are there !

Be sure to do this when at Bondi Beach. Bondi is a beautiful place which took me by surprise as it's such a tourist location. This area is to the right of the beach - about a 10 minuet walk? You'll be able to see the place from the beach, I actually thought it was further away reading reviews. We didn't swim in the pool - we basically just soaked up the views and took everything in. Definitely check it out.
Great walk!. A simply amazing walk! I loved it, The views were so amazing and swimming at a wonderful beach after walking in the sun is just amazing!

Great Walk-Hike. Bondi & Coogee Beaches are beautiful, but it's all of the beaches in between that make this walk worth taking! Bring some things, gathers & towel in your backpack & take a detour in one of the bays. About half way there is a cove with changing rooms. Australia has it figured out!! Public toilets & handy showers & changing areas! Bring a bottle of water, but not to worry if you run out. Also, along the way are fresh water spouts for you & your pooch. When you stop at the outlook spots, don't forget to look back where you came from. The vistas are beautiful from both directions. A word to the wise on logistics. I started at Bondi & thought I'd just hop a bus back to the start. It's more practical of you leave from Bondi, just to hop a bus from Coogee back to your hotel, in our case Sydney CBD, so I took the bus from Coogee to Bondi Junction (note: Bondi Junction is NOT near Bondi Beach!) & caught train back to the city. The other note about this walk is that it is not flat. There ate hills & valleys, so prepare yourself for a hike. The trail is well kept, so you can easily do in tennis runners, but don't try it in thongs. Wear sunscreen & reapply. There is very little shade. There are plenty of food & drink places at both ends, so no need to worry on that score. It's great to say you did this walk. I've never been anywhere like this!

A great walk. . Come all you outdoorsy types yet again the powers that be accommodate every type of person that can navigate this great picturesque walk. Take your time, its not a race. Oh and don't forget the sunblock and some water to keep hydrated. ENJOY.

Incredible Views!. We did the Bondi to Coogee walk on a sunny afternoon this February. The views are to die for and its a great way to get a workout in and see all the beaches on this side of Sydney. We started our morning with breakfast in Bondi and a few hours tanning and swimming there. We then had lunch at the Bondi Icebergs before beginning the walk. Overall it's not too challenging although towards the end there are some more hills and stairs. We stopped and swam at Bronte and Coogee as well to take a break. Overall it took about 2.5 hours to complete including the stops, and then we had a snack at the Coogee pavilion before heading back! It's a must do if you're in Sydney!

A stunning and pleasant walk. This was the first thing that I did upon my arrival in Sydney. After a quick refreshing dip at the crowded Bondi Beach, we walked all the way to Coogee which offered phenomenal views of beach after beach. Finally, we ended up in the very crowded, party-central Coogee as it was a Saturday. Everyone was out and about having a good time. We took the bus back to Bondi Junction. This is a must do! It is the fastest and most pleasant way to see really amazing views not far from Sydney's CBD. Would recommend!!

Most Beautiful Coastal Walk on the Planet. This walk is great because you get beautiful photos, a nice "hike" and you can stop at just about any point to catch a bus or hang out at the beach. I've done this walk with friends and with my parents and it was lovely both times. Absolutely recommend it for anyone visiting Sydney.

Lovely walk on a hot day - very busy. Lovely walk, extremely scenic. Mixture of path and steps. Various parks and cafes along the way. I walked it on a hot summer afternoon. It was very busy and noisy with people everywhere - so very much a city feel to it
Gorgeous Views. Amazing walk with spectacular views. Some parts were hilly if not used to it, but pretty easy walk. Definitely a must do!

Amazing Cliff Walk. A great way to see some of Sydney's best beaches (Coogee, Gordons Bay, Clovelly, Bronte, Tamarama and Bondi) whilst walking around the cliffs and always looking out to sea. At certain times of the year you can also see Dolphins close to the shore and whales a little further out to sea. You'll feel fantastic afterwards and can enjoy a cold beer or coffee at one of Bondi's many cafes or bars and a swim at one of Australia's best beaches!
Coastal walk. Definitely worth the time; plenty opportunity to take scenic pictures; could be combined with lunch afterwards at the Cogee pavilion

Gorgeous Way to Explore. The first part of the walk has some steps, but is relatively flat. The end includes some hilly portions. Gorgeous views of beaches and cliffs the whole way, and plenty of places to stop and rest or grab a coffee.

Spectacular views and great exercise . What a great way to spend a couple of hours. The walk is a mix of footpath, boardwalk, and stairs, with plenty of places to stop along the way. The walk is achievable for all fitness levels and ages but there are some steep uphill sections and staircases here and there.No matter what time of the year, be sure to take plenty of water, wear sunscreen and a hat. Especially in summer you will need sunglasses as the glare off the water is dazzling.This is a very popular track, especially on weekends when it is packed with runners, power walkers, plus family groups. On busy days there will be points of congestion, you just need to be patient. If you want to avoid crowds, you'll need to either be up early or go during the week.Golden rule is to try to keep to the left of the path to allow for people coming the other way and faster people to pass you, walk single-file in busy sections.Be sure to take a camera, the ocean, beach, cliff, and park views are truly spectacular.You can start at either end - Bondi or Coogee - or anywhere along the way such as Clovelly, Bronte, or Tamarama. The full walk at a moderate pace with light people traffic takes around one and a half to two hours.

Fantastic way to spend a day. Catch a bus to Bondi beach from Circular quay....walk from Bondi to Coogee on an easy path passing lovely beaches . Views are superb. Best thing is you can stop and swim in salt pools especially at Bronte beach. Good place for lunch on the path at Clovelly beach. Coogee is really nice for enjoying the waves. The walk is not long but it takes all day if you want to really enjoy the views and swim. Bus back from Coogee. Great day out.

Most scenic walk I have ever taken!. A great way to experiences the many beautiful beaches Sydney has to offer.Aboard the bus in Sydney to coogee.The walk takes around 3-4 hours but it is well worth it.kiosks for refreshments and toilet stops along the way.I would not recommend the entire walk for wheel chair users or buggys.

Great for walkers. I didn't do all the walk but did do at least three quarters and the views along the way are spectacular in parts.and would definitely recommend this to any walkers thinking about it.Make sure you take plenty water and sun-cream with you though.

A must do when in Sydney!. Absolutely stunning walk! Breathtaking scenery, lots of photo opportunities & a some of the worlds best beaches! Tip: If possible, complete the walk on a weekday, when it is much less crowded.

Must!. Don't forget to apply sunscreen as it's actually veeery hot during summer. Haha! If you want to fo beach hopping, this is it. You can walk from Bondi to Cooger and admire the beautiful Sydney coast.

Best Walk in Sydney. I have done this walk many times with my wife and even our dog.It is the best walk along the coast of Sydney in my opinion.It is challenging but mostly easy but it enjoys the best scenery one could imagine.Also, bring a towel as there are many spots to have a dip and enjoy the ocean as you walk.

A pristine and amazing coastal walk ,sun/sea/sand and a natural beauty. If you only get chance to do a few things whilst in Sydney ,this is a must, the coastal walk from Bondi beach to Coogee. its nature at its best ,thrilling and scenic views ,got to be one of the worlds best coastal walks,you can take the local city bus to Bondi beach then walk about 2-3hrs to Coogee ,and have a few beers before you take a bus back to Sydney ,, Bondi is world renowned for its beach life ,and surf,but get away from that and take the walk ,and i am sure you will not be disappointed for taking the effort ,keeps you fit too,

Gorgeous beaches. Definitely worth the trek! Mostly very easy walking though towards Coogee there are some steeper inclines. Lots of places to explore along the way and plenty of cafes, gelato places and eateries so you could make it a whole day venture.

Bondi to Bronte Walk. a very scenic walk that we undertook, delighted with the beautiful sights. we walked upto clovelly and then took a bus back to Bondi Junction. Highly recommended not to be missed

A must. The walk will get you through amazing views and you will feel the freshness of the ocean breeze.
The path has been really well constructed mainly in wood so that it's perfectly integrated to the landscape.
The path will lead you to different beaches where you can enjoy and relax.
disappointing. Thought that this was going to be much more spectacular. North Coast much more scenic. Lots of built up areas, interspersed with snippets of natural beauty.

Awersome!. This is a must excursion while visiting Sydney. I had no idea that the harbor, the beaches and the coastline was so stunning. Sydney CBD is great, but getting out to the water is IMO what Sydney is all about. The walk is stunning and not to be missed!

Couple hours well spent. You pass by some beautiful beaches on this easy hike from Coogee to Bondi. I kick myself for not wearing my swimsuit because it would have been really nice to jump in. There are a few places along the way to fill up your water bottle for free so one bottle is enough.

Great way to explore the beautiful coast. My friends and I got the bus to Coogee and then started on the coastal path and made our way up to Bondi. We all really enjoyed the walk and loved seeing all of the stunning beaches from different view points. We got some great pictures and the path itself was easy to walk around. Very enjoyable, would do it again.

Happening place. Bondi beach and that walk to coastline is very nice... you will see beach at one side and lot of restaurants at the other... It gives you feeling of miami... Good place to chill out in the evening...
Drop dead gorgeous!. Jaw dropping scenery all around you on this coastal walk. Before getting to Coogee is Tamarama Beach. It was perfect with swimmable waves, great cafe, and golden squishy sand.

Pick a nice day to experience iconic Sydney beaches at your own pace. We started at Bondi and made our way to Coogee, stopping in at the small beaches along the way. It is mostly an easy walk, some steeper sections but fine for people of moderate fitness, and plenty of opportunities to stop off along the way to take in the great views, or grab a drink at one of the beaches main strips. We travelled via bus to Bondi and back to the Sydney Central station from Coogee. The Pavilion at Coogee is worth a visit to take in a cool bevvie on the rooftop bar at the end of the walk, with views across the beach.

Daily Relax. the natural walk in this areas are the most relaxing moments that you can have in your daily life and also for tourist are coming to this place can enjoy of this more beautiful place can not be describe is just the best Coastal Walker.

Excellent Beach and Coastal Walk. I had been here last year in April, there is nothing new I could find about the beach and its as good as many other beaches I had been to but the coastal walk was really nice. Unfortunately, we had to return in between as we didn't find the walk safer for pregnant woman (as it started raining).There are plenty of restaurants in that area and shops. I really enjoyed the beach. I would love to visit it again someday. :)
Beautiful. Very enjoyable walk along the beautiful coast. Passing many beaches like Tamarama and Bronte.Takes about 1 hr 20 mins. There are a few climbs but it's worth it.
Fantastic!. We were lucky enough to take this walk in perfect weather! It is simple amazing. The coastal views are simple amazing!

Best views of the beach.. To be truthful, Bondi Beach may well be iconic in the eyes of surfers and Aussies, but for travellers from afar with an aversion to watersports the views along this coastal route afford the best entertainment. Whether idling with a beer (or two) in one of the bars along its route, watching energetic surfers and joggers alike or just marvelling at the rocks and seascape is a wonderful way to spend a few hours.No, it's not the most picturesque beach I have ever been to (by a long way), but this lovely and gentle little walk makes up for many of its failings. A definite must for any visitor to the area that doesn't want to get their feet wet.

Great coastal walk in Sydney!. Really enjoyed around 6 KMs walk in a sunny day! The beautiful Bondi Beach with tiny white sand, clear water and a sunny day, what a beautiful life it is! Along the whole way, you could really enjoy fresh air, wind from the sea and beautiful view. Also you could take a break during the way, there are some cafe at each bay provide fast food and beverage.

Stunning walk, worth the trek!. You will be crazy not to give this walk a go! Most people opt for the shorter walk Bondi to bronte which is very beautiful itself, however take the plunge and take the whole walk to Coogee. Stunning coastal views that everyone can enjoy. Go early in the day to avoid crowds and heat.

Fantastic beautiful weather in February. Me and the wife did the Bondi to Coogee walk on a beautiful day in February 2016. The crowds on the Bondi end can be a bit of a nuisance, but once off on the walk, it is beautiful. Gentle breeze, fantastic temperature, excellent views, and do not forget .... the public transport and restaurants and coffee shops at both ends of the walk (& along the way), mean you have total flexibility in when you start, end, and when & how you return home, or to your next destination. If you have some time, a really nice walk to do!

Great way to spend a day!. Did the whole walk and started at Coogee beach, dropped down into several beaches for a swim and ended our walk grabbing a drink at the Bondi athletic club with a beautiful view!
stunning water views. easy walking and great way to see what makes Australia so coolGood for locals, visitors and families.

Worth it for long walk. We walk for Sculpture for the sea. Children loves it. Just take lots of break for little foot, water to hydrate and good waterproof jacket as wind can be chilling. Yet enjoyable sceneries Despite windy weather, our boys love it especially with range of Bondi beach culinary

Great exercise and amazing views . Only downfall is that the pathway is busy especially on weekends but it is worth it for the views. Great exercise and stop as often as you want on benches for a rest or drink from the water bubblers along the way or stop at cafe or kiosk.

Best way to see Sydney. This walk takes you along the water from beach to beach. The views are spectacular and you visit tiny bays you will never find otherwise. It's an easy walk without too many ups downs (but that's a relative opinion) and easy to get to and from by public transport. You can even stop part way if you find its too much. It's also a popular walking/jogging track for locals.

Awesome. Can't think of a better way to start the day. The views of all the beautiful beaches in the Eastern suburbs are wonderful. If you want to run, jog, walk or stroll it's up to you. There are plenty of watering holes dotted along the way. If you are feeling hot and bothered you can swim in the sea, rock pool or swimming pool to cool down. There are quite a few steps along the way so not suitable for those with mobility problems. Great walk, got to be top of the 'free' things to do in the area.
A nice, gentle walk but gets busy!. Best enjoyed during the week as can get very crowded during the weekends. Take swim stuff so you can stop off along route and snorkel/cool off.

Great walk!. The cliff walk is a beautiful walk along the gorgeous coast. Start at Bondi near the Iceberg pool and walk along the pathway. Enjoy the views and the eroted rock formations. Have a stop at the amazing Tamarama Beach and then continue into Coogee.

Amazing Views and Beaches. A must do when you're in Sydney and want to experience as much as possible. Starting either at Coogee oder at Bondi Beach you will see 5 Beaches in total (Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly and Coogee).Better to do it on a day where it isn't that hot, since most of the walk is in the bare sun and there are a lots of steps :)

A beautiful walk that captures the delight of the amazing Ocean and beaches around Stdney. I always do this walk the first day I arrive in Sydney. Starting in Bondi and around Tamarama, it's truly spectacular with the gorgeous colours and the sheer power of the Ocean. There are normally surfers out and it's a great way to recover from a long flight. Worth taking a swim at Tamarama and having lunch at the nice beach Cafe there

Beautiful and cruisy. So glad I read about this on TA. It was gorgeous, to echo many other reviewers. It had some ups and downs (stairs), but it was easy. Considering how expensive Sydney can be, this is a (free!) gem not to be missed out on. Many beaches along the way, some with unique swimming and snorkeling options. Highly recommend doing this walk.
A must-do activity in Sydney!. I have done this walk many many times, it is just fantastic. The beautiful beaches in Sydney, the coastal cliffs and the sea breeze make the walk easy.

Excellent exercise. A great walk along the coast with spectacular sea views. Wise to wear trainers or comfortable footwear. Quite a bit of climbing up and down so you have to be reasonably fit to do it.

Great walk - not too taxing. I thought this would be like the Pembrokeshire coastal path but - although the scenery is similarly beautiful it couldn't be more different. It's paved all the way with toilets and snack bars round every corner. That being said, it's still a peaceful and enjoyable walk and you could probably even manage a push chair on it!
Best weekly scenic walk!. I walk this quite often. As a Sydney local, we really are such a lucky city to have amazing coastal walks like this so easily accessible
Gorgeous!. Stunning coastline. The walk wasn't at all difficult and there were great spots to grab something to eat or drink along the way..and of course, swim!

Nice, refreshing, picturesque views. I did this walk when summers just started and it wasn't that hot to burn your skin. I would say I had witnessed breath taking views while doing this walk. It was kind of delight for your eyes when you observe a new view after every turn during your walk. It's really worth it if you like walking on a track where you have sea accompanying you on one side.It may be little difficult for people with strollers but not impossible as there may be occasional stairs in between.If you get tired or want to take break in between, there will be intermediate beaches between Bondi to Coogee. You can stop at Bronte beach or Tamarama beach.

A SYDNEY MUST DO. This is a fantastic walk along the NSW coastline. I prefer to do it Coogee to Bondi, set out mid morning and arrive in Bondi in time for coffee or lunch. Mid morning mid week means you have escaped the weekend crowds and early morning joggers. Be prepared for a moderate level walk with stairways to negotiate. Apart from one small section of road between Coogee and Clovelly, most of the walk is a dedicated walking trail including a cliff hugging walkway in front of Waverley Cemetery. This cemetery is worth exploring for famous burial sites. On arrival at Bondi, you will be greeted by panoramic views across the famous beach. There are plenty of eateries in Bondi, some better than others, but one worth noting is Bondi Hall, 75-79 Hall Street on The RHS heading up the hill. Formerly a St Ali Sensory Lab it has recently changed hands. The same staff still make a great coffee but now also a great pastry and lunch menu at sensible prices.

Beautiful Scenery. A must see walk along the coast on your visit to Sydney. A long pleasant walk with many places to rest and bring your cossies for a swim. We also enjoyed "Sculptures by the Sea" , an extra treat for us. It is a free outdoor gallery.

Super walk. This is a location in Sydney you must try out, beautiful beach, friendly people overall spectacular place. Getting there is not that difficult if you have a Opel card, bus, train all works. Must do the whole walk through the beach, passing world famous Bondi Rescue station. Pubs and restaurants are all around so you could have a good time with your friends or family. Overall good site seeing location, relax in the beach have a chill beer and a plate of battered calamari. Enjoy! !

Absolute serenity . We caught a bus to Coogee and walked to Bondi instead but it was beautiful. I would highly recommend doing this walk even if you don't hike often. You can take it at your own pace, it took my partner and I (who hike often) an hour. You can swim at any of the beaches in between but we chose to swim at Bondi. Definitely a must do if you're visiting Sydney!

Beautiful views. This walk is a great way to get a little exercise into your vacation while taking in the incredible beach and coastal views and the personalities of the towns along the way. Grab a coffee after a walk or run along the walk - you'll be in very good company and have many places to choose from.

Perfect Sydney walk. Having done this walk several times I cannot recommend it enough to anyone who loves a stroll. It is an easy walk and unless you arrive very early or in the middle of the day you need to be prepared to share it with a few like minded people. The scenery as you leave the bustling noise of Bondi and pass the much photographed and famous 'Icebergs' swimming pool, is constantly stunning regardless of the weather conditions. Even as a Sydney sider I always come away realising just how fortunate I am to live close to such a beautiful coastline. Wether you want to run,jog or amble this path is acceptable and you wont be disappointed. Children love it. Go on put it on your list. It's free and the sun will warm your back and the smiles from people you pass will warm the experience along with the photo opportunities every step of the way.
Spectacular. Amazing views all along the coastal walk with beautiful beaches, which are much quieter than Bondi.Make sure you slip slap slop before the walk which can take a considerable time.
Did Coogee to Bondi - beautiful. Absolutely stunning beaches, there is a very clear boardwalk that takes you from one to the other. If you don't plan on stopping at the beaches, I'd allow 1.5-2hrs.

So good we did it twice. Fantastic. Put it at the top of your to do list. We enjoyed it so much we did it twice. Once from Bondi to Coogee and then Coogee to Bondi. Its a fair walk which is up and down steps and hills as you walk around the various bays but the scenery is spectacular and its great that they have water stations on route to fill up your water bottle or just take a drink. When you get to Gordons Bay it looks like its easy to avoid the steps and walk to the beach across the rocks. Trust me you need to be a mountain goat to do it and it took us nearly an hour to navigate and it invoved a fair amount of climbing. If you end up at Coogee go to the Pavilion for a beer. You have deserved it.

Speechless and beachless. An amazing special time to wonder along the coastline, especially when it is the sculptures season take a look and leisurely walk-not to mention the scenic views and watering places along the way.

Must do even for locals. Watch the sunrise, watch the sunset or frankly get those walking shoes on an experience the beauty of the coastline from Bondi to Coogee. Mirnkng is fewer people as is pre sunset. You can stop when you have had enough, have swim ( between the red and yellow flags at one of the beautiful patrolled beaches) and there are some super places along the way for a coffee, juice, beer or cocktail. It's a great walk.
Fabulous. magnificent views of the ocean on this lovely coastal walk well worth the effort the beach in congee is not as nice as bondi but that's not the reason for doing the walk

Beautiful walk. We, of course, picked the hottest day to try to walk the Bondi to Coogee Coastal walk but found the scenery spectacular. The water was crystal clear blue and the views as you rounded each corner were awesome. Take a water bottle with you - there are filling stations along the way. There is a very cool graveyard about three quarters of the way in to the walk that just sits peacefully on a huge hill overlooking the ocean. Although we didn't hike all the way to Coogee - my husband was too hot and crabby(!) - we walked most of the way and would definitely recommend this to others!

Great scenery. Didn't manage to complete the entire stretch as we set off late because of the scorching afternoon sun in early Feb. Only managed to reach the cemetery but I enjoyed the walk along good views of the coast and the few beaches that lie along this coastal walk. Could have been even better if not for the rushed timing as we have to walk to and fro so do allocate enough time for a leisurely walk as the distance is quite substantial.There are lots to see with some interesting rock formations along the way and of course, the timeless past time of people watching haha. Love seeing families on beach picnics with their super happy dogs, people playing beach volleyball etc.Definitely a walk I would love to complete if i have the chance to visit Sydney again.
Amazing. This is one route you can never tire from. I recommend walking from Coogee to Bondi. Enjoying lunch at Bondi beach and the walking Bondi to Coogee. That should make your fitbit happy.
Coast walk near the city .. Great walk to see the coast and close to the city , views of the beaches as you turn a corner what a surprise . our magnificent coast

One of my favorite walks in the world. Yes its a big call but this walk is so dramatic with so much to look at and enjoy...I keep going back...Its fun...its not that easy but make sure you walk both ways...smae walk 2 different views...and wear good shoes

A must do.. Fantastic views all along the route. It was very crowded when we went on 30th December but that was probably to be expected. It's suitable for everyone as there are so many places to stop at on route and enjoy the view.

Great way to enjoy the weekend and the sun. This walk is beautiful with scenic views and a great way to see some of the many beaches/bays in Sydney. At each beach there is a cafe and toilet if you need a rest stop and to catch a breath.

The best coastal walk in the best city. Sydney is a beautiful city, the best harbour in the world, amazing beaches on the North side, the East and the South. The coastal walk from Bondi to Coogee is simply spectacular. If you have never done this 'top 10' Sydney experience, then it's a must do. You will not be disappointed. If coming by car, parking can be difficult / expensive. Park away from Bondi and Coogee ..... some of the side streets, where you can find, with some patience, an unrestricted park.Enjoy :-)

Walkway enjoyed by all. I always love this walk - haven't done it for years and it was fabulous. Judging by number of other walkers, amblers and runners I'm not the only one. Clear beautiful skies coupled with lots of stop of points make it fun for everyone!
Walkies. This is a great walk. Exercise and walk at the same time. Breathtaking views and worth the walk. It's fantastic on any day bar rain. Can highly recommend.

Great Ocean Walk. This ocean walk is fantastic beautiful walk. This walk can also be shortened if so desired! I did Bronte to Bondi stretch of this walk 3 times during my first visit. I had the advantages of staying right in middle at Tamarama beach. The rocky cliffs followed by sandy over and over is simply awesone. Definitely a must do during Sydney visit.

One of Sydneys treasures. This is one of those must see walks I always recommend to friends and family when they visit. Superb view of all that makes Sydney one of the most beautiful cities I have ever been to.Plenty of places to stop, refresh and take in the view too.

Gorgeous views, smooth path. This is a great walk for most levels of fitness. Views are stunning, There are a good number of stairs, but path is paved and relatively gradual as to the incline. It took us about 4 hours which included lots of breaks to take in views, watch beach volleyball. There are lots of benches along the way. Bring water and wear good shoes. I did it in flip flops :(

The perfect walk. We have walked this path many times and each time there is some thing new to see it's about 5-6Kms to walk from Bondi joining the path at Icebergs and finishing at Coogee.With lots of places to stop for coffee or a bite to eat on the way we would recommend the Coogee Pavilion as the final stop great food and friendly atmosphere. Enjoy this walk at any time of the day but it's at its best in the evening with the sun setting over bay at Coogee.

Great walk. During a stay at Bondi Junction, my wife and I took the bus to Bondi beach, after having a coffee we set off on the Bondi to Coogee walk, and what a walk it is the views are brilliant and it is a very enjoyable walk all round, lots of things of interest on the way.

Great views, long walk. I heard this walk was 4K but it was probably 4 miles. It is a very lovely view, all the way to Coogee. There are 3 or 4 beaches in between, each is a little different than the others. If you are coming from downtown Sydney, I would suggest to take the train to Bondi Junction, then a local bus to Coogee Beach, then walk to Bondi Beach. Then hang out near/on Bondi Beach before heading back.

Beautiful Beautiful Beautiful . 6km of walk took us 4hrs, but worth it! We started the walk 2pm from Congee and finished it at about 6pm at Bondi beach. A lot of filter water spots and seats along the way. P.S. You may start at either end, and there are buses to/from city in both ends.
take a camera. great walk lots of photo opportunities wear a good pair of shoes & take a bottle of water, plenty of places to sit & rest along the way if needed.
A perfect day. A great walk.Bus to Coogee and then walk to Bondi and Watsons Bay. Ferry back to Circular Quay. What a great day out.
Great Walk. Beautiful walk along the coast line of Australia. Bring sturdy shoes as this walk is quite long. If it sunny bring sunscreen. Definitely one of the best attractions in Sydney.

Stunning walk. Great path with loads of benches to rest if needed. We did this during Sculptures by the Sea which is a fabulous experience. It was so crowded walking along the trail tho. I went back and walked another day to experience the beautiful serene outlook. It's a must do when in Sydney. So relaxing and an easy walk.
Crisp Walk. Great easy walk even for people who do not consider themselves fit, such a chilled out walk covering beautiful homes and beaches

Picturesque. It is a beautiful walk along the coast offering fantastic views. One can start right from the Bondi beach and further walk down to Coogee. There are many small beaches in between for taking lot of snaps. Again a must go when in Sydney

good place for swimming, hiking, wave surfing and view lovers. we made a walk around the bay on the special trail. watch the main entrance for the vessels to Sydney bay, big sand stones with nice variety shapes along the trial.
Nice View. I love it. We visited the place last week and it was awsome. the weather and the view was very nice!

Beautiful walk!. Such a beautiful walk!! Even going off the designated walk and along the rocks was wonderful. You will find little pools of water flowing in and we were able to take a nice break under some overhanging rocks and watching the more local side of things. Stunning views!! The walk non stop is about an hour, but as we stopped at several points to enjoy the view or cool off in the water, we spent about 4 hours doing it. Take LOTS of sunscreen and enjoy!!

Terrific walk. Great rock pools along the way not to be missed. We swam in every one along the way. Bronte and Colvelly were our favorites on this walk. Tamaramma was so nice and Gordons bay. You can't go to Sydney and not do this walk.

Beautiful Walk. Fantastic walk that can go as long as you want it to. There are water stations along the way, so just bring a small bottle to refill. You can also 'bail' at any point along the way to catch a bus or taxi back to where you started. There are plenty of restaurant options as well.

A COASTAL WALK. We set off from Bondi Beach to walk to Coogee. The walk took us along the cliff walk which was brilliant and quite an easy walk for the novice the bays on the way were breath taking t say the leat. Well worth the walk some 6 Kilometers average about 3 hours depending how many times you stop for refreshments etc.

Stunning views along the east coast of sydney. We started our walk from bondi beach and enjoyed every km of it. It seems very well looked after. You may experience some gorgeous lookouts and beaches as well.

One of the best walks in the world . If you're in the area... Don't even think about it - just do it! Seriously a walk of absolute beauty. If possible try to go out of season or on a weekday - summer weekends it can get very busy, especially when 'Sculptures By the Sea' is on (October). It's not too far, and despite a number of steep steps at various points, it's a reasonably easy walk - can be done in flip flops. Some people even jog the route. There are water fountains on the way and some lovely viewpoints... Take your camera! Personally, I think the best bit is up until Bronte. The onward walk to Coogee is still gorgeous though. On a hot day, you may want to wear swimmers underneath to go for a dip. Also there are cafes en route at the beaches. At Coogee you can get the bus back to Bondi if you want. Also you can walk it in reverse direction - just as gorgeous! :)

Great way to spend half a day. Even on a very windy day this walk is 5*. Most enjoyable with great views and good facilities along the path. Easy access from the middle of the city and a quick bus trip back from Coogee to the CBD. Highly recommended

Wonderful. I've been lucky to travel a lot to cities around the world. Sydney is without doubt one of the most beautiful and this walk along the seashore is absolutely stunning. Do not miss it on a visit to Sydney.

Good walk good views good hills for your heart. Really good walk from Bondi or in reverse. Open views out to see but well maintained paths. Pretty steep climb out of Clovelly and one other beach but worth it. Glorious views of all the beaches you pass. Tamarama in particular small but looks great. Clovelly good swimming. Quite a few drinks stops possible on the way but not at cemetery just after Bronte.

A wonderful way to see the coast. Enjoyed a beautiful walk along the famous beaches of Sydney and the rugged cliff tops and clean park in between. An easy way along a clear path to stroll and take pictures and stop off at your favourite beaches for a swim. There is great water bottle filling stations along the way so you can top up instead of getting dehydrated. A must do when visiting Sydney.

Highlight of our weekend. Lots to see, and some great views are to be had! Make sure to take plenty of sun screen and a hat! Great photo opportunities and the perfect way to spend an afternoon! Shall definitely take family when they visit later this year!

Nice Walk on a cool day. It's a nice walk, considering the weather is not too hot. Start at Bondi Beach, check the Iceberg Pool and then continue walking. There are amazing views of the open ocean and several beaches in the way, such as Tamarama, Bronte and Coogee.

Don't forget your mask. Easy to see why this is on so many "must do" lists. This is a wonderful, approximately 2 hour walk, that takes you past many beaches. It can of course be interrupted to sit/lie on one of the natural limestone ledges or at one of the perfectly positioned benches for viewing the spectacular coast and its swimmers and walkers; or to have a meal (I brought along fantastic fish and chips from The Chip Store at Bondi Beach); or to have a swim (in a pool or the ocean ) and snorkel- I snorkeled at Clovelly, (where incidentally you can also watch a game of bowls). Being a very good snorkeling site it was a little crowded but I wasn't disappointed. I ran out of time for hot baths at Coogee so can't comment but hear they are wonderful. You can catch a bus at Coogee that will take you to the train at Bondi Junction and back to the city.

Great free activity full of beautiful bays. See all the eastern beaches bat Maroubra in one walk. I would actually start in Coogee and finish in Bondi. See Coogee, Gordons Bay, Clovelly, Bronte, Tama, Mackenzie's bay and Bondi in one hit over two hours. Enjoy! Great free activity.

Easy, scenic, walk. Wonderful, scenic walk. Nice and easy, walk at your own pace. So many choices of restaurants, bars and coffee shops to relax after the walk at either end. If you want a stop off on the way there's always kiosks on the route. Can't recommend it enough.
rugged beauty. enjoy the beach, can be very rough. then walk the bronti beach walk. stop at the little restaurant above the pool and get 'harry's sandwhich'

A wonderful walk. I've done this walk about 15 times and always enjoy it. It is a must for any tourist who likes beaches. Both Coogee and Bondi are well served by public transport so its easy to get a busy to Coogee do the walk and get a bus back from Bondi or vice versa. There are beaches with cafes along the way to stop for a coffee, rest and people watching. It is very popular and does get crowded with locals on the weekend, so if you are able would recommend doing it during the week.
