Don't Miss the Rock Pools!. An excellent (and free!) way to spend a warm afternoon in Sydney: the walk itself is not terribly strenuous and covers some truly breathtaking scenery along the coastline. We stopped at each of the beaches beginning with Bondi and ending in Coogee, with quick public transit to and from the city on either end. There's a nice stretch of lunch places at Bronte beach to refuel mid-day.

Amazing views!. This walk is a 'must do'! We took a bus to Congee and walked north to Bondi - the views were outstanding! It's a longer walk with steps and steep hills, so be prepared. There is water fountains to refill water bottles along the way.

Gorgeous walk - as long as you make it. This beautiful walk starting at Bondi follows the coast along a couple of beaches. It's absolutely gorgeous, and one of the places I remember most from my trip. I loved seeing the plant life and the open vastness of the gorgeous Pacific ocean.

Fabulous!. This is a great walk and doesn't require a high level of fitness.
There are other beaches where you can stop along the way for refreshments.
You will need your good walking shoes, a hat, sunscreen and a bottle of water each.
One of my favourite things to do in Sydney - the great outdoors with spectacular views.
pleasant surprise. what a great walk didnt know what to expect but the views were fantastic my best bit of the trip to bondi

Beautuful walk . If you have a spare few hours on a sunny day this walk is absolutly lovely. Bring your swimmers so you can stop of for a dip to cool off as you go along.
When yoy get to Coogee yoy can chill on the lovely beach or have a drink / snack at some nice restaurants and bars.

Great afternoon walk!. The walk was quite straight forward with plenty of spots along to way to stop and enjoy the view and get a few photos in. Can be a difficult walk for people who are not used to stairs and slight slopes. Finishes off St Coogee with an option to keep walking but Coogee was a good place for food options afterwards. Definitely one of the better ways to see the iconic beaches of Sydney in one go.

Magnificent views - Great Beaches - Breathtaking Views. A gorgeous 7 km long walk featuring absolute breathtaking views, beaches, parks, cliffs, bays and rock pools. It's a must whether you're visiting Sydney or living in Sydney.

Not to be missed!. The walk from Bondi to Coogee takes quite a while (because you'll want to make frequent photo stops) but it is absolutely worth it, since it passes through some of the most stunning coastal scenery in Australia. The first part, from Bondi to Bronte, is a very easy walk, but it becomes more strenuous the closer you get to Coogee as there's a bit of an uphill climb and quite a few steps towards the end. The advantage, however, is that you can then reward yourself with a cold drink and a lovely relaxing lunch at the Coogee Pavilion.

Stunningly majestic . The phrase "must see" or "must do" is a cliché, but this walk truly is one as it has so many beautiful views, is relatively short (can be done in just a few hours), and has many great diversions along the way if time permits. I highly recommend the Clovelly Bowling and Rec Club along the path in Clovelly. Trying a new game was a lot of fun, the staff were very friendly and helpful providing a primer of the rules, and the opportunity to throw a few balls while enjoying a beer with the beaches and the South Pacific at one's back certainly blew this born and raised Midwesterner away. Take the time to leave the city and head east to the coast for a third or half day for this gorgeous walk.

A memorable walk (with a few stairs)...spectacular views all along the way!!. Bondi Beach walk to Coogee Beach is a wonderful sensory experience. The surf and surfers, the rocky windswept cliffs, the beautiful flowers and plants spilling down the cliffs, and the white sand beaches make this a perfect outing. It is an easy train ride from the Sydney Central station and a change onto a bus for a 15 minute bus ride through some interesting neighborhoods.I wouldn't recommend trying to push a stroller because of the many steps and the uneven path surface but my 73 year old husband and I thoroughly enjoyed the walk. There are numerous spots to sit and enjoy the view...and many water fountains with a side tap to refill your water bottles courtesy, I assume, of the local municipality.My advice: Don't miss this!!If you are interested in history, be sure to walk around the Waverly Cemetary, along the way.

Amazing walk in Oz. Did this walk several times during our stay. Each time different with weather and surf down below. Path safe many people to pass and say hello. Unbelievable scenery and a must to do while here.

Pinch me, I'm falling in love with Bondi. Rain, shine, who cares. You're in Australia. You're at Bondi Beach.It is glorious. This is not a flat walk. Be in good shape or just do a little of the walk. I enjoyed every moment. The breezes, splashing waves, happy beach people, smells, energy, hillsides, views..............so marvelously gorgeous. Walk it once. Walk it many times, you'll never tire of the views.
Beautiful costal walk. This is definitely a must do when visiting Sydney. If you're lucky to come in October, check out sculptures by the sea along the walk. It is a quite unique experience.
Great walk - great beaches. Great walk - great beaches - fairly easy walk with a few steep steps but suitable for all - Coogee Beach Pavillion a must for a drink after !
Amazing!. The trail is about 6km long with stunning views, beautiful beaches, parks, cliffs, and rock pools. It is amazing. A real must do.

Coastal Experience. 14km return trip or 7km one way from Coogee to Bondi. Finish in either location for a well deserved meal & beverage or take a day & stop along the way enjoying the café experience at any one of the great beaches. the path is cemented & whilst there are stairs at Clovelly take your time & it wont be an overwhelming energy drainer

Go early and catch the sunrise. This is a really crowded and popular walk/joggers' route. There are literally hundreds of joggers every day. If you go early you not only are able to beat the rush but may see some on the most spectacular sunrises around. Don't be put off if it is not clear, the coastal walk will surprise you no matter the weather. In fact there are less people so you may enjoy it more.

To do. A lovely walk through the most beautiful of Sydney's beaches. Each beach has its own personality, great view points of waves, surfers doing their thing, refreshment spots plus the areas amazing seafront properties to lust over. We stopped for a swim in Bronte's brilliant swimming pool in the rocks, good shade cover above for hotter times of the day. Also a great way to get over groggy jet lag with a gently challenging sunny stroll.

A must!. Classic coastal walk which is featured on oh-so-many pictures from visitors all over the globe. A real must if you're in Sydney, the best views in town. Takes a few hours to do (especially if you stop and take pictures) and is best to do in early morning, when only the local fitness people are out running and power walking their way to a healthy life. Can be quite busy during weekends but it's a long walk so it can never really get full. Plenty of water refill stations along the way so bring a small water bottle (can get really hot when the sun is out), don't forget sunscreen!
Beautiful. Be sure to take your swim suit to swim in the big pool filled with ocean water. Lots to do in Bondi. By a bus pass and you can travel all over Sydney, even the ferries.

NOT TO BE MISSED. This walk is very scenic. Make sure you check out the ocean rock pool at the Northern end of Coogee Beach either take a dip yourself or enjoy watching the swimmers enjoying the fun. Many nice places also to get good coffee in Coogee.

Love this walk. Beautiful and serene, great for a stroll or a full power walk or run. No bikes allowed which is great. Not great for prams or wheelchairs etc as a fair few stairs. The dogs love it and there's a couple of off leash parks along the way.

Nice hike.. Great views... If you want to combine hiking and swimming,, this is a great choice.. You start behind the Yacht club and just follow the path. Remember there is a cafe with cold beer at the other end.

A MUST DO AND SEE IN SYDNEY. This walk is a must whilst living or visiting Sydney. The ocean views are magnificient. The whales can be seen migrating in season. So bring your hats, water bottles in summer although there are plenty of public water outlets along the way. Don't forget to call into the Clovelly Bowling Club for a cold drink or two or even book in for a game of barefoot bowls. The "best" bowling club in the eastern suburbs.

Amazing walk, best I have done in Sydney views spectacular. This is a great walk, not for people with sore legs, good trainers needed, did see a few with thongs though. You can stop and many a point, take water with you, with a hat on a sunny day, a backpack with swimmers would be a good thing! just lovely
beach. All this coastwalk is great to walk. The water is super and my surprise was the people ...they were so friendly and helpful to give you a direction or helping find your way.
5 star coastal walk. 5 star coastal walk. This is a really great walk and I highly recommend walking at least some if not all.

Stunning scenes. A brilliant walk if you have a few hours in the area. I'd recommend planning it carefully though as I don't imagine it being very fun in extreme heat or wind. We had a lot of wind which made the experience a lot harder but would have been amazing with the right weather.One of the best things to do in Sydney for sure and brilliant photo ops.

Beautiful, easy walk. My friends and I used to do this walk quite regularly when I lived in Sydney. The views are fabulous. We would often stop along the way t take pictures. The walk is quite easy and takes about an hour.

A beautiful "must do". We had enough of the crowds and headed out on the 373 bus to Coogee. We got watered up and then walked the 6km to Bondi. Stunning scenery all the way around and we especially liked Bronte beach. 2 hours at leisurely pace. It really is a "must do"

Coast, Coastal homes & Coastal Crowds-summer walk on show!. This walk is a must to view spectacular Australian coast & beaches and the lucky people who live and relax in the suburbs between Coogee & Bondi and beyond.There are many places to stop, swim, relax, eat & enjoy the views. The walk is along a excellent path and is very crowded in summer. There are water drinking/filling stations along the track and at some popular beaches are cafe's/shops-nearby. The walk takes about a easy 1.5 hours. Don't forget the towel, swimmers, sunscreen and a hat. Enjoy a must do walking activity for all ages on the most expensive and most beautiful part of NSW, Australia.
Best walk in Sydney. Great way to get your exercise happening and see our amazing coastline and surf beaches and stop at a cafe for breakfast or lunch
A tourist must.. Starting at Bondi beach walking past the iconic Icebergs pool, then taking in Tamarama, Bronte and cemetery. This is a lovely walk the can also been done as a round trip.

A must do when in Sydney. Start with a coffee at the Iceberg pool and end with a wave jumping session on Coogee beach. Use Opel card to travel by bus both ways. The views are just amazing. Walk should take around 90 to 100 minutes. Be warned though, the fit tanned specimens running past you will make you very jealous!

Best walk ever!. Took us 2 and a half hours to walk, stopping off at all the beaches on the way and taking in the scenery. We would never had seen all the sites if we haven't of done this walk. One of the best things we done in Sydney.

Walk of life. The walk from one beach to another was great and really beautiful, the views are breathtaking and so peaceful, the beaches are clean and well taken care of,the friendly people who greet you along the way makes you feel so welcomed and safe..take the walk and you will love every step you make...

A must for any visitor. This is a must do on any visit to Sydney to walk from the crowds threw Bondi gazing at the crowds and people watching then start walking this amazing breathtaking walk.Along you will see aboriginal rock carving between Bondi to Bronte.Awazing and awesome scenery all along spectacular beaches.with great little places to stop and have lunch coffee or wine .Have a swim then walk back if you have the energy or have lunch at The Pavillion at Coogee.
good fitness, relaxing scenic - hard walking. Fantastic sea views, pretty safe walking track but very hard on anyone with knee problems. Needs to be done in cooler part of day.

The Best. Best of the best. I have nothing to say about theis walk as I'm speechless. It's the most beautiful walk you can ever do. The beautiful coffee shop in Tamarama beach it's very relaxing and enjoyable.

A truely great walk - a Sydney experience. Just love this walk. It has something for everyone. Whether you want a really long hike or a short stroll, this walk is perfect. Make sure to walk at least once during the whale migration season and enjoy the beauty of Sydney beaches!

A spectacular coastal walk. The Bondi to Coogee walk can only be described as spectacular and one of the world's best scenic attractions. The walk grade is medium in general. Parts are easy, others difficult with steps. There are no toilets or shops available, so prepare beforehand. The coastal seascape is always changing, good or bad weather, it is always photogenic. The area is frequently used by the fitness set, so try to keep to the edge of the path to avoid collisions, partic, early morning or night. Each end has excellent transport and my favourite, a gelato shop ,on the beach at Coogee. I take an hour to do this , dawdling and looking at the scenery. A memorable deviation on any travellers list.

Enjoyable experience every time. A great and enjoyable walk or run if you are feeling energetic. The views range from good to breathtaking and there are plenty of places to stop and appreciate the scenary. Which ever end you finish your walk at, there are plenty of places to sit for lunch and enjoy a beer or glass of wine.
Perfect Sydney walk. Go anytime but especially when Sculpture by the Sea is on in October/November. Glorious scenery and exciting art - everyone loves it.
Best walk ever. Wonderful scenic exhilarating walk with a great restaurant at Coogee to eat at the end. Lots of very friendly also doing the walk to chat with.

Walk/run. A must do while in Sydney. The most beautiful walk/run. Great for couples, singles, and maybe families with older children..
Great stops on the way include cafe at tamarama or bronte or maybe wait to the end and go to the fab Coogee Pavillon for lunch or a drink and views upstairs

Great scenic walk. We had coffee and breakfast at Bondi and then walked at our own pace- stopping at the beaches along the way. The walk was easy with a few stairs, but nothing too strenuous. The views were amazing- with water fountains along the track. Had a beautiful lunch at Coogee before catching a bus back to Circular Quay. Second time we've done the walk and highly recommend it.
A must do for visitors to Sydney. Beautiful and majestic. A lovely walk suitable for most people. Level of difficulty depends on how fast you walk. Not suitable for prams or wheelchairs.

Spectacular views, invogorating walk and good coffee on the way. I am a Sydney resident and love this walk. We try to take overseas friends to see Sydney at its best - and this is always a highlight. We usually walk from the south to the north (ie start at Coogee or Bronte and head to Tamarama then the spectacular vista of overlooking Bondi Beach. There is excellent coffee and meals to be had in a variety of cafes on the way. We usually choose one of the many at Bronte.Of course, the Sculpture by the Sea exhibition each November adds to the wonder of the walk with its around 100 huge to small fascinating sculptures from all over the world elegantly placed in open parkland, on the beach and in niches and ledges along the track from Tamarama to Bondi. If it's a sunny day, the sparkle on the water adds to the wonder of the view. But REMEMBER, the sun is fierce in Australia and hats, water and sunscreen are essential.

Stunning views and easy walk. The Bondi to Coogee Beach coastal walk should be on every visitor to Sydneys must do list. It's a relatively easy walk along a paved path but be warned there are some stairs involved. The views are fantastic and there are plenty of spots to either take a break or go for a swim. In October sees the Sculpture by the Sea Exhibition (a free event!) from Bondi to Tamarrama. When you get to Coogee there are many restaurtants and cafes and busses back to the city or Bondi Junction.

A must when visiting Sydney. Any time of the day or nightA beautiful walk through this amazing part of the world is recommended for everyone! Visiting or just want an adventure head to Coogee or Bondi for the brilliant walk I have done it during a full moon which is the best! Lights up the local cemetery which can be a bit creepy though an amazing experience.

Fabulous walk. Wonderful vistas, exceptional when the sculptures are on, can be busy but that only adds to it for me and at the end of the walk you have the icebergs club for a brilliant lunch, couldn't ask for more.
Choose day . Lovely walk with the Tasman sea for company. Can be uncomfortable with strong off shore wind. Takes 1 to 2 hours at a leisurely pace.

Beautiful coastal walk. The coast in this area is spectacular!
The walk is pretty easy and you will encounter a lot of runners and fitness junkeys along the way.
You will also pass beautiful beaches (Tamarama is my favourite) and see the colours of the sea.
Take enough time and photos and enjoy.
Best to do with clear skies or at sunset.

Walk the Edge of the Ocean. My girlfriends and I take this walk often. It is about 16km there and back, or you can join the track at other places along the way, such as Clovelly, or Tamarama (for a much shorter walk). Some good tips are: Try to avoid weekends, there are far fewer people on the trail on weekdays; park your car in Coogee to walk to Bondi and back, the parking in Bondi is very limited. The walk is especially rewarding when Sculptures By The Sea is on, (during November I think), as the whole trail is dotted with entries for this exhibition of amazing talent from around the world.
Perfect!. An amazing walk! With a bunch of fantastic photo opportunities. You experience the "tourist" beach of sydney and the "local" beach, both fantastic but different.
Breathtaking!. If your planning a trip to Sydney then you have to make this walk apart of it! I have walked it a million times and will never get bored! Its truely stunning!

Picturesque Coastal Walk. The Bondi to Coogee is a great seaside walk. The track is easy to follow and you get some fantastic views of the coastline along the walk. Stop of at Bronte for a coffee and muffin at one of the many cafes beach side. Well worth the effort, particularly for overseas visitors. You can even have a swim at one of the beaches along the way as a reward for your efforts.
Coastal walk. One of the best walks you will ever doEven better if you can go from bondi all the way to clovelly ( going past tamarama and bronte)

Stunning way to show off our city. A lovely relaxing walk that shows the classic beauty of Australia's east coast. It is easy to moderate, lots of opportunities for a swim or a rest in a cafe. Summer mornings or Autumn/Spring afternoons are best. If you're visiting Sydney this is a must - and its free:)
Unbelievable views. This can be quite strenuous if done at a quick pace or you can take it leisurely. Best done early to mid morning as it can get very hot. The views are amazing.

A must do experience in Sydney. I'm a local but still find the walk fascinating. Firstly, you don't really have to walk all the way from Bondi to Coogee. The walk passes through the best eastern beaches of Sydney, Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly, together with places such as Macenzies and Gordon's Bay so you might just make the walk from Bondi to Tamarama, or, from Coogee to Clovelly. If you are looking to make a day of it I would start out with Breakfast at Bondi at any one of the cafes along Campbell Pde, have a swim at any of the beaches on the way or in the ocean pool at Clovelly and finish with lunch at any of the cafes in Coogee Bay Rd or in The Pavilion which is the local pub on the beach in Coogee. And if you have come from the city just jump on the 373 bus and enjoy the trip back to Circular Quay.

Bondi to Coogee Walk . This walk is a very easy stroll along passed some of Sydney's iconic beaches.Bondi,Tamarama,Bronte,Clovelly and finishing at Coogee.You can do it leisurely or more strenuously.It's up to you but it's very good

Beachside Stepping Bonanza. We've done the walk several times (having the good fortune to live in Sydney) - each time we've done it we've had an exceptional time. However, I should note that we always do the walk in the opposite direction (Coogee to Bondi)... I'll explain why in a moment).The views are wonderful (which, admittedly, we can sometimes take for granted) and the solitude you find on great swathes of the path make enjoying them that much more magical. The walk is not a difficult one for anyone with even a semblance of fitness - however rather than see it as a race I'd suggest making an afternoon of it and stopping off at some of the fantastic cafes and bars along the way - each enclave has its own 'flavour and flair' and, if you're up for it some friendly locals who'll be happy to have a chat. If you really want to make an occasion of it - pack along some fancy footwear and, once the schlep is over, pop into Icebergs for a phenomenal degustation - which you've certainly worked up an appetite for. (Yes, this is why we flip the walk around - its well worth it!!)

The rocks, the ocean, the breeze, the windy track, yes you're on Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk!. Living in Sydney and walking this track countless of times I can say it's one of the best activities to enjoy Sydney's beautiful weather, uninterrupted ocean view and a decent exercise at the same time if you're into it. So do yourself a favor and try it!

A Sydney MUST!. If you're visiting Sydney and only have a day. Do this walk. One of the best walks in Sydney and can be easily accessed via public transport. Either start at Bondi or Coogee. Either option works. There are a quite a few stairs so can be a bit of a challenge, but essentially you can walk at your leisure if needed. Plenty of places to stop and get your breath, or have a swim at many of the beaches along the way. Bring a hot, sunscreen and some water (although free water stations are along the way) as some smaller cafes.If you finish in Bondi, stop off at the Bucket List for a few beers and watch the sun go down. A bit of a warning - can be busy at peak times with walkers and runners - so off peek can work best.

The BEST costal walk around!. We always do it Sunday mornings, beautiful way to start Sunday. We start at Coogee, end up at Bronte - have brunch then walk back to Coogee. Takes about 2 hours and is a great way to get fresh air plus some sunshine.

Beautiful blues. A lovely non-challenging walk for anyone who wants to view the beautiful beaches of Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly and Coogee. This walk does get quite busy so I don't recommend it for a run, unfortunately. There are some steps along the way but these are not too challenging.

Stunning coast walk, beautiful views. Fantastic walk and either way you do it you can have coffee/ lunch/drink to celebrate! It is a stunning coast walk, with amazing views of the sea and beaches along the path. Do it on your own or with groups.. Lots of places to stop and admire the view and take in a few breaths..

Love this walk. This is a beautiful short-medium distance walk which is immensely popular because of the scenic views and lively atmosphere. Lots of food options at both ends and in between. Parking can be a challenge so best to take the bus in and out.

Best stroll in sydney. This is a awesome stroll from iconic Bondi Beach to Coogee via Tamarama. I have done this walk on many times and have never been disappointed, great ocean views and many interesting stops to rest up and take it all in.

Views from every vantage point.. We started with a refreshing swim at Coogee Beach Walking the coastal trail towards Bronte & Bondi requires a reasonable level of fitness . The paths are undulating & steep over  boardwalks, up & down steps & onto spectacular headlands.Overlooking the ocean from high points & down into quiet bays. Where fishing dingies lay on racks.Arriving at Bronte after a 90 minute walk called for another swim in protected waters. The 440 bus from Bronte took us back to central Sydney.

Beautiful scenery. This is a must for anyone visiting Sydney. The walk is not difficult. The only hazards are the runners- and getting out of their way. If you are fortunate you can see whales in the distance. It's a good idea to have water and wear a hat . It gets hot!

Coastal walk fun for whole family. We took the coast walk between Bondi to Coogee . Great exercise for the family , children over 7 advised . On a sunny day the views along the way are gorgeous. And you can have a swim at one of the beaches as you go. When you get to Coogee . Reward yourself with a cold beer or juice at Coogee Pavllion. Family friendly and relaxing watering hole .
What a view!!!. Nowhere in the world you can walk along the most beautiful coast line, breathing fresh air with a taste of salt on your lips.

everyone should do it !. This is one of the best walks you will ever do ! We have done it many times (couple in our 60's ) and just love it, any time of the year is a good time .Lots of seats along the way and water stations too. Whenever we have visitors its always a must !

The most amazing coastal walk in Sydney? I think so.. I had heard a number of friends chat about the Bondi to Coogee Coastal walk, and couldn't understand what the fuss was about... until I did the walk with my friend. On a pleasant morning I can imagine a better way to start the day, fresh air, amazing scenery and a gentle walk from one of Sydney's most famous beaches. My favourite beach though is Tamara. Enjoy.

Coogee to Bondi and back. We did this walk the other day and started at sunrise. Lots of joggers and runners, but other then that: beautiful vistas of the Ocean especially when the sun is about to come up. Lots of photographers to capture the sunrise.

Beautiful Walk!. Stunning costal walk! Took about 2.5 hours to complete. We opted to start at Coogee and head towards Bondi so we could finish right at Bondi Beach. Path is well maintained! Definitely bring a hat, sunscreen and a water bottle along (there are a few fountains along the way to refill).Definitely a must do in Sydney!

Beautiful walk past Sydney's inconic beaches. We did the Bondi to Bronte walk. It was beautiful and relatively easy walk. A lot of people there when we went (New Year's Day) but stunning none the less. A must do for locals and visitors alike.Hot tip: bring a water bottle, hat and sunblock, not much shade along the way. Also, try to avoid peak time to avoid the hoards of people

So beautiful it didn't feel like exercise!. This was a great way to get over jetlag, lovely views of the beaches, sunshine and fresh air. I recommend taking a bottle of water along that you can refill at various water fountains since you will break a sweat!

Long walk. The walk was longer than I thought it would be, about 6 miles. But, it was definitely worth it. You can see some great coastline and several different beaches. There are commerical areas at both ends--Bondi and Congee, but not much in between.

Don't stop at Bronte!. So many people just do Bondi to Bronte - what a waste! Head all the way to Coogee, Not only do the sights get better, but the Coogee Pavillion is at the other end and their pizza is off it's chops stellar!

Refreshing Walk. If you want to see some of the most refreshing and beautiful coast line of Sydney harbour, then this is one of the walks you must do. You can wither do it one way and have breakfast or lunch there, & then catch a b us back or walk both ways & then have lunch upon your return. Or eat at both ends as there are plenty of little cafe to stop at
Dont miss. This was a wonderful little track.Requires little or no effort just a beautiful stroll.Great us of time

Postcard Perfect. Absolutely Stunning. Easily one of my favourite walks in Sydney. I did a return walk and that took me 2.5hrs. Coogee to Bondi was a leisurely slow paced walk, Bondi to Coogee was a medium paced walk. Definitely recommend a hat, sunnies, bag pack and a litre of water. When it's hot, it's freaking HOT!

Amazing ealk. I am so glad we did this! Amazing views and well worth the effort! We are of average fitness and our family of four all managed it! The swim at Coogee that awaited us was the best I have ever had! We were glad we started the walk @7.30am before it got too hot! Lots of drinking fountains along the way.

What a view . Went to bondi to coogee coastal walk amazing view stopped at coogee for refreshments caught in thunderstorm on way walk jogged last 5k in roasting rain this is a must see for any walker or jogger
Beautiful walk. Lovely walk with some gorgeous views. Definitely worth the trek, be sure to take your time and enjoy it.
wonderful vistas. walked from coogee to bondi took an hour and a half but what stunning views and a cemetery to die for (visually that is )

Mobbed. We walked from Bondi to Bronte on a Sunday afternoon, with our 6 and 8 year olds. Stunning coastline, a few steps to climb, it was really busy, at times a bit more like walking along a pavement at a busy shopping area than a coastal walk!
Good for exercise and relaxation. Great coastal walk with peaceful view of the wonderful ocean and the cool breeze fromthe wind. Loce nature, just take the walk
Great coastal walk. As a Sydney-sider, this is one attraction that I always take my guests to experience. The walk provides a great perspective on what it means to live in this wonderful city.
Spectacular on a sunny day. Don't rush the walk. It is amazing, with a lot of photo ops and hop-in-the-ocean ops! Don't forget your sunblock.
Lovely Walk. Its a lovely walk along a beautiful coastline and should not be missed. You need about 4 hours to it properly. Bring your camera as the views are great

Must do for first time visitors to Sydney. I have done this walk more times than I can remember and whenever I go back to Sydney I always try and squeeze it in. Even better now they have revamped the Coogee pavilion, so you can enjoy a well deserved drink at the end.Coogee hotel is currently doing 2 for 1 meals on Monday nights, when I last did the walk and food was exceptional value and of high quality, especially the steaks and the lamb.Only $30 taxi back to central Sydney afterwards.
tough walk many many stairs but scenery is lovely. lots and lots of stairs both up and down. We were doing it it was a little overcast thank goodness as I would have struggled on a really hot day.
A beautftul scenic walk to take visitors to Sydney!. This foreshore walk really takes in the most lovely features of the Sydney ocean views, well worthwhile.

Very popular walk.. As part of our stay in Australia our daughter took us on the bondi to congee beach coastal walk.This is a great walk taking in some fantastic scenery.If you like scenic walks this is well worth doing.
Great walk. This is a must do in sydney. Great walk And fairly easy on a nice day. Take a bottle of water. Enjoy the scenery and see what makes sydney great.

Gorgeous views, but longer than anticipated + VERY windy. We took the bus from Circular Quay to Bondi Beach and then walked to Coogee Beach. The hike was gorgeous - blue skies, flowers blooming, and waves crashing on dramatic rock formations. The trail is paved and has gentle rolling hills and some stairs. The day we went was VERY windy (like lean into it strong). It is a 3.5 mile walk, but definitely seemed a lot longer (it winds in and out of all these coastline "fingers" with little seaside towns. Bring water - there are a couple places to get a drink or ice cream along the way - and wear comfortable shoes.

Great views and lovely walk but quite busy. Great walk to explore the coast line and stop at the beaches on the way. It is quite a challenging walk with steep hills but there are good paths. It is definitely a must do if you go as get to see all of the different beaches and choose your favourite!

Great first thing in the morning. Great walk with amazing water views to match. However, you will need to go uber early if you don't like crowds as it can get pretty busy! You can also walk your dog here! After you do the round trip - take a dip at bondi!

Lovely coastal walk. This is a lovely coastal walk which is not too long and you can stop at many places for refreshments.It can be done in either direction and then you could get a bus back.We started in Sydney with a bus to Coogee and a coffee at the lovely pavilion. It is a fairly easy walk with some steps and inclines. Beautiful views and scenery interesting historical features such as the old cemetery. Bondi beach was not as lovely as I had thought but some development seems to be in progress . Views of the Cliffs good.

Walk with the pram. I love the coastal walk. Did it so many times, but without the pram. Very nice views and beaches along the way. If you want to bring your pram along make sure you bring a foldable one or ask someone to help you carrying it up and down for you. Lots of steps.

Wonderful walk. This is a stunningly beautiful walk from beach town to beach town. Each beach is a great destination by itself, often with changing rooms, drinking fountains, fresh water showers, places in the shade, free salt water swimming pools if you feel like swimming laps etc etc.Sydney has a first class bus system, and it was easy to take a bus from the city to Bondi beach. And no matter what beach you end up at it is easy to get a bus back to the city.I would definitely recommend a broad rimmed hat and lots of sunscreen. One water bottle is probably enough because there are so many public drinking fountains along the way. We walked from Bondi to Coogee on a 75 degree late summer day, and by the time we reached Coogee we were pretty cooked. But then we had a wonderful meal in a cafe overlooking a park near the ocean, and had a nice swim before taking a bus back to the city

A must whether visiting or living.......The Dream!. This truly is a must when in Sydney! I never tire of this walk whether I walk part or all; the scenery and people watching outstanding AND free!It'll take you a couple of hours but you can make 'pit stops' along the way, stopping off to have a dip or a cheeky coffee at Tamarama or Bronte. Or stop to have a workout on the equipment supplied by the council!Enjoy!

beautiful walk. It is a very easy walk but worth seeing. You can do it with flip flops despite how some people say it is a hike. In December it gets really hot, so make sure you have plenty of water and wear sunscreen

Best Outdoor Experience Beside Sydney city-Family must try!. We know the trekking on high altitude of Tibet is tough with probable snow mountains or light-green grass in summer, but here the hiking from Bondi to Coogee gives you amazing experience. You can have closer tough to the sea waters, enjoy the playing the sand on the beaches, and the swimming there is just so nice. The scenery is FANTASTIC. If you have young kids, you need to try to offer them the tough walking experience, to refresh your life and strenth your travel value. It is a MUST DO Experience, at least you should have more than 7 nights as some hotels will give you special price if you stay over 7 nights, and to explore Sydney, 7-10 day are not even long enough, frankly speaking. We would love to come again, trust me!
Great views. A great walk and a better views- but make sure you go on a sunny day. Also make sure you wear proper walking shoes, I wore sandals!

stunning coastal walk. If you have the time, slip over to Bondi and walk along the coast to the south and head to the beautiful cliffs and beaches along this area... stop for an ice cream to admire the view.. great family activity.

Must do. . World class collection of beaches so close to the city! The walk offered great views and many opportunities to hang out at large and small beaches. The walk is a bit long and hilly, if you're not used to or don't want walk a bit.

A long, easy, wonderful walk. Did the Coogee to Bondi (South to North) route so we can spend the rest of the day in Bondi. We did it the day after Australia Day so there were only a handful people mostly locals walking their dogs or exercising. It's only when we got to Bronte that we met, who we assume were tourists, because like us they were covered up and had backpacks.On the day we walked, it was cloudy. There is a clear footpath and a few stairs and we did the entire walk for 2H and 20 minutes taking time to take pictures, sit on the bench and finish off our breakfast. There are water fountains along the way.Coogee is a nice beach. I liked Clovelly where you can swim laps on the ocean across the two ends of the concrete sides. It seems safe because you're within that bay. There seems to be a lot of seaweeds by the beach though. Bronte was bigger than I imagined. Tamarama also looks nice. This is where we stopped to finish off our breakfast. And Bondi, well, it is what I expected. Thankfully, there were not a lot of people and there were flags up. But, we still didn't go into the water as we felt chilly. We came back on the weekend though for the hubby to run Bondi-Bronte-Bondi. He said there were a lot of people. And we did swim this time and enjoyed the water.Showers and toilets are at Bondi Pavilion and are free. Lockers available for a price.I watch Bondi Rescue which introduced me to Bondi and the other beaches. I was thrilled to see the lifeguards and kinda sad that there were no rescues while we were there and see them in action. The show actually made me scared to go into the water because of the rips. And it was also the reason why me and the hubby didn't go into the water together because someone might steal our bags (it doesn't happen often). Most people though just leave their stuff and go dive into the water.

Worth the walk. Awsame. We had a really good time. The view is fantastic and the wather is warm.
Child friendly and very secure as well
A beautiful little hike.. Definitely do the Bondi to Coogee walk when you're visiting Bondi. It's a very easy hike on a paved path and the views are stunning.

Beautiful walk!. This walk represents, to me, how beautiful Sydney is. We walked from Coogee to Bondi, enjoying the stunning and picturesque views of the coastline at different points, the beaches and the rockpools (Coogee's rock pool is so pretty!). It took us 1.5 hours at a moderate walking pace.Definitely a must-do activity if you're one who likes the outdoors, hiking or jogging.

Gorgeous. We walked from Bronte to Bondi. There are a few steps. We had a stroller and a 4 year old on a bike which made it a bit harder than usual but the views were beautiful. The path is very busy. We did go on a weekend though. I did think I would like to run it one day but the foot traffic would make it pretty hard to do so I would think.

No better way of stepping out and catching a sea breeze. Locals during the week - busy on the weekend with people from all over. Good Cafes at either end. Trekked this route many times - its never boring! Dolphins, whales, seals and that's just the sea life. Wear sunscreen and sunnies if you are on the path after 9am those UV rays are strong bouncing off the water .
Amazing walk along the coast. Would absolutely recommend doing this walk. We actually went coogee to bondi to be different. Either definitely tick this off your list!

Get up and go early to avoid the summer crowds. Start at either the Coogee or Bondi end, or begin or end in Bronte and enjoy one of the many excellent cafes on Bronte Road. The walk is well served by buses and beats driving around looking for a park. Excellent for whale watching in spring, very crowded during Sculpture by the Sea.
Loved the costal walk to Bondi. My brother recommended me to do this walk. It was amazing, the landscapes are really beautiful. You walk by a lot of nice bays as well.

Great views. I did the coastal walk twice, once from Bondi to Coogee, and then from Coogee to Bondi. Either way you're going to see magnificent views of Sydney's eastern beaches.The walk is a bit tiring but you can chill and rest in the beach.Definitely worth spending your weekends here especially after a very tiring week.
Simply amazing. This walk is mandatory for those who want to see simply the best of Sydney. Sunshine, seaside, rocks will impress you and make you love them, no chance of disliking it :)

Enjoy the walk, watch th water, look at geology, or find a new beach. A wonderful walk along the cliffs between the 2 beaches. Lots to look at either onshore or offshore. Get out and enjoy the scenery.

Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal Walk. Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal Walk very nice walk andd very nice views of the beach and surroundings, amazing spot por pictures also, we hav great pics from this place

Nice walk with great views. If you don't want to sit on Bondi all day then take a walk along the coast. Its a pretty simple route (keep the water on the left) and not hard going at all, there are a couple of nice beaches on the way that aren't busy. There's an interesting old cemetery called Waverley cemetery right on the cliffs between Bronte and Clovelly, once in Coogee catch the bus back to Sydney.

RECOMMEND!! . Awesome walk, completely free and the views and beaches are great! Plenty of opportunities for food or coffee on the way as well. If you are into fitness there are small outdoor gyms along the walk available for use. Definitely a recommendation for tourists travelling in Sydney.
Stunning walk. Bring plenty of sunscreen and even a top to cover shoulders, I got badly burnt on this walk even with factor 50 on!! Beaches along the way so you can have a refreshing dip.

Beautiful scenery. This is not a walk I would recommend for anyone that is out of shape. It can be quite steep at times plus has quite a few stairs. The best scenery in my mind is from Bondi to Bronte. I don't feel as if I gained much by continuing on. I found cafes to be far less frequent than the Manly walks so bringing enough water is a must. All in all it was a nice walk but I would have been happy doing only half of it.

Beautiful coastline near Sydney. We walked from Bondi down to Bronte Beach. On a very hot day, that was enough after having walked several miles earlier in the day. Another 2 miles was okay as the paved trail is relatively easy. There are the occasional stairs to climb or descend, but they are pretty easy.Bondi was great for people watching. We were there on a Sunday and there were literally thousands of people there. Bronte was also nice albeit smaller. We grabbed a taxi from there down to Coogee Beach ($12). Coogee is nice and supposedly more popular with the locals. Saw some people jumping off some of the 25 foot cliffs into relatively small pools of water. A bit crazy, but nice to be young and brave.Overall, the walk is really nice and the coastal scenery - water, beaches, cliffs, rocks and houses are all pretty spectacular.

Bondi walk. Beautiful all the way, coloured rocks, amazing beach views, picturesque views.Lots of gorgeous people around, plenty of joggers, its a real feel good place.Short cuts if the walk is to long with mini kids play ground.Bondi Icebergs, the place to be, general admission for those who want to swim in the pool, definitely next time. It's Very beautiful

One of the most beautiful walks you can do!. This coastal walk is just amazing. The view is breathtaking. I know others use this expression a lot but in this case it truly is. I have walked the Cinque Terra and in its own way this walk rivals what I think is the most scenic walk I have done.Note the track can be busy on a nice day and some parts are a little narrow. I would recommend going out early and finishing the trip with a lovely brunch.I always start and end in Coogee, easier to park and less of the hustle and bustle of Bondi.This is a don't miss opportunity if you have a couple of hours for a stroll. You don't have to walk both ways.l.many people walk one way and bus back.
An amazing walk for all levels. Beautiful scenery along the way and you can stop and have a swim at many spots. Then catch the bus back to your car! Best to do it on a not too hot day though!
Beautiful, but busy pathway. An essential visit on any itinery when in Sydney, lovely coastline,easy walking paths and friendly locals.
Beautiful Bondi Beach. The beach was beautiful! The walking path well laid out and an easy walk. The vistas from the walking path were spectacular

Great Coastal Path. Have walked this walk before and decided to do again on our second visit to Australia, something different on every visit. There are walkers, runners, people doing part of the walk and others going the whole way. Something for everyone. There is a good easy to follow path and boardwalk with many stunning views of the coastline. Along the route there are many small sculptures to look at and read about. A great walk with many opportunities to stop and watch the world go by or a bite to eat. The walk can be as long or as short as you want as the route passes through many of the coastal villages. Enjoy.

Fantastic. Absolutely stunning, if done early morning and/or mid-week. Views are incredible. It's moderately tiring but a good level of fitness is definitely not required.If you don't mind a lot of people any day of the week is good. However, to fully appreciate the scenery is best to go when it's not too busy, in which case you should avoid it at the weekends at all costs!

Amazing views . Let's be honest. It is a bit physically challenging so take breaks if you need them. You get to experience several beaches along the way including Gordon's, Bronte and clovelly. If you are lucky you might get to see the sculptures by the sea along your walk. Wear comfortable shoes, a hat, sunnies and Sun cream. Water bottle essential. Hope you enjoy it.
Hard work but great views. Has to be done to get a greay view of the coast, tiring on the legs but a wonderful experience. Loads of places to stop and have a cool drink and soak up the coastline.

Lovely nature walk. This is not a novice walk, but worth it, walking on sand and up and down steps.The end is worth the walk though.Take in water and a snack if you plan to enjoy the scenery as there is nothing available.Make sure to keep the area clean and take your trash out when you are finished.
Beautiful caostal scenery. Really enjoyable walk with lovely views of the beaches and sea. Very busy when we did it as around New Year so lots of people - but still worth it.
Good for the thighs. Quite apart from the obvious fantastic views, there were story boards, maps and water stations along the way. More steps than I had anticipated though!
Great Walk. this is the place to be on Saturday or Sunday morning. It is a great walk or jog and has some brilliant views.

A must do walk. Incredible scenic coastal walk, locals have an unbelievable asset which is in excellent condition, plenty of cafe stops and wcs on route, plus of course beautiful sandy bays and beaches.

Beautiful views. We walked from Coogee to Bondi (it doesn't matter which side you start) there were a few beaches along the way which were nice to visit if you have the whole day it is worth having an hour on each beach. The views along the way are amazing, really worth doing the walk
A day at the beaches. Who doesn't love the ocean? Great view, nice walk and covers two of Sydney's beautiful beaches. Great for tourists and locals!

Very enjoyable day. Fabulous views & coastal scenery.
Lots of people on the walk. All the beaches lovely. Massive waves in Bondi.
Well worth doing 😀
Only downfall was the heat. You are very exposed on a hot day on this walk. Don't be in a hurry like we were. Had to bail before Coogee as we needed to get to the airport. Good walk all the same.

AMAZING VIEWS. This is a must do walk in Sydney with the views being breath taking. I would recommend Bondi to Coogee ending up at the Coogee Pavilion for lunch and then walk back or do it the other way having lunch at icebergs or The Bucket List. This walk is hilly and has stairs but an easy walk. Take a hat , sun screen and water. When the Sculpture by the Sea is on this walk just gets better.

Simply stunning. This is a must not miss walk for any visitor to Sydney showing off some of the most beautiful parts of the coastline. The walk is easy and graded and will suit young, old and al ages.

A nice walk. We walked this yesterday as it was such a grey day (too many of those unfortunately since we've been in NZ and Aus) Quite busy .what would it be like on a good day! Lovely beaches and interesting rock formations (never thought I'd say that!) Definitely not the prettiest back drops though as buildings everywhere..but I know it would have all looked stunning with blue sky and sun. Went in see at Coogee. ..waves are so strong..lovely though.

Worth the time and great views. We did the coastal walk after spending a few hours sunning ourselves on Bondi beach and checking out the murals. Really enjoyed the walk and the views. Highly recommend.

Coastal Walk & Sculpture by the Sea spectacular. The usual spectacular views in this unique coastal walk along the cliff between Bondi Beach to Coogee, is more than doubly enhanced by the addition of the Sculpture by the Sea exhibition, which I visit annually. The walk for me did stop earlier at Bronte Beach which is where the sculpture stops. I always take photos of each piece of sculpture and also stop for a delicious lunch at the Grounds by the Sea cafe so the whole experience takes me half a day. Well worth investing time to do this walk and you must take your camera. I recommend taking a jacket as it can get gusty along the cliffs and wearing block out lotion and a hat for the sun of course.

How could you skip this ??. Walk to Coasta and you will find it is worth all! Superb view, eased my desire and never regret for being there! Take a dinner by the beach, chilling on the seashore and enjoy your evening there. You will definitely like it !

Energizing Walk. We joined the walk at Bronte due to the lack of parking at Bondi, although we still had to cut the walk short as parking was limited to 1 hour. When you get on the walk the views are fantastic and the only issue is the envy at this not being the walk you could take every day. Lucky people who live close!

Feeling both relaxed and vibrant. I had taken a bus ride to Bondi Beach, and walked along the seashore for more than three hours. Very relaxing experience.People from every sphere of the world seem to love these beach area, and you can feel vibrant atmosphere here.

A MUST do in Sydney. The Bondi to Bronte (not been all the way to Coogee) is a MUST do activity for anyone visiting Sydney. I do this walk on a regular basis and I'm an Aussie! I walked there when I was based in the US and made it a compulsory activity with mostly my family when I came home to visit, and now I live in country NSW I still walk it regularly. The view are spectacular and give one an immediate sense of the beauty of Sydney, its gorgeous beaches and a reminder of what the city is built on - sandstone! The rocks are really interesting, the walk is a good length and there are great cafes at either end. Make sure to stop at Tamarama Beach for a coffee. (You just might spot a celebrity - I have seen Gerard Butler there!)
Great walk, brilliant views. Love this walk every time we do it. A must for locals and tourists alike. Always good to book-end with beer or two!

Great walk for views of the ocean, cliffs, beaches and people......... lots of people. This is not a walk to get away from the crowds. It can get very congested if you don't pick your moment. But don't let this put you off. The views are spectacular, there is plenty of interesting wildlife and so many other things to see and do along the way. And perhaps people watching is an important part of the overall experience.

Should be the #1 thing to do in Sydney. I had two full days in Sydney and wanted to make the most of each day, so I took TripAdvisor's advice and spent an afternoon walking from Bondi To Coogee Beach. I am so glad I did! I knew Sydney had some nice beaches, but I was completely blown away by the sheer beauty of these beaches and coves (please see my pics). It is not an easy walk – it's about 5K and a good amount of stairs. But I think it is completely worth it! Even if you don't do the full walk, it is worth doing any part of it as it is really that impressive. I also went to Manly Beach the next day which was also nice, but nothing compares to the variety of natural beauty you see while doing this walk. Highly, highly recommend doing this if you have some time in Sydney.
Great views . The Bondi to coogee walk is amazing great views of the ocean and the beaches. Must take a camera to get some good shots.

Nice views!. The costal walk from Coogee to Bondi is really worth a visit.This walk is a nice choice for a morning walk, there is no too much distance between these two beaches. You can combine walking with a swim or just lying in the beautiful beaches you will find along your way.Quite busy of locals and tourists.

Oh so pretty. Just did this yesterday 24Jan2016. We really enjoyed all of Bondi beach then off to our walk. It's so picturesque with the rock formations and just beautiful coastal amazement. You'll love it.

Amazing walk. This walk overlooks Bondi Beach and you go past the famous Bondi Iceburgs Club (which is also has a cafe and bar). The rock formations are stunning and the views are really beautiful. Although there are some stairs it is an easy walk worth doing.
Great Views. The walk was very scenic and extremely breathtaking to see the beach in a new perspective. I recommend this to anyone planning to visit sydney.
Excellent activity for nature lovers. If you love walking holidays you cannot miss this walk. Between two amazing Sydney beaches the walks provide glorious views of Sydney.

Great walk . I would recommend this to do when you are on bondi. It's free and a great walk you can start at coogee or even Bronte which makes the walk quicker. But you Have great views along the way and some nice bars/ cafes to stop off at as well as the beaches.

Morning walk . I do this walk quite regularly and I love it every time! Beautiful views, lots of hills and stairs, I actually forget I'm exercising! It's a fairly long walk, allow 2 hrs return. I generally go quite early, I went a little later yesterday (Sunday) and would never make that mistake again! Too crowded and lots of people dawdling blocking paths!! Very frustrating! I leave from Coogee parking is so much better.

Iconic, must do - but your 10,000 closest friends will join you. Spectacular scenery, iconic sights. But very very busy. You should do it, but on a day you feel people-tolerant...and try to extend downward from Coogee which is less crowded.

Favorite activity!. When it got too crowded at Bondi, I finally decided to do the walk because I just want to spend a quiet time at the beach. I loved doing this because the views are just spectacular. The path makes it easy for anyone to do the walk and you can make various stops (at Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly) if you think it's already too much for you. I would love to do this again.
beautiful walk. we were amazed at how beautiful it was to walk from bondi to coogee. every beach we passed was more beautiful than the one before it! must do.

This is a lovely this walk you can enjoy many times. We have taken this walk every time we have visited Sydney and love it every time, regardless of the weather (although sunshine does help make it even better!!).A few gradients can be paced by stopping to admire amazing views and take photographs. The walk can go on to beaches beyond Coogee or can be shortened. There are some refreshment stops available along the way to keep energy up, but the walk will probably not prove to be over testing.
Do it. We walked from Coogee to Bondi. An excellent walk, great views, minimal ups and downs, lots of fellow walkers, joggers and runners also about.

Have your walking shoes and expect some exercise. After spending our first day at Bondi, as tourists should do, we walked three quarters of this well maintained and accessible coastal walk. Beach ofter beach, cliffs and waves, birds and fishermen, all sorts of shapes of beachgoers. Good workout after a lazy day and good lunch.

Fun walk in Sydney. It's an excellent walk for a city suburb, but don't expect too much in terms of a coastal walk. The good points are lots of beaches on the way to stop at (with cafes, etc), as well as the two busy larger beaches bookending the walk - Bondi and Coogee of course. It's varied - making its way up and down from Bondi around a cliff face, on top of a cliff, through parkland, streets, and even a cemetery. The parts I didn't like so much was that there were lots of people using it so it wasn't ideal for a jog (although it may add to the walking experience). Also there are many parts of the walk which are just along streets so the views are only in certain sections - next to each of the beaches.For those who are visiting, the walk is very well signposted and there are direct buses from the CBD to Bondi and Coogee. You are on exposed cliffs at certain points so it can be windy. At a good pace without stopping, it takes 60-90 minutes (6km).

Amazing views!. Quite a leisurely walk from Bondi to Bronte (including Taramara beach).This coastal walk is a must do for anyone visiting Bondi beach. Excellent views and a lovely walk that takes roughly 45 minutes each way. There are food/restaurants available at both Bondi and Bronte and a few venders in between at Taramara surf club. There are some excellent spots to stop for some photographs and views you certainly won't forget!

Great little qalk. Hot off the plane and in an effort to keep us awake ref jet lag our host had us do this walk but from Coogee to Bondi. Jet lagged, midday heat, no hat - not the best combination but a beautiful walk. Ended in Bondi with a beer and food and well deserved!
what a walk!. we had a blast walking this coastal walk - however it will take you some time, so don't underestimate it. i think one way is 6 km but you are rewarded with great views!

Classic Sydney. I grew up in Bondi so have mixed feelingsThe view is spectacular but it is SO busy!I find particularly annoying the joggers , can't they jog somewhere else?But in the ens too beautiful to not love.

Take your camera!. Definitly recommend taking your camera for this one as there is plenty opportunities to take amazing landscape photos and also breath in the fresh air. Also wear comfy shoes while your doing the walk and take bottled water too.

Stunning Walk. With Bondi Beach being so crowded and touristy I decided to walk from Bondi down to Coogee on the coastal path. This walk was incredible. Loved mixing with the locals and enjoying an afternoon walking in the sun through beaches, on cliff tops and across grassy areas. Would recommend this walk to anyone who, like me, doesn't particularly like just lying on a beach for hours but wants to enjoy the atmosphere and sights this area has to offer!

Spectacular. Get your walking shoes on, slip-slop-slap and off you go to breath taking scenery. Be ready for walking uphill and up some steep steps as well. Make a brake at Bronte Beach at great cafes just off the beach.

Beautiful and not too difficult. We walked from Bondi to Tamarama Beach (closer than Coogee) and jumped into the ocean there. The walk was beautiful but VERY windy! No hiking boots needed - We walked in flip flops and we were fine.

Great views. This a thing to do if you want take in a ice lessureally pace and you will be amazed with the views .You can take your time and sit then carry on at your own pace.when you get to coogee beach it's in my opinion a better beach than Bondi a spot smaller and more family based.There are restaurants cafes shops all on hand you will not be disappointed with this walk.

Ok. Meh. It's ok, nothing spectacular! We'd heard it was great so had high expectations. We'd travelled quite a lot of Australia though and so compared to some of the coastal walks it was pretty average.A nice thing to do but you won't be wowed. Quite a few parts veer off from the coast slightly too.

A long walk. They have now built a proper walkway that you walk on through some parts of the walk. This means though that this is now a busy and popular thing to do, so it can be really busy. IF you have time to do it then great. If not just make sure you visit Bronte and Coogee beaches!
Place to be. This is a 'not to be missed' if you're in Sydney. No matter the weather you MUST do this walk. The scenery is unbeatable

Excellent views.. Excellent views all the way from Bondi to Coogee. Definitely worth doing this walk if you are in the area. Not much shade along the way so take plenty of suncream and water with you. Places you can fill your water bottle in several spots along the way.

Beautiful and breathless . Coogee Walk is a must do for any first timer! Can be leisurely enjoyed or a great way to take in the sites while getting a good workout. You will encounter so much life and breathtaking scenery while walking this path. Late October, they display a large number of large sculptures along this trail during their annual art walk. No biking allowed and not handicap friendly. Moderate stairclimbing in parts. Reserve almost a full day to enjoy this walk.

Awesome views. The walk is beautiful with awesome water views. There are stairs at many places. Do it at a leisurely pace & do sit on the benches provided along the path & take in the fantastic views. The beaches have good cafes to rejuvenate you if you are exhausted. If you don't want to do the whole walk, do try & do a part of it just to enjoy the natural beauty of this country!

Beautiful walk. Takes around 90 minutes for fit people.. The walk is suitable for anybody wearing comfortable shoes. There were steps and this is not suitable if you are pushing a chair. This is longer than you think, not what it says in the guides. What is awesome to see are the coves that you can swim in with children before you get to Coogee. These are in between Bronte Beach and Coogee and if we had our kids with us this would have been perfect for safe fun swimming.

Must do. This is a hell of a long walk in the middle of the blazing sun however it is well worth it for some of the most amazing views you can imagine. Just make sure you bring your sunscreen and plenty of water

Stunning scenery right on the coast. This is a fabulous walk right along the cliff face above the surf. You will go past many beaches on the walk - so you can stop off for a swim or a coffee as you stroll. The path is either concrete or board walk and there are a couple of sections on the suburban streets. It is quite a long walk so it might be best to catch a bus or taxi back to your starting point.

Stunning walk!. This coastal walk is so beautiful. It runs along some of Sydney's famous beaches and is beautiful any time of year. It has some steep stairs that may be difficult for some people but otherwise it's just a lovely walk and a must see on your visit to Sydney!

Absolute Must See in Sydney. I was contemplating skipping heading to Bondi and doing the walk along the ocean. I was feeling a bit lazy from the jet lag and thought about just walking around Sydney for my day #2 there before leaving for Melbourne. I am so happy I motivated myself to get out there. The views are outstanding!! Definite Highlight of my time in Sydney. Don't delay in getting out there.

The best free entertainment in Sydney. A brilliant way to spend a few hours. The scenery is fantastic, it's great to watch the surfers or people playing with dogs on the beaches, there are a few sculptures dotted around, some fantastic photo opportunities. The full walk is about 6km, there are a few inclines or sets of steps, but nothing too strenuous. Coogee is a lovely place to finish, thought it was probably the best of the beaches and a nice little town. My favourite day of our holiday.
Stunning scenery. Spent a few hours walking from Bondi to Coogee, then back to Bondi. Loved every minute of it. There are a lot of stairs.

Spectacular seaside stroll. Don't miss!!! Awesome easy walk along well marked paths. Nice and blustery in November. Was so glad as an out of town visitor that my friend recommended we take the Sculpture by the Sea exhibition. One word = unforgettable. Very informative exhibition against a lovely backdrop. Marvelling how they managed to install the works of art. Just go see

Amazing!!! Great view,beautiful beaches,totally worth the time. We took this coastal walk on a nice summer day,not to hot with light wind-perfect for this kind of activity. It can be a bit stop at times but if you are in decent shape,shouldn't be a problem. Sunscreen! Even if you think it is not too hot and lots of water. Enjoy!
Great costal walk. This costal walk was one of the best with the occasional dog poop here and there. The council does a brilliant job to keep this walk great.

Fantastic day. Based on the suggestion of the fantastic concierge at the Park Hyatt I took the bus out to North Bondi then did the coast walk. Not only were the views amazing I thought the layout (reasonably wide paths, many places with handrails) assured the walk was appropriate for almost anyone (seniors, kids, tourists, locals). The breeze off the ocean help you keep cool. There are benched along the way as well as historical and natural history tips posted along the way.  And do stop off for a drink or a bite at the famous Iceberg Club!
amazing walk!. Beautiful walk from Bondi to Coogee, lots of small beaches between. Beautiful rocks and cliffs also, I recommend it to everybody.

Weekdays , not so busy.. You can start at either end, bus 277 from city to Maroubra Beach and walk back, about 6 klms. Reasonably well sign posted , Some of drink bubblers were not working , so take your own water supply and top up as you go. Lots of ocean / landscape to see , not much else. Had lunch at Coogee at Silver Parsley.Good food and very generous sized helpings. You can terminate the walk at many spots if you are tied or had enough and get a bus back to the city. Some couples with young children and prams , not sure if that is a good thing ?.

Sydney's Coastal Walk Trail. This is a must do! The City of Sydney has made it possible to hike (walk or run) along the magnificent coast line that separates the famous Bondi Beach from Bronte to Coogee Beaches. The entire trail is a long one, and it is workout, but the views are simply spectacular. With Bondi as a starting point, you will travel along the path that is comprised of concrete/rock-like stairs (steep in some areas), natural surface or paved walkways, as well as wooden and metal bridge ways; safety rails as well so not to worry. There are several cliffs and rock clusters that overhang the ocean which are perfect photo staging posts. You will pass magnificent rock erosions, either as side walls or overhead, that are reminiscent of cave interiors; simply amazing rock formations carved by nature. And yes, the sea breeze or spray from the ocean leaping over the rocks is just ideal to cool your brow while you sit on a cliff. The walk is best enjoyed by taking time to stop at the beaches along the the way; there is even a mini gulf/pot pot park! Randwick's Clovelly Bay is along the way too and presents an opportunity to learn about the fish life in the area. The long walk ends with the last beach on the trail - Coogee Beach! A dip is quite fitting at this juncture. I enjoyed this walk immensely!Please note that while I did not time myself, the entire walk took me over an hour to complete. I am runner, and I stopped at each beach, but I found it to be a long trek. I saw walkers of various ages but not everyone should do the entire trail. Tip: Wear appropriate walking/exercise shoes and carry water with you! Also, do the walk early evening after spending time at Bondi Beach.
Beautiful Walk!. This walk was wonderful. You can walk as far as you'd like then stop. You do not have to commit to the entire walk.

Majestic views. This is a delightful and not difficult walk - about 4 miles, during which you will experience some outstanding natural beauty and have access to areas you wouldn't be able to get to by car. I was advised that you were likely to meet the world and his dog on this walk but, although it was busy, the volume of fellow walkers did not detract from the enjoyment. A must-do when you're in the area.

The greatest experience.. I did this walk with my friend but we did it the other way round, we started in coogee and ended back in coogee because we did the return. It was such a fantastic walk, such beautiful scenery along the way to take lots and lots of photos. id recommend to do it from Coogee to because its more exciting when you get to bondi. It was a pretty wet day that we went on and i wouldn't regret it either because it actually kinda cooled us when we were walking.Theres so many things to see along the walk too and the most beautiful was the old cemetery, we walked through it and read a couple gravestones and some of them were from the 1800 which was amazing to see. We were lucky to go and see the sculptures by the sea too. We did the walk in in 1 hour there and 1 hour back. it doesn't take very long at all.Id totally do it again.

Pick your time!. Straightforward walk Bondi to Coogee or the other way round. Lots of steps and up/down not you need to be reasonably mobile, but not difficult and all walkways. Through some pretty beach areas, Bronte and Clovelly and if you don't want to walk back there is a convenient bus that runs the route!Some lovely views but we went on a summer weekend afternoon and so did everyone else, which made it more like hacking through the Sales crowds. Pick your time, early or late should be less busy...

Best views in Sydney. For a free thing to do in Sydney this definitely has to be the best. Its not very hard to find and is well worth going for a walk with your camera to enjoy the million dollar views. Would highly reccomend for tourists and locals alike
Browse before you choose. Great walk along the seaside. We get too see a few of the best beaches in Sydney. Just take your pick and dip in ( personnally I really enjoyed the natural pool at Coogee )

A great afternoon - sucking the breeze!!!. people watching, whale watching, soaking up the sun, catching a breeze, tasting the salt in the air, checking out the bikini talent, talking to the locals, viewing the waves whilst sucking on a bottle of water....................this is heaven.The walk through the cemetary, jogging the parks, up and down the new stairs adjoining the cliffs.................this is a great part of the world....................it is something that the locals do not take for granted and the tourists want to take home with them. PHENOMENAL!!!!!!!!!!!!

A must while visiting Sydney. This is a spectacular walk along the coast, that combines views beaches, rockpools and parks. Its approx 6 km of coastal path, sometimes very close to the edge as you walk along cliff tops and boardwalks. Start at the iconic Bondi Icebergs, just above the Bondi Baths, the walk takes between 1-2 hours at a leisurely pace, offering plenty to see and do along the way - I suggest packing your swimmers. You can walk either direction and as there are lots of stairs you should have a reasonable fitness. You can also walk back, continue on to Maroubra (another 3km) or catch a bus back to Bondi.

Well worth the walk . Stunning walk with beautiful views but go when it's cooler. It could take about 2 hours at a good pace and had places to stop and enjoy also food and amenities. Well worth the effort
Non-stop beautiful views. A great 6km walk. All paved, clear to follow. There are inclines and stairs. The path takes you along multiple beaches.

Done it 3 times and never sick of it!. I will do this everyday if I could - Such breathtaking sights and the walks are simply therapeutic! I have done this about 3 times so far - each visit to Sydney I have to make it a point to walk this walk by myself, and i would feel absolutely content. it's free-of-charge, yet what you get out of it is priceless. Why not?

Go for a run!. If there are any runners reading this, go early! The crowds are heavy throughout the day. Don't expect any PRs. The walk has a lot of hills and stairs but it's absolutely beautiful. There are water fountains along the path.

A beautiful scenic walk. We walked from Coogee Beach to Bondi along the coastal walk on a beautiful but breezy day. The walk is quite easy with only a few steps and easy gradients. There were literally hundreds of people doing the walk in both directions. They were of all ages. Some jogging some walking and others just strolling. The walk hugs the coast and gives beautiful coastal views and ducks in around the quite small beaches. We ended up at Bondi with only a few people on the beach as the water had many rips and lots of white water. Well worth the effort, with views to rewarding you and your time.
Beautiful walk along the cliffs. Great views, nice cafe's along the way, one of the highlights of our trip to Sydney! Fully recommend it.
Stunning . Lovely to drive coastal Sydney , every turn I take is a better postcard picture, weather kinda wasn't the best but on a sunny day it's a must to do in Sydney! Love Bondi

Nice morning walk before it gets busy. If you want a walk with a view that can get your heart racing, this is a good option. With stairs at a few places, and exercise equipment dotted along the path you can get a good workout in addition to the great view.If you set off early it won't be as busy.

For any age, an unforgettable ramble. For us two young at heart, 76 and 84, this walk was a collage of spectacular views. Pick a temperate day, ramble slowly, sit often, and a hugely rewarding morning or afternoon is yours without charge. Walking shoes preferred but street who's will work.
Great walk. Loved the walk around the coast line, seeing the different beaches, well worth the 6km trek especially on a gorgeous sunny Sydney day.

For all ages to enjoy. We took a trip to Bondi through some very interesting places with a commentary about the journey. We loved the beach, though it is much smaller than I imagined, though not packed. School children were having surf boarding lessons, all ages were swimming and paddling as well as sunbathing. There is a small area for toddlers, too. It was scorching hot (32 degrees C) even in November - their spring. It is a must!

Recommended by the locals . Friends who live nearby took us & it was so amazing, we went back 2 more times after. Australia is filled with so much natural beauty & this cliff walk (the shorter segment is Bronte to Bondi) is unforgettable. Make sure to set time aside - even on a cloudy day, it's that spectacular. Stop for coffee at Iceburgs! (At the south end of Bondi Beach)

Gorgeous walk!. We did this walk during their arts in the park show. It was beautiful. I loved all the bays you walk around, the people you meet as you are walking and seeing everyone having fun in the ocean and pools.

Disappointing really.... The prom did not have enough sitting places, a place geared for surfers and younger set....there was a small cafe which we were able to have a drink, but disappointed overall.....

Beautiful walk -- and so thought many many others. A wonderful walk with beautiful views, plenty of opportunities to swim along the way. The graveyard on the hill somewhere midway was impressive. Even though it's only 6km, it was a nice little workout because of all the height differences. Next time I'll be wiser and not go on a summer Sunday. I started around 5pm on a not too warm day, but that was not enough to make for a nice quiet walk at all. One long string of fellow visitors.Walk can easily be done on your own, no paid tour needed.

Great walk seeing 6 beaches over 6ish Km's, 2 hours. Did this walk on a lovely hot day. Free to do, easy to follow, great views. Only criticism was that I went with a pushchair and there are plenty of steps but we managed.

Fantastic. We did the coastal walk on a cloudy and windy afternoon. The plus is that the sun does not hurt, the minus that there is a lot of wind which did not disturb us. Since we were somewhat short in time we walked only till Tamarama and enjoyed any miunute. Beautifuyl walk and not to miss.

awesome walk. best coastal walk i ever done in my life, take a bottle of water and a cup of coffee , go for a walk with your partner , u will enjoy every steps u have taken, awesome view, fresh air whatelse you want.
Nice walk. Good view of the beach.. A nice walk to do in the afternoon when its not too hot. Lots of people exercising and there is plenty of shops either end to grab some food or a drink.

Beautiful ocean views and beaches. A great walk taking in some of Sydney's iconic eastern suburbs and beaches, coves and bays, natural coastal flora and fauna in the shape of birds, dolphins, seals and even whales (May to November). The paved and boarded walk is up and down and as strenuous as you wish to make it. There are cafes and facilities at all the beaches.

Great walk, good fun even in bad weather . We enjoyed doing this walk even in the windy weather we got. Would highly recommend stopping off at lawn bowls on route, and pack a BBQ so you can use the bbq's at coogee beach once you've finished the walk. If it's a nice day bring swim stuff for a couple pools on the way.Walk isn't strenuous so suitable for all ages

Excellent scenic coastal walk. This walk has great beaches and great cliff-top views. There are spots to stop for a snack or ice cream and eve have a snorkel. This is one of the top things which we recommend to people who come to visit us in Sydney.

Lazy stroll for those who enjoy walking . My partner and I did this walk for a date when we first starting seeing each other and a cheap and easy way to get to know each other. It was perfect and simple the way i like it

Stunning Walk. Our daughter, who did a semester abroad in Australia, took us on this walk and it was amazing. There is so much to see!! It is mostly an easy walk, but there a few mildly difficult hills and stairs, but it is worth it.There are some areas that have the most gorgeous ocean views, and then there are little coves that are beautiful.There are places along the walk to stop and rest, or have a drink and a snack.This walk is worth doing!

Make sure you have a hat on. Great walk, covers essential Sydney beaches and offers good choices to stop and chill. We had a break at Bronte to have lunch up on the hill at Char. Water, towel, hat and sunscreen are absolute essentials.
