Great free activity. This walk takes around an hour. Lots of amazing views on offer in this walk. Make sure you have sunscreen, goggles and a hat on a sunny day.

Best thing in sydney rain or shine. This walk involves you in magnificent scenery. The power and beauty of the coastal walk is unbeatable. If you do nothing else in sydney (which would be a shame), do this.

Fabulous walk on a fine day. Enjoyed this great walk on a fine sunny day, followed it up with a welcome beer and lobster taco at Bondi beach. there are lots of opportunities for swimming and surfing as well as hiking -- and shopping if you wish. We mostly enjoyed the walking, the views, and the ready access by local bus to the trail head from downtown Sydney. A stroll that really helps to learn something about contemporary Australis

A great walk. We enjoy coastal walking whilst holidaying in Australia.The Bondi to Coogee walk is very scenic.The path is well delineated and provides for some stunning views.Very accessible by public transport.Highly recommended.

Spectacular Sights. While studying abroad in Australia, I often took walks along this coastal path. The path has a beautiful view of the gorgeous coastlines that Australia has to offer. I would highly suggest bringing a camera as there are many photogenic areas that look straight out of a stock photo.

Finish with a coffee and snack at the Crabbe Hole. The Crabbe Hole is a no frills cafe on the same level as the Icebergs pool. Go through the turnstiles for free after telling the staff you are only going to the cafe. The view of Bondi Beach is unbeatable. Good coffees, cakes, toasted sandwiches etc. We always go after doing the walk or having a swim at Bondi. You just have to do it.

amazing australia. It was last n our list but we loved every moment of our walk it was breathtaking view from the cliffs near Coggee there are lots of people jogging and walking the beach and the waters and the houses facing the beach presented a spectacular impressive view as it was getting hotter we could not finish our walk but we took a taxi along the shore route and completed our trip I would rate it number one in sydney as I like walking in general

Lovely walk, great views. The walk is not too far for anyone, or very hard either. There are lots of spots to sit down ( on the ground or rocks though, not many benched) if you need rest. Beautiful views.

Great way to spend Christmas Day. We took a taxi from Sydney and hiked from Coogee to Bondi. This is a better direction than Bondi to Coogee because:- We wanted to spend a little time at several of the beaches along the way, picnicking at one of them, then ending up at Bondi to spend the rest of the day- it's cool to view Bondi from the cliff path as you approach itTips:- Be aware than most restaurants are closed Christmas Day so pack a picnic- the Subway at Coogee was open- Pack sunnies, SPF lotion, a hat and plenty of water (I wore a hat - the others in my group who didn't ended up with a sunburned face)- Ben & Jerry's ice cream parlor was open at Bondi. Nice place to reward yourself for the hike

Nice. Nice views and not too long walk with a spectular sea to watch.In THE top three walks i did.Everyone can do THE easy walk.Must do It If you in Sydney as Tourist.From Quay to Bondi take bus 333.Its cheap and good.

Great Free Activity In Sydney. Weekends will be busy no matter what time of day though it is still worth it. All year round it is a great walk, usually park at Bronte or Coogee and grab a coffee/ice cream at Bondi then walk back.

Beautiful walk with amazing views. Just 30 mins away from sydney CBD , the coastal walk was a nice breather. The views were awesome.It really is not an issue whether you start the walk from Coogee or Bondi as both the ways has same kind of incline and stairs .The pathway was well laden and there is absolutely no problem for that 2-3 hours walk which includes few stairs too. Just get some snacks and make sure of sun screen if you are visiting during peak hours in summer (12-3pm). It can get crowded later in the afternoon after 4-5pm.There are safe drinking water fountains to refill your water bottles. There are sit-downs so that you can stop by along the walk and enjoy the views. The coastal walks covers Coogee, Bronte, Clovelly, Tamarama and Bondi beach.This is a must do if you are in Sydney and the views are just wonderful and refreshing.
Beautiful!. A rather short walk, but so beautiful!!! This was amazing!! Definitely worth the trip to Bondi. Make sure to pack some water, though, specially in summer.
A must do in sydney. One of the classic scenic walks to do on Sydney. Take some water with you and enjoy the stunning views. Can get crowded during holiday season though..

Beach, sea and sky. If you visit Sydney, you've sort of got to go to Bondi beach. But once you've seen it, a great route away from it is south along the coast to Bronte and then Coogee. There's a path most of the way, and it's an easy walk - even when the temperature is in the 30s and the sun is beating down on you. There's usually lots of other people around, so if you want solitude, go somewhere else. But if you enjoy walking along the coast, with wonderful rock formations and lovely views, this is a great walk.

Beautiful & interesting walk. My husband and I walked this path recently and found it to be exhilarating and beautiful. However it was slightly longer than we anticipated - around 7 km each way and there are sections of it that are fairly steep. The views are lovely and it is mostly paved walkway. Reward yourself with lunch at the Coogee Pavilion when you finish !!!

Spectacular views. The Bondi to Coogee coastal path is a great way to appreciate the stunning Victoria coastline and check out some world famous beaches.The path itself is very impressive. I was expecting a dirt track but instead the entire path was either paved or decked which made it perfect for walkers of all abilities. It is an extremely popular walk and we were surprised at how many people were on the path.We walked the entire stretch from Bondi to Coogee but there are plenty of points to stop or beaches to visit if the full route is a bit daunting. Bronze and Tamara beaches both looked great, while Bondi and Coogee both have great facilities as you'd expect.
Great view. This is an excellent walk with vistas of cliffsides, beaches and the expansive ocean. It can get a bit congested in certain places and is tiring as it's a long distance!

Great walk, ther are plenty of steps. This walk is a good one, take a bottle of water with you if its a hot day, there are plenty of steps & a few up hill sections, there are rest stops you can have a long the way. This walk can take you right through to Maroubra Beach if you want to go that far, good views as well.

Great walk along prehistoric rock formations worn smooth. A great walk paddle or wade depending on the tide along the smoothed rocks,some may need shoes(crocks) depending on the soles of their feet as not all are equally smooth.The little kids love to marvel at how the water is trapped in the tiny pools trapping the occasional crab
Easy walk with great view. Wear sunscreen and try to avoid peak times (11 - 3pm) to be able to take breathtaking pictures of the view and be able to walk at a leisurely pace without be rushed.

loved this coastal walk. took the bus from central quay to Coogee beach, very easy with a little help from the visitor info. Loved our coastal walk and went all the way to Bondi Beach and then took the bus to Watson's Bay for a delcisous lunch at the Doyles take out then took the ferry back to central quay. We felt like a local!
Fantastic . Great way to enjoy fantastic coastal scenery, even when the weather is a little "European". Something different to see at every turn with plenty of places to pause and enjoy.

Beautiful View Whilst Getting Fit!. This walk is a local favorite and it's easy to understand why! You can walk Bondi to Bronte Beach or Bondi to Tamarrama or Bondi to Coogee take your pick. It's all along a beautiful coastline and by each beach you will find cafes, surfing, white sandy beaches, Aussie surfers etc. great people watching, great way to stretch your legs. Walk, run take your pick but it can get crowded on beautiful days!
Beautifull walk along the coastline. It's a long and a little bit hard walk between Bondi and Coogee beach. A lot of stairs, but views are spectacular

Stunning oceanside walk.. A beautiful Oceanside walk on any day, but on a sunny day it brings out the best. Stop and imagine living in one of the Condo's over looking the area and seeing that view every day. Take a Picnic lunch or dinner and enjoy ones surroundings and even take a swim if you desirer. Listen to the crashing waves as they hit the shores. Watch the surfers challenging themselves along the waves. A must see while in Sydney. You can get there by the bus system or car.

Fantastic walk to see beautiful coastal scenery. It was definitely worth the 2 hours to talk from Bondi to Coogee. Be warned there is very little shade so bring suncream or a hat. Not challenging to walk but if you have a pram/buggy, the stairs could be challenging, as there are quite a lot. Once arrived in busy Coogee, there are plenty of restaurants. You can then take a bus back to Sydney CBD for around AU$3.80

A very beatiful coastal walk with a great outdoors feel and life!. I was with my wife in June (so winter) it was very quiet but still sunny and pleasant the beach itself is pretty but not spectacular however the coastal walk is very worth while. Very pretty and you get a feel of the bondi outdoorsy life stile with lots of pretty joggers dog walkers and surfers.

The walk of pleasure. This walk if done in a less exhilarating place would be a chore in some parts, but the wow factor makes it a breeze, (excuse the pun). The stunning view along with the great sea breeze keeps you going, and the people watching ain't to hard on the eye either.

Awesome activity to do on a sunny day.. This is a wonderful way to see some of the local Sydney coastline if you are a visitor. There is a newish boardwalk in for a large section of it, making it easy to walk right along the coast. Just be aware alot of locals use this path for running, so be sure not to get in the way :)Good for all fitness levels and ages.
A must do when you visit Sydney. Stunning views, great exercise and a real Sydney experience. Even better when the Sculptures by the Sea is on.

Absolutely beautiful! . This was on our list for our 3 day trip to Sydney as per recommendations from friends and family and it did not disappoint! We started it around 3pm so had completed the return journey by roughly 7pm. Beautiful beaches and views all along. You can stop many places for drinks etc. Spectacular!

A 'Must Visit' in Sydney. The coastal walk between Bondi to Coogee provides the opportunity for locals and tourists to appreciate the beautiful & iconic Sydney beaches in the eastern suburbs. The famous Sculptures by the Sea exhibition is typically in the first few weeks of November. Spring and Autumn are the best seasons in Sydney to enjoy the walk, but can be enjoyable all year round.

Bondi to Cooge Beach Costal Walk. Bondi to Cooge Beach Costal Walk is a combination between beaches, parks and coastal views. When Costal walk between Bondi Beach you feel Walk through winds your one side is rocks and one side clear blue water. Tis is around 5-6 Km coastal walk and took 1-2 hours. It is a leisure place and wide see view of Water and feel fresh breath.
Walk, Run, Stop - amazing pathway adjacent to the ocean!. Is it any wonder why this path is now one of the top attractions in Sydney? I love using it for runs and sculpture by the sea. Don't miss it!

A walk with views and smells of seafood. Check it out on both those beach walks, you experience fantastic views of surf , sand, waves, surfing if you indulge, fun people on he walk mostly tourists like yourself, a few local fun people, stretch you legs, fresh air and at he end a seafood cafe, doesn't get better than that!

Stunning views and not too busy. We enjoyed our walk along the coast way between Coogee and Bondi. Lots of great views and things to see along the way. It took us about a couple of hours, but we weren't pushing it - the temperature was close to 40C.Tried to catch a bus back and that wasn't too easy as there is no direct service, so walked inland instead and halved the distance of the coast route.

One of the best walks!!. This walk is full of breathtaking scenery. The coastal strip includes many great residences, photo opportunities,surfing beaches as well as starting/finishing with a wide choice of places to eat & drink. Icebergs overlooking Bondi Beach is an iconic restaurant (not the cheapest but good value for money) offering a great menu & location for a relaxing lunch. If walking from Bondi, Bronte beach is recommended for an after walk swim.
Fresh Air. This is a great walk and better when Sculptures are on its great art to walk and view. easy level walk only a few stairs to climb

one of the most beautiful walks ever. no doubt one of the most beautiful walks i've ever taken; stunning view of the ocean, coast, beaches and beach houses. the path is easy to follow and i definitely recommend going all the way to coogee. instead of walking back the same way, to save some time, we cut through the city streets which was easy to do with the help of locals who all seem to be friendly--of course, who wouldn't be in a good mood living there?

Not To Be Missed. This walk is simply stunning. The views are to die for. It's very popular and quite busy with walkers and runners. There are plenty of places along the route to stop for a refreshing ocean swim or you could opt for a dip in the seawater pools. There are pools at Coogee, Bronte and the famous Icebergs at Bondi. There is a lovely cafe on the beach at Tamarama, plus lots of other food and drink spots along the way. If you're not quite so energetic you could do a shorter walk rather than the whole course. There are some steep and slightly uneven steps at the Bondi Beach end which would not be recommended for the elderly or less mobile. Otherwise it isn't difficult.

Must do classic Sydney walk.. Great walk alongside rugged ocean cliffs, protected bays and sandy beaches. Takes about 60 minutes one way from South Bondi Beach to Coogee Beach. Plenty of cafes along the way.
A Sydney 'must do'. Best on a sunny day, graze along the way with cafes and restaurants at all beaches along the route. Don't forget your camera.

Beautiful Coastal walk. Beautiful walk, especially if you can make it at sunrise. You can choose to do it fast and it will take about an hour from Bondi to Bronte and back. Or take it slow and have brunch/lunch at Bronte in one of the many cafe's there.Pack your swimmers if it's a hot day and plunge in the ocean at Bronte beach or Bondi. Tip: Wear a hat and comfortable shoes!

Walk during Scupture By The Sea. Have walked form Bondi to various parts toward or to the end at Coogee. Best times have been during the Sculpture by The Sea exhibition (generally around October each year)

Special views of the beautiful coastline.. You can begin this walk at any of the beaches it covers, and I recommend walking South to North, as you conclude at Bondi beach. Take a bus or taxi to any beach. Taxi from city to Clovelly or Bronte beach cost us $29.00 (non-peak hours) and about the same from Bondi back to the city. Bus is cheaper but you may need an "Opal Card" in advance for most busses, but some still take cash. Have an ice cream at Bondi Beach and enjoy the beautiful scene.

Bondi to Coogee -Beautiful, Scenic, Coastal.. I've completed this walk a few times now, and find it can be relaxing, calming, slow or a bit strenuous at times if you want to get exercise, but mostly it is just the right amount of time to spend on a walk and is simply beautiful and scenic the whole way. You walk across the gangway most of the way, with sign posts. Many beautiful little beaches are found along the way, some providing picnic and BBQ areas, dog friendly, some with a lot of people, some more secluded. The walk can take you between 1 and half to 2 and a half hours, depending how quickly you walk and if you want to slow down to use any facilities or grab an ice cream... go for a dip, etc. A must visit for Sydney Siders !

Beautiful Coastline. Thoroughly recommend this walk along the gorgeous Sydney eastern suburbs coastline. Great exercise, you can walk the whole way at your leisure or break it up over a few trips. Lots of cafes and restaurants at many of the beaches you pass through and you could make a great day out of this walk.During whale season you might see a few heading up or down the coast.

Best New Year's Day Ever. Although crowded this is definitely my favourite day adventure in Sydney! Amazing views and incredibly enjoyable. Pack your camera,hat, sunscreen and sunnies and prepare for a great coastal hike! The earlier the better to avoid the crowds and heat!

Beautfiul Scenery. The walk from Bondi to Coogee is a beautiful walk. We did it backwards as it was easier to park in Coogee. Its a great path to walk on but be aware there are several set of stairs. There a great beaches to have a dip in as you walk along. The path is easy to traverse and don't forget your camera. To finish your walk you can have a meal in one of the great cafes in either suburb.

One of the best beach coves I've seen....and I've seen many!. While it is a summer vacation destination, and it a bit of a honky tonk venue, the beach is just spectacular! Well worth the trip by ferry (my preferred transport since it travels all the way through the harbor!) or by the hop-on-hop-off buss tour.
A Sydney must do. A Sydney must do, very pretty and a good way to get away from the hustle and bustle of Sydney. Remember sun screen and water
Gorgeous Coast. Beautiful beach and coastline ...... great for people watching. Stroll along this pristine section of Australian coast while enjoying the amazing rocks to beautiful sandy beaches.

Beautiful views, try to go during the sculptures by the sea. Always enjoyable, any time of the year.But best with the sculptures.Take a baby carrier if going with babies. Too hard with prams to do the whole walk
fabulous walk. Congratulations to local govt.for providing this gorgeous clifftop boardwalk wonderful views of cliffs and ocean a must do for the averagely fit stroller.

Beautiful!. I completed the round trip walk with my best friend. At some points it was a little strenuous but so worth it! It is quite a busy walk in Sydney so pick your time of day carefully. It's also a good idea to take or wear your swimmers as you can stop along the way at different beaches to cool off.We timed it so we made it to Bondi in time for a relaxed leisurely lunch, then strolled back, stopping for a swim.If you are lucky you may run into the lovely crew from Bondi Rescue- my hat blew off around a bend and one of the really sweet life guards from the show picked it up as he passed me. :-)

Leisurely walk and enjoy the coast line!. I would suggest that you decide where you'd like to end your walk. My friend and I actually walked pretty leisurely, stopped many times to just sit and relax. There are many ocean baths to check out and all the other smaller wonderful beaches to chill out or swim. The walk is completely paved with railings. I don't hike because there is nothing to see en route and you have to go up hill. This walk is pretty much even, not many inclines, like I said, super leisurely. If you are tired and you don't want to finish the walk, come back the next day, start from the half way point, that's what we did! We walked from Bondi to Tamarama, then the next day Coogee to Tamarama. Coogee beach is alright, there is Wylie's baths or McIver's baths (women and children only), then my favourite spot to swim is Clovelly beach. We stumbled upon Clovelly! There is an out door pool (small) but because it's in an inlet the waters are super calm. Many entry points too.

Always a fantastic walk for a bit of excercise with magnificent coastal views. We have taken this walk, often from Bondi to Tamarama beach, but occasionally the full distance walk along the clifftops. All weather conditions are OK, but for me especially when the surf is running and with mild off-shore breeze to hold the waves a few seconds longer. It is a great place to bring overseas visitors or just locals getting some exercise. At times parts of the route can be rather crowded.
Great for an amble or something more intense. This walk is great, you can be serious and work up a sweat. Or amble along and make a day of it stopping to eat some treats at the points off the track.

Beautiful on a clear day. Even on the hottest of days, this beautiful coastal walk will have the wonderful prevailing sea breeze that the Sydney beaches enjoy. Stop at Tamarama or Bronte Beaches for a quick dip or a drink if it is too warm for you. Recommended all year round, even in winter it's OK provided there is not a howling southerly (wind) blowing!
Lovely walk . We walked this on Christmas day and as did many others.. including alot of people dressed as santa! I would definitely recommend it and you see alot more of the coast.
lovely!. We walked from Coogee to Bondi (as parking is easier at Coogee). lovely coastal walks with great view points and beaches to visit.

A Must Do While in Sydney!. What I can say about the walk... breathtakingly beautiful. We were short in time after we had arrived to Bondi Beach, and I marked the Coastal Walk as a must for me. So my uncle and I did the walk, to Bronte. The walk itself gave me views that I never expected to see, the Pacific waves hit the shores violently and miles of coastal plants guided the path. Stop by in Marks Park and few viewpoints along the way, you'll get to see surfers challenging the tsunami-like waves and headlands. Tamarama Beach was the smallest, but having the lowest crowd. But nothing beats Bronte Beach,the most spectacular of all and also my favorite beach till now, the scenery was indescribable and we got to spend a few minutes at the beach before heading back to Bondi. We wanted to walk all the way to Coogee but the sky was getting darker and darker while we were making our way back,eventually we went back but the views alone were unforgettable. Just one thing to avoid - touching the handle (sometimes there's bird poop and you can hardly notice them) along the way.

Great walk and views. An awsome way to see the coast. Great vews and very well kept walking path. Take your towel and swimmers as there is many hidden beaches along the way. Set of early and you will see great sunrise spectacular views and photo opertunities.

Iconic Sydney Beach walk. This is a must do walk for beautiful coastal scenery and beaches. Plenty of opportunity to swim, eat and drink along the way. However, be aware that there are a number of steps along the path. Each of the beaches and bays have something special. Great to see so many people enjoying the water.

Great workout with stunning views. The total walk is around 10 km from Coogee to Bondi Beach and back and it's an amazing experience. It's a low impact workout but quite an effective. The only problem is that I had to stop multiple times to take photos.

Beautiful views. For the walk, you walk right along the coast on a path the led you on rocks and around the different beaches. The view was beautiful the entire time, and it was definitely worth it. The walk was a little tiring since there were a lot of stairs and hills.

Great Sydney Walk!. We did this walk when 'Sculptures by the Sea' was on, which made the first part of the walk pretty busy but doesn't take away from the amazing coast. The walk itself is pretty easy, even with the odd hill... but very relaxing when your by the coast.

Fantastic sights all along the way. We commenced the walk pre dusk and finished at Bondi beach in the early evening. Along the way was a series of beautiful views culminating in the lights of Bondi from the headland. Highly recommended and not to be rushed.
Beauutiful. Soooo beautiful walking between the too! Stopped at bronte beach was incredible! Gorgeous hot sun, saw the shark helicopter hover over a possible shark siting! Love it

Views and walk are perfect. When we landed this was our first adventure. We happened to stubble across as we were merely just taking in the views at bondi. The walk isn't an easy one if you require level ground but with all the bay's and seats plotted around you can have as many stops as you need. This was certainly a highlight of mine
Walk for the living!. So much to enjoy. Walk, swim, dine, view, ponder, socialise. Just do it. Great public transport for the return . From iconic Bondi to quintessential Coogee!
Highlight of our 2 week trip!. Very popular, but very scenic walk. Pass by a number of beaches and different landscapes. If you're in Sydney, it should be the number one thing on your list!

Excellent walk with great views. You need to be reasonably fit - there are many changes in gradient - slopes and stairs - throughout the route. It's easily followed in either direction. We went in the late afternoon and received some respite from the hot sun. It took about 100 minutes, but we didn't spend much time sitting or swimming. It could easily cover a pleasant 4 hours with a couple of stops for a swim and ice cream or coffee. A hat, sunglasses and sun-screen are essential. Wander around the graves at Waverley - surely the most scenic final resting place in the world?

Stunning coastline. The walk is an easy stroll along a beautiful coastline and is thoroughly enjoyable. Beginning at the iconic Bondi Beach, it didn't take us long to get to Bronte and there are great opportunities for taking great photos of the coastline.

Must do. This is probably the one thing everyone says you must do in Sydney, and I would agree. The walk is pretty. It can take as much time or as little time as you want. We stopped for a few drinks along the way, so we didn't rush! I loved this area.
A must see. Beautiful scenery, amazing day at the beach. I particularly enjoyed the cleanliness, people's relaxed attitude and the delicious ice-cream sold at Bondi.

Dont miss it. Can't believe we have been to Sydney so many times and this was the first time we did this. It is just wonderful, so many lovely sights and exercise to boot! Finished with a swim at beautiful Coogee and a coffee. All is good with the world.

A walk between the best beaches in Sydney!. I have done this walk many times and the stunning views keep me coming back. Both Coogee and Bondi Beach are easily accessible by public transport. The walk can be done in either direction, but I always start in Coogee. It is easy to follow the path at the North end of Coogee Beach, through Gordon's Bay (a great place for scuba diving), Clovelly (my favourite place to go snorkelling), Bronte, Tamarama and finally Bondi Beach. Most of the path is via a cliff-top board walk and walking path, but even when the route diverts to a road, you can simply follow the other walkers to find the way. The walk itself should take about 2 hours, but I would allow at least another hour to stop off for a drink, snack or swim at one of the amazing beaches. There are some uphill sections and it contains several sections with stairs so you need a moderate level of fitness. My favourite time to do this walk is late afternoon/early evening on a summer's day. It is very popular with tourists and locals, especially in late October-November when the Sculptures by the Sea art exhibition is on, so expect quite a few people to be sharing the path with you!

Local opinion. As a Sydney local sometimes it's easy to lose sight of the natural beauty surrounding us. Sometimes it takes an outside perspective to help us rediscover what we should have known all along, our beaches are beautiful!My outside perspective came in the form of a travelling friend from the Netherlands. Upon her suggestion we decided to do this walk and see what all the fuss was about. In truth, despite living here I had never bothered to attempt it.It is well worth the time and effort and is not physically strenuous. It really is a walk - not a hike or an uphill battle against your legs. The views are constant and stunning. Additionally, if you are not familiar with Australian beaches or our coastline it is a great way to experience such beauty in under 2 hours or so - maybe quicker depending on your pace. Take a camera - there is so much beauty to see as you look out towards the seemingly endless ocean ahead. Take your swimmer - incase you want to swim at the beach at the beginning or end of your journey.Choose a good time - While there is no ideal time to do this walk, I found going midday / arfternoon had a bonus of being able to see the sun begin to set at the end of the journey. I believe if you have an interest in sunrises, as these beaches are on the eastern side morning sunrises can be spectacular.Note you will be going for the view but there are plenty of good cafes etc around that you should be able to grab a decent meal at the end of the trek. There's also a Coogee beach takeaway shop called 'Chish and Fips' close by the beach towards the end of the walk. I can't remember the quality but don't believe it was a bad eat from memory

Beautiful. Whether you're a tourist or a sydney-sider this walk is definitely something you should do. Set aside a few hours and stop at some of the beautiful beaches while viewing the phenomenal coastline

Lovely. Beautiful landscape! Didin't have the chance to walk all the way, cause the entire path tales about two hours. We stopped in Tamarana and came back, what was already wonderful! Totally recomend it!

A Sydney highlight!. The most beautiful coastal walk I've ever experienced! Lots of lovely beaches and vistas, and lots of cute towns you pass through on the way. If you stop at a few places this can take the whole day. So spectacular!

Simply our favourite walk in the world. Visit our daughter from UK for 13 years. We love this walk. All the little bays like Tamarama, Bronte Clovelly and Gordons bay are just beautiful. I have a few problems walking and it is quite up and down we think it is about 9km in distance but I manage it at my leisure. I would not miss it for the world and would highly recommend it.We stop off at Clovelly for lunch at Seasalt beautiful.This last time on Friday 8th we finished with a swim at Wyles baths Coogee perfect day.

Brilliant walk. This is a great thing to do. The walk is fairly easy and the views are stunning. There are plenty of water fountains and restaurants along the way so make a day of it. It was hot today so be sure to wear good shoes take water and coat yourself in sunscreen.

Very Enjoyable "Come Prepared" . Very easy going and enjoyable walk along he coast. Awesome views, was longer than expected and would advise taking Suncream, a hat, water, wear comfy shoes and pre gaps swimmers to have a dip along the way. I would defiantly do this walk again and it's a not to be missed if your visiting. Was a busy trail but that's to be expected could do with a few more bubblers towards the Bondi end of the walk :)

Amazing views. A must do!
The view from the trail is just awesome! Stop at the beaches in between but in special at Coogee natural pool. It's beautiful!

Loved this walk!. It's about a 5K I believe. The coastal walk is very relaxing with the amazing beach on one side of you. You have lots of walkers and runners on this path all the time.Definitely an enjoyable experience.
Do not miss it! . This was my favorite place and thing to do during my holiday in Sydney! This place is just amazing! Great morning walk with many spots for outdoor gym. Absolutely loved it!!!!

A great stroll if you are feeling fit. The walk from Bondi to Coogee is stunning and is especially good if you have your bathers and warm weather. We had both so were spoilt for choice, in terms of great swimming spots. The views are stunning the whole way. We chose to get a bus from town to Bondi then walked to Coogee, (about 6km) had a swim then caught a bus back. Perfect!

A must do :). This was such an amazing experience and when I return in March I'll take this walk several times on different times like sunrise, sunset etc. There're water post on the way so on a hot day you'll get enough water if you just bring a bottle. If you take your time walking there is so much beauty hidden in the rock etc.

An iconic Sydney walk. If you only have a couple of days in Sydney this is one of the things that you must do - although I might change my mind if it is bad weather!!! This is a stunning walk. This time I drove and parked at the lovely looking coogee pavilion (good coffee). We did it return as obviously the car was in coogee. It is such a stunning stroll - drop dead views all along the way. And of course don't miss the most instagrammable of spots the bondi icebergs pool! Bondi beach is almost always packed - it is best photographed from a distance so all the sun seekers are small dots on the horizon
Brilliant coastal walk. Very easy walk with stunning coastal views and lots of opportunities for coffee or snacks along the way (or dips in the ocean!).

The best costal walk I have ever had. We took a train and bus journey to Bondi Bay. This is an iconic beach in suburb Sydney. Bondi beach is an epitome of perfect coastal paradise. Its waves are big, marvelous and graceful that surfers love. Its water is glittering sapphire that everyone could admire. Its sand is white and so fine. We may not be lucky enough to see whales and dolphins in the water, but we were lucky to see and behold the beauty of this beach. We took the Bondi-Congee Coastal Walk and we enjoyed every step of the view. As I uttered during our walk, “the view is getting better and better as we walked further and further” from where we started the journey.

Easy walk with wonderful views. My wife and I did this walk on a hot Wednesday morning. We caught an early train out from the city centre, getting to Bondi junction for just after 7. From there we caught a bus to Bondi beach and were on the walking track with coffee in hand by 7.30. As mentioned in previous reviews this is a great free walk which shows you Sydney's fashionable seaside suburbs as you meander along an easy track. It has a few sets of steps but these are easily climbed.The walk takes you past many gorgeous beaches where you can stop off for a dip.We recommend getting to Bondi early in the morning to avoid the heat but also the hoards of tourists who head out to this popular beach.

Very good fittness option!. Nice coastal walk with plenty drinking water spots, benches and rubbish bins. Amazing views, but would recommend taking the walk early in the morning - not that many people and not that hot!

Long walk but a great walk well worth it. We walked from Coogee beach to Bondi but ended up liking Coogee better (less crowds and a smaller beach) so I would recommend the walk in reverse. It keeps to the coastline and there are plenty of photo opportunities. Wear sunscreen and or sun protection as it is an exposed walk.
A must do!. Such a beautiful walk. Worth stopping at The Pavilion at Coogee for a drink and to admire the view. Pretty hard going at times with the stairs but lots of places to rest. A true gem!

One of Sydney's best walks. We have done this walk a number of times and it is just spectacular. The most recent trip was to see the 2015 Sculptures by the Sea which was crowded, especially near the Bondi end.
The walk itself isn't very long but we strongly suggest wearing LOTS of sunscreen, hat, sunglasses and long sleeve clothing as it is very exposed.

Lovely walk on a sunny day. We actually did it the other way round, from Coogee to Bondi.
The walk itself took us a few hours of taking it pretty casually and making stop offs.
There are numerous beaches along the walk, and a good spot on the cliffs to watch the waves crashing against the rocks below which was pretty cool.

I did the reverse.... What a beautiful coastal walk! I started at Coogee and walked up to Bondi, with tons of pics along the way. The trek is marked from time to time, so keep an eye out. Once I arrived in Bondi, I took the bus up to Watson Bay. Incredible pics there, and you won't be disappointed. Get going now!
Great Views. When in Sydney this walk is a must, the views are just spectacular. The rock formations are stunning. The walk too is awesome!!
Must do walk. This walk takes around an hour. Lots of amazing views on offer in this walk. Make sure you have sunscreen, goggles and preferably a hat on a sunny day.

Great views and easy walking. Lovely coastal walk which is easy to do. Plenty of toilets and water points along the way. We found the walk to be pretty busy but this didn't detract from our enjoyment. Plenty of keep fit body worshippers running and jogging their way. There are a few steep steps to negotiate but nothing to worry about - views more than make up for them!

Beautiful walk- ignore those who say Bondi is overrated. The walk from Bondi to Coogee is stunning, plus it's a way to tick off Bondi without having to put up with some of the surfer types who aren't to everyone's taste!
Cool. I could relax here. I really spent time here very good! Very nice place. I enjoyed to spend a time here.
Amazing scenery, beautiful beaches, fabulous coastal walk. Lovely coastal walk on well kept pathway, undulating walk past some beautiful bays, possible for stops en route for a swim. Take water!

An enjoyable Christmas Day walk. We were visiting our family over Christmas and after a BBQ did this walk. A lovely walk, not too strenuous, with great views. Bondi beach and surrounding area was buzzing.
Very nice walk. Great coastal walk - took me around 3 hours at a leisurely phase. A bit overcrowded and windy though :-)

Long but worth walk. . At first, this walk by the sea was recommended as a 30min walk - no way. I have done this in approximately 1:30h. However, it is totally worth the time and effort. Wonderfull views, very pleasant walk by the sea and fantastic beaches and natural pools. A spectacular experience.

Superb views of the coast line. One of the best beach walks in Sydney by far. Slopes are gentle, although there are steps at various points of the journey. May not be fully accessible to those in wheelchairs, but that still doesn't preclude one from enjoying the views along the other sections of the walk. Very light and easy, suitable for young and old alike, and is also free. You may be tempted to take a detour along one of the beached so bring your swim gear.

Great walk. Really enjoyed this walk, which took a few hours at a moderate pace to complete. I did this walk on a weekday, as recommended by a friend, to avoid weekend crowds. Really amazing views along the way. I went on an overcast day, I can just imagine what it's like on a sunny one!

Fun morning. This walk makes for great exercise with beautiful views. From Darling Harbour we took the train to Bondi, then the bus to the beach. Note at 9am the bus line was short, at noon it was crazy.
The must on anyone's list. If you have just one day in Sydney, you should do it, no doubt about it. These walk is the face and one of the best exemple of what is it the Aussi way of life

Nice walk by the sea. This is not a unique Sydney specific attraction - you can have a walk by the sea in other countries. But nevertheless this walk is really beautiful. This was a nice break during our Sydney travel. Sydney is an awesome city with a lot of things to do and eat and explore. It's great on art, food and views. But Bondi to Coogee is another layer. I went there in the beginning of Australian summer and the walk was very refreshing. Almost all the way just beside the blue water. You can swim for sometimes and relax. You can jog too if you want. Overall, a great walk by the sea that is so close to the heart of the city.My advice will be to take public transport (bus) to Bondi and then walk to Coogee and take a bus back to the city. Because I have seen parking is a big problem around the area.

Excellent Day Out. You pretty much can't come to the area and not do this. Excellent scenery, not that difficult of a walk and a cemetery with the best view for eternity in the world. What more is there to say?!
beautiful views. This walk was beautiful but we did not finish. We did it on Christmas day and it was PACKED! It was also very sunny and warm and we were running short on sun screen.
Scenic Walk!. Just relax at the beach or swim in the ocean. Otherwise, take a stroll down from Bondi to the nearest Tamarana Beach, and remember to take lots of pictures at Bondi Iceberg.
Great walk on the beach. My boss took me here to enjoy the view of the beach when it was still not full of patrons. Had a bite while watching it as well.

Panoramic coastal views.. This picturesque walk is suitable for almost anyone physically capable of climbing a moderate number of steps. The paths are well maintained and there are a number of convenient rest stops. The walk is well worth the effort as the views of ocean, beach and general landscape are breathtaking.
Do it. Now!. Totally excellent in summer or winter. Bring your togs for a swim! Stop and have brunch or coffee along the way in many awesome cafes/restaurants.

An enjoyable walk with beautiful scenery. It was a nice walk. Lots to see and good fitness. Wish I had of gone for a swim half way around but next time! Definitely recommend. The beaches were crazy busy though so I probably wouldn't spend much time in the beaches just focus on the walk.
Among the best coastal views in the world. Australia is famous for its beautiful coast and this walk will give a taste of the magnificent view of the Sydney's beautiful coast line.

Beach life - Sydney style. We did this walk twice, during separate stays in Sydney. The first time was during the Sculptures by the Sea exhibition in November. The second time was on 29th Decemberbwhen the beaches were crowded with families and holidaymakers. Both days were enjoyable, and illustrated why the beaches are such a draw to residents and tor it's alike.
Absolute must!!!. We are the lucky country!!! absolute must to visit and soak up the beauty, air, vibe. Stunning scenic walk.

Loved it!. Great 2+ hour jaunt. Suggest a start earlier than 9am and walking southbound. This will keep the sun at your back as nearing the end of the walk you will be warm if not hot. Wear a hat and don't be shy with taking stairs. Not for the faint of heart if you want to walk it quickly. Lunch in Coogee a must.

Loved it!. Great 2+ hour jaunt. Suggest a start earlier than 9am and walking southbound. This will keep the sun at your back as nearing the end of the walk you will be warm if not hot. Wear a hat and don't be shy with taking stairs. Not for the faint of heart if you want to walk it quickly. Lunch in Coogee a must.

Bondi Beach Walk. An easy days walk with several opportunities for food stops along the way.Very scenic and a great way to see some of Sydney's most popular beaches.Very popular, so best time to do the walk is weekdays.

An Amazing and Scenic Walk well worth it. We parked at Coogee which is a little easier to park at than Bondi and did the walk on a beautiful mid morning with the aim of having lunch and ice cream at Bondi Beach. Mum, Dad and the kids were all in tow (kids 9 and 8) and no one had problems with the walk.Its about 5-6km or so long and took about an hour and a half to complete. There are lots of steps in some parts but it is a purpose built walk.The kids were not keen to walk all the way back after a beautiful lunch, so we just caught a cab for about $15. Great day out. Just be sure the weather wont turn sour with rain or excessive wind and you will love it. Don't forget hats and sunscreen !

Beautiful walk. Really enjoyed this walk. The beaches are so scenic with unique rock formations and lovely views. It was really interesting to see the differences between all the beaches along the way--it's easy to see how everyone has their preferred beach. We stopped for lunch at Bronte. There's plenty to see, and plenty to do along the way if you want a bite, a drink, a swim, or even just a rest.

Wonderful walk. We do this walk every time in Sydney, and always enjoy it - the sights, of beaches, water and homes; the people, of all shapes, sizes and nationalities; and the dogs, of all breeds. At either end, there are cafes and restaurants to please any taste. Special recommendation of the fish and chips on Bondi Beach.
Walk by the sea. Amazing walk along the coast, especially in October for the Sculpture by the Sea.We saw whales and dolphins offshore.Take water with you.

One of the best coastal walks in Aus. Ok we were there over the New Year so footfall was massive in the sunny day. But it is easy to see why this is recognised as being one of the best coastal walks in Australia. Take your time and it can be several hours or stride on and it is an hours walk linking two great surfing beaches. Heat up early or do it mid week to avoid the crowds

Best walk!. This is a lovely walk where you can admire a nice string of coast.Along the walk you get to see huge beaches such as Coogee and Bondi and some smaller beaches as Tamarama and Bronte and some even tinier ones which look like the ones in the Balearic beaches in Europe.I recomment you reach Coogee by bus from your location and you walk back to Bondi. It's quite a few kilometres but it is definitely worth it! It's a good idea to stop for a swim and for a bbq at Tamarama beach to break the walk before you reach the amazing spot which looks upon Bondi Beach.It's also a lovely walk to spot some of the fanciest villas of the coast! Best walk in Sydney and best way to stay fit while having fun!!!

My Daily Walk. Weather Permitting . Sydney at its best. My daily walk that is Clovelly to Bondi and Back. Coogee to Clovelly. Sorry to many Stairs for my knee. Even saying that. Clovelly to Bondi is 8km and takes about 75min at a good walk. Enjoying the Coastal views.

Stunning coastline walk. I highly recommend the Bondi to Bronte (and back!) coastal walk. Beautiful scenery of the cliffs and ocean beaches. It's challenging enough to make you feel you've worked out - about 6km with stairs and up and down sections of the walk. Have coffee at one of the cafes in Bronte, then return to Bondi for a swim in the surf. If you're doing this walk in summer - you will need to cool off in the ocean - bliss. If you are in Sydney in October, the Sculptures by the Sea will be on and that makes the walk even more interesting, however it does get extremely busy...Pic below of the beautiful Bondi Beach

One of the best things I did in Sydney!. Make sure you walk the whole trail! I've hiked in many places in the world, and this is one of the most stunning trails I've ever seen. Be prepared for some decent hills, though! You can never see the view without climbing the mountain! ;)

not once or twice. Every summer, at least twice.
By November, early summer , there are sculptures by the sea, always stunning, specially on sunny days, not rare around Sydney shore.
Used to do walking also by February, and if you keen, visit the cemetery, it's quite on the way.

A great walk. this is a beautiful walk and well signposted which you can take at your own pace and there are plenty of places to stop along the way. It's a lengthy walk but well worth it. There are amazing views along the way and you can always take a breather to watch the surfers in some of the bays. I like to start at Bondi and have lunch at Coogee to prepare for the walk back.

Summer walk. This is a great leisurely walk around some amazing beaches in Sydney.There are quite a few steps and maybe not for prams.ther is a coffee stop along the way and either end is a great lunch destination .

In love with this place!. Best coastal walk in the world, beautiful views, dramatic cliffs and the ocean all the way!Best time to do the walk is during the week as it gets really crowded on the weekend and you end up queueing the walk instead of walking it or running. Best part of the coastal walk to me is Gordon's bay, and best time of the year is a sunny warm winter day.
One of the best experiences in the world. An absolute must. I have done this walk many times and every single time I am amazed all over again. Magic!

Beautiful . Did this coastal walk in winter (July15 and summer Dec15). Just love walking along the rough coast and lots to see. Come by a couple of beaches, which are perfect for a rest in between the walk.

Stunning. The 6 kilometer walk from Bondi to Coogee is an easy walk along some breath taking scenery and a lovely excursion if you have some free time. We went late one afternoon and were blown away how well maintained the path is and how many people enjoy the route. A fabulous and free excursion in an otherwise expensive city

Excellent, scenic walk!. This walk was among my favorite things to do/see while in Sydney. The views and rock formations are simply incredible. We took the train / bus to Bondi Beach and walked towards Coogee Beach. As others mentioned, there isn't too much shade so be sure to wear sunscreen to protect yourself from the sun.
Icebergs. Amazing view and reasonable value for money Would go again with overseas visitors. Easy to get to from The Macleay.

One of the most wonderful walks in the world. Whenever I'm in Sydney I try to get down to do this walk at least once! I believe it's approx 12km from Bondi to Coogee and back but because of the breathtaking view, and the stops along the way, it seems like an easy stroll. I can recommend stopping in Coogee at the Pavilion for lunch with a view before the return home. A cocktail or two don't hurt the walk home either...
excellent end of day. excellent way to end a day at the beach. You can do it as long or short a you want. Beautiful views.

Too far!. Unbelievable views and lovely walk if you have a gallon of water and hiking boots! The walk started off lovely, but after miles of walking by the time we got half way there I was ready to give up! Don't do attempt if you aren't fit/keen walker
Stunning walk along the coastline. This is a lovely walk which takes you through several beaches. Spectacular views and it's not that strenuous. Take water and sunscreen!
Simply a must do. Beautiful walk, amazing views, great if you can go when the sculptures are up. You can run it, jog it, or simply take your time and amble along this path

A must for walkers and nature lovers alike. A glorious walk along coastal beaches with safe paths. The views are spectacular! catch the bus from Bondi Junction to Bondi and walk up to Bondi Iceburgers club at the end of the beach to start the walk.

Walk slow and enjoy this one. A group of 8 of us walked from South Coogee to Bondi. We ate, snorkeled, drank and hit every beach on the way over a wonderful day that we will always remember. Too much to say, but don't power walk this the first time, enjoy a long slow adventure.

Beautiful Rock Cliffs and formations. This walk has so many views and different beaches. The restaurants in Cougee for breakfast are great, especially the rooftop pavilion. the icebergs restaurant in Bondi has an energy all of its own. we stopped for a drink at the end of the walk. the walk is very well maintained. Not good for bikes as there are stairs along the way. Better to go on weekdays as the walk can get busy
Beautiful walk to do even if the sun is not out!. This is a beautiful coastal walk that I have done many times! The views are beautiful and its a really great walk to do.

Walk along the coast. This is a nice relaxing amble along the coast with some stunning views of some beautiful beaches. We started in Coogee and finished in Bondi. We stopped many times for pictures/photos and it took couple of hours. Lovely day out
Enjoyable walk. Had a nice walk down the coast. Really beautiful scenery and lots of opportunities for people-watching.

Great views!. We walked in the opposite direction, from Coogee Beach to Bondi. The walk goes along the coast and took us about 1.5 hours. Not very much shade so make sure you wear suncream and take some water with you. I'd definitely recommend this walk if you're ever in Sydney.

Race track?. It's worth doing just to see the geology of this coast.
The path takes you past some pretty coves and safer bays for children to play, but beware of getting in the way of joggers! Its busy and unpleasant.

Gorgeous walk. Started the walk at Bondi Beach and meandered around at our pace, Just the most delightful walk with some lovely beaches on the way round. Stopping off at various bays for a well earned drink. It's an easy walk and not hilly.
Wonderful. The most amazing views along Sydney's best beaches is a perfect way to spend a day. Plenty of stops available along the way and a all round wonderful experience.
must do. just walk and enjoy the path and the view... different beaches... flowers, nature... better doing in the afternoon

Great walk. The paved path from Bondi Beach to Coogee Beach hugs the coastline all the way. The path is by no means an easy walk, as there are many steps and inclines along the way and almost no shade. The views are fantastic and there are several places along the way to stop an enjoy the beach, have a bite to eat or just get out of the sun.The entire walk is about 6 Km one way, so takes about 3 hours round-trip. The 333 bus from downtown Sydney gets you there for about AUD3.50 each way and takes about 20 minutes (off at the first Campbell Parade stop). There are lots of beach clothing and souvenir shops along Bondi Beach as well as many neat places to eat. Allow yourself enough time to take the walk and enjoy the beach too.There are filtered water stations along the walk as well as bathrooms at the beach areas. Definitely wear sunscreen, especially when it's windy because you won't realize you're getting sunburned until it's a done deal! We were there around Xmas/New Year's so the walking path was very crowded...a bit frustrating to walk at your own pace.This is a great getaway from the Sydney CBD and doesn't cost much. A great day trip.

Stunning Views. This is a beautiful walk with many places to take great photos. The walk will take you a full afternoon or morning to complete, and there are places where the walk has a decent incline. If you are not ready to complete the entire walk, you can simply go a distance from Bondi and turn back around.

Beautiful views. This was our 2nd visit to Sydney and this is the only thing we decided to do for a 2nd time. We did the walk in fantastic weather on New Years Day and it was as good as we remembered. Yes, it was busy...but the views are so nice with lots of great photo opps. We were going to stop for a drink in Bronte but it was so busy we opted to sit on the park area in the shade with a sandwich. We caught the bus back from Coogee. Would recommend doing thus walk as it is easy, good paths etc.

Beautiful views. My husband and I spent a couple of hours meandering along this walk on a glorious late winters day. They views were quite spectacular and there were places along the way to sit and reflect on the views. A moderate level of fitness is required as there are quite a few stairs and steep inclines. There are also Cafes to stop and enjoy a coffee and bite to eat if you wish, p,us lovely sheltered coves for a dip should you desire

Spectacular coastal scenery . Sydney is at it's best at this time of year. The summer weather is perfect for this coastal walk which shows off Sydney's beaches and beautiful coastline. Can get crowded in some parts on the weekend but be patient and you'll be rewarded with a great day out and expansive coastal views. Less crowded during the week. A relatively easy walk if you take your time, even if you opt for the whole walk to Coogee and back to Bondi. One of Sydney's best walks in my view, even if you only do part of it.
A jewel of a walk. Truly a fantastic walk along the for shore. Plenty of great spots to stop and have great coffees and food.

This is a beautiful walk but tough on little legs. This walk is stunning. It takes you all along the coastline & the views out to sea are gorgeous. Well signposted & well used it is easy to navigate. Good pubs & breakfast spots at either end to reward yourself after your little trek. Would highly recommend for adults & non-whinny 5yr+ kids
Lovely walk with beautiful views. I took the walk twice as it was so nice. :DGreat views, great photo opportunities.Of course crowded, but what else can you expect from such a beautiful trail?!

Spectacular!. You can't visit Sydney without doing this easy walk. The beaches, the rock formations, the surf, the cliff dwellings, the rock platforms ... it's what characterizes Sydney and what sets it apart from the whole rest of the world. I come from Sydney originally but have lived away for over 30 years now, and I do this walk or one of the lesser-known harbour/ocean walks every time I come home. Start at Bondi (drive & park for a fee, or take a train to Bondi Junction, then a bus down to Bondi beach), walk around to Tamarama, then to Coogee, stopping and eating along the way at Tamarama Beach then continuing on. The take a bus to almost anywhere you need from Coogee. Or just go as far as Tamarama if time is tight, and walk back to Bondi directly through the streets instead of back around the ocean pathway. And if you do take the pathway back again, stop at the Bondi Icebergs and take a dip in their historic pools, or just have a coffee there and watch the waves, swimmers, yoga devotees, or the clouds rolling by.

Great way to get a workout and a virw. We enjoy our walks and this would have to rank among the best. The crowds on Jan 2 made it feel more like the Long March in China but it was fun to hear the different languages en route. For older people or those with joint problems, please note this walk is graded as medium due to the stairs that need to be negotiated. On a hot day I can highly recommend a break in Bronte for an iced coffee.

Beautiful coastal walk. An absolute must-do in Sydney! The walk is beautiful and rather easy. If you happen to feel tired you won't have to go all the way to Coogee (or Bondi) since you can stop at Brontë beach where a bus will take you back to the city. It's really worth it
Love this walk!. I actually have done the walk twice (in a couple of months). I just love the views, the beaches etc. It's not a very difficult walk.

Bronte to Bondi. We chose to do part of the Bondi to Coogee walk and walked the Bronte to Bondi leg both ways .The walk was challenging in places with several steep stairs to negotiate but the effort was worthwhile with stunning views and scenery to take in along with the many beautiful houses to envy ,all in a great walk.

Seriously Stunning Cliff/Beach walk near Sydney. One of the very few negative reviews I could find on this site about this hike (and I was surprised to find any) claimed the following: "Lovely views but there is only so much sea to look at before it gets repetitive." Point very well taken and my view exactly. If all you want to see is the sea, this will get very repetitive- and perhaps you may want to avoid this incredible coastal sea hike- past beautiful surf beaches and scenery at every turn. If repetition is your thing, however, this hike will more than satisfy! Highly recommended.

Lovely walk - more strenuous than we'd thought... Having found the Sydney Bridge climb less strenuous than we thought, the 10km amble along the Bondi to Coogee beach walk was the opposite! Quite a lot of steps up and down - but the views were lovely.. Well worth the trip.

Picturesque walk/run. Whether you start at Coogee or Bondi, this is a gorgeous walk,stroll or run along the coast. Well marked and easy to follow, the views are fantastic, as are the beaches along the way. It gets a little busy on public holidays but still a joy, and if you end up in Bondi, get a beer at Icebergs which has the best view of the beach possible.

Must try Coastal walk. My children and I walked this beautiful coastal walk, I must say that is Aussie's proud!!!❤️❤️❤️❤️It is not easy to describe what a fantastic feeling once you walked on the coastal line!!We have been to other countries' coastal walk, recently we went to Vancouver city Coalwalk, we've also been to Victoria BC harbour walk. In the past, we love walk around the lake in Queenstown, and so many other countries , there is no any other place can compare with Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal walk!!! Come and join everyone, walk here!!!By the way, just a reminder for orderly people, there are many stairs, may not be good idea to go through whole lots, but partial walk is still OK to look at the view!!
Lovely walk. Definitely worth doing, not very strenuous and well worth the views. We did Coogee to Bondi and had a swim as a reward at the end at Bondi.

Breathtaking! . Ignore the heat! Forget the pain! This walk will make you feel alive no matter how tired you are. The waves, the blue water, the smiles on people's places... everything reminds you that there are places on earth that deserve to be called - PARADISE

Breathtaking!. Prior to this, I've done the spit bridge to manly walk which I very much enjoyed but this walk really blew me away. The scenery attractions are absolutely breathtaking!! Highly recommended! Be sure to carry sunscreen :)

Great walk. Lovely two hour coastal walk. Recommended. Lovely beaches and swimming spots along the way. Nice restaurants to enjoy and we enjoyed a nice lunch at Coogee. Easy bus access to and from city.

Amazing walk. My friend and I hiked this route while in Sydney. We took a bus from the city center to the starting point in Coogee, very easy, then followed the signs. Much of the walk was spectacular, overlooking cliffs and beautiful beaches. We stopped at a beach about 2/3s of the way to Bondi and swam--amazing and although well-populated, not over crowded. I loved watching people play with their dogs in the surf.
A lovely scenic walk. You can walk from Bondi to Coogee in less than 45 minutes. It is very scenic and you get to see the ocean and all the different beaches on the way. A great excercise walk to do.

Great walk. Our daughter-in-law recommended this walk while staying with them,she suggested we do coogee to bondi as this way round was easier walk.So off we all went,very easy walk with gorgeous scenery as we're not avid walkers we did manage nearly 10 miles in all,keeping fit on our hols.Looking forward to planning our next walks for next week.

Scenic walk!. It's a must-do if you have some time to spare in Sydney. Can get quite crowded with the regular runners and dog walkers. But if you time it during mid-day then that would be ideal. Soak up the scenic views from a height and there are quite a few bays along the walk, if you feel like a swim.

Wonderfull Beatiful Walk. More to Bondi than the Beach, The track goes past the swimming Pool and climbs up to the top of the cliffs with stunning views of Bondi beach and the Cliffs and Blue Ocean with boiling seas. It's not a long walk but a magnificent one.
Beatiful. When you are in Sydney this is a walk you need to do. Beautiful views, a cemetery right at the Oceanside and natural swimming pools. It is about 6 or 7 km and you can do it easy going.
Stunning!. Absolutely stunning walk, so many beautiful beaches here and fabulous views! It does take a little while, nothing too strenuous though. Very easy to navigate

Amazing walk with fantastic views. We are first time visitors to Sydney with family who live on the Gold Coast. They joined us. We were recommended the walk by another friend and it did not disappoint. We got the bus from the City out there and then took our time, stopping and having a swim on the way. A great way to see the area and get a feel for the place. Getting back was hectic but the bus did the job as well.

beautiful walk. We were recommended this walk during a tour of Sydney (Free tours Sydney) and we absolutely loved it! The guide was right it gave us a look at the local beaches and the beauty of the ocean.

Don't miss this walk. Bondi Beach is world renown for it's natural beauty and surfer culture and is well worth a visit on its own. But make an effort to make time to walk the cliff walk from Bondi to Coogee Beach. We were fortunate enough to do the walk during the Beach Sculpture exhibit with at least 100 sculptures placed along the walk. But even without the exhibit, it is well worth the walk for the spectacular views of the beaches you pass. If you are going in the summer (or on any sunny day), be sure to wear a hat and bring water. It will get very hot.

Sun and sites on a beautiful coastal walk!. I've had friends who have raved about this walk--and they were right! It is a beautiful walk--just be sure to bring plenty of suntan lotion and water -- the heat can be brutal and while there are some options for picking up a bottle of water, you won't find much shade!

What a truly delightful way to enjoy the Day...Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk. Getting to Bondi from the CBD via the bus is a excellent way to see parts of Sydney. Be sure to get an Opal Card. Traveling on Sundays for only AUD 2.50 per person is an incredible way to utilize Sydney's Public Transport, Hats off to Sydney for making this special fare allowance on Sundays! Remember to enjoy lunch and coffee at the Bondi Beach area.
Great walk on a beautiful day. What better way to spend a beautiful summer afternoon than doing this outstanding walk. Excellent views of our beautiful coastline.

Sculptures at the beach. Upon our arrival to Sydney we were in time to see the Scuplture in the park at Boni Beach. It was our introduction to Sydney. We walked along Bondi Beach early Sunday morning and as well as the sculpture we saw the Little Nippers(young children on the beach participating in various beach activities). The views of the beach were breathtaking and accessible to the public.

Beautiful. This was almost the first thing we did in town. It's a beautiful walk along the coast line. People are very active here and are running/walking and it's very inspiring to become active. Can get busy.

Breathtaking!. A great way to spend a few hours! The views are nothing short of spectacular and the walk itself is not at all strenuous (even with a 7 year old). If you're looking for a true hike, this is NOT the experience, but a beautiful way to peacefully take in the sights.

Such an amazing walk. The walk was FANTASTIC! The view was great and I really enjoyed the walk. It really is a must! Make sure you wear lots of sunscreen and also just take in the views. Society is very much focussed on selfies these days, but you really need to soak the atmosphere in.. this is one of my regrets (yep - I am the selfie addict). Also if you like wine, have a vino at Icebergs before you start the journey.. another great place to be!

Spectacular Vistas. Took bus from Sydney to Coogee Beach and started coastal walk there towards Bondi (about 4miles walk). Beginning of trail not obvious in Coogee, but knowing that the trail hugs the coast you can pick it up at the northern end of the beach, top of hill. Take the time to absorb the scenery rather than just to get your exercise, you won't be disappointed. Path is uneven in sections along with inclines and declines. This not a multiuse trail (no bikes). Bring along a backpack with bathing suit, towel, snacks and water bottle and you can stop at the multiple beaches you will pass. Facilities at many of them. Not a strong swimmer? Some inlet beaches are very calm. You can also swim in ocean pools; Bondi Beach charges you a fee but Bonte Beach does not. You will pass a Lawn Bowls club - stop in and see if you can learn to play. Worth walking on this path more than once, but vary time of day to enhance experience.
AMAZING!. This was the most scenic beautiful walk I have ever done! Make sure you do it!! It was beautiful and so much fun!

Great coastal walk. We took a bus from Circular Quay to Coogee (approx 40 mins) costing AD 25 for 3 people. The walk to Bondi took approximately 1 hr 30 mins and this included several stops for photo opportunities.The scenery along this coast is spectacular with large waves crashing in the coastline.The walk is not particularly strenuous although more difficult in the heat.We thought the Bondi finish was ideal to enjoy this iconic beach. The weather was great and waves on Bondi good fun to negotiate in the knowledge that the beach is so well patrolled.A great way to spend a day in Sydney.
Better than the beach. If you are somehow tricked into thinking bondi beach is amazing, and find it as disappointing as I did (as a beach lucky Novocastrian) then this trail will redeem the journey
Good walk . This wonderful walk is worth to visiting. The view is amazing and starting from Bondi there are a lot of bars and restaurants for having a break.
very great walk view. It took about an hour walking trail and you can take pictures, the beach is very clean and nice. I have to say there are a lot of great spot taking pictures.

A must if you are visiting Sydney. The Coastal Walk is one of those walks that is truly great. Natural beauty, the beaches, cafes along the way. It does have stairs and is not a flat walk - the walk provides some exercise as well. The great thing is you don't notice the exercise because it's so beautiful!

Guaranteed amazing views - no matter the weather! . Coogee to Bondi. Bondi to Coogee. Either way, you are guaranteed amazing views, exercise and fresh air and all for FREE! Though you can drop a few bucks and grab a coffee on the way! Rain or shine this walk will always give you many a selfie opportunity! With amazing cliff lines, surging oceans and of course people spotting, it's a walk all can enjoy - well maybe not oldies with walking sticks - but they can hang at a coffee shop!! I can talk forever - this free attraction is THE BEST!
Amazing and natural. Amazing place for escape from accelerated life, work pressure and traffic and.Its so natural and prefect for couples or families.

Breath taking . This 10km walk is nothing short from breath taking. This is the 3rd time for us and it never gets boring. Easy enough to anyone that likes walking, this trail offers amazing ocean views, plenty of great stops along the way and fairly easy rolling hills with a few stairs very now and then. Tamara and Bronte are our favourite beaches. It tools us an easy 2.5 hours and at the end I recommend stopping at the Coogee bite cafe. If you stay in the city, bus 333 from the Circular Quay will take you to Bondi beach and 373 will take you back from Coogee.
Amazing views. A very easy walk that takes you from Bondi to a few nice little bays. Along the way you get some breathtaking views of the pacific

Amazing views!!. This walk is incredible, would highly recommend it! Very few spots that I would say could challenge folks...its a hike, but nothing too strenuous! Great spots to stop and lay on sand or rock, or simply take in the view. Do bring water!
nice view. Nice view here, and of course a must to visit when in sydney. but a bit overrated, if you ask me, too trendy

Such an amazing walk. Doesn't get much better than this walk. Amazing coast line. Love all that Bondi offers & then there are all the little surprise beaches along the walk to Coogee. So much history in the cemetery. Take hat, water & comfy walking shoes so you can enjoy. Easy return on bus if neef be. A wonderful way to experience a beautiful part of our great coastline.
Famous coast walk in the world!. Famous coast walk in the world!It's a must to do in the list when you visit Sydney, especially in a nice sunny day!

Nice, easy Walk. The walk from Bondi to Cogee is easy to do. Whilst it is a long walk, there are plenty of stop offs on the way and there is a footpath so you can easily do it in your flip flops/sandals.Excellent views and a brilliant opportunity to see nicer and smaller beaches compared to Bondi

No better way to experience the Eastern Beaches. My husband and I do this walk on a regular basis and it never gets old. If you can avoid periods over Christmas or 'scultures by the sea' it will be a much more pleasant experience as the crowds flock at these times.

Nice walk, lunch, walk and taxi home. Take your Uber app then when youve walked far enough hail an Uber to take you home! We usec the hop on bus from the city but Uber home, worked a treat, was only $22 back too!

Nice beach walk. Nice walk around the eastern beaches of Sydney. Heard it's rather crowded on weekend so try to do it during weekdays. Some nice small stories along the way. A lot of people using it to go running, so be alert not to be run over.

Best walk. When visiting my daughter we do this walk several times. It is a beautiful walking/running path along the ocean. The views are breathtaking and the walk is not too difficult except for the many steps along the way. Just about to go out now and do it again now!

Pretty Nice Walk. If you do this walk make sure you have your camera as the views are absolutely stunning. It is certainly a very up and down walk so a good pair of walking shoes I would say are a must along with plenty of water as there is no shelter from the sun and it can be extremely hot even in March when we were there.

Amazing vistas at every twist and turn. Gave it 4 instead of 5 stars as we only walked the Tamarama-Bondi section. This section alone was worth 5 stars and is a relatively easy and quick walk for those with less time (me) and less able. Finished the walk with a lovely breakfast overlooking Bondi Beach. Getting there can be difficult but with 3 people it was worth getting a taxi to Tamarama and a taxi back from Bondi. Don't do the other way as taxis and transport is hard to access at Tamarama. The walk itself is absolutely wonderful - every twist and turn in the walk provides another fantastic vista and photo opportunity with people walking, jogging and generally exercising throughout the walk's length (admittedly we walked on a Sat morning). Walk goes past the lovely ocean pool just as you hit Bondi. Definitely worth doing.

Bring your camera, take your time. We took the local bus from downtown Sydney to Bondi and after just chilling on the boardwalk a bit, began our 5K walk to Coogee. It took us a few hours to stroll, sit on the benches provided here and there and marvel at the coastal scenery; surfers, swimmers in the iceberg pools, sun bathers, locals playing games, dogwalkers, and cemetary gazers. Wear comfortable shoes, bring a charged camera, and water as you go up and down steep steps a lot.
Beautiful. A must do in Sydney! The whole walk is beautiful. Take in the fresh air and stunning view in one of my favorite seaside walks.

Simply stunning. This walk is a must while staying in Sydney.If your going to do it in summer either go early or later in the day as it does get quite hot and hilly or keep it shorter and just walk Bondi to Bronte rather than Bondi to Coogee. If you don't want to walk back it's possible to catch a bus back to your starting point or back into the city.You could also catch a bus to either Coogee or Bronte to start and walk to Bondi to finish...Bring swimmers as their are lots of beaches and bays to cool off in and good local Cafes to have something to eat and drink.Clovelly has good snorkelling with tropical fish and the resident blue groper to see.

Beautiful and breezy. I was able to finish this walk much faster than the maps and tourist information signs had estimated it would take. There are bus services from Coogee and Bondi beach so if you walk it you can pick up a bus to the city. It was very windy the day I went so I was pretty cold and wish I wore a wind-proof jacket although it was Sydney's summertime. Overall it was a beautiful walk and a great path if you want to run it, with only a few hills and staircases to conquer.

Wonderful easy walk. You can start your walk at either Bondi or Coogee and both are easy access from the city by bus. Everyone says that Bondi is the best,l but I prefer Tamarama, Bronti and Clovelly, they are just as good as or even better that the crowded areas around Bondi. Clovelly is a beautiful little enclosed bay, safe swimming for all the family from either the sand or the Prom. The cafe serves nice food and a great place to break the walk. The walk through the Waverley Cemetery is interesting and very old with spectacular views.

A must for all tourists and great for locals who enjoy exercising. I love this walk! It is so picturesque. There are some stairs and hills but don't let that put you off! Take your time, soak up the atmosphere. Its so beautiful

Run, walk or photograph... fantastic with either option. Whether your enjoying this walk at sunrise, sunset or in the heat of the day, it is beautiful and a must for tourists and locals alike. It does get busy in the warmer months and during 'Sculptures by the Sea', so if you're planning on doing this walk as exercise, go early or late.Plenty of food and drink options along the way, or take a picnic and take your pick of the many locations to take in the view.

Great walk and beautiful scenery. Take the time to do this walk when visiting Sydney. Absolutely stunning! The coastal walk is worth the time, took us about 3 hours, but we took our time to explore the areas a bit. You also walk past the most beautiful cemetery, what a view! Highly recommend walk this during your visit.

Best beach walk.. The path is paved all the way. There are several different beachs you can walk too. There are penty of places to stop and have lunch. The crowd of walkers get fewer after a couple of miles. The path goes further. We saw some marine life in the tide pools

Strenuous not for the infirm. Excellent walk ,great views ,however,there are steep steps and as one would expect from a coastal/cliff walk there are also significant gradients.The walk can be very busy in both directions but with good stopping points at either Tamarama or Bronte well worth the effort.If you do not want the return walk think carefully how you will get back to Bondi although there is an excellent bus service.We also did this walk during sculptures by the sea .....fantastic experiences but extremely busy.
beautiful walk. Sydney is walking heaven and this Bondi to Cogee Beach Coastal walk is beautiful, as well as the walk from Manly Beach to Shelley Beach.

Excellent Work Out. I recently undertook this walk and forgotten how hilly it gets towards Coogee. Would definitely recommend people not to undertake this walk on a hot day as it was quite taxing for that part. The pavement was in excellent condition. There were great views and was an excellent work out.

An Easy and Entertaining Stroll. One of the best days in Sydney, breakfast in Bondi followed by a nice stroll to Coogee along iconic coastline, witnessing dolphins playing in the surf and finishing with lunch in Coogee.
Excellent walk . Excellent walk with stunning views , but can be a bit busy at times. Coggee is my favourite beach , not so crowded and more intimate.

Coast and coffee heaven. There is something special about the coast. And here in Sydney there are some beautiful sections. Rock steps, cliffs, lovely coves, hardy headlands, neat and sunny beaches, and water in view almost all the time.The section between Bondi and Coogee is really great for grabbing some fresh air and enjoying some exercise.
