The path is undulating with some steeper sections but it's manageable for most people. If you struggle with steps or slopes then it may not be for you.I've walked the route in both directions. It doesn't matter where you start. I guess if you've not been to Bondi you may want to start in Coogee so you get the impact of your first view as you turn the last headland.The beauty of the route is you can choose to do as much or as little as you like. Probably 1.5 to 3 hours one way, depending on your walking speed and how often you stop for a rest, photos or refreshments.Take a sunhat, suncream, sunglasses, a bottle of water and some cash for coffee with you. There are drinking fountains at some points along the route you can make use of, too. Take your time, especially if it's your first experience of this route. There are some obvious points where you may want to stop and take in the views of the waves crashing against the rocks below or see surfers in action (eb Bronte).Coogee has one of the larger beaches and it's a gentle starting point for your walk. Plenty of options to get anything you need before you set off. The coastal route is pretty easy to find and keep to. If unsure, just follow the crowd or ask. Past Gordon's Bay, with boats lined up just below the path, it's a short walk to Clovelly.Clovelly has a small beach and a lifeguard-patrolled inlet of water. Very popular with families. It's a lovely little spot. There's a cafe and takeaway kiosk here, too. With toilet facilities. A handy pitstop should you need it.Parts of the path now have dedicated walkways. Less fun than the exposed rock tops below but probably a lot safer.Passing a large hillside cemetery, you reach Bronte. There's a popular beach, some parkland and for surfers some decent waves when the sea is right. Overlooking these is a road lined with cafes and eateries. Take your pick. There are some good ones there, usually pretty busy, too.Tamarara is the next main point towards Bondi. A small beach. Am told the surf can get quite rough here. You may notice that on your wanderings from the safety of the headland. Again, some good cafe choices here.Bondi has a certain kudos and mystique, yet it's not my favourite beach. It is worth seeing. It's a wide sweep of a circular bay with an inviting stretch of sand. A mecca for backpackers from around the world, it's a place heavily geared up for tourists, not always on a budget.A great walk for the early morning or late afternoon. Just be aware that the weather can change quite quickly. Clouds can build up and afternoon thunderstorms in the summer can be short but very sharp, even with hail. Check the forecast before you go.
Stunning views. Beautiful walk. Stop for a photo or powerwalk your way through! Go early before the crowds! Good for solo, couples, families or take your dog for a walk.

Spectacular views!. What an amazing two hour walk along the coastline. I started at Coogee Beach and walked to Bondi Beach. Easy bus ride to Coogee from Circular Quay and then I rode the bus from Bondi to Watsons Bay for a great ferry ride back to the Rocks area. Perfect hike for a morning. The scenery along the coast is spectacular.

Makes you want to exercise.. Spectacular view and a great opportunity to people watch. It's a magnificent introduction to a number of beach suburbs that make this city great. It's thoroughly enjoyable. NB Stairs!

Just stunning!. This walk was one of our favorite things we did in Australia. It was just so breathtakingly beautiful. It is clearly marked along the way so there is no confusion where you are going. The public bus transportation was very easy to use to get from Sydney to Bondi and then back to Sydney from Coogee. Make time in your trip for this walk!

Soak in the views. Must do outdoor activity for visitors and locals. Started from Bondi at sunrise and finished with breakfast at Coogee. Enjoyed the beautiful views and the breeze. Lots of photo opportunities. Easy access via public transport.
Incredible walk. If you see the sky is blue and the sun is shining, then this costal walk is perfect. Incredible views of the cliffs and Bondi. One of the best things to do in Sydney

Impressive views. A must do for tourists looking for stunning views of the coast. The walk passes through many different beaches and coves. Good for both joggers and those who prefer take it slow. Was one of the highlights of my trip.

Rock pools, pounding oceans and parks see why the locals love sydney. This walk is one of Sydney's special things. It's free and the walk makes you feel alive with the bracing clean air, and your eyes get a visual feast. The path is wide and is well marked. Note although suitable for families and people of all ages It is up and down the coast line for around 3 to 4 kilometres and there are stairs. Prob not suitable for wheelchairs. There are parks with kids play equipment, rock pools, beaches and cafe along the way. Toilet blocks are located at the beach. Last week in oct to end of first week in November the walk way has sculpture by the sea with artists from all over the world competing . Perfect in the morning for runners.

Stunning views . Beautiful walk with breathtaking scenery. Found Bondi busy and geared for tourists but beaches along the walk were quieter. Lonely Planet said it would take 3 hours but we did it in half the time.
Stunning. I was very jealous of joggers on this route... wow! With views like that it might tempt me out jogging every now and then! Really stunning walk and not difficult if you are average fitness.
Lovely walk. Beautiful walk. So worth doing. Took runners which were comfortable. Stunning views. Swam in water at Bondi. So refreshing.

Must do part of Sydney visit. This is a must do part of our holidays to Sydney. A beautiful part of the world. We generally arrive at Bondi then walk south for as long as we can manage then find a bus to take us home.
Wow!. Stunning walk. I started from Coogee (took the 373 bus from Elizabeth Street in the CBD) and walked to Bondi Beach. There are plenty of places to swim along the way.

Either Way It Is A Great Walk. We did this walk in the reverse direction by taking the bus to Coogee, then walking to Bondi. We then stayed on Bondi Beach before returning by bus to the city centre. Either way the views are fantastic, so keep remembering to look back as well as forward. You pass several other beaches and coves along the journey and most of these have somewhere to stop and eat.

Great walk even on a cloudy day!. We enjoyed this walk in early March. The weather was not idea, but the sites and beaches were still well worth it! I would definitely recommend it. You find lots of secluded beaches as well, away from the hustle and bustle of Bondi!
Stunning. Breathtaking views, beautiful beaches and a good way to enjoy Sydney's coast. You can start from Bondi or from Coogee. It is a way nicer on sunny days.

Love this walk!. We'd have done this walk several times - stopping along the way for coffee, a swim, lunch at Coogee bay hotel or Bondi icebergs club - either way there is beautiful views and awesome food.

9to5explorer: 5*+++ walk, do it in reverse. As many have said, it's a great, great walk, and easy for all. I prefer it in reverse. Especially if you haven't seen Bondi before, that way you get a thrill of the reveal when you come round the final headland. You can easily get public transport to and from both from the CBD. Also pack your bathers. There's a really nice swimming spot off the rocks, with easy access ladders, coming out of Coogee.
Don't skip this walk!. Amazing views! Even if you don't do the entire walk, at least start to get an amazing vantage point of Bondi Beach!

Beautiful - and it's FREE. My family loved this walk. We got off the hop on/ hop off bus and began the walk from Bondi beach. The main beach is beautiful, and the artwork along the walk was fun to take pictures with. The walk itself is laid out really well. You get to see all the different formations along the coastline and it's just beautiful. The beach is the beach, but the rocks and just the way the water shaped the coast is quite stunning. It's amazing that this walk is part of one of the largest cities. Good job Sydney, for preserving some of your greatest spots for the public to enjoy!

Beautiful, easy, fun!. I loved this walk! It's an easy cliff walk, very easy to navigate and takes you past and through several beaches. I went on an overcast day and it was still lovely. On a blue sky day it would be gorgeous. Highly recommended.

Amazing coastal walk from Bondi to Coogee Beach.... The Bondi to Coogee coastal walk combines six beaches and a number of coves and bays, rockpools, parks and spectacular coastal views. Also, the walk passes by the beautiful historic Waverley Cemetery on top of sandstone cliffs and rock platforms. It was a great walk offering plenty to see along the way.

Should be No.1. The Bondi to Coogee walk is beautiful. We went Coogee to Bondi though and I was so glad we did as the Sculpture by the Sea exhibition at Bondi meant that section was heaving. It's not too tough of a walk and there are loads of benches and beaches to stop at.

Awesome Walk. Check the weather first before attempting this walk. Paved track so no need fancy hiking shoes... and ah-mazing view. Easy walk, beautiful scenery. We bussed to Coogee then walked to Bondi. Took the bus to Watson Bay then ferry back to the city. Love the ferry rides too.

Walk with Scenic Views. this walk is a wonderful costal walk which is very easy to access. I started at the Coogee end and it took about 2 and a half hours to reach Bondi. The scenery was stunning with lots of small bays and inlets as well as costal shrubs. There are great cafes at both ends with some along the route as well. Bringing swimmers and a towel as well as sunscreen and water are essential.

Oh that magnificent view!. If you consider walking from Coogee to Bondi (or the vice-versa), do it in the early morning or later in the afternoon (read here after 5 pm in summer). In this case you will not be sweating all the time and you will avoid the risk of being sun-burnt. Though applying sunscreen is still a very good idea! The walk itself is not hard at all and can be enjoyed by people of all ages as long as you love the beach, coastal line and the uninterrupted view of the ocean. It is great all year round! Not to mention, that you can enjoy swimming right after the walk or grab some snacks at Bondi pavilion, enjoy a glass of sparkling wine at Iceberg or have a dinner at one of Bondi's cafes :)

Lovely but busy. This came highly recommended. We started st Bindi and followed the walk to Bronte beach Oman overcast Thursday morning. So had half of Sydney by the look of it!! The views were spectacular and got better as we progressed and the weather cleared. Bondi is crowded but Bronte was really lovely. We enjoyed a dip at the end and particularly in the rock pool. Not as good as I was expecting but nice to do

Exhilarating Walk, Splendid Walkway. Fantastic. After getting off the Hop On Hop Off Bus at one end of the Bondi Beach we strolled along the length of the Beach taking in the beautiful Pacific Ocean, the surfers, the sun and the vastness. At the other end, where the public washrooms are located, the Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk commences. This winding, undulating walkway is a great venue for strollers, walkers, joggers, people looking for some quietude, and even an occasional friends group sitting with drinks on the rocks. The walkway is dotted with several exercising facilities, such as step ups and bars where you could do a host of calisthenics. Nice to see the authorities spend public money wisely for public good. Many countries could learn. The Bondi to Coogee walk is quite long mainly because of the many short climbs up and down the paved way. It's exhilarating and another must-do. We went a little over half the way before turning back to Bondi beach where we boarded a public bus to Bondi Junction to catch a train back to our hotel. A beautiful evening -- exactly a month back to the day as I write this -- when there was daylight until 8 pm.

Scenic - good to do. Very pleasant walk around the coast with scenic views and several beaches along the way. Some quite steep steps in places. Can get busy at times but not overcrowded the two times I was there.
Great Coastal Scenery. A great walk along some stunning coastal scenery. The walk isn't too long and not too difficult to complete. Both beaches are great to swim at too.

Simply a MUST!. We began at Coogee and walked to Bondi: the most breathtaking way to experience the coast and exercise at the same time! We were in love with Sydney, but after this walk and experiencing the life just outside the city, we want to live here! You can make a day of it and stop at all the beaches :)

An absolute must on a nice day. Scenic views, you can stop at the various beaches along the way. Tamarama is my favorite but the waves are brutal. Bronte has a nice area where you can enjoy the ocean water without being in the ocean.

Interesting easy walk. Pleasant stroll along the coast path. Not exactly open country but it's all path rather than road which is impressive so close to a city. The walk can even be extended to Maroubra with only a brief diversion onto roads.Impressive scenery all the way if you can avoid paying too much atention to the "art" currently littering the route. Most of this looks like it has been borrowed from a kids playground (where it looks like anything at all that is ....)

Breathtaking scenic walk. A walk for anybodya couple of hints : take some water, wear walking shoes, take an umbrella and wear sunblock. When equipped like this you can expect a beautiful leisurely walk along wonderful clifftops. Its about 6 kms one way ,so be prepared for a 2-3 hour walk and some steps.

We do it every Saturday. We live in the most amazing place, the costal walk is something myself and my girlfriends never get tiered of. It's absolutely beautiful and a great chance to get some exersize in.If you're in Sydney, make sure you visit this walk.We do Coogee to Bronte - return, it takes about 2 hours as we stop for breakie at Bronte on our return route.Tip: take cash with you as they do not do split bills.

The best costal walk in Sydney. Well, I started this journey from the Iceberg restaurant, southern end of this world famous BONDI BEACH. Just about 10 minutes of walk I arrived at another small but very beautiful beach called TAMARAMA BEACH. The view from Tamarama beach is breathtaking and just after a short walk you will reach another beautiful beach called BRONTE BEACH. There are a few cafes and restaurant if you like to eat and rest. The walk from BRONTE BEACH to COOGEE BEACH is a bit long walk and you will definitely enjoy the view along CLOVELLY BEACH. You can certainly end your trip at clovelly beach if you are tired and catch Sydney Buses to connect to Bondi Junction or Central and Circular Quay in the city. If you are fit enough continue along the coastal walk and you won't even realized you are at COOGEE Beach.

Beautiful!!!!. We took it slow enjoying the lovely weather it took us about 2hours stopping for scenic pictures and to refill our water at the water stations. Definitely worth doing! The views are amazing

really nice walk but bring proper walking shoes.. Daughter and I took most of this walk, we went to McKenzie Bay. If you go off the walkway onto the rocks, I suggest wearing proper shoes. Plenty of places to take pictures along the way and do stop at Icebergs for a bite to eat and have a beer. Would do this walk again.

5km - Fantastic views!. Visited this coastal route during the sculptors by the sea exhibition. Brilliant installations if not somewhat packed with school kids at some points.I jogged the route and it is a very straightforward path. There are some serious steps towards the end but you pass some fantastic coves and beaches!A great 5km/3 mile walk suitable for all levels of fitness, not wheelchair accessible at all!
Lovely scenic walk with awesome views. Great walk and great scenery en route and Coogee has some nice bars for a nice cool drink afterwards! It's well worth it!

The best skywalk ever ! Better than stay just in the beach . No one can go back to the own country without do it . Take your best mood and positivity and your comfy shoes . Do not forget your camera ! Are you ready for having the best view of this city ? Go for it !

Bondi to Coogee -. I walked this very scenic walk few times already. once with a baby carrier and also with a prem and every time it was a rewarding lovely walk. it's got some stairs but it is mainly flat. The view is amazing and there are cafes and restaurants along the way.

Cliff-top stroll. Have done this walk a couple of times most recently during Sculptures by the Sea ( a must see if you are visiting Oct-Nov. The walk is easy and of course the views will use up a lot of your memory card...truly spectacular and encapsulate the ruggedness of the coastline. You can stop off at Tamarama, Bronte or Clovelly beaches along the way for a cooling dip or some great choices of food and drinks. If you fancy a bit of history research you can visit Waverley Cemetary on the way where many of Sydney's famous and infamous enjoy some pretty spectacular everlasting views. Finishing in Coogee with another fantastic beach and the Coogee Pavilion for a cold beer.

Sydney's own slice of the Mediterranian. This beautiful paved walkway winds its way from Bondi to Coogee, leading entranced followers around cliffed headlands and into golden sandy bays, wending along the boundary line between high density homes and apartments that cling precariously to the hilly eastern Sydney shores, and the open Pacific stretching to the horizon. The ever-changing mood of the ocean means no two visits are the same - varying from sunrise reds and silvers through to noon-time transparent azure; from millpond calm, through petulent grey, to wild and stormy. Opportunities for swimming, snorkellong or surfing abound; or perhaps picnics under shady gazebos may appeal, or beach playgrounds and rock pools for the kids. If you happen by in November, Sculptures by the Sea, along the Bondi to Tamarama secton, is a marvellous spectacle of the most outstanding of human sculptural art backdropped by the finest that nature has to offer. At one point, between Bronte and Clovelly, the coastal trail even passes through historic Waverley Cemetery, perched forbodingly on the sloping sandstone clifftop. Bus services frequent both the Bondi and Coogee ends of the walk, and various points inbetween.

Lovely walk with gorgeous view. We only completed about half the walk as we were too hungry. However, it was such a lovely experience and if I have another opportunity, I would definitely do it again. Gorgeous view!!! A must-do if you are in Sydney.

Iconically Sydney. This is a great walk and a must for any visitor (or resident) of Sydney with a few hours to spare. There is lots to see and do along the way, including cafes for food or a coffee. Take as long as you like or run it for a nice up and down workout.

Sculptures by the seaahuc!. Just seems to get better every year with thought provoking, inspirational and aesthetically beautiful works ! Food and great sunsets just add to the magic and the great collective spirit!!

choose a weekday over a weekend. The walk is stunning!! I recommend to go on a weekday instead a weekend to avoid crowds. Also - it's nicer to do the walk if it's not super hot. A sunny winter day is actually perfect! The walk is easy, but has some steps etc. in there. Take plenty of time to take photo's and have brunch or lunch either at Bondi or Coogee half way through the walk.

Excellent views all along and easy walk. This is the perfect Sunday morning walk with friends or family. The walk is quite short overall and clearly signed. It is easy to spot the start of the walk once you're by the beach, walk as if you were going to Bondi's iceberg swimmpool. You can also catch the bus from Coogee back to Sydney or walk back to Bondi. The views are spectacular!

Urban bushwalking. A beautiful walk along the coast. Magic views and lots of fun looking at all the amazing houses that some people are lucky enough to call home. The walk is on a pavement but has several short hills/stairs along the way. I parked in Coogee, 4 hours for $12 and walked up to Bondi for brekkie then back to Coogee. About 12kms that took us 3.5 hours including eating brekkie. We finished it off with a swim at Coogee (although the water is still pretty chilly!). There is basically no shade so go early or late and a hat and sunnies are essential!

Fantastic walk. Well this walk is a great way to enjoy the sea breeze and take in some great scenary. You will love this walk see some great surfers maybe whales or dolphins, the cockatoo's are always flying around.

Coastal Walk with beautiful beaches, graveyards and cliffs. When we decided to do this walk it was promising to be a very hot day but as this was the only day the two of us could do it together we decided to proceed. So we set off with bottled water, caps and covered in sunscreen. Thank goodness! as it turned out to be a 35 deg C day!!!This is an amazing walk and the only negative I would speak of would be that there was really no shade to speak of along the way. It was a great walking track but no trees shading any part of it. So.....be much wiser than we were on a hot day. We started off at Coogee Beach and walked towards Bondi. The beaches are truly beautiful - and each one of them incredibly different. My particular favourite was Gordons Bay - the water was that rich turquoise colour - so pretty!Bronte Beach was our lunch stop (we had planned to get to Bondi for lunch but because of the heat we really needed a rest and a bit of refreshment before we could continue). There were lots of cute eateries at Bronte and our lunch was yummy.As mentioned we were very glad of our water, caps and sun cream as they were necessary. It didn't take our water long to warm up as we walked but luckily there are filtered water taps along to path so we were able to fill up with cooler water as we travelled along.I would really recommend this walk but make a better decision when you walk than we did. If you do choose a hot day - at least walk in the cool of the morning or the evening.

Make sure you stop at the icebergs club all visitors welcome make you have your passport with you. Great views make sure you do the walk during the week.it gets extremely busy on the weekends.great stop at bronte beach lots of little cafes.try the Rockpool as the surf can be rough.
Walked the sea path. Busy at Bondi but gets less busy as you walk. Stopped for lunch on the way. Watch out for whales. Got the bus back to the city from Coogee.

A beautiful scenic walk linking two great beaches. Linking both Bondi & Tamarama beaches; its a beautiful walk in almost any weather; except a cold wet day (unless you love walking in the rain). Late Oct - early Nov is also when Sculpture by the Sea happens; with many sculptures placed along this walk. World class public art with entries from around the globe. Usually about 50- 60 sculptures. Accessible from the Southern end of Bondi beach or the Northern end of Tamarama, it's paved & has some great places to sit & enjoy the view in the sun. Accessible for people with disabilities - i've done this in a wheelchair & on crutches but if in a chair, you'll need someone to push a bit on any sections that might be a bit steep to manage on your own. Lots of accessible buses from the city to Bondi Beach as well.

Stunning. Well paved (although be prepared for stairs), this is a wonderful which I have done with my family a number of times. It can get quite windy sometimes but that's just part of the fun. Grab a coffee at the Coogee Beach cafe to get you started and then choose which cafe at Bondi will address you next fix (or maybe lunch). Summer or winter, this is a great walk.
Lee & Erica. This walk is a must if you are visiting Sydney. Beautiful scenery and great beaches to chill for a bit and have a dip in the ocean.

Do in reverse, Coogee to Bondi. Only so you can have refreshments at the famous Bondi Icebergs, no better place to sit, eat, drink, with one of the best views in the world. Try to do weekdays, as weekends get very busy.

This is an easy walk for most ages - I am lazy and unfit and found it no trouble - only a few stairs.. I had no idea this walk existed or how absolutely beautiful and amazing it is. We did it for Sculptures By The Sea which I can't recommend highly enough. Even if you are not interested in Art, as such, then the sheer imagination, engineering, effort and diversity cannot be ignored. This walk has been carefully planned to capture the beauty of this part of Sydney's coast line and is so very worthwhile I can't stress it highly enough. We spent 2 years on the road travelling Australia, and this little patch of pleasure is up there with the best.
Take a walk on the wild side..... Amazing views, a great walk and you get to see the true beauty of Sydney's eastern suburbs beaches...

Stunning views so close to Sydney city. I am a local Sydneysider but still am in awe of how beautiful this coastline walk is. I love stopping off at Gordon's Bay, Mackenzie's Bay, or Clovelly for a dip as well. A wonderful, healthy day out! Wear sunscreen and hat. There are water filling stations along the way to refill your water bottle and a few kiosks at Bronte and Tamarama as well as cafes at Bronte.
Must do walk. Whilst there are some stairs, they are not difficult to negotiate and the spectacular views provide an ample reward.

Amazing walk to see the beautiful eastern beaches. Incredible views, low fitness required - a must see for tourists in Sydnety. Lots of beaches to stop for swim along the way and also bars & restaurants - even shops if you want
Views. . Great way to spend a day. Views with a little exercise. Take water and your time. Go during the week as it's quieter. Well worth it.

This is one of the top coastal walks in the world.. This is a fabulous walk in any weather and you don't have to walk all the way. You can stop at Bronte for coffee or lunch and walk back the way you came or catch a bus back to Bondi Junction. Advise you to catch a bus to the start of your walk as parking can be expensive.
Nice walk. We had a really nice walk with a lot of options to go swimming! We really enjoyed it and the walk is not too long even if its quite hot.

Superb exhillarating walk. Walk fast walk slow...You decide..the vistas are many and never a dull moment..One way in and hour or two ways in 2 and a quarter hours...Plus coffe lunch or breakfast time....This is one of my favourites...do when 100 pieces of art are there.....You wont be disappointed.

Perfect Sydney Day. This is the most ideal way to spend your time. It's not challenging but it's a decent walk, it's always sunny and the water is a rich blue. From the start to finish i couldn't wipe the smile off my face, i did it with my family (all different fitness levels) and we finished with an ice cream on Bondi and it's still one of 'those days' that we all cherish immensely. If you're headed to Sydney, amoungst the plethora of other things to do, take some time out and give yourself afull day of walking and then sunbaking/relaxing on the beach. You won't regret it and you'll never forget it. :)

Ocean edge walk. Great views of iconic Bondi Beach and many others eastern suburb beaches. On the walk there are swimming areas,toilets and cafes. A little bit of history to found at the graveyard and public transport at either end of the walk. Lots of stairs and some uneven areas for those who have bad knees beware.

Ocean edge walk. Great views of iconic Bondi Beach and many others eastern suburb beaches. On the walk there are swimming areas,toilets and cafes. A little bit of history to found at the graveyard and public transport at either end of the walk. Lots of stairs and some uneven areas for those who have bad knees beware.

Great walk . Took a cab from CBD to Iceberg for Sunday Brunch then leisurely stroll to Coogee, relaxing, could have stopped for swim in sea pools but carried on to Coogee and drink and snack at Coogee Pavilion? And then cab back:great day out

Family Walk. Had an amazing walk from Bondi to Bronte, afraid breakfast at one of the gorgeous little cafe's was too inviting.
Amazing walk along the cliffs beautiful views easy walk breathtaking!

A walk in a million. My husband and I recently took the Bondi to Coogee walk while the kids were at their grandparents. The view was stunning, the sun was shining and we can't wait to do it again! What a great way to get exercise, we were enjoying the view so much we didn't even notice the effort.

Only if you are able to walk long distances. I would not encourage this if you are not a strong walker as it is quite a distance to walk. You will have to walk up and down some steep steps along the way but I definitely recommend this if you are abled. You get to see breath taking views of the beach from a distance and admire the coastal beauty of Australia as you go. There are many seats along the way where you can rest and filtered water to fill up your bottles in case you get thirsty. Do remember you will have to walk back to where you started. There is one or two bus stop at certain beach where you can take the bus if you do get tired but you have to check the bus number to see where it goes.
Fantastic Walk. Although a bit tricky to find parking here, the walk along the coastline was absolutely gorgeous. We really are the lucky country!
Chillax Baby !. 7km sounds tiring ! Boy oh Boy are you right.. But, the views are worth walking for ! Amazing way to relax and calm the mind but also exercise the body on a weekend with friends.

A great day out. A really fun day for the family. Take your time, and take your camera. We walked from Coogee to Bondi, had a nice lunch as reward for our kids (14, 12 and 10) for making the effort - and then walked back! Great day.

Coastal walk. One of my favorite place to take interstate and international friends. The view is stunning and it's also great for people watching. There are also cafe stops along the way if you want it to be a leisurely walk. You will also be tempted to swim along the way and if you end the walk at Bondi the pool is very inviting and so is the bar.

Spectacular . We started the walk in Clovelly and walked north to Bondi, we did it during winter and it was a thoroughly enjoyable experience. There are numerous water points that would be very handy in warmer weather and there are a few spots to get food along the way. We were watching for Whales out at sea and also stopped to watch the surfers at Tamarama Beach from the cliffs above. I'd highly recommend this walk to anyone visiting Sydney and who wants to get out of the city for half a day
Wonders on Earth. Amazing walk along the most iconic beaches of Australia. Take your time for a swim or some pictures!

Brilliant. Here on visit for business and have the weekend to kill. This walk was absolutely worth it. Not only is it beautiful but you also get to climb some rocks and find points for nice photos. Or selfies if you like. If you can handle walking long distances it is definitely something for your to-do list for visiting Sydney.

From Coogee to Bondi. Took a bus from CBD to Coogee and started walking from there. It was a long walk consisting a small portions of steep stairs. The walk took about three hours. Though it was almost 6.30pm when I reached there, there were still many beach revelers having great time at the beach. The view of the beach and cliffs are amazing. It is definitely worth a visit, away from the city.

When you want wonder and experience Sydney's unique beach views.. This once was a hidden walk for locals but the annual Art by the Sea has smashed records in attendance and interest in the area.Very easy to get to and the walk is fantastic for visitors and locals alike.Catch the 380 bus to Bondi beach from the city any where along Elizabeth Street and alight first stop when you see the beach.Cross the road and head southward along the path past the surf club building.Easy walk heaps to see and many more places to eat.Enjoy!
Best walk on the Eastern Suburbs. Beautiful walk, and goes past some the best beaches. Best to go when Sculptures by the Sea is running, or have lunch at Bondi Beach. Can't beat the views.

Walk early in the morning. Heartily agree with whoever said walk from Coogee to Bondi rather than vice versa. Actually we walked Bondi to Coogee, loved the views so much we walked Coogee to Bondi the next day! I say walk early in the morning since there is no shade.
fantastic walk. fantastic walk, gorgeous and beautiful,wish we lived there , take good sun screen and hat and glasses, worth every second
Awesome views!. This is a strenuous walk but well worth it! Don't try this walk unless you are healthy. The views are incredible!

Highlight of our trip. The hike from Coogee to Bondi was really memorable. We started early, before the sun got too strong. The entire trail is paved-- so don't bring hiking poles. There are a lot of hills and stairs, so it might be too strenuous for some. The walk took us less than 2 hours and we stopped for breakfast at bondi when we finished.

A great way to see some of Sydneys beautiful beaches.... Reasonable level of fitness required as there are a lot of steps in places and a few large hills..Allow a couple of hours and stop at the beaches for a swim or a snack...Bondi, Bronte, Clovelly and Coogee are beautiful as is Waverley Cemetry..a view to die for..Try and avoid this walk on very hot or windy days as there is little or no shelter...
Great walk. Wonderful especially on a great day. Wonderful beaches, areas to swim or surf, or just enjoy the great sights. Not difficult although some elevation changes.

Pleasant walk with beautiful views. The best time to do this walk is in October when the sculptures by the Sea exhibition is open, but it's a great stroll/gentle walk pretty much any time.
Even if you're not very fit you can probably manage this one. It meanders along the edge of the ocean with fantastic views up and down the coast.
Amazing!. This is a must do for stunning views of the coast and crystal clear waters. Be warned there are a lot of hills and steps but it is totally worth it! Do not leave sydnty without doing this!

Beautiful Scenic Coastal Walk. I do this walk several times, every time I visit Sydney. They have done a lot of work to the paths of this walk. They are very safe, and manageable, although still maybe a little steep in some areas. As my title suggests, it is a beautiful scenic coastal walk. Do it for yourself, and see what I mean. Enjoy.
Quick and Easy. Great walk and run. Can be only 3 miles if you turn around at Bronte from Bondi. Quite a few runners on trail, but never so crowded it became difficult to keep your pace.

The coastal walk as only Sydney can do. Take your walking shoes, water and a hat. The walk is spectacular and actually goes down beyond Coogee to Lurline Bay, some areas are wheelchair accessible, others are definitely not. There is interpretive signage along the way providing interesting historical, environmental and social information.

Wonderful easy beautiful. Not to be missed. Fairly easy walk with some grade and stairs. All paved. Stunningly beautiful winding walk above the beaches and rocks. In Sydney for 1 week from US. Worth the time. Took about 3 hours including travel from 4 seasons. Cabbed it there about $50. Took bus back for about $4 each. Bus was easy, clean, safe but slower.
Nicest walk south of the harbour. Very nice and easy walk. Very beautiful views especially Tamarama beach and the arrival towards Coogee.

Beautifk. We took our dog for a walk along the coastline and it was absolutely beautiful. Walking through a park with a cafe and you could even pop in for a swim at the beach. We loved it. We can't wait for our new puppy to be vaccinated to take her there.

Stunning coastline views!. The walk is easy we either park the car at one end walk to the other then bus back.....it hets very busy on holidays and weekends, mid week the best....apart from the little beaches you encounter there is the grave yard on the cliff edge....everyone should do the walk it is great!

Very beautiful beaches. A great to go surfing or walk around shopping and many good restaurants, it is a little hard finding parking but the transportation in Sydney is very good, the Coogee beach hotel is also a nice place to grab a cold beer
Beautiful!. One of my favourite walks!! Nearly as good as the cliff walks in Cinque Terre, Italy. Be careful and don't go too close to the edges though. Love love love!

A Sydney must do. If you have only one day in Sydney I suggest you start your day with this walk at the beautiful Bondi beach. Fantastic views, not too long and you get to see the best of Sydney beaches. There are many places where you can just sit down and savour the scenery. It takes about 2-3 hours and the trek is pretty decent not too bumpy or steep so anyone can do this. I have done it twice and cant wait to go on and do it again!

Very Enjoyable Walk. I completed this walk a few months ago found the walk very enjoyable and would definitely recommend if ,Sydney has many lovely walks even though this is not my favourite still a good walk the problem is it is to popular and to many people walk the track so would recommend the week days when most people are working

An amazing time enjoying the coastal sights!. We started on the Coogee Beach side and worked our way back to Bondi as we wanted to end up at the Sculptures by the Sea event. The hike itself was pretty hilly and definitely requires some physical fitness to complete. We enjoyed the little harbors and beaches around each new section. Some of the views just take your breath away! Strongly encourage you to do this walk if you have a couple of days in Sydney.

Coastal Walk. Great walk with fabulous ocean views and local beaches from Cooggee to Bond only 1 1/2 hours paced walking. Snorkeling at Clovelly ocean pool along the way. Each beach has an ocean pool. Cafe stops for yummy food and beverages
Wonderful walk. A must do for any visitor with time and no knee problems! A very picturesque walk.Factor in a stop at Bronte for great coffee and/or food!!

Keep fit with the worlds most spectacular view. must do for all levels of fitness as you can travel at your own pace This Magnificent walk showcases the Sydney Coast line and you can explore several beaches along the way Stop for a swim grab a drink and end up at one of the cafes

Sculptures by the Sea. The Bondi to Coogee walk is a lovely walk at anytime. The get the best experience try and time your visit for when Sculpture by the Sea is on show. It is a very busy time but the artwork makes it all worth while. Allow plenty of time to enjoy the walk. Bondi has numerous places to eat as does Coogee at the end of the walk. Take some water with you and comfortable walking shoes.

Great walk. Scenic walk which took us just under 2 hours. The views were amazing of all the beaches you walk around. Sweaty work if doing during the summer months so light/exercise clothing is advised

Great views. This walk offers stunning views and is well worth the effort. It is strenuous although the locals jog past at a rate of knots. You pass by many beaches and inlets and the cliff top cemetery is rather beautiful. Allow a couple of hours at least if you want to enjoy, eat and swim along the way.

Loads of stairs - up and down. Really enjoyed this walk but I would suggest you need to be reasonably fit as there was a lot of stays and uphill stretches to the walk. In the heat of the day it could be a struggle but there are points where you can shorten the walk. Good surfaces to walk on.
Always a delight. We do this walk regularly, it's one of Sydney's many delights. Several cafes on the way if you need the caffeine. Sometimes you'll get the bonus of whales & dolphins.

Awesome walk and FREE. Walk along this stunning coastline and enjoy the best of Sydney. Too hot? Go for a swim in a rock pool, or the quiet Clovelly Bay, or the pumping Bronte. Thirsty? There are plenty of places to quench it along the way including the Coogee Bay, the Palace, the Clovelly Hotel, Bondi Icebergs, etc. Hungry? Same again, lots of cafes and options right on or close to the beach/walk. Do yourself a favour!

Not worth the hype. There's honestly better things to do. I feel that Bondi beach hype has made this place less than what it should be. Still beautiful, just not as good as other beaches and walks in Australia

A Jaw Dropping Experience . This was a spur of the moment idea and I had no idea how long it would take, how hard or easy it would be nor what to expect.4 of us ventured out from just outside Coogee Beach area so had clocked up a few kilometres before we found the trail.It was a reasonably hot day and fortunately had the presence of mind to take water.I would suggest that the Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk is a must-do on your Sydney schedule.The scenery along the route is absolutely spectacular so make sure you take a camera with a big memory card!Starting out at Coogee Beach and ending up at Bondi Beach you'll get a good workout with about 6km of walking. There are several stairs and steepish climbs along the way, so pack comfortable shoes and chilled water. If you just need a quick breather, stop off at one of the beaches along the way for a swim or there are a couple of places you can get refreshments, but be advised there aren't that many!Bronte is the perfect point to sit back and enjoy and refuel. You'll navigate beaches from atop beaches, parks and even a massive cemetery plus there are some resting benches along the way.We took it very easy and estimate we took us 3 hours but it can be done more quickly.It's definitely worth and it doesn't cost a cent!!
Spectacular views. Everybody should take in this walk, it is truly beautiful. Stop on the way back for a drink at Icebergs and if not to cold sit out on the balcony or outside in the coffee garden.

Scenic and unique. This is a great way to spend an afternoon enjoying a coast line that is uniquely Australian. The path is paved and easily walked although there are a few spots with stairs. It is a good walk even for a novice walker. Would suggest you pick a cloudy day as the sun can get quite warm.
Nice. Beach look as if it was straight out of a post card...have breakfast there. The water was warm and the blue seas were very nice to see in contrast with the pool and beach.

Fantastic scenery, chance to enjoy the local flavour. Walked from Coogee Beach to Bondi Beach, enjoying the views, plant life and people watching along the way. Scenic in every dimension. Waverley Cemetery was a particularly moving stop along the way. Great way to spend a couple of hours.

Amazing Walk. Only did the Bondi to Bronte part, but still a fantastic walk with amazing views. There are steps involved in certain sections which some people may find a little challenging. The views are amazing, especially on a nice sunny day. Highly recommended.

Bit more than a stroll. A good walk to while away a morning. Be sure to leave early so you miss the heat and take a backpack, hat, sunscreen and water. You might want to have a halfway dip at Coogee Beach too or even take a little morning tea to have there. Be sure to walk through the cemetery if you have time as there is a lot heritage and history and the best part is having a beer overlooking Bondi when you're done.

LOVE THIS PLACE BUT PEOPLE ARE A BIT UP THEMSELVES AND PRETENTIOUS. terrific terrific terrific walk. i have done it so many times. that i need a bit of break. i was suffering deep deep deep deep deep depression. everyones having fun. o great . i'm being sarcastic hahahah.that's funny. so the walk was a heavy heavy heavy burden due to crisis in my life. but the fresh air and taking pictures is my passion.

Fantastic walk with swimming and facilities along the way. My parents and I walked the coastal beach trail from Bondi to Coogee beach. We made a day of it by stopping to swim and have lunch along the way. We were very impressed at all the bathroom facilities, the maintenance of the trail, the water fountains and the trash/recycling containers. It was just a great experience with the most breathtaking views!

Beautiful scenery and well worth the walk! . Great for people on a budget as this is simply a walk along the coast! Has amazing views and can take you anywhere from 30 mins to 2 hours to do depending how often you stop for pictures on the way!
Great views, good exercise.. Nice walk, many great lookout points, a few beaches along the way - which we didn't stop to enjoy. Also, drinking water is available along the walk.
Incredible . Have done this walk on a number of occasions and each time it has been incredible. On a sunny day there few better things to do in and around Sydney.

AMAZING!!!!. Fantastic walking from bondi beach to coogee!!!The view is AMAZING. ...... Easy to afford also with baby. It take about from 1 to 2 hours.There are no many place where you can stop for a drink or something else. First place where you can stop for a drink Is Bronte from Bondi beach. Anyway bring water with you ......

One of the lost beautiful walks.... This is one of the most beautiful walks you will do. If you live in Sydney...even if you have done it before, get back out there and enjoy what's in your back yard. If you are a visitor, it's an absolute must to do. At the right time of the year you can also take in Sculptures by the Sea.

Stunning walk. Fabulous coastal walk around the bays from bondi to coogee.we were lucky enough to see a pod of dolphins just offshore.Very easy walking path that you can start from either end.we started from bondi where we had breakfast before walking.Caught bus 333 from central Sydney to get there which was really easy to use with an Opal bus pass.If you don't want to walk the whole way you can just do a section or break it up with food/drink stops along the way.Definitely wear comfortable walking shoes and take sunblock and water bottle as the day we went it was extremely hot!

There's no better walk in the world. . I'm blessed living in Coogee and do this walk regularly.
If you come to Sydney it's a must do.
Whether it's a sunny day, wild seas or just wanting to take in some you time. It's a perfect journey. At either end you can finish it with smell food & a drink.

Good stroll on a summers day. Great walk in any weather, we did it from coogee to bondi had few drinks at coogee started the walk half way there is a bowling club so stopped there for a swift one then carried on to bondi .
So enjoyable!. Beautiful! Best thing to do in Sydney! Great for locals and visitors. Make sure you bring a water bottle. There are fountains to fill up along the way :)

Poor timing. Went with about 1 million other people during the Sculpture by the Sea exhibition. massive crowds. The organisers should charge a minimal fee to help look after the footpaths, litter collection and plants which get destroyed under foot. Will be back, but on a week day when fewer people are on the walk.
Gorgeous and popular beach. Take a hat and sunscreen. It was hot! The water was wonderful. Places to swim (between the flags) and surf.
Good view. Lots of people on the beaches on summer days. But the view is always great along the way. You can bring a mat and choose a nice spot to lie down somewhere along the way.
Nice walk. This is a decent coastal walk which is peaceful and enjoyable, it gets you away from the hussle and bussle of Bondi over to the quiter and nicer Coogee beach.

Bondi to coogee. Wondeful walk and a lot of natural rock formations to see.
It was a visual wonder.
The walk was very easy and straight forward even kids can do it .
Wonderful walk. Go for this coastal walk. It is really great, with amazing views of the ocean and surroundiing nature and also the liviing areas.

Nice but.... Benefits:- there are frequent stations where you can fill up your water bottleNegatives: - no shade- long (takes a good 1.5 hours to and back)- need to be quite fit- the walk is very choppy in that it can go from being quite steep to suddenly flat. There are also many stairs. - crowded (the really fit locals are always running so it's hard to enjoy the scenery when you have people behind you screaming HURRY UP)Advice: Do it anyway just to say you've done it.
Get out and experience Sydney. One of the best parts of Sydney that should not be missed. Take your swimmers and jump in the water at Gordon's Bay. You will feel like you are so far from the city.
Beach walk to fascinating different beaches. Good to meet other travellers and work & travel people, tour guide provides interesting information and gives the opportunities to do your own thing

Coastal scenery . Stunning coastal scenery. Very photogenic. Covers all the great Eastern Suburbs beaches, including Bondi. Relatively easy walk but there are sections that can be steep for those who are of low fitness and not all sections are disable for wheelchair bound people.
Great view. One of my favorite walks in Sydney. Great to just have a walk and enjoy the view or go for a run and exercise.

Beautiful scenery. Such a nice walk to take any time of the day. It is a little tricky to make the walk from Waverley Cemetery to Bronte when it is busy because you have to walk on the road. Other than that, the path is easy to follow and well kept.
Great for kids and adults!

Beautiful Walk. I recommend to take the bus 373 or 374 to go to Cogee and do the reverse-walk. It takes you 2-3 hours and there are beautiful places everywhere. If you have enough time, take swim clothes with you and stop to go swimming in the ocean.

A must do for locals and visitors alike. An easy walk with breathtaking views and the vibrancy of the Pacific Ocean swirling beside you. Enjoy a swim at any of the many inviting and popular beaches along the way or alternatively have a pit stop at one of the many Cafes scattered along the route. The Bondi Icebergs Bistro is always a pleasant spot to sit for a while. A true Sydney experience.

Beautiful day out. It was a very hot day in the city. So we caught the bus to Bondi 5% cooler with the cool breeze and a great clean beach. Excellent cafes and restaurants and even some nice shopping along the way.

Beautiful!. We only managed half due to running out of time (and it being the hottest day in November - ever!)Spectacular. I will return to Sydney and this will be top of my list of things to do.Take a camera, and decent shoes.

THE BEST THING YOU CAN DO HERE!. Having lived in Sydney for six years, this is the first thing I tell ANY visitor to do when they arrive. My advice would be to start from Coogee and finish up in Bondi, there is something quite dramatic about rounding the final turn and setting your sights on Bondi for the first time. A finish in Coogee is a little anticlimactic. Have lunch or a drink at the Coogee Pavilion and be sure to bring your swimsuit in summer so you can have a dip on Bondi when you finish!

Great But Long Walk. Decided to to this in reverse and start in Coogee, based on other Trip Advisor reviews. Good idea. Take the #373 or #374 bus from Circular Quay to its terminus in Coogee. Get off the bus, walk towards the water and voila` - you will see the path. One thing to keep in mind is that the path shifts around a lot and at times you could end up walking on a street instead of along the cliffs. Just keep your eyes peeled and you'll see the best way to go. And I recommend walking through the cemetery, not around it, it was beautiful and you don't have to walk on the graves in any case. Make sure your camera/phone is charged - lots of great pics to take on this one. It was way empty til I got up to around Tamarama, then it was getting full of tourists going the other way. I highly recommend this for early morning on an overcast or cooler day. I loved seeing how the Aussies utilize the ocean to their advantage by building them right along the cliffs. If I had more time I would have planned a swim! 6 miles, it took about 2.5 hours at a slow-middling pace. If you use walking sticks, definitely bring them. Proud to say I was mistaken for a local twice, mostly because multiple off leash dogs being walked by locals kept running up to me to say hi (this happens to me worldwide), and I was asked "Which dog is yours?" both times. I do my best to blend in wherever I go ;-)
A must do in Sydney . We are lucky enough to love closeby to this walk and it is a must do activity!!Take your camera as often you will see whales and dolphins!
The best things in life are free. A fantastic walk, great views and scenery and plenty of nice places to stop for a swim or a bite to eat.

Great walk along the sea. What a great way to explore and see the different communities and beaches along the Sydney coastline. It's easy too complete. A few stairs here and there. Took a bus from the downtown area to Coogee, easy ride no connections. While we were there Sculptures by The Sea was on. Saw some interesting and some not so interesting pieces of art.
Great views but a long walk. Amazing views and not too difficult although a few steep spots. Walked only one way as too much for me to walk back to Bondi.

Perfect Trail For Taking Pictures. We walked from Bondi Beach to Bronte and returned on what was a perfect day at the beach. There were several places along the way for taking pictures and the trail was not difficult at all.

Best place to go for a jog in Sydney...... Every chance that I get when in sydney, I do this run!! Park at Clovelly Beach (free) car park then follow the path to Bondi to Coogee and back. If you like a challenging run, this is a must do!! The spectacular views alone are worth it!! You won't be disappointed! Good for a walk as well!!

Lovely walk. We took the bus from Circular Quay to Coogee Beach for the beginning of our walk. The views were spectacular and the walk was not very strenuous. At Bondi, we took a bus to Watsons Bay where we had fish n chips before we boarded a ferry back to Circular Quay. All in all, a lovely day.

One of Sydney's greatest walks. I have done this walk many times, and it has never bored me. If fact, one can continue through Coogee all the way to Maroubra. Make sure you take your swimmers and camera. There are also several wonderful places to go snorkeling on this sublime walk.

Quintessential Sydney Coastal Walk. A lovely and relaxing walk that stretches about 7 kilometers from Bondi Beach passing through other amazing Sydney beaches like Tamarama, Bronte, Colovelly and ends at Cogee beach. Breathtaking and spectacular ocean views and delicate rock formations. It is easy to walk on the well groomed pathways but be mindful of a lot of stairs and some narrow paths. You will pass through pretty landscapes, gully and parks. People were surfing, swimming and sunbathing - a great lifestyle here! And please don't forget to wear comfortable clothing and bring your hat, water and sunscreen lotion. A great walk indeed and buses will take you back to the nearest train station.

Beautiful Walk . My friend and I walked this coastal walk and it was just beautiful. Luckily we had a clear day so made for some breathtaking photos. Just remember to bring water! Perfect thing to do for travellers on a budget!
A must !. This is a must ! No need to go until Coggee if you consider a little walk, the bit from Bondi to Tamarama is already stunning !
Sculpture by the sea walk. We did part of this walk to see the sculptures - amazing and beautiful walk. Magnificent. It took us a couple of hours but we caught the bus back - truely a natural marvel.
Love the walk!. Best views, beautiful beaches all the way along the walk. You can go at your own pace and enjoy the spectacular nature all around you! Bondi is our favorite beach!
Great walk on a hot day. Had a few hours spare on a hot Sydney day in November. Really lovely walk along the spectacular coastline, with headlands and sandy beaches. Fab.
A great way to spend a Sunday morning. There are some great beaches on this walk and whilst Bondi might be the most famous it's definitely to the best that you wil see along this stretch!

sculptures by the sea. We started doing the walk to appreciate the sculptures by the sea exhibition which were riveting but as it was a weekend there were many other people with the same idea and it was a bit crowded however by the time we got to the end of the sculpture exhibit the crowds had thinned and the remainder of the walk was fantastic.

Rock, sea and beaches. This is a made path walk that you can make as long, or short, as you want. It is usually a day time walk, but it is beautiful on a clear night. Because the path is following the cliff lines, there are a lot of stairs and slopes. I usually do it as a return trip, so, keep a note of how you are going and turn with energy in hand. It can get hot in summer so, take water and a hat. If you want to start at Bondi end, there is plenty of public transport to the beach. Head to the south end of the beach. The start of the walk is behind the Icebergs building (large white building with pool in front of it). You can get to it by the footpath on the road or from the promenade behind the beach, using the stairs near the Icebergs building. Note the cafe/bar in the Icebergs building (beside the entrance to the silver service restaurant), you will want to go in on your return. Off you go. Sydney sandstone carved by wind and water. The ocean swell rolling in. Scrub, small streams. Small deep beaches of yellow/white sand. Board riders on the waves off the beaches. The occasional whale swimming north or south with calves, in whale season. After walking, drop in to the Icebergs club bar and cafe for a well earned beer and burger looking out over the ocean. Also check out the shorter walk from Christison Park at Vaucluse to Watsons Bay, for views out to sea, along the coast and up the harbour to the city.

Great for locals and tourists. I love this walk, spectacular views and iconic Sydney beaches, what more could you ask for? On a sunny day it gets hot, so take a water bottle, hat and suncream. All fitness levels can have a go as you can easily drop in and out of sections of the walk if you don't want to do it all.It is touristy and can get quite busy - don't go looking for peaceful nature trails as you won't get it. Locals like this route also and you can see the regular joggers up and down.A good walk for guests in town, ice-creams and food en-route for the whole walk and good transport links. There are also water filling stations along the walk (free of course!)
User friendly. Wow, what a lovely walk! You can take your time and really enjoy the views or pace it out for some exercise. User friendly paths. Will definitely do it again next time.

Splendid. This i took along with my daughter, it was visually and a lovely experience, albeit Quite tiring. plenty of people of all ages, a varied and challenging walk, , the day was hot, however, being so close to the ocean , and checking out some of the 'scupltures' along the way. made it to the end!!

What a phenomenal walk. I absolutely LOVED this walk. Stunning from beginning to end, Lots of lovely little beaches to stop off at along the way, lots of pit stops to top up your water bottle.
The Views were unbelievable! I knew Australia was a beautiful country but WOW!
The walk has loads of points where you can get a bus or taxi if...


More

Fabulous vistas and mostly easy walk.. Fabulous vistas and mostly easy walk.
The locals are just as interesting as the views. The cafe at Tamarama is well worth a visit. Toilets at Mark's park and at Tamarama Beach.

don't miss this walk if visitng Sydney. This is a very scenic walk that really showcases this beatiful area of Sydney, with a great birds eye view of the famous Bondi beach. It's an easy walk and the best part about it, is that it is free! Bring your towel, as you'll definetely want to dive in that blue water after getting hot from the walk :)

A pleasant walk mainly along the cliff top.. This is one of many coastal walks round Sydney. Starting from the world famous Bondi beach , easily accessible by a combination of train and bus, the walk runs to Tamarama ( the location of the annual "Sculptures by the Sea " and thence on to Coogee Beach. Good breakfast/Lunch spots are available at Bronte Beach past Tamarama.

See Sydney's beautiful beaches while you walk. See the magnificent beaches of Sydney while exercising. Walk, jog or run and breathe the fresh ocean air. There's no better place to witness the crashing waves these sun soaked beaches and rocky cliff faces.

Bondi is Beautiful. Taking a leasurely walk along the beachside what better way to spend an afternoon. Seeing the locals swimming and the unusual salt water pool spilling into the ocean. Just beautiful
Beautiful scenic walk. This is an absolutely lovely walk. Great views. Its a paved walkway bu there are steps. Coffee opportunities at Bondi and Tamarama.
A must do. Stunning, with great little cafes to stop in along the way. We did Bronte to Bondi which is enough if you don't want to do it all.
Rad. It's a friggin' gnarly walk. YOU should do it. I live in Clovelly (right next to Coogee) and it never gets old. All welcome!
Fab Walk. We did this walk yesterday, really easy to navigate, some fab beaches along the way. Bus was waiting at Bronte to which us back to boindi junction. Fab day, well worth the trip!
One of the best walks anywhere--six beaches 3 hours. This is where 100 characters is not needed--the walk is one of the most beautiful--cliffs-sand-sea-and great swimming.

Great seaside walk. We did this in reverse, in fact we had to wait a day to do it with the weather not being co-operative. We took the local bus to Coogee and headed over to Bondi from there.It's a well trodden path so even fairly early in the day there were plenty of people alongside us. It did get busier as we got closer to Bondi where people were headed in the opposite direction.We saw many aspects of the beautiful ocean, the crashing waves, watched the surfers at certain points. I spotted a Kookaburra in one of the trees. We noted the adult outdoor gyms in some of the parks which was a cool featureMy favourite though was the cemetery on the hill, what a view and perfect resting placeI was pretty glad to see the end and the Surf Club Pool at the other end though, nice walk great views sore feet!

Visit to Bondi Beach is a must!. Our visit to Bondi Beach coincided with the last day of the Beach Sculpture Exhibition. The place was packed with people but we walked on to see the scultures that we read about online. The weather was lovely and the views were just stunning, especially towards the end where most of the sculptures were. Along the way, we past by the famous Bondi Icebergs Hotel which was a truly stunning sight!After the walk, we stopped by at Trio Cafe for lunch, as recommended by Tripadvisor. What a great recommendation that was! The entire Bondi area had a relaxing feel to it. Definitely a must-go!

#1 thing to do while in Sydney!. I am SO glad I did this walk. Do it on a weekday, as it tends to get busy on the weekdays. I started at Coogee as I wanted to spend longer at the iconic Bondi Beach, but you could easily do it the other way around, or just do sections of it. Coogee has some great cafes and restaurants for a more chilled out vibe if you want to end with a meal. Incredible views throughout, and the walk takes you along five different beaches -- Coogee (chilled, great cafes), Clovelly (sheltered, swimmable), Bronte (gorgeous! watch the surfers!), Tamarama (smaller, right next to Bronte) and finally Bondi Beach. It shouldn't take more than 1.5 - 2 hours and is a relatively easy trek. Factor in more time if you like to take photos or stop off at a cafe (which you should!). I can't wait to come back! :)

Great Walk and Amazing view. Breathtaking view and amazing scenery for taking photos. Good walking distance from restaurants and bars across the street and easy access to the bus stop that goes to Sydney.

Perfect walk!. I was recommended not to miss the beach walk from Bondi to Coogee (approx. 6.5km). And, indeed, it is a breathtaking experience. Rocks and cliffs, beautiful flowers, well marked path and surfers all the way. It is an easy walk, yet very exciting. Don't miss in visiting Sydney.
Great views. If you like coastal scenery this is a great walk. Very atmospheric. Also great that there are spots to refill water bottles also along the way.
Nice walk, great beaches. Definitely bring towel when good and hot weather a try to swim in pacific ocean. Plenty of beaches. All of them nice.
Amazing views! . This walk is lovely, you can see amazing views all across the sea. I wouldn't go on a really hot day, when we went there was a nice breeze. Would definitely recommend.

Walk Never Gets Old. Absolutely a beautiful walk. It never gets old. You get to see Bondi, Mackenzie's Bay, Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly, and Coogee. Great places to stop in for a quick bite or to grab a refreshing drink.

Was cultures on the beach. We took a bus directly to Bondi Beach from near Sydney's ferry terminal. Easy direct trip. The beach is beautiful and we were there when they had the Oct/Nov sculpture exhibit a real treat . There are lots of restaurants.

We were there for the Shelf cloud!. This walk was amazing - however to add to the comedy of the rainy trip we had to Aus we then got stuck in the shelf/Tsunami cloud whilst walking from Coogee to Bondi... Thankfully we were walking that way around so we could escape in a taxi!Great walk... Great views!
Stunning Vistas. A bucket list item to tick off...stunning views...and a must see is the wonderfully situated cemetery...

Great walk with great views!. You want a sunny, but not overly hot day. We usually walk from Bronte to Bondi and after a lunch there walk back. Excellent exercise and very easy on the eye! There are a couple of staircases on the way - one small near Tamarama SLSC, another - big one closer to Bondi.
Stunning Views. We only partially walked the coastal walk. We stopped along the way to view the artwork during the Sculptures by the Sea. Even without the artwork it would be a gorgeous walk.
Must do !. The entire walk will take 4 hours if you idle around and spend time. But believe me, it's worth the effort and time.

Bondi Beach Coastal Walk - Very Scenic. A beautiful scenic coastal walk.The distance from Bondi to Coogee is 6km, about 1.5 hrs.The distance from Bondi to Bronte Beach is 2.5km, about 40 minutesWe rode the train from Central station to Bondi Junction. Then Bus 333, 380, 381, 382 from Bondi Junction to Bondi Beach.Another option is to take the Bus from Museum station to Bondi Beach.You do not have to walk the entire distance of the walk to Coogee, we stopped at Bronte Beach and caught the Bus from there back to Bondi Junction.

Lovely walk. The day we went it was fairly busy on the path at the Bondi end but after a mile or so its users were fairly sparse. There are some lovely views and scenery. We got the bus from Coogee back to Sydney.
Lovely vistas, beautiful beaches. Excellent way to rejuvenate! One of the best coastal trails and a must do on Sydney's to do list. Do take Cam and beach towels to unwind on the rocky/ Sandy shores.

Beautiful walk hampered by construction. Part of the beach itself was roped off as well as the upper reaches of the trail due to maintenance but what we could see was gorgeous. Lots of typical touristy beachy shops and cafes.

Do this!. this is for everyone! especially if you want to spend some time at the beach but don't want to get burnt.Do this in the morning, and end up at either cogee or Bondi for a swim, or take a dip along the way at either of the beautiful beaches you pass

Gorgeous views, lots of steps. Beautiful views of Bondi beach. The pathway above is easy to walk but there are many stairs/steps if you are sensitive to up and down. You can still walk most of the pathway for great views and avoid climbing to the top of the park area. A very beautiful area.
Beautiful . Really nice walk and wasn't to challenging. The walk goes all the way along the coasts and some beautiful stops on the way.

Amazing scenic coastal walk!. Fantastic coastal walk from Bondi - just passed the Iceberg pool to Cogee beach. Taking in coves, the Pacific Ocean and beach properties along the way. Duration approx 1.5 hours stopping to take pics and leisurely walking speed. A number of steep 3/4 story steps but all Boardwalk so easy to walk or jog. Best to go Cogee to Bondi as more to do and a bit more upmarket.

Camera ready for action. Make sure you have plenty of memory on your camera for this walk. There are amazing views every where you look. The blue ocean, sheer cliffs, amazing rock formation and plenty of places to stop and take in the views, this walk was incredible. I could barely put my camera away as there was so much to capture. If you're in Sydney and you love to walk and take in the scenery, don't miss it!!!
Relaxing Walk or Workout. Anytime of year the views are magnificent, the air is clean and there's refreshing sea breezes. Don't miss it and go all the wsy to Coogee if you can manage lots of steps.

Heavenly walk thats good for the soul. There is a reason Sydney boasts about its beaches and this walk showcases a bunch of them. A little busy but easy to complete. Go in nice weather for ocean breezes and sunshine.

Challenging walk, beautiful views. . Generally do this walk the opposite way (Coogee to Bondi). The walk can be done at whatever pace you're comfortable with but will take around an hour each way. Beautiful views as you walk above and through some of southern Sydney's most beautiful beaches. There are some challenging parts, particularly around the Gordon's Bay Area (just north of Coogee). Recommend doing this walk during the week as weekends get very busy.

Great walk. We loved the walk around the beach area. A great lunch spot was recommended to us and it helped us to enjoy more of the view! Lots of people out the day we were there and we were blessed with a beautiful Spring day!
The peaceful place.. It's beautiful and peaceful place.I love Coogee and Bondi beach.I wanna go back to Beach.I really really miss...
Bondi Sculptures by the Sea. Really enjoyed. I recommend buying the guide book ($10) to understand a little about the art (or at least attribute it on your instagram pictures!)

Fabulous Coastal Scenery. Spend half a day doing this coastal walk with stunning scenery as you move from cove to cove. Lovely eateries in Bronte for excellent lunch along the way. we visited at time of Sculpture festival so part of walk was very busy but it did not detract from beautiful views. Easy bus journey from circular quay to Bondi for start of journey. Bring water to keep hydrated.
Dr Gonzo did sculptures by the sea. Its what youd expect with sculptures and bizarre explainations by stoned artists.But it a great walk and shows off our coast well. We saw dolphins
Must take walk!. Most beautiful walk of any time of the day!Its Mesmerizing beauty of the sea! We never get bored of this walk

Walk around Bondi beach. We came here because the restaurant our friends chose was in this area. We walked from the street where we parked to the restaurant on this walkway. There were several sculptures along it as part of an art installation. The views are stunning and the best was to see the sunlit peninsula against a background of dark clouds.

One of the best coastal walks . I lived in Bondi for 10yrs and walked at least part of the Bondi to Coogee coastal path almost every week. The views and the beaches are second to none.*The path is not really wheelchair/pushchair friendly, though short parts could be completed.

A must! You will not be disappointed.. Took the train from Sydney to Bondi Junction, a bus from Bondi Junction to Bondi. Enjoyed the beach a bit then started the lovely walk way to Coogee Beach. Spectacular views, really excellent coastline wakway. Have a waterbottle, wear a hat, sunsecreen. The walk can be challenging for not your average walk/hiker. Hike walk has varying terrain.

Stunning walk with stunning views. A great day out. Stunning views, great beaches, and lots of little bars and restaurants on the way. Recommend to bring something to drink, and good shoes.For those into more of a challenge, this route is good for runners.. with some steps inbetween to keep them legs going :-)Would do this walk again for sure
A fabulous walk. This is a fabulous walk with so much to take in, Limestone formations, Whales off the coast, spring flowers, beaches, coves, birds etc.

A Definite Must!. We enjoyed this immenslely! We did this on a warm sunny day, took a backpack w/ swimsuits and towels. Had refreshing swims on most every beach we hit. Gorgeous views! Once we got to Coogie, had a nice lunch, and walked back to Bondi. There were interesting art sculptures along the way. A great day of views and excercize!

Beautiful coastal walk. We caught the bus from the city to Bondi Beach (very easy; can look up on google maps - make sure you have an oyster card!) and started the walk south. Beautiful views, combining beach with greenery. Little pockets of beach that were very inviting! The whole walk took less than an hour, and we went at a VERY leisurely pace and took a fair few photos. Stopped at Coogee to dip our feet in the water and then had breakfast at X74. Great, relaxing morning.

What a fantastic experience - far better than even the iconic harbour. Anyone able to walk a couple of km shouldn't miss out on this urban treasure on the coast, particularly as the beach sculptures adorn what is already a superb experience. Starting from the park adjacent to Coogee Beach, we enjoyed a pathway leading around the many bays and inlets of the southern Sydney coast affording a superb array of coastal views, rocky headlands, lush flora, and pounding surf. And all over a very well constructed path that undulates up and down the coastline. We were amazed by the sheer diversity: beaches, surf, parks, and the Waverley Cemetery which must be one of the most beautifully scenic locations for the dear departed. We saw surfers and snorkellers, sunbathers, swimming and sauntering. The Sculptures by the Sea comprises a wonderful array of modern shapes to challenge our imagination. There are places to stop and just be, see and enjoy. We did the walk on a November Saturday afternoon and it was busier than Sydney airport arrivals' lounge at times, but walking back from Bondi in the late afternoon was much less populous and far more tranquil, with just the company of sea birds and occasional joggers enjoying being here. There are a few places to get refreshments, and if the walking gets too much you can always take a link to the roads and get a bus. Although the 6km out and 6km back was a fair trek, rather than a genteel stroll, we thought it was by far the best experience of many great ones during our holiday here. Well done to the far-sighted community members who created this stunning resource.
wear your walking shoes. Bring your bathing suit. We started at Bondi beach but there are great beaches along the way. Nice place to watch surfers as well.

the walk that takes your breath anyway. I have been living back in Sydney for 30 years and when it comes to beaches and walks I always seen to go where I know and where I grew up as a kid, Freshwater was always my pick, but after so many people telling me about this walk I needed to do it.. Now after 2 very surprising open heart ops in 3 months of each other first me then my husband, we both said we would start ticking things off the bucket list, well we signed up for the city 2 surf and trained hard .. this was one of our most favourite walks early on a Sunday, even trying it from Coogee to Bondi some weeks, it really dose take your breath away.. We still do our training walks and this is one we do monthly, early morning is brillant but sunset is made up of all the Wright Stuff we say.. if your ever in Sydney do it even if its just part of the way!! but once you start you will have to Finish as it truly is just beautiful, lots of stairs in some parts and very high but a must see and do

Fantastic walk along the cliffs!. I would definitely do this walk again if I'm in Sydney. Bondi and Coogee are only 30-40mins bus from Sydney CBD and the walk is about 6km (around 1.5 hours). Stunning scenery the whole way and a number of beaches to stop off at for a swim!

Stunning coastline. This walk is great for a bit of exercise and to see the sights. If you only want to go in one direction you can catch a bus back the other way. Best finished of with a beer or a cool glass of wine!

Lovely views. We walked from Bondi to Clovelley beach , we took our time and enjoyed the ocean views. Some steps and slopes but well worth the effort and you can get a bus back to Bondi from some of the places,along the way. Weekends can be very busy so maybe go midweek. It was great to watch the surfers at some beaches and enjoy the beautiful scenery.

Yes, fabulous views and well worth a visit. Not to be missed, the best and easiest way to get a taste of the coastline which so influences and characterises Sydney and much of Australia. Take swim gear and pause to enjoy the water as well as the walk. Great facilities for changing and showers at each beach. Very good snorkelling in some bays, surfing in others. Avoid weekend afternoons and extremely hot days - busy and tiring then. Otherwise, great.
loving the breeze. A quiet and breezy beach. Was there for vacation and decided to take a stroll down ... the was quiet and not crowded. sat by the soft sand with a book. Amazing
Very nice walk. Lots of beaches and beautiful rocks to see. Good colors and lots of benches and water fountains along the walk.
Great. Reqlly good views of Bondi and a nice cool breeze. P.S. Remember to wear a jumper it does get cold. Great walk for a morning jog with cafes that we had breakfast at in Bondi.

We will re-do this walk when it is not so busy. We walked from Bondi to Tamarama Beach to view the sculptures a few weekends ago. It was very interesting but oh so busy. We intend to re-do when we visit Sydney again hopefully when it is less busy so we can stop to admire the views at our leisure.
Bondi to Coogie. Great scenic route Bondi to Coogie walk , you can stop at Bronte beach for a swim. Take your camera for memories .what a a beautiful coastline on a sunny day.

Stunning Views. Me and my partner walked this route not long after arriving in Australia for our years working visa. The walk itself can be a little difficult in some places due to the high number of inclines/ stairs, but is well worth it! The views are simply beautiful, and there are many free public baths along the way (so bring swim wear!)

Excellent walk. Its the best walk ive ever done...see different beaches using the boardwalk...make sure you have enough time.we did it in 4 hrs.including our photo shoot and just sitting admiring the views...be prepared to bring an umbrella just in case it rains...its kinds hard to find a taxi in the middle of your walk so mite as well you just finish the whole thing and find a nice bar after...no problem with public transport when you decide to go back to your hotel.
