Lovely walk on a sunny day. This walk takes around 2 hours at a pace, the sights are beautiful and on the way you pass many bays, one of which you can stop off at for a coffee if you wish. Please be aware that there are a few points where you have to climb steps so you have to be fairly fit.
Great Walk. One of my best coastal walks ever! On this way you pass the big beaches as well as the smaller hidden ones. Enjoy the beautiful australian costline!
Highlight of our trip. A lovely walk with stunning scenery , would recommend giving yourself a couple of hours , or more if you choose to make a few stops along the way.

Walk, swim, walk and enjoy the coastal views. Catch the 360 bus from Bondi Junction to Clovelly. Walk down for a swim and then walk to Bronte Beach, Tamarama Beach (stop for a coffee and a bite at the cafe) and to Bondi Beach. Have another swim. Catch the bus back to Bondi Junction. Or catch the bus from Bondi Junction to Coogee and walk to Gordon Bay for a swim, then continue on to Clovelly..... Great air, great scenery, and possibility of coffee and snacks at each beach along the way...what more could a cityslicker want! The ques to catch the bus to Bondi can be maddening at times, hence do the walk in reverse. Ie. catch the bus to Coogee.

Must do coastal walk. I live in Sydney and have done this walk many times. The last time in October this year with friends from the United States. It was a perfect day and they couldn't get over the stunning blue water and the amazing Rock formations. The walk is relatively easy but there are a number of stairs leading from Bondi but they aren't too bad. However for people with a walker it might be a bit of a problem. There is a good coffee shop at bronte if you need a coffee fix. Be sure to take some water though.

Great Walk, Perfect Distance, Terrific Restaurant at the end. We did this walk last week (Nov 9th), and it was a great way to enjoy the coast. Very beautiful, not too long, nice wide path. But the BEST part is dining for lunch at Coogee Pavilion at the end. It was recommended by a friend and turned out to be the best meal we had the entire 7 days in Sydney (and we went to very high rated restaurants). Don't miss this walk and the great lunch afterwards.
Sculpture by Sea 2015. The Sculpture by Sea is an excellent morning activity for mums looking for exercise, stunning views and creative inspiration!
Scupture event was wonderful but crowded. We were there during the extensive sculpture event. Nice works, but crowds. Would do it again and always on a weekday!

Best views in Sydney. I am lucky enough to currently live in Bronte so have walked this path many times but it never fails to impress me. The views of the ocean are incredible and if you're lucky you might spot dolphins and whales. There are some steps along the path though so unfortunately it is not accessible to all.

A Jogger's Delight...Bondi Coastal Walk. This beach is awesome for young and old. You can sit and enjoy and peacefulness of the surroundings, swim, or talk the Coastal Walk depending on your schedule. I was there when it was misty and experienced a beautiful rainbow. This is a great photo opt and to take the family for a picnic. It is well maintained and is family friendly. You need to give yourself a couple of hours to really enjoy the area.

Stunning Coastal Walk. Stunning coastal walk. You can walk to Maroobra too the other way which is also beautiful but the most popular route is Coogee to Bondi. Sit on the rocks at Gordons Bay and go for a snorkel to see Groupers and other marine life. Stop at the Clovelly Bowls RSL for an hour. Its the best place to play bowls in the world with the most stunning of views.Breakfast/Lunch in Bronte and rest up on Tama beach before cruising round to Bondi. A few steps but nothing too tricky. Beautiful rock formations and stunning views of one of the best urban coastlines in the world.

What a Hike! Beautiful!. My wife and I walked the coastline from Bondi to Coogee in November. The walk takes you through several beaches and a lot of rocky coastline. Beautiful views and a nice way to get your heart pumping. Not too strenuous but you burn enough calories for a guilt-free drink or two at any of several nice cafes (whether you start at Bondi or Coogee).

Great walk along the coast. Super walk on the coast between Cogee beach & Bondi beach. We actually walked from Cogee to Bondi beach which took approx 1.5 hours. We passed lots of lovely coves & beaches. It is all paved so no hiking gear required just comfortable footwear. We stopped at the Bondi Icebergs Club and restaurant for a lovely lunch. A well known eatery at Bondi. It was reasonably priced with lots of choices. You could have a full dinner or just a snack . Lovely views over the bay with lots of outdoor seating. We had a lovely day out of the city which is just what we needed.

Spectacular scenery and great exercise. This is a lovely walk with varying scenery along the way that make it both interesting and entertaining. I would suggest finishing at Bondi as lots to see and do there.
Lovely walk uphill. We timed our visit during the exhibition of Sculptures by the Sea. The artwork were impressive. The view was absolutely stunning.
spectacular views. easy walk also used by joggers, families, etc...Great experience, from beaches to coastlines, beautiful houses as well.
Oz outdoors culture. This walk epitomizes Oz outdoors culture with walkways, steps, gardens, pools, changing rooms, etc. all immaculately maintained and walkers kitted out in top dollar sports gear

Stunning views and free of charge - Paradise. Most amazing relaxing walk, way to spend a saturday afternoon on a sunny day starting off with breakfast/brunch at Bondi Beach and followed by a long stroll all the way to Coogee. Stopped along the way to check out the views and took lots of photos, there are also a lot of indigenous remainings that can be spotted on some of the rocks. Definitely worth the trip to Bondi and walkDo not go there if there are events such as 'Sculpture by the Sea' or on a very hot summers day, might make you feel woozy if you are not use to crowds.

Come in november and enjoy the "Sculptures by the sea". The walking is amazing! The stunning blue waters contrasting with the most different shapes of the cliff!Definetely a must do in Sydney. If you can, try to come in November, time when they have the "Sculptures by the Sea", a open art gallery making the views even prettier!

Fabulous views, free and fun. Although the sun wasn't shining the walk to Coogee beach along the coast was a wonderful way to start the day. Lots of amazing views and it was great that you could refill your water bottle along the way. Sydney will remind me of steps and athletic spirit, everywhere you go people are exercising regardless of the weather.

Just do it, you won't be sorry!. Caught a bus from Martin place, interesting suburban trip to this iconic beach. You should do the walk as its really very easy and has spectacular views. Go early or late and avoid weekends for a more serene experience. No wonder it's number two on the list of attractions in Sydney. Really recommended.

Beautiful walk along the coast. Great walk and not too strenuous. We parked our car at Coogee . Caught the bus to Bondi and walked back to coogee. We had a great lunch at Barzura. Looking forward to walking again and snorkelling at Clovelly and lunch at Barzula or Coogee pavilion or legions club. So many great places at Coogee and less people than Bondi.

Beach Coastal Walk. We would recommend everyone to do this walk. Nice view, well maintained, generally it will take 1 hour and 15 mins for this walk. At times, you will see young people who are annoying but won't harm you, just ignore them. We won't recommend you to walk after 9am, especially in summer time, as it will be really hot.

Magnificent Coastline. Stunning rock formations, beautiful beaches and great exercise. This walk to very unique. The beaches along the way range from small protected coves to large stretches of swimming beaches, rock pools and even cafes. A must do!!

Coastal Walk - Wonderful Views. Who gets to walk along the best coastline of the Eastern Suburbs - we do! We did the Sculptures by the Sea as well as the coastal walk. So pleased we made the effort. Some steps but do-able for most. Good sports shoes, casual cotton clothes, hat, glasses, sunscreen, waterbottle, fruit/snacks/chocolate and lightweight backpack, plus a walking buddy. Phone with camera or digital camera also a good idea. Make sure you set aside at least 4 hours and decide if you will stop for breakfast, lunch or dinner before your return journey. There is a 353 bus that travels to and from Eastgardens and Bondi Junction that has stops at Maroubra and Coogee Beach. What a healthy and bargain day out in the fresh air and sunshine! Good for Spring, Summer, Autumn & Winter too!

Great walk and views. If you go to the southernmost end of Bondi beach the walkway start along the coast and cliffs to the next beaches and neighbourhoods of Tomarama, Bronte, Clovelly, and Coogee. Along the way views of surfers, sunbathers, dolphins, birds, flowers and maybe some whales. Great walk and exercise. At each beach you can stop for relax, food an/or drinks.

Beautiful coastal walk. Easy, beautiful walk along the coast lineMost of people should be able to do it without too much problem. Everybody should do it to appreciate the beautiful coast line and weather in Oz.Also it's free

Great views. We have done this walk many times. Take the time to do the walk slowly so you can really take in the views and breath the fresh sea air. There are several sandy beaches and plenty of coffee shops along the way were you can stop and enjoy the views. There is easy bus transport to get you to and from Bondi and Coogee. A great day out.

Stunning. This should be on everyone's bucket list!! Such a stunning walk and suitable for all levels of fitness as there are endless places to stop and enjoy the views, grab a bite to eat, have a drink or just finish up if you don't want to do the whole walk. We started at Coogee as we planned on going to Bondi markets and didn't want to carry our shopping on the walk. I'd recommend an early morning (before 10) or late afternoon if you want to minimize the crowds of families. Whilst there are a few places with steps, overall it's a fairly easy walk. The added benefit of starting in Coogee was there seemed to be more downstairs than up :)The views are breathtaking and the atmosphere of everyone enjoying the same thing was an added benefit!

one of sydneys best (and even better with sculptures by the sea). i love this walk and try to enjoy it anytime i am visiting sydneys eastern suburbs.......always popular, always busy and A1 for people watching........and if you happen to be around during the two weeks when sculptures by the sea is on exhibition, all the better......
Must do!. Its excelent! Amazing views, lots photos. Takes around 3h. I suggest start in Coogee and walk to Bondi in early morning.

Beautiful scenery, quick escape from the city. As a Sydneysider, I have came here several times for the nice walk/ jog or to admire the sculptures.Sculptures by the sea happens each year from mid October until early November.You can always do the walk at other times, which can take 1hours ish to over 2 hours depending on how fast you walk, if you stop to admire the views etc.You can start either in Bondi or Coogee, I would recommend doing it during a weekday if you can to avoid having too many, when finishing in Coogee you can go to the Coogee pavilion for food or drinks, and Bondi also has several options.Getting there by public transport, you can take a bus from Bondi Junction to start in Bondi or Coogee, or take a bus from the city to start in Coogee.I have made a recommendation of the top 10 activities in Sydney ! Check them out on my page or youtube at /watch?v=7WTDvASldcY Let me know if you have any question !

Lovely walk. This is a relatively easy walk however there are a few places where there are steps up and down. The views are wonderful with some lovely smaller beaches along the way. There are a few cafes, water fountains, toilets and benches along the route. If you're into running or fitness that would be a very good trail. On the day I walked it there were many people out exercising. You follow the marked trail or the other walkers/runners. It is approx 5 Kms but as you walk at your own pace it can take as little as long as you like. In both the towns of Coogee and Bondi you can catch the bus or a taxi.
Very good easy walk. A lovely uninterrupted view of Sydney's Eastern suburbs coastline. And it is free. Well worth the effort.

Wonderful Ocean Walk. Head along the paved walkway/running path south from Bondi Beach and see the beautiful ocean views. In summer you can pause at Tamarama Beach for an ice cream and swim. Do it again at Bronte Beach. It takes less than 30 minutes or so walking to Bronte. You can stop there, or keep on walking for more down at Coogee. Many choose Bronte to stop, and have coffee or fdood at one of a few cafes. One of Sydney's delights.

Wonderful local attraction. I grew up in Sydney so this is a walk I have done many many times. I would strongly recommend you leave the car at home- parking is difficult. There are lots of buses going to Coogee, Bronte (one of the beaches on the walk) and Bondi. You can also pick up the walk at Clovelly and Tamarama (bus services go there as well). It is a fairly easy walk- but not really wheelchair accessible. It is right on the coast- so wonderful views out to the ocean, and if you are there in November/December you might even see some whales migrating. In Ocotber /early November a significant part of the walk becomes the Sculpture Walk- fantastic, but very crowded.If you feel like stopping for a coffee or bite to eat- there are lots of options along the way, and of course plenty of swimming opportunities.And you can walk beyond Coogee on to Maroubra- you would have to go along a few suburban streets to do this but it is lovely to see Maroubra beach as well.Allow at least an hour to go from Bondi to Coogee- up to 2 to do it comfortably.

Iconic Sydney coast and beaches. Just do it, in almost all weather. Maybe show discretion on a stormy day as is exposed! Fantastic views, great cafes along the way, great swimming at the many beaches.Take your camera. Parts of it are wheelchair accessible too especially from the Coogee end. Park in the car park on the headland and walk/roll back for a nice walk.

A beautiful and iconic Sydney walk. I have enjoyed this walk many times..in every season. It is best to park at the Clovelly Pool end of the walk and walk across to Bondi... usually achievable in the morning - and then you can have some brunch at Bondi, and walk back in the afternoon. In summer you can enjoy a swim at either end of the walk or even half way through at Bronte.By staring at Clovelly, you get to walk past a wonderful old Sydney Cemetary on the headland.You are able to get great photos of the coast and of Bondi. highly recommend.medium fitness level required to do the walk to Bondi and back, but all levels of fitness can achieve 'some' of the walk. Whatever you can manage is worth it!

A must do from Bondi beach. This is a walk not to be missed. I run a walking group and we regularly do this walk. Can be hot/windy or wet so check the weather and take water, hats and jackets if necessary. So beautiful and if your lucky enough to be here in early November you can see the Sculptures by the Sea which is a free event on this actual walk. Busy with narrow sections and steps, DO NOT take a stroller. Older people should take care especially in the wet.

Great for a Stroll. A great stroll along the cliffs overlooking the ocean. Beaches include Tamarama and Clovelly. At Clovelly there were seniors racing in the pool. Lots of people on the weekend so you won't get lonely. If you go Coogee to Bondi and drink and lunch at the Bondi Icebergs is recommended. Bus to Coogee. From Bondi bus to Bondi Junction then train to the City and beyond.

A stunning and classic walk but it can be busy. This is an iconic walk taking in some beautiful beaches and scenery. I have done this walk a few times now and will be doing it again as its never the same. The last time we saw dolphins which was just wonderful. The path is clearly marked so no need for a map and there are plenty of places to get a drink or sandwich so you can travel light. If you love walking and happen to be in Sydney, this walk is a must!

Sculptures by the Sea (Tamarama to Bondi walk). This is a magnificent addition to Sydney's annual events calendar. We went on a Saturday to avoid the crowds. Even then it was crowded but not overly. The walk itself is a beautiful walk from Tamarama to Bondi even without the sculptures.For intrepid travellers, take a train to Bondi Junction, than a bus (ask a transport staff person) to Tamarama and then do the walk. At Bondi you can stop for lunch at a host of restaurants before getting a bus to Bondi junction then a train back home.On a beautiful summer day stop for a swim at Bondi Beach (swim between the red and yellow flags).This is a beautiful part of Sydney close to the CBD If you do happen to do this walk when the Sculptures exhibition ( Oct-Nov) is on its a bonus.Enjoy

Exercise with a great view. Bondi to Coogee one of Sydney's most popular walks.Beautiful scenery, lovely beaches to stop at on the way.Hills for those who want a challenge.Can walk all the way or stop at the various beaches for coffee/ snacks for a rest.If the walk is too long for you busses are available at each of the beach areas to take you back to the city or BondiJ unction.On a sunny day no better place to be.

Magnificent. This is one of the best world coastal walk I can share. Just been there last weekend to see the Sculpture by the sea. First time me and my husband walk in there, I can tell the view is so beautiful. You can take the panoramic photo view of Bondi beach. Is just so nice.

A local treasure. I have lived for many years near this walk. It is one of the best Sydney. It never fails to lift your spirits. Even in the rain, the Pacific is magnificent. Peak time is at the end of October, early November when it hosts Sculpture by the Sea. Fabulous sculptures and extremely busy. It is busier on the weekends so if you have the opportunity to walk on a weekday do it. On the odd occasion we have seen whales. Lovely sandstone cliffs and beautiful beaches Wear sunscreen, take a hat and enjoy the scenery. Have a coffee at Bronte or a swim on the journey. It has lots of steps so leave the bikes behind. Very young children may find it too tiring so just do part of the walk. There is a playground at Tamarama for the kids. Great for jogging or even dog walking. (No dogs on the beach)

Afternoon Delight . One of my favourite walks to do on a Sunday afternoon that combines spectacular coastal views, parks, beaches and fantastic eateries on route. Some of the stairs on the walk are a little challenging for some but overall a wonderful walk that you can do all or part of. Finish with a cold drink at Bondi Icebergs ... Cheers !

take the chance to see Sculptures by the Sea if you can!. This is a lovely walk, and especially so during the annual Sculptures by the Sea exhibition. A beautiful naturally sculpted coastline, enhanced by superb artistic sculptures.

Lucky enough to catch the Sculpture on the Beach event - terrific walk - but watch out for all the runners. This is a terrific walk - great antidote to my jet lag - as I went from Tamara to Bondi and back to Coogee. Quite a way, 90-120 min round trip. Mostly it has great views - but is not well signed so you have to follow your nose - though I ended up on dead ends a couple of times. Also the hard-core fitness people are pounding the paths and generally manage to avoid you, though it can be disconcerting. I can see why they use the path as it's a stunning and easy walk - though not wheelchair friendly as there are many steps.

Beach walk. Walked from Bondi to Coogee to view the sculptures. The walk is very beautiful and there are some amazing photo opportunities along the way. The Coogee Pavilion is a great place for food and drink

Easy walk and fantastic views. Parking is a nightmare so it's best to come by public transport. It's an easy walk and the views are magnificent. And it's free!! Just watch out for the overzealous and impatient runners. They're a menace

A lovely walk, well worth the time!. The Coast Walk is gorgeous and well worth your time! You'll walk along beautiful sandstone cliffs, with views of the ocean, numerous sandy beaches, and lovely oceanfront homes. It's not strenuous at all, and you can quit whenever you like and catch a bus back to Bondi Junction, and the train station. We had lunch at the private Bondi Iceberg Club with views over the outdoor swimming pool and Bondi Beach. (Just show you ID to prove you're a tourist, and they'll wave you in.) IT was a gorgeous place for lunch!
Gorgeous walk. The walk is an easy one - takes longer than recommended when you are taking lots of pictures and absorbing the scenery. Could be done quicker than recommended time if you don't stop.

Ocean View Walk. The Bondi Beach walk is not difficult for most people to make. The beautiful scenic views of the ocean, beaches and rocks are worth the effort to get to this side of Sidney. We had a grey rainy day but the paved path was easily walked. There was a sculpture exhibit going on while we were there which made this walk even more interesting. If you are going to Sydney include this walk as part of your experience.

Fantastic walk. I never managed to do this walk on my previous trip so was determined to do it this time. We had the perfect hot weather. We hadn't realised they had the Sculptures by the Sea so that was a bonus. All the beaches are fabulous and I can honestly say it was the most perfect day. I will do the walk again on my next trip.

Great walk. What can I say that hasn't been said, except you may enjoy it more during the week as it becomes a bit busy at weekends but a great way to find a beach and see the views at the same time, good path , plenty of loos and cafes on the route
Best at any time. Love to visit when Sculptures by the sea is on, but anytime is brilliant to sea the sea/sky and nature.

A must on a visit to Sydney. We walked from Coogee to Bondi. It was a beautiful clear day. Around each bend was another spectacular view. Clovelly was a unique beach as the constructed concrete sides make the beach appear like a giant swimming pool. On the way you pass a cemetery which would be the perfect place to rest in peace. We were fortunate to see the Sculptures by the Sea exhibition. It was fabulous. The walk finished at Bondi which was just stunning. It couldn't have been better

Must do. This is a great walk and you see some a range of beautiful and varied beaches along the way. The walk is not particularly hard and will take a couple of hours especially if you decide to stop at one of the coffee shops hidden in the little bays.When you arrive at Coogee you can continue to Maroubra if you like or just check out a beautiful beachside area.Getting back you can walk back the same way , although walking along the road is more direct and will halve the time back.You could also cheat and take a $10-$15 taxi ride back to Bondi.To get to Bondi from the City you take a train to Bondi Junction and change to a bus at the station for a short ride.Return the same way. Bondi is a popular beach , However to me Coogee is a much nicer beach on a par with Manley and the Northern Beaches.

What a stunner.. I visited during the annual Sculpture by the Sea outdoor sculpture exhibition and it was brilliant. The artwork was perfectly set off against the stunning backdrop of the coastal path. The walk is pretty easy -- a few stairs but manageable for most people.

Stunning walk . What a beautiful walk. Even in grey rainy weather we still got to enjoy the gorgeous scenery. We were lucky enough to see the sculpture expo along the coast as well. Don't miss this experience.
What a wonderful walk. We had a beautiful day and the sculpture walk was fantastic. The view is beautiful ! Not too crowded . A very enjoyable experience.children and dogs abound.
Beautiful! . Magic spots. Nothing like these views! Fantastic walk. Often dolphins to see. Must when you are in Sydney. Unforgettable experience.

Art & Photography. Fabulous variety of quality artwork. Weather was spectacular at sunset and artwork was accessible as we visited on the final day - we were lucky it was extended by one day due to many days of storms and rain. We had visited prior but left due to lightning.

Energising coastal walk. This is one of the many great coastal walks that can be found in Sydney. But none start and end in the iconic beach areas of Bondi and Coogee. It is a reasonably challenging walk as there are lots of stairs and steep pathways to navigate. But the scenery is magnificent and there are many good vantage points from which you can take pictures of Bondi and other beaches. And in November the walk also feature an art exhibition called Sculptures by the Sea. The sculptures were scattered along the walk, on the rocks and on some of the grassy areas. Just another great feature to add to the ambience of the walk.
Very chilling and relaxing. Beautiful walk from beach to beach. Is a very beautiful coast line. Ideal if you are with someone special ;)

Sculptures by SEA. Scuptures by Sea is an Event each year organised by Bondi Beach. Its just 2 KM coastal walk.Its worth going there. Lovely amazing experience. Do not forget to eat Pan cakes from Cafe @ beach, they are mouth watering pan cakes.

Really nice little walk !!. I'd definitely recommend this walk down the coast if you are looking for something to do in Sydney, you can visit bondi beach and then walk along the coast and visit other little beaches which are less crowded than bondi and more chilled, as well as swing some beautiful scenery along the way.
Beautiful walk with great views. You will love this walk. Truly amazing coast line! Bondi beach alone with the great view and restaurants is worth it but the walk along the coast line is a must!

A nice way to pass a couple of hours. The scenery and views along the walk are always impressive, the beaches to stop off at are often quiet and secluded. If the art displays are on then it is even more important that you bring your camera!I recommend going from Coogee to Bondi, the final turn and having Bondi open up in front of you is spectacular.

Breathtaking in its beauty!. A stunning walk on the cliffs above the ocean. Every turn reveals a beautiful vista, breathtaking and enticing! An easy path to follow and not taxing for a moderately fit walker, highly recommended.
What a coast line. Stunning. An excellent walk with spectacular scenery. What a beautiful coast line. Take water as its a bit dry in the sun

Not to be missed!. This spectacular walk passes by the most beautiful beaches in Sydney. The natural honeycomb sandstone formations are stunning. It can be crowded during the Sculpture Exhibition in late Spring but it's worth it for the world-class artworks on display. Parents with small children will need to either take their time or do smaller sections of the walk as it is quite hilly in parts.
Saw the Sculptures by the Sea,. So many stunning works of art and now with a marquee of smaller works, it is a must at this time of year

Nice, easy-going walk. The walk from Bondi to Coogee was a nice way to see the sea and escape the hustle and bustle of the city centre. It is not a particularly challenging walk, but it does contain quite a few steps and the terrain in parts can be quite difficult. Me and my friend, in our early twenties completed the walk in an hour and a half, with stops, so the walk only takes half a day, including getting to the walk and returning to the centre. I would recommend the walk as the scenery is stunning, and it's good to do the walk even when the weather is not that great.

Breathtaking experience!. What an amazing coastal walk! You won't be bored at any point along the way with the breathtaking coastal line stealing your heart. Definitely a must do on a visit to Sydney!

Great views. A wonderful way to experience coastal Sydney. Wander from the hustle of Bondi to quiet coves at Bronte. Do in the early morning and swim and breakfast along the way. I found parkiking at Bronte the most convenient. Early weekday mornings are also best for viewing the annual Sculpture by the Sea exhibition.

Awesome walk even on a rainy day. The view is amazing, great opportunity to see the coast line and the beautiful bays between Bondi and Coogee. The Waverley cemetery is special sitting high on the cliff with the yellow flowers growing wild. The ocean baths along the walk way would be great to cool down in on a hot day.

One of the Highlights of Our Australia Trip. We did this walk on a sunny day in early October. What stunning views the entire length of the walk!The walk passes over cliff tops and then descends down to a beach for every little suburb you pass through. Recommend stopping for lunch in Bronte which is about half way. Some people only go that far but we continued from there to Coogee. We road the train to Bondi junction, took a 10 minute bus to Bondi beach. From Coogee, there was an easy bus trip back to Bondi junction for the return train to the city. Great way to spend a lovely Spring day!

Unforgettable Bondi Beach. You will love it! it was a sunny day in May when I got there and it was the first time I really got to relax on a beach.On the opposite side of the street there are great bistros offering a wide range of fine and healthy meals. Ladies - if you want to pick up some hot bikinis, you are on the very right place! There is a great store next to the bistros where you can find a variety of bikinis and other types of swimwear to look cool while sunbathing or balancing on your wake board. ;-)

10/10 experience . Went to enjoy Sculpture by the Sea (stunning); whopper thunderstorms developed in front of our eyes! Sheltered for 20mins, then went on with our walk in the warm humid air. Amazing scenery (cliffs & ocean views), great sculpture, thunderstorm show from nature - didn't know where to look. Stunning!

Every step is breathtaking. Forget the pictures you'll take on the way, those are going to be mindblowing anyways. Go in the evening just before sunset to witness breathtaking views and immerse yourself in nature.

Not too tacking. I am not an energetic person and I found this walk not too adventurous for my level. Beautiful scenery, coffee shop half way and glorious weather. Pavillion meal at the end - what could be more perfect.

Sculptures By the Sea, Bondi - Excellent. We caught the bus from Bondi Junction to Bondi, and went to Sculptures By the Sea, a wonderful way to appreciate great sculptures and fabulous coastal views, an amazing walk. I am not that able bodied so I didn't walk all the way, but took a slow walk and had plenty of rests, sitting and appreciating all the scenery and artworks, well worth the effort, take your time and enjoy.

always amazed. We love this walk! Always like to start in Coogee, leaving the car there. Sometimes we use the relaxed walking speed, but sometimes using the opportunity to do power walking (around 1hr). Beautiful picnic spots along the beach, like Tamarama. We have lunch in Bondi, and after walk back. It's approx 6 km one way. Especially great since the boardwalk was renewed couple of years ago. Definitely my favourite coastal walk in Sydney.
Amazing view. Amazing walk, highly recommend it! You can take the most beautiful photos from the area and enjoy the nice walk!

Fantastic scenery!. Our family of teens and adults all loved this walk. The views and scenery are amazing. Dropped into the cheaper cafe part of the Bondi Icebergs building for drinks and food on the way back and had superb views with our coffees! Best thing is you can do this walk just for a little while if you don't have much time or aren't feeling like too much exercise, or go further if you're up to it!

Sydney is just so beautiful. Spend an enjoyable 3 hours doing this walk, in either direction or take all day stopping for a swim or lunch,It's an easy walk especially when the view around each corner is so spectacular. To walk the coast is a pretty special feeling, in just one small length of maybe 800 meters the houses interrupt the walk, a small disappointment , lucky residents !And in Sydney there is a bus that will take you just about everywhere , so hop on and do the walk it's what Sydney is all about.

Explore the seaside arts sculpure with the baçkdrop of the ocean. The sea sculture walk is a must for those wanting to take in a great walk while appreciating innovative and clever sculpture. You'll need a reasonable level of fitness and good shoes as you traverse the çliff side steps with the appreciative crowds
LOVE THIS. I love this walk, this has to be the best walk in Sydney - All I do is literally put my earphones in & the world is OFF!
Love the walk!. The walk is remarkable! Azure blue seas, amazing beaches and perfect weather. I also love the Sculptures by the Sea exhibition going on right now.
Stunning. Absolutely a 'must do' if you can. Breath taking scenery. Go at your own pace to take it all iin don't forget to take a camera.

A must do activity when in Sydney!. A little bit hard to get to from the centre of the city, you will need to either catch a taxi, uber, or otherwise take a train then swap for a bus down to Bondi Beach. Once you get there it is worth it with great coastal scenery, beaches, exercise, beautiful people and sights. A must do if you come to Sydney and like the outdoor lifestyle.

Sculptures by the Sea. so wanted to see the Sculpture this time in Sydney, was very popular with tourists and school children, was a good walk and the sculptures were interesting, varied ones from abstract to cute, loved the walk, did only half as had somewhere else to be, but glad I had gotten to see more than just Bondi beach

A great walk. This is a fantastic walk with wonderful views along the way. You can start at either end, that is Bondi Beach or Coogee Beach, or at any point in between. You can take it easy and stop for a coffee as you go or as a fitness routine.

Scenic Walk with Sculptures. This is a must do for anyone who visits Sydney and wants to take in some beautiful beaches and seascapes. We visited while the Sculpture by the Sea exhibition was on, which made the walk from Bondi to Tamarama Beach even more spectacular. Be aware that it can get particularly crowded on weekends when there are events such as Sculpture by the Sea, so leave yourself plenty of time and be patient with the crowds. Absolutely wonderful experience.

Great walk along the ocean. We walked along the beach and there was a sculpture festival going on. We enjoyed the walked and finished the day having drinks at Icebergs. If you are daring take your swim suit along and swim in their pool.

Relaxing, peaceful walk. I did the walk on an overcast afternoon. I thought that this would have an effect on the mood of the area and my attitude towards doing the walk but it ended up making the walk a really pleasant one as it wasn't too hot and the sun was not shining down on us. We started at Bondi Beach and walked for a short while along there before heading to the concrete walking track. It's a really easy walk to follow with the path clearly marked and wide to cater for all the visitors. It's effortless really and leads itself to a nice gentle stroll. I was initially a bit daunted by the distance of the walk when I looked it up on the internet but once you get walking and enjoying the view, you really don't feel the distance.There are numerous places to rest and take in the view along the way. There are also beaches you can stop and have a swim at or shops where you can buy drinks and ice creams too.

Art at the Waterfront. Currently along the beginning of this path there are many sculpture installations, which enhances this walk beyond the natural beauty of the area. However, this also means that the walk is drawing an even bigger crowd than normal and on a sunny weekend day. If crowds bother you, go early and on a week day. While Bondi Beach seems far away on Map of Sydney, it is actually just 4 metro stops from the CBD to Bondi Junction where you switch to a buss that will drop you directly at the beach. It is fairly fast and pretty darn cheap trip to get here and a cheap, but long trip back from Coogee Beach at the end of the hike.The cliffs along the way are beautiful and the tourqouis and teal water is gorgeous.At the end of the hike, here is a quirky, but yummy Coogee Beach Club serving up Aussi style cocktails and Meditteranean food with beach views.
Bondi was amazing. My partner and i spent 2 weeks at bondi, the beach and coastline is so beautifull. It was the most magical place in the world.
Highly recommend this walk. Beautiful coastal scenery and lovely beaches, lots of people both locals and tourists were out enjoying the day.

Well worth it. This is a good hike. If you are into walking along a well built boardwalk and path system this has to be one of the best ever designed. Yes there are stairways, but none that can not be taken easily. The views are amazing. We went in October while the artwork was being shown along the pathway.

Gorgeous seaside walk. We started from Bondi, walked to Coogee in about 5 hours, including a stop for lunch at Clovelly beach and some rock trekking. Took a cab back to Bondi. The walk is not strenous and the coastal views are really spectacular.

Beautiful Walk. What a great time of year.. The weather was nice and the walk beautiful. Our timing was just right as they had the "Art by the Sea" event going on. Some beautiful art work displayed in a gorgeous setting. Be sure to stay hydrated due the distance and sun.

Must do while in Sydney. This is the best urban coastal walk you'll ever find. Starting from world-famous Bondi beach, walking along stunning cliffs and through parks, beaches (and even a cemetery!), you'll get to stunning Coogee beach. The walk continues all the way to Maroubra beach; if you are not too tired, it's well worth it. There are plenty of refreshments and food options along the way, however bringing plenty of water would be a good idea.From the City, catch a bus to Bondi beach(380,333), then catch a bus back to the City from whichever beach you end at (Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly, Coogee, Maroubra).TIP: The path is packed with joggers, specially early morning, so keep your left while walking!

Time your visit for Sculpture by the Sea festival. The best time to undertake this walk, is in late October / early to mid November to enjoy the walk and see the annual Sclpture by the Sea exhibition. There are stairs so it's not really suitable for strollers, and it can get busy, so try and head there early in the morning to avoid the crowds. Beautiful coastal walk in Sydney.
The WOW factor!. If you want the best view of the Pacific Ocean and happen to be in Sydney, walk from Bondi Beach to Coogee Beach. A wonderful vista and good exercise as well.

Do it, you'll love it. Well, I was blessed with spotting a pod of dolphins just 5 minutes into the walk. Top day for me, as it is not too common to see them. I think it is a nice walk, can get crowded if you go when I went (Sculptures on the sea was on). Somebody recommended me to do it at sunrise and I think it would make sense. Plenty of opportunities to go into the water on the way, so bring your swim suit (or swimmers, as they say)! Can be done in flip-flops (or thongs as they call them here, cause they have another word for that, too) and it is all under the sun, so have shades, sun screen etc if you go late morning/early afternoon. It is not hard but I am not sure kids, buggies or senior people should do it, as there are quite a few up's and down's
bondi beach. a good attraction - bondi beach. .nice place to go and roam around with family. love to see the shore and the activities

A lovely walk. ( Coogee to Bondi ). We decided to do this coastal walk after seeing other reviews and photos. We caught the bus from Redfurn where we were staying to Coogee after getting details of times etc from the Sydney Transport website which is brilliant for planning any journey.We walked from Coogee to Bondi Beach along the easy to follow path. The views are great and the walk is suitable for most walkers but there are quit a few steps along the way. We stopped briefly along the way for a glass of wine. After lunch in Bondi we caught another bus to Watsons Bay to get the ferry back to Sydney. We enjoyed our day even though it rained a bit along the way.

Beautiful Coastal Walk. The walk from Bondi is just beautiful. The views, the natural sculptures and sandstone carved out by the sea are just beautiful, sea breezes help, cliffs and beautiful beaches make it a spectacular walk. The slopes and steps make it great exercise - even for someone of my vintage. The Sculptures by the Sea, currently showing, make it even more special.

Great Day. We were originally going to visit Manly Beach but were running short on time and decided to go to Bondi instead. They had Sculptures by the Sea exhibit and decided to take the walk to Coogee. Glad we did the walk. Beautiful views of the water and neat art displays. Like most art, some pieces were really neat and others made you question what you were seeing. I talked to a local and I guess it's an outside gallery with people paying thousands to purchase the pieces.

A Great Sydney Tradition . The curator should be proud of 2015's Sculpture by the Sea . A balanced, well positioned grouping of artworks which invite and engage .This year we decided to do it a bit differently to previous visits and we had an easy and enjoyable outing. We recommend attacking the walk from Bronte. Aim to arrive around 7am and take breakfast in one of the many eateries. We parked in the car park directly adjacent the beach running up the hill. Take a 3 hour ticket. Cost is $10.50. Then take the walk to Tamarama where the sculptures begin. Progressing towards Bondi at thus time for us was fewer crowds and better viewing, You will feel the busyness growing as you get closer to Bondi. Don't forget to stop in to the Sculptures Inside exhibition in the park near the Grounds of Alexandria pop up. A great morning out and social media fodder abounds.

Wonderful walk. We did the whole walk stating in Bondi and ending up at Coogee Beach. Really nice coast line with cliffs, beaches for surfing and awesome landscape. Took us about 3 hours as we had lots of breaks for taking pictures and enjoying.

A Classic Coastal Walk - Many Worse Ways to Spend Half a Day. Jaw-dropping vistas from start to finish. An easy walk suitable for most fitness levels. If you're doing it with a toddler, you might at times regret bringing the stroller (a fair few steps along the way), but once you get to Coogee, you'll probably be glad you have it, as the little one will probably be ready for a nap. Just a quick one, because there's a fantastic place right at Coogee Pavillion for lunch which has a wonderful kid zone. Perfect to let them romp about while you slurp oysters and reward yourself with bubbly. Great way to spend half a day in Sydney!

Must do for any nature enthusiast. Sydney is a beautiful city and has lots to offer in terms of nature walks. Bondi to Bronte and Coogee is the first one I did and repeated a few times. Beautiful coastline and so much flora and fauna! Highly recommended.

Stopped at Bronte, that's the beauty of it.... You can walk as far as you want. Enjoy the beauty of a seaside walk on a paved trail and get off pretty much whenever you are done and ride the bus home. Its a wonderful way to take photos, watch surfers, catch sight of whales, or just get some fresh air. Loved it.

Long but Wothwhile. In good weather, the walk is very pleasant, with the sea breeze blowing in your face. Sculptures fill the walk from one end to the other, enhancing the naturally beautiful scenery. Be warned to wear something comfortable to walk as it is long and sandy. I have done the walk more than once and enjoyed it every time.

Great Walk... Amazing views! A Must Do in Sydney. This fantastic coastal walk stretches from Bondi to Coogee and takes around 2 hours at a meandering pace to complete. There are plenty of places along the way to stop and gaze endlessly out to sea or soak in the sun.The local council have done a lot of work over the recent years to make this walk easier and more enjoyable. Now instead of needing to cut through a graveyard you walk past it on a purpose built walkway. There are two stair climbs on the way, both are quite taxing and definitely not built for wheel chairs or prams. I would suggest stopping off at the Coogee Bay hotel for a cold beer at the end of the walk on a hot day... you may want to take a bottle of water, a hat and some sunscreen too as there is little shelter as you go!

Great walk for exercise and to see the best views Sydney has to offer. The walk is really beautiful, it is recommended to go on a day with good weather. Good for a walk or for a jog, especially at the moment as the Sculptures by the Sea are about to start, where you can see sculptures made by Australian artists throughout the year.
Beautiful. You can't beat this walk. Did this with family and had a great time taking pictures and soaking up the scenery. Go at your own pace, tons of things to see.

Beautiful easy 6K one way walk!. Best to park your car in Coogee. It certainly has more free street parking to offer than Bondi. We parked in neptune st, coogee. It was a nice bright sunny day that added those extra bright colours to the sea, the sea surf, the sky and the contrasting rocks. We were lucky to sight a couple of whales as we walked past clovelly beach(this beach is popular for snorkelling). And ofcourse "Sculpture by the Sea" was just too good. A nice Italian lunch was icing on the cake!!. We came back walking to coogee which was equally satisfying.
Sculpture of the Sea. You walk around this coastline during the Sculpture of the Seas festival in late October, early November
Beautiful walk!. In October there is the "Sculptures by the Sea" which adds a cultural twist to the walk. Blue sky and ocean...

Spectacular views--beautiful surf. We took the bus from downtown Sydney to Bondi Beach to see the sculptures on display along the beach walk. This gorgeous blue, sandy beach must be one of the best surfing beaches for viewers as you overlook the surfers long ride from out on the swells to the pristine beaches. Sittin or standing in the sea breeze has to be one of the most healing of meditations. If you're not a surfer you can still enjoy the beach and/or the salt water pool on the cliff side. ($6.50 fee for Bondi Iceberg Pool with swim lanes, beach is free). The art on display was contemporary and varied. Lots of shopping and eating opportunities in the neighborhood. Recommended walk if you are visiting Sydney.

Great walk especially when the Sculpture by the Sea exhibition is on. I did this walk this afternoon in lovely sunshine. The sculptural works were great but the star of the show was the ocean pounding on the rocks as we wound our way from Bondi, past Bronte and on to Coogee. The stretch from Bondi to Bronte was very busy because of the exhibition (but still pleasant). The latter part of the walk was peaceful - only the sound of the waves.

Incredible Sydney scenery, second only to the harbour. Besides from the harbour, this walk offers Sydney's most spectacular coastal views. I recommend to get the right vibe to start at Bondi and make your way to Coogee. Mostly because the beaches at the Bondi end are more active and surf orientated and the beaches at the Coogee end are focused more on relaxation/snorkelling (in the cases Clovelly and Gordon's Bay snorkelling is amazing!); and personally I find things much better when you do the relaxing things at the end rather than at the beginning. If you're a beachgoer and have a day to spare I strongly recommend making a day of this and stopping for a while at each of the beaches on the way down. Great idea to have breakfast in Bondi, stop somewhere along the path for lunch and have dinner as the sun goes down over the ocean at Coogee Bay.

Fantastic! Bring your walking shoes and a hat/sunglasses!. What a beautiful walk! If I lived nearby I would be doing this walk regularly. The coastal line is everything it should be- beautiful, powerful, dramatic! As the walk is quite long it's worth making sure you have suitable footwear. We were there over the summer so you definitely need to use sun block, have a hat and sunglasses too if you're used to that kind of heat. The coastal walk is very exposed but there are a few places along the way to stop for a drink. The walking path is also very clearly marked so even as managed not to get lost! Highly recommend this.

Wow wow. Been meaning to do this walk for the last 8 years whenever I'm in Sydney. Finally got to do it today, and Sydney turned on the sunshine. Walk it from Coogee to Bondi. On my watch 6km, took us 2hrs to do (including a few quick stops at Scuptures by the Sea). Spectacular views. A definate must do. Only reasonable fitness required.

Nice walk. We got taxi from circular quay for 35 dollars to congee beach.We had breakfast there and started walk.Nice path right along coast but lots of flies ( maybe just time of year - October?)It took us about 2 hrs to walk to bondi where we had a well deserved beer in a bar called vue To be honest bondi is not very pretty but I suppose famous and iconic - manly is much nicer

Amazing any time of the year.. I have done this walk heaps of times all year round and it never gets boring. Amazing views and sights to see. The beaches a long the way are beautiful. This walk takes roughly 2 hours, if you're stopping and starting checking out all the views. Take a picnic and make a day out of it.

If you only do one walk do this one!. Stunning scenery and a great choice of cafes and eateries along the way. This is easy walking for all ages and abilities with only one reasonable uphill piece. The Coogee Pavillion served us a splendid lunch at the end.

A walk for the Soul. This is an amazing walk where nothing is the same each time you are there. One day you may see whales, another dolphins and depending on the tides, huge waves crashing or a calm see. Bring your walking shoes and camera and indulge yourself with nature's gifts. This week see the beautiful Sculptures by the Sea, art and nature combined.

Walk, run, stroll it doesn't matter.. Definitely a must for all to do, you don't have to be super fit to do it as there are plenty of places to stop off and have a rest along the way - the beauty about that is you can actually stop and appreciate the beauty this walk offers. Popular with the locals and tourists alike - go for it and take a camera. Best enjoyed on a day the weather is at its best.
Wonderful . My Aussie mate took me to the Bondi Beach, where we started the walking track. It was really awesome.I would recommend this track. So try it for yourself :)

Excellent walk and do it from Bondi to Coogee. We have done this wall several times. It is very easy and there are regular buses to both Bondi and Coogee, so logistics are straightforward. The path is extremely well maintained and there is little chance of getting off the route.The reason that I suggest walking from Bondi to Coogee is because the pavilion at Coogee has recently been renovated and is a great place to rehydrate with a cold one (or two) after the walk. It is extremely child friendly and the catering options range from a coffee or ice cream, through stone-baked pizza to excellent seafood and sushi. Something for all tastes. And there is a decent bar with Lashes on tap.
Scenic footpath along some of the most stunning coastline in the world. We did the there and back walk of approx. 8 miles whilst the Sculpture Trail was on which is free and well worth visiting.
Nice walk, great views!. It's a great way to see the coastline from a different point of view than just lying on the beach. It is quite steep at some points. Beautifull walk!

One of Sydney's best walks. Alongside the Spit to Manly walk, this is one of the best walks in Sydney. Breathtaking beauty, and plenty of opportunities along the way to stop and take it all in. World class.

Best coastal walk (or run) in the world. The views from this coastal walk are second to none, and the fact that they're in a popular suburb of Sydney and a few km from the centre is incredible, given most similar locations would usually be far out in the wilderness.There are convenient cafes en-route at each of the beaches, which themselves are fantastic, and it's great to hang out at any of them.

Beautiful beach!. If you love beaches, this is a great beach to visit via public transportation from Sydney. The coastal walk from Bondi Beach to Bronte is well worth the effort. We were fortunate to view humpback whales frolicking off shore. The views are stunning!

Best things in the world are free :). This is what I enjoyed the most in Sydney. Absolutely stunning views of the Tasman Sea, great cliff views, people watching, small cosy beaches to grand big ones where you can see surfers practising, probably what I think would be the world's most expensive burial plot, world's best views from a swimming pool - all this for free during this refreshing wonderful walk. I would recommend everyone to do atleast a part of this walk, if not the full path. Infact, due to lack of time, we could not walk from Maroubra Bay, but started instead from Coogee and walked upto Bondi. Very very well maintained coastal walk where you can see the locals doing their morning yoga, and running along the same path <no wonder they're all so fit!>

Beautiful coastal scenery. Enjoyed the Bondi to Coogee coastal walk on the weekend. Also happens to be the Sculptures by the Sea exhibition at this time of year when there are an amazing selection of sculptures placed at interesting points all along the walk. The Sculptures by the Sea exhibition is held every year at the end of October to early November. It is extremely popular and thus attracts quite large crowds. Most of the crowd are visiting the sculptures and ice you reach Tamarama walking south most of the crowd starts to disperse and the remainder of the walk is much less crowded. Some amazing vistas looking both north and south taking in both coastline as well as beach views and some amazing coastal homes. The walk is easily accessible by public transport by train to Bondi Junction and then a bus to Bondi Beach. Equally there are ample buses servicing Coogee at the other end of the walk from a number of parts of the CBD. On a fine day it is an amazing day out that is a relatively easy walk.

Great walk, go during sculpture week. A beautiful walk along the coast, I would recommend walking from Bondi to Coogee, as you are supposed to walk on the left hand side. This will put you on the ocean side, so any stops for picture are easy and you do not have to cross a line of people.We were there during sculpture week, so it was a nice addition to the scenery, with 50+ large pieces of art along the way. If you have the energy, it is a great walk. If you don't think you can make the full 6km, walk what you can and take a bus back home, they seem to be along most of the route.

outstanding walk. absolutely great coastal walk. so scenic and pretty. and you can have a swim at the end too. doesn't take too long and at the right time of year can see whales moving through. good to run it too early in the morning or late evening when less people on it.

A beautiful walk. We did not do the whole Bondi to Coogee, but we were blessed with fabulous weather and the sights are breathtaking. A lovely way to spend a few hours, breathing in the fresh salt air!

An awesome walk that tourists and locals need o take. This coastal walk is superb.... Obvioulsy best taken on a clear sunny day - but really at any time this spectaculr coastal walk is worth taking.For tourists from overseas this is a great way to see some of our beautiful coastline - while see the locals jog by or the surfers making the most of the local swells.Both the beginning at Bondi and the end at Coogee have lovely restaurants and cafes for a break. Starting at either end will allow you to catch a bus back to where you started.

Sculptures by the sea Bondi to Tamarama Beach. My husband & I completed this walk today with our dog.It was very relaxing . We stopped for a snack at Tamarama Beach kiosk as there was a rainy squall. Standards of the sculptures have mproved from the early years. Sculptures will be there till the 8th November 2015. Weekends would be very busy.
Always Good in Any Weather. I prefer Coogee to Bondi direction, but hey, it's always good no matter which direction you start from. An all time classic for locals and tourists alike.
A 'must expereince' if visiting Sydney. Visit Sydney's beautiful Eastern Suburbs beaches on this magnificent coastal walk and experience Aussie beach culture up close.
Great Walks. Walk alone, with a friend two or four legged, love the views. Some hills and stairs to keep it interesting and lots of food and coffee choices after.

Must Do. Lots of native vegetation along this walk that attracts the local birds. In December and January the Large Black Cockatoos can be seen feeding on some of the smaller trees and shrubs. And circling on the cooler air currents offshore to escape the heat.The views are amazing and plenty of places to sit and relax as well. Clovelly is gorgeous and worth the walk if you are coming from Bondi.

Amazing walk. The walk from Bondi to Coogee beach is higly recommended. The grade is moderate with some steps, but easily achievable even by reasonably mobile older folk. It takes 2-3 hours each way - and we had lunch at a very nice Coogee restaurant! Views are outstanding, and the beaches and ocean (and whales) lovely. Recommend parking at North Bondi where parking is usually available and inexpensive

Sculptures by the Sea< Hobbit hole to eat at, Sculptures inside. What an amazing way to spend the day, family friendly, this year they have a Hobbit Hole to eat at, thanks to The Grounds, and Sculptures inside. All awesome things to see. Amazing water colour, there are a couple of levels, to view from, if you have bad knees, some stairs are a killer, but there is a rail. Great for Couples, Families, Friends, Solo.
GOOD IDEA. We did it with some friends. it was a really nice afternoon. Something to do when the weather is sunny
Sculpturific. Go and see the free sculptures between hunter park and tamarama park until 8 November 2015. Worth seeing and you can carry on the costal path.

Sculpture By the Sea. This is a gorgeous walk, with and without the sculptures. Sculpture by the Sea is the highlight, however, enhanced by the natural beauty of the Australian coast. We would heartily recommend visiting the sculptures, or at other times of the year, just savouring the view.

Art by the sea. First took this walk a few years ago when the open air art exhibition was on. I think it was November! So interesting, every few yards there was another piece of contemporary art. The walk itself was fairly easy going in the most part with the most stunning views of the sea and the beaches although I wouldn't recommend it for anyone with moderate walking difficulties, it's quite a way!

Bronte Beach to Bondi Beach walk. Spectacular viewswalking along the coast. Bronte Beach to Bondi Beach is a fairly easy walk - not for mobility issues though. Would highly recommend doing this - and soaking up the views!

Spectacular on a nice day. This really is a great walk on a nice day and at the right time of the year you can also see the sculptures by the sea at the same time as well as spending come time at some famous and lovely beaches.
Stunning walk. Amazing views, make sure you take a camera. The walk is reasonably flat( a couple of hills). Make sure to wear sunblock.
lovley weather. great walk easy, about 2 hours a long to beach, I'll be walking this path again. Such beautiful views and fun places to stop for coffee/ ice cream along the way.
Heavenly. Beach is beautiful, soft clean sand. Easy swimming. Lots of surfers. Catch the 50 meter pool, only $6. Walk wasn't too crowded, but we're a bit off season. Walk is doable for all ages.
Fabulous views of the coast. Great for an early morning run or just a walk... Fabulous views, clean and clear pathways/boardwalks with water fountains along the way!

Perfect day, perfect walk. I have wanted to do this walk for years and finally got my wish. It was a hot and sunnny day, ideal conditions. We started early from the Coogee end with a breakfast first at Barzura (separate review, very good) and then walked at a moderate pace to thoroughly enjoy the breathtaking views and soak up the atmosphere. There are some steepish spots and quite a few stairs. I am not particularly fit, but we managed it easily within about 2.5 hours, including a stop for a drink and a sit at Bronte. Favourite spot was Gordon's Bay. Take a camera, sunscreen and water. There are drinking fountains along the way if you forget. Ended it with a swim at Bondi icebergs, a magical place. Perfect walk, perfect day. You Sydneysiders are lucky people!

Fantastic views! Truly spectacular! And other superlatives:))). We walked this Coastal Walk in February and we did it again this October! We're sunburned --- again --- but it's so worth it:) Awesome!!!It's best to start at Bondi Beach, meander along the coast, watch the surfers, take a million pictures, have a picnic, swim at Tamarama Beach, dive into the Bronte pool (freeze your bum), swim again in Coogee Beach, then catch a bus back to Bondi Junction.
Awesome view!. Probably the best walk you can make in Sydney. Stunning views and a feeling of freedom that is hard to find somewhere else.
Best Scenery in Sydney. This 3 km. walk edges coastal areas and 3 beaches. You can do it at your own pace and visit beaches as you like. It is clearly marked and signposted.

Lovely walk. A lovely walk along the coast with some interesting and beautiful view points along the way. There are some steeper inclines and steps during the walk and you'll be exposed to the sun for long periods of time so dress accordingly - good comfortable walking shoes and sunscreen. If you want a good workout this is the route for you - several outdoor gym points are easily accessible throughout and have guidance on how best to use them provided. Loved that I got to see the building and start of Sculpture by the Sea exhibition - fun addition to the walk.
Lovely Walk. One of the worlds best coastal walks to be recommended if you are visiting Sydney or even Australia. It is a great way to viewing other beaches besides Bondi!

Beautiful walk. This is a must if you enjoy walking and taking in the beautiful coastline. Make sure you wear a hat and sunscreen on your walk, as there is a lot of exposure to sun along the way. My boyfriend and I did the walk spontaneously, and were not dressed comfortably for a long walk - we were hot and sweaty, and got burned.

Never been a better time..... Sculpture by the Sea begins today, making this walk probably the best thing you could do in Sydney over the next couple of weeks.Things to remember: there are heaps of steps and there are gonna be a lot of people (especially on weekends). Prams and bicycles don't make any sense here. Neither does running, either, really.No, bring some sunscreen and a camera and a bikini. Don't forget your Opal card to take the local transport outta here. Best tip: if you insist on being dressed, then finish at Icebergs (overhanging South Bondi) and have a cold beer, looking for whales. Tis the season!
Magnificent!! . Great walk path along the coast. Stunning views of the Pacific Ocean. Great for running and other outdoor activities. We went on a rainy day however it was still amazing experience.

Make sure you apply sunscreen. Even on an overcast day in oz, the UV rays wreak havoc. The walk is quite long - depending on your pace it might take 2 hours to fully appreciate each of the beach coves etc. Tamarama is beautiful and likewise Bondi perspective as you come around the corner to see the beach is too. Don't forget to visit Bronte though, also a pleasurable beach!!

Beautiful, relaxing vibe. Must do if your in Sydney and love beaches/nature. A mixture or urban architecture/ coast and beach views it was simply stunning. I got lost part way but the friendly locals made sure I got back on track.

An Energetic Walk Along the Coast. This is a great walk with fantastic coastal scenery. It is very up-and-down, with lots of steps and steep sections, so it is better for people who are reasonably fit and active. There are many places to stop and take in the view, so you can go at your own pace. Once you get to Coogee, reward yourself with a beer at the Coogee Bay Hotel. Sections of this walk can get very crowded on weekends and holidays, which can affect your enjoyment if you get caught in it.

Walk, Admire View, Take a Photo. Repeat.. My colleagues and I flew in from San Francisco and landed at 6:30 am. This was the perfect way to spend our first day adjusting to the time, stretching our legs, and breathing in the fresh ocean air. Though it was late August, I even took a dip in one of the cove side salt water pools. If you have the time, stopping for lunch at Icebergs, a surf lesson, or some lawn bowling would be a nice way to lengthen the day. Caution: The buses were hard to predict, so returning to the start of the route took a bit longer than we anticipated.
Great 3 mile ocean side walk.. Easy 15 minute train ride from DT Sydney. Fun surfing town and beautiful beaches. Lots of nice beachside cafes.

The Best of Sydney. The Bondi- Coogee beach walk is the perfect way to get a taste of all Sydney's most beautiful views. From the city beach at Bondi, to the smaller bays, you might see volleyball tournaments, snorkelling youngsters, park picnics, rock pools, lifeguards and about 6 of the prettiest beaches in the area, each with their own personality. The walk is 6ks 1 way, and the traffic ranges from mum's & bubs, retirees, to young athletes racing for time. Weekdays are the best time to go, and both Bondi or Coogee have plentiful eating opportunities as a post-walk reward. I prefer to start at the Coogee end, as there is street parking nearby, or a beach carpark ($4/hr).

A must do acitivity while in Sydney!. Given that I love the outdoors and walking, and after reading all the great reviews on this walk, it was definitely something I had to do whilst on vacation in Sydney. It was really great, beautiful beaches, the views were amazing. You will see a lot of rich and famous people in Australia here it's interesting to see those giant mansions. There are lots of little cafes and restaurants along the way to grab a bite to eat and relax. Also plenty of beaches to take a swim (although the water was a little cool for me). I definitely recommend this if you go to Sydney

Good walk and caught the bus at the end. Was surprisingly busy path for a Tuesday with a few showers. Is likely a bit crowded on a weekend with nice weather. We used our Opal cards to catch the bus back to Bondi Junction making the trip easy.
Dream place for a jogger. Everyone visits Bondi Beach but take your time to walk or jog the whole coastal walk, You will see spectacular views and beautiful people.

Amazing walk. This walk is s challenging but rewarding walk , this walk takes in stunning scenery and many beaches along the way before you reach coogee beach , the walk is 6km in total and takes around 90 minutes to complete at a steady pace. There are water fountains along the way to fill up water bottles to prevent dehydration , overall brilliant walk and will challenge your fitness

Beautiful walk. We actually covered only half of this walk, and worked it in reveres (Bronte Beach to Bondi), which made more sense since we wanted to dine in Bondi (more options there). It was a great walk, not very demanding (for two folks in not-too-great shape), with lots of photo-taking opportunities.Highly recommended!

Great coastal walk with decent paths / some steps. This walk is a great way to get some fresh air & exercise whilst enjoying the coast line. You can walk at any pace or run it, and you can go one way (6k), part way & return or you can walk the full distance and return. You can walk in either direction and stop off at any of the beaches (or cafés at Coogee/Clovelly/Bronte/Bondi) along the way. It is hilly and there are quite a few steps (some are steep/uneven, but all with handrails) but generally the route is well paved and manageable for most people of all ages, just walk it at your own pace. Some people walk it in thongs but I'd recommend wearing trainers or walking sandals and taking a water bottle (there are refill stations on the walk if needed).This walk is worth doing for visitors or Sydney-siders alike.

Lovely walk with nice views and some stairs to help with that cardio. The walk itself is pleasant, but having the ocean and view makes this one of the best places to exercise. There is usually an ocean breeze, and there are great places to stop along the way. From beach level you also get to the headlands and can watch the surfers catching the waves. It;s best to avoid the Bondi end during the Sculptures By The Sea period as it's too busy then.

Nice way to see the coast. Caught the bus (333 or 380) from circular quay to Bondi. Takes about 40 minutes. The walk requires a reasonable level of fitness,due to the steps and undulating terrain. There are lots of places to stop. Pack a towell, bathers and sunscreen. Takes about 2 hours with a few stops.

One of the best walks in Sydney. A must do!!!!!. This is a totally fabulous walk. There are lots of stairs to climb but the view far out weigh the climb. The view is absolutely spectacular. Try and park in a back street in Bondi/Tamarama, there is all day parking available there or catch a bus from Bondi Junction. There are a few great spots to stop for lunch or a coffee, or just power through and it's fabulous exercise. Go early and enjoy the peace and quiet. The later you go the busier it gets. First 2 weeks of November is Sculptures by the Sea. It's free and fabulous, but so overcrowded. So definitely go early or on sunset. Take you swimmers and enjoy a swim on the way.

Great and beautiful walk in Sydney. The Bondi to Coogee Beach costal walk is very scenic walk along the coast line taking in some of Sydney's iconic beaches. I wouldn't consider it easy but a moderate walk due to some steep hills and stairways. There are plenty of toilets along the way and lots of places for a snack or a meal.

Fantastic Walk!. The Bondi to Coogee walk is probably the best free attraction in Sydney. We were lucky enough to have great weather for the day. The walk is around 5 km and is mostly flat or gently sloping. It has great views of ocean, cliffs, beaches and surfers!

Busy but good!. Best done over a full day so you can swim at each beach (walking gets hot!) but full thing can be done in 2 1/2 hours. The path does get very busy in summer but views a re great. Would recommend walking from Coogee to Bondi rather than the other way round. Its cool to see Bondi from a distance and walk towards it.

a very good walk. Its a very beautiful long walk besides the coast. We liked the Bondi and Bronte beaches esp the Bronte beach less crowded , shady and green. This walk would be better on less sunny day as we were totally burnt during our walk , but still it was worth it

A 'Must do' when in Sydney. For various reasons this walk a must do at least once in a lifetime, whatever your age, for personal wellness physically, mental well being. On such a walk the sheer beauty of your surrounds wakens your creativity, quietens your very inner soul, brings you peace, personal satisfaction. Your senses wake up so suggest no headphones or mobile distractions. Just listen to the birds, the sea, the wind, just look for whales, tortoises, fish, the movement of the waves, the clouds in the sky, enjoy the rthythm of your body whether walking, cycling or jogging, with or without company. Do pack water, wear sunscreen, bring a camera, wear sunglasses & hat, enjoy a coffee/wine/water after the event. Most special time to do this walk is when Sculptures By the Sea are exhibited for extra stimulation, interest. After such a day, you are sure to sleep well with a smile on your face.
Lovely walk. Enjoyed the walk plenty of places to take photos. We actually did the walk in reverse which was really good. We were surprised by the area the cemetry took.
Great walk. Peaceful walk, l enjoyed the gentle stroll but you could use it for training purposes.Great views of the beaches and rocks faces

Gorgeous. This is a great walk if you have the time. Be sure to dress appropriately and bring water. It can get quite crowded, especially in the Bondi region, but well worth it for the views. Be sure to take the time to stop at some of the cafes in Bondi.
Spectacular views. Amazing scenery and a great work out too. Can often be very crowded and there are some steep stairs so must be moderately fit.

Beautiful way to view the Coasts. My sister and I decided to join the Seven Bridges Walk this year and needed to warm up for the event. This walk was on the top of the list of walks to do in Sydney and I can see why. The surroundings are magnificent. The walk is about 4km and took us 90minutes to complete. I dread walking even a km but this was well worth it. Along the way you'll encounter plenty of people walking, walking their dog, running etc each coast was packed with people swimming, tanning or playing volley/frisbee. Although the sun was hella hot, it didn't stop us the beautiful scenery/views are the things you wanna capture so make sure you stop along the way and take a panorama shot. If you're on a mission to lose weight/stay fit, doing this walk will help you'll definitely be too busy enjoying the surroundings to notice you're 'exercising' lol
Fantastic link between two most enjoyable beaches. It is not just a link or walk but a belt connecting many small beaches together. The beauty of it is beyond any word. Highly recommended.

It is a lovely walk. It is a super walk, but there are lots of ups and downs, and numerous sets of stairs, so wear comfortable foot wear. Just before you get to Bronte there is a massive grave yard, which is worth a visit. It not there is a walkway round it now. The scenery is amazing.

You'll be glad you didn't miss it!. The most perfect way to spend the day not matter who you are. The sun shines, the sand is soft and the water is crystal clear. The paths are easy to walk, with slight elevation, to the scenic cliffs of the eastern coast and to then down to the beautiful bays. Enjoy the vibe of everyone's enjoyment as you hear the laughter, chatting and distant music. I hoped off at Gordon's bay for a snorkel, after a morning swim at Coogee. This is my mist favorite place in Australia.

Coogee to Bondi coastal walk. Have done this walk several times and always has been enjoyable.We normally park in Denning Street, South Coogee and walk down the 217 steps ( I think ) opposite Garie Place to join the walkway. The walk is pretty testing at times but the views compensate for this, there are some nice places along the way to grab a coffee and take a break, carrying some water is recommended and the walk can be pretty busy at times. After a nice stop and wander through Bondi we do the reverse and walk back to Coogee giving a different perspective on the views. By the time you have ascended the 217 steps you are able to sit on the bench at the top, gather your breath, have a drink and feel pleased of you effort before heading home.

One of my favourite things to do!. As long as you don't have young children this is one of the most wonderful walks in Sydney. Whichever way you walk you have coffee stops at Taramama beach and lovely cafes in Bondi and Bronte as a treat at the end x

Fit, fun and fantastic coastal walk. Circa 7 k walk one way. You can either do the whole or partial walk, and can commence at either Bondi Beach or Coogee Beach, both are easily accessed via bus services to / from the city. If decide to break journey, best to do so at Bronte / Clovelly where bus access to the city is also available. If drive, there is time limit parking at Clovelly and Coogee Beach. Most scenic coastal walk that will connect you to the sea whilst still on land. Rustic cliff rocks, sand, surf, swim, snorkel and kite flying - young and old, couples and families - scenic and relaxing - you can easily be lost in the atmosphere which truly reflects Australians' favorite past time. Walk is generally easy path with some hills and steps. You can however stop and rest at kiosk or seaside / parkland benches to recharge. Best spot to snorkel - Clovelly. Private swimming bath at a small fee available at Coogee Beach and Surf school at Bondi Beach. If visiting in late October, Sculpture by the Sea annual event is a must inclusion at Bondi Beach. Make the effort for this walk to get fit and enjoy the fun day out by the sea.
One of my favourite walks. I just love this walk. To think it's pretty much in the heart of Sydney - spectacular views, sea air!
Coastal Walk. Mid summer this track is very busy but it is always a great track to walk regardless. The scenery is always changing, is coastal, and urban.

Congee , Clovelly ,Bronte and return. It was a rather windy and overcast October morning , but we did the coastal path from Coogee to Bronte , where we had an enjoyable stop for lunch ( at least eight restuarants , so plenty of choice ) anfd then the return cutting through the cemetery , Accoding to the Smart phone app , total steps 14,251 , total distance 10.41km , total climbing 40 flights , total time ( including a fairly leisurely lunch ) - three hours . Well worth the effort !

One of my favourite walks in Sydney. I've done this walk numerous times and still love it. Fantastic views plus it gets the heart going. There are a view hills to navigate (+ steps) and it can get busy but don't let that put you off.

A must do while in Sydney. Yes, it can get crowded, particularly in the summertime at weekends, but the views more than make up for it.Take a couple of hours to get away from the hustle and bustle of Bondi Beach by taking a leisurely stroll along the coastal walk taking in some breathtaking views. There are plenty of water stations en route in case it gets too hot as well as nice cafes for a pit stop. You'll also get to see some of the smaller lesser known beaches away from Bondi - Tamarama, Bronte, and Clovelly are all very nice and a bit more secluded.Finish the walk in Coogee with a well deserved drink or bite to eat at the Coogee Pavilion, nicely set on the edge of the beach. It's a big airy venue, has a good drinks selection and the food is pretty decent too.
Lovely easy walk. My husband and I started this walk fromCongee beach. The walk was nice and easy with lovely views of the coast. Definitely worth seeing.
