Beautiful walk. Took a while as i did it with my friend, Alice. We just walked and talked and took plenty of photos, it was great. I enjoyed myself, and the day wasn't fabulous weather but I still loved it.

A must visit!!. If I'm lucky enough to return to Sydney, I'll be walking this path again. Such beautiful views and fun places to stop and grab a bite along the way. Tips, Be sure to get the number for a taxi wherever you end up. It can be a long walk back depending on how long the stroll. Also, bring good shoes to walk in but that can easily slip off in case you want to get some sand between your toes. The walk can be as short or as long as you'd like but I recommend giving it the full afternoon at least with stops for snacks, pics and exploring.

Spectacular views around every corner.. We took a cab from Sydney to Coogee and then walked from Coogee to Bondi Beach. Then we had lunch at Bondi Beach. The walk winds along the coast line and around each corner is another beautiful beach. Bring your camera and a water bottle and wear sneakers. It's a great half day activity.

Room with a view . Actually there is no room but there are lovely views on this walk. The walk is mostly a stroll and there are rest stops and water to be had on the way. Once at Coogee there is a large buzzy cafe for a few well earned calories.

A Must Do. Bondi Beach is fabulous. Great surf, good beach so well worth the trip. Then be sure to top off your visit with the Bondi to Coogee walk. A variety of spectacular views as well as diverse beaches and quaint shops. Have lunch along the way to take in the beach vibe. It seems longer than it is but still a moderate level walk. One of the best free activities in Sydney

Best views in town. This was one of my fav walks to do... we did it nearly every Sunday when we lived in Coogee. The views are amazing. Its the best way to kick the hangover after a few drinks on a Sat. Its a much if you are in town
Beautiful Views!. Highly recommend this when in Sydney. We did it late afternoon when the sun was coming down and it was stunning. It isn't a hard walk. Just stroll and enjoy.
Great views. Lovely walk but not suitable for wheelchairs or prams. Views are fantastic. Do remember to put on suntan lotion as there is no shade. Plenty of beaches and cafes on the route.
Life's a beach . Absolutely the best beach near Sydney. Enjoy a cooling swim or surf the insanely waves a bit further from the beach.

Healthy & stunning views. This walk is a must for anyone who likes good views and walking. Your able to enjoy the Australian great outdoors in an easily accessible location. Get fitter and then have coffee and lunch at one of the many great cafes.

MERMAIDS MISSING. Much cleaner beaches than when lived here in the sixties. Sadly the three mermaids on the rocks are gone?? The walks are worth doing. The views are great. there are some great coffee spots and there are some wonderful natural health shops for incredibly tasting tucker. Bondi will always be worth visiting by all world visitors.

Amazing views. The walk is a fairly easy walk just over 5KM with well maintained boardwalks and steps. Its not lit up at night so best to walk during the day through to sunset. The views are amazing so don't forget your camera and swimmers in the warmer months as there are many beaches you pass on your walk with nice cafes for a break.

Stunning. Did the Bondi Beach to Coogee walk my first day. Was speechless for most of the walk - it was so beautiful it took my breath away. I walked the trail in 4 hours (should only take about 1-2 hours but I stopped a lot to take photos and to have a coffee and lunch). Definitely something I will do again when I'm back :)

Gergeous walk especially at sunrise. One of my favourite walks in Sydney especially if you love the ocean. Best time to go is sunrise....beautiful views and less people.Talk a bottle of water with you. Plenty of steps and ups and downs to get the kilojoules burning but you can go as fast or slow as you like. also plenty of rest areas to take in the view. See dolphins off the coast at the right time and it tops it off.Stop at Bondi to refresh with a yummy breakfast and get on your way again to burn it off. a must any day of the week

Scenic walk, fantastic views. A great way to see Sydney coastline. We love to drive to Tamarama and walk back to Bondi having breakfast or lunch at the beach before making the return journey. As a tourist it would be spectacular and a great way to show off Sydney. Can get very hot so would not recommend in the middle of the day in summer. When Sculptures by the Sea is on it gets REALLY crowded so be warned but the sculptures are fantastic to see and even my kids love seeing and discussing them.

Awesome event. Beautiful coast made more beautiful by sculptures! Sculptures by the sea is my favourite event in the Bondi calendar. Installations are occurring and this year it runs from 22nd oct to 8th November. Now you can't traverse the coastal walk with prams, but baby carriers and a bottle of water are fine. Every year just gets better, so this is a must!

A highlight of Sydney. The coastal walk is one we always take overseas and interstate guests on. If fact we don't even need a reason to do this beautiful walk.Starting at the southern end of Bondi the path winds its way around the various beaches and inlets all the way to Coogee. On the way you can sea the dramatic seascape, sandstone cliffs, whales (if you're lucky), surfers catching waves, Sydney locals going for a walk or a jog, people walking dogs etc. This is a real Sydney-sider thing to do. Along the way you can stop at Bondi, Tamarama, and Bronte for a coffee or more at one of the many cafes or beach kiosks, or have a picnic with a view. Another thing to do is to stop at the Bondi Icebergs (perched on the southern end of the beach) for a drink or snack. This is a great way to see a spectacular part of Sydney for free! Highly recommended.

Fabulous views..must do.. This is a wonderful walk and very easy though if you have knee issues the stairs can/do hurt afterwards but it's worth the trouble. Take your time with short stops along the way, just to enjoy take in the view. There are several places to stop for brunch, lunch, or coffee. Wait until you finish before that well earned glass of something. I would recommend not trying this walk on the weekend as too many people. I tried but ended up going back during week when not so busy.

One of Sydneys best attractions. Start from Bondi, breakfast at Bronte and don't forget to wander the cemetery (who wouldn't want to be buried in there). Try to tee it up to coincide with Sculptures by the Sea in Oct/Nov.
Amazing coastal walk. It's a beautiful walk, and not too difficult. Stop along the way for a meal or coffee or just to enjoy the scenery. Nice cafes in Bronte.

Time Out. Get away from the big city with this fabulous coastal walk at the southern end of Bondi Beach. It's a cliff walk with stunning views. Stop off halfway at one of Bronte's numerous cafes, then walk to Clovelly or Gordon's Bay where you can have a swim. Finally down the hill to Coogee where you can stop in At the Coogee Pavilion for lunch. If you're lucky you might see dolphins and whales. Easy walking. If you're in the mood you can go all the way to Maroubra on this coastal walk - allow another 45 mins.

Stunning views and whale watching. This walk is a must do. Best in summer when it's warm and you can swim, but the views are amazing on any sunny day. Full of beautiful people out for a jog or walk before work. Must see Sydney attraction, even if you just spend an hour and walk from Bondi to Tama and back.

Amazing views. A great way to see the fantastic coastal scenery ! We walked from Coogee to Bondi which is 5km it's a clearly marked coastal path that takes you to Gordon's Bay , Clovelly, Bronte ,tamarama then finally Bondi .It can be quite strenuous in parts & I would recommend comfortable shoes .Its great in all weathers but I would also recommend suncream even when cloudy as the uv rays can still burn you Again this is a free activity but I have seen it advertised in tourist booths for $40 ! Don't get sucked in !
fanastic view. great view we walk from Coogee to Bondi as at Bondi we have duck pancakes at Ravesi Hotel on Campbell Street Bondi just great

Im unfit and found it an easy walk.. What a wonderful walk-easy for any fitness level-just take your time and enjoy the amazing views!!!!!! Recommend Bondi to Coogee seemed a little less up hill steps.
A Must!. the walk is easy and breath taking! Plan a full day at Bondi, do the walk and then treat yourself to the downtown. bus 333 goes direct from the harbor to Bondi.

A world class walk. This is by far my favorite walk in and around Sydney. Take your time and do the return trip. Stop at Tamarama for coffee (and a quick dip). Eat at Bondi RSL for a real cheap treat afterwards.

Amazing!. My husband and I did this walk in October 2015. We were short on time so we ended up taking a taxi to & from. We started in Coogee and headed up to Bondi. All together, it was close to 4 miles. Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful. One of our favorite things we did in Australia.

Breathtaking views and not strenuous. If you're visiting Sydney, be sure to put the Bondi to Coogee Coastal walk on your To Do list. Take the train to Bondi Junction and then the bus to Bondi Beach. Roughly five kilometers later you'll catch a bus from Coogee back to Bondi Junction. Bondi Beach is incredibly wide from shore to water. We were there on a week day in October and attendance was sparse. We watched some skilled surfers tackling sizeable waves. The rock formations formed by eons of erosion are remarkable. Be sure to have your camera batteries fully charged and plenty of room on the storage card. Unlike the beach walk in Newport, RI, there are no difficult stretches. Every path is smooth and wide. Crashing waves might prompt you to shoot some video. There's even a large plot of land devoted to lawn bowling. You'll pass multiple beaches. This was one of the highlights of our trip to Sydney.
Mark. Great walk from Bondi to Bronte setting up sculptures by the sea around Matks Park today the ocean was Wild with southerly wind and ocean chop not to many walking today

Photogenic coastal walk. One of the best coastal walks we've done. A fairly busy path on a weekend, but wide enough to cater for everyone using the path, from casual walkers to joggers. Plenty of photo opportunities. Plan a couple hours to really enjoy, perhaps even stop for a coffee or a swim at one of the patrolled beaches. Easily accessed via public transport.

An amazing walk. Well worth the time and sore legs! A remarkably diverse walk; you can watch the surfers at Bondi, see the rock carvings, explore the beaches, clamber along cliffs, see people fishing out on the rocks, watch wedding photoshoots. If you can time your walk to finish at either Bondi or Coogee at sunset, so much the better!

Breezy diversion. Nice walk and easy. There and back about 2 hours. On a par with Cliff Walk in Newport Beach without the palatial cottages, but the Aussie real estate prices are still high for something less than a palace

Sun, beaches and good company!. One of the best coastal walks I've done and loved it. I found there were many places to stop and take photos of the view. It can be crowded sometimes especially when there's a mix of people running, families and tourists but nonetheless, it's a great way to get out and enjoy the views and finds along Bondi to Coogee. I would definitely do this walk again with friends!
Great way to see Sydney beaches. A great free activity to do in Sydney. Wonderful views, and great tracks, a great way to experience the Sydney beaches first hand

Wonderful Walk. My husband and I took this walk and started the actual walk around 11. I would recommend starting earlier in the day as the sun can get pretty intense. We are not big beach people but loved the water views and the amazing way the rocks have formed along the path. I wish we had been able to view the sculptures but there was one from 2012 still standing so I am sure the whole exhibit would be beautiful. The walk took about 2 hours but there are plenty of spots to stop and relax if needed. Please keep in mind there are quite a few stairs and some steeper spots so be prepared for those.

Must do! . One for the bucket list in sydney, a must do for tourist's and locals. Especially early morning when it's quiet, avoid if possible on weekend afternoons in summer because it's packed. Enjoy a cocktail in Pavilion, Coogee afterwards or in Bondi try Bucketlist / Hardware on Hall St

Congee > Bondi. The views at Congee surpass that of Bondi. It is an easy and paved walk with clear signages along the way. Do wear comfortable shoes. I would strongly discourage people from cycling the route as it is not bicycle friendly. We walked from Congee to Bondi and ended with an awesome lunch at Trio Cafe in Bondi. Advise for winter travellers, do bring a warm coat as the area gets pretty windy in the morning.

A truly beautiful walk - just do it!. A truly beautiful walk - just do itThis walk follows the cost all the way from Bondi beach to Coogee. It's a reasonable distance and includes some fairly big climbs particularly towards the Coogee end, which can be hard work when it's hot. I'd suggest starting in Bondi, which is easy to get to from Sydney using the buses. I'd allow 2 to 3 hours so you can relax and enjoy it. There are plenty of places you'll want to stop and take in the views.

Beautiful walk! Great for exercise or scenic view. Highly recommended.Put aside a decent 2 - 3 hours for this. Opportunity to take hepas of photos at various points from one end to the other (Coogee to Bondi).On the route there will be plenty of people who are exercising/jogging so if you're into fitness this great walk/atmosphere to be in amongst. The color of the water and the waves amongst the large rocks make for good photography!Overall scenic experience!

Tremendous. Tremendous walk. The beautiful beaches are each different in their own way. The natural pools and rock formations are fantastic. We ended our walk at Bronte and took the bus back to the CBD because continuing to Coogee would add another 1-2 hours.

Take with you some of the most interesting views Sydney has to offer. If you are an early bird and like walking, the Bondi to Coogee (or backwards) is an amazing way to start your day with a beautiful sunrise.You will have to the east the endless view of the sea, to the north Bondi houses and south Tamarama , Bronti, Cloverlly and finally Coogee. Each beach has its own charm, you will watch the early surfers getting into the water before jumping into a suit to work, many will be exercising in Tamarama, Further on the swimmers in Cloverlly and once you get to Coogee, you get the best views of the endless ocean (the occasional whale or two jumping off the water and the rock pool to the side) that are just breath taking... Many (including myself) go there to take a sit and watch the sun go up for a few minutes.If you are a visitor of Sydney, this walk is delightful. Is not too hard and anybody (regardless of your physical condition) should be able to do it. There are lots of ramps for people riding motorised chairs, so no worries. If you get tired at some point, no worries, you are pretty close to bus stops which are running regularly without delays. Also there're lots of stores/restaurants open from 5/6am to 6/7pm with some (in Coogee or Bondi) opening extended hours.If you planned it correctly, you might be able to come during the Sculpture by the Sea expo (google it as "Sculpture by the Sea Sydney"), making the work even more enjoyable (although a tad crowed) and worthwhile. It takes place around late October early November.By mindful, the Aussie sun is merciless and the walk at a relaxed pace will take about 2 maybe 2 1/2 hours... doing it after 10am to 3 or 4pm might be a little extreme on the skin without proper protection; take your sunnies (shades), sunscreen, hat and a bottle of water with you to be safe (regardless of the season). Be extra careful in summer. During winter (Jun to Sept) take a coat with you as it gets very windy around the coast and nobody wants our good people sick ;)As you probably imagined, a two hours walk kind of commands you to wear good footwear. Some of us (locals) might do it barefoot... but we are crazy and like the feeling of the pebbles and sand under our feet but this is not recommended... ever. Hell! we walk barefoot even on winter. Comfy shoes will be the best, no need of boots or similar as that will be an overkill, the entire path is very well maintained.Again, if you are a new around the area (or a visitor), take the train to Bondi Junction then the bus to Bondi (it takes about 10 minutes), don't pack lunch as there are plenty of restaurants from Bondi to Coogee (Coogee being the best place to eat as it has way more variety and quality), a small snack should suffice to get you good to continue all the way to Coogee. There are buses in Coogee that will take you back to Bondi or to the train station (that are many lines connecting everything) so moving around is not going to be a problem.Finally (and again)... bring your bottle of water, sunscreen and enjoy.
Beautiful walking opportunity.. Great views, commentary. Be aware steeps steps with handrails.Water and seating stops along the way, so allow time to amble and enjoy.
Glorious views. This walk is my favourite thing to do with guests to Sydney. A round trip takes just over an hour and there are great places for coffee either at Bronte or Bondi.

Great view, tired legs!. It looks easy but it can get quite tiring for the legs at some parts. Hahahha. Or maybe my legs are just too lazy. Anyway, it's a great place to have a walk. Plenty of things to see and great views. Lots of people on the coastal walk everyday. Scenic and picturesque.
A must see!. Spectacular view, nice beach and cute little boutique. Spend the day walking on the beach and always time for shopping.

amazing coastal walk. The coastal walk from Bondi beach to Cooge is gorgeous. You should take into account about 2 hours one way, but if you just want to have a glance of the shore, you could just stop at Bronte beach which is about half way distant. Great spots for pictures

A Sydney MUST DO. On any day this is an interesting and beautiful walk with nature... but on a sunny day its unbeatable... not too difficult.. a few steps to climb in places.. and just long enough to be a good walk but not exhausting...
Nice walk and good ocean views. Great walk and places to stop for coffee or brief lunch. Towards the end and past the cemetery it gets less interesting. Take a bus back!

A must-do free activity. Pick a sunny morning and set aside 2 hours to enjoy this glorious walk. It's not challenging as long as you're able bodied and moderately fit, but there are lots of stairs at various points. You can cruise along at a slow pace and enjoy the view, or keep the pace up with the power-walkers and runners. There are spots at Bronte to enjoy a snack or a juice, or bring your own picnic and stop anywhere along the way. Lots of food options at the end. Buses to Bondi are frequent, and it's just downhill to start, and you can grab a bus back to the city from Coogee easily. There are public toilets at Bondi, Bronte and Coogee.

Lovely walk with a stunning view. A very nice walk, not to hard, and a stunning view. The beaches were nice too. When walking in the heat, and is always good to bring some water, something I forgot on my walk. Absolutely worth the bus ride out, especially when combined with a swim at Bondi beach.

Simply spectacular. Anyone visiting Sydney / surrounding areas must take a trip to Bondi (35 Mins Bus). Once at Bondi you are instantly in awe of the beach and in particular the stunning coastal views.
Great but busy. Beautiful beaches and a nice length walk, but a bit too busy to really appreciate the majesty. Lots of tweens running around and seemed to be a school trip out there that day.
Best Walk Ever. I was told that I should do this walk when I visit Sydney, so I did. I spent 1 hour walking from Bondi Beach to Coogee Beach, and it was very much amazed by the scenery on the way.
Spectacular. I love walking Bondi to Coogee or stopping off halfway for a coffee.Occasionally I've seen whales off the coast during the walk.

Disappointing. Travelled early Sunday morning to do this "iconic" walk. Seriously? So crowded with beautiful people and joggers, you had to be on your guard at all times. Although the view is typically Sydney Coastline pretty, there are much more spectacular views and far far fewer people down in the region Bundeena to Wollongong! Just have to do without the organic soy free trade latte!

Breathtaking view of ocean, seashore and rock formation. Breathtaking view of ocean, sea shores, and rock formation. can be very windy, it was 20 miles per hour wind when I was there. So dress properly.
SCENIC. Super scenic and beautiful. Wear a comfy shoes and keep walking! :) I can't say anything more. Just enjoy the view, enjoy your company or a book or anything!
Best View Along the Coastal. We had amazing time walking along the coast. The view along the coastal was exceptional and breath-taking. Don't forget to stop at Giles Bath!

One of my favourite walks on the planet!. I have been doing this headland walk for over 20 years and it is one of my all time favourites. Stunning views and landscapes, challenging in parts and a good cafes located in Bondi and Bronte for a well deserved refreshment.

Visually most satisfying walk along the coast. A long -- a couple of hours -- but visually most satisfying walk, passing Tamarama and Bronte. In fact, on this stretch "Sculptures on the Sea" takes place each fall and it is a fabulous occasion for a leisurely stroll of a couple of hours, while taking in some of the > 100 or so works of art that are typically exhibited along the coast.
You can't miss this!. Cannot recommend this highly enough. Postcard views around every corner, Forget that you're actually getting some exercise. Don't forget to bring your camera
walk in the paradise. this walk is amazing along the coast from bondi to coogee.its so beautiful that you'll wish time to stop.its best to go early morning or in the evening.beautiful views

for the fit, outdoorsy types. This fabulous coastal walk is a good 8k with lots of hills and stairs, and then there's the walk back.If you've got the time and energy, it's well worth doing, and a great way to experience the spectacular coastline.Lots of spots to stop for a swim along the way, so pack your cossies and a beach towel. There are not only the best ocean beaches, but also rock pools and tidal pools, and 'baths'.And plenty of great cafes and eateries too.It's a fabulous thing to do.So if you're a jogger and want to run it fast, allow at least an hour fast running there and back. Or take your time and walk, and make a day of it! So much to do along the way. Especially in nice weather.Both Bondi and Coogee are good final destinations. And there's Tamarama, Bronte and Clovelly along the way.Just do it!
Must do walk.. One of the must do activities when in Sydney. Make sure you visit the Irish memorial at Waverley Cemetery near the half way mark..

Loved the scenery. Excellent views of the coast line. Bondi beach then the coast... Wow... Really enjoyable. One can get there by public transportation, walk along the coast then return to the city again by bus.if you like the sea and the coast, this is a must do!

Great views on a feel good track. Who doesn't like a sunrise walk along the Bondi to Coogee track?Best way to start the day by watching the sunrise over the sea. After you're finished, all the good breakfast spots will be open.

A great wlk not far from the city. I've long loved the cliff walk south from Bondi, especially late in the day. Unfortunately so do a lot of other people. Still I recommend it to any visitor in the area.

great views early morning or late evening. Lovely walk. Easy access with good path and walking track. Stop at the snack bar at the Coogee end for a well earned drink and back to Bondi for breakfast or dinner. I would not recommend doing this after 8.30am on weekends as the path is full of joggers, tourists and locals alike jostling for space. There is little or no shade along the path but room to stop and a few seats along the way. Parking is sometimes hard, but the bus from circular quay is a cheap alternative.

Scenic walk - recommend starting at Coogee and ending with a Messina ice cream in Bondi!. A very enjoyable cliff top walk. Takes around 2 - 2,5 hours with breaks. Lots of great photo opportunities en route.There is no shade so pick your time of day for doing this one.

Lovely coastline. Bring your bathing suit, good walking shoes and enjoy a day at the beaches. You can easily see a half dozen beaches, swim, get lunch and and wear out the kids. It is a very good family outing.

An exhilarating scenic walk. I always wanted to do this walk - in either direction I didn;t mind. What an exhilarating walk, with an ever changing sky of bright sunshine and dark stormy clouds, even the rain did not diminish the dramatic scenery. We parked on the seafront at Bondi (very expensive) and allowed 4h to walk to Coogee, have lunch along the way, and return. You could join the path at other places like Clovelly and Bronte and probably find parking free on the nearby roads. It is up and down - some long stretches of steps - but nothing too challenging - and lots of seats to rest and take in the stunning views. Loved Bronte Baths especially, how fortunate residents are to have this exciting oceanside pool, with waves breaking over the edges at high tide, and free entry. Bronte Beach is charming, and has some nice cafes. Coogee Pavilion is a good lunch stop - it is big, but the formal part of the restaurant gets very busy and booking can be advisable but you can get excellent casual lunch dishes from the general menu and sit almost anywhere. One of the "must do" activities when visiting Sydney.

Fantastic views of coastline. We took the Hop on Hop Off bus to this area. It drops you off in Bondi Beach which is one of Sydney's top attractions. It is a beautiful walk and has scenic views. While its peaceful and can be relaxing after being in Sydney's Central Business District, you won't be alone. This is a popular walk and many others will be there with you. But it is definitely worth it.
Relaxing, beautiful. This is the most beautiful coastal walk, it rivals what you can see on the royal national park coastal walk, and it's right here in the city!
Great for running!. Amazing scenery, it can get busy so go earlier in the day if you can. The best walk in all of Sydney.
Nice place to visit. Nice place and a must see if you are in Sydney. Buy some fish&chips and relax on the lawn. Plan an hour there.
Best coastal views in Sydney. This is probably the most picturesque walks in the world. A definite must for any tourist visiting Sydney.
amazing walk. This is one of the most beaufiul thing to do in Sydney and it's free. The view is amazing, you can enjoy the ocean and all its shades. Perfect every day

Love this walk. One of the best thing about living in this region is this spectacular walk. Have been more times than I can count but remember the first time vividly- it's what helped us decide to move to Sydney. The section from Clovelly Beach to the Clovelly Bowling Club is accessible by pram but recommend baby carrier for other sections. Watch out for uneven ground in some sections particularly if you are distracted by the view! The annual sculpture by the sea is not to be missed but it is very popular so be patient with crowds. Bronte Bogey Hole Cafe is good for a pit stop the lentil burger is delicious.

A Beach experience. Itas a wonderful beach with na excellent structure for visitor with showers and lockers. The people are friendly, but the water is cold. Be careful with the waves and signal over the beach. Its na amazing aussie experience.

Spectacular ocean walk. This is one of the most beautiful coastal walks in Australia and simply a must do. You need to be moderately fit as the course does have a considerable amount of stairs. Be sure to take along a bottle of water, especially in the hot summer months!

A memorable walk. We did this walk in September 2015,from Bondi beach right up to Coogee Pavilion. It was definitely a tiring journey but we had so much fun taking pictures along the way, the view was stunning & the weather was cool (around 17deg C) so we didn't sweat like crazy.Highly recommended if you love nature & the beach.

One of the worlds most awesome walks.. A fantastic walk at any time of the year but if you are lucky enough to get your timing right (Oct/Nov) it is then simply breath taking and not to be missed. Your calf muscles and glutes will thank you for days!
A combination of Shiny beaches. A walk from stagnant stable water to wavy oceans , a taste of typical Australian shiny beaches, some of the areas are very well developed while some are just normal.
You must do it!. You can take around 2 hours doing it if you stop all he time for pictures (as we did). After the walk, you will understand why people LOVE this city.

Great coastal walk. A great way to spend a sunny day. I used to live in Coogee so did this walk a lot. Views are great, and with a few small beaches in between, there is the opportunity to break up the walk with a coffee or snack. Just sit back, enjoy the sun and people watch for a while : )

Easy sunny day walk - with thousands of others. If you can be bothered getting to Bondi (and believe me - its a punish for those not used to queues/big cities/traffic gridlock) do this lovely scenic walk from Bondi to Coogee with the thousands of others you'll find on a sunny day. If you like a little more quiet though, and easy to get to , and don't care for the celebrity status of Bondi - take the ferry off to Manly Beach and wander around there.
Exercise. Great Costal walk allow approx 2hrs to do the walk at a leasurely pace and enjoy the views along the way.

I can see why this is rated so high.. There is no wonder this is rated as the second best attraction in Sydney. The walk is spectacular, passing through many bays and beach areas. There are quite a few stairs, but for every one you go up, you also go down. Lots of places to stop and take photographs, or get a drink or bight to eat.

B to C has never been so beautiful!. This walk from Bondi to Coogee is just so relaxing and spectacular. Although there are sets of stairs it is not a difficult walk but expect to pass many other visiting walkers. The section that passes by Waverley Cemetery is interesting and utilises a wonderful walking platform. The beaches that the path connects are picturesque and unique whilst providing great spots for a swim, toilet facilities and kiosks that sell coffee! It is easily connected to the Sydney CBD by either train or bus and therefore is another free activity that can be enjoyed by tourists and locals alike.

Great Walk!. Whenever we have visitors from overseas we always take them here! It's a definitely a must-do in Sydney...gorgeous views showcasing the magnificent Sydney coastline! It gets pretty crowded on the weekends especially during the summer time...It actually gets even more crowded during the annual Sculpture by the Sea (Oct -Nov) so beware. During the summer time, they have shuttle buses running from Bondi to Coogee (and reverse) so you can do the entire Bondi to Coogee and just take the bus back to your starting point.
Beach Walk A Must. A beautiful beach walk along the cliffs of Bondi to Coogee - a popular spot for all. The colour of the water was outstanding and well worth the visit.

Great for a walk or a run at anytime of year. I am fortunate enough to live in Coogee and get to take advantage of this walk whenever I wish. I always recommend this to any of my friends who comes to Sydney as I believe it is one of most spectacular coastal walks in the world. My personal favorite thing is to use this as one of my training paths for my long distance running hobby. The scenery makes the long runs click by much quicker because I am always distracted by wonderful vistas of the ocean and coast. There are plenty of water fountains along the path and also cafes at the various beaches if you need to refuel. Be sure to bring a hat and your sunscreen to ensure you stay sun safe as it is not a shaded walk. There are some stairs and hills and various points so proper walking/running/hiking footwear is recommended.

Stunning Scenery!. This is one of the most beautiful walks I've done in a long time. Starting at Bondi Beach, every view is gorgeous. With pristine beaches, the shimmering ocean, the cliffs,the amazing cemetery, the amazing houses, and of course the people watching, this walk has it all. The path is beautifully designed with plenty of rest stops, toilets, and places to fill your water bottle. I took the 333 bus from Sydney CBD to Bondi and returned from Coogie on the 373 bus. Highly recommended.

Absolutely gorgeous . A great afternoon walk, but make sure you start early enough so you can see everything in the daylight. Stunning views of water, beaches and cliffs, this walk is a place to return to again and again.
Very busy path. Great walk, very busy though. We did this on a particularly hot and humid day in the middle of summer and were ill prepared drinks wise but plenty of places to stop on the way.

Spectacular cliff walk. This is a dramatic coastline with a path carved out of the sandstone cliffs. It's best experienced at sunrise, as the sun comes up over the Pacific Ocean - just breathtaking! Stop for coffee or breakfast at Bronte if you need a half way break. Avoid weekends during the middle of the day - lots of people have the same idea! If the wind is on-shore you may want to reconsider.

My Favourite City Walk of All Time. This walk is a spectacular must do for anyone who enjoys fresh air, spectacular coastal scenery and a healthy amount of exercise. Make sure you take water and wear good walking shoes, sunscreen and a hat. We caught the bus to Bondi, took in the iconic beach and then set off for Coogee. Loved the coastal outlooks over some pretty impressive surf and surfers. Got my heart rate up a little on some of the hills and enjoyed a swim and a coffee and cake at Coogee before catching a bus back to Circular Quay. Brilliant.
Sydney Must do. Amazing views, great scenery and fantastic cafe at the end. Highly recommend this for all visitors to Sydney.

The best walk ever. This would have to be one of the best walks anywhere, along the top of the rocky cliffs and visiting the wonderful beaches of Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly and Coogee, with a stroll through the historic Waverley Cemetery thrown in for good measure. The walk took us about two hours at a very easy pace, most of it at an easy grade, but there were a few sections with stairs that we took our time to negotiate, whilst admiring the coastline views. Getting too and from is simple using public transport, with plenty of buses from the City to Bondi and the same on return to the City from Coogee. There is a good selection of cafes, coffee shops and public restrooms at each of the beaches along the way, so easy to pull in for a coffee or snack if you have worked up an appetite.

a must to take visitors to, especially those from overseas. I make it a practice when I have visitors to Sydney and have a morning to spend with them to walk from Bronte to Bondi and talk, as we admire the wonderful views, the not-too-challenging walk, and the fresh air. The feed back from my visitors has always been very positive, and when they return to our fair city, they are quite agreeable to repeat the walk.

Stunning walk. Stunning coastline full of lycra clad running folk and those out walking their cute miniature dogs. I saw a humpback breaching no far off the coast. Definitely worth the walk. It gets pretty hot, even in spring/autumn so head out early in the morning

Sydney at it's best!. This is a wonderful walk - beautiful coastal views, rock formations and the possibility of seeing whales on their journey north from June, or on their return trip south from October. There are beaches with cafes along the way, so it can be a relaxed walk, an exercise run, or just an opportunity to explore some of Sydney's beautiful beaches.

Magnificent coastline. Amazing coastline. Even though the day we went was windy and unusually cold it did not detract from the beautiful scenery. Rug up, get out and do it! If only I had access to this walk every day !

A beautiful walked spoiled by too many people. Amazing walk with great views, but with the large amount of runners and everyone else your best bet is to do the walk at odd times. If you are lucky you might even spot a whale.
walk of Sydney iconic beaches. definitely a thing to do if you spend few days in sydney...couple hours of walk passing different beaches, neighborhoods with a perfect view on the ocean and cliffs

sit and relax. enjoy the breathtaking view. this is a must visit for those who love beach and nature. the view is just amazing. the blue sky, the turquoise water and the rough waves, it's just perfect! i am not sure how long will it take to go from bondi to coogee, but for me it took about an hour from bondi to bronte. we did several stops and took photos, that's explain why we took longer time. for people who have exercise routine, take this chance for a morning run. i will recommend half day just to complete the coastal walk. it's definitely a worth one. but please check the weather before you go. rainy season and windy season totally not a good weather to explore this area.

Beautiful views!. I have done this walk twice now and loved it! Beautiful coastal views from some of the most beautiful beaches I have ever seen. My favorite is Coogee Beach. I highly recommend for anyone, although you should be fairly healthy to do this walk. The whole thing takes about 3 hours, depending on your pace.

a very good surprise. a must do in Sydney with a nice weather and a bit of time for a good walk ...enjoy a great view , , a bunch of dolphins were following us for half an hour , discover some quite unknown beaches and come back by bus or taxi
A beautiful walk. This walk is especially nice during the morning before the sun gets hot. A beautiful way to see the sea and bays along the Sydney Coast

Sydney must do. I have walked this wonderful scenic route many times whilst clearing my head and feeling absolutely refreshed. My most recent walk was on a day with heavy winds and great surf, a must do!
Gorgeous coastline. What a beautiful walk. Possibly easier if you walk from Coogee to Bondi as more of it would be downhill. Well maintained pathways. Stunning coastline.

Beautiful views!. Great way to spend a few hours with excellent scenery and some exercise on the way! The paths are well signed, safe and the views are spectacular. Okay for different levels of fitness depending on how fast you want to walk.
Went to see the art exhibition's.. Great walking along the trial from bondi beach to the top.art work's were placed all along the track to the top where they had them spread all around.

A beautiful walk. walked in January 2015, it was an amazing summer's day. There's a few stairs and a bit steep in spots but worth it. Allow enough time to jump in the water at the beaches and swimming holes along the way. Took me a good 3-4 hours alternating strolling and swimming, with an ice-cream as a reward at the end!

Wonderful way to see the coastline. Very nice walk along the coastline. You can make it as easy or invigorating as you like, make your own pace. We enjoyed it so much we would do it again on our next visit to Sydney.
A great walk, with plenty of places for a beer at the end. Great walk, fantastic views! I highly recommend it. Another great Sydney walk and opportunity to see the absolutely stunning coastline.

Perfect on a sunny day. This walk is a must when you are in Sydney, especially on a sunny day. I have done it many times. The views are amazing, the smell of the ocean puts you in a holiday mood and there are several places along the way where you can stop to have a drink or something to eat. It does get a little bit busy on the weekends, but great during a week. If you happen to plan it when there are Sculptures By the Sea, get prepared for even bigger crowds.

must do while in Sydney. a must do for everyone how is in Sydney. I would suggest to walk from Coogee to Bondi. In my opinion the views are better but in both directions it is an amazing walk. You can stop for a swim or coffee.
A must walk. One of the most popular, but still amazing walk from Bondi to Coogee. It's easy and the cliffs are spectacular!

Must do walk!. Whenever you are in Sydney, this walk is a must-do! Take your time to walk from Bondi to Coogee on a beautifull sunny day. Enjoy the beautiful landscape, the surfers, animals and the beaches on the way!Take at least a couple of hours to fully enjoy this hike before taking the bus back to Sydney.

Great walking with amazing views!. Great walk with amazing views! Great cafes at Bronte Beach in case you are walking with friends and decide to stop for coffee or brunch! It is a must if you like to walk and visiting Sydney! Highly recommended!!!
Bondi to Coogee Beach. A fantastic walk on a stunning day in Sydney - a few steps and paths to climb but worth every bit of effort. Stunning views

Beautiful walk!. This walks takes about 2-3 hours, depending on how many picture stops you make along the way. You get beautiful views of the coast and come across some nice beaches. You also come across the Waverley Cemetery, which is quite impressive. This is a cemetery next to the ocean on a cliff, it looks quite surreal. I walked from Coogee to Bondi, and treated myself on a lovely lunch at Bondi afterwards. It isn't too intensive so it's good for pretty much everybody. It's just a wonderful day out.

Beautiful. Such a stunning walk. I went in July, so managed to miss the manic of a summer at Bondi beach. Beaut walk or run (quite a lengthy run though) but definitely worth heading over to this side of Sydney to do this walk.

So gorgeous!. A must-do for locals and visitors. Amazing views, good exercise and can stop for coffee along the way. There are stairs, some of which are a bit wonky, so not for people with poor mobility issues.

Amazing walk - prams / strollers not suitable. Awesome walk. I think this is a must do if possible. It offers awesome amazing views of the Ocean.Couple of items of advice:- Do the walk from Coogee to Bondi, as there are better eateries in Bondi Beach area- If you have infants (like myself), consider not taking a pram/stroller - There are places which are quite steep and me and wife struggled dealing with both a pram and a heavy child. Use a baby carrier if possible and if you have the capacity to carry the child for 3-4 hours (with breaks). If you absolutely need to take a pram, consider (i) giving the walk a miss, or (ii) doing a shorther walk (eg. Bronte to Bondi)

Beautiful walk and easy to do. This is a great walk to do near Bondi. Finish up at Bondi and stop for some lunch. It won't give you much of a workout so I can't really call it a hike but the scenery is beautiful and it's a nice way to spend a few hours with friends. Easy for everyone of most ages.

Good exercise, great views. This is a great walk on along the cliffs just outside Sydney. The path literally follows the cliff and does require to traverse some stairs and some somewhat step and uneven uphill and down hill portions. If you can handle that, you're in for really great views.

Great walk with awesome views. Beautiful view of Bondi Beach. A nice walk in the wind, and the waves were amazing! It is possible to walk just a part of the route. We walked 20 minutes, and caught the bus back to Bondi.
Lovely views. We had a wonderful walk along this stretch of coastline. It is very popular with joggers as well as tourists with various eateries along the way.

Wild, woolly and wonderful.. The weather was very windy and overcast and we found this walk to be invigorating, exciting and definitely worth doing. It wasn't too strenuous, very well sign-posted and designed, some steps of course. We took the train to Bondi Junction and then a bus, on the way home, enjoyed the ride on the bus to Circular Quay with a very cheap look at lots of areas in Sydney.
All shades of blue. If in Sydney, this walk is a must. The beaches are wonderful and it's quite an eye-candy. You will not be sorry. Just bring sun screen and a hat.

Fantastic walk.. Didn't book with a tour, just hopped on a bus from Circular Quay to Bondi beach and did the walk to Bronte. When your local beach is Burleigh or Southport, then Bondi as a beach is not that exciting, but as a city beach it is great. The walk is full of different features to look at and is just long enough and taxing enough to be enjoyed as part of your day, and suitable for nearly everyone, unless you struggle with steps.
Very enjoyable. Lovely walk on a nice sunny day. Lots of steps though, so bring good shoes, and dress appropriately.Lots of places to stop along the way for a rest, goes through some nices beaches

Best view in the world. I live in Coogee and still do this walk weekly! It's great to do mid week early morning as it's less busy..but also good for whale watching and people perving in the summer time

Stunning walk. Took the train out to Bondi , then bus from there . Gorgeous sea side walk , approx. 6 ks , easy paths & lots of eatery's when you get to Coogee . Great look out points & plenty of photo op's .

The best part of Bondi, unless you surf!. Beautiful! This walk is a great way to see Bondi. There's beaches, rockpools, parks, and coastal views, strung along 6 km of coastal paths. Buses from Tamarama, Bronte and Clovelly, mean you can start or complete the coastal walk from various points. Hence, if you don't fancy going the path's full length, you can plan a shorter walk. For the full walk start at Bondi Icebergs. You have to make your way up steep steps but you're rewarded by Aboriginal rock carvings in Marks Park. This is one of the highest points on the walk and so you can have a secret rest by whale watching (May and November). It's a good start to the walk. By the time you get there, you have a chance to take stock in one of Bronte's cafes. At Gordon's Bay there is a very steep staircase that rewards the climb with its views. You finish the scenic walk at Coogee where you could swim in the bay and take a beverage! With easy transport links by bus.

Casual walk. Walked along the beach and it was a beautiful day and the pathways are perfect for a nice walk safely. The views are stunning and breathtaking. It's a bit far to Coogee Beach but great exercise to keep it with the steps. Comfortable shoes are reccomended.
Worth the effort. Gorgeous walk .... be aware there are many stairs. The views are incredible and worth the effort of the walk.

Great way to enjoy the eastern beaches. Do not book a tour. Take the walk yourself. Take a friend. A pet. Run. Walk. Just get there and enjoy it stunning views. Finish off at a cafe or stop at icebergs club bistro and enjoy some refreshment whilst looking over beautiful bondi.

Bondi Beach is gorgeous. Gorgeous beach! I was there during the winter time so I could not go in the water; however, it was truly a gorgeous walk and gorgeous beach. The scenery was absolutely breath taking. I recommend going at sunset!

Amazing walk. Start on coogee, go to bondi and be ready to dive in some beautiful places to refresh.If you just want a piece of it, start at tamarama, but the whole track is very worth it.Bondi has more things to do, that's why it is better to finish there.Great morning for every kind of group
Coast to Coast. Good way to spend an afternoon. The walk is of medium length but is made more challenging with the many stairs and hills, which can be quite tiring if you are walking in the heat.
Nice walk. This is a pretty nice walk along different beaches with nice views. Many people use this track for running, too. And a few exercise areas are there, too.

Well worth the walk.. It is a must do - the ocean views and little bays are amazing. There is nothing not to like about it. If you go in summer - take your swimsuit as there are plenty of places to stop and have a swim.

A treat for fitness freaks. This trail is extremely scenic and is ideal for people looking for a healthy walking/jogging trail with an excellent soothing sea view. It starts from Coogee Beach , then on to Clovelly, Bronte and finally Bondi Beach or vice versa. If you do not take any breaks, it can be covered in about half and hour.

Nice walk. Walked from Coogee to Bondi today. First time I did this was on my first visit to Australia - and it was a lot less busy and less paved then. Must say I was a little disappointed as I remembered it as more of a cliff walk than what it is now. Nevertheless is a nice walk.

Great walk. Take the walk from Cogee to Bondi and enjoy a bit of beach delight in Sydney. It wasn't warm enough for us to swim, but on a less windy day (or if we were brave souls) we could have. The ocean pools are glorious, the beaches beautiful and the amenities excellent. To my mind Bondi is a bit overrated, the other beaches are lovlier, and the views either way up and down the coast great.
Lovely views. What a lovely walk - if it's your first time doing it, allot yourself more time than you think you need as you'll be stopping plenty to snap pictures.
Invigorating and beautiful vistas. Beautiful, easy and gorgeous walk along one of the best coastlines in one of the prettiest cities in the world.
Nice walk for everyone. no need to be a good hiker to do it. You'll have a nice view all along the walk, very good to do and not long at all.
Beautiful coastline. Stunningly beautiful and very well done. Shame it was like London station at rush hour!It was so easy to get on and off the walkway and meet up with public transport.
A nice stroll along the coast . Do alone, don't waste money paying a guide. Getting to or back from Bondi or Coogee is the problem though. Lovely to do in Spring time

Make this walk part of your stay in Sydney. Fabulous, very rewarding and most interesting too. Each of the beaches is different from the other and the first view of Bondi and the Icebergs made a very hot walk very worthwhile!

Gorgeous views and a great way to see east Sydney . The walk itself is about 7km long with a few uphills and taking nearly 2hrs if you take into consideration photo stops and a bit of gazing. We caught a bus to North Bondi and walked from there to coogee. Had a great brekky at trio Cafe at Bondi along the way before we continued south. As time did not permit, we had to just look at the lovely beaches along the way. you have the option to continue past coogee if you wish for a longer walk.  There are buses that take you back to Bondi Junction where you can train it back to the city but we opted for another 3.5km walk back to explore the suburbs Waverley and Bronte. Good work out I might add too!

Wild and soft. started with very smooth send and u could meet like cliff hammer rock after that.very nice match impressiveonce again what a nature behavior~!But the send from somewhere~! not originally there but i like it
Beautiful. Beautiful walk, not too difficult but truly wonderful. We did the entire walk in about 45 minutes, not hurrying and not going too slow.

Gorgeous coastline - must do. I lived in Sydney for over a year before making this costal walk - do it!! I will take everyone who visits. The views are amazing. They've done a good job of building boardwalks or putting in steps most places. Stop at the hotel in Coogee after for a drink!

A classi Sydney coastal walk. An easy meditative walk, with great beach views, interesting alcoves and options for eating and drinking along the way. It's a walk that you can do many times over and see different things every time.
Wonderful walk. Wonderful views. This is an easy and pleasant walk that I believe everyone should try. On a beautiful sunny day, its an excellent way to spend the morning or afternoon.

Best walk, best views!. If you're a visitor to Sydney or a resident, you must do this fabulous walk! The views are second-to-none, the walk follows the coastline snugly & there are plenty of opportunities to stop for a swim, have lunch or just sit & rest, taking in the wonderful views of the beaches & coves. There are some stairs & inclines but overall it's a moderate walk (of about 8kms, one way) but you can do whatever sections you want to. Parking is (slightly) easier at Coogee rather than Bondi so walk that way. There are always buses back to the car if you don't want to walk both ways! It gets very busy on the weekends, best to go early then have a relaxing time at the end point. Watch out for joggers, they stop for noone!

Awesome. Listen to the sounds of the sea, soak up some sun while you exercise, what could be better, except by topping it off with a breakfast at a cafe at Tamarama, and walking it off on the way back to Bondi

Spectacular. for little effort you are greatly rewarded with amazing views and plenty of cool beaches to stop off at on the way. Take a swift jog or a gentle walk. If you feel it might be a bit tough do it it in the winter it is just as beautiful and not so busy/hot.

Away from Bondi Beach. The beach itself is just a beach, nothing special, it is only what goes on around it that interests. The walk from the far end of the beach was fascinating. As previously said, amazing rock formations and from the walk looking down you can watch anglers trying their casting techniques against the mighty ocean. A pleasant way to spend a couple of hours, taking pictureque photos along the way.
Views. The views were awesome. Could sit it several different places on this tour for hours. The coastal walk is well marked out which helps a lot.

Worth a visit! . We took a taxi from our hotel (near the opera house) to bondi beach. The beach itself is nothing too great but the hike along the coast to coffee beach is worth doing. Great views with rock formations and clear waters. The hike itself takes roughly an hour.
Crisp brisk beach walk. It certainly was a lovely start to Sunday morning out in the crisp air and indulged in a scrumptious brunch along the way.
Beautiful!. Worth it! It looks so beautiful! You will have an awesome view and some beautiful nature snaps. It takes about an hour
Walk On Water - Nearly. A great place to see Sydney on a lovely spring day or for taking overseas visitors along. It showcases Bondi and the local beaches well.

Gorgeous. Get there early, especially as it is getting hot earlier now. Really gorgeous scenery and a fairly tiring walk, but well worth the amazing views. Highlight is the beautiful rock formations, along with the turquoise waters. Not to be missed!
Beautiful walk. This was quite magnificent. Well worth the time to take in the coast from Bondi to Coogee. If you like to run, this would be one hell of an enjoyable run.

Beautiful. Make sure you wear trainers and have a bottle of water cause the walk is easy but long. It's a fair distance and it's full of people jogging and exercising. Beautiful walk, highly recommended!

Is there a better walk in the world?. I have done this walk many times. Each time I do it, it just gets better .The area is clean and tidy, it is free to the public and there are rest stops, beaches and some eateries along the way
Beach walk. This is one of the most beautiful walks in Sydney. Great to get some exercise while admiring the lovely residents along the way.divine.
Amazing views. Best walk in Sydney. Stunning coastline with a great atmosphere with beautiful beaches along the way. Best time to go is sunrise.

Don't miss this. Beautiful urban walk, not to be missed while in Sydney. The Coogee Pavilion is a great place for a drink and a meal after the walk. Found it easy to get to/from Bondi and Coogee from the CBD on the bus.

A must do in Sydney. We started the walk in Coogee and walked all the way to Bondi. The view on this walk is just stunning and there is a lot to see and explore on the way. Due to this the hall walk took us about 3 hours and we came to Bondi at the perfect time to enjoy a great lunch at the beach. I would highly recommend this walk to everyone who is visiting Sydney.
Vibrant beach life. Stayed in congee beach area for four nights over new year 2015 in rented holiday apartment very nice area and lovely beach with good eateries

A long walk but well worth it!. We caught a train from Town Hall Railway station to Bondi Junction and then an express bus to Bondi Beach. It is a beautiful beach and it was packed on that day as there was an annual charity race. From there we walked to Coogee. It was a glorious hot sunny day and the walk was just spectacular - it took about 2 hours and en route we passed some beautiful secluded coves. The walk, although not difficult, can be strenuous and either trainers or walking sandals are sufficient. When we reached Coogee we stopped at the Coogee Pavillion for a truly sumptuous lunch. After lunch we spent a few minutes on the beach before taking a direct bus to the city centre. A wonderful way to spend a Sunday afternoon.

Nice easy walk with sea views. Beautiful walk, mostly flat with a few ups and downs, my girlfriend didn't complain and she hates walking! We got the bus from Sydney to Bondi then Coogee Bay back to Sydney. There are some restaurants along the walk where u can stop for lunch etc Beautiful views and an interesting cliff top cemetary

Would highly recommend this. Must do in Sydney. Great views, fresh sea breeze, interesting sights and sounds. The energy and vibe is positive. The walk is a must , put aside a morning and view the sunrise. You will walk away energized and refreshed.

Great day, great walk, great views.. This was a great day out, we had brunch in Bondi and then started our meander to Coogee. There were water stops (taps) all along the way to help us along. Places to break the walk and go to the beach for a walk along the beach or swim. The views along the coastal walk were magic, shoreline views to cliff hangers over the crashing waves against the shoreline wall. If you have had enough you could break the walk and catch a bus or taxi, but we didn't I have to say. At the end we stopped of at the local Coogee hotel for a late late lunch. It was a great day. Magic...

Bondi is brill. I love Bondi beach its a cool place to swim and sun bathe and also eat, the walk to Coogee, it can be long especially in the warm weather and good shoes recommended rather than flip flops. the different beaches you see along the wa and the scenery is beautiful

Take a camera as you will need it!!. Lived in Australia for 31 years and the first time I did it was last weekend mid September.. I could't have picked a better day, 27 degrees and not a cloud in sight..I had a injury to my foot but that didn't stop me from limping around. Took over an hour one way and pretty much exactly an hour to return. The view and scenery is absolutely amazing

Stunning views. This is one of the must do things in Sydney. The views of the beaches as you walk along the cliff face are just stunning. It can get very crowded particularly on weekends with good weather but everyone is polite for the most part allowing joggers, prams and dawdlers time to enjoy the view.A little while back they extended the walk to encircle the perimeter of the cemetery which in itself is peaceful and relaxing if you feel like a wander through the headstones.Take a picnic and have a break on one of the grass areas along the way or pop into a cafe/restaurant for a leisurely meal. Either way, just go and do the walk. It really is beautiful.
Great scenery!. Great scenery, cool sea breezes. Possible even for unfit people (like me) - there are places to rest all along the walk. Even though busy on a week-end, still enjoyable.
great day excellent walking path. so beautiful & well maintained quite an easy walk, there are some steps involved so maybe not suited to prams

Amazing Views. The walk was a little difficult to get to, as the buses from the Bondi Junction train station were so busy the lines stretched on forever; so I decided to walk to the beach. It is manageable (if you don't mind trekking long distances of this + the Coastal Walk) and not too hard to find. The walk itself offers spectacular views and takes you by some great beaches. Bondi was incredibly packed with people but all of the flying kites were fun to see. However, if you are looking for a place to relax on the beach, you might try any of the others you pass along the way. Once at Coogee, there are plenty of buses to get you where you are going. If you are a tourist, like me, get an Opal card BEFORE going on the walk, as bus passes can be difficult to find down there.

AMAZING views. This was the loveliest of walks.. I did it at night at sunset and also at sunrise.. You do need to consider the amount of hills and steps.. however there are plenty of view platforms and seats to stop and take a breather and take it in. I highly recommend you consider giving this a go, even it you only do it once. GORGEOUS

Best walk. We caught the train to bondi junction straight out and onto bus to bondi beach. it was the perfect day. Hardly any wind just lovely. Great views of the ocean, gorgeous beaches and rock formations. The walk is in very good condition and only a couple of steep bits. We had lunch at Bronte beach and walked through to coogee beach. Don't forget your water. And get an opus travel card they are brilliant.

Wear good shoes!. The Beach walk is definitely worth going! You get to see all the different types of beaches near Sydney and what you can do on each one. Wear good shoes and no flip flops, the walk is long and not actually on a beach:-D

Amazing. This walk is a must do! We made it in two seperate walks as we stayed in Clovelly which is the midpoint of the walk. The scenery and views are spectacular on a hot day we had to stop a few times but there is plenty of water points and benches to rest! 10 out of 10 we even spotted a whale in Bondi :)

Nice easy walk along beautiful coast with gorgeous views. Bondi beach easy to reach by bus, then walk to Googee, along beautiful coast. Quite busy with other hikers and joggers. Pity there are no nice cafés in the various locations along the coastal walk. Very easy walking.

A must on a sunny day. It was an awesome experience, we were toured around with a good friend of mine and the views are simply stunning, would do this walk on weekends if we live in Sydney.... If your a nature lover like us then go and put on your walking shoes and enjoy the views on a sunny day

If visiting Sydney, this is a must-do activity. If you're visiting Sydney or haven't been to Bondi for a few years, I cannot recommend the Bondi-to-Coogee Beach Walk highly enough.The council have done an amazing job renovating/adding the boardwalk and as I write this review, I suddenly realise its been over 24 months since I did this walk. Need to fix that shortly...If visiting and don't have a car, recommend catching train to Bondi Junction and then one of the many buses that go to Bondi Beach. You can start your walk here and take a leisurely stroll to Coogee. Depending when you go (mid morning is best), you can stop for brunch/lunch in Coogee and there are many choices; X74 and Coogee Pavilion are a couple I know of...For the brave, you can walk back and enjoy a swim at Bondi or catch a bus. Buses go straight to Bondi Junction if time is short. NOTE: If you are short of time, this is an activity you shouldn't rush. The walk itself (some 6kms) take approximately two hours excluding travel time and lunch so I would put 4 hours aside if you want to take it all in.The Good:- Fresh Air- Amazing Views- Enough space to walk- Good exercise- Open space- Whales if you are lucky enough- Lunch at the other endThe Bad:- Watch out for the super fit runners who get a little annoyed when you don't make way- Dogs with long leashes- Runners (yes, said that but will mention again)- Windy days. (while still enjoyable if sunny, windy days not fun)- Not wheelchair friendly- Not pram friendly (recommend not taking one)- No water stations (however, that may have changed given I haven't been for a while)The Ugly:- Nothing I can think ofEnjoy. I've walked this track 20+ times and still not sure why I have't been for a while. Maybe having kids is something to do with it...

Great views of the eastern beaches of Sydney. A beautiful walk along a coastal track and boardwalk through the eastern suburbs of Sydney. It can be very busy on the weekends and when the Sculpture By the Sea annual exhibition is on. Starting from either end, this walk is just over an hour long (depending on how far and fast you walk). Stopping at one end for lunch and then returning the same way is a good way to get a decent dose of exercise.Although it is not a hard walk, there are some very steep parts with lots of stairs, so if you are very unfit you may want to have a look at it before attempting it.Also, if you need to park your car at one end, it is best to park at Coogee as it is very difficult to find any parking at Bondi for a reasonable length of time, and without great cost.

A must do when visiting Sydney. As a local, I feel blessed to be able to regularly use this path for a bit of a stroll. Whenever I have friends or family come visit, I always take them for a walk along here, and it never disappoints.

See the best of Sydney while breaking a sweat. Nothing beats Sydney's beaches, and you can take in the best of the Eastern suburbs coast with the rest of the locals as they keep fit and catch up on gossip. A great place to go for a run, take a stroll, go for a swim, get a juice on the way or walk between brunch and lunch spots.Once a year there is a great art show called Sculptures by the Sea which can be seen around October time. Don't forget the sunscreen and a hat as the sun will get you out on the walk. Keep sun safe.

Too amazing for words!. This is a must do when in Sydney - the views are simply amazing! Take a slow walk from Bondi to Coogee or vice versa, while enjoying the scenic views and fresh air. You can either complete the walk within about an hour (if it's a quick one), or it can last longer if you're stopping to take in the views and snap a few photos - great photo opps here!

Friends and Family. I would love to do this walk in summer!We completed the walk during A warm winters day in September! The walk is well resourced with water stations and food outlets in most of the bays!I would recommend if you are taking small children be prepared to carry them as there is a lot of steps. Wonderful views- highly recommend!-also recommend the Coogee Pavilion for a beverage at the end of the walk
beautiful beach. nice beach lots of surfers lots of shops and restaurants, nice walk along the cliff edge beach and olso the nice pool buy the beach, great for lots of pictures too.

Spectacular. We started from Coogee on the ideal Sunday spring morning, ideal for us and many others! However the spectacular coast and walking path was enough to keep us very happy. The sea was a translucent green and blue and each little bay an individual delight. Free water and facilities are available along the way and you can tackle the walk at a fast pace or meander along leisurely for the 6kms to Bondi.A highlight for anyone visiting Sydney for a few days.

Bondi to Coogee - even more special during Sculptures by the Sea. This is a beautiful walk along the cliff edge. Beautiful views. Visit during the Sculptures by the Sea event in October every year for a wonderful experience.

A must do while in Sydney!. We are so glad we did this walk last month as this was such a peaceful and gorgeous scenic route. The sidewalk gets pretty cramped up on weekends especially if the weather is nice but still absolutely worth it. Bondi is such a surfer's paradise and the waves there will make you want to jump right in. Cant wait to go back and do it again!

A Sydney Highlight. This is an integral part of any trip to Sydney. The coastline is sensational and if you get up early enough you may even catch the sunrising over the water which is beautiful. Stop half way at Bronte and grab a coffee at one of the many cafe's. It is a beautiful walk and if you go in summer make sure to take swimmers and a towel.
Wilderness on our doorstep. breathtaking views and not too hard to be done with families. Busy on SundaysIdeal in spring and autumn, summer is a littel hot and busier

Best stretch of ocean views in Sydney. This is my favorite walk in Sydney. I've walked the entire set of ocean front views in Sydney and I think this is the most beautiful and nicest walk of the entire stretch. It is truly amazing and I'd highly recommend it to locals and tourists alike.

Peaceful Coastal Walk with Some Hidden Gems. This is a great way to experience both the majesty and tranquility of Mother Nature while taking in some gentle exercise. Observe the the ferocity of the waves as they break over Bondi Beach and the rocks or smash against imposing cliff faces, lose yourself in a moment of calm on one of the many peaceful hidden away coves that dot the walk. You could walk it in an hour - if you must - or just take your time...

Priority in Sydney. Live in the area and I still do this walk once a week. The coast line is beautiful with 6 different styles of beach to admire and choose from. Sundays are too hectic and busy so avoid it then but otherwise always make this a priority when in Sydney.
Must Do. Best way to spend a few hours. Every time I stay here I walk or run to Bondi and back. Absolutely beautiful!!! This is good for your soul. Get out and enjoy God's beauty.

A little exercise with stunning view.. Bondi to Coogee should be on everyone's top 10 things to do in Sydney. Every end of October host "Sculptures by the sea" which can a bit crowded. Best time is to get up early morning get coffee and see sunrise and all the sculpture with morning sun.

The best city coastal walk. The Bondi to Coogee Coastal walk had us walking on the cliff edges whilst viewing the beautiful coast line. It was a comfortable walk with stairs and paths which have developed over the years. Each time i return to this walk I feel blessed that this is available to remind me of the beauty in the world. It is a but do, a gift to oneself.

It's a really scenic walk along the marine terrace pathway. The walk is really scenic and pretty, but pick your weather, getting rained on would make it unusual but miserable. It runs along e waterfront and is a great way of seeing the coastline between bondi and Coogee beaches. Takes about an hour I guess.

Great views along the coast. this is a great walk along the coast from Bondi to Coogee. great views out over the bays but it is not Pram or wheelchair friendly. there are many steps which make for a great workout and is frequented by many people keeping fit. there are a couple of little coffee stops etc along the winding path where you can sit and watch the world go by. Bring your camera for some great photos

Gorgeous winding walk. Well worth the walk, bring a decent pair of trainers do not attempt in flip flops as its quite long. For those with a healthy mind set jog it! Can take about 2.5 hours if your stopping all the time to take pictures etc. Enjoy a pint at Coogee bay hotel when you finish.

Great beaches & great night life!. This outstanding coastal walk is one of Sydney's icons. The views are wonderful and depending on the time of day it will never cease to surprise you. Bondi is the home of Rip Curl and Billabong and one of the most important lifesaving centers in the world which without a dought was an inspiration to the famous tv series Baywatch. Cogee always brings back beautiful memories of all the great bands that I discovered in my younger years at the venues. Definetely a must when you visit Sydney and just a short train ride from town!

Worth the ferry ride over. Incredible to walk along and feel the soft sand beneath your feet while watching novice and intermediate surfers challenge the ocean waves. August was a little cool weather wise, however still worth the visit. The quaint town was also extremely welcoming.

THE BONDI TO COOGEE COASTAL WALK. I always make sure I do the Bondi to Coogee coastal walk during the "Sculpture by the Sea" exhibition. Even if you are not able to do the walk at this time and see this amazing exhibition, it is just delightful strolling along the walkway with magnificent views north and south. When the exhibition is not on it is not so crowded and you can take your time enjoying the view.
Breathtaking Coastline. When we live here this would be a go to thing to do at the weekend in the spring. The walk is breathtaking and if you are lucky you may even spot a whale..
Great Short Walk. Possibly the best short coastal walk in Sydney to experience the sandstone cliffs and beautiful Sydney coastline. Best to start with breakfast at Bondi before heading off.
Beautiful and HOT. Very nice walk, but be cautions about the heat- it might be near water, but it can be very warm. Remember good UV protection, hat, and plenty of water.
Stunning scenery. This is a great walk to do and the views on the way are exceptional. It gets a little crowded on the weekends but try and go during the week you won't be disappointed.

Always a winner. I take all visitors to Sydney on the Bondi to Coogee Walk - especially interesting during Sculpture by the Sea, but also great on spring days that we have been having here recently. Last weekend caught the bus back to Bondi.

Beautiful!. Its a must do in Sydney! Its about 5Km, usually 3 hours you can do it. Beautifil beaches and good vibe for photos. I recomend start in Coogee in the morning and finish in Bondi for more lunch options and relax the rest of the day there.

Best thing since avo on toast. Beautiful and tiring. Take water and a camera (phone). Plan to treat yourself to a big lunch at either end. One of the first place I take tourists and one of the best things to do for free.

A Walk to Remember. My most favourite walk in Sydney!! In fact, this is the first thing I think of if I have to show off Sydney at its finest to all my friends visiting from overseas.The views are spectacular and every time I do this coastal walk, I cant help but smile and be grateful that I live in the most beautiful city.This walk is most suited for summer/spring time when the coast is filled with vibrant colours. Whilst daytime I ideal, there is something romantic about this coastal walk at nights...If you are looking to know why Sydney is amazing, do this walk and checkmate... you will be moving to Sydney in no time !!

Famous for the Bondi bathers, Sculpture by the Sea, Bondi Life Savers. There is amazing graffiti art work around the walk to Bondi to Coogee. They also have the sculpture exhibition which is amazing. Get some fresh air into your lungs, have a look at the famous Bondi bathers, Bondi Life savers, Bondi Icebergs (they swim in winter) if you are up early enough in the morning.
Great place for a view and to get fit. I love this part of town! Breathtakingly beautiful, a good walk and plenty of foodie places along the way.Best to go on less windy days.

MUST DO. I live in sydney and do this walk every weekend. It is a MUST DO!!EVery time I do it I am blown away by the beauty. If you are lucky you may see a seal, dolphin or whale. you can stroll it, or run it, just wear decent shoes, hat and suncreen.There are a few coffee shops to stop off at the different beaches on the way for a break or a lunch!!If you do one thing in sydney, do this!

When nothing but the best will do........ The best any city has to offer is usually it's most unique offering also. This majestic walk along the rugged east coastline of Sydney is no different. Start at either end - Bondi or Coogee - and just relax, take in the views and watch out for the whales along the way.Tip - stop half way in Bronte beach for a refreshing milkshake or fruit juice to recharge.

If you're in Bondi this is a 'Must Do'. This walk is a terrific way to really get a good look at the Eastern Suburbs and soak up the beach culture. Starting at the Northern end of Bondi Beach, you can walk the whole beach, up the steps past the Iconic Bondi Icebergs establishment with its ocean swimming pool, and continue along up the hill (this walk is not for the faint hearted) towards Tamarama Beach. If you're lucky and visiting in January you will be treated to the wonderful installations and sculptures of the 'Sculptures By the Sea' yearly exhibition. As you keep the ocean to your left you simply follow the well-maintained pathway all the way around to Bronte Beach, passing colourful rock caves, gorgeous beaches, ridiculously picturesque views. This all combines to help you forget that you're actually exercising and walking around 8 kilometres there and back (if you go the whole way). For the more fit ones amongst us, there are many little side options of very steep steps leading up to the suburbs above which can be run up and down. I prefer the more leisurely walk keeping the ocean close, but whatever you do, try to make this walk (or part thereof) a part of your stay in the Eastern Suburbs of Sydney.

Lovely walk along a beautiful coast. Great walk to do at a leisurely pace, or a full on sprint (like a lot of the fitness fanatics do). My wife and I took a couple of hours to walk from Coogee to Bondi and then had a bite to eat in Bondi. There's lots of places to stop and take a pic, have a drink, or sit and take in the views. AUD 25 in a taxi from the city centre, and lunch at The Bucket List was well worth it at a very reasonable price.

Great day out . Caught up with a friend recently to do the coogee to Bondi coastal walk. Must be one of the most impressive walks in sydney for sure. The walkway is quite hilly and becomes a bit narrow at times which isn't much of a problem but needs to be taken into account if you're planning to go for a run instead of a walk (bottlenecks can slow you down) or if you're struggling to climb stairs. A great day out with plenty of beautiful beaches and coast line to explore. In the right season you can spot whales. What a treat!

Awesome walk. Have done this walk on several occasions. It's great exercise with amazing view. The terrain changes constantly. My advice is go early as it not must fun in the heat of the day. 4 hour parking is available at Bondi beach where the walk starts at a hefty price of $7 an hour! Train to Bondi Junction and bus to the beach is your cheapest option especially if you go on a Sunday and use the Opal card which will only cost you $2.50 to travel all day. You can incorporate Sculptures by the sea in this walk which is on the part of the leg from Bondi to Tamarama every year for 2 weeks in late October early November, however if you choose time be prepared for huge crowds especially on the weekends.

Stunning coastal walk and prestine beaches,. I've lived in Sydney for 23 years and never get tired of this walk. I inevitably take guests on at least a portion of the walk whenever friends visit Sydney. It is a paved path with rolling hills, a few stairs, and plenty of photo opportunities.
