It will take about an hour and a half at a reasonable pace along five beaches (Bondi, Tamarama, Bronti, Gordon's Bay and Coogee). There are plenty of places to stop to eat, have a coffee or a dip in the sea so you may want to allow more time. There are also restroom facilities at the surf clubs located on each beach. Dogs need to be on a lead (and take a bag with you - be a good citizen and pick up your dogs poo!).

Wow. If you are feeling energetic or just wanting to go for a walk, this is a must do. Enjoy the amazing Sydney Eastern Suburbs coastline or stop off at the many beach cafe along the way to have a rest.

Must do, make a day of it and bring swimsuit. The best walk of my life and probably in the world. Take an express bus from Circular Quay to Congee Beach, grab some snacks and water and head on to the trail back toward Bondi. Take your time to enjoy the scenery and take pictures, there are many spots along the way to rest and restock on snacks or water. Bring a towel and bathing suite so you can make a pit stop at one of the beaches for some swimming to cool off or at one of the nature ocean baths. Have a late lunch or dinner at Bondi, and catch the buss back to the train station for a ride back to circular quay. A day well spent.

Spectacular, amazing, stunning, priceless views. Ohmigod how beautiful is this walk? Sydney's beaches are amazingly beautiful. The all so famous Bondi is perhaps the least interesting. This walk is easy, forget how many kms it is, it is really easy, a delight with plenty of places to stop off at. Even in the winter months you need to plan on having a swim somewhere or at least stripping off down to a swimming costume and having a picnic on a beach as you simply enjoy the view, the people and the colours of the ocean. The coastal walks cover all of Sydney's beaches and all through the harbour area and are the best way to get a real feel for the beauty of my home town.
Wonderful hike!. Just a nice way to burn some calories and spend the day outdoors while viewing the bay! Be prepared with comfy shoes and water:)

Gorgeous Coastal View. We took a bus from Circular Quay to Bondi and started our walk there. It was 4-mile long, with ups and downs. The views were always gorgeous. There were a lot of local people jogging on the trail. We took bus from Coogee back to Circular Quay.

Dog Poo Ally. The Randwick section of the Eastern Coastal Walk is disgraceful. The view cant be admired as walkers have to keep their eyes on the path for fear of stepping in dog poo. The Randwick section is great for dog walkers as it is an unofficial leash free path. Rangers wont patrol the area for fear of confrontation with dog owners. Black plastic dog poo bags are supplied by ratepayers, but those dog owners who occasionally 'pickup' tend to drop the bags in the bushes rather than carry them to a rubbish bin or take them home. Stay away from this walk and leave it to the dogs!

Great exercise. Best way to see many of the small communities,along the ocean. You'll probably get some sun, sore muscles, and a great chance to try all the coffee places. Love Jenny's at Bronte. Look for whales. Lots of steps. Bring water.
Yeah great. Really really good!!!! Great place to visit and walk. Would highly recommend it. Always a fabulous place to visit.

Walk (or Jog) Like a Local. This is a great scenic walk - or if you are more vigorous you can jog it - that you can do at your own pace. The walk has dramatic cliffs, beautiful views of the NSW littoral and little beaches and coves along the way. It has a few steep climbs but really it's not too strenuous. Go early in the morning before it gets too crowded. Finish with a well earned coffee or breakfast in Coogee. A Sydney "must do" activity.
Loved i!. Don't miss to go there when the "Sculptures by the sea" are on at the Coastal Walk - stunning view and easy to access :)

A lovely, chilled way to spend a couple of hours. A nice distance that it gives you long enough to enjoy the walk and take it in without getting too tiring. Lots of places to stop on the way albeit other beaches or cafes and with the rolling hills and cliff tops lots of spots for great photos.
Amazing views!. Great views of the beach and ocean! Walkway can get a little crowded during afternoon, especially near end points (Bondi, Coogee).

Excellent Beach. I like the beautiful coast line most. I walked along it and appreciate all those beautiful things witch made me in awe. It's really interesting to eat fish and chips there. People there do surfing and jogging. It seems like a good spot for sport. I first went to Bondi Beach, walked south and then caught a bus to a train station. I really recommend it, and it definitely worth the visit.
Beautiful. Beautiful walk, the nature is worth stopping for a few times and just enjoy the view. If the sun is out bring water, since it can be really hot and the walk requires some energy.

Sculptures by the Sea - Sydney's most popular annual outdoor art appreciation event. Sculpture by the Sea is Sydney's largest free-to-the-public outdoor art exhibition. I think this is Sydney's best outdoor art event where ocean, city and natural landscape, art culture and sightseeing merge together into one great weekend.There are over 100 contemporary sculptures intricately placed along the 2km scenic coastal walk from Bondi and Tamarama beach. It is one of my favorite coastal in Sydney (Oct-Nov) and every year the event attracts over 500,000 local and international visitors to view the eclectic mix of sculptures and still life artwork under the sun. Sculpture by the Sea is well worth the visit. It is a joyous and uplifting event where you can appreciate some unique fine artworks, enjoy the natural scenery of Sydney's pristine beaches and get fit at the same time. I could not think of any other free event that gives away that much benefits. A must for Sydneysiders and tourists.

Simply amazing. We'd heard plenty about the walk, and tried it out on an August day. we (inc 3 boys 6, 8, 13) took a bus from central Sydney and walked from Bondi to Coogee. probably the best walk we have ever done anywhere in the world. Loads of places to stop and play/drink coffee and every beach superb. Loved it.
Well worth the time. Well worth it even on a winters day. The beaches and views were amazing throughout. It was quite busy but putting this down to it being a Sunday. Still more than worth it.
Scenic Walk. Great walk along the Coast line with a perfect view to the beach life (Surfers etc). We prefer Coongee and suggest a stop at "Little Kitchen" for Drinks or lunch/breakfast.

A beautiful walk along the Sydney west coast beaches . Highly recommend strolling along the beach for a walk from Bondi to Tamarama (or further to Coogee). A beautiful setting, even when the weather is cooler during late winter/early spring. Lots of shops and dining options along the way, plenty of stops to rest and enjoy the view!
Fantastic!. My first walk on a first day of the arrival to Sydney. Spectaculars views. Nice and relaxing walk. Great introduction to the city.

One of the most amazing walks in the world!. Beautiful walk, one of the most amazing and spectacular walks in the world. Beautiful scenery which changes along the way, surfers and often dolphins and whales.

A beautiful day. Totaly amazin, so beautiful! A walk that not take to long time, but plan a lots of time for it so you can enjoy and stay at the different beaches and just enjoy the sun and the sound from the waves, and watch the surfers.
Relaxing Walk. Before we settled on the beach we took a long walk. It was wonderful. The rock formations along the was amazing and birds sing for you too while you walk. Just a beautiful experience.

Stunning!. Please do the beach walk! I wish I had more time to do the walk all the way to Coogee Beach actually... I had to turn back half way due to time constraints. Nonetheless, Bondi to Bronte was already very beautiful. It is really a different way to see and admire the natural surroundings and have some quiet time. It was very nice and I would do the full walk in future!

Best of the City Beaches. Best of city beaches, views to die for. If you are lucky - Bronte to Bondi sculptures by the sea might be on (great but the crowds are horrific). There are cafes and picnic spots but can be quite uneven in places so wear walking shoes. This why we love living on the coast
Stunning. Brilliant scenery. We saw whales and dolphins from here. Our guide dropped us off and met us further along
got to do it. great view fresh air awesome was worth the walk , and doing it again and again , had a great friend to walk with
Peaceful. Last week was our first time doing this walk and it was great. The views are spectacular and it is an easy to follow track. We will definitely be doing this again.

Great way to see the beaches.. We did the walk in reverse and was so much fun. However it was pretty crowded but worth it. I would go early in the morning to avoid the crowds. It feels too much like walking in a lineup otherwise. But the views are worth it.

A must do in Sydney. What a wonderful walk around the beaches and headlands. An easy to moderate walk on a very well maintained path. Plenty of spots to stop for a coffee or snack or enjoy the many cafes in Bondi. The scenery is just spectacular especially if there is a decent surf rolling in. It can get quite busy on a nice weekend but hey enjoy the people watching. A moderate fitness level is required but well worth the effort that's for sure!! Definitely worth it and it's free!!! Enjoy :)

wonderful walking/hiking experience. Done this coastal walk twice and it was always a great experience. The first one was memorable because it was during the time the Sculpture thing was on. Scenery is amazing which is what makes you inspired to keep on going. Make sure that you experience this coastal walk.

Coogee to Bondi Beach Coastal Walk. It has been many years since I repeatedly did this walk as I was living in Coogee/Randwick in 2002-2003, but it is truly impressive. Starting from Coogee, near the cliff-top memorial to the local residents (several from the Coogee Dolphins rugby league team who were on an end of season trip) who died in the Bali bombing on 12/10/02 and walking past Gordon's Bay, Bronte Beach, Clovelley Beach and finally Tamarama, one then arrives in Bondi (about 45 minutes to an hour if memory serves) where the first sight to greet you is the huge sweeping arc of the iconic beach. Well worth doing one way and then having lunch and a drink at the end point, and walking back in the opposite direction. A great way to spend a Sunday! PS - please note the date below is inaccurate, and so I chose the furthest from today, but in fact I did the walk much longer ago than was available in the drop down date list. If it was a fantastic walk in late 2002 and 2003, I imagine it is even better now.
Coastal urban hike. easy walk taking along a beautiful, quintessential Australian coastline and beaches. Stop for a swim, good cafes, parks and sea pools. Fantastic day out.

The no'1 thing to do in Sydney. I live here and run the walk regularly, do the Sculptures by the Sea annually and hang out most weekends, but this walk on any day, any weather, is the best thing you could do when visiting Sydney. What's not to share. Start at Bondi, take a break at the café at Tamarama for a decent coffee and head round as far as Coogee or if not up to the hour long walk, cut short past the cemetery at Clovelly and return back along the new boardwalk all the way back to Bondi for a well earned lunch. Forget the harbour!

Breath Taking!. Not to be missed, especially in summer (will look forward to that someday)Beach and view were still nice in winter and while it was cloudy in the city, weather was nice at Bondi.Atmosphere gave a great relaxing feel.

Beautiful walk surrounded by the beautiful people. We joked that Wolverine was running by! The beaches are amazing and so are all the fit people running around and working out in the dead of the Australian "winter"! Great views and worth the trek. It's easy enough to walk from Bondi to Coogee and take a quick bus back into town. Highly recommend.
BEAUTIFUL!. Amazing sights of the coastline with plenty of places to stop, have some food, or just enjoy the scenery. I can't recommend this walk enough to visitors and locals alike
Unbeatable Ocean Views. You can't get a better view of the Sydney shoreline than this. Can get a touch crowded at the weekend...but take your time and be rewarded.
Such a beautiful walk!. Such a beautiful walk! A must do when in Sydney, beautiful views, and breath taking beaches along the way. Simply stunning.

A wonder to behold….. I've lived in Coogee for 20 years and have walked this hallowed walk numerous times - sometimes only part of it, sometimes its whole length. I never take this splendid experience for granted…..whether it be listening to the waves, watching the whales or eavesdropping on the excited tones of numerous foreign languages……..don't miss it!

Beeeeeauitiful. Great Views of Ocean and Beachwear. Definitely a walk not to be overlooked with surprises around every corner. Well maintained and easy to navigate with adequate handrails and water fountains

Spectacular in every way. As a local Sydneysider I walk and run this track along the cost 3-4 times a week. The views never quite look the same twice. Fantastic seascape with an endless sky. If you are visiting Sydney make sure you do not miss out. I recommend getting up early and catch the sunrise. When you get to Clovelly, walk up Clovelly Road about two blocks and have one of the best coffees of your trip at Top Hat.
Must do for visitors.. This is a spectacular walk along the beaches and cliff tops of Sydney's eastern suburbs. Take your time. Check out the whales in winter and the celebrities in summer.

Great walk, easy trail and beautiful views. I had a chance to walk form Coogee to Bondi on a beautiful day. The views were amazing. The trail was an easy walk, with opportunities to rock hop on the cliffs along the shore. There is water and public restrooms at all of the beach areas. My walk was at the end of August, so it was a bit on the cool side. But, there still were plenty of surfers and a good number of swimmers at the several beaches along the coast. On a warmer day, it would be fun to swim at each beach on the trail. Coogee and Bondi also have pretty cool beach business areas with all of the beach stores and cafes.

Spend time at Gardon's Bay. My favorite part of the Bondi to Coogee Beach walk was hanging out at Gordon's Bay. I enjoyed it so much that I made a trip back to spend an entire afternoon there. It's a small area, but that's what make it enjoyable. Not much sand there, but instead cliffs to lounge on. I'm jealous of anyone that gets to hang out there while I'm stuck in Ohio

Beautiful peaceful coastal. Bring you close to nature.. I went to Bondi beach to see the beach but on arriving, I see the coastal walk on the right side of the beach.Just follow the trail and you will eventually reach the rock. The view is amazing. You will love it if you love nature as there are many natural rock formation and you can walk on them and touch them.We walk pass a swimming pool which is located beside the sea. Too bad it was under cleaning, or it could have looked amazing. Worth walking over if you are a tourist at Bondi Beach.
Beautiful coastal walk. Beautiful views along this coastal walk, goes past 5-6 beaches so it does cover some distance, there are delicious cafés at the end of your walk regardless of where u start

The best walk in Sydney. A must do when art by the sea is on annually from 22/10 till 8:/11 it is the largest free outdoor sculpture exhibition in world a must see as weathers just getting nice spring nearly summer a stunning walk

Breath-taking coastal scenery. My favourite walk in Sydney. Perfect for jogging and unwinding after a long day. The stretch from Clovelly to South Coogee is my favourite as it winds through beautifl Coogee Beach and past the iconic ocean baths of Wylies Baths, McIvers Baths and the dog off-leash park at Trenerry Reserve. A must for visitors - and oh it's free!
Popular but scenic Walk. We did this walk late afternoon and despite being very crowded, we still found places to stop, take photos and admire the view, Well worth the trip...
sydney beaches, the best in the world. stunning walk with breathtaking views can be enjoyed in any season, the only thing to avoid is crowds

A great walk to blow the cobwebs away and feel happy to be alive !!. This walk is one of the best walking tracks in Australia. If you are seeking stunning views and fresh air, this is the walk for you. There are plenty of places to rest, to take in the beautiful surroundings. There's no need to rush if you don't need to. Fellow walkers are friendly and considerate. At either end of your walk, there are many cafes with wonderful beverages and food. This walk is one you will never forget!!

A definite must!. I did this walk with 2 friends and it took us just under 3 hours including a lunch break and many stops to enjoy the amazing views! When you are in Sydney, you cannot miss out on the Bondi to Coogee Beach Walk! The views of the ocean, nature, the beaches and surfers are well worth it. I would not recommend this walk to people who have problems walking stairs, since there are a lot of those on the route!

Exhilarating coastal walk/jog. Simply stunning at any time of the day. Either for a solid exercise or just a stroll this is an amazing place to walk or jog. Be patient with the crowds as everyone is just there to enjoy themselves.

Stunning views. We took about four hours walking , as we stopped a lot to take pictures and to eat. People have picnics and relax , while look at the amazing and stunning views. A very beautiful walk!
Most enjoyable. Take in the beautiful coastline. People watch and catch whales having a splashing good time. Simply wonderful!

Beautiful Coastal Walk. This is a beautiful coastal walk. You will see big waves, surfers, and unique local landscape. It is something of a demanding walk with lots of elevation change. There are limited places to grab a cab or bus if you can not make the walk, so be sure you are committed for at least 1 hour of continuous walking. Would not recommend doing the full walk with young kids. Just go to Bondi beach and walk along there if you have young kids or health limitations.Highly recommend as this is a good way to see the coast and is free (small bus cost notwithstanding).

This is what I call beach.. Bondi Beach plus the entire coastal stretch is really a harmony of nature and urbanisation. I particularly love how the development made walking along the coast a wonderful experience. You can walk along the beach and let the sand slip between your toes or tread as if time did not exist in a paved pathway nearby. In either case, you can savor the sound of the waves as it crashes into the rocks and beach. The winds never stop tossing your hair and by the time you get tired of walking, all your problems would have been blow away!

Best attraction in Sydney!. The Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk is the best attraction Sydney has to offer, in my opinion. Stunning views of the ocean the whole way, plus beautiful beaches! I make sure I do this walk every time I come to Sydney. My only secret is... we catch the bus to Coogee and end up in Bondi - it is definitely better! Especially going early in the morning and watching the surfers at Bondi Beach ;) Also great for people watching! You see all sorts of people on the walk, from tourists, to locals, children, and dogs (yay!!!). Highly recommend to all!!!
Stunning vistas. Did this walk with friends while sculpture by the sea was on, just beautiful, but go mid week to avoid big crowds

A Tourist must do if in the area and have some spare time. Great walk, awesome views especially on a beautiful day, take in a coffee or drink either end and work up a sweat with a power walk or just talk a stunning view stroll and ponder at the ocean and the amazing homes.
Great walk to do with visitors. I have done this walk several times when friends and family come to visit and everybody loves it. It gets a little less crowded when you are further from Bondi

Sculptures by the Sea. We did this walk when they had the Sculptures by the Sea on display. This walk is amazing. It never ceases to amaze me how beautiful this country is and how much money the government spends on ensuring boardwalks and walking paths are maintained. Definitely recommend doing this.

Great walk. A must if you have the time and good weather. Spectacular views, took us 90 minutes but although not a difficult walk there are some steep steps. We took the bus from Circular Quay to Cogee and walked to Bondi and had lunch there.
Stretch your legs. Amazing walk in any weather, keep going around to Clovely and Gordon's Bay to Coogee for a good stretch of the legs.
Lovely in cooler weather. Beautiful scenery, and definitely worth doing if it's not too hot. It's quite a walk but you can take it at your own pace and stop along the way.
Amazing views.. Enjoy a lot of nice and beautiful beaches on that way. There are also nice views from the cliffs. With nice weather there are a lot of tourists and locals there

Wonderful walk. Sensational walk, incredible views and lovely sea air. No need to go all the way to Coogee if you don't have time - making it to Bronte or Clovelly can be nice shorter walks too. Sure it can be busy at the weekends, but it's worth it. If you're visiting Sydney, put it on the must do list - take the bus to Bondi Beach and head out there.

Scenic and enjoyable - a must when in sydney. Great walk with fabulous views. Well worth the time and effort to do! If in sydney it's a must!! Can break the walk up and have coffee at tamarama beach. Can commence walk from Bondi or Coogee, either way- it's great!
You will have the time of your life in this walk. Excelent for a good , long morning walk. Marvelous views . Good places to have a lunch between some of the beaches

Wonderful walk. The Coastal work is wonderful! We started along Bondi beach and walked around the point through to Coogee and it was fantastic! If you don't want to do the full walk you can turn back along the way. There are some steps but it is mostly flat and an easy walk. Highly recommended!

Picturesque walk!. Very picturesque walk along Sydney's beautiful coastline. Massive waves break along the coast - a paradise for every surfer's heart! Its just a short ride from the city and well connected by public transport. The only 'downside' it might be very crowded on a sunny weekend day - try to avoid the crowds and you will have one of the "Wow" experiences!
Breathtaking walk. This is a must for a Sydney visit! Unbelievable easy walk with magical views. Don't need to be super fit either.
Lovely Walk. Lovely walk but couldn't manage the return walk as my knees didn't hold up after all the steps.The views are spectacular.

Perfect day to watch the surfer dude. Despite it was winter in this August day, the Bondi beach was full of people, on the beach and in the water. The Coastal Walk was very pleasant, enhanced by the warm weather (about 18°C), perfect sunny and blue sky. In the water, there were numbers of surfer. A couple of them walked up to the shore. They were the stereotypical surfer dudes - tall and handsome. No wonder many women hugging the coast line and just watched. The view from the Walk of the bay and the ocean is just stunning!
Must do !. A must do when in Sydney! The pathway is very scenic and amazing. Be sure to take your camera as there are lots of place you can take amazing shots !!
Great Way to Exercise. Great walk or run The views out to sea is just beautiful .The walking track is good for all including wheel chairs

Walking the Coast. I walked this coastline along with ten friends. A lovely board walk which you can either stroll along or run. Great views of Bronte and Bondi Beach on a beautiful sunny day. It really makes you appreciate life as you walk and breathe in the sea air. A "must do" activity.

Stunning views. Beautiful views of the ocean as you walk from Bondi to Coogee beach. We walked up to Bronte beach about halfway through. Not a very strenuous walk, though the steps are steep in a few places. Loads of places to stop for a photos/ a breather.
Stunning. Our family thoroughly enjoyed this journey. Amazing views and lots of opportunity to chat with locals. Not to be missed.

Beautiful Walk. Stunning walk for walking and running lovers. Parked the car at Clovelly beach and walked down all the way to Bondi. Breathtaking scenes, trees, cockatoo birds, the rocks, the graves area, the greenery everywhere ...etc

Great scenic route!. A wonderful scenic walk for families, friends, joggers - pretty much anyone! Would recommend getting an early start from Coogee so that you can end up at Bondi around lunch time, and also to avoid the afternoon soon. Definitely take lots of water, apply lots of sunscreen, wear comfortable walking shoes and take lots of pictures!

Beautiful scenery and exercise to boot!. We did the Bondi to Coogee walk on a Saturday - it's very busy but still lovely. We caught a bus from Circular Quay to Bondi and back from Coogee - and easy way to get there and avoid any parking issues. Must wear decent shoes or sandals and take a water bottle - there are fountains to refill along the way. There are lots of steps up and down and it is not wheelchair accessible, in fact if you are unfit the walk may be too much on a hot day. We ate at Bronte beach - lots of little restaurants along the road. There are plenty of sites for picnics if you take your own food. Lots of lovely beaches and coves, each seems perfect for a different purpose - surfing, swimming or some that are best for small children. The scenery is lovely, we saw a seal and plenty of birds. It's about 6km but takes a while with the ups and downs, and stops for photos. Well worth doing.

Skip Darling Harbour and Do This Walk. A Sydney Must.. Whenever people ask me what to do in Sydney, I tell them to do the coastal walk. As someone who considers themselves a professional walker, this is a must. Just outstanding. Start in Bondi, go to Coogee and grab a couple pints of Coopers at the Pavilion. A great way to spend a Sunday afternoon, you won't be let down.
Breathtaking view and scenic!. The beach was amazing, but the view you get while walking the pathway is breathtaking. Cold breeze and sunshine makes the walk even better. Must go.
stunning. This place was so beautiful to take my husband for our anniversary. The views drove us crazy it was so relaxing too have to go back !
Beautiful. Stunning walk, try to do it when it's not too hot out! It's quite pretty at dusk as well if you want to avoid the heat. One of my favourite things to do in Sydney

The views are incredible!. This walk is breathtaking! I was staying in Lavendar Bay (north side of the Sydney Bridge), and I took the train and the bus to Cooge. I don't know what kind of parking fees there are, but the public transportation is great! I did the walk from Coogee to Bondi because I wanted to spend some time in Bondi at the end instead of the beginning. Ending in Bondi was pretty cool beacuse you come a corner, and you can see the whole beach in the distance. I stopped at Iceberg's for a coffee, and looked out over the pool and beach while drinking it before making my way down to the beach. There are only a few somewhat steeper parts (due to stairs), but most of the walk was pretty easy. There are water filling stations, bathrooms, benches, and places to buy food and drinks along the walk. The views are gorgeous, and I will definitely do it again the next time I am in Sydney.
Lovely Views, saw dolphins.. Easy walk with lots of lovely eateries to fill your boots in Bondi! Took the train from Town Hall in Sydney and bus to Bronte to start the walk. Would recommend.

Coastal walk. The Bondi to Coogee coastal walk was brilliant. Easy to do except for a couple of areas and the view was great. Stopped for coffe along the way. Take your time and enjoy the view. We did it from Bondi but it may be just as good starting at Coogee

A beautiful walk. I took the coast walk from Bondi to Coogee on a weekday morning and hence it wasn't too busy. I followed the convention by walking on the left of the path. Joggers and those faster than me easily passed by while the route passed by stretches of beautiful ocean scenery. There were a few parts where steps made the walk a little demanding [I'm almost 70] but water stations were available at several places en-route to top up water bottles. There were cafes and toilets at various points too.

A breathtaking walk. A must for every visitor in Sydney. Start from the famous Bondi beach and walk your way south toward Coogee. You'll pass several cute beaches where you can stop and refresh, and you'll constantly walk along the coast, taking in the landscape at every step.

Breathtaking. I just loved this costal walk. I would recommend it to anyone visiting Sydney. It is a easy walk approx. 2 hours if you walked consistently without stopping for too long. You pass by several beaches and the views are just fantastic. You must do while in Sydney!!!

Bondi beach to coogee, and if keen to maroubra beach. Best done during weekdays less people, need water bottle and good walking shoes, if keen can continue to maroubra from coogee, the walk deviates along residential streets south of coogee, there are steps and slight grades, check weather before starting off , may need a hat , one walks flush with coastline, so great camera opportunities , views as good as Monterey coast line if not better , due to access, you won't be disappointed if tired, after walking one way catch public transport back to Bondi or bondi junction station , enjoy

A must for visitors and locals. We have walked this walk on a number of occasions. The walk consists of steep cliffs with unobstructed views of the pristine ocean and coastline, good for whale watching in the season, late April to late November. a reasonable standard of fitness is required with good walking shoes, but you can take a little walk along the cliffs or all the way down to Coogee Beach.On your return you can call into the Bondi Icebergs Club. Anyone residing outside a 5 K, radius can sign in and enjoy the benefits of membership and enjoy refreshments and the vista looking north across Bondi Beach.

Bracing and beautiful. This walk is a real delight. Once you get over the shock of the cost of parking at Bondi Beach, there is nothing but pleasure to be gained from the natural beauty on show. It is quite strenuous and popular.

Negative Ions and Positive Vibes. Ths is one of my favourite morning runs in Sydney. But obviously also great walked. On weekends it gets a little busy but the energy of fellow Eastern Suburbs pedestrians sucking up charged air from the crashing ocean beneath with smiles wiped over their perfect teeth is contagious. Even when one is struggling for breath after running up a series of steps along the cliff face dotted with wild coastal plants. And not looking nearly so fashionable. More often than not I am outshone by the stylish canines being walked too.

Do it Coogee to Bondi!!. Beautiful walk and definitely something you should do! We started in Coogee and ended in Bondi on the advice of a friend that lives in Bondi. Definitely the best idea! Bondi is bigger and is such a cute town to tool around in after finishing the walk! I would recommend Messina gelato on Hall street (also a rec from a local).. amazing gelato!!!
Beautiful. The whole journey takes around 2 hours, with one of the best views in Sydney. Pleasant experience with all the fresh air.

Try to avoid Sunday afternoon. We were warned that this walk was busy on a Sunday but did it anyway as it was the only time left. This is a great walk and you can go as far along as you feel you can manage. Around every headland is another amazing seascape with little bays that you can duck in to. This is a popular walk for locals and tourists alike and so close to the city. You can catch a bus from north quay. If shopping and/or swimming are your thing, you can incorporate this into a day trip. Despite lot's of people on the path, this was still an enjoyable afternoon.
Good option for weekend. Very nice walk. There are some uphills but the view is very beautiful and pleasant. perfect for a weekend walk.
must do it!. great walk. better walk from bondi to coogee, since there are better coffee in coogee after the walk ;-)

Nice way to finish Sydney trip. I enjoyed watching local life on this walk - seeing the houses facing the sea, locals out for runs etc. An interesting walk. We started with fish & chips at Bondi, walked and then caught the bus from Cogee. Buses easy to use to and from Circular Quay.

First beach day after winter. I came here by bus from Paddington, where my new home locates, it dropped me directly to the sides of the Coastal walk. The stunning view of the shore opens in front of my eyes, it is deep blue with silver waves, people are surfing, swimming, playing beach vollleyball or simply enjoying the sunshine. This is a dynamic and harnumious beach. Compared to Santa Monica beach, it is shorter, more activity intensive, less touristy feeling.

Wonderful . If you like cool walking sightseeing a simply enjoying moments this is for you! A must do when in Sydney, beautiful views, and breath taking beaches along the way, you will not be bored neither will you regret!

Must do in Bondi. Stunning coastal walk along the cliffs between Bondi and Coogee Beaches. We made the trek with our two kids, ages 8 and 5. They loved watching the surfers along the various coves and amazingly didn't complain. Without kids this would be an amazing run. We made the day trip from Manly just to do this hike (although more of a semi-paved walking trail) and it was well worth it!
Amazing walk. One of my favorite places in Sydney to walk through! It's a wonderful area outside the city center, if you're in Sydney, go for it :)

Beautiful Coastal Walk. This is well worth the effort, a good solid walk. The coastline is beautiful and the path is great. Not an easy walk but solid. We went further on to Coogee as it was such a beautiful day. Highly recommend.

Perfect Walk. What a way to spend your time. It's a beautiful coastal walk that you can do at any pace. The scenery is amazing. It's also a good time to go while Sculptures by the Sea is on but expect crowds.

Coastline walk. I love this walk, or even half of it and do it quite often. he coastline is breathtaking and there are cafes at the beaches where you can stop and have a break. Take some time to actually walk through the cemetery as there a few intersting ostoric graves
lovely coastal walk. Lovely coastal walk, with a few hills to climb, but well worth it. Great cold larger at the end at Coogee.Average fitness required.

Brilliant coastal walk. Take your time walking leisurely with a friend or jog the route. We always start at Bondi and then walk across to Bronte. It's a great walk. Really busy on the weekends and early mornings and also when "Sculptures by the Sea" exhibition is on. Little chilly in winter and hard on the ears when cold and windy. But on gorgeous sunny days it's one of the best walks in Sydney. There's a few stairs in places but overall it's just an easy walk / jog. We buy a coffee in Bronte at one of the cafes or have lunch there and then walk back. Great way to spend a few hours!

One of the world's great short walks. This walk si wonderful anytime but very special around dawn as the sun lights up the colours of the Sydney sandstone cliffs. It can be a leisurely walk or a faster aerobic jog. There are some possible deviations for refreshments t cafes along he way and you can walk all the way south to Maroubra or even La Perouse. Fantastic for whale watching or a quick swim at one of the beaches along the way.

My favourite walk in sudney. I just love this walk especially around this time of year (not too hot or too cold). The most beautiful views and cafes from start to finish. It's a good workout and lots to see!

Weekend well spent. The walk will take 2.5 hours at a leisure pace. I started it around 3 and ended by 5:45. There are plenty of rest stops and restrooms on the way. Dont forget to take your camera. Finish the walk with some food and drinks at the Beer Garden.

Great Walk. This was a very enjoyable walk. We did not do the whole walk but maybe a fourth of the total length. I thought the scenery was great and the paths well maintained. There were quite a few people jogging/running along the trail. There are many areas where you can go off the trail to sit on the rocks to enjoy the views of the waves coming in or surfers in the area. If we had more time i would have liked to walk more of the trail but our schedule would not allow.
Refreshing walk. We were here early morning for a walk. The breeze was cool and fresh. The colour of water os sky blue and soothing for our eyes.
lovely. This is a great walk whether you are exercising or just going for a casual stole. Great views & great opportunities for scenic pictures.

Amazing experience. Guys if you are visiting Sydney then don't miss opportunity to visit this place. Bondi beach is awesome but Bondi to Coogee coastal walk is the best experience I ever had in my life. The view is just amazing which you can enjoy while relaxing on any of the benches.

Lovely walk. Did this walk for the 2nd time (2nd time in Sydney)- still as stunning! Walked from Bondi to Coogee, quite an easy and relaxing walks with many toilets/ beaches/ parks and really stunning views in between. Waverley Cemetery is quite a sight. Will recommend this walk to everyone.

Coogee to Bondi 1hour 30. I took a taxi to Coogee and walk to Bondi and took a taxi back.I did it this way to be rebel ..seams to be as good this way. I though it was better to arrive in this mythic beach ..almost like a trophy after an hour and a half walk. Nice scenery

Coastal walk on a windy day. Was chill in the wind but still, outstanding views and beaches to see along the walk and the chance of seeing Dolphins although none seen today. Lots of surfing going on and chips from chish and fips on the sea front were delicious
Breathtaking. Best view in Sydney. Time it with Sculptures by the Sea in November and you have a fabulous day out. Walk in either direction and enjoy a drink at the other end.

Breeze~. I spent a day at Bondi by walking around and relax during my trip to Sydney. Very cool breeze in April. i enjoy the nature and everything here. Wishing that there will be a chance to come back again. It is good for rest and relax place with sea breeze.

Must do in Sydney. I really like Manly and Watsons Bar but do this first in case you run out of time. This is a beautiful coastline and after the walk there is plenty of eating places or enjoy a swim. Coogee is our favourite.

Breathtaking walk. . This is a must do when visiting. The view is spectacular - rock formations , aboriginal art, wonderful flora , and a bit of history to read along the way. You can watch the surfers and if you're lucky , see the whales

Beautiful walk with stunning views. Having landed in the morning and needing to do something to keep awake we decided to do this walk. It was recommended by relatives staying near Gordon's bay which was our starting point. Although it was busy in places, particularly with runners/joggers, it is possible to walk at a steady pace and enjoy the surroundings and great ocean views. We stopped off in Bronte Bay for lunch which was nice and then refuelled with coffee and banana bread (of course) once we reached Bondi. Great scenic coastal walk with lots of steps so not suitable for people with mobility impairments.

A great way to pass a beach day.. Tired of the sand, surf and crowds at one beach. Well just walk to another beach. The Bondi to Coogee Beach walk passes through a couple additional beaches too. This walk offers great views of Bondi, Coogee, and the Ocean itself. The walk can be a little difficult at times, but nothing too hard. The walk does go a little beyond Coogee, but ends randomly. If you do go all the way to the very end, just note you will end up in a neighborhood. It is still possible to hope onto a bus from this main road back to Sydney CBD. Be warned, check the bus route.

Pleasant evening walk along the coast. Definitely walk the coast after you've been to bondi! You will get a great view of the entire beach area from the coast, with the setting sun in the back. It was a beautiful easy 45 min stroll :) not to be missed!

One of the best walks. I have done this walk both in winter and summer and loved it every time. There are quite a lot of stairs so it always seems to take longer than it should but mostly because you MUST stop to take pictures every few minutes. The views are beautiful. There are public restrooms at several locations along the way as well as drinking fountains. And once your are done there are some nice cafe's in Coogee to refresh yourself before you walk back
Unwind and relax. Great way unwind on fine, chilled day. Can take 2-3 hours depending how relaxed your feeling. Certain times of year there tends to be sculptures showcased along the coast

Beach, bays & people watching. It has to be one of the better coastal walks in the world.Some general fitness required. So good that I have gone from Bondi to Coogee & return, naturally stopping for coffee & a bite to eat on a temperate day. Not expensive to catch a taxi back if you cannot make it back on the return. Gordon's Bay reminds me a little of Europe as it is sheltered & hard to imagine that you are close to a major city.Yo will enjoy.
Best ocean view I had so far!. The coastal walk was something I couldn't imagine was so beautiful and scenic. Definitely it worth every mile walking!

Eastern Beaches walk - spectacular scenery in Sydney!. I walked from my accommodation to Bronte, then took the coastal walk to Coogee. Absolutely stunning!!! (the weather was 18 degrees, and fine). The next day I walked to Coogee, then on the coastal walk to Maroubra. Warning - I had to ask a local re part of the track, as not all (but most) of the coast is park. You need to walk up a street, along a main road, and down again to rejoin the coastal track! Also - scrambling over rocks is OK if you have the right footwear, and are comfortable in doing so. Not for everyone, though - and watch the tide!! Kind regards, Robyn
Very enjoyable. A lovely walk that can be experienced by all. The views are beautiful and there are plenty of places to rest along the way.
Beachside walks. Absolutely stunning views on this walk. Easy strolling with no hard inclines.A lovely way to spend an afternoon.
A must-do!. Highly recommend doing at least part of this walk (e.g. Coogee to Bronte). It is truly spectacular, easy-going and free! Don't forget your camera. :)

high light of Sydney. its best to enjoy the walk with so many stunning ocean views & save your swim toward the end in Coogee @ the Bath or Coogee Surf Life Saving Club then stop at the Coogee Pavillion, perfect day :-)

Bondi to Bronte. Only walked as far as Bronte(intentional)......fab experience..Sunday afternoon -not busy as other reviews suggested! Great beaches and scenery.....an absolute must........treat yourself to Fish & Chips at Bronte....

Stunning walk . This is truly amazing! We did not have time to do the entire walk but got off at Tamarama and walked to Bondi for brunch. It was packed at 10 on a Saturday but that is to be expected. If you want to run go early on a weekday because there are so many people stopping to take pictures or walking on both right and left sides (lots of tourists) its impossible to get your stride going. Breathtaking views and great vibe that it totally different than the city. Cant recommend getting out of the city to do this enough.
Worth it.. We do this walk all of the time when we have tourists come out to visit - you can't beat the view or the variety of beaches! An incredible way to view the Sydney coastal line.

Just do it ! Its one of the best things to do, when you like walkings!. Every year I do this great walk from Coogee to Bondi. So amazing, unforgetable views to the rocky coast line, the nice beaches between.. and always in July August, when i be there, I watched out to the sea, cos sometimes you will see dolphins and by bit more luck, you see the whales !!!

Magnificent views. A fantastic, well marked walk with beautiful coastal views. The entire length is paved and so easy to walk, although there are a few steep uphill bits. There are good bus connections to both Bondi and Coogee from central Sydney.
Burn off the fab Sydney food. This is a MUST it is a beautiful walk - but wear solid shoes . Loads of water drinking points everywhere - exceptional

Huge variety for the distance travelled.. I can't remember how many beaches there are in between Coogee and Bondi, but I remember that every single one had something unique about it in its own way. Many people told me about the beautiful cliff faces and the cemeteries before having done the walk myself (which were also great) but I enjoyed all the different beaches more than anything (Gordon's Bay was my personal favourite). Full day activity.

Great walk along the coast. The Bondi Beach to Coogee walk provided some amazing coastline views, from beaches to cliffs, and the expansive ocean. It's not too long, and offers places along the way to stop for a cold drink or meal. It's a free way to see some of the best beaches in Sydney.

Scenic walk. Great walk not too difficult . Just take it at your own pace . If driving need to park one end and bus it back to car. Or public transport to and from . Cafes either end of walk for lunch.

Beautiful Walk. Beautiful view of the sea during this walk. It takes a couple hours to get from Bondi to Coogee but on a nice day, its breath taking. I did the walk during off season so it wasn't very busy but during the summer expect it to be quite crowded. There are cute spots to have a picnic. You'll also notice an interesting cemetery mid way through.

Busy!. Nice views but be warned it is a busy place. I have done this walk many times but wouldn't even consider doing it on a weekend or during school holidays as it is just too busy which for me makes it less enjoyable.

Best things in life are free!. Great walk along the coastline. Don't miss out on this and don't worry about the time it takes to walk from Bondi to Coogee and back. Quite easily it can be done in about 2-2:30 hours or even less. If you don't want to walk to Coogee then just go as far as you can and then walk back. You'll love it and the best part of it is that it's for free.
great places good food and loads to drink. We had great weather and easy travel with the hop on/off bus which is easy to find as they travel most parts of the city
Sydney=Beach. Sydney is a summer city. These walk is safe, beautiful, not to short, not too long, parks, outdoors gyms and now better coffe shop all around. Sydney soul!!

Cheap sightseeing exercise. If you want to sightsee while you exercise, at absolutely no cost, take a walk from Bondi to Coogee, especially during the "Sculptures By The Sea" FREE exhibition during November each year. Sydneysiders never tire of this walk, and if you are a visitor, you will be well rewarded with spectacular views. The time spent on this walk is entirely optional, depending on time available.
For tourists and locals , not to be missed. Not to be missed, this is a breathtaking walk, an easy walk with amazing views of the cliffs, ocean and beaches.

On a clear day!. We had such stunning weather for our August weekend in Sydney and decided to complete this walk to take in the relaxing views after a hectic few days. Unfortunately the day we chose to do this coincided with the City to Surf run and even though we left it to the afternoon it was very busy. This did not detract from the beauty of the walk but we did not find it quite as enjoyable. We had intended to take advantage of some of the eating places around the track however after the first few with very long queues we abandoned the walk in favour of getting back to a place to grab a bite to eat. It was all new and all very pleasant. One note would be that at this time of year, head to Coogee from Bondi as the sun will be at your back instead of in your face which suited hubby perfectly as he had endured a bit of sunburn already and did not have his hat.

Bondi to Coogee Walk the "Sculptures by the sea"!. Picture this...a warm, sunny spring day, a view out over the horizon and up and down the East coast of Sydney, beaches as far as the eye can see AND art. You can have all of these things on a walk between Bondi and Coogee in October every year. From 22 Oct to 8 Nov artists display commissioned sculptures for anyone to walk around and admire. Not only is the walk pleasant, the sculptures are so much fun to walk around that you barely notice you're exercising.

The Best of the Great Outdoors. A visual overload! There is so much natural beauty to be seen on this walk. You can stop and enjoy a coffee or a swim or just take in the surroundings. A truly beautiful place not to be missed.
Absolutely beautiful . The scenery is absolutely beautiful along this walk. The whole way it is paved and fenced and so is accessible to many.

Sea Side view by foot. One way to see the famous Bondi beach and the coast of Sydney. Lovely walk, lots of scenery to take in and grab a bit of fresh air. Quite a few beaches to check out and choose from, all have great character.
The dog really enjoyed it as well!. Really good way to spend a weekend morning. Plenty of people, plenty to see and an easy walk at that. Whole family enjoyed it.

sculptures by the sea. ive done this walk many times but only recently did the sculptures by the sea.....I love this walk. plenty of hills & steps so preferable you have some degree of fitness. the sculptures by the sea made it busier than usual but they were amazing & worth battling crowds!! The views are amazing.....couple that with breakfast/brunch or lunch st Bondi (I usually do the walk Coogee to Bondi) and you will have a fantastic day!!
Good Walk. Started with a Lunch at Bondi and ended at Coogee for afternoon tea. Bit hard of a walk with many stairs however the view is breathtaking.

Best enjoyed in Spring and Autumn. It's no secret that Summer can be very hot in Sydney. (But at least there isn't the awful, energy sapping humidity of the tropics! ) Of course, any time of the year is lovewly for walking from Bondi to Coogee: the scenery is stunning, the topography challenging, and there are many places to stop, rest and refuel.Like other walkers, I usually do this walk in reverse- from Coogee to Bondi, or even from Tamarama to Bondi during "Sculpture by the Sea" (which is on this year from 22 October to 8 November).If you , like me, don't enjoy walking in the heat, then the best seasons to go are Spring, Autumn and Winter. Even Spring can be unpleasantly hot if you start after 10 am. This is especially so during the aforementioned "Sculpture by the Sea" : " a 2 km long temporary sculpture park featuring over 100 sculptures by artists from Australia and across the world" set up from Tamarama to Bondi along the clifftops. As well as the hot sun, there are thousands of people on the path admiring the sculptures. Don't be put off though. If you start at 8am, you can beat the heat and the crowds.My favourite spots on the walk are the cafe at Tamarama beach, recently relocated and renovated, and anywhere with a view from the cliff tops and a cooling sea breeze.A word about getting there. Unless you are prepared to park a long way from your starting point, I suggest using public transport or going mid-week only, and not on weekends. Watch out for parking meters in the shopping streets close to the beach. There are residents parking schemes in most streets which limit visitors to 2 hours. For more information about travelling to Bondi Beach from the City go to: http://www.bondivillage.com/location.htm

great walk. we did the coastal walk a few weekends ago early around 10am good timing not many joggers around weather was magnificent the coastal walk was amazing and looking at the turquoise waters along the way very easy walk

Stunning. A beautiful coastal walk/run not far from the centre of Sydney. It gets busy particularly on weekends, public holidays, or sculptures by the sea (end of Oct/early Nov) but still worth the crowds; just ignore others and inhale the salt breeze, you'll feel like you are alone. Suggest (as others) doing it 'backwards' from Coogee to Bondi. Or start 1/2 way from Bronte with a yummy breakfast. Slap on sunscreen and a hat on sunny days, take an umbrella when clouds look threatening. There are some stairs, prams/wheelchairs will need to be lifted in spots and it can be difficult for those with a lower limb impairment. But there are many spots where you can stop, sit and soak it all in.
wonderful views.. A wonderful walk with some great views and photo opportunities. Need sturdy shoes as it climbs up high.

Coogee to Bondi to Coogee Run.. I've only walked this a couple times. I've run it many dozens of times.This is a feast for the senses. The salt air, cliffs, blue seas, and clean beaches. Depending on the time of day and time of year you could see surfers riding the waves, scuba divers prepping/recovering from a dive, swimmers, walkers, runners, and people playing on the beach. You might have calm seas or high winds. Cool or heat. So bring your camera (or smartphone) and be prepared.Many times I've run from Coogee to Bondi, and back to Coogee, taking care to run on the Coogee and Bondi beaches, often barefoot. It's about 7km one way, 14km from south Coodee to north Bondi and back. There's water fountains along the way, and a few restrooms. If you're into gothic funerary architecture, walk through the cemetery about halfway in between and notice some of the older tombstones.There's plenty to eat in Coogee and Bondi, after you've finished your run. There's buses that get to Bondi and Coogee.There are a few events there which make running difficult. City2Surf and Sculpture by the Sea come to mind.

A must do for all visitors to Sydney. spectacular views, not too strenuous a walk, great coffee shops at either end, endless stunning photo opportunities - what's not to love? Great for kids and adults alike - though having a pram can be a little challenging as there are a few sets of stairs you need to navigate and if you complete the walk in summer you get to swim at some of the best beaches in the world

Spectacular cliff, beach and ocean views. This walk is spectacular. Access is perhaps the hardest part because parking in Bondi can be difficult. Try starting at Coogee or, even easier, around the middle (perhaps near Waverley Cemetery)

Jewel in the crown.. This is a spectacular walk around the coast. You will be speechless. This is a good 2 hour leisurely walk. You can stop at Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly and Coogee beaches for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Make sure you have your camera, swimmers and a towel as the water is very enticing. There are seats dotted around the walk so you can sit and be mesmerised by the ocean or see some dolphins if you are lucky (May to November). It is a must if you have the time.

Walk with friends. We did this spectacular walk along the coastline with friends. It was made all the beetle as it was a great day weather wise. I wouldn't recommend on either a really hot day or too windy as it would take away from the experience.There are lots of places to stop and rest on the way. The views are great the walk is not too challenging but you get a good level of exercise out of it.If you are keen you can go there and back if you want to have a bite to eat .The only downside is parking

Fabulous walk.. This is a lovely walk that can be done at your own pace. There are only a few steps which are easy to navigate. A few vantage points along the way, allow you to sit and just take in the view and enjoy the sunshine. At either end you can dip your toes in the surf, sit on the beach or go for a swim. At the Bondi end, there are some fabulous cafes and restaurants or you can just sit on the boardwalk and watch the activity on the beach. Winter or summer, this walk never fails to leave you feeling relaxed.
worth doing. a great walk views of the ocean are amazing and you can get a bus back if you don't want to walk #the walk is fairly flat and spacious

Almost wilderness. We did the southern end of this walk on the weekend, from Malabar back to South Maroubra. It's not really open, as there are fences and signs to try and stop people entering, but the fences are pretty quickly opened up, and the signs ignored. There not a lot that will stop rock fishermen getting to their favourite spots.The major issue is the continuing presence of the rifle range, however nobody was shooting on Sunday so it wasn't a problem. They need to be a long way off target to bother anybody doing the walk anyway, but it would be much better if they could find somewhere else for the shooters to play. The most impressive thing about this area is how remote it seems, even though it's quite close to a huge city. The scrubland seems much as it would have been before European settlement, with the exception of the privet and bitou bush which has infiltrated.There are some interesting remnants of the observation posts, gun emplacements, ammunition stores and barracks which were built to repel the Japanese in WWII. Sadly neglected, but worth a look.The view over the cliffs onto the wild coastline is spectacular. At times you could swear the nearest civilisation was many miles away. Just hard to believe it's so close to Sydney.

Who doesn't like a stroll beside the sea side.. Pick a nice day and stroll from one end to the other. Walk back or catch a bus. Your call. If the Sculptures by the Sea is on it's a bonus as the section from Bondi to Bronte is filled with visual distractions. Winter is my favourite as it brings clear days and a chance to see dolphins and whales as they migrate up and down the coast.

Visit when the Art is there. This is another great low cost Sydney activity. catch the bus to Bondi Beach and walk along the cliff face to Bronte where you can get another bus back to the city. The absolute best time to do this is in November when the Sculpture by the Sea is held. Amazing art works are placed all along the walk, but beware don't go on a weekend it's packed. The walk is quite arduous with lots of steps and it's not wheelchair accessible.

Amazing and unique cliff top walk!. This is one of my favourite places in Sydney.It costs no money, yet will reward you with unbelievable views of Sydney's iconic beaches, Bondi Beach, Tamarama beach and Bronte Beach. You can walk as slow or as fast as you wish along the meandering cliff top walk, some people run it!Take your camera as the views are spectacular. There are a few cafes along the way for a break and water fountains to rehydrate.If you are lucky you might be there for the annual Sculptures by the Sea which is usually in November for a few weeks.This to me is the real Sydney, iconic and beautiful!

Simply stunning. This walk is just beautiful, gorgeous views, not difficult and so scenic. Not to be missed. Great places along the way to have a coffee, breakfast or lunch. Even the cemetery you walk past is an eye opener. What a place to lay down for your final resting place !
Spectacular views. This walk has many spectacular views and is a must do if staying in the area. It is very hilly and has many stairs, so my run turned into more of a run/walk!

Great costal walk. This is a very doable and very beautiful coastal walk, that's highly recommended. It takes about 2 easy hours to complete stopping for photographs, rests, and enjoying the views. Reading the reviews, the constant replies from Andrew "the owner" seem unnecessary except when providing extra relevant information (i.e., buses info).
walk the beach. A very long and enjoyable walk take the city tour bus to bondie beach and walk along the route and join bus at other end or call ubber if you can,t make it to the end

Great any time of the day or night. I usually do this in reverse from Coogee to Bondi. Its simply BEAUTIFUL. There are lots of serious runners along the walkway which push you out of the way but keep walking and take in the view. A warning: pick your times if its when the Sculpture by the Sea is on
Morning Exercise!. Avoid during the "Sculpture by the Sea" - any other time this is a magnificent walk! If you're staying close by, its a nice way to start the day.

A must do in Sydney. I did it on a chilly windy winter day in 26 years in Sydney but this walk made me so refreshed and relaxed. The walk is not that hard as you can take a rest if you feel tired. The weather was great except the tempeture and the beaches and coastline were so perfectly beautiful and i would never forget the walk. I will do it again when weather gets warmer and maybe I may jump into the beach if i feel hot while walking. Coffee at Coogee was also nice!

Awesome Costal Walk ever in Sydney and I'm really really like it. I Almost do coastal walk about 5 times in a year. It spend about two hours walking and it's very fun and healthy. Its Combining beaches, rockpools, parks and spectacular coastal views (perfect!). I recommended you to you a comfort shoes. You can go here by bus from Bondi Beach Station.

Bondi to Coogee beach!. If you have some spare time, and it's a sunny day, make sure you go on this walk! No doubt there's quite a fair bit of uphills and downhills but the scenery is well worth the exercise. Go! Don't miss out.
Lovely way to see a beautiful stretch of the coast.. Lovely way to see a beautiful stretch of the coast. Takes about 2 hours and there are cafés scattered along the way.

The most beautiful Aussie attraction! The coastal walk.. If you only do one walk along our gorgeous Australian coastline - this is it! No matter the weather you will be in awe of the spectacular views. Great stops along the way and when you end in Bondi treat yourself to your choice of high end or quirky dining or just chillout on the sand with your choice. Enjoy !
Stunning. Thoroughly enjoyed the stunning views. Great as not to many stairs to walk up and down. Fun family day out.
Superb beachside walk. Excellent coastal walk, a romantic place to be .. although it is also a great place to have fun with friends. Relax at Coogee beach after a walk and have a great eve.

A Relaxing Walk with Amazing View.!. My mum and I walked from Bondi to Coogee beach, although it was in the middle of winter, all the walking and excitement kept us warm enough to keep going. The views along the coast were absolutely beautiful and lotsa scenic spots to get your postcard kinda pictures :)There are a lot of good & cosy cafes around the beaches as well.! Just that the walk from Bronte to Coogee beach is slightly further with a flight of steep steps involved. Just a note for those with bad knees / knee problems. There are plenty of bathrooms around which we are pleasantly surprise how clean they are maintained. After Coogee, we took a bus back to Bondi Junction and shopped at Westfield shopping centre. All in all, I definitely recommend the coastal walk as there are views not to be missed.!

Great walk despite the crowd. Breathtaking views of the ocean the whole way through.There are well planned side visits/trips along the walk for photo opportunities or rest breaks. Would recommend going in the middle of the week to avoid the weekend crowd. Fantastic route for morning runs.

A beautiful blue walk. It is a nice walk, the scenic is great with the typical ocean coastline views. Soaking up blue is the best way to describe it! The path is extremely well marked and easy to complete, despite some up and down hill. You can do the entire walk or just part of it, it is easy to step off route and catch a bus to bondi junction for instance. It can be windy.

Most breathtaking views. Its the best coastal walk in Sydney and its a must do for anyone visiting Sydney. Its can be done during any time of the day. There are the most amazing view points and lots of relaxing places with water/rest rooms all along the way. I was lucky to find super model GiGi Hadid on the way during this walk :)
very nice. wonderful landscape and very easy i good way to see the coast and the sydney's beaches and if its too long you can do a shorter one like bronte to bondi

Beautiful brisk walk. So lovely and scenic the Bondi to Coogee walk is great for all fitness levels.I love parking in Coogee and then rewarding myself at the Icebergs RSL when I get to Bondi and then a long stroll back to the car.

A must do when in Sydney. Very worthwhile walk, with amazing views and plenty of photo opportunities especially the pods of Dolphins. There are plenty of places to rest and also restrooms if required.

Bondi coastal walk. Whilst in Sysney you must do this coastal walk which was a wonderful experience. Bondi its self is a magnificent beech however the area around it is typical surfer establishements however the coastal walk is well constrcted and a wonderful experience, plus the villages and beeches on the was were excelllent.

Memorable walk with a bonus. Spectacular views and a must stop at the "Icebergs" pool, and restaurant. The scenery is gorgeous and a camera bugs delight. But plan on a pit stop at the "pool", and then garb a great lite food break and a drink at the Icebergs restaurant.
Different Walk. I do recommend this walk along the beaches. It was a new thing for me cause we don´t have this kind of path here in Rio.
Fantastic walk. Definite to do for a first timer in Sydney. Relaxing, scenic gives you a great sense of Sydney geography and some good food options on the way.
Spectacular seaside so close to the city. Bring comfy shoes and a bottle of water. Be ready for some good people watching - it's fun. And the walk is not too strenuous .

Beautiful sights. We grabbed the bus to/from Sydney, got of at Bondi and returned from Coogee. THe walk is simply stunning - and great for running and working out along the way. Free water-fountains and training gear are found throughout the walk.
Great beachside walk.. Great walk with stunning views and suitable for senior citizens, stop at Bronte for lunch before continuing.

Great walk. Every time we visit Sydney we set aside a day to visit Bondi and take the costal walk to Coogee.The views are outstanding and there are beaches and rock formations alomg the way that mean you can easily spend a day here. The cafe at Tamarama (excuse the spelling) offers a nice break and a chance to have a bite to eat or grab a drink or icecream if the weather is hot.My tip would be ..... if you are travelling from Sydney on the train, when you get to Bondi junction buy a RETURN bus ticket. We didn't and then discovered that all return busses were pre-pay only so we couldn't gt back. in the end we walked back to the junction but it's quite a long trek so wouldn't recommend it unless you're keen on walking.Still regardless of how you get there it's an amazing walk and well worth the effort.

A must do Summer or Winter (Blue skys preferable for max impact). A must do in Sydney. If it's hot, take a snorkel and make a stop at gordons bay for a spot of aqua water & fish galore. Local tip: either way you start (coogee or bondi, or shorter starting at bronte to bondi), make a stop at bronte for a famous sydney brunch, then wind up at a beachside bar with a drink in hand.

Nice walk with scenic view of the coasts. Took a 3 hours walk from Bondi to Coogee Beach. Lots of steps with proper footpath and boardwalk. The distance is about 5km with lots of viewpoint and rest stops along the way. Bring alone water bottle as there are refilling points along the way. The various scenic view along the way is worth the walk. Plan such that you have breakfast at one point and finished with lunch at another. There are plenty of eateries at both Bondi and Coogee. Enjoy!

Free and Fab. Walk it!. Not suitable for prams, very small children, or the overly ancient, especially in the Sydney hot, hot, hot months. But you can start this at different points on the route, so GOOGLE options to pick up the walk.There are lots of beach spots to picnic at, and swim from. Water fountains on the walk.Heaps of stairs, and spetacular ocean views. Clear ocean water on a good day, and on a wild storm day, completely different perspective. I've done both and it is worth the aching limbs.Watch out for the runners, who shoot past and <sigh> at those who stop to marvel and sniff the breeze.Advice fo tourists, start at Bronte Beach and end at Bondi Beach.

Beautiful coastal walk. This is a beautiful walk on a cool, cloudy day and absolutely spectacular on a sunny one. We took the bus to Coogee and walked south to Bondi Beach. The walk took us about 3 hours with short stops along to enjoy the view and take pictures. There is no way to get lost along this walk, as it is well marked and well traveled (although the further north you go the fewer people are on the path). Not only was the scenery amazing, but it was fun to see school groups at the beach, surfers in the water, coastal pools and lifeguard buildings, and read some of the tombstones in the cemetery. Our kids were a little tired by the end (or maybe just bored waiting for me to take pictures), however, you can start and stop the walk at any point along the route if you are limited by time or energy -- it is all fantastic. If you only do a portion, try to include the cemetery. It is so unusually striking set against the coast, and the boardwalk along the cliff at that section is particularly scenic. Bring your water bottle, as there are city-sponsored water bottle stations to refill along the way.

Beautiful coastal walk. . I absolutely love this coastal walk. You could not ask for a better view! Great for families as well as friends etc. great to see the variety of beaches and little restaurants along the way. Lovely rock formations and plenty of sculptures. Bondi and coogee are both excellent places to visit.

Wonderful experience!. A wonderful walk, along an equally wonderful beach! There is plenty of space to walk and is absolutely safe (fenced). You can take beautiful pictures of the surrounding area, during the walk.

Stunning. Stunning coastal walk requiring moderate fitness (lots of steps).Took us 3 hrs with a swim at each beach along the way. Gorgeous views with plenty of seats to stop, rest and take in the coast line.

Beautiful scenic walk. A must do, especially if the weather is kind. We caught a bus to Bondi, walked to Coogee then bussed back to the city. Lots of steps in places, but lots of places to sit or stand and enjoy the glorious views. Places to stop and eat along the way if required.
A good view and a good breeze. We really enjoyed the beach. it was a bit crowded but the breeze made it all the more good. A must visit place in Sydney.

Bucket list. A magnificent view. A must for everyone's bucket list.I tried to take my 2 year old, but there are just too many stairs for a stroller. You will need a little bit of fitness but there are several places to stop and enjoy the view.

Beautiful East Coast Sydney at its finest. For anyone, tourist or local, the Bondi to Coogee beach coastal walk, especially on a sunny day, is nothing short of spectacular. The water is bright blue and the journey from the trendy Icebergs (take a photo there on a beautiful day), past all the other beaches to Coogee is relaxing and perfect. Nothing better than stopping in Tamarama or Bronte for a smoothie after your walk. Photos are necessary.

Could not be better to see the nice view . My friend recommended and advised me to walk along bondi to coogee beach and it was so amazing! A lot of people walked, jogged and swam there so I felt i I am alive. I found that charm only Sydney got!

So pretty!. Who would have thought that Sydney had so many amazing beaches. They're all unique in their own way. They're also very clean too! I was impressed since the beaches are so closed to the city.

Perhaps the most beautiful oceanside walk ever. Perhaps the most beautiful oceanside walk ever. It is long. There are boardwalks in many places, grass and pavement in others. There are restaurants along the way. But best of all there is the ocean and numerous beaches to play on or walk on along the way. We did this walk from Bondi to Coogee (and the reverse) numerous times while in Sydney.

The Walk. A must on everyone's list of things to do while in Sydney. I am an Aussie and this walk never gets old. Looking out to the Indiana ocean and seeing the whales swimming in the water is surreal.Lots of cafes in both Bondi and Coogee.
BONDI TO COOGEE WALK. Beautiful coastal walk and a must do for anyone visiting Sydney. Would highly recommend to young and old!

Gorgeous landscape and nice walking path. This walk is a must do. We loved watching Dolphins play and the waves crashing, it was beautiful and changing around every corner. Wasn't busy on a week day in winter but would probably be more crowded on the weekend. We used our opal card to take the bus to and from the bonds junction station, very easy access.

Great for family expeditions. A beautiful walk, especially for young children. While the beaches are cold in the winter, there are many rock pools to explore and clamber over on the walk. Our kids spent an hour just climbing up and down the rocks on the shore and exploring as kids do. It's easy to take a bus from Sydney city center - only a 30 minute ride through some nice suburbs. You can spend a whole morning or afternoon there and I would suggest planning a whole day if you have young children as they will want to explore and play to their hearts' content
Great atmosphere. Great atmosphere. We were there in June and we could have walked on the beach in a T-shirt and ice-skate in the ice ring on the beach, which is a great atraction.
Marvelous Experience. Walk the walk, totally pleasurable. Enjoy the cool breeze touch you cheeks. Watch the beautiful sights around you. Highly recommended.

Beautiful Scenery, nice experience. I’m a big rock fan! So was very excited and pleased to see all the unique and wonderful rock faces encountered along the walk- the sea and sky competed for the title of unrivalled beauty but drew a complete tie in the end! Lovely beaches and coves to explore along the way! If you have lots of time to explore Sydney I recommend this walk!Like all the other reviews… we were faced with copious amounts of joggers, toddlers, prams, tourists and gangs of travellers queuing in both directions – so go with a full stomach or snacks and water in preparation for walking much slower than you might normally at your own pace. Potentially would not rank in my top 20 things to do in Sydney

Classic Sydney Walk - Must Do. This has to be one of the classic Sydney walks along the waters edge of the Pacific. Sweeping views, lots to view along the way through small suburbs and walk-ways. Has to be one of the best walks with views!
Lovely Walking. I've been there 5 times and each time I had a different experience.Great views absolutely gorgeous Walking along the ocean.

Stunning scenic walk. Put on comfortable walking shoes and give it a go!It is a long walk there and back so depending on the weather be sure and bring water and sunscreen and your camera and head off! Maybe a towel also as there are lovely little beaches along the way to stop off if you want to cool down or take a break!It's a beautiful area and really nice to get out of the hustle and bustle of the city for a few house and finish up with a nice lunch by the sea on bondi!
Nice walk on the ocean front, views on Bondi. A nice and easy walk to see the Ocean and Bondi beach. Accessible to all, also appropriate for jogging.

A must-do in Sydney. I jog or walk this beautiful coastal path on an occasional basis and it never fails to please, regardless of the weather. It does become busy at the weekends especially during the holiday periods but that is to be expected. 'Sculptures by the Sea' is held around late Oct - early Nov between Bondi and Tamarama and is well worth a visit, don't forget your camera.
Gorgeous Walk!. Worth the trip! Give yourself time to linger / wander as you pass rocks and ocean access - such great views!
Fantastic walk with great views. Fantastic walk (some steep parts) along a great part of coastal Sydney. Passing the Bondi Baths, The Waverley Cemetery and the iconic Tamarama Surf Lifesaving Club

Don't Miss. Gorgeous Views!. Beautiful walk. Our family of five enjoyed the walk there and back (with a delicious brunch stop near Coogee). So many gorgeous views. A perfect way to spend part of a day.
Great beach walk. So glad we did this, based ona friend's recommendation. Reached Coogee by bus and returned from Bondi by bus, both easy and reasonable. Saw dolphins swimming at sea
The most picturesque walk I have ever done. Wish I had given myself more time to enjoy this walk and gone with a friend so I could chill out of the rocky outcrops along the way!

Incredible View to Pacific Ocean. I stayed in Sydney for 1 year and this is one of the place that I visit more than twice.It takes about 2-3 hours for leisure walk. Perfect views to Pacific ocean. You will start from Bondi beach, Tamarama beach, Bronte beach, Clovelly beach, and end up on Coogee Beach. From Coogee, you can continue to Maroubra beach that will take about 1-2 hours.
An outstanding walk in Sydney. Spectacular views all along this coastal walk. Beautiful painted murals at Bondi beach, fascinating rock formations, most scenic cemetery you've ever seen and more.
Fabulous coastal walk!. I actually walked from Coogee Beach to Bondi soon after I arrived in Dec 2006. A wonderful walk, full of interesting things to see, weather perfect that day. Recommended.
Amazing views!. A photographer's dream walk with picture postcard views at every turn. Beautiful. Suitable for most walkers, keep a look out for Art by the Sea exhibition that happens here too.

Magnificent views of the worlds most famous beach.. Something everyone needs to do. The views are spectacular. People are friendly and you can always start a conversation with one of the locals or fellow tourists. Great coffee at the beginning and end. Lots of busses if you do not want to walk all the way back.
The perfect Sunday walk. The most Scénic walk you can do in Sydney! The views take your breath away! It's the perfect walk when the sun shines! You get to see the natural pools along the way!

A beautiful walk on a sunny day!. We couldn't complete the full walk and only travelled from Bondi to Tamarama Beach, but we witnessed some very beautiful views on the way. number of people were jogging, brisk walking, with their dogs on this route. you could walk off from the main walk on to the big boulders too to get close to the water. the water looked absolutely beautiful and it was a lovely sight to absorb. Since it was winter in June, couldnt find too many surfers in the sea. Definitely requires a visit if you are at Bondi. please note, there are no enroute food stations. so plan lunch, snacks accordingly.
