Absolutely Beautiful. Admittedly we only did half the walk due to time constraints, but so wish we had had the time to do the full walk. We started at Bondi Beach and walked for about an hour and then turned round to return to Bondi. The scenery is absolutely stunning and our teenage children even enjoyed the experience! We only started the walk due to the high rating on Trip Advisor, but it really is a must do. If we ever return to Sydney, we will definitely make sure that we complete this walk.

Morning walk. Pretty amazing views from this walk and some great photo opportunities The walk has some quite challenging hills and steps so if you have any medical issues maybe this walks not for you.The walk ways and boardwalks are all well maintained and kept very clean

take your time go early or late. Having been a local here, it is worth it!As a local does I would suggest going early morning or brunch period have coffee light meals at BronteI prefer to return to Bondi and not continue to coogeetake time to relax on the sand of Tamaramait does get very busy, and don't forget hat and sunscreenIf you visit Bondi You must include this walk on your plans!

What Australia is about!. I did this walk both ways, Bondi to Coogee and Coogee to Bondi. It takes around two hours if you want to explore Waverley Cemetery and take a few photo stops. You can do it quicker though.You take in Coogee Beach, Bronte, Clovelly, Tamarama and if you're doing it Coogee to Bondi you can always glimpse Bondi in the distance. It really is how you imagine Australia - miles of golden beaches, big surf! I did this walk on a windy day and there is a particular stretch on the top of the cliff where it was literally gales and it was a little hard to stay on your feet so bear in mind weather conditions because when you're higher up the wind will be stronger. There are lots of points of interest along the walk and lots of water pumps if you're thirsty. There are also toilet facilities along the route.The walk seemed to me to be very safe, lots of people around, and there are railings along most areas at the cliff edges.It is paved throughout so you're not hiking over bare grass and it is not overly strenuous though there are a few hills.If you're in the area it's one of the walks you should definitely undertake and if you've walked one way and can't face the return walk there are buses along the route and they are extremely cheap!Great walk for exercise, to catch a tan or even practise your photography skills!

excellent walk. as always i love the coastal walk . i take the walk every time i visit Sydney..we enjoyed the view and took so many pictures .it was amazing to see dolphins and take pictures too.we stopped on the way to have a delicious lunch at bronte as always.

Must do!. This was without a doubt my favourite part of our trip to Sydney! I was slightly dubious about the walk, but my friend was insistent and I'm so glad she made me! A lovely coastal walk, there is a plethora of pools for a dip, my only regret was not wearing bathers or leaving enough time for the walk - you can really make a day of it, although at a leisurely pace it took us a few hours. Plenty of dog walkers and adventurous runners en route, but very pleasant!

Some good views on this walk. An enjoyable walk, I started in Coogee and did not do the full walk to Bondi but this is a bonus of this walk, you can walk as far or as little as you like and then there are bus connections along the way so you can get back to where you started from easily. Some nice views but I also prefer the walk around the Botannic Gardens or from Cicurlar Quay to Darling Harbour just as much.
Great morning walk. Great place to get out for a long walk with friends or by yourself, also tends to be quiet crowded in the afternoon so try to go in the mornings - this worked for us really well.

Go hike a beach (or two)! Fantastic!. An excellent experience. Do not miss this walk.We started at Bondi beach, taking the train and local bus. Great way to experience Sydney like the locals do. It is easy to navigate and inexpensive. (There's lots of people to help if you get yourself in trouble.) We walked all the way to Coogee, stopping at a local pub on the way for some fresh fish. The views are simply fantastic and the walk is not very rigorous. Easy and peaceful. Don't miss it.
Easy walk!. An easy walk along the coast. Some nice lookouts. Can be really crowded due to nice weather. Take swimming or snorkeling gear with you to enjoy some of the bays.

great views on a clear day. the negatives first: it was very crowded and the views were all about rockformation and cliffs BUT: a wonderful walk, also not too long and you get to see a total different side if sydney

Coastal walk. I started my walk from Bronte beach crossing tamarama beach upto Bondi brach and what an experience it was. To see nature's beauty enjoying the surfers showing their skill in high tides and watching the surroundings, it was an amazing experience. It was very plesant with temperatures around 10 deg, with good sunshine and the whole walking back and forth taking close to two hours it was not enjoyable but an incredible experience. One should not miss this, when you are around Sydney.

Breathtaking walk!. We took the amazing Bondi - Coogee walk on a warm Sunday morning and what an amazing walk it was! there are numerous beautiful beaches on the way - Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly and finally ending in Coogee.The walk is splendid and runs all along the coast overlooking the blue waters of the Pacific, interspersed with rocks of varied hues and the white sandy beaches. Add to that a serene cemetery and the diverse flora and fauna. It takes about 3 hours to complete the walk leisurely, but the way is well made throughout, not at all steep and with the option to stop at any of the major beaches to take a bus to the nearest station (rather than having to walk all the way to the end in case you are feeling tired). Add to that eateries and drinking water facilities at nearly all beaches and you have a wonderful walk for a weekend morning!

Fantastic coastal walk. This walk is a great, chilled-out walk to do of an afternoon. With great bus connections from the city to either Bondi or Maroubra you can start at either end of the trail. The full walk will take around 2.5 hours, and takes in many of the best beaches in Sydney. However, there are buses back to the city from Coogee and Bronte if you dont want to do the whole thing. There is also the slight chance of spotting some whales from June through to September.

I don't get the hype?. This was a nice walk, but not a highlight of our time in Sydney. Things we enjoyed more were the harbour itself, Manly Beach, and the Royal Botanic Garden. The 50 minute bus ride from Circular Quay was not nearly as enjoyable as the ferry rides we took to Manly and Watson's Bay. I'm glad we saw Bondi and did the walk, but I don't see how it's rated above so many other things. Tip - If you are going to see both Bondi and Manly, go to Bondi first. That way you won't be disappointed at all when you do the Bondi walk (because Manly is so much nicer).
Breathtaking!. A long walk but worth it. Amazing coastal path. Busy on weekends of course. Not easy with a pushchair as lots of steps. Take your camera and a bottle of water!
good running. ... but it is better for walking. The path is too chaotic for a good runs. Most people walk there. Noting to add to the view, which is just stunning.

fantastic. The walk and view along the coast is fantastic. Good exercise and good views. And, at either end there are lots of restaurants and cafes for coffee, dessert or lunch. It is worth it to take a bus or taxi over to Coogee or Bondi from downtown Sydney if you are visiting.
Great views, great people, all for free. This offers a classic Sydney experience: fantastic views and great people contact. And the fresh air and exercise are good for us! Did I mention it's free?

Great walk with excellent views. Decided to do this walk on New Years Day to get a bit of exercise after a heavy night. The walk was gorgeous. It's an easy walk, not really physically demanding at all, so is a great way to spend the morning relaxing and taking in the views. Well worth taking your time and having a sit down as you go round to take in the calm and beauty of the area. Don't forget your camera for some stunning shots.

A must. No need to book a tour unless you enjoy those. Just have some water, snack, good walking shoes and enjoy.I love the promenade, graffiti arts, the view of the ocean, the carved out creations of what was once part of the ocean walls.This is a must while in Sydney.

Beautiful walk.. We caught the train to Bondi Junction, then bus to Bondi. Did the walk. We took our time and enjoyed the beautiful scenaries. Finished at Coogee where we had our breakfast and caught the bus from Coogee to the city.

Stunning beach walk. This beachside walk is so picturesque- beside some of Australia's best beaches. The walk is very user friendly, a paved walkway with some steps which are easy to manage. My daughter and I live in a northern Sydney suburb but we choose to drive to Bondi, in east Sydney to do this walk as it is so inspiring. !! The cafes of Bondi are so easy to visit, at the start or at the end of this walk.
Beautiful!. Beautiful walk along the coast line. From beach to beach with stunning views. A nice 3 hr walk going up and down.
Lovely views!. Always a great walk along the coastline but just be wary of the continual stream of runners!! Lots of places to stop off for photographs or to just take in the views.

Beautiful views. Really Great walk along the coast with many cafes to choose from! I wish we had more time to go further along the walk! i would do it again.There is also parks/swings along the way where you can stop for little legs.Using a pram would be difficult as there are stairs but if you are able to carry the pram up and down the stairs this could work as a family day out!
amazing. Living in Southern California, and being South African born, thought, I had seen some of the most beautiful countries in the world. . . . wrong!!! This part of the world is truly beautiful!

Our Favourite Walk in Sydney. We have walked this track five times and each time we experience it in a different way. It has a wonderful mix of natural and man made highlights. The track is clearly marked and the coastal scenery an absolute delight. There are plenty of spots to stop for a break and some good coffee spots in places. The supply of drinking water at various intervals is appreciated. Highly recommended.

Put the camera down. I've done this walk twice now and there's one thing you need to know: your camera simply CANNOT capture the depths and the views you will see. So put it down, and soak it into your memory, where it will live forever. The walk itself is pleasant with some stairs and hills but nothing major. There are lots of stopping points so if you get winded for some reason you can stop and catch a ride at several places. Or you can do the whole walk and experience everything is has to offer!Sometimes there's a lot of foot traffic but that's to be expected on beautiful days. This is a must do!

Spectacular views and great exercise!. This walk was a great way to see the Sydney coast! We traveled via public bus from Circular Quay to Bondi where we began our walk. Each bend of the path offered beautiful views of the coast and nearby villages. We are "regular walkers" who found a few parts of the walk challenging (pitched paths or steep steps), and count on 2.5-3 hours for the entire path. We rewarded ourselves with delicious lunch at the end of the walk at Coogee. What a great time!

Beautiful coastal walk. Lovely scenery, a bit cold a the moment, head north in the morning and treat yourself to a coffee at Bondi at the end, or head south in the afternoon and a beer at Coogee at the end
Great Walk And Views. The walk is just simply stunning and is great on a sunny day, the views are amazing and is a pretty easy walk, the views are like something from a postcard

Not only bondi beach is really special . The walk is awesome you can easily go from the city by bus to bondi beach and walk from bondi to coogee where the bus goes back in the city. All in all will cost you between 7-9$. Drinking water is everywhere provided. Watch the surfers and with some luck dolphins and Wales.

Take a "Hike". Be sure to make time for this walk. It is a "hike" that is more of a walk with the most beautiful views. My pictures look like post cards! We met a man practicing the drums out in one parking lot (his wife does not know he owns drums) and many other locals along the way. We ended up on Bondi Beach where we got lunch and rented surfboard for a bit. I would consider this a "do not miss" activity!

lovely walk. beauitiful walk past lots of beaches and stopeped at a cafe along the way, this walk is longer than you think took almost two hours and when we reached the end there were no taxis back to bondi. so had to walk back the whole way. its pretty flat but does have steps and small inclines.

Amazing views and walk!. On a sunny day this is a must to do. The views are spectacular overlooking the Pacific Ocean. We walked from Clovelly to Bondi Beach and were lucky to have such a beautiful sunny day, although being the middle of winter. We stopped at a little café for coffee, and then on the way back we had lunch at Clovelly Beach. The hamburgers were amazing!! This took a few hours, but was a wonderful day out.

Paradise between Bondi & Coogee. Stunning views along this coastline.On a sunny day this is picturesque perfect.Lovely sandy beaches & rock pools to enjoy and cool off in.Great cafes at Bronte for coffee, snacks, luch or dinner.Kiosk at Bronte for snacks & ice cream.

Beautiful walk. Don't miss this walk. Took the 333 bus from circular quay to bondi beach, and walked to the right hand side of the beach( as you look at the sea) to start the walk. It is About 6km, then when you are a Coogee take the 380 back to circular quay. So the walk is interesting with ups and downs with steps, not really suitable for the elderly especially with walking sticks, and it you have a pushchair you will be lifting it up and down stairs a bit. But anyone else will be fine. Anyway to the walk. It covers about 6 bays and is stunning, sometimes along by rock pools and sometimes the path is up high, but at every corner there is another stunning view. there is the occasional cafe along the route and public toilets. The vegetation is lovely and there are seats along route to take in the vistas. Well worth the effort of getting there, really- don't miss this.

Lovely way to experience the coast. I walked this route from Coogee to Bondi on a cloudy, sometimes drizzly, sometimes sunny winter day. My favourite section was between Coogee and Bronte - much quieter than the section closer to Bondi. The views are spectacular. Reading the headstones as you wander past the cemetary gives insight into how tough life was in the past.Look out to sea for evidence of whales between May and November (you may not see the whale but it's spume looks like a puff of smoke above the water).There are stairs, but in the first half of the walk from Coogee they are very well maintained with sturdy handrails for those less steady on their feet.

One of the best coastal walks there is. Be sure to take your visiting friends on this walk. It is relaxing, an easy walk, picturesque, and has many places to stop for coffee, ice creams or more. Fun to see the variety of people doing the walk in addition to the most gorgeous coastal views of Sydney. Walk all the way from Bondi to Coogee. You can bus or taxi back if you are too tired to do the return.

Great walk all year round. This is without a doubt the best free attraction in Sydney. Logistically it's best to catch a bus to Coogee, walk to Bondi & get the bus home from there. Alternatively, you can do what we do and walk back to Coogee! This makes it a decent outing as one-way is only a few KM's/Best early morning in summer but really this can be a stunner all year round.

One of our best travel experiences. I challenge anyone to find a more enjoyable coastal walk. This is full of hidden gems, tiny little local beaches and parks that are great for families. This walk is a must for any local visitor - I so desperately wish we could do it more frequently!! Highlights are the Coogee Pavilion for food, coffee or just letting the kids (and big kids!) run wild in the games area, Gordon Bay for secluded paddling and the great family park at Bronte.Got to say, my least favourite part was Bondi - there are so many more beautiful areas to see here!

Great Back Yard. Any day or time of the year is great for a refreshing coastal walk. Whale watching if you're lucky. Check if the wind is coming from the south, if it is, then you are in for a few cold blasts. In Winter, scarf & gloves will keep the chill away. In Summer - blockout is a must, a hat if its not too windy. Explore St Marks park, between Bondi & Tamarama, seating facing north & south are there. Good for a quiet meditate. There are also toilets and fresh drinking water available. For those looking for a good set of stairs to test yourself on, find your way to the back of Tamarama Gully, a beautiful hidden valley, there is a challenging set of steep stairs that lead up to Birrell St.

Best free experience in Sydney!. When my husband's family came out from the UK the first thing we did was take them on this walk. It is the best way to see Sydney's beaches. We've done this a few times, and the following is the best way to spend the day!We started at Barzura- a great café on the beachfront in Coogee- where we had breakfast, then walked from there around the clifftop to Gordon's Bay, a gorgeous hidden cove great for snorkeling, before following the path around to Clovelly where we stopped and played Frisbee on the beach for a while before having a swim to see if we could attract the resident Groper fish (over a metre long and attracted to the sound of tapping 2 rocks together). We then continued the walk around past the Waverley cemetery- a great spot to take in the views out to sea- and then on to Bronte beach where there are a number of gorgeous little cafes where we stopped for lunch. From there we continued to Tamarama beach and on to Bondi. Walking around past Mark's Park is a great first view of Bondi for those who haven't seen it before. At Bondi we hired surfboards and introduced the in-laws to surfing. After this we headed up to the Bucket List for drinks right on the beach front. The Brits all said this was their best day in Sydney- I can't recommend it enough!

One of the Best Parts of our Trip. We took the train and the bus out to Bondi. It was pretty easy to do and the walk was beautiful. You will walk past several beach fronts and beautiful cliffs and scenery out over the ocean. There is an old cemetery right on the ocean. There are a lot of stairs over the entire walk. I think this is a must thing to do if you are in Sydney.

One of the greatest coastal walks in Sydney. Sydney has plenty of coastal walks that you must do and Bondi-Coogee is certainly in the top of the list. I recommend to go on a sunny /warm day and be prepared to climb up/down a lot of steps. But don't worry, if you get tired, just relax for a minute and check the amazing view.

Beautiful walk. This walk has many good view points, however it can get quite crowded on the weekend so I'd recommend going during the week, if you can. All in all, it's still a great walk worth doing

Take a long walk along the coast on the South side.. I admit I did not get to the end of this walk, but the scenery is so good. We went with friends from Canada who had done it the last time they were in Sydney, and it was a great discovery.

Awesome. Even in winter when I figured not much would be happening, this was an awesome experience. We actually parked at the Waverly Cemetery, who knew resting in peace could be such a room with. A view?? Beautiful tombstones, and relics from the past( sorry for the bad pun)The walk itself was take your breathe away gorgeous!! I should have videoed the whole walk so when I am back in dreary NYC this winter I could put it on an endless loop in my head! Sheer cliffs, surfers, turquoise blue water, the stuff calendar pics are made of!! Definitely don't miss this! Also a 5 star reccomendation for lunch is Macelleria for made to order burgers and steaks!! Unbelievably good! We have a picky vegetarian too in our group and even his veggie burger was fab! So don't wait, just head on over there! Enjoy!!

Lovely Walk. Started off with a breakfast in Bondi before walking down the coast to Coogee. We had great weather and the scenery was fantastic, tried some bowls along the way and was rewarded with a beer at the end. :)
Great coastal walk and lovely view. A must do at Bondi Beach. Great coastal walk and lovely view here. Very beautiful sunset view. You can catch a bus back to the Bondi station from Coogee beach.

Walk Along the Coast - Great Photo Opportunity. This walk is whatever you want it to be. You can run or walk. You can do the whole thing or just a portion of it. This is a great thing to do on your first day in the country. It will stretch your legs Andes a good way to walk off the weariness. I started at Coogee and ended at Bondi Beach at Bondi Icebergs Club with a nice Australian draft beer and you can sit outside and look at the crystal blue ocean and watch the surfers!

Don't miss this!. Even on a winter afternoon in June, this is an enjoyable opportunity to view the ocean and the beaches from the cliffs. Be sure to allow time for photography. Our group walked from Bondi to Bronte based upon the advice we received that this portion of the walk was the most scenic and involved the least amount of climbing stairs.From Bronte, the 378 bus departs every 10 minutes on a weekday afternoon, taking you through Paddington and Darlinghurst on the way back to Central Station.

Great Coastal Walk. This walk is a must for people visiting Sydney if you are up to it. The entire walk is quite long (about 6km) and depending on fitness levels can take anywhere from 1hr to maybe 3hrs. There are also steps involved.Best time of the year to go is in Spring when there is the annual Sculptures By The Sea

A great way to start the morning. A taxi to Coogee and the coastal walk back to Bondi is such a great way to see and appreciate the beautiful coast and bays. The walk is around 6-7K's and undulates but is easily done in a couple of hours, including numerous stops for another fantastic photo!!!I would strongly and wholeheartedly recommend that any visit to Sydney is enhanced by doing this walk.

Awesome walk. You can't be in Sydney and not do this walk which is awesome. The beautiful east coast of Australia is on show here. Make sure you stop at bronte for a bite to eat and coffee or juice. Then continue up the way to coogee through the historical cemetery and have your history hat on as Henry Lawson among others is buried here. Great Australians.

Congee to Bondi. We walked from Coogee to Bondi and was well worth it, some of the best views I've seen. Plenty of spots to stop off and gave a breather and a dip. We then caught a bus back. Couldn't recommend it enough.

Spectacular Oceanside walk. We went on this walk the day after a tremendous damaging storm and the city was busy cleaning Bondi Beach. Impressive response renewing the beauty of the beach so close to Sydney. The walk snakes along the water with some steep stair climbs but manageable for most able bodied people. The scenery is spectacular as the waves crash on the cliffs just below you. Very safe walking path with rails when the cliff paths narrows. The rock/cliff formations are unique and colourful. The path was wide enough for several people to pass safely. Highly recommended.
Awesome!. One of the best pathways I had never walked. Beautiful views and the best way for walking from Bondi to Coogee.I did this way almost every day for one year without getting enough

Beautiful walk along the coast. We took the train from downtown and changed to bus at Bondi Junction. We walked along the coast to Bronte Beach, and got a bus back to Bondi Junction. The trip is lovely, and even though we have health problems and are not very good walkers, it was not to hard. There are places to stop and enjoy the view. The samdstone cliffs are amazing, and there are also signs telling about aborigine culture and the nature. We spendt a couple of hours, but you could easily spend the day.
exhilarating. Lovely place to walk and take in some of the best views of Sydney.Not hard to walk for most people and plenty of places to stop for a meal or snack when you get back to Bondi
Bondi beach. It was great to see the surfers and saw the pool next to the ocean. Relaxing and easy walk, with great views. We walked around the rugged coastline which was beautiful.

A must must walk. When we reached Bondi beach, we were not sure of taking the walk, but when we started (finally) we couldn't stop.The views were awesome. The stretch of water which lies in front of you makes you feel to sit and relax and let everyone else pass by.Initially when you will start the walk from Bondi, there will be more steps but afterwards it is mixed.I will highly recommend this walk if your health allows.If I ever go to Sydney again, I will sure repeat this walk.

Sydney bucket list. Born and bred in Sydney, I moved to QLD 5 years ago and now come back for family events.... I had a free few days so I ventured to bondi for breekie and on a whim I did the the bondi to coogee walk.... Our country is breathtaking and this walk showcases the best of sydney... Every one should do this walk, simply amazing...

Views to blow your mind. This walk is one of the great coastal walks of Sydney and in summertime you can stop at any of the beaches along the way and refresh yourself with a dip in the ocean. Simply catch the bus from the city to Bondi Beach and catch the bus home again from Coogee. All beaches have changing facilities. Both Bronte and Clovelly have cafes where you can sit and eat close to the water and watch it sparkle.

Great weekend activity!. What a beautiful walk! Great if you are new to the area and are looking to get a feel for the different beaches. I always grab an ice cream cone at the Ben and Jerrys shop at Bondi when I get started. YUM! I highly suggest doing this walk during sculptures by the sea. Great for all ages and personalities. Breathtaking!

Beautiful Walk. This is one of the best walks in the world along the path between Bondi and Coogee. This is a busy path in Summer or Winter. Stop along the walk maybe for a swim or a coffee at the many cafes you will pass along the way.
Walk not hike with views. This is a very pleasant coastal stroll it takes 45 minutes and is very safe .The uninterrupted views are stunning with wedding cake island being a highlight
So pretty!. Excellent views, not too strenuous at all, just bring water and sunscreen (and a hat!). I would give this all day if you have the time; otherwise you can do shorter walks and backtrack.
Lovely walk!. Can get rather windy, so make sure you have a good windproof jacket during the cooler months.Gorgeous views!!

Peaceful. A very peaceful walk, and a must-do when you are in Sydney (even in Winter). You can get here easily by public transportation. The walk is well marked and has a lot of nice spots for picture-taking. It is perfect to relax, let your mind go and refresh your soul!

Magical walk in the winter sun. We walked this from Coogee to Bondi on a cool July afternoon with whales and surfers for company. The views are spectacular. We stopped for a cool ale at the clovelly bowls club and the coopers pale ale on tap was one of the best I've had. Not a hard walk for anyone who walks a bit and well worth while. Easy access by bus to and from the city.

One of the world's best coastal walks. Wow. If you like coastal scenes, you will have to look hard to find a better one.It is worth getting there early to avoid the crowds, before wandering along the well-marked path to enjoy the beautiful scenery which will have you stopping to take pictures every five minutes.
Unbelievable and breathtaking. Did this on a perfect sunny day in Sydney and it was stunning. A beautiful part of the Australian coast and a absolute must-do if you're in Sydney

Staggeringly rewarding. My advice would be, take your time. The vistas are constantly changing. You can always break the walk, as we did, with tea/coffee and cake along the way. Lots of ups and downs but one of Sydney's "must dos".
Coogee to Bondi Walk. Lovely walk. Very crowded but beautiful and well worth the walk. Best to avoid it on the weekend as too busy.

Beautiful Sandstone cliffs and wonderful Sydney beach views. Wonderful way to pass a few hours, I'm sure it must be on the top 10 things to do in Sydney! Walking along the sandstone clifftops and meandering through the bays is just wonderful for the soul, come rain or shine! However, do be careful even if it is not sunny, you can get very sunburnt/win-burnt!Some people can rush through and do in it less than 2 hours, however, camera/iPhone in hand and wonderful views always ensure I take more than 3 hours to do this walk!There are a number of steep slopes and steps which make it difficult for some people.

A must do, even if you cover just a portion of the walk. Were blessed with good weather and even though it was a Saturday, it wasn't very crowded. Very easy to reach from Sydney central. We did only a small portion of the walk but the views was beautiful. Pack in some shopping in the shops, a coffee or hot chocolate in one of the cafes and yes, a nice fish and chips lunch, and it will be an enjoyable day out.

Great walk - avoid it during the Sculpture by the Sea. This walk is stunning. You can find quiet spots to look out to sea. Check out wild life, aboriginal rock carvings, amazing real estate, take quick swims along the way. There are spots to stop for coffee, snacks or brunch. You can make it day trip or do it as a run. In May - July and October / November you can see whales on their migration. There are almost always dolphins if you look carefully from the sandstone cliffs.Gets way too crowded during the annual Sculpture by the Sea event - but if that is what you want to see there is no more spectacular setting for viewing artworks which often incorporate the environment.

Coastal walk. My absolute favourite walks in Sydney! The only downside is if you try to do it during the "Sculptures by the sea" exhibition; it can get too packed, but that's only 2 weeks a year.Great exercise with breathtaking views!

Glorious coastline. Stunning. Fresh air, sea salt spray, clean water and beautiful rock formations.Best Mon through Fri, unless you want to perve on all the beautiful people running over the top of you. Great dogs. Very crowded on weekends. If you are strolling, go later inthe day. Take your camera/iphone for fantastic photos. Don't forget your hat and lockout. Water available on the walk.Amazing when the surf is huge. Do this walk as often as you can...good for the soul.

Whats not to like?!. Rain or shine, this coastal walk is amazing. It can get busy on the weekends - but thats because it is such a fantastic experience. You may be lucky and see some migrating whales!, but even without that, theres the amazing views - a visual delight, the cliffs are stunning and the smell of the ocean will make your heart smile. Take some water - though there are some water stops along the way!
Wonderful views. Took Bus 333 from Sydney to Bondi beach. I couldn't finish the walk as my legs began to hurt when I made it to Bronte. The photos I took did not do it justice.

If you want a different view of the ocean, take a few hours for this. This is a seriously beautiful walk. It's not as popular as it should be. I know people who've lived in Sydney for years and never done it. It's a sweet 5km walk along the coastline with the most amazing views. It was cloudy but hot the day I walked it so I needed lots of water. They do have water fountains along the way so be sure to bring a water bottle that you can fill up. If you're doing it in sunshine, keep applying sun cream unless you like the lobster look. Bring a camera and enjoy the beautiful ocean in front of you. You stop at different beaches so there's the choice to go for a quick dip along the way.
Great day out. Great walk and great scenery Make sure you pick a nice day. Take your camera for some great photos. Very relaxed atmosphere

Awesome. I loved the walk. Didn't spend as much time at Bondi Beach as I should've. Lots of running and walking traffic in the forest. My travel party ended prior till the ends round Cloverly. Give your self time and wear comfortable shoes and workout clothes. Bring your camera.

Perfect power walk / jog / run circuit . Dependent on your tempo and pace, the faster you are, the earlier in the day you need to visit. As a local whom power walks this trail 2-3 times per week, by late morning it's so crowded with tourists and families who don't keep left that your exercise activity can be met with much frustration. Stunning views of the coast, and of homes and people, any visit to Sydney is not complete without walking parts of this track. Lots of water bubblers along the path, as well as steps and sign posts.

Absolutely stunning walk!. Not to be missed; the views throughout are superb. There is more up-and-down than you might expect, but the effort is worthwhile. The bus service back from Coogee is not easy to understand (but then, none of Sydney's bus services are easy to understand!)

A highlight of Sydney. I always enjoy this walk when I am in Sydney. The views are magnificent. I have run it a few times and it is a fairly easy jog. You can turn around at various points if the whole walk is too far.

bondi to coogee coastal walk. walk from my hotel in surry hills to bondi beach 5km then the walk from bondi to coogee along the costal walk is about the same but its a must wonderful views and was told coogee means smelly place (ask why they will tell you) but its not and some say that coogee beach is better than bondi beach let you make your own mind up on that one
great weather and workout. The path was more hilly than initially anticipated.. make time to turn this into a stroll vs. a workout hike so you can enjoy the scenery and take alot of selfies

Beautiful Costal Walk. Easy walk along the coast with fantastic view of the ocean and a series of beautiful white sand beaches. Quite often, you can spot whales migrating through - bring your binoculars and spot the water spout from the whales. Sculpture by the sea is usually held last 2 weeks of October and 1st week of November. It is a magnificent event with many innovative and artistic sculptures dotted along the 1st part of the path between Bondi and Turramarra. However, because of its popularity, the walk can be quite congested during the exhibition period. One does not have to finish the walk and can stop at any of the beaches along the way. Bondi is easy to get to by public transport. Buses are available at Coogee Beach and Bronte Beach if you do not want to walk back to Bondi. Highly recommended.

One of the best urban walks in Sydney. Beaches, cliff tops, a cemetery, houses of every size and type can all be seen on this walk beside the sea. I prefer to start at Coogee and end at Bondi Beach and resuscitate myself with a coffee and a meal at one of the many great cafes.

Don't miss it!!!!. This is the best way to see what Sydney is famous for, the beaches, the ocean front,. I could go on and on but some things speak for themselves. The views, the beach suburban setting, the people, Everyone will get something different out of this, but whatever it is for you, it will be something you remember forever.If you visit Sydney you can't miss this walk, that's all.
Beautiful view of the ocean. Easy walk with great ocean views. Go mid week if you can otherwise it's really busy. We Went for a swim at both beaches and had a great day out with friends.
Top Coastal Walk. A stunning coastal walk, easy pathways and stairs cut through the cliffs. Plenty of benches to have a rest and soak up the views. Bring your camera for some great photo moments.

Sydney beach stunning stroll. A great way to see how the local Sydney-siders live. Feel like a local as you walk along the stunning coastline of Sydney's eastern suburbs beaches. Cafes along the route and a great place to cool off at one of the beaches or enjoy the ocean side parks

Well worth the effort.. Coogee to Bondi or Bronte to Bondi for the less energetic, both are magnificent. Park the car and walk to Bondi to see the iconic beach and have lunch at the Icebergs Club. You will have magnificent views all the way and pass several lovely beaches. Just do it.

Great Walk to take Visitors from Overseas. I always take friends and family on this walk. I used to do it once a month with my dog when we lived in sydney. but now only when we have friends or family coming over. They always enjoy the walk and we stop for coffee or a swim lovely views. a Nice day out.

Best Coastal walk in Sydney. Ive lived in Sydney all my life but this is still my go to coastal walk. Amazing views from Bondi to Coogee. You can stop and swim along the way. Make sure you take your camera and watch out for all the runners.. Great for People watching :)

Bondi to Bronte cliff walk. Fabulous view, great sculpture in the windswept cliffs and ricks, great coffee at either end. In November, the sculpture walk is a bonus. You can get a bus from Oxfird Street to and from both Bronte (378) abd Bondi (333 or 380). Not good for strollers and those on crutches and there can be a lot of runners.Recommended.

Stunning scenery and good exercise. Loved the views and that the walkway was well marked with distances, names, fun facts. Scenery just like you would see in the Mediterranean. Very easy to take public transportation to either starting point.

good walk good views. A very nice walk with good views on the way and variety of scenery.It was very windy on the day I walked making it a bit miserable but that's the weather not the walk! I would advise to walk under less windy circumstances!!

Great walk. It's a really good walk esp in the slightly colder months as in summer its very crowded....and you feel like your melting in the sun. I've done it a few times and I like to dawdle. Walk a bit, have a swim, explore, walk a bit more, have lunch etc. Totally recommend it.

beach trip. Had a great time on the beach. My daughter enjoyed playing in the sand. I could not believe how clean the beach was. I don't remember seeing any trash anywhere in the beach or the boardwalk area.

Fantastic coastal walk. As a jogger and a walker this Bondi to Coogee coastal walk is one of the finest Ive ever done. Magnificent ocean views, beautiful beaches, fresh ocean air to enjoy as one walks on a well maintained path .... it breath taking .... I never get tired of fantastic coastal walk !!!!

Sun, sand and sea.. If you are looking for a scenic walk where you can capture some picturesque memories that will make your friends jealous then this is it. I personally love to stop in Bronte at the Three Blue Ducks and have a bite to eat and a juice or if I can hold off ill go to Cali Press back in Bondi, but the ducks is a must do as well as the walk. Enjoy!

Great walk. This is a fantastic walk for locals & tourists. It offers stunning coastal views & scenery. This is not too difficult a walk & can be completed in stages & as fast or slow as you wish. However, there are steps & reasonable slopes as part of the walk, so the entire walk would be difficult for some people. There are plenty of places along the walk to stop & contemplate life & the view as well as many cafes & restaurants as you pass through the several beaches on this walk.The best time to do this walk is on a week day if you can as weekends, you will find the walk very crowded & full of runners (some of whom get annoyed with the slower walkers!!)

Stretch your legs after that flight.. A beautiful afternoon walk. Collect your guests from the airport and take them on an adventure. Park the car, don't forget where, and catch a taxi back to collect it.

No matter the weather conditions its always a great view.. Firstly I would like to suggest if you can do the walk not on a weekend just as there are so many people that if you have another person with you, you end up walking behind each other and are unable to really talk. The walk has great places to stop and enjoy the view in between but just remember if you plan to walk all the way and then back it is a around 7km.

A Wonderful Walk. Best when Sculptures by the Sea exhibition is showing but a wonderful walk in any event. Easy, popular, public transport reliable and wonderful eateries at both ends. A great Sunday Stroll!

A great scenic walk if the coast. First time in Sydney you must walk between these two iconic beaches. On the way walk through Waverley Cemetery to get an idea of the many immigrants that have travelled to Australia to call it home,

Very crowded on weekends...go mid-week if you can.. This is a spectacular walk along the cliffs and around the beaches of Sydney's Eastern Suburbs. You can do all, or part of the walk...there are a lot of stairs if you go the whole way from Bondi to Coogee, especially between Clovelly and Coogee.We saw a whale from the Clovelly Bowls Club where we had paused to wath the barefoot bowlers. Lots of places to stop for a coffee or cool drink, or, in Summer, to swim...Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly (snorkelling heaven) and Coogee. You can also snorkel at little Gordon's Bay which is tucked away between Clovelly and Coogee and has an underwater trail youcan follow. Public transport services all the beaches along the way...easiest being Bondi, Bronte and Coogee.
Regular run. Great location for a run, try to avoid the weekend if you are running as people walking the path are usually 4 abreast and do not move for anyone else to share the path. Beautiful views
Best walk in Sydney. A must do even on a crisp winter day. No better views and you might even spot a whale as they migrate.
Great walk!. This is a lovely walk with great views and plenty of rest spots along the way! Be sure to take sun screen during hot summer days as it isn't sheltered!

an amazing cliff side walk. Visited the walk twice during thenSculptures of the Sea exhibition. The only downside was the huge crowd. One day was in bright sunshine and the other day was cloudy but on both occasions I loved the sea view and the rock formations as well as the sculptures. Recommend it for anyone who is able to walk but there are steps to climb so itmis no good for wheelchairs.

The most scenic coastal walk. If you don't have time to enjoy coastal walks in Sydney, you have to do this Bondi to Coogee walk.The scenery is awesome, you will pass beaches and there is filtered water stop along the way.Start from Bondi Beach walk towards the iconic Bondi iceberg, and follow the trail to bronte beach via tamarama beach, and continue to coogee beach via Clovelly beach.Highly recommended.

Beautiful walk if a little crowded. We did this walk in the pouring rain and it was still crowded - we enjoyed the walk and the easy stops for coffee and cake. The path is well maintained and the views are lovely. There is public transport at beaches if the distance is too far or the rain is too heavy!!

East coast walk with sculpture. Come early, miss the crowds. Sculpture By the Sea is too popular for its own good, sadly, but with an early start, it can be a good walk and see most of the art in 2.5 hours.
nice views. Easy walk with nice views and lots of activities to do within: beach, surf, swimmingpools, terraces, cafes

Great Views But Often Crowded. this is a great walk in any direction. Start early to avoid the crush as locals use this walk extensively as well as tourists. Walking or jogging early in the morning allows you time to stop and take in the great views without being crowded out.

Unbeatable scenery.. This is absolutely one of the best things to do in Sydney. Spectacular views with excellent cafes and beaches along the way. Remember to pack a hat and sunglasses as even on an overcast day the glint off the water can be extreme.

Must do, especially if Sculptures are on. This is a great walk and way to see the coast, surfers, cliffs and people watch. If Sculptures event is on its pretty packed, but a great opportunity to double the benefits. Recommended.
Breathtaking!!!. A beautiful walking trail not too hard with some amazing photo spots. A fantastic view over the entire Bondi Beach area.

Picturesque, serene walk with 'ken' dolls.. It's a great walk that shows you the wonderful eastern beaches of Sydney, starting at Bondi, to Tamarama, to Bronte, and then Coogee.Unfortunately the usual East Coast superficial runner finds it necessary to run through the already over crowded infrastructure, elbowing the slow moving, picture snapping tourist crowd. I guess they aren't serious enough to run in the morning, or they just want to photo bomb the tourists with oiled up abs.Go when the weather is nice, go early before the crowds, then have breakfast in Bronte.

Beautiful views. My partner at the time decided we would do the Bondi to Coogee walk one Sunday in November - the place was crazy busy but the views and the sea breeze make it all worth while. My partner also made it all the more special by proposing along the walk... perfect backdrop for such a special occasion.

stunning breath taking views and so close to Sydney CBD. The coastal walk is especially special during the end of October beginning November period when the annual exhibition Sculpture by the Sea is on. In 2014 over 500 artists entered this amazing competition offering over hundred sculptures to admire between Bondi and Tamarama foreshore. Parking spots can be difficult to find during the day so commence this terrific journey early; you could park your car in Bondi and pick up a bus back (361, 362, 378) when you are so exhausted that you thrive for a legendary brunch on Bondi Beach

Easy Walk Stunning Views. Walked this walk on a beautifully warm 19C Saturday. Very popular. Lots of joggers huffing and puffing and sweating - as per usual they make it look hard work!! We walked it and took in the wonderful views. Beautiful home, superb seas views all the way. People fishing, canoeing, diving and swimming. Stopped at one stage not far from Bondi (we started at Coogee - getting off the bus from Sydney a 25 minute trip) and watched the whales. very special. Had lunch at one of the numerous eateries in Bondi and caught bus back to Sydney. Do it. Saturday and Sunday obviously really busy but that wasn't a problem.
A great activity for the weekend. A great way to spend your weekend. Breathtaking views and an easy leisurely walk. I usually walk to Bondi stop for breakfast or lunch and then walk back.
Brilliant views. If you really want a chance to wind down or do some exercise this is the place. A pleasure just to be there.
A must do for visitors and locals. This is a beautiful way of capturing a small part of Sydney; it does get very crowded at times though

Gorgeous coastal walk. We started in Coogee and made our way to Bondi. What a beautiful walk! The views are lovely the whole time and there are so many nice beaches and areas along the way. Definitely a must do when visiting Sydney. Gorgeous scenery.

Quintessential Sydney. It's one of the most scenic walks you can do around Sydney. If you like impressive coastline and want to see what Sydney lifestyle is all about, this walk is a must. You'll pass several beaches and bays and walk my favourite walkway (renovated just recently) which hugs the cliffs just near Coogee beach.
Loved it. Great walk and a "must see". Enjoy being at THE beaches in Sydney, you like to get in touch with the Australian way of life - enjoy Bondi and Coogee!
A nice morning stroll. This is fun free walk that a lot of places offer its a good way to see some interesting things that you would normaly miss out on

Lovely walk with plenty of beaches to enjoy . Sandy bays everywhere. Gorgeous views. Some interesting floral and birds on this mainly paved walk. Its a good stroll and you can grab refreshments from a number of restaurants along the way. What dies let this coastal walk down -as u have noticed throughout my travels here. Is the complete lack if signs and ver few description panels.
Really nice view. Really relaxing, one of the best walk of Sydney.We went for the sunset and the light was perfect.Take the time to watch some surfers !

stunning views. This walk id fabulous and free. If you like coastal walks then this is one of the best, easy to navigate , not too long but not too short and scenic. If you do it in summer you can have a swim along the way

Sydney stunning in winter. My husband and I decided to see what all the fuss was about. Last Saturday we put on our walking shoes and started of from Cogee Beach at about two in the afternoon, it was a perfect day.. The sun twinkling across the aqua blue crystal clear water.. Many people were out with their dogs & sunnies. Each bend we went around revealed gorgeous bays, sparkling water miles into the sea. You can even stop for a quick coffee and contemplation on the rocks near Waverly, it is a must do in Sydney. It was such an uplifting experience that reminded me why I live in Sydney.

Great way to see an amazing stretch of seashore. This walk is among my best memories from my visit to Sydney and environs. The walk is well-maintained, easy to follow, and provides views of the ocean and cliffed shoreline that are incomparable. Bondi is, of course, one of the most famous beaches in the world, and the restaurants around it are affordable and wide-ranging, making an excellent reward for this trek.

This view and exercise is worth the trip not to mention the locals you will see. I like the fact that you see a lot of locals who use this path all the time as I am a local I too enjoy this breathtaking walk no matter how many times i go there.
Stunning and invigorating walk. This is one of my most memorable walking trails, reminding me in many ways to the coast of California.
Great walk. Lovely walk which visits some hideaway coves and beaches. With stunning views it is an awesome way to spend a day

Owe-inspiring walk. I did this walk at the beginning of February 2015. It was pretty hot at that period of the year, but windy enough to cool the air down. You do have to do it before leaving Sydney, the landscape is really outstanding, especially at Gordons Bay and Closely Beach. You'll cross most of the mythic beaches of Sydney.

Just Beautiful. An amazing and beautiful walk. Stark coastland, picturesque beaches. Bit windy in winter. have done the walk a number of times, if really lucky, can see dolphins. Great in both directions, and can have lunch or coffee in either Coogee or Bondo - spoilt for places, before heading back
Must do. To have the delight walking along our coast is the best. Recommended for both locals and visitors....a must do!

World class walk. This is an amazingly beautiful walk, made even better by the wonderful sunny winter weather we enjoyed. Lots of people out and about on this Sunday. Shame we didn't see any whales in the distance, but that would be a huge bonus to what is already a great experience.
My favourite walk in Sydney. The view was absolutely beautiful while walking along the coastline. I went there several times and always feel it's worth to spend whole afternoon walking there.
Must do in Sydney.. Must do in city. Amazing view throughout the whole walk. So many places to stop to take in the amazing vibes . If you are lucky you can spot whales & dolphins.

One of the best and beautiful walks in Sydney. This is a stunning walk, and probably one of the best in Sydney. I've strolled this walk and also jogged (there and back). Its wonderful as both a picturesque walk with family or full on sweat session (there's a few stairs). It's nice to stop in either Coogee or Bondi (which ever way you're travelling) for a coffee before heading back again.I wish I lived in the area to walk this more often.

Fantastic Views - Well Worth It - Rug Up In Winter. We went from Coogee to Bondi.We caught the bus to Coogee from the CBD and had breakfast at the Cafe Congo in Coogee.The views on the walk were spectacular. It is quite hilly so it is best to take your time. I suggest you pause at the really pretty bays to soak in the views.We went in July and it was quite cold. The sun was out and shining but the wind was cutting so you needed to rug up a bit.We took about 90 minutes at a fairly gentle pace.We then stopped for drinks at the lovely Bucket List before catching the bus back.

Great walk - can get busy.. This is the most popular part of the Sydney harbour walks. I love to walk in Sydney and I do this walk on rainy days. Too busy for my liking on pleasant weekends. Plenty of signage, plenty of shops. I usually cab, but seems like there are buses everywhere along the walk.

A dawn start avoids the crowds. This is a regular haunt for me - You would have found me along this track at least once per month since the year 2001… I start from and return to Clovelly, where it's usually easy to find free parking, even if you are not there as early as me. This is my regular exercise venue - I run to Bondi, touch a foot in the sand and then return. If I'm really energetic or training for the City to Surf, I might tag on the length of Bond Beach as well. In summer, if you don't start early, there are too many people for running safely (so I start around 730am). It's OK for walking though. It's different every time with dramatic clouds, watching the surfers out on an exhilarating break, whales and dolphins, white foam smashing against the rocks. Usually I don't even notice the exercise, including stairs and slopes en route. There are plenty of bubblers and toilets along the track as well. My only warning is to be careful on the boardwalk around the cemetery at Clovelly. It looks harmless enough but a jogging friend took a tumble on it and it tore his hands to shreds - long deep gashes, down to the tendons and muscles, requiring a visit to the hospital emergency department and loads of stitches.

Great way to experience Sydney like a local. I live in greater Sydney and I really enjoy doing this walk. Can be done at any time of the year in most weather conditions. I found it less enjoyable during Sculpture by the Sea as there was just too many people. It is a very popular walk particularly on a sunny day.

Stroll from Bondi to Coogee. Began with breakfast at Bill''s at Bondi. Then enjoyed watching surfers while sunning on the beach before our stroll to Coogee. The trek from Bondi to Coogee is a beautiful walk with beaches and pools to cool off. Snack shacks are located on beaches for a snack or drink too. There are stairs and up and downhill areas, but rails are provided in many areas. It is a little more than 4.5 miles, but I recommend taking your time and enjoying the experience. Best coastal walk I've ever seen!

Beaches and beaches . This walk is 6km long so do get yourself a pair of sports shoes coz you'll be spending more time for the walk than expected. Get your camera with you to capture the beauty of the Pacific. Start the walk after lunch with sea breeze that fresh you up. You may consider walking only part of it if you're running out of time.

A very hot walk. We took the bus from circular quay to Bondi and on a blistering hot and sunny day walked to Coogee and then took the bus back from Coogee. We loved the views and enjoyed a cafe stop just over half way. Very impressed by those jogging or running the walk but we felt more comfortable with a sedate pace! Sunscreen and water essential.
Relaxing walk. Scenic walk from Bondi beach. We did it on an overcast day with 2 young kids and they had fun and enjoyed seeing the waves crash into the rocks below the sea wall.

Beautoful. This walk is 100% worth it. However, I would definitely try to do this on a cooler day. I have completed this walk numerous times and the first time I attempted it, it was the middle of summer so I walked as far as Tamarama (the first beach after Bondi) and laid down for the rest of the day because it was simply too hot. I've seen a lot of pushchairs/prams on this walk but there are quite a few steps at some points. It's really a beautiful walk though and every time a friend visits Australia I make them take the walk!
Great walk. It can be easy or hard depending on the pace you want to go at. There's amazing picture spots and lots of cafes to stop at along the way

Perfect come rain or shine . I've done this walk twice, once in the sunshine on a weekend - it was busy but so lovely.I went again on a windy and slightly rainy day and it was even more beautiful! We even spotted humpback whales by chance! I couldn't recommend this walk enough, you can't get bored of such lovely views and the beaches you visit on the way are great stopping points. Don't bother with a tour, just do this walk yourself, it's signposted and easy to follow!

Scenic View. The view was breathtaking - beach, rock formations, surfers. The walk was great because there were rest area where you can sit and relax for a little bit. It might be a little tiring since some paths were uphill but all-in-all a great walking experience. It's a good way to exercise while on vacation, too.

Magnificent Coastlime. You just have to take this walk and experience Sydney's magnificent coastline. Just don't do it when Sculptures By the Sea is on in summer, unless you want to blend with the throngs of people. Walk and enjoy and stop for a coffee by the sea. So very special.
Breath-taking walk! Unforgetable. One of the most beautiful walks ever! Don't miss it! But please be aware that it is not a short walk and there are ups and downs.

AWESOME!!!!!. i enjoyed every bit of the walk. despite being on the heavier side, I did managed to walk all the way till the end, it was exhausting but the view was worth every sweat. You do need a good pair of walking shoes if not you'd not like it.

Amazing views of the coastline. Great for a sunday stroll with anyone, easy track with plenty of amenities on the way, toilets, drinkimg fountains, breakfast or lunch spots. Absolutely breathtaking scenery all the way through this beautiful walk, some of the best auatralian coast line.Walk as far or as short as you like
Breathtaking View!. Beautiful view and certainly a breath of fresh air. Pictures just don't quite justify the astonishing views, I suggest seeing for yourself.Also, very clean!
Bondi - Coogee coastal walk.. Easy stroll with a fantastic view. A great way to walk off the calories that we partook of in the surrounding cafes, restaurants.

My regular walk. what is not to love? Beautiful scenery, surfers, dolphins, whale watching, cafes along the way and fresh sea air. If you're a tourist walk one way and have lunch in either Coogee or Bondi.

A good day out. Watches three pods of whales swim by while walking. Stopped for a coffee along the way. Not crowded during the week. But not sure how I would enjoy this walk on a weekend. The Coogee Pavilion is amazing. A brilliant children's area, dog parking available, views of the ocean and the food was also great. Will definiantly go back.

Peaceful Place. AUS has lots of amazing views and the walking among Bondi and Coogee is definitely one of them.You'll be able to see beautiful beaches, a cemetery and live a little bit of Australian lifestyle.
stunning in the morning. Do this walk before breakfast. The ocean is calm and the dolphins are about. In winter you may catch sight of passing whales.

Bondi...great experience. This is my number one thing to do anytime of the year,it is a relaxing walk along the cliff tops,coastal scenary is beautiful ,Bondi with all its hotels,food and entertainment,pubs is the best beach....do not miss this walk!!

Great scenery and Art interest. This is a very pleasant walk and easily taken from Bondi during the 'Sculptures By The Sea' each year. The sculptures are on the coastline between Bondi and Tamarama from 22nd October to 8th November 2015 and around this time each year. You can make this trip at any time but the sculptures just make the trip a little more interesting. Probably best to take a bus which can be boarded from Circular Quay to Bondi. The bus drops you close to the pool in Bondi, where you can take the path and begin your walk up the hill and then South. Take the opportunity to use the ammenities or go to the shops at each place as you travel. Don't forget water and sensible shoes. No Heels. Some surfaces are rock and sand not just a boardwalk. Take a bus back from Coogee. Don't forget your camera!

Exercise, excitement, activity, fun ....It's all in this walk!. A really interesting walk with loads to see and many stop-off points to enjoy. Take in Tamarama Beach, a secluded small sun-drenched inlet patronized by Sydney's famous & glamorous bikini set. Squeeze a swim in as there are showers available. Then onto Bronte beach for NSW's best brunch cafe's. They are all good so you do not need to be fussy. Continue past Clovelly & the famous swimming club that has fostered many an Australian Olympians including Graham Thorpe. If the legs are tiring stroll amongst the early settlers tombstones and take the time to read some. It's historical bliss and very interesting. You are almost in the final staright? As you round the last bend Coogee stands out like an oasis. A beautiful beach, pristine azure surf washing against crystal white sands with the Cliff backdrop amassed with apartment buildings of every shape and size? Somehow and regardless of the lack of council planning this mess of buildings almost akin to the appearance of a Brazilian favela, is quite beautiful in itself. The home of Mel Gibson for many years Coogee is a minature version of its Big Brother, Bondi. The Bondi to Coogee walk is up and down hills and stairs so exercise, fatigue & sweat is guaranteed. However, all can be remedied in the beer garden at The Coogee Bay Hotel with a large jug of cold local beer or a resort style cocktail in a friendly, jovial, 'chug-a-lug', noisy, but very aussie atmosphere! I suggest taking the bus back to Bondi which is only a 20 minute trip. Take your block-out, shades and a hat. Have fun! It's as Australian as you can get! ..... Pick a fine weather day. .... You will recommend this one.
Super Stroll. A beautiful, relaxing, energizing and wonderful stroll!! We did it two times. We did it for the scenery, but physical fitness here beats any gym or spa!

Beautiful but long walk!. The walk was very beautiful with wonderful scenery! The paths are very well made and there are plenty of places to rest and take photos along the way. You can tell it is both a tourist and local favourite because it is very busy! It is much longer than we thought, however it is not a problem if you want to finish earlier as there are places to catch public transport along the way. We walked from Bondi to Clovelly.
Bondi to Bronte. Took bus to Bondi and walked to Bronte. Nice walk - lunch at Bronte - beautiful scenery, lots of people and fun to watch the surfers.
Great Day for a Walk!. It was great weather and got to see a lot of surfers and swimmers. The people along the way were friendly and I learned a bit of history about the coast.
Great walk!. The walk was beautiful! Highly recommend it. We went on a rainy day and still had a great time! A must do if you are in Sydney!

Great Sydney Coastline. A wonderful scenic walk along the cliff tops of some of Sydney's loveliest beaches,this is good any time of year and particularly wonderful during the Sculptures by the Sea, usually in October. From the large world famous Bondi with all its hotels, food outlets and entertainment to the quiet coves of Tamarama and Bronte you have it all here in spades with a thousand photo opportunities.

without doubt my number 1 thing to do in sydney. do not miss this walk. pick the right day, wear comfortable clothes and take your time. explore the walk - take a few hours and visit as many beaches as you can, spend time at the most beautiful and peaceful cemetery and enjoy drinks and food at nice pubs. sun, sand, beaches, cemetery, beer - can't ask for more, can you?
the scenery is amazing. On a summers or spring day it is a relaxing walk or for fitter people an excellent workout.Coastal scenery is beautiful.

Beautiful and refreshing. Walking along the coast line beaches and clift walks is very enjoyable. The full walk may be too long for some esp elderly and small children. You can easyly catch public transport buses to intermediate locations along the walk and start their. Eg. a short popular walk is Tamarama beach to Bondi beach.

What a way to spend a winters day. Beautiful walk, with fantastic views and plenty of opportunities to take photos! Easy walk although spots with steps though plenty of rest stop opportunities and coffee shops along the way. Beautiful rock formations and art work along the Bondi Beach promenade. Definitely worth taking the time to factor into your holiday. Saw one of the Lifeguards from the TV Show Bondi Rescue to.

Beautiful scenic walk . Take the coastal path from bondi to Coogee it's a great day out although you may find getting to Bondi a bind.There are many beautiful sights on route including Cove's and facilities such as water points and toilets. I would recommend for all able bodied to take the challenge. 8km each way or 1 1/2 hours at a good pace. 4 hours in total with lunch in Coogee. I would though spend the day on this excursion.

Stunning walk.. I did this walk a few years ago, just couldn't enter the date on this site. I walked from Coogee to Bondi on a stunning winter's day. It took 3 hours and was wonderful. What a beautiful coastline! I had a look at the Waverley cemetary on the way - some interesting graves. I must do this walk again.
Really nice, but.... The walk there was one of the best walks i went on in Sydney, it is an amazing place. The problem is that there is a lot of people because of how popular the place is.

Stunning casual walk. This walk is for those who are not totally fit but would love a spectacular but easy coastal walk. It is a walk that hugs the coast but is paved all the way. Depending on your fitness it can be easily negotiated within an hour.
Must do. An amazing walk not to be missed. Better if done from Coogee to Bondi, in my opinion. The views are just stunning and you will get some amazing pictures along the way.
Beautiful walk. It's the best walk on a sunny day, magnificent view and a good exercise for your legs, finishing off at one of the Cafés in Coogee. It ticks many boxes.

Healtyhy & Beutiful Walk. If like walking,the sand and the ocean and magnificant views then the walk from Bondi to Coogee Beach is a must for a single, couple or family. If you would prefer, or if it is more convenient for you, the reverse walk is just as good if not better. Bondi is considered a better Beach for a swim or surf and has more eating / drinking places on the Promontory with excellent views of the beach and the sunbakers,swimmers and surfers, I have walked this walk with family many times and can very highly recommend you do the same. You will not be disappointed. Cheers.

Stunning views. This is the kind of thing that everyone does when visiting Sydney, and there's good reason to it: the views are fantastic, it's a semi challenging walk between beaches and it let you appreciate the human fauna of Sydneysiders (there's at least three words to describe this group of people: ridiculously attractive, health / sports oriented, friendly).
this is definately a must do in sydney. this should be a highlight of every visitors trip to sydney, just walk as far as you like & then catch a bus back to central sydney

Stunning Seaside Walk. This is one of the most beautiful sections of the Coastal Walk and is not too challenging with well maintained pathways. The distance is approximately 5.5 kilometres and will take about 1.5 hours. If you are in Sydney in late October the walk incorporates the annual Sculptures by the Sea Exhibition. The only cost is the bus to get there or the car parking if you park at Bondi, Coogee or Clovelly. You can catch a bus to Bondi Beach and a bus at Coogee at the other end.

Sculpture by the Sea. Must see for locals and tourists. Is annual event. Great weather and view interesting art. Walk is good anytime. Wear good walking shoes. Take bathers and towel for a swim on a hot day.

Beautifully Calming. It's simply a beautiful walk. It's a nice stroll with a brilliant view. I went with my sister and it took about two hours at a generally slow pace. There aren't too many people and there's good seating along the walk if you want to have a rest. I would definitely recommend this walk for anyone who wants a nice morning stroll.

one of the best beach / cliff walks in the world. the walk is just beautiful and spectacular all in one, to have this walk right on the city beaches is a real plus as you can get there so easy by public transport ie: train and bus or just bus from the city CBD you can walk from Bondi beach to Bronte beach to Coogee beachCombining beaches, rockpools, parks and spectacular coastal views, the Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk winds its way along 6 km of picturesque coastal paths at the edge of Sydney's eastern suburbs. STARTING by the iconic Bondi Icebergs, just above the Bondi Baths, the walk takes between 1-2 hours at a leisurely pace, offering plenty to see and do along the way. Make your way up a set of steep stairs near the start of the walk and marvel at Aboriginal rock carvings in Marks Park, one of the walk's highest points and a prime whale watching spot during the migration season between May and November. Heading towards Tamarama you'll pass by Mackenzie's Point Beach, one of the smallest beaches in the State which is only ACCESSIBLE at low tide. The beach is not suitable for swimming, but is a popular surfing spot and a great place to relax by the water.Follow the coastal trail towards Bronte Beach and once there take the stairs near the rock pool to the cliff top board walk for postcard views of Tamarama, Bronte and Bondi to the north and Malabar Headland to the south. Recharge at one of Bronte's charming cafes, or find a shady spot for a rest.CONTINUINGon from Bronte, the walk passes by the beautiful historic Waverley Cemetery on top of sandstone cliffs and rock platforms. Follow the cliff path to reach Clovelly Beach, a popular swimming and snorkelling spot nestled in the narrow bay between Bronte and Gordons Bay. The walk to reach Gordon's Bay features a very steep staircase that challenges but REWARDS with its clifftop views.COMPLETEthe scenic track from Clovelly to Coogee and unwind with a picnic at Coogee's shaded parklands or enjoy a BBQ using the public facilities. Cool down with a swim in Wylie's Baths, take a dip in Coogee Beach's protected bay or enjoy a drink at one of the many cafes and bars in the area.and then you turn around and walk back it is just wonderfulit is good for all ages just do it at your own pace you will not regret it

Great walk. Always enjoyable no matter what the weather views are spectacular stop for coffe at bronte then enjoy lunch at Barzura fantastic food very pleasant ,lots to see after lunch enjoy a long cocktail at little Jack Horner on the corner opposite Coogee bay hotel

Nothing special. Bondi beach is over hyped the walk is nice but I've been on better walks . I think a lot of people go there just to say they have been there. Don't loose any sleep if you don't get to see it.

One of the better coastal walks. This is a must do if you like the beach or are visiting Sydney for the first time. Fresh air, wonderful views, exercise. And all for free! The walk is relatively easy so can be done by most even with average fitness. Plus, if you get too hot from walking, just stop at the beach at either end! Once a year there is also an art display that is tremendous viewing along the walk.

Bring your camera. I did this walk on New Year's Day this year with friends. It was a beautiful walk and when we got to the end we were able to go for a refreshing swim. Bring your camera as there are so many pictures you'll want to take.
Great walk. Great walk, good way to get fit and enjoy a great view... just below 4km about 30mins to complete one way.

Views to die for. A beautiful, scenic walk. You can stop and take rests on the way or just keep walking and take in the sights. This is one of my favourite places to bring guests or just take a walk by myself.
Majestic view. You never seem to get bored of this walk. The view is impeccable and truly captivating,great way to catch up and take in the view at the same time!

Walking for fun. My cousin was here from UK for a few days so I decided to take him on the walk to show off our beautiful eastern suburbs coast line. I have done this walk several times. We walked from Clovelly to Bondi, had lunch at the Icebergs and then walked back to Clovelly where we had left the car. I strongly recommend this walk for people who love to walk. You cannot take wheelchairs and I do not recommend taking young children. It is harder walking back from Bondi, seems more uphill for some reason.
Great coastal walk. Enjoyable Sydney walk. Great beach views. Nice way to spend a few hours. Good cafés at Bobsi and Coogee for the beginning and end of the walk.

Awesome coastal views. Great beaches, coffee, food and more....... This is one of the best coastal walks in Sydney... however... its popularity means it has become very busy in the last 10 years.... gets very crowded in peak times especially when the sculptures by the sea is on. some great places to stop and have coffee, snack or lunch like Bronte, Tamarama, Coogee and Bondi.

The #1 coastal walk !!!. I could be biase as I loved this walk . If you visit Bondi, allocate some time to do the walk. There's some flight of steps to climb that leads to the walk . There is proper pathway but it is advisable to wear proper walking shoes. Views are breath taking and on good days and depending on the season, you could see school of dolphins and whales. You could start from Bondi Beach and ends in Taramara Beach or vice versa. There are buses on both beaches to take you back to the city. This is also the site where Sculptures of the Sea takes place - in the month of October to November.
Perfect for a Sunday stroll. A favourite walk with gorgeous views of Sydney's best beaches. Love the soft, picturesque hues at sunset. Gets a bit busy at the Bondi end but well worth it.
Stunning scenery for a sunny days walk. Perfect walk on a nice sunny day. Stop for a coffee or bite to eat on either end before heading back to the start.

Sydney 'Must Do'. Doing this walk you get to realise why Sydenysiders love Sydney ..... Take your time, camera and enjoy a coffee or a whale watch along the way. Either direction .... Or both. Enjoy!!!

A must if you visit Sydney. Just a beautiful coastal walk experiencing how awesome Sydney is....nothing bad here...bronte beach lovely....coming into Bondi on a sunny day (winter or summer) is just spectacular..don't just visit the beach, do yourself a favour and do the walk, start from either Coogee or Bronte but either way you won't be disappointed.

Scenery. good pair of shoes, water bottle , swimmers in summer , check out the cemetery at Waverely, be ready for walking up and down Hills and plenty of steps but once you get to Coogee stop at the local Coogee Bay Hotel and have a nice cold one
Beautiful Coastal Walk. Worth doing any time you're in Sydney or for locals when you're near Bondi/Coogee. Can get a bit busy in Summer so good for walking only (not so much for running)

Nice walk on non-windy days. Enjoyable walk especially when the annual Sculptures by the Sea is held in October. I would recommend walking from Bondi to Coogee rather than the opposite direction. Plenty of options for meal or snacks at the Bondi esplanade.
Fantastic Sydney iconic walk. Don't miss this one!. Great views, easy walking, and great food/cafes at both ends. You can get a bus back if you only want to do a one way walk.

walking in the city. this is the really amazing part of one of the best walks ever...its not in a remote National Park...its a city walk ! Definitely a 'must do' for Sydney. I like it easy in the morning around the sunrise most. Even if it is busy at this time especially in the summer the time stops for a brief moment until the sun has raise out of the ocean. If you wanna avoid the early morning fitness traffic you should start past 8 am when everyone is already heading to work...By the way...Coogee is not the end of the walk, you can continue to Maroubra, one of the more local beaches and it gets more quite between Coogee and Maroubra....The whole walk will take about 3-4hours...depending from speed and the frequency of the coffee breaks in between !

Brilliant.. This is a very long walk.BUT., It has all the trappings of a very unique coastline.Beautiful in any weather,and you have to be able to walk up and down some steps and hills. Very worthwhile for your fitness and your eyes. Love It!!

A great to spend a warm winter afternoon.. We actually did Clovelly to Bondi return (10kms). It was a beautiful afternoon to be walking and enjoying amazing scenery. I've lived in Sydney all my life and hadn't ever done this walk - we'll definitely be back again and again. Tip: You can park for free on Clovelly headland - plenty of spots in winter.
The best of Sydney. Walk or run with the fittest in Sydney on this amazing walk which showcases the scenic East coast! See the million dollar houses perched on cliff tops and the famous Bronte Beach
Good walk. This is a great walk as you are right on the coast. It is long but there are comfort stops available along the way .

A beautiful coastline seen up close. This is a beautiful area, and the walk can be done in total, or piecemeal, just a small section, then off the track to enjoy a local watering hole...This place has special memories for me, as it was on the boardwalk that my husband proposed to me one night. In the daytime there's lots to see, but at night it's ever so special, as the sound of the waves crashing seems amplified and there are lots of quiet spots to enjoy the moonlight on the water. A must try when visiting Sydney's eastern suburbs, and a regular exercising route for locals and visitors alike. Often there are sculpture exhibitions to enjoy and much beauty for photographers to snap, and can be enjoyed at your own personal pace.
Nice scenic walk. Slight hilly. slight to moderate difficulty. Took us under 1 hour. Definite must when visiting Sydney

Fitness, Fun & Experience. At any time of the year this is a wonderful experience. A great way to get healthy, and a great way to see a wonderful part of Sydney. The highlight will alway be Sculptures by the Sea. What a wonderful way to see art/sculptures in an inspiring place. You can get a workout, a view and an education all in the same place. But if you miss it, don't despair ... this is still a great walk. A great experience with health and fitness. Do you need more? I think not. Go do it ... you know you should.
