Best view in Sydney.. Being a Sydney local I can honestly say this is one of my favourite walks in Sydney. You get to see the beautiful and sometimes dramatic coastline while you comfortably walk along the well worn track. See beautiful beaches, stunning backdrops and have the opportunity to stop at the many great cafes along the way. Take a picnic and enjoy this gem of Sydney.
Pure Joy. We walked some stopped for coffee, walked some more, sat on a rock and inhaled the environment. One of Sydney's best days out loads of good places to rest and eat.

The Great Ocean Expanse. Not to be missed when visiting Sydney or Bondi, a unique experience to get back to nature and enjoy the sights and sounds along the way. Sydney still some of the best beaches in the world and what a great way to be a part of it all year round.

Walks. One of the best oceans walks in the world.It can get rather busy in weekends but during the week it's amazing..Watch whales and dolphins frolic in the surf or just sit down and take in the sights of bondi.

Fun in the sun as a stroll or run. It is a nice walk to do on your own, with friends or as a couple, especially when then art by the sea exhibits are on. A few stairs but nice views and fairly casual stroll mean it's fun for all ages. Be prepared for a few joggers and walkway hogs to accompany during the warmer days as it's quite a popular route and can get congested in parts
greta way to get a taste of Sydney beaches. This is what Australia is all about. I live in Sydney and still love to do this walk every time we have international guests!
A must do walk in Sydney. Enjoy wonderful ocean views from Sydney's most iconic walk. It's very rugged but can be broken into smaller sections.

The Coastal Walk with a constant view...... Superb walk for those with energy and are not afraid of a few stairs and hills. The views are impressive and air feels clean. If you are prone to Sunburn Sun Block is a must.
Great walk. We love this walk especially during Sculptures By the Sea. We usually start in the south and end at Bondi to eat food.
One of New South Wales best walks. Best to do early in morning. The air is at its best. You can take breaks on the walk if you just want to drink in the view. Well kept path and surrounds.

Is This The Best Day-tripper Walk in Sydney?. It could well be! In summer put on your bathers, walking shoes and take a towel and swim at each beach you come to and you'll soon have a taste of what it's like to live in Sydney. Even if it's not hot enough to swim, the walk is a spectacular sample of why the First Fleet stopped when they arrived in this area...spectacular coastline with alluring beaches. Start with breakfast after a quick dip at Bondi, proceed for a mid-stop swim and smoothie at Bronte, another swim at Tamarama then on to Coogee for another dip and lunch at any of the great cafe's or just hang out the rest of the afternoon shooting pool and eating great food at the Coogee Pavilion - the beachy-chic latest addition to the Hemmes Empire. Camera essential.

Beautiful every step of the way. On a sunny day this can not be beat for beauty and fresh air. Wear your comfortable walking shoes and be prepared to share the path, especially on a suu y day and a weekend but well worth it. Treat yourself to a drink, coffee or lunch in Coogee!

Bondi to Codgee. This walk is stunning in parts , an easy walk for most our day of the walk Sunday 28/06 was just beautiful weather the view along the coastline in most parts is simply breath taking we also had a bonus of watching the whales swim passed. I would highly recommend this walk.

It's a fabulous view of Sydney - and it's free!. This is a great activity for visitors to Sydney - starting at the iconic Bondi Beach, the boardwalk takes you along the edge of the cliffs, skirts past some impressive homes and drifts down to the beach at Bronte where you can call in at one of the lovely cafes for a break before heading on to Coogee. During whale watching season you can occasionally catch a glimpse of whales breaching in the distance, but that's not necessary to make this a great couple of hours.The most difficult part might be transport - park the car at Bondi and catch the bus back from Coogee. You can walk the return trip, but that makes it a LONG walk!

Unbeatable views on a fone day!!. No matter what direction you go, the views on a beautiful sunny Sydney day are (near) unbeatable. The walk, for the most part is not strenuous, and even the uphill sections are generally easy (one uphill to the south of Bronte, if heading south may cause some to struggle a little). Plenty of spots to stop and rest along the way and, who knows, at the right tome of year you may catch some whales off shore. Also, who says you have to do the whole walk??? You can always go part way and then turn back!!

Bondi to Coogee. Fabulous coastal views! Great for that early morning run with less people to navigate. During the weekend it can get busy, but we found it wasn't too busy. Stop for a swim or to admire the view. Plenty of great food and coffee along the way. Clovelly is a favourite with 3 Blue Ducks Cafe serving up a feast for breakfast and lunch. plus there are any number of great cafes situated close to the beach along the way.

Stunning walk like no other in the world. You don't have to be super fit, you just need some joggers, bottle of water and your phone/camera. You can never be sure if you will whales at this time of year. It is one of my favourite places to unwind and remember that life is too short to be unhappy

Beautiful views. Living in Sydney, you have to do this every now and then. Just chose a beautiful sunny day and the viewwill be stunning! Allow 2/3h to complete the walk, having time to stop for taking photos or even for a swim. I like to do it in the morning because it gets really hot.
"One of the most beautiful coastal walks". With the Pacific Ocean on your side you walk on the path built along beaches and cliffs.Just spectacular.
Nice. Try and stay for the sunset- very nice! there are a lot of people though, it gets quite crowded sometimes.

Bondi walk. Fantastic walking area. Plenty to see and do as well as cafes along the way, tourist shops. We were lucky to have great weather, but you do need good walking shoes. Lot of people excising, swimming surfing. Very relaxing atmosphere and surrounds.

Great safe walking track. Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal Walk is one of my favourites coastal walks in Sydney. it can get busy in Summer time or during Sculptures by the Sea festival so avoid these times. Best time to do it is weekdays any time during the day after 830am.

What Sydney is all about. If you do one thing in Sydney do this. Amazing beaches, beautiful views, great cafes and great fun. Extend it to South Head if going north or down to Maroubra or even La Perouse.

Sydney on show!. My daughter and I love to walk from Bondi to either Bronte or Coogee. We bring our little dog along and make a morning of it. There are plenty of stunning ocean views along the way and many cafes to stop at and watch the world go by. Highly recommended for all levels of fitness and on a sunny day in Winter, it would be hard to beat.

Thoroughly enjoyable. Beautiful, scenic coastal walk with designated pathways, moderate. Not difficult except perhaps in parts for elderly. Scattered seating. Rewarding views and sandstone natural sculptures. Go at sunrise, awesome Sky colours and fewer people. Free off street parking till 8 am, then metered parking.

stunning way to see Aussie coastline. If your an active and into it kinda person, you will love this walk. Either way - Bondi to Coogee or doing it in reverse. Its stunning. And there are so many places to have a swim, lay on the sand in the sun, have coffee, lunch, a beer....

Perfect Beach Walk. It starts at the headland north of Coogee, where we pay our respects to the Bali Memorial, remembering all those who lost their life. I say silent Hail Marys for their families and think of their heartbreak. And then we start our walk. It's so spectacular, the beauty of nature is almost overwhelming,, the colours of the sea and sky, the curved beach, the white and blue waves and then the wide walk way stretching out ahead of us towards South Coogee and beyond. There are lots of other people walking and cycling too, but somehow it doesn't seem crowded, there seems to be space for everyone and people are so polite. Step by step we keep walking, both speechless in the uplifting surrounds. We walk on, to the peat area - an amazing piece of land history by the walkway - and then turn around and return. Going on this walk makes us feel grateful to be alive and experiencing such a gorgeous part of our world. There is nothing else like it.

Stunning Views. A great day activity with stunning views of the eastern beaches. During the weekend it does get fairly busy , you’ll find some people are very serious about the walk and will be hot on your heels!. Would suggest to do it early in the morning or late in the afternoon. Ensure to wear comfortable walking shoes and clothes as it does get strenuous in some parts, there are a few steps and inclines. This time around we brought our 18 month old son with a pram, but its not very pram friendly, we were with friends and needed their help with lifting the pram at the steps… if you have little ones suggest you take them on a carrier. But a great activity to do that will take up the day , well worth it on a beautiful day.

Great family outing!. Enjoyable walk with lots to keep the kids exploring and happy. Great to see the turquoise waters of the beaches. Bring water and a small picnic to stop along the way on a grassy hill. Good outing with friends and kids.

Breathtaking. What better way to enjoy the coastline. Refresh at one of the many restaurants which you deserve after the walk then catch a ferry back to town.What better way to spend a beautiful Sydney day

Not to be missed. This walk which takes around 2 hours or a bit more to complete should be on everyone's agenda when visiting Sydney.Following the rugged coastline passing several scenic beaches it is not a difficult walk and can be managed by older people easily. Many locals jog along the track and is an iconic attraction in the eastern suburbs not to be missed
Great views. Lovely easy walk, taking in all the beautiful coastal views. It's great to go either way from Coogee or Bondi. Lovely cafes and restaurants to eat at both ends.

Best things in life are free. Breathtaking views , warm coastal breeze ,easy walk with dog and kid s in tow.Sculptures were amazing and all the bustling activity on the path between Coogee and Bondi. Everyone all ages can do this stroll. Great exercise -never know who you might meet on your journey

Or Reverse for less stairs to climb.. A brilliant walk from iconic Bondi Beach around the coast to Coogee for a beer at the iconic Coogee Bay Pub. You walk through the amazing Waverley Cemetery with breathtaking views and Bronte Beach, Tamarama Beach and Clovelly Beach. Approx 3.5 km walk with some hills and stairs can be done in an leisurely hour.
Spectacular scenery - great photo opportunities. This walk has been much improved over the years and with many spots to stop for coffee, lunch and photos it doesn't get much better.

Bountifully beautiful. Wonderful experience walking alongside the sea, atop the cliffs with the sound of waves crashing and a vista that takes your breathe away. Go early (before 8am) if you prefer a more solitary walk as the pathway is quite narrow and you jostle with runners, walkers and doggers. Numerous vantage points if you like to stop and take it all in, and the promise of a coffee at Tamarama or further along en route will encourage a faster pace, if you're that way inclined. This walk is a must-do for locals and visitors alike and it is my monthly fix to retain any semblance of sanity midst the occasional corporate world insanity.
Great excercise. If you enjoy a good walk with a view - this is the one you will love.. lots of ups and down and steps
Great views Whale watching. Great views ideal for whale watching right time of year. Swim at Coogee Pool after walk or lunch at Bondi. Consider fish & chips on the beach

Don't fall in. During big seas spectacular - and inspiration of a great art work by Shaun Gladwell (Storm Sequence). There is an Aboriginal rock carving right near the path between Bondi and Tamarama. How many see it? about 5/100. We counted. Good eateries at Bronte

Wander and watch. A great thing to do on a sunny Sunday afternoon. Enjoy the beaches and the views. Lots of steps to keep you fit and make you feel like you have had a bit of a workout.It can get quite busy on perfect days though.

Great day out. Great place to visit, full of lots of great restaurants, nice walk along the beach front. We went to Iceburgers for lunch, sat on the balcony overlooking the ocean and the pool, weather was great, food really good, we had the seafood platter to share, nice and fresh and good value. Highly recommend a visit when you are in Bondi.

One of the best walks in the world!. This is a fascinating experience every visitor to Sydney should complete! It is a relatively simple walk (or many run to!) and has fantastic views from everywhere. It's not however wheelchair friendly. If you have a pram, you'll need to carry it up and down a few steep sets of stairs but not too difficult. Kids can scooter for example but not suited for bikes. Winter often provides some views of whales in the distance and low tide walks reveal some lovely rock formations being funded by the surf! I do this walk at least twice a week for exercise and Bondi to Bronte return can be done at a leisurely pace in about an hour.

A must do for Sydney. This is a magnificent walk with spectacular views - also close to places where a well earned thirst can be quenched afterwards ! Once a year for a few weeks there are "sculptures by the sea " - however it can become very crowded then so if this event is on do the walk in the early morning on a week day . If you are in Sydney do not miss this walk and of course its best on a sunny day . Autumn or Spring are the best times of the year - could be very hot in the middle of the day in summer - bring a hat and sun screen !

Coogee to Bondi Walk. I prefer to do this walk from Coogee to Bondi. The walk itself is fantastic in either direction and there is bus transport at both ends, but the lure of the Icebergs bistro and bar makes the journey worthwhile for me.The walk is an easy one with small hills and steps along the way. Great views of beaches, homes and the ocean and an iconic cemetery makes this one of Sydney's great short walks.

This one of the most beautiful coastal walks worldwide. This is a spectacular walk along the clifftops starting at the classic Bondi beach. It wends its way to Tamarama beach first, then to Bronte and finally to Coogee. You can just do one section and then return or walk through from one end to the other. I live in Sydney and it's still something I love to do on a regular basis. Every November,there's a fantastic event called Sculpture by the Sea for 2 weeks. Artists do installations on both sides of the path and in the parks above and on the beach at Tamarama. It just goes for that first leg and it truly worth planning a visit at this time.

Breathtaking views. It's a great walk with views of several beaches. You need comfy shoes and should take a drink and a camera. There are lots of steps so you need to be quite mobile. You can choose to access the walk from the two main beaches or any imbetween

Great weekend activity!. We were blessed by perfect weather.The walk takes you across some wonderful costal tracks and offers really interesting views of Sydney's architecture. At the end of the walk, we stopped off at the Coogee Pavilion for a very memorable lunch. Over the weekend you get to see locals exercising and enjoying the walk. A great family activity.

Better than Bondi!. I loved this walk and thought it was lovely. I went early in the morning and shared the path with runners and dog-walkers. The path is quite clearly marked out and easy to follow. If you want a little escape from the city, this is the perfect walk for that.
Great walk with awesome views. Lots of walkers and joggers on the walk .Quite busy when we went and it was in winter. Lots of places to stop and admire the view.
Tamarama to Bondi.. A really pleasant walk from Tamarama to Bondi. Would have liked to continue but the weather was lousy.
Must Must Visit. best beaches every visited. really nice and clear. must must visit. good for family, couples and surfers.

Free amazing coastal views, walk. Good workout but views should take the pain away. In summer go early, 7.30 ish. Amazing views. Wear sun block and hat. Need some fitness, lots of stairs and hills but you can leave the walk at plenty of places and take a bus either home or to one of the next suburbs and pick up the walk again.

Bondi to Maroubra Beach walk. The coastal walk from Bondi to Coogee is well known and easily laid out, but it is possible to go all the way to Maroubra Beach. When you reach Coogee, walk along the promenade past the Life Savers' Club and continue along the path. It takes you over the rocks and seems to end at a cul de sac high above the ocean. Don't go down the stairs, instead go straight ahead on a path between two houses. On the other side, turn right and walk up the street, turn left and left again to go back down to the sea. This road bends to the right and straight ahead are wooden stairs to the rocks below. Scramble over the rocks (pensions do it) and rejoin a path on the other side. Follow that all the way to Maroubra Beach (and beyond if you're energetic). There are cafes at Maroubra Beach. If you're tired, you can take a cab back to Coogee and a bus to Bondi Junction.

Glorious, even in the "dead of winter". I walked at a brisk pace, leaving my relaxation until Coogee at the end, and I made it in about 1.5 hours. If you actually want some beach tinge, Bondi is the best, but also the most crowded. Gorgeous vistas throughout.

Beautiful Coastal walk. Living close by I have done this coastal walk many times and would have to say it is one of the best, if not the best in Sydney. Beautiful scenery and plenty of stairs this is also a good option if you enjoy a morning run, however I would warn go early. This walk gets very crowded from around 9am and can be hard to get around walkers as the pathways are quite narrow.Would highly recommend for visitors and tourists.
Great rocky coast. Really nice walk along this rocky coast with nice beaches.. it's great to use bike, you can make all the trip.

Swimming in the sea water pool on the way around the walk.. An easy coastal walk from Bondi Beach or even start from Bondi Junction train/bus station. Stop for a swim in the sea water pool along the walk. At the Coogee end regular bus services are available to take you back to Bondi Junction.
a relaxing walk with awesome scenes. The trail is easy to walk but the scenes is spectacular.Can combine with the trip to Watson's Bay cos bus is available in Bondi Beach.

Coastal Walk. We made our coastal beach walk on a beautiful day in June. The weather was perfect and the scenery is breathtaking. We ate breakfast at a small café at Bondi Beach before starting. This walk is well marked so no fear of getting lost. Highly recommend this.

Breathtaking views.. If you have a reasonable level of fitness this is quite an easy walk ( there are a few stairs and inclines). Commencing at Bondi, about 25 mins in, you will come across a kiosk on the beach at Tamarama, perfect to enjoy a refreshment or snack. I found this length of the walk gave us wonderful views without tiring ourselves out too much and we had plenty of energy for the return trip.
Walking sydney. Great walk and scenery perhaps go mid week as always busy weekends The walk can be extended both ways if you feel energetic

Stunning. Whether you do this alone, with friends/family or overseas visitors you won't be disappointed! Beautiful scenery and people watching. Can do this walk at a leisurely pace or run. On a beautiful spring/autumn or winter's day it's preferable or either early or later in the day in summer (unless you enjoy basking in the heat). There are some steps to navigate and you will have to find your way back or better still walk it after stopping at one of the many cafe's at Coogee/Bronte. Just enjoy as I am sure you will :)
Sculpture by the Sea. A magnificent walk coupled with brilliant sculptures.Best early evening when the crowds have gone home. The return walk gives the view a different perspective.

Spectacular coastal walk. This is a stunning walk - hard to believe you are only a few kilometres away from the city of Sydney. It is truly spectacular and gets the heart rate going a bit without being a hard walk. Lots of cafes and places to stop along the way.

You took my breath away. This is a magnificent walk with breathtaking views. Do not forget to bring your camera for some great photo opportunities. There is alot of climbing involved so it is better if you do not wear flip flops. You get to pass thru many different beaches as well as restaurants and cafe s on the way. You can get off the trail at many points however finishing the walk is well worth it. Once you arrive at Coogee Beach there is a bus terminal to get you back to where you want to go.
Amazing views!. The walk was quicker than we thought, and not strenuous at all. We walked on the weekend, and was quite crowded, but well worth it,

Did it several times. Never tired of it!. I first did this walk with a few of my friends. Started Early in the morning from Coogee and spent almost 6-7 hrs to reach Bondi. There are several small beaches on the way. The coastline offers you hundreds of photography spots with stunning views of the ocean and the surroundings. There are several locations where you can arrange for picnic and have any sports activity. We thoroughly enjoyed the walk and after my first walk I have accompanied almost every friend/relative of mine who came to visit Sydney for any purpose. This is just awesome!

A different kind of Christmas Day. Coming from the northern hemisphere, I was really keen to see how folks celebrated Christmas in the southern hemisphere. So you can imagine my amazement when we visited Bondi Beach on Christmas Day and found the beach literally strewn with hundreds of sun worshipers wearing Santa hats. And, in the centre of the beach there was a giant blow-up trio of a snowman, Christmas tree and Santa; I thought I was seeing things at first.After a leisurely stroll along the soft sandy beach we had lunch at a neat little Thai restaurant that served wonderful pad thai. To walk off the calories we took the coastal walk from Bondi towards Bronte. The coastal path starts beside the iconic Bondi Icebergs, just above the Bondi Baths, the walk takes between 1 hour at a leisurely pace, offering plenty to see and do along the way. There were rock pools galore and gigantic rock formations, some with caves, others jutting into the ocean like giant buttresses. The waves were spectacular, crashing against the rocky shoreline offering great surfing for the fearless. Heading towards Tamarama we passed by Mackenzie's Point Beach, one of the smallest beaches in the State another popular surfing spot and a great place to relax by the water. I know the path continues to Coogee, but we headed back to Sydney after Bronte.
Great Sydney walk. Great view & great way to see a few Sydney beaches. Can get very busy on weekends so be prepared to walk with the crowds.

Sculpture by the sea - Bondi. I love this event and make the effort to do the 2 km coastal walk from spectacular Bondi beach to Tamarama coastal walk, which is transformed into a temporary sculpture park featuring over 100 sculptures by artists from Australia and across the worldThis is one of Sydney's most loved events, the outdoor sculpture exhibition returns to the stunning Bondi to Tamarama coast walk from 22 October - 8 November 2015.

Bondi to Coogee walk. This is a spectacular walk around the coastline right in the heart of Sydney! It's easy to reach by bus from Central or Wynyard( the two main train/bus terminals in the CBD) and everyone knows Bondi Beach!! You start the walk from the Southern end of Bondi Beach, walking down a small road past a modern apartment block ( which is the home to a few A listers!) and the famous Bondi Icebergers ( a club for swimmers who swim everyday of the year at Bondi) then you'll find the path heading south along the headland. The views are spectacular ...I particularly like the section from Bronte Beach south to Coogee as you walk on the boardwalk past the Waverley cemetery... There's a seal colony , and if it's whale migration season, you'll see them as they head north!You pass a number of beaches on your way south, and it's ok to take your time to watch the surfers catching waves...especially at Tamarama Beach, a small indent in the coastal map. There are plenty of really good coffee stops/ cafés along the way...so take your time! It's a good two hour walk at a moderate pace.....and you can choose to walk further south along the coastline, but it's not the dedicated boardwalk, it's more finding your way through streets... But it's doable!

What a great walk. My wife and I recently did the Bondi to Coogee walk, it was great. We really enjoyed it it was a great way to see the beautiful coastline and and beach side suburbs. We would thoroughly recommend this walk. It is not hard and you can take your time have breaks and still enjoy it.

Stunning Views. Whenever I hear of someone visiting Sydney, I recommend the Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk. The walk is filled with breathtaking views and a great representation of the coastline in Sydney as well as a handful of different beaches.

Coastal walk. I did this coastal walk last year..I liked it very much. when I was walking by the sea,I was overwhelmed by the breath taking views.So many times I stopped on the way to enjoy the views. That was a wonderful experience..I can't explain it,it is something to experience by yourself.The words can not do justice to the beautiful views by the walk.Camera is a must for this walk.If tired, there are benches to sit and rest.it is a long walk not a very short one.So, water bottle,sun hat,sun glasses are good to be taken with you..Backpack is better than carrying a hand bag:easy and convenient.

Lovely way to escape the city. I managed to walk to the beach from Bondi station in around 20 minutes despite being told it would take too long. The coast walk is nice on a sunny day and there are plenty of opportunities to stop off at the beach and passes a couple of ocean pools
Superb views. One of the best morning walks I've taken, wonderful views and a good workout. A real insight into the small bays that make u0p the eastern beaches

Coogee to Bondi. We did this walk the other way round from Coogee to Bondi. We caught the bus from Sydney City Centre to Coogee. It's an amazing way to explore to coastline and experience a whole host of of beaches. As Bondi appears around the corner of the coastline, it's a view you won't forget.Trainers are a must, flip flops won't cut it!

You will feel so clean and alive ..... when you take this beautiful walk. If you want solitude, this is not the walk for you. If you want clean air and sunshine this is it! Don't forget to swim, either in Icebergs, where the waves will knock you into the pool, or in the beautiful Bondi waters. Oops, it is winter now but the walk won't change.
Beautiful. Whether you're on your own or with people, this walk is lovely! It's great with sunshine of course, but even if the weather isn't on your side when you do it the views are still excellent!
Fabulous Walk. Great views and an easy enjoyable walk, the sun was shining and the birds were chirping, loved it, would highly recommend for anyone in Sydney

Lovely walk along the coast!. The walk was really nice! A friend and I got the bus down to Bondi and walked back along to Coogee, we didn't stop in many places so only took us about 50 minutes to walk, but got some great pictures and the walk was really easy! A nice pub at the end or some shops to grab an ice cream if it's a nice day! I walked on a day it was raining so although the sea looked great I will definitely be doing the walk again in the sun haha!

Just breathtaking!. I just loved loved loved this...must do when in Sydney...doesn't take long and you don't have to be super fit because I'm certainly not! I started at Bondi...in my opinion it's the best way as even though Bondi is so famous...it's not the nicest beach!

A MUST DO FOR EVERY VISITOR. Simply stunning. The Bondi-Coogee or Coogee-Bondi walk is a fantastic way to see the beauty of Sydney and get some exercise to burn off all those sausage rolls and meat pies. Try coming on morning or late late afternoon to avoid the tourists. Don't despair, most barely make it 200m past Icebergs from the north or Coogee Pavilion from the south. Take your time and grab brunch or a drink on the way.

Magnificent walk - invigorating, fresh air with stunning scenery for good eye and muscle exercise. Magnificent walk - invigorating, fresh air with stunning scenery for good eye and muscle exercise . This is a MUST when visiting Sydney and with some luck, you may even hear or see the yellow-tailed black cockatoos who frequent the native banksia trees. This is Australia, this is Sydney - openness, beauty, stunning coastline and majestic waves, natural rock sculptures and warm sun. You get it all on this walk which is mostly boarded so easy enough for even amateur or sporadic walkers.

Stunning walk. Such a beautiful walk on a sunny, warm day (just make sure you wear sunscreen and bring a hat and water!). The walk from Bondi to Coogee includes a walk up a big set of stairs, so be prepared for that. It is worth it though! It's lovely walking along the coast and through a number of beaches, all with entirely different vibes. Pick your favourite(s) and stay for a while.
Beautiful walk. I loved the views and the beachside cemetery, lots of hills for fitness. Just a great walk in general and surprising that it is in such a major city.
Amazing views & Walk!. Have done this walk multiple times. Recently did it in Winter & still as good as ever. Amazing views & a must do for any person living in or visiting Sydney!
Great walk. Take the time to walk along this coastal walk it is worth it! (the first part gets very busy during the "Sculptures by the Sea" festival, between October and November)

great activity. Parked the car at Bondi, walked to Coogee, coffee and lunched, and walked back. very pleasant activity. We did it early morning but it would be equally as good late afternoon. Can get a bit crowded.
Great views, easy walk. Views are good and the walk is not too long...there's not much in terms of cafes or shops in between.

Spectacular Walk with changing vistas. This is one of Sydney's iconic walks. A good 9 km-10km round trip. The views of the coast line are spectacular and the beaches along the way are all very different. Lots of places to stop, rest or eat. Down side are the crowds on a fine sunny weekend. You should be reasonably fit as there are varying elevations and steps however, it is not a difficult walk and one is not captive as there are many exits to hail a cab... public transport not so easy along the route other than at the beaches
Awesome. Lovely walk.. Fantastic thing to do on a Saturday or Sunday morning. Great to bring the kids, family and dog! Great views.

Beautiful coastline and a lovely walk... A wonderful walk - as a local I take it for granted. Its not too difficult, you can take your time - there are cafe stop points at bronte, clovelly and coogee if you so choose. Its spectacular coastline and on day with not too much wind, its hard to beat as a way to while away a few hours and just enjoy life!
Sumer time walk. Last Sumer I walk from Bondi beach to Cooge beach the walk inner the water you can her only the vent and the wevs

Stunning. Lovely stroll along the beach! Absolutely do not miss this trek. Take it quickly or take it slowly, either way it's a gem. Many beautiful views to be had and many spots to stop along the way if you want a bite to eat or a bit of a side adventure.
Beautiful Views. The beach had beautiful views, but the hike is kind of long. I only did a small part of it to get the point. i went in winter and it was a bit crowded. would still recommend though

Stunning!. When staying at Bondi beach we did this walk at least twice, Coogee is a sweet town with lovely cafes and a cool park and beach. The walk itself isn't difficult, though can be a bit slippery in the rain, it is a must for the area just for the views and photo opportunities! some of it is carved out of the rock and the patterns are beautiful. Very very pretty at sunset on the rocky outcrop by Bondi.

Lovely Scenery Constantly Crowded. Lovely Scenery Constantly Crowded. If you find a quiet time to go then it is ideal, otherwise it is much more enjoyable to get out of the city for a nice walk or even head along the coast north of bondi. Find some quiet places and views and you will enjoy it ten times more.

Incredible views of Australia's coastline. So many people told me that I had to go on this walk. It's a very scenic walk and provides many opportunities to stop and enjoy the view, take pictures, swim, and have a picnic. It was a little crowded at certain spots but nothing that was too much to bear. There were 5 of us on the walk together, and we all really enjoyed it, including a teenager. Highly recommend this walk. It was cold and sprinkled on us a little, but we were prepared for that. We actually cut the walk short because of time, so will have to return one day to do the whole walk.

holiday. i was originally going to stay at coogee beach but glad i did not.the sea is much more rough herethan at manly beach.the walk is lovely but gets very busy with joggers and youre are always looking behind you..bondi beach is nice wth all the big mansion houses overlooking it..although i think we have much nicer beaches in scotland.we had a nice lunch though before walking back to coogee..
Stunning walk. Fantastic, a great experience and one to share. Perfect for locals and tourists... Fab photo opportunities
BEST. Must do if visiting sydney or even if you're a local. Lots of runners and the path is dog friendly. Gets heaps of people during summer, but worth it. Perfect picture taking scene too.
Beautiful. Bondi beach hasn't a patch on the beauty of the rest of this walk!The views from the clifftops are breathtaking.A lovely alternative to the city sights.

Scenic walk. I and my partner did the Bondi to Coogee walk and really liked it. It can be a whole day affair if you stop at certain beaches, swim and take a break. The walk is approximately 6 km long and very scenic, and there are many spots where the views are stunning. The first stop - Tamarama beach - is a small nice beach and less crowded, next stop Bronte has a ocean pool open for all, next stop Clovelly is a good spot for relaxed swimming and snorkeling - it was full of families and kids as it is a calm and quiet beach. Just before reaching Coogee there is a small bay - Gordon bay - which appeared to be a good snorkeling site as well.
busy but spectacular. you know it - what the others said. easy walking on concrete paths for 90% of it. we didn't have the best weather but it was still spectacular. just do it!
Beautiful. Was a great walk, it's like 2.5 miles to Coogee. We were there end of May, so it was a little chilly but very Sunny.
Love it. Biased as live close by but always enjoy this coastal walk. Busy though. One can even walk just part of the planned walk eg Bondi to Bronte. Lots of cafes at each beachsite.

Must do walk. If you can avoid the joggers this is a must do walk that can easily be done in the morning. Great views and keep an eye out for Aboriginal rock carvings. End up at Coogee for lunch and then get a bus back into the city via Bondi Junction.

The best things to do in Sydney. It had the best time in Sydney doing this coastal walk from Bond Beach to Coogee Beach. It was one of the most satisfying walk I have ever had. The views we were treated to was out of this world. Though the close to 9km may be a little difficult to do for some, but fret not. You will never regret embarking on this adventure.

A wonderful beach walk suitable for all ages. I love that you start at arguably Sydney's most overrated beach Bondi) but then as you head south along an easy path that hugs the shoreline, you see so many prettier & more interesting beaches and pools.

Wow around each curve. Beautiful rugged rock formations with stunning azure blue waves. Great work out to keep fit on holidays and a joy for all you people watchers. Plenty of beach stops to get refreshments and sit a while. Go for a swim in one of the cove beaches, rest on the lawn or sands and just chill. Terrific when Sculpture By The Sea is on or the Festival of Kites. Ever changing based on the weather and suitable for all fitness levels. Never tire of the great scenery and the "vibe" of the location.
always lovely. Its a great walk to do with company. There are quite a lot of stairs but very doable.beautiful views all year round

Fantastic views, Must visit. What a great walk... I was motivated by a local to make the trip out to Coogee so we can do a walk/jog back to Bondi. The views can't be beaten and I have to hand it to the visitors - There was very little rubbish which is usually a problem with such popular attractions. Quite a few stops along the way to sit down and enjoy a coffee if thats what you're into or you can push through to Bondi or Coogee and enjoy many of the wonderful cafe's around.

Breathtaking. This walk/run offers some incredibly beautiful views, fresh air and peace and quiet. The trail has ups and downs so it's ideal for anyone wanting a good work out. The view is unbeatable. I could walk this every day and still be in awe. Recommend +++

The best walk in Sydney. We always go from Bondi to Coogee. We tried it the other way once but it seemed to be more inclines/uphill steps that way. Fantastic views and just the right distance. A couple of weeks ago we saw a penguin on the rocks just round from Bondi! We haven't managed to see any whales yet though. We try to avoid weekends as it sometimes gets super busy. But we always look forward to a beer at the Coogee hotel at the end.
Spectacular walk. All sydney visitors need to take this walk. The scenery is spectacular but because of the stairs not wheelchair friendly

Quintessential Sydney. This walk (and the extended Sydney coastal walk) is really easy to get to by public transport and provides a real taste of Sydney suburban life by the sea, along with fantastic coastal and beach scenery, great spots to stop off an eat before, during and after, lots of scenic chairs to rest your weary bones and is a must-do on a fine Sydney day. I would avoid it on a windy or wet day, and you do need to be reasonably fit as there are lots of stairs, some quite difficult for short legs!

Daydreaming and walking. Just let yourself go and all your troubles will flow - and that's out of your mind and worries - just take in the scenery smell the delightful scents in the air and hey be one with nature it's all there

Great views, good exercise and destination. Did the Coogee Bay to Bondi walk and all the way back again on Sunday. This is without doubt one of the most underrated tourist attractions in Sydney. It's free. It's beautiful. It burns off calories. The view is sensational. There's a 100 spots to rest, seats etc. And the best thing is if you want to go slow, or fast, it makes no difference to anyone except yourself. The sculptures are good to look at too. Even better when there are more when 'Sculptures by the Sea' is on. Must do this walk more often.
Perfect way to spend a day in Sydney. An absolutely BEAUTIFUL walk, best of all it's FREE!!! Suitable for families and visitors of all ages.

SOOO LONG!. The walk is beautiful with all the amazing views along the way. Great photo opportunities with smaller beaches and parks along the way. But seriously, it is sooo long. If you are a local, it'd be a great place to spend some time to get out and get some exercise. There are a lot of people out running and walking their dogs. However, from a tourist perspective... it is too long to spend time doing the whole walk when you have limited time and so much to do in Sydney. I would suggest just doing a segment of the walk, like Bondi to Bronte or Coogee to Clovelly. And then just split it up instead of doing it all at one time. Another good portion to walk is Maroubra to Coogee. Anyways, it's beautiful! And do it if you are a local or have a lot of time... but just do a portion of it if you have limited time.
Spectacular views. Great walk , very popular with lots of walkers . Stunning views along the way. Highly recommend you do it.

Breathtaking. Superb views. Lovely walk. Plenty of photo opps along the way. Handy enough walk so very relaxing. Definitely recommend to get out and about and just take in the fresh sea air and see some of the most spectacular scenery.
Beautiful and peaceful walk. Just gorgeous. So many places to stop and enjoy the view along the way! Not too strenuous, mostly relaxing, but still a good workout.

A nice walk along the coast. A friend of mine that lives in Sydney suggested this as it's her favourite for a run and going on the route I could see why. Nice views out to the Ocean and busy with other joggers and walkers.
such a good walk. Breathtaking walk. Meet the locals on the walk as they pass you on the way (how lucky they are to live on this coastline). Lots of little cafes on the way for refreshments.

Spectactular views and well-made path. This walk follows the coastal headlands of southern Sydney. Views are spectacular as the well-made path winds its way along the top of cliffs and down to beaches. The walk takes about two hours and is an easy grade. There are bus stops along the route so it is possible to catch a bus back to the centre of Sydney at the end of the walk or to shorten the walk if necessary.

Spectacular. This is a terrific walk so see now only the beautiful ocean scenery, but also do a bit of real estate snooping - some of the houses along the way are amazing. There is some nice restaurants in the suburbs along the way that you can stop of at.

Amazing. This is a must for travelers to Sydney, as well as locals who might get complacent with the amazing scenery we have. Breathtaking sea views, gorgeous beaches and nice places to stop on the way for coffee or food.

Beautiful!. Did this the other way round from Maroubra Beach, just south of Coogee, to Bondi on a quiet Monday when there were no crowds. It was stunning, the view of and from Waverley Cemetery will always stay in my memory.

Beautiful walk along the coast. Easy walk along the cliffs with some steeper stretches. Amazing view! Nice beaches with bathrooms along the trail to rest and go for a swim. A bit crowded close to Bondi Beach, but it gets better after a few minutes. I would totally recommend on a nice day! :)
Easy walk. Easy walk along the cliffs. We walked Bondi to Coogee. The walk does a get crowded at first, but once a distance past Bondi there are less people.

Beautiful walk. We went on the June bank holiday - very busy but gorgeous weather, great views and a lovely walk. I would recommend anyone in the area to do the walk and treat themselves to an icecream and dip in the sea at the end. Well worth it.
Nice walk. It's a nice walk, pretty coast line, also pretty crowded when I went but not in a bad way. I got some nice photos

Save this for a rainy day activity. The walk to Coogee Beach is nice if you want to do some hiking along the rocks. I'd recommend enjoying Bondi if it's a nice day and take the walk if the weather isn't great and you're looking to walk on the beach like we did that day. It was really windy and overcast and not really beach weather. The coastal walk gave us an activity to do with some good views before we had lunch to check off our Bondi Beach visit. You can see some natural rock formations in the water, but I'd do the Shelly Beach walk from Manly before I'd put this one on my list.

Brilliant - Do not miss !. My family inlcuding seniors (70+) and young children (ages 8 & 5) took a train from Town Hall to Bondi Junction. Then we took a bus to Bronti and walked from Bronti to Bondi.We did probably half of the entire coastal walk - it was absolutely beautiful.Its a must do and simply not to be missed.The walk is on a well parked path and has mild slopes / steps and offers beautiful views and photo ops. There was a lovely park for the kids at Bronti and we were pleasantly surprised to find an 'ocean water swimming pool' at Bronti.We had a lovely lunch at one of the cafes at Bondi to round up our lovely excursion.
AMAZING!!!!. A view to die for. You will wear the battery of your camera out ;-)Just dip into the ocean or have icecream or a coffee.
Great walk. Must do this if you go to Sydney. Easy to get to by bus from the city this walk along the coast is an easy path with amazing views and bays to stop off at for drinks etc.

great walk. We walked from Coogee to Bondi. It took 2 hours with a few stops. It was great being able to look out to sea, examine all the interesting rock formations, and sticky-beak at the expensive houses all at the same time! Seeing the cemetery right on the headland was also very poignant.

Beautiful bondi and beyond. Bondi beach may be the most familiar sight, but walking around to Tamara and Bronte give spectacular views, and great vantage point for whale watching.The rock pool at Bronte is divine, and there is a large park as well, which is perfect for family picnics. So if Bondi feels a little too commercial, head over to the smaller beaches and enjoy a more family atmosphere.

Breathtaking. What an awesome view!! The walk to the beaches and sight seeing was amazing!!! If visit Sydney, you must take this tour. We didnt need a tour guide due to family already did this walk a few times, so we enjoyed it on our own. They were soooo many people on the beaches yet you still did not feel overwhelm or uncomfortable. We found a spot on the beach (bondi) and enjoyed the waves, laying in the sun and eating from one of the venues. Cant wait to go back
Wow. Did Fred hollows walk first time to walk this piece of coastlineWill do it again must do if travelling to sydney
Scenic, Non-Stressful Stroll. We did not take the entire walk, but this was an excellent path with spectacular views and well-maintained surface. Very convenient to access from Icebergs.
Amazing views. The walk offers majestic views of the Pacific Ocean and the beautiful Sydney beaches & cliffs. A must see if in Sydney.

Amazing day. After reading previous reviews we thought this a must do. Caught a bus from Randwick to Coogee and arrived at an amazing beach, after soaking in the view we heading up the path around the coast, each corner brought with it another stunning view. We stopped and had a picnic lunch and again for cold drink before arriving in Bondi. We spent time there watching the surfers before catching a bus to watsons bay, here we watched the sunset over Sydney as we waited for the ferry to circular quay. This was our last day in Sydney and it will definitely be an amazing memory

Very pretty. I didn't know that this walk went all the way from Bondi to Coogee so I only went to Bronte and turned around. The walk was not too bad and there was beautiful scenery along the way to look at and take photos of which made it go by even faster. I really enjoyed this walk and got a lot of great photos and an awesome experience from it
A way to walk - Coogee to Bondi.. We walked the cliffs and beaches between Coogee and Bondi mid morning. It was warm and track was busy but the views were amazing.

Wonderful!. Wonderful walkway! I really enjoyed it, even when weather was bad. :-) I was there during the sculpture by the sea festival which even made the first part of the walk more special. After this first part I was virtually alone on the path and could enjoy the beautiful views all by my self!
A must do at Bondi. Beautiful scenery. It can be quite busy, definately worthwhile as a nice leisurely stroll with a latte or a fit bit driven power walk.

Great workout with fantastic view!. This is a must do when in Sydney. You get to walk along the coastal line and have access to some of the best scenery along the way. Pick a sunny day and just do it. You won't regret it.

One of Sydney's great coastal walks. Start your day early on one of Sydney’s great coastal walks. The stretch between Bondi beach and Coogee Beach is a three-mile trail that’s pounded by locals and tourists alike, enjoying Sydney’s wild coastal beauty, as the waves break below the path. It’s also a mild pre-breakfast workout with some swooping up and down gradients and the perfect way to build up an appetite. Stride halfway and then head back for a great start to the day. The Bondi to Tamarama stretch of the walk also becomes a one-and-a-half-mile outdoor art gallery from 22 October to 8 November, with the Sculpture by the Sea event featuring 100+ art works dotted along the length.PS I wrote a whole article about this and other suggestions for 24 hours in Sydney on the Australian Times which you can visit here: http://www.australiantimes.co.uk/norman-peires-perfect-24-hours-in-sydney/ Thanks for reading!

Quintessentially Bondi. Beautiful easy walk, expect a lot of tourists but once you go out slightly further it starts to die down and you get to truly enjoy the walk. This is such a bondi experience combined with people watching, cafes and stunning views perfect for photos.
Perfect length and views. Long enough to see a lot but short enough that you're not searching for the end. The views along the way are great too with many stops for photos.

Eastern Beaches Coastal Walk. Its a great walk, be prepared for stairs though and some ramps. It is not an easy walk, but also not a hike.The walk actually goes further south than Coogee, it goes to Lurline Bay. There are interpretive signs telling you of the history, environment and people of the area.

Don't miss this walk when in Sydney. A must do when in Sydney, spectacular scenery! Try to go on a weekday to avoid huge crowds. see if you can spot some dolphins or even whales, when migration season.

MUST DO!. If you come to Sydney you MUST do this beautiful walk. Takes about two hours. Easy to take the train in. Might want to bring your swimsuit if you're here on a warm day you'll likely be tempted to jump in the water. Incredible views of the Australian coast!

Exercise and beautiful vistas rolled into one experience. The Bondi to Coogee walk is not difficult, but it is a fair distance. This is quickly forgotten with the beautiful views you will find on every turn. Make sure you bring a towel and your swimmers in the warmer months so you can stop at a number of beaches along the way for a dip in the ocean to cool off. Also don't forget your sunscreen, hat and some water. A great way to get some exercise and take in some of Sydney's best coastal views!

if the weather is right this is a must do!. A group of us did the Bondi-Coogee-Bondi walk recently and it is much improved on how it was more than ten years ago. Some of the slippery, awkward pathways have been upgraded so the full walk is now much more comfortable, particularly around the cemetery. This makes it easier to keep up the walking and talking and still let you admire the fantastic scenery. Some sections have stairs so it is not pram friendly. There are a few points where a little signage would be helpful so you know you are going on the through pathway and not up a dead end. If it's a busy day just follow the crowd. There are plenty of points along the way where you can top up your water bottle. Plenty of restrooms too. If you want to park a car while walking it is best to get an unrestricted time spot. You won't find one of these near the beach but about halfway along Bondi Road some of the side streets offer good possibilities and won't add too much to the distance you'll cover. When you are walking try to remember to keep to the left of the path to let the faster walkers and runners get past you.
Wonderfull views among a walk. The pathway is good, is about 1h and half walking, within many stops for pictures among the amazing views and landscapes. It is a must visiting.

Just do it. Well set out walk on a beautiful coast; you can drop down into secluded beaches or (as it was autumn) just press on with the walk. Starting from Bondi Beach, we headed off around the coast and LOVED the amazing views, the restless sea, the well-marked and well-laid out track; and caught a bus home from Coogee to our apartment. Good exercise, great views, beautiful coastline. Strongly recommend this as an afternoon stroll...

Lovely. The walk was lovely, I just dislike Bondi, which I know does not relate to the walk, but I find it way too busy. That is just me though and the walk as a whole was definitely beautiful. I would absolutely do it again

Spectacular. Such a beautiful walk along the coastline! Easy hike along a paved walkway. Many places to stop along the way for pictures as well as taking in the local flavor in terms of shopping and foodies. When in Sydney or local area, take time to do this walk.

If you have seen Great Ocean Road, Give this a miss.. I cannot understand why this is the best rated walk, especially when you have Great Ocean Road in Victoria. Unless you want an adventure in your stroll. Not suitable for wheelchairs or prams.

Coastal walking at its best. Very enjoyable coastal walk with some amazing scenery. Enjoyed the various birdlife around and also the flowers. Great café at Clovelly, nice rest stop for a tasty milkshake!
Absolutely loved!. Must do! Light walk around the beach and costal walk with breathtaking views! One of the must-dos on a Sydney trip - and even a must-do for locals once a year on a spare Sunday.
Beautiful views. The quaint restaurants by the seahore on the boardwalk we delicious. The area is a bohemian paradise.

Amazing views!. Great path and great views along the way! We started at Bondi (got there by ferry, then bus) and walked the path to Coogee. We ended up hanging out at Coogee longer as it was less crowded (and we were tired from the walk!) Great physical activity in an otherwise lounge day.
Stunning views!. Easy walk, great for a lazy morning, along a gorgeous rocky coastline and dipping into beautiful beaches.
great walk. We got bus to Coggeee and walked coggee to Bondi beach.it was a excellent walk that took about 90 mins stopping to take photos.from Bondi took bus to Watson bay and ferry back to Sydney

Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk. I have done this walk about three times over a span of 23 years. The first time I did this walk by myself during the week. There were not many people on the track then. The second time around I was joined by a friend and we walked it on a weekend, when it was sunny and busy. The last time was in November 2014 during the Sculptures by the Sea. This was definitely the most crowded occasion. The walk in itself is very pleasant with lovely views of the ocean, the beaches, the rockpools, the eastern suburbs coastline, the many ocean front dwellings and the cemetery. The walk winds its way between Coogee and Bondi and finds Tamarama, Clovelly and Bronte on its route. The length of the walk is approximately 6 -7 km long and gently slopes up and down and around the different coves. There are plenty of cafes, toilet facilities and playgroujnds along the route. It can be started anywhere along the route. Parking is available but sometimes hard to come by or at a fee. This walk can be done by people of any age, family groups and there is wheel chair access as well.It is a good way to get some exercise in, while enjoying the scenery.mmshiri
Scenic beauty. Well formed path, lovely little coves and popular beaches to walk by. I did the reverse route after a pleasant bus ride from Circular Quay to Coogee.

Easy walking trail with spectacular views. If you are looking for a relatively easy walk with fantastic views and plenty of places to stop for a drink or bite to eat then this is the perfect walk. Easy location to get to by bus the coastal walk enables you to relax or get some brisk exercise depending on your need. We finished at the Coogee Bay Hotel which has open and spacious beer garden overlooking the sea and good feel to the place.

Glorious walk along Sydney's best beaches. The Coogee to Bondi walk is something you must do in Sydney. It takes about 75 minutes - or longer if you take your bathers and stop off for swims, lunch or coffee. In addition to beautiful beaches and cliff top views there are iconic Sydney rock pools and some great ocean view cafes. Coincide the walk with the annual 'Sculptures by the Sea' for a perfect outing as a solo or group traveller.
Great outdoor adventure. It was a beautiful walk, amazing scenery. Take your time to enjoy the experience. Make sure to bring your camera.

Best coastl walk in Sydney. Simply stunning views and suits a range of fitness levels. We start at Cogee and walk to Icebergs, do lunch and return. Its a 14km loop but its not too hard.Choose your day as its coastal and if the weather is wet and windy it will be unpleasant.
Coastal walk. A beautiful walk online the coast, it is very popular on the weekends so I would recommend doing it during the week

Must-do activity in Sydney!. I have been to Sydney a few times however never knew about this walk. What a great experience it was! The scenery was amazing, and provided a very different perspective to Sydney which I never knew existed. The variety of landscapes that you venture through on this walk are fascinating. And the best thing about it is that it's free! Take a camera, capture some amazing photos and enjoy one of the best inner-city coastal walks Australia has to offer!

Don't miss doing this walk if you have time!. Absolutely gorgeous! Wish I could walk it every day. The coastline is genuinely spectacular with stunning birds and plants. Also don't miss having a bite or drink or both at The Coogee Pavillion at the end.
Great exercise. This walk gives the best of both worlds.Getting exercise and witnessing some stunning views.The path is easy and the walk is relaxed.

Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal Walk. A great walk - Starting at Coogee Beach or Bondi. A very scenic walk over and around rocky headlands.Starting at Bondi then walking up over the headland with great views before dropping into Tamarama Beach and skirting around Gordon's Bay Clovelly then crossing Bronte Park with it's beautiful gardens then on to Waverly Cemetery with an amazing boardwalk that skirts around the edge of the cemetery alongside the ocean. Then skirt around more rocky headlands.Clovelly Beach. Walk along a couple more rocky headlands with good views then you are at Coogee Beach, the end of the walk and time for a coffee or a meal. No shortages of places to dine here. Walk up the steps to Coogee Bay Road and to the left is the beer garden - great for a drink or a good meal. The walk has many ups and downs including steps but a great walk and amazing homes built on the edge of the sandstone with commanding views across the ocean. This is one of many Coastal Walks around the Sydney coastline. This walk can also be contiunued along to Maroubra making it a 10km walk from Bondi

Fabulous 6k walk with wonderful views. I throughly enjoyed this lovely walk which took about an hour and a half with lots of stops for photos and staring at the view. It's such a great chance to get out of the city and stretch your legs. I personally think the walk is better done in reverse from Coogee to Bondi for 2 reasons:1. There are more buses from Bondi back to the city so no need to wait too long when you're tired.2. The views going this way are I feel a little better.The walk itself is beautifully maintained and well sign posted. Do not be put off by other comments about the number of steps etc. it's a gentle incline nothing more and well within the reach of most people. Only the infirm should be wary.Do take a camera and some water.

Coast Walk. Coogee to Bondi. A beautiful scenic walk along some of Sydney's amazing coastline. If you're lucky, you might see whales or dolphins, especially at this time of year when the whales are moving north.Walking at a leisurely pace, the walk takes close to 2 hours. There are a few stairs but are mostly downhill on the way to Bondi.There are opportunities to grab a coffee or something to eat at Coogee, Clovelly, Bronte and Bondi.Return buses are available. Sometimes direct or via Bondi Junction.
Stunning walk. Stunning walk - has to be done! Take your time and breath in the atmosphere, this is a lovely part of the world.

A must do in sydney. Have done this walk a number of times, it's beautiful and I think a must do in sydney! There is a numbers fm great places to stop and enjoy the view along the way and you can take as much time as you need to enjoy the walk!
A great seaside outing. Pick a nice day and just set off. This is not the Champs Elysees or Fifth Avenue but it is a rewarding exercise on what is sometimes a narrow path easy to negotiate
great!. Bondi to Coogee walk is great to walk or run all year round with spectacular views, lovely swimming spots and cafes along the entire stretch including a great sculpture exhibition once a year

From amazing to amazing. A workout with a view.. You can really see why this is such a popular walk. From start to finish, the walk is coupled with spectacular views. We walked on a beautiful warm sunny morning, with the slight coastal wind blowing, conditions couldn't have been more perfect. We started in Bondi and made our way to Bronte where we made a pit stop for a swim on Bronte beach and the pool there. We then continued onto Coogee where then made our way back around to Bondi and ended our walk with lunch at Icebergs. The whole walk is quite easy, paved all the way with slight hills and staircases so even if you are not fit, you will be able to walk along the paved paths. We did try our hand at being a bit adventurous, opting to make detours onto the rock pools from Mackenzie's Bay and treking it along the beach through the rock and towards Tamarama before joining the footpath again to Bronte. There are many other walkers on the path but as it is quite a long walk, everyone is spaced out so the path didn't get too crowded. As it passes various beaches, there are many toilet facilities along the way.I highly recommend this walk. I listed it for more than 3 hours because it's best enjoyed at your own pace, though if you were ambitious the walk probably would only take somewhere between an hour to 2 hours.

Must do it at least once. This is one of the most breathtaking walks of Sydney that is easy to access. The views show of sydney beautifully. Great for people watching with other travellers, local surfers, runners and everything - this walk attracts a very eclectic crowd - the only downside is the crowd - its a very popular walk but you might need a little bit of patience when its busy on weekends.Another nice alternative is the coastal walk at Watson's bay - less crowded and beautiful steep cliffs.

One of the best scenic walks in Sydney. I live in Sydney and often do this walk with my family and our dog.In short - it's a brilliant walk. We usually start around Coogee beach and sometimes go to Bondi beach, sometimes turn back at Bronte beach.The views are spectacular, air is fresh, people are nice and friendly, lots of options to have a break - beach, park, or cafe. We often pick a cafe at Bronte beach for lunch,I would recommend this walk to anyone who has a spare few hours. It gives a feel for what the life in Sydney is like and it's just spectacular.
One of my favs. This walk has got to be one of Sydney's best costal walks. Close to all the mod cons cafés and amenities you can't go wrong. Keep your eyes pealed for many great surprises.

Nothing better on a sunny day.. "Spectacular" is the word. Make sure you pick a nice day as it's the best way to enjoy the scenery. Stop along the way to have a snack or drink. the best advice is to go slow and enjoy.

A Must Do. A wonderful Sydney thing to do .Early morning is the prime time with the sun rising ,but any time is still great ,and in any conditions , great when the surf is huge and the weather is wild or calm and blue . Walking is easy some steps and hills no real fitness required ,but you need to be healthy enough to walk .

Beautiful walk, plan your parking!. This walk is without a doubt a must do on your experience list. The views are incredible and quite dynamic, not to mention it's great exercise (walk or run). The down side Is finding a park and getting back to it. I tend to leave my car at Coogee, photograph where I parked then after walking to and having lunch at Bondi, I'll get a taxi back to my car, otherwise it's quite time consuming. Allow about 20 mins minimum to find a park, it's frustrating but the walk is absolutely worth it.
Must do. One of the things everybody who visit Sydney should do! Enjoy a lovely walk and finish it off with a stay at bondi beach! The cliffs and beaches are gorgeous!

A Photograper's Delight!. If you can drag yourself away from Bondi Beach and are up for a most enjoyable walk all the way to Coogee Beach then this is an amazing walk along the board walk and along the scenic seafront.. Sticking to the walk which hugs the sea and beaches like Bronte, Tamarama, and ClovellyBeachs the walk will take you to Coogee Beach where you can enjoy a meal and drink in the Coogee Bay Hotel as you look out over the sea!

A great view and good exersise also.. This is by far my favorite coastal walk. I enjoy avery part of it, broad rugged vistas and smaller coves, watching huge waves and exciting surfers and seeing all the dogs on walks with there owners. Wales swim by in season, but the very best is when the Sculpures By The Sea is on in October.

Beautiful views. Bondi to Coogie walk is one of the most scenic walks I have done in Sydney. It presents you with beaches, coves, shaded paths, rocky patches, beautiful houses and cemeteries facing the sea. Perfect for a first timer to Sydney or for any of looking for fitness! It goes up and down with many steps and will definitely give you a good "natural" workout!

Stunning walk and views. Views fantastic what a great thing to do on your first day in Sydney. Very well sign posted and handrails to help on sections where steep steps of which there are many. It was beautiful and I finished it haven't a swim inWylies salt water swimming pool.

One of the best coastal walks in Sydney. Love the Bondi to Coogee walk. Great exercise, great view....and something that can be done all year round. Make sure you bring water and a snack as the return trip can take quite a while

Don't miss this walk. Sydney at its best. Lovely views, do not have to be too fit and you get to see Bondi Beach as well. About 2 - 3 hours, a little (but not much) climbing. If you come to Sydney and miss this walk, well you have missed out on a great experience. World class - only Sydney can give the visitor such an experience.
Relaxing and Stunning Walk. The Bondi to Coogee walk takes you along the beautiful Sydney coast, the walk is leisurely and can be done by most people.

All these years, I've missed this. All my life I've lived in the Eastern Suburbs of Sydney and I was amazed at the amount of beauty that I've missed.This walk also goes all the way down to Maroubra and Malabar of you go behind the rifle range.Highly recommend this for the whole family.

Top five things to do in Sydney!. This walk is one thing that local Sydney-siders love as much as tourists. The view is exceptional regardless of the season and there are lots of cafes to stop off at throughout the walk. This is a bucket list item!!
Beautiful View. you have to do this walk if you come to Sydney. We did it as a family with one young child (2 1/2) and it was brilliant. The view out to sea and the coast line of Sydney is amazing

Scenic but a bit too commercialized. We did this one and the Manly Scenic Walkway, which was better in our opinion. If you only have time for one, do the Manly one. The Eastern Beaches Coastal Walk is very scenic and beautiful, but it felt a bit too commercialized. Instead of a natural hiking trail, there's a boardwalk. Sometimes the boardwalk was right next to the roads and houses. It felt a bit unnatural. Nevertheless, the views are terrific. Our favourite part was the cemetery on the cliffs.

Great views. This was a really nice walk with enough people that made it feel safe but not too crowded. Great views and pictures. We went in the morning and grabbed a snack near Bondi beach and then went for the walk. We stopped on the way back for lunch. This is worthwhile if you don't want to sit on the beach all afternoon.

This walk is a good way to work up an appertite. The walk along the cliffs is a good workout, and you can take in some spectacular views along the way. There are quite a few steps at stages but don't be put off. There are several cafes you can access & some restaurants not far from the track if you so desire.There are some great photo opportunities along the path.

Well worth it. There are certainly some great views of the Aussie coastline to be had, and there are lots of nice restaurants in both the start and end points (Coogee Beach and Bondi Beach). Bring good walking shoes... and a camera!
Amazing views. This place has got some amazing views. Its a must do walk on a sunny day.Make your you take your camera along and you have sufficient time to enjoy this walk.

Excellent - Wear comfortable shoes.. This is a 3 mile walk going up and down the coastline. I'm a runner so not a huge deal distance wise but not for the faint of heart either. Beautiful coastline. My daughter and I started in Bondi. We took a bus from City Center (20 minutes or so A$4 a person). We ate lunch in Bondi (great burger place is Moos) and started off. Coastline fantastic. Come across several beaches with bathrooms and water - bring a bottle if it's a warm day. Also a heart rendering cemetery. A must do. Restaurants at both ends. Could start either way. Coogee is a more casual town.

Fantastic views and walk!. Started from Bondi to Bronti and back again, with the weather warm but with a nice cool breeze. Great experience with great little coffee shops at bronti which is ideal for brunch! Such fantastic views and makes me very temped to want to move out to here!

Best walk in Sydney. This is one of the best walks in Sydney. Either you go for a run or just walk it with some friends on a sunny day. Loved the part from Bondi to Bronte. Take a look at the weather before you go. It can be really windy or rainy there.

Beautiful beach and lovely walk. We were dropped off near the beach by our host, and we just wandered onto the beach area by accident, in awe of the views there! There were quite a bit of people on the beach, but from afar, the views were just mesmerising!! I think this is a place for visitors of all ages, and it is definitely worth a visit! Don't forget to go around the neighbourhood as well! Lots of shops that are worth popping your head into!

A scenic wonderland on the Pacific. How is this free? Really? How could a walk so stunning and magical around every twist and turn come free of charge? Well it does from Coogee to Bondi. Wow, what a spectacular place to take in some of the most memorable views. Seriously, every pano photo I took could be a bonafide postcard or magnet. I could go into the souvenir business after this walk after all the great photos I got. Such a standout activity from our trip. And again, it's free.

A SUNDAY WALK. A sunny day with lots of fresh air this is an easy walk that you can take for as long or as short as you like stopping along the way for a coffee if you like. Make sure to make it to the Cemetery and take a walk inside it. A bus can be caught at Clovelley to get you back home.

The Wonderful Bondi Beach. Not as big as I see it on TV. Great visit and walk on the beach for a relaxed day. If you like surfing and catching a wave then Bondi is the place. You can hire boards at the beach and have a lesson on how to surf. If you do not want to surf you can just lie down and get a tan. Make sure you wack on your sunscreen cream first:)
Great Beach walk. We walk from bondi to brenti, it was great lovely experience.the beautiful scenic view forced us to visit bondi twice.

Gorgeous!. This is well worth it! The views are stunning and there are well maintained public toilets and filter water bottle filling stations all along the path. My husband and I are in our mid-30s and quite fit, but we still found sections of the trail challenging (some steep uphold) so keep that in mind. I was expecting there to be little stores and restaurants accessible from the path along the way, but unless you ventured off and detoured into one of the towns there wasn't anything until you reached Coogee so bring snacks. We had lunch at the Coogee Pavilion which was incredible. There's a great variety of seafood, salads, and wood fired pizzas to choose from. We had pink snapper sashimi that was to die for. I was tempted to order 2 more servings! The kingfish poke was delicious as well - very lemony. The gnomo pizza was tasty too. The desserts left us wanting more. I had the rhubarb sundae which was light on rhubarb and lacked flavor and I wish they'd included more of the delicious merengue. My husband had the marshmallow chocolate chip cookie ice cream sandwich but the cookies were hard and the marshmallow was non-existent. Overall, tho, I would return and recommend this place to others. There's also a great area in the back where you can play ping pong and other fun games for free.
Great views. We took the bus to start in Coogee and the views are not disappointing. It is a well laid out path and surface and you may get to see Dolphins if you're lucky.

Beautiful way to see the eastern suburbs' coastline. Did this walk on a Winter's day in Sydney. Unlike winter in other countries there was still lots of sun and it was relatively warm. It's a great way to see Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly and Coogee. Advice for others doing this: - wear sensible shoes. Some of the steps are narrow and steep and there's about 6kms of walking to be done.- wear layered clothing and unless it's incredibly overcast take along a cap and wear sunscreen too.- bring along a bottle, there are plenty of places to refill along the way.

Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk. Great walk so close to the CBD. We caught a ferry to Bondi and a bus back from Coogee Beach, all on a single day ticket. Great value. Well made and maintained pathways. Los of people (and their dogs) using the paths so very safe.

A must for visitor if you like sea view and beaches. If you are in Sydney and like sea and beaches then you should not miss Bondi Beach. Get a car and bike and you will get some fantastic view and secret beach sites and view of Sydney water front

Excellent for seeing Sydney's wonderful coast line. We did the walk in a quick two hours (it was close to sunset when we started), although most locals we asked said this would probably take double that. This walk is excellent for taking in views of Sydney's beautiful coastline.It's a relatively flat walk, but be prepared for stairways and some inclines. The air is very fresh and refreshing, making this a perfect exercise. There are lots of spots for that perfect (and not-so-touristy) Sydney picture.

My favourite Sydney walk. Pick any day and you will not be disappointed and even better when the sculptures are added - I think that is October! This beautiful coastal walk is stunning with the most amazing views from countless lookouts. Don't miss this experience and there are some great spots to stop for coffee and food.

Pleasant afternoon. Quite hilly and quite a few stairs. A reasonably easy walk with lovely views. Path is quite uneven in places. Definitely need comfortable shoes.Take a water bottle as there are places to refill along the way.
Nice coastal walk. Walked from Bondi to Coogee with an 8 month old in a baby bjorn. It was great for this. Don't take a stroller or pushchair as there are way too many stairs / steps.

Absolutely beautiful. What a fantastic experience - the walkway is so well maintained and signposted and the views are spectacular. Lovely places to stop for a coffee or refreshments if needed. I have visited many places both here in Australia and overseas but can honestly say that this is one of the best walks ever. I have never seen rock formations or colours like it.
Love this walk!. I have enjoyed the Bondi to Coogee walk many times.On my own, with a friend, it's always lovely.Beautiful views in all seasons.Take in some fresh air and get out!

One of the best runs/walks in Australia. I love this run (about 6km each way). When we stay at Coogee it's a great run to Bondi and back....quite a few steps and changes in elevation. The Waverley Cemetery on the cliff face is stunning. Bronte Beach has some great coffee shops to stop at if you don't want to go the whole way.

Best walk ever!. Amazing surrounds magnificent views along the coast, just don't go on the weekend its hectic people walking both ways just make sure you start from Bondi rather than Coogee because a cold beer at the Coogee Pavilion is worth it!

COASTAL WALK. This walk is the local keep fit walk.The coastal scenery is lovely and the little villages which form little harbours are very like north Cornwall. Very pretty.The Waverley cemetery is worth a walk through , some historical figures buried here.Great coffee shops at both ends and in between along the walk.

A must do in Sydney. A great way to spend an afternoon in summer. Started the coastal walk at Bondi Beach and walked at our own pace along the coastal cliffs. There's a nice cooling breeze as well. We got as far as Bronte beach where we grabbed an ice cream and then headed back. Once back at Bondi beach we grabbed fish and chips and stayed until sunset. Watch those seagulls!

Does not get any better. . One of the best things to do for free in Sydney. This is a great walk that is not hard to do at your own pace with an awesome view at every turn shared by walkers, runners, sightseers and photographers. You can stop off on the way if you like at Tamarama , Bronte or Clovelly for a rest or a bite to eat. Not to be missed.

Wonderful attraction, but you will not be alone!. After arriving on holiday in North Bondi recently, one of our picks to so was the coastal walk. However it rained solidly for the first two days. By the third day it was clear and we saw Bondi Beach in it's glory, and eagerly partook in the coastal walk. Well, so did everybody else in the area, so it seemed. It is obviously a favourite thing to do for tourists and locals alike, strollers, jiggers and the leisurely walkers who want to take the time to enjoy the views.And what glorious views they are, as well as the beautiful little bays, the amazing rock formations, parks and of course the beaches including Bronte.
