"Life Be In It" surely is the motto adhered to in this area of Sydney, and it was so refreshing to see fit and healthy people everywhere along the way. It's certainly an attraction not to miss.

A great walk. Take some time to do this walk it's great!Excellent views places to stop on the way and take in the scenery. Make sure you look around you at the awesome sandstone formations.It only takes a couple of hours return trip and when you get back to Bondi go to the Icebergs club bistro for a great lunch and views.

Great view of the coast with plenty of small beaches to explore. The walk from Bondi up the coast is a great way to not only get some exercise (wear good shoes and be prepared for plenty of stairs) but also enjoy some of the stunning smaller beaches in the heart of a large city. There are several small beaches to explore on the walk, however be very very careful and only swim where there is a lifeguard.
great beach. walk was not to difficult with great views of coast and beach refreshments at regular intervals lovely

Great walk. This is an easy track to find and follow, great way to get out and active whilst also enjoying the beautiful coastline.Be aware that buses directly from Coogee to Bondi only operate in the summer.A taxi between each place is around $15-$20.Total walking distance is about 3.5km each way

great walk views outstanding. This walk is a great one around the coastal walk, there are cafes on the way so if you feel that you can not walk the whole way stop have a coffee and enjoy the view, It one of the best walks in Sydney take in the atmosphere and enjoy

A great walk. We walked from Coogee to Bondi. A well defined route which took us a couple of hours at a slowish pace with stops to enjoy the changing scenery. A great way to see the five beaches of Coogee, Clovelly, Bronte, Tamarama and Bondi. The coastline is rugged and changing. A lot of joggers use the route (both directions) so there is a need to be aware of who is around you. Frequent water fountains to keep your drinking water bottle topped up.

Great scenic walk. Should be at least moderately fit and healthy and capable to undertake this walk. I wouldn't say suitable for elderly or disabled , but there are parts that are ok. Some stairs and can be busy with other walkers / joggers / families. Worth seeking and doing and even nicer walking from one side to the other to have breakfast / brunch / lunch and walk back. On a nice day it is a must do experience and activity.

Coastal Walk. Combining beaches, rockpools, parks and spectacular coastal views, the Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk winds its way along 6 km of picturesque coastal paths at the edge of Sydney's eastern suburbs.We Started by the iconic Bondi Icebergs, just above the Bondi Baths, the walk takes between 1-2 hours at a leisurely pace, offering plenty to see and do along the way.

Lovely walk. Beautiful walk from beach to beach. We made a day of it and stopped for a while at each beach. It was a hot day when we went, make sure you have plenty of water! Easy to get to from Sydney- catch the train to Bondi then the bus to the beach. There are regular buses back to Bondi train station.

Coastal walk Bondi to Coogee. A beautiful walk along the cliff top giving stunning views of the beaches,bays and cliffs. Although the path rises and falls, the going is good because of the well maintained footpaths,boardwalks and steps with handrails.

New Discovery. Although I have been to Bondi numerous times over the past few years I had never had the time to take the walk along to coast from Bondi to Coogie Beach until my latest trip in May 2015. I am glad I took the time. This trail takes you along the coast where you will experience beautiful and breathtaking views you would otherwise miss. While you finish your return walk to Bondi treat yourself to lunch or a drink at Icebergs Swim Club for elevated views of Bondi Beach.

Beautiful easy coastal walk. We took the bus from the city out to coogee and walked to Bondi. What a view! We were lucky to have a nice clear sunny autumn day, but it was a beautiful walk. It was quite easy, and you could go at your own pace, although there were quite a few walkers/joggers on the path and it was well sign posted. Would definitely recommend this, even if you just had a few days in Sydney.

Very nice place. Bondi beach is very nice, very near from Sydney CBD, it can be reached by bus. The water is very cold, so swimming might be very difficult for most people, however there is a sea water pool on the side that I have not gone to but it looked very nice.The restaurants and bars over looking the beach are very nice and have balconies over looking the water.

great views. a great way to start a Sunday in Sydney--plenty of food and dining options in Coogee---we did it in regular street clothes and not a problem but you will see lots of locals in proper gym gear along the way. if in summer pack your suit and enjoy the rock pools along the way

Wonderful walk!. Make a day trip of this! We started in Bondi for breakfast at Bills, then strolled around before heading off on the walk. Check out the beautiful little bays, impressive real estate and a cemetery with the most amazing views. We then caught a bus back to Bondi for a hearty lunch at Henleys and finished the day off with a spot of shopping at Westfield.

Breathtaking, in both ways!. This is a great walk, I found the walk more enjoyable closer to Bondi, and less scenic the closer I got to Coogee. Keep in mind that it is a long walk, and you need to be in reasonable shape to do all the inclines and stairs. I know some people had difficulty with it.

Coogee & Bondi beaches. All the Sydney beaches are lovely. Cooper is a particularly beautiful beach. Waters are calm. Great for family outing. Lots of pubs and restaurants. This is a popular beach with the locals. Not as touristy as Bondi beach.

Best Sydney experience. By far the best Sydney experience of all! Simply stunning views, showcasing Sydney's most beautiful beaches (and homes!) The full walk is long and a great mix of easy to medium grades, meaning anyone of any fitness ability can enjoy it. Make sure you do this walk!

Magnificent walk glorious views constantly changing, exceptional in every way. A must do for people who love nature. Walk around exciting bends, waves crashing on rocks below, tiny coves, sandy beaches, rest for lunch midway in fabulous, healthy food restaurant overlooking inlet bay and water. I have done this walk 4 times, love it, go back for more. Took my son and grandson a few months ago, but alas, at 78 and very hot weather, burning hot sun, could not complete this time. Had to take a Taxi up and around corner, and wait to meet others for lunch. Enjoyed every minute.
Not to be missed. Even on a windy day this walk was amazing! Definitely not too be missed. The coastline is dramatic and beautiful and there are lots of rocks for the kids to climb!

Beautiful but difficult at times. I was determined to do the entire walk and I am very happy to say that I made it! I am in my 60's and not in the best of shape. I knew the walk would be a challenge especially since it was hot and sunny. The views were beautiful and well worth the effort. Right before you get to Coogee is the most difficult part with a huge flight of stairs and steep pathways. Some of the walk is very flat and easy to do. There were many joggers running past which was great for the breeze! So, if you are older and out of shape I still would recommend this walk. Take water, a hat, apply sunscreen and just take your time. If possible, chose a cooler day. There are little towns along the way for food, restrooms and where you can stop your walk if you can't make it to Coogee. It was beautiful and highly recommended.
Most scenic walk ever. Perfect for a good stroll which truly defines australia. World class beaches and incredible views. Great outing option for all ages.

Spectacular Walk. This is the best way to spend some time on the weekend or during the week. Great views and a challenging path at times. Beware of joggers they feel this belongs to them and make little effort to share the path.

a wonderful, well documented walk. A well laid out walk covering all the beaches from Bondi to Coogee. Took about 2 hours at average speed (for the older person) Some steeper inclines but nothing serious. Take your time and you will enjoy it.
Amazing walk. A great way to burn a few calories and see some of the beautiful sites in Sydney. The walk isn't too hard or too easy and lets you see a number of the wonderful beaches.

Going on the walk when the "Sculpture by the Sea Bondi, 22 October – 8 November, 2015" is exceptinal.. The Bondi to Coogee walk is wonderful at any time with the possibility of seeing dolphins surfing on the waves or just enjoying the scenery. Walking and saying hello to others on the walk or watching the joggers do what you used to be able to is just as much fun. The Sculpture by the Sea Bondi, 22 October – 8 November, 2015 is not to be missed as there is so much for everyone to see. There are areas for the children to run around as well, so they don't get bored. Lots of exercise and fun and always a great turn out.

Stunning views and a beautiful walk. Well, Sydney beaches are stunning anyway, but the walk around takes you past some fascinating rock formations, snippets of Sydney coastal suburban life, an old cemetery and each beach is different. We only walked as far as Clovelly and then there was a bus to get back to Bondi Junction to get the train back to town
Easy walking with very good view.... I went there with my 70+ parents, they loved the place much.Easy walking path even for elderly.

Lengthy but gorgeous. It's long. Budget at least 2 hours, if not a whole day if you're leisurely sightseeing. If you live nearby, it's a great run. Also, highly recommend good shoes; even if you're a barefoot expert, there are rough points where you'll want even basic flip flops/
Love this walk!. enjoy the great views and fresh air, and get a good stretch at the same time. Grab an ice cream to take in summer.
Dont miss this while visiting Sydney. from historic graveyards to life savers to fab places to eat and then a easy walk with to die for views....why would you miss this walk.

Great walk plus Sculptures if you pick the right week. I have done this walk many times from Bondi to Tamarama. I haven't ever gone the extra distance to Coogee.All the section I've done is totally paved but there are a few sets of steps en route. The views of the ocean out across the rock shelf is wonderful. Tamarama is a seriously sheltered beach and has some great rock pools and places for kids to play. On the return walk to Bondi, you have the wonderful vista of the legendary Bondi beach.If you are going to be in Sydney during the last week of October through to the first week of November there is the added attraction of Sculptures by the Sea and it is FREE.There are a lot more people on the walk when this festival is on, but you have the added benefit of some fun and sometimes quite wonderful sculptures.

The Cinque Terre of Sydney. I have stayed in Coogee about ten times and never discovered this gem. The Fitbit made me do it! So glad glad to walk this path, winding round the cliffs and beaches from Coogee to Bondi( about 6-6.5km) great views of natural wonders and the sticky beak heaven of looking also at interesting and no doubt unaffordable homes! Ok so I was the only girly in about 500 females passed NOT in trainers and leggings, but hey, it's a city walk really! Best thing I've ever done in Sydney.
Very relaxing . This walks a must if your looking for some time out from all your hustle and bustle is recommend this walk it's a longish walk but amazing views that's for sure

Excellent weather, excellent views!. Excellent weather, excellent views!A nice stroll with great views at certain points. If you are lucky, you might even catch sight of whales!Bring drinking water as well as sunblock!
Great Day Walk. Very scenic walk with stunning costal views, great restaurants at either end for a midway stop and plenty of places to stop for a swim to cool off!

A must do. Wonderful walkway linking many of Sydneys best beaches, quite a lot of steps and up and down. Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly and finally to Coogee. Can join the walk at lots of places along the way so no need to do all of it.

lovely views. This walk is amazing if you ever get the chance to try it you must! The views of the water and the rocks are beautiful and! You can also get a good view of the beach too. If by any chance anyone is ever in Sydney, this is a thing they must definitely not miss!
great walk. for anyone traveling in sydney, i would do this walk, great beaches to visit and great walk, takes about 2 hours if you walk slowly to enjoy it all
Never get tired of this walk!. I lived in Sydney and never ever tired of the route from Coogee to Bondi! Definitely my favourite thing to do it Sydney!
Its fun to walk along the cliffs. We started in Bondi beach and walked along the cliffs, it was lots of fun and you can enjoy great views

An unbeatable set of coastal views. Can get a bit crowded at times...so pick your time. Lovely walk and it never fails to please. You really are walking right along the coast...pick your time of year for whales.

this is gorgeous. you can go either way, and at times through the old cemetery you can lose the trail, but just stay along the water's edge. It is well worth doing. It doesn't matter what weather it is, this is amazingly beautiful. Have a coffee and catch a bus at Coogee to get home.
great walk!. Go on the weekdays if possible, otherwise too many people during the weekend. Stop at Clovelly beach and swim or snorkel there. Then eat the the restaurant there.

Great way to explore the eastern suburb beaches. It's always a great way to spend your day, not only for the beauty of the coast but also the cardio workout you put in the walk. For people not too keen about a long walk, you can simply reach Bronte and chill in this beach; buses depart from Bronte back to the City. Make sure rain is not in the radar!

The best view of the beach. If you like walking with a great view the trail between Bondi and Coogee is a must. You will have parts of the trali for your own and also segments where you see nice people. Three hours or a full day you decide. you can cool down in the many beaches along the path, have a coffee or eat in the many places along the trail..To get there ask the concierge at your hotel it is easy. catch a bus or two and you are there!!
Great start to the day. I would recommend you do the walk first thing in the morning and then stop over to one of many café. Have brekky and then continue with the walk. Great start to the day.

Sculptures, Lifesavers and Tombstones. This iconic walk is a must, any time of year but fair weather is best of course. You need to be in reasonable shape to do the whole walk but it is still worthwhile even if you only do part of it. Do it during Oct-Nov to see the famous Sculptures By The Sea but be prepared for heavy crowds and a lack of parking - catch a bus to Bondi or Coogee to start. We have attended the Sculptures event numerous times over consecutive years, we look forward to it every year. Another point of interest is Waverley Cemetery - with it's panoramic views to the sea and some very famous Australian's graves including the poets Henry Lawson, Henry Kendall and Dorothea Mackellar to name a few.Then there are the beautiful houses, stunning views and the 'social pages/trend setting/out to be seen' groovy people doing the very popular section of the walk at Tamarama, AKA 'Glamourama'. You might even spot a celebrity or two. This is classic beachside Sydney. If you're coming to Sydney, you've got to do this walk, especially during the Sculptures exhibition.

Exercise with a view. This is a great way to exercise and see the spectacular coastline for about 7kms. There are stairs as well as flat surfaces all which are paved.mdo it early in the morning and experience a majestic sunrise, have breakfast at the end and if you're up for it walk back!

Glorious Coastal Walk. This is a definite must on a beautiful sunny day in Sydney. If you can possibly visit around the last week of October to mid November you will be able to view our wonderful "Sculptures by the Sea" exhibition. Many unusual works of art are strategically displayed around the walking pathway between Bondi Beach to Coogee Beach. On this walk you will pass by other lovely beaches such as Tamarama, Bronte (take a break at one of the lovely cafes nearby), Clovelly & finally Coogee Beach. There you will find some lovely restaurants & bars to have a delicious meal.Thoroughly worth doing!!!

Peaceful, winding walk. This is a walk gives you a great view of some of Sydney's most iconic beaches and headlands. Long enough to be interesting without the need to be terribly fit. Would highly recommend it.

A lovely walk with fantastic scenery. It's quite a long walk, but if you take your time it's thoroughly enjoyable. There's some amazing scenery along the way. When we got to Coogee we found a fish and chip shop, which was rather expensive but very enjoyable and well deserved after a long walk!!

Mobile devices off- Now look up & breathe!!!. I've lived in Sydney for 20years and whenever I am home I always make sure I find time to do the Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk. I fly for an international airline & I make sure I tell every visitor to make time to enjoy this wonderful easy walk.It will take around 90 minutes at a leisurely pace. Or you can break it up and do an easy 45 minutes from Bondi to Bronte Beach. Or an equally beautiful continuation from Bronte Beach to Coogee passing through one of the oldest cliff top cemeteries in Sydney.Make sure you stop at The Tamarama Beach Cafe halfway along the walk between Bondi & Bronte.& say a g'day to Al who has run the place for well over 20 years, or drop in & see Hannah & the girls at Salinas Cafe Bronte( you must order the crispy corn fritters with a serve of smoked salmon or bacon) wow.. The best!! Not to mention fantastic coffee at either.Oh & at Coogee Beach either at your beginning or end .. Stop or start at Coogee Bites Cafe for great coffee & eats- say hi to the lovely Arki for me.

Bondi to Coogee walk. very scenic view... its a very pleasant walk.. enjoyed.. wish I can go everyday.. we went to Bondi it was a very cold day, and decided to take this walk... which everyone says and I have read so much.. when I actually started walking I was bit afraid of muggers.. however, its pretty safe and was refreshing walk... I wish I can walk everyday as sort of exercise!

Beautiful & A Must Do. Gorgeous walk although challenging at times. If I was doing it again I would bring my bikini and have a swim at icebergs on the way back! I think one day entry for tourists is $6.50- nice even in the winter when it gets quite warm walking along the coast! Plenty of places to rest along the way if you fancy it too. Gorgeous walk all in all!

For the romantic. The sound of the sea and the feel of crisp ocean breeze will take your breath away! The walk requires you to be fit and energetic but plenty of scenic halts on the way that you can enjoy ! Definitely worth it.

Bondi to Bronte Walk - Best in Sydney. This is one of THE great coastal walks on the east coast of Australia. Do it during low tide for the best experience, though. Seriously, this is the second best thing to do when visiting Bondi beach; I consider it a must! Also, its best during late spring - early autumn when you don't need a jacket and you can finish off with a great swim.
Pacific stroll. It's a decent walk - about 5 miles - on an excellent coastal path with great views over the Pacific. Check out the large cemetery on the way...

a definite thing to do. I have undertaken this walk a number of times over the past few years. Best time is part of the Sculpture by the Sea season.Lots of places to stop for a coffee, great views and usually not too many people.
Beautiful walk. Loved the walk.. Gets a bit spooky around the cemetery if you are talking the walk in the later part of the day in winter

.panoramic walk. Start either end, Bondi or Coogee or you can just walk to Bronte beach which is about halfway. Quite a few steps up & down along the way & can be busy with joggers. It's a lovely way to be a bit active then relax at a cafe after for a coffee or a bite to eat. You are spoiled for choice with cafés at Bondi, Bronte, Tamarama & Coogee . You can just do the walk or maybe spend some time ocean gazing from the great rock platforms. Or stop for a swim a.long the way

Beautiful scenic walk. Apart from being a little windy the walk was fantastic. Along the way there were seats to sit on and lots of things to see and do. We were happy doing our walk. I would recommend this to tourist.
Great scenery. Great walk, with plenty to see and do. Can take tour time or do it fast. Stop off for lunch at many different places, at a restaurant or take away.

Beautiful coastal walk. Taking the Bondi to Coogee walk is a must do for anyone visiting Sydney. The eastern suburbs coastline is so beautiful. There are some challenging steps for younger kids but the average family could manage just fine. The coastline is interesting because if the number of coves and beaches along the way, the colour of the sea changing as you move and the small paths that take you all lead to more beauty. You will pass the gorgeous Sydney sandstone, noticing the patterns and shapes this rock forms as you walk from Bondi to Tamarama. Tamarama is a stunning small cove, then leading on to Bronte, a family beach, with cafes strewn along he street leading from it. Onwards to Clovelly, passing a beautiful cemetery, hen up some steep steps to Gordon's Bay, which is a tiny fishing bay. Finally Coogee.... Take a rewarding drink atthe new Coogee Pavilion, very cool place that carts for the smaller kids as well as the bigger ones.

For every Sydney visitor. See the beautiful Sydney coastline from an elevated and well maintained pathway. From the famous (for unknown reasons) Bondi through to the pretty Bronte and on to Coogee Beach. Take your time, stop at a cafe or swim at each beach. Crowded in summer and busy on the weekends, a warm mid-winter day is perfect for this week.A must for every visitor to Sydney.

Stunning views. Firstly I would suggest that if you are a visitor to the area, Coogee would be the better option for accommodation. Coogee has more of a village feel about it. This walk is fantastic. We walked from Coogee to Bondi and back again. We did this mid week and the walkway was not busy.A must do activity!!

Excellent way to see the coast of Sydney. Great way to see and observe the coast of Sydney, great views and also good when the Sculptures by the Sea is on, low impact walking, not suitable for wheelchairs, and coffee shops at either end, perfect for a day out in Sydney

Walk the Walk, see the Pacific Ocean and Enjoy!. One of the best coastal walks in the Sydney area is the Coogee Beach Coastal walk-to Bondi Beach- that great and famous surfing and swimming beach just a few kilometres from the heart of the beautiful city of Sydney- or in reverse, Bondi to Coogee, and annually there is a sculpture exhibition along this walk in summer which attracts hundreds if not thousands of spectators who enjoy the exhibits and the walk as well! Pick a nice sunny day and you will be thoroughly swept away by the beauty and the magnificence of this free offering.!
Never to miss. If you don't do this walk sydney trip isn't complete , try to streams to maroubra , great winter weather now. Stop in bronze for breakfast and continue

Breathtaking walk. I love this walk! Take your time and enjoy the many vistas on the way. I love to stop for coffee at Tamarama and a swim at bronte sometimes another coffee from Jenny's there. If you want to park car at Clovelly you can walk towards bondi passing bronte then Tamarama and on to bondi. Then turn around And enjoy the view the other way

Great way to enjoy the coast and sun with some exercise. We love this walk, although we mostly walk from Bondi to Bronte, have brunch then head back. A November visits ill mean you may catch Sculptures by the Sea which is worth a walk but keep it to early morning due to the crowds.

Stunning walk - a must do!. Every local and every visitor should do this walk along the coastline. It is simply breathtaking. It takes about 2-hours at a leisurely pace. Note there are some steep steps along the way but on the whole it is not strenuous and there are plenty of places to rest. You will go past Tamarama and Bronte Beaches before you get to Coogee. The Bondi to Tamarama section of the walk in October/November is a highlight for the Sculpture by the Sea annual event but it can get crowded particularly on weekends.

Great walk on a good day. What a spectacular walk. Have done this walk in full and in smaller sections a number of times and best on a cool sunny day for the entire length. In summer you can break up the walk with a swim or snorkel at any of the beaches and coves along the way.

A must for Sydney visitors. This walk is fantastic no matter what the weather. In fact it probably is more exciting in wild weather. There are magnificent sea and cliff views, but also the chance to "people watch" on the other walkers or joggers and to have a look at some pretty nice houses along the way. It would be even better if there were a few coffee carts strategically placed. It is, however, quite demanding physically. People with mobility problems will be able to do part of the walk but may struggle with the stairs and steep paths.
Sydney's Best Coastal Walk. Bondi to Coogee or return is simply beautiful or you can just do part of the walk. Fabulous scenery and very popular so can get busy on weekends. Beautiful anytime.

Wonderful Sydney sight!. I love doing this walk especially with friends on a lovely sunny day. I would recommend wearing joggers or walking shoes rather than sandals. The views from this walk showcase off some of the best coastline in Sydney!

Best walk. An incredible walk in any weather - maybe better to start at Coogee end and finish in Bondi. Budget about 45 mins from Coogee to Bondi - free filter water fountains along the way (Tamara maybe)

Beautiful views with every turn. Started the walk on a slightly drizzly day at Bondi. Weather cleared up quickly and soon we were in awe of all the sights. Each turn along the coastline rewarded us with a brand new spectacular view. Took about 2 hours to complete and got tiring closer to the end but worth it. Spend a bit of time at Waverly Cemetery - the best lookout point of the walk.

Experience the Best of Sydney's Eastern Beachs. This is a must-do for any tourist to Sydney who is not afraid of a decent 5km walk. For those less energetic, stopping at Bronte is an option. You'll experience magnificent beach & ocean views with plenty of stopping points along the way for pictures and/or refreshments.

A "must-do" if time permits in Sydney. There are so many ways to enjoy the coastal walk - walking,running or jogging,taking as much time as you want. Even if your time is limited,a couple of hours should do some of the trick. The start of the walk is easily reached in either direction by Sydney public transport.There are many glorious highlights along the way and plenty of refuelling stops adding to the breathtaking beach and swimming opportunities that abound. If there is a more beautiful location to play lawn bowling than Clovelly Bay Bowling Club,I have yet to have the pleasure of coming upon it.The welcome provided by them suggests that the Australian bowling community are imbued with the same spirit of cordiality and fellowship as in my native Scotland.Perhaps the greatest aspect of the walk is the love of the local community for their beautiful surroundings which they embrace with gusto and in full measure.Try to ensure you do not miss your opportunity to share if only for a short while,in their bounteous good fortune.
Great ocean view. Did a walk from Bondi to Bronte beach as it could take a while longer to reach Coogee beach. The view was great and different from the harbour view in Sydney.

A stunning coastal walk that showcases our beautiful coastline. A group of friends and I met up early on a Sunday morning and had a leisurely breakfast on the boardwalk before setting off to do the Sculpture by the Sea walk along the cliff tops, it was a stunning day. This walk is beautiful at any time of the day or year and easy to get to on public transport as parking can be hard to find.

Stunning. My partner and did this walk on the. The views are stunning. The walk is quite easy, there are a few areas with steps but we walked past an elderly couple who looked around 70 and they managed the stairs with no problem. A definite must if visiting Sydney.

Invigorating and Beautiful. I have done this walk from Coogee to Bondi by myself early during the week as on the weekend there is an endless row of walkers, runners and doggies heading both ways.But if done early there is less human traffic. Also it does get quite hot during the mid morning in summer, so be sure to take hat and water. Also,there are a few steps to tackle, some quite steep! But worth the effort, just take it slowIt is just a glorious start to the day, the beautiful view of ocean and coast is so easy to take in and enjoy. At either end you will find lots of good places to sit and have coffee, breakfast or lunch makes this a really enjoyable walk !
lovely stroll. I was not impressed with Bondi beach, too much expectations probably. Walking around the cliffs, that was very nice especially at sunset.

Sydney's secret - swimming pools at the beach. This is a very "Sydney" thing to do - take a walk along our Magnificent coastline.There are limited facilities along the route, except at each beach there are cafes and restaurants... perfect for a day combining lazy indulgence and good exercise.But go just a little further south than Coogee for the best experience... the famous Wylie's baths. A small entrance fee gets you change rooms, shade (in summer) and an uncrowded pool for swimming laps. You can even get a massage here.

Bondi to Coogee coastal walk. June '14 the last time I've done this walk in whole, though ive walked it in parts heaps and in whole-meaning from bondi to coogee a few times.a great walk can be done by anyone who can walk. Even the stone steps which there are a few aren't aa problem you just walk at your pace . The path is as easy as to walk and the view is magnificent like the end of the earth and factually you are on the edge of the earth. Seeing no end to the ocean yonder. A great day out and makes you feel alive. If the walk isn't enough well along the way there are exercise implements if you want to stretch or pull your own weight. You can stop off at the beaches in between from Bondi to Coogee for a rest, coffee or a swim & icecream if its hot. And there's a cafe restaurant at Clovelly-you can feel you're somewhere else rather than just in Sydney. Those beaches are Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly then Coogee. Where you can get the bus back to Bondi Junction. If you walked the walk without stopping it's about a 40 min walk..it just depends how often you stop-to take photos perhaps or what pace you do. A visitor should do this and see our beautiful land and if you live here its a must. And be proud of our beautiful city.
No better way to introduce friends to Sydney. Must be the best walk in Sydney, so beautiful, and you will alsays see smiling happy faces. A great way to show travellers around the East.
Views Aplenty. Worth doing this walk. Many good places to stop for photos along the way. Bring your camera, sun block and water.

A beautiful coastal walk on a sunny day. Winter or summer this is a very pleasant cliff top walk from Bondi to Coogee. I would have rated this a 5 except there are stairs to climb not many but enough if you have issues with stairs. Take it slowly and you will make it.The best time to do the walk is when Sculpture By the Sea is on (from October 22 - Nov 8, 2015). The weather is generally bright and sunny with over 100 sculptures placed along the walkway, with a back drop of beaches and ocean, simply stunning.Or just have a stroll along the walk anytime as long as it not inclement weather.Stop over for coffee at Tamarama Beach then lunch at the various restaurants and bars off Coogee Beach on the parade.It's then just a casual walk back to your car or public transport at Bondi

Great view pleasant exercise . You'll enjoy the 1-1.5hours walk no matter you are with friends or by yourself. The ocean views, the neighbourhood, the people, and the sand stones. You'll never be bored walking and seeing with those. It's good to walk in a sunny morning or afternoon, and you can stop for a coffee or fresh juice on the way, shops just on the street's side. Ware comfort clothes and have a coastal walk.
Great way to spend a morning. This is a great thing to do on a sunny day . The views are spectacular and there are plenty of places to stop for a coffee or some food .

Easy and Enjoyable walk.. This is a wonderful walk not just for tourists but locals alike, you really don't get sick of the scenery. There are plenty of opportunities to take a little break and enjoy the many restaurants & cafe's.However I feel one of the best times to do this walk is when "Sculpture by the Sea" is on, this year it is from 22nd October to the 8th November, yes there will be a lot more people but it is well worth it. Choose a weekday if you can and miss the the worst.

Energy boosting on a sunny day. You can step onto and off the path at various locations for a break or shorter walk. There are cafes sprinkled along the journey and the path intersects with Sydney Buses a number of times if the weather changes or you do not have the time to complete the whole Walk.To take out the vertical challenge of Gordon's Bay, you can park at Clovelly easily and walk onto Bondi from there!

One of the world's great walks. This eight kilometre stretch of coastline is simply beautiful. That it sits just a short drive from Sydney's CBD is even more incredible. The path features spectacular views, several famous and iconic beaches - Bondi, Tamarama, Clovelly and Coogee. Lots of places to stop and sit, water taps, exercise stations and cafes if you want a break before you turn around. It is as good a workout as you can get as you look out at stunning very Australian seascapes.

Scenic and Refreshing. Its a great walk specially early in the morning. You can start it from either end then then return half way through if you don't want to taken the bus back to the car park.I loved it,
A must do in Sydney!. If you have the time, this is a must do walk! Beautiful scenery...one of the best walks in Sydney!!!

Stunning views. This is one of my favourite outdoor activities to do in Sydney. The views are fantastic and it offers a good level of challenge with some hills and stairs. My only advice is if you are planning on doing it on the weekend, go early as it can become very crowded.
Great walk. Really interesting walk along the ocean front. A few stairs but not particularly arduous. Worth it for the views
Just a great activity.. Do plan to go early in the morning. It can get a bit hot if you don't. This is an amazing walk and we really enjoyed all it had to offer.
Well worth it. Such a nice walk next to the coast! Plenty of little towns on the way to Coogee with plenty to see and do.
very relax day.. easy way to go thru. nice sightseeing around. very long way, but worth it. good way to keep in shape.

Nice scenic walk, great at sunset. I have done the walk both ways and they are equally as good. Normally Coogee to Bondi is better for transport, but there are buses available to CBD from Coogee too. Take plenty of water as it does get hot and there are a big set of stairs walking to Coogee which take it out of you!
Great Scenery. Even if you can't do the whole walk, you have to at least walk by part of it, since it is really gorgeous and one of the nicest coastl walks I have seen so far!

Walk it in the other direction. We went from Coogee to Bondi and were happy we did. In that direction, you avoid some uphill stairs, you come at some key sights from what I think is a better angle, and you end at the Icebergs pool - great for post-walk swimming and beer. The views are just as beautiful as everyone says. The one drawback, if you can call it that, is that I thought it would be much easier to stop for food and drinks, but with a few exceptions, that really involves leaving the walk and going into nearby towns. Not that that would be at all hard to do - i just mean you aren't passing cafes as I imagined might be the case. There ARE are plenty of places along the way to get free filtered water. Took us about three hours to do this walk. Was easy to get out to Coogee on the 373 (or any bus starting with 37). One of our favorite things we did in Sydney.

Great coastal walk. We did it from Coogee to Bondi on Sunday. It was busy with walkers, joggers and families but all very civilized. You can get to either Bondi or Coogee on a bus from the city or Bondi Junctiion, so no need for a car. It's a great way to be active and see the coastline.

Scenic long walk. It was a scenic walk along the coast of Bondi to Cogee. You will enjoy the beauty all through the route. Stop at few locations, where you can see the fantastic views of the cliffs, beaches and of course for a beer or coffee. Do not expect the walk on a plain road. There will be some rocky places, where you need to climb through stairs and you have adequate toilets en-route. My suggestion is to start your walk from Coogee to Bondi. Take some time to enjoy the walk and end up in Bondi for a drink to relish the day.Happy walking.

finish your walk with a ferry ride to cbd from watsons bay. we want to thank a recent reviewer for suggesting a great loop for this walk. we took bus 373 from cbd on elizabeth street to coogee beach...a good way to see other areas of sydney. the walk from coogee to bondi beach was beautiful but crowded because it was a sunday. from campbell parade in bondi we caught the 380 bus to watsons bay and then a ferry back to circular quay. it was a wonderful way to finish the day and watsons bay was fun as well. ferries from watsons bay run all day only on saturdays and sundays so, unfortunately you have to deal with the crowds unless you complete your loop by early afternoon.
Love love love. The best place to be! The views are amazing! You even [put up with the joggers who think they own the palce ;)

Somewhat disappointed. Given the hype about this walk I must say we were a little disappointed. Yes, there are some lovely views but it's not all coastal and you end up going inland and walking along some streets. Quite a lot of stairs and it's further than you think! We stopped at a nice cafe in a cove for a quick toastie half way along. We took the bus all the way to Bondi from Sydney Central Quay area and got a different bus back from Coogee. There is a map online which gives you an outline of the walk and the distances for each section.

Lovely coastal beach walk best suited to those who are reasonably fit. I have made this walk a couple of times and in different seasons. I think the most pleasant times are the warmer seasons as there can be quite a breeze that blows off the ocean. There is a lot of up and down and stairs, so that's why I think it would be best suited to those with reasonable fitness levels. (It is easily at least 1.5 hrs) There are different beaches and some cafes etc, that you can stop off at along the way, but they are at specific spots (Bronte, Tamarama etc.) so they are not all along the trail.It is a beautiful walk and seeing the cemetery along the walk is surprising.Take water and a wind proof jacket with you and maybe some snacks to keep your energy levels up and finish off with a meal and/or icecream/drinks etc, at Coogee or Bondi - where there are lots of options.

Don't forget this during your trip to the city!. I LOVED this. It's a 1.5-2 hour hike from Coogee to Bondi beach or visa versa, along the coast with one after another outstanding views of the city and the surrounding cliffs. On a beautiful day it's unbelievable.
Fun and fascinating. We walked, ate and talked as we watched the many people and sports activities going on. The beach is fascinating, a bit windy, but of course, it's a beach!

Favourite walk on a sunny day. This is a great walk round the coast with lots of interesting places to stop off and have a rest if you want. You will see some of the beaches that the locals go to that are not quite as famous as Bondi.

Bondi-Coogee coastal walk. Walk along the coastline for 3 hours (return trip), or maybe do just a section of it. There are coffee shops & toilets at several spots along the way, even a club to get a beer. There a a few spots where the walk is more difficult as you have to climb a few stairs, or hills, but they are not too bad.

Australia's famous Beach was picking up the piece after a big storm. We got to Sydney the afternoon after one of the biggest storms in years. They had much of the beach covered in heavy equipment trying to get the beach sand BACK on the beach. Regardless it was still an awesome walk and area to visit with great surfing. It is absolutely worth the visit as you can get some great picture during your walk.

Glorious Views - Lovely easy walk. Absolutely fantastic walk! It is not a tiring nor testing wlak it is particularly easy and generally flat walk around the coast with a few stairs or inclines along the way. Fantastic opportunity to see the coastal sides and visit the natual beach side pools.Definitely a must for anybody visiting Sydney

Fantasic walk. This is a greAt walk to do to experience the coastline between Bondi and coogee. It's a well marked path with plenty of stop off points. Lonely planet gives a great step by step route itinerary.

One of the best oceans walks in the world!. This is probably my favorite oceanside walks anywhere in the world I have been. Easy walking and beautiful scenery. It's especially nice during the annual "Sculpture by the Sea" event. During this time you will find fabulous artwork lining the path. I love to stop at Tamarama Beach along the way.

Great walk to chill near the sea. This coastal walk was really stunning with great views of the sea, rock formations, fresh air, it's just nice. If you are in Bondi/cogee and you are not in a rush, my advice is do it!!

Walk Coogee to Bondi. We walked this from Coogee to bondi and def better. Have brekky in Coogee then walk the track along this spectacular piece of coastline. Bondi itself is bit of a let down after the scenes at Bronte and other bays along the way.
cool climate beach. Usually beach are worm or hot, but Bondi beach is cooler, so I can long time for swim, to walk around it or just sitting on the sands..There was already afternoon tends night..
Simply stunning. Absolutely gorgeous walk, when I went it was blowing a gale but that didn't detract from the beauty of the coastline. About 5km from Bondi to Coogee one way so around 1.5 hr walk
You must do it. very beautiful walk, especially when the weather is nice. You can't leave from Sydney without have done this.

One of my favourite ways to spend a morning . Such an amazing view and a great way to get some exercise.Can get really busy at peak times so I tend to get up for sunrise and run then. Location for Sculptures by the Sea, which is even busier still! Worth putting up with the crowds though.

Beautiful walk. I did the Coogee to Bondi walk one day in early May and my only regret is that I didn't do it sooner!Such a lovely walk with loads of beautiful beaches and hidden spots to see. Took me about 2.5 hours, a little longer than it should but why would you want to rush it?Highly recommended.

A visit is not complete without doing this walk. A fantastic walk in the sunshine taking in some amazing coastal views. Walk from Bondi as far as you like to Bronte- with their tasty breakfasts, or further to Tamarrama or even Coogee.Keep your eyes peeled for a pod of dolphins or if you get very lucky even whales as they make their way up and down the coast (May-November).About a two hour walk depending on pace and how many places you stop in to visit or take in the views.If needed you can get a bus back, but recommend walking back the other way!

One of our favorite memories of Sydney!. Easy walking with a paved trail (but lots of stairs to climb). The sandstone rock has beautiful striations and has been sculpted by the elements into interesting shapes. Many of the beaches along the way provide washrooms and water fill-up stations. One of our favorite memories of Sydney!

Take Your Time and Take in the Scenery. We have done this walk several times, and in both directions. As we do not live in Sydney we generally book into the Coogee Crowne Plaza for a couple of nights as our focus centres around The Sculptures By The Sea exhibition, which I feel enhances the overall impact of this walk. Admittedly, there are far more people on the walk during this time of year, but obviously the crowds are between Bondi and Tamarama.Irrespective, the walk itself affords spectacular views, it is not difficult, with well constructed walkways, very safe to negotiate. Whilst there a few reasonably steep gradients, the key is to take your time and soak up the magnificent scenery.Numerous places to refresh yourself at either end of the walk. Additionally, as we have done we stop at the Seasalt Café overlooking Clovelly Beach. Alternatively, Bronte offers plenty of options for food and other refreshments.For anyone visiting Sydney, this is a very worthwhile experience to enjoy. Public transport from the city is easy. The Coastal Walk is well worth the effort.
Start at coogee. Make sure you finish at icebergs or the rsl next door to it. Can get frustrating with lots of runners or rude people in your way. But chill out and enjoy the beautiful scenery.

Stunning views. A fabulous and relatively easy walk. Can do it either way starting at Bondi or at Coogee. Quite a few steps along the way so not for bicycles or prams. Take an empty water bottle and fill up with filtered water along the way to hydrate - especially in summer. Love the board walk past the cemetery jutting out into the ocean. Gordons Bay is the jewel in the crown. Cafes at all the beaches along the way and start and finish. Highly recommended.

Spectacular views all the way. You can start from Coogee and see how far your legs will take you or, as I've done before, park in the Clovelly carpark and go from there (either way). A good place to stop is the Tamarama cafe which serves nice coffee and fresh food. It's a wonderful walk with breathtaking views. We recently finished at Coogee and had lunch at the Pavilion which has a great vibe and fabulous fresh food.

Nice way to get a bit of exercise. This is a easy walk, great for a walk & talk. Can be done at an easy pace to to run. Always calming walking and looking out at th ocean. We walked at dusk and it was cool and great to see/ feel the night enclose on you and the lights of Bondi twinkle as the moon rose.
Spectacular views, great hike.. All paved paths although there are quite a few steps. But all worth the effort for the beautiful views of the sea and surrounding towns
A beautiful walk. Took the bus to Coogee and did the walk backwards.A super easy walk - not too much uphill and lots of seats all along the way!

Stunning. The coastal walk is by far one of the most beautiful spots in Sydney.The views are breathtaking, no need to have great physical preparation. There is drinkable water at many spots all the way.

Cheap touristic activity. This is an anything-activity; mornings or afternoon. You can take it as far as you want or have shorter routes. Wonderful way to experience the sun/sea in Sydney. You can stop in Bondi/ Tamarama/ Clovelly or Coogee for snacks / coffees. Recommend to start from Coogee and finish at Bondi for better restaurant options and public transport

How to get there and back by public transport. We got the train to Bondi Jct, and then caught the 333 bus at stand A3, which took us straight to Bondi beach. The stand for the bus is within the station.From Bondi it was a lovely 2hr scenic walk. Very crowded on the weekend so hopefully better during the week. A few water fountains along the journey too.At Coogee we caught the 314 bus opposite Mcdonald's, which took us back to Bondi Junction, where we then got the train back into town.
great walk. Great views along the clifts. can get busy particularly from Bondi to Bronte but worth doing. take snorkel gear for Coogee Beach
Just do it!. About 2 hour walk with lots of stopping along the way. Gorgeous! Be sure to get a celebratory cocktail at Coogee Pavilion when you finish the walk in Coogee Beach
Spectacular!. I like walking and this coastal walk provides is stunning and suitable for any age. Try to catch lunch or a drink at The Iceberg along your way.

Tourists? You must try this.. Firstly, I would suggest the reverse way of going ie, Coogee to Bondi as there are faster and more varied transport options available for tourists. This cliff side walk is spectacular and will show you part of Sydney that many never see. Wear comfortable shoes and reward yourself with food and drinks at the Bondi end. The best time to do this is in the A.M. As early as suits you.

Aussie lifestyle. Australia is well know for its weather and its beaches.This is a fine introduction to both,a easy scenic walk for all ages ,great scenery over looking the beaches and surf and the beautiful people on the beach.Take your time and enjoy.

A nice stroll. We had a nice stroll and took some pics. It was a weekday - just before midday - so we didn't encounter huge crowds others have spoken of during weekends. The walk is nice, the view nice, but is this really Sydney's top attraction? I'm puzzled as to why someone named "Andrew" is detailed here on TA as the "OWNER"... This needs to be corrected by TA. This is public land, managed by state and local goverments. Just because this "Andrew" character runs some sort of tour business does not give him the right to answer any reviews of people who did not participate in one of his tours. This is public land - accessible by anyone!

Walking through ancient rocks. Back to nature, within this huge City, this walk provides many photo opportunities for even the most amateur snapper to capture a glimpse of nature at it's purest. Look over cliffs to the bluest seas, and white fluffy caps of the waves, notice the soft colours of the rocks, trickling with water, and touched with moss and ferns, this walk is time to peace out, and look at beauty surrounding you.

A fun walk for all abilities. I regularly do this walk as I'm sure the locals do every day.You don't have to start at Bondi or Coogee as there are a number of beaches/access points along the way, eg I normally cut through Waverly cemetary (which also has histocric graves & the Irish Martyrs memorial).Bathrooms are available for free at all the beaches but remember they are "public" so sometimes not fantatsic.Reasonable restaurants at all the beaches but get dearer the closer you get to Bondi.Bring a hat & a bottle of water.
Walk in the winter sun. Excellent walk from coogee to bondi, one of the best walks in Sydney. Boardwalks, stairs and the lovely beaches of the east side.

Well worth the effort. This 8km walk takes a little bit of effort in places but is well worth it for the views and you can break it up into sections if you don't want to do it in one go, there are lovely restaurants in Coogee to reward you at the end

Scenic walk with the hoarde. Early morning walk with friends starting at Coogee and doing the return trip. Extremely popular and scenic walk - love it when the Sculpture by the Sea is on too! Don't forget the camera There are beaches to stop off at if the number of people on the walk is overwhelming and heaps of cafes to enjoy at the end, middle or start of your walk. This isn't just a fitness walk but a social experience too

reconnecting with the sea. great view and varied pathways! Nice on a slightly warm day, good on a hot day to stop for a swim in one of the many bays you pass on the way. It's so popular probably good to get there a little early when it's not so busy.

This is Sydney!. Stunning walkway hugging the coastline and beaches from famous Bondi beach to Bronte and further if you desire. On a gorgeous day the sea sparkles and is bluer than blue. Sun, sand, fresh air, inspiration is all around you. A moody day is equally impressive watching the waves crash to shore and the surfers doing their best. You can usually find a car spot (metered of course) and public transport from city or Bondi Junction shopping centre works well too. Start and stop wherever you like and plenty of places to sit and admire the view. Cafes and parks at each beach. Lots of joggers, walkers and tourists but path is wide. There are steps here and there but also good stretches prams and wheelchairs can do. If you are a visitor to Sydney you must head to the beaches to experience a major part of Sydney life. This is an excellent option.
“Great place for a quick visit”. 2 hours walks several stops and great views, It's good to take some snacks and water, you will find good restaurants where you can get lunch or dinner.
sea the sea walk. walking at a slow pace enjoy wonderful views stop at cafes, eat be lovely on a sunny day best walk in Sydney

Exercise and sightseeing in one!. Brilliant walk especially if you can catch it on a clear day. Amazing views along the coast and plenty of god stop off points with the beaches and cafes/ restaurants. Bring a good pair of shoes and enjoy!

Brilliant sightseeing in Sydney. This walk is the most scenic fitness test for you. It hugs the coast all the way to Bondi. You see the beauty of the cliffs, the beaches, the picturesque suburbs and much more. Walk it!

You shouldn't miss this for the world!. What can I say? Absolutely stunning! The walk for almost three hours was worth it! You'll see very very nice views. The beaches, the coastal lines, the villages and the whole surrounding was just so amazing. Perfect maybe during sunrise/sunset but you can do it anytime of the day!

Now that's a walk.... Great way to spend a few hours, can be a workout or leisurely walk...totally up to you. There are endless photo opportunities here and plenty of spots for a rest or dip.A there and back stroll takes about 3 hours given stops etc but it's a walk you'll remember.

Spectacular!!. No visitor to Sydney should be allowed to leave before doing this walk. You don't need to do the whole length. Start and finish where you like - but just do it! There are a few steps and inclines, but don't let the frail or youthful be put off. Take a water bottle - you may need a rest if it's sunny. Quintessentially Sydney - the ocean, the surf, the beach and the people - experience them all, up close and personal. It's spectacular!

A great walk for all ages with spectacular views all along. There are many sections of this walk that can be done for shorter lengths. I used to live near the walk at Clovelly and my favourite section is from Clovelly to Coogee, with a great open area over the headland, where I used to fly kites with my kids when they were very young. Or you can walk alone near the barrier and stare out to sea, with the city behind you and imagine yourself out on the ocean. Even with storms raging, if you dress appropriately for the weather, it is a spectacular coastal walk.

Stroll by the ocean. What can you say? Not difficult terrain to walk, but providing a series of wonderful views , both of the individual sandy beaches, the enthusiastic surfers, and of course the ever-changing ocean beyond.

Great walk with amazing views of the coast!. If you're looking for a little exercise or just a nice stroll along the coast, this walk is perfect! Easy for kids but may be a little tough for the elderly with the stairs, etc. You can't go wrong with any of the beaches!

Sydney as advertised. As mentioned by other traveler, the view is really amazing. I was walk the other way around from Cooge to Bondi. The route is easy, with some stairs, but nothing serious. I walked it easily less than 2 hours with many stop in between. This was my route (take around 4hours in total - exclude lunch and bus waiting time): 1. Go to museum station (one of the station in SYD CBD area), get out at liverpool street and wait for the 373 bus to Cooge beach - you can't miss the beach, it's huge, take appr. 30 minutes (cost around AUD 3.6 - please check if you need to buy prepaid card first on weekday)2. Walk down along the coastal walk - you will start from "east coastal walk" in Cooge, all the way to Bondi (stick to the path, you wouldn't get loss), take some stops, especially at the cemetery, the view to the beach is amazing. The weather was a bit chilled, and the water is freezing, but there was a lot of sunshine with no clouds at all. It's Sydney at it best. Arrive at Bondi, you can try the legendary "Hurricane" restaurant, the most delicious rib in Sydney (even Australia, or possibly the best in the world :))3. Take bus 380 to Watson Bay - make sure they go to Watson Bay, as not all 380 bus go there - walk a bit, have a fish and chip, visiting library and church. It cost you around AUD 3 and appr. 15-20 minutes from Bondi beach to here4. Take ferry back to Circular quay - around AUD6, 20 minutes - if you can stand the wind, stay outside of the ferry and take a lot of picture for Syd Opera house and harbour bridge. Alternatively you can take bus back, but it will take longer with the traffic (could up to 1 hour)5. Get off from Ferry and walk to the Sydney opera house and botanical garden all the way to Macquarie chair, domain, hyde park and finish either in St James station or Museum station. If you art lover, you can visit "art museum of NSW" at the domain, I skipped it this time. Enjoy beautiful Sydney.

There and back in an afternoon and Wonderland to boot. Had to see the Wonderland filming location so caught a cab direct to Coogee Beach from the airport. Walked just half an hour or so to Sea Salt Café (that needs a separate review!!!) and then continued the next 90 minutes to Bondi. Not the bluest or warmest day but the coastal walk was stunning nevertheless. Had planned to cab it back to Coogee Beach but walked the back roads instead. Although shorter and quicker going back it was up and down so pretty stuffed that night. Slept well though!

A must do!!. I've done this walk three times and really enjoyed it every time! It is fairly long so I'd recommend some good shoes and plenty of water and sun screen! And take a camera there's some great places for photos!

Best walk ever. We come to Australia twice a year since our son, daughter in law and two youngest grandchildren live here. Our favorite activity is this walk. It never disappoints! Beautiful views, great exercise, and terrific people watching. We always hear a great variety of languages and see people from all over the world. Everyone is very friendly.

Great ocean view. this is a spectacular walk with great views of the ocean. Paved walkway with some Streep areas so you need to be reasonably fit. Best direction is Coogee to Bondi and take I a drink at the boat club just before the beach. Food and drink at good price and you can watch the surfers from the veranda. Take ID to gain access.

Watch out for those sea breezes!. A wonderful, relaxing but invigorating stroll taht will take you past some beautiful scenery, hardcore surfers and cool as you please beach houses. But when the wind blows - hold onto your hat.. literally!

WHAT A VIEW!. Amazing walk on the side of the ocean; if you are enough lucky to be there around November, you'll be able to see "Sculpture by the sea", a 2km long temporary sculpture park featuring over 100 sculptures by artists from Australia and across the world.

A great walk take your swimming gear.. The walk is easy enough and you get great views. We took the 378 bus to Coogee and walked to Bondi then got the bus to Watsons Bay had fish n chips at Doyles then ferry back to Circular Quay.

Amazing Coastal Walk. Amazing views of waves crashing over rocks on shore, beautiful sand beaches between headlands, lovely little cafes along the way, surfers out in the water. Loved every minute of this walk and then had a great time swimming at Bondi Beach. Highly recommend!

Exceeded my high expectations!. I've done coastal walks all over the world--from Northern Ireland to Big Sur. So I thought I knew what to expect by this coastal walk. Not so. Bondi to Coogee is exceptional.The views are consistently spectacular. You walk from one beach to another to another to another. Each is just as spectacular as the previous one with its own distinct feel/character. You also pass by some pools, which are beautiful and open to the public. The terrain involves some moderate ups and downs, but it is not overly strenuous. You could probably complete the entire walk in a few hours, but I took a more leisurely pace. It took me all day because I stopped at each beach, had lunch, and swam in the pool beside Bondi Beach. The "trail" is mostly paved or otherwise improved. It's easily accessible from Sydney, and I highly recommend doing it. Everwhere you turn, you get a beautiful view.
Great trial walk. One of the best places I haveEver been to. Especially if you like outdoor activities. awesome views in many locations. Best with friends and family for a leisure walk

One of the best beach walks in the world.. I so love this beach walk - one of the best in the world.The view is spectacular and a brilliant introduction to Sydney. Refreshing, invigorating, and joy for the eyes.

Nice bit of exercise and great views. Have done this walk and shorter one to bronte - both really good . You can stop off in bronte for a quick drink to break up the walk. It's quite hilly in places and plenty of steps and best to wear comfy shoes
just wonderful. This is a picturesque walk and an easy work, so anyone could do it. Then at the end we had lunch at the Bondi Pavillion
What a lovely walk and a great way to see the beaches. We did this fantastic walk on Easter Monday with friends ending with drinks at Bondi. Its well worth the effort.

Lovely coastal walk. We got the 373 from central Sydney to Coogee, walked to Bondi along the path before another bus to Watson's Bay. That was easy, quick and cheap.The walk goes through a variety of coastal scenery and along the edge of small and large coves, even a cemetery at one point. An interesting stroll through Sydney's beach culture and scenery.It is a pretty tamed footpath with boardwalks and tarmac for much of it, and as such suitable for all sort of groups. There are a fair number of steps so not for wheelchairs.There are a number of places to swim or stop for a coffee,
Good short coastal walk. Good half day excursion from Sydney, some lovely coves and sea views, don't bother with the explorer buses, just use the ordinary ones.
Best thing to do in Sydney!. Had a great time doing this. Heard great things about it and it lived up to its expectations! Def the best thing to do in Sydney! Even if it is raining!!
Breathtaking. One of the best walks in the world! Stunning coastal walk combined with urban Sydney vibe. Always notice something new
A Must.. Brilliant, beautiful, stunning this walk is a must to do on a visit to Sydney. Views are superb clear water and a relatively easy track to walk.
Another bucket list item. A series of amazing walks that are good even if it is raining.Lots of places to grab coffee at Bronte, Bondi or Glammeramer.Highly recommended.

One of Sydney's best attractions. The best route to walk and talk with a friend or lover. Fresh Pacific breezes, gorgeous on a sunny day, dramatic on a stormy one. You can't go wrong, particularly if you stop for coffee in Tamarama, and a swim at Clovelly.

Awesome - an absolute must do!!. I cannot recommend this highly enough - you can't visit Sydney and not do this! We caught the train to Bondi Junction then hopped on a bus to Bondi Beach. What a beautiful beach - it was a lovely warm sunny day and the beach was packed! We walked down the end and climbed over the rocks - stunning views! Then we went for a swim - just gorgeous! Great facilities - large changing rooms/toilets and lockers for hire. Lots of cafes and outdoor eating. This is where Bondi Rescue (TV program) is filmed so was great to see where it was filmed. Then we started the walk. Wow where do I start - the walkway itself is great - and the bays and beaches just beautiful. But the stunning coastline just takes your breath away - looks just like the Mediterranean! It takes approximately two hours - 6km but longer if you stop for lunch or to swim along the way. Great facilities - toilets, cafes.....the iconic old cemetery on a cliff overlooking the sea is priceless. The track can be difficult in parts with lots of steps - no good for wheelchairs or pushchairs unfortunately. We did see a few pushchairs but what a pain! It's an extremely popular walk - lots of people walking both ways. We were lucky with the day - it was just stunning! We finished off at Coogee Beach - another beautiful beach - and had to have another swim as soooo hot! Then we caught the bus back to Bondi Junction and the train back to our hotel. Can't recommend it highly enough - do it!!!!

Coogee to Bondi(walk) to Watson's Bay(bus) to Circular Quay (ferry). We caught a 373 bus from outside museum train stn and were at Coogee Beach 31 minutes later. A beautiful iconic beach with paved and grassed areas. The coastal walk is signposted but hard to miss anyway, looking directly at the ocean, head to the left and up over the hill. 6km of up and down, around into small bays each unique and charming. Bondi beach is another beautiful bay with sand, surf and lifesavers.From the beachfront(on the shops side of the road) we caught the 380 bus(not all 380 go to Watsons Bay,so make sure it says Watsons Bay on the front) and headed for Watsons Bay. I was told you must have fish and chips at Doyles Watsons Bay. Looking at tripadvisor it gets mixed reviews and wonder if its because there are 2 locations. Doyle's on the wharf and Doyle's Restaurant on the beach. We went to the restaurant (hopping off the bus at the terminus we walked down towards the water, turned right at the beachfront. We had a lovely meal with a fantastic view of Sydney across the harbour.From there we walked down to the wharf and caught a ferry back to Circular Quay, enjoying another view of the harbour. It was a lovely way to do our own tour, with many highlights.
Breathtaking views. I would actually suggest doing the reverse of this walk and walking from Coogee to Bondi. This is what we did and it was simply awesome.

One of the best things to do in Sydney. A great walk with spectacular views.We are Sydney locals that been doing the Sydney Coastal Trek in stages. This is a good part of it. If you like this, you'll also love the section from Kurnell to Cronulla.

Sampling Sydney's beaches. This walk allows you to see some of the smaller beaches in the area. Bronte beach is beautiful. There's also a cemetery facing the ocean that is just great for sunset shots. I'd say this walk is a must if you're visiting Sydney.

Must do walk. The day was gorgeous and sunny. The walk was well marked and the views were spectacular. Take the day and do this. Great exercise, great views and you can rest at each beach if you want!
Really good although it was raining. Unfortunately it was drizzling when we had the walk but it was still great I can imagine how nice it would be on a sunny day.

Spectacular Views!. AMAZING!!!! Really amazing. Such a wonderful walk along the cliffs. The views were spectacular and just breath-taking. Don't forget your camera!!!!The walkway is clean and easy to navigate regardless of your fitness level. Some of the steps are uneven but there are hand rails you can use to help keep you steady if needed. There are a few drinking fountains along the way which was quite nice to see, especially if you forget your water bottle. There is little shade on along the walk so make sure to apply the sunscreen and wear breathable clothing if it's a sunny day. If you're in the area I wouldn't miss this walk!

Bondi to Bronte. I only managed Bondi to Bronte beach as Coogee much further and walk takes about 2 hours one way I think. This is a nice walk though, quite gentle inclines but little shelter if hot. Refreshments at Bronte and nice park.
Divine views!. One of the most breathtaking walks with some of the most incredible views you will ever see. Particularly amazing during the Sculpture by the Sea festival,.

Must do. Whether you're in Sydney for a couple of days or a couple of weeks, this should be in the top couple of things to do. It's one of the most beautiful coastal walks in the world. It's slightly on the challenging side to complete the entire walk, but you can stop as often as you like and take in the view.

Nice views, easy beach walk. This walk is easy to do even for kids or elderly, nice views all the time. Good idea for exercise, or for families with kids. I've been there several times, always relaxing experience. There are filtered water stands everywhere, Cafes and restaurants along the way. You can make some nice photos, too.

Amazing views, but very crowded.. This is a beautiful hike with stunning vistas. Our youngest hiker was 5 and she was able to do the hike with some assistance, but I wouldn't recommend doing the full hike with children under 6. The kids loved exploring the tide pools on the Bondi side of the hike. The only drawback is that the trail is very crowded, but this is a 'must see' for the views alone.

Nice views! . Walked from coogee to bondi beach with a friend. Unfortunately the wheater wasn't very good nevertheless we enjoyed the walk along the coast. We both can recommend to do this while you are in Sydney. Have fun!
Busy but beautiful. This walk is definitely worth doing but only if you are relatively fit and don't mind crowds (or being bumped by joggers)!
Actually did the walk with my two lovely sisters. A fabulous experience, stunning views and a wonderful way to spend an afternoon • finished off with a well earned beer at Coogee Pavilion

A walk of your life. I have been to many treks and walks but this one mesmerized me .The walk starting either from Bondi or Coogee takes about 2 to 2.5 hours with beautiful scenic views all along the cost, greenery, narrow lanes, grave yards, couple of beaches, view of dolphins and other aquatic life to places where I can sit for my entire life. You cant walk the walk by reading my review , its high time mate - get down and walk . A walk of your life !

Beach walk. The different vistas of the ocean were amazing, but the walk exhausted me as I have a bad back. I made it though. The temperature was 35C but we did not have time to cool off in the water., tempting though it was. Excellent pub at the end though.
Amazing views. Beautiful coastal walk, right along the edge of the ocean with stops at all the best beaches Tamarara, Clovelly, Marubra

A "must do" in Sydney. This is a fantastic walkway to do on a fine day that is not too windy. It is a paved path all the way with spectacular views of the rocky coast and lovely beaches all the way along. There are quite a few steps and up and downs so not suitable for baby buggies or anyone who is not a good walker.It can be very busy at the weekend. Best walked from Coogee and end up at Bondi for lunch or snack, as lots of cafes there.

Everything everyone else said!. Walking along the cliffs of these beaches was like walking through paradise. It wasn't too difficult. I did it in under two hours in flip flops. Plenty of places to stop for food or coffee right on the water. Great free activity. You won't be disappointed!

Fantastic Sydney Coast Walk. Well by starting from central Sydney by bus to Bondi,interesting Trip in itself. The Walk starts from one of Sydney best known spots. The walk is well sign posted and starts from South Bondi near the Icebergs Club. The views are great,always remember to look back to see where you have been and you will be rewarded by beautiful beaches and cliff views.The walk has some stairs and will take you up to 2 hours depending on your breaks. Remember to bring your swimmers for a dip in one of the many small beaches along the way. There are many cafe,s and places to have a stop to refresh. I would recommend this walk to everyone. The bus connection from Coggee back to the city is frequent and easy to use.

A must do while in Sydney!. You really must do this while in sydney! Its a really nice walk that doesnt take too long to complete if you dont want to stop or all day if you want to relax at all the beautiful beaches! Loved it!

Wear a hat. This is a good way to spend a few hours. We really we able to take in the local atmosphere all the runners the walkers and the surfers.watch the skateboarding on the prom at Bondi. Not too crowded in the early morning but was starting to get crowded as the day progressed

Spectacular Cliff walk. On a bluesky day in April, with a bit of wind and decent sized waves rolling in, this walk was spectacular. Done from Coogee Beach to Bondi, it winds into small coves and over rocky headlands exposed to the force of the open sea. The waves crashing up onto the rocks contrasts with the sandy beaches.Surfers are found at several spots. The coves all have different character and Bondi Beach, at the end for us, was much better than we had expected from the TV show!

fantastic views of this coastal walk. the walk from bondi beach to coogee beach is lovely, especially when the Sculpture by the Sea is on. you can see lots of nice artworks on display. on the other days. there's beautiful ocean views. lots of stairs tho!! enjoy.

Sculpture by the Sea+ Bondi-Coogee Walk. Watch out for this annual event, held on the Bondi to Tamarama section of this fabulous walk. Spectacular, but very crowded with locals at this time of the year.
Something to blow the cobwebs away. Good long walk taking in all the different seascapes you can imagine. You can take your time or you can power walk and all you see is sea, beach and more sea.

Spectacular scenery - mind the runners. It is a beautiful walk about 2 hours there and back, climbs in the middle. Choose your day - is uncomfortable in a winter wind. The ocean views are amazing, the views back across Bondi to the city are great. Lots of flowers and cliff creeper type stuff and sea birds. Watch the fishermen on the rocks, the surfers at either end and have a meal at the finish. I do it early in the am about dawn or just afer.
Just do it!. Often as you can. After 8am and before 10am are the least crowded times on fine weekday mornings. Magic whatever the weather.

Rugged sandstone cliffs, glistening ocean, golden beaches and some of Sydney's most exclusive homes. A great walk for couples, families, friends or one your own. There are some steep steps but it's not a difficult walk. Amazing views along the coastline. Early in the morning see the locals going for a run. Stop along the way for a swim at Sydney's best beaches. Bronte is a great stop for coffee or lunch. Very popular during the Sculptures by the Sea exhibition each spring.

Take your camera and bikinis. This walk started with a beautifully healthy breakfast at the Coogee Pavilion , then slowly meandered photographed and walked with gusto at times up the staircases that has become the well known coastal walk. A must do!

beautiful walk but its hot and long take a hat. I Love this walk and it is great when sculptures by the sea is on, but be warned this is a LONG walk and it will be HOT and sunny so take a HAT (even in winter). I recommend going from Coogee to end up at Bondi if for no other reason than there is more food and coffee when you get there.

Essential for any trip to Sydney. We live near the walk and we use it actively. We are originally from Melbourne - so we take all our families and friends who visit us. The beaches are spectacular and the houses along the walk put on a great side show. There are plenty of options for eating and drinking. Our main tip is wear sports clothes or something very comfortable for walking. There are many places where you have to climb steps and it is an active walk who most use for their exercise. Don't wear jeans and heavy knitwear.

Beautiful walk with great views over the Bondi Beach and coastline. A beautiful walk providing great views over the iconic Bondi Beach and coastline, and swimming at Bronte and Coogee, with kiosks, barbeque facilities and picnic spots along the way. There are some stairs on the path but otherwise ideal for families, with the option of doing part or all of the walk and bus or taxi back to beginning. And it's free!

Take my overseas visitors on this walk. As a Sydney sider I never get sick of this walk and share it with my overseas visitors.Train from the City to Bondi Junction bus to Bronte Beach to start the walk - lunch at Bondi -bus to Watsons Bay for afternoon tea - ferry back to the City.

Great views over the ocean. I love this walk and do it every year, it's awesome and I recommend it for all ages it's a must do. It's good to take some snacks and water, you will find good resteraunts where you can get lunch or dinner.

best of the coast short but sweet. A short Bus ride form the city or drive ,we parked at Coogee caught a cab to Bondi & walked to the car ,This is the best & you never know who you will bump into. Glamorous Tamarama, it says it all ,plenty of places to stop & enjoy [eat & Drink] & Gordon's Bay ,makes you want to get your clothes off & jump in with the fish .This walk costs you next to nothing to enjoy ,other than the fares. if ever I am overseas & somebody asks what should I do in Sydney this is always top of the list.

A must if you're in Sydney!. You get to see about five different beaches and witness the huge waves crashing in on shore that makes this place so good for surfing. It's very pretty with lots of variation and things to see on the way. Easy to get to and from. You won't regret it!
A 'must do'. You will have to do it to know why we say it is a 'must do'. Stopped and had a fabulous lunch along the way.

one of the best coastal walks in the world. Awesome! Would recommend to walk from Coogee to Bondi. A bit easier and more spectacular. Lovely outlooks. Take water and a hat if hot, there is not much shade.
A perfect 6km/2 hour walk. Well sign posted, easy to follow. 2 hours at a leisurely pace (1.5 hours if you're quick!). Beautiful views.

It was raining!. We really enjoyed the views, the walk, and watching the surfers on a wet Sunday morning. The only problem was the weather. It's a great walk for anyone, although there are steps so not so good for wheelchairs or pushchairs.
gorgeous. Easy 40 main bus ride to Bondi a must as far as I was concerned... Back packers hotel almost on sea front.

Gave up halfway due to cold+winter but would have loved to complete it. Went in August 2014 with a bunch of friends and I think it's definitely a must-go.
