Great scenery and it's relaxing to grab some food and walk. But it got dark really quickly due to daylight-saving and we decided to stop halfway before we got lost.

Great walk. This is probably one of the best walks I've done in Sydney. Spectacular views over the ocean especially when you pass the graveyard ( don't know what it's called ) Lots of water points where one can fill up with fresh water. Would suggest comfy shoes (sneakers) to walk in ... Bout 90 mins walk one way at a comfortable pace

Easy long walk. This is a must do walk when you visit Sydney. It is an easy walk, although there are many steps. Plenty of places to stop to have a rest, have a coffee, have a swim, or have a picnic. If you can't make the whole length, you can do part of it, it would be as great. The view to the ocean is breath taking, in a sunny day you can see the blue of the sky and water meets, many people on the beach, it is just gorgeous

Excellent Walk. Used the City Sightseeing Bus to get to and from Bondi and did the walk in both directions with a stop for lunch on arrival in Coogee.An excellent walk on a fine Saturday in April with some marvellous views.Well worth the trip out and certainly one for the list of things to do whilst in Sydney.

Perfect long walk along the beach!. I have done this walk a few times with different groups of friends, the last one was during the Sculptures By the Sea exhibition November 2014.I would recommend this to travellers and locals alike. It is the perfect trail to run or walk, particularly during an early morning or twilight (perhaps not in winter because winds do tend to get quite high and things will get very chilly, very quickly.)

Amazing coastal walk. Start in Coogee: Fist a little swim at Coogee Beach, than georgeous coastal walk for about one or two hours (depending how fast you walk). Finally sit at Bondi Beach in the sun maybe with a Latte enjoy the surfer - or have more fun by swimming or surfing. Just do it!

A Good Hike. Put on your walking boots and park in the long stays around Coogee, Bondi parking is outrageous price and you'll struggle to find a park. The round trip was around 12ks and took about 2.5hours of good pace walking with the dog. There are some incredible cliff spots and beautiful natural swimming pools all along. Bronte is especially beautiful. Not to be missed. Pack plenty of water each and a banana for half way. Or stop for lunch and beers in Bondi.
Nice views. This is one of those must do things if you have the time. The walk is spectacular and the boardwalk is well maintained.

Coastal Walk. If you enjoy waIks with spectacular views try this. Can't go wrong on a nice sunny day, I prefer cooler weather. I suggest doing it in reverse & grabbing coffee/snack at Bondi (more options than Coogee)
Awsome!. Must vist place. You could enjoy all the beautiful beaches and parks while you are walking and taking rest on the wonderful coastal walks. For me, Coogee beach was nicer than Bondi beach.

Beautiful beach good exercise. It was a very relaxing and enjoyable walk on a beautiful Saturday. The colour of the sea is so amazing. You can get to Bondi Beach from Sydney CBD in half an hour. This is the best outing for weekend. There are many good cafes where you can have good food and coffee after the walk.

Breathtaking views. Did the Bondi Beach to Coogee walk in March 2015, and it was an absolute treat. Actually walked past Coogee beach all the way to Maroubra beach. No regrets whatsoever. Views of the headlands and bays and the rock formations and the ocean were phenomenal, and hey, it was completely free of charge which was icing on the cake. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Sydney! Was pretty pooped by the end of it though, so make sure you're prepared. Wear comfortable shoes, bring lots of water (though there are plenty of water dispensers along the way which was very convenient) and make sure you use sunscreen if you don't want to end up looking like a boiled lobster at the end of it. A cap and sunglasses won't hurt either.
beautiful walk. this walk was a very beautiful walk and very relaxing. The only slight downside is that it is exposed and when we went it was very windy.

One of the world's best sea walks / runs. At the very least make your way to the Bondi Pool and take in the views. For the more adventurous take the entire walk starting at either end. Not good for strollers or small children. I ran both ways but that's me. This coastal walk offers lots of amazing views from up high to right down at the ocean edge. There are plenty of stairs to climb up and then down so its an excellent workout for your body and your camera. Its a given every visit to Sydney I take the opportunity to get onto the coastal walk. Highly recommend.
Beautiful hike on Easter Sunday. Gorgeous views on a beautiful Easter Sunday. Lots of energy in the air. Watch the surfers and enjoy the spectacular views. A city like no other!

Beautiful and relaxing walk. I knew this was definitely something I wanted to do while visiting Sydney and I’m so glad we did. We purchased our bus tickets at Circular Quay. Then we walked to stand E and waited for bus 333 (which is an express bus). The bus ride to Bondi Beach was about a 40-45 minute ride. The bus got quite crowded along the way. We stopped to eat lunch at Pompeis first and then walked a few blocks to Bondi beach.We took a dip in the water (surprised the water was quite cold), and continued on our walk. I was glad the sun wasn’t out as it was very hot the day we did this walk. We stopped again at Bronte Beach to take a dip in the water to cool off and to grab a quick snack. We took our time walking along the path stopping countless times to take photos. The views are gorgeous and I was surprised the walk was not crowded (this was about 2pm on a weekday in February) We even walked past the cemetery and I joked that I wanted to be buried there overlooking the ocean. There are many steps along the way but it is not a difficult walk at all.We didn’t make it all the way to Coogee but stopped at Clovelly beach and took the bus back to Circular Quay from Clovelly due to the fact we were having dinner with relatives that night and it was starting to get late.Highly recommend this walk for the sheer beauty of the cliffs and beaches.
spectacular coastline. Must do walk along Sydney's beaches, bays and headlands, with lots of opportunity to stop off for excellent food and coffee!

Great exercise & views. This is a lovely walk - very clear where you need to go so no maps needed (although be warned, I didn't actually see any signposts on route). I just kept walking until I hit Coogee!If the weather is nice, take a towel and stop at each of the bays to have a little swim!

Coogee to Bondi. Did this walk with my hostel...the views are amazing. I would recommend doing Coogee to Bondi because the other way around would be somewhat dissappointing only because Bondi is such a spectacular view that it's hard to bear. Definitely a must!

Beautiful Walk. New since I lived in Coogee - many years ago - a FABULOUS walk with lots of opportunities to stop and have a coffee en-route! The walk has been well designed and I really enjoyed walking a small section of it. I understand it takes about an hour and half from Bondi to Coogee.

a must do. I did this walk on my first day in Sydney, starting from Bondi beach and taking the two hours to walk past fantastic scenery, beautiful little communities such as Bronte overlooking beaches and also the majestic graveyard that overlooks the sea. This walk was full of runners, power walkers and strollers like ourselves.
Lovely coastal walk. We caught a bus from Circular Quay to Coogee and then walked to Bondi beach.Probably 6 kms mostly flat with lovely views throughout
A walk and a half!. Great way to spend a few hours strolling along the gorgeous coastal path, especially when the local art display is on!

Worth the wait. I have been wanting to do this walk for about 20 years. Never had time to do it when we were working crazy hours, and it's not something to do with a pram and young kids (too many stairs for a pram, too long for younger kids, too hot in summer etc). So we finally took our chance on a mild April day with our 13 and 10 year old kids. We loved the walk, from the wild sandstone formations and colours crafted by the ocean and the wind, the waves crashing onto the craggy rocks, the peaceful rock pools and calm waters to be found at low tide, the beachside baths that had been built so long ago, the architecture and occasional artworks that can be spied along the way, the stunning vistas up and down the coastline, the footy ground and bowling greens seemly on the edge of the cliffs at Clovelly and the wide choice of places to stop for a swim or refreshments. Wear a hat and sunscreen, and take a bottle of water and enjoy the walk for as little or as long as you choose. We made it from Bondi to Coogee in 2 hours at a comfortable stroll including lots of photo stops, some footy at the clifftop ground and a brief stop at Clovelly.
Beautiful. A breath taking view of Sydney. getting out and about in our gorgeous city reminds us of how lucky we are to live here.

Walk both ways. Yes this walk deserves its high praise. The views are varied and magnificent. The path is well signposted even where it goes away from the coast occasionally. The bus service from Coogee back to Bondi junction or Sydney is not the best but, like all walks you do get a different view in the reverse direction.

Monday morning tonic. We went up to Bondi to really do nothing much but ended up walking around the cliff walk with friends from the UK and I was so struck by the coastline. It was the second time I have done this walk, and I had forgotten how good it is. It is better to go through the week to avoid heavy traffic on the path and the early morning joggers. We did take a short cut on the way back the RSL was calling....

top thing to do in sydney. no trip to sydyney is complete without a trip to bondi beach...simply lying on the beach and people watching is the best activity...the coastal walk is amazing...lots of restaruants and pubs lined up..a must do

A good walk for those visiting Sydney.. This is a great walk to do with teenagers and younger children as it encompasses many great Eastern suburbs beaches and stunning scenery. We love walking along the cliffs and watching the surf crashing against the rocks. It's also interesting to have a look at the homes perched on the cliffs. Whenever I have visitors from interstate or overseas I always spend a half day doing this great walk. It's challenging enough to feel like a workout but not too strenuous that you get too sweaty to enjoy lunch at the iconic Bondi Beach. There are loads of great eateries at Bondi Beach if that's your final destination. However I usually visit the RSL club at The Icebergs as the food and drinks are great value plus the views over Bondi Beach are sensational.

you can start/stop at any point you want. Is it bad that I only made it to Tamarama?Next time, I'm going to do the entire walk. Even just that short 30 minute walk I did offered me some pretty amazing views of the coast. I can only imagine how awesome the rest of it would look.You can start (or stop) at any of the beaches, which is the best part. If you get too tired, you can always just jump ship and take the bus home. Or you can just stop and lay there on whichever beach you happen upon. It's really a win-win situation.You must do this walk - tourist, or not. Hopefully you'll make it further than I did!

Simply incredible. I had heard lots of enthusiastic comments on this walk and I must say they were right. It's absolutely amazing. I did only the first part between bondi and bronte because of rain. It was enough to enjoy the wonderful landscape and atmosphere. MUST DO!

Beach Beauty.. I love the Sculptures by the Sea!!! The walk is great exercise and gorgeous salty breezes mixed with incredible cliff views are not to be missed!!! Put on your runners and a hat and grab a coffee or green juice and climb those stairs... Do watch out for the runners as they can get pretty cranky if you are on the wrong side and get in their way!!!

Wonderful views, good exercise... do at your own pace.. We've been in Sydney for a few days now, and I think this will be the most memorable part of the visit. We walked from Bondi Beach down to Bronte Beach (you can keep going if you want), which was about 5km round trip. It's not particularly difficult, but there are some stairs/hills to deal with. The views of the beaches and the oceans are spectacular. There are a million good photo opportunities... I highly recommend it.
Start Early. Great walk from Coogee to Bondi. Interesting seaside scenery, but you must start early in the mornning as it gets so busy and you could be tripping over people or those pesty joggers.
Awesome. Excellent walk, but do it in the morning before it heats up. It is a long walk, but you can get off at any time.

Handy Tip- keep a lot of time on your hands, this is to be done at leisure. I am never going to forget this walk, obviously because it was insanely beautiful but also because this was my first ever solo traveler experience in a foreign land...the walk is very scenic to say the least, but it consists of random inclines and stairs, so make sure to wear comfortable shoes. Also, the blogs will tell you that you need 3 hours but if you really want to take in the experience, keep a good amount of time on your hands because it might look like one long stretch, but you will be amazed at how many different wonderful sights you will get to see throughout the walk. i started my walk around late afternoon so I had the privilege of seeing the colors of the sky change every few minutes. i bet this walk will give you an experience you will never forget

Lovely experience. Walked with a friend but the other way - Coogee to Bondi. We stopped in Bronte and had lunch then continued on to Bondi, I think about 6 kilometres all up. Railings all the way but quite a lot of steep steps coming from Coogee which can be a bit slippery with leaves in Autumn. At 70 years young managed it quite easily but people with a disability or difficulty walking might find some parts a bit tricky. Well worth the walk, magnificent views all the way along and easily managed cement paths the whole way.

One of my favorite things to do!. I have lived in bondi for over a month now and this is my favorite thing to do. The coastal walk between Bondi and coogee is one of the most breath taking views of Sydney and sure one fun experience for tourists. Bring your waterbottle because there is places to fill them during the walk. And even if you are not very fit and are not able to go all the way, you can stop in one of the many beaches in the way to chill and catch a bus back to Bondi Junction.Its a must do.

Stunning and rugged. The views are stunning. The walk is rugged. I did it all in one shot, but I suppose you could stop for breaks. There are lots of stairs - up and down. Gets crowded. Go early to beat crowds and heat. Plenty of bathrooms and restaurants along the way. The Coogee pavilion at the end is an oasis. Take the shuttle back to Bondi or a bus into Randwick, Redfern. Easy! Bring your swimsuit.

Beautiful walk - a bit windy. It took us a while to work out the sydney bus system to get to Bondi Beach (great beach but too cold for swimming this time of year). But we were so glad we did.This walk is a really beautiful clifftop walk, a really nice way to get out of the town center. We walked from Bondi to Coogee and back, which took a few hours, and rewarded ourselves with ice cream afterwards :)
Just beautiful!. A great way to look at some of Sydney's beautiful coast and beaches. A must do for visitors and locals alike.

Amazing Walk. A fantastic way to spend a sunny day, take your time, swim at every beach, have a beer in a view good pubs, chat too friends, soak up the atmosphere and fall in love with Sydney. A must do.

scenic walk and workout. This is a beautiful walk - a must do! Beautiful scenery and lots of stairs and climbs either way. Coogee is a great destination- lots of good healthy eating options in main street upon arrival.

One of my favorite attractions. Take your time and have a beautiful stroll along the coast. The area can be reached by bus from the city center. There are many eateries in the neighborhood. This is a great spot to spend a day.

Everyone knows it, but there are secrets. This coastal walk is so famous. My secret tip is to take it from Coogee to Bondi at night and watch the stars! IT s amazing. Everyone is sleeping, city is silent and you and your friend(s) will just looks at the dark beautiful ocean and the sky! ENJOY!
It was good! you should to try!. really good view! and nice market and many people!

Coogee to Bondi. This is a must do walk but maybe not on a Sunday morning when it was very very busy. We started at Coogee because we wanted to finish at Bondi. Stunning views so take your time. We stopped for a drink at Bronte and watched the surfers.

Amazing views of Coast. This is a very lovely scenic walk from Bondi Beach to wherever one wants to stop Coogee or any other beach along the way. The views are spectacular and it can be an easy stroll or you can adapt it to your own liking. Along the way stop at a cafe for refreshments and take in the scenery..
Amazing fun walk. A must if coming to Sydney for a forst time and you get some good exercise too. Start at Bondi and walk around until you can go no further
Good time. Got to see a lot of beaches and get some activity in at the same time. I walked it with my wife and we had a nice time. If you like to walk, this is a great place to do it.

Really nice walk. You'll have the best views of Sydney's beaches with this walk.Totally worth it, one of the best things to do in Sydney !Careful, not a pathway, you'll have to hike to see have the best views ;)

Stunning views of Bondi Beach. There is always something to see and do in this scenic area, from a walk along the beach, boardwalk or Bronte to Bondi walk...we have done it all!! Had a bite to eat at Bondi Fresh for lunch and a coffee by the water...what ever the season you will enjoy the views!!

Wonderful nature walk along the Bondi beaches. The path is basically just a walking trail between multiple Australian beaches, so I would have a hard time even considering it an official "attraction". That said, it is an amazing stretch to walk with beautiful beaches and rock cliffs. We spent about 3 hours walking down and back and it was one of the most enjoyable walks we did in all of Australia.

An Epic Walk along the coastline.. Great little walk when its not too congested. It doesn't have a direct path so you will be walking on mixed terrain. The best way is to start from Coogee and welcome the sheer enormity of Bondi at the other end.

Great Way to Spend a Morning. We took the bus from Sydney which dropped us off right at Bondi Beach. Had a very good breakfast at Sejuiced and we were on our way. The walk is beautiful and interesting. We took the bus back from Coogee to Sydney.

Loved it!. Great free family activity. A gentle 5km walk along the coast in Sydney. We did it in reverse ie Coogee to Bondi which meant we got a great first view of Bondi beach. Lots of other beaches to see on the way and a number of places to stop for refreshments on the way. A few places have steep steps so not easy for push chairs or wheelchairs. Quite busy when we went ( on a Sunday) and watch out for many people running.

Easy and pleasant walk. Highly recommended - this walk is generally billed as two hours but is actually shorter.Easily accessible from city centre by bus (about 30 minutes) it is all on concrete or boardwalk paths.We did it on a Saturday morning before late afternoon flight home - a very popular route with hundreds of Australians out exercising in early autumn sunshine.As with many Australian attractions and walks plenty of water facilities, toilets and refreshment facilities available if you want them.

Take the time and make the walk. Pictures don't do the path justice. It's gorgeous! Wear good, comfortable hiking/walking gear as there's lots of hills, steps and pathways. It's out in the sun along the water so there can be a breeze along with the hot sun so plan (sunscreen for sure!).It was one of the most attractive experiences I had in Sydney. Very easy to get to from any bus that stops at Bondi. Follow the people who walk up towards the Iceberg swim club as that's where the trail begins.
2 hour plus leisure walk. we took 2 hours plus to complete the walk but it was worth it!View was amazing and you get to see small beaches and nice houses along the way! =)

Lovely couple of hours. Walked with my Wife and 9yr old boy and 12yr old girl. We all enjoyed the scenery and there were no complaints from the children at all. We did do it at a leisurely pace however and it took us about 2 hours with a coffee/milkshake stop. My Son had a swim at Coogee and loved it. We caught buses from the CBD to Bondi and from Coogee. The buses were easy to locate and ran regularly.

Simply the best. I honestly had no idea Sydney would be this beautiful! It's a good little walk - not too strenuous but still some good exercise, so bring water and tennis shoes.Beautiful views, beaches and people along the way. One of the highlights of Sydney for sure. There's some good places for food in Coogee at the end of your walk.

Beautiful coastal walk.. Just loved being close to the ocean for the whole of the walk, the scenery was outstanding pleanty of benches to sit and watch the world walk by, Stopped to watch some of the surfers trying to paddle out to get the wave of the day. Interesting walk.

Pure Perfection!. I'm lucky enough to go running pretty much everyday here.It's the best that Sydney can offer to travels.The Ocean breeze, the reflection of its blue with the immense Sky....just pure perfection!Everyone should come to Australia, to have a stroll here.

Wonderful views and envigorating walk. This is one of the best coastal walks in any city that I have visited in the world. It is mostly a dedicated walking and cycle path which hugs the coastline all the way from Bondi to Coogee. It is a fabulous walk to do early in the morning or on a sunny winters day. When you get to Coogee there are many places to stop and have a nice lunch or just a cold drink. You can either catch the bus back to Bondi or walk back again if you have the energy.
stunning views. great walk with stunningly beautiful views, lots of little beaches and swimming pools along the way. well worth it, will definitely be doing this one again. recommended for all.

Recommended walk. Started at Coogee where we were staying, and walked to Bondi. Theres a lovely cafe somewhere about halfway, I'm afraid I can't remember where, but you can't miss it. Lovely walk for all ages, and some fantastic sights along the way. We spent a few hours at a beach bar on Bondi and cheated by catching the bus back, but a lovely memorable day

OMG- one of my most memorable experiences!. I'm delayed in posting this review but it is still vivid in my mind. This is one of the most visually appealing hikes I've ever taken. Due to the various elevations you can see the ocean from multiple perspectives. The walk takes you past several salt water pools which is amazing especially if you are from the States. I definitely recommend and hope to return one day.

Brilliant Walk with excellent views!. It was a brilliant walk which goes through multiple beaches were people can sit and relax. Some of the views during the walk were brilliant. Even though it started raining, me and my friends were also able to find shelter in the the intermediate beach.

Easy coastal walk with so much to see. Takes about 1-1.5hrs and you get to see some of the best beaches on the east side of Sydney. My advise is to take a long stroll and really enjoy the sights. Take the bus back to Bondi for a full days entertainment.
Great way to explore the eastern beaches. The beaches are fantastic and varied. Stop, swim, walk and great places to eat at both Bondi and Coogee

Great walk. Try and do the walk on a weekday, weekends get really busy and it can get annoying if you prefer peace and quiet to enjoy the views, it can be a victim of it's own success. It really is as pretty as it looks and there are some great cafes to treat yourself to brekky at the end. Can be hilly in places so sensible shoes are a good idea.

WHAT I WALK. I did the walk on my one and it was fantastic, the views of the ocean were great and when I reached Bondi Beach I had a nice lunch and did the return walk, make shore you have block out water bottle as you can fill it on your way and comfortable shoes.

Stunning walk, well worth the time. Starting at Bondi beach and walking southward, this made for a very pleasant afternoon for my last day in Australia. Take the #380 bus from Circular Quay (buy zone 3-5 tickets at most convenience stores) and get off at Bondi beach. The swim club offers a nice vantage point for watching surfers and taking pictures of the beach. It also provided shelter from a storm that came and went quickly but I passed many soaked hikers later. Tamarama beach is also quite stunning. There are steep uphill climbs that may tax some folks but overall the walk is relatively easy and there are lots of benches for taking a rest if need be. (Total length is 6km/3.6mi). When you get to Coogee beach, there's a pavilion where you can get food and drink, and nearby is the bus stop. #373 is a fast bus back to Oxford St and Circular Quay. You really shouldn't miss this one.
Beauty..... This coastal walk has a lovely feel either if you go on your own or with friends. So much to see - the scenery is beautiful.... I do recommend it to everyone who is in Sydney area....

It makes you feel alive!. I've done this walk many times and I never tire of it. The sounds of the ocean at your side, the wonderful clean air, just being out and about.Keeping fit was never so good.At the end you can kick back and enjoy a relaxing coffee, something to eat, a picnic, a swim.It makes you feel alive.

Totally deserves its number 1 ranking. This is a great way to see the best of Sydney. Great beaches, stunning views and a slightly challenging but well maintained track.We caught a bus to the beginning and from the end of the track to the central city. It was well worth doing this. Plenty of eating and drinking spots on the walkway!
amazing. did it with a pram for the baby, little bit hard at the beginning because of the steps but worth it!
6km Walk with a bar at the end. We walked from Coogee to BondiIt was a very scenic walk up & down hill including cliff face viewsBut I was very glad there was a bar with roof gardens in Bondi
A must do!. A definite must! Seeing all the beaches, the tourist attractions while also feeling like you're at home in that little piece of paradise!

Probably the most scenic activity in Sydney.. I lived in Sydney for a few months and used to run along the Coastal Walk every other day. Simply amazing, words can't do justice to it. You can choose between 5 or 6 beaches to hang out along the way.

Enjoyable afternoon. Although it was Easter weekend and quite busy on the walk it was still an enjoyable walk. There are a few stairs along the way but plenty of beautiful spots to stop for a breather if needed. Take your togs for a swim in some of the pools along the way.

Stunning. Beautiful scenic coastal walk which has a couple of small beaches and places to stop along the way for refreshments if you need to. I walked to Coogee from Bondi, had lunch there and then walked it off going back. Definitely worth it. (Steps along the way which may need to be taken in to consideration.)

A great walk. I did this on a clear sunny day and it's a lovely walk and not really challenging for someone as unfit as myself. There's one steep set of stairs close to Coogee but well worth it. There's great views of the beaches as you walk by and plenty of places to stop to eat and drink once you arrive at Coogee (or at Bondi if you walk it the other direction).

Just beautiful. An easy coastal walk, the view is always excellent, sometimes lots of people. I everyday a must do in Sydney. This is a water city and as with a ferry ride to Manly we advise all our guests to have this experience and gain an insight to the essence of the best of this city.

Awesome and free of charge. This walk takes you past the most beautiful Sydney beaches and I strongly recommend to take a stroll through Waverley Cemetery, which is the most scenic graveyard that I have ever seen. It dates back to the 19th century.

Breathtaking views. Highly recommend this walk, even if you don't like walking - it's not particularly strenuous, the views along the way are absolutely amazing and there's a reward at the end in the Coogee Bay Hotel for a post-walk drink, so just do it!

Must Do for any Visitor who wants to experience Sydney's best known beaches and coastline. It is the opposite of secluded given these beaches are in the densely populated Sydney Eastern Suburbs. But the walk is rustic and the path is in very original condition. You get a great view of the beaches, rolling surf and surf action which is ALWAYS happening. Take your time for this walk and I would recommend timing the walk so that you can have lunch at Tamarama or Bronte. Tama has a good place just off the beach and Bronte has a famous cafe strip of some 6 or so good places. Then you have plenty of energy to tackle the slightly harder part of the walk (not challenging really) up to Clovelly and then Coogee via Gordons Bay. Never heard of anyone who did not love this walk. During busy times (weekends and public holidays) it can get a little crowded.

Hard work. I have done this walk several with my very fit daughter, I am 74 yrs old,this lovely walk is quite a challenge ,but worth it ,the views spectacular, and have often seen many Dolphins having a great time in the oceon,the walk is quite hard but but worth all the pleasure experienced.

Amazing Views from Every turn. Had the best time walking from Coogee to Bondi Beach. Amazing views from every turn and angle! High on cliffs and along the beaches - the best of Sydney. Would definitely recommend!

most spectacular walk with outstanding views all the way. I have done this walk a few times because it's so good,nothing like it.Plenty of stops along the way for drinks,food and a swim,then at the end go to Bondi Icebergs for a few more drinks and lovely food at reasonable prices, and one of the most spectacular views of iconic Bondi Beach.Isn't Sydney just wonderful we have it all.

Great Afternoon Coastal Walk. We have been staying in the city and had all the depressing Easter weather but still wanted to experience some of the great beaches - we left the city in torrential rain prepared for dreadful weather but by the time we got to Coggee the rain had more or less stopped. I would advise you to start at Coggee and walk to Bondi the scenery, beaches and coves are amazing and after lots of expensive excursions this one is free If you are going to do one thing make this top of your list
excellent. took a few hours but with a beer in coogee afterwards it was all worth it...great to stop a while and take in the view. wear comfy shoes though.

Great walk. Away from the busy city.. We did the walk in reverse from Coogee to Bondi. It's supposed to be easier as you go slightly down. The views of the beaches and cliffs were spectacular and we saw lots of beautiful flowers and birds. We ended up having lunch at Icebergs Restaurant in Bondi with great views of the beach. It was nice albeit a bit pricey.

Excellent day out. Went for a walk with my wife and enjoyed it very much. A bit overcrowded with a lot of people enjoying the sunshine at the same time we were but overall a great experience and an excellent day out. Do wear decent footwear!

Beautiful walk, don't forget the sunscreen!. Very fun walk along a beautiful coastline. Not a difficult walk; there are some places that are a bit of an uphill climb, but it's probably not a problem for most. Toward the end my husband and I were huffing and puffing up a big hill, but the older couple in front of us seemed to not break a sweat. Ha!I think the walk took us maybe 3 hours with lots of photo stops. I didn't write this soon enough to remember exactly. My 50 spf sunscreen didn't cut it; I probably sweat it off. Definitely don't forget it and reapply!
Spectacular, beautiful coastline!!. It is an amazing walk that every nature lover MUST go for!! ...........................and the views!!! WOW!
Great views to see ocean and area. Not too strenuous a walk but great views of ocean, beaches and ocean front area. recommend taking water and light jacket as it was breezy in July (winter months).
Excellent scenic walk.. It does require a bus ride to the start and from the finish but it's well worth it. A great walk with beautiful views of the coast and wonderful beaches.

very good view. It is a nice walk along the coast or rather above the coast.Do not walk in summer or as long as the sun is in the sky. There is practically no shadow.Mind: public transport is poor, bus numbers are intriguing.
Beautiful. Absolutely stunning views from start to finish. An amazing way to see every beach! Well worth the effort.
Great Walk. Lovely walk in the sunshine passing several lovely beaches. These beaches are smaller and quiter than Bondi and worth stopping at.
Lovely walk. Lovely views and a lovely day. Lots of beaches and coves to see, best to do the walk from Coogee to Bondi as less uphill!

Glorious Easter Sunday after a wet Easter Saturday. Trippers, happy easter to you all.What a great Easter Sunday especially after a horrible wet Saturday in Sydney.Great day to do this amazing walk although, we only did Coogee to Bronte which is half way, passing through Clovelly also, amazing oceanic views.I recommend this walk to anyone, I have also done the Bondi to Tamarama
Make like the locals!. Busy walkway with all the beautiful people out running and enjoy Sydney's lovely beaches. A great (cheap) way to enjoy an afternoon.
Nice walk. It's a nice enough walk but if we had our time again we would do the walks round manly as they are far more scenic. The coogee bondi coastline is very built up and concreted over
Mark's Park the highlight. Be sure to include Mark's Park at dusk on your walk. At the edge of the headland, with views of Bondi and the surf, it's a must do when visiting Sydney.

Really nice but crowded in peak time. Nice walkway next to the ocean with stunning views of the coastline. The beaches are beautiful, especially the more sheltered ones! Bondi Beach can get really crowded though. Expect to meet many people on the walk.

A refreshing perspective to add to your memory of your visit to Sydney. Given the right weather ;which I had the good fortune to have,this was a wonderful way to spend an afternoon.The walk is accessible and not difficult to do. Although there were at certain parts where, I found identifying the specific path a little less obvious. Having said that , it is a coastal walk and all paths lead to your destination whatever the case. You can start the walk at either end and to get there you can catch a bus from Circular Quay at bus stop 'E' . Great vistas and an easy ,well laid out path. I did this on my own during the afternoon and did not feel my security breached whilst walking along. Obviously be street smart anyway. There are public amenities along the walk and given a warmer day would have thought about a stop for a swim or a snooze on the beach. It does get blustery in parts so do bring along all the necessary paranephalia one needs when doing walks. There are limited water fountains along the way too.I so enjoyed this walk and was a wonderful reprieve from the city.Just a note to add this is not a wheelchair or pram friendly terrain as there are stairs and one fairly steep slope to contend with.

Fantastic way to spend several hours.. Amazing views. The trail is not easy, but it is well paved and there are water and rest points throughout. Highly recommend to anyone staying in Bondi, Bronte, or Coogee.

great exercise and scenery combined. love the views. its a fair hike tho if you get tired there are bus stops on the way you can give up and go to bondi or bondi junction half way. a few good coffee shops and the odd resturant on the way and nice swimming beaches
Stunning. A really lovely pleasant and scenic walk. Great way to kill an hour or two and lots of great bars and cafés at both beaches to reward yourself.

Excellent walk & mind blowing views!! Out of the world for me!!. Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal Walk is the one of the most beautiful walks that I have done so far. Mind blowing and stunning views all the way and unimaginably scenic it was. The boardwalk was too good at places. There are plenty of uphills and downhills and steps and it so much fun to keep walking. A super relaxing walk with lots of pictures in my DSLR. A must thing to do if you are in Sydney. I had a great time walking and was blown away by the beauty of the sea.
Beautiful walk. This walk is awesome, you can see the beautiful ocean and beaches. It is a long walk and there are some steps but do it anyway. :)

Beautiful walk and swim. This is such a beautiful walk on a fine day, the scenery gets better round each corner. The boardwalk bypassing the Waverley cemetery is new since we last visited Sydney and is a great improvement. We stopped for an excellent lunch at Seasalt Cafe next to the path in Clovelly. We finished the walk at the wonderfully quirky Wylie's Baths just beyond Coogee Beach and enjoyed a swim at high tide with the waves breaking into the pool. Good bus transport to Bondi and back to the city from Coogee. Don't miss this walk!

Best costal views. Took the bus from Sydney to Coogee and then walked to Bondi beach for a day in the sun. There are water fountains to fill your bottle along the way. Took the bus home from Bondi. Really great day!
fantastic walk. On a beautiful day its a really lovely easy walk. lots of places to stop and admire the views. also plenty of cafes and restaurants for the thirsty.
windy Day. Just a note if it is windy . Try and start from Coogee end .Not like us and walked all the day in a full on head wind
Must Do. if you are in the Bondi area you must do this walk the views of the coast and little beaches are fantastic

Beautiful. Do not visit Sydney and not do this!!!! The most spectacular views I have ever seen!!!! It took us about 4 hours and we loved every minute of it. We stopped for many pictures and even a ub or 2 along the way.

A must. A fantastic walk. I did it from Bondi to Coogie but I think that it is probably better the other direction. Arriving at Coogie is an anticlimax. Before you do the walk look at photos of both beaches and their immediate surroundings. I did not take a photo on the approach into Coogie. The approach to Bondi gets better and better.

Stunning walk. Went on this walk with my mate, the Nos. The views of the coastline and the beaches between Coogee and Bondi are stunning. It took us about one and a quarter hours each way at an average pace. In warm weather you could have a swim at some beautiful beaches on the way. Or you could have lunch at one end (Bondi or Coogee) before the walk back. There are plenty of uphills and downhills and steps, so not for the unfit or faint hearted, but the walking surface is very good. On a nice day this has to be one of the best walks in the world. And it's free!

Possibly the best attraction in Sydney. If you walk along the coast from Coogee to Bondi (or vice versa), you'll be sure to see amazing landscapes, gorgeous beaches, and lovely villas. It is a very relaxing walk, with lots of wonderful things to see. If you are a tourist in Sydney and you want to go for a hike and see what this city has to offer, you should really do that walk. Bring some suntan lotion, a good camera, and get ready to spend a wonderful time where you'll be blown away by the beauty of the sea!

Relaxation. It is a beautiful walk, across the coastline and through Waverley Cemetery. I often do the shorter Bondi to Bronte, however male the effort to do the whole one. The views of the ocean are spectacular.

Beautiful Costal Walk, Amazing Views. We took the train from Kings Cross to Bondi Junction and took the 333 bus to Bondi - it was easy. We went along the beach and town first which was nice and then headed on the costal walk. It was a beautiful fall day with a nice breeze, cloudy but with off and on sun.Excellent way to spend a few hours.

Nice Walk. We walked on a nice afternoon (26/79 degrees). Lots of people, and a little longer than expected, but the views are great and it was nice to stop at a few spots along the way to watch the beach goers. Surprised there weren't more shops/eateries on the beach. We wanted to grab a late lunch, but really none of the beaches had anything with a good view. Coogie Pavilion was okay - good food/drinks but still off the beach (and packed!)

Enjoyable and a perfect distance. My wife and I have visited Sydney twice and both times we bused to Bondi and did this walk to get rid of the cobwebs. It is just the right length especially if it is hot, and you don't get covered in sand.
Stunning Coastal Walk. Easy transport from downtown Sydey. Combine this stunning coastal walk with a swim and a meal at one of Sydney's iconic beaches!

WINDY!!. Very beautiful walk along the coast. There is a cool public swimming pool and a place with a great view to grab a drink and a bite. It was VERY windy when we went, but that also made it kind of fun. There were beautiful rocks and waves and lots of grassy areas and benches to stop and sit. There were also steps that led right down into the ocean. If you are not up for the walk, sit on the grassy hill and watch the surfers.
breath taking. need to be physically fit,but if you are it is so worth the 11/2 hours!!! Best of all it is free.We did Coogee to Bondi,then had lunch,watched the surfers,walked the beach

Bondi Beach to Tamarand Beach. Beautiful coastal walk way past the salt water swimming house and along the coast filleed with vista views and many tidepools and sandstone formations similar to La Jolla Caves in San Diego, CA. Tamarnd Beach used to be more exclusive but now has public pavillion with showers, cafe, lawn, four beach volley ball courts. Alot of surfing and some topless sun bathers with active lifeguard station,

My favourite walk in Sydney. It's a fantastic trail which makes you forget that you are in a city-you wander round the beaches dotted along this part of the coast and end up in Coogee. It's a welcome escape from the bustle of the city. It has steeps steps here and there on the way but that doesn't detract from the walk. Cafés along the way provide an excuse for a refreshment.
Best scenery. Great walk along the coast. Excellent views and not crowded. Takes about 1.5 hours each way. Take sun cream as there is no shade

A treat for your eyes and your fitness. Nowadays people pay hard earned money for expensive subscriptions at premium fitness centers. They exercise on a running mat, on a stepper or cross-fit device whilst watching the news, music videos or a 3D modelling of their virtual route... All of this for what??? to emulate nature... to make the experience real...This coastal walk has it all and is actually real. It shows what mother nature can do.Treat yourself and go for a walk !

Beautiful, well worth the effort. On a good day this walk is stunning even on a bad day this walk is still entirely worth the effort. The dramatic coast line is visually stunning but the path is still entirely accessible to all abilities. I would strongly recommend it to anyone!

Amazing views!. I've doe this walk many times, and it never disappoints. What is better than to combine physical activity with stunning views? It's even nice when the weather is not! It takes up some time, depending on your speed and eager to take pictures, but it's totally worth it. During weekends it fills up with people, especially if the weather is good. You could start at either Bondi or Coogee to take the whole walk, or even shorten it by starting at any beach in between.
Exercise with a view. Very beautiful setting for a morning run, a lot of photo opportunities if you're just being a tourist. I suggest finishing in Bronte where there are lots of delicious cafés.

Excellent day out for fresh air and beautiful scenery. Loved the walkway. Lots of people running and walking on Sunday afternoon. It was very busy. Suggest walking it earlier in the morning or later in the evening.
Bondi to Coogee is a must. Beautiful scenery, wonderful beaches, good track, convenient to get there and leave, really a pearl in Sydney.

Put this on your bucket list. As with all the other reviewers - if you have an hour or two and fancy a fantastic walk between the two beaches then this is perfect. I have been to Sydney a few times and do this walk everytime. Highly recommended but make sure you wear teeshirt and shorts if its hot!

A definite for your Sydney bucket list. This is a great way to spend a few hours soaking up Sydney's beautiful east coast!You can start at either Bondi or Coogee, in fact I much prefer to do this walk and finish in Coogee, as I find Coogee a much more relaxed beach than Bondi, which is perfect after the walk. It can get busy around the summer, especially on weekends, but the walkways are plenty big enough. This is also a great walk when the Sculptures by the sea exhibition is on in October/November. There are a number of great little beaches on the way, so if it gets too hot you can cool off and go for a dip.
Awesome. This walk is challenging with hills, long enough for fitness and the views are beautiful as the track meanders along the coast.

Most enjoyable. We did the Bondi to Coogee coastal walk which took us around 2.5 hours that is including all the stops that we did along the way, I say it would take 1.5 hours if you just walked no stopping but the idea is to take in the views and the sights we saw Dolphins surfing. We took a bus from circular key to Bondi then walked to coogee & bus back to circular key.
Beautiful. It is a very beautiful walk. Love it and would love to do it again. My husband wanted to come back the next day and do the entire walk again :)

Fantastic, energetic way to see the coastal sights of Sydney. This activity is a well-spent morning / afternoon. Grab your walking gear and some water and enjoy the variety of sights along this coastal walk. Beautiful beaches, vast horizon, several spots to stop off and enjoy a drink / snack and/or ice cream. For visitors (or early arrivals) to Sydney this walk also provides a good perspective of the Eastern suburb beaches, their individual 'falvour' and how they flow from one to the next. The contrast between Bondi (large, mainly tourist beach) to Clovelly (small, mainly locals, narrow swimming 'channel') is telling, for example. The coastal walk is popular, of course, so weekends can attract busy foot-traffic year-round. If you are hoping for less people, I would suggest aim for a weekday, if possible. Buses run to every beach so, if you are staying in the city, for example, it is a ~25 min ride to Bondi (it;s also possible to catch a train).
Beautiful Walk. This is a real must do if you have time in Sydney. Stunning scenery. Be sure to take a bottle of water though!
A must do. We did it Coogie to Bondi and It is a great coastal walk taking in the many beaches between Coogie & Bondi

Kids Loved the walk. our four children loved doing this walk...they are very active kids so they found it easy. It was the weekend so it was busy, buy hey just cast your eyes out to sea and forget the other people. Such a great coastal walk to do with the family.

If you only have three things to do in Sydney this is on the list!. Sydney has a terrific number of coastal and bush walks. I recommend this one if you only have one or two days in Sydney as it captures so much that is special about Sydney. People talk about the iconic Bondi Beach and so why not factor it into your day. I recommend starting at Bondi....North Bondi in fact, where you can walk around the rock pools before doing the broadwalk where amazing street artists turn over the long mural wall every three weeks. You pass the skateboard park which is fun before ascending past the iconic Icebergs swimming pool. Make time to pop into the waves or the pool if you can. Thewalk then proceeds along the coast line with beautiful views, so invigorating and a great way to walk out your jet lag and get some heart rates up.Strongly recommend you do this walk on weekdays as weekeneds are full of weekend warriors...the boot campers and joggers who will push you aside. Also consider starting at sunrise or ending at sunset so you get an extra dimension to your visit. We walk in the morning and drop into beautiful Bronte for breakfast. A small stretch of great cafes with great juices and wonderful breakfasts. Continue to Coogee to fully enjoy the cliffs and formations with historical Waverley Cemetary on the way. If you tire there are buses at every beach that quickly take you back to the city.If you love life you will love the fresh air, big sky and sunshine. We usually finish it by 930am which leaves you a full day of sightseeing.
Beautiful walk. Take water!! It can be hot.. Beautiful scenery. Loved this walk, but it can be a little strenuous at times. The Coogee Beach pavilion was lovely.

One of the most fabulous ocean/sea walks in the world. We walked for 4 glorious hours, went swimming, and ate the lunch we brought. Don't skip this walk on your trip to Sydney. I had no idea that such a beautiful ocean/Tasman Sea area existed so close to Sydney. We walked along 4 beautiful beaches with lots of waves breaking on big rocks in the rocky areas that separated the beaches. So much fun

There is nothing that beats the coastline of Australia for Beauty. A brisk summer morning with the breeze just ruffling your hair and the beauty of the ocean breaking against the coastline. What mor is there to say. The coastal walk offers the best of the Sydney eastern coastline as it weaves around the beaches of Bronte, Tamarrama and Bondi however there are things that need to be taken into consideration. There are often runners and while most of them are reasonable about sharing the walking path some are not. Chatty walkers like to walk abreast and can be loathe to let you pass if it means breaking the line and probably the conversation. The are stairs of varying heights and while I don't think the wall is overly difficult it does require some negotiation. While most people might head to Bondi for a coffee I still prefer the quieter atmosphere of the cafe at Tamarrama.
beautiful. Really nice walk with beautiful photo opportunities, take a haft day to have time for the walk and to relax in one of the nice cafes along the way.

Over-rated When Compared to Great Ocean Road. Bondi of course gets the "hip" youngsters & "hip" oldsters and the Asian picture posing takers ... beach packed... enjoyed watching the surfers & waves. Did not do the full walk... too many "sightseerers & posing photo takers to continue etc.". After experiening the Great Ocean Road's desolated beaches, dramatic cliffs and spectacular vistas a week eariler; would say it's extremely over-rated. If you need to visit Bondi... visit Bondi. Oh yeah, did not see a baby buggy parking area in any of the numerous sites I have visited.
Breathtaking walk. Breathtaking (and sometimes scary) views over the cliffs. Altogether not a difficult walk for most people.

Breathtaking walk. There really nothing specially prepared for this walk, it's just the eyeful of lovely ocean and beaches. Can be challenging physically, but there are spots to stop take a rest and take in the view or grab some food on the way.

Great romantic date. Great exercise, views and acts as a little romantic getaway from the busy streets of Bondi. Make sure you wear sturdy shoes and shades as there is no sun protection along the walk. Could get quite busy during the summers too!

Amazing views. I have done this walk so many times now as I always take any overseas visitors on this walk. The views are amazing and you'd be surprised how much there is to see. If you don't feel like walking the full distance you can just do bondi to Bronte or Clovelly. I would try and make it to Clovelly though as Gordans Bay (between Bronte and Clovelly) is gorgeous - my favourite bit of the walk.

Worth the Effort!. The walk from Bondi Beach to Coogee Beach is a cliff walk along the coastline. The path is paved, with many stairs up and down, and plenty of places to rest/take some photos. The gorgeous views and the great swim at the end made the 2 hour trek worthwhile!
One of the best walks in sydney. Fantastic walk past beautiful beaches all with a different vibe. Great views and not too difficult. Lots of joggers.

Top of the list of things to do in Sydney. Walking from Bondi to Coogee is breathtaking, we made a day of it firstly a swim & sunbathing at Bondi, a quick coffee at The Bondi icebergs cafe the best coffee in town in my book, followed by a light early lunch at Tamara beach Cafe, fresh tasty ingredients made an excellent salad, allow $15 with a drink. Sunbathing & swimming continued along the way, please beware that Rip Tides are very strong at times on many of these beaches & follow the rules set out by the lifesavers. Bronti is probably my favourite & cafes that serve healthy options & veggie juices that taste oh so good. The next stage of the walk from Bronti to Coogee is tougher on the knees as there are a few steep hills and steps, but the walkway that has been built in the past few years makes life much easier & offers outstanding views. Enjoy..

To help clear the cobwebs. If you are in the area you should try and walk this coast line. It is so beautiful, with lovely breezes and places to stop for a coffee along the way. Really clears your head and gets you into a relaxed beachside state of mind - perfect for holidaying or just winding down after work!
Amazing view!. It's not the best view ever (mainly if compared to Cottesloe beach, in Perth *cough cough*), but it's certainly a must when visiting Sydney.

a great easy walk.. A very scenic easy walk that is suitable for push chairs and jogging. can be quite busy but well worth doing. the path winds around some interesting rock formations and if you are lucky you will see dolphins swimming just off shore.

Great walk - and not only for visitors. This walk is one of the Sydney to-do's that I always recommend when my friends or family come to visit Sydney. It takes you from the south corner of Bondi Beach all the way through to Coogee via the other eastern beaches (Tamarama, Bronte and Clovelly). Given that it can be a bit of a stretch (around 2.5h - 3h walk) you can always break it up in one of the other beaches.

Beautiful backdrop. A very popular walk judging from the amount of people seen. Spectacular scenery from atop the sheer cliffs to little beaches & coves like Tamarama. A bit hilly - which the eastern side of Sydney naturally is but a very pleasant walk and the view of Bondi as you round the corner coming down the hill is worth it.

THIS WAS AMAZING. I loved this walk. It was beautiful. After a lovely brunch in Bondi we headed all the way to Coogee stopping off in Bronte for a drink and a swim. I think the whole walk took around 90 mins. There were a lot of joggers and a stunning coastline. It really is spectacular.

Relax and pleasant, stunning view, worth the time. This is a great place to spend your morning. The walk from Bondi to Coogee is about 6km, takes about 2 hours depending on your walking speed. It's awfully stunning walking along the cliff and it feels great to see the vast ocean, humongous waves coming on over and over again, chirpy birds and lots of seagulls, beaches, park, cafes, open lawn with lots of children playing rugby....you will never forget the feeling and experience of this beauty. You will see lovely beach houses along the coastal side. You will also come across the spot where it used to house a tiny timber residence of Nosey Bob, who is the first salaried hangman in the 19th century. As you enjoy the cliff walk, you will come to see the Waverley Cemetery, established in 1877 which houses graves of many famous Australians. This is definitely a place with lots of photography opportunity and totally relaxes your mind.
Beautiful. Hard work going uphill but well worth it. It took us less than 2 hours to complete and the lunch we had when we got to Coogee was great.
Amazing Scenary. I am blown away every time I do this walk just how pretty and diverse Sydney is. This walk is a great way to start a lazy Sunday morning then drop off in Bondi for breakfast.

Stunning scenery and a great place to exercise. Not many places with a coast line like this. So many places to want to take photographs. We took the bus to Bronte, walked to Coogee, had lunch then walked back to Bonding for the bus. Meant we had a 10k walk and could end up at the Iceberg for a drink enjoying the atmosphere before getting a bus back to Sydney. Hard to beat...

Stunning!. Absolutely beautiful. Don't miss this if you are visiting the area. The walk is spectacular. Bring your camera and your bathing suit. And end a wonderful day at the pub in Coogee. Loved it all!

Stunning views of some of Sydney's best beaches. This well-designed and well-maintained walk affords some stunning views of a few of the best beaches Sydney has to offer. Along the way there are a variety of lookout points, resting spots with benches in many cases and places to stop and eat if you fancy.There's not a lot of shade, so make sure you sunscreen/cover appropriately on hot days. There's a fair bit of up/down stair action, so although it's by no means a challenging hike, it's not a casual stroll either.Staying in Surry Hills, we got the train from Central to Bondi Junction and the bus on to Bondi Beach. Once we arrived at Coogee we bused back right to our front door on the M50.Bronte has some great places to eat, though we held on and had a delicious stone-fired pizza and beer at the Coogee Pavilion. A great reward at the end of it.

Fabulous. When staying in coogee this is a must, I job it early in the morning and it is fabulous, it's long ole track but well maintained path that winds along the coast offering amazing views, passing many of the Sydney beaches as well a rock pools and man made sea filled pools. Take time out for this!
One of the best coastal walks in the world. Totally stunning - Just do it! You can jog or walk or stop and swim along the way. You will feel renewed at the end of it.

A must do when in Sydney. This is one of my favourite things to do in Sydney. Late spring (Oct - Nov) is usually a great time as the weather is perfect for it, not to hot, but not to cold to go for a dip afterwards. Very popular these days so as early in the morning as possible is best. Highly recommended to anyone visiting Sydney
A must do while in Sydney!. Its a easy walk with breathtaking views over the wild coastline of Sydney. Don't expect it that you'll be all alone, its buzzing with tourists & locals-out exercising.
Great day's walk. We started at Coogee and walked to Bondi. Lots of pretty beaches. Don't forget to go to Iceberg's (sp) for lunch at Bondi. We loved Icebergs!

Recommend finishing up at Bondi. I do this walk from Bronte to Bondi with visitors who want a casual stroll - this way it's only about 30 minutes, and so it's feasible to wander back after a stop at Bondi if you've left the car where you started.PS I took a stroller the last time I did it which isn't impossible but it is a bit ambitious. Make sure your walking companion is prepared to help lift it up and down quite a few stairs!

Awesome walk. The sceneries and atmosphere during the sunrise are amazing!The path goes thought greats spot in which you can easily connect with the nature especially with the ocean and admire its magnificence.
Stunning views of Bondi. Most enjoyable if you have a companion. Stunning views of Bondi. There are a lot of houses around. Be careful in some places as it is narrow.
A must do walk!. Fabulous views & fabulous beaches. Well worth the walk & terrain is good too. You'll pass lots of joggers/keep fit people en route!
A Beautiful Walk. Just a lovely walk ... yes, do bring water, sunscreen & camera. Gorgeous, panoramic views of the beach and the saltwater pool.
Really doesn't get better than this!. I stayed at the Coogee Sands Hotel, which is right on the Coastal Walk, and I made the trip once a day during my stay. Weather was perfect 20 C, 68 F).

Beautiful Views, Boardwalks, Beaches & More!. You can’t go to Sydney without enjoying a day trip to the iconic Bondi beach. Of the many beaches in Sydney, it's probably the only one most Brit’s would be able to name. Like it's two fellow heritage listers; the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House, it is an international symbol of the city. But then so is Summer Bay, the fictional beach on Home and Away! We made the most of the day with a long coastal walk along Australia’s beautiful East Coast from Coogee Beach towards Bondi. The Coogee to Bondi walk features stunning views, beaches, parks, cliffs, bays and rock pools. We enjoyed the fresh sea breeze and the glorious rays of the Australian Sunshine (despite it being their Autumn, temperatures still soared into the 30’s). The board walk takes you past Waverley Cemetery; that has been described as the most scenic burial ground in the world and is easy to see why with the outstanding views across the Pacific Ocean.
pleasent. very nice not what you would expect to find in a city.some history to see on the way and some nice sights.take water.

Beautiful coastal walk. It was pouring with rain when we did this walk with a friend. Bondi beach was beautiful and deserted apart from a few surfers. The views from the walk were magnificent. The walk was almost flat throughout so suitable for most people
lovely walk. A very lovely picturesque walk taking in several different beaches. Beautiful views and very easy walking .

Spectacular. This walk is absolutely incredible. I would highly recommend it. Beautiful view and family friendly. Pop your swimmers in as there are a few beaches you can stop at for a swim along the way. There is also places available to eat, very conducive to rest breaks!

Coastal walk. We stayed at Clovelly and often walked both directions to Coogee and to Bondi. These were easy walks on prepared paths and stairs. They were a treat, even, or especially, in rough weather. On those days the crashing surf was lovely and there were always a few mad surfers to watch.

amazing views. when visiting, I try to do this walk every time. The walk is pretty easy, a few stairs though. The views out to sea and the rocky coast line are breath taking. You can walk back to bondi, or catch a bus at bronte or coogee.

Stunning views. Winding along the coast this walk gives you some stunning views of the sea, be prepared to see some joggers passing by and photography enthusiast here and there. We did not make it all the way to Coogee but still was a very pleasant walk.

very picturesque and soothing. I ran the 6k it takes to complete the Bondi to Coogee coastal walk and it was often a highlight to my day. it was very theraputic to just enjoy what nature has to offer and listen to the soothing noises of the ocean! would definitely recommend it.

A Favourite Family Day out in the School Holidays. My Family and I have completed this walk on several occasions over the years, and everytime we do it we enjoy it immensley. The scenery is spectacular, and shows off this Sydney Gem in all it's splendour. Sometimes we stop at Tamarrama for a coffee, or just continue on and return to Bondi for a well earned burger at Moo Burgers, Bondi Beach.You need a reasonable level of fitness to enjoy this walk, and don't forget the camera as the photo opportunities are endless :)

Great coastal walk. Excellent 6km walk from Bondi to Coogee or vice versa. We caught train and then bus from the City to Bondi Beach, had coffee overlooking the busy beach and then set out on the walk to Coogee. On a beautiful, sunny and warm late summer day it was an enjoyable walk followed by a well-deserved swim and lunch at Coogee before catching the bus back to the City. The views are wonderful and well worth it.

Must do. Great walk with fantastic scenic views of the sydney Coast line. For fast walkers it will take you well under an hour- I personally prefer walking from Coogee to bondi instead of the other direction.Avoid weekends as possible unless you don't mind the crowds

Wonderful coastal walk. Allow 3-4 hours to walk both ways fantastic at to see Australia's coastline good pathway too numerous bays to stop off at beautiful Gordon's bay, Bronte beach , too much to say reallyDo Not Miss This

Beautiful beach walk, has some hills. I agree this is a definite "to do" when in Sydney. Beautiful views: but I considered this a bit of a work out on a warm day. I recommend leaving enough time to enjoy Coogee beach after you finish the walk.

Spectacular scenery. We took the bus from the city in Sydney to Bondi Beach then quickly found the walkway that ran along the beach. We followed it all the way to Coogee. I'm not sure how long the walk would take without stopping to take in the breathless views and photos, but I suspect you should plan at least 1 to 2 hours. Just amazing scenery! Don't miss it!

The definition of Australian life. This was my favorite part of Sydney. This walk has breathtaking views and lots of activities on the way. There is something for everyone... Swimming, surfing, BBQ, snorkeling, boating, eating, drinking, socializing, or just relaxing in the sun. Wear comfortable shoes, a bathing suit, some SPF, and bring your camera. Absolute must do!!!
Awesome. Very nice walk ! To have good time not only on the beach, go to do this walk, you'l have many occasion to stop and swim...

Lovely walk, good views. I did the walk from Coogee to Bondi. It is a really lovely walk to take - quite easy so really anybody who is fairly mobile should be able to do it without problems. There are many places to stop & take a look at the view - also a good number of stops where you can refill your water bottle. One of the highlights for me was the cemetery - if you don't like taking a stroll through the graves, just walk past. If you do only one walk in Sydney (apart from walking the harbor bridge of course!), then do this one.

Pretty views, pleasant walk. A pleasant 2 h walk with very nice views. The path is in concrete and has wheelchair access throughout. It is very nice, especially in the evening as it is cooler and the changing light makes it even more interesting!

well worth the visit. Our walk was really enjoyable. The weather wasn't the best but the views were great, the beaches were spectacular. It was an easy enough walk. It is well thought out show case of Sydneys coastline.

Stunning Coastal Walk. We loved this walk, its a wonderful mixture of natural beauty and historical landmarks. There are a few little cafes to get refreshments and the path is very well marked, you won't need a map that's for sure.

A definite must do. The scenery along the way is breathtaking and the walk, although up and down steps in places, is not too difficult. There are several beautiful beaches to enjoy and some lovely places to stop for coffee or food. Just has to be done

Many tourists but a lovely walk on a balmy day. This is a well known Sydney walk but it's one of those iconic must check off the to do list. In August it is even busier when they have the Sculptures by the sea exhibition on, not a good time to do the walk if you want to exercise but if you don't mind strolling with 30,000 other people, sometimes the sculptures are worth the trek. Personally I prefer it a little quiter.
The View. Great walk and lots of beautiful scenery. Fishing, jogging, surfing, taking pictures, you name it- it was going on.
Has to be done.. Always an amazing walk. To explore the Sydney foreshores is always exciting. The privacy of the homeowners on the foreshores has been well maintained and the walks so beautiful.

Great time!. We had amazing weather and it was just amazing. Make sure to bring some sunscreen :) My favorit part was the two beaches you come to before coogeGreat place make sure to spend some time at bronte and tamarama

Breathtaking Views, Icebergs Swimming pool, A Must do in Sydney. After a day tour to Blue Mountains from Dingo Travel, I got off from the ferry at Circular Quay(5:30pm on Sunday Feb 8 2015), took a bus 338 (or take #333 displaying North Bondi for $3.80 one-way or buy return as #333 is pre-pay ticket only). I asked the driver for Bondi Beach and had only $3.60. She was generous and allowed me to ride the bus. I had the google maps print out and also asked a lady where to get off for Bondi Beach, I got off at Hall St, walked 5-10mins through the market and was at Bondi Beach in 45mins. Spent little bit of time at the beach and then made my way to the famous coastal walk. It had amazing and breathtaking views, specially the Icebergs Club with an outdoor swimming pool. I wish I had time to swim there as it was open to public (with some charge). The walk was amazing, with ups and downs, stairs, steep walk etc. Saw a lot of people walking, running, jogging, strolling with dogs or families. Even after 6:30pm it was hot and humid with 30'C and I was exhausted after a long day. I walked upto the Tamarama Beach, which was the first beach on the way. My plan was to walk upto the Bronte but couldnt. Still it had amazing views and I enjoyed a lot, took lots of pics n videos. I exited from the walk pathway, climed the stairs. and waited for a bus. It was Sunday and already 7pm, so had no buses but only 1 bus going to Cogee Beach. I had to go back to CBD, so my only option was to walk back the coastal walk and take a #333 from Bondi. So I walked back and was lucky enough to catch the bus. I tried to pay the driver but he said its a pre-pay only bus and I should have my return ticket. But the driver was friendly (yet again) and he allowed me ride for free :). If you have time, spare atleast half a day for Bondi Beach and the Coastal walk. I would prefer early morning or late evening, so as to avoid heat and sun but make sure you have enough sunlight to take amazing pics and enjoy the views.
Best walk in Sydney. Potentially one of the best scenic walks in Sydney . Views of the ocean set against rocks & cliffs absolutely beautiful in all weather.

Superb Walk. This is a must, its a stunning clifftop walk winding along the coast to Coogee beach. Take your togs, along the way there are fantastic salt water pools to cool off in, the one in Bronte is the best. On a hot day it feels a bit further than 6kms but its really worth it. Coogee beats Bondi hands down as far as I'm concerned. Everyone talks about Bondi but Coogee is quaint and beautiful. Don't miss walking out to the Baths Point - now called Dolphins Point where sightings of the Virgin Mary were reported in 2003 and 2007. There's a little shrine to the event which is quite interesting even if you're not a believer.

The best costal walk i've ever done and in a city!. I used to live in Bondi and I walked/ran this coastal walk 4 days a week as many other locals and tourists do. The views are superb, there are points that walk along the beach promenades, cliff top views and even bits that go through dirt paths and trees. Along this path around october each year they have "Sculptures by the Sea", a sculpture art exhibit that runs for a fortnight. It is very busy at this time so running is an issue but going for a stroll/walk is very fun and interesting to see the art on display. You could walk this path every day for months and never cease to have a smile on your face as you breathe the fresh ocean air and have the beautiful auusie sun beam down on your face and skin.

a stunningly beautiful adventure & we did backwards. Got the bus to Coogee, where we had a chippy brekkie by the sea. Then we set off for the walk. It's pretty easy going & well sign posted. And the views are worth it. On a sunny morning, we were joined by dog walkers & local runners. Who like us were enjoying the sun.There are plenty of benches on the way to rest on. And the walking is easy, so it'll be child friendly. BUT don't take the buggies, as you will be climbing a few steps.We celebrated the end with a lie in the sun on Bondi. The sea was quite choppy, & the lifeguards are brilliant at looking after everyone. If you want a safe swim, there are other smaller beaches on the way there. Also there is a kids pool.This walk was one of the most beautiful things we did.

Beautiful walk / jog. A definite must do . For all ages be it a morning jog or afternoon stroll. Plenty of caffe's along the route and plenty of seating to take a break and people watch or just sit and enjoy the views which are simply magnificent .

Get your steps in!. If you are looking for an incredibly beautiful energetic walk, this is it! Around every corner is another breathtaking view. There are a lot of stairs so be ready to really get out and exercise. Since you are walking along the towns, there are places that you can stop and have a bite along the way or before heading back to your starting point. Bring a water bottle!

Scenic walk. If you are visiting Bondi this walk is a must do. We are in our 60 s and it took us one and a half hours from Coogee to Bondi. It is one of the best scenic walks I have ever come across, do it.

Specutacular way to see the Sydney beach coastline. Caught the bus to Coogee. Great foreshore precinct with cafes & shops. The walk to Bondi was spectacular - great views of the surf beaches, bays, clifftop houses, cemetery, bowling club. Took us several hours because we took time to enjoy the scenery. Bondi was a great place to enjoy lunch and a refreshing 'vino' and soak up the beachside atmosphere. Bus stop on foreshore made it easy to find our way back to Sydney CBD.

A beautiful walk at anytime of year.. If you are visiting Bondi or the Eastern Suburbs, this is a must do. Stunning views, great for people watching and gentle exercise. Also includes a wonderfully atmospheric cemetery by the sea!

Must do. One of the best coastal walks in the world. A must do walk, with cafes at each and every beach to sustain you. For runners it is ideal and you can run past Coogee to Lurline bay and beyond...all the way down to La Perouse for ultra distance runners.On weekends & when the Sculptures by the Sea is on -best to go early as it can get crowded and busy.There are water fountains and toilets at every beach and park.

Excellent walk with different views at each turns.. The Bondi to Coogee walk features six beaches and a number of coves and bays. if you have the time and enjoy walking i would recommend this to experience the place. Don't rush it, you can find the time to take a swim, have a picnic or just enjoy the sea breeze and view from the coves.
great views, easy walk. just a delightful walk with wonderful scenery, worth doing. there are a few steep bits but plenty of seats to sit and enjoy the coastal view

A classic walk - not to be missed. I love this walk and have been fortunate to have done many times, both walking and running it at various times of the day. Every turn leads to a breath taking view, the lovely little beaches, the boardwalk around the cemetery, the steep steps and headlands.If you are in Sydney and like to either walk or run then make sure you do this and for extra fun do it in both directions. (I even saw dolphins once whilst doing this walk)

The coast with the most. the coastal walk from Bondi to Coogee is a great way for locals and visitors to Sydney to sample the delights of this city's beautiful sandstone coastline. Following the coast between two of Sydney's most famous beaches, this walk lets you enjoy the wonderful sandstone rock formations, rock pools and surf. Fantastic at any time of the year but even better during Sculpture by the Sea, Sydney's annual sculpture exhibition in which works are displayed from Tamarama Beach to Marks Park, Bondi. It can get very crowded during the day and especially on weekends but we tend to go very early in the morning or late in the afternoon.

Spectacular. having done this walk on many occasions it is always great when showing visitors around this beautiful walk. Breakfast followed by walk and a swim at the end is a good way to start the day

Fabulous views around every corner. After a long flight from Canada we hopped the local bus from Sydney to Bondi and walked the Coastal Walk. It was glorious! Bondi Beach has to be experienced to be believed. Surfboards and bikinis everywhere. The walk is along paths and boardwalks and the views around every corner are fabulous. Water is available along the walk as well as stops for bathrooms and ice cream. There is a bus back to Sydney via Bondi Junction from the beaches along the way. Highly recommend.

Favourite walk in Sydney. This walk offers something new every time. Whether it's seal or whale spotting, sculptures by the sea or simply enjoying the incredible views. Amazing beaches with great snorkeling options. A must do if visiting Sydney!!

Great day out. Easy walk with so much to see and take in. Take your swimmers and stop off for a dip in the water. The walk is only an hour or so but you can easily make a day of it stopping off, eating, swimming, napping etc.

one of Australia's best walks. Gorgeous views and a great café destination ( Barzuka's) at Coogee beach. The terrain is easy walking and the views are spectacular. It is exposed to the elements so a hat an sunscreen are essential
Wonderful walk. Great walk to do. Very easy to catch bus to either Coogee or Bondi from Circular Quay. Lots of cafes to stop at if you want along the way to break up the walk. Well worth it.
Spectacular views. A breathtaking scenic walk. The fresh smell of salt in the air, the sounds of waves crashing on the rocks below. This is a beautifull walk or run anytime of day.

Didi it in reverse. I was staying centrally on Campbell street and got the bus to Coogee from the stop on Pitt Street, only took 30mins and cost AUD3.80. Have a look online for times and bus info. Lovely 6km walk, easy going with great views. You can see why people want to live in Sydney.
Lovely walk, great views. Fantastic walk, easy pace, a few stairs is the hardest part BUT take your time and enjoy the views, heaps of coffee shops on the walk as well!!!
Definitely visit while in Sydney!. Beautiful walk - but make sure you are prepared to be walking uphill/stairs. The views are spectacular.
Beautiful. One of the most important thing to do in Sydney.Such a beautiful path, a beautiful view. Just amazing
Stunning views!. Loved this walk! Walked from Bondi to Clovelly and back. Not to difficult a walk and paths are good. Lots of places to stop for a coffee on the way.

This is Australia.. I lived a year in Sydney, and I think this portion of the city represents its spirit very well. Breathtaking views, easy going life, quiet and wild beaches.
