Then, take break and have a seat in one of several coffee shops at Coogee or Bondi. Enjoying the view will bring you the feeling that life can be really good sometimes. In my opinion, one of the best views in this walk is from Waverley Cemetery. Finding it was really a surprise (sorry!).

A nice enough walk with the great surf as a constant backdrop . As 1 or 2 others have noted this isn't the amalfi coast or the Cinque terra but it's a lovely walk to do - suggest it's best done before 11 or after 4. I walked from bondi to coogee as I was told the latter is a nicer less manic place to dwell a while. The coogee bay hotel is a nice place to stop for refreshments and does a wonderful cheese board & coffee!
Great views. This was such a good idea, you get to see Bondi which is a must then lovely coves and beaches. Take sun cream, a hat and water. Lots of look outs.

Amazing Views. This is a well paved beautiful coastal walk. Many joggers and others are walking along so you never have to worry about getting lost. It is several km with many beaches in between. You can stop every km or so at a beach for bathrooms and a snack. The signs say 1.5 hours but I recommend at least 3. I kept stopping to sit and soak in the amazing views.

If you only do one thing in Sydney this is it!. Unless you have a distaste for awe inspiring beauty don't miss this walk! I started in coogee based on a tour guide's recommendation for views; but really liked hanging in coogee I thought the beach and town was much nicer. We took an Uber instead of the bus, under $40 AUD. My 50 year old mom and I did the 7K and tell everyone meet to do it! She stopped for breaks as some parts are up hill, but nothing crazy! There are toilet and water stops along the way too. You pass through 5 other beaches, beautiful cliffs that you can take pictures on, coogee has an area for cliff jumping (small but fun), and a huge coastal cemetery. Then entire walk is paved and along the coast, this has been in my top three for Australia so far! The ferry boat to manly beach was nice too.
Good views. We walked the length of the walks and stairs, taking in the sights. Craggy cliffs, wild surf, surfers, lots to see along the way.

Nice costal walk. Not overly scenic. Don't get carried awayThis is not the Amalfi CoastThis is not one of the great costal walks in France, Italy or IrelandIt's a very 'nice' walk up and down hill along the Coast. Make sure to wear sun cream It's great value as its free More a case of doing the walk as its thre Won't ruin your holiday if you miss doing it

Annual Sculpture by the Sea Walk. The excitement of seeing another year's exhibits and contributions to this spectacular event is there again. A meal of your choice before you begin, overlooking one iconic beach, makes a good start.The sight of the sandstone headland above the spectacular waves and beach which is never bereft of people. - it's a great sight.As you walk around the paths, hewn out of sandstone, the salt sea air clears the head and the enthusiasm of the youngsters who have come for a daytime school excursion abounds. People of all ages, of all kinds and in amazing variation in attire surround you. It's not a place for you if you have a joint impediment, but there are many who manage it with a walking stick.A must, each year!
BEAUTIFUL!. This was stunning scenery. Highly recommend for any visitors. It was a nice walk and we briskly did it in just over an hour. The beaches were stunning and lots of great photo ops.

A great coastal hike. Did this on our first trip to Oz in 2002 and wanted to repeat our experience. Although it was busier this time and places along the route are more developed it is still a great hike..Views and bird life terrific.

It certainly is walking.. The Bondi to Coogee Beach coastal walk, certainly is a walk. There's a path, you take steps, there are other people around (usually a lot). The ocean is on your left, houses and cars on the right. There's not much more to say. If you're in the mood to burn off some calories after lunch, go ahead and do it. There are a couple of nice views, but there are a lot of people on the path at all times and I can't say that there's anything to recommend it over picking one of the beaches and going for a swim.

A must visit in Sydney!. We really enjoyed this walk today! Getting here there are different options. The bus 333 from the city brings you directly here however rather than sitting for a longer time on the hot bus (today was boiling hot!) we opted to take the train from Town Hall to Bondi Junction (air conditioned!) which is fast then take the 333 bus from Bondi Junction station which is really easy to find as large signposts everywhere showing you the way to go. Then 5 minutes on the bus and arrived!I loved the walk for the amount of photo opportunities there are , really so many! Even though it was a hot day today being on the coast you get the sea breeze and that really makes a difference.If you are in Sydney or coming I would definitely recommend this for an afternoon out. We arrived at Bondi around 11am and after exploring the beach and taking the walk we were leaving by about 2pm.I would suggest to take water with you though at various places during the walk there are snack shops/cafe when you arrive at the beaches during the walk and also water fountains with fresh water.It's the kind of thing I would only do once in the daytime (unless I was a fitness fanatic and lived in the area as many people looked to be using it as their workout route!) .. however possibly another perfect time to do this walk for me either sunrise or sunset, I can imagine how nice that would be.Definitely give this a go in Sydney. I've lived here for many years and thanks to tripadvisor I am discovering my own city, and it's amazingly beautiful!

Its worth it!. Its takes alot to do this walk, esp after beach activities at bondi, but its totally worth it. Stopby at Bondi iceberg club / bar for another round of swim (paid entry), before you resume your walk again.

Scenic Walk. This is a great walk that will take between 2 and 3 hours if you take it easy. Plenty of places to take a break. Views can't be beat and the walk takes you to several of Sydney's most famous beaches. We took city bus to Coogie from the CBD and after walking to Bondi returned via city bus. This gave us the added benefit of being able to see some more suburban areas.

So close to Sydney. A great walk along the coast which encompasses big sandy beaches with rolling surf and small sheltered bays where you can snorkel. The path involves ups and downs and steps so a fair degree of fitness is required, and bottles of liquid in the summer. Refreshments are available en route, for instance at Bronte and Clovelly, which together with Coogee, are more pleasant than the better-known Bondi.
A great walk. This was a lovely, scenic walk. Lots a places to sit and enjoy. Also a easy walk. Lots of photo opportunities?
Coogee to Bronte cliff top walk.. A little shorter than the full Bondi Beach/Coogee walk, even so this has fab views, varied terrain and lots of interest along the way. I loved it!

Must see in Sydney. Do yourself a favor and allocate a day to explore the coast by walking along this magnificent line, stop for lunch, swim, finish with dinner and a drink. When all done just cab it back to your hotel to fall into your bliss.

Scenic walk, but do it in reverse. This is a great walk, especially on a windy day it is extra spectacular. It is a good idea to do it in reverse and start at Coogee as the cafe scene is more extensive at the Bondi end, and if you are feeling fit you can continue to Rose Bay. Take the ferry back to the CBD from there. Better than the bus ride to Bondi Junction.

Coastal heaven.. As the 3526th reviewer of this beautiful walk, I'm sure I won't be adding much to the sum of information about it, but I'll try! Three of us set off from Bondi Beach at 9:30am on a humid March day. It was already warm, and as the morning progressed, it seemed hotter than the 29-degrees predicted for the day. It is a superb 6-kilometre walk along the cliffs and headlands, from Bondi to Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly and finishing up at Coogee. The track is what we refer to as "cut-lunchy", meaning paved, even and wide. There are some hilly sections and stairs but nothing a fit person would baulk at. We are in our 60s.We stopped for a coffee at Bronte Beach, where a strip of cafes offers about 6 choices. Cafe choices at Tamarama and Clovelly are limited, and Coogee is too bustling and massive to offer cafe intimacy. We didn't time our walk but the actual walking was probably about one hour 20 minutes. We caught a bus to Circular Quay from Coogee Beach after the walk, a trip of about 25 minutes. The buses run every few minutes. Recommendations for this walk are to start early if walking in summer, wear sunscreen, and take your cozzie for a swim if time allows. Lots of fitness freaks were in evidence, as were some very cute and well-behaved dogs. Highly recommended.
Great beach. As oz as you can get. Went on a hop on hop off bus and hopped off here for a while. Some cafes near by and plenty to see with good views of the beach from the road

Great walk. I did this walk from Bondi to Coogee.It tends to follow a well defined pathway - some of it specially built so you cannot really get lost.It has a fair few steps so it is not for those that are frail.Lots of places to stop and some good smaller beaches along the way.Stopped at the hotel at Coogee for a fish lunch.

Awesome views!. Did this with a group of friends, but we took a bus from central station to Coogee beach and walked to Bondi beach, then we rewarded ourselves with an nice meal at Bondi! The views were spectacular.
Great walk. This walk gives an insight into the lifestyle of Australia and the Beach culture. A definitely must do !
One of the best walks in Australia. Easy to do, along wonderful coastal scenery, finishing at Bondi Beach. Spectacular.Easy bus access to Coggee (no 333) from Sydney Circular Quays for the start.

Stunning Coastal Views and Great Path. I did the walk from Bondi to Coogee Beach on a Tuesday afternoon. It was an overcast day and that was actually nice as most of the walk would be in the sun if it would have been out. The breeze off the water cools things down a bit, but it would probably still be pretty warm in the midday sun.The path itself is very well taken care of. There are drinking fountains along the way and that was great to either have a quick drink or fill up my water bottle. The shore is striking with a great variety of rock formations and the beautiful sea. It is quite hilly and there are many stairs up and down throughout the walk, so you should definitely go prepared for exertion. I had walking shoes on and was glad I did--some folks were walking around in flip flops and I don't think that would be the best, especially if you plan to do the entire walk. It is possible to shorten up the walk at many points along the path, so there's no need to go all the way to Coogee if you don't want to.

Spectacular!!!. Sure hope you're in good shape when you decide to do this walk. Most people start from Bondi Beach to Tamarama Beach, to Bronte Beach, to Waverley, to Clovelly Beach, to Coogee Beach and lastly, Maroubra Beach. It's a looong stretch, so be ready for a looong walk. Bring water! We packed lunch and stopped repeatedly, swam in the ocean and pools, ate, took lots of pictures---and chatted with friendly folks along the way. Like us, people without selfie-sticks were more than glad to play photographer-of-the-moment, kindred travelers doing a good deed for the day:)Besides, there's always the bus! Make use of your Opal card. From Bondi Junction, take the #353 bus to Maroubra Beach; this will also pass Coogee Beach. Just tell the driver where you want to go and he'll tell you where to hop off. Walk as much or as little as you want, and find the next bus stop.From Bondi Junction, #378 goes to Bronte Beach. Do know that from Bondi Beach to Bronte Beach is 2.5 kilometers via the Coastal Walk. The path goes up and down and there are stairs, too.From Bondi Junction, #333, #381, and #382, all go to Bondi Beach. Bus #380 goes north towards Watsons Bay.Warning: while enjoying the vista, it's easy to forget how long you've been in the sun. You'll get sunburned even with suntan lotion.

Nice to be but overrated all are talking about Bondi but i think Manly is much better. Nice to be and to see the area and the people but better in Manly in my personal opinion. Not allot of choices to swim if the wind is too strong. and too many people in the beach usually on the WE.
Beautiful coastal views and beaches. Beautiful view of coast. Nice to get away from the crowds and explore beaches and coastline. Even in hot weather it was not too strenuous

A great way to see some of Sydney's best local beaches. This scenic walking self-tour along some of Sydney's favourite beaches is not to be missed.. Great for both locals and overseas tourists alike. If you only have limited time in Sydney and want to explore the great outdoor sunny lifestyle that the Sydneysiders enjoy then you should definitely do this walk... There are ocean lookouts and places to rest along the way, and it's definitely pedestrian friendly.. There are some stairs and uneven pavements to walk through, but you're definitely walking along the beach trail pretty much the whole way.. One of the highlights is actually walking through one of Sydney's most scenic and eerie cemeteries along the way at Waverley. You could do the walk in both directions, roughly 2hrs each direction.. Treat yourself to a nice beer or coffee at the end of your walk or along the way.. Stop over for a swim at one of the beaches ... Definitely great for some exercise with friends and family.. And do bring your camera or smartphone along for those all important selfies
Lovely coastal walk. A must do when visiting Sydney! Walking along the sea path is a great way to see all the little beaches and coves in the area and it's perfect for topping up the tan!

Great Lovely Walk. At last, fresh air for us! walk along this coastal line is very refreshing and romantic. Along the way, you can find stores and restaurants that will make you feel a little entertained. You will notice that you have walked very far already. the place is nice and clean too..

The most beautiful coastal walk.. From Bondi Iceburg passing through Tamarma beach, Bronte beach to Coogee. Great cafes to visit on the journey. Walk takes approx one and half hours if you don't stop.

Amazing ocean views. this is a hard track to do, plenty of hills and stairs, but the views are worth the efforts. the tracks went through a few beaches, so if you are not in a big hurry, it is nice to have a swim or have a coffee/cake at one of the many coffee shops along the way.

70th. Birthday trip with 2 daughters. This has to be one of the most beautiful walks I have ever done . It was on my bucket list to go and stay at Bondi & this was done with my two daughters for my 70th,, Birthday. We did this walk as many times as we could fit in the 5 days we were there , stopping off at the Iceberg baths for a swim , then Clovelly Beach & finally at Coogee, taking in all the breath taking views along the way. Lunch at Coogee and got the bus home to Bondi .It was just magical . Loved every minute . My visit was not with the list below , Family with older daughters in their 40s 'which has not got a box I could tick.

Definitely worth the bus ride out... beautiful walk and views.... The is a great 1.5 to 2 hour walk and easily accessible from Sydney by bus... we got the bus to Coogee and walked to Bondi vs. the other way round, then got another bus from Bondi to Watson's Bay, spent a bit of time there and then got the ferry back to Sydney..If you do it on a Sunday your Opal Card will get charged the grand total of $2.50 for the whole day!!! :-)

Great walk , amazing views. we had been recommended this walk, so started at Bondi Beach , walk is about 1.5 hours in total, but lots of beautiful bays, wish we had taken swim wear and spent more time

Worth a visit. Was a great walk (we nearly got to Coogee but ran out of time) the weather was great. Fantastic scenery. Many places to stop and have a rest or a coffee. We went on the train and only downside was that is was a decent walk to to beach from Bondi Junction station and not very well signposted, but was worth it when we got there

Spectacular. An easy walk with spectacular views, I had to keep stopping to take it all in. Stopped for a dip in the water at Bronte and a lovely lunch at one of the local cafe's. We kept walking to Clovelly beach and caught the bus back to circular quay. Highly recommended!

A must-do for anyone visiting Sydney. Australia can be expensive but going for this walk is a great example of something you can do for free which is good for you as well. Combined with the beach and local shops it makes a good day out. Its just a shame there is no train all the way upto the beach and you have to get a bus from Bondi Junction.

Great walk and easy bus links to and from Sydney centre. We really enjoyed the walk along the coast. There are good options for food and drink along the way although these are a little pricey (more so than Australia is anyway for food and drink) due to the location. I would recommend this as a good excursion out of the city for some fresh air and beach time.
Beautiful coastal walk. a nice and easy coastal walk with beautiful views and some great photo opportunities. Go with a bottle of water and a charged camera... You'll love it!

Beautiful walk. Worth the walk, amazing scenery and great way to check out the different beaches. Did a few times running, (good for hill training, lots of steps!). Very hot in the summer though so take care with sun cream / hats!

rejuvenation. a famous walk best for the body and the mind. really picturesque scenic and mind boggling experience. the waves the ragged sandstone edifices the lovely beaches the serene cemetery and the beautiful lookout at the end - all amazing.
Gorgeous views!!. The walk is breathtaking... It is a bit of up and down but there are plenty of opportunities to stop and take pictures.

Great small ,beautiful walk South to Bronte. Stopped ,sunbathed in great small beach at tamarama,,,Great facilities ,toilets ,shower ,coffee ,life guard station for safe swimming ...Great spot ...sea and surf ,waves slightly strong ..lol

Brilliant!!!!. I debated between spending a second day in Blue Mountains or coming back to Sydney to do the Bondi to Coogee Walk. In the end I decided to do the Bondi to Coogee walk and it's the best decision I've made! Absolutely stunning views, gorgeous cliffs and beaches! Definitely recommend to everyone! Super easy walk and can be easily completed by those of any fitness level!
Great walk , stunning views. We had this recommended to us, it took us about 90 minutes, but worth the time, lovely views, beautiful beaches. A must to while in Sydney
Glorious beach walk. A beautiful walk with breathtaking views. Amazing that this is in a city. Loved the easy trail and the views.

Incredible scenery. This walk is well worth the time. We started at Coogee and walked to Bondi and then spent time at the beach. There are several nice lookouts along the way. Some of our best photos from our trip to Australia were from this walk.

Views that are absolutely out if this world!. We did this walk on a very hot day, so several water stops were needed. The ocean views are stunning. The flowers on the cliffs are truly beautiful. The cliff formations are spectacular. We saw what appeared to be a baby penguin but in the event was a young cormorant! At the first beach there is a lovely kiosk which sold a brilliant frappe coffee. Just what we needed. The gradient is a long climb and there are three sets of steps. When you get to the kiosk, again it is all disabled accessible and a wooden walkway goes right to the end of the beach. My son and his friends go there a lot because of the wheelchair accessibility. Lovely sandy little cove and not crowded.

A real treat. What a great way to see beautiful sandy beaches & get a flavor of the way the Australians love sport & the outdoors. I felt positively lazy just walking, but by the end of many stairs. I felt invigorated and ready for a late breakfast in Bondi, before my return walk. The water faucets & cafes were much appreciated as was the partial cloud cover on a hot day.

Wonderful Views. One of the best walks you can do on a sunny day... I have taken Friends and family there and it never tires me... Although it can be very windy at times. Make sure you bring sunscreen on clear days!

Stunning. Beautiful walk, would recommend to anyone. You can take a break at any of the fabulous beaches along the way and chill out. In my opinion its not a strenuous walk at all! Plenty of view points and lovely picture opportunites.

Sculptures by the sea. Make sure you do this walk while Sculptures by ther sea is on the whole place comes alive with amazing sculptures created by some fantastic up and coming artists. The scuptures compliment the surrounding landscapes of the rugged coastline.

Beautiful walk. It is a very beautiful walk with many steps (not for a baby stroller or pram). Beautiful coastal scenery with cliffs and hidden beaches. We went from Bondi to Coogee and returned to Bondi Junction via bus. We ate lunch at the Coogee Pavillion which was average. If I was to do it again, I would stop at Bronte and either return to Bondi via the coastal walk or get a bus at Bronte. The walk from Bronte to Coogee was not as pretty and had a lot of elevation change.
What a scorcher. It is a lovely coastal walk, best avoided in the noon day heat. A cool beer at the ned is worth the 7.5 k walk.

A must do while in Sydney!. My husband and I enjoyed our walk from Coogee Beach to Bondi! In fact, it was a highlight of our trip to Sydney. I recommend starting at Coogee (several buses run there regularly from the CBD) and ending in Bondi for lunch. The entire walk took us 2.5 hours and it was glorious with the morning sun and ocean breeze. We passed 4 beaches, the Waverly cemetery, and one bay. There are places to fill up a water bottle, use the washroom and change into a swimsuit along the way. Do it during the week to avoid crowds...we were fortunate as it was also low season (February).

Stunning. I took the Hop-on/Hop-off Sydney bus to Bondi on my recent visit to Sydney. (This worked well, as I bought a 24-hour pass and saw the Sydney loop on one day and the Bondi loop on the next day.) The bus drops you right on the sidewalk near the beach, and if facing the water, walk to the right to pick up the beach walk after the parking lot.The walk itself is breathtaking. The beaches and coastal cliffs are stunning and there are multiple opportunities to step off the path and explore further. Each beach has restroom facilities and filtered water. Highly recommend!
Walk. The view Walking from one beech to another was stunning , but make sure you have descent foot ware .
Beautiful walk and high waves. Great beach with lots of high waves for body boarding or surfing. The walk was gorgeous. Take a slow stroll to take it all in.

amazing views. Choose a nice morning to start your walk. The view is fantastic, the walk was not too strenuous. There are many "water points" along the way, to drink from the spout or refill your water bottle. At the end, at Coogee, have a nice meal and a cool beer.

What a view!. This was a stunning walk along some breathtaking coastline. It takes about 2/2.5 hours to complete. We didn't think it would take that long, however stopping for regular photos does mean it takes longer than you think! It is not particularly strenuous, just be aware of the heat in summer. I'd recommend comfortable shoes for walking but keep flip flops in your bag for the beaches on the way.There is a bus from Hyde Park in Sydney, directly to Coogee where the walk begins. Plus, there is plenty of food available in Bondi to replenish your energy when you have finished!Pack that sun cream!

Beautiful beaches and superb sea. I completed this walk feeling very proud of myself as without any stops it can take 2 1/2 to 3 1/2 hours however from a scenic stand point it was SO beautiful! There are some quite steep hills and plenty of steps to climb so I wouldn't recommend it if you are not fit and healthy. We stopped at Bronte Beach for a picnic as they provide picnic benches under shade. Take plenty of water and don't forget sunscreen as this walk does not have many shaded areas, maybe a hat too would be advisable.

Hop on Hop off bus. We travelled to Bondi and the Hop on Hop off bus. Well worth doing. It was a nice walk along the beach and surrounds and watching the surfers on a windy day.Many good eating places overlooking the beach.
Picturesque walk. Best done on a sunny day, a wonderful way to see some of Sydney's best surf beaches. You can stop along the way and swim and have coffee or lunch. The water is crystal clear.

Awesome Walk, never get tired. This attraction when searched in the things to do in Sydney, is on top of the list. After visiting this personally we understand why it is so. Its a 6 km walk connecting 4-5 beaches (Bondi, Tamarama, Clovely, Coogee) and giving endless sea views. On a sunny day the views will be amazing. Also the layout on every beach is so thoughtfully engineered, which gives us a different settings every 15 minutes of the walk.There are endless photo oppurtunities on this walk.Also the facilities provided and top class.Definitely recommended when you are in Sydney.

Stunning views, A must do if you visit Sydney!. It was amazing! I walked Bondi to Coogee with my partner, Mum & Uncle while visiting Sydney for a family wedding... Such a cool walk, Nice wide paths & Board walks, Views to die for, Plenty of spots to stop at & swim or just relax...
Good little walk. Not as intense as i thought it would be so i recommend running. Take your wallet and go to breakfast at the other end ;)
Beautiful and clean beach!. This is not Venice beach, but a beautiful clean beach that has so many things to do. What a beautiful destination to visit!

A must must must walk. This walk is actually from Bondi to Bronte to Coogee Beach .We did not do the Complete walk, after a swim at Bondi Beach, we walked till Bronte beach.It is Totally Recommended.The sights enroute are totally awesome, I would keep on turning back to see the Bondi Beach. The Water was pristine blue and the setting appeared to be set in Heaven .
A Good Walk. The whole walk is paved and well laid out with many water stops along the way. Great views unless it's raining! Gets a lot of runners so beware

Surf and rocks. This is one of the world's greatest coastal walks, not least because it is just a couple of hours. Bondi beach has gorgeous sand and iconic surf; then you walk around the headland watching the surf crash onto the rocks below; then Tamarama beach with its historic Surf Lifesavers Club House; a short walk across the beach, around another rocky headland and there is 'family friendly' Bronte beach with the protected rockpool and the seawater swimmingpool. You guessed it - another headland, a boardwalk above the rocks, another family beach - Clovelly and then the final headland around to Coogee. Cafes and swims along the way - what more could a person wish for?
BEAUTIFUL!. Absolutely stunning walk and what's more, its free! So many beautiful places to stop and sunbathe/swim/relax along the way.

Beautiful Walk. I loved this walk and did it several times while I stayed to in the area. The walk is easy to follow and there is no chance of getting lost. There are also several places along the way where you can get a drink or snack, go to the bathroom or sit down for a bit. Make sure to wear your sunscreen as there is no shade.

Lovely walk along the coast .... but not as nice as it used to be. In the past 10 years a lot of the walk has new barriers or is fenced off to restrict access. Still a lovely walk and I would recommend going midweek and take plenty of water .... fountains are available at Coogee and Bondi.You can also start at Coogee and stop at Clovelly or Bronte Beach which are protected from the breeze so a lovely place for a picnic.

It Should be on Your Bucketlist. Since it had been on our list to do 2 days before the end of our month trip to Australia we decided mid-morning to take the bus to Coogee Beach and walk back to Bondi. A great outdoor activity and plenty of remarkable points of view. We met many individuals or couples doing it as part of their exercise program but most visitors do it at their own pace, enjoy the many opportunities to take pictures or the waves, beaches and coves as well as of the surfers. Don't forget your suntan lotion and water.

Must do!. It is a must do. Best attraction in Sydney. Better than anything. Come early in the morning or in the evening as it might be difficult to walk under sun. It is a long walk but if I can do it with my wife so can you. But still if you think you might not be able to complete, START FROM COOGEE. It is by far the best joggers track I have ever seen. It has breathtaking views. Carry spare clothes as it will be very difficult to control yourself from going into water.
Lovely Walk along the coast. Its a lovely place for a nice stroll in the evening. Its beautiful. I think the complete walk is about 6kms.

Great. It was fabulous. A can't miss. On a hot day, take a hat. The scenery is wonderful and finishing the day at Bondi, at the bar overlooking the surf beach is amazing. Plus, you can "join" the swim club and cool off in the pool. Towels can be rented and there are showers. After, go up to the restaurant/bar and while away the day.

Coogee to Bondi Walk. We did this spectacular 6km walk from Coogee to Bondi, as we wanted to relax in Bondi after the walk. The coogee beach is very nice for a swim, although the water can be choppy at certain times of the day. The walk is medium level, but provides stunning views on the way. One should budget 2-3 hours for the walk. We also enjoyed a dip at the Bronte Bath to cool down on the hot and sunny day.

An absolute must for anyone in sydney. A beautiful and spectacular pathway along the cliff tops and beaches between these coastal towns. A combination of concrete paths, timber boardwalks and stairs. Take your bathers and try the beaches along the way. Or if it's cold schedule in a coffee stop or two.

Grab a coffee and enjoy a morning walk. This was a great way to spend the day. Grabbed a flat white at a local cafe and walked from beach to beach to beach. It was beautiful and a unique way to spend the morning.
A great walk. A great walk along the coast. Remember to take plenty of water and sunscreen (I forgot the sunscreen!). Was further than I was expecting!

Great way to see multiple beaches. We set out to do Bondi to Coogee, but it was a pretty hot day so we weren't sure if we'd make it. As we left Bondi we started sweating as it's an uphill climb right then, but then it levels off. The path passes through several beaches along the way and there are plenty of places to stop to rest. The walk is very well maintained and has some amazing views along the coast line. Ending in Coogee Beach was great as there are a lot of places there to eat and relax.

Stunning, go both ways.... Very different views from both directions, well worth doing it both ways! Busy, lots of runners, quite challenging even though I am fit, but mainly as it was quite hot and humid. We started at Coogee and stopped of for drinkies at Icebergs, above Bondi pool, then walked back to Coogee. Super morning, wonderful scenery, lots of half naked men running, what's not to like?!

What a beautiful walk!. As they say it's not the destination, it's the journey and this one surely makes that true. We took the bus to Coogee beach and then walked to Bondi as suggested by our concierge. It would have been even better had it been a little cooler but the views are absolutely fantastic. There are also public utilities at regular distances. It's a must do in Sydney!

Breathtaking in more ways than one!. Seriously one of the most beautiful coastal walks Australia has to offer, I highly recommend the Bondi to Coogee walk, especially around Sculptures by the Sea time.But be warned, there are several very steep areas and a fair few stairs so a medium level of fitness is required. But there are several places to stop and rest ad enjoy the view along the way, or take a dip if the weather gets hot.

Excellent shore walk. I found myself in Sydney with a day to do whatever. I had been there before and seen all the famous sights like the Opera House and other things downtown. Someone suggested I do this walk and Im glad I did! It was very scenic, I got to see several beaches, and I felt like I did something not a lot of foreigners do, which I liked. I'd definitely recommend it if you have the time (took me about 2 hours to walk from Bondi to Coogee). Just make sure you bring your walking shoes and go when the weather is decent.

it's OK I guess. Look, if you come to Sydney, the best thing you can do is check out all the amazing beaches before you settle on bondi and coogee, especially if you want to get away from the tourists.My recommendation would be to go south to the national park or north (anywhere between northern beaches and gosford) but don't get conned by the whole over priced, over rated, tourist trap that is Bondi.Or if you're really looking for amazing coastal culture, get up to Byron but remember, Bondi is just a flash in the pan compared to what else Australia has.

One of the best things for free to do in Sydney. The coastal walk between Bondi and Coogee is one of the best things to get a real feel for Sydney you can do for free. You can either drive and try and I said try to get park in the area and then do the walk or get a train to Bondi Junction and then a bus to Bondi.Better option to do this if you like the coast but dont have to be on a supper busy beach like Bondi, (you wil either love it or hate it) A beach great for people watching , a bit of sun baking and a swim but dont expect a seculded beach tropical paradise. Bondi is not this. Think more like Vencie beach LA. But the walk is something else. Really worth the effort. I like to do the walk half the go back for a quick swim at Bondi and head of to a coffee shop near by then home as you get the best of both worlds.

MA says " a stunning walk". This has views of sea, cliffs, sandy bays, it has it all. The paths and steps etc are all well organised and barriers etc safe and well maintained.You have everything here to pass by a bowls club, a cemetery, multi million houses, ramshackle places. All of life you pass by. The attention to preserving the environment is obvious and impressive and the headland view of Bondi beach is nothing short of spectacular. everyone visiting Sydney should do this walk!

Breathtaking coastal walk. We prefer to do this walk the other way round. Do not set a time limit, but make it a leisurely enjoyable stroll. A continually changing scene, of bays, crashing waves and passing one of the greatest cemeteries you are likely to see anywhere. (Yes, I did say cemetery). Lots of places en-route for refreshments, toilet breaks and places to just sit and absorb the surroundings. If you like or want to try outdoor bowling, at Clovelly the green is right on the cliff top. The experience is unbelievable, and at $12 with all the equipment provided, tremendous value.

Lovely walk with great coastal views. A fabulous way to spend a couple of hours. Lovely coastal views, a brilliant path well set out, fabulous beaches in lovely coves, places to drink and eat on the way. Really enjoyed this walk.

Great Walk. I love this walk. As long as you go when it is quite. Early morning or in the evening. It is lovely when the wind is blowing off the sea; very bracing and invigorating. But like anywhere in Sydney the place can get horribly overcrowded (during Sculptures by the Sea - is one time to avoid) At the Bondi end there are some very steep steps and on a hot day I am pretty exhausted just climbing them! Lots of walkers, children, dogs, joggers and posers! An interesting mix if you are into people watching. You can pick up food and drinks at either end of the walk. But parking at either end is an absolute nightmare; especially in summer. Catch the bus there and back if you can.

Sydney at its best. We live in Sydney and my husband and I love walking. We drove to Bondi Junction, caught the bus to Bondi and started the coastal walk. The weather was perfect, the sun making the blue water sparkle. Not many people around which was a bonus as we followed the well marked track. We took our time, stopped so many times to take in the spectacular views of the ocean as well as the landscape. Seeing where the cliff faces have fallen into the ocean was amazing. Although there are steps it is not at all difficult. On reaching the beautiful beach at Coogee we enjoyed lunch at a local and well priced café. Are you visiting Sydney? You must do this walk!
Fantastic. We were advised to do this walk & we are glad we did. It was a unforgettable experience. The sound of waves hitting rocks was just amazing.

great walk. This is a great walk path along the coastal. You probably be able to see the art works during the period of annual event normally held in Oct-Nov. Fresh air, beautiful sea view, great exercise. This is definitely a good option to choose. Don't miss it.

We had many great experiences, but this was a true highlight of our visit to Australia!. It is like a walking version of Highway 1 in California! The footpath takes you around and through the beautiful rock formations along the coastline. The views are simply magnificent. Don't miss this incredible walk.

Iconic walk even better during Sculpture by the Sea. Great scenic walk-mostly easygoing-from Bondi to Tamarama to Coogee. Coast beautiful. Fun to people watch at the beach.Careful with Tamarama beach-easy to lose footing even in shallow surf

Sculptures by the sea. The walk itself is spectacular especially on a sunny day although even when its raining and blowing a gale you still get a sight of mother nature at her best smashing the waves at the rocks below. I generally do this walk when Sculptures by the sea is on, the most recent event was fairly average in my opinion compared to the previous year but its definitely worth looking at.There are plenty of beaches and cafes on the way so there is always somewhere to stop and cool off with a dip in the sea or a drink/snack.

Beautiful scenery. We were told by a lot of people to do this walk and we are very pleased we did. We didn't do the whole walk as we had our 2 year old with us and it was a rather hot day. The views are fantastic and getting a little exercise at the same time is a definite bonus!

A regular walk on every visit to Sydney. Superb views, from an easy walk that you can do in either direction using buses to get you around. Stop off at Bronte for a beer or snack and then try lunch at the Bondi Icebergs swimming club (visitors welcome.) What's not to like? (Well perhaps the 380 bus from Bondi to the city rammed with returning backpackers at the end of the day!)

Breath-taking!. Ocean breeze. Spectacular views. We hiked the trail from Bondi to Tamarama, and were blown away by the beauty of the Australian coastline. For budding photographers, it is a dream: at every turn an idyllic vista smacks you in the face. For the health conscious: I can think of no better environment for a run or brisk walk. Our entire trek was paradisaical, and if we had had the time we'd have hiked the whole trail. Kudos to Australia for constructing this public walk! Well worth an afternoon.
This is a MUST do!. wow what a walk! bit of a mission to get to the start via public transport, but well worth it. tip : try and avoid the peak hour traffic as much as possible.

Do what the locals do.... When every I travel, I want to do what the locals do. I don't want a pre-packaged plastic tasting mass marketed experience.The Bondi to Bronte walk is one of my top 3 things for out of towners to do. But preferably early in the morning ie 6-8am, before the tourists come and meander.Bring your runners. Great cafes either end so the 3.5km walk either way does have a silver lining.

Enjoy the beauty of Sydney's Eastern Suburbs Beaches. This walk is one of the best you can do anywhere in the world! Power through or stop and take in the beauty - accessible 12 months of the year. No two days are ever the same so do it over and over. Plenty to do along the way or just do a section one day and finish the next. A great way to take in some of the prettiest beaches in Sydney.

Quite a workout. I had previously always completed the walk/run from Bondi to Bronte and never ventured further. Extending my run beyond Bronte and all the way to Maroubra, the setting is extremely picturesque. There are sections approaching Coogee when the steps are a little steep...leading to a solid workout. If continuing onto Maroubra, it doesn't get any easier!
Fantastic day!!. A must for travellers to Sydney. Wonderful views along the coast.Very easy to travel from downtown Sydney
Amazing. I live nearby and go for a walk along the coast every week if possible. The views are amazing. Maybe start in Coogee and have a drink afterwards at Icebergs in Bondi.

Location for Sculpture By The Sea. Stunning cliff top pathway undulating around headlands via Tamarrama, Bronte & Clovelly Beaches. Also passes historic Waverley Cemetery. Late October / early November in the springtime is the wonderful Sculpture By The Sea exhibition between Bondi, Marks Park & onto Tamarrama Beach...Everything about the walk is stunning... Experience the greatest spectacles which are Sydney's essence

Beautiful walk and scenery!. The best things in life are free! We took the bus to Bondi beach from Downtown Sydney and took the scenic cliff walk to Coogee. The walk was a little difficult and had it been a hot sunny day we would have had to stop and swim. We did the walk in about an hour and a half and stopped along the way for photos. This was a highlight of our trip. We ate in Coogee at a quaint restaurant on the beach.
Great walk. fantastic views, relatively easy walk. Goes along the cliff tops and gives you great views of the beaches below.

Amazing views the entire walk. It can be a little challenging in a couple places with steep hills and a lot of stairs but if you take your time to take in the beautiful views it's absolutely worth it! Definitely go early in the day to avoid hot sun in the middle of the day.

perfect views and a happy feeling. you will get, if you walk this nice way from beach to beach. It's packed on the weekends with joggers..... But it is really a nice retreat walk if you want to leave the city behind you and don't want to just sit at the beach. Short break for coffee or water at Tamarama Beach is a nice opportunity as well. Enjoy ! I did !

Best Coastal Walk - Sydney. Any visitor to Sydney should do the Bondi - Coogee walk (or vice-versa). It's a great way to see our fabulous coast line, walk through several beaches (including Tamarama, Bronte, Gordon's Bay), take in the fresh sea air. On a warm sunny day, it is Sydney at it's best - welcome to Australia!! Whichever beach you end at, try out one of the many local cafes (great food, reasonably priced, excellent coffee!).

Breathtaking! . This walk is absolutly fantastic! My girlfriend and I did it on her Birthday, what a great idea, especially at sunset. Took us about 2,5 hours, but a lot of photo stops and easy Walking :-)

Not a whole lot of shade available, but a beautiful beach. Not much available in refreshment or dining opportunities. Manly Beach is a far better option if you have to choose. Bondi does have a much more attractive crowd and better surfing.
what a walk to start your day. great walk at any time of the day, watch the surfers on the way, have some break in Bronte, or simply enjoy all the sights and steep cliffs to walk along.
Best Coast walk in Sydney. Fresh air, great scenery and a great time to take overseas visitors is when "Sculptures by the Sea is on"!

A great walk with scenic sea views. It's a great walk with lots of opportunities to stop off and have a swim in some of Sydney's best beaches. Beautiful coastal scenery and great pubs/cafes to rest feet at either end. No weather protection and largely unsheltered so best for good weather days w hat & sunscreen.

Amazing walk from beach to beach. This is a paved board walk between the beaches in Bondi Junction, Australia, just outside of Sydney. It was clean,safe and provided hand rails. There were public restrooms and refreshments at each beach. The inclines on the walk were moderate. It took us about 2.5 hours to hike the full way. There are public buses at each beach to take you back to town if you don't want to walk back.

One of the best.. Amazing walk. Incredible outlook and so many rewarding things to do at either end. I find early mornings are the best time, when the scenery is at it's most beautiful and the crowds at their smallest.Note that there are quite a few stairs, some of them pretty steep, which makes it next to impossible for parents with prams.I highly recommend this for visitors to Sydney and locals alike.
Coastal Walk. The walk provides spectacular views of the Australian coastal region that lies just a city-bus-ride from downtown Sydney.
Beautiful Scenery. Just don't do it in the middle day of summer. Go either early morning or late noon. Take a rest at Bronte Park and grab some fish and chips.

Coogee to Bondi Coastal Walk. This is a must to do. The scenery of the different beaches is breathtaking. There are bubblers along the way if you get thirsty and a couple of cafes. There are a lot of steps so people with prams or people with bad knees might find it a bit hard. We had lunch at the Bondi Hotel and it was great value for money.
Stunning!. This is a stunning sea cliff walk only 15 mins drive from the city. Schedule time to stop at one of the cafes at Bronte beach for lunch or even coffee.Unmissable!

The best beaches in the world. This walk is a must-do for anyone visiting Sydney. It is truly spectacular and absolutely free. You will walk along the coast starting at Bondi, then Mackenzie's Bay, Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly, Gordon's Bay and finally Coogee where you can relax at one of the local cafes. Sculptures by the Sea is an exhibition not to be missed if you are in Sydney 22 October-8 November 2015. The sculptures are scattered along the coastline between Bondi and Tamarama but be prepared for crowds. If you don't like crowds go in the early morning or evening.

Breathtaking coastline!. This is a must-do for those visitors to Sydney who won't have time to explore our fantastic coastline ! The walk is best started at Bondi and can end at Bronte which has a delightful rock pool, numerous cafes and where the pace is a little "slower" than Bondi.

Spectacular scenery. I have done this walk three times, two during the Sculpture by the Sea display. On those two occasions, the crowds were almost overwhelming, even though it was mid week. It did tend to take away from the pleasure of viewing the sculptures. Nevertheless, at other times it is a most lovely walk, some steps, but not too difficult and the scenery is delightful with many delightful places to stop, catch your breath and just absorb the delights of rocky coastline, deep blue sea, crashing white onto the rocks, and bright sunshine. Coffee at Bondi before starting, stop at Bronte for some fish and chips for lunch and then wander onwards to Coogee.

Great easy coastline walk. Great early morning walk from Bondi to bromate, have brunch then walk back. Big dramatic coastline with great views. Well worth it. Look out for aboriginal whale carving in rock floor half way along. Only downside is it can get a bit busy with the serious joggers and fitness fanatics innthe cool of the morning/ evenings
Beautiful scenic walk. Only 14km return...start at Coogee beach and lunch at Bondi...lots of cafe. After walk back to Coogee, very good exercise!

best walk in Sydney. Lather on the sunscreen and put on comfortable walking shoes - talk some water and a camera and goBreakfast in Bondi first - leisurely walk exploring the bays and looking at the houses on the wayLunch in Bronte on the way back
Where else would you be.. This is one of the beat coast walks around. There are now many board walks installed to add to the enjoyment of this great walk.

Great walk Picturesque. I did the walk from Coogee to Bondi with a friend who lives in the Sydney area. It was cheaper to park in Coogee. It is a great walk with ups and downs and even a cemetery to walk past. The day we did it, it was cloudy so the sun did not beat down on us, imagine on a sunny day it would be very different. We went through all the beaches and every on was slightly different as if their own personality. I enjoyed it immensely, there are even places to sit for a bit, and you can even wade through the water at each beach. If you are into photography, there is a lot to photograph because each beach area is different. I even got some shots of flora that is unique to Australia. There is a house just past Coogee that has some unique windows all to take in the light and probably nice to look out from. If you are into the scenery and just being outdoors this is a great experience. We did it in 4+ hours just sauntering and taking pictures and enjoying the scenery. It is about 5K so you can do it in a number of ways, there were some jogging and walking fast etc. Enjoy.
Stunning walk. Just a blow away walk with great coastal scenery, and easily accomplished for anyone even moderately fit.
Beautiful place. Really nice place, have to see this if you go to sydney, its a really nice walk. Not too long to go there with the bus from the city. I recommend that beach if you love the sea !
What to do at bondi. Put on your runners and have one of the nicest walks.. Ever. October plus or minus has sculpt upturn by the sea. Too good for words. Early am best. Nice eye candy!

Beautiful Views. The weather was perfect, which assisted in incredibly beautiful camera shots. The walk wasn't too long and there were so many different photo opportunities.... water, rocks, wildflowers and birds (that fly in the sky!!!).

It's a "must do". This iconic walk is an absolute must. It offers wonderful views of this fantastic coastline. It is a little up and down but should be easy to do unless you are really unfit. The weather was a little rainy so we walked from Coogee to Bronte and then caught the bus from Bronte to Bondi Junction. This is an option if you didn't want to do the full walk to Coogee.
Beautiful Walk along the Sea Front. Great Walk along a path with great scenery along the shoreline.Lots of other walkers and runners to check out.

Great Walk With The ability to make your own. Views that are breathtaking go with out saying. But The added bonus is you can modify this walk to provide a personalized fitness routine. Add in a detour to the top of the cemetery and back, continue past Bondi Beach and pavilion and continue to north Bondi, stop at Bronte if you're short of time or just want a well made coffee. Remember to visit this location when the annual sculptures by the sea is On.... Its Magic
Scenically stunning. walking shoes on, bottle of water, and sally forth. Love this walk, always something new to see. Try not to go when its busy though early morning is best.
The walk. Best done in the early morning and even better at sunrise to beat the crowds. Take your camera and take your time.

Natural beauty... It's a 'must do'!. The Bondi to Coogee Beach coastal walk does not need any further explanation as you have already seen from previous reviews. Suffice to say, just do it if you have the time, the energy, and are reasonably able bodied! It is naturally a stunning coastline and the walking track provided is rustic yet practical. You can also opt to do part of the walk if it's a sweltering hot day or you're not feeling as energetic. There are always nice cafés and bars along the way to break up the journey. Please wear a hat and sunscreen and I recommend you have a bottle of water on hand. Bear in mind that on a sunny weekend the pathway will be one of a high volume traffic route! Not as well known is the continuation of the coastal walk heading south from Coogee. You will enjoy it equally. Take a dip at Wylie baths along the way. Enjoy the stunning views and coastal breezes everyone! And if you're totally exhausted Bus or Uber it back to base...
the best views. this is a great walk any time but especially interesting when the sculptures are set up. Bring or wear your swimmers as you wont be able to resist a dip!

Nothing else like it. You cannot visit the Eastern suburbs of Sydney without doing the Bondi to Coogee walk. It is spectacular. Some of the walk can be a bit challenging with quite a few steps at the Bondi end and best to go during the week so as to miss all the weekend crowds.Pop into the Bondi Icebergs swimmers club for breakfast or lunch and take in the view. Fantastic!

Always amazing, year round. This walk is my favourite, as a local to the area, to do all year round. In the summer months, head early or wait til later to avoid a slow walk with crowds. Winter is lovely as it's less people and the seas are a lovely grey colour. Sculpture by the Sea is fantastic to see, but crowds are extremely hard to avoid. Bring your camera! Then treat yourself to one of bronte or bondis amazing restaurants - I recommend Harry's in North Bondi!
Gorgeous. A must when you visit Sydney... You can spend the day walking from one beach to the next and swimming at each one.

Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk. This walk or part thereof is one of the most interesting trips you can do in Sydney. I used to do the whole walk but these days I walk as far as Clovelly only. The views from the cliffs are amazing and you can at times see whales on their journey. In November the sculptures walk is very popular and many people get their artistic fix as well as the exercise. It is recommended that you drop into the Icebergs Club soon after the walk starts or at the end if you start at Coogee. You can have a welcome drink and/or something to eat and take a seat looking over iconic Bondi beach.There are some steps at various places so you need to be aware of that. You pass several beaches on the way where you can stop and have a rest. At the end you can take a bus back to the city or wherever.

Good coastal walk. A simple walk along mainly defined paths following the Pacific coast. Good in windy weather but even better in sunshine! Make sure you take the coastal walk as there are maps showing a route along roads upto a few hundred metres from the sea which will get you there but are nowhere near as picturesque. You will find cafes at most of the beaches between the two locations so although it is always advisable to take a water bottle it is not imperative on this walk.
Gorgeous walk. Have done this walk two times. Wear flat shoes if possible. It is a fairly easy walk, and you will see sensational ocean views and surrounds.

Beautiful Beach. This beach is beautiful and easily accessible via bus tours. It is a fun place for shopping, great restaurants, or just sun bathing. For those with children you should know it is semi nude bathing in this area.

Walk the cliffs like a local. This is a lovely walk which can be a relaxing stroll or a full power walk depending on your frame of mind. Note that the track can get busy on the weekend and can get very congested at peak times. Best time to go is week days during working hours when you can enjoy the view, stroll at leisurely pace and stop and try some of the great local cafes -tip- the coffee is always good!

A comfortable exercise walk. A surf side healthy work out walk. The Pacific Ocean is adjacent through out the walk...each beach one passes , is different, with surf riding of all kinds apparent most days.

I`m a local.. Bondi to Coogee is right up there with the best. Every day is different. Some days the sea s dead flat & other days the sea can be huge. Plenty of surfers doing their stuff. Whales & dolphins can often be seen. You can get a bus almost anywhere on the walk if it gets too much. Plenty of toilets & cafes along the way. Not for wheelchairs & never will be because there are too many steps. This is where i live & love it. If you do the walk in November you will see sculptures by the sea on your walk.

A nice way to get an idea of Australian beach culture.. I love doing this walk but I have to say that the summer is not the best time despite what one might think. It's far too hot. Love seeing all the weird and wonderful sights.

Great day out without spending a fortune.. Lots to do along the way....enjoy the scenery, take a dip, stop at a café, visit the historical cemetery. Even better when the weather isn't the best because it is less crowded!

Just beautiful - shame about the joggers. This is a stunning walk along the cliffs and valleys of the eastern suburbs. Especially good when the Sculptures by the sea are on, but watch out for the annoying joggers who seem to think they own the path and aren't willing to accept people might want to enjoy the view and stop to take photos.

Bondi to Bronte to Coogee Coastal Walk - a Must. A classic Sydney coastal walk.Along the tops of rugged sandstone cliffs with non-stop breathtaking views, with its easy path gently wending up & down via a variety of beautiful white sand swimming beaches, bays, pools & parks - & an abundant collection of smart restaurants cafes & kiosks bunched along the way - this walk is a must.Variously sparkling, moody, calm, windswept or otherwise - it is always rewarding.The wide easy paths are great for strolling & sharing in a group, more meditatiively quiet experiences, or pounding along for exercise.Bondi to Bronte (including a variety of great food & drink) is an easy 20-30 minute stroll of probably about 2km, while Bronte to Coogee (& yet more food & drink) is probably another 25-35 mins / 2kms. Take your pick, in either direction, or walk it all. Half an hour - or a whole day of walking, swimming & eating. Do it !

Best Coastal Walk. This is fabulous great scenery, lots of photo opportunities, places to stop for a sit down or even a coffee along the way. Each beach is unique from iconic Bondi, through glamorous Tamarama, very Aussie Bronte and onto the great snorkelling spots of Clovelly and Gordons Bay and onto family friendly Coogee

Stunning. This is a lovely part of Sydney that is sure to please all. The views are stunning and if you pace yourself it is a very pleasant way to spend some time. Always remember to take a bottle of water and stop to admire our wonderful coast.

Great weekend exercise - sparkles on a sunny day. Bondi to Bronte for a walk & breakfast. Fantastic views of the ocean, will take you about 35 to 50 minutes of walking and has several sets of steps. Take your swimmers and swim at Bronte beach, then breakfast at one of the cafes.

Great Views. The walk from Coogee to Bondi is wonderful and very popular. Go earlier in the morning if it is hot and preferably wear good shoes, although it is paved very well. Stop at Bondi for fish and chips and a gelato ice-cream. A must for any tourist.

Breathtaking coastline and wonderful sea breeze. This is a must for visitors - get yourselves away from the city, opera house and harbour bridge and head to the coast - this walk gives you a real taste of Australia in all its beauty.Plenty of cafes to grab a drink and a bits at along the way.Allow 1/2 day and make sure the sun is shining

do it, regardless of the season. Take a back pack for a picnic, hat and sunscreen.In summer its beautiful and the occasional stop with a swim is a must. In winter its still beautiful refreshing and you'll enjoy a paddle.Walk from one end and taxi it/catch the beach bus back. There are plenty of eateries at each end to reward yourself for the effort!A Sydney must do.

Stunning. A must do in Sydney - amazing views, beaches and people watching!It can get very busy at the weekend during the summer so recommend doing it mid-week or early morning if possible.I Bring your camera!

easy walk great sights. Fairly easy walk, views were great plenty of seats to have a break. enjoyed a great meal at the end It is a great activity to do with friends and you can do it at your own pace. lots of photographic moments as well I have some amazing shots.
Good for the heart and soul. beautiful long coastal walk with amazing views of ocean against the buildings. afterwards you can treat yourself with a nice salad in one of the Coogee restaurants.
Quintessential Sydney. This is a must for a Sydney visit. If not on a budget then do Coogee to Bondi and stop at Icebergs for lunch. Otherwise plenty of cafes along the way.

Just do it!. Fantastic views and a well maintained walkway make this walk an essential part of your Sydney stop over . You can make this as hard as your fitness allows by starting and finishing where you want. and great public transport makes this easy to achieve. It is gorgeous travelling in either direction but I like the views heading north slightly better. Pick a sunny day and just do it.
nice to stretch the legs. Great opportunity to escape the city confines, get some fresh air and finish with a snack and a beer at Bondi beach. Great views and seaside time.

Best Coastal Walk in Sydney. A great way to take in all the sites of Sydney's Eastern Beaches. The walk goes from Bondi to Coogee, however you can obviously start and finish anywhere you like. Its a 6km coastal clifftop walk passing some of Sydney's most iconic beaches and coves. Being a coastal walk there are plenty of opportunities for you to to stop and take a swim in one of the many beaches, or to stop at one of the beachfront cafes. This is a very popular walk for both tourists and locals, so the track can get very busy, especially on a hot summers day. The walk is a medium grade walk but there are some steep gradient paths and several staircases along the track.

Breathtaking.... I flew into Sydney having been head hunted for a job. I met the team, was interviewed and then taken for the Bondi to Coogee walk. It was the clincher. Such beauty; the opal sea crashing onto the rocks and beaches; the coves; the unexpected vistas. I'd never experienced anything like it before. I now take visitors on the same walk and get the same response. Magnificent.
beach walk. This is a beautiful walk with the beaches and water to enjoy. Best done on a sunny day. However, still good in any weather

Nice walk, suitable for the family. One of many great Sydney walks, this is an easy varied walk which is quite popular on a nice day. Along the way there are cafes and some shops. There's public transport which can get you back to Bondi (and visa versa).

WOW!!. This walk has to be the best views in the world.From Bondi Beach all the way around the cliffs ,past Bronte,Tamarama, etc etc all the way to Coogee where you can have a great swim in the sea,some coffee or lunch and a good walk back.

invigorating way to experience the NSW coast. Starting from Bondi Beach - an icon on the NSW coast - and travelling south on this walk you are able to experience the grandeur of sandstone cliffs, pounding surf, coastal heath vegetation that native to the area as well as sandy beaches, coffee stops (especially at Tamarama) and extensive southerly views.It is a must do for visitors to Sydney, particularly if the annual Sculpture by the Sea is installed.
Amazing walk. Beautiful walk alone the coast!I went with friends, took our time and enjoyed every minute on the way!

See beyond Bondi. I love this walk at any time of year. Whether the sea is sparkling blue under the Summer sun, or grey and moody on a Wintery day, the views are always spectacular and good for the soul. The whole path is paved so it's not strenuous, although there are some stairs. You can do the whole thing in under 2 hours, or take all day, depending on whether you want to swim at one of the beaches along the way, or stop for coffees and lunch. There are lovely food choices at most of the beaches - Coogee, Clovelly, Bronte, the new kiosk at Tamarama, and of course Bondi. Plus there are buses that run between the different points so you can start and finish wherever you like - or do the whole return walk!

great walk/run avoid weekends. great walk but avoid weekends especially if you want to run it, even early is full of people walking, jogging and taking pics... best time is after 9 during the week, better if is not sunny

Beautiful way to exercise. This walk is fabulous - be sure to take your swimmers to cool off afterwards! It does get quite warm in the morning, as the sun is rising, so be sure to take a hat/wear sunscreen.

Great walk with beautiful views and refreshing pools.. The views are really beautiful and the walk is a good exercise. The best part is when you stop to swim at the pools on the way. We started at Coogee after having a buffet breakfast at Farinha and finished at Bondi with a drink and beautiful views from the Bondi Icebergs Bistro.
It's a must!. Beautiful beach, fantastic views. You can walk and admire amazing landscape, or visit one of the cafes near the beach. I can really recommend this walk!
Beautiful way to take in the sights. it is such a great walk you feel like your a local , getting your fitness in as well as the breath taking views

Spectacular walk. We agree with most reviewers: this is a great walk and you really should consider doing it if you have the time in Sydney. It took us 2 hours to complete the walk from Bondi to Coogee and we started at 830am to avoid the heat of later hours. Views are amazing. Once in Coogee we walked another kilometer and had a late breakfast at X74 (separate review, great place!). The sun was too hot and we decided to cut our return by taking a bus (check the available routes to avoid returning to Bondi Junction). In all, it was a great day.
Excellent!!!. An amazing walk from Bondi beach to Coogee beach. The views are incredible the entire way and if you can do it when they have the sculptures even better!!
Stunning Walk. A beautiful walk. If you can, stop halfway and enjoy a game of bowls at the Clovelly grass bowls club. They welcome visitors and it great fun.

Only made it to Bronte but.... If you like walking and want to experience the natural beauty of Sydney, then this is a must. Walk the path along the ocean, looking out a sail boats and ships, while you run your hand around worn away rock faces. Stop in at each of the communities along the way for some beach time, a dip in the water, or a refreshing drink.

Scenic and calm. Must do if you visit bondi.. You can catch a bus from coogee to city. There are surfing beaches in between the walk and you can you can also sit on benches and Enjoy the views while taking breaks.

Amazing Views. The views along this walk are simply amazing. Although due to time constraints, I only walked a few bays over and back, I was able to see some beautiful scenery, with gorgeous blue waters and craggy rocks which have been worn over time. There are stunning little beaches in each bay to relax at. Be sure to bring good walking shoes and plenty of water. If it's a holiday expect to be surrounded by a lot of people also doing the walk. Don't forget the camera!

Definitely do this if you love great ocean views. Love this walk. I never tire of it. Relatively easy but does involve some stairs. Might be a bit tough with a pram. Spectacular views. If you end up in either Bondi or Coogee there are plenty of great places to eat after your walk. If you want to reduce the distance if you have children, park at Clovelly and start there. Walk either to Bondi or Coogee. You can also swim here with kids and there are change rooms and a shop where you can buy food and drinks. Take your camera. Enjoy the scenery.

Bette then expected, spectacular!!. My wife and I took a 8 mile walk around the beaches and the views were breathtaking. Took the train there and spent the day and had lunch at lovely bistro. A must stop if you are visting, wish we could have spent another day there

Amazing views. Well worth a visit for any local or tourist! Always packed when the Sculpture by the Sea exhibition is on, so go early or late in the day. Stop at the Clovelly Hotel along the way for a meal or a drink.

Breathtakingly Beautiful. A well travelled path, easy to follow and the best views of the coast line. There are so many things to see and do on the walk you can take a little or as much time as you want to complete it. I would recommend going early in the summer though as it gets so hot. Definitely a must for anyone going to Bondi/Sydney.

Nice scenic walk. A must in summer! Bondi is a very trendy area filled with brown bodies and muscles. The scenic walk is beautiful. It takes about 40 minutes for the average person. It is a must if you are in Bondi. There are plenty of great cafes and places to have lunch with a venue.
among the best. If you can do this walk when the sculpture festival is on it will be doubly good - bear in mind it will be crowded

Good walk. This is worth it for the views. You can go as fast or slow as you wish. It is a bit of a walk but the views make up for it and you don't realise how far you are walking. You can stop along the way for lunch.

Gorgeous scenery. Beautiful,gorgeous,gobsmacking. There aren't enough words to describe this beautiful walk. The scenery is picture postcard and I will definitely do this walk again when I am next in Sydney.

An easy walk. Good way to see the spectacular weathering effects in the sandstone cliffs. Some steep sections but generally easy or no gradients. You only have to beware of the fit bods of Sydney as they run, power walk, walk or stroll along the paved path. Plenty of little stop off beaches on the way all backed by fresh water points, shops and picnic sites. We only walked to Bronte Beach then caught the bus back to Bondi Junction.

great walk or run!. This is a great walk or run, which I did a number of times while staying in Coogee. Lots of steps, but that just adds to the chalenge!Stop in Bronte or Bondi or Coogee for a coffee!go in the morning before 8am, when it is quieter and cooler.

Beautiful walk & a great work-out.. Plan to allow lots of time to take in the beauty of this walk. There are so many fabulous beach vistas...each one just around the corner from the last. Be prepared for LOTS of stairs....up and down....as this walk winds around from beach to beach. You could make a whole day of it, if you took time to walk the beaches as well. Water spots were available for refilling your bottle, which was much appreciated on the very hot day we were there. Not all parks or walks have that amenity. Highly recommend this walk.

Sculpture by the Sea a feast for the senses. This coastal walk would be amazing anytime of the year but doing it during Sculpture by the Sea exhibit is a special treat. Highly recommended but be prepared for the crowded pathways during peak season, weekends and events.
Nice walk. The coast line is almost 1.5 to 2.00 Kms and it best to do in the morning. and not in evening as it gets breezy in the evening.

You need to do this. We walked the reverse of this and did Coogee to Bondi which I felt was more appropriate, as you are heading to the main beach you want to see.The walk is beautiful and the coast line is just amazing. As you walk for about an hour you and greeted with the amazing site of Bondi at the end which is just stunning. The walk is not very sheltered, so if the day is sunny please remember your sunscreen. The walk can be challenging and not great for people with walking problems and wheel chairs and buggies will struggle. There are lots of little coves and outlets you could stop for a swim, so bring your bathers and towel.Just take a M50 bus from George Street to the last stop and the rest is easy and free!

One of the finest walks in Australia. It might sound long, though it is well worth the effort. From the different beaches, to the incredible old cemetery, to the coastline areas - another must do if you have the time. Make the time if you don't think you have it!

Take a hike-- So worth it!. Beautiful views. Couple of hour walk round trip. Easy walk- with no significant hills--moderate shape Beautiful views. No trash-- no graffiti. Lots of tourists--Lots Of locals. If you visit Bondi, ya gotta take this walk. If you visit Sydney, you should take this walk. Did I mention the Beautiful views? So worth it!

A must-do when visiting Sydney!. This is one of the most scenic walks you can do in Sydney, I highly recommend it, weather permitting. I personally think its better to start in Coogee and walk to Bondi as opposed to vice versa.

Wonderful sense of the power of the ocean. This is a great walk to build up an appetite for lunch - setting off from Bondi you get a great feel for the power of the sea as it pounds into the shoreline. You then pass the most scenic of cemeteries, before moving onto new coastal villages like Clovelly before you finally get down into Coogee. Easy to get good food for lunch there, then you can either catch a bus on or retrace your steps to Bondi.....

Beautiful beaches to relax and walks. Love sydney and love the place that is all I have to say. Better than anywhere in the world!!!! As we have it all here in Sydney. Why bother going anywhere else for a beach life???

Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk. I am a 63 year old who has had a total need replacement (A Stryker knee replacement). I have done the walk today with the sun shining on your back and a coastal breeze. The photo opportunities are great, the 5 beaches/inlets are fantastic. There are a few stairs to climb but I could still manage it. At the end there is plenty places to eat plus the Coogee Bay Hotel. Then hop onto a bus back to the city and seeing that I am a senior it only costs $2.50.

Fabulous sights.... We loved Sydney and what better than to spend a day leisurely walking from Bondi to Coogee....Bondi is busy as to be expected but to walk the coastal walk you get away from the crowds and embrace the coast from a different perspective...the lone brave surfers...the wild huge crashing waves...local flora and fauna....birds...the sea breeze to cool you in the hot sun....with breath taking views...Coogee sporting its mind blowing 'baths' is a must to see and experience for the not so timid!

Do it. It wasn't clear from other descriptions what the footing was for this walk. The footing is just fine, either a paved path or stairs. Yes, there's up and down, and it can get hot in summer, but the views are terrific. The northern part, from Bondi to Bronte, is particularly beautiful, but the whole walk is worth doing. There are places to stop for a meal midway at Bronte Beach, or at the end points of Bondi or Coogee.

The must-do in Sydney. If you like to walk and stop to smell the beautiful ocean air - this is the local and tourist must-do for Sydney. On a hot summer's day, take your togs, water bottle, HAT AND SUNSCREEN (50+ for the sun-sensitive) and good walking shoesOn the perfect sunny day whether it be winter or summer, this walk will visually astound you. There is a reason that sculptures by the sea occur between Bondi and Tamarama every year - it is one of the best settings in the world.If you like to run, try to not do this at midday - you will only get frustrated with walkers enjoying the day out.There are some great cafe stops along the way if the walk is a bit too far in one hit, but easily one of my most favourite pastimes in Sydney

Definately a thing to do when in Sydney….. Why this walk is No 1 on the things to do at Sydney … Well because its simply great, Beautiful view and a excellent walk. The walk has number of places in between where u can sit, relax and admire the view, number of places where you can refill ur water bottle and grab a bite or take a swim if u feel like it…If u get tired in between u can take a bus back to Bondi… Definitely a must thing to do when in Sydney.

Relaxing 2 hour walk. It's roughly a 2 hour walk from Bondi to Coogee. It hogs around the coast visiting multiple beaches, some of which almost untouched and good surf spots. There is also a memorial to those who died in 2004 Bali bombing. It's a nice walk

Great walk. Full of interesting sea scapes and even an old graveyard to walk through . Plenty of choices for food at the Coogee end and then a bus back to Circular Quay - which is in itself a fascinating route to enjoy..

A fantastic coastal walk. A great walk which allowed us to see 5 seperate beaches all offering something different. The lesuirely walk itself will take under 2 hours, however the there are wonderful photo opportunities and places to stop for a picnic or a swim at one of the beaches. A must do during a stay in Sydney!

Stunningly Beautiful Views. This is an absolutely sensational walk with the best views in Sydney. It is well planned and pathed so there is minimal risk of slipping over. This is the best way to see the stunning beaches of Sydney, whilst getting exercise and enjoying the beautiful sunshine.

Short walk with premium views.....a must do..... Even though that it was my 2. stay in Sydney, I had to do this walk again, as it contains beautiful views and places to sit and enjoy the ocean.How to reach: Several bus-lines will take you to Bondi or Coogee, depending on where you want to begin. The service is frequent and cheap. During the busride you get to see part of the city as well, so it is a win-win.What to bring: If you, like me, want to take your time to enjoy the day, then bring something to drink, sandwishes and enjoy your lunch with a scenic view. Besides that: Sun cream, cap, camera and good walking shoes.Conditions: The walk is about 1,5 hours and it is a bit up and down. Stairs are frequent, so if you suffer problems with your knees, etc....then maybe only to a part of the walk and then take a bus from there to your next destination.Absolutely recommedable.

View the rugged coastline and surf beaches. It is an easy to follow path along the coastline and across several bays and beaches. It looks stunning when the surf is up. Stop for a swim in the many protected swimming pools if the surf is rough.
A sculptured time. What is not to like about the Sculpture by the Sea? An amazing collection of installations along this already picturesque path.
A must for a visitor to Sydney.. Glorious views and an easy walk. Call in at the Iceberg Club for a drink and lunch when you reach Bondi . Lovely views of Bondi Beach

Must Do Walk in Sydney. There aren't many better coastal walks anywhere in the world. Highly recommended even on a short visit to Sydney. You get to start out in the iconic Bondi Beach and end in Coogee beach. Of course you can do the walk either way and the public transport to get back to either end is great and easy.
definitely worth the time. It has fantastic views and it is a great way to become acquainted with Australian urban beaches. i started at Bondi and walked south. Good access by city buses.

Good way to spend a morning. Embarrassed to say that I've lived in Sydney for more than 3 years and only just completed this walk for the first time last weekend!
