I'll say this much - it doesn't disappoint! My husband and I walked the reverse (Coogee to Bondi), only because we live closer to Coogee so started on our end. Things to know:* The cliff-top coastal walk takes you through Coogee, Clovelly, Bronte, Tamarama, Bondi* The total length is approximately 6 km. We walked it in about an hour and a half, stopping to take some quick photos. You can really take as long as you want, depending on what you're in the mood for. You could easily make a day of it by bringing a picnic or stopping for a swim at any of the beaches* There are lots of stairs. The terrain is well-groomed, so it's not a difficult walk; however, be mindful that there are quite a few stairs along the way. We saw plenty of kids finish the hike, so it's not that bad :)* Bring water! It's a decent length walk and can get VERY hot - not a great deal of shade, as you're walking along the cliffs

Fun and scenic walk. Very nice walk....a must do types....do keep some snack and water with you....take rest in between and start a little early in the morning or do in evening as we did. We spent the day at bondi beach and then did our walk and enjoyed it very much. Keep comfortable walking shoes with you.

Just perfect!. Recommended by girl living in Coogee!This top cliff coastal walk, approximately 6km long, features stunning views, cliffs, parks, bays, rock pools and beaches where you can enjoy a swim or relax with drink along the way. We walked from Coogee to Bondi and back and on the way we stopped twice to have a swim on the little beaches along the way. The one way takes approximately 2 hours of relaxing walk. Pick a nice sunny day and you won't be disappointed. One of the top things we did in Sydney!

Bondi beach walk. This spectacular walk is most often started at Bondi. We did the reverse and FINISHED at Bondi. I think the views were better and we had a lovely lunch at the end of the walk. Walking in the AM was less crowded and not as hot either. Lunch at North Bondi Fish was delicious and had lovely views (ask to sit by the front windows).

Spectacular. We did the walk from Coogee to Bondi, stopping at the beach in Bronte for lunch. It's just a spectacularly beautiful walk. There are a lot of stairs but there is no difficult footing and there are lots of places to stop and rest or look out at the sea, surf, cliffs or beaches and you can stop at any beach to use the loo or to pick up water or a snack.

I strongly recommend that you do it the other way round! Read why.. This was our second time in Sydney with the firm intention of going for that fabulous coastal walk.It is indeed scenic.But we believe having found an even better way to do it!You should start at Coogee Beach. Sydney public busses go there.Then, you walk from Coogee towards Bondi.There are two significant advantages:1 - There are more steps going down than going uphill. After 5 km your legs will be much more relaxed than climbing the other way round.2 - The arrival at Bondi is beautiful. If you are walking to Bondi you have plenty of time to enjoy the landscape.If ever we go back to Sydney, we will walk from Coogee to Bondi.An useful practical detail: there are quite a few public toilets along the coastal walk.

Wonderful!. i loved that trail very much. I went there twice in two days. It is about 6km from Coogee to Bondi. Nice views all along. Bring a bottle of water since it is a good exercise (lots of stairs).

Just beautiful. I loved the raw nature. And when I return I'll use the small stations on the road with exercise suggestions. There is lots of waterpost on the way so just brought a 1 liter bottle and keep hydrated.
You have to do this walk!. This is such a beautiful walk! Plus you can have a nice meal at one of the great cafés in Bronte on the way!!!

Pleasant surprise. I had gone to Bondi beach unaware of the Bondi to Coogee Coastal walk. However few locals recommended the hike and I must say I thoroughly enjoyed it. The coastal walk offers stunning views of the ocean and great exercise. Its roughly 5-6 kms long. I did the mistake of going in the afternoon. I recommend that you take this up an hour before the sun is about to set so that you beat the heat. Never the less keep your self hydrated and use plenty of sunscreen.

Beautiful..... I would recommend this to anyone - it is a long walk along the coast. The view is absolutely amazing, there is a wonderful old cemetery along the walk which is a must see... There are many beaches to visit through out the walk and many cafes and places to eat along the way. I would recommend taking a bottle of water...

Boring. Its a good walk in terms of exercise but too many smelly and selfish joggers and even bikers take the fun from what should be an enjoyable walk. Remove the joggers and bike riders and this walk would be far better to enjoy. A lot of the local housing is rotting away which isn't the best look for an area of prime real estate value.
Great views!. The coastal walk provides dramatic scenery as you walk along the path from beach to beach. Coogee has a great pavilion.
Great way to see the coast. Great way to walk and earn a thirst for a cold beer at Coogee Bay Hotel ! Not a difficult walk but pleasant and plenty of cafes along the way to rest and recharge.
Great walk, very hot. I did this walk in January, great views but so hot in the 30C heat. Next time I visit Sydney I will go again!

Spectacular highlight!. This was an unexpected highlight of our trip. The walk offers inspiring views and provided a great change of scenery and pace from inner Sydney. We did the walk on a sunny but windy day and the surf was spectacular (the beaches were closed to swimmers). This is an easy walk, so very accessible to most ages and fitness levels. The bus trip out to Bondi from Elizabeth Street was enjoyable, and we even fitted in a little shopping at the Westfield at Bondi Junction on the trip back for a little variety. Highly recommended.
Great walk. Treat yourself to a drink in the Iceberg bar for a great view.. Fabulous view, food lovely but overpriced. Have a drink in the bar and go elsewhere for lunch would be my suggestion.

More crowded than ever. Look, it's amazing, there's no doubt about that. It's really a must for anyone who enjoys coastal walks, especially if you come from somewhere where such scenery is rare. The sandstone cliffs give you an up close look at the rock much of early Sydney was built from and if you are around in spring or autumn the chances are good you will spot some of the migrating whales heading to or from their breeding grounds. Dolphin pods might be seen any time of year.BUTevery time I take this walk it seems to be more crowded. Maybe it's just me getting older? I am sure there are more prams out there, because people seem to hate letting their preschoolers walk anywhere these days (see, I am turning into a grumpy old woman!).The joggers have always been rude on this walk - they are out there all day and evening and god help you if you get in the way of one of the manic merchant bankers listening to motivational podcasts while he pounds his warrior spirit into obedience along the cliff paths! I've seen joggers spit on people who were too slow and swearing, huffing heavily and deliberately shaking head sweat onto others are not at all uncommon.Anyway, if you only have a short time and want a bit of exercise while you soak in a spectacular aspect of the real Sydney, do this walk and don't let anything stop you. If you hate crowds, try starting from the southern end (Coogee) and maybe turn back if the scene gets too busy as you near Bondi.Whatever you do, though, get out of the way when you hear heavy breathing and a Nike thud!
Beautiful Walk. Great walk, the beaches are incredible! I really enjoyed this, it was challenging to run and the views were really worth it and rewarding.

We've been to Sydney 3 times and done this walk 3 times - love it. Great to twist your way round the coast and call in the various bars restaurants on the way. A great way to explore this coastline and definitely one of the top 10 things to do in Sydney exploring wise.
Absolutely Beautiful. The walk from beach to beach is so relaxing and beautiful. You will feel real peace as the breeze blows over your body and through your hair. Absolutely stunning views.

Wonderful walk!!. This walk was absolutely fantastic! We started in Coogee and walked up to Bondi and it took us about 3 hours, but that was with a lot of stopping and enjoying the views!You will not regret going on this walk I highly recommend it!

Visually splendid cliff top coastal walk. This is a great walk. Fantastic rock formations and scenery along the path. We took our time on the walk stopping for brunch at Bronte Beach and enjoying the views. We did the walk on a Sunday and it was busy. Great photo opportunities along the path with many benches to sit and enjoy the view. The path is paved all the way with the occasional short street walk. It is six kilometres long and we did a return walk. It took us a very leisurely five hours. We also stopped at Bronte Beach for a long brunch. To get to Bondi Beach from the city you take a train to Bondi Junction and then a bus to Bondi Beach which takes 10 minutes or less depending on traffic.

Very scenic route!. Amazing swim pool for that perfect dip in a hot summer day! The walk is a MUST to soak in the goodness SYDNEY has to offer. End it at Bondi beach with a bottle of beer and a big burger to reward yourself!
Nice to do in Sydney. It is a nice walk to enjoy the see views and the chance to see some of the most popularl beaches of the eastern suburbs in Sydney.
Stunning walk. The walk was easy to complete as long as you have a few hours to spare. Well worth doing. Did prefer coogee beach

Amasing views, great experience. Walked from Coogee Beach to Bondi. The scenery was amasing, breath taking coastal views. Excellent walking tracks although lots of steps and ups and downs. We went through the middle of the day so was hot and very busy with lots of walkers/runners, very interesting 'people-watching' (lots of eye-candy for everyone!) as welL as the scenery! WoI'll probably recommend going earlirrelevant or later in day when not so hot.
A must do in Sydney!!. Thias is every travellers must do.... especially during sculptures by the sea week... celebrity spotting is inevitable
Scenic walk on the coast. Walking from Bondi to Coogee you find impressive view of the ocean you will get enthusiastic of such walk

Woe. Absolutely glorious walk along the coast. Famous speeches were well worth seeing. The beautiful topless bathers were great.Australians really I have some good looking gals.Definitely a must when visiting Sydney area.

Wonderful stroll along cliffs and beaches. A leisurely stroll with nice places to break for lunch or beautiful bay views. I'm not really a beach person so this was the perfect way to enjoy a bit of sun and the sea breeze.

A good walk. We hadn't been on this walk in years but decided to go when they had the Sculptures by the Sea on after having breaky at Jenny's Cafe..So that Made it good tho there was too many school kids and the teachers weren't always watching them. We walked from Brontee to Bondi but Next time we want to do the Bronte to Coogee walk.
Great view. Great for fitness in a beautiful scenic landscape..........................................................

Bit of a trek. Very picturesque and well worth the effort. Once in Bondi if you're hungry check out the restaurant called Lock Stock The sandwiches defy measurement , huge is an understatement and mighty tasty.

A great walk. We walked from Coogie to Bondi and the variety of views were surprising. There's an amazing cementary along this walk filled with the white marble headstones looking over the ocean cliff side. There was a part of the walk that had a swarm of flies we walked through...it was weird, but the walk was so worth it. I took lots of great pictures on this coastal walk.
Stunning. Had been advised to do this walk and so on a beautiful clear New Years Day off we set and weren't disappointed. The views were breathtaking and can't wait to do it again.

Try to see the artwork. This is great scenic walk at any time of the year but if you have the opportunity to go when the Sculpture by the Sea exhibition is on, it is well worth it. The exhibits are all along the walk with some being interactive. It's godo for all ages.
Nice. Nice to relax and enjoy the sun! It is about 6 Km long and easy to walk. You'll come along some nice beaches.

I've done this a thousand times and I never ever get sick of it. I love doing this, I love the smell of the salt in the wind, I love that each beach has a very different clientele, I love that although vastly different each one is beautiful in its own way, I love Gordon's bay just as much as the others even though its often the forgotten one. ****If you're not a experienced surfer, please avoid Tamarama at all costs, its rough and dangerous and not worth the risk vs reward****

Fantastic Walk scenery is amazing. I did this walk few after NYE it was recommended by a friend. It was during the day a hot Saturday so wear good trainers and slap on the cream! It takes quite a while between stopping and appreciating all the beaches and views. So if you're there so the walk :)

A fresh walk and view.. With the new sculptures along the route, the walk is as good as a coastal walk can be. I prefer starting in Coogee and ending in Bondi, the final bend and having Bondi open up to you is spectacular.

Good walk in any weather!. This is a great walk, but only if you are fairly fit. There are a lot of steps.The views are amazing all along the route. Beware of the sun when it appears to be cloudy, you can still get burnt, so use sunscreen. Take a bottle of water, you can refill it at fountains along the route. Also good birdwatching along the way, look out for the blue fairy wrens. There and back is quite a tough walk, so be prepared to bale out and use buses or taxis to get back to your start point.

Breathtaking. We walked a little way along this rugged coastline and it was amazing!!Saw great views of Bondi beach and along the way crystal clear water.Maybe one day take a dip in the outdoor pool? :)

If you have to go for a walk make it this one.. If you have to go for a walk make it this one.Being my morning or afternoon exercise when in Sydney I couldn't recommend this walk highly enough.Just like everyone else I too have plenty of photo's but if you ever get the chance try and plan your walk when the "Sculpture by the Sea" is on. You will not be disappointed.The views are amazing.The path is very easy to follow so you just can't get lost.There is always a lot of people around, unless you are running/walking early morning or early evening.There is water available when you approach Bronte (at the top of the hill coming from Waverley Cemetery. There is water available along the way like at Coogee, Bronte SLSC, Tama SLSC and again when you get to Bondi. Naturally you can do the walk in reverse.How hard is the walk?There are quite a few stairs around Gordons Bay and South Bondi so if you struggle with stairs then you can always take the streets around.You can break up the walk with a number of cafes to choose from in Bronte and Coogee.The walk also extends another 2kms south of Coogee towards Lurline Bay.
Bondi to Coogee. Stunning views. Absolutely worth the trip/walk. Incredible rocks, cliffs, curves, beaches, and just beauty in every turn and pass of the walk.

Awesome. This is one of the best things you can do during your stayed in Australia. Start in the early morning, take your own pace, take a dip in each beach, take pictures... be relaxed and enjoy the breathtaking view:)
A nice Stroll but carry Water. It can be very hot. make sure you have sun protection and carry water. Take you swim togs in case you want to swim
Nice walk despite a very hot day. It was beautiful and the path was well taken care of. We never made it all the way to Coogee because of the heat, but the part we walked on was beautiful.

Amazing! A must do while in Sydney!. We took the bus to Bondi and began our walk. The views/scenery are stunning. It's hard to stop taking pictures! Be sure to bring lots of water. We walked in the morning on a very hot day and definitely felt the heat. There are a few areas that are a little difficult (lots of steps, steep) so be prepared. Otherwise, the walk isn't too bad. Take your time and just enjoy your surroundings. We ended with lunch at Coogee Pavilion, which I would HIGHLY recommend. This was one of the best things I did in Sydney. (Note, there are plenty of places to swim along the way, so bring your suit and a towel if you wish).
AMAZING. I absolutely loved this walk. I took my time and really soaked in the experience. The views are absolutely incredible! It's a good walk too - lots of ups and downs. Good exercise.

Free, Beautiful and Healthy. We did this walk with some friends from the UK. We took a ferry from Sydney Harbor to Watson Bay then took the bus to Bondi. We walked to Bronte and had a nice lunch then walked the rest to the way to Coogee. It's a long walk but very enjoyable. I really enjoyed seeing the salt water swimming pools at the waters edge. We took tons of pictures along our walk. The view seemed to change around every corner.Highly recommend.Getting a little walking in with all the food was great as well.The only regret I have is not planning a day at Bondi Beach. The waves were incredible.

Simply Stunning. One of the best walk ever and its free. Most people did it under 2 hours. But i done it over 3 hours because the scenery was too beautiful to leave in a hurry. There are benches along the way where you can sit and relax, which i did. Go on weekdays to avoid the crowd.
One Word "Beautiful". It was a Rainy Day that is why we could nt enjoy much in Bondi. but we thoroughly enjoyed our walk from Coogee to Bondi. Scenic & Peaceful.

Abbreviated to a Bronte to Bondi walk, with kids. My 3 children ages 6-11yrs, have very different views/abilities in long walks so I decided to shorten it and make the destination Bondi Beach where they all wanted to go to see the Bondi Rescue crew in action! We caught the bus from Sydney's Museum station to Bronte and started our walk through the cemetery where Henry Lawson is buried (although we didn't see) to join the coastal walk at the bottom of hill. From there we continued along the coast past wonderful houses and cute picturesque beaches. It was pretty warm and the kids appreciated drink and ice cream stopovers at various beaches and we're just starting to complain when we hit the view of Bondi beach. Although the kids wouldn't put this walk on their highlight list, mum and dad definitely would.

Very enjoyable walk along the famous Sydney coastline!. Like most people, we started from Bondi Beach and followed the route down the coast towards Coogee Beach. The route itself is very straightforward and we didn't have any issues following it as some others have reported. It certainly helped that we had crystal clear, blue skies and 33C of heat as the entire coastline just looked stunning. I don't think it would be quite the same on an overcast day! Very much enjoyed it.

Second to none. This is one of Sydney's true highlights and an absolute must on a sunny day. The walk is not too strenuous but anyone overheating can easily cool off in one of the beautiful beaches on the way.

Nice walk and view but very crowded. This is a really nice walk with lovely views of the beaches and the headlands but the crowd is really crazy busy here so be prepared to be surrounded by a lot of people. If you prefer a beach with less people I recommend not to go to Bondi

Fantastic Walk. Walk takes about an hour with some steeper bits, but worth every bit of effort. It is a fantastic walk and one where you cannot help stopping to take in the views and take pictures. Enjoy!!

Beautiful Coastal Walk for all ages. On a clear sunny day, you couldn't ask for anything better. I have gone on this walk a few times now, watching the sunset and during peak tourist season and it has been a lovely experience every time. You start at a beautiful beach and finish at a beautiful beach. I have even seen the humpback whales further out on the horizon. Whether it was with my friends or my mother, it is a well maintained walking path for all ages.
Great walk. Always worth doing in any conditions. Can get very busy sometimes but always quite relaxed, just watch out for runners! The Sculptures by the Sea walk is on our must do list every year

The walk for all walks of life. The Bondi to Coogee walk is a must for all travelers and locals alike. I have taken visiting friends along the walk for a carefree half day meander around the clifftops and beaches that line the coast, and I have also done the walk as an afternoon run. I highly recommend the walk, although if you are going to run it, I would choose your time wisely as foot traffic can get a bit congested at times.

Fantastic. This walk is a wonderful way to spend an afternoon. You will pass by fishermen fishing from the rocks, surfers, rock pools (awesome swimming pools that use ocean waves to refresh the water), and wonderful vistas. You will pass interesting rock formations and sandy beaches. If you so desire, interrupt your walk with some time on the beach. If you continue on far enough, you will pass bowling greens and eating places. If you have some time to spare, you won't regret a walk along this beautiful coast.

Nothing to shout about. This was number one thing to do in Sydney apparantly :/I can't understand that to be honest. Don't get me wrong, the views are really nice, and there's plenty of nice beach areas to relax on along the way, but at the end of the day, it's just a long walk along the coast.I didn't even bother completing it fully, I ended up stopping near the end and opting for a swim in a small harbour area, which was definately a better option.Then I just managed to catch a local bus only about 5 mins away all the way back to kings cross where I was staying.I suppose I only did it as I was looking for things to do in Sydney that were free and because I have already done most things in Sydney, but yeah if your a keep rambler then go for it :)

HOT!. We wanted to do the walk but managed to choose a day when it was over 35C. 6kms later it felt like it had been an endurance event but still loved it....great views and a really well maintained walk

A Walk to Remember. We had an excellent time on the Bondi to Coogee walk. Be sure to pack water and wear comfortable shoes. It is not safe for small children as there are many spots without railings. I believe this walk would best be done in the morning before it gets too hot. I wish the paths were better marked past Coogee. We wanted to go further (past Coogee), but eventually the path ends and you are diverted into a neighborhood before you can pick it back up again. My recommendation would be to stop at Coogee – otherwise you’ll be wandering around in neighborhoods, lost, looking for Maroubra.

Walking on Sunshine!. This HAS to be on any visitors bucket list. Quick train it to Bondi Junction then a short bus ride or downhill stroll to Bondi Beach. At about 5kms e/w it's a couple of hours of pure Australian coastline heaven. Bondi - Tamarama - Bronte - Colvelly - Coogee .. on one hand 5 of the best beaches in Sydney .. each with their own personality and beauty. And views, sights, sounds and smells of sale and sea to assault the senses. You dont need to be a mad hiker either. Sure, it's not flat-flat* .. but you'll see folks of all ages, shapes and levels of fitness enjoying this great walk on any day of the year.If you do it late Oct and November you'll also likely catch Sculptures by the Sea. Amazing. * If you want a relatively flat beach walk you can also try the equally fabulous Greenhills - Sth Cronulla (Bass & Flinders Pt) walk, or a Botany Bay experience from Sans Souci to Kyeemagh. Enjoy!!!

Beautiful Hike. Bring your camera and your hat, it's sunny! A great walk to do with friends. It gives you a nice exposure to the coastline and time to chat. The water, the rocks, the flora and fauna provide a truly majestic landscape. Some areas can be steep, so might not recommend for those with mobility challenges. Public restrooms, free water bottle fill up and snack shops are along the way.

One of the best coastal walks in the WORLD. Awesome place to enjoy the splendour of Sydney and get out and active great place to walk run or jog. A must for any traveller or tourist. Such a beautiful scenic walk.
Beautiful coastline. Very nice day, lots of people at the beach. Scenic coastline. Board walk was a great walking surface for us.

Great walk and really great views also!. I can recommend this walk to you all when you visit Sydney. Super views and all the big mansions of the rich people and of course beautiful beaches that we don't get back in Germany! To get here you need to catch the train to Bondi and then change on the bus, there are plenty of signs here to guide you. Walk to Bondi Beach and the walkway will continue all the way to Cogee. Super views!
wow. so worth it.. Can get crowded but this is such a great way to see the coast line in Sydney. Lots of great spots for photos.

A great way to see some of Sydney's hidden beaches. This walk is a very pleasant stroll linking Sydney's beaches, with great views and changing scenery. You can stop for a coffee or lunch along the way.
Great walk. Done this walk on a recent visit in November was a great walk with lovely scenery and beautiful views and beaches .

Long walk, but what a view!. It's a long walk, if I had to estimate about 6kms, but well worth it. On a good day, you can see the ocean, the beautiful shores and enjoy the nightlife along the way. I was skeptical about it at first, but WOW, well worth if (don't go if you are in a rush)

Lovely scenery but can get quite busy!. The walk is a nice long one, although can get quite frustrating. Here are narrow paths that often get blocked by slow walkers or tourists out for a stroll which makes it hard for those trying to keep their heart rate up by running or power walking. There are water stations along the way. The path isn't always clear but there are plenty of people around to guide you since it's always so busy. I've gone on weekdays and weekends. Weekdays aren't so busy but theres still a good amount of people, weekends however can get quite busy & tricky to manoeuvre in some spots. There are stairs (steep) & also a few inclines. Hard to find parking some times especially on a hot summers day when the beaches are busy. Worth a visit the views are lovely, as you pass the different beaches there are toilets & cafes.
Salve for the soul!. We loved the smell of the sea, the wind, the views, etc. It is not a difficult walk as there are paths built over the rocky areas. It is good for the body and the soul.
Stunning views. A great walk with visitors or to just get away Durimg the week is a little QuiterSome lovely cafes to stop off in Coogee amd Bronte

Stunning walk.... Well worth the effort.. Stunning walk.... Well worth the effort. Went this morning and thoroughly enjoyed it. Scenery is fabulous and the most amazing cemetery is on the cliff path as you walk past. Take plenty of water with you, and have a well deserved treat in one of Bondi's hundreds of cafes.

Hilly hike. Amazing views over challenging hilly path. We went only from Bondi to Bronte but saw lovely coastline and beaches. It was a hot summer day with little shade and we had forgotten to bring bathing suits.
Nice winter walk along the cliffs. Iconic beach of Sydney, much smaller than I thought it would be. The cliffs are great and offer superb views. Plenty of birds flying around and surfers to watch

You need to be fit and in the full of your health to complete this walk.. Brilliant walk along the rugged coast .You can break the journey with a break in Bronte or Clevelly for food/ drink . You need to be very mobile as there are a lot of steps / steep hills . Bring your swimming gear and have a swim in Clevelly.
Amazing views. Great walk with the best views ever in the great outdoors. Make sure you take your camera for some amazing shots. Waverley Cemetery is unreal.

What a view!. Whilst we have walked the full length, we prefer the Waverley to Bondi stretch. We always manage to find parking along the side of Waverley Cemetery and enjoy the walk around Bronte and Tamarama beaches into Bondi. The beaches are glorious and it's always a joy to walk along the cliffs overlooking the Pacific Ocean. After admiring the view as you turn the corner and first glimpse Bondi Beach, we often walk to the far end of the beach for a cool drink at the North Bondi RSL Club which has a magnificent view of the beach. Then up Hall Street to one of the many cafes for lunch, before walking back to the car. A very pleasant way to spend a few hours - and get a bit of exercise too!

Do it!. This walk was absolutely stunning. We were in Sydney for 4 days and almost didn't have time to do it on reflection it was our favourite thing in Sydney so I would have been absolutely gutted to have missed out.

Beautiful walk in the sun. The walk from Bondi to Coogee is about 6km long and leads over beautiful cliffs along the ocean. There are a lot of stations to refill your water bottle on the way. There is not a lot of shade along the way. Therefore, stay hydrated, put on sunscreen, rest frequently and enjoy this stunning walk!

Bondi to Maroubra - great walk. A great walk that locals and tourists should do! We started at Bondi,lots of seats along the way to stop and admire the view. Stopped for a coffee at Bronte then lunch(take away fish & chips) at Coogee, then continued on to Maroubra, just under 9kms in total. The stretch from Coogee isn't well signposted as you need to walk some of the streets instead of following the coastline. We ended up walking the rocks of Lurline Bay - lucky it was low tide!Our ciders at the end were very refreshing! If doing on a sunny day make sure you have plenty of water & hat as there is no shade and could get very hot, we were lucky to have an overcast day.
An amazing view. People leaving in Sydney are very lucky to have a lot of beautiful walks. Some walks are calming, some challenging, but the Bondi to Coogee walk is magnificent.

My Fav Tourist Attraction as a Local. I live in Sydney and would recommend this to everyone! The views are stunning, head there in September for Sculpture by the Sea. Love the walk over from Bondi to Tamarama also...http://tipi.me/sydneys-7-top-beaches/

Spectacular views. This walk is about 6-7 km. In June, the weather was warm-perfect. It was sunny and there was nice breeze from the ocean. During this walk we see spectacular, beautiful views. while your walking you will pass several smaller beaches where you can sit, buy something to eat or drink. There are also positions for exercises.

A Must Do in Sydney. This is a beautiful walk with breath taking scenery. We went on the walk on a lovely sunny day. There are some great spots for talking pictures. It takes a few hours and can be quite strenuous in parts but it's great exercise while taking in incredible views of the lovely coastline. Make sure to bring a water bottle. There are plenty of refill stations along the path which is great. What a great tourist attraction and it is free of charge!

Great views. If you are going to Sydney, this coastal walk is a must-do! Lovely views and great beaches!!!!!! I walked from Coogee to Bondi, as I knew that Bondi would have more restaurants. Bondi is more crowded than Coogee, but both beaches have a good infrastructure.
great views and easy walk. easy walk along the coastline. we started at coogee and walked back to bondi, really enjoy the walk, ending with a great meal at bondi pizza!!
Fab. Breath taking views lovely walk some lovely beaches on the way takes a couple of hours to do the walk not a good idea to do with young children as a few hills
worthwhile. this walk is a must because of the scenic views and if you get a little hot on the way you can go in for a swim because its beaches all the way

Pinch Yourself.... One of the best things to do when freshly arrived in Sydney. The path takes you on a tour of stunning coastal views, past countless points that you will want to stop at and explore (rocks, smaller beaches) ...This is the reason Sydney is such a lovely place to live in.
Good Exercise. Very scenic well worth doing. We did it the other way round. Take plenty of water if doing on a hot day.
Great Walk. Bondi Beach is great and worth a visit, the coastal walk is fairly easy and very a nice way to spend an hour.

Stunning..... It’s a lovely picturesque walk featuring beaches, bays, rock pools, cliffs and of course stunning views. The walk begins at iconic Bondi Icebergs, just above the Bondi Baths at the southern end of the beach. There are actually two routes you could take from this point. Either walk along the path, or climb some steep steps to Marks Park where you'll find spectacular views, and a range of Aboriginal rock carvings.Awesome for photography.
Beautiful. A lovely walk with plenty of beautiful sights and a great way to discover the different beaches along the way

Like everyone said, it's really really really cool!. The best coastel walk I have ever done! I know there are blue seas everywhere, but this sea so many beautiful shades of blue. It's not very crowded. Take a hat/sun screen etc if you are doing this in summer. I recommend this walk to be done in the late afternoon (if you are lazy like me) or early morning.

Stunning. Walked during the week to avoid the crowds at the weekend and it was amazing. Mile after mile of stunning beaches but it was the rocky sections I loved with very Greek feeling bays. We did the extra section and got a little lost as you have to walk along streets to pick up the last section to Tamarama Beach this was one of my favourite bits across the rocks which blew my mind.We did in flip flops no problem and popped into the sea along the way. Bring water with you!!
Stunning views!. The walk is quite long so try to avoid very hot days. Otherwise enjoy the amazing views along the way and end your trip on Bondi Beach to spend the afternoon there!

Beautiful Scenic Walk. We did the Bondi-Coogee Beach walk on January 6th 2015. It was beautiful with some lovely views. Extremely Hot so would advise to take a couple of drinks or stop along the way to keep hydrated.

Incredible!. This is perhaps the most beautiful coastal walk I have ever done! Gorgeous landscapes and wonderful beaches. We walked from Coogee to Bondi and it took approximately 4 hours. If you wish to spend time at multiple beaches, consider a 6 hour itinerary. There are multiple stops en route (you just can't stop staring how beautiful the landscape is!). There are plenty of opportunities to snorkel as well.There aren't any places to eat while you do this walk. So eat well before you venture out, and carry a bottle of water to keep yourself hydrated.

Beautiful Scenic Walk! A Must!. Bondi beach is Sydney's most famous beach and it's easy to see why. It's so beautiful and the walk is a great way to get exercise and see the coastline. HIGHLY recommend you do this.
What a walk!. I simply loved it, it is the best walk ever, the ocean breeze is mesmerizing! and the atmosphere is so lively..:)

Fabulous walk. A really fantastic walk along the coast that took about 2 and a half hours at a leisurely pace. Ferry from Sydney to Watsons Bay (6AUD). 380 bus to Bondi - Walk to Coogee. Bus back to Sydney. (About 7AUD for the two bus rides). Very easy. lots of places to stop and rest if you want. water available along the route. If you got nothing to do and want a bit of exercise, it's worth the effort.

Beautiful little hike / walk. A gorgeous ocean view walk with lots off potential beach stop offs. A hat and strong sunscreen are definitely a good idea so you don't burn to a crisp. I highly recommend this walk.

Superb!. Put on your walking shoes and bring your camera! But don't forget to bring your bathing suit to enjoy the beautiful beaches you encounter on the way. This walk is simply amazing!! Beautiful views! The walk from Bronte to Coogee becomes quite difficult! But so worth it!!

Bondi to Bronte cliff top walk. This is one of the most beautiful and enjoyable walks I've ever done. Every visitor of mine to Sydney either asks to go on this walk, or discovers a true beauty of nature. The walk is along the cliff top overlooking the coastline. There are many stairs hence it is fairly challenging but extremely rewarding. Along the walk one encounters a few smaller beaches along the way that one can walk past or through. At the end of the walk as far as Bronte there are numerous cafes and restaurants to relax and catch your breath. At this point one can continue along to Clovelly beach which is another beautiful and busy beach. I always feel highly envigorated by this incredibly beautiful walk and and enjoy it each and every time. The rock and cliff formations are amazingly beautiful. Once a year there is an sculpture show along the route - well worth the trip.

Gorgeous Walk. Walked the trail and was stunned by the views. Plenty of things to see and many beaches to take a pit stop at along the way. There are also multiple points to go down to the water on the rocks. Would go the reverse way (Coogee to Bondi) the next time as it seemed the uphill portions were more frequent from Bondi. Bus stations are available everywhere so no need to try and find a parking spot. When the walk is finished there are a number of places to relax and have a beverage of your choice and food as well. Definitely recommend making the effort to do this walk.

Tamarama slsc - hidden gem. Today I walked past the iconic Tamarama SLSC clubhouse as I did the coast walk. The building is beautiful and worth a photo. I also saw the club members swim to sea and spread the ashes of a departed member and it was a moving sight.

The second best thing you can do at Bondi. If you are not zooming through Bondi, if you have spend the day at the beach, done a few of the restaurants on the main road, I do suggest this walk as it is a great way to see all the other smaller beaches as well as lend some spectacular views.When they say 6km it doesn't take into account steep descents and climbs so be aware of that. Take your time, there are plenty of rests, cafes and even toilets to break your journey. Take in the views and get inspired by the hundreds of joggers who make this trek seem so easy.Plan it such that A) you have sufficient energy and time to get back to Bondi the same way or B) you head out of Coogee to wherever you need to go to next as there is no bus directly on weekdays from Coogee to Bondi. You will have to go Bondi Junction and the come back to Bondi if you are tired.

The most beautiful beach walk I've ever been on.. You'll dream about wanting to live here! Walk is along the shoreline and you get to experience several beaches including the famous Bondi Beach. Loved it!

Very hot. We had a very nice walk along the coast line the only draw back was it was extremely hot, so take time to stop off at the beaches along the route to cool off, we much preferred coogee beach to bondi, bondi is just too commercial .

This is on my doorstep - spoiled me? You betcha!. I weekly do this awesome walk, mostly the other direction Coogee to Maroubra. Wonderful views, excellent photo opportunities. Love taking visitors on this route. Go really early in the morning and step aside for the joggers and speed walkers. Take your time and enjoy. Toilets and drinking water along the way

Coogee, very sunny and relaxed. I didn't do the whole walk, I was mainly around Coogee. The area I was in had a European feel to it, with café strips with tables and chairs outside, and stone paths leading into the park and up the hills - a lot of bikers and joggers around, as well as young families. Stunning views of the beach (And the incredible mansions built into the overlooking hills)Very very beautiful part of Sydney I wasn't expecting for a big city
One of the world's best walks. I might be biased but if you are ever in Sydney, this is one thing you MUST do! the scenery is amazing and sooo close to the city!
windy walk with views. Great stroll up and down the coast line. Views of Bondi and apartments overlooking the beach. Go early to avoid crowds.
Such a nice walk!. Well well worth the walk even if its really hot. The views are amazing so plenty of photo opportunities!

Lots of beautiful beaches!. Lovely walk from Bondi to Coogee, lots of nice beaches and great views. Remember to take sunscreen and water. Stop off at a beach for a quick dip to cool off if you get too hot. Coogee has a few great bars to grab a beer and some food at the end to celebrate.

Stunning. This is a fantastic and easy walk to do when you're in Sydney and the beaches are amazing. Word of warning - there are stairs along the way, so if you have a pram be prepared to carry it or go a creative way sometimes (eg through the cemetery that looks out over Bronte!)
More steps than expected. The walk was brilliant but I got a sunstroke because I had no hat on that day and there are a lot of steps I did not expect

The other direction is better. To be honest, the Bronte to Bondi walk is my favourite. If, however, you are coming the other way and still have energy, I guess you could continue to Coogee. Bear in m ind you have to walk through a cemetery, and that can freak some people out. Personally, I think Bronte or Bondi are the better destinations as they have more interesting cafes for that coffee and cake reward you will deserve after all that exercise

Stay fit and enjoy the view too!. This is the second time we have done this walk when staying in Sydney. It's a great fitness walk or run. Just be sure to bring sunscreen. This time we stopped at Bronte beach and had lunch in a great little cafe! Catch a bus from Sydney. It's easy and inexpensive.
Too crowded. This walk is beautiful but don't expect a workout. It is so crowded walking is often the only option.

Beautiful coastal walk!. Great views and nice walk. We started in Coogee and finished in Bondi, I have not walked the other way starting in Bondi. I did the walk while it was raining, could only imagine how beautiful it is when its nice and sunny! I think it took about 1hr- 1.5hr.

Lovely way to spend a summers day. Did the walk on New Year's Day, great weather, and a nice way to spend the day, a variety of different beaches in between.. Lots of places to sit and watch the world go by... One world of warning, it's a Coast walk so beware a few big hills... One killer
Breathtaking rock formations and panoramics of the ocean. I did not do the whole walk but definitely if you are at Bondi beach walk along the trail it was a major highlight of this day. Gorgeous.

Exhibition of statues. Its a beautiful walk. When we went there was an exhibition of statues along the way which made the walk interesting. Take water but there are loos and a lovely cafe along the walk.
A Treck Worth Doing. Brilliant scenery en-route and many places along the way to stop, have a coffee or take a brunch. Take plenty of sun screen!
Great walk. Great walk but go before it gets too hot and take a hat! Stop at both cafes for lollies and drinks - Tama cafe does fantastic juices and smoothies - even dairy free ones!
nice. once to go is worth. Yes I liked the beach. It is clean. Parking charges are very high. you can go for a picnic.

Nice but hard. Lovely views but there is only so much sea to look at before it gets repetitive and if you don't like walking and haven't got a drink and wearing jeans it gets uncomfortable haha. Im sure if we was properly prepared for the walk it would have been great
Great Workout or Leisurely Stroll. Took us about 1.15 hrs (had to take time for photo's), quite a few stairs but we're fit, if it's too much you can always go halfway and turn back.

Plan for a few stops along the way.. Definitely make this walk part of your trip to Sydney. We took the train to Bondi Junction, then a bus to Bondi beach. We had purchased round trip train tickets, so after arriving at Coogee we needed to take a bus back to Bondi Junction to pick up the return train. There were more options to take a bus back to (if I recall correctly) to Circular Quay which would have been fine for us. Of course traffic might have made the route by bus longer in the end.We enjoyed stopping at a couple of spots along the way to swim.
Bondi to Coogee beach walk. Absolutely stunning views, wonderful refreshing walk! There will be a lot of runners at certain points of the day, but you can still enjoy it because it is so beautiful.

It's Okay. Walk was okay, it's a pretty busy and crowded path though.At some points there are some great views and the walk was enjoyable enough, did it in about 1.5-2 hours (at a reasonable pace).It's worth doing if you don't have plans but personally it's not on my list of best things in Sydney.
Don't have to go all the way to Coogee. Going to Bronte is enough. It gets a bit long and "repetitive" after the graveyard. Though Bondi to Bronte is beautiful.

Amazing walk. It's a beautiful and easy walk. Gorgeous views, and plenty of places to stop off on the way if you want to hang out at a beach or get something to eat or drink.this is one of our favorite things that we did during our honeymoon
a pleasant walk to enjoy the Australian coast line and australians life style. this is a nice walk and you can easily spend a day to enjoy the Pacific waters and the Australian's life style
stunning. one of the best walks i have ever done coastal scenery and surroundings out of this world could walk everyday and not tire of it

Fantastic views - wear a hat!. This was an amazing walk. The views are incredible. We did it from Coogee to Bondi in blistering sunshine and got fairly sunburnt. Definitely recommended on a trip to Sydney.
An easy stroll. Did as part of a much longer walk from Coogee to South Head. Have also walk here when sculptures by the sea was on but it was far more crowded then!
Amazing!!!. a must do!!! Pretty long but worth every second of it!!! Be sure to wear good walking shoes and bring a camera for the views!

Incredible deal!. What a lovely walk to take - probably nothing like it in the world. Public transportation, bring your own food and drinks or buy anything you want. So much to enjoy. The water, the beach, the people, the nature. Watch out for creepy crawlers - spiders etc. that come in all sizes.

Great seaside walk:). We did the cliff top coastal walk starting at Coogee and ending at Bondi Beach. The walk is about 6 km and takes 2 hours to complete. It features some stunning views of beaches, parks, cliffs, bays and rock pools. It isn’t difficult, and there are medium gradient paths and several staircases with occasional seating. The day we took the walk, it was sunny with temperatures 35 C or 91 F, so be sure to take a bottle of water, some sunscreen and a camera to capture the beautiful scenery. We got to/from the beach by local bus, which made for a very fun filled, low cost day of exercise.

Amazing Coogee to Bondi Walk. It was am amazing walk, wasn't that long and you don't go 5 minutes without seeing something beautiful!! Would really recommend it, but wear appropriate footwear. I didn't so wasnt ideal!! But still enjoyed it :D
Beautiful. Bondi Beach is a spectacle in itself, but this kind of slow walk along the ocean offers beautiful views. Well worth it.

A Must Do in Sydney. We did the Coastal Walk from Bondi Beach to Cogee. It is a beautiful walk and I am glad we did it. However, we did this walk on our last day in Sydney and our legs were quite sore already from everywhere we went...so it was quite tiring and we are in pretty good shape! If you are not used to a lot of walking you may not want to walk all the way to Cogee...do a shorter walk. Bring water especially on a warm or hot day! It was a good workout but is something we will always remember and cherish from our trip to Sydney. Highly recommend!
Sydney at its best. This is such a lovely walk - beautiful ocean views, big skies, and plenty of places to stop for a coffee before or after.
Nice walk. I did this walk on Sunday and it wasn't very busy. It is a nice walk with some lovely views along the way. There are also a few smaller beaches and rock pools to stop and enjoy.

Fantastic Coastal Scenery. We walked a section of this walk during the Sculptures by the Sea exhibitions. Great idea although a busy time for the walk. Lots of people to pass along the sometimes narrow path! The scenery is spectacular and great for photos at any vantage point. At the right time of year you will see whales easily from the path.

A long walk in hot conditions!. The walk was spectacular with great views all the way along it. However, be mindful of the weather conditions. It is hard work if temperatures are running high, be sure to be suntan creamed up and fully hydrated.

Nice views. Very pleasant walk, nice and easy, and the cliffs are really pretty. You can stop on the way at one of the beaches. You can also continue the walk beyond Coogee, down to Maroubra - it's much less crowded.

Must do, perfect way to see the eastern suburbs beaches!. Worth the long walk for the amazing views! Try and go on a cooler day, as it's a long walk or make sure you take your swimmers to cool off at the beaches a long the way! If you can't make it all the way to coogee the You can stop at either one of the beaches along the way! Tama has a wonder cafe on the beach & so does Clovelly! if you make it all the way, then deffinatley reward yourself with an ice cold beer or a pizza at the coogee pavilion!

Awesome Views!. We did this walk in reverse - so started in Coogee & finished in Bondi. Scenery is just amazing! if you do this walk in summer then I recommend going as early as you can just to beat the heat! There will always be a coastal breeze but there is not much shade along the way. Also take lots of water! There are stops along the way where you can fill up a bottle. there are quite a lot of stairs too!A must do if visiting Sydney!

What A Way To Begin Your Day!. While visiting Australia, we stayed at Coogee Beach. This walk is a must do! I woke up every morning, and began the 12 km run. This is the most beautiful scenery I have ever ran around. It was motivating to see the runners/walkers from sunrise to sunset. I suggest running early in the morning so the sun does not have an opportunity to cook you. Enjoy!

LOVE this walk!. If you enjoy the great outdoors, exercise or even swimming then this walk is for you! Its a great walk for all fitness levels and you can go as quick or as slow as you want! Take a snorkel and a camera as you have lots of photo and swimming opportunities along the way! Top tip: Drink plenty, wear sunscreen and a hat!
Take your time. Lovely beaches along the way, not as far as you think so do it, it was so hot when we went but it's not a hard walk

Quick and Beautiful Coastal Walk!. I did the walk in a bit over 1.5 hours. I did quite a bit of stopping and hopped on and off the path and climbed around on the rocks. The walk itself is beautiful and takes you through a series of beaches. I tried to run part of it, but it was quite crowded and a bit tough to navigate the other tourists. Make sure to bring an empty bottle of water to fill along the way and in the summer going earlier is recommended to avoid the heat.

Lovely evening walk. It took us 2 hours to walk from Coogee Beach to Bondi Beach. A relatively easy walk. Since it is a combination of several walks, you can start and end in between without going the whole distance.Bring your swim clothes as you will be walking by beaches with waters that seem to invite you in. I was most impressed with The Bath. If I had the time and proper attire, I would have gone in for a dip.Water fountains are available throughout, bring along your water bottle to refill. Public toilets are also available but will close after a certain time.Certain parts of the walk will take you to the edge of the cliffs. Stay inside the fence to avoid accidents. Winds are strong and sometimes sand particles could end up in your eyes.Apply sunscreen, put on your sunnies and a cap/hat. Wear proper shoes although I did see people with flip flops.For pictures, visit Lyn, Life Explorer: Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk (http://arazlin.blogspot.com.au/2015/01/bondi-to-coogee-coastal-walk.html)
Nice Scenery!. Very Nice walk! We walked mid day which was very warm during summer, but the views were worth the heat. A must do when you are in Sydney.
Bondi Coastal Walk. Get there early to avoid the crowds and find a parking spot. Views are stunning - a visual feast. Be sure to take your camera.

Stunning Scenery. This is a great and not too strenuous walk along the coastal path. Go morning or evening to avoid the heat in Summer, and ideally go when the Sculpture Trail is up which makes the walk even more enjoyable. There are water stations along the route.

What a beautiful walk!. we took a bus out to the eastern suburbs and walked from Coogee to Bondi beach. Someone on Tripadvisor recommended doing the walk in reverse, we agree! The weather was perfect and the views spectacular! The difficulty wasn't too bad for a couple of 60 year olds in ok shape. Do stop in Bronte Beach for lunch. There is a great little fish and chips place across from a lovely park.
Nice nice day for us. Walking walking walking didn't seem to be walkingJust enjoying the views and the atmosphere Pick a good sunny day and ur set!

Christmas in the sun. We took the bus to Bondi on Christmas Day - what a great trip with lots of young people dressed up in Santa hats, some even carrying small decorated Christmas trees. After walking the beach we did the coastal walk to Coogee which was lovely with great views over the water, various beaches and headlands. All in all, a great day. Got the bus from Coogee back to Sydney in the late afternoon.

Spectacular view. Ain't we glad we did! We've saved this for our last day in Sydney. We have opted to walk to the Bondi Beach from the junction so as to have the opportunity to sightsee the neighbourhood as well. It was actually not a long walk as it was breezy today though hot. The beach is expectedly lively with ppl sunbathing and surfing and relaxing. From the information we've gathered, the walk from Bondi to Coogee was straightforward. Undoubtedly, this coastal walk is one of the best and most popular. We have visited most part of the city but nothing beats this one. The route has well guided signs and map points. Starting from Bondi Beach, walking South you will see cliff top trail with sandstone cliffs and endless spectacular water of the ocean. Next, there is the Tamarama Beach which is smaller but still beautiful with surfing lovers everywhere. As we did not have enough time so we had lunch in one of the cafe in the Bronte Beach area and backtrack our route back to the Bondi Beach. With what we have seen and walked, the view was truly amazing. you simply have to come to see it for yourself.

Absolutely Amazing! . Breathtaking views and gorgeous scenery. Lots of water fountains along the way which is great! I walked there and back and stopped at the beaches for a dip here and there. The whole trip took me 7 hours, but it all depends on how many stops u make. Highly recommend!

Beautiful views and wonderful beaches. This is a lovely walk. While Bondi is a nice beach, the other beaches we explored along the Coastal Walk felt less touristy. We had a wonderful lunch at the beach restaurant at Clovelly. Don't skip the Coogee Pavillion to toast the end of the hike. Great afternoon.
Great walk. The walk was quite pleasant, Thankfully, it wasn't too hot on the day we walked. Kids enjoyed a swim at Clovelly pool on the way.

Always a treat. The views, the variety, the difference in all the beaches, and the rewards at both ends! We did Coogee to Bondi, and then we had lunch and did it the other way... a little tiring, but rewarding!

Beautiful scenic walk. This is definitely worth going out your way to do, the views are lovely. We didn't experience it being too busy but definitely a lot of stairs to climb. I don't know the rating criteria but it seems strange this is no. 1 when there is Bondi Beach and Sydney Opera House to name the most famous two!

GREAT!. Great walk, took just over an hour to complete this walk. I would recommend doing the walk from Bondi-Coogee as you can then stop and have lunch or a drink at Coogee Pavilion which is awesome! We walked both there and back and thoroughly enjoyed this beautiful coastal walk-it can get quite busy and hot so start off early if you can. Plenty of toilets on the way.

Stunning walk by the ocean. It might be 6 kms long but well worth the walk, yes there are stairs but also seats to have a rest if you need to, plenty of places to eat at in Coogee, we only walked one way as the rain was starting when we finished our lunch so caught taxi back to Bondi, a walk not to be missed

Do it so you can tell everyone you did it.. We were told this is one of the best walks you will make in Australia.I can't say I agree. Like most "organised" paths it is concreted over and feels unnatural. There were so many people on it the day (cold and windy) we did it it was like a motorway. As kong as you keep looking out to sea it looks nice but it is lined from start to finish with houses which detract from any natural beauty it may otherwise have had. For a really great short walk (5km) go to Nowra and do "Ben's Walk". Enchanting.

Begin at Coogee finish at Bondi. Amazing! Views are superb. Finish at Bondi, more restaurants and a better view. People recommend begin at Bondi, my husband and I did that and we decided that next time we would do the opposite and recommend our finds to do the same.
Walk this the other way. We like walking this famous path in both directions. It is especially lovely between Tamarama and Bondi.

Great views. Amazing 6 km walk! Fantastic views of the coastline whilst passing a number of beaches. But beware, it goes up and down and there is a lot of stair climbing involved. You have to be fit to do it!

Nice walk with great views. While Bondi beach itself was very crowded over Christmas, if you go, give this walk a shot. There were quite a few people and it can be windy but the views were amazing and you can end at a number of other beaches.
Amazing View!. Bring a water bottle. It'll tire you out but views to die for! Along this walk you'll be able to see 3 - 4 different beaches! Great opportunity to people watch too.
Superb Hill top beach walk. Fantastic walk,plenty of water fountains,have a beer in Coogee and get bus back to Central station. Excellant walk

Sometimes the best things are free. How we for there: We took the train to Bondi Junction and a bus to Cogee Beach from the Cogee beach you can easily see the sidewalk/paved walkway…you can't miss the walkway since everyone is going that way.. We started the walk at around 3 pm during a cloudy and windy day and ended at Bondi Beach around 6 pm. It took us longer because we took lots of rest and pictures along the way. This is a fairly easy walk and I think most people can do it. In any case, if you get tired you can always catch a bus in between. One thing is for sure..the view is spectacular!

Best coastal walk in sydney. Have done this several times, close to the city can walk either way from Bondi or Coogee, buses run frequently to both places, some great cliff faces and water and beaches to photograph, coffee shops and food outlets on the way at each beach. Just brilliant. start early take your time and enjoy.

Always a good walk. One of the best views in this planet, you always see someone famous and can spot a dolphin or two. The only time I don't like the walk is when the Sculptures by the Sea are on, it's crazy...
Beautiful. What a beautiful walk and virtually in our own back yard. A must do and see. Great location for families.

One of the best walks in the country. The Bondi to Bronte (or on to Coogee) is quite simply one of the most beautiful walks in Australia. You have the amazing Pacific Ocean on one side, and the beautiful Eastern Suburbs of Sydney on the other. And I don't even have to mention the beauty you will see walking/running along with you as well!! The walk has a great variety of hills and stairs, but is never too challenging. Fantastic beaches litter the walk, that you can stop and enjoy a dip, or stop at one of the many cafe's for refreshments along the way!
The best place for a run in Sydney. This is my regular run route and it is the best in the world. The route has lots of hills and stairs which makes for a fun run.

Lovely coastal views. We chose to do this at a weekend when the coastal sculptures were on display. It was absolutely heaving with people. This slowed our progress considerably but it was still worth it. We got the bus from Circular quays in Sydney and got the bus back from Coogee - all easily done. Plenty of eating ,drinking places for a break en route

Stunning landscape.... It is a great walk to do but it is not on flat terrain and I think its longer than the suggested 5 kms. The views along the way make for great pictures and the landscape is just stunning on a clear day. We did the walk at about 4.30 pm and avoided most of the harsh sun.
incredible. Very good route whith which you walk throught the coast and you can feel the waves very near!!! Worthseeing

Great Views. We actually did this walk from Coogee to Bondi (after a Sunday morning swim on Coogee beach).A nice walk providing good views of beaches cliffes and properties between Bondi and Coogee.The walk isn't flat - lots of ups and downs between cliff level and beach level - but not too strenuous
Best free activity in Sydney. This is the best free thing you'll do in Sydney. Worth the effort to enjoy some amazing views and to see some of the nicest beaches Sydney has to offer.

I'm scorched but it was worth it!. Whoever said Bondi beach is overrated must have some unrealistic expectations - or maybe he didn't take this wonderful coastal walk... The views are priceless. It was quite a long and mostly uphill walk and there was seldom any shade but all the sweat and sunburn are very well worth this amazing experience! Don't miss it!

This walk is one you should not miss. This costal walk is offers amazing costal scenery, great sea views and a challenging enough walk whilst still suitable for families. There are plenty of places to stop and take in the wonderful scenery or to move along more rapidly if looking for an exercise venue following Christmas lunch. There are plenty of opportunities for snacks or drinks along the way or a swim if cooling off is needed.

Varied. we took the walk the other way round. It takes about 1 and 1/2 hours. There is some up and down and not much shade, sun cream and hat and water important. There are several little beaches and snack places on the way. Lots of stunning views.
Spectacular walk. This is a must when you visit Sydney. The views are spectacular. Take a dip in any of the beaches/coves equally stunning as Bondi you will pass along the way.
Walking around the cliffs and rocks at Bondi. Absolutely Beautiful!!!!! there were many walking around the rocks the views were excellent and really pretty
Fabulous free walk. Beautiful scenic views, did not disappoint. Highly recommend Coogee to Bondi then lunch in bondi. Quite busy with runners on a weekend, maybe weekday would be better.

Do it!. We were only able to do Bondi to Bronte but it was still amazing. The views are gorgeous but if you go I would recommend being in comfy clothes since you have to do quite a lot of steep stairs and walking. It's a great place to do a run or a workout. Quite a few people were jogging. We took a ton of pictures. I would recommend stopping at Tamarama beach and getting a fresh coconut from the beach cafe. It definitely hit the spot for a long walk.

More than a walk. Just fill up with water and sun screen and do the walk , take in all the scenery at a slow pace , the picture changes every step of the way ....a magic walk ....enjoy the cool beer at the end ....
Breathtaking views. a wonderful walk; gives incredible perspective of the harbor and surrounding beaches. Perfect activity for a morning or afternoon
A lovely walk, with stunning beaches!. Loved seeing the different "vibes" at different beaches.... Stunning views! Walk is a nice alternative to laying around in the sun!
exciting/charming place. For an European like me this place is so amazing and exciting. To have a beach like this one IN your city is n.1.
Good coast walk. Several beachs, nice scenary. Bondi beach was amazing. Would suggest carrying out the walk backwards ending at Bondi.

Nice walk. User friendly. Very hot on New Year's Day. Loads of people on the beaches. Easy walk. Great cure for the previous days jollities:-(Need more cafes, beach bars, umbrellas and sun beds on all beaches. Didn't think much of Bondi. Manly better.
great walk. amazing walk that gets you away from the traffic of sydney and bang smack on the best walking / running track in Australia!

Superb. How to describe this place , the must visit place in sydney . The beach even i can say A dream beach for anybody , I have been many beaches in south east and middle east but this place is awesome and very klass and different in all terms kindly see the pics on TA and you feel and find must visit place in life time.

Coastline to challenge the world's most beautiful!. We cannot believe that we lived in Sydney's East for so long and never encountered this gem.The walk from Coogee northward to Bondi was a highlight of our recent visit. Beautiful bays and beaches, stunning rock formations, a cemetery filled with history, great people watching,... and the list could go on. The walking tracks and facilities are well maintained and make it easy for all ages to enjoy some or all of the walk. We started with excellent coffee at one of Coogee's many fine cafes, then ambled to Bronte beach where we stopped for the mandatory fish and chips, enjoyed in the shady beach park. We finished with the best part, and I do recommend a South to North walk for this reason! The final part of our walk from Bronte around to Tamarama and Bondi was stunning. If you have limited time, or have younger or older walkers, this is the part to try. Short and easy, but the best of the views.Public transport to most places, especially Coogee and Bondi, is easy to negotiate from the city and tourist hotels. But we were so in the groove, that we then walked across from Bondi to Rose Bay and around the waterfronts to the city. We agreed that this burned off the calories from the fish and chips, and ensured a good night's sleep! Don't wait as long as we did to discover this Sydney highlight.

Scenic Walk. What is there not to love about a nice scenic walk on a wonderful sunny day. I live in Sydney and I can't believe how lucky we are to have such beautiful walks available to us. The views are amazing and you forget that you are getting in your daily exercise. The walk is quite an easy one for any able bodied person. Especially if you need a regular break, it's easy to stop and just soak in the view. We always take overseas visitors on this walk and they are always in awe of the beauty of our coastline. There are better coastlines in Australia especially in WA. This walk however is great though.
Nice walk, but crowded on a holiday weekend.. Scenery was good, heavy crowds difficult to negotiate on narrow pathways. Would recommend bringing swim trunks for the public sea baths.

Stunning scenery. If you would like to immerse yourself into the local lifestyle and do what many Sydney siders do every day then head over to the Eastern suburbs and walk the coastal trail from Bondi to Coogee.It's a path that takes you through 5 beaches plus Gordon's Bay which is a great spot for snorkeling and diving. If you don't mind getting up early (before sunrise) it's probably the most rewarding time to start your walk on Bondi beach.Bondi is frequented by a lot of fitness enthusiasts and you will see many of those working out in the morning just before sunrise and after. The sun rises up from the ocean and often times colours the sky in bright orange and red hues. Prime photo opportunity...The walk itself is fairly easy eventhough there are stairs and up and down sections through smaller hills/cliffs etc. Set aside 2 hours one way if you stop for photos and walk with a moderate speed. I'd recommend having breakfast at Bronte beach as a bit of a pit stop. Any cafe just up from the bus stop will serve up one of the best breakfasts you have ever had. As a local, I always take my visiting international or interstate friends on this walk. It's a must do when in Sydney regardless of season.
Cloudy day. Still beautiful. Took the train and bus to cookie and did it backwards. Less crowded. Lunch at icebergs in bondi

Perfect beach walk. This is a cool beach with tons of surfers to watch along the way. The walk is gorgeous and relaxing. You can go out on the rocks in some places. The trail can get a little crowded but overall wonderful time and if you like the beach but don't just want to sit there, this is your perfect solution.
Nice views. Great for a morning run or walk. Excellent ocean views and very close from local cafes to have breakfast afterwards.
<3 loved it. It is so worth doing this walk... fantastic!The weather was excellent and Bondi beach provides a lot of surf-activities as well as shopping possibilities.

Don't forget the camera. Great walk along an iconic coastline. A couple of suggestions: 1/ Don't forget the camera and water/sunscreen etc. 2/ Try and have lunch at the Ice-Bergs club. The views from the veranda whilst enjoying a drink and fish lunch is very special. The walk is what you make of it.. Don't rush and take time to look back and enjoy the views. Read the plaques and enjoy the escarpments. There are coffee shops and cafes, but more importantly for those less fit, public transport for the return.
Great outdoors. Enjoy one of the best scenic walks in Sydney! It's worth every minute spent. No surprise, bearing in mind that Bondi beach is considered one of the most scenic beaches in Australia.

Excellent coastal walk! take your camera.. Well this has to be one of the best walks in Sydney. Cliff views over the ocean. An ambling and energetic walking track. A must-do when you're in Sydney. Take your camera, and amble on this walk. Amazing!
Spectacular views. Nice views, good walk, few hills and stairs but very enjoyable. Quite a few people doing the walk, so not a secluded walk like other walks in Sydney. Pleasant sea breeze.

A must do stuff for visitors. Excellent coastal views, my family had a coastal walk on 27 Dec 2014 and were really impressed. The bondi beach itself isn't that great (compare to other beaches Australia has to offer) but the coastal walk has so much to offer. Although the paths are well serviced but if you have a toddler with you then I advice to be little bit careful.

Beautiful Walk. We traveled in Oct and started our day catching the ferry from Circular Quay to Watson Bay. Saw the area and walked along the beaches on a paved path. Had lunch at Doyle's on the pier. Then took bus to Bondi Beach (The Gap) and walked to Bronte, past the Bondi Iceberg which is an outdoor lap pool where waves flood over the pool and you have a great view from the walkway. The walk is very scenic with cliffs and waves crashing and surfboarders. The wind can be chilly so be sure to bring a jacket. We also carried water and snacks. Plenty of places to stop and sit and enjoy the view. The walk can be quite steep in places. We continued on the Coastal Clifftop walk to Coogee where we caught the bus back to Central Station. It was a great day for taking pictures and enjoying the outdoors.

Amazing walk and views, all for free!. Thoroughly enjoyed this walk. Easily get public transport back and forth for spectacular experience! What a delight that Sydney offers multiple coastal walks. Highly recommend. Not strenuous.

Good but busy and not all that special. I was expecting more from this hike based off the reviews I'd read. Honestly it didn't deliver that much, the paths are well serviced but the views and towns along the walk aren't all they're cracked up to be by other reviews.

A panoramic walkway beside an ever-present ocean. So privileged to be there. Ikipa. Great!! My wife n I walked the Coggee to Bondi during 26 Dec 2013 n were impressed. We returned to Sydney and walked Bondi to Coggee on 25th February 2014 n Bondi to Coggee same day. We were visiting daughter n son on both occasions. We are back for Xmas 2014 n New Year 2015 n will do the same walk. It is wonderful. Ikipa

Look both ways!. It may have been the sculptures that got you there but it will be the joggers that send you away. If it is not their wide-set elbows, it will be their sour faces. Not the welcoming, friendly locals you would hope for. Try to visit Bondi not during the S x Sea. The scenery is great but, sadly, not worth the struggle in September each year.
A great way to spend an afternoon ..... what a great way to enjoy the sun and spend an afternoon ... a leisurely stroll ... enjoying what Australia is known for ...

Great walk. This is not a difficult walk .There are benches everywhere , it is slightly undulating but a really scenic glimpse of the ocean and the coastline away from motorised traffic It would take an hour if done briskly
Brilliant. Not overly recommend for buggys but we managed it but perfect for walks and joggers fantastic views and beaches
Coogee to Bondi. Loved the walk but it was crowded and very windy the day we went. Despite this it was well worth the effort

Nice beach, very busy and crowded. Bondi beach has too many people on the beach. along the area, they have Tamarama beach which is abit smaller beach than Bondi. Bondi beach is very famous for tourists compared to other beaches. Can take the hop on hop off bus go to Bondi beach.

Great walk great views. A great day out. Some beautiful bays on the way. The wild sea was awesome. Fairly easy but some steep parts. We stopped often to take photos and it took us 3hrs. We got train to and from Bondi junction then bus at the start and finish.

A grand day out.. A lovely way to spend a day. Stick your beach towel in a bag and beach hop along the Sydney coast with stunning views, gorgeous beaches and some nice places to grab a beer and a snack. Take water - there are also refill points at various locations - and be prepared for some steepish bits, but it is all well maintained.
Thoroughly enjoyed. Beautiful cliffs/ocean view/winding natural paths. Numerous photo opportunities: breathtaking views from morning to sunset. We did not dislike anything.

Lovely walk. Amazing views of the coast of Australia. Walking past the beaches of the eastern suburbs and enjoying the fresh smell of the ocean air. The walk is easy but does have steps and not suitable for the less mobile. There are plenty of little beaches to stop off along the way.

Way too windy. We tried to do this walk, but we were not prepared to carry our stuff as far as this went. In addition, it was super windy and overcast. It was cold and we gave up quickly. We went back to Coogee beach and were literally pelted with sand. The views are gorgeous, so on a non-windy, sunny day, it would be fabulous. Wear hiking shoes and a backpack.

So beautiful, you can't miss it. Whatever you do when you go to Sydney, just don't forget to catch a bus to Bondi and do this walk. The coast is dramatic with its ups and downs and weather battered vegetation, the path is confy to walk, and the ocean has a shade of blue you will fall in love with.

Very pretty coastline but can be crowded on the weekend. It really is a must do if you visit Sydney. Parking is revolting so I recommend getting there via bus with very comfortable shoes. Avoid it over October/September when "Sculpture by the Sea" is being displayed along that area of coastline as it is hiddeously crowded and the scuptures are ridiculous.

Bit longer than i expected!. Really good walk - took longer than i expected - wear proper footwear not flipflops! really pretty views and a great way to decide what beaches you want to visit later in the holiday!

Definitely walk this Trail. Not as far as it seems, but it's still a good distance.In December holiday season it was very crowded. Beachside cafes were crowded, not easy to get a seat.Take plenty of fluids as there is little shade.Coogee has the most choices to eat/drink once on the Trail. Despite the guidebook comments there seems to be only 1 bus route ( not 3) to get back to Bondi Junction.

Lives Up to the Hype. Given how much people talk this up, I didn't think it would live up to expectations, but it's really stunning. Just do it. Go at sunset or sunrise for some amazing light. For a twist, take a bus to Coogee and walk up to Bondi.

Great views and scenery. Did this walk yesterday and loved it. It's about 4 miles in total and is quite up and down but not a problem for most people and there are plenty of places to stop along the way for a swim etc. if you do it on a hot day make sure you have plenty of water and sun cream! There are water stations through the the walk where you can refill your drinks if necessary.

Fantastic walk. From Coogee to Bondi is mostly going downhill so if you want to avoid climbing the stairs, walk from Coogee. On the way there are many beaches and nice shaded places for short breaks. At the end of the walk is the famous Bondi beach where you can end your day with great food and drinks!

Amazing view. We decided to do the walk after reading all the reviews and well worth it. Only criticism was that there is no shade during the walk and it's long time in the sun. Make sure you wear a hat or get sunburnt
excellent walk along the coast. excellent walk with beautiful views of the coast. Highly reccommended. Wild parrots in the trees along the cliffs.

It's not as far as it sounds!. We decided to do this walk after much deliberation but it was well worth it! Stunning scenery, plenty of places to sit down if you need a rest and loads of places to refill water bottles. We were surprised that Bondi Beach was not as commercial as we expected and the bays and beaches we walked through we're just lovely. We ended up eating lunch at a cafe called Little Jack Horner in Coogee which was great. Definitely do the whole walk rather than stop at one of the earlier bays. We are in our late 50s and it wasn't a hard walk. We spent roughly 3 hours walking because we stopped for photos etc. fit person could do it in just over 1 hour without stops.
Beautiful, must-do in Sydney. This walk takes you through some of the best Sydney beaches. From Bondi, to Bronte to Clovelly to Cogee. It's about 5km, not strenuous and stunning ocean views.
Easy walk for fresh air and great scenery. Nice. Not too crowded. Drinks and food available in beaches. Fresh air. Breathtaking scenery. Some nice houses.
Lovely walk. A pleasant walk, well recommended especially on a sunny day. Stunning views over Bondi Beach and other beaches. Make sure you take something to drink.
