Great walk. I did this there and back in hot weather. Great walk from Coogee to Bondi. Saw lots of Whales on route. Excellent views.Nice beer at Bondi before the walk back to Coogee. Must do.
Beautiful!. Don't miss this! It's a nice long stroll with some slightly strenuous moments and a massive payoff with stunning views, making you come away feeling refreshed and enlivened!

Eastern Suburbs Top Attraction. This walk is one of three "must do's" in the Eastern Suburbs of Sydney, along with visiting Watson's Bay/South Head and taking in the harbour/city views from the top of New South Head Road. The views are second to none and it's a great way to catch up for a chat with someone while also getting some exercise. In October every year, this walk hosts the "Sculptures by the Sea" art exhibition which is becoming a Sydney favourite.It takes approximately 1.5 hours one way at a leisurely pace. Be aware that there is no shade on this walk, there are several sets of stairs (so not wheelchair friendly) and given the clifftop location, it is very exposed to the wind. For these reasons, I recommend doing the walk early to enjoy the sunrise over the water or towards sunset when the weather is cooler. At the Bondi end, Bondi Trattoria, Icebergs public bar and North Bondi RSL are good spots to have a drink and some food at a reasonable price. At the Coogee end, Barzura, Tropicana Café and Coogee Legions Club offer drinks and food at reasonable prices.This walk can be extended to the north by continuing to Watsons Bay and to the south by continuing to Maroubra.Enjoy the beauty that Sydney's spectacular coastline offers.

from cooge to bondi.... The beach gets much more interesting if you walk the walking path connecting it to cooge. It's one hour and a half with no difficulties and lovely views, different terroir and even a cemetery on the edge of a cliff. Nice way to know the region.

yes; it is #1. so, when you see the listing of activities on TA for sydney, this walk gets the #1 crown. we did this from coogee beach to bondi beach and can only agree that this is a top reason to visit and explore the sydney area. it is beautiful at so many stops. give yourself time as your camera will be demanding multiple stops. high expectations were delivered.

Great walk full of great scenery. We walked opposite direction and although I had lived in Sydney for 10 years never managed this walk before. It was an easy walk with well concreted path which was nice and wide. Some stairs in places which could be hard for some. Very busy with other walkers/runners in some places. Plenty of public toilets along the way. Take lots of water although can also be purchased along the way.

The great walking gem of the Sydney Coast. Bondi to Coogee Beach is both healthy and exhilarating. Some of the climbs at the Bondi Beach end are quite steep, so be prepared to hold on to the rails and pace yourself, despite a fair sprinkling of runners in just a bit too much of a hurry. If climbing stairs is a problem, sadly this walk may be just too taxing. This walk will connect you with wonderful sandstone folds, breathtaking headland views, and reward you with fine café refreshment once you reach your destination, or pause at Tamarama on the way. As a photographer some of the intricate details of the rock formation are a constantly changing mosaic, best viewed from sun-up to 2 hours afterwards. The clarity of winter skies can also enhance the experience. Wrap up warm if it's a howling south westerly in Winter, dress lightly if it's a warm north-easterly in late Summer, bringing onshore humidity. No matter how many times I've done this walk, it's a joy. The parking fees at Bondi are steep, you'll pay $12 or more if you make the return walk. But the uplift in spirit is worth every penny. And in the Sydney Spring, make sure to look out for Sculptures by The Sea, a magnificent collection of sculptures arrained along the coastal walk. 5-Star walk in every sense.
great walk. We were able to get very good views of the coast. Check it out sometime! Take lots of photos for sure!!

DO NOT MISS!. Took the bus (just $2.50 each with unlimited travel all day on Sundays!!!) from the Sydney pier to Coogee and walked to Bondi: fantastic coastal views and wonderful trail...Spectacular scenery. Would be amazing even on a stormy day; maybe even more dramatic...but we were fortunate to have perfect weather. Very memorable...

Breathtaking views on the walk. Absolutely the loved the walk but only for people who are relatively fit! Lots of steps but plenty of seats enroute! Gorgeous views and beaches before finally arriving at Coogee. Worth visiting the Pavilion for a well earned cuppa!
Great. Great way to spend the day! Don't just stay put at one beach - take a walk and enjoy the great view, go for a swim at one of the many beaches you pass on the way and get an ice cream half way.
beautiful views. The walk has beautiful views; it is a unique Sydney experience. it can easily be done in 1-2 hours, depending on how leisurely you walk.
Wonderful!. Perfect scenery, clean, tourist friendly! Great!Easy to get to. Got on bus 380 at Museum station in Sydney. Forty minutes to Bondi beach. Must be very nice to live there!
Fantastic walk.. Great views of the coast . Terrific lunch at Bondi Icebergs with more spectacular views over Bondi beach.

Stunning views, kids can definitely do this. We did this with our five young kids and while I wouldn't recommend taking a stroller on this, it was very cool and the highlight of our time in Sydney. It took us around 3 hours, and we were going at a leisurely pace and stopped for a dip and water breaks.

Picturesques coastal walk. In my opinion, if you love to walk, this is a MUST. This is a 6-km walk where you'll see beaches, swimming pool, cliffs and outstanding view! I saw several people jogging. There are excercise equipment along the way where you can stop and use them. It is very easy to get there. We took a train from the Central Station to Bondi junction and then a bus to Bondi beach. It took us between 2.5 to 3 hours to finish. We stopped once in a while to take pictures or just take in the amazing view! If you are fast, you can probably finish the walk in 2 hours. Make sure you bring your hat and plenty of sun lotion.

Great Walk & Great View. This walking path stretches from Bondi beach to Coogee beach in the eastern part of Sydney. To get here you catch a train to bondi junction and then a bus (the buses leave there all the time and go straight to bondi beach). You could catch a taxi from your hotel but it would be very expensive with a lot of traffic in this area at all times of the day! I recommend the train and bus option to get here. The walk offers outstanding coastal cliff scenery, lots of million dollar mansions of the rich and famous types and I guess another benefit is you get some exercise to go with the views. If you have already seen the main tourist attractions in Sydney and are looking for something else to do then I recommend this attraction

Stunning Views of the Bondi, the cliffs and the water. The white sands of Bondi Beach dotted with sunbathers, bordered by the emerald blue waters dotted with surfers is a great place to start or finish your walk along the cliffs. The vistas will have you thinking, "I think I have to move here and learn to surf." After walking to Bondi or Coogee, you will have the choice of taking a bus or taxi back...or walking...we chose to walk.

Stunning and great exersize. We walked from bondi beach to Gordon's bay and loved every minute of it. The. Jews were stunninGM we found ourselves taking pictures every ten minutes or so. It was great to see so many people running and staying fit in the trail, there were multiple public outdoor gyms allong the way to work out the rest of your body along the way. Plenty of public washrooms with toilet paper, and shops to buy water along the way. Highly reccomend!
Beautiful walk. Lovely seaside walk combining rugged coast and stunning beaches. A little stop at bronte for lunch. Can be done in 2 hours or longer if you dawdle, pretty easy going. Loved it!
great views!. it was a bit chilly, but we had great views of Bondi beach. the walk was not that difficult, kids could do it. it is a definite do again!
Awesome views. Easy hike on pavement from one bus stop on Bondi to another bus stop.The coastal views of the deep blue sea are inspiring.

Spectacular. Wonderful thing to do on a Sunday morning early which is when we did it. The views were amazing but also were the places you could sit and mediate or just contemplate. As the morning wore on it did bet a little busy and that did change the atmosphere a little. Depends what you like.

An exceptional way to experience Sydney. A great work along the iconic Sydney coastline...beautiful views, white beaches, blue ocean, surfers, walkers, joggers....its all on show and on a sunny day there's no better place to be or better way to enjoy Sydney....

Pity about the weather!. We were enjoying the walk - the Sculpture by the sea exhibition was a bonus - when it started to pour with rain! We got as far as Bronte but had to return - soaked. We had highlighted this walk as one that we would like to do whilst in Sydney - pity. Nice easy walk though.

a gem of sydney. i love this walk, its a grest stretch of coastline and a challenging run. it can get busy with tourists,walkers etc but that just shows how good it is. go early morning to have it all to yourself.
Bondi to Maroumbra beach walk. The view was amazing on a clear sunny day! I did it on my own so I walked all the way up till maroumbra.I would recommend it to everyboddyi
Excellent. Great walk, especially considering that it's in the heart of a major metropolitan suburbs. It takes some time, but it's definitely worth it.

Walk of a Lifetime!. Wear a hat and bring water! Even with some cloud cover, this walk is fairly exposed. We really loved exploring all the coves between Coogee and Bondi. What fun! We saw a blue toungue skink, many birds and of course the sandstone boulders lining the cliffs and beaches. This is an exquisite spot, not to be missed. To get there we took the bus from Bondi Junction to Coogee and walked up the coast. Then we had lunch at a fab Thai restaurant in Bondi and bussed back to our hotel. It took about half a day altogether, but we walk slowly to take all the views in.

A nice alternative to frying on the beach. This was a cool thing to do in Bondi, if you are not a surfer and not keen on sun bathing. Although it can be a bit hot; and dont forget - in Bondi you dont get tanned - you BURN... I enjoyed the up and down walk. Never managed to find the Aboriginal rock paintings but saw plenty of good graffiti
excellent walk. A great walk among Sydney's famous beaches. Put on good walking shoes and take a water bottle (there is plenty of drinking water stations along the walk)

Spectacular views of the Pacific Ocean. Enjoyed a relaxing walk from Bondi Beach to Coogee. Great to do it when Sculpture by the Sea is on. The Beach at Coogee has clean sand, and perfect for sunbathing.

Superb, Wonderful Vistas!. We were staying at Coogee Beach and walked along the path several times for part of the way, once to Clovelly Beach, twice to Waverly cemetery and once all the way to Bondi (where we had lunch) and then back.This coastal path is a gem, following the coastline it twists and turns around the many coves and beaches, up and down steps, always in sight and sound of surf. Approaching/departing Bondi you need to time one brief section at high tide between breaking waves. Sometimes on concrete paths, other times on timber walkways anchored above rocks, with every turn there is a vista demanding attention and photographs.Hats off to those that planned and built this wonder. And best of all it costs not one cent to enjoy it. BTW, the path continues from Coogee to Maroubra with an interesting section just south of Coogee on a wooden walkway over restored native wetland vegetation.
Sydney beaches. Great walk for seeing some of the famous beaches of Sydney. Stop for coffee at the Coogee Pavilion--it's way cool!

Amazing views. I went to Bondi beach while in vacation, and it looks just like the pictures you see on the internet! I think is really cool to have the beach in the middle of the city. Lots of restaurants along the coast. I love the fact that you can take the bus to get to the beach. I saw parking Areas for those who drove. Nice blue waters with lots to do. Would definitely go back again!
Seaside sculptures. Sculpures by the sea exhibition was great but very busy as lots of junior school pupils were also visiting
Great walk. Fantastic walk - especially when sculpture by the sea is on - great walk to do then have a nice breakfast

Nice views, comfortable walk for the fit. From Circular Quay take the 333 or 380 from stand E and come off at Bondi Junction on Campbell St. near Hall St. Have breakfast at Bills on Hall St. They have awesome service and good food. Beside them is the famous gelatissimo for the most famous ice cream in Sydney. Yum. We had this in the afternoon when we went back to bills for lunch.The walk from Bondi to Coogee was very good...the trail is well kept with bathroom stops and cafes along the way. It's best to swim at Bondi on the return leg as this is the better beach in my opinion. Coogee also looked do-able but who wants to walk 6km back wet and cold. The temperature on the walk gets from chilly to hot and back consistently an the water is around 17 - 20 degrees depending on the beach in the summer! Coming from Jamaica this is crazy cold beach water. Lol.. but felt good once you muster up the courage to go in...Though we didn't feel that this should be a number one attraction...and we can't say at this point what is... it is a must do...if only for the exercise and scenery.

Can't miss ocean walk. The Bondi to Bronte walk is the older section but if you have time walking on to Coogee is well worth the time. Its beautiful and you get to see what may be the cemetery with the best views anywhere, a lawn bowling club that makes you want to take up lawn bowling for the views and much great scenery.

great views shame the weather wasnt better!. Loved the views from the cliff tops steep climb but worth it!!Easy train ride from Kings Cross but strongly recommend catching the bus from bondi town centre to the beach as its a long walk!

Where to Start? Both ends have good views.. It's hard to choose where to start since both offer a good view of the coast. You have a number of coves and bays, not to mention the six beaches you'll pass along the way. Some people can't walk the entire length so you can choose to take a public transport half way. Although some parts are not fully developed, this walk offers a stunning view, a great walk and nice places to stop and have refreshments. Just leave nothing behind except foot prints.
Do It. Fantastic views and coastal terrain around every turn and corner. Ending up at the delightful Coogee bay and beach
Best part of my Sydney Trip. Great way to spend your day. Incredible views and both places have good options for restaurants and bars as well.

Easier than you think. Walked Coogee to Bondi. The pathway is excellent and far better than anticipated making the walk much easier than I would have thought, even on a hot sunny day. There is some uphill walking but that means you get to walk downhill as well. There is the opportunity to stop for refreshment if required while you admire the great views, especially the bizarre cemetery half way along the walk.
Must do!. Beautiful walk, enjoyable and scenery amazing, great restaurant at the hotel in Coogee to look forward to when you finish!
Great walk. Very popular so often very crowded between Bondi and Bronte. Be patient and carry water. Be kind to the environment.
Make the time. Awesome walk (especially if you go both ways). It's challenging at times in the heat so take water and your swimsuit...
friends visiting from San Fran. Gordon's Bay is absolutely stunning! A beautiful walk to do with anyone visiting.. We did a "beach hop" - the eastern beaches are truly majestic.

Great views. Great views but there are parts that can be challenging if you have a low level of fitness.Would take 45 - 60 minutes from Coogee to Bondi.One option is to walk only one way then get a taxi back.

Where the Blue meets the Green. Tourists, locals, swimmers, surfers, celebrity and Joe average all walk the walk and talk about it. Who wouldn't do it?I've even caught a glimpse of a breaching Southern Right whale. More people should be outside exercising (Vitamin D folks) and what more of an excuse do you need for a long afternoon walk along our wonderful coastline.Remember go past Bronte and walk the boardwalk in from of the cemetery - those residents have million dollar views!

Great walk, beautiful sights, loads of places to stop. This walk is incredible, you can extend the walk as much or as little as you like. Definitely start at Coogee and finish up in Bondi - if you fancy some food or drink. Loved it, will be doing it at least weekly.

Unique Views. Walk took 90 minutes one way Bondi to Coogee. Enough stairs and hills to make this a physical achievement even for a group with reasonable fitness. Wear your best walking shoes and choose a time of day where you won't cook in the sun. Unique view of coastline and small coves/ surf clubs/ concrete pools that you will only serif you do this walk. Next time in Sydney will try to run it in the early morning.

MUST DO!!!!. One of the most beautiful tour in Sydney and the best part, for free...The coast is amazing and thre´s a lot of people walking everyday... During summer time it`s the best time to do it, so you can stop in every single beach on the way like tamarama. It´s a must do!
The endless blue horizon. magical views of endless water. Great way to experience Sydney whether visitor or local while breathing in the fresh ocean air xxx
Stunning walk. This walk is beautiful. You can make it as long or short as you want. Their are quite a few steps so take comfy shoes. Lots of benches and places to stop for a coffee on the way.

One of Sydney's must do.. A very refreshing walk, with great views. Not too hard, either, so can be done with the kids. Just find the good pace. And if the kids (or yourself) get tired anyway, just drift away and stop by somewhere between, either on the rocks, a beach or a café. I try to do it at least once a week, and never get tired of it.
A must do coastal walk. Easy to get to and from with bus connections both ways. Amazing coastal views and well worth the effort. Take a picnic lunch and water bottle.

Yes, do it!!. Hell yeah, if you have a warm & sunny, do this walk! We took the bus from Darlinghurst to Coogee and walked it up to Bondi. This was recommended to us by a local b/c you'll end at Bondi beach and have the restaurants & neighborhood. Bondi is more happening than Coogee.We probably took a few hundred pictures. The water is beautiful and you will find yourself constantly stopping to take a picture.Took us a couple hours since we stopped so much to take pictures. You could motor through it in probably under an hour if you wanted, but, you'd be a moron not to soak in and appreciate the scenery.

Great for a walk at 6am. I woke up one morning due to yet lag at 4am and could not go back to sleep again.So I decided to go out for a walk and found myself again on the Costal walk and enjoyed a very chilled and cold but very relaxing walk around this amazing Australian landscape!I loved it!

Highlight of the trip. My friends and I did this walk on our first day in Sydney, and it remained one of the highlights of our trip! The views are stunning, and we all enjoyed strolling along the coast, watching the surfers tackle the waves, and dipping our toes into the ocean! Even in August, the weather was perfect! Easily one of our favorite experiences in Sydney!

I'd prefer Coogee to Bondi!. My first tip ir to do the opposite way: start in Coogee and finish in Bondi! The longest way from cit center is to Coogee, by bus. Then you walk with astonishing views, no matter if you are coming or going. Then, you stop and take your time on sandy Bondi beach, a lively neighborhood, with options of restaurants and stores. And wi-fi on the beach! It's not a very long trail - 6 km - but be prepared cause you'll find some ways up, some down and some stairs. But locals use it to run. The views are a reward. Coogee, Tamarama and, finally, Bondi!
Stunning view. the coastline was stunning and it is a lovely way to explore the area. if walking is not your preferred choice of transport, you can get the bus

Sensational coastal walk. Sydney is blessed with numerous coastal gems, but this walk is superlative. The view changes every few yards. New vistas continually open: rocks, beaches, coves, and waves. Also, it's a suprisingly easy walk. Finally, both ends of the walk are accessible by public transport. So, there's no excuse for missing out on this spectacular experience!

One of the best coastal walks ever!. I love the Bondi to Coogee walk. The views of the coastline are spectacular and the walk is suitable for all fitness levels. It's a must while in Sydney. Be sure to check out the Sculptures by the Sea exhibition if you visit in late October/early November.

Incredible. One of the best walks I have ever done. Stunning scenery. Lots of beaches to stop at along the way for a swim, something to eat, toilet stop etc. Easy gradients, suitable for nearly everyone. A must see/do whilst in Sydney.

What a walk to remember!. Once you have experienced all that Bondi Beach has to offer, walk off your lunch with a wonderful walk around the coastline to Coogee.There is also Sculptures by the Sea late in the year as well to view. This is a must do too! Enjoy!

Great walk with great views. I did this walk with my family after reading about it on trip advisor. To get here you could get a taxi (very expensive from the city) or tak e the cheaper option of a train to bondi junction and then change to a bus to bondi beach. The trains and buses run very regularly and it's easy to get to. The walk starts at the end of the beach in bondi you just follow that walking path all the way too coogee. Lovely views, stunning clifftop scenery, lost of amazing big mansions (must be a lot of rich people here in Sydney I think) and you also walk past some lovely little beaches. Make sure if you go that you take your camera! Recommended.

Good walk but very crowded. This is a very nice walk as you get to see nice beaches and nice coastal cliffs. The only negative point is that it is often crowded, not only with tourists but also with a lot of people that think that doing their run there is a good idea. You spend a good deal of your time trying to avoid other people especially in the weekends.
Beautiful. A fantastic walk, we walked from Coogee to Bondi taking in a few stops at the other great beaches on route. Worth doing and remember your camera.
Gorgeous ocean views and great beaches. If you like beaches and ocean views, this is a wonderful walk - especially in November when Sculpture by the Sea is on.
breathtaking view. so beautiful..sculpture by the sea event was going on when i was there..so many beautiful sculptures by the talented artists. the walk itself really breathtaking..

Beautiful, not too difficult, hike. Well marked paved trail with breathtaking ocean and rocky cliff views around every corner. Nice wild flowers, tree's, and overall sense of being surrounded by nature while being aware of civilization in close proximity. Easy to get to via the T-4 Subway to Bondi Junction and then a well market bus connection spot inside the subway terminal. Easy Return by well marked, close by bus stop to the Bondi Junction station from either Bronte Beach (If you get tired out from the occasional steps after 2.5 KM) or from Congee Beach after the full 6 KM hike. Overall a very nice experience.
very nice walk. the cost is very nice. many Surfers and other interesting People. the way goes up and down and you see from beaches to wash oout rocks alot of Special places

Sculptures by the sea. We did the walk while sculptures by the sea was on and it was just magnificent. Look around Bondi and the pavilion then did the walk. The views were spectacular and the sculptures added an extra bonus. The walk could be done at any time and it would still be stunning.
BONDI to Beach walk excellent. Great walking path and excellent views.. Would definitely put this one on my list of to do's and have some lunch while you are out.

A long walk. We were told it would take about 40 minutes; she was a tad worse for a bottle of vino though. Ha! it took at least 2 hours up and down stairs along the cliff edge. It was tiring but the views were fabulous. When we arrived at the cemetery I thought I may need to book a place. There are plenty of stops along the way for refreshments and we were pleased we did this 6k walk. Coogee is a lovely stretch of beach but personally I prefer the waves at Bondi.
Pleasant walk!. A pleasant walk from Bondi Beach to Coogee. The path is good, it goes up and down. Around every corner you get a new view!
great. Really enjoyed Bondi Beach and the walk.Beautiful area of Sydney with nice bars and restaurants.Got the bus to Watson's Bay and took the ferry back to the Quays
Nice stroll. Nice stroll along beautiful beach / ocean with great sculptures (the moment we've walked it). By public transport easy to reach. So popular that is was very crowded.

Nature's sculpture was best. Didn't think much of the Sculpture By The Sea, but was stunned by the amazing rock formations and prolific wild flowers along this beautiful walk. It got horribly crowded towards the end of the walk because of the Sculpture, so would advise to go early or late. Also got very very hot so don't forget to take a bottle of water because it's well worth doing. Or better still take your swimmers and have a plunge at the end. The walk is not difficult, though not possible for wheelchairs as far as we could see.

lovely views and a must do in Sydney. If you have the time I recommend this walk. Catch the train from the city (presuming you are staying in the city) then the bus to Bondi Beach. That's where the coastal wark starts just follow the signs at the end of the beach. You will walk past some lovely city beaches with heaps of people surfing and of course lots of pretty people everywhere you also walk past million dollar mansions of the rich and famous. A great thing to do to fill in some time on your holiday to Sydney
Don't wait for sculptures by the sea!. If you like urban seascapes, an easy walk that begins with lunch/drink at Bondi Life Savers then this is a MUST!

Spectacular views with great cafes at either end.. Best cafes are at Bronte beach. try to go on a week day to avoid the crowds. Look out for whales migrating in Spring and Autumn. Dolphins any time of year.
Beautiful. The walk was great but better to do the full length and get a taxi back to Bondi. beautiful little beaches and walk is not too difficult and very rewarding
Loved this!. Beautiful walk! Make a day of it. Lots of locals and tourists. Make sure you get in the water at each beach.

Must do it yourself trip. While you are sydney this is must do trek. It provides breathtaking views all across the 6 km, where you cross some of pristine beaches. You may plan it either ways from bondi to coogee or vice versa.

The most beautiful walks I have taken!. Not a usual thing to do by a lot of people, even I didnt do it during my first visit to Sydney, however this is a must do. The walk is literally across the sea through small beaches and also rock faces. Its through this beautiful cemetery. If you are tired then start from clovelly beach and continue to Bondi. Do not start from Bondi and go reverse, it will be a bummer when it gets over. Bondi becomes like this trophy where you can chill after the walk. Keep your swim wear, some food and a lot of time for this walk. There are beautiful beaches and rock pools on the way just to take a dip in.

Nice walk. VEry nice walk along the coast, nice beaches, very scenic. We went the other way around, ending in Bondi Beach. Did some snorkling on the way in one of the little bays. The area around Bondi beach is very scenic, loved it. Make sure you stop for a beer at the Iceberg.

Classic walk. At each end there is a pub as an incentive. But seriously, the walk is worth it. You can see Aboriginal etching's in the rock on the cliff face, Beautiful coastal beaches, swim with the fish. Nice walk
You have to see it!. It's really an eye catcher. On this walkway you can see why the sydneysider love their town so much. Every corner of the walkway offers a new look.

Pleasent walk. Probably nicer on a sunny day as it was overcast and windy when we walked this track, but we quite enjoyed it. lots of cute beaches, clifftop graveyard, lots of views. apparently popular for locals to jog to keep fit. If you give up part way round you can get a bus back to Bondi quite easily.

Easy walk great views. After reading some of the reviews we were a bit concerned that the walk would be too much on a hot day so we caught a taxi to Bronte to start (half way) walking to Bondi. We found it was a relatively easy walk, so long as you can manage a few stairs, with lots of places to rest and a good path. We were there quite quickly and I wished we had done the whole walk. Even though it was a hot and humid day there was a bit of a breeze so not too bad. Lots of walkers and joggers on the path on a saturday morning. A very scenic walk and highly recommended.

A must-see in Sydney. Put on your best trainers! This walk is fantastic,the view is breathtaking, you'll see the ocean non-stop for the next 2h. Quite a sportive walk, you'll see most locals go for a run every morning between Bronte and Bondi. Come early if you can!
So nice when the art exhibition was there. this is a thing to do, that's an easy walk, and it's beautiful ! I went there when pieces of art where exposed, and that was super cool to discover

Iconic Sydney Coastal Walk. This has to be one of the most scenic walks in Sydney. Have done this walk many times and it never disappoints. A walk that can be enjoyed by all age groups, but be aware that there are quite a few steps to negotiate along the route. So many photo opportunities on this walk that you will find it hard to decide where to take the next picture. Lots of lovely beaches along the route, Tamarara, Bronte and Clovelly to name a few. If you are in Sydney, make sure that you walk this walk as it is something you will never forget.

Spectacular cliffs. We walked from Bronte to Bondi - part of the walk- and it is a highlight of a Sydney trip. Sidling around the rocky coast, you experience the force of the Tasman sea and can look back at the sharp cliff faces that have been eroded by the sea. Lovely walkway and stairs go up and down and interesting Australian trees and vegetation. Tamarama beach is my favourite and we were there at the time of the sculpture festival. The end point Bondi is a large beach but great for sunbathing and people watching and a welcome cold beer! This walk should be part of any visit to Sydney.
Just beautiful!. A lovely relaxing walk, run or jog. Such amazing scenery, while enjoying some exercise. I do recommend that its done early in the morning before sunrise!...
Great walk. Views, exercise and interesting people en route. Has been improved over the years to accommodate most but with lots of steps you do need to be quite fit. Not suitable for pushchairs etc.

Great walk. Beautiful walk on a sunny day. Great views. Stopped at the Iceberg club for Lunch on the Balcony (take I.d. - I had a driving licence on me, to be allowed in, although you can fill in an electronic form when you arrive)

Enjoyable walk, worth doing. We walked the other way from Coogee to Bondi - both easily accessible by bus from central Sydney. The path meanders up and down round the coast (quite a few steps here and there) and takes in several beaches and settlements, so plenty of places a for a break or a swim if you fancy. Attractive views as you go and fine views across Bondi as you come into the bay. Easy walking all the way.

Amazing views, a must do. I know everyone says you have to do this walk. They aren't lying. Around each corner is another stunning view.It's not a hike, but wear sneakers. You can make it more challenging in parts. Also give yourself a fell 2+ hours, a little more than 1 hour to walk and time to relax and enjoy the sites.

Premier Coastal walk. Bondi beach midweek, so few people. The start easily accessible from the south end of Bondi beach, great coffee shops, down past the Bondi Icebergs pool and a great and energetic walk along the coastal cliffs (sometimes of year there are magnificent sculptures) usually a booming surf so that you feel the salt in the air, good coffee at Bronte and Tamarama, along a couple of streets and back to the coastline for the last few hundred metres along the curve of Coogee. Plenty of places for a swim

Great day out, at any pace. This is a beautiful iconic Sydney experience. My advice, start at Bondi Beach and walk round the gorgeous coastline to Coogee. Stop at Clovelly or Bronte for a swim if it's hot, and have lunch at one of the number of cafes at Coogee. Then, if you're keen for more, continue the walk on to Maroubra. Different coastline, less touristy, and after that good walk a beer at Maroubra will be really welcome.it follows the coast so it's mostly flat, so there are some stairs and couple of hills. Suitable for pretty much any age and ability.

Beautiful walk. I walked from Coogee Beach to Bondai Beach on a cloudy Saturday afternoon whilst visiting Sydney for work. I began my walk with lunch in Coogee, where there are quite a few restuarants to choose from.From there I headed north along the coastal walk towards Bondi. In total, I think I took around 2 hours to get to Bondi, but one could definitely do it quicker with less stops to take photos. Note that the walk does involve a lot of stairs and isn't really wheelchair, bike or stroller friendly. Bike and strollers are managable (I saw a lot of both), but you would be carrying both up some sections.I finished my walk at the Icebergs at the south end of Bondai. If you don't live in the immediate area, you can go into this member's club for free to have drinks. I stopped and drank a flat white over-looking the beach, which was a nice finish to my walk.I'd also recommend you go when the sun is out. I felt my experience was a bit muted by the lack of sunlight, which would have made the colours "pop" a lot more.I didn't find too many places to stop for coffee along the way, but apparently there are some. Also, importantly, there were quite a few toliets along the way...All in all, it was a nice way to spend Saturday afternoon and I'd gladly walk it again in better conditions.
Great views. If you haven't walked it, it's an iconic Sydney "must do".. Great views and a solid distance. Perfect.

In many respects, it's a prettier version of the Southern California Coast. It's hard to believe that this coastal walk is actually within Sydney. Just stunning, cliff walks hugging the ocean with deep blue and turquoise seas. The walk is for people in good shape as there are many long flights and stairs and steep grades along the walkway. But the views are worth getting sore legs.

A walk for all. during the whole year this is a great walk but two weeks in November makes it an absolute visit- Sculpture by the Sea is just incredible-- each will like some and question others but such an incredible experience
A must see for Sydneysiders and tourists alike!. Every time we have guests we recommend this walk - the views are amazing and you're greeted at the end by Coogee beach with her great waves and cafés!

I could do this walk everyday!. This walk is a packed full of scenery -- A stunning coastline, beautiful beaches, rocky cliffs, amazing homes, and a cemetery with a view to die for... Oh yes, than there's plenty of stairs spread out here and there, to work your knees overtime. Great for exercise, but not if you're a jogger... You'll be weaving in and around the mob of tourists and locals alike that dot this famous walk for much of the day-- Unless you come really early in the morning, or in the evening. The problem is this walk is very narrow in many sections -- Just 2 way traffic, and if you happen to be here for the annual Sculptures By The Sea in November, it's even more packed! However the scenery and the fresh ocean breeze make up for the walk's shortcomings. Every time I come here, it puts a smile on my face. Enough said.

Perfect walk near Sydney. Took the bus from Circular Quay to Coogee (about 50 mins) and then walked to Bondi along the coastal path. Beautiful beaches and scenery, proper pathway made easy walking, well signposted, no litter, lots of local people jogging and making the most of it, outdoor gyms being used and no graffiti. Top tip: if you get the bus back to town from Bondi then take something warm to wear even on a hot day as the aircon nearly froze us in our shorts and T shirts!

Lovely day, lovely walk, you have to do this..... We did this on a bracing early summer day in late november.It took us around 90 minutes without any food/drink stops and the whole route is on proper coastal paths and boardwalks. There were a few hilly steps sections.There were loads of friendly dog walkers and joggers out and we ended the walk at Icebergs at Bondi (which is right on the end of the walk as you reach Bondi).Really once thing to do.

Nice walk on a nice day. This was about a 3 hour walk for a fairly slow couple on a well paved path. We saw the nice beaches and some nice shoreline. It was fairly crowed on a Saturday morning but overall we were glad we did it. The bus service from Sydney was frequent and reasonable.

Breathtaking.... Bondi to Coogee walk is one of the most breathtaking experience. I've lived in Sydney for 19 yrs and discovered this wonderful walk recently. The view is beautiful, magnificent, breathtaking and it's free !!!

maybe don't do it the day after city2surf. lots of stairs & beautiful scenery - need your good legs on for this one. A few options for coffee & food along the way. Allow a few hours there & back - the turnaround coffee/lunch is a good idea. Take water with you.

Best coastal walk ever!. I live in Sydney but cannot go a month without doing the Bondi to Coogee coastal walk at least once a month. It is not a difficult walk, but does have a lot of stairs, which might not suit some people. There are quite a few little coffee shops to stop and rest of have something light to eat, so every one should be able to enjoy this. The Bondi Icebergs is a favourite stop for fish and chips as a reward afterwards.

Envigorating with a cool breeze.. A beautiful walk that can be accessed from Clovelly, Bronte andTamarama as well. Sculptures by the Sea is held annually and can be a lot of fun. Avoid on weekends if possible as it can get a bit crowded. A must do walk whilst in Sydney.

awesome. My wife and I come to Sydney as the first stop off for our honey moon. The Coastal walk was a nice escape of the tourist areas of the city center. Places to put off the path and enjoy the tidal pools, and walks along the oceans. A must do, a lot of locals almost no typical tourists.

Sculptures by the Sea. This is not the first time I have done this walk and every year it gets better.My one criticism would be the cost of the brochure for pensioners, no discount. More portable toilets would be good too.The walk is spectacular but I would advise you to go as early as possible because it does get busier the later it gets. Take a hat & sunscreen, lots of water as well as your camera. Parking is virtually non existent after Bronte so the bus is the best way to go.
Excellent walk. Do this walk often with family and friends.Excellent views and fresh sea breez.This will maintain you in good health

A must do !. Colourful scenery with the sound of powerfull waves against white cliffs...The more you walk, the better it gets!Water fountains all along the way, requires good shoes though if you want to go further.
Great Walk. Endless scenery and photo opportunities for photography buffs. It was also a very easy walk that almost anyone can do. It was a great way to see all the beaches in the area.

Something I never get tired of doing. As a Sydneysider I have done this walk many, many times in all sorts of weather, by myself, with others, with and without my dog. It is one of Sydney's great gifts to its locals and visitors. It never fails to impress and inspire. You can start at many different points and continue on past Coogee where it is quieter as most people tend to stop once they get to Coogee Beach. My favourite spot is Gordons Bay where the the deep turquoise colour of the water is magical. It can often get busy especially on the weekend or in good weather - so my suggestion would be to go early or later and on a weekday if possible. And please don't not go if the weather is not great as this if often the best time to view the atmospherics and the drama of the ocean, the sky and the cliffs. There are so many places to go in for a dip and to stop, rest and have a coffee. There are steps in places so the whole walk is not very accessible for wheelchair-bound people so this is disappointing. However, there are sections of it that would be most accessible for those people. Definitely one of my favourite spots and believe me there are many to choose from!

Not very long, but nice and peaceful, nobody else seemed to be walking. The path is easy to follow. Take water with you!. I did run across a topless woman playing in the surf, that was nice! I also looked for the ancient drawings, but they are very subtle and hard to see.

nature at its best........magic. Start your walk from Coogee to Bondi so as you are not walking up the steps along the way. A beautiful walk either early morning or late evening. Good coffee shops before or after the walk. Sun hat and cream as there is no shade as you walk.

A perfect morning!. Visiting from the US to see our daughter, she planned the perfect Saturday morning. Breakfast at Bill's, yes the ricotta pancakes are awesome, then a walk down to Bondi Beach. Our group (about 9, ages 26 - 60) began the walk to Coogee. We planned a one-way walk with a bus ride back to the train station. It turned out to be the perfect plan.I think its about a 6K walk, up and down the bluffs of the coasts, and the overcast day did not spoil the magnificent views around each corner. Easy to talk and walk, plenty of water and other refreshments along the way as well as restrooms. Arriving at Coogee, we stopped in at the pavilion and were surprised to find an amazing restaurant, bar and other things as well. I think we spent as much time at the pavilion as we did on the walk. The morning walk turned into a day on the coast and we were glad we did not plan to walk back.Highly recommend this attraction!
beautiful. nice and easy walk, you can see the whole beach, and its wonderful, the view is amazing and you can walk along the rocks as well
Great walk. Amazing walk, stunning views, great places to sit & relax along the way. So much to see aside from the beautiful beaches - cemetery is pretty cool as are some of the rock formations. Go.

Spectacular coastline views in the best city in the world. This walk takes you along the rocky coastline between Bondi and Coogee. The views are spectacular. It can sometimes get very busy but still worth a visit. Particularly good during Sculptures of the Sea festival. I never get sick of this walk.

Fantastic views. The Bondi to Coogee Beach coastal walk is a must when visiting Sydney (especially when visiting Bondi). The views on offer are incredible. Don't forget to bring sunscreen. If you're walking around midday you can get very easily sunburnt. Make sure to bring plenty of water, and a camera (although your phone probably already has a decent one!). It's also very easy to get to. Simply catch a Bondi Beach bus from the city or Bondi Junction. Recommended.

Sculpture by the sea. Get the best out of the fabulous coastal walk by timing it with the annual sculpture by the sea exhibition. Miss the masses of school children by starting the walk around 3pm and finish back at Bondi with early dinner at one of the many seaside cafes

Cliffs and Coves. This is a lovely walk on the Sydney coastline and something that many visitors do not do.Preferably choose a warm, sunny day but it has it's attractions in any weather.If you can,time it to take in Sculptures by the Sea in November.

Best coastal walk in Sydney. This an outstanding coastal walk, terrific views, it can be tiring, we found a great half way stop-off point for coffee or lunch was Seasalt Café Clovelly. Very good service and food. The cold beer was very enjoyable. Even managed to see a pod of dolfins playing just outside the Clovelly pool.The locals told us they also see whales in their seasonal pilgrimage up and down the coast.

Scenic coastal walk. This popular walk is used by hundreds of runners, walkers, tourists and just about anyone who loves the fresh air and sea. The path starts or finiashes depending on your location and destination, at Bondi Beach where you can stroll along the esplanade taking in the golden sand and rolling surf of the beach front.The pathway leads you south up on to the sandstone foreshore where it weaves and climbs the wind eroded cliffs. Some of the steps are steep and not good for the elderly and disabled person. There are short sections that can be accessed from McKenzie's Cove or Bronte Beach without the steps. If you have the time to walk all the way to Coogee Beach there are many restaurants, cafe's and bars to rest and have lunch. Bondi Beach is one the the most famous beaches in the world, unspoilt and informal in setting, it is almost unchanged for the last fifty years I have been gong there. If you are there in November you can enjoy the Sculptures by the Sea for free. In spring there is the festival of the wind with kite flying, and other interesting events.

Spectacular View. Walk along Bondi beach to Coogee beach is the most beautiful experience in Sydney. It takes 2.5 hours on way. Better walk from Coogee to Bondi in the afternoon and from Bondi to Coogee in the morning. I strongly recommend if you have time.

Sculptures by the sea. Great walk to take overseas visitors on as long as they are fit and can walk for overran hour and a half. You pass many beautiful beaches with cafes along the way. It is not an easy walk up and down hills and a we stairs but for the fairly fit person it is certainly worth doing especially when sculptures by the sea is on, although more crowded at this time. A must do thing for visitors to Sydney.

Fantastic experience for locals and travellers. I am a Sydney local and this walk NEVER fails to take my breath away. You can enjoy it whether you're young or old, local or traveller. Be aware if you are walking with a toddler that you cannot do it with a pram - lots and lots of steps. Hidden gems along the way are the Bali bombing memorial site at Coogee, and the cliff top view at South Bondi. Both magical spots. Also be aware that if it is a Saturday or Sunday, it is quite packed, especially with impatient runners, so best to do it on a weekday if you have a choice. The views are just spectacular. Good outing for solo, partners, family, or friends. Sydney at it's best!

A magnificent coastal walk and more. As a long-time 'Sydneysider', every able-bodied tourist who has heard about, and wants to visit, our famous Bondi Beach should make time to do the Bondi to Cooge walk. As others have quoted, you will need about 3 hours round trip, and time out for a good cup of Barista pulled coffee, with a local version of an 'all-day breakfast' menu. That's where I take my overseas guests, if they are here on a weekend in our Summer (October to April). It also coincides with our 'Daylight Saving time' when sea breeze can be very refreshing, morning or late afternoon.Along the way you will enjoy magnificent Ocean views and delight in watching the many surfers on the smaller beaches - particularly Tamarama Beach or Bronte Beach. Obviously the preferred times are in Summer, however even during our Winter months the surf is up, the sky is blue and the sun still shines. Come on, put on your best walking gear and enjoy the walk - jogging is allowed, at your own pace! You'll just have to watch out for the slow tourists and the locals enjoying the view, with a freshly brewed cup of coffee.

Perfect Sydney Coastal walk. Don your trainers, grab a jacket and head for Bondi. Watch where you park - the rangers are red hot- and start your walk at the famous Bondi Icebergs. It's beautiful, exhilarating, interesting and busy. You pass Tamarama beach, watch the surfers and if you pick the right time of year will be entertained by Sculptures on the Sea- a fab annual exhibition of quirky sculptures which make a special outing. At Coogee you can eat/drink or just relax. After returning to Bondi get a very reasonable meal at the Icebergs club (below Icebergs restaurant ). It's a fraction of the price of its swanky neighbour and offers the same view! Great day out
views. Best walk ever views are spectacular food on the way great experience very relaxing if you take your time

Love this walk. This is a great walk to do.Starting at Bondi beach,you make your way around to Tamarama,where you can stop for a swim,or a coffee.As you come around to Bronte,you can sit in the park,have lunch at one of the cafes,take a swim at the beach.....Then you can make your way through the cemetery with the best location,before taking a swim at Clovelly,and then heading around Gordon's Bay,over to Coogee.There's so many great places to sit and contemplate life.Even on a bad weather day,being by the ocean is fun.If you want a safe swim,usually Coogee is a good bet,or Clovelly.There's cafes and surf clubs at each spot,and plenty of places to rest along the way,as it is a good long walk if you do it all at once.

Fantastic walk great views. We did this walk for the first time and loved it . The views are fantastic , it is easy in two hours , and there are plenty of chances for coffee stops on the way.Tip - the bus from circular quay is 333 or 380 , and the bus back from Coogee is 373 or 374 - all are every 10 minutes or so Enjoy!

Magic. Starting with breakfast at Bondi. Plenty of great little cafes but we chose Bills at Bondi delicious. We walked from Bondi to Coogee and enjoyed Sculptures By The Sea. Normally the walk would take us a very leisurely 2 1/2 - 3 hours (hat sunscreen water camera [lightweight showerproof jacket in winter] a must). But this time a meandering look at the sculptures made the experience longer but no less enjoyable. We decided to lunch at Coogee fish and chips on the grass overlooking the beach. A great day, family friendly, spectacular scenes at every turn. Sydney is such a jewel.

The Edge of Australia. This amazing walk can easily be completed by young and old alike, it features some of the best views on the East Coast of Australia. The scenery is breathtaking and on many occasions during the year you will see the migrating whales, which is an added bonus.On either end of your walk you can take in beautiful beaches with great places to each and take in the local sites.Whether a local or a tourist this walk will be one to be remembered.
Enjoy the Walk!. It is well fenced and not much of steep paths to climb, and you can walk at your own pace. It is very popular when the Sculpture by the Sea is on.

Bresthtaking. If you love a walk in the great outdoors this one will absolutely blow you awayIt can be broken into sections and the path is very safeYou can stop and have a coffee or a swim as you take in the best coastal views on the south side of the harbourRestaurants are abundant offering great food and beverages Don your hat and blackout and enjoy a great day outLeave your car at the start and bus or taxi it back at the end of the day

Breathtaking. If your Chi (Energy) has been blocked by by concrete and urban cluster living then this walk is for you.A decent distance for all ages yet won't leave you tired as every step of ocean air and sites will leave you feeling energized.

Great day out on a beautiful day!. My husband and I started at Coogee and walked to Bondi. Someone told me its an easy walk and I would say its a moderate walk takes about 2hrs plus depending on how many times you stop to take in the breath taking views.There are plenty of cafes you can stop at along the way. The walk has steps, hills, road walking it is all in good condition but takes all day to go there and back. We loved it, however the day we did it (Sunday 23/11/14) it was a very hot day and had a weird fog hanging around interrupting some of the views at times, although naturally beautiful in its own right. We got to the end and could not see the view of Bondi through the fog. We didn't go right to the end to go to Bondi Beach as we wanted to get back to Coogee Pavillion for lunch. Definately worth putting on your bucket list of things to do in Australia. We also swam on the way back at Clovelly which has alot of history but its like you are swimming at the barrier reef.

Good for the Soul. I often walk this path in sections as I live there! It truly is a worthwhile trek with spectacular scenery in all types of weather. There are buses available at Bondi/Bronte and Coogee if you did not want to take the whole walk........which by the extends further south to Maroubra.Plenty of cafes and restaurants at Bondi and Coogee with less at Bronte and a small one at Tamarama (between Bondi and Bronte). There are steps naturally as the path hugs the coast.Take a bottle of water and wear good walking shoes. Remember your camera and have a swim along the way - the surf can be dangerous so BATHE BETWEEN THE FLAGS always and check the beach is open first and patrolled by our wonderful lifesavers many of whom are volunteers.It will be a day you will always remember and will certainly lift your spirits for your travels ahead.
Fitness & Fun in the Sun. Great place to go for a walk, we usually take out dog as well, we usually start a clovelly where there is plenty of parking.

Way to Herald Springtime!. We set out on a bright Sunday morning to walk from Bondi to Coogee Beach and return - along with many other people! Very very easy walk as long as the weather isn't too hot. For those who may not enjoy the summer months I would suggest a walk in springtime!

Beautiful views a must do in Sydney. I did this walk with a group of friends on my recent holiday to Australia based on reviews I read of it on trip advisor. I'm definitely glad I did this walk the views were wonderful, you will see beautiful coastline, cliff faces, beaches and of course multi million dollar homes of I am guessing the rich and/or famous of Sydney. As a benefit you get some fitness while on holidays hahaha! Please note that to get here you must either catch a taxi (can be expensive) or do what I did and get a train from the central train stop in the city to a place called bondi junction then from there you can catch any number of buses to bondi beach where the walk begins. Definitely recommend and best thing is that it is free!!!

Great Walk with Stunning Views. This is a fantastic walk encompassing a few great Sydney beaches, some lovely views and a few different gradients. It is about 6 km in length but can take you anything from an hour upwards depending on how long you stop. If it's your first time i recommend taking a picnic at stopping at Tamarama on the way - it's great to take in everything at a leisurely pace. I enjoying running this route and there are a few 'outside gyms' on route to bump out your workout. Beware though this route gets very busy in summer and on weekends - I love going for an early morning weekday run when there are few people. It really can be difficult to navigate at peak times. There are plenty of great places in Coogee to eat and drink after, i love the Coogee Bay Hotel and some of the smaller cafe's further from the beach.You can get a bus back to the city fairly easily from just next to the beach. The 'M' express buses are great and one goes through Newtown which makes a great stop off if you have never been and want to explore.Enjoy! :)

A stunning walk. This is a stunning walk around the coast, with beaches, cliffs, waves, surfers, blue water, yellow soft sand, and little cafes and restaurants to stop at before, during and after for a drink, coffee or a bite, or a cold beer or a glass of wine.catch the bus to South Bondi, have a coffee or have a meal overlooking the beach at the Iceburgs restaurant. Walk around the stunning cliffs, pst little bays and great views to Tamarama Beach, have a quick swim or a coffee or drink then continue on to Bronte Beach. If you missed a swim/drink at Tamarama, then take your pick here at many cafes and little restaurants full of the locals. Either finish here and get the bus back to the city or continue on to Coogee beach passing the old and interesting Waverley Cemetry and again the views are amazing.If you are there in October then the sculpture by the sea is a must. It is one of the most spectacular venues for the fascinating and beautiful sculptures with a background of blue sky and water, with some of them covering Tamarama Beach. A photo opportunity at every turn. On a lovely sunny Sydney day, whether it be early morning, throughout the day or late afternoon, this is the place to be and not to be missed.

Must be on your Top 5 things to do in Sydney List. Stunning walk along some of the world's best suburban beach coastline. Enter from any suburb, exit from any path, though try to do the whole walk. The best coastline is between Tamarama and Bronte. Walk, run or meander ... lots to see and do. Many water taps as well.
Spectacular walk. some of the best views on the coast, moderate fitness required as some stairs. Do it during the week to avoid the crowds

Beautiful scenery. Recommend to all. Pub stops throughout the journey are also a good add on if time allows - Clovelly Hotel being my personal favourite, then to end the trip with a reward beer at Icebergs in Bondi. IF warm enough we have swum in the old baths towards the Coogee end of the walk. Very nice.

Great scenery - excellent walk track. On a beautiful day this was just a delight to walk along the coastal track taking in the scenery, and fresh sea air. I also got to see Sculptures by the Sea at the same time so was enthralled.

Coastal views galore. this walk is perfect for out of town visitors or to just rediscover our own beautiful city and surrounds. Parts are steep with steps so not ideal for elderly/infirm or those with strollers. Suggest doing the walk on a weekday when there are less people using it as it is very congested on weekends. Our dogs love the walk too, though again the steps are a challenge for our elderly dog now. take a book and a camera so you can stop and enjoy at one of many vantage spots along the way.

A great way to spend a day in Sydney. We did this walk in early November when Sculptures by the Sea was in progress. Very crowded but very interesting. The scenery is just fabulous. We stopped halfway at the a Clovelly Pub for lunch. It has an extensive menu but no view unfortunately. The Clovelly Bowling Club sits on top of the cliff top with great views but typical club food. End up at the Coogee Bay Pub. Another good walk with great views is from Bondi to Watsons Bay however it involves quite a bit of on road walking.

Go Coogee to Bondi. As a local I take this walk when we take visitors out for the day. It's easy to get to Coogee and parking is better (or take a bus). The walk is superb with great views of bays, cliffs and the sea. There is plenty of public drinking fountains along the route. It is well sign posted and impossible to get lost. At the end sit down and relax and have lunch at one of the many great restaurants overlooking the sea and the beach (there is a road in the way though).
Take My Breath Away. hard to beat this walk for a breath of fresh air and spotting of sea life - no to mention the landlubbers enroute .

Breathtaking!. This is a must-do for all visitors to Sydney. You can stop and have a swim along the way and grab a cool drink or bite to eat at a beach café. See breathtaking views of some of Sydney's most spectacular and picturesque beaches. This walk is famous for the Sculpture by the Sea annual event in Sydney where crowds flock to Bondi Beach and surrounds to walk this path and view amazing art and sculptures. This occurs in November each year. It's hard to believe you are in such a large city as Sydney, when you are taking this walk.

A must do in Sydney. This is an easy walk with fantastic views the entire way. A great activity at any time of the day although early morning is best in summer before the midday heat. Stop off for a swim in Gordon's Bay or at Bronte Beach and refuel at the Tamarama Cafe right on the beach.

Spectacular. If you were to do one thing whilst in Sydney this iconic walk should be it, the views are breathtaking and you wil get to see 4 of Sydney's best beaches along the way. Bookend your walk with some great cafes at either end and you will leave happy.

What's not to like?. With the sea with you all the way - beside you, in front and behind you - and the sound of waves crashing and water gurgling around you this walk takes you to another world. Most of it is easily managed and not too strenuous. You can stop and or resume your walk at Tamarama and couple of other places along the way if you can't manage the whole length at one time.My only complaint is that the walk is not friendly for disabled visitors. There are some very steep steps in places so you you need to be reasonably able to do this walk. This is a pity because wheelchair or less mobile visitors should be able to enjoy the unique sights, sounds and smells of this stunning walk.

bondi to coogee walk. I have done this walk a number of times - but my last walk was on a cool, overcast day with dark clouds forming - superb!!! The atmosphere was amazing & the sound of the crashing waves wonderful - although a nice sunny day with blue skies & clear water is great I found the overcast day so atmospheric & electric.Don't be put off by the weather.
beautiful walk. I had a relax walk with my family last weekend there. The view was stunning and I could feel the sea breeze so refresh my mind!!

a walk with everything, strange shaped rocks, blue sea and culture. I would say if someone comes to Sydney for a visit for just several days, take this walk would give him or her a good idea on the beauty of Sydney beaches. There are lots of colorful and strange shaped rocks along the blue ocean. Walking on this track, you will see those several millions houses looking down at the blue water, an old cemetery with gravy stones and beautiful sculptures showing the love and sorrow from beloved people, beautiful native flowers and trees along the cliffs, and some restaurants and cafes just next to the beach. Definitely a nice place to go to.
Spectacular. Amazing views. Bring your swimmers so that you can have a swim at all the amazing spots along the way!

Beautiful views, beautiful people. Amazing walking track, set amongst the beautiful people of Sydney.Swimming, walking, child friendly, and you pass the beautiful beaches of Tamarama and Bronte. Definitely one of the nicest parts of Sydney.

great walk with an amzing vista. we do various parts of the walk whenever we can with the family. The walk is fairly easy for all levels of fitness and the view is incredible. One of Sydney's best attractions with a swim whenever you get too hot. Best of all, its 100% free.
Nice wsceic walk. Was a nice walk along the coast. Woukdn't day it's a must see but its a lovely walk. Gets crowded though.Bondi is nice enough beach. Nothing special though
Nature pure. If you want to enjoy the costal line of sydney without only going to one beach this walk is the perfect thing to do

Beautiful views - somewhat physically demanding. The views were spectacular and the trail diverse. You pass many beaches, each being unique to the one before. This is not a walk for anyone that is having difficulty walking or even a stroller. Prepare yourself for both uphill and down, at times strong winds, and lots of other people on the trail. Don't forget your camera as the scenery is spectacular. Many of the beaches have places to purchase a lunch, snack, or drink so you can take a break and just enjoy. Allow yourself at least 1.5 - 2 hours to do the hike to Coogee (and another 1.5 to return) so you can enjoy all the trail has to offer. No gym required after this hike.

Very enjoyable. We took the walk from Bondi to Coogee just as they were cleaning up the sculptures exhibit so managed to see a few, lovely walk with some great views.Took us about 2.5hrs, nice change of pace from the City.

An afternoon well spent. My friend and I spent a good 2 hours at Bondi and set off on the Bondi - Coogee trail. It's breathtakingly stunning and definitely one of the must dos in Sydney. Spend a good 3 hours on this walk as it compels you to take photos at every bend and every cliff. It's absolutely beautiful and the Waverly burial grounds (which you will see in the course of your walk) struck me as a wonder - it's huge and is beautifully located. If you are taking this walk in the summer, DO NOT forget your sunscreen, hat, sunglasses and all the other requisite summer gear. Have a great time!

Wonderful senic walk with no bikes. Because there are quite a few steps there were no bike riders which was great as they tend to come up behind me and give me a start Wonderful ocean views We went on a sunny day so was a little hot but you can jump in the water at a few places and cool offWe parked at Coogee walked to Bondi and caught the bus back As we are avid walkers but not as fit as we used to be so I was happy it was a gentle walk with a few challenging sections and not too long

Pleasent and relaxing. If you are at Bondi Beach, try and put one hour a side and walk to Coogee via The coastal walk, the view of the ocean from the cliffs is breathtaking. As good as I have seen any where in the world
A great way to spend an afternoon. This walk is fairly easy and flatish and is certainly worth the 3 hours or more it takes (at a leisurely pace).
Amazing views. I lived in Clovelly Bay for 6 months back in 1990 and have never forgotten this wonderful walk with it's amazing views and breathtaking terrain
Scenic Walk. Nice place for a weekend walk and to take photos with friends or family :) as it is very natural sightseeing activity located in an urban area

Great Visit. We are lucky enough to live within walking distance of this walk and love bringing visitors when they come to Sydney. It is a must do for those capable of walking and is an easy fairly level walk and you don't have to do the whole length if you don't want to. There are some stairs (about 15) towards the middle). The views all along the coastal walk are fantastic and we have seen dolphins and whales from time to time. During part of September/October you can see the sculptures along the walk which is a different experience every year from the great works of art to the not so great but beauty is in the eye of the beholder.
nice beach. the water and the waves was very good. The walk is very busy, so it is best to do it in the morning, where there is not so many people.
What a view. We enjoyed this walk and enjoyed lunch at a French cafe before returning. We were able to see whales jumping along the coast on our trip back to Bondi.

Energetic walk without being too exhausting!. I was lucky enough to be there to see the annual outdoor sculpture exhibition. Huge collection of very varied creations. Downside was that I wasn't the only person to know about it so it was pretty busy!
Sculptures by the sea. A great healthy walk with spectacular views & great art work. Unique. Well loved & much visited in Sydney. Free & fun.
NICE WALK. And amazing walk, natural and close to the city !2h30 to do the walk, crossing nice beaches like tamarama and bronte (my favorite)
Bondi - Coogee. One of the things to do list if you are in Sydney. Try to visit this place on summer! Beautiful view from one beach to another beach.
Beautiful. If you want to see how Sydney is beautiful. Bondi view is amazing and I love Tamarama and Bronte. Coogee is nice too but not my favorite.

Great coastal walk. It reminded me the Great Ocean Road, I just needed to walk instead of driving this time :) I was there for the Sculpture by the sea, memorable experience to see those creative artworks done by amazing people.

Great walk around beatifull beaches. Great way to go out of the city centre and visit several beaches at the same time. Take a taxi to bondi beach and start walking or jogging next to the coastline. Really nice
The Bondi way!. Done this walk a good few times- excellent vistas and great beaches to stop off at along the way.Sydney must-do!

Must do! Spectacular walk and views!. Must do! Light walk around the beach and costal walk with breathtaking views! Absolutely loved! Wish we wouldve had more time to walk further but we had to drive to the airport. Definitely make this a priority!

Gorgeous Scenic Walk. I've done this walk twice during my 2 weeks here in Sydney... once was during the annual Sculpture By the Sea exhibit along the path, and the other was a few days ago on a rainy day. First of all- this is a beautiful walk. Nothing beats the fresh air, scenic overlooks, and being able to explore several beaches along one path. I haven't gone on a weekend, but I imagine it would be pretty crowded, as the trail isn't terribly wide in some areas. Bring your swimmers along and some snacks, as a lot of restaurants are closed after 5pm on/near the smaller beaches. There are a few points along the trail where you can refill your water bottle, which was a life saver! Overall, a beautiful walk and FREE, which is super rare in Sydney. Go on an overcast day- the views are still beautiful and it's not as crowded. :)

Breathtakingly beautiful . I've done the whole coastal walk from bondi to coogee by myself during the sculpture by the sea exhibition season. I was not disappointed and it is an experience that will last a life time. It is simply amazing coastal scenery one after another, will come back with my boyfriend for a romantic stroll if I ever return to aussie land
Breathtaking!. I understood this word in its true entirety when we walked from Bondi to Coogee. The views around each corner were simply breath taking.
Make sure to do it. One of the must-dos on a Sydney trip - and even a must-do for locals once a year on a spare Sunday. Coogee to Bondi to the best route - make parking easier as well
Busy but rewarding. I don't think much of the refreshment venues at either end but at Clovelly Beach there are some great cafes and superb fish and chip shop

Beautiful Walk. Well worth the 7KM each way, Beautiful views & not too steep and not too many steps. Make sure you take a drink but there are quite a few spots on the way where you can top up a water bottle.
Sculptures by the sea. Very busy because of the sculptures, but awesome walk. Go on the weekend and you can catch the markets at the same time.

Amazing walk. Almost 1 and a half hour walking, it's amazing you can see all the beaches that are in the middle of bondi to coogee, there is also a water fountain so you refull your bottle for free. you see a lot of views and I f you like to photos, this it's a great option.

Excellent views. We did this on a overcast day however the views along the coastline are spectacular and best of all it's free! It took about an 90 minutes to do and there are plenty of places to stop off en-route to get refreshments. Well worth doing
Nice walk. Nice coast, the beginning of the track is little overcrowded on sunny days.There are some modern arts on the path.
"Magnificent". A beautiful walk from Coogee to Bondi (and return !!). Stunning scenery all the way and a good cardio workout too.A must to do if visiting either place.

Beautiful any time of year. I live in Bondi so I have the privilege to walk from Bondi to Coogee any time. It's the best stress relief. And so beautiful. And for free. You don't need anyone with you. Just you and the nature. Me and partner do from time to time Bondi to Bronte run. Always takes my breath away.

Incredible views. Bondi and coogee are two of my favourite places in sydney, combined with breathtaking views along the coastal walk, this is one of the best things you can do in sydney. It can be a bit challenging at times but it is definitely worth it. The best thing about it is not having to do it as part of a tour group, you can just take it at your own pace and not have to worry about anything else. There are also a few nice places to eat along the way but it's better to wait until you get to coogee for more choice and higher quality restaurants.

Beautiful and free!!. This is one of the top things to do in Sydney and I have done it every time I have visited the city (3 times). The scenery is beautiful and you can stop at each beach along the way for a swim in the sea or a dip in the pools. I would recommend walking from Bondi to Coogee (rather than the other way around) as Coogee is a nicer beach to spend the rest of the day on / have lunch on.

A 'must do' short walk & eats along the way. An excellent way to see Sydney life by combining the ferry to Bondi, an easy walk with spectacular ocean views and several places to stop for Sydney cafe culture. My only criticism is the ferry/buses and the walk are busy at weekends in summer. In summer, try to do it midweek. Of course you can do it in either direction, but Cooggee is probably a better beach to end at if you want to finish with a swim/sunbathe. Buses back to Sydney are frequent.

Best Beach Ever!. We took a day trip to Bondi while in Sydney! We won't regret that decision ever! It's just a short and fun ferry ride then a quick hop on the city bus to the fab stores and restaurants. Don't miss Bondi Iceburg Club. Great food and atmosphere.
Spectacular and testing. Just do it! A nice walk to get the blood flowing and to take in the views at the same time. Some nice stopping off places on the way.

Sculptures + gelato = seaside bliss!. We bused from Sydney to Coogee, spent some time swimming then walked to Bondi. It was "sculptures by the sea" season - amazing! The Sculptures only start at Tamarama, so the first bit of our walk was just enjoying the views: but the seaside path is breathtaking at every turn! It is a long walk, so if you're not up to it then I would recommend just doing Tamarama-Bondi, but we found Coogee to be nicer to swim/body surf at as it is less "touristy", so much quieter and our bags were safe!

Lovely Views, Beautiful Weather. I did this walk recently along with a friend and had a lot of fun. The weather in Nov is really good as summers are approaching.Then the views along the way are really pretty - blue skies, puffy clouds, bright blue sea, gusts of wind, waves crashing against rocks, some cafes along the way.We even stopped at one these cafes and had nice big glass of fresh juice in the sun :)It's a great to-do while in Bondi!

A total must if you are visiting Sydney and the weather is good.. This is a lovely way to spend an afternoon. Just walk along the coast, stop at any of the beaches along the way for a sit down or an ice cream and just enjoying ambling along beside the sea!
annette and pat. didnt like the heat the day we visited it was 40 there it was cooler in sydney .had a good time there but did like heat

Sculptures by the sea. This is simply a wonderful idea combined with a spectacular walk along a lovely piece of coastline. The 2014 display finished in early November, but I believe it's annual ,,, so go in 2015!

beach. it is beautiful long beach and it has all the facilities for the people visiting the beach. the lifeguards are there at times when one can swim in the waters at the beach. there is specific area and time for the swimming in the beach area. one can play beach games. people come here on picnic, running and exercising, swimming and sunbathing etc.

Breathtaking - both in view and level of fitness.. A lovely couple of hours walking drinking in the views and reading the history on plaques along the way. The entire walk, I would recommend for the fit and healthy as there are a lot of stairs coupled with inclines and declines along the way. Definitely more than ample photo opportunities along the way. Recommendation - if you're fit do the whole walk (we did there and back), early morning is great before it gets too sunny or too windy, wear plenty of sunscreen and take a water bottle with you, you can refil it along the way. There are a couple of cafe opportunities along the way if that's your thing. If your fitness isn't up for it, go along as far as you can it really is worth a couple of photos.

The best things in life are free. A great walk in beautiful coastal scenery. Suitable for all ages. If you get tired on the way take a stop at one of the many beaches on the way. It was a bit crowded at times, but I guess it depends on day of week/time of day.

Spectacular!!!!!. we did the walk in a couple of hours , stopping along the way to marvel at the scenery. There are areas of the walk that can be challenging if you have any kind of physical liability . Bring your camera, sunscreen , and a hat .........and enjoy !
My favorite Bondi walk. Always do this walk when in Sydney. Beautiful views and not too difficult for those who are very fit. But be warned - bring the sun screen!! Not much shade cover at all.

Lovely walk by the sea. Busy walk at the beginning because of the crowds viewing the " sculptures by the sea "which were spectacular ,got quieter as we neared Bronte and a lovely pleasant stroll into Coogee

Great but more steps than we thought.. This is a briliant way to see something different in Sydney. We walked from Bronte to Bondi but reached Bondi too soon so decided to do Bronte to Coogee the next day. This part had more steps and greater incline than we thought and were happy to see Coogee (which was great). The walk was very interesting with briliant views.

Spectacular!. If you're in Sydney and you have the time to do this walk, then put it on your 'to do' list. Its a beautiful coastal walk that has breath-taking views and a few nice coffee bars along the way. It costs nothing to do - and it will give you happy memories of Sydney. A nice alternative to the hustle bustle of normal Bondi life.

What a view!. When you're walking alongside such a beautiful and iconic coastline how could life be bad? If you get tired along the way you can stop off at Bronte Beach for a coffee and rest then it's back to the mission of getting to Coogee. Yes, you have to contend with the joggers that use the same path but somehow it works, and it's worked for years. Take your time and enjoy the view.

Well worth it. A beautiful walk where you can stop off at plenty of little beaches. We took some drinks and food with us and it was the perfect way to spend a day. I don't exercise (at all) and I didn't struggle one bit.
