lovely view. we took the whole walk from bondi to coogee which was gr8 .we spent the whole day at the different beach and had lunch and tea there and even rested near the park area.saw dolphins

Enjoyable walk with pleasant views. We enjoyed this coastal walk. It was easy underfoot (a footpath) with a few steps and hills. The sea and beach views were lovely.Although this is a pleasant thing to do while in Sydney, and is free, we don't think it deserves to be the no. 1 attraction.

Don't miss this place. I didn't do the whole Bondi to Coogee walk, but I was really glad I took the day off from Sydney CBD to see this area. It really is a beautiful place to spend a Saturday. The sights are "very Australia". Tip - Check out the Icebergs resto and pool! It's BEAUTIFUL.Also the beach has wifi if you need it
Fabulous views. Worth taking your time or power walking this - good exercise. Take the bus to either Bondi or Cogee.
Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal Walk. Awesome views and great trek! Beware of stairs if that is a problem. We really enjoyed the walk and the great Coogee Pavilion restaurant at the end of the walk!
Great walk. A great walk past five beaches and if your lucky (and we were )dolphins are a plenty some great café to stop for a wee drinky

A must do. Amazing walk suggested by my teenage son who was backpacking in Oz . I thought it might be too challenging for an oldie who isn't overly fit but it wasn't at all . Just remember to take a drink bottle .

Breathtaking. Something you can't miss if you are in Sydney. A long amazing walk with a stunning view. Starting in Coogee, going through other little wonderful beaches, ending in the famous Bondi. Just ten minutes before the arrival, you get an excellent view of the whole Bondi beach which will stay in your heart forever.

Great view and well worth the effort!. I did this a few days ago during my holidays in Sydney and I'm glad I made the effort. To get there you have to catch a train to bondi junction and then a bus to bondi as it is quite a long way from the city (you could catch a cab but it would be an expensive trip) but the effort is definitely worth it. Not only stunning coastal views but also you can see some huge multi million dollar mansions of the rich and famous. When we did it there was a art display here called sculptures by the sea which is a famous yearly display that lasts for a couple of weeks I believe before they take the sculptures down. Because of this it was very crowded the walk but I'm glad I went. Not only the great views and really interesting art pieces (loved the giant frying pan in the sand) but also a great way to exercise whilst on holiday!
Awesome views. Amazing views and we were able to see the sculptures by the sea which was brilliant- all the beaches were super clean and great to hang out on!

Family walk for November the1st. The first of November is the "All Saints Day" in the Christian calendar. This tradition is very much alive in Europe, not so much in the sunny Australia. However, to remember this tradition we walk the coastal walk to the Waverley Cementary. The large status of Angels overlooking the ocean view remind us about this special day. Each year it makes a great family outing that keeps our traditions going.
Soooo beautiful. There was a sculpture exhibit along the beach on when I visited. It was sooo amazing - I wish other cities did this.

Sydney at its best. You have to do this iconic walk. The view is spectacular, your heart specialist would definitely approve ... book brekkie at Trio to reward yourself afterwards. If you have a foreign passport you can get into the membership club there just below Icebergs Bar and Restauant. The breakfast there is totally OK but the view - looking back and down over the beach is jaw-dropping. Take your camera (and your passport, if you want to do the club breakfast) and squeeze you and your luvie onto the balcony ... they'll be no regrets!

I Concur: #1. Sydney is one of the greatest cities on the planet, and there are an awful lot of very good things to do and see. But I agree with the TA rating on this one. The Eastern Coastal Walk from Bondi to Coogee, if you do it, will be one of the most spectacular walks in your life. Don't stop at Bronte Beach; the Bronte to Coogee stretch amply rewards the additional effort. Spectacular seascapes, amazing rock formations, some of the best-engineered walking paths anywhere, scenic beach communities; wild waves crashing against headlands: what more could you ask for? Well, OK, if you're lucky (I was), some fashion photographers will be doing a bikini photo shoot on one of the beaches, but you can't count on that.  If you go the whole length, do stop for a few minutes at the Bali Memorial. I'm betting that each one of the 43 NSW victims of the Bali terrorist attack was in Kuta because they loved the ocean and loved beautiful places. I'm glad the memorial was placed where it is.

Best. Walk. Ever. Super walk along the coast line, easy breazy, you can even do it with kids. Count 1h30 to 2h to go all the way to Coogee. Worth it ! Do it in the morning, as there is almost no shade. But plentiful water fountains, wich means you will not die of thirst. I would recommand starting from Coogee and going to Bondi, and to have the nicest view for the end of the walk, but also to be able to bathe. We could bathe along the way since there were no flags = no swimming (due to strong currents). I would definitely do it again.

Great way to experience Aussie beach lifestyle. You can start with a coffee in Bondi then enjoy a leisurely or fitness walk to Coogee. An opportunity to see whales in the right season, the small bays, surf crashing on the rocks and the beautiful coastline. You will be joining many sydney siders who do this walk as part of their daily ritual. When you get to Coogee enjoy a lovely meal and a glass of wine at Bazuras. This wonderful cafe is at the southern end of the beach. There are government to and from both Coogee and Bondi.

A beautiful walk. Once you get to Bondi we all know you're just going to lay in the sand anyway so get out and do the walk. It's beautiful and great exercise. Walking along the cemetery is actually really neat. I highly recommend the walk.

Try the walk from Coogee to Bondi instead :). We did this walk on 8th November 2014, in the opposite direction from Coogee to North Bondi! The entire walk was rather leisurely, several sets of steps and slopes along the way. Definitely a beautiful view! We preferred to start from Coogee as it is relatively less crowded as compared to Bondi and hence didn't get caught in human traffic that much.Do remember to apply copious amounts of sunblock before doing the walk especially in this season as the sun is scorching. The cooling sea breeze does help a lot though. We took about 2 hours to walk from Coogee to North Bondi. There was a bit of human traffic between Tamarama Bay and Bondi due to the ongoing Sculptures by the Sea exhibition but in generally there is enough space to walk leisurely. There are some benches, lookouts and every outdoor gyms along the way if one is keen.Would definitely love to come back here for a run in off-peak timings though! Highly recommend!:)
Beautiful. Gorgeous walk with great views and awesome beaches! I can imagine it gets pretty busy on the weekend though!
Bondi Beach Sculpture on the Beach. Just happened to catch the last day of Sculptures on the Beach - wonderful opportunity! Beach sand was beautiful and views were amazing.

Great walk. Takes about 1.5 hours each way but beautiful views along the way. We happened to go on day when Sculptures of the Sea were on view so was a bit congested at the beginning but otherwise a great walk

Scenic Delight.. We were staying in Coogee for a few days in the middle of this year with some friends, they recommended that we make the walk to Bondi, and have a few beers down there, it takes around 2-3 hours to walk it at a slow pace, but the views you get are incredible, rocky at some points so if you like to live dangerously the path can get good! Fantastic graveyard to walk past, which has this surreal setting, when you get to the end and you can see Bondi, the view is breathtaking, you can see the long sandy beaches and the beautiful blue ocean combined, Just the Best views in Sydney by a long way A+++

Sculpute by the Sea. The beauty of the beach was breathtaking. The rock mountains surrounding the beach were beautiful, Tons of people enjoying volley ball, walks, sun bathing and swimming. The sculptures were quite unusual and unique.

Sculptures by the Sea. Beautiful walk along the sea front! Bus 333 from Elizabeth St, and make sure you buy your bus tickets at a news agency before you go to the bus stop. There is a news agency on the bottom floor of the Westfield shopping centre near Elizabeth St.
Sculptures by the Sea. Fabulous sculpture exhibition along the walk. Added to the enjoyable beach views and coastal scenery.

Lovely walk along a great coastline. We did this walk last week when the "Sculptures by the Sea" was on. Even without the sculptures it would have been great, but enjoying the creative skills of the artists gave an extra "wow factor" to the day. Highly recommend it.

Outstanding Sculpture by the Sea exhibition. We were lucky to catch the tail end of the sculpture by the sea exhibition. Even though it officially finished on the Sunday most of the artworks were still up on the Monday and the crowds were much more tolerable. It would still be a great walk without the exhibition as there are nice beaches and interesting rock formations along the way.
Bus. Traveling by hop on hop of bus, Bondi is the only useful stop for the out of Sydney route, Must tell driver your retired fot reduced price

Beautiful but crowded. Went on a Sunday morning but the trail was packed already. The sculptures by the sea was on so there were probably more people than usual. Many sculptures to look at during the walk and the views of the cliffs next to the ocean was amazing. My only complaint was that there were too many people, especially the walk from Bondi to Bronte, made me felt like canned sardines walking through an assembly line.

Rugged Pacific Paradise. The coastal walk in Sydney is truly spectacular. The beaches themselves are not extremely large but they are visually unique and interesting with beautiful rocky cliffs, green pastures, great sand and of course that turquoise Pacific water. The walk is really well manicured so it is simple to follow with neat steps and hand rails along the way. It is also a great workout - you will walk and climb a lot and depending on the temperature it can feel pretty vigorous. When I was there the "Sculptures by the Sea" exhibition was on so we took frequent detours onto the beach to see the sculptures. As another reviewer noted these beaches draw crowds so the walk can be clogged at points, but we managed to walk around people without incident. A positive side effect of the crowds though is that you can stop and take scenic photos without bothering anyone behind you!
Great walk with breathtaking views. I would actually suggest doing the reverse of this walk and walking from Coogee to Bondi. This is what we did and it was simply awesome.
Beauty and the Beach. The "Sculpture by the Sea" was outstanding. Many artist displayed thier work in an outstanding environment

Lovely Ocean Walk. Beautiful ocean walk, taking you from a nice beach with nice cafes and restaurant to another nice (smaller) beach, which also has nice cafes and restaurants not far from it! Ideal!!! If you can stay away from the weekend crowds it is even better (it does get extremely popular, more so than usual on weekends)

Inspiring. The "sculptures by the sea" was on display so the cliff paths were terribly busy and crowded. But regardless of that the walk was suitable to someone with average fitness and there were plenty of places to sit down and enjoy the view. This walk show cases another side of Sydney

exhausted but worth it. This is certainly a long walk .When we visited it there was an art exhibition (Crazy Sculptures etc)and for Spring was just edging on the 30`s so check the forecast before and take plenty of water .A walk round the graveyard is a must as are some of the exhibits .
Great walk along the beach. We were fortunate to arrive when the art Sculpture by the Sea was here. Very cool! The pathway was great. Used by lots of walkers, runners and sightseers.

Sculptures by the Sea. We have walked this stretch several times on our visits to Sydney and always love it. The exhibition finished last weekend by was a highlight of of our trip. It is a memorable walk but if you want a quiet walk don't do it when the exhibition is on. We enjoyed the sculptures and view but not the crowds.

Nice beach walk but not amazed by it. This is a nice walk and has some stunning views. Lots of tourists about and gets rather busy. It's was a nice setting and lots of place to eat nearby. I've seen better beaches and better costal paths but been as this one is in Sydney it makes it 4 stars rather than 3.

Enjoyable but hard work with a pudh chair. Beautiful walk, with the bonus of art works on display when we did it. But with the grandson in a stroller it was tough going in places with lots of steps to negotiate. Thankfully my other son was with us to help his brother do the carrying!

Crowds, crowds.... Too toristy, hard to walk smootly. If you want a serene views this is NOT the walk. Maybe at midnight, off season... Too many joggers bumping into you. There definitely must be many many better walks along the coast.

why i love Sydney. this walk is one of the most amazing walks around Sydney.We started at Coogee and followed the path,there are markings/signage all along or just ask a local ,friendly bunch.First beach was beautiful Clovelly,where at the top of the hill we found a quaint old fashioned bowling club,we stopped for a quick midi sat outside and had the best ocean views.Then walked past the old Waverley cemetery, past Tamarama beach and finally to Bondi which is spectacular,and walked straight into Bondi Icebergs,where we had a lovely lunch and few more ales,with the magnificent view.
A must do in Sydney. We had the opportunity to be there while "Sculpture on the beach" exhibition was on and finished our walk at the Bondi Iceberg for lunch

fab walk. great walk with breathtaking views! If you're lucky you may sight some migrating whales and dolphins! The walk is suitable for all abilities but there are a lot of steps and hills! A good pair of trainers and a bottle of water is all you need really. There are several great bays and beaches en route so you can stop for a rest and refreshments if you need to! We were lucky enough to be there when the sculptures were on display between Bondi and Tamarama...worth seeing but very crowded at that time!definitely a must do!!
Great Walk of Sydney. Brillant Day out if you like to exercise, beautiful walk a must do wear sneakers and comfortable clothing, backpack too

Too Crowded But Great Walk. We visited during the Sculpture by the Sea in the arvo and it was packed with people although it was a weekday. We started at South of Bondi and walked pass the Iceberg following the path, there were stairs which is quite steep at certain location. However, we turn back halfway due to the crowd and the heat. Would come back to complete the walk as the view along the walk is just beautiful

Nice walk. My wife and walked from Bondi to Bronte beach and enjoyed the walk. It is not too difficult and paved the whole way and winds along above the beaches. lots of places to stop and take pictures and we had lunch in Bronte beach. A nice pleasant walk.

Beautiful walk on a well trodden trail. I loved this walk which I tackled on a late sunny morning recently. It started well with great views over the ocean and the sight of many dolphins frollicking in the shallows. On the section from Bondi beach to Tamarama they are currently displaying the "Sculptures of the Sea" exhibition which was certainly drawing the crowds on the Saturday that I was there. The raised path close to the large Waverley cemetery was particulalry interesting - they say that this cemetery is the most scenic burial ground in the world. There is something quaint about a bowls club up on the cliffs and each beach community seemed to be doing something special in the way of events, BBQing etc. In total this walk runs over 6 km and I took ca. three hours to amble along it. It covers six beaches (with lovely names like Clovelley & Bronte) and a number of coves and bays. After a week of business meetings this was the ideal way to get a bit of exercise, explore the real coastal around Sydney and blow away a few cobwebs without getting cold.

Great walk, starts easy and gets more challenging.. Beaches at both ends are lovely and serviced by transit. Walk is well signed. Some hills and stairs so not a stroll. Opportunity to try some of the other beaches and pools along the way.

Great Walk. Start at the southern end of Bondi Beach and walk up the hill and past the swimming club.This lovely walk then heads down the coast hugging the shoreline with fantastic views along the way. The pathway is excellent but there are quite a lot of steps to negotiate. Toilets are available at various places.Worth stopping at the cemetery and looking at some of the very old gravestones. Many well known Sydney residents can be found buried there.Certainly nice food available in both Tamarama and Bronte.Good to walk all the way back if you can, but plenty of buses going into the city from Bronte or Coogee.

Amazing!. We did the walk during our five day stay in Sydney and it was the highlight for us - amazing scenery, cute beach towns, shops, restaurants, etc. We started in Bondi and walked our way to Coogee where we had Coopers and appetizers at Coogee Bay Hotel. Highly recommend!

Sculptures by the Sea. Did they Coogee to Bondi Walk which is very popular & have seen some celebs each time so far as well. There are steps, flat, but most of all beautiful coastal & ocean views. It's not too hard and can stop on the way for a swim, best to take a towel with you . Just recently,they have the sculptures of the sea exhibition which is pretty crazy & something to see. Make sure you take a hat & block out cause one of our friends got burnt haha. Take it at your own speed, go for a swim, get some fish & chips or coffee on the way at the beach shops at Coogee, Bronte or busy Bondi
Just Do It. The walk is along the coast line and you'll come across 3 more beaches in between. Definitely worth a walk during the day or twlight
Love that Coastal Walk.. Easy walking with stunning views and plenty of places to stop for great coffee and icecream! Easy to get to from the city on public transport, well worth the trip.
Do this!. if you are beach starved in Sydney this is a great place to check out not too far from the city core.

One of the best coastal walks ever. "The penny dropped" for me when we visited Bondi and took five languorous hours to stroll this gorgeous path on our second day in Sydney; I felt I understood one major feature that sets Sydney apart from other grand cities - the wonderful and accessible beaches. I was amazed to see how lively the beach scene was on a weekday afternoon, and how well used the beaches are at the end of a school or work day. We also had the good fortune to enjoy the "Sculpture by the Sea exhibit during our visit. The Walk is an easy bus trip from the harbour or downtown Sydney. Next time we will stop for a drink at Icebergs.

Stunning views. This walk is a must do if you are visiting Sydney. Take the bus to Bondi and walk the walk. Whatever time of year you go there is always so much to enjoy. Avoid early October when there is a sculpture exhibition, but go the rest of th year it is brilliant. Places to stop and have coffee or just sit. Do it, you will not regret the excellent experience. X

Coastal Beauty. This walk is a beautiful way to get exercise.The sea is everchanging, the houses you pass are delightful and you would wish to live in any of them.You always have a bit of a breeze but in summer you should wear a hat as you may find yourself being sunburnt.There are some some hills .
What a coast line!. Beautiful to the extreme. I have never walked so much on a holiday as I did in Sydney but it was all just so beautiful I just wanted to see more and the beaches were no exception.

Scenic Walk. Good way to burn off the holiday weight! Started my walk at Bondi, walked past Tamarama and ended at Bronte Beach. Couldn't go all the way to Coogee, regrettably since I had to go for an SCG tour at 11am, hence I couldn't complete the entire walk.It was breezy, stunning sights, cool wind flowing from the east to the west and the sculptures by the sea exhibit for those who love artwork that makes the walk worthwhile.Still plays second fiddle to the Great Ocean Road in Victoria, but it was pretty nonetheless.
Avoid the crowds. The walk is beautiful and relaxing as long as you avoid the peak times for the Sculpture by the Sea. Crowds can be overwhelming. Go very early in morning to avoide school groups.

Walk from Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk. We completed this walk one Sunday enjoying the magnificent views of the water. We saw a mother and baby whale frolicking off the coast at Bondi. I would not class it as an easy walk but my husband and I managed it without difficulty ( we are in our late 60's). Well worth enjoying.

Unbeatable views. The Bondi to Coogee Walk takes you past some of the best Sydney beaches. There is even an historical cemetery that you can check out near Clovelly. Have enjoyed the walk in previous years when Sculptures by the Sea was on. Bring your camera on this walk as the views are spectacular.

Excellent Walk. Highly recommended especially if you are new to Sydney! Get some exercise and its free too! Great way to see the sights. You can come in two cars, park one at one end and the other at the other that way you can keep going and dont have to turn around at the end.

One of the most iconic coastal walks in the world. This is one of Sydney's must-do's. Especially good (if not very crowded!) when the "Sculptures By The Sea" exhibition is on. It's suitable for all ages although there are some steps along the way that may require some assistance for disabled visitors. The perfect place to see sunrise in Sydney : )
Gorgeous scenery!. Definitely worth the hills and stairs! Fantastic views and a great way to visit some of Sydney's great beaches!

Sculptures by the Sea. November is the time to do this walk to see the Sculptures by the Sea. The walk is fantastic at the best of times being on the cliffs above the beaches. However, the sculptures make this a "must do" walk. It is very busy on weekends!
Sculptures by the Sea. Fantastic a great walk, art, people and it is hot at this time of the year. Take hat and sunscreen! Even without the sculptures a fantastic view and walk.

One of my favourite walks. Stunning views.. I have waked this part of the eastern suburbs coastal walk many times.It has such stunning views and is an easy walk along a purpose built pathway.And each day you get a different view.I love it!

Amazing coastal walk. The best time to go is during the Annual Sculptures by the Sea exhibition in late Oct. Creative and interesting sculptures line the walk and the park above Tamarama Beach. Stunning views and plenty of stairs for exercise. Enjoy a coffee at one of the lovely cafes at the end!!

Favourite Sydney walk. The walk from Coogee to Bondi is a must do for visitors (and locals) to Sydney. It is a very scenic footpath that follows the coast. It has great paths that are easy to navigate. For those who are fit, do one end to the other and return, for those less able, do one way or just one section. There are fountains to refill your water bottles along the way. There are plenty of spots to stop for a coffee along the way and opportunity for some great photos. My favourite time is early morning or near sunset. Take your swimmers for a dip at one of the beautiful beaches along the way. At the end of October and early November, the free annual Sculpture by the Sea is held which is worth a look.

beautiful coastal walk from Coogee Beach. It is indeed a pleasant walk from Coogee Beach to Bondi Junction and all the way to Bondi.Along the way, you get to see many people, young and old come here for a relaxing time. There are many clean public toilets if you need to run to the washrooms. There are also many places you can drink water for free. It is common for people lying on the grass sunbathing or reading a book or chit-chatting with friends. The birds flew freely there, not afraid of human being. Overall, the whole place has a positive vibe. The ocean is beautiful, the water is very clean, surfers are having a good time and i got to see seals playing in the water. The coast is dotted with sculptures that are cleverly crafted. I would highly recommend this place to anybody that comes to Sydney.

An eventful walk. It is always fun to walk along the coast .On a sunny day or on a stormy afternoon, you ll enjoy the scenery ! Parking is not always easy if you are not leaving in the area. Dont miss th eyearly sculpture by the sea, it's crowded but always full of interresting ideas !

Choose your time wisely !. My husband & I did the walk on a weekday for the sculpture by the sea, from Tamarama to Bondi. View was great but there were thousands of people with the same idea, including lots & lots of schoolkids.Unfortunately this made for a very uncomfortable walk seeing as the pathway is quite narrow ,so we couldn't finish.Will try it again with hopefully fewer people.

A must in Sydney!. If you have time, do this!The walk is very easy and beautiful. It goes all the way along the coast and, at one point, we even saw a humpback whale jumping in the sea! (this was in october).As a suggestion: we took the bus from Sydney to Bondi, walked around Bondi and then did the walk to Coggee. We had lunch in Coogee and then took the bus back to Sydney.

Exercise, culture and beautiful panorama.. Did the walk this week. Easy to get to via 380 bus from Bondi Junction.Best to do during the week when the sculptures exhibition is on, closes 9th Nov.Some steps involved but generally a relative easy walk. Not necessary to do the complete distance as transport available along route back to Bondi. Check before proceeding!View out to sea and along the coast absolutely fabulous.

Curious rock formations. We walked from Bondi to Bronte. The rocks are eroded into interesting shapes and patterns.We got the bus back to Bondi Junction. (There wasn't much choice of food at Bronte in the evening.)Bronte is !overly during the day, as there is a big park with lots of picnic sheds. It's more family-oriented than Bondi or Tamarama.

Stunning walk. We took the bus from Bondi Junction to Cloveley to start our walk back to Bondi. The sculptures from Bronte to Bondi made this walk really interesting but detracted somewhat from the wonderful views especially since it seemed that every school in Sydney were there on a trip! We stopped at Iceberg for lunch before getting the bus back. Nice walk if you don't mind the crowds

Great Free Leisurely Outdoor Activity. This walk is ideal for persons of all ages and fitness levels who have no trouble walking. You get to experience a very pleasant walk at your own pace and at your own time along the picturesque coastline which incorporates some the best beaches in Sydney's eastern suburbs. Locals say whales can often be seen breaching only metres from the coastline.as they make their seasonal journeys up and down the eastern seaboard. Although there is easy access to shops and amenities along the walk it is advisable to take water with you as well as covering up with sunscreen.. Coogee Beach is a lovely place to end the walk. It is so alive and spending time there was great and we went back there several times to take in the leisurely lifestyle enjoying the beach, cafes and the local hotel which has a sociable beer garden in which to relax. I would recommend the walk and a visit to Coogee Beach to anybody holidaying in Sydney
Bondi to Coogee. An excellent exercise/viewing path that encompasses plenty of stairways and flat sections. The ocean views are unsurpassed.
One of the most beautiful Coastal walks. So many sights to see on this walk! Easy walking, so it suits most age groups. Best done on a mild spring or autumn day, as it can be a bit hot.

Easy walking with a few steps. A 3 mile walk around the coast, along a well laid out path with a photo around every turn. At Coogee just catch a bus back to the city, easy. Easy going but not for people who can not climb stips.

Bondi natural wonders. The Bondi to Coogee walk allows you to experience the natural rock formations as well as the beautiful views of one of our most iconic beaches. If you are in the City Centre it is easily reached by public transport - buses leave from the Quay.

Fabulous Walk. This is a great walk any time of the year. But during the 3 weeks Sculpture by the Sea is on it is a must do for tourists! Gets very busy on the weekends and it is best to go during the week or in the early evening. You can catch a train to Bondi Junction and then a bus to the beach.

Have done this loads of times and still the best! . Absolutely stunning walk. Recommend some good walking shoes as it can be quite hilly and steep at points (Clovelly into Gordons Bay and Coogee) but a fantastic walk. Time it right you may see whales and dolphins along the coast. Last time I did it a few weeks ago saw dolphins swimming at Bronte beach. Bring sun cream. Wear a hat and bring snorkel gear to have a go in Clovelly Beach which is a pretty cool experience.

My Saturday morning walk. This walk is one off the best walks I walked ever, on Saturday,s I walk with my partner and it does not matter how the wetter is, its beautiful, in spring there is the sculpture at the beach Art exhibition, Artist from all over the world showing their masterly crafted pieces..Not only can you swim in the Sea but also can you swim in the Natural rockpools,have a picknickusing the free BB or have a breakfast on the beach in the new beach restaurant [Tarramarra]this walk is a must for tourists to see the Ausie beach life style

Excellent Walk. Starting at Coogee Beach, with lunch at Tropicana (on Coogee Bay Rd.) - an EXCELLENT place to eat with large, healthy helpings. You have a choice of walking on a paved footpath, or do some rock-hoping in parts if you wish. You can swim at the various beaches on the way, or lie on the white sands. The views are terrific! The air is pure. I've done this walk many times over the past 20 years and it is ALWAYS great. You could walk back to Coogee or catch a taxi for about $20. There is an outside gym Clovelly, newly installed, with the latest equipment (no cost). Also a coffee shop. Time is about 90 - 120 minutes without rushing.

Smashing coastal run. Excellent spot for sports, leisure or photography. My friend and I ran this route during the exhibition of Sculptures by the Sea, and did find that for runners, the tourist crowds may be a bit of an issue to those interested in running, but otherwise, definitely not to be missed.

Bondi to Bronte regular - never fails to invigorate. This is one of the world's best coast walks: from busy, fun, if-rakish Bondi along a stunning pathway to pretty and slightly more peaceful Bronte beach. A good workout if you keep up the pace, too!

One of the 'must dos' of any Sydney visit. This coastal walk is incredible. It goes from Bondi, through Tamarama, Bronte, Thompson's Bay, Clovelly and Coogee Beaches. The scenery is incredible - the smell of the ocean intoxicating. In late October-early November, there is the Sculptures by the Sea exhibition. In summer, of course there is the chance to have a swim (watch out at Tamarama Beach - called 'glamarama' by the locals because of the body beautifuls basting themselves in the sun in summer. The surf can be quite dangerous here. An excellent way to get some fresh air and exercise walking one of the most impossibly scenic routes anywhere in the world.
Sculptures by the sea. Amazing experience fantastic art with wild ocean setting. Early morning weekday walk proved great as not too many people and weather cooler

Seemed longer than advertised but great scenery. A great walk half way there was a lovely park with the help yourself barbeques, take some grub and chill there a while. Plenty of toilets along the root quite a few steps .

The Coast and all it's Beauty. This walk is an absolute must do when your in Sydney. This scenic coastal walk is nothing short of spectacular. Allow yourself a few hours to take in the beauty of the Eastern Beaches.In Winter. Pick up a coffee at Bronte beach. Take an Umbrella.In Spring. You might see whales. Take a camera.In Summer. Wear sunblock.And always wear sensible walking shoes.

Get out of bed and see the sun rise!. Everyone who comes to Sydney has heard of Bondi Beach. It's iconic. But once you've been there you will realise that unless you are swimming, sunbathing or playing in the park, there's not much else to do. Bondi is a bit overrated. However the walk from Bondi to Coogee is sensational.There is a wonderful walkway that follows the ocean, providing you with sensational views, wonderful clear, clean air, the smell of the sea and the sound of waves crashing. See the sun peep over the horizon saying "Good morning Sydney, it's another wonderful day in paradise"BUT YOU MUST GET UP EARLY TO ENJOY IT! This walk is very popular and unless you get out of bed early, you will have to navigate your way through the madding crowd. Enroute you can walk, you can stop and have a swim, you can snorkel. There are plenty of drinking fountains along the path, so no need to take loads of water. For those who love a longer walk you can go all the way from Coogee to Watson's Bay. Stop at the pub for brunch.Its a great way to spend a morning.Of course if you are an evening person, you can do the walk in the evening, again avoiding the crowds.
great walk. lovely easy walk ,great views along the coastline good way to pass a few hours with a lovely beach at the end with shops etc

Beautiful and relaxing!!. It is a really nice walk and the landscape is just beautiful. It takes around 1 1/2 hours for one way and maybe a bit more if you take pictures in between. Also a very nice track for joggers...around 13k for a round-trip.

Bask in the view!. This is the most fabulous coast walk I have done. There are places to stop along the way if you feel like it or you could do as we did and stopped at the first pub in Coogee and knocked back a cold one. If you love coastal views and some brisk exercise then you will love this walk. You can even catch the bus back from Coogee if you don't have the energy to walk back.

A Beautiful Coastal Stroll. The walk follows the coast via undulating footpaths, boardwalks & steps, so it's not for the faint hearted, but wheelchair ramps & paths do exist for most of the way. A number of beaches are traversed along the way with scenic views, lookouts, swimming, scuba, snorkeling & surfing to breakup the walk. It's very popular amongst the joggers & fitness afficionado too, but all seem to share the way without too much trouble, even in the narrow sections. The walk can obviously start from either Bondi or Coogee(& beyond)& there are buses to provide a return if required. A Sydney Treasure! Enjoy.

morning walk is the best. I think this coastal walk is best done in the morning so you do not get the hot sun between 11am to 3pm. We did the Bondi Beach to Tamarama Beach coastal walk at this time of day and it was great. You might get a few joggers but who cares. The walk and scenery is just fantastic on a clear day.
Sydney at its best. A fantastic walk, Sydney at its very best...just love the scenery,glorious views, the exercise ...love everything about it.Nothing to dislike!
Scenic Ocean Side Walk. A great way to see and experience Sydneys coastline. Easy to moderate walking conditions. During June and July there is a good chance of sighting migrating whales

Fabulous walk. Did the walk on our wedding anniversary in late July. The day was exceptionally warm for the time of year, the water was sparkling, girls were in their bikinis and the walk was full people of all ages and nationalities enjoying both the natural beauty and the man made. Would recommend the walk to anyone with a few hours to spare.
Fantastic. my title is fantastic,great,awesome,beautiful,fun,brilliant,relaxing,amusing,outstanding,excessively good

a slow walk!. An excellent walk that must be done! The crowds can be enormous when Sculptures by the Sea is on so go early or during the week. Good food at Tamarama or at either end. toilets along the way make it easier for families with small children. The weather can be unpredictable and windy so be prepared
Fabulous walk. I have done this walk many times, it is very relaxing and stimulating and everybody that does it really enjoys it, the views are beautiful the people you see doing it are friendly.

Great views and pathways.. This is a great way to see the coastline between Bondi and Coogee beaches. Plan your trip so that you are there for Sculptures by the sea and make a day of it. Medium fitness is required for this walk. There is no access for wheelchair users. I recommend that you leave younger children with a friend or family, as this walk is not for them.

One of this writer's favourite walks. Despite having lived in Sydney's Eastern suburbs for over 35 years, this is one of my favourite walks and one that I do not tire of. It ambles around the coast from Bondi and impossible to get lost, even for those with no sense of direction (like this writer). One do it at whatever pace is best. It is undulating, stairs are involved (perhaps not so good for those with prams or dogs that tire easily). No two days are ever the same and one passes through Tamarama, Bronte etc, with plenty of little spots to stop off at if refreshments required. A must see for locals and visitors alike. Note that parking can be expensive on Bondi Beach although there are plenty of public transport options available.

A must do for both locals and visitors. A fantastic experience. this is a wonderful walk not only for exercise but for the natural beauty as well as the physical beauty as well. Lots to look at while your heart rate is up.
Brilliant, even if it's raining.. I regularly run this walk for exercise then a swim afterwards, love it! Sometimes will see passing dolphins and whales, a real treat.

Easy exercise and great views. amazing walk along the waterfront connecting two of Sydney's beaches. Great any time of the year, better in summer of course.Late Oct-early Nov they have Statues by the Sea where the walk also includes some totally amazing statues to add tothe value of the walk.

Sculptures on a hot day.. Great walk, did the reverse, that is walked north. It was a really hot day so the sea breeze, free water provided by Sydney water was appreciated. Strongly recommend swimming apparel.

Amazing. i live at one end of this walk and i still find it simply amazing. The scenery across the rocks make for amazing photos. There is a great park to stop if you have kids in bronte. You can stop at bondi icebergs for a drink with perhaps the most amazing view in Sydney.Tip; in whale season look halfway to the horizon and look for a "puff of smoke". Almost everyday you can see humpbacks here if you know what you are looking for. Also, from the cliff on the south side of bondi spend a few minutes looking closer to shore, if you are lucky you may see the dolphin. If you want to swim, take a snorkel mask and check to the fish in Clovelly.

Great coastal walk. Living in Sydney we often do the Bondi to Coogee coastal walk. It has a lot of stairs and up and down hills. The view is magnificent and stopping in Bronte on our return for breakfast is a huge plus with many places to choose from. The ocean always has a calming effect on us. Enjoy.

Eastern suburbs squish-up. Our last walk from Bronte to Bondi was an experience. Managed to secure a park up at the top of the hill in Bronte - as parking was full everywhere else. We grabbed the dog and headed for Bondi along the path. It was a weekend day so we expected it to be busy. But we didnt expect that the local runners would choose to run the pathway while thousands of people are walking it - after the 5th time of watching runners bang into pedestrians - and associated apologies or screaming matches between the well heeled participants - it seemed like a good time to turn around and go back to the car via pavements. Still a beautiful walk - but on weekend days give it a miss - its Eastern suburbs hell xx

Great scenery!. We arrived at Bondi by bus and began our walk to Coogee. The paths and boardwalks are well kept and wide and follow the coastline closely.There are bench seats along the way and signs giving you information about birdlife and plants you are likely to see. The views out to sea are fabulous and we saw a huge pod of dolphins. The walk isn't difficult except near Gordon's Bay where there is a steep set of stairs (about 60) and a steep walkway otherwise it's an enjoyable walk.
Walk with a view. The walk from Bondi to Cooge is a lovely scenic walk of beautiful Australian beaches, a must do for a great view of the spectacular coast.

Absolutely Beautiful. A lovely, leisurely walk along some of the most beautiful beaches in Sydney. Gorgeous views the whole way along - start and Bondi (because its really not that exciting) and walk to Coogee and stop for lunch and a swim when you get there. Gordons Bay has some great snorkelling and easy swimming. Also great when Sculptures by the Sea is on in November. Definitely recommend for longer trips to Sydney :)Enjoy!
Sculpture by the Sea is a top annual event. It's worth going as early in the day as possible or maybe late in the afternoon to avoid the crowds.

Stunning views. This is a very popular coastal walk, which takes in stunning coastal views of famous Bondi Beach and all the beaches southwards. Definitely worth doing. Can be very busy at weekends, making dodging the crowds a bit frustrating. If walking with infants, avoid taking a pram as there are plenty steps en route. Along the way a coffee stop at Tamaramma or Bronte is a sheer delight. Look out for dolphins and seasonally even whales. Recommend hats and sunscreen.

Enjoy the best views in Sydney. It can get a little crowded on this track on a sunny weekend, but if you head out in the morning or evening during the week there are wonderful sights all the way along the coast. In November the Sculpture by the sea is on (usually last week oct/first week nov) so worth trying to arrive during that time if you can. This is one of the great coastal walks like the Cinque Terre in Italy so do not miss it!

Great way to spend a day in Sydney. Great walk. You can do sections of it, or start at either end. Would take over an hour to walk from Coogee all the way to Bondi though! Amazing views. Relatively quiet during the week but can get a bit busy on weekends in summer. Good for runners as well as walkers. Few steep sections and stairs but there are good parts which are pram friendly for those with youngsters.

Super views. Important Point - unless you are there to see the sculptures during the annual Sculptures by the Sea, avoid the walk. It is a slow shuffle between Icebergs and Tamarama. At all other times the walk is relaxing and has great view
Well worth the time. A scenic coastal walk with amazing views, take your time to enjoy the views. Always somewhere to enjoy a drink and a nibble when you finish the walk.

Fresh air, Exercise and Breathtaking Views. This walk is a great way to shake off residual lunch or breakfast excesses and clear your head. Combined with a swim in the warmer months it has to be the perfect outing for my money. I did the Tamarama to Bondi walk yesterday which is in the opposite direction to view the Sculptures by the Sea exhibit which is a great walk as well.

Scenic coast. The coastal walk from Bondi to Coogee is a tourist must-do. Begin at either Bondi or Coogee. No need to walk the entire distance either. There are some steps along the way. My suggestion is catch the train to Bondi Junction, then the bus to Bondi Beach. Begin the walk at the south end of Bondi Beach where Bondi Baths are. Have a drink at the bar of Bondi Icebergs where you will take in a fabulous view of the beach and all the activity, including many surfers. On the walk you will come across Tamarama, Bronte and Clovelly Beaches plus more secluded bays. Remember a hat and sunscreen. Finish the walk with a swim at Coogee Beach. Return to Bondi Junction by bus to connect with rail services. If you are lucky enough to be visiting in October/November you might catch the annual Sculptures by the Sea.

Coastal walk. For any locals or visitors to Sydney this has to be THE most spectacular coastal walk you will experience. Starting at Bondi this walk can take anything from 45 minutes to hours... depending on how many stops you make for photos/coffee/swims/food..a.all up to you.

Ocean stroll. A lovely walk by the sea past several beaches, at times on cliff tops. There are a few steps but not difficult for anyone in reasonable health. Some shade and seats, past a historical graveyard which is worth a wander around. Cafes both ends and several toilets along the way. Enjoy ! If you are there in October then a bonus is Sculpture by the sea, multiple pieces of sculpture constructed from various materials. ( free to see)Best swimming at Bondi and Coogee.

Challenging Walk & Great Scenery. I'm a keen walker, and have done this walk many times. The scenery is fantastic, and many walkers take this as a leisure stroll. If you like walking exercise, this walk is one that you have to do, and is 'up there' with many other Sydney scenic walks, incl. (a) Manly to The Spit; (b) North Head Walk; (c) Manly to Dee Why Coastal Walk; as well as (d) many Royal National Park Walks.
Breathtaking. it is one of the most beautiful coastal walk on Sydney harbour with amazing views. We have done it several times.
Views to die for. Views are amazing worth the climb up there, when I went there was a sculpture exhibition all the way up to the point

Great walk!. A must do when in Sydney! Magnificent walk along coast and cliffs. Not wheelchair accessible but not a difficult walk. Some young Mums take prams, great exercise! I prefer to start at Coogee Surf Club and finish at Bondi for lunch/coffee then either walk back to Coogee or catch a taxi, depends on weather.

One of the most beautiful and enjoyable coastal walks!. Whether walking slowly or fast, this coastal walk is a true Sydney experience ... no matter what the weather conditions! The views are beautiful and different at every turn, and the salt air is always fresh and clean.

Amazing views and great workout. Anyone can do this walk. You don't need to be fit, you just need to go at your own pace. There are plenty of resting places, and what views they provide. The cliffs here are magnificent, and the even changing ocean provides enough to keep you happy.However, there is so much more to this lovely walk. Beautiful beaches, great cafes, happy people and during the whale season it is very easy to spot these magnificent creatures, sometimes right in close. This walk is really worthwhile and will definitely give you your daily workout

Beautiful Views. If you are a local or a visitor, I'm sure you will enjoy this beautiful walk. I normally start at Cooge as the parking is better. Just follow the path,and keep the ocean on your right. nothing scary to worry about. This walk is suitable for young children but not prams as there is sections of stairs. Each way would be about 1.5 hrs if you stop send take some photos along the way. There is lots of food shops at Bondi beach if you want to purchase food. Otherwise plenty of shady depots to have a picnic. The only downfall with this walk is that the locals think they own the place. Keep in mind it is public land and is there for all to enjoy.

Stunning. If you want to feel good about living in Sydney - do this walk. It's a go-to for tourist's too. It has everything that is amazing about living in this part of the world. Sun, sand, wind, hundreds of shades of blue, sandstone cliffs and endless stretches of ocean. Take a dip along the way. Star spot. Grab a juice. This is what makes Sydney - Sydney.

Sculptures by the Sea. Just completed my 10th consecutive visit to see the annual Sculptures by the Sea exhibition. Whereas in previous years had little problem with crowds as we went midweek, this year we went on a Sunday. Big mistake!. Even though we started at 8am the pathway was very congested & our focus was on getting thru the crowds rather than on the great sculptures. Fortunately there is plenty of room in the area round Tamarama Beach & up at Marks Park for viewing the many imaginative sculptures located there. All in all with the fine weather & great ocean views it's a special time to visit the area - just go midweek.

Always a good place to walk. Been many times always enjoy the scenery of the water plenty of places to stop and watch life go by, enjoy a coffee, lunch at many cafes along the way,make sure you have a water and plenty of suncream and time to enjoy the full walk.

Sculpture at the Sea a perfect time to do this walk. The walk from Bondi to Bronte is best done when the Sculpture at the sea event is on. Not only do you have superb views of the ocean and shoreline there but the sculptures are just wonderful. Go early in the morning before the crowds.
Sensational all year round. This walk is superb in summer or winter. It is particularly good now in November with sculptures by the sea in full swing. Best activity to do in sydney.

Best Views in Sydney. Any visitor to my home city should take a day and do this awesome walk, Bondi to Coogee along the cliff tops, it's free and you will thank yourself for doing it.Don't forget your camera.

The best walk in the world. Absolutely the best walk in the world. You can get the real feeling of Australian coastline with spectacular views, coastal houses and beaches. You can do the whole walk in approx. 1.5 hours (if walking only) or cut it short in Bronte or Clovelly. If you are doing it in hot weather, the beaches are at your service with all sorts of facilities. You will not only get to see #1 beach (Bondi) in the whole country for its global reputation but also see (and experience if you like) #1 and #2 roughest beaches in the whole country with their dangerous rips and current (Bronte and Tamarama respectively). If you don't like waves or rough surf or even deal with sand, you can still swim and/snorkel in crystal clear waters of Clovelly, and sunbath on warm concrete on both sides of the beach (personally my favourite). The aquatic reserve inhabits plenty of species of fish including a few big resident groupers. You can pack your own lunch or nibble on what cafes and kiosks around have to offer.A must do walk and experience for anyone who's in Sydney even for a day or two.
Easy walk. Great walk for anyone to do. Not too strenuous. Just make sure you wear comfy shoes and take a bottle of water. Few places to stop along the way for a quick bite to eat.

A must for all. Located on the iconic beach areas of Sydney. The Bondi to bronte coastal walk is a definite for all tourists and locals alike. Currently this walk is showcasing the "sculptures by the sea" a huge array of sculptures located all along the walk so as to showcase the talents of the business. AmazingHowever even without the sculptures this walk re energises the traveller and showcases the amazing scenery and the blue waters of Sydney as well as the best surfing beaches in the world. You cannot visit Sydney without partaking in the walk

Beaches and sun. If you are taking this walk don't forget to grab water, swimming suit, hat and sunscreen. It's all about relaxing ang enjoying views. When you get too hot, just swim opinion one of the beaches: Coogee, Bronte, Tamarama or Bondi. In November it's quite busy due to Sculptures near the sea.

breathtaking views. Loved this walk, we did Coogee to Bondi as wanted to sit on Bondi and eat fish & chips at the Bondi Fish Bar. Easy walk, with fantastic views, and enjoyed the art displays on the beaches prior to Bondi. The walk was definitely busy towards the Bondi side and would probably go earlier if did it again. Stopped for coffee & to take in the views at the swimming club as you approached Bondi, amazed at the fair prices that were charged!

Pleasant afternoon walk. Impressive coastal views and an array of interesting sculptures while enjoying a healthy stroll. Only downside is very poor signposting of the route, including a lack of distance indicators.
An easy walk. Views .interesting developement in this area since 1975 when first visited. The views are spectacular and so wonderful considering proximity to a large city.

Make sure you wear proper footwear as it is a real walk. Its a beautiful walk, with amazing views and quirky finds along the way - cute beaches, a very old cemetery, a bowls club with the best views in the world and this weekend Sculptures by the Sea. What started out as a 2 hour walk took 4 hours as there was just so much to see.
A MUST. beautiful scenic walk, it is quite challenging but if you attempt it you will be able to visit quite few beautiful beaches.

Sculpture By the Sea. Fantastic, been going every year to Sculptures By The Sea and each year they just keeep getting bigger and better. More influences from other countries coming through, This year has been the best yet.
Excellent walk. This walk was fantastic, the views were great, in addition the Sculptures by the sea were on display. A great way to get some exercise, see views and watch some volleyball.

Every visitor to Sydney should be taken on this walk.. Now it is Sculpture By The Sea all along the coastal walk, but anytime of the year is the time to do this wonderful walk. Look out for the rock carvings amongst the incredible sand stone boulders. The walk can be done at a run like many of the fitness fanatics or at a leisurely pace. Wear a hat and sunglasses it you have fair skin, or wear one anyway, sun sense, and a good coating of suntan block in the summer. In winter a jacket will help keep the wind out. And don't forget your camera.

Amazing Australian beauty. No doubt a must go spot in Sydney. We were there and we were there again and experienced both type of weather there, a windy cold day and a sunny warm day. We were lucky the place was not crowded and the walk was really memorable... speechless, just go there and experience yourself!
Amazing Views. Great views and great for a run or walk... the only down side is that its very busy.. so get there early if you're a runner!

A great walk and spectacular views. We heard a lot about this walk and if you have the time and energy, it's really a great way to see the coast around Sydney.Take the bus from Circular Quay to Bondi. Sins for this walk are not easy to see but anyone will point you in the right direction. It took us about 75mins to reach Coogee. There are not lots of steps in places , so it's definitely not suitable everyone.A fab place for a coffee on Arrival is the Coogee Pavillion. ( see sep. review)

Way too crowded while Sculpture on the Beach was on. We actually started walking at Vaucluse, North of Bondi and stopped at Bondi for the markets and breakfast. The northern part of the walk was not as good as the Bondi to Coogee part because we had to walk on roads away from the coast.

Iconic walk. What a great walk. It is popular with both locals and tourists. The sea views are spectacular and one can find many places to stop and rest, or have a snack or drink. The smaller beaches like Coogee are a delight.
sculptures by the see. most enjoyable walk. From Bondi to Maroubra .Do it early before it gets to hot. Takes about 1 1/2 to 2 hours.

Wow. I completed the walk on a wet and windy day but it was well worth it! The walk is well signed and you can't go wrong. I walked from Coogee to Bondi and back. There is a great restaurant in Bondi which does huge buckets of Prawns and lots of other tasty treats you can eat whilst looking out to sea! Well worth a walk and the scenery it just lovely.

Windy but rewarding.. We started at Coggee and walked to Bondi. The day we did it was sunny and very windy, but gave great waves and terrific photo opportunities. There are some lovely bays and plenty of refreshment opportunities.

Some Tips. I do this walk for exercise once a week - Coogee to Bondi and then back again - which takes a bit over two hours at a fast walk.Really you can take as long as you want - but don't attempt it one way in less than 90 minutes unless you really are just doing it for the exercise.Personally I think the views unfold better walking from Coogee to Bondi than the other way - but there is not much in it!Is it hard to follow the path? Not at all - just keep close to the sea and its obvious where to go. Sometimes it dips inland through a park - but not very far. In summer its much better early morning or late afternoon once the sea breeze has come up and cooled things down. In winter its the opposite - middle of the day is best.There are lots of steps - some quite steep -so if mobility is an issue this is not for you. As "easy" section if you are time constrained is Bondi to Bronte - which is less than half way.Parts of the walk are quite elevated and if its whale migration season then there is a chance of spotting one or a few - they rarely come in any closer than a few km's offshore but even so its an awesome sight. How will you know? Don't worry plenty of people will be standing around pointing. Is it every day? No - but its common enough that the locals glance and then keep walking.On the way Bronte is renowned for lots of cafes (opposite the park), there is a good pub at Clovelly and lots of cafes and bars at Coogee.If you want to swim - the first two beaches you come to - Tamarrama and Bronte are both picturesque but dangerous for the inexperienced - stick between the flags. Clovelly is really an enclosed bay rather than a beach and generally calm. Coogee itself does not have a big surf, but does have a dangerous shore break sometimes - again stick between the flags.Finally if you are super ambitious the walk keeps going onwards from Coogee - just keep following the path. You can get to Maroubra (another 30 minutes) but about half way there the path takes a detour via some suburban streets that is not well signposted and then you have to rock hop around Lurline Bay (not advisable at high tide with a rough surf).

Being healthy has never been easier than walking Sydney's coasts. This walk takes in some of our most special Eastern Suburbs beaches. Tamarama, known to locals as Glamarama, for the young gorgeous things who swim and sunbake here, onto Gordon's Bay which has amazing fish and underwater life, snorkelling at Clovelly is a must and Bronte's tidal pool is one of the most charming. A photographer's delight, even on a grey day, you'll find locals lined along the walk just watching the waves. Surf city. Lots of cafés and restrooms at the beaches, with great public transport. If mot a skilled swimmer please swim between the flags. Two of these are our most dangerous beaches, with rips that will suck you out to sea.
Amazing. Weather fab and Sculpture exhibition a bonus. Easy walk then easy doing it Coogee to Bondi with a bus back if you continue walk to Bondi Junction.

Excellent walk. Great views, easy path to follow, lots of places to stop and swim along the way, great scenery, well worth taking a whole day and stopping off at each beach/pool area, lunch at Coogee Pavilion. Highly recommended. if you go during Sculptures by the sea and start in Bondi expect crowds.

Beautiful walk along the sea. We took the train from Central station and a bus from Bondi junction to the beach. You can see people going in a certain direction so it is easy to follow the route. There are some beautiful views along the way. We were able to see the sculptures along the route which was a very unique experience. It was windy and a mix of cool and hot so be prepared for both. Lots of water and sunscreen would be recommended. We only reached Tamarama beach because it was a bit late when we started. I would have loved to finish the walk. There are buses to take you back to Bondi beach or Bondi junction. It was very busy hence better to start early.

one of the best walks in sydney. If you like Sydney, like walking, and like beaches, you have to do this! Bring your cossie, there is a great sea pool/swimming beach at Clovelly in particular. Best eating is at Bronte, or at the end in Coogee. A tip - end in Clovelly, walk up the hill to the village to eat at the fantastic Darley street bistro (book a table), and then get the 339 back to central!

Unbelievable beauty. Take the bus to Bondi, walk to Coogee and have a well earned beer and steak at the Coogee Bay Hotel. Take the bus back to your hotel. The walk along the headlands surpasses anything we have seen before. Crashing surf, beach bodies and the blue sea all combine for a very memorable afternoon.

Stunning. I had a swim at Gordon's Bay then went for a walk around the bay. The view was stunning. The walkway is paved and goes up and down, but is not suitable for wheelchairs or strollers. Lots of joggers. A "wow" place to get some exercise or just a stroll. Parking at Gordon's Bay could be difficult in peak times. Definitely worth the effort though.
Bondi walk. just walk it, fantastic, although quite a bit of up and down but great views of the coastline and lovely houses !Plenty of places to sit and rest along the way
Beautiful walk. I was on holiday here in august, the weather wasnt great but the walk between coogee and bondi was beautiful, it was a bit expossed but still well worth the visit

Worth the walk. This is one coastal path you will not want to miss. You get to view Bondi from a great view point and then see equally, if not more beautiful beaches on the way to Coogee. Bronte Beach was breathtaking.
Overcrowded and windy!. Perhaps it was a mistake to go when the sculpture by the sea was in progress - hordes of people shuffling along. Not fun.

Very pleasant walk not too strenuous. Very picturesque, have been meaning to do this walk for some time and so glad I got around to doing this. Went by bus so did not have to walk the same route back but actually having done the walk this would not have been a problem as it is very pretty.
Excellent walk for the willing. long walk but excellent by the beach, just either go early or late, don't go when the sun is at its highest peak.

Walk. We walked along this path several times during our 2 week stay in Bondi Beach. It was relaxing and great excercise along the coastline. Many locals run, walk along it for their daily exercise. There's nothing more invigorating than being near the ocean. There are some steps so take care.

Great walk. Great views and call at Waverley cemetery on the way a great few hours walk ,quite and peaceful not many people walking so great walk coogie beach and town beautiful when there call at ex service men's club the food great and cheap

One of the many great walks in Sydney. There are many walks around sydney harbour and coastal walks and this is one of them. they are all worth doing. This one is nice in good weather. Usually windy as very exposed. the views are spectacular. Great photo opportunities for most of the walk. Nice places at both ends for coffee and a meal.

It's gods country. Busy busy busy. That's the only negative about this walk. I always enjoy it and as a Sydney person it's a favourite thing to do with friends. A must do for any traveller. If your in Sydney for Xmas making your own picnic and being by one of the beaches along this walk is a treat.
Beautiful walk. Beautiful walk, but would have loved to stop at a cafe or restaurant for a coffee with a view. There weren't many places to do that.

well worth the effort. The trail is well marked, you cannot get lost. Be aware that there is no shade, so take plenty of water and sunscreen. At the end of the trail in Coogee there is a nice pub just few meters from the beach.
Coastal walk Sydney. Beautiful. Great vista and you can grab a swim and a bight on the way. Nothing if relevance to dislike

Picturesque walk. We did this walk from Coogee to Bondi and it was simply stunning. It's a relatively easy walk with stop offs on the way for refreshments or toilet breaks. The coastline is beautiful and takes in some great views and lovely beaches. We particularly enjoyed Bondi beach, touristy it may be but well worth a visit.

Lovely views. Easy walk even for someone recovering from a slipped disc. There is no need to do the full walk which measures almost 6km, I did a walk fr Bondi to Clovelly and that was fantastic. There is a bus back to the city from Clovelly Beach. :)

Always a classic. This is probably the best walk in Sydney.. More food options in Bondi side but I MUCH prefer to start Bondi side and finish Bronte as this is more local and better place to picnic, or beach it.. Cool cafes and fish & chips.. Bronte also has nice cubicles for under cover lunch in a big park by the beach.. If you can walk in (October I think) you will see the famous sculptures by the sea which is amazing and features hundreds of modern sculptures along the walk// Tamarama beach is a good stop along this walk.. Just after you leave Bondi and reach the top you will have a great view from south bondi across the whole beach, this area was where gun turrets were erected originally for the russian scare in early 1900's and then the Japanese in WW2.. Bronte has a good bus service back to city & Bondi Junction..Enjoy this is a classic..
Wonderful views. Walking along this coastal track is brilliant. The views are excellent and the little stopping places along the way allow you to enjoy it even more !You need to do this walk !

Pack your walking shoes.. It's worth the walk…. I walked the Coogee to Bondi beach coastal trail in January and it was awesome. It was a fun way to see the coast of Australia and some of the more popular beaches along the way. There are stops for snacks, bathrooms, etc. We ended at Bondi and took a dip in the Bondi Icebergs pool for a dip. It was a fun way to end our walk.
beautiful walk - favorite activity in Sydney. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Sydney. It was absolutely beautiful and my favorite thing I did in the city.
Amazing welcome to Sidney. The first experience in Sydney. Wonderful landscapes for pictures! So many locals and tourists on the way. Superb!
Lovely views!. An amazing spot to spend a day. Whenever I visit this place I feel relaxed. It's clean and the surrounding is just beautiful.
Outdoors in a big city. I Loved being so close to the sea, being able to walk for a long way by the sea and all from a major city.

Well worth the effort. We were advised to do this walk in reverse by our hotel i:e from Coogee to Bondi and i agree it is much better this way. Coogee is super relaxed and sets the tone for your walk, We had a great great meal at the Pavilion restaurant to fuel us before we set off (will talk about that later). The views along the cliff tops are amazing, it's a 2hr walk including all the time we stopped for photo's which was a lot. Give yourself time and just take in the amzing sights and sound of the waves crashing againt cliffs beneath you. When you finally see Bondi as you turn the corner atop a super windy cliff it will take your breath away, its truly amazing, and as you walk pass the iceberg swimming club you will see the coolest swimming pool ever set right next to the sea with the waves lapping in. Awesome!!!

Great scenery but can be busy. A really nice walk, but probably better to do off-peak season or on weekdays as it can be very busy.A nice journey along the coast with a number of lookouts and beaches along the way.

Great Coastal Walk. We did the walk from Bondi to Coogee today and loved it so much we walked back again. Stunning views, a healthy walk, great coffee shops and the added bonus today of the Sculptures by the Sea exhibits being put into place. The return walk took us 5 hours and that was with plenty of stops for photos and coffee. Highly recommend this 8f you have the time in Sydney.
outstanding walk. a must do walk if you ever go to Sydney. Amazing landscapes and stunning beaches. Totally recommended.

what a great view. This was a nice distance to walk to really see a few beach and cove areas. We even saw a whale in the distance from one view. it's not too difficult and you can take your time and stop along the way. I think the best option is to start at Coogee and end in Bondi, so you can eat at one of the cafes when you finish. Or dive in the water if it's a warm day.

Easy coastal walk in the middle of "city" never hurt :). I went to Clovelly Beach and decided to walk along the shore and the small path which actually didn't know where it gonna lead me to. But luckily I decided to do it. It was a lovely mid day where the sun was shining not too bright where you might get a sunburn or something. Walked pass the cemetery where you can see white tombstones facing the ocean and you can see the cliffs and ocean beneath your feet. The breeze blows your face, quiet place, not too much noises like you can find in the city life. It was a nice feeling when you can see the ocean and how blue it is. I recommend you to do this and it can consider as an exercise with a bonus of the coastal view :)Happy exploring ^__^But make sure before doing it, go to the restroom to do your "stuff" and have foods and water in your bag (just incase).

A Must Do. Bondi is the Tourist Heavy, but stunning eastern beach. Start here with a cold beer at the IceBergs and walk your way around to the relative quiet of Bronte along one of the best coasts in the world
BEST part of the holiday. The walk is scenic the whole way - we loved it!!First bit to Bronte an easy walk, there after slightly more challenging but overall great experience
so beautiful. nothing beats nature at its finest, the sand the sea, the sky the birds, the people, what a great way to spend a day

Noce introduction to Sydney beaches. Very well designed path! It enables to explore several beaches with nice views. It is frequented without being overcrowded. easily accessible (ca 20' in normal times) by bus or taxi.

Free and beautiful, a budget traveler's favorite thing.. Spend a day at the beach, watch the surfters, check out graff and then take the beautiful walk to Coogee making scenic rest stops on the way. A great way to spend a day.

Sculpture by the Sea 2014. I'm a Bondi local with no affiliation with the exhibition, so I thought I'd post a little information about this imminent event based on my experiences : I've visited the exhibition the last several years and it is always great.In 2014 Sculpture by the Sea will run from 23 October to 9 November with open-air exhibits all along the Bondi to Tamarama section of the Bondi to Coogee coastal walk as well as more sculptures in Marks Park above the South Bondi headland.This is a fantastic experience and adds a special dimension to this already spectacular walk. The sculptures are a range of sizes and materials and are placed sympathetically/humorously/synergistically in the natural setting including several on Tamarama Beach. In 2013 the two-tonne, 1.5-metre diameter, transparent, water-filled acrylic sphere "Horizon" near Tamarama surf life saving club was amazing!Be warned that it will be extremely crowded during the weekends so a more relaxed experience can be had during the week or very early on the weekend. Best starting point is the southern end of Bondi Beach in Notts Avenue where you can buy an official guide. In my opinion the path is not really suited to prams or strollers when it's crowded. Hot tips for an enjoyable outing: - catch public transport to Bondi Beach as parking will be difficult- travel light but bring a hat, sunscreen, water, camera and patience- keep left on the path- smile !Google Sculpture by the Sea for more details.

Great coastal walk. I stayed at Crowne Plaza Coogee beach (great place) and made the walk from Coogee to Bondi.Nice views along the waY and a couple of nice swimming places to cool off as well.I liked Gordons Bay .BRING WATER and sunblock !!

Walking in style- combining sun tanning, sightseeing and exercise all in one. Stunning views, enjoyable walk (I'll rate it as "easy"), iconic beaches, easy to get to by public transport, easy to decide which beach to start (Bondi or Coogee)- whichever you'll end up in has cafes, restaurants and nice beach anyway. Normally, I'll start from Coogee, get a fresh large juice.... stopping at Bronte for sunbathing, swimming and falling asleep on the beach.... carry on to Bondi and have drinks/ dinner there! Take a bus back to Bondi Junction..... catch a train back home. Fun-filled day!
Beautiful. This is a great walk along the coast near Sydney! It's a must do if you like enjoying the scenery! It's about 3 hours, more or less, froom Coogee to Sydney. It's a nice place to visit!
Every (wo)man and their dog. Don't go expecting peace and quiet - this is the busiest walk ever! Beautiful views, but you won't have them to yourself.
Great Coastal Walk. Actually did the walk in the opposite direction and it was a treat from beginning to end. Enjoyed a swim in a pool on the way

Great Fitness , Good looking people and beautiful homes!. The coastal walk is a must do if you are an avid walker or if you have more then 2 weeks in Sydney.You'll see a lot of good looking fit people and some beautiful homes along the way.. not to mention the 4-5 different beaches you'll also see along the way...
Worth the effort. walked there and back took approx 3 hours great views. Couple go good pubs at Coogee for a beer & meal. Seemed further than 6kms being 12kms round trip but felt good to complete it

Beautiful Sites on the Coastal Walk. I would recommend doing this coastal walk to any visitors in the Sydney area. It took us about 3 hours to wonder from Bondi to Coogee. I think the trek was about 4 miles total. There are many beaches during the walk, and there are public bathrooms available at the beaches in between. To get there we took a train and then hopped on a bus, but you can also take a ferry from Watson's Bay and then catch a bus to Bondi. There are also several places to eat in either Bondi or Coogee. Make sure you spend some time in Waverley Cemetary. It's about halfway through the walk. The signs for the coastal walk are mostly easy to follow. I think we only got off course once, and quickly figured out when we came to a dead end.

Amazing way to enjoy Sydney. This walk has so much to offer. Easy to get public transport to/from the start and finish points. Sweeping views of the bays you walk past. Opportunities to stop for a drink.

Great Way to Spend an Afternoon. It took longer than I expected (2 hours?) but it was really fun. I'd recommend starting at Coogee and going to Bondi and rewarding yourself with an overpriced beach cocktail! Be sure to check out the graffiti wall at Bondi!
Make the time for this walk!. Lived in Sydney for 2 years. Don't miss this walk. Spectacular scenery. Early morning is best to avoid crowds.

A fabulous experience with wonderful vistas. This walk along the shore goes for (about) 5 miles. We started at Coogee and ended at Bondi. I'd call it a fairly easy walk, though certainly not a short one. There are some steep hills and stairs to climb at spots.The views of the beaches along the way are simply magnificent. On a crowded Sunday, the paved path is fairly crowed, but there are many opportunities to sit on benches, the laws, or the beach and people watch.There's plenty of water fountains and bathrooms along the way, as well as many opportunities for eating.It tends to get pretty crowded at Bondi, and getting a cab back to your hotel can be a bit of a challenge (one we solved by walking back - up a hill - to a spot above Bondi where the cabs seemed more plentifyl).Bring your camera and be ready to shoot some spectacular, picture post-card views.
Stunning. Beautiful walk, take it at your own pace and take in every sight. Something you could do over and over again.

Amazing views, nice walk.. I went Coogee to Bondi (north bound) and it was spectacular. Things to know -there's a lot of up and down as you go from the cliff fronts back into coves and inlets. And the temp changes a lot with cool wind in the exposed areas and warmth in the protected coves. Several places to stop for rest room breaks and places along the way to re-fill a water bottle. don't forget your camera, the views are amazing.I had planned to take a cab from hotel in the CBD, but my hotel suggested the bus - which was very easy and cheap. And it was easy to find a bus headed back to Circular Quay once I reached Bondi. Lots of weekend beach goers on the bus. If you're doing the whole thing I would suggest comfortable shoes. Lots of lunch options when you reach bondi (of the beach-front café type level) and a few other options along the way. Certainly worth several hours to check out.
Pleasant walk. The weather was cooling & love the sea breeze! Can see people surfing at bondi beach & running the trails along the coastal line.

A Picturesque Walk. Follow superb iconic Australian coastline as you walk between two of the most famous coastal suburbs in Australia. If you are fortunate enough to pick a day with nice weather it will be the highlight of your Sydney visit.You can have breakfast in Bondi and finish with lunch on the beach in Coogee. We were lucky enough to spot a dolphin frolicking while passing one of the smaller beaches along the walk.
Awesome. Brilliant on a nice day. The views are spectacular, can be a bit cold if there is a breeze and finding a park can use a huge chunk of your time.

Love this walk:). I live in Coogee and I do this walk often. Takes about an hour each way and there are some steep steps at the Coogee end which are a good work out on the way back. It's beautiful on a sunny Spring day, can be a bit windy at times but always gorgeous views. Best during the week as can get really busy on weekends. Take sunscreen!
Walk a must. Only regret was doing it so late that we couldn't explore coogee and had to hop the last bus out at 615. So gorgeous

Wonderful view!. We were blessed with great weather on the day of our walk. Didn't managed to walk to Coogee Beach as my mum was feeling quite tired (after our endless walking around Sydney). We decided to head back to Bondi Beach after a while but the view was enough to enthralled us. We saw quite a few joggers around. Definitely a place to visit. I will be back to finish my walk to Coogee Back.
Breathtaking views of the ocean. Breathtaking views of the ocean and so many different beaches enroute.We had only 4 hours for this but wished we were able to spend some more time here.
Beautiful. This is a beautiful walk, with amazing clifftop views of the ocean. The walkway is lovely and well maintained. Definitely worth an afternoon.
