A wonderful way. A nice and beautiful landscape. It takes us around 3 hours to finish the coastal walk. You can enjoy ice cream, fish and chip during your walking tour.Stop many times to take photos and selfie photos with your friends.Beautiful and wonderful

A walk to remember. I've been to this walk many times now. Most recently I took my friends who visited me in Sydney to this walk on the last day of their trip. Best day to do this walk is on a clear day with max temp under 28C. We were lucky that on the day we did the walk the temp was around 24C and there was a cool breeze all the way. To add to the stunning beaches, views and rock pools there was big pod of whales showing of their tricks not far from the coast.This is a must do walk for everyone who visits Sydney. Pack some food, water and wear appropriate clothing. There are taps available to fill water bottle along the way. Also there are few cafes to eat at the beaches on the walk way.

Wonderful way to exercise. It's a walk to remember, past rock escarpments, cemeteries, bowling clubs beaches and on and on at least 6 kms which at the end you will enjoy a lunch and coffee great way to spend a few hours, whale sighting a distinct possibility

A day out in the not so city. Camped at the heritage rooms Coodgee Bay hotel overlooking the beach and main drag what a spot of accommodation that is felt like royalty.Walked from coodgee to Bondi comfortable if you push it the calves will tighten :) the history and views priceless,we were lucky and got a good day early July,not to crowded alsoBreakfast is a number of choices,after,if you take a small backpack, a swim at the iconic beach,,,then the return is " buses if you choose" via Bondi Junction shopping mall Bondi bus drops on the main rd, so cut through the mall south for the connecting bus hold the wife`s hand though,there are some nice shops,Back to Coodge shower rest up with nibbles on the verandah,then a short walk for tea the pub or restaurants are many,We stayed Sat night Sun Night,allowing late check out Monday all well spent money will surly do this one again
A beautiful hike. We lucked out with a gorgeous day and the scenery proved unbeatable. Just being a part of the hiking, surfing Sydneysiders' atmosphere proved wonderful.

Amazing. This walk was longer than these old legs could handle, but we were able to do enough to get a beautiful view of the coastline and cliffs. There were benches strategically placed so even casual adventurers could enjoy the experience.

Best views of the Eastern Suburbs. the best views of the local beaches indeed as you take a gentle stroll from Bondi to Coogee. I prefer running it as it is one of the best pathways in the Eastern Suburbs for some fresh air!

Stunning seaside scenery. A great walk - we did Coogee to Bondi and back which was about 14 KM's.Took us 3.5 hrs.The coastal scenery is stunning and you walk through smaller beach locations along the way.There is plenty of opportunity to stop, sit in the sun on a beach, have lunch and generally relax.Great family day out.

Gorgeous!. This is an absolutely gorgeous walk! It's paved the whole way and easier and shorter than the Spit Bridge to Manly, which I would also recommend. You get to either beach by bus from downtown. Weekends are crowded, but not so much that you'll be unhappy. The views more than make up for the people walking with you. There are several beaches along the way if you would like to get some sun or swim a little. It's somewhat hilly, so I would recommend a bottle of water. This is a wonderful way to spend your morning, afternoon, or park at a beach along the way and spend the entire day!
Breathtaking. It was an amazing walk, the views just kept getting better and better. The surfers were fun to watch and the water just sparkled.

Beautiful views. Beautiful views of Sydney's best beaches, it's really difficult to decide which one to settle down in, I was really tempted to stay at each! Next time I will definitely spend an entire day, not just an afternoon. Definitely a must experience when in Sydney.

awesome scenery. The whole walk was amazing. Bring a water bottle especially if it is hot. It was 33 when we went and boy was it hot! Nice little quiet spots to rest at and just enjoy the spectacular scenery. The cemetery from the early 1900s was surreal but I wouldn't like to be there at night. The walk took roughly 2 hours - a bit more with the stops due to the heat and intense sun. There are pools and beaches one can stop at so a great idea to bring your bathers and a towel. The water was still too cold though in last September.

Lovely Walk. The Bondi to Coogee coastal walk features beautiful views, lovely beaches and rock pools along the way. It's an easy walk anyone can do, take your time enjoy the views and take some pictures along the way!

Great walk. We walked the section from Bondi to the next beach along. The view is spectacular, beaches are gorgeous. Wanted to keep walking but it was at the end of the day and getting late! This is a MUST for anyone visiting Sydney.
lovely beach. a day walk here is great! nice view and the the air is really fresh. you dont need to go too far to to enjoy nature's gift will go back here
Amazing view. The Bondi to Coogee walk features stunning views, beaches, parks, cliffs, bays and rock pools. Love it
Great way to see Sydney. This walk is very easy to do and allows you to see some of Sydney's spectacular beaches. This would be a must do on your list.

Beautiful morning or afternoon walk along the beaches. The Bondi to Coogee walk is popular with locals and visitors for a good reason... Really accessible and absolutely stunning. Well worth the effort.
must do walk. Fantastic walk, with the added bonus of fantastic food at the renovated Pavilion Pub in Coogee - not to be missed!

Amazing!. Great way to see the hidden beaches between Bondi and Coogee. The walk took us about 2 hours, only stopping for photos. We will definitely be going to Tamarama Beach for a beach day. Not as big and hectic as Bondi and Coogee. The walk is up and down - there are stairs, but not too many and the walk is a great way to keep fit. Clovelly Beach and Gordons Bay are great for snorkelling. The walk finished in Coogee and on the day we did the walk, Coogee Beach was very busy - worse than Bondi. Will definitely do the walk again but maybe in the opposite direction, from Coogee to Bondi.
Start from Bronte -- Bring Picnic supplies. Make sure to start the walk from Bronte Beach and bring picnic supplied to Bronte. They have free barbecues. There are some fantastic views along the walk.
Bondi to Coogee costal walk. If you like walk and like the sea this is the place to go.In a nice and sunny day is the best!If you are lucky you may also be able to see some whales.Enjoy

Fabulous insight into coast of Sydney. Put on your good walking sneakers or whatever you call them and begin a beautiful coast from Bondi beach to Coogee. Along the way you can grab a drink. Start early and enjoy some lunch in Coogee or better bring along a picnic lunch. The scenery is worth all your exertion. Take a break and admire the beauty from a bench or rock along the way. I

Great Coastal Walk. Have lunch at Bondi Beach and walk along the paved/concreted path to Bronte Beach where there are many cafes to stop for coffee or a milkshake. Then you can continue on the path to Coogee and watch the sun set while having a drink. Best time to go is when Sculptures by the Sea is on at the end of October/beginning of November - join the crowds for the walk from Bondi to Tamarama.
Stunning as always.. A great walk to do on a trip to Sydney. Get the bus to Bondi Beach and just head south and keep going until you get to Coogee. Have some lunch and a milkshake when you get there!
Amazing. I lived in bondi and at least once a week I would do this walk. Never gets boring. Such great views and if your into your fitness it's a well used route for running
world famous Bondi Beach. Bondi Beach is quite beautiful during the summer. walk around, take pictures, eat and just enjoy the beach..! Take me back to Bondi

Amazing walk, don't do it on a sunny Sunday morning!. This is a world class walk across the cliffs with amazing views as you go. On a sunny day the water is a clear turquoise and on a cloudy day it's still magnificent, so you can't go wrong. Word of warning, on a sunny Sunday morning this walk is crowded and almost too busy. It's hard to get past the dog walkers and the big groups of people out to do the walk. So try to find a less busy time so you can enjoy it properly.

nice and peaceful, scenic. I did this alone, nice peaceful and lovely views. Do not do in midday heat you will suffer. It is a walk and it is the beach. Plenty of water sots and bbq grills by the beach. Experience

If you have the time. If you have the time, I would certainly give this walk a go. It has amazing scenary but not sure if you need to walk the entire way to Coogee. We walked to the next beach after Bondi and it was great although the stairs were a work out! Took lots of pictures and it was a great morning out. Make sure to wear good shoes and be ready to deal with the heavy crowds that walk this daily.
Good walk in the morning and after noon. Nice views and fresh airbit cold in the morning at this time of the yearYou can syop in tamarama beach and have a drink

Stunning!. A stunning walk amongst the coves and beaches of eastern Sydney. Fantastic when Sculpture By The Sea is on at the end of the year. And make sure you have some fish'n'chips along the way - there are a few fantastic cafes in Bronte.

Sydney's true beauty. I live here and often do this fabulous walk. Halfway is Clovelly if you do not want to do the whole Bondi to Coogee. It is quite hilly with stairs and good shoes help. There are a few new water stations and Bronte is good for coffee. Enjoy the breeze and the waves! Welcome to Sydney!
Bondi Beach Beautiful. Easy to get to by bus. Very Scenic. Great place to just sit and watch the surfers and get your feet wet.

Coastal Walk. This is a very pleasant and not too taxing walk along a lovely part of the Sydney coastline. Coogee and some of the other inlets and bays are really beautiful and obviously Bondi is a surfers paradise. There are some lovely little cafe's along the way so plenty of opportunity to take a rest; soak in the scenery and of course have a cool [or hot if you prefer] drink. Some of the bays remind me a little of Cornwall but Bondi's golden beach is something else, although the seaside shops and amusement arcades do remind you of some of the tackier parts of UK beach resorts, but Blackpool in the sun would be to undersell what is a lovely place.

A must do!. This is one of Sydney's great walks! Not only are you bound to be drenched in sunshine when you walk it and catch stunning views of the beautifully rugged coast line, and hear the amazing raucous of the crashing waves and get fit and and and! Seriously, this one of the things that you will remember about your travels to Sydney for a long time to come. And I guarantee you will want to seek out a real estate agent soon after you finish, just to make a cheeky inquiry as to what one of the beautiful homes you will pass actually costs, because you will want to move here :-).

A 'must do' in Sydney!. This walk is so beautiful and scenic with the most amazing views of the sea from the coast. The day we did the walk the weather was beautiful but I'm sure it would be fantastic whatever the weather. Just don't forget to bring a camera!!

Spectacular vista. We loved watching the surfers, the 50 meter sea water pool with the surf crashing in to it! We had brunch at Bronte beach. Very friendly staff and great food. Bondi was a bit cool so we bought Bondi Hoodies as a souvenir. A must to do when visiting Sydney.

Very relaxing & scenic walk. Nice walk along the coastal but remember to bring a water bottle to hydrate yourself. No worries about water as there are filtered water kiosk along to refill it. Enjoy and you might be lucky to catch a glimpse or 2 of the whales & dolphins during the migration season

Really what Sydney is about.. We chose an amazing day with calm breezes, mild temperature and blue skys. Even on a weekday we found it busy but if you leave from Bondi, crowds drop off by Tamarama. Easy walking, great trail, pathways and wooden bridge/walking structures. Directions could be abit better in some parts of some bays to pick up the trail again.We carried water and lunch and I'd recommend this as water is scarce on the track.Public transport to and from the beaches is easy for visitors and regular so it can be a smooth journey the whole way. I wouldn't like to walk it when really windy or really hot but thoroughly enjoyed it on a lovely spring day.
Great Views. Perfect weather makes for a great walk. Also great when sculptures by the sea is on. Should prob do it more considering I don't live that far away from it

Fabulous shoreline stroll. Follow the well maintained route above the cliffs linking several spectacular beaches. Plenty of cafes for a pit stop at both Bondi and Bronte. Go all the way to Coogee, past the world's best located cemetery. Simply one of the best short excursions in the city. Do it!

My daily weekend treat. A great coastal walk with some stops and mild slopes. Walk at your own pace. It's heaven on earth to walk a pathway hugged by the rocks with a view to die for. Pacific Ocean in all its splendour. Water hues are aquamarine, royal blue, turquoise and more besides. Been walking this path for many years and it never ceases to amaze.

Beautiful!. This walk is always my highlight of a trip to Sydney. No matter what the weather, it delivers! It showcases the beauty and the ferociousness of the sea. With the warmer weather, it is very busy with joggers scooting past, but people are always friendly when in the company of nature. For those of us whoa re a bit more sedate, start at Bondi, stop for a leisurely coffee at Bronte and wander back - allow 2 hours for this!

A must do walk especially if you have overseas visitors. A great way to show of Sydney beaches and coastline while getting some exercise. Great to do on your own or take visitors. We often finish with fish and chips on the beach. Cant beat it.
Great views. The best way to see our coast line while getting some exercise, plenty of opportunities to grab a good coffee too!
Great Coastal Walk. Amazing Scenery the entire way. Lots of great beaches and places to explore. Great food and pubs on either end and a few in the middle.
Stunning. Great seaside walk in Sydney eastern burbs, great in any weather. Love walking it on a rainy stormy winters day

Sydney people should do it too . It is impressive that the council has such a good quality walk with native shrubs all along. So the native birds can be heard, and the views of course are sensational. A great activity, from someone who lives in the suburbs.

Stunning Coastal Views. We did the walk at sunset, gorgeous views. Its mesmerising watching the waves crashing on the rocks, and the little harbours are quaint and picturesque. Allow 2 hours to do it at a leisurely pace.

Fabulous Walk. An absolute must do when in Sydney. Great way to visit the different beaches, enjoy great views and do a little exercise, all at the same time. The walk is about 6km long and took us slightly more than 2 hours (strolling and stopping for photos). It is a relatively easy walk, although at some points you will need to climb (stairs or slopes) a little.

Amazing walk with fantastic views. I thoroughly enjoyed this walk, was a perfect way to soak up the sun, see some lovely beaches along the way with amazing views. If I could do this walk daily I probably would, very jealous of all those who have this one there doorstep.
Great walk. Very nice walk, nice opportunity to get to see different beaches less busy than bondi beach.Would recomand, very pleasant while sunny

Fabulous as always. Done this walk multiple times! Wonderful on a nice day, take some water with you and good shoes. Though I did do it in flip flops. Great views, stunning coastal line. Beautiful beaches. Takes about 75mins from bondi to coogee without stopping.
An absolute 'must do' in Sydney. I do this walk every time I visit Sydney and I never tire of it. Have seen whales, pods of dolphins, famous and just plain'beautiful people'!
Beautiful. It was winter there and a bit chilly. But, beautiful and not crowded. We took the city tour bus to the beach and spent about an hour walking around before getting on the next bus.
What views. Excellent walk, need a fair degree of fitness as some of the stairs are steep. Views are amazing. Look out for the perfect picture opportunity at the overhanging rock.

awesome views. A great way to exercise whilst taking in the terrific sights . Uphill and down one gets to see a number of beaches and the clifftops are amazing. One can walk , run or jog depending on your preference.

Truly fantastic walk, a must in a sunny day. What a beautiful walk this is! We did it from Coogee to Bondi. You walk by beautiful beaches, fantastic creeks, an extraordinary cemetry and plenty of amazing houses. It takes between one to two hours including several stops to take pictures. You'll find a few fountains to drink water along the way but not many coffee places. Bondi beach is enormous, and there's plenty of cafes and small restaurants to eat there. I would pick this walk up as one of the things to do in Sydney even if you have just one or two days to spend there.
Excellent walk with good views. Well worth doing this walk, some amazing views! Takes around 2.5 hours depending in your pace. Nice places for photographs along the way too

Stunning. It's easy to see why traveller's from overseas think Australia is so beautiful when you do this walk. Absolutely stunning!!! Blue blue ocean against jagged cliff faces. One of the best things to do in Sydney.

Great Sydney 'thing to do'. The walk from Bondi to Coogee beach is well worth taking the time to do. From busy international Bondi you go over the headland and onto what is mostly a boardwalk all the way to Coogee, passing numerous other beaches along the way. You get to see a bunch of more laid back 'locals' suburbs and also the opportunity to spot the rich and famous as its a favourite activity for local and visiting celebs alike. You'll pass what must be the most scenic cemetery in the world and maybe get to see whales and dolphins along the way.We went with our 5 year old and at 6km it could be a bit far. But with a bit of imagination there is plenty to keep them interested along the way (and the promise of an ice cream at the end helps!)
Cliff top clamber. Well worth doing, once you get up in the view your feet just keep walking. Bay to bay it was a great way to explore the eastern suburbs and get a feel for Sydney on a Sunday.
Always good fun and viewing. One of Sydney's highlights. Pleasant walk but always busy. Great views. Great cafés at either end. Imbibe the Sydney atmosphere

costal walk. Most beautiful walk, especially when sculptors by the sea is on, but just beautiful to do anytime, take a picnic lunch and you can stop and have lunch where and when you like, easy to get to via bus from Bondi Junction

Don't miss it, just do it!. Stayed in Coogee because of work and did the walk in the early morning, hoping to see some dolphins, whales and penguins. I was apparently too late for the marine life action (7 am), but enjoyed this path with its breath-taking views tremendously. Take some money and your swimmers, so you can stop along the way for a coffee and early morning swim.Am sure that this walk is amazing anytime of day and in any kind of weather. The views will never bore you!

Great walk!. The costal walk from Bondi to Coogee beach is really amazing...the view onto the seaside and as well onto the costal rocks is very great! There are two or three little/middle beaches between and lots other opportunities to rest, so that this walk can be done without any stress.
Fantastic. Did this walk on the weekend fantastic with great views & stopping points along the way to take great photos. highly recommend especially if you have visitors in town.

Incredible Views of the Coastline. Get away from the bustle of central Sydney, get out to Bondi Beach, and take in the spectacular ocean scenery along the coastal walk from Bondi to Coogee. The pleasant, easy walk is worthwhile as it rewards you with beautiful views of the water, the rocky coastline, and a different perspective of Bondi main beach and Tamarama beach. Be sure to take your camera. If you're not up to walk all the way back, you can take a bus back to Bondi on the road above Tamarama beach.

Spectacular views. Absolutely breath-taking views along this path. Have done on a number of occasions and would highly recommend anyone visiting Bondi to have a wonder. It does get very busy on weekends so if crowds aren't your thing, do later on in the day or week day. Some lovely coffee shops along the way. Keep an eye out of for whales and dolphins, depending on the time of the year.

Best first Impression of Australia. My friend and I took a 30 min bus trip from the sydney harbor to do the walk. Easy to find (walk to the right of Bondi beach and the walk begins near the rocks) Follow the walkway along the cliffs for breathtaking views and plenty of places to sit on the edge and enjoy the breeze. So glad we did this walk. Perfect cheap way to experience Bondi!

Absolutely Breathtaking!. Our daughter lived in Coogee for a few months and told us we just had to do this walk. We took her advice and did it on a cool and overcast late evening -- despite the weather, it was still stunning. We enjoyed it so much that we went back to do it again 2 days later, even though we only had 4 days in Sydney. The path is very well maintained and has many benches to rest on the way, if needed. You will stop on the way just to take in the beautiful views! You pass several coves and beaches on the walk and see so many interesting things. I can't recommend this more highly! DO IT!
Great views...and exercise. Must be the best city beach walk in the world. Start early to see the sunrise. Good coffee shops along the way.

It's just the real sydney. Sydneysiders do this all the time. Forget the tourist stuff put on your shorts, vest and trainers and walk stopping at the end for a latte - people watching and listening at its best - and the scenery and walk just great

A walk well worth the walk. Some of the best walks are along the coast line of the eastern suburbs in Sydney. Bondi to Coogee is no exception. Sandstone cliffs, stunning houses and amazing views. The path is very wide in most parts and in good condition given the traffic it receives. Great for fitness people as there are fitness stations along the way to do a workout.
Nice. Well kept beaches.Nice coffee shops and some nice restaurants.Again--public transport easy to catch

Nice beach views. Good for: Healthy walks and jogs. On cheeky sides, if you like to perving on early morning joggers and surfers then this is a good site too.Events: There are always something happening on week end. We were there Sunday 14/09/14 and they got the kite event.This is also an icon for TV series Bondi RescueNot bad for showing tourists friends since its free but have to pay metered parking.

Spectacular walk. I walked from Bondi Beach to Coogee Beach and back in early June of 2014. It was an easy train and bus ride from downtown Sydney and the walk, including an enjoyable lunch at Coogee, took about 3 hours. The views are breathtaking and the walk relatively easy. It was a great way to spend a morning and I highly recommend it.

Perfect walk for a sunny but not too hot day. Liked the way you go from one beach to another, crossing different landscapes and enjoying the breathtaking views. The walk is medium and is really enjoyable on a sunny day, even with few clouds. Probably even better when not too hot. You can have some break and snacks at Bronte beach which is pretty good.
B2B - Best way to start a day. Beautiful views - the best way to start or finish a day. Walk the coast via Bondi Tama & Bronte beaches.

Great walk along the coastline. I actually prefer to do the "Coogee to Bondi" walk, mainly because I used to live in Coogee. Anyway, It's a great way to spend a weekend morning or afternoon. The view is great and you great some exercise and fresh air. Then of course, you've earned yourself a visit to the local fish n chip shop by Bondi beach!
Bondi. SPEEDS CAFE good food and coffee, north bondi nex to RSL.Trips was via bondi junction which has good shopping at Westfield new and modern.

Surprising!. Around every corner awaited a new surprising beach, all different from each other. Walked from Coogee to Bondi beach. It has some height differences so not handy for disabled people (e.g. crutches or wheelchair).

A must visit Coastal walk. One of the most beautiful and scenic walks. Awesome walking trails and equally good places to sit at the lookout points in between and look at the huge sea....No matter how much short you are on your time, this place is a must visit. Easily accessible with ample of buses from the Sydney CBD and Kings cross. The bus service is really good and it drops you right in front of the Bondi beach and cafes. During the walk, there are other beaches as well which fall in between. So, you can stop at those beaches and return, in case it is not feasible for you to go up til Cogee beach.

Scenery with your exercise. Bondi Beach may be as well known as Copacabana and Ipanema, but the beach and the water are cleaner... Don't just stop there - the walk along the cliffs to Coogee is well worth it. Sandstone cliffs drop into the ocean, waves crash into the shore, and around each headland is a beach as nice as Bondi and often clearer and more space. Surfers have four beaches to choose from, Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte and Coogee, all with their own surf conditions. For the fit, try running, there are enough hills and steps to challenge, and the track is frequented by locals. for the culture buffs, try the walk in October to coincide with Sculpture by the Sea, when the walk between Bondi and Tamarama is dotted with sculptures by local and international artists presenting works of whimsy and beauty. On a winters' day it's bluff and blustery, on a summer's day, take your "togs" swimming costume and cool off at any stage on one of the beaches - but beware of the rips if you're not experienced; many an innocent has needed to be rescued because they went swimming away from the flags.

Amazing Views, must do in Sydney!. No matter how short your time is in Sydney, if the weather cooperates this is a must do! The views are amazing at every turn, and it is so cool to see the surfers out catching their waves. We stopped at a little cafe along the way and had lunch and beers - very easy and convenient. I would highly recommend this to any visitor in Sydney - young or old. The walk didn't take us long at all, maybe a few hours both ways including lunch. Must do!

people live like this..?. whats not to like..? A beautiful 30 - 40 min coastal walk where one can walk along & view houses by the ocean & beaches..and just when it feels like you need one there are good cafes at bronte beach..

Fresh air and exercise!. You could easily spend all day hiking this very easy-to-follow trail if you stopped for a dip at the various little beaches and dropped in at the cafes along the way. The views are spectacular and each little cove has its own unique character. If you walk it non-stop, you'll cover the distance in 3-4 hours but you need to be reasonably fit as there's lots of up and down, some of it fairly steep, though always on a well maintained paved surface. There are very regular bus links back to central Sydney from either end that take aout 40 minutes to cover the distance.
Beautiful walk!. Although we went in winter it was a beautiful day. Lovely walk to do and lots of places to stop for a picnic on the way which I would recommend.

all four seasons in one 5 km walk. We set out on an early spring day and had a bit of everything: sun, cold wind, rain...but the views made the jackets on/hoods up/ jackets off routine worth it. The cliffs from Bondi to Bronte make for a stunning beginning. Finish your walk at the Coogee Pavillion just recently redone as a dining establishment you shouldn't miss. Cool vibe and crazy good food. As with most public spaces in Sydney, there are water bottle refilling stations along the way. Use them as fountains or carry your own bottle. There are "toilets" as they say at some of the beaches which is a nice convenience. But take your camera and go. It's worth the trip. We took a bus from the CBD which way super easy.
Spectacular coastline. A great workout and relatively easy walk. Some stairs are a little steep for an older person or young child.

Nice view!. Brilliant walk with superb views, a must go for all travellers in Sydney when the weather is good. If you do not have enough time to walk all the way to coogee, just stop at Bronte and take a bus back.

Nice walk, not strenuous, v crowded. Good views. Good variety in walk - wooded bits, little coves with cute boats, big beaches, some steps, windswept rocky bits. Very crowded, full of people. good photo ops. Gorgeous on a sunny day. Very accessible, some steps though, smooth path all the way.

At leisure do it in two parts! Bondi to Bronte and Bronte to Coogee. The Bondi to Coogee walk begins at South end of Bondi Beach near the Iceberg Club, there is a board walk along the cliff, ramblers rushing both ways and no sound from their feet is audible as the mighty ocean waves break into the rocks. As one walks on the elevated path, there are stunning views of the Bondi Beach, Tamarama to Bronte is a smaller walk ( 700 meters) One can take the steps to reach the Bronte Beach or can go down to Tamarama Beach and walk along it. By the time we reached Bronte it was twilight so we had to call it a day and decided to come another day for the rest of the walk. On a later day we started at Bronte, read more about it in my blog- www.joyfultravelpie.com.

Fantastic walk. Great walk, but just be careful where you park in Bondi, the foreshore carpark was closed and I had to park in a back street. I was ten minutes past the expirey on my meter and copped a $99 fine. NOT tourist friendly
Nice walk. Nice walk, wish parts were closer to the ocean though. Worth the walk to see all the beaches in between
Just do it. Worth doing, go to Bondi and then around the walk, its busy, don;t go during the hot summer months (Dec,Jan,Feb) , otherwise the scenery its worth it
Beautiful scenery. A lovely, if busy, coastal walk. Beautiful views over the ocean with many cafes and restaurants to break your journey.
best beach walk. Its about a 40 minute walk along Sydney's famous iconic beaches. Great cafes at the end, or a dip in the ocean.
beautiful walk. Spectacular, fairly easy walk along the cliff top paths,plenty views and stops along the way in the towns along the coast.

How lucky are we Aussies?. Free! Breathtaking (the views and, ok, maybe the walk too depending on your pace!) and accessible to all. Even if you only walk a little of it, give it a go one sunny Sydney morning and admire the scenery and your fellow walkers and jiggers etc

If the suns out and you have the stamina do it !. Take your camera because you'll not be able to stop yourself from gazing with amazement at the most beautiful ocean and coastal views you;ll ever see. There are a lot of stairs and it is a long walk but you can break it during the walk at various cafes or kiosks along the way. Or just sit on a rock or bench and breath in the freshest sea air imaginable. Wonderful experience +++++
One of the best sights of Sydney!. Easy to follow, great route - just don't go in winter! This walk is especially great when Sculptures by the Sea is running!
Great. Even in the windy weather this walk was fab...amazing rock formations, great surprises round every corner... Took us around 3-4 hours but we stopped for lunch at clovelly ...
Nice Beach walk. Clean Water...good water sports with safety too....nice crowd and have excellent surroundings to give a perfect picture

Bring your walking shoes. This is a must do!If the weather's right, bring your walking shoes and your camera and wander the coast to your heart's delight.Watch out for the hot Australian Sun though, it's stinger than it is where you come from....
Beautiful walk. Really nice thing to do with friends or family in a sunny day or not! A little bit tough, about 2 hours walk...but believe me, it worth. Stunning views!!

Very pleasant.. We walked from Coogee to Bondi, then took a taxi back. It's very peaceful and relatively easy. You are walking on a paved path all the way. Good views of the ocean. It is quite a walk and you may have to climb some stairs, depending.

Beautiful, relaxing and inspiring!. What a great job has been done refurbishing this natural path between two iconic Sydney beaches. The views are amazing, and I'm not just talking about the amazing scenery;) Certainly one of the must do activities for visitors and locals alike. Particularly great for running.
great pics. If you want awesome view and pictures to take home take this walk. BEWARE it can be windy with a lot of staircases
SYDNEY COASTAL WALKS TO DO. Walking from Bondi beach to Coogee is one of the most spectacular walks to do. The uninterrupted views, rock formations and coastal properties are to be seen.

Can be surprises - even in the rain :-). Last weekend was visiting fam in Tamarama and we did the walk through to Bronte - had a 4 hour lunch at one of the several great cafés tucked in at the sheltered southern end of Bronte beach while it rained lightly. They brought our little dog a bowl of water and she made lots of friends :-) you can't beat the feel of the sea crashing onto the rocks, the amazing little sandy beaches, and the surprising green down to the water in places. Walking back when there was a break in the rain we stopped at a very small Tamarama beach (with a growing crowd) to watch a love struck dude scratch a big "marry me" in the sand...then a young lady walked around the cliff top and looked down - and the whole beach erupted in cheering and clapping as she ran down the stairs, across the grass, onto the sand and the big hug :-)And then....without a word of a lie - a rainbow. Gold.

Great way to get exercise with exciting views and exposure to the best coffee. This walk is so much more stimulating than a boring gym, the street or the local park. Every few metres brings a different view and experience. At each end are great cafes and restaurants and there is plenty of local parking if you do not live locally

Not overrated, completely worth it!!. It's a decent distance that you can cover in 2, 2.5 hours and enjoy the scenes in that time as well. Best way to do it - plan a little ahead - check the weather forecast a night before for the next morning. Start the walk from Coogee instead of bondi (the sign boards at coogee will get you on the walking trail)Start the walk around 9 ish after a little morning snack so that you reach bondi just in time for brunch. Also, bondi has some great options for food, hence the advantage of doing it from coogee to bondi.I ate my lunch at this really well located cafe in the icebergs club, called the icebergs terrace cafe. The food tasted even better after the coastal walk, and I would definitely recommend that place!!
a great walk. We did it in reverse. Had a nice lunch at Coogee beach. The views on the walk were Brilliant! Easy bus ride back to downtown Syndney.

A Roaring Beach With Amazing Scenery. Visiting Bondi Beach was a recommendation of my Australian friend who lives in Sydney. She gave us a right recommendation. My husband and I was attracted to the dynamic and beautiful scenery. We walked along the beach for an hour and took a rest at a Cafe and enjoyed cafe late. Please look at my photos, and then you'll see how wonderful this beach is.

My regular walk - lucky me!. I live locally, so when the sun is shining there's no better place to take the dog for a walk and to get myself a little fresh air and exercise! Its got the most gorgeous views and plenty of places to stop along the way for a stretch or to grab a cup of coffee. My favourite times to go are earlyish in the morning or during the week as it gets pretty packed on the weekend.

A good way to experience nature and amazing rock formations in almost inner Sydney.. This walk is best done early in the day as it is quite exposed to heat and wind. Be sure to arm yourself with water, but if you forget, there are lots of charming coffee shops en route. Heading out of Bondi there is a bit of a climb, but quite manageable. You will go past the Bondi sea pool there, where you will see swimmers enjoying the experience of ocean water in a pool environment, and maybe enjoy a swim yourself! The more ragged parts of the walk are fenced off for safety, but there are plenty of places where you can walk right along the cliff top. Sturdy shoes are a good idea. There are often runners doing their thing along the path, but there's plenty of room.The next bay is Tamarama, and it's easy to stop for a paddle here as well. The path continues past the surf club and on the Bronte. Bronte is a good spot for a snack or a coffee. A few iinteresting shops there too. Coming out of Bronte you walk past the Waverley cemetery, a wonderful last resting place with a fantastic view. Throughout the walk there are several areas with steps, but not too many. Obey the road rules and keep left to avoid bumps and collisions! Clovelly Beach, like the others on the path, provides an opportunity for an ocean swim. As always, obey the surf life-savers to be safe. Again coffee shops! Arriving at Coogee, you will be surprised at how quickly the time has passed, unless you stopped at every bay, as I did! Allow between 3 and 6 hours, depending how many photos you take of the outstanding scenery, and how many shopping stops you make!If you run short of time, there are buses from each bay for a quick getaway, but it is such a nice part of Sydney, that you probably want to make a day of it anyway.
My Haven. My haven - my home - Coogee to Bondi. I've travelled the world and will always return to this homeland wonderland. It's what dreams are made of. Just MAGNIFICENT!
A bit of nature in the city. This is something special - especially when there is a light breeze; sun shining from above and whales out to sea.One cannot believe they are in the city.
nice walk. very senic walk good exesise also dood for swim and bbq on the beach bronte or tamarama nice and clean voda tu swim

the best things in life are free. Great walk any day - just be prepared for the day's weather.Wear comfortable shoes for a long stroll.Stop for a swim, coffee or just to breathe the fresh salty air.Run/Jog early (very early), it gets busy with the locals.It's also the location for a major open air art exhibition in summer .....

An Energetic Walk. This walk follows the coastline from Bondi to Coogee and goes past some very pretty bays and beaches. The walk is very much up and down so it gives you a good work out especially if you are out of condition.

Scenic walk - a must for locals and tourists. I'm a Sydneysider and do this walk frequently. It's pretty and and the walk is paved quite nicely and there is some little cafes along the walk if you decide you need a bite to eat. I would recommend to not do this walk after sunset though as some areas are not well lit. Other than that - highly recommended.

Sensational views. One of my favourite walks in Sydney. This walk is around 5 kilometres in length but is a good workout with steps without being too challenging. This walk passes a number a beaches.bay's and cliff tops and includes many stops for refreshments and amenities. Great coastal views. Good people watching. Busy on weekends.
Great walk. It's a really beautiful walk with lovely Ocean Views....Coogee & Bondi also have many great places to eat....

Breathtaking. The past few weeks have had rare sunny days but on this one the sky was a bright sunny blue and the sea reflecting the calm. perfect day for Bondi to Coogee especially since its a week day. If you take this path on weekends, especially in summer, you will need to negotiate your way past the thousands that flock to take advantage of fresh air, wonderful views and exercise. Try to visit midweek when it is less travelled.I began the path at the North end of Bondi Beach early in the morning. A level 1 km walk on the promenade of Bondi Beach will bring you to your first set of stairs to the road leading down to the beginning of the coastal track. It is possible to short cut through Icebergs and experience the panoramic and iconic view of Bondi Beach. The path meanders around, skirting a rock platform and reaches the next set of stairs at the top of which you will be able to see down the coast line and the majestic cliffs along the coast. Continue on following the path to Tamarama and stop for a drink or continue on to Bronte by either following the road or once again taking a short cut across the park at Tamarama. You can not get lost on this walk. Once you reach Bronte you have a choice of lots of great cafes or you can just sit on the beach or in the Park and rest up for the return to BondiTake sunscreen and water. There is no shade.
Great Walk. Great walk anytime of year. Ideally suited from Solo runners to young families. Allow up to 2 hours if leisurely walking or up to 1 hour if jogging.

Don't miss this spectacular walk 5 of Sydney's best beaches.. A great stretch of the legs, wander past some of the jewels in Sydney's crown. Check out the surf and the lifesavers at famous Bondi. Take in the volleyball at Tamarrama, where the beautiful bodies bake. Continue on to breaky at Bronte and then walk it off towards glorious Gordon's Bay and sparkling Coogee. Take a dip and if you are really after the exercise, return trip. Watch out for whales along the way between June and August. As a local I do it twice a week. It never gets old.

Great walk. Took the bus from Circular Quay to Coogee - walked the coastal walk to Bondi Beach - lovely warm day, took us 2 hrs with time to admire the views - a must do but need to have some level of fitness - can do a shorter version - lovely swimming pools along the way for wheelchair access.
Do not miss this walk on a sunny day!!. So picturesque and such a great walk! Great for exercise and great for a casual stroll. Stop at a couple of sneaky pubs along the way too! A must do!!

One of the best ocean walks Ive done. Have breakfast at Bondi Beach, then take the trail south to Bronte or even further. My the time you reach bronte Im sure you will need some morning tea so stop for a refreshment. Dnt forget your camera.
beach walk. fabulous coastal walk along the cliff edge ,great views out to sea .coogee is cool for food and drink

Full of drunk kids and doped up surfers. The walk in itself is pleasant but watch out for all the joggers and cyclists. The scenery is beautiful. We found that many of the youth of Australia run wild and meet up along walking trails, parks and beaches. The walk would be much better if the police would patrol the path. We even witnessed a scuffle between two drunk boys.
hero"s hike. Walk along the rough coast line from either end and time it with the bus schedule to take you back home. Take your camera! Wonderous views the path!

Spectacular!. Wow! We walked this path during a week that Sydney experienced some of its worst winter rain storms and loved it. The surf was spectacular and even though we had to abandon the walk due to an incoming storm about 2/3 of the way it was one of our most memorable activities. We even returned again on a hot sunny day a few weeks later before leaving the country. This time the beaches were busy and the surfers kept us entertained. Enjoy!

wonderful time walking from Bondi to Bronte. Beautiful scenery, also amazing rock formations where the ocean has hollowed out large pieces of the rock formations. A short train/bus ride from Sydney, my wife and I actually went to Bondi and walked to Bronte beach and back during a long layover while connecting between flights at the Sydney airport.

Great Walk!. We were told by a friend about how lovely this walk was but I wasn't expecting the incredible views that we had, the whole way along! It was a great walk but I should have worn more practice shoes ! Runners/sneakers(or whatever else you may call them) would be a smart idea, I only had my thongs (flip flops) and I couldn't wait to sink my feet into the sand at Bondi! Being late August it wasn't swimming weather at Bondi but there were lots of people out surfing along the way!

Fantastic View along the coastal. If you have time to spare it is worth it to walk from coogee beach to bondi beach. I took 3 hrs to walk leisurely and took a lot of fantastic view along the coast. The view in the evening was great.

Best views in town. Dont think about it just do it. Pick a sunny day and you will be rewarded with some of the best views in Sydney. A leisurely hour stroll. Top it all off by stopping at iceburgs for lunch at Bondi....perfect!

Incredible view of the sea. We walked from Bronte to Bondi on a sunny day in August and wow, the view was SPECTACULAR. We are moderately fit and it took us around 35-40 min. Definitely wear sensible shoes. The view of Bondi Beach as you approach from the walking path is unforgettable. Highly recommended.
Must do!. A Must do when visiting Sydney, brilliant way to see some of the Sydney beaches. Also great for a run on a weekend :) but not for strollers
Nice little run. I only went as far as Bronte but I used this circuit for my morning runs whilst I was over there. Beautiful.

Picturesque experience. Counteless photo ops, lovely paths and plenty of sandy beaches along the way. If I lived in Sydney I would frequent this walk as a running path, hangout or beach spot. What as asset to the local area.
Worth the long walk. It was a long healthy walk for us when we went here. The seaside was so clean you wont mind walking around.

lovely. I have been on this walk twice, once in January with my sisters and again in June with my sister and mum and dad. Both times the views were amazing. Obviously warmer and sweatier in January but cool in June. Beaches are all gorgeous to look at and enjoyable to stroll across. Lots of wildlife and interesting things to look at on the way. Recommended for travellers especially as it's not too long and it's a safe route to take.
A pleasant walk. Track in perfect condition and breathtaking landscapes. Save some time to relax at the beaches and don´t forget your camera.

Nice little walk. The scenery is beautiful, and the walk takes way less time than people usually say. Its a very light walk, and you can do it barefoot if you want (it's kind of the aussie way, I guess).

Windy but well worth the walk. This is a fabulous coastal walk once you've explored Bondi Beach. Some of the steps are a bit steep but the path is well paved and mostly well fenced, although there are a few places open and quite dangerous for dogs and/or children. Joggers and runners can be quite a hazard if you're not paying attention, they duck and dive round you as if they have the right of way and can be quite rude if you don't get out of their way quickly enough. Each beach stop has a cafe with reasonably priced food and drinks and the bus runs along the coast so if you tire, you can always jump on one of those. It's a very scenic walk with lots of photo opportunities but can get quite busy and difficult to negotiate in narrow places.

Very busy but terrific views. We were really lucky with the weather - a clear, crisp sunny Sunday in early August, but what a great walk this is. We did it from south to north - caught the train from the City to bondi Junction then a cab (quite cheap) to Cogee Beach - lunch at Bronte Beach en route, a few drinks and a bit of shopping at Bondi, and a cab back to the station - all in all a great way to spend a day. Also a great way to poke your nose into a few prime clifftop real estate locations....
Great walk. easy walk not far from city center. a "must do" in Sydney for first time visitors. pleasant moment away from the center
Breathtaking. Take your time with this walk. I climbed up ledges for some breathtaking views. I usually walk 6k in an hour, but this walk took me almost 3, so amazed was I by the scenery.
Fabulous coastal walk. Breathtaking views and fun watching the surfers in the various bays, even though it was still Winter. Lovely way to pass 2 to 3 hrs
Beautiful walk!. A must do walk if staying in bondi or congee. Amazing views and plenty to see along the way. Don't forget to take a bottle of water and sun screen!

Coastal walk. Its a nice and easy walk if you can manage a few steps up or down. Gives you the chance to see Bondi Beach from above, and have the ocean facing you. Beautifull views, a breath of fresh air.

Beautiful walk in good weather. Beginning at Coogee we walked along this coastal walk on a lovely autumn day. Stopped along the way for morning tea at one of the kiosks at the beaches along the way. Beautiful views, and fresh sea air. Don't forget a hat, water & sunscreen. Ate fresh Fish & chips for Lunch at Bondi Beach while enjoying the Sun. We caught a Taxi back to Coogee where we left our car, but there is also a Bus you can catch.
What not to like. A must for anyone who can to do. This has to be one of the best walks in the world. Great food and coffee before and after, or even a champagne or wine available from friendly cafes
Must do. Beautiful scenery!!! Great people watching. Loved it. We started in coogee and ended in bondi. Decided to walk instead of run. Hilly terrain!
Great views. A long but easy stroll with substantial views out the ocean. The plaques are really interesting for those with a historical bent.The path itself is well travelled and very safe

WHITE SANDS IN SYDNEY. the place is very good and the powder sand is very clean. nice to eat in the nearby restaurant. you can drink and unwind there. they have seafoods and many more to offer. the waves is clapping and calling you to come and swim, but we have no time. if you love swimming be sure to bring with you swimming suit and take more time to enjoy the water.

Beautiful. We got a bus from Sydney to Bondi, and had a late lunch of fish and chips before starting the walk. We should have set off earlier, though, as with all the photography required it took us about 2 and a half hours!It is a very easy walk, with good paths all the way, and there was some lighting at the end which was lucky as we ended up in Coogee after dark, as it got dark at about 5pm.We caught the bus from Coogee beach back to Sydney.A very lovely afternoon.
Fabulous beaches and views.. Get the bus from Darlinghurst to Bondi Beach (not Junction) and grab a bite when you get to Coogee. A highlight of our holiday.

The must see for anybody visiting SYD. This is the place to showpiece Australian way of life. I've had my parents from Europe visiting for the first time. We've parked at Tamarama and walked back to Bondi. There were a few steps so his is not wheelchair/pram walk but the views, atmosphere and feel were the top notch. I did enjoy walking Coogee - Bondi when living in SYD but this walk re-freshed my positive feel and memories. A must to see - even if it takes a few precious hours off your stay in Sydney.

Make time to fit this walk into your schedule. Took the bus from Museum station to Coogee, took about 40 mins direct. Well maintained footpaths help make this an enjoyable walk. The scenery is stunning, lovely sandy bays and rocky coastline - make sure your camera battery is fully charged ! Allow 2-3 hours as there is so much to appreciate. Bus 333 from Bondi is a limited stop service so only abt 30 mins backl to the city. Several parts have stairs so tricky with buggies.

Breathtaking. Worthwhile to catch Bondi Junction and make it to the beach. Views were great and a nice little walkway to walk from beach to beach with amazing views. Also nice town to grab food in as well.

Fabulous day trip from Sydney. This coastal walk really was an amazing day trip from Sydney. Scenery was spectacular! It did take a little effort to get here as I didn't have a car, but the bus/train schedule was convenient from downtown, and all told was no more than 30 min via public transport. The walk itself is fantastic, a little hilly in places, but completely paved. I got a map from the visitor's center, and planned to do it all the way to Coogee, but you can go as little or as far as you like. I'm not sure you would want to do this walk/hike with a stroller - it's very walkable for all types of folks, but the path is along the coast, so you have narrow parts, steps and some hills. I ran all the way to Coogee which is probably one of the most beautiful, scenic runs I've ever done anywhere, and then I walked back to Bondi. I spent all day on the path and opted not to shop in town - although there are plenty of shops and restaurants too. The path has many wonderful look outs and benches on which to just enjoy the views and take pictures. At many sections, you can walk onto the rocks where the waves crash right around you fairly close up. Be careful. I happened to visit on a blustery day, which was cloudy and dark (winter time in July), and this provided incredible wave activity. Take your best camera with the extra lenses. You just feel the power of the ocean. Stunning scenery. I'd like to come back in the summer and spend more time on the beach itself, and in the town shopping. Don't miss this.

Breath-taking.. If you want to get an idea of just how spectacular and unique Australia is, you must do the Bondi-Coogee walk. The scenery changes every kilometer, and the combination of geological formations, flora, and fauna is awe-inspiring. Plus, it's fantastic exercise! The walk usually takes about two hours, but definitely take your time and enjoy the views.
Loved this walk. Absolutely gorgeous views around every turn. Definitely worth the few hours of good exercise and relaxation all at once.
Scenic beach view. Stunning walk overlooking different Sydney beaches. Especially recommended during event Sculpture by the sea when sculptures dot the trail.
a must do for any visitor to Sydney. If you visit Sydney for only a couple of days then this should be in your top three. it's just a simply stunning walk and easy

Must do Sydney experience. This is a must do of Sydney natural beauties. We often stop in Coogee and the walk is dramatic with amazing sandstone cliffs, ocean views and coastal views. You walk past on of the best bits of real estate in Sydney... Bronte cemetery and can't help but wonder...who thought this would be better served as a cemetery than any other purpose. The local councils should be commended on building the pathways, and maintaining them. If you don't want to do the full walk (from either end) Bronte is a nice stop off with great coffee strip opposite the beach.
nothing beats it. no where in the world have I walked such a magnificent coastal walk across so many beaches starting and ending with cafes and restaurants.
Great beach walk. Very picturesque. A must for overseas visitors who enjoying walking and beaches dunshine and sea air

Stunning. This is really worth the effort. You will walk past those fabulous sandstone formations that are characteristic of the Sydney landscape. It is almost possible to imagine the coastline for the first settlers.

Not to be missed. Lots of spectacular views. The walkways are well paved and there are places to sit when you get tired of walking. It is a popular place but you can understand why once you see the scenery.
East Coast. Great way to see the east coast and have a nice meal at ether end of the walk. You could start with Breakfast at Coogee and have lunch at Bondi after a lovely walk.

What a lovely walk. The Bondi to Coogee walk is a easy promenade that will take you a couple of hours on a leasury stroll.You get to see great scenary and can go for a dip when you fancy one. Definitely worth doing and bringing a picnic bag

track the coast. not only will you see Sydney's most expensive real estate on this enjoyable trek but breathe in fabulous salt sea air and enjoy the freedom of being on the edge of life for this continent and the Pacific Ocean- this is a wonderful experience available to walkers of every level- take it at your own pace.

Fab Coastal Walk. We started from Bondi Beach (which we got to from Sydney CBD via train to Bondi Junction, and then walked down to Bondi Beach – there is a bus that can save you the walk). In the summer months, Bondi Beach and the walk to Coogee can be quite busy. But people seemed friendly enough along the way.This is a great spot to walk at sunrise or sunset and can go any time of year (even on a bad day!)You can walk in any shoes but underfoot is a little uneven, so if you plan on using this route for exercise – make sure you wear the right footing.Its definitely somewhere you can revisit and great to soak in the sea breeze!

Stunning views. This is an easy undulating walk. We walked as far as Bronte beach as it was later in the afternoon. The views are wonderful , with fantastic photo opportunities. We saw a little penguin at the north end of Bondi.a wonderful way to spend an afternoon strolling.There are a few steps that you should be aware of if you have a wheelchair or buggy.
Best thing to do in Sydney. Love this walk! The views and route are just spectacular! Also its so nice to chill in Coogee or Bondi after doing it :)

A great walk. I usually spend my free time on the beach, love the ocean and the sounds of waves crashing. So this is where i can get a piece of mind. It is a lovely walk, Start from Bondi or either from Coogee and turn around at Bronte or Tamarama. Its just great on a sunny day..

Best thing About Sydney. This walk is one of my favourites. You dont have to go all the way either, you can easily start at either Bondi or Coogee and turn around at Bronte or Tamarama. Walking along the water practically the whole way. When it is sunny it is amazing. When it is cold and windy it is breathtaking and when it starts raining you'll still find yourself in heaven.

"nice walk, good for workout". The Bondi to Coogee Beach Walk is just amazing, it's a good distance for people who want to go for a longer walk or workout walk and you cross nice bays like byron bay and many more. Especially for tourists a must when they visit in the souther suburbs area.

The best walk in Sydney!!. I do this walk weekly.. it is a must-do for anyone visiting Sydney! It's about 12km from Coogee to North Bondi.. the views are spectacular and the work out is totally worth it!
Do this however many days you have in Sydney. Forget walking up and down George Str all day long, get away from the pretentious Sydney locals and walk this route.

One of the great urban coastal walks of the world. I never tire of this walk. I do it in reverse because of the abundance of places to eat at Bondi. So I start at Coogee and walk north. When I get to Bondi, I have a meal or a coffee and catch the bus back to Coogee. You walk the rim of the Pacific in all its moods and the view changes with around every corner.
Lovely place. Wow what a nice beach or two! Very beautiful place, would be so Awesome in the summer too, great hotel,little cafés
Gorgeous walk. Highly recommended. Bring your swim togs to take a dip in the various swimming spots, including a seawater pool!

Best walk in Sydney. This coastal walk is a must for anyone visiting Sydney. It is best to see during the arts festival early in the year but is a good walk anytime. When we take our tourist friends on the walk, we travel to Bondi Beach by bus from Sydney CBD, start out with a late, hearty breakfast at one of the main street cafes at the southern end of Bondi Beach and then walk our way around the coast's cliff line. We tend to tire at Bronti, rather than at Coogee, and return to the CBD by bus at about lunchtime. There are a number of scenic coffee opportunities along the way.

Beautiful Beach after Beautiful Beach. Our family had a great time on this walk. The path was fairly busy as it was a gorgeous Saturday afternoon. It was beautiful vista after beautiful vista. If you are visiting Sydney, it was pretty easy to get the train or ferry to Circular Quay and then the ferry to Watson's Bay, once there you hop a bus to Bondi Beach. This was an entire day we spent (we are slow walkers) we also enjoyed lunch in Bondi and dinner in Coogee.

Relaxing. This coastal walk is the best thing you need to relive your stress.Plenty of stunning views along the walk and gentle sea breeze will keep you cool.To finish the walk off have a nice sea bath in the beautiful ocean.

beautiful views. This walk is a must! I was tempted to stay on the beach at Bondi, but once i started the walk, I was enthralled by the fantastic views along the way. Very easy to get a bus from Coogee back into Sydney CBD or Bondi depending on where you are based.

breathtaking. we did the reverse cuz wanted to end in bondi with more choices for eating and activities. were advised to take the train, if I did this again would not take the train, instead take the bus from cbd. had to transfer trains and take bus to get to coogee. all in all about extra 45min wasted. bus from cbd straight shot. I did read this in a review on this forum but decided to listen to our concierge instead, oh well. the walk was breathtaking. took us close to 3hrs as we had young kids so took our time, potty breaks and lots of pics. it was a sunday so a little crowded but not bad, if we did this on a weekday it would have been less so.

Great walk. I just love this walk! It meanders through a secluded path atop the cliffs of about five beaches . In the summer it is extremely hot and I have done this walk in the hottest times and still loved it. It does go by a giant old cemetery and is quite interesting to see. At the end (matters which way your going) is a nice cold drink and a rest before you start back. You will be tired at the end of the two way trip. I encourage you to go... -David

Breathtaking. It took me a few years to actually get to do this as I was told it was so amazing and never really believed it. It was one of the most amazing walks I've ever done. So sad that I left it so long to do it. It is so scenic and makes for a great workout. I can't wait to do this walk again.

Stunning walking track. Stumbledupon this walk way by accident, but thoroughly enjoyed it, stunning views whilst you walk along the coast with information avaialble on plaques as you go around. Well done NSW tourism this is a brilliant idea and well maintained easy to walk, safe track. Loved it
great veiws. its a great run or walk, awesome views, it can get crowded but if you go at "non-popular" times its ok.

Stunning. A jaw dropping walk. The views will take your breath away. Not a tough walk, good for people of all ages and fitness levels. Parts of the walk are wheelchair accessible but there are several lots of stairs. If you have the time while in Sydney it is worthwhile. Start at either end and there are food and drink options at either end and water available throughout the walk. I suggest going early to watch the sunrise. You dodge the crowd and see the majesty of the rising sun.The walk is amazing any time of year and in any weather.
What the hype says. Beautiful walk that hugs the coast and the splendour of the shoreline with the breathing sea. Walkway is well laid out and easy to traverse.

Great way to see this area. A fantastic beach and coastal walk - many steps in places but also lots of places to stop & rest. A couple of drinking fountains on the way too. Stopped off at the Coogee Pavilion for a drink at the end.

Amazing walk. You will see some amazing scenaries on this walk! Don't bother with the direction do whatever is easiest. The walk is short, but there are alot of hills and stairs. Wear good shoes and keep left and you'll be fine ;)

We loved it!. We took a bus to Bondi beach as our kids wanted to see it. The concierge recomended this walk and it was really one of the highlights of our trip to Sydney. After walking on Bondi beach and taking all the necessary photos you can see the walk on the right hand side of the beach. You walk out by the sea on the cliff path. The views are spectacular! You pass various beaches on the way. We stopped at Bronte Beach and had a lovely lunch is a beachside cafe. A great day out with the family. Our favorite day in Sydney!!

Sunday Stroll. It is years ago now - but I did this walk while the sculptures were on display. Only issue I had was that you can park nowhere near the start of the walk in Bondi. And of course at the other end you have to find your way back to Bondi Beach - or start early enough to walk back. Having shuttle busses would be great as there is no direct public transport link - you need to change bus at Bondi Junction - and we had a fair wait - no doubt due to Sunday Bus timetable.
beautiful walk. the walk is beautiful and a nice thing to-do on a not so hot day. sadly we saw no whales. there are some good surfers to watch or to join.
Amazing Breathtaking Walk. Do not miss this experience. Only a short trip from the city center and meet some friendly people along the way. Cameras a must!
Great walk. Perfect to spend an afternoon. Start with a dip in Bondi, then take the walk to Coogee and appreciate the nice parks and the fabulous creeks!

Great Coastal walk. An easy and beautiful coastal walk . There are multiple beaches on the way that you can stop at any of those and return in case if you dont want to do the entire 6KM stretch ( such as Bronte , Tamaram etc.) .Bronte is especially amazing with the view of cemetry overlooking sea . I did the walk from Bondi to Coogee though i feel the other way round would have been better,so that once you finish the walk you have more eatouts and options at Bondi. There is not much shade through out the walk . So a hat/cap would be a good idea ...

Get off the couch & get your feet onto this pavement. This is a sensational walk as its suitable for all ages or walking abilities and it presents a picture perfect birds eye view of 2 of Sydney's popular coastal beaches. Wear sunscreen (even in winter) & make sure you have water ... and your camera at the ready. Do the walk in either direction then reward yourself with a coffee at one of the many great cafes that are available at Bondi or Coogee. If you don't like crowds do this walk early and avoid the middle of the day

Don't Miss This!. This is something every visitor to Sydney should do(if they are capable of it).You can start off at either Coogee or Bondi follow the path and you can't really go wrong.All you have to do is walk (though lots of people run!) and enjoy the view.It's magnificent and it's free.There is only one word of warning: there are a lot of stairs and so the walk will affect those with mobility issues.But you don't have to complete the whole walk,there are many places to exit.It's wonderful!
A must do in Sydney. This walk reminded me that Australia has some of the best beaches in the world. There are fantastic photo opportunities along this walk.

A sunny day would make it perfect! - but take water. This was a lovely walk, the website gives really clear directions and the maps along the way are helpful too. Getting to Bondi Beach, and back from Coogee Beach on public transport from central Sydney was extremely easy - the signs at the Bondi Junction train station for the bus could not have been bigger!The paths are very well maintained, and the sections without steps would be fine with a buggy, wheelchair or walking difficulties - when the directions say steep stairs though they mean it, the ones near the end are very steep.We had a grey day for our walk, so the views were good but not as beautiful as blue skies & sea and sun would have made them. The rocks though are spectacular whatever the weather.You can divert off the path to get food & drink in the villages you pass by but as it's a long walk it's still a good idea to take some water with you. We took a picnic and stopped in one of the many beach-side parks along the way.

wonderful coastal walk. Wonderful coastal walk, in such a stunning part of the world. Suitable for even a short casual walk, or for a much longer one, with stunning views of Bondi and other beaches. Fabulous.

Keeping up with the antipodeans. Get the bus to Bondi Beach watch some surfers then walk along the cliffs to Coogee Beach ( or part of the way ) Go at the weekend and join the 100's of tourists and locals making use of this brilliant scenic walk.

A must to do.. Living nearby I do this walk from Coogee to Bondi 2 to 3 mornings per week. Approx 6km in each direction, it takes you on pathway passed 4 beautiful white sand beaches, 2 small rocky bays and a graveyard. One small section is on a road but its usually not too busy. If you are staying in CBD, its only a short bus ride to either Coogee or Bondi to start the walk. You can also continue the walk passed Coogee and head further south to Maroubra however there are some road passages to negotiate. Plan to do it midweek, after the dog walkers and the joggers have finished from about 8am otherwise you will have to move over all the time to let them pass. On weekends the path can be very busy.

Wow! Loved it.. We decided to take the walk one weekend and i can't wait to do it again. The walk if you are starting from Coogee may be a bit long for some walkers but it is enjoyable from start to finish. It is so nice to do on a clear day as the sea and scenery are so beautiful and its nice to arrive at the different beaches along the way. Would recommend this walk to overseas visitors and Sydneysiders. I am a bit jealous of the locals who get to do it everyday!

The thing to do with a foreign visitor. One of the world's best city walks. Comparable to Tate to Tate along the Thames. Varied, good eateries, amazing views, a stop off for a bit of lawn bowls is a good idea. Dolphins and whales in the winter. Love it.

Awesome views. Nice long walk (approx 2hr walk) on a winter sunny day. The beach view was breath taking with clear blue skies and nice blue sea, not forgetting the cold wind with sunny sun. The only regret we had was not packing our swimwear with us for a dip into the clear sea.

one of the worlds great coastal walks. amazing views and a good workout. Can get packed when it is sculptures by the sea, and the runners can be a bit rude and barge past walkers sometimes, but all in all on a warm day nothing beats this walk.

It doesn't get much better than this.. One of the most scenic walks in the world. You can go for as little or far as you like. Good, wide path and amazing natural beauty walking along the cliffs, past wonderful beaches and stunning scenery. This is a MUST if you are in Sydney.

Beautiful walk. A must do on a sunny day. Experience Coastal Sydney at its best. You walk along beach promenades, cliff paths and inlets with stunning views. Its hilly terrain but take your time and stop at a café or swim at one of beaches to refresh. Best time to go is during the week or early on the weekends as it get crowded on Saturdays and Sundays.

Stunning. It's easy to see why traveller's from overseas think Australia is so beautiful when you do this walk. Absolutely stunning!!! Blue blue ocean against jagged cliff faces. One of the best things to do in Sydney.
Breath Taking. The views breathtaking. Must do this walk. Whilst the up and down of some stairs on this walk were quite tiring i highly recommend this walk, it is so worth it!!
Stunning but exhausting. Definitely worth doing during your visit. Bring water because the trails can be very tiring, depending how far you walk.

Breathtaking. We had been told by lots of people before we got to Sydney to do the walk, so we made sure we set aside a morning to come down and do it, and i am so happy we did. This walk is breathtaking, the coastline is by far one of the most amazing i have seen. Its also really easy and quick to get there by bus from Sydney.
Nearly as good as Cinque Terre. This is not to be missed, incredible views, lovely houses and the restaurants in Bondi are wonderful.

Not to be missed. Favourite thing to do in Sydney. The best thing about Australia are the beaches. Coogee to Bondi walk will take you about 1-2 hours to complete (and there are plenty of stops you can take along the way) but it will be all worth it. Views along this walk are breathtaking in any weather. I recommend doing in reverse - starting at Coogee, stopping for a quick coffee at Bronte and having a glass of wine and some nice meals at Bondi's Icebergs (no need to go to the fancy restaurant of this establishment, RSL section is much cheaper for alcohol and food and has exactly the same amazing views of Bondi)

Sculptures by the Sea. If you are fortune it enough to be here in October; there is annual event called 'Sculpture by the Sea'.This is not to be missed because of the spectacular beach/cliff walk all the way from Bondi to Bronte.Stop at Bronte and walk across Bronte rd. to the shops and grab some fish and chips at the end fish and chip shop.........it is a hole in the wall but great value for money.Take your bounty back across the street and sit in one of the pavilions overlooking the breakers and beach. Watch surfers duck and dive off the rock pool into the swell.It is not legal to drink Alcoholic beverages in public, but a paper bag covered bottle of wine or beer, discretely enjoyed with your F&C is just almost too perfect a Sydney casual lunch.(Stay away from iconic Doyles it is a rip off)Walk it all off as you hike back around the cliff faces and re-enjoy the sculpture.Do Not attempt this on a weekend!Go week days late morning so you arrive at Bronte hungry for lunch. The only other time is late afternoon, being mindful of joggers but well worth it for watching the long shadows start across water, beach and sculptures.(Wear sun screen on your nose and lips, the rest of you is going to tan just by walking and being outside.)

A must for all visitors. Most visitors (or even locals for that matter) head down to the iconic Bondi Beach and that's about it. You are missing one of the most beautiful and easy walks if you don't take the Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk. This path winds it's way along the beach front from Bondi Beach around the cliffs to Coogee, where you can relax with a coffee or lunch before catching a bus back! The walk is wide and paved, so people in chairs or parents with prams will have not problem. The path is right on the ocean and the views are wonderful.
Just Do It. Rug up on a winter, windy day. Coffee spots and toilets blocks along the way. A must for overseas visitors
Fabulous. Great walk on a clear day. Beautiful views. Take your swimmers and swim at the rock pools along the way. Lunch at Coogee beach - what more could you ask for.

Just Me. Fabulous place to go strolling. Wear a hat, sun screen, bring your cameras, comfortable shoes and take a bottle of water. Not easy with a baby pram/stroller as there are a lot of steps. Sculptures by the sea is held here every year and it does get super busy and some what congested on the week end but worth going. The view around this cliff top is is very picturesque and you don't have to go yo whole way. Plently of little coffee shops at The Beaches along the way so you can stop off for refreshment as you go. Public transport is plentiful to get you to the start and then again wherever you might like to stop. Toilets available along the route. Well worth the the time you won't be disappointed.
stunning. the venue itself is breathtaking, one of my favorite walks in one of my favorite cities, would recommend this not to be ignored

Walk with a view. Fantastic piece of coastal area. Accessible "almost" for everybody (no wheelchair)! Great ocean views, easy to medium "level" of walk. Best to go there via public transport as parking is very difficult to find! If you live in Sydney - this is a whole day activity. On some days it becomes "overcrowded" and you have to "share" / "battle" your way with joggers, tourists and others... Overall a great "family style" outdoor activity.

Scenic and must do for some one who like coastal walks. Very scenic hilly with ups and downs, goes via cemetery..one of the best walks around Sydney and probably the best coastal wall I have done around the globe..

A spectacular ocean walk. This walk gives you the ideal view of Bondi. As you get to the circular lookout at the first point, look back and you get the perfect view of the huge arc of the beach and appreciate why Bondi is regarded as one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. Then walk on to Tamarama, now with a stylish new cafe from which you can watch the surfers tackle the powerful waves of this small but challenging beach. Then as you walk further along the cliffs to Coogee, you get a great view of the cliff face and the great expanse of the Pacific. End your walk at Coogee where people stroll along the esplanade, stopping on the way to pay respects at the memorial in the park to the victims of the Bali bombing.

Fancy a leisurely scenic walk?. Then this has got to be one of the worlds best. Not too strenuous but you'll be distracted by the sea views to noticed the walk. Plenty of places to stop for coffee and toilet amenities along the way. If Coogee is too far, then you can stop at Bronte. Bronte has many choices of cafes and restaurant for that casual brunch after a early walk.

Coogee to Bondi. Take your time and smell the fresh, salt air. Enjoy the wind and the sun on your face. Have a full camera battery, enough money for an ice-cream & coffee, and comfy walking shoes. Take a wind breaker (just incase).There's an easy two buses back to Coogee if you don't want to do it all in reverse.And remember, go back and do it again in different weather!
One of the must do's in Sydney. Great walk. Pick a sunny day, take your swimmers and enjoy. You don't have to do the whole walk if you are not so fit just do a little bit as the views are worth it.
Great walk must do while in Bondi. We loved this walk, it's a must do. We to the bus from Bondi junction to Coogee and walked back to Bondi. Fabulous to see all the beaches along the way.

Pinch yourself - these views are amazing. This is an incredible cliff top walk that meanders its way past some of the best beaches in the world. Breathtaking views of the sweeping arc that is Bondi Beach and then you weave your way around to Tamarama Beach, Bronte Beach, and past the best located cemetery in the world, to Clovelly, where if you have your snorkel and flippers you can swim with the fish' past Gordon's Bay and finally to Coogee. Along the way there are numerous great spots to eat and lovely parks for relaxing. It's stunning anytime of the year.
Best walk I did in Sydney! . Best place. I went to nice peaceful walk lots of good views and meet lots of people on the way! Organised by the hostel. Well worth doing!!

Got to be on your list for Sydney sights. The iconic venue for the Sculptures by the Sea, the coastal walk from Bondi to Coogee can be done in it's entirety or just take short hops between Tamarama, Bronte and Coogee.
