Coffee stops at Tamarama and Bronte. Lots of trendy cafes and restaurants in Bronte, where a bus can also take you back to Bondi Junction and the city. Sunset a popular time to do the walk, but watch out for the joggers,,,KEEP TO THE LEFT of the path!

Lovely Walk & Friendly People (joggers excepted!). This is a really nice walk and I'd recommend anybody doing it to bring their swimming gear as there are some really good bathing spots along the way. Just watch out for the very assertive joggers, if you happen to stray out from the edge of the path you are in danger of being mowed down!

Walk this way!. This was my favorite memory from my first visit to Sydney. We started at Bondi beach and slowly made the trek to Coogee while taking plenty of pictures (no selfies), and just enjoying the scenery and the small cliffs. There are many openings that allow you to walk through the rocks, and get closer to the water. Along the way you will see cliffs, coves, a beautiful infinity lap pool that blends in perfectly with the ocean, and even a cemetery. Allow for a 2 - 3 hours to complete. This walk only requires for you to, well, be able to walk and no special level of fitness is required. At the end you can take a public bus that will take you back to the city. Do this walk early in the morning, and in your first full day in Sydney; you don't want to risk bad weather keeping you from this experience.
A must do. Fantastic coastal walk, do this on a sunny day! Fantastic beaches, great coastal walk, brilliant any day of the week!

Highly recommend. Great walk this with lovely views in all seasons. There are plenty of places to stop on the way if you like, both cafes and photo spots, so you can take things at your own pace. A special place unique to Sydney.

Dull Saturday livened up. There had been a bit of rain and it was fairly chilly and very dull when we set out from Bondi Beach at 1100 on a Saturday.The unattractive weather kept the crowds away so there were not too many doing the coastal walk.I especially enjoyed the heathlands with their boardwalk. The coastal views were terrific while even on a dull day, some of the quieter sea near rocks was almost turquoise in colour - by no means as visually stunning as on many Filipino white sand islands such as Malapascua off Cebu Island, or Boracay - but quite impressive nonetheless.There are many steps to climb along the way but that adds to the fun. There are toilets about every 1.5 to two kilometres which is very good. The rocks throw up unexpected surprises such as exposed white as a feature to photograph.Later, walking around Coogee, I came across a kookaburra on an electric wire. One wouldn't normally see that in Melbourne.I used a MyMulti2 weekly to get around: train to Bondi Junction, bus to Bondi Beach then back from Coogee.

Beautiful and relaxing. The reception lady at the hostel told me to do this walk and I wasn't disappointed. It is breathtaking, the beaches, parks, and cliffs. It isn't crowded and there are little cafes along the way. Highly recommend.
Wonderful Views. Easy walk and the views were amazing. We walked along the beach and the cliffs. We were there during the week when it was not crowded and it was a really nice visit.

An Absolute Must-Do in Sydney. We have done this sensational walk many times over the years. The scenery is simply gorgeous. If you don't think you can make the distance, do the shorter walk by starting at Bronte beach (can be reached by bus from the city - we caught ours from Hyde Park).There is a beautiful old cemetery on the way which is definitely worth strolling around and reading some of the headstones. Allow an hour for a leisurely walk from Bronte. Enjoy a picnic on the lawn overlooking Bondi Beach at the end. Unfortunately word has spread and in recent years the crowds have grown dramatically along this picturesque coastal walk.
Aboriginal art and whales.... ... are both on this walk if you keep your eyes peeled. Well worth it. Since great little cafés enroute too.

Great walk, Beautiful views, unique scenery. If you take the train to Bondi Junction, hop a bus to Bondi beach other wise its a fair walk before you even start the coastal walk. The beaches on the walk were mostly empty in late July but there were many people walking and running on the path, looks like a great place to exercise. The coast was beautiful, the blues in the water and green of rocks with algae was a great contrast. Many houses along the path were nice to look at. We saw some whales as we were alerted by the presence of whale watching boats off the coast. It must be great to live near by and have this beautiful place to walk and run on. The path was generally in good shape and wide, only occasional unmarked dead ends that were easy to back track on and figure out the correct path. Prepare for some stairs, its good hike.

Beautiful easy walk. We took this path just as it was getting dark and watched the sun setting so did not manage the whole walk. We were a little nervous of being on the path once it was dark as there is no street lighting, but with lots people around and never being too far from human habitation our fears were unfounded. Stunning views and charming little beaches on the way.

A must do. Set out early or late. You just need a smile to reciprocate the many smiles and hellos you may get from people walking the other way. Don;t be discouraged by the weather - unless perhaps it is truly monsoonal rain. Blowing a gale can also be a little challenging. One of the great walks in Sydney

Stunning. THe walk took me about 3 hours, but I didnt go all the way to Coogee. The panoramic views are perfect, and the people along the way are friendly. Every beach encountered is different, and if you are feeling tired, just sit down somewhere on the rocks and just watch the surfers and boogyboarders, are simply just observe the waves.
Nice coastal walk. We did enjoy this walk but it was a bit busy, what else can you expect on a nice sunny winters Sunday ;-)
for walkers, runners, bike riders,.... A really nice path along the coast with great photo opportunities. Also, many smaller beaches and even pools where you can stop for a swim.

Would have been "excellent" if it wasn't winter!. This is a great walk along cliffs from Bondi to Coogee (or the other way). Coogee's beach is better in my opinion than Bondi. It's more "real" and seems less foreign touristy. The views of the beaches along the way are really nice. It can be pretty windy and if it is cold, the wind will be very biting, indeed.

Lovely beach walk, try in Nov for Sculptures by the Sea. At the end of every year, the Bondi to Coogee walk is transformed into the Sculptures by the Sea exhibition. The walk is great to do at any other time, it's just a bit more special when the exhibition is on, combining art and the magnificent views. Must see.
Best thing to do in Sydney. One of the best things to do on a week end sunny day. It s beautiful. Long trail but quite easy. Very scenic views of the coast!

Beauty and worth the walk. We walk this track often when we are in Sydney. It can be a leisurely stroll (with some steps) and you can make it as challenging as you like, the walk can be joined at many suburbs, Coogee, Bronte, Clovelly Tamarama & Bondi. I highly recommend it, the views are perfect and in October there are sculptures by the sea to enjoy.

Definitely a good day activity in Sydney. I did the Bondi to Cougee roundtrip walk last Tuesday. The trip took about 3.5 hours with a stop off in Coogee for a drink and pauses for photos. This is a great walk that will remind Americans of a walk along the ocean in La Jolla. There were many great views along the way. The entire walk is on sidewalk with some stairs, mostly climbing up from Bondi. Bring your sunscreen.You take the 333 bus from the CBD. You need to buy a prepaid ticket, which are available at most convenience stores. You cannot buy a ticket on the bus. I imagine you could get off and on during the trip, but I did not. if the weather is good, you'll love this walk.
Spectacular. Wonderful walk,especially when Sculptures By The Sea is on in October.Spectacular views.Places to stop for coffee.
Best running track in Sydney. I use to run this 3 times a week when I lived there. It has spectacular views and so refreshing.A must do walk for all visitors to Bondi.

A Different Planet. We missed our tour to the blue mountain and went for the walk instead and we were soo glad we did it ... it was partially cloudy afternoon and the reflection of the sunlight on the clouds and the see gave an out of this world lightling to these amazing beaches that the walk covers , I felt I was in a different planet. Its so lovely how the different styles of houses are scattered around those beaches ..makes you want to own one of them.

Oh my we are so lucky to have this on our doorstep. As Four friends aiming to walk from the city Cronulla.this stretch is part of our walk. So beautiful..great during the winter months..you might spot a whale. Take a back pack stop to eat overlooking the ocean. Can get busy..because everyone wants to make the most of this great free activity. Enjoy

Great way to exercise in during a holiday and fun winter alternative. My friend and I did the coastal walk from Coogee beach to Bondi, the other way, as our direct bus from our B and B ended in Coogee.I quite liked ending in Bondi as we got to reward ourselves with a great lunch, gazing out at the famous Bondi beach!Since there wasn't much going on during winter at Bondi itself, this walk really added to the experience.There isn't much signage or maps of the coastal walk at Coogee, which threw us off. But I looked at the Lonely Planet guide book and figured if we hugged the coast, we'll be fine! The walk isn't always exactly hugging the coast so don't be thrown off if you have to walk inland on the pavement, now and then.Along the way it's all very urban with public restrooms and cafes. People are all around so it's very easy to do the walk on your own.

Park in Coogee. Park in Coogee and walk to Bondi. Enjoy some brunch or lunch or a coffee and walk back. Great way to see the coast and enjoy the outdoors.Good cafes at Bronte if you need a midway stop.

A must see. It's gorgeous.. I get the chance to do this walk at least once a month it is beautiful. Just gorgeous. Take a camera to snap amazing photos. Keep your eye out for dolphins and whales. I'd also recommend extending your walk to Maroubra. The cliff side walks along the entire route are stunning.

Bondi Beach to Coogee Beach walk. We stayed in the Bondi Beach area for a week and it was my favourite part of my holiday. We started our walk along the beach in the early morning watching the surfers practicing their skills in the waves and walked past lots of people practicing their yoga and exercising along the cliff walk. The walk takes you past an outdoor cliff side swimming pool which is filled with sea water and occasionally the waves crash over the wall and fill up the pool. People are once again swimming lengths and children are taking their swimming lessons there and it is such a joy to watch. The views from the cliff walk are amazing and you pass lovely coves. It is lovely to take it easy and just stop for a tea in the lovely little cafes along the way. A long but lovely and enjoyable walk and definitely recommended.
Great. Fresh air great views fantastic location and fun. The best part is the Coogee Bay hotel or Bondi beach or the walk.
beautiful. well kept, nicely taken care off and water is available at certain spots for refreshments.one of the best!

Gorgeous.... So breathtaking! I actually did Bondi to Maroubra (Maroubra is after Coogee). It took me four hours (stopping here and there for pictures and coffee), but it is SO worth it. It's so peaceful and beautiful and there are also workout stations on the coast. There are even private bath spots, too! Don't miss out on it! It's free, so why not?!
Great View. Lovely walk, great views and pictures are to die for. Its a must do walk if you visit sydney. Will do again when I return in Jan 2015

Breath Taking. Although it was a little breezy the day we took the walk, the senery was worth the chill. Ever step is just another photo op!! Beautiful, beautiful!! If you only have a few days in Sydney,this has to be one of the areas you visit!!!

The best Coastal Walk in Sydney. An idyllic and stunning walk from Bondi to Coogee beach. Stop at a cafe in Bronte or the Bondi Icebergs bistro for a drink and or lunch overlooking our iconic beaches.
Easy and enjoyable walk and fantastic views. Compared to other coaster walks, this one is super easy anc cozy. Suitable for all ages. Walk beach after beach is so enjoyable on a sunny day.
loved it. walked with my kids 8 and 10 years old and it was a easy long walk, it was simply beautiful, nice coastline, nice little coves,

Give yourself time. This walk is breathtaking. We didnt expect for it to take as long as it did as we kept stopping to take in the beauty. Give yourself a good day to do this walk so you can enjoy it and take everything in and stop off at the different points. My highlight of Sydney.

Brilliant views, a walk to remember. This is one of the highlights of Sydney, whether you are a walker or not. The walk starts at Bondi beach and follows a beautiful coastline down past Tamarama, Bronte and Clovelley beaches to Coogee beach. Each beach has something to offer in terms of the view, options to swim in the water or public pools by the sea and public amenities.The Waverley cemetery in between Clovelley and Coogee is also not to be missed, with the white tombstones contrasting beautifully with the deep blue water.It is an easy walk (does have some steep steps) due to the number of options one gets to rest and refresh oneself. The views make it easy for one to keep going. A must do for any visitor to Sydney!

The best coastal walk for visitors to Sydney. We are a family of 2 late teen children and parents. We regularly go walking around the harbour foreshores. This is a spectacular walk of great interest with lovely coastal scenery. If you don't have much time in Sydney, do this walk. It is at its best on a sunny day.

Spectacular Sydney beach & coastal walk. I did this walk with 2 other lady friends. We did it in January and it was a particularly hot day but being right on the coast and getting the breezes we did it very easily. I'm in my 60's and found this to be a very enjoyable day with breathtaking views of the coast, great coffee shops and cafes on the walk.We stopped at Tamarama Beach on the way back for a swim…(I also do some ocean swimming as well as walking) but this is not a safe beach. Coogee or Bondi are much better if you want a swim. The people walking the same walk are all friendly and it is not a hard walk at all.Another spectacular walk to do while in Sydney is Taronga Zoo to Balmoral. Wow!!! Each time the track took a turn the view, you would think, could not get any better but it did. With each turn in the track my jaw dropped further. What a beautiful city we have in "Sydney". It doesn't get any better. When you arrive at Balmoral Beach that will blow your mind also, how lovely. Great restaurants, cafes, coffee shops and any thing else you heart desires.Julie RP.S. I did this walk in January about 3 years ago but the option to tag that date does not appear so I tagged January 2014. To be sure it's still open for the walk ring Tourist Info Sydney 1300 669 511.

One of the best things in Sydney. This walk is one of the best things in Sydney for locals and tourists. If you are a tourist it is not to be missed. It is really a must do especially on a lovely sunny day. It really is not that long a walk and the scenery is incredible and you can always stop at the many cafes along way and grab a coffee breakfast or lunch and then keep walking. I live in Sydney and we do it regularly. It's fantastic. If you are short on time you could do Waverley to Bondi and back which is 6 km round trip (3 km each way) and it is the best part of the walk.

No. 1 thing to do in Sydney. This was by far the best thing I've done in Sydney. It only takes about 30 min to get from CBD to Coogee and the views are amazing! Take in the sea and treat yourself to a afternoon tea.
More than just a walk.. It was fun getting out to Bondi on the bus. The walk along the cliff was refreshing and gives you a taste of suburban life in Sydney.

Stunning Views. I'd highly recommend this beautiful walk suitable for all fitness levels. There are lots of cafes along the way to break up the walk and plenty of amazing sea views. You will not be disappointed.
Make this No.1 on your list for Sydney. I guarantee this will be one of the best scenic walks you will ever do. Easy, short and breathtaking. Just do it.
Bronte to Bondi Beach Coastal Walk. Took us 1.5 hours with a lot of time spending watching the waves and munching on chips. The view is lovely.

A must do in Sydney. You can't leave Sydney airport without getting your walking shoes on and borrowing a dog. This walk is a must do on a sunny clear blue day. Don't forget to have fish and chips at Bondi on the green grass.
Awesomeness. This is the most gorgeous walk I have done in a long time. Easy bus ride from the CBD and well worth it.

Bondi to Coogee July 2014. The Bondi to Coogee walk was brilliant. Got the train to Bondi Junction then walked to the beach (Would recommend getting the bus rather than train from the city as the walk was long!).The beach walk was lovely, so much great coastal scenery to see and photograph. The winter sun was perfect temperature, just make sure you wear layers and take comfortable shoes.The walk is about 6km, and a lot of undulating paths so be prepared for a work out!
A must be. Very beautiful 3 h walk on the cliff coast. Very beautiful 3 h walk on the cliff coast. Very beautiful 3 h walk on the cliff coast.
Beautiful. Really great walk to do.The scenery is stunning, plenty of photo opportunities! We went on a nice day, not too hot. There were lots of water stations on the way for the summer months.

If I had this in my backyard I would exercise every day!. This walk was the highlight of our visit to Bondi Beach! The views were amazing. Every time we turned a corner a new gorgeous vista opened up before our eyes. Lots of locals walking and running on the path as well. After our walk we had Harry de Wheels pies on the beach. I can't think of a better way to spend an afternoon!
A nice stroll. Spectacular views of the coast. The path is very good, some steps but not too strenuous. Passing the cemetery is an amazing site.

Just do it. Simply stunning.. This is a magnificent walk. Guessing it is about 5 miles, well marked and simply stunning. If you are in Sydney and are able to walk, you must do this. Take a bus to either Bondi or Coogee, walk along the coast, stop along the way for drinks or spend time on a beach or two, and when you get to the other beach just get back on a bus for home! Simple.Note my partner and I did this walk three times in 2012. Sorry for the delay in posting but I am sure it is still there. :P

Best walk in Australia. I shouldn't have that heading as I am a melbourner but it was such an enjoyable walk! Each corner we turned revealed more beauty and it was a easy walk to do with the kids. Don't hesitate, do it!

Wonderful walk. Spent a day on this walk. Not difficult at all. Took loads of photos. You can spend a whole day looking at the areas you walk past in detail. There are some small towns, restaurants, cafes along the way and you can stop and explore them, but I didn't. There's loads to photograph.

My weekly haunt. Love this walk! My partner and I walk it on a weekly basis! Amazing views and some great picture opportunities. Don't forget to drop your shoulder into the runners when they try to push by!

World Class Coastal Walk - see 4 stunning. Beaches. 6km return walk if you walk to the north end of Bondi and back. If you can't do 6km then cut the trip back to 4km by leaving from South Bondi and returning to South Bondi.The walk is notorious for being one of the best in the world. Starting at Bondi point winding around and up to the stairs to Maccas "Mackenzie's Bay" a tiny rocky beach often with little perfect barrelling waves. Continue to Tamarama beach or Glamourama as locals refer to it. Grab. A coffee, then head up to Bronte beach which has a gorgeous valley. Complete with waterfall for those who want to walk up the back. Whales and. Dolphin sightings are very common over winter months. Do this walk! It's free. Gorgeous. And you will feel good for it.

A lovely way to spend an afternoon. You can do a part of this walk, or go the whole way if you want extra exercise, but all along the way you can enjoy the spectacular views, and just spend time watching the waves and the surfers.....well worth it!

best beach walk. I visited the beach walk while in Australia and found the views breathtaking. Its the most amazing walk in an australian city Take the walk on a sunny day and enjoy the breeze of the ocean

Best late in the day or midday in the week. It's a beautiful walk, though could definitely improve signage. I recommend not doing this walk on the weekends or during school holidays, it is way too packed, and Bondi locals aren't exactly easy going when there are people blocking their path. Take a picnic and some water, you'll need it before the end

Beautiful Costal walk - easy commute from Sydney central. We started this walk around 3pm during winter. bondi is just a ashort train and bus trip ceom Sydney central and this Costal walk is definitely a must do for those spending a few days in Sydney!Our walk took us from Bondi - Tamarama - Bronte - Clovelly - Coogee. I would think that it's even better when you do it in warmer months as I would've really wanted to take a dip at the beaches as we walked along. You could easily spend a day doing this if you hang out in one beach before moving onto the next! though I'd advice to bring a good wind breaker if you plan to do it in Winter as the ocean winds get really chilly (in the afternoon anyway).The paths are paved, with some long slopes but easy enough if you're not planning to run it. It was pretty crowded with families and runners alike on a Saturday noon. There are enough toilets, food places on most beaches. Dont forget to bring a beach towel!

Weekdays Please. I tried it on a Sunday and thought I had place-warped to Broadway, NYC. The reason for the crowds is the incredible beauty of the area. If they could sell tickets at $5 each, the city might be able to fix all those potholes. Never bus or train if you are physically able for the walk. However, having said that, the bus or train is cheap.
breathtaking. Great to take tourists or to enjoy it as a local. Stunning views with plenty of spots along the way to make it an all day events, beach stops, cafes, more beaches. And healthy too

A must- do if you are in Sydney. This is one of the best excuses to get some exercise without feeling you're doing it! Beautiful scenery and stunning views make this really worthwhile. If you can avoid having to find car park, it's better as most of Bondi has a 2 hour car parking limit so not very practical - this walk is fairly long (I think roughly 5-6kms) with a few steps along the way. If you can, pick a day outside the weekend as you will avoid lots of dogs/ runners and other people who make this path extremely busy. I highly recommend doing it when it's the Sculpture by the Sea expo so you can make the most of seeing the sculptures (although if you just want do do a straight walk avoid that time of the year as the crowds will be massive!)

A stunning walk along a beautiful coastline.. My husband and I were staying in Sydney CBD, so we got the Bondi special return train ticket, which gives you a train to Bondi Junction and a bus to Bondi Beach. When we got to Bondi Junction we got a bus to Coogee instead. All buses are prepaid and we bought a ticket from a 7-ll in the city. You need one for 3 - 5 sections. We set out from Coogee on the walk. It was a beautiful sunny but cool day - perfect walking weather. The walk winds around the coastline - up and down cliffs and around the small coves that dot the coast. It's a walk of about 6 kilometres in all and I think you'd need a certain level of fitness. It wouldn't suit those who can't handle stairs as at the Bondi end there are quite a few that some people seemed to be having difficulty with. I'm also not sure how you'd get on with a stroller the whole length. The views are stunning. At certain points there were groups of people staring out to sea, whale watching. If you're lucky and patient you may see some at this time of the year.The communities around the coves look amazing and provide something else to look at as you wind your way along. Doing the walk from Coogee to Bondi leaves you at Bondi at the end, which has a large selection of eateries in which to rest your weary feet. From Bondi you can use your ticket to get the bus and train back to the CBD. This walk was one of the highlights of our trip to Sydney.

Beautiful view and good exercise. I took that walk with my 10-year old son--from Coogee to Bondi. Despite the distance, he loved it. It took us about 2 hours with one stop for a bite to eat. Stunning views all along the way, good surfing sights, and overall a very refreshing walk. Had to take a taxi back to Coogee as it was quite late. Otherwise would have walked back again. Highly recommend!

Amazing coastal scenery. This walk was a lovely walk along the coast of Australia. We started at Bondi Beach near Sydney and walked toward Coogee Beach. The coastal sights are well worth the time and effort. The walk is an easy one, but there are stairs and it is fairly long. We turned back before Coogee Beach and thoroughly enjoyed the walk.
Stimulating walk. Signage could be better. Quite tiring, medium to slightly heavy terrain in places, especially if you're unfamiliar with it.
Always a great walk with fantastic views. Beautiful scenery throughout. Inviting turquoise waters and if you go during summer, gorgeou secluded beaches to swim in.

Free!. Fantastic views, amazing houses to see , exercise and it's all free! There is free parking and you can plan to have lunch at Bondi (the beach is sooo overated!) either at a cafe, restaurant or take your own picnic. An easy walk for everyone!

A "must-see". Beautiful beach! I've been to so many beaches but this is different. It just feels safe to me. and very good for surfers. No wonder I saw a lot of surfers there. Nice view around. There is a little town and we went to a pie store called Harry's- best pie in Australia , so they say and I cant agree more. And it is very easy to go there from the city. Ten minutes on the train and the bus ride was another 10 minutes. The hop on, hop off tour bus will take one there too.

A natural wonder - and no wonder. The bus from Circular key out to Bondi was fine with kids. Bondi beach - remarkable in many ways. We spend too much time at the beach and not enough of the afternoon doing the walk. It isn't too hard but the views are remarkable. We did it on a Sunday in September and the number of people was crazy - didnt spoil it but seems that lots of locals appreciate it for what it is. A natural wonder!

Such amazing views. We took the bus from Circular key out to Bondi and that took half hour or so. then the bus back from Coogee which was similar. Sent the afternoon doing the walk. It isn't too difficult, a few sections where you walk up steps but at the top of each crest and at around every corner there is such amazing views. Got a sandwich and ice cream along the way and had a great afternoon taking this in. Would definitely recommended.
A must!. An absolute must. You go via multiple small fab beaches. Make sure you pick a good sunny day and an empty camera card. You will take lots of photos and comfy shoes! Did it twice.

Great way to spend an afternoon. We only walked to bronte as that was all the time we had, but it was well worth it. The weekend is very busy, so go mid week if you can. We had a swim in the pool very refreshing on a warm day. Need to go back and walk all the way to coogee.
Surfs Up. The place to surf and then warm up with a hot drink at the fantastic cafe opposite the beach and a decent distance for a lovely walk.

Scenic coastal walk on southern side of Sydney Harbour. Scenic, wonderful walk along picturesque headland. Many restaurants, cafés, little beaches and cliffs along the way. Do a short or long walk. Some sections more for easy walkers and wheelchairs but some sections have stairs and gradients. Eat at Bondi Icebergs Club under the restaurant for a spectacular view of Bondi with an inexpensive meal.

Taking too many photos. The view is superb. We took a long time to walk from Bondi Beach to Bronte Beach because we stopped so many times along the way to take photos to the scenery. Highly recommended.
Give it a try, won't regret it. I did the opposit: Coogee to Bondi, even though it was partly cloudy and a few raindrops fell it wasworth every minute, breathtaking!

A must do!. An awesome walk. The views were amazing well worth the effort. The track was used by walkers & joggers of all abilities the day we did it. It is very well maintained and great walking surface. It has a combination of paths and boardwalk.If you have a day or just long enough to do part of it. Well worth it. If staying in Sydney and using public transportation you can get a Train+bus to Bondi beach ticket. Much cheaper and easier.

Stunning. I can see why this is so high in the list of things to do in sydney. What a stunning place.Take the walk nice and steady and stop for a little paddle at each of the beach's on the journey. Highly recommended if you can walk ok.Wear comfortable footwear flipflops (thongs I believe they are called in aus)

Fabulous walk for the moderately fit. This is a must-do walk if you are moderately fit and can manage going up and down steps and varying gradients. That said, you could just walk from Bondi to the next bay at Tamarama Beach if you don't want to do a long walk. Our family (mum, dad, teen boys 12 & 15) walked from Bondi to Coogee on a beautiful (if slightly windy) Sunday morning. This is a very popular walk on Sunday mornings! We started late morning, the 6km took us at least 2hrs, and it felt a lot further than 6kms! You start the walk at Bondi Beach (I was stunned at what a beautiful beach it is, the sand is so fine and white, no wonder it's popular) near Icebergs Swimming Club and follow a winding path along the coastline with spectacular views (very bracing in parts as it was quite windy). After Bondi, you walk past Tamarama Beach (my favourite, cute and great café kiosk), Bronte Beach, Clovelly Beach, and finally arrive at Coogee Beach. I particularly enjoyed the boardwalk section alongside the very old Waverley Cemetery and overlooking the ocean.By the time we got to Clovelly Beach, our teenage boys were complaining "How much further?" but they soldiered on and I felt quite a sense of achievement when we got to the Coogee Foreshore - hooray! Lunch at Yeeros Café overlooking the foreshore area was delicious - authentic Greek yeeros (souvlakis) - and it was very pleasant sitting in the undercover outdoor area. My advice is to do this walk on weekdays if possible as it is very popular on weekends with both walkers and runners. I actually didn't mind the 'busyness' but some might find it annoying or less than tranquil.
Serene. If you love to walk this is the best you can get. It is beautiful beyond words can describe... See it for yourself. Suggest to spend a day at least in this area
A Sydney must-do. This is a great walk on a nice sunny day and something I would recommend to all visitors to Sydney. Also enables you to take in the sights of Bondi Beach which is great

good to walk till end of the island. The beach is nice to relax and see many surfers in brave games... The coastal walk is easy and it's amzing to walk till the end and sit on the rocks right beside the sea. The sunset at the sea made me think of an old Chinese saying "Di Lao Tian Huang" which means end of the earth and heaven...I would enjoy sitting alone there or with my best lover for the whole evening.
A++. A spectacular walk. The highlight of our vacation. You can take a bus back rather than walking round trip.
Coogee to bondi walk. Its was a beautiful walk with amazing view. It was more of a stroll for us as we stopped several times to take photos. Absolutely loved it.

A MUST for visitors. Gorgeous coastline and unique beaches. The scenery changes as you walk. A tip: start at Coogee and work your way to Bondi. Bondi offers more cafes and restaurants, and you'll want to kick back with a cold drink and talk about the beauty of the walk.

Start the walk in Coogee and finish in Bondi. As an ex-Sydney native, I can honestly say this is one of my favourite walks. This time around was my first since the upgrade around the Bondi Cemetery, and now that the walkway is complete, this walk is now a must-do when in Sydney. I took a friend with me who had never been to Bondi or Coogee and she just loved it. It's easy to navigate, and the views are without a doubt spectacular. I think finishing the walk in Bondi is better as you have more options then to eat/drink. Worth noting that this walk is suitable for the not-so-fit as well as the fitness junkies, both me and my friend were not in particularly good shape when we did this walk a week ago and we both finished up just fine.

must do in sydney :-). loved this walk , beautiful beaches and scenery , one of the things I was looking forward to during my time in sydney and I was not disappointed, a visit to bondi is a must do and if you can do the coastal walk then even better, you won't regret it as it's stunning :-)
The wind in your hair and fabulous views.. I like the easy path but not too modernised. I loved the great views out to the Pacific Ocean and enjoying the simmers in the sea rock pools.

Nothing beats this walk. Lots of people of all ages do this walk and the scenary is spectecular and thus everyone is a great frame of mind. At the end of the walk (we did Coogee to Bondi), a nice coffee aor smothie t one of the many cafes did not go amiss.

It not only Bondi Beach that is spectacular. I always visit famous beaches around the world and Bondi Beach is a must do. Is that all? No, it isn't. The Coastal walk show many different rocks shape by nature's wind, water and sand. It is a stroll away from the hectic at the beach and gives you an excellent chance to enjoy the ocean side. The walk is well prepared and easy to do with children. If you do it in a moderate pace you will find a lot of beautiful rock shapes and little ocean critters in the little rockpools. Absolutely enjoyed it and would definitely recommend it for those whose really want to see more of the Oceanside.

Brilliant walk. This is such a good walk with lots of things to see along the way. Very popular. The area is different and you go through a cemetery which has lots of different types of graves stones.

Great views. I've done this walk lots of times as my cousin lived at Tamarama beach next along from Bondi.I took my friend this year and she absolutely raved about it to everyone when we got home.One of these experiences travellers could easily miss as they are not aware of its existence.

A must do experience. Can't recommend this walk highly enough. The scenery is breathtaking. We were lucky enough to spot a whale out in the distance which made our day. The walk does have some stairs but it was fairly easy given you can go as fast or slow as you want. There are lots of spots to sit and rest along the way. Take your camera!!!!

Fantastic way to spend a day. Awesome walk! Anyone can do it, as long as you are able to walk. Do it at your own pace. There are plenty of benches and rest areas to sit and admire the excellent scenery throughout the walk.Water coolers that provide filtered water are dotted along the whole length of the route, so no worries about water. Do stop at Bronte to try out the Fish and chips at Bronte Road. Scrumptious meal at a delightful price. Must try the salad. Since there is limited seating area, just purchase take-away and have a picnic meal at the park. Very convenient to catch a bus back to Sydney once you reach Coogee.

Delightful walk ending with great lunch at Bondi. Start on the Coogee (or further) coastline and a dip into the baths (sheltered ocean pools). Walk the gorgeous coastline along paths up and down hills for a lovely, low-exertion workout. End up at Bondi Beach and choose a fabulous lunch from Trattoria's.

Good walk, great views but lots of people. There are some amazing coastal views on the walk and you get a great view of Bondi looking back. The walk is relatively easy with some steps up and down in parts. The part past the cemetery was a good section of the walk. Coffee shops at the end!

A must for any visitor. If you have decent health and fitness, I would rate this as a must-do tourist attraction for any visitor to Sydney. Beautiful views. Plenty of places to stop along the way. Do not miss!
beautiful place in sunny days. It was a really nice place and we enjoy visiting it. You should be ready to walk for an hour or more.

Must do beach walk. If you are a walker or hiker, you must do the Bondi to Coogee walk. The trail is well marked and mostly paved. The walk offers beautiful views of the coastline. I really enjoyed the change of scenery after a week in downtown Sydney. Each beach had services such as bathrooms, cafe's, restaurants so it was really easy to stop along the way. The bus stops at the beginning and end were easy to find and the buses were frequent.

Lovely cold beer/bubbles at the end of a great walk. The walk itself is fairly easy and you get to see a side of Sydney and the suburbs that is totally unexpected. Weird to have a cemetery taking up such prime real estate..when you walk past it you'll understand what I mean

Go on a nice day. This is a paved walk that has beautiful views of the ocean. It goes in and out of villages where you can leave the walk and find food and/or drink. There are even public restrooms available in some of the beach parks that you will be walking past. After a few hours we were running out of energy and time and we saw a bus stop. We had a bus pass so we hopped on the bus and got ourselves back to Sydney. Very easy.

Only walked to Bronte but.... It's a must do, it's a pretty easy walk if you can handle a few stairs and up hill bits. The views are stunning and the little coves you walk past make you want to stop at each one!

My home. This is where I live and it is the most amazing coastal walk. Just sit back and absorb the view at many of the well located benches along the way. Every turn has a different outlook and if you are coming from Bronte to Bondi once you turn towards bondi the view is breathtaking. If you are lucky enough you may see the dolphins and whales along the way. If you like views do not forget the Bondi Icebergs If you are from out of town you can pop in and have a cuppa or meal without being a member. The posh restaurant next door is far more expensive but the same view. Have fun.

The most amazing walk. Fantastic walk along the cliff. Probably the best city walk in the world. Great for fitness too, as there are steps everywhere and every 5 minutes or so there are places where you can do different types of exercise.

Beautiful coastal walk. What a great trip along the beaches and promenades. Easy to walk, but remember sneakers (comfortable shoes). My kids had a blast walking and there are fun things to see along the way.

Wonderful, would recommend to anyone. Absolutely love this walk. I did it in perfect whether, but I'd happily do it in crappy weather. Beautiful views the whole way, and great places to eat at the end.

Most Gorgeous Walk. We walked the 4 mile walk from Coogee to Bondi Beach on a beautiful Saturday in June. It was one of the most beautiful walks we've ever taken. The trail was perfectly maintained the entire way with steps and handrails where needed. It remained right on the edge of the cliff or along the beach almost entirely, It was an easy walk even for us seniors. I would recommened it highly. Se were staying in Sydney and were able to get to and fro the hike on the local bus.

Put the shoes on get 2 dollars in pockets and walk. Loved it, it was a sunny summer day hot but nice, arrived at destination, got the money out znd took the bus back to our hotel. The drive back was good we could see other perpectives.The walk is also where people jog so be mindful of your steps...this is serious sport out there even in the heat!!!
Great walk but busy!. Love the views but try to go away from week-ends when it gets very busy. Weekdays and evenings are terrific. This is even truer for Sculpture by the Sea in November!

Coastal variety. Not only beautiful coastline and views of the Pacific but interesting sites along the way. Clovelly beach with its narrow cove and strip of splendid beach was lovely. The visit enhanced by some brave winter swimmers and a cosy cafe. Tamarama and Bronte also boast beautiful beaches and coffee shops with lovely views. We walked from Coogee to Bondi having to shelter from the rain at Clovelly for 15 minutes. One highlight was the cemetery perched on the cliff with the residents occupying some of the most expensive real estate on the coast. The path ranged from concrete steps and paths to steps and boardwalks. Lots of walkers and joggers added to the experience.

Must do on your trip to sydney. This was a lovely walk and very picturesque. We started from Coogee and walked our way till Bondi. We really enjoyed each and every bit of it.Tip for travellers -There is bus service for Boondi as well as Coogee beach from circular quay so you can start either ways

Great walking experience. Liked: the weather and the fresh air, the wonderful view and the pristine cleanlinessDisliked: the path was for most of the part a thin, winding one and joggers keep brushing past
Art on the coast. Beautiful walk a definite must. Well maintained path. There is an annual art display that is fantastic although a little busy!

A Walk to Remember!. I went to this walk as I wanted to explore the coastal beauty of this place. An it is one decision I am not going to regret for my life. I took a bus to Bondi Beach. The weather was sunny and it was the perfect setting for a nice weekend. The walk is around 5km long so carry plenty of water and something to eat midway. Trust me, the sights are so beautiful, you'll never feel tired. I took 3 hours to cover the entire stretch but only because I spent 45 mins sitting on a vertical cliff face, soaking in the sights, the calm and the serenity. Every 10 mins, I would stop to take a picture. Better start off early, say, 10AM so that you can beat the afternoon sun.

a must do.... this is for everyone, from people with kids to fitness junkies......you can start from any end, BONDI or COOGEE. we caught a bus to coogee from there we started walking Coogee > Clovelly > Brinte > Tamarama > bondi ( I am not sure of the order). it has beaches, bays, pools, cliffs and yeah the most stunning sites to stop by and admire. public transport is available from both ends, so you need not worry about it. WALK IT ALONG !!!The best part of the walk was the famous Waverley Cemetery along the way, I wonder how would it be in the night. I am going in again for the experience and most importantly to take a dip in the water this time.

Unique and exhilarating. You don't have to be an athlete to do this walk. The air is so clean and the views are extraordinary. But just go as far as Bronte. That's enough and there are great cafés waiting as a reward. Enjoy

Beautiful-one of the best things we did!. Loved this walk. It was a fairly easy walk, with magnificent views. We stopped half way through and had lunch at a little cafe. This was one of our favorite things we did in Sydney.
Nice experience. It is a must to go there!!! Stunning sights, an inspirational place to go around, for sure I'll come back as soon as possible

Coast Walk. Great walk to do with the family. I took my children aged 10, 7 and 4. The older kids ran ahead while I walked (slowly) with mr 4. Great views. There was a southerly so it was a bit windy in places but others were sheltered. We did the walk in winter so if it is blowing you might need a jumper. There are parks, cafes, and other points of interest. Had lunch on Bondi beach and then returned to Bronte.

Best Walk Ever. Start early with a good relax in Coogee Beach. Then walk through some cliffs and enjoy some views and soon you get to Gordon's Bay, a small but incredibly beautiful beach, awesome for diving/snorkeling...some time later you'll get to the unexpectedly beautiful graveyard of Waverly, right in front of the sea... I could describe the rest of this walk, but you'll only realize how beautiful it is after you've done it. If you're in Sydney, don't miss the chance!Take some food with you and a bottle of water (there are many places to fill it) and appreciate tthe great walk =)
Coastal Walk. This is a very enjoyable coastal walk with some steeper sections. Runners might want to make this a coastal scenic training location. It is well worth the visit
beautiful walk. Its a gorgeous walk to have with your kids, family or your loved ones, or even to lay and soak up the sun all day, a must do while in Sydney
Best walk in Australia. Dead set wraps around the best suburbs in the Eastern Suburbs of Sydney. Whether you real walker or want the best views for photos, take a walk on the wild side...
Beautiful walk!. We did this our last day in sydney and it was absolutely stunning! I highly recommend doing it on a clear sunny day!
Was wonderful.. Went there with my partner and had a great walk along the beach, the salt water pool is fantastic! Views are stunning the whole way.

Wet and Windy, but well worth it.. Loved every minute of it, you must start with a coffee in Coogee, then enjoy the 7k coastline walk taking in the views, as well as the cemetery on the cliff. Once in Bondi, grap another coffee before boarding the No 76 bus to Watsons Bay Beach Club for a cople of beers, then catch the ferry back to circular quay !!

Simply Stunning. A walk along this 5.9km is mighty rewarding. Starting at Bondi the iconic pavilion, golden sand, surfers and the Iceberg Pool are all as described. then the fun begins, jagged cliffs, stunning bays around each corner, some hidden, many joggers - walkers heading north and South make this trek so enjoyable. take a bottle of water and a snack and make the most of the numerous seats provided for your benefit and at remarkably scenic lookouts. I went on a weekday and there certainly was a number of users but plenty of time for finding your own personal space. absolutely must do. Also great as the number of steps (some steep) make it impossible for bikes to share the walk so you can meander as you like.
we went only halfway. great view but bad weather. i love the place with the surfer community. one drawback was the public transport. its far from the nearest bus station to the city.

Classic of sydney. Coogee to Bondi is a must do when you come to Sydney. If you are lucky, you will be able to spot whales, dolphins.... At some time of the year, the sculptures by the sea in November is a good place to go around Bondi and Bronte. Crowded during the week and early morning when everyone is doing their exercise. Best spot in sydney to watch the sunrise, especially between Bronte beach and Tamarrama beach.

Refreshing & Romantic. Its worth all e hassle goin to Bondi! E view was well worth the time and effort,we were lucky that we even spotted a whale when we were havin breakfast in Bondi iceberg cafe! Will surely wana go back again :)
Workout by ocean. Great place to take the 2 hour walk / jog/run or pack your own picnic with a beautiful view of ocean all the time

Sculptures by the Sea. This walk is fantastic at any time of the year but its an extra highlight during November when Sculptures by the Sea is on. Walk is a proper sealed path but with stairs and gradients so maybe not suited to everyone.
Nice walk. Nice walks along the shores with some beautiful views of the coast. Great to spend the day walking a bit, rest some time at one of the beaches and continue your walk

"Totally recommend this breathtaking coastal walk". This walk is crazy amazing and I recommend doing it both from Bondi Beach to Coogee and then Coogee to Bondi Beach on another day. The views are stunning especially on a clear blue day – the shades of blues in the water marrying with the blues in the sky is breathtaking. Then you look towards the land and be amazed by its rock formation – it is like natures priceless art. You can also smell the ocean and the sounds of the waves are calming and soothing. It takes about 2 hours one way.Check the bus timetable and bus stops on the Internet and plan your trip. http://www.sydneybuses.info/routes/timetables-route-mapshttp://www.transportnsw.infoAs you walk, you will pass the following beaches – all of which are uniquely beautiful:Bondi BeachTamaramaBronte BeachClovellyCoogee BeachStop for a swim, if that’s your thing, however beware of the rip current, especially if you are not a strong swimmer. A piece of advise to people coming from the topics - the water is cold even on a hot day. It is so refreshing though.There are places for you to sit and relax or even mediate. Plan your trip such that you have a meal at Bondi Beach or Coogee Beach to catch a breath, soak up the views and top up on your energy levels before you head back to your hotel. Or you could take a break halfway at Bronte Beach. There are pretty nice cafes and eateries along these beaches.I am bias with this attraction because of all the things I have done – the Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal Walk is one of my favourites. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!!!!!

Get up early to avoid the crowds. Despite what the locals tell you the walk is not that long. The scenery though is fantastic. It's a birds eye view over Sydney famous beaches. If you do I early you avoid the crowds and can pick your spot on one of the beaches.

"What a breath of fresh air". Walked from Bondi to Bronte Beach and took about an hour. Stopped for coffee at Tamarama Beach and enjoyed watching the beach volleyball and surroundings.Caught the bus from Bronte Beach so no need to walk both ways......great!!!!!Would definitely recommend doing this in Sydney if you have the time.

Beach walk. We reached Bondi beach via the hop on hop off bus Bondi tour. It was a nice experience. There are shops where you can buy beach wear in case you didn't bring yours. It's beach that is open to public right next to where the bus stops. But if you are not a swimmer at all, it is not a good place to swim because of the strong current. It's more ideal for surfing I think. But the scenery is overall relaxing.

Fantastic scenery, great walk!. I did it the other way around, starting from Coogee and finished in the South End, stopping for a swim both at Bronte rock pool (fantastic place to swim laps!!!) and at Bondi. The scenery is breathtaking, you think you've seen the most beautiful scene and the around the corner is something even more amazing. Going all the the way to the South End takes a few hours if you stop for a swim or two and may be a lunch. A perfect way to spend a day in Sydney!

Superb walk. The only real problem with this walk is making your way to bondi, which either by bus or taxi is hard. There is no direct train service. But once you are on the walk you will see decide that all that hard work paid off. I don't want to write much about the actual walk itself, except GO DO IT!

A simple must-do when in Sydney. The beach walk is gorgeous, well marked, easy to walk, and has some breathtaking viewing points. Even though it was winter Bondi Beach was swimmable and it is always fun to watch the surfers.
Must do in Sydney. No walk like this in the world, with 6 distinct beaches along the way. Takes about 1.5 hours and wear a bathing suit and coverup because you will get heated.

Wonderful way to spend a couple hours!. The view was certainly nice, but the rock formations, shapes, textures and colors were so exciting I kept stopping to take pictures. SO glad we spent an afternoon doing this walk. The rain didn't lessen our fun!

Walk was amazing with the sculptures by the Sea. While we are on a tour, our tour guide dropped us off at Bondi beach and suggested we do the coastal walk. We just happened to be there at the same time as the sculptures by the sea, and we had such a great time snapping funny pictures with some of the sculptures, however, the walk alone is amazing. We were surprised at how close you can actually get to the cliffs. We had our picture made with our feet dangling over the cliffs with the beautiful water in the background. The water crashing onto the cliffs was breathtaking..Plan to spend no less than an hour on this amazing walk to truly appreciate the beauty. This is a walk you don't want to miss.

You must do it. if you are visiting Sydney, specially the beaches, these are 2 beaches you must visit: Coogee and Bondi. Even better if you can enjoy the walk between both of them. .. I would suggest you to first go to Bondi, have some time there. Bondi is huge, large part of sand as well. The beach is surrounded by many places to eat. Then you walk to Coogee. Take your time, enjoy the beautiful view all the way and you can stop by smaller beaches on the way. Also, drinking water is available on the way. After around 1 1/2 hour relaxing walking, with some ups and down, you arrive at friendly Coogee, which is my favorite beach. kind of smmal, but very nice!

One of the best walk in Sydney. Wonderful scenery, cliffs and beaches. I even spot a whale once. It is about 6km and takes 1.5 to 2 hours. The best time to visit is at the end of October when the Sculptures By The Sea is on.
Awesome walk. Great walk not too challenging but the scenery is fantastic. Clearly marked and plenty of coffee shops if you need a beak along the way.

Stunning scenery, exercise and coffee. An iconic walkway, well used by locals and visitors alike. We've never found a bad time to walk it tho it is extremely busy during 'Sculpture by the Sea' time (advice - go early to avoid biggest crowds). Can stop for a snack, coffee/cake or toilet break at Tamarama part way before climbing up to Waverley Cemetery. Cemetery interesting (a few historic figures buried here) but the views along the coast are the real reason for walking. At the right time, you can even whale watch as you wander

Lovely walk despite the rain. This is a truly beautiful walk along the coast passing several very nice beaches. We took the bus to Bondi beach and after exploring that area we started out on the walk. It was cloudy at the start but turned to steady rain later on. But that gave us an excuse to stop at a lovely little cafe for some excellent coffee when the rain started really pouring down. After our coffee, the rain had almost stopped and we continued on our way to Coogee where we took a bus back to downtown. All is all, this was a very pleasant walk despite the rain.

The locals top 5 walks to do in sydney. When visitors come to Sydney then this is one of the best things to do and most would agree it's on the top 5 walks you can do in Sydney.Start in iconic Bondi and head south along the coastal path and you'll be treated to some stunning ocean views and pass some fantastic swimming pools and people performing surfing stunts for your viewing pleasure.Check out Bondi icebergs which has a great pool for public use which include the use of a sauna and has a small cafe downstairs. In the middle section this place has a club which you can sign yourself in for free (if you live further than 5km away) and get a balcony seat at the best view of bondi beach and surfers and the 50m pool below bar none!The walk takes in various beaches - Tamarama (or Glamarama as the locals call it because many of the 'beautiful' people like to hang out here) - This has just been renovated with a new cafe and park with childrens play area and free bbq facilities!Next beach along is Bronte which is like a mini Bondi with a smaller arc of sand and a more cosy feel. This has a great park with childrens train and play area with coin operated bbq facilities too.Try out one of the 10 cafe options behind the park too - they are all pretty good since they have to compete for the custom but they have different owners and styles.At the south head of Bronte is the fantastic ocean pool. WARNING - if you walk past this pool you're going the wrong way for the coastal walk since it leads to a dead end! However it's a great diversion and you just have to backtrack to the stairs near the changing rooms.Up the hill you'll see a cementary in the distance as you head to Gordons Bay and Coogee. There's now a metal coastal walkway ocean side which means you don't have to be up close and personal to the stark reminder that life is short. Enjoy life and walk on by to Gordans bay popular with snorkelists and scuba divers before you come around the headland to the fantastic Coogee beach with numerous eating and drinking options - it's like the slightly smaller brother of Bondi beach. It's Icebergs swimming pool is called 'Wylie's baths' and although it doesn't have the glamour of icebergs it has it's own charm which is more secluded and hence less well known.
Fabulous. Marvelous walk on the beach with a very hectic sea! Impressive to see how daring all the surfers are of the huge waves. Always busy!

Go for it!. How good is this! Ocean views and invigorating walk close to major city. If weather is ok, bring bathers and try out clovelly ocean 'pool'. Don't just do bondi to bronte. The cemetery part of walk south of bronte is very picturesque.

A fine view of Sydney. This is an invigorating walk around the beautiful cliffs of the eastern Suburbs with the bonus of great food and drinks at either end . The views out over the ocean and the little peaks at bushland and great houses make it a must for those visiting Sydney....and people watching? Perfect.

Love this walk. One of the best walks in the world- easy walking- finish with lunch in the icebergs club- superb views, great food and club price drinks. Enjoy watching the dolphins catching the waves. In November you have sculptures by the sea.
Just beautiful. Walked to beach and was impressed how clean Bondi Beach was. Had lunch with a wonderful view of the beach. Would definitely visit again.

Don't miss this walk, it's a must!. We just did the Bondi Beach to Bronte walk but really enjoyed the views and the wind sculptured rock areas. Plenty of places to sit down and enjoy the scenery along the way. A few stairs but manageable. Nice lunch at Bronte Belo at the end of our walk. Will try and do the walk all the way to Coogee next time.
Bondi hike. Great hike...make sure you go to at least the cemetary...roughly 2 miles each direction...beautiful beaches along the way.

Amazing views. What an amazing walk to take! Gorgeous views, multiple beaches, small town and friendly people. The only negative is that once you get a few beaches away from Bondi it is difficult to find a cab to get you back to the city. Be prepared to put a few miles on your shoes and enjoy.

Unbelievable beauty! A must do in Sydney!. This is a walk for all ages and all fitness standards. You take do it as quickly or as slowly as you like. The views are magnificent and you feel close enough to the ocean to almost touch it. Early morning is best because it is less crowded. As popular with locals as with visitors.
a must walk. It doesnt matter if you are visiting Australia or a local, this is a great walk across teh ocean front. Do it at subrise or sunset for great photos or mid morning for a bit of sun

A must do if your in Sydney. I have lived in Sydney all my life and have done this walk more times than i can remember. I still love doing it.I remember take someone from the UK to Coogee , parked the car and walked early morning to Bondi for a swim. That was enough for her to want to move to Sydney. Enough said!

Good views but allow 3 hours to do the walk.. We are pensioners and found the walk very interesting. You do need to be quite fit to be able to do the entire walk. The great thing is you could break it up into smaller sections or select one of the beaches for a relaxing break for a swim and lunch. We started at Bondi, but had to finish at Clovelly as we found the walk quite tiring. I would still choose Manly for a day trip from Sydney CBD over Bondi.

Beautiful. Breathtaking view... Although we were initially tired and not very keen to do the coastal walk, in the end we decided to go for it as it will be a pity to miss the beautiful sights of bondi

Clovelly to Bondi - always great. We have done this walk many times - always great. Starting at the huge Clovelly free carpark, coffee overlooking Clovelly beach, then onto Bondi Icebergs via Bronte and Tamarama. Regular dolphin sightings, and whale sightings when they are on the move.Only about 1-2 hours, and we always end up at the Icebergs for lunch overlooking Bondi Beach. Then back to Clovelly, maybe a coffee at the new Tamarama coffee kiosk along the way. What a way to spend a sunny Sydney day!Tip - better done during the week, can get crowded on a weekend.

Great views on this coastal walk. This is a lovely walk, we went from Coogee to Bondi. It is a coastal walk so there are hill climbs and a lot of steps, very safe though with hand rails etc. The only problem was there are not many places to stop for lunch. The Bondi Bath Club is well worth a well earned visit at the end of the walk, you are allowed in on a day pass, great food and fantastic views overlooking Bondi

Incomparable views. The Bondi-Coogee Coastal Walk has some of the best views of Sydney. We started from Coogee Beach and it us about 2.5-3 hours to walk back to Bondi though it felt much quicker than that. It was an easy walk and we stopped several times along the way to take in the postcard-perfect scenery. We were lucky enough to spot some dolphins near the Waverly coastline. Best to do this walk on a weekday without the hordes of families and tourists that throng on the weekends - though even then, the views will still be magnificent and well worth it.

whata a city. Wonderful views and scenery. Paths are well paved and defined. The day we walked locals were selling lemonade along the way. Everyone very pleasant and relaxed -suitable for all family and at the end enjoy a great coffee or meal to put back on the kilos. Bring camera.

The coast walk. On a sunny day there is no better way to start the day. We start from North Bondi and head around to Bronte. Stunning views along the cliff tops. Very safe with guard rails and adequate stais. But there a quite a few in some spots. We take our pooch as do lots of other walkers.

Beautiful walk. We didn't go all the way to Coogee but walked from Bondi to Bronte. It was a great walk with spectacular views. There are taps for drinking water along the way so take your water bottle to fill up. There are some steep climbs and steps but you can take it at your own pace so good for all fitness levels. Worth the views.

Beautiful beach, beautiful people. There are so many beautiful things on the beach that you woulden wanna miss out, be sure to reach on a good sunny weekend to enjoy the awesome views of the beach sand and sky. not to miss out the hunks and babes in skinnies

Totally A Must-Do. If you're visiting Sydney and want to have an unforgettable experience, go and do this!! We walked, start from the Bondi Beach, all the way through Tamarama Beach, Bronte Beach, and Clovelly Beach and ended our walk on Coogee Beach. We went after lunch and it was hot as hell, but it was so worth it! The view was just awesome and it certainly was one of the best experience I had in Sydney that I won't forget. Choose to walk early morning or late afternoon to avoid the heat. And note this: please wear your sunscreen cause you can get sunburn really bad if you didn't. Wearing hat will be very helpful.

A lovely walk. We've been doing this walk now nearly two times a month and it is very nice each time. Especially during the whale season where you can spot with binoculars a lot of whales!Try not to swim at Tamarama beach as this is the most dangerous beach in NSW due to its rip curls.

Beautiful walk, very scenic, wear sneakers. Loved the walk! It is very scenic and made for a very nice leisurely stroll. Enjoyed quaint Gordon's Bay as well as seeing all the surfers at Bronte's beach. A bit longer than I anticipated and lots of ups and downs, would recommend wearing sneakers as my feet were not happy after that walk in flip flops.

Beautiful views just keep going on and on.... This was highly recommended and luckily we had a wonderful sunny day to enjoy it. The walk is not that challenging and you can go as fast or slow as you want although it can be steep at times. Each beach has its own charm and I would have liked to stop off at each beach and have a swim along the way but it wasnt quite warm enough for that. There are lots of people on this trail on a good day so be prepared for lots of people and I wouldn't recommend trying to go for a run! Absolutely stunning views must see!
Great Walk. The views from the tops of the cliffs were stunning and visiting the small beaches was memorable. Worth the two hours it took.

Fantastic experience. A great walk on a clear sunny day. Stop at the Clovelly Bowling Club for a refreshing drink and fantastic views. Many people on the path but that adds to the buzz. Stop at Coogee for lunch and then return.

Bondi/Coogee Beach track to run and walk.. I walked partway and my husband ran the whole track several times while we were staying at Coogee Beach. The views were amazing and the attractions along the route were interesting. Take your camera.

Amazing. This walk is one of the most beautiful coastal walks in the world. The path is comfortable & plenty of places to swim and surf. Lots of places to get a cool drink or a bite to eat & amenities.

Local haunt. You'll share this walk with every local resident (especially on a weekend)...or, at least, that's what it might feel like....but to be honest, this is what makes it so special. It's one of Sydney's urban slices of heaven - winding around parks, homes, under cliffs, past an old cemetery, and above beautiful beaches and bays. There's training stations if you feel like getting down and sweaty, or outcrops to sit upon and soak up the views. If crowds are really not your thing, go on a weekday. But, for my money, if it's a one time only adventure, go on a weekend and watch the locals strut their stuff. There possibly isn't a better place for people watching!

Stunning Sydney coastal walk. We've done this walk several times and could never get tired of it. It's a stunning walk to satisfy both locals and tourists. We start the walk at the southern end of Bondi Beach by the famous Bondi Baths and Bondi Icebergs. It's a relatively easy walk, around 2 and half hours. It is, naturally, busier on week-ends than during the week and a haven for joggers. Lots to observe - beautiful beaches, parks, glamorous properties. There are plenty of scenic spots to have a picnic but lots of cafes and eateries along the way. This walk has something for everyone.

a quick way to see a wide variety of the best Australian beaches. This clifftop coastal journey meanders amongst quiet sleepy suburbs, the old Coogee Cemetery, the oldest lifesaving club in the world at Bronte, and concludes that magnificent Bondi Beach.This is a good way to blow a day, stopping at various beaches; enjoying the scenery the history of Sydney and is very well kept and maintained clifftop pathway. don't let the kids behind it and have fun climbing on the rocks playing in the rock pools enjoying Sydney sandy beaches and wind up at the magnificent Bondi icebergs swimming pool. But the adults of course it is time to stop in at Bondi icebergs restaurant whether the lunch afternoon tea or evening meal. It is probably easiest to get here I starting from the Coogee end and and walking back towards Bondi.this is the undiscussed whale watching journey that every visitor should make whilst in Sydney. Between the months of late May and late November literally thousands of Whales passed by these shores and are viewed by passers-by.Another great attraction which occurred between late October and late November is the world famous sculptures by the sea.

One of the great coastal walks!. Make the effort to set out early around daybreak. There's plenty of stairs and hills to negotiate but the breathtaking views of the sea and the sun coming up make this about the best way to wake up in the world. Have a coffee after you have a swim in the sea at south Bondi under the Icebergs restaurant.

See why you came to Sydney. Cliffs, Walk, Beaches, Exercise, Amazing Whales.. This is the best side of Sydney and the most underrated of Sydney's scenery. This very accessible attraction is probably best approach from the Coogee side by one of the buses from the city or even the inner west.Don't let the kids behind because this is an easy enough walk for anybody over the age of five. you get to see the very best of Sydney as you stroll along the cliff tops. This is also the location of the world-famous sculptures by the sea. This open air sculpture exhibition is a must see and occurs between October and late November. Visit www.sydney.com for full details.During the whale season which starts in earnest in June and continues through to November these magnificent creatures of the deep can be seen just off the coast from many of the vantage points.This 60 to 80 min walk wouldn't be complete without a stop off at the Bondi icebergs a saltwater swimming pool located on the southernmost tip of Bondi Beach. Or enjoy lunch or afternoon tea or some of Sydney's finest dining at the Bondi icebergs restaurant.
Bondi beautiful weather with beautiful people. Love to run along the coastal walk way - the weather was warm in April for April - stopped for a coffee at Icebergs on the way back

'Close to the city" coastal walk. Wonderful walk (or run! Many people run this full path, with dogs)Best way is starts from Coogee and ends in Bondi. More bars, cafes, restaurants to go to, such as Hurricane ribs (its a must!). Going through 5 beaches in total. Can stop by at Clovelly Bowling Club for a game of lawnballing. Beautiful view. If non stop, the walk will take about 2 hours. Best if the Sculpture of the Sea is on too, which is normally in mid November. Recommend it!

Don't miss this Sydney experience. Beautiful views and a way to see the beautiful beaches and sites in the Sydney suburbs. While the walk isn't challenging, there are a number of staircases -- keep in mind if you have bad knees.

Go for it, one of the few things that are free in Aus!. We have completed this walk on at least three occasions on our visits to Australia, combine it with lunch either side and it makes a good day out. Scenery, as expected in Australia is amazing, you will need to be reasonably fit to accomplish this walk. As the title says- it's free, not many things are in Aus so make the most of it!

Great day trip. My wife and I enjoyed this coastal walk back in March and really enjoyed it. The bus ride from Circular Quay (if you get on the one with less stops) was really simple and not too long. You get to enjoy the view of Bondi beach the second you get off the bus and they don't stop for the rest of the walk. If you go all the way to Coogee I believe it will end up being about a 10 mile round trip day, which is just about right if you are an avid walker, runner, hiker.There are numerous great spots along the way where you can enjoy some great cliff views, beautiful beaches and neighborhoods along with lots of fun beach places to stop for a bite to eat. This was the best way to spend the one full day we had in Sydney before heading back to the states and really found it relaxing. Recommend it for sure!

Scenes to remember for a lifetime. Surf-boarders, huge breakers, sculpted rock and excellent walking paths! The beach walking and coastal paths offer views, flora and seascapes and people of all ages enjoying the areas.

Great walking tour.. We stayed in Randwick for some of our trip, so Coogee beach was just a 30 minute walk away. That was the start of our walk to Bondi. From Coogee beach, through Dunningham Reserve, around Bundock Park to Clovelly. Great cafe, The Seasalt. Its then around the very well protected beach, through Burrows Park to pass by Waverly Cemetery, a history lesson on its own. Soon passing Bronte Beach, followed by Tamarama Beach. After Marks Park comes Hunter Park and then the edge of Bondi Beach can be seen. Before reaching it you pass the Bondi Icebergs swimming club pool. Fascinating history of the area. Then the broad sweep of the scimitar shaped Bondi and the famous beach. All along the route are water stations. Not just to drink from but to fill your water bottle too. Great cafes are available. Each beach has its own lifeguards and of course the famous Bondi Rescue are in evidence. We watched while an episode of the programme was being filmed. The great thing is the many people from all over that you meet and chat to. Everyone has a reason to be at Bondi. There are busses to and from each beach if that is what you want. We walked back, ending up at Randwick after a stunning sunset. A most wonderful and entertaining walk.

Scenic delight. This walk is wonderful on a summers day. It winds around the coast from Coogee Beach to Bondi, passing several beaches on the way. It a good hike so wear comfortable shoes but well worth the effort. At certain times of the year they have sculptures by the sea, quite amazing works of art, very unique and lots of fun.

great coastal walk. Catch the bus from the city or drive and park, this is a beautiful walk along the top of sandstone cliffs beside the ocean. Fabulous views and some great real estate to look at. It is an easy walk with several short flights of steps. It's easier to find parking at Coogee than Bondi though walking from either beach is a great way to spend half a day. Have a meal or drink at Bondi, Coogee or Bronte. There are plenty of good cafes and a few bars.

coogee. A cliff top coastal walk, coogee to bondi walk extends for six km in Sydney’s eastern suburbs. The walk features stunning views, beaches, parks, cliffs, bays and rock pools. The beaches and parks offer a place to rest, swim or a chance to eat at one of the cafes, hotels, restaurants or takeaways.You can get there by train and bus or just drive and take the walk.Along the beach walk there are picnic shelters, play areas, kiosks, toilets and change-rooms.Some of the beaches are Tamarama, Bronte, and Maroubra. They have have free electric barbecues. The coastal walk is a medium grade walk but there are some steep gradient paths and several staircases along the track. There are rest stops with great views and seating along the the way. It takes about two hours to complete the Beach section of the walk and another hour and a half if you choose to continue to Maroubra. A board walk takes you past Waverley Cemetery, the most scenic burial ground in the world.
The best of the East. Probably the most stunning walk in the Eastern suburbs, and one of the nicest coastal walks in greater Sydney. Some great cafes on the way, too.

Breathtaking views. This walk along a beautiful coastline is at times breathtakingly beautiful. Around every corner is another picture perfect beach. There are many places to stop and sit and just enjoy the view. At some of the beaches there are lovely little cafes where you can enjoy a well earned coffee or cold drink. Towards the end of the year you can enjoy Sculptures by the Sea which is a definite must see. At other times you may be lucky enough to spot a pod of dolphins or migrating whales. Even if you see none of these the walk is spectacular.

Free, beautiful and easy. If you want to se some dramatic coastline of Sydney in a relaxing way, this is the best way to do it. Public buses are available to and from the city at either end of the walk in Bondi and Coogee, or you can stop half way at Bronte and catch the bus back from there. Definitely a must!

Bondi to Coogee walk. If you never have done this its a must. On a good day you can make a day of it. Start at Bondi, Take your swimmers and a towell there are many spots to have a cool dip on the way. Have lunch at Coogee in one of the many cafe and walk back to Bondi. There is always the option to get the bus back.
Worth the walk!. The scenery on this walk makes it worth the effort. You get to see houses that are unbelievable, cliffs, and beaches. There is some great coffee shops to stop along the way.

One of Sydney's great walks. On a beautiful day, this is a wonderful walk. great scenery out to the Ocean, surfers abound, it is not too strenuous. Also fantastic eating places at both ends of the walk (Bondi & Coogee or Bronte). At the right time of the year, whales abound just offshore, and sometimes give a wonderful playful exhibition.

A Sydney MUST, with good reason. This is my meditation walk every week, so beautiful. It can get hectic on the weekends, so I recommend a week day or, if you must, late afternoon on the weekends. Don't just do the Bondi-Bronte component; things get really interesting when you pass Bronte and pass through the old cemetery and past oldies playing lawn bowls.

backdoor beauty. This is the way I walk to work. Its magical. In all weather its worth the effort, sun or rain - wind, it can be majestic, crashing waves and surf - and suntanned bodies or early morning yoga meditators. Stop along the way for rest/swim/coffee breaks. Sydney locals love this walk, it refreshes your senses and sets the tone for the day.

Favourite Sydney spot. Any time I have a friend from out of town in Sydney I always take them here. Even in winter on a calm day it is perfect. At certain times of the year you can see whales out further. It's a great spot to unwind after a tough day, or start your day fresh here. Breakfast or lunch at Bronte is always an added bonus before the walk back too.

Beach heaven. As a local this is still one of my favourite things to do in Sydney and a must do for visitors, so close to the city yet amazing coast line and great beaches......and in June you may even get to see Whales If Coogee is too far you can stop at Tamarrama or Bronte if starting in Bondi

A MUST do!!!. I live right opposite Coogee Beach and do this walk regularly and never ever get bored of it as its always something happening and its different every day.So if your a tourist my advise is it DEFINITELY needs to be done!!! Start at Coogee and then pop in for breakfast at Bronte Beach on the way and then finish with a swim at Bondi and drinks and lunch at the Bucket List or Seafood Restaurant at the Rat House. Perfect!!!

Scenic Coastal Walk Bondi to Coogee.
