Start out on your walk from Bondi Icebergs watching the swimmers in the sea pool doing their laps.The swimmers are year round so even on the chilliest days they are there to be seen. continue up the path, keeping left to allow the joggers and fast walkers to pass. the coast line is beautiful and the rock formations are great. after 15 minutes you will reach Tamarama Beach, either walk down the steps and cross the sand to the other side if the beach is relatively clear. If not take the high path as the beach can get very crowded on nice days. This beach is also called Glamarama so the view from on high can be spectacular.Keep walking and the next beach you come to is Bronte. A beautiful inlet with a great park for a picnic or cross the road and get a fresh juice or coffee Continue on the coast you come to Waverly cemetery. This is a beautiful cemetery with the best views in sydney. Recently renovated take a while to walk around and discover who is buried there.Continue on round the corner to Clovelly, very much a family beach with protected areas for light swimming.keep on and you come to Coogee. After your walk you deserve a cold beverage in the beer garden of the Coogee Bay Hotel and watch the holiday crowds wander by.

Beware the foot traffic. Great for sweeping Pacific Ocean views and cliffs with smashing waves. Often see dolphins and com September, whales. Good place to spot peregrine falcon hunt pidgeons that roost along the cliffs.There are almost always jiggers and walkers aplenty. Best to go between 10am and 3 pm to avoid the crowds on week days. Nice spots to pull over and take in the vista. Sandstone cliffs and wee inlets are magnificent.

A Must Do!. Simply stunning views. Do this on a sunny day. You can stop at any of the beaches along the way so you don;t have to walk as far as Coogee. I like to walk from Bondi to Bronte and then have lunch in Bronte. It's a great work out as there are a few steps and a slight incline. Wear good walking shoes. The views are breathtaking- so take your camera!

Scenic. A fantastic theraputic walk with fantastic views of the ocean, only drawback is the weekend crowds. This walk does entail some steep sections and ocean sprays, so beware if asthmatic or unfit.

Great half day outing. Take the 333 bus from the city to Bondi Beach and start your walk to the South passing Bondi Icebergs as your first stop. Try and book a dinner at this icon but have your cheque book at the ready, it is not a cheap location! This fantastic walk is very busy on weekends and early in the morning due to joggers however outside those times you might be lucky enough to have the place to yourself. With an option to stop at Bronte Beach (small beach stop before Coogee) have some lunch/breakfast and take the bus back into the city from Bronte.Similar from Coogee (a much bigger and busier beach) lots of options for meals and buses back into Bondi Beach and the city.
Spectacular. This is one walk not to be missed. Summer or winter the walk should not be missed. The views fron the cliff and waters adge are fantastic.
One of the best. How lucky we are to have this walk in a city! Beautiful and the view changes around every corner. Do it, you won't regret it!

A piece of beauty in my own back yard. What a fabulous way to get around - yes, it's takes a bit longer than the direct route, but the rewards are fabulous! Spectactular scenery as far as the eye can see.

Craggy coastal views and cafe land merge. This is one of the things to put on your 'must do' list for Sydney. You can walk from Bondi to Coogee (and beyond) or the other way, or start at a mid point like Bronte Beach. Some sections have staircases like the section between Clovelly and Coogee via Gordon's Bay. The walk has a beautiful cliff top boardwalk on the Bronte to Clovelly section and the views across Waverley cemetery are stunning. You are probably no further than 20 mins from cafés and coffee at any point on the walk. This is a not to be missed outing.

Whale Watching on the boardwalk. The walk from Bondi to Coogee is a great way to see whales (during the season) as they swim down the coast close to shore. Its a popular spot with tourists and locals following the path and boardwalk while taking in the great views.

A great way to experience the local Sydney way of life. This walk is highly recommended for visitors and locals alike. The fresh air, exercise and spectacular views are just amazing on a beautiful day. There are also a couple of playgrounds en route, which allow for stops for families with younger kids. I recommend going in the morning as it's less busy and the playground equipment is not so hot. A great way to spend your day without having to spend any money.
A Must Do!!. There's no better way to see the picturesque coastline of the central city beaches!! So many photo opportunities from incredible vantage points, that can be reached fairly easily.

Beautiful scenary. A lovely natural beach view walk. Can be extremely crowded on weekends making it difficult to walk. Some lovely spots to swim either end of the walk. Has been upgraded since I last did the walk

Beautiful. Love love love this place! One of the reasons I love living in the Eastern Suburbs. Takes about 2 and a half hours at a brisk-ish pace. Make sure you wear suncream!! Feels cooler here than lying on the beach but the sun is so strong, I burnt badly in the 2 and a haf hours because I forgot to put some one! Also wear sensible shoes NOT flip flops. Even though so many people use this path it is not too busy. Great way to discover your favourite beach too!

Lovely walk, great way to see the coastline. We got recommendation for the walk from friends and really enjoyed it. We took ours on a hot summer day, but being close to the sea and the breeze helped. The small beaches on the way are lovely (bring/wear yr swimming suit). Scenery on the way quite stunning, camera will be busy...Also cafes and bars on the way, but at Coogee there will be lots of choice. Much recommended!
Great coastal walk. This I a fantastic walk to do at anytime but even more so when Sculptures By The Sea ievent is happening.
Spectacular .... Enough said!. Make the effort. This coastal walk is simply amazing. With the redesign of Tamarama ... Now the perfect midway stop (or the cafes in Bronte) ...
stunning. absolutely stunning walk. I went with my husband and a couple friends and we absolutely loved it! The weather was also perfect

Stunning Coastal Walk, Jog or Run!. If you do one walk while in Sydney, this is it!It is frequented by tourists and locals daily of all levels of fitness and ages - busier on weekends. There are lockers at the South Bondi lifesaving club for hire if you need - or at the various other clubs along the way. Bondi Beach to Coogee Beach and back jogging and walking will take you 2 hours.The order of the beaches is:- Bondi (Sydney's most famous beach with cafes with great people watching - South Bondi has the famous Icebergs Restaurant and Bar, stunning ocean pools and North Bondi with is more a family scene with smaller ocean pool and restaurants and cafes overlooking it),- Tamarama (which is a smaller boutique beach with a life saving club and a lovely cafe and kids playground), - Bronte (a 'cousin' beach to Bondi with lots of lovely cafes facing it, ocean baths, a life saving club),- Clovelly (which is a little cove that's family friendly with a shaded pavilion, cafe, life saving club and ocean pool), - Gordon's Bay (a very small bay dotted with little row boats on the beach), and - Coogee (another stunning larger beach with all the services).Take a hat, sunscreen, comfortable shoes or sneakers and enjoy the fresh air, and stunning cliff and beach scenery. Recommended for couples wanting a romantic walk, active families, travelling friends or solo. If with young children you may have to carry then for some of the steps - in between Bondi and Tamarama there's Marks Park with amazing views but also a huge grassed area for little ones to run around and a kids playground to one side - note that it is also a dog park meaning that dogs are allowed to be off the leash but the dogs are friendly ones and are too busy running around.If you're after a shorter walk I recommend Bondi to Tamarama or Bronte.If you need wheelchair access I recommend the beach promenades at Bondi or Coogee - great people watching and fresh sea air.Just do it! It'll cost you nothing and you'll remember it forever!
Sydney must do!. My favorite walk in Sydney! If you're in Sydney this is a must do.Best way to see the eastern suburbs beaches & coast.

One of the best views in sydney. Love this walk. Normally I start of with breakfast at Three blue duck at bronte then I walk to bondi and back. Best exercise while enjoying the views and the sun. Don't forget to check oct-nov's sculptures by the sea along this coastal walk.

Not to be missed: For all types of fitness. This is a great outdoor activity for all levels of fitness and for all ages. We passed families pushing strollers and 5yrs+ kids walking. It can get quite hot, so it is better to do in the morning or after the midday sun. I am a slow walker and did this with my husband in 2.5 hours. The walk is all along the coast with beautiful views.There are a few ,(minimal steps) at one part. There are cafes along the way at some of the beaches to get refreshments, although it is highly recommended to take water and sunscreen with. You may want to stop and have a swim at some of the beaches too. Of course a camera is a must - even if you are local. From Bondi you can take at a taxi back to Coogee or a bus to Bondi Junction and then another bus to Coogee (or anywhere else).
Oceanic and metro in one. The walk was beautiful, it was also a bit of a 'scene'- trendy and popular with all walk of life. Good for people watching! But be warned it can be crowded!

Breathtaking!. This walk is a photographer's paradise, views, cliffs, blue ocean, waves and beaches. The walk takes about 3 hours with plenty of stops. Also be sure to bring a lot of water and sunscreen. Even though it is a long walk its pretty easy.
Bondi Boardwalk. This walk is a great way to experience multiple beaches, a grandiose cemetary and very scenic views of the ocean. Definitely worth a couple of hours of your time.

beautiful views - a real must do in sydney!. a easy walk with stunning views and tons of spots to stop and swim or picnic on the way, as well as resteraunts and cafes.if your less laid back it could just be a great venue for a morning run...

Breathtaking, paths the whole way, rocks awesome. This walk took us about three hours and we must have taken over 200 photos! Wow, the view was just awesome, will do this walk again next time we go - loved that the beaches all had something different to offer.

Spectacular!. Be sure the walk the coastal walk. The scenery is fantastic and on a sunny day it is wonderful. Try the cafe at Tamarama and look for Josh and his pet macaws at Bronte beach, he is there around 11. A visit to the cemetery along the way is also very interesting.

Beautiful Cliff Walk. I loved this walk! The Cliff Walk took us about 3 hours with stops at some of the beaches and lookouts. The views are unbelievable and it's a great outdoor activity. The terrain was at times challenging but overall pretty easy. We ended in Bondi where we went for a swim at the iconic Bondi Beach and then caught a bus into the CBD for the afternoon.

Amazing!. I did this walk before when I went to school in Australia (Coogee to Bondi). 6 years later, I'm back on my honeymoon and this is the walk that my husband and I did (Bondi to Coogee) and we were not disappointed. The water is breathtakingly blue and the waves crashing makes the pictures iconic. It's unreal. It can get really hot due to lack of shade so plenty of water and rest is required. We had sunscreen on but was still burnt by the end of the walk.

great view, and some good exercise too. Great views on this walk along the coast between some of Sydney's most beautiful beaches. It can get pretty hot in some places, so make sure you have some sunscreen on!

Great views easy walk, worth doing.. We have done this walk many times and never tire of the beauty of the coastline. Lots of places to stop for a drink and rest if need be. We usually walk from Coogee to Bondi then have a lunch in Bondi. We catch the bus to Coogee then the bus from Bondi back to the city. Its an easy walk although a bit of a climb and manageable by all fitness levels.

Lovely, easy walk. Very nice scenic walk between Bondi and Coogee beaches. Not difficult, but very dramatic views. Easy to find and follow the trail. Neither Bondi nor Cogee is very convenient to the train, so be prepared to figure out the buses, take a cab (if you can find one), or walk a loooong way uphill at the end of the hike.

Great walk. My son took me on this walk on my final day in Sydney. The weather was lovely for fall. The trail is well maintained. The ocen views are lovely and so are the homes that rim the trail. Its nice to see so many people enjoying this walk. I can't wait to go back to walk it again.
Great walk. We did the walk Coogee to Bondi. Bus out to Coogee and a wonderful walk along the bluffs to Bondi, lunch and bus back downtown. Great way to visit several beaches and the coastal scenery.
Nice walk around the coast.. Started at Bondi...Went for a swim at Bronte beach and then walked back. Plenty to see. great views. beautiful people. Parking was $16 for two hours in Bondi approx.
An urban escape. A nice trail close to the city, along great views and wonderful beaches. Easily accessible with public transport, and highly recommended for anyone who has 2-3 hours to spare!

Scenic coastal walk.... We chose to do this trek on a gorgeous fall day. The color of the sky and ocean with the dramatc cliffs made for a spectacular walk. It is a popular walk, so be prepared for the crowds. Lunch at the Icebergs on Bondi Beach is a must.

Nice scenic walk. very easy walk, we did from Coogee to Bondi and it was really nice and chill. The view was amazing and we stopped so many times (not bcoz we were tired or needed rest..haha) but because the view - we just wanted to stare out and enjoy it!In total, it is about 6km, good for a run in the mornings too and personally, i feel ending at Bondi is AWESOME! Beach-time, sun, yummy food. Good end to the walk :)

Beautiful walk. I really enjoyed this walk. It´s so beautiful all of the views, coastline and nature around. It´s very easy and pleasent walk. You walk on the cliffs, pass different beaches, also an interesting cemetery and a memorial for the victims of Bali terroristic attack. You can stop in a restaurant and have a lunch or a drink. I really like Sydney and this was a highlight for me of our stay there.

Beautiful!. My boyfriend & I have done this walk a few times now & we don't seem to be tiring of it. The scenery is beautiful, there are plenty of spots that you can stop off at for a rest or a picnic/meal in cafe's. There are also routes you can take to shorten the walk if you don't want to do the whole thing.

Great views, easy walk. Easy going walk, not much uphill. Good views over the coastline and the beach settlements. Particularly good for a cloudy day when sunbathing is not so appealing. Can even swim in some of the outdoor pools on the way. Finish day off with a drink in Coogee.
Pretty amazing walk. Just do it! you will love it... some of the most beautiful beaches in the world await you on this walk...
A must!. Fantastic views and a must do in Sydney! Friendly people and lots of great scenic photos. A memorable day.
worth doing. Hard work on a sunny day. Need decent pair of walking shoes. Very scenic and dramatic view along the cliff, beautiful quiet sandy beaches.

Coastal Walk Coogee Beach to Bondi. Was a lovely walk along the coast. We did it the opposite way round and took a bus to Coogee from the city and then walked to Bondi Beach. We ended up at Icebergs Hotel for a few drinks at the end of it!
Fabulous. A great walk beside fabulous ocean beaches, rocks, etc. Wonderful views as you walk and breathe in the fresh air.

Excellent way to spend a morning or afternoon. Start off at Bondi Beach then a couple of hours walk to finish at Coogee.A chance to check out a number of the beaches that lie inbetween Bondi and Coogee.Not too strenuous a walk and walkable in a couple of hours.

In almost all types of weather, this walk is a must do. Bondi Beach has this way of making me feel so ALIVE. I'd recommend to almost anyone (there are hills) to just get out there, breathe in the fresh air and smile.
Great Coastal Walk. Our favourite walk while staying in Sydney. Great coastal/beach views and rock formations. Allow 3-4 hours one way.
Beautiful and Scenic walk. it's a great walk - lots of picturesque scenery. There will be some locals running along the path as well as other tourists/locals walking the path. It's all paved nicely.
Great walk. Great walk with great views. We caught the bus to bondi and bus home from coogee. Well worth the effort

Highly recommend you put on your walking shoes!. Even with higher than usual 'Mother's Day traffic', this is a great way to spend some time - and burn a few calories.Scenery is spectacular and track easily walked. We used the public bus service at start and finish, rather than walking return trip, but would certainly recommend that you add this walk to your bucket list.Cheers

A nice walk but just ocean to see.. We caught the bus out there which took 45 minutes and started at the Bondi beach for the walk. It was not really so special to walk along the cliff to see views of the ocean .The homes along the sea front are quite run down and Bondi is a bit of a mess of a suburban area.
Great View. Coastal Walk had very great view. We didn't do the whole walk. But the it had an amazing view. Bondi Beach is really clean.
beautiful views and good exercise. Not too difficult, breathtaking views; a great way to see this part of NSW. Did it twice, once in each direction!

Beautiful. We took the train from Central to Bondi junction and then a bus 333 to Bondi. Very efficient and fast.We started our walk from the rockpool at Bondi and it is really easy to follow because of teh white fence, We had nice weather so we have a nice 2 hr walk and then took the bus back to the trainstation back to central.

Beautiful sights on this walk. We enjoyed this walk on Easter Saturday this year. Despite it being a very busy walkway, we really enjoyed the wild sea, the beautiful bays and the fascinating rocks and cliffs along the way. It is fairly easy apart from some steep steps. The walk takes about 2 hours. We went from Coogee to Bonding and ended up with fish and chips on the beach. Perfect!

A pleasant stroll. A not particularly demanding walk in either direction.Plenty of seats along the way to admire the views, also exercise apparatus if you wish to burn off even more calories.Reminded us a little of the Cornish coast, but warmer and more whales.Thought Bondi itself overrated and too commercialised, but this was not apparent elsewhere on the walk. Buses both ways from central Sydney without difficulty.

Great way to spend 90 mins. I walked from Coogee Beach to Bondi Beach on a Saturday morning in May - weather not to hot but nice enough for plenty of people to be out. Views are stunning - just do it!

Magnificent views. Beautiful coasts and the ocean view is magnificent! The winding paths present surprises upon each turn. Do bring a windproof jacket if you're worried about the cold and of course your camera.

Great way to spend a morning and work off some calories. I hadn't done this walk in its entirety for years but had a great time doing so. We caught the bus from the CBD to Coogee and then walked to Bondi. It was a bit further than I recalled but had really been done up with great boardwalks, plenty of places to stop and sit for a breather and amazing views! If I was a local I would make this a regular weekend activity.

Breath taking views. I went to Australia solo and was decided to do the walk. I started walk at Coogie Beach and ended at Bondi Beach. The views along the path were amazing. They are Similar to postcard pictures. Took almost 250 pictures of the views.I did have to ask walkers and jog to take pictures of me against the backdrop, which they were so helpful to do. I did not time the walk, If I was living in Sydney( I can dream) I would take this walk at least twice a weak. The beach views are so peaceful, combined with just the water hitting the rocks.This was definitely a highlight of my vacation, I REALLY enjoyed the walk. Was about 5 pounds overweight. I credit this walk for the loss of extra weight. Normally don't walk this much in NYC!

Amazing!. Stayed in coogee! What an amazing seaside walk. Equally as informative was the stories behind the crazy society that were against gays of whom through them of the cliff edge. Crazy times. Great for walkers. Joggers. Runners. Lots of gym apparatus scattered along the journey!

9 Km of coastline!!. We actually did this walk in two days. Only were able to go from Bondi to Bronte the first day, as we stopped and took so many pictures!! We started again the next day from Bondi and completed the trek to Coogee. Great coastline.

Speechless. This walk is beyond worth it. The views are beautiful and on a hot day you can beach hop to the different beaches along the way. We made a day out of it to check it out...we preferred these beaches and the walk much more than manly beach. There are rock pools along the way... Places to grab a quick sandwich...water fountains... Make sure you wear your walking shoes and dress for the weather ...but it's well worth the hike for the views alone!
Beautiful views. Walked along Bondi Beach. Beautiful rock formations, water views, plants and people watching. Definitely try to do at least some of the walk, it's really lovely.

magnificent. Bondi to coogee is a beautiful walk.You pass stunning cliffs, hidden coves and serene beaches.Take your time and stop off at the numerous beaches along the way. My particular favourite was Bronte where there is quaint little cafes where you can get ice cream or a bite to eat before enjoying the beach or carrying along your way.There is also a stunning graveyard where the view will make you envyable of the dead and is fantastic for a photograph or ten.Enjoy and I will be jealous of you whilst you're there!

wow, Very nice view.. i was surprised with the view and it is amazing. Every visitor to Sydney must do this walk to see the real beauty of the place.Its a panoramic place and cool air refresh the body and soul.
Different View of sydney. Great place to see a different view of Sydney and take in some fresh air. Can get quite busy on the weekends, early morning or evening with runners and dog walkers.

Amazing views. We left our hotel expecting a cloudy day and hopped on an express bus going to Bondi (probably could have taken a local which would have been cheaper). By the time we got to the coast, the sun was shining (can't say that this will happen every time :-)). We walked along the coast enjoying each and every new angle. We had plenty of company but it wasn't overly crowded. The steps were a bit uneven here and there but not a big problem. We stopped at a couple of the cafes along the way. We caught a local bus from Coogee back to Sydney. All in all, a beautiful day!
We loved this walk.. Amazing views which rival the Italian Coast. We had children with us and the walk took 2 hours which was at a pretty slow pace. Were a hat and avoid windy days.

Spectacular Walk. This is such a spectacular walk. Go early morning if you can and beat the crowds. It is amazing and not only gives you amazing sea/coastal views but also great to look at all the architecture. Take your swimming gear and you can sample all the different beaches. There are some great cafes along the walk too. If you are staying in Sydney this is a must.

Fantasic and enjoyable walk. We didn't realise that the walk is as long as it is but we are fit enough that it wasn't a problem for us. We concluded our walk at Coojee and caught the bus back to Bondi Junction. The walk along the cliff tops was very enjoyable.
Breathtaking. Must do ! Need comfy shoes and bottle of water , don't rush , take in the scenery ! Lots of places to stop and take photos

WOW!. The views were beautiful. We did this walk and loved it, even with a 2 and 5 year old in tow. The best part is you can go as slow or fast as you like and stop as many times as you want to admire the scenery. I definitely recommend taking a walk/jog on this path.

Magnificent. If you've got time, its a must. You can walk from North Bondi, all the way around to Coogee beach, have a liquid lunch over there, and stumble back! Better still if you have a lovely dog that loves walks, please take it, you both will love the scenery, the other doggie people and see the best part of Sydney.

Coogee to Bondi - Bucking the Trend. This walk was recommended by a friend who lives in Sydney. They suggesting taking the bus to Coogee first and walking towards Bondi which worked out perfectly. We finished around dinner time and were able to eat at Bondi before going back into the CBD.It was a great walk wrapping along the carved out coast. We couldn't help but take a lot of pictures, but because of this, it took us about 2 1/2 hours to do the walk. It was so beautiful that you could spend the whole day walking from beach to beach relaxing and taking in the views.

A Walk of a life time. Just the views and the weather. It was like a dream come true to do this walk and the views were breathtaking we are both in our 50th and not too fit but we managed it so all you young people out there just do it its fab,

what a find!!. loved this. u just keep walking and finding all these awesome beaches wit very cool names. kinda europeanlike. some parts are steep but very doable. woudnt run it myself ( especially not in the heat)but lots were. u can walk all the way to Tamorama( spelt wrong) beach. love that beach!!. the bra boys hangout. also walked it at night 'whole different kettle o fish. theres a coastal graveyard that u have to literally almost walk thru. really spooky in the winter months when it windy & coldish(im irish it NEVER gets cold in oz. Awesome views. theres soo much energy in the ocean. brings u to life

Get walking!!. There are no words as to how much I enjoyed this 8km walk. Everytime we rounded to the next beach or the next cliff, I was struck by how beautiful the views were. I would love to sit on a bench and close my eyes and listen as the waves come in and out by the cliffs. It was a long walk that took about 2 hours, with minimal stopping, but at a leisurely pace. Pack snacks and lots of water. Take your time! At the end, we stopped at Coogee to grab a delicious lunch and grab the bus to our next stop.
Wow. What a beautiful area, just wish we had brought our bathing suits. Make sure to bring water for the walk.

My backyard. I have lived in Bronte for over 7 years and am a creature of habit which means I always do the Bronte to Bondi walk. My partner and I decided to try the other direction and actually walked to Maroubra last week which is past Coogee. Excellent adventure and not many hills to encounter if that is not your thing. The scenery was beautiful and a welcome change.

Beautiful scenery. I did not do the whole walk from Bondi to Coogee but I did enough to know that the scenery in these parts is absolutely wonderful. From Bondi Icebergs, I saw so many weird and wonderful rock formations along the coast, which I did not know existed. It is always nice to be surprised when travelling, especially in the age of TripAdvisor where seemingly now everybody knows everything!I would plan at least 3 hours for this walk, especially if need to be back at Bondi Beach to catch a bus back to downtown Sydney. The views across the sea are amazing, and there are ample opportunities to climb down some easy rock formations and dip your feet in the water.I did get worried on one occasion when the trail became more of a pathway through grassland, where people take their dogs for walks, and they are not on leads. It can be disconcerting to see them darting about, as you don't know if they will jump up at you or not.

Coogee seems a long way off in the end - but worth it. Was coaxed along by my wife - but very glad I did it. Had a swim half way along and the views are great. Path is in good knick - I conquered it just wearing crocs! Give yourself at least two hours.
REally nice. Better when is the sculpture time. Not sure when but I guess august or onward. Be rady to walk for at least 1 hour.

Great views!. Bondi alone is totally overrated if you've been to excellent beaches around the world, but the coastal walk from Bondi to Coogee is much much better than just visiting Bondi itself. A must do if you're in Sydney!

A scenic walk at the top of the cliffs on Sydney's coast line .... We are lucky enough to live 15 minutes away from this walk and we tend to do it at least once a month (except during the summer months when it can get a tad too hot).It's not an overly strenuous walk, but there are a few steep stairs and a few small hills along the way. However, you will be rewarded with spectacular views of the ocean, Bondi Beach, Tamarama (Glam-arama, as it's known by some) Beach and Coogee Beach.Set aside about an hour and a half to do this walk comfortably. Walking from Bondi, just before arriving at Tamarama there is a lovely cliff top spot to sit down at and take in the view and watch the surfers.

Best hike. Can't beat the scenery of ocean, sand, surfers. The cemetery is a must stop. The hike is easy to follow as it takes you through several little towns along the coastal highways as well as through the awesome sand. Bring a camera, sunscreen and an open heart as you will fall in love with the sights and sounds.

Bonfi to Voogee BeacH walk. This quite a walk that quite impressive. It is hilly and tough in some spots. There is a fantastic rock jutting into the sea .took many photos of it. And there is a pretty bad restsurant that everyone goes to. The have a beach view, a pool, and some of the sorts food sround. You have to stand and order it. Really no service.

Awesome Views. We did the Bondi to Coogee section of the walk and there were a few challenging sections for a less than fit person such as myself, but I paused for a breather occasionally and admired the awesome views and kept pressing on! The walk was well-laid out, with lots of interpretive panels detailing the history of the area with pictures, and lots of places to get a drink of water along the way. There are also plenty of spots to stop for a coffee/meal along the way if you wish. We had a late breakfast in Bondi and a restorative ale in the Coogee Bay Hotel at the end. A great way to see some of Australia's most beautiful coastline.........and, it's free!!

Best Day at Bondi. My friend and I took the bus from Sydney CBD to Bondi and it dropped us off right at the beach. It was a very easy ride and it was easy to find. We started out taking in the beach and looking around the bather's facilities. Next we walked along the beach toward the sidewalk that would lead us on the walk to Coogee. I could see this amazing looking pool in the distance and I wanted to go check it out. It was the Bondi Icebergs pool. We paid the $5 admission and decided to go in and check things out. We thought ahead and brought our swim suits and towels. We found the changing rooms and put our suits on. We went down and took the plunge into the cold water of the largest pool. We swam a few laps and then went and hung out in the lane that is closest to the ocean where the waves would smash into the side and come falling into the pool. It was awesome! We then showered off the salt water and sat in the sauna for a bit. After we were good and relaxed we showered again and put our things in a locker so that we could continue the walk to Coogee, which picked up right outside of the Icebergs. It was a beautiful scenic walk. The views were breathtaking. There is a bit of stair climbing and walking up steep sidewalks so be prepared for that. Not ideal for folks with mobility problems nor for small children. Active kids with lots of energy will have a blast! It was all paved and very safe. On our return trip we stopped again at the Icebergs to get out stuff (readmittance is free) and to eat a bite at the cafe inside. All the while we enjoyed the beautiful fresh sea air and the billion dollar views. Just above Bondi, along the street, there are tons of cafes, shops restaurants. This was one of my favorite days in Sydney and this should NOT be missed!
What a walk. Great walk passing all the little coves and bays and little hidden beaches along the way, don't forget the cemetry
Great Walk. Awesome day going this hike and afterwards a refreshing bath at Bondi Beach. Strollers are possible but a couple of steps to take. So bring a strong man
Bondi to Bronte - in perfect Easter weather.. Great views, perfect weather, quite busy but that didn't detract from the enjoyment. Bronte a perfect spot to stop for a rest.

walk. About a 6 kilometer walk. Just brilliant. Fantastic views. It is an easy walk. You can sometimes see dolphins frolicking in the ocean. It is easy to get to - take the train then the connecting bus.

Coastal Walk. This is a nice, easy walk along the coastline of Sydney. The walk had beautiful views of the ocean and strange views on the cliff-sides of Sydney. One strange view was a Cemetery facing the sea which must be one of the most desirable views in the area which would not be seen. The walk was an undulating easy to follow path along the coast. This path encouraged use by people of all ages and fitness levels. There were water stations along the walk and stations for 'poo bags' for dog walkers, all free of charge. Our walk ended with a refreshing dip in the sea at Bondi Beach

Great views but many steps. I read many reviews saying how great this was so decided to do this walk when we were in Sydney. However, we didn't realise the number of steps along the way which made it awkward as we were pushing a baby stroller. Yes, we could have checked, but we probably would have persevered anyway. Despite carrying the baby and stroller for large parts, the views were great, and the swims at the beaches were very welcome after working up a sweat carrying everything.

one of the best walks in sydney. one of the best things you can do when visiting is to do the coastal walk. it's a decent walk bondi - coogee. you can always walk bondi - clovelly and back instead (10km all up).

Do this. Caught the bus out one morning. As tourists it was funny watching the locals running around flat tack getting their morning exercise. Stopped at Bronte for breakfast. Only cafes in the local shops so plenty of choice. Bus goes from right outside.
A must do. Thus us the most amazing walk with the most beautiful views and scenery throughout. Give yourself a couple of hours.

One of the best beach walk ever. Lovely, lovely, lovely. Views is nice, warm waters and nice soft sand. Kids totally loved it. Some little cafés along the walk, the ice cream and family having fun. We love the warm sea water and the nice soft sand.

Beautiful!. This is such a beautiful walk - pretty easy, and mostly paved. This is a very popular walk on the weekends - all the locals are out jogging and walking their dogs. You pass by Bronte beach where surf life saving was organized in 1903. Also a very cool "ocean pool" that is open to the public here. Lots of history, spectacular rocks/clifs, amazing blue water and huge waves. Many of the beaches along the walk are full of surfers to watch also. Highly recommend. Bring your own water and a wind breaker.
A nice walk on a nice day. Avoid icebergs top floor if you like money. The most over priced lunch I've ever had.Public transportation made the walk easy
Great Walk near the City. The amazing views of the sea and cliffs. So Memorable. It is close to the city yet gives you the beach and sea experience

Perfect half day adventure for family with three boys. Our family took the bus from downtown Sydney to Bondi in the morning, braved the surf there for awhile, then enjoyed the breathtaking walk from Bondi to Bronte, and finished with the boys enjoying the public pool at Bronte and then all of us enjoying a lovely lunch at one of the cafés overlooking the beach in Bronte. Catching the bus back was easy, and everyone was happy! I'd definitely recommend it for ease, expense, and the beautiful views. Take plenty of water, and if yours are like mine, snacks for along the way.
Great views. The walk really gets the heart pumping, and what great views along the way, would not miss it, well worth the effort.
What a walk. One of the best walks you can take when visiting Sydney. Stunning views and exercise at the same time.

Exercise and sights to see. Do pick a good day as the walk is exposed. If you like walking and ocean views, this is for you.If you don't, don't bother. There are no refreshment stops along the way, so bring a bottle of water.

Sunshine and scenery. We caught a bus from Circular Quay out to Bondi, had a coffee at one of the beach cafes, watched the boys from Bondi Rescue get ready to film and then walked the track as far as Bronte and back. Couldn't go further due to injury however the walk is easy with fantastic coastal views along the way.
Enjoy to Bondi & Coogee Beach. Bondi Beach and Coogee Beach very nice place ~ Swim drink beer and enjoy your free time!
lovely beach and nice shops. Lovely beach ,, with white sand and cold water,, nice shops at the beach with not friendly ones,, people can do sports there

This walk should definitely be on your Sydney must-see list!. I cannot imagine a more gorgeous way to start the morning than venturing out on the Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk. Sydneysiders and tourists alike crowd the picturesque path to walk, run, exercise their pets and take pictures (of themselves and the views).
Backpacking 1999. This walk is fab, great views you pass a few beaches. Bright Blue sea's it is an amazing walk. Coogee is fab too. Great place spent many times there.
Beautiful. A beautiful easy walk around the bay. You can really enjoy the coastline and area in general. Sydney is lovely but Bondi and Coogee are someplace else.
So so. It looks scary more than relaxing. Good for playing surf only. Good thing is it's easy to go. Just take a bus.

Great Views. Its a six kilometre walk from bondi beach to coogee. It takes at least 2-3 hours but the views are stunning with all the beaches and headlands. If you can handle the walk its definitely a must

Iconic views. This walk is easy to do and can be broken up with stops and coffee shops and beaches if you're that way inclined. Unfortunately, unlike the a Manly to Dee Why coastal route this is VERY busy, so don't expect peace and quiet. Take your camera though!
Great for walk/run. This walk is great even if the weather is not very good. I recommend to do it and stop to some nice bar/cafe/restaurant in Bondi, Bronte or Coogee.

A walk with great views. This is an easy going walk along the coastline of the Eastern suburbs of Sydney, passing the beaches of Coogee, Clovelly, Bronte, Tamarama and Bondi. You can take the walk leisurely and stop along the way at cafes for something to eat and drink and also go for a swim at any of the beaches. One of the best times to take this walk is during Sculptures by the Sea, usually sometime in October-November each year where you can view the art installations on parts the coastline from Tamarama to Bondi beaches and even better it is free.

Great walk, but watch out for runners. A wonderful way to see the coastline, but I find the runners think they own the path, so be wary. Make sure you stop at Icebergs for a drink and/or something to eat.

Not as good as people say!!. This is a busy walk and the views are not as good as I expected. Parts of it you have to walk on streets! I also got bitten so wear some protection! Best part was arriving at Coogee - really nice

Can't miss Sydney experience. Spectacular views and well graded. If you are in Sydney, you should not miss this. You can see the ocean, the cliffs, beaches, and during the annual Sculpture show, you can see world class art. Run, don't walk to get there but walk while you are there.

WALKING SWIMMING GREAT VIEWS. Good to go beach hopping take your swimmers, start at world famous Bondi, take a dip in the pool and swim in the surf beach as well, then Tamarrama (affectionately knows as Glamourama by the locals as many models and beautiful people frequent this beach) further around is another very special beach in Bronte. At Bronte it is suggested you try one of the many food shops, great smoothies. A favourite stop of mine, you can see the sea from the shops and sometimes dolphins or whales pass by. The next stop is Clovelly a safe still water swimming spot, you could take lunch at the hotel. Following that is Thompsons (sometimes called Gordon's) Bay a quiet scuber diving spot and finally arrive at Coogee. There is a substantial beach shopping area. From there you can catch a bus to Oxford Street at Taylor Square then catch a Bondi Beach bus back to Bondi if that's where you're staying.
Fantastic walk. I love this walk, great way to tire out the kids. It's for the fit but it's fantastic, the sea crashing on the rocks.
A magnificent walk. The vistas are just wonderful. One can stroll at their own pace, rest, and take in the view, and at the end, have a meal or a cup of coffee. On a sunny day, what could be better?

"From a Sydney locals view!". A leisurely but long walk, if you are up to it, with spectacular sights. Sweeping views of the coastline, ocean and varying levels of homes that Sydney's Eastern Suburbs has to offer. When you reach your journeys end there is a bus to the city from there you can choose your next Sydney tourist destination.
See the coastline. It's a narrow sometimes crowded path, but if Sydney is your only chance to see the NSW coast, this is your best bet.

Great Coastal Walk. A great way to see the coast of Sydney.Try and do this when the Sculptures by the Sea are being presented, which is usually late October to early NovemberDo this from Coogee up to Bondi, have lunch in the Pavillion overlooking the sea, then stroll back.Fairly easy walk, no real challenge, and if you wish you can take the bus back.

Must do on a sunny day! . Lovely walk along the coast with the chance to see some of Sydney's best beaches. It'll take a good couple of hours (more with breaks at each beach) - we stopped at Bronte for lunch under the gazebos. Plenty of toilets along the way if going with kids.

Amazing under the sun. My trip there was a bit funny. The temperature was supposed to be 31 degrees. but when I went there I couldnt stay more than 15 minutes, huge winds are blowing all the sand , I couldn't open my eyes.I went walking from Bondi to Coogee beach coast. I still can't forget it, it's an amazing neighbourhood with friendly people and nice cafés all around.

Beautiful Walk. If you want to find an easy way to check out a number of beaches in the Eastern Suburbs this is a great way to do it. It allows you to see how unique each beach is along the way. I highly recommend this walk whether you start in Bondi or Coogee.

A beautiful way to put in some mileage. I was fortunate to have picked a clear and warm day to make the walk from Bondi to Coogee. The panoramas are amazing and there are ample opportunities to venture off the path to find new things to see and do along the way. Given the duration of the walk, I chose to take the bus back to Bondi, where I was staying. During the weekdays, the bus only goes to Bondi Junction, which requires a connection (380 or 333) if you're going to Bondi beach. During the weekends, there is direct bus service back to Bondi beach if you decide not to make the trek back along the trail. As far as difficulty is concerned, it's a moderate walk. There are a few areas where the steps can be quite steep, though there are numerous benches located along the route for those need a little time to rest an relax.

Must Do!. This was one of my favorite things we did in Sydney - it's a must do! It was easy to get to and from on the city bus. The views along the path are amazing and there are a lot of great photo ops. It wasn't too strenuous so pretty much anyone should be able to do it although there are places with a lot of steps. It took us about 2.5 hours and I thought we walked at a pretty leisurely pace.
So pretty. We did this walk coming up to sunset, a lovely place to while away a couple of hours, we did it in reverse, Coogee to Bondi.

Must do in Sydney!. Absolutely stunning, and probably my favorite thing that I did in Sydney. I started at Bondi and ended at Coogee and it took me probably an hour and a half. It's not a hard walk by any means, and the views are breathtaking. Every time I turned the corner I was blown away that the view could get more amazing. Easy to get to via public transportation... an absolute must do.

One of the great coastal walks!. The walk is easily accessible, we took the bus to Coogee beach and, well, just follow the coastline! The views en route are spectacular, the path is well maintained and takes in several nice bays, beaches (and cemeteries!) between Coogee and Bondi ending up at the entrance to the Bondi Icebergs Surf Club. It took us a little over a hour but there were many people of all ages running the route and others moving at a more sedate pace.

Satisfying. Goal accomplished, happy walker. The scenery is magnificent, the weather was perfect (slightly overcast but comfortably hot at around 23ºC) and the walk was somewhat easier than the description makes it sound. Yes, there were some steps, but nothing I couldn't manage. Only once did I have to stop halfway up to catch my breath and admire the view. I enjoyed wandering around the Cemetary that takes up acres of prime coastal land, giving the 'residents' the best views in the world! I stopped to watch swimmers in the seawater lap-pool and was impressed by the exercise equipment provided along the way (near the beginning). But the best was arriving at Coogee and finding a very reasonably priced café with delicious food right at the end of the walk. There's also a shop that sells delicious ice cream, right next door, to that was lunch sorted - bought as takeaways and eaten overlooking Coogee Beach from the grassy hillside.What a satisfying morning! To top it all off, there's a bus back to Sydney City that passed right by where I was staying (No.370).
Awesome walk!. If you are in Sydney, this is a "must do"... Amazing walk, amazing view, amazing experience. You should do it.
Stunning Scenery. A hot tip.. wear lots of sunscreen. Aside from that a beautiful and my favourite walk along the coastline of Sydney's beaches

Coastal Walk. What's not to like? Fresh air, ocean views, flowers and friendly people along the walk. Also there is a nice beach side cafe for breakfast or lunch in Tamarama. Get a little hot and go for a swim .Beautiful water and lovely beaches between the cliffs!
Walk with a fantastic view. This walk takes in Bondi, Tamarama beach, Bronti beach Clovelly beach & Coogee beach,so if you get a little hot you can call in to any one & have a swim.

Worth every step. You can do this any way you feel like - a leisurely stroll or stride it out. Do the whole thing or parts. Easy to get to and from on public transport and plenty of swimming stops. Be prepared for steps and the sun - lots of drinking water fountains along the way. It is such a great way to see the coast and great seeing so many people out there enjoying it too.

A must do!. A lovely way to spend a day! A must do if the weather is good. We started at Bondi and had lunch before we set off. The path is easy to follow and you are presented with fantastic views. A good hearty walk that's not overly strenuous many beaches and rock pools to stop at. We stopped at Bronte beach and took a dip in the rock pool. Lovely and refreshing. Then continued the walk the Coogee where we finished with a beer at one of the many bars. Lots of Busses to take you back to town at Coogee some on the walk too if you needed. Couple of tips, bring swimwear and towel so you can stop for a dip. Take Sun cream and a water bottle. Also number of places where you can fill your water bottle up enroute.Enjoy!

Great way to spend a sunny day and get some exercise.. This was the one sunny day or our five days in Sydney and I enjoyed the walk. We did it from Coogee to Bondi and it was great to see Bondi since it's so famous. However, some of the tiny beaches and inlets we walked by were far prettier than Bondi, which feels a lot more like a city beach.

Beautiful! Do at sunset.. We ended our day doing the coastal walk from Bondi to Coogee and were able to watch the sunset in the process. The views are fantastic, and we even got to see dolphins swimming in the wild! Wear tennis shoes, or at least comfortable shoes.

Very nice scenic walk!. Did this walk at the end of March '14 and it was excellent. weather was really nice and this made for superb views of cliffs and out to sea. Walk was easy to moderate in some sections..we started with brunch in Bondi, completed the walk over a few hours stopping for photos numerous times and went for a beverage in Coogee upon completion. An really enjoyable way to spend a day in Sydney!
WOW. The walk exceeded my expectations- great for photosPros:the ocean breezethe views- must have DSLRCons:the rain
Amazing views. If you travel to Sydney, you must visit this place. The view is spectacular. It is about a two hours walk, the road is signalized, it is hard you get lost. Highly recommended.

Beautiful coastal walk. Catch the bus from Sydney's CBD and do this walk. While there are plenty of stairs and ups and downs, the scenery and views are amazing. We started mid-morning, stopped at the Bronte cafe strip for excellent coffee and stopped at coogee for water and a breather before repeating the walk back to Bondi for lunch. Weather was great, 25 and sunny, and the only negative was the runners - some of whom think they own the paths and everyone should move for them.Just over two hours each way for us but stops for viewing the sites and coffee could add another hour.One of the best things to do in Sydney and free.
Spectacular views. Great if you can go during "sculptures by the sea", makes the walk a little more interesting.Amazing views and good cafés either side

THE VIEW!. No, you don't need to want to surf or swim to go to the beach. I just wanted a good walk and coastal view. I got what I wanted and easy access.Nice additional to my personal travel journal on blogspot. Highly recommended as sidebar to business trip as it is short ride from city center and does not take much time. I took advantage of the long daylight in summer and went just after work. Great break away from work!
really good. enjoyed every minute of this what a great place and great people cannot wait to return here when im back next month !!

256 Photos Worth Of Scenery1. This is a really really nice walk, it isn't too taxing, a little uphill but very few actual stairs to climb, what little effort it takes is far outweighed by the scenery itself, beautiful panoramas over the Pacific including a load of good angles over Bondi.Some of the beaches are nice, others are lovely but all have something of their own purpose, some very much surf orientated, other geared best for families and the odd one where it is just the place to be seen! You can go for a dip or a surf as you wish, or just sand hop and top your tan up a little at each one. There are plenty of toilets and water fountains on the way so bring a bottle and keep hydrated.Ideally do it in nice weather (of course) but also I'd do it during the week if possible, Bondi isn't so packed and you have fewer people crowding to get the best views of the vista.

Stunning scenery at every curve in the coast. Make it a fast hike or a slow stroll, run a marathon or just jog, but you will never get enough of the variety in this beautiful coastal trail. Beautiful beaches, each one unique. Great for people watching, photo shoots, landscape artists to paint and bird watchers to check out. Dogs of all sizes love this playground as much as do the children. It is so close with easy public transit access and all amenities surrounding it. The perfect mix of a resort with city life. Bring a picnic, a bottle of wine and find a cave or tree for shelter. Enjoy the public pools for safe laps or try the waves for surfing. Lots if ice cream stands too.

A highlight of our trip. We cheated a little bit in that we started from Bronte rather than Coogee. We had a great day with sunshine and a mixture of white fluffy clouds and dramatic sky's that threatened rain that never arrived. The views are just amazing and no photographs however good will do justice to them. You just have to go out and do it, and if we lived here we would do it again and again. We did it on a relatively quiet Monday morning and then rewarded ourselves at the end with a drink in the Iceberg club who allowed us to sign in for the day there and then. Really nice outlook from the club bar.

We did the walk with a stroller. The views are breath-taking! We pushed and carried our 9 month old daughter in her stroller. It was a good workout but totally worth it for the views we saw. There are steps at certain points.
Picturesque walk. Stunning walk along the coast from Bondi - obviously need the weather but we did - fantastic chilled Sunday

so good we done it twice !. What an amazing walk, so well planned out , with pit stops along the way if needed and free spring water stands. The views are stunning , each bay has its own appeal, we even saw a wedding on the rocks. The waverley cemetery is lovely and well worth a stroll round. There was a man skydiving off the cliff and lots of surfers to watch too. What a great free walk.

What a way to spend the morning.... Probably one of the most scenic beach walks you'll ever do in a city - so many photo opportunities and areas along the way to sit, rest and take it all in. Would do it again if I returned to Sydney and would be one of the first things I'd recommend to a first time visitor.

Fantastic walk but bring your walking shoes. Very lovely walk through bondi beach, bronte, cloverly , coogee and others. The views are spectacular. Best of all its free. The only problem is parking if you come by car, make sure to park in the residential streets otherwise it will lighten your pocket significantly. All the beaches on the walk are nice and have different features so its worth checking them out in its entirety. Best of the walks free so enjoy the air and the views. Cloverly beach is a nice place to snorkel so bring your googles.

Truly marvellous experience. One of the highlights of my trip to Australia. The walk takes in stunning rock formations, views and wonderful little beaches. Mackenzies Bay, Bronte and Tamarama are particular highlights. These are topped off by the amazing Waverley cemetery which has a fabulous location and is immense in size and atmosphere.

A great healthy way to spend 2 hours. We picked a gorgeous day for a start. We began at Coogee and walked to Bondi. It was just so lovely, such a nice way to spend a few hours and a good way to build up an appetite. The track is interesting. It's not just a plain path, sometimes it's rocks, sometimes steps, sometimes almost seems to disappear and then reemerges a few meters away. There are lots of special little beaches to discover along the way. You could easily stop for a dip during the walk. The cemetery on the sea cliffs when about 3/4 the way to Bondi is a sight t see. Loved it.

The scenery!. The views are fantastic! Put on comfortable shoes, sunglasses and sun block and take this walk! Make a stop at any of the beaches you pass by and go for a swim. In Coogee you have several nice cafés to choose between for a drink or something to eat.
Well worth doing. Lovely views,not too hilly but a bit.You can take your own time,plenty of places to stop off on the way.

nice when it's not too hot. this is a nice 30 minute or so stroll - maybe 15 each way - you could continue to Bronte, even Coogee if you had the energy/enthusiasm but I've never been that far - I usually park in the backstreets of the south Bondi headland (last turn right just before the bottom of Bondi Road hill tight left curve towards the beach - more likely to find a park on a non-busy weekday)as your walk around the headland path approaches Tamarama Beach (Glam-a-rama if you see attractive bikini sunbathers) nature has sculpted the sandstone bluffs into extraordinary shapes that put humans' paltry efforts in Sculpture by the Sea to shame - that's still good - just relatively.At Tamarama - wet your feet - but with a steep drop into the sea and likely rip currents, most people won't be swimming there.On a good day Bondi produces regular rolling swells at 5 minute intervals with lovely flat swimmable water in-between - but coming from closer to the Equator, I normally find the water temp. even at 21C/70F too cold for me ... nice for a stroll tho' and maybe a Nando's Portuguese Chicken at the north end - if it's still there ...

Worth the walk - don't forget your camera. You are not limited to walking, you can also jog/run along the route. The views are awesome, perhaps does help motivate the runner to complete the distance.If you're not exercising, taking this walk is still worth while and there are ample of opportunities for picture taking. Along the way, there are also informative boards regarding the history of the place, local conservation efforts, flora & fauna etc.In the event you are tired or short of time, you don't have to complete the whole distance (about 6km long). Just take one of the many exits and you are free to head back home (via public transport) or head to the shops nearby for a cuppa.Don't forget your sunscreen, sunglasses, a cap/hat and an umbrella/raincoat in case it rains.For more things to do in Sydney, visit my blog Lyn, Life Explorer (http://arazlin.blogspot.com.au/)

Beautiful views on this walk. Walk is a nice distance for a family. We started at Bondi at 11am and stopped several times for photos along the way a a cold beverage sea salt cafe. Then a nice lunch at Coogee beach at 2pm. So glad we took the time to do this. Easy bus ride from the Circular Quay.

Brilliant walk with sensational views. This is a superb walk for everyone, but especially so for visitors to this city. Excellent views and variable terrain and walking environments. On a fine day make sure you have plenty of sun protection as parts are quite exposed. For walkers visiting Sydney, this is a must do!

Cool Pools. Had never seen a true ocean water filled pool. The walk was great, relatively easy, lots of people use it (and their dogs), but the saltwater swimming pools were a sight to behold when the waves started crashing over the sides!

Each beach is unique. I did this with part of the Ultimate Oz package and it was my first glimpse into Aussie beach life. I wasn't expecting it to be all that good but each beach between Coogee and Bondi is different with its own vibe. Whether its the busy Bronte, the chilled Tamarama or the tourist haven that is Bronte. Walking along the cliffs between the beaches is good too. I was surprised by the number of workout stations and BBQ hotplates. Thats not something you find at home!Good for a morning walk followed by relaxing on your favourite beach!

This is a must do. We arrived in Bondi and just took in the immediate views . They were excellent until we started to walk. as we progressed the views just got better and better . We were blown away by the amazing landscape , the clarity of the deep blue sea and the beautiful properties on the journey. It was to get to the café areas for a welcome break for coffees. It took us 1.5 hours and I can honestly say I didn't feel the time going nor did I feel tired until we got on the bus to go back to Bondi.Absolutely fantastic walk.

Great Walk. We were recommended this walk by a friend who lives in Sydney and we were not disappointed.You start at the south end of Bondi beache by the " Bondi Icebegs " and from thereon you follow the path past 4 beaches and bays before arriving at Coogee. There are rest areas, cafes and toilets along the way so you can take as long as you want to do the walk which is 12Kreturn.The walk itself is not that demanding and It was a lovely sunny day and around 26C but being by the coast it was not too hot. There are lovely views throughout and if you look at the websites these will tell where best to swim,snorkel or dive. We think what is best is that there is so much to do besides walking you can do the walk in stages and return another day to do all of the walk.

very picturesque, worth the effort.. great scenery, path is not challenging if you walk/jog at your own pace. lots of places to take pictures. i'm not sporty at all, but it doesnt seem so taxing because of the lovely view. definitely bring lots of water with you.

a great beach full of life. and yes, we did the entire coastal walk. we took bus 380 from the city center to bondi - it takes about 40 minutes to get there. It goes thru very nice suburbs. The beach is huge and very lively . we were lucky to managed on a sunny day. it is a must do in a visit to sydney.

Brilliant and healthy too. This walk is fabulous especially when Sculptures by the Sea is on.If you can go on a week day as the crowds are down but the joggers still seem to try to jog with hundreds of people walking and stopping to admire the art and view.

Gorgeous. This walk is beautiful but it's not for small children. There are a lot of joggers and cliffs. We walked from Bondi to Bronte and it took about an hour round trip. There is a cafe at Tamara(sp?) Beach to stop for a drink.

Don't go when it's going to rain. We went in hurried because we will be leaving the next day. So it leave us no choice. Had to visit before we leave Sydney. The sky looks so dark and it's not as beautiful as described.

Pick the right time. Yes, the scenery is amazing and the whole thing is beautiful. Just make sure you pick the right time to go. We started walking on a very warm Sunday morning, and this was a mistake. There is no shade along the way. Make sure you have ample sun lotion on and big hat. Also look out for all the runners on their Sunday morning run. I'm guessing if you do the walk later in the afternoon the sun would be in a better place and it might be a bit cooler.

Loved Bondi. Loved the beach. Beautiful and wide and lots of eye candy. Nice restaurant at top of beach. Also there is great walk down to Bronte beach. A bit dirty on the end, but very clean at the beginning.

Great Walk. Got off the Hop-On-Hop-Off Buss at Bondi and decided to do this walk. It is a lovely walk but for me way too hot so we didn't go far before deciding to return. Not a good walk to do in the summer. would be better in the winter time.
Breathtaking Views. Very relaxing walk with the sound of waves clashing directly below. Great destination for beautiful pictures or exercise.

A Sydney MUST. I'm not one for walks, but this is amazing. A *MUST* for visitors. Gorgeous coastline and unique beaches. The scenery changes as you walk. A tip: start at Coogee and work your way to Bondi. Bondi offers more cafes and restaurants, and you'll want to kick back with a cold drink and talk about the beauty of the walk.

Amazing walk not to be missed. If you are in the city you must head east to this beautiful coastal walk. Views in both directions are amazing. Plenty of locations for a drink or snack. Time to sit, relax and soak in the atmosphere. The walk does require lots of short climbs with steps therefore you match the length of your walk to suit your ability. Photo opportunities galore.

peacefulll. This walk is just excellent, it's not really hard to do, you can stop any time you want since it's on the city's border, the views are really mind blowing. Overall, this walk is just quiet, beautiful, and not hard at all! :)

Beautiful Walk. I love to walk anywhere, but walking in a place as beautiful as this makes it even more special. The rock formations along the coast are just a marvel to look at and watching waves crash into the swimmers in the pools was enjoyable! Wonderful way to spend a few hours.
PERFECT. Awesome. The walk is wonderful, so many things you can see. maybe a whales when you are in the good period. Un mst have

A beautiful relaxing walk. I took this walk one of my first days in Sydney and also walked back. I liked it so much so one of my last days (was there for three weeks) I walked it again, this time starting in Cogee and walking towards Bondi. You pass beautiful beaches, views, a cemetery and a little fishing bay. You see surfers, villas, flowers, people. And you can stop at one of the beaches for a snack, a toilet visit, a bath or just relaxing. My favorite is Tamarama beach. Don't miss this!

Well worth the effort. We walked from Bondi to Coogee , on a beautiful day, and enjoyed it. Scenery is wonderful, plenty of water stations to quench your thirst. There is no distance markers on the sign boards along trail ,to indicate how far you have to go to the next beach. This was not a concern for us, however, if you are physically limited make sure you research what section to do prior to taking off. There are also sections that have many stairs and steep grades, that could cause a less fit person to struggle. Be sure to bring your towel and suit as a quick dip in the ocean is a perfect ending to a beautiful walk, then lunch in Coogee.

"A must do walk on a Autum morning". This is one on the best walks with views to match, our favourite was to do this walk from Bondi to Cogee Beach on a Sunday Morning,best to leave early,2 or 3 hrs depending how fast you walk, it is quiet a long walk but worth every step,then have a delicious Breakfast when we got to Cogee at one of the nice Cafes overlooking the lovely park and Picnic area, a must do!!

Brilliant Scenery. We only did about half of this walk. Took the bus to Bronte Beach from the city - change at Bondi Junction - and walked one way to Bondi, then bus back from there. It was perfect weather and there were some reasonable waves which had brought out the surfers. Might be better to walk the opposite way if doing this during the morning, then sun would be more behind you. There were some good looking cafes in Bronte for lunch although we didn't use them. Facilities in Bondi are more plentiful of course. Allow a good hour if you want to stop at all - more than the guides say.

A must do walk!. Before I left for Australia asked for tips from anyone I knew that had lived or traveled to Australia. The one common recommendation from everyone was the Bondi to Cogee Beach walk. They were right, it is a must do. Beautiful, relaxing and you can stop at the various beaches along the way. Walk takes about 4 hours round trip if you don't stop along the way. It was recommended that we start the walk with lunch at Iceberg in South Bondi. Food was okay, nothing special. Views were cool though and they have a beautiful pool that over looks Bondi beach.

something other than surfing. if you want to get a different exercise from waiting for a wave then the coastal walk from Bondi to Congee is well signposted and the views of the Pacific are fantastic-be aware there are LOTS of steps but plenty of water dribblers along the way
Just keeps getting better. The council have done a great job with the boardwalk along the ocean; a must do and see while in Sydney.

A Great Piece of Sydney. You know your alive when you are walking/ running Bondi to Coogee, The sun is shinning (you hope) beautiful views as far as you can see and a Cemetary thrown in the jagged coast line. Weather you are a social walker, jogger/ runner or a photographer this is a great walk with many points of interest along the way. One major piece of advice, if its a lot of people or runners you are not keen of then walk it out of busy periods because this can at times take over some of the paths. Once at Coogee you can either have a swim or enjoy some food at one of the many cafes.
Must do!. One of nicest walks you could ever take! Bring your camera. Multitude of beaches with rock formations in between.
Good to do with friends. It's a great walk. The route is very agreeable and simple, so you can do even if you arent a sports person.

Gotta Love Bondi. Very nice beach and clean. The Coastal walk was informing and nice and had a comfortable pace. It surprised me a bit that there was an alcohol Ban all around Bondi but I understand why :)
STUNNING!. It's a long walk, especially under the summer sun, but the views are breathtaking! It was the first thing we did as we arrived in Sydney and we absolutely loved it!It's a must...NO DOUBT!

An absolute must.. One of god most stunning and beautiful seaside walks anywhere. An absolute must for any visitor. Beach after glorious beach, stunning flowers and trees, gorgeous homes and surfers galore.

Beautiful hike along the coastal walk.. We visited Bondi Beach on a lovely day, so the coastal walk was a "must". There were hidden coves, lovely flowers, only a few stairs, and a great way to stretch our legs and feel the sea breeze. We highly recommend it!

its got to be done. Done this walk on a regular basis and stopped at every beach for a swim along the way. Don't give up when you get to coo gee beach, head up the hill and hit maroubra beach, great for surfing and sunbathers alike

Go early and get the full exercise experience without the crowd. I've done this several times. As a walk/run it comes with what is possibly the greatest views on the planet. The trail is challenging with steep steps and winding turns. The views are amazing! From the nippers competitions on the local beaches to the cemetery overlooking the cliffs, you really have to do this with a GoPro camera because there's so much to take in but you have to concentrate on the path too! Very cool.

Beautiful - but don't forget the factor 30!. My daughter had enthused about the first time she and friends caught sight of Bondi beach - one of the best known beaches in the world. My husband and I took one look and said - great! it looks like Newquay just bigger and hotter! The walk along the coast is an easy stroll with plenty to see along the way including cafés to take a break. There is of course very little shade, so hats, sunnies, sun lotion + water of course are a must. You can stick to the promenade - popular with walkers and jiggers alike, or walk down on to the rocks and beaches in the coves along the route.
Fabulous scenery. Great coastal walk,the best inSydney...take a picnic..lots of pit stops on the way to enjoy the views...well worth doing.

A pleasant walk. A stroll which does involve some steps and slopes but one which we found easy. It's about 7 km long and allows you to visit four stunning beaches which are far more attractive than Bondi. Lots of water fountains, restaurants and bars along the way. Stunning views

Nice walk did it in just over 60 minutes but..... We hated the lack of etiquette with people walking 3 abreast or not staying left. The local council needs to paint a line to help separate the morons! And to make it worse I had to listen to my wife moaning and complaining all the way.

One of Sydney's Greatest Attractions. Regardless of the weather - just do it! It is impossible not to be impressed. I'd go from Bondi to the south with a snack at Tamarama or Bronte then onto lunch at the Clovelly Hotel before continuing to Coogee.

Nice walk or run. You can see all the beaches in the Eastern suburbs. Cool surfers along the way, lot's of people out and about walking, running, chatting and having a nice time. I love this walk and anyone coming to Sydney should do it.

Great day out. We started south of Coogee and headed up towards Bondi. Really stunning coastal walk. I gather if you go at low tide you can walk lower down but that was not the case when we were there, not that it detracted from the experience. Great day out....for free!
Nice walk. Nice walk along the coast line. Great to see all the different beaches. Make sure you stop half way for a smoothie/milkshake/ice cream
Great Walk. Very relaxed walking along this stretch of the coastline, lovely bays for swimming and views along the route. Well worth it.

Stunning. This is a very beautiful walk but go early morning to avoid all the joggers. The later in the day, the more people will be out. It is a very popular walk but well worth it when visiting Sydney. Get out of the city and head to the coast...you won't be disappointed. However, unless you're a young backpacker, don't spend too much time in Bondi. Don't say I didn't warn you.

Awesome walk with amazing views!. If you come to Sydney you have to do the Bondi to Coogee walk, it has amazing views and you can stop at all the different beaches along the way and go for a swim! A great way to see the amazing beaches around east sydney!

Great view!. The path is good under foot and lets you climb a few hills and take a breather at some fantastic look outs while getting ready for the next leg. The walk from bondi to bronte provides spectacular views whilst offering a good honest workout at what ever pace suites you. It can be traveled in either direction and allows you to see the 3 beaches the walk covers. Cafes are located at either end.

Nice views. I made the coastal walk last week and it was one of the stoplights in our stay in Sydney. Even in a cloudy day still a good option. If you have lucky to go in a sunny day don't forget sunblock and a bottle of water. The walkways are in pristine conditions, so take your time to see the views and make a picnic in reserved areas along the way and swim in the saltwater pools.

Worth it!. Just beautiful, nothing more to add... except: if you're doing it during the afternoon and planing to have a drink at the end of the walk, then walk from Coogee to Bondi since the Beach Bar is nicer :-)

Beautiful. This is a beautiful walk that should be mandatory for all visitors ;) All the beaches are different from another and you should spend the hole day enjoying the walk, the scenery, the restaurants (except the icecream at the Fish and chips located at Bronte) and the beautiful beaches and the nice water.

Most beautiful walk early morning. Lots of people is the disadvantage, but who cares when you have the best views in Sydney! It is hard to park in Bondi, so best starting in Coogee and of course then have brekkie at Icebergs overlooking Bondi! Hard to beat!
A gentle stroll. Actually there were a few steps but it wasn't a hardship and the views made up for any difficulties.

Great walk, wonderful views. The walk was not difficult and the views were breathtaking. Plenty of places to stop along the way for photos as well as spots to grab a coffee or a bite to eat. Would highly recommend. Great way to see a Part of Sydney that shows how beautiful our coast truly is.

A Must Do. If you are in Sydney for a while, instead of just visiting Bondi...do the walk...it's well worth it...I have done both ways but one way starting from Bondi is great...take your time and stop at one of the smaller beaches..Bronte for coffee, brunch or lunch...and Coogee beach is great, good hotel for more food and drink and the bus back to Bondi.

Always a great view. Love this walk done many times over the years its always pleasant , and the views are fabulous, walk as far as you can stop have a coffee , etc on way and return , even by moonlight its great.

Proud to Live in Australia. What a glorious coastline we are blessed with. The walk from Bronte to Bondi is relatively easy although there are some steps and one has always to be on the lookout for enthusiastic runners. However the view cannot be matched. A word of advice though. I find it easier to park at Bronte to start the walk rather than Bondi and take a towel just to sit on Bondi Beach before making the trip back. This is a personal preference however for parking.

Great Walk & easy to follow. Great Walk. Get the bus from Bondi Junction to Coogee and walk it downwards to Bondi. Great views (we say dolphins) and some great little beaches (some with better surfing than the great Bondi.

Awesome views. Long walk but not terribly taxing. Beautifully pathed and completely safe with places to rest and take in the view along the way. Finish off with a treat to eat at iceberg club ( day membership available with no fee), magnificant tables overlooking the pool and ocean and totally affordable:)

Lovely walk. A very gentle walk. A couple of times the route disappeared and I had to ask some locals where it went, so a few more sign posts would have been good. Buy water before you go, 3 dollars for a small bottle is not good when I could have bought it for 1 or 2 in small local shop. Profiteering! But a lovely hour.

A must go if you love beaches, the sea, nature and long walks. Totally enjoyed the walk even though I was caught in the rain. Not much shelter along the path so be prepared to get wet if you go during the rainy season.Very well maintained walking paths and the view along the whole journey is breathtaking. I managed to catch views of dolphins in the sea. Bring your swimmers as there are wonderful rock pools to dip in if you feel too hot. Unfortunately, it was too rainy for me to jump into the pool as there aren't any lockers so I didn't want my bag to get soaked.Stop by the cemetery to look at tombstones that date back to the 1920s. I thought it might be creepy to walk by a cemetery but when I got in, it ignited more of my curiosity then fear.Bring your camera and be prepared to snap plenty of superb pictures along the whole walk.

Beautiful Walk- Great way to see the beaches. What amazing coastal views you get and no better way to check out all five beaches of Bondi, Bronte, Tamarama, Clovelly and Coogee. We did it in the pouring rain and still enjoyed it, we even followed a pod of a dozen dolphins across the first portion. Just gorgeous!

Spectacular coastal walk. If you enjoy walking,put on your best pair of walking shoes and go! from cosmopolitan Bondi and Tamarama to family friendly Coogee,via pretty Bronte and (almost) secluded Gordon's Bay,it will take you about 2 hours (not counting coffee/photo/picnic breaks) to enjoy the beauty of this part of Sydney.It is stunning and will leave you breathless at some points,and full of happy memories :-)

Picturesque walk across the coast. I had already set my plans for the sunday to cover this walk. Read a lot about it on the internet. The morning I woke up & it was a gloomy rainy day :( I still decided to go on and do this walk. I was staying in CBD and took the train to Bondi. Then a bus ride (10 mins) from the station. Luckily, it was only a drizzle. The coastal walk is probably a two hour walk, I was glad that it wasn't sunny :) The weather was amazing. Do wear walking shoes because it is really a very long walk. There are loads of places where you can stop and just admire nature. One of the most beautiful pools that I have seen is on the way, where sea water comes in to fill in the pool.
