Unfortunately, I could not get into it, but I am sure, on my next trip, I would do this walk only for this beautiful swimming pool. Further, there are few restaurants where you can decide to eat. Before you reach Coogee, you would cross a cemetery (one of the biggest I have seen) and it is by the coast. It is a tiring walk, but one of the most beautiful walks I have done. There are great places to eat in Coogee making the walk a memorable one.

Scenic walk. I walked from Bronte Beach along the sea-wall trail to Bondi Beach. It was easy to get to Bronte Beach via the Sydney public transportation system (train to Bondi Junction and bus #378 to Bronte Beach). Exit the bus and cross the street to Bronte Beach and pick up the sea-wall trail there. The walk to Bondi Beach from Bronte will take about 45 minutes to an hour. Be sure to pause along the way to take in the beauty of the area. Once you reach Bondi Beach, catch a city bus back to central Sydney or the Bondi Junction train station for a return to the city. This is a short time commitment for such a rewarding experience.

Allow an Entire Day. One of the nicest walks I've ever been on. It's about 10km, so give yourself plenty of time, all day would be ideal. It's a very relaxing walk, it's mostly flat or downhill so not very strenuous, so it can be done in flip flops. There is a nice breeze along the water as well, but be careful with the sun as it's quite strong - so slap on lots of sunscreen. It's possible to stop and swim at every beach along the way, and there are tons of little shops and restaurants where one can have a meal or coffee and relax before continuing on. Some beaches are better than others for swimming - strong currents make swimming in some places quite a challenge, so you may see lots of surfers instead. Still, there is plenty of space on the sand to lay down and enjoy the scenery before continuing on the walk. This is a must do on any visit to Sydney

Awesome. A must do if you are out Bondi way. A good track....a few steps in places but very manageable. Have plenty of time so you can enjoy the views, have some swims in the rock pools or sea watet. swimming pools or have a cafe stop. We walked to Coogee and after lunch and a swim there we caught the bus back to Bondi junction for some shopping time.

Awesome Coastal Beach Walk. This is one of our favourite activities when in Sydney. We recommend taking a pack and taking the time to swim in each bay as it's a unique experience for each one with varying views. Pack a water bottle as there's many water stations along the way for refills. Seating is often for those who may need a rest and there are toilet facilities in most of the bays.If you're not keen on the bigger waves there's generally a salt water pool/baths along near the cliff edges of a couple of the beaches.
Beautiful! . Extremely Nice! It's an easy walk for all ages. I went on a not such nice day and still it was very nice. There was a lot of joggers and many people just cruising like me.

Well worth the walk, take your snorkelling gear in summer.. We really enjoyed this walk in the lovely spring sunshine. The path is well marked and runs around some magnificent cliffs. There are some great beaches with easy access. Shame it was October so too cold for me to sample the snorkelling pool that has very easy access to some clear calm waters. Lots of places for a coffee or a beer on the way!!

Coastal Walk. In looking for something to do as we adjusted to travel we selected the Bondi to Cooge walk and were not disappointed. There are beaches, pools, cliffs, waves, small towns and great views. It was a great way to be outside in the sunshine and get a little exercise. Only regret is that we did not have more time.

Great Activity!. We took this walk after arriving at Bondi via the Hop On/Hop Off bus. The walk was certainly work, but my husband and I loved it. There were beautiful sites, beautiful people, and it was a great way to spend the afternoon. Highly recommended.
Great coastal walk.. It doesn't cost you anything and is worth more than most paid attractions. Unbelievable scenery. Bring your camera and enjoy!

Great Outing!. This was our second trip to Sydney, and after visiting Bondi beach 2 years ago we made this coastal walk a priority on this visit. We were not disappointed! We took the bus direct from downtown and grabbed a bite to eat in Bondi before starting out. The day was hot and we made good use of the water bottle refilling stations along the route. The views along the walk were stunning, and we were amazed by the uniqueness of each of the beaches we encountered. No doubt the walk could be done in a few hours, but we enjoyed a leisurely pace, poked around the cemetery, took lots of photographs, sat on a few of the beaches, found a few geocaches, and made an afternoon of it. And then took the bus back from Coogee. A great day!

A Fantastic Walk. We stayed in Randwick so walked to Coogee beach, then walked all along the coast to Bondi with the odd stop on the way. It really is a beautiful walk with lovely beaches and scenery on the way. But if you don't like steps or hills don't do it as there are a lot of steps and very hilly in places.

bracing the sea air. fabulous way to feel you escaped the city yet be so close to it. only a few KM's - take a picknick and good shoeas for climbing if your adventuros, best done when they have the sculpture walk - missed it this year - all in all a great way to blow the cobwebs from the night before - enjoy

Wonderful!!. This walk is like being in a wonderful dream! The views are beautiful! I started the walk at Bondi and it took about 2.5 hours with stops to take pictures. This is a must do while in Sydney.

Coogee to Bondi. This is a very scenic walk and well worth the effort. We took bus 373 from Circular Quay to Coogee Beach. The bus dropped us off right at the beach. Although several people have said that you can do the walk in 1-1/2 hours, we took our time and spent over 3 hours on the walk. We stopped several times to enjoy the views. There were also a number of places to have a picnic, which I highly recommend. There are restroom facilities and water fountains at each of the beaches. I really believe that this walk is worth a little extra time.We did the walk on a weekday, so there weren't as many people on the path as there might have been on the weekend. There was a light mist in the morning with overcast skies the rest of the day. But that all worked in our favor because there aren't many shady places to protect you on a hot sunny day.Even on the weekday there were plenty of joggers, so on the narrower sections of the path we spent a lot of time trying to stay out of their way.Although the path isn't extremely long (6 km or about 3.5 miles), it does have some steep sections.After we had walked to Bondi Beach, we took bus 380 to Watsons Bay for a ferry ride back to Circular Quay. Be careful about the ferry from Watsons Bay. It doesn't operate very frequently (about once per hour) and the last ferry leaves at 16:45 (weekdays). They run later on the weekends. But there are several places at Watsons Bay to sit and have a drink or a meal while you wait for the ferry.

Epic walk. It's like being on a discovery adventure: every beach you pass along the way has its own character and charisma. Make sure to bring plenty of water and sunscreen as it can get very hot and there's little shade.
Unbeatable views. Great walk, good views (better during Sculpture by the Sea), restaurants/cafes at both ends! Swimming if you so desire - be careful at Bronte and Tamarama if not competent!

Spectacular views, Great Family Outing. We visited Sydney in July, mid winter, when the usual beach activities were not on offer, but we wanted our two kids, ages 5 & 7, to experience the spectacular beaches somehow. I had lived in New Zealand and had visited Sydney several times, and my husband had attended New South Wales uni in Coogee, so we had seen the usual tourist attractions many times over. We stayed in Coogee and started the walk from there. The girls were thrilled to walk along the paved path, and we couldn't get over the jaw-dropping views of the raging winter surf. The path is varied, we went through a graveyard and marveled at the statues and monuments, stopped for ice cream at Bronte, gawked at surfers riding huge waves at another beach, walked up and down steel stairways bolted to the cliff sides. At each of the five beaches along the way, there are facilities and usually a playground. When we reached Bondi it started to rain (as it does in winter) and we took shelter under some limestone cave overhangs, where we enjoyed the pic nic we had packed , and watched the scenery, while the girls made 'cave paintings' on the limestone with the ochre-coloured water in the puddles. We waited out the rain under cover, then poked around Bondi shops, and hopped on a bus back to Coogee. I recommend this walk to all non-summer visitors, who are looking for something active, and off the beaten tourist track.
BONDI WALK. Amazing walk with great views...husband thoroughly enjoyed the topless beaches. Wear comfortable shoes, bring a camera and sunscreen.

Walk with a view!. I'm from the Gold Coast, so in no way am I deprived of beautiful scenery on my morning beach walks..but there's just something different and unique about the Bondi to Coogee walk. I go on this walk every time I visit Sydney (probably five times a year on average) and I never get sick of it. There are a few steps and even I get puffed after a while but it is very enjoyable. Despite there sometimes being huge crowds on the walk, you are walking alongside the beach which is very calming. I've taken a friend's dog on the walk and he absolutely loved it...even climbing down to the little rock pools for a swim. Plenty of cafes to stop off at and I'm not sure if it's still happening but Sculptures by the Sea were pretty great! Highly recommend this walk as it is very refreshing and doing it first thing in the morning is a great start to the day!

Mobbed on Bank Holiday Monday. Great walk with breathtaking views of the coastline - bit hilly in places but worth the effort - got bus back though !!Very busy though because it was Australia Day weekend - Im sure on a normal day it would be less hectic !!
Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal Walk. We did this walk slowly enjoying ourselves, stopping to enjoy the views. The place is very lively. Many locals were jogging too.

A truly iconic walk. This one had been on my bucket list and it lived up to expectations. We caught the train to Bondi Junction and the the bus to the beach. It was easy to find at the southern end of the beach, the views are awesome and the path well maintained with plenty of drink fountains along the way. The beaches all have kiosks. A highlight was the Waverly Cemetery.

A must do when visiting Sydney. Every trip to Sydney we take this magnificent walk along the beaches and cliffs overlooking the ocean. It truly is world class and a must do activity when in Sydney. Its great exercise, but its an easy walk and you can take your time and stop and rest at many cafes along the way.
Amazing. Definitely a must! My wife isn't very outdoorsy so she was concerned I was taking her on a dangerous cliff hike but she loved it. Nice path with tons of benches and incredible views
Coogee to Bondi walk. Wow, if only I had this on my doorstep everyday. A gorgeous walk on a warm summer's afternoon. Lots of people on the beaches, on the track. Spectacular

Crowded but good.. You won't get any alone time with nature on this walk, but its a good one to do and has some great scenery. Be warned that there are a lot of steps on this walk and it's reasonably long - it's not for people that don't like a good walk.

Great way to see the area. We did a roundtrip walk from Coogee to Bondi and loved the exercise and the chance to see the beautiful coast up close and personal. The 5+km hike (each way) took about 2 hours with lots of short stops for photos. Any visit to Sydney should include this walk.
beautiful views. One of the iconic Sydney coastal walks - very enjoyable with scenic views - long but well worth doing

I attempted to do this walk. The day I went to Bondi the weather was absolutely horrible. So I attempted to do the walk, but with the rain and wind it became near impossible to go around some of the bends so I had to stop halfway and turn back. Although the weather was nasty the walk was definitely beautiful. This is a must do.
A long way.. It is quite a hassle to get to this walk from the city as it is a long way out. Once there the walk is nice but not a lot to see just the ocean and waves. We guess the fresh air is nice.

Spectacular. This walk is a breath of fresh air from the city. It feels like you are far away from the hussle and bustle but is very easy to get to. We began in coogee for sunrise and walked to bondi and then took the bus to watsons bay, followed by the ferry back to circular quay. We saw somewhere between 50-100 dolphins. Arriving in circular quay and seeing the bridge and opera house after this walk around the coast was a splendid experience!
Best walk!. Bondi-Coogee coastal walk, the best walk in Sydney! Best part? Beaches at either end to cool off on!
Breath taking. Two beautiful beaches sandwiching the most amazing cliff side walk you can imagine. Definitely give yourself the entire day to enjoy Coogie - Bondi!

Stunning!. This is one of very few amazing experiences you can have in Sydney that doesn't cost money! We've done this walk several times, and rain or shine it is always popular. Views are stunning, and aiming for a twilight arrival into Bondi is just amazing. Well worth escaping from the city for a few hours to take in the endless ocean views.

Spectacular walk. This is one of the most scenic walks in the world. The coastline here goes from rocks to beaches back to rocks. So scenic. And the walk ends at the famous Iceberg Swimming complex and Bondi Beach. Takes about 1 1/2 hours if you pause often to enjoy the spectacular scenery and take pictures.
A lovely and interesting walk. Lots to see and the pathway is excellent. Not too energetic with some lovely views over the coastline.

Great views!. I higly recommend this walk on a visit to Sydney! It took us about 3.5 hours round trip, with stops on beaches and to take photos, etc. It was very beautiful and also great exercise! Very safe and clean! I wish we could do it again!
Awesome Beach. Great views, live music, open air shopping, surfing demos. Loved watching the lifeguards training water rescues.

Great hangover cure!. This walk was beautiful! You pass three fantastic beaches and it is worth it just to be nosey at the beach side houses! Some of them look divine!The only thing annoying is it is that the people enjoying themselves in the sea and on the picnic areas actually LIVE THERE! Hahaha. This is their daily life and it is so so lovely. It is full of dog walkers so if you do not like dogs maybe avoid.Took us two hours both ways but we were taking in the views and going very slow. There are some interesting stones to read with facts and history.Well worth the time and effort! All three beaches are gorgeous - Take your camera!
Beach heaven. Bondi is great and very popular but Coogee is better with less crowds, great eating and easier and cheaper to park

Beautiful scenic walk. I'd say this walk is in my top 5 favourite things to do in Sydney, and it's free! The views are magnificent and there are plenty of places to stop to sunbathe, eat, drink along the way.Just be warned that there are many steps and inclines, but all the more reasons to take it slow and enjoy the views!

An iconic Sydney attraction. We do this walk to Bondi several times each year, it takes about one and a half hours to do both ways. A good variation of hills, steps, cliff faces, iconic beaches, ocean views and celebrity sightings. Its a must if visiting Sydney.
Get fit. We stayed at Clovelly and took the coogee to Bondi walk. Excellent sightseeing.lots of healthy people everywhere.great place to get motivated. Weather was excellent
Beautiful and free!. Beautiful views, goes through several pretty beaches, very easy walk can be done in flip flops and it's free!

What a great way to spend an afternoon!. My wife and I took the city bus to Bondi...very easy to do. The costal walk is magnificent. I think you could walk for days. We walked for a couple of hours or so, then turned around and headed back. We had lunch in one of the cafes, and then continued on the bus to Watsons Bay...again, very easy. From Watson's Bay, we took a ferry into Sydney harbor. It is a great way to see the harbor and snap some great pictures.Bondi is a beautiful area, which gets you out of the city and we definitely recommend visiting and taking the ferry from Watson's Bay. Have fun!

Very relaxing. I did the coastal walk in the very early in the morning. (Around 6:30am) I am very surprise to find there are many local people doing exercise, running, jogging, walking with dogs, swimming, surfing... The view alone the coastal walk is stunning. I enjoyed the walk very much and took so many picture all the way. It's really a great way to start a day!

Scenic views. Didn't get to walk all the way to Coogee as it was very windy, but it was awesome anyway. Lovely scenic views. We happened to be there during the annual "Sculpture by the Sea" exhibition so there were also some interesting works of art to look at. Must be even more perfect on a less windy day and with fewer people.

Amazing views. We did the walk from Coogee to Bondi in January. It's a fairly easy walk but it does include quite a few steps. The views of the beaches and the surrounding area are amazing. Well worth the walk. Once you start the walk there are places where you can opt out and catch a bus back to the city if you need to.

Walked for 2 hours fantastic. I am a walker and this is a 10/10 Sydney walk. Lots of amazing views, a great smattering of normal people weirdos and hotties jogging around. Bring a drink or cash to stop and plenty of sun cream. My tip is it is windy so make sure you have the right clothes & you dont have to walk back, you can bus back to Bondi Junctions from just about every bay.

A great scenic walk. Did this walk with a friend of mine who lives in Sydney and it was fab! It was a hot day but we set out early. There are so many little beaches to stop at en route if you want to although we mainly just walked, There are also free water taps that you can refill your water bottles and also some taps for dogs too! The walk overall took about 3hours, you could certainly take longer if you wanted to.

Beautiful views. Great views over the water. Easy to walk with a footpath running along the coast. There are a few small beaches along the way that are good for a swim, and bus stops along the way as well.

An Enjoyable Way to Burn Off Those Extra Calories. Our last day in Sydney, so after 4 weeks of eating and drinking what better way is there to endeavour to get into shape for the long flight home than a good walk. And what a walk. 6kms of coastal path passing a variety of coves and beaches, all packed with people enjoying themselves on the beach or in the sea. I just wish I had packed my swimming trunks and taken a towel. Do so to get the most out of this walk as you pass within metres of the sea. Bondi is well known, some of the other coves and beaches less so, but all have something to offer. The path does have some steep climbs and steps so one needs to be ambulant. Take the bus from Circular Quay to Bondi remembering not to get off at Bondi Junction, finish the walk at Coogee followed by a beer or two, then hop on the bus back to Circular Quay.Whether the extra calories are lost is a moot point, but this doesn't detract from a really good walk

Nirvana. Beautiful long walk you can do at your own pace .. Just be a little careful as it can get really hot in summer if you do the walk during the middle of the day .. Best from about 4pm onwards or before 11am .. Have fun

It's beautiful… and it's free!. Such a great walk. Take all my overseas friends here on a regular basis. Start at the Coogee end - have lunch and enjoy Bondi then walk back (via cafes for coffee or pub for a beer!).

a beautiful walk. We started our walk at Bronte Beach - got a bus there from the CBD. We ended it at Bondi for lunch (Sababas - excellent felafel!). The walk was beautiful with a varierty of things to see (including the most scenically situated cemetery I have ever seen) as well as the amazing coastal scenery.

Great day trip. Caught the bus to Coogee, walked to Clovelly beach and stopped off at the ocean side pool for a swim and snorkel in the bay. Really great set up to cater for all ages - very gentle sloping beach for littlies, but more confident swimmers catered for in the snorkelling area deeper out. Alternatively the pool is safe for all ages. Really pretty area. Continued onwards taking in the rugged ocean scenery until Bondi beach reached and then went for a swim between the flags. This walk is definitely worthwhile doing. If you have limted time and need to choose between this walk and Manly scenic I would personally choose Manly scenic walk - the views are more beautiful.
great walk great views. Great walk to coo gee beach. A few nice restaurants at coogee to cool of at. Track is well maintained & wide enough. A must do if you like to walk

A delightful walk. This approximately six kilometre walk is for people with moderate fitness. There are some hills, and quite a number of steps. The views are superb, and it is well worth taking a camera to record the sights.There are plenty of options en route to stop and rest, or to abandon the walk and catch a bus.

A walk worth doing!. A beautiful walk! Though it was a very hot day we walked along several beautiful beaches and Coogee was a fitting finale. The walk was easy with some easy slopes as we walked from bay to bay. There were plenty of places to get refreshments in the heat.

Run it on the weekday - at dusk. This walk is beautiful. While Socal has beautiful beaches, the way this pathway is set out as intentional to see perspective of each beach is amazing. It's summer in Oz, so a run at high noon is a little balmy. Also, the weekends there are so many people on the trail, that your intentions to run it are squashed in 3 minutes. If you run it either really early or like 5:40/6 pm to 7:30 pm, you can get some amazing pictures.

You've just got to do this !. I think all the guide books recommend this & they're not wrong. A superb 6K walk with spectacular views passing fantastic beaches, Tamarama, Bronte, & Clovelly arriving at Coogee just in time to quench your thirst with a schooner of Fat Yak in Coogee Bay hotel. Even the folks residing in Waverley Cemetery have got a great view. Fortunately, the return journey also promotes a thirst. Un-believable.
Stunning view. If you have the chance take the walk you will be surprised with stunning views its not that hard to walk if its a hot day take enough water with you.
Beautiful beaches. A picturesque walk along spectacular beaches. We had lunch at North Bondi Fish followed by Gelato Messina, then a swim at Bronte.
great coastal walk. Just amazing walk along the cliffs. Breath-taking scenery and well planned. Stunning. Could stop off at beaches along the way for food or swim or rest.

Amazing- a must do- aim for sculptures by the sea in November. This has to be one of the best views in Sydney.It is incredibly popular with tourists and locals alike. Early mornings and weekends it tends to get busier, as well as afternoons during summer daylight saving times.If you are here in November there is the Sculptures by the Sea exhibition. This has artworks of all different kinds line the walk and beach areas from Bondi to Bronte. It has been going for about 10-15 years I think, and just keeps getting better.This is a must do, and great for lots of photos.
Great views!! so worth it!!!!. Easy walk with awesome views!!! no matter what age group you are in take the time to do it!! Dont forget to take some sunscreen.

A good walk. This walk takes about 1 hr 30 mins to complete. There was an art exhibit on the walk from Bondi Beach to Gaerloch Reserve. The art displayed around the area was amazing. The walk gets better on the way to Coogee beach. The only drawback of this walk was that I didn't find the scenery as spectacular as the walk from Manly to Spit walk. But overall it was a good walk and would encourage people to do this walk.
Nice walk and run. Nice coastal walk for runners. The views are amazing. A must if you visit sydney and you like running
A must!. A beautiful coastal walk. Definitely recommend it for all ages. Really well facilitated: plenty of toilets and cafés en route.

Amazing Coogee Beach. The Bondi to Coogee walk takes about 2 hours and I love to end it with a beer at the Coogee Legion Club, directly opposite Coogee beach which has a verandah to enjoy the view. This is a secret little place, which the locals love - cheap drinks and food! Then cross the road and get onto the bus to whichever direction you need to go.

A must. I have done this walk countless times and it never gets old. This is absolutely one of my favourite things to do when in Sydney. Lovely coastal walk- beware, a few steps involved, no prams access, unless you want to carry it!
Something for nothing. This is a walk we did as kids, many moons ago, a lot .A great scenic walk if you don't mind the annoying joggers, that think they own this area. Just breathe and walk...

Beautiful views. This is a terrific walk to do to for great views of the coast line as well as the fabulous houses and beaches in the area. You can make a whole day of it with lots of refreshing stops along the way. We liked this walk better than the Manly walk.

Awesome sights. The pathway is very well planned, some up- and downhill to make it a bit of a workout but suitable for all ages. The views at every nook and beach are amazing at both tides. There are places to rest and have a snack. A great way to spend a day at the beach without actually just laying on the beach.

Spectacular. Friends of ours recommended the coastal walk and we were not disappointed. The scenery wa spectacular and we loved the fact that we could stop along the way and have a coffee and a bite to eat or just sit and enjoy the views.

Loved this walk and the scenery. My husband didn’t want to go to Bondi. He is not a beach person. I told him I wanted to do this walk. He was still hesitant but agreed to go. We walked from Bondi to Bronte. There was a drizzle. By the time we made it to Bronte it was more of a driving rain and you had to walk with your head down. We decided to turn around. My husband loved the walk. We both agreed the scenery was fabulous. It was crowded but not too bad. I can only imagine what it would be like on a nice day. If I ever get back to Sydney I will earmark a whole day to explore this area.

Love this walk. I love this beautiful route and have made a point of walking it each of the 4 times I've been down under. If it's hot, just remember to cover yourself in sunscreen, wear a hat and carry some water. You can top your water bottle up at a few places along the way, or buy extra drinks in various convenient shops in the bays. I always find that it takes much longer than you expect, because you stop to look at everything on the way, take photos and stop for food and drink, and very much longer if you are geocaching too, as we were this time!
Fab Walk. Loads of places to stop and hide from the sun. Plenty of great views. Lots of beautiful people. Good exercise to clear the head and mind..

Best walk in Sydney. Its an amazing stretch of 6 km along the coast of East Sydney. You can take a bus to Coogee and start there and walk down to Bondi. Or the other way around. There are loads of places to camp in between. Good cafes along the way to have a quick drink of coffee. Dont forget to take your water bottle, camera and sunglasses. You get plenty refilling stations along the way. If you are into swimming, take your swim wear and a towel. you wont regret it :)

Great views and good exercise. Not only are the views spectacular, but you get lots of exercise going up and down the stairs. We started at Coogee and ended at Bondi, with the intent to eat at one of Bondi's many restaurants, unfortunately we didn't have time. We hope to return one day and spend the full day at Bondi. There is so much to do and see and places to eat. The views along the walk are very interesting, lots of plants, and rocky sandstone cliffs, interesting beaches and viewpoints of the water and surf. The cemetery is amazing. What I liked is that the path was clearly outlined with the white wood fencing all along the way.

A pleasant coastwalk!. It is a pleasant walk with moderate intensity and great one to explore Sydney beaches and take some nice photos. There are a few small bays where you can take a stop and have a swim, and of course Coogee and Bondi beaches are some of the Sydney's finest.
Spectacular views. The walk for Bondi to Coogee is spectacular but don't stop there. Continue south of Coogee for even more stunning views. Only wish I could get back there.

stunning walk. This is an beautiful walk along the stunning coastline. It is also great for running if you like. I have done it many times and still enjoy it. I usually start at bondi and end up at coogee where i get some food and drinks.

A Brilliant Walk. We spent a morning enjoying this spectacular walk. Was one of the best things we did on our Sydney visit as it was lovely to compare the beaches and their neighbourhoods, and imagine if you were uber rich, which house you would buy.

A Sydney Must-Do. Every time I have a guest to Sydney we do 2 things - this walk and the ferry to Manly. I have done this walk countless times and never tire of it; The water, the views, the dramatic coastline. It's spectacular and reminds me how lucky I am to live in this city!

Picturesque. This walk follows the coast line from Coogee to Bondi and you can start/finish at any point along the way. It is very busy during the weekends but the views are stunning and not to be missed. Mind the runners and joggers and remember to stick left!

Wild Coastline. The walk from Bondi to Coogee takes in the beautiful coastline close to Sydney. The path is easy and well maintained, and you cannot get lost. The rolling surf and spectacular views make it a must for visit to Sydney.
Perfect length, great views. The length of the walk is about 5km, perfect to get to know the northern beaches of Sidney. Great outlooks at different spots.
Fabulous. Stunning walk along the very well laid out coastal walk. Fantastic beaches to visit with beautiful clear water and white sand.

Walk and swim. Do the walk and have a swim at every beach! It's not mentioned in most of the guides, and is not really a beach, but Gordons Bay is great for swimming. Bronte is another highlight.Spectacular views throughout the walk, and easy walking. Long bus ride from the city to Coogee.

Great Coastal walk!. Take your swim suit as lots of places to get wet...walk in the water or swim. The water was surprising to me, cold! Also lots of stairs to climb but the heights and depths are well worth it. Take time to just sit and soak in the beauty.
A must do for all visitors. If you like amazing views of pristine beaches and the ocean, then you must do this walk. A great run if you are fit too...

Simply a "must-do". And while you're en route, why not take in some barefoot bowling at Clovelly (one of the best views from a bowling green?!?) or finish with a swim at icebergs..... best beach en route possibly Tamarama..... especially now a new facilities block and cafe have opened.

Do it!. This walk is great, nice views, not heavy, many places to chill out or take a swim. Bring your self a bottle of water, a towel, sunscreen and your swimmers and you'll have a great day!Take a lunch halfway, challenge the waves, enjoy the beach and walk on. Catch a bus to Bondi Junction or the CDB and i'm sure you'll have a great day with some good photos.

A great way to spend half a day in Sydney. A fairly easy 6 km walk that hugs the coast with spectacular ocean views, cliffs, beaches and rock formations. Start at Coogee around 10 to finish with lunch at Bondi Icebergs (mains $15-$30, drinks at club prices) with a bird's eye view of swimmers doing laps in the pool below. The art gallery at Bondi Pavillion currently has a terrific free exhibition of paintings and prints of nearby beaches, bridges and birds. This is a very popular walk so go mid-week to avoid the crowds.
Beautiful coastal walk. Great way to spend an afternoon! The walk takes between 1 1/2 to 2 hours and is beautiful! Loved the sites! Got to Bronte and caught a bus back. Great bus system!
Worth the effort!. Such a beautiful walk that shows you the variety of beaches that Sydney has to offer. Loved every minute of this walk and the relaxing dip at Coogee was well deserved!

Walk by the Ocean. Great way to exercise and enjoy the ocean view and BBQ dusring summers on the beach. you can spend entire day taking the walk, stopping by at beaches in between . It takes about 3 hours to complete entire walk but the view is breathtaking all the time so you wont feel the tiredness.

Tuff walk but beautiful scenery. This is a lovely walk to do but it is tuff going and lots of steps etc but the scenery, views and beaches you see along the way make it worth it.Worth doing while in Sydney

Dreaming of the Coastal Walk.... I walked the Coastal walk every day that I was in Bondi - I was completely taken with it!! I has some of the most amazing views I have ever seen and it comes with a great workout too!! Not great for anyone with a low fitness level, a fear of heights or a problem with stairs. Definitely a must do for anyone who visits Bondi! It will take you straight to Tamarama Beach and then further on to Bronte beach - both of which are just as beautiful as the famous Bondi!!I can't wait to take myself to Bondi again and the Coastal walk will be the first thing on my to do list!
faboulous. This is a great walk scenery is awesome we stayed in Coogee and done the walk several times it is about 14k there and back the scenery is fantastic

Not to be missed. This is a great way to spend a few hours. You can either walk from Coogee to Bondi or vice versa. Either way the view is incredible as you will see people, landscape, homes, and the ocean. We had a family of 7 adults and it took us about 2 hours to do the whole walk from Bondi to Coogee but we stopped and took pictures. We took a bus back to Bondi Junction when we were done. There are places to eat along the way as well as bathrooms.

A must do experience. I did the walk on a beautiful sunny day after a relaxing lunch in Coogee. The scenery, in every sense of the word, was wonderful. Everyone seemed so happy and relaxed. A must do on a sunny day.
Beautiful scenery. Did the walk in Nov, first impression , WOW. It's was a fantastic two hour walk from Coogee to Bondi. Go if you can, highly recommend. I was so glad that I did the trip.

Do. Not. Miss. This.. Every time I go back to my hometown of Sydney, from the US, I do this stunning walk. If you want to see what Sydney is made of - ie., the most beautiful rock formations in the world, mixed with deep blue water, golden sands, blue skies, cafes, amazing outdoor sculptures, outdoor yoga and/or coffee at the Bondi Icebergs, buff young surfers in their bare feet and boardies passing you by momentarily distracting you from the other scenery, etc. etc. etc. ... then get thee down to Bondi Beach (south end) and start the walk. Go as far as the next beach or all the way to Coogee, then get a bus back to town from there - or wherever you're staying. Moderate effort - some stairs - but take your time and enjoy.

Best FREE entertainment in Sydney. Take a leisurely stroll but be prepared for a bit of thigh burning as the stroll takes in extreme stairs and a varied up and down terrain on what is part of the beautiful and dramatic Sydney Coastline. It is a regular for joggers and walking fanatics but you can also enjoy coffee stops along the way at the beaches and have a meal at Bondi or Coogee at either end. Spectacular scenery!!!!

An annual pilgrimage.... An early start to a brilliant day in Sydney is a brisk sub 60 minute walk to the sea water pool at Bronte and back to breakfast at the Wet Bar/Cafe in North Bondi.A longer and tougher walk is the one to Coogee and back which adds another hour, and much sorer legs, to the journey.

Nice views over the coastal line. This walk takes you in approx. 2 hours one way from Bondi to Cogee. You pass several beaches and the beautiful "Gordons bay" (google it!). You get nice views from the coastal line. I can really recommend this walk. You can take the bus to CBD from Coogee, as well as from Bondi beach, so you don't have to walk the return.

Stunning Views. We did this walk one afternoon. It was very hot and we didn't rush so it took us about 1 and a half hours. The walk was very nice and scenic, however there was a lot of runners along the path. We reached the end and then caught the bus back to Bondi. It would be nice if there was somewhere to get a drink on the way.

Best walk (Run) in Sydney. Sea Views from every angle and the cemetery is amazing. Running is hard going as there are lots of steps and walkers in the way - the Coogee part to the end is best for Running
An amazing world class walk and views.. The beaches you pass along are fantastic and the views are superb. Stop at Tamarama beach for a coffee and relaxing 30 minutes.

Every step offers more beautiful views. We had high expectations of this walk given that it was ranked as #2 for attractions in Sydney, and it didn't disappoint. We thoroughly enjoyed every step of the walk and took hundreds of wonderful photos along the way while enjoying some great weather and exercise. I wish we had time to stop for some swimming along the way, but we were on a tight schedule. There are so many pools and beaches along the walk that looked absolutely gorgeous!The walk itself was not very difficult, and you can make it as long or short as you would like. Some portions had some steep stairs as website suggests (http://bonditocoogeewalk.com.au/the-walk/), but overall it can be a manageable walk if you are in relatively healthy condition.I recommend you take water and snacks (if desired) if you go because there are not many places along the way to purchase food and drink. There are a couple of sites for bathrooms, though, and they are well kept for the most part.Loved the walk and would do it again if I return!!

STUNNING!. This was the most stunning walk I've ever gone on!!! If you love photography this walk will give you endless photo opportunities with all of it's stunning rock walls, and coastlines. Stair-climbing is involved and would not be practical for strollers (unless you're willing to carry it up) or wheel-chairs.

Stunning. The Coogee to Bondi walk was without doubt one of the highlights of our stay in Sydney. We did the walk mid-week on a beautiful warm day when the walkway was busy but not too congested. At every point along the coastal path there was a fantastic view of the different shades of blue sea, blue sky, rocks and sand. There are numerous stopping points along the way for drinks, toilets etc. We ended at at Bondi and had lunch overlooking the beach there and loved every minute of this walk. A must do if you are visiting Sydney.
not for the faint hearted but worth it. Its up and down steps and cliff walks for 2 hours, views and coves are really worth it. Take protection against sun and plenty of water.
fabulous views. We actually only walked Bondi to Bronte beach but it was lovely, took us about 2.5 hours round trip, well worth doing but make sure you take water as it gets very hot.
great walk, very scenic. Fantastic day, was a lovely sunny day, saw alot of coastline and plenty of great beaches and pools at the beaches to swim in. Was very picturesque.

Great short walk right on the coastline. This is an easy, relatively short round-trip walk with specular views of the ocean, which is right off the pathway. The walk is on macadam surface, and wide enough to handle two-way walkers and runners. Bring a hat and water.

Lovely walk with great Ocean Views. This is a lovely gentle walk with some steep parts, but the views of the Ocean are great. It does get a bit busy though so better to do in the week rather than the weekend.

Scenic but crowded. This walk was absolutely beautiful. You get a totally different view of Bondi beach and the stunning beauty around. The day we took this walk it was extremely hot and there is very little shade. It was also extremely crowded.When you do take this walk make sure not to go on a very very hot day

A highlight in Sydney. Has to be one of the most beautiful 6 km walks we have taken. Did not hurt to have hit a cloudless day in the mid-70's temperature-wise. Stark cliffs descend down to a white-capped sea, drawing into jaw-drop beautiful coves and inlets. Also met interesting people on the walk. A must do. We took city bus from downtown Sydney to Coogee Beach and then walked to Bondi. A must do while in Sydney!

Take lots of water. We caught the bus from Circular quay to Bondi, about a 20 minute bus ride. We were dropped right at Bondi Beach and started the Cliffwalk to Coogee. It was a good 85° day, bright sun but a prevailing breeze most of the way. We had packed our own lunch and found a cool spot for lunch on a bench under a tree. The walk is well supplied with water fountains and the occasional beachside cafe, but I would recommend bringing your own water. Though we walked the entire way and part of the way back there are buses available at each town in case you decide you've had enough.
Awesome. What a great walk. Saw whales not too far off. Snorkled and surfed at a couple spots. And tons of water fountains along the path.
Gorgeous!. Beautiful walk with waves crashing on the rocks! We stopped at Bronte as that took us about two hours to walk.

Nice walk. Oh it's sunny!. The walk is pretty nice. Coogee Beach is one of my favorite in Sydney. It is smaller than Bondi and it has some shade. The walk is easy, quite sunny and a bit crowded sometimes. However, it is a nice 2 hour stroll with beautiful scenic views.
Great Beaches and Walk. Bondi to Coogee is a great walk, climb, or run. Do not forget the cemetery with many famous Australians! I advise doing this walk/run early in the morning due to the heat.

A very nice walk and bath on the beach. The beaches and cliffs are beautiful to have a walk. At one beach there is a very good infrastucture for having a shower and changing clothe. There was nothing we disliked.
A delight. This is a dramatic part of the coast line and well worth the effort. My favourite swimming point was Coogee where I stayed at Dive.

Stunning views!. This walk was incredible! highly recommend if you can handle the physical aspect of it. You basically can't put your camera down, with every turn or angle you're snapping shots, one more beautiful than the next! I did this with a group of friends and we loved it. Starting at the famous bikini Bondi Beach was fun and ending at Coogee, where we enjoyed some cold beers at the local club/bar nearby! If the weather is nice (which it almost always is) and the time allows it...do this!

Enjoy great views and watersea swimming pools. It is an ~3.5Km walking tour with interesting views, different beaches and great swimming pools built to gather water from the sea. If you are in downtown, going there buy bus is quite easy. Great swimmings wait you there!

Beautiful Walk. Beautiful scenery. Lots to look at, so many different beaches, and an amazing cemetery along the way. A very special walk.(I'm thankful the city of Sydney placed a filtered water station along the way, where everyone can refill their water bottles)

Oceantastic. A beautiful walk done by beginners and serious walkers alike. The ocean is spectacular, the rock formations stunning and it's fun to watch the surfers and those swimming in the ocean side pool during big waves.
Beautiful beach. A busy beach filled with sun worshippers in bronzed bodies. The water is crystal clear, reflecting the blue sky in the waves. A lovely beach and a must see when in Sydney.

Stunning walk. We took the Coogee to Bondi route.Absolutely superb, and enlivened by a lifeguard rescue along the way. Allow at least one and a half hours to take in the sights along the way, and beware of joggers!

Eastern Suburbs Classic. Especially after the upgrade of the coogee to maroubra section, this classic walk is a must do when in the area.I would recommend an early start, especially in summer, as it gets really hot when the ocean breeze has not yet set in ( usually starts around 2 pm ) and definitely avoid the weekends, which tend to be reminiscent of an ants trail with scores of people especially between bondi and bronte, with joggers/powerwalkers/pedestrians almost running into each other !!For a more relaxed and in my opinion even more scenic route, start at bronte and make your way all the way down to maroubra, where the crowds are so much thinner, just be aware that at the end of the south coogee trail, after passing the "castle " ( an iconic clifftop house ), turn right up Cuzco, then at the top left onto malabar and then left into mermaid to take you back to the ocean.Lots of nice options to go for a swim and rest for a cold drink on the way, especially gordons bay tends to be almost deserted even during peak hours, with super calm waters and amazing underwater sealife All in all a must see and do !
Lovely walk. Beautiful scenery and especially fantastic when Sculpture By The Sea is on, though it is busier then.

great views, good exercise. we actually walked from Maroubra to Bondi taking about 3 1/2 hours, but well worth it even if it means a short detour from the coast just outside Maroubra. need to take two bus to M abut only 1 from B back to the city centre
Highly recomended. Went mid-summer and was worried it might be busy, but it wasn't and this is a great walk to see a variety of Sydney's beaches. Manageable for all competent walkers
Scienic. Majestic views. A must for anyone with minimal fitness level. Highly recommended for overseas visitors.

Not as good as the Balmoral to Taronga. It is good to stretch your legs by the sea and, if they don't kill you in their rush, it is great to watch the lycra clad beauties pounding the beat. But, the path and a number of the beaches are man-made and contrast with the national park coastlines in the north. One for pushing the kids along in the buggy.And, if you do it in reverse and end up at Bondi, it is almost impossible to get a bus back into the CBD because they are too full.

Great walk. We took at bus from Sydney to Coogee beach and ended at Bondi. What stunning views of the coast line! Took my 4 and 7 year old for the long walk, took our time but they did it. They wanted to stop at every beach along the way. Had a nice meal at Moo Gourmet Burgers in Bondi eating outside looking at the beach. Bring plenty of water and a few snacks. Don't forget to stop and enjoy the view.

Long but well worth it!. I did this walk with my parents and young children, starting at Bondi and ending at Coogee. It's just the right length to tire them out, and we stopped plenty of times to enjoy the view and take photographs. The day was very sunny and hot, even with the ocean breeze - lots of sunscreen and water bottles (there are fill up stations along the way) are essential. The highlight for us was taking a few minutes to wander through the old colonial cemetery. Expect to see lots of beach bodies and joggers! At the end, we caught a city bus back to Bondi Junction from Coogee.

A must to do in Sydney. A great walk and better to start early in the day to avoid crowds and for good photo shots. Scenary, people, dogs and eveything on the way are to be enjoyed. A healthy walk (6 km) with a lot of pleasure.
superb. Did this walk and really enjoyed it . Approx 8 kilometers i think. A little tired after but all worthwhile. Lots of lovely bays and spectacular views. Highly recommended.

You haven't visited the beaches unless you've done this walk. We did this walk and stopped and swam at Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte and Coogee. It is gorgeous and a must-do. It is not difficult though there are some stairs.

One of the great walks of Sydney. Not only do visitors to Sydney do this walk so do all the residents - this is one of our great walks. If you need beautiful views to motovate you then this is the walk for you. You can start at either end ie Bondi or Coogee. The views are spectacular, however your legs will feel it as there are steps hills etc, just take it at your own pace. Try to go the whole way to Coogee or Bondi it really is worth it. Take a little back pack have a dip in one of the beaches on the way or to motivate yourself promise yourself a yummy meal at the end. If you've had a big lunch then try walking back to work it off.
Great scenery. This path has breath taking scenery but Take water as there is not water fountains provided on the way
Super coastal walk. We got tube to Bondi Station then bus to Coogee. Steady walk to Bondi with lots of stops on the way. Great way to spend half a day

Walk along the South Pacific coastline. This is an interesting walk, following the coast, past several different beaches. I think it is better done from Coogee to Bondi as you approach Bondi from the side.

Wonderful coastal walk. I took the bus to Coogee and then walked to Bondi beach. Its a fairly easy stroll of around 2-3 hours (depending how many pictures and coffee breaks you take), offering grand ocean views. The coast can be as breathtaking as seeing the waves roll into Bondi beach. A great city break if you are fed up with the CBD crowds.
Lovely Coastal walk. Walked from Bondi to Bronte didn't quiet make it to Coogee as a very hot day. Easy walk along lots of lovely coastline. Cafe at the end of walk at Bronte. We'll worth doing.
Great Walk. Brilliant - lovely walk. Highly recommended. You can go from Bondi to Coogee or Coggee to Bondi - or both!

Great walk and sightseeing. Just finished this amazing walk. It is a nice day in Sydney. Clean air. The view from cliffs just amazing. The walk is a bit long and going on the edge of shore, so get ready take a lot of drinking water and comfy shoes. We also had a swimware because you can actually stop for a swim. If you visit Sydney I would absolutly recomend to do this walk
Beautiful views. I loved it. Take your time and walk along the coast with very beautiful views. Definitely one of my to do-activities while you are in Sydney!
Superb. Beautiful scenery. Relaxing walk for people of all abilities. A must do Bondi area obviously very popular & busy.

Run this and feel like a superstar!. I ran this and my parents and adult brother walked it…what a great time! Bring a backpack and a camera and water and sunscreen and athletic shoes…you'll need it all! Some of the most attractive and fit people on the planet do this walk/run, so the scenery isn't all beaches and ocean :) Hang out at Coogee when you're done…the people watching is great and the beach is beautiful (though the water was cold in December). It's about a 25 minute cab drive out of the city, and we had a little bit of a problem finding a return cab in Coogee, but apparently there is a bus that you can take back into the city, so potentially investigate that. This is a must-do!

Is there really anything bad about Sydney. the walk is beautiful, lots of people so I also felt very safe. Lots of spots to stop and take pictures then relax and sit on the beach when finished. Take your time and enjoy it.

One of the best things to do in sydney. A beautiful coastal cliff walk but all paved and easily managed by all fitness levels and ages. There can be crowds for some parts of it but would recommend tying it in with a breakfast in bondi and then stroll along past all beaches on the way to coogee. If u don't make it all the way there will be cafes to break it up or cabs/buses to get u elsewhere.
leisure beach. great beach with clean environments. walk the streets for shopping and good food. The area is vibrant and just sit down and view all the surfriders

Another Syndey attraction leaves you impressed. The coastal walk runs along the cliffs and beaches from Maroubra to Bondi Its easy and takes about 1.5 hours to do.Jump off for a coffee in many places and enjoy the surrounding localities.Take a swim.A must do

Good exercise with a rolling panorama of wonderful views. What's not to like about this walk? I only have one small quibble and that is that it isn't that well sign posted.... yes I know it's a coastal walk so you go along the sea but there are a couple of places where the sea path just goes to a beach and you have to come back out again to join the walk..... But apart from that it's a lovely way to spend an hour or so ( depending how fast you walk!

BRRRRRR. Just a word to the wise- bring a jacket!It was SO windy and cold along this whole path. However, it was a gorgeous walk. Also be ready for a bit of a trek- it took us an hour or 2 (and we're not particularly slow walkers).
Walks around Sydney. Excellent easy walk . takes about 2 hours. It was sunny but there is very little humidity so you do not pespire which is good.
A great walk. If you are looking for a good coastal walk to do in 2-4 hours, this is a very good option. Great views, and easy walking.
Great Day. This is an amazing walk. The scenery is something out of a movie. So much fun to walk this beautiful trail and stop at different beaches along the way.

Simply stunning.. A must do in Sydney! Beautiful walk with stunning coastal scenery. Wide, even path makes it suitable for people of all ages with average fitness. Plenty of places along the way to fill up water bottles or stop on one of the beach cafés for food. Also a great place to go for a jog.

Wonderful walk, beautiful beaches. We set off from Clovelly Beach (a gorgeous little beach where you can park your car free of charge) and walked the coastal pathway to Bondi. The walk is free. It is really accessible for all ages and all levels of fitness. There are kiosks, picnic facilities and toilet facilities at each beach along the way and well as water bottle refilling stations which are free. The beaches along this walk are spectacular, and each is fabulous to stop and have a swim. We arrived at Bondi and visited the Icebergs - a wonderful club perched on the cliff overlooking the entire length of Bondi beach. If your 7 or 70 .. or younger or older ... do this walk. It's fabulous!

Wonderful. We did this walk in reverse from Coogee to Bondi but either way its fantastic dropping in little coves and beaches along the way. Wonderful scenery, well signposted and well managed pathways

Very Enjoyable Walk. This is a great walk for people to see the coast line and the stunning views of the landscape. I would recommend starting at Bondi before finishing at Coogee Bay as it's a much better beach to spend time. Visit the Coogee Bay Hotel to grab a beer in the garden to finish.

Great way to see the beautiful coastline, with lots to do along the way. It's a great easy walk and I would recommend this to anyone going to Sydney. There is lots to do along with way - good snorkeling on Clovelly, great cafe's on Bronte and the best swimming on Tamarama and Bondi. The Hermitage Foreshore to Queens beach is also a beautiful walk with the most amazing views. Not to be missed!
Sydney's iconic walk. Beautiful scenery. Very easy walk for all ages I'd imagine. Avoid weekends if you can though as its very busy.

Great walk, fantastic beaches. We spent a few hours strolling from Coogee through the faro beaches to Bondi and loved nearly every minute. What stunning views and beautiful beaches to swim or sunbathe.

A Hot Day. We set off from Bondi on a lovely hot day and followed the coastal path, which winds its way from Bondi to Coogee and has fantastic views all the way around. There are numerous beaches you can stop at and some have swimming pools built into the cliffso if the surf is to high you can still cool down in a pool.Clovelly has a great Bowls Club perched on the cliff with great views to sea as you bowl and a very unusual beach which is very user friendly. All the way along the route are areas to BBQ and picnic and plenty of watering holes ! There are numerous water fountains to refill your bottles for free.Once you arrive at Coogee relax and pat yourself on the back as on a hot day it is tiring but well worth the effort.

Must Do. We did this walk in reverse from Coogee to Bondi. Either was its beautiful. Incredible views. Lots of cute beaches to stop and photograph and or take a dip in. Make sure you stop at Icebergs for lunch or a snack!

Need to be in shape. We (four adults - mom, dad, two daughters 21 and 26) did the walk in reverse. Coogee to Bondi. It's literally breathtaking because of the views, the stairs and the heat. We went through several bottles of water and rest stops. It took us two hours at a fairly leisurely pace and lots of photos.We wimped out and took a cab back. In our defense, my husband has a bum knee. We were all sore the next day.

Gorgeous walk. My husband lived in Sydney for over a year and had always raved about the amazing Bondi to Coogee walk, which he made very frequently. We were not disappointed! The walk is indeed amazing. Prepare yourself with water, a hat, and comfy shoes. There are plenty of places to sit and rest, but it is a 3.7 mile walk in one direction. There are also a lot of stairs. I would not recommend this with a young child. We brought our toddler with us, and sure enough, we had to carry her for much of the walk. Strollers would not be possible on this path. We got a cab from Bondi back to our hotel at Circular Quay.
Beautiful walk!. My teenage sons and my parents who are fit and in their 70s equally enjoyed this walk. Lots of places to eat and shop in Bondi too, so it is a good mix of nature and urban fun!

Sun, sand and surf. The well marked and easy to follow hardscape trail winds from Bondi through the hills to Coogee. If traveling by public transport from Sydney, you can easily take a bus to Bondi and take the return at Coogee.

Only went as far as Bronte. I took the 333 bus from Liverpool Street and Hyde Park in Sydney and got off at Bondi (pronounced Bond-eye by the way) and the proceeded to walk the coast to Tamarama (a little glam for me) and then onto Bronte Beach which was a wonder complete with a salt-water pool and nice places for coffee. Also try the Bronte Life Saving Club for an affordable meal. Clubs in Australia are great places for travelers to get an affordable good value meal in an expensive country.

Lovely free activity for a sunny day. We walked from Coogee up to Bondi (which is possibly easier - more downhills than uphills I think) & took it leisurely over the day, stopping to swim at the beaches we liked & pick a place on the way for lunch. The views are great, the path is easy to follow, it is fun to cool off along the way as you discover new beaches. Highly recommended! :-)

Great Walk. Beautiful walk with some great views, nice to see facilities at each beach so we could get drinks as we went from beach to beach. Walk takes about 2 hours, most places you have to pay for parking except for clovelly beach. Would say its a must to do when your in Sydney.

Great walk with beautiful views. I have done this walk a few times albeiy that I have only done the walk up to Bronte. It is a beautiful walk and great place to take photos. It's great to start or end the walk with a drink in Bondi, Bronte or Coogee.
Great but best on a cloudy day!. Great walk! Very scenic and you get to see more of the "lesser" known beaches in the area. We went on a cloudy day and can imagine it would be hard going in the sun.

Walking instead of waiting for bus. I really liked the walk to Cooggee, We didn't plan to do it, we did that walk because we couldn't get a bus from Bondi back to the city. It's a very nice option when you are not in a rush.
Great Walk. The views are great. Quite tiring but well worth the walk enjoyed every minute. You can have a dip in the sea to cool of great.
Great Walk. This was a great walk. Easy to do (even with a young child), stopped along the way and had a coffee and sat in the sun, taking in the fantastic views.
Peaceful walk, away from the city. Nice, quiet coastal trial and a few flights of steps. Relatively easy walk. Did it in the late afternoon when the weather was cooler. Even saw dolphins from afar.

Perfect walk for families with small kids. We brought strollers for our 4 and 5 year olds, and despite the stairs, it was well worth the walk. There were so many nooks and crannies the kids could explore at the rest stops, and the playgrounds at the coves were much appreciated. We swam in each of the beaches along the way and made a whole day of it. Highly recommended as a family outing.

One of the most scenic walks!. Did this walk on a warm summer day. Did it in flip flops so it isn't strenouous. There are some stairs here and there but not a huge challenge. The views are spectacular. My only regret is that I didn't have my swim suit and snorkel as we passed two different snorkel spots: Clovely and Gordon's Bay. When we got to Coogee some of us were quite sun burned so bring hats & slather on the sunscreen. We opted to take public bus back to Bondi (Coogee to Bondi Junction to Bondi)

Great walk with great views. A great walk along some of the most beautiful coast. On a hot day be prepared there is little shade and need plenty of sun cream. There are several water stops and shower/toilet blocks along route. The walk takes you past sereral great little beaches all unique in there own way. The walk in total takes about 2 hours at a good pace.
Bondi beach walk. Walked thus costal path one afternoon. There was an art festival on and the walk was surrounded by modern art pieces. Great attraction and beautiful view along the coast. Lovely.

One of the best experiences on offer in Sydney. Bondi - Tamarama - Clovelley - Waverley - Coogee. What's not lo like in such a beautiful stretch of real estate?The beaches are beautiful, clean and well maintained. The vistas are spectacular and the walk is made easy by the boardwalk/path as well as the numerous resting and refreshment spots along the way. Definitely worth doing on more occasions than one!!
Must do walk - but watch the crowds. A beautiful walk with fantastic views, but keep to the left and watch the crowds, runners and believe it or not, the cyclists!

Great walk on a sunny afternoon. Great walk to enjoy the seashore and get some great views of the various beaches. We were able to watch a number of surfers and see how the locals enjoy their wonderful beaches.

Really pleasant walk. Starting from the end of Bondi beach , by the swimming pool , this is a well signposted tarmac walk. Fantastic views and you can get a bus back from Bronte or coogee to sydney. Lots of steps from bronte , but well worth the extra effort it is well worth cintinuing to Coogee , a quaint little town with a small beach and lots of restaurants . I particularly liked the love cooge kitchen right at the end of the walk where I was made most welcome and had a delicious milk shake .
A must do!. Fantastic walk with fabulous views. Stop at the Clovelly Bowls Club for a mid walk thirst quencher! Lots of beaches to stop and explore. Finish with a bits to eat at the Coogee Bay Hotel.

terrific trek. It was a lovely walk! The tricky part is figuring out how to get from Sydney to Bondi, then from Coogee back to Sydney. (We took a cab, but that's sort of pricey.) But it was worth it....the scenery was fantastic.

just perfect!. I love this walk. I usually do the shorter Bondi to Bronte walk, this is a full hour and lots of steps. It's for the fit and not stroller friendly. But it's gorgeous! you see the sea crashing on the rocks. It's well maintained and used a lot by locals and tourists alike.
outstanding. it was a little bit cold that day buy the walk on the beach warmed you up. the blue water was spectacular,

Take plenty of water wear good shoes. This costal walk is amazing, right alongside the beaches and water. The coastline is beautiful, especially on a warm sunny day. The walk is longer than you anticipate, but not difficult. It is a relatively flat walk, with a few spots with stairs, which can be a bit steep, but manageable if you take your time. Take water as you,ll need it. There are drinking water spots on the way to refill. Count on taking a good 2 1/2 hrs return, so you can enjoy the scenery without rushing.

Great walk for exercise and coastal views. Liked the walk very much. Ups and downs make it a very good exercise! Not just for views. There are lots of people doing this so I would prefer to go early AM next time. We ended up taking a bus back to Bondi Junction from Coogee where we were staying, which was perfect.

Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal Walk. I caught bus from Central to Bondi Junction then walked to the beach as the buses were jam packed and long ques. The coastal walk was incredible! So many nice cliff edges and beaches! Did a bit of rock trekking too. I recommend this to everyone! So beautiful!

bondi beach :D. Love the scenery, nice shops and good eating places around. Friendly people everywhere and an awesome place to spend pretty much the whole day..just remember to bring suntan lotion and a pair of sunnies =)

Fabulous Cliff Top Walk. We got the bus to Bondi beach from Central Sydney and then did some of this walk. It was a hot day so we only got as far as Tamarama Beach where we stopped and had a very nice coffee with very friendly Australians running the cafe. The walk is beautiful and used by walkers and joggers alike

Nice Easy Walk. Good coastal walk. Had to abandon due to thunder, lightening and rain! Got bus back to Bondi Junction from about half way but when sun come out after lunch got back on bus and finished walk.
Amazing!. Had a wonderful time walking Bondi to Coogee Beach. Nice walk, enjoying the sights, and amazing blue water.

A must to explore the Eastern Suburbs Beaches. A very enjoyable walk which takes you around the coast, seeing the beautiful beaches. You can stop at beautiful cafés along the way. Breathtaking views all the way along, it too long walk. Try going just from Bronte to Bondi

Great walk with stunning views. A great walk with stunning views, and it's free.Take as long as you want to complete the walk... or don't. It's an open attraction so there is no tour guide, you can go at your own pace. You even see some people perching on the rocks just reading and relaxing. Take a good camera because the views are stunning.
Excellent scenic walk. Great walk with numerous hills and steps. You get to see lots of little coves along the way. The path is for walking only and really worth the effort.

REMEMBER. To always KEEP TO THE LEFT when walking on any Australian footpath, trail or sidewalk, especially this narrow but beautiful coastal walk. The locals will snarl at you if you don't keep left The same goes when standing on escalators, keep the right hand side clear for people overtaking. Just like the roads.
Nice views. This walk is interesting, but not the 'must do' that others have suggested. Glad we went, but would put other things higher on the 'to do' list in Sydney.

The best walk ever. We decided to take the bus from Circular Quay to Coogee to start our coastal walk back to Bondi as we wanted to end our day having dinner in Bondi Beach. What a walk! The Oz's have water fountains everywhere. You walk from beach to beach and the scenery is spectacular. There are plenty of places to stop for a break. The walk is not difficult, is well signposted and really enjoyable. Do not miss out on this experience whilst in Sydney.

Bondi Coast walk to Coogee. Great walk, but a little tight with joggers and strollers constantly sharing the not to wide pathway. Great exercise climbing old sandstone stairs as you round the corner towards Tamarama beach. The best views of the maxi yachts as they bob down the coast at the beginning of the Sydney To Hobart ocean leg.

Bucket list must!!. This is without doubt one of the best ocean walks in the world and absolutely stunning scenery to enjoy on a long stroll via fantastic beaches and villages...simply a must if in the area

amaizing free walk don't miss this!. one of the best parts of our Sydney visit- go for it! we walked afternoon and saw the sunset was great and you can end earlier if you get tired as the trail meets the road and buses a few times.

A delight. Water views and beautiful rock formations as you walk from one cove to the next. Depending on your pace and how often you stop to take in the view or take a photo, this walk is 1 to 2 hours one way. We took a bus from circular quay to Bondi; did the Coastal Walk and then took the bus from Coogee back to Circular Quay. This is a walk I could do over and over. Loved it.
Lovely Walk. very peacefully walk. Takes around 2 hours but you have loads of stops offs in beautifully beaches. You have to do it if you are in Sydney

Nice escape from Bondi. Christmas Day on Bondi 2013 was a washout… So, we decided to take the walk towards Coogee Beach. Great choice. Lovely walk along the rocks, both high and low as well as several beach stops. We had a dip in the surf at Tamarama beach. Watch for the rip tide as this is not a place for a weak swimmer but much quieter than Bondi. Plenty of rest stops along the way. Not to be missed.

Fantastic coastal experience. I walked the Bondi to Bronte (not quite all the way to Coogee) and it was beautiful. The rock formations and the endless ocean expanses are breath-taking. A must do for beach lovers!

The most amazing sights and sounds. you need to be a healthy individual to complete this particular trek from Bondi to Coogee and trust me, every step you take will be rewarding! the vastness of Bondi beach will make you feel terribly miniscule, a dip in the ocean pool at Bondi and then start your trek... by the time you reach Coogee, you will see a few different moods of the ocean and the people around. you will also witness some of the best 'crlibrity' houses if you are walking with a local who knows the area. upon reaching Coogee you want to have the best breakfast in the quaint little eateries around the beach.

not for the laid back relaxed tourists. the six km walk is fully filled up with spectacular views. I was accompanied by my wife and 2 year toddler (on a pram). there are a few spots where we had to carry the pram, which was really gruesome. otherwise it was simply GREAT!!! though not a good option on a hot humid day or in the mid day. Best time would be in the late aftetnoon. It would be wise to carry a water bottle. But shouldn't miss the full walk.

Highly recommended! . Weather was very cloudy when we went but still hot! The walk itself was amazing, with some great sights and wonderful beaches. Was quite physical at times with steep stairways and a few hills but nothing you wouldnt expect from an 8.6km walk! Took us about 3 hours to complete but we stopped at every beach and stopped for food half way. Also recommend anyone who does this to continue from Coogie on to Maroubra(not sure on the spelling!) beach! This took another two hours but was well worth it and you can still get a bus back to City from there.

What an incredible way to spend a day. Got up in the morning as a kite surfer sped across Bondi's unusually calm ocean. The walk along the coastline south was incredible. You pass 5-6 beaches with wonderful curvy shapes and hills. Every beach has something unique and incredible to offer, so take your time at each!

Must-do daytime activity. This is a lovely scenic walk along the beautiful coastline of Sydney that certainly deserves a slot on your Sydney itinerary. We took about 2.5 hours completing the entire distance from Bondi to Coogee, stopping quite frequently to take pictures and enjoy the views. At some places the walk can get a bit steep, but there are several places to stop and rest along the way. The weather was very good during our walk - you might want to start a bit early if you want to avoid too much of the sun (the waters look gorgeous in their blue-green colors in the morning sun) and take some sun-block as well. The entire walk is along the coastline and there are several places where you can easily walk down a few rocks to get to the water and yet, its only a climb of a few steps to get to the road. There are several park benches and lookouts for some great picture opportunities - make maximum use of these. If you have a lot of time in your hand, you can always stop by any of the beaches for a swim and take it slowly. There are quire a few nice restaurants along the walk where you can have a quick breakfast / lunch if required. Several good restroom facilities are available as well.

Great walk but not as easy as some have said.. It was a lovely scenic walk but quite undulating and tiring. When we arrived at Coogee we expected a nice cafe but the best we could find was a Macdonalds. Felt a bit disappointing to be honest but glad we did it

Stunning views and great swimming. Walking the reverse from Coogee to Bondi on a hot day was perfect, clear blue sky and sea throughout the walk. Head onto some of the cliff tops where access allows and you gain amazing views. Stopping off at different beaches is great to cool down too.

Absolutely stunning.. We took our time completely this walk and found it was one of our favorite activities in Sydney. Each of the beaches offered its own perks and the views were spectacular. There are ample water and rest stops at each of the beaches along the way and I would say this is appropriate for most fitness levels. Also, take a hat and tons of sunscreen as there is very little shade or cover throughout. We started from Bondi and finished at Coogee - in our opinion, Bondi was the prettiest beach - gentle waves, clear aquamarine surf, no seaweed and although busy, there was lots of space in the sand. Coogee was beautiful as well but at the time we were there, had significant seaweed both on the beach and within the water forcing hundreds of people to swim in the small area where there was none. If you were to choose only one spot to swim, I would suggest starting the walk at Coogee (arrive by bus) and walking toward Bondi to cap off the afternoon relaxing or swimming at Bondi (and bussing or training back from there). A fantastic day trip and choose a sunny day if you can!

Bondi Beach. If time in Sydney is limited I would definitely do Bondi beach over Manly. The walk is easy and the views are stunning. We stopped and had lunch and a swim in Bronte. Highly recommend this if visiting the area

Good exercise, Excellent views. The walk takes about 2 hours from one end to the other. My advice is to pack swimming gear when going for the walk! The water along the way are absolutely beautiful, it makes you want to just jump in and have a swim, especially on a hot summer's day!

Spectacular, not to be missed. We walked the route from Bondi to Coogee (well, we got as far as Clovelly as we ran out of steam - long day in the sun, and pushing a stroller). Absolutely incredibly beautiful, easily accessible with a stroller (not wheelchair friendly though unless someone can lift you up and down a couple of sets of stairs). Would advise 1) that you do this early in the day or later; very hot this time of year, not much shade; and 2) prepare to fall in love with the beaches along this walk MUCH more than Bondi. Take water and a hat.
Enjoyable when the sun shines. Great views,lovely beaches and easy to catch a bus out to Bondi Beach and then back into the city from Coogee.
Refreshing. Must do when in sydney! Fresh ocean air is fabulous. Recommended going weekdays and avoid the weekend crowds when the weather is sunny.

A must in Sydney. This walk was undertaken by two older people who found it quite an easy physical achievement. The views were spectacular and the beaches superb. Spent some considerable time watching surfers. We fell in love with Clovelly and stopped here for an ice cream before moving on to Coogee for lunch. This may sound like a difficult walk but it was a doodle.

A Sydney Highlight. This was one of the highlights of our trip to Sydney. On a beautiful, sunny day, we easily walked from Bondi to the old cemetery and back to Bondi. From pounding surf on ragged rock shores to rolling surf on pristine beaches, the views were stunning. The path was not busy (Tuesday)...most people strolled along, and there were a few runners. A pod of dolphins was clearly visible during much of our time on the path and there were surfers, snorkelers and a few people fishing from the shore. We stopped at Jenny’s Cafe at Bronte beach for a ‘long black with a side of milk’ (the Australians sure do coffee right), and at the Lamrock Cafe in Bondi for lunch (good pasta and cold beer under the street umbrellas). The picturesque main boulevard of Bondi (Campbell Parade) has many shops and eateries for those so inclined. Definitely a half-day must-do excursion in Sydney.
haha. features stunning views, beaches, parks, cliffs, bays and rock pools.six km in Sydney’s eastern suburbs.

What's not to enjoy?. Very easy coastal walk with plenty of alluring places to pause and take in breathtaking views from clifftops or some of the beautiful smaller beaches that you pass en route. We started in Bondi and caught a bus back into town from Coogee. Highly recommended to any visitors.

A beautiful coastal walk. We took the hop on hop off bus to Bondi beach...actually we weren't that impressed with Bondi beach or the town but the coastal walk was really beautiful and worth the time. We also enjoyed seeing the little towns along the path and how they had developed their beach line. It was a nice sense of community. I highly recommend taking this walk.
Good walk. We did part of this walk when Sculptures by the Sea was on. The part we did was lovely, and the sculptures were interesting!Recommended.
not to be missed. One of the best things you can do in sydney for free.. The view is amazing.. A bit uphill walk but worth it..
Great. Great value for your dollar as it's completely free. I miss this walk. Nice to shark spot, or dolphin spot. Great for working on your tan and keeping fit.

Best thing we did in Sydney. We did Coogee to Bondi. What a beautiful walk - swam three times and enjoyed 'Sculpture by the Sea' at Bondi. It gives you a really good feeling for the beaches and the coast.

Worthwhile visit.. Super little town and beach with beautiful sand and waves. Loved the cleanliness of the area. The public bus from the city made it easy to get to. Enjoyed the ride through neighborhoods getting there.
A walk cannot be missed. Fantastic views are along the 10km coastal line. To finish the walk, you need sunglass, water, comfortable shoes, and camera.
Wetting my Feet in November at the beach!. I liked and enjoyedy the views and the water...but had to run back to the bus bcuz it started raining and that was my dislike!!
