Bondi walk. This is one of my favourite coastal walks in the world. It changes every time I walked it and has facinating outcrops of rocks along the way. Gives you a lot more to do than just surfing Bondi, and what's more, it's free!
sunday walk along the beach. is a good walking track along eastern part of Sydney ,beautiful scenery along the way only bad thing is part of the track is a bit narrow and lack of signage
Stunning walk. I visited Sydney for walk and this walk was recommended by some friends. It was well worth it. The scenery is breathtaking. It is quite hilly so would not recommend it for the elderly.
Long Walk. Long Walk but well Worth it, We started in Bondi and the weather not great but as we went around the clouds cleared and the views were amazing

Gorgeous views of the coastline. Coming from the UK - this walk is simply stunning. Incredible views, beautiful homes, fantastic beaches and yummy places to eat and grab a coffee. Keen to do it again before I go back!

A true Sydney experience. I revisited the walk recently, with some time gap since living in Coogee and doing this walk nearly daily. They are only improving the quality of this trip - with useful historical signs, better paths and drinking stations. The whole trip is worthwhile, but short trips are also fun Coogee to Bronte has the beautiful cemetery and Bronte to Bondi is beautiful. Share with friends and keep your eyes peeled for the bazillion joggers (avoid mornings to avoid the most of these).
best thing to do in Sydney. We have been here in Sydney for 1 year, this is our favorite place to go, if you are in Sydney, do NOT miss the walk, vies are unreal

See why Sydneysiders love their coastline. Walk the cliffs with the southern coast of Sydney stretching before you. Sparkling seas, wonderful rock formations, whale watching in season, great coffee and meals at Bronte and Coogee where you can cool off in the beautiful bays.

Beautiful walk!. I highly recommend this walk -- it's breath-taking! Great views of Bondi Beach, plus you get to visit several other (lesser known and therefore less crowded) beaches along the way (like Tamaranda, Bronte, and Coogee). Make sure you have sun protection as much of the walk has no shade. Also make sure to bring your camera and the views and sights are amazing!

So Beautiful. Highly recommend this walk. Australia really does have the best beaches in the world. Many restaurants to stop at along the way and fabulous views the whole way. You will find places to swim and rock pools to explore. Wonderful life guides and very friendly locals.

Great piece of real estate, busy at weekends.. Try and do this walk during the week (less crowded) and stop at one of the many eating/drinking holes along the way. Fabulous views along 95% of the walk.
great walk. beautiful coastline. amazing path to go from beach to beach. walk it, run it, or take a picnic-- it's a beautiful spot and activity.

Oh so Beautiful!!!. We made our way to Bondi Beach using public transportation and started our walk to Coogee Beach. It was art week and all along the walk were many sculptures and works of art which was a highlight. Bring good walking shoes and you will do fine. Plenty of spots to enjoy the sites or have a meal.

Hot walk. Took train out to bondi junction and walked down to beach which took about 30 mins.Clear blue sky and very warm as we started the walk round the coastal path,path very busy with runners.The views out to sea are great and you soon reach the other beachs.By the time we got back to bondi beach it was very busy and very hot but still a very nice place to visit.

Made the beer in Coogee taste even better!. It was so windy! and awesome! Great scenery! who doesn't like a walk along coastal areas? Water fountains along the way, with dog bowls, too. Moderate ups and downs, a few steep areas but nothing too strenuous for the average fit walker. If you have time, bring your bathing suit - many pools along the way. Many places to stop and rest, too.

Beautiful Outlook. Somehow I thought walking along the beach means you're walking on sand. But it's actually a nicely paved path with intermittent stairs and wooded sidewalks. So, sandals are not a good choice of footwear for this coastal walk!It's quite a long walk, especially when it's sunny and hot. So, a hat is highly recommended.We went during a weekday afternoon in spring and the path was not crowded at all. Absolutely loved the view!

Best walk. Quite along walk you have to be reasonably fit a lot of stairs and sharp inclines , there are quite a lot of resting places, so if you went slow you would probably make it . I thinks it's about 3 or 4 kilometres. Not a short distance but well worth the effort glorious views.

Great way to see many beaches in one afternoon!. You will get many photo opportunities and fabulous views of the ocean on this scenic walk. You set your own pace, and folks of all abilities can enjoy it. Bring along a water bottle and a camera - good walking shoes are a bonus.

Amazing, especially during the sculpture show. Was able to go on the last day of the art show. The installations on various parts of the walk were very interesting. Now there were a lot of crowds there, including several people walking dogs but there was enough room on the walk that we didn't have problems. Even on a cloudy day after a rainstorm this was a very scenic walk. You can get plenty of pictures out on the rocks, just be careful as you do so. While you are on the walk, make sure to keep a look out for the Aboriginal rock carving that is just north of Tamarama beach. There is some up and down elevation during the walk, but we found our walk from Bondi to Tamarama easy enough and that is with having a recent ankle injury. After some wait, we then caught the bus at Tamarama back, but had to transfer to get back to our original spot.

Love this walk so much to look at and see. You can run or walk this one. Nice views and people watching. I used to run it everyweekend. It's about a 14km walk / run from Coogee to the north end of bondi. If you run in the peak period you better get ready to dodge people because that's all you will be doing. Get up early for a nice run without having to get around all the people walking.

Love this walk!!. On a warm, sunny day this is the best walk in Sydney, give yourself a couple of hours and take a drink. If you begin at Bondi its great to look back occasionally and see everything from a different angle. There are some lovely sandy bays on the way if you fancy a sit down or have a packed lunch, there are also places where you can buy food at Coogee. Very enjoyable!

loved it. I only spent about a week in Sydney - and I ended up doing this walk three times. It takes you to some of the best known and most beautiful beaches in Sydney and between them along some spectacular cliffs. It can be walked in a few hours or you can easily turn it into a leisurely day/afternoon at the seaside. Don't miss out! Can be extended in both directions if you want to see more of the scenic coastline.

Mad Busy. It was so busy you could hardly walk, got bitten loads!! The sculptures by the sea were on when we went but I would say the best part was the Coogee beach and the fish and chips onthe front.

Pleasant. We walked here on a day that was exceptionally windy, but that didn't ruin things. The crashing waves and sound of the wind just made the whole experience feel even more, for lack of a better word, epic. Granted, there are a tad too many residential developments around now, but the walk is still pleasant and relaxing nonetheless. The sun, sea and surf that Australia is famous for are presented perfectly here.

Nice walk spoilt.. Why are planners and developers allowed to build houses, some quite large and obtrusive, right up to the cliff line. The walk is worth the effort, but you will find it difficult to take a pic that isnt spoilt by a man made structure.

I WONT EVER GET TIRED. Its just perfect.... the ocean view you get its unbelievable, thats just it. The best way of exercising, if you want to, and enjoying sydney, Don't be afraid to get off the beaten path, i have a few amazing spots, where i can relax, and have a time for myself. It feels you with energy and happiness

Smell the ocean breezes on this walk.. This is an interesting walk at a pace you control. Most of the walk is high above the blue waters of the Pacific Ocean.You will walk along some of the finest beaches in the world....with rolling waves and golden sands.

A must do if you are in Sydney more than 3 days. Once you have done the opera house, harbour bridge, ferry to manly for a waffle cone, NSW Art Gallery, National Museum then head out to Bondi to do this fabulous locals walk. There are plenty of tourists around but the space is a real locals space. A really great walk, not too challenging with plenty of amazing views/beaches/cafes along the way. Plenty of celebrity spotting too, if you know your Australian sports people and tv faces.
relaxing walk. relaxing walk by the beach, some nice views, good cliffs and interesting scenery. nothing too crazy but worth seeing if you are in bondi

Beautiful Coast. A great walk between two magnificent beaches with fantastic views of the sea as you hug the coast. It was a nice day when I did the walk so it was delightful to be outside. We took a picnic and just sat at various spots to take in the nature and were also happy to hit the beach to cool down after our walk. The walk takes about 1.5hrs strolling the awesome rugged coastline.

Favorite part of Sydney!. Absolutely my favorite thing we did on our 4-day trip to Sydney! Breathtaking views! Pools along the way with beautiful beaches! Bondi has a lot of great restaurants to stop and eat at as well! Definitely a must see!

Great fun way to see the coastline & experience this vibrant city. From the city, get a bus (or taxi) to Bondi. Enjoy the sights and eats of the suburb. Then make your way to Iceberg's at the Southern end of the bay. The walk commences there and works its way around headlands, bays and suburbs. It takes about 60-90 minutes depending on your pace and is a great way to see and feel the coastline. The Sculptures by the Sea Exhibition is on in November too so beware of big crowds with that.Finish up at Coogee with a beer at one of the famous hotels (pubs) along the seafront or have a simple coffee and then head back to the city via one of the buses or another taxi.A great way to spend a morning walking and you'll really get a sense of attraction of seaside living in Sydney from the walk!

Fitness with a view!. This walk is great. You can push yourself, or take a stroll. The view is spectacular and all of the beaches you see along the way are wonderful. There are also great cafes along the way.
The ultimate in exercise!. The walk isn't hard but gives spectacular views. Coffee at Tamarama Beach is great and lunch at Clovelly is awesome.We were lucky enough to see whales. Wow!

Magnificent ocean views, beaches and cliffs. Around NOvember there is an outdoor art exhibition along the route with some amazing sculptures. Never far from a cafe, public toilet or water point. Dedicated path - some steps but OK for anyone of average fitness. You can pick up a public bus at either end (or at each beach along the way) to return to the city or Bondi Junction where there is good train service to the city and beyond. About 8km one way.

Nice coastal walk. You could start at Bronte Beach (catch a bus from the city or from Bondi Station) and end up at Bondi Beach. Once a year, there's the Sculptures by the Sea which is rather interesting. Grab a coffee or some hot chips from the shops nearby and enjoy the walk!

Iconic. I've been to many countries and several beaches, Bondi, while looking typical, is somehow very different to the others.It has a very unique culture attached to it, which can be seen in the vibe around the area, type of people that hangs around and the activities that people do when they come.If you want to surf, there's plenty of sunshine and waves, and if you don't like the water, the coastal walks are beautiful too. If you hate both, then go to the center of Bondi and enjoy good food and do some shopping.

Tips for a pleasant walk. We did the walk in reverse. Took a bus to Coogee beach, hung out at the beach for a bit and then started our walk.We realized that the reverse walk had more of walking down stairs than up - so if that's important to you, consider doing the reverse walk.Give yourself at least 60-90 minutes more than you'd estimate - you need the extra time to a) ooh and aah over some distinctive scenery b) stop very frequently for pictures c) linger at an unexpected spot.You will encounter lots of lovely beaches and rocky outcrops until you see the distinctive crescent of Bondi beach.Dress in layers - we did the walk in winter, but were soon stripping down layers as we walked.Carry water with you - some if the beaches have outdoor showers and water fountains, but there are stretches where having your drinking water source would be helpful.The path can get really crowded - if possible go early in the morning or later in the afternoon. Finally, don't forget sunglasses and sunscreen.

Bondi to Coogee. Lovely walk, beautiful views, lots of steps so you need a reasonable level of fitness. Used the bus to get to Bondi from CBD and to get back from Coogee, cheap and frequent, but tickets need to be bought from newsagents or other outlets.
This is Sydney!. Favourite walk: Just skip the crowds by going early or late during the week. In particular love the sections just south of Clovelly and Coogee.

Breathtaking coastal walk. I'm a local & I always love this walk, I particularly love showing it off to overseas friends & family who visit, which I did today with a friend from Germany. I particularly enjoyed our swim at Coogee to cool off afterwards. The walk took us just under two hours, we stopped lots too to take photos. I highly recommend it. Take the 333 bus from the city to Bondi & the 373 or the 372 back from Coogee to the city, you will need to buy a bus ticket beforehand. Enjoy!!

Best Scenic View towards a Beach. From any entrance that you start from, the view of the coast along with the sea and residences completes this picture perfect experience. Feel the wind in your hair and the smells of the sea and surrounds. Joggers are up at 530am doing their runs. You can't help but feel like exercising too as everyone on the trail is in good spirits and having a good workout. It takes about an hour to complete the walk to bondi beach. Best to go at sunrise as the views are AMAZING!

Great walk!. Took a UK visitor on this walk and she was so impressed. We took our time and stopped in Clovelly for a cuppa, the sun was shining, a light breeze ...how lucky were we? She had the added thrill of the Tamarama to Bondi Sculpture exhibition and her camera worked overtime. The walk took us 2 hours (we went Coogee to Bondi) and were lured on by the thought of a swim at the end. A dip at Bondi was the icing on the cake!

Don't miss this - it's beautiful. We walked from Coogee to Bondi.. We enjoyed bathing in the sea there, crowd was less so it was very nice. The walk is awesome don't miss it, you will not get this anywhere else.

Go to Bondi Beach. This is definitely a place to go to see how Australians enjoy the beach. On Sundays (when we went) the Coastal Walk is really a very scenic jogging trail used by tourists and natives. If you like beach scenery and walk even a little, you can have a great time.

Lovely urban/coastal hike. We started our walk at Coogee and ended with dinner in Bondi. This is an absolutely gorgeous walk. Fantastic views, lovely beaches, rocks, cliffs, wind and great looking waves. Seems Sculptures By the Sea is on end of October, early November and was great fun to walk through. I was here on a Tuesday and the walk wasn't too crowded but I hear can be quite hectic on the weekends. Bathrooms, bars and drinking fountains along the way. Wonderful way to spend the afternoon. Easy to catch a bus back, I think the cab back into Circuwas about $30.

Beautiful Walk, best early in the AM. Absolutely stunning views of the coast starting right at Bondi beach. You can walk as long as you want with many places to stop and enjoy the view. Each cove is unique, some tiny and others more developed. Trail is well maintained, but not Pram (stroller) accessible. Trail gets busy as day goes on, so for a less crowded experience go early. Great Lunch options when you get back to Bondi, including Icebergs right on the water
its a 2hours dream. great scenery with a surprise at every turn -it takes roughly two hours and it goes up and down -winding its course along the coast.

My Frontyard. I live on the Bronte to Tama section of this walk, and jog this path frequently. Even after many years of living here this coastline still strikes me with it's beauty. So close to the city, everything at your fingertips - cafes, good coffee, public transport, culture (Sculptures by the Sea), people watching..the lot - and yet so close to nature. It's not unusual to see pods of dolphins, manta rays, schools of various fish, crabs on the rocks at Bronte, bird life, and of course it's a brilliant spot for whale watching in season, especially from Bondi point. You cannot come to Sydney and not visit the Bondi to Coogee walk

gotta do it.... If you're up for an urban beach cliff hike, jump on the bus out to Bondi and do the walk. Need to be happy going up and down hundreds of stairs if you want to do the whole thing. Take your swimming gear and swim in one of the beautiful rock-enclosed swimming pools. But back to the city from Coogee.

Dispointing.... The walk from Bronte to Bondi used to be one of our favorites. Now Tamarama is no longer "Glamorama". Crowded, poorly maintained, cheesey art. Not nearly what it used to be. Every year it seems to get worse... Now that it has been discovered it needs something to keep it lovely...
Top 3 destination in Sydney. One of the best coastal scenary in sydney. It is so easy to access and you can relax on beach or have nice ice cream/ coffee after the walk. Very relaxing.

Amazingly beautiful walk. This is by far the best walk i have ever done in my life. Just the color pallets across the sky and the sea is amazing!! You would have never seen so many shades of blue as you would find here.The walk itself is not too easy, but its an amazing place to run of you're a runner.

A lovely walk. A really lovely walk that is about 7km long, so at a very leisurely pace, takes about an hour and a half. When we did it there was very interesting (!!!) art along the way which made it different!! Great views all along the way.

Great way to discover the sea side. We would recommend this walk to everyone that happens to be around in this area. We arrived by bus from the CBD and got off at Coogee. Walking the whole way at the coast gives you a great impression of every bay. Watch surfers, divers or the airplanes flying relatively low above you. Stop at one of the beaches and enjoy the sun or be impressed by the huge cemetery facing the ocean. If you take your time it will take you around 3h. Finish at Bondi Beach and have a fried Mars bar.
A Must-Do!. I made this walk the other way around, starting from Coogee. Also great! Very recreative, always new perspectives. Very safe and clean walk. Stunning!

Be prepared to stop often to take pictures.. What an amazing walk. Easy walk with amazing views, lookouts, and spots to just relax and take in the views. Beautiful views of the water, rock formations and homes. There were even bathroom stops. We ended our walk and relaxed on the beach while my kids took surfing lessons. Book before as they are small group or private lessons.

Impressive sights and beautiful beachfront houses. Bondi was a bit of a disappointment but the walk to Coogee made up for it! I began the walk at Bondi's Sculpture by the Sea and made my way through the cliffs to Bronte, Tamarama, Gordon's Bay and ended up in Coogee. Great experience! No need to take water or sunscreen as there are sunscreen stations and fountains along the way. I especially recommend the pools in Coogee, where you can spot whales from! End your walk treating yourself to a nice lunch in the Coogee beachfront...
Sculptures walk. Even though it was crowded, it was great - and the free shuttle back was an extra bonus.We wouldn't actually buy any of the sculptures, but they are interesting!
beautiful walk - very busy on the weekends. well worh the trip, lots of people, various recreational activities: nippers, surfing, touch football, runners, dog walkers - all along the walk.

A Must-Do. Living in the hunter valley I have never been a huge fan on Sydney. I recently did this walk with family for the Scultpure By The Sea event and it made me see the beauty behind the city. It was a generally easy walk, with a few stairs here and there. The views are spectacular, with rock cliffs and landings against the concrete path.The perfect place for the Scultpure exhibition.
lovely walk. this is a very scenic but easy walk . it can get busy especially on a weekend but is very worthwhile.

Great views!. I have walked this a number of times now and also like to jog along here at least once a week. It is a must when you visit the area and a must for when family comes to visit. Beautiful scenery and a fantastic walk. A must do when in Sydney!

Frequent Traveller to Sydney says You Must Do This. This is just one of the most spectacular short walks you will ever do. Please take the time to get a taxi from the Central Business District (about 15 minutes) and do this walk. The water is an incredible Caribbean colour with surf, and the walk is inspirational! I live in Melbourne but do this walk as often as possible when I go to Sydney on business. Finish the walk with a swim at Bondi if you have time! Early mornings are great but anytime is good.

Only Go To Bondi Just To Say You've Been There. Bondi....mythical Bondi.....rubbish, overpriced and commercialised. The beach is ok, the location is ok and the sea is ok and only spoiled by ponces who think they're cool because they can surf. The day of our visit had the art exhibition along the walk to Coogee. The artworks were great but the insufferable crowds of oafs and tourists that think taking a photo of a seagull is a worthy and artistic endeavour and not a complete was of memory card space. If you want to save yourself time and money watch 'Point Break' whilst frying chips and emptying all of your money out of the window.
A must-do in sydney. Views were really good and the sand at Bondi was just so fine. We were lucky that the sculpture by the beach was ongoing which made the whole walk much more interesting.

lovely. This was wonderful, Great fish and chip/ resturants around, loverly stuning views, and great atmosphere, beautiful photo opps and in the summer its just a great place to relax and spend a day with friends, partner, or dogs, also the coastal walk is great, perfect for outdoor workouts

A bus ride from Sydney. A trip to Sydney would not be complete without a trip to Bondi. From late October to early November there is also the bonus of the Bondi Sculptures - some of which are quite amazing. The coastal walk is very relaxing and well worth the visit.Tip - buy a Sydney Transport multi-trip ticket - don't use the expensive tourist open deck bus.
A great view. Well worth the effort as you us get great views. And you can stop for a swim or coffee along the way.

Absolutely brilliant!. The views were fantastic all the way down the coast. Easy enough to get a bus to Bondi Beach and from Coogee back into Sydney. Although the weather was cloudy (even with some spots of rain), it was perfect for walking and it didn't detract from the views. The walk itself was not arduous and should be possible for anyone with reasonable fitness.

The best running/walking track I've experienced!. During my time Living in Sydney, I walked this path many times. It is absolutely stunning! make sure you wear your swimming trunks to stop off for a dip at one (or all) of the amazing beaches you will pass. My favorite Tamarama also known as glamarama due to stars like Hugh Jackman owning a house here :)

Scenic. We ran this path from Bondi to Coogee return. It was very crowded but that meant we got to enjoy the scenery a bit more. I wouldn't have seen Coogee if not for this walk and in many ways I thought the bays around from Bondi were nicer than the famous beach itself.
Fantastic. Great walk with the best views! Stop at Bronte on way and have a coffee at one of the great little cafés.

Include This Coastal Walk on Your Itinerary. Amazingly beautiful walk along the wind-swept sandstone cliffs overlooking the gorgeous blue ocean. We were lucky enough to see whales cavorting in the surf! Many photo opportunities abound along the trail.

Dont miss it. This is a very beautiful walk. We didn't rush the walk from Bondi to Coogee, so it took a few hours - stopping and looking, watching the surf, the Sculptures by the Sea, lawn bowls at Clovelly Bowling Club etc. probably slowed us down. Clear pathway along the whole walk, all sealed. Just heaven.

Gorgeous!. One of the most beautiful walks I've ever taken in my life. We only went as far as Bronte which I think is 5km because we were running out of time but it was easy to do but fun with a few ups and downs and arounds and perfectly placed look out points along the way. It's not just the water that is sublime but the rocks and cliffs and everything is just a natural wonder. I'd highly recommend doing at least part of this walk.

Beautiful, easy walk. This was a gorgeous walk. I took the train to Bondi and then walked about 30 minutes to the beach walk. The walk is paved and there are plenty of bathroom breaks along the way. I wish I had worn my bathing suit. There were so many places to swim. I walked to Clovelly which had a small bay you could swim in that was like a natural swimming pool. There is a bus stop right at Clovelly so it was easy for me to get back to the Bondi train station.

Gorgeous. This is a stunningly beautiful walk along the cliffs - head right if you are facing Bondi beach (which is worth a walk on its own, so beautiful). The walk is easily done in an hour, and you will enjoy the crashing surf, cliff views, and brave surfers. Continue on to Coogee if you're not tired. It's not much further. Be prepared to catch two buses back to Circular Quay, something the bus kiosk clerk did not tell us. Only local buses service Bondi beach, so you'll go to Bondi station and then catch a bus to CQ.
Great coastal scenery. Completed the first part of the walk as far as Bronte while the sculptures were on display. Added an arty atmosphere to a great walk.

Beautiful scenic views and a bit of whale watching. So glad my partner convinced me to do this. Allow plenty of time to stop and stare, take photos etc. We did this on a warm 26 degree day and it was just beautiful walking next to the coast. We loved the scenic views but the highlight was definitely the whales we spotted maybe 500m out playing and splashing for a good 10-15min - it was spectacular! Keep your eyes open if you're there in the season.

We were there for the Sculpture By The Sea. We didn't do the whole walk; from Tamarama instead. The sculptures were a great way to keep walking along the coast and admire it without tiring - an easy walk though anyway!Be aware that Friday traffic is horrendous and the bus back, if you're not walking back, from Bondi to city took almost twice as long as normal!

Beautiful walk!. We did this walk whilst an art exhibition was on (which made it twice as fun), but even without these displays it's a relaxing scenic walk. Recommended to fill in an afternoon on a day with nice weather!

lovely coastal walk. We were lucky enough to be in Sydney during the sculpture trail week, and if you are around then, this walk becomes a must see. The works are on the walk from Bondi Beach towards Coogee, original, clever and sometimes witty.This walk is easy to follow, but has some steep sections, and also some stairs. There are stunning coastal views to be had, but try and avoid windy days as it is very exposed. There are plenty of places to swim, from the icepool in Bondi, to the pool at the side of Byron, as we'll as the beaches themselves. Our favourite was Byron. There are also cafes on the way.

Amazing at sunset, great hike while not too strenuous.. Great hike for all ages. Beautiful views while getting in a light jog or evening walk. Sculptures By the Sea is fantastic. Cliff at the point impressive and provided quite the adrenaline rush for one of our friends as he sat out over the water on one of the ledges.Wish we could have gone back for sunrise too. Recommended to all!

Best coastal walk ever! Tips for you :). Best coastal walk ever. Period! Tips: 1. Carry a light jacket in your rucksack as it does get windy in some parts and towards the end of your walk, around dusk it gets chilly here specially during this time of year :) 2. Carry your own water bottle. There are filtered water refill pts at every beach/along the way 3. Carry your own food as you can then walk at your own pace (& not hurry to the next beach for food) & there are some gorgeous private spots you can find :) 4. Keep aside 4.5 hours for the walk alone. 5. Easy to walk but those with knee problems may want to wear knee pads as going downhill will pose a prob during the end of your walk 5. Take some time out at Coogee if that's your final destination. We chose to sit by the sloping hill on the grass overlooking the beach below :) 6. There are couple of free pools along the way so if you want, you could carry your swimwear though we just stuck to the walk. 7. Needless to say, carry your camera. I clicked most shots from my iPhone 5S and they came out great so if you don't want to carry your heavy SLR, you can do with a good camera ph Over all one of the best experiences you'll have in Sydney. And it's a rarity to find something that's FREE here :P so enjoy every minute of this walk.

Early morning Glory!. Doing this walk every second day is therapy in itself. Being so wonderfully close to the ocean and feeling the waves splashing below is addictive. You can go at a slow pace and enjoy the scenery all around you or a jog to keep you fit...stop and just enjoy the awesome views.
Fantastic. I was also fortunate to experience the Sculpture by the Sea Exhibition. Bondi Beach is set in a breath taking setting. The sculpture only added to the drama of crashing waves.
At must for sculpture by the sea.. A very pleasant walk even without the sculptures, they just make it.Go early and walk to Bondi for breakfast, and see what you missed on the way there.

Windy, Windy Windy. The beaches amazing. The views amazing. The picture opportunities are amazing. But the wind is insane. I felt like I have been sandblasted on my face after finishing half the walk. We could not finish the second half because of the wind.

Beautiful beaches - wear comfy shoes!. Loved this walk so much, I just wish I had taken a better bag to carry not just my normal bulky handbag with my beach stuff in, the walk includes lots of steps but the views are wonderful and we spotted some dolphins too!The only issues we had were getting to and from Bondi - we had to que for a long time to get a bus from the tube station, and then when we left Bondi at 5pm (along with what felt like the whole of Bondi) it was jammed packed, there were nowhere near enoguh buses to take people back to the tube and we were waiting for over an hour to be crammed in - we could have just got a taxi, but they get expensive!Thoroughly recommend the walk, take a book, towel and your swim stuff and just enjoy the sun, sea and sand !

Beautiful views. From Bondi beach you walk to straight onto this walk way, it is very well maintained and has various beautiful look out points. Have a walk and enjoy, we turned around after a while as we did not take the time to walk all the way to Coogee (wanted to sit on the beach also..). It is easy to get a bus from downtown Sydney to Bondi, takes approx 30 minutes.

Fantastic views, one of the most strikingly beautiful urban walks I've taken.. Amazing views of the cliffs. Be warned, there are quite a lot of stairs. We took a 2 year old in a stoller and had to do quite a bit of lifting, but it was definitely worth the effort. A must on a visit to Sydney.

You don't have to do the whole walk to experience one of the best walks in Australia. Indeed, you don't have to do the full Bondi to Coogee Beech walk to experience one of the best walks in Australia. For example, Bondi to Bronte can be done at a leisurely stroll in two hours. You'll experience coastal cliffs, views of famous Sydney beaches, historic beach baths, and trendy cafes. If you are fortunate to be in Sydney during the sculptures by the sea, then this is an added bonus.  The Bondi to Coogee beach is the most famous, most walked track in Sydney for good reason. It’s easy to get to and there are many vantage points to take photos along the way. It's an easy walk but do but be aware that there are some rocky patches and some steep sets of stairs.

coastal walk no matter which way is great!. we did it reverse from Coogee to Bondi, but it is spectacular either way. the path is very easy to follow. there are beaches, a few restaurants and clubs to stop at along the way.If u don't live ther, you can be an honory member for a day and avoid the membership fees. If it is too much walking, you can always just hop a bus back to Sydney. It feels far from it all but it is just a half hour from sydney.

Wonderful walk and sculpture too!. This is such a beautiful walk and the perfect way to see the rock formations and beaches along this stunning stretch of Sydney coastline. At the end of October and early November the Sculpture by the Sea Exhibition is on which makes the walk an even more exciting experience. If you can go during the week instead of the weekend it is a good idea as it gets more crowded on the weekends. But anytime of the year this is a wonderful place to visit and it is all free!

Wonderful walk. This walk was a wonderful surprise. Lovely beach after beach with beautiful rock formations. Swimming pools build into coast line make swimming less risky. Easy walk and was especially great with the sculptures by the sea. Little coffee shops abound. Not much shade though so wear hats with lots of suntan lotion!

A wonderful way to enjoy the Sydney coast. This is a great walk, easy, plenty of places to stop and enjoy the view. Try to do the walk when the "sculptures by the sea" are on display. It is an unforgettable walk the whole family can enjoy.

Favourite Coastal Walk. This is an easy walk to do (it says hiking-trail but you can do it in normal shoes).It can get busy but the views are so beautiful, you walk along the edge of the coastline and you get to see the beaches in between. You can stop at one of the coffee shops afterwards!If I lived near Bondi I would do this walk every week.

The Sculptures are here!. Perfect time to visit Sydney. I was here for the weekend and caught the beginning of the 'Sculpture by the Sea' Exhibition.Amazing pieces of art, set against an amazing coastline.Well worth the visit :)

Simply stunnning. Took a bus to Coogee, walked to Bondi and took the express bus back. What an amazing walk. Beautiful views, lots of people enjoying life. It's well marked and there are water refill points along the path.

Must Do!. This is a must du in Sydney. It's a wunderful walk along the beaches of Sydney with many spectacular views. Along the beaches nice bars and coffe-shops are waiting to sit down and enjoy the life around the beaches. I Just loved it!

My second favorite thing to do for free in Sydney!. Just an amazing walk of the eastern suburb beaches and a glimpse into the locals lives especially on a sunny weekend day. Australian's love the sun and the beach and are out and about walking and having breakfast and lunch at cafes. If you are fit you can do this in an hour and about 20 minutes, only stopping briefly. If you stop more often and linger allow for two hours. If you go all the way have lunch at Coogee hotel outside on the patio, great vibe. Also the cafe at Clovelly is lovely and has amazing views.

What a great walk!. Give yourself a few hours to complete this walk (both ways). Alternatively you can take a bus to the starting point and return to your hotel from Bondi... but do it both ways. Stop for an ice-cream or a beer along the way, and enjoy the stunning bodies tanning on the various beaches along the way.

Amazing views. This is quite a walk but well worth the time. The route is clearly signposted and there are many stops along the way. There are different types of beaches to chill out on and also Waverley Cemetery on a hill looking out to sea. If you're legs do get tired or the heat too much hop on a bus back to Sydney.

stunning coastal views. A fabulous way to spend a Saturday. The walk is an easy walk with the odd steps and inclines, wear walking shoes/trainers and you'll be fine. There are plenty of places to stop on route whether to take in the scenery or to enjoy the beaches that are dotted along the path and there are numerous filtered water stands to fill up your bottles along the way.

Great scenic walk. Great hour and a half walk. We were able to enjoy the lovely weather and check on the beach scene at many of the major beaches in Sydney. We ended the walk with having lunch with friends at Ceviche in Coogee.

grt. do it - if you are pale & pasty or think Morrissey ( recent release - now at Berkelouws 9360 3200) sunscreen, shade - be aware of crowds - love it , if you are a visitor, chances are you daily life is not like this. Luckily mine is!! Visit Sculptures by the Sea, then Berkelouws Paddington for dinner, wine or coffee. KB

Great walk. This is a great way to spend an easy afternoon. Great views ! there are a few beaches you can stop at along the way and have a quick dip so dont forget your bathers. Walking shoes are a must.
Great walk. We walked from Coogee to Bondi, it took us about 1hr 30min but we stopped to enjoy the view and take some photos along the way. The views are amazing

Amazing views. We took this walk on a very hot day and were grateful for the breeze. The cliff side views are lovely, and the sculpture by the sea exhibit was interesting. Met some friendly folks on the walk. Take a dip in one of the many ocean pools to cool off.
Really good.. Walk is well worth it. Some great spots for a swim. Try the natural sea baths and pools to the left of Coogee Beach.

Great way to spend late afternoon/evening. My daughter (10 years old) and I did this walk as the sunset and it was so peaceful and relaxing. Just make sure you plan on how to get home afterwards! We asked a local shop for the number to a taxi service. Had we arrived any later, the shop would have been closed and we would have been stranded!

Great Coastal Walk. Very doable walk, my husband's mum walked with us and she is over 80, after one hip replacement. But there are some steps. The shapes and colours of the rocks shaped by natural elements are amazing, we've got some wonderful photos. And the views to the ocean - breathtaking. We did it on a beautiful, sunny day, and it was great.

Sculptures by the Sea. Now would be a perfect time to get outdoors and walk along the coast with some amazing sculptures on display.The display will on from 24 October - 10 November 2013. Would be a great day out for the family to enjoy the sun, fresh air and scenery. I did the event last year and there were a lot of people about, best time to go would be late afternoon. I prefer starting from Coogee and ending up in Bondi for dinner as there are better food options. To name a few, places like Icebergs, Pompei's, Envii, Messina, Ravesi's and Fishmongers.
Gorgeous walk. an easy walk for most fitness levels with STUNNING views along the coast. Perfect way to spend a morning!

Great way to spend an afternoon. This is an excellent walk that is suitable for most people.We had lunch at Ice Breakers at Bondi which I can highly recommend before we started. There was no issues with crowds or joggers for us and we captured some great photos on our way around

Enjoyable Walk. A short, pretty easy walk. 6 KM or 3.6 miles. Some ups and downs, but the walkway is sturdy and well designed. Very picturesque with the cliffs and breaking waves. A fair amount of folks doing their exercise, walking or jogging.

Geocaching at Bondi along the coastal walk. What a wonderful walking trail for all abilities. We started at Bondi and cruised along. there were a few points of steepness but overall very doable. We even grabbed a few geocaches along the way. loved it.
Must do in Sydney. Fantastic walk. Great cafe just over halfway at Clovelly. Take snorkelling gear as there are some great spots to get in the water.

Amazing views on this bustling walkway. Walking on this well kept path from beach to beach is quite obviously the thing for both locals and tourists! Joggers jostle with people with dogs and sightseers for superb views. At times there are a lot of steps so this would not be suitable for prams or wheelchairs. There were artists along the way trying to capture the colours of the sea on this amazing clear day. The only negative is that not all dog owners pick up their dog poo, making a mess of an otherwise perfect walk.

good walk. we caught the train and bus to bondi and enjoyed the walk and great views that were along the route it an easy enough route, saying hello to people coming the other way and the locals who run the walk it is well signposted so you cant get lost and plenty of places to sit and view and take in the scenery and once you get to coogee there are plenty of places to eat and to catch the bus back to town

Beautiful walk. We really enjoyed this walk. The views are spectacular. It's an easy walk although there are quite a few stairs. I only wish we had brought our snorkeling. Apparently Gordon's Bay has a snorkeling trail. Who knew? You can spend anywhere from a few hours to all day along this trail. There are lots of places to stop and explore or just sit and take in the scenery. Loved it!

beautiful walk!. I started from Sydney Harbour with a ferry and a bus to Bondi Beach. That was a nice trip to get there in the first place and better than just to take the bus! The Coastal walk was very beautiful and easy to walk. I did it on bare feet and enjoyed the stunning landscape and views over the ocean and coast! If you there, I warmly recommend this walk!

Visitors to Australia...go and see its cheap!. only thing I dislike is the weather for this wonderful sightseeing adventure...its the most gorgeous walk, people here in the eastern suburbs are extremely friendly, most of us have dogs, and yes say hello!

start at coogee. Make sure you start at coogee and end up at icebergs. Lovely walk. Winter or summer. Some steepish parts and there can be some arrogant joggers but dont let them put you off. You may even see a whale between may and oct.
Wonderful walk with great views. This coastal walk is great and the views of Bondi as you come around the headland are wonderful.its worth the effort !

Coogee to Bondi coastal walk. It was an amazing walk with stunning houses built into the amazing rocky cliffs - overlooking the incredible blue ocean. There were little bays of sandy beaches in between and also rock pools for swimming. I've travelled the world and haven't seen the wonders we have here in Australia. It was just fantastic!

Best run in world!. This must rate as one of the finest running/walking tracks in the world. With beautiful coastal views throughout and gong through lovely cloves and beaches. Running has never been tis much fun!

Any walk is a good walk but this is wonderful. Pick a sunny day and you won't be disappointed. Preferably a week day to avoid joggers who harrumph a lot if you impede their progress. Spectacular views, usually a cooling breeze and at the start or end somewhere to get a good coffee or food. Or take a picnic! If the surf is up there will be some good riders out having a ball. Not a difficult walk and plenty of places to sit and rest

Amazing scenery!. It something in a certain way similar to our "Cinque Terre" in Liguria (Italy). It's a beautiful walking along the coast with amazing views! It's worth trying to do it! It takes you half day (better to go there in the morning) and it's very nice to stop here and there looking around to appreciate the marvellous nature that sorround you.
Beautiful Walk. We walked part of the way - from Bondi to Bronte beach and it was a beautiful walk around the coast, gorgeous views and a comfortable walk.

Make sure there's plenty of space on your memory card!. Every beach you come across will be better than the last! You will be outnumbered by people in lycra (this is a nation that takes fitness very seriously!). Clean, deserted beaches and fantastic views.

Great thing to do. I live in Sydney and talk this walk many times. It is always an enjoyable way to spend an afternoon. Plenty of cafes and view stops on the way, Bondi Icebergs is at the beginning or end depending on where you start which is worthwwhile wtepping into for the view, snack or drink.

Must do. This a great walk. We planned to walk Coogee to Bondi and enjoyed it so much we also walked back as well. Great cafés in Bronte for lunch. Lots of places to stop and admire the views. Will do it again on our next visit to SYDNEY.

Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk. THe Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk is a great way to get some exercise whilst taking in the amazing scenery of the coastal cliffs of the Eastern Suburbs. The walk offers amazing views of the ocean, the sandstone cliffs, lighthouses, parklands, and is also fun for a bit of people watching.
Most enjoyable. A lovely thing to do on a lovely day. The only problem is parking and how do you get back to your car after you finish the walk?

Coastal Walk is Fun. Many overseas people love the coastal walk. It's a great way to see miles of unspoiled coastline.In October-November it has Sculpture by the Sea. You can easily Google that. It's busy but fun. And free!

Fantastic walk. A very easy walk with a few steep steps in the beginning (near Bondi). Fantastic views throughout the whole walk. There were lots of benches for you to take a rest and admire the sea view.I went for the walk in the evening. It was cooling as the shadow cast by the cliffs provided some shade. I would imagine a walk in the early morning to be magical with the sun rising from the eastern sea.

Fantastic Walk. Gives you a real sense of just how beautiful Sydney really is. Sea stretches as far as you can see with the occasional distant whale in the right season. An easy walk which you can pace as you wish. There are benches and a few steps along the way. Buses are easily available for those who tire although it really is worth trying to walk the distance.
Get out for a walk. Great walk on a spring day, fabulous views good company on the walk. Good cafés in Bondi and other bays on the way

Must Do. You can vary the walk around the coast to how far you want yo go.We arrived Sydney day before daughter took us on the walk to show us the scenery and nearly killed us doing the longer walk suffering from Jet lag and soaring heat. The walkways are excellent and safe with awesome views.A must if you are in the area finishing of at Bondi Beach with coffee and cake.

Great walk, great scenery. Excellent way to spend a couple of hours in the sunshine. The walk is well maintained with board walks along most of the way and the views are fantastic. Mostly level but there are some lengthy steps along the way.

An excellent and exhilarating day out. Walk it north to south (Bondi to Coogee) or the other way (my preference) either way this is a superb cliff walk. It has everything, the bays of Coogee, Clovelly, Bronte, Tamarama and Bondi. The cliff spurs separating them and the amazing cliff boardwalk by Waverley cemetery. It has a very varied flora and fauna and look out for the pretty fairy wren, a flash of blue and the gulls soaring on the updraughts from the ocean. Each bay has its own beach, surf live saving station and cafe, many of them providing excellent snacks. Walk north to Bondi for lunch ( so many choices it will be difficult to choose) and either stroll back afterwards or take the coastal bus. An excellent and exhilarating day out.
Visit to Sydney. Fantastic view out to sea, we even saw whales in the distance. Amazing to see a large cemetery at the end of the walk.

Must do. This is a fantastic coastal walk any time of year. Wonderful views all the way. To take this experience up a notch, do it whilst Sculptures by the Sea is on, truly spectacular but do it early as the crowds are enormous.
lovely views. the walk was so breathe taking such a pretty walk and so clean take water with you and you can go for miles around the coast
Best beach. I've always heard of Bondi beach, but you have to actually see it to appreciate it! A must see, easy to get to, clean blue waters.

Perfect walk on a lazy afternoon. If you have time to spare, and finding relaxation, this walk is for you. The views and vibe of the ocean is simply amazing. The walk is best enjoyed on a natural pace, stopping on lookouts and cliffs to take in the view of the water.
So beautiful. We did a lttle bit of this walk from the Swimming Club to a very cute beach called Tamaramma and it was spectacular. Highly recommend trying it out.
Fabulous walk along cliffs looking out to sea. Used to live in Bondi and always go back to do this walk when in Sydney. Stunning views out over the ocean and good to watch the surfers

Glorious views... more than just exercise. This is not a difficult walk and offers spectacular views of the coast. You could use it as part of an exercise regime by running it but then you might miss the delights offered by the natural landscape. Take a stroll and soak up the environment. It is well worth the effort.
nice. took us two hrs -- strolling. was windy so maybe cover yourself well, water taps on the way, beaches so maybe take a dip in between.. make a day out of it
Nice walks with nice views. It is really a nice walk with a lot of nice views. Would really recommend it! I think it took us about 2h to walk.
WOW, I loved it!. We had a great lunch there. Walked on the beach. Met and talked with some of the Lifeguards and had a wonderful time!

Perfect walk. We made the walk from Cogee to Bondi last week of September. Weather was perfect, sun and blue sky. Everything has been made refurbished in order you can walk along the beach and discover beautiful landscape. You can take a lot of great photo. Don't hesitate to go one half day if you are in Sydney and enjoy it.

Just spectacular. This is a must do in Sydney. Stunning walk, from start to finish (whichever direction you go) and excellent for walking off a big meal (or for tiring the kids out). Can be a little busy at times, but this is a minor gripe. And it's free!

Best experience you'll have in Sydney. I've done the opposite, strating in Coogee, what I think was better. I have to say one thing about that walk: FANTASTIC!!! Many breathtaking views of the New South Wales coast!! Not only beautiful but also a very relaxing thing to do. Most of people do in more or less than an hour but I took more than 3 as it was such a nice experience.

Fun, exercise, and great views. I only did part of the walk from Bronte beach to Bondi beach but it was plenty to see the magnificent coast line and the cute little beach communities. If the weather is nice, take some time to walk at least part. It is well worth the time spent.

Withouth a doubt the highlight of sydney. We stayed in australia for 2 months, this was one of the absolute highlights, if the weather is good. Remember to bring your swimwear, as youll want to take a dip in the many small beaches you pass on a warm day, and take with you some water. i would recomend setting aside most of your day for this if you have the time, but you can walk it in a few hours, but where is the fun in not stopping in the different places along the route.

Refreshing and healthy!. Loved every bit of the coastal walk. I went during end July and the weather was perfect. The view is great and getting there is really easy with the buses from the city. The walk is easy and suitable for all ages! Would definitely do this again when i go back to Sydney.

Breathtaking!. What an incredible walk! My wife and I decided to do the walk as we were recommended to do so by friends. They were right! The views around the cliffs and wandering through quality beaches was fantastic. Highly recommended!

Most amazing part of my trip~!. This was so awesome! we walked from Coogee to Bondi- too the bus and then started the walk. We wanted to have relax time in Bondi. It was a log walk and we were a little tired because it was the last day of our trip but it was so worth it!
Nice walking track.. Wanted some extra walks so got the bondi bus from the city. Lovely cliff top walk in the fresh sea air. Then at Coogee got the bus baby to town. Nice way to spend a morning.

Sunshine and sea breezes. Exercising is so much nicer with a view and a cold drink at the end on Bondi Beach. Especially great during the Sculptures by the Sea exhibition, although it gets busy on the weekend.

This is a great walk, and not just for tourists!. A relatively short walk, it covers beautiful sandy beaches, high rocky headlands, some small grassed parks and lots of people - particularly on a good day. Doesn't require much fitness and well worth the effort for the views alone!
world class beach within reach. i must say, if you want clean beach go to bondi. good food, accessibilty to public transport, great shopping and cool people

Beautiful!!!. There are quite afew little smaller beaches besides Bondi and Coogee, that are much prettier!You most certainly wouldnt ever get bored of this coast line. The walk is a betetr one to do in better weather.l Loved the beach with the boats in it - so pretty.Must do!!
Great way to work up an appetite. Terrific way to see these beaches. Allow good 1.5 to 2 hours. Lots of steps but plenty of room for people going in each direction.

Great scenic walk. Have experienced this walk (and run!) on several occasions and have never been disappointed with the experience. Fabulous views of coastal Sydney, with several bays for a cafe stop along the way. Can get very busy at diferent times of the year, but still a great way to spend a few hours.

Very good but be prepared to walk !. It took us like 3 hours to do it and i didnt pack anything to eat along the way which was a big mistake !! The walk is quite easy! Just bring some snacks if you need to and definetly water if its sunny !!!!

Coastal highway between Bondi to Coogee. Awesome walk but if you can try to avoid bussy times of the day as there are plenty or walkers and joggers which makes this a very bussy coastal walk. Take the time and enjoy the views, you make it to Coogee stop for a swim or a bite to eat.

Beautiful scenery. This s a brilliant walk! It's not difficult, although there are some stairs. You can move along at a leisurely pace and stop at many different locations, or you can power through at a fast ave or even run it if you wish. There are any diverse beaches and coves along the way and when the tide is low there are places to go out on the cliffs and enjoy some solitude. Worth the time to do this.
Awesome walk.. I took a mate from NZ walking but we started in Coogee instead.This is a great walk for any visitor and local alike. Great views all around

Backpackers dream ...but not mine!. Very nice beach with metred parking. Lots of restaurants and shops nearby. There is a bakery with baked goods displayed in the front window on the street front across from the beach. Do not miss buying some of there pastry!!!!! Absolutely amazing. The girls said it was Hungarian ...whatever it was it was the best I had in Sydney and there are bakeries on every corner there. also a great little Italian sandwich place on the first street corner behind MacDonalds. Highly recommend as they cure all their own meats.
Beautiful. Quite a tiring walk but it is beautiful. I look so many fantastic photos and really enjoyed this beautiful walk.
Bondi. We loved the beach and access to local eateries. The beach was almost empty and gave us ample room to have a relaxing time.

Great Australian Walk. One of my favourite walks, my husband and I have done this walk twice. The views and scenery are amazing. We caught the bus from the city to Coogee, had a light lunch and then headed off. We took our time, enjoyed all the beautiful views and explored the Waverley cemetery. Wear a hat, comfortable walking shoes, take some water and enjoy!!!
Another Great Walk. This is a very nice walk from Bondi Beach to Coogee. Stunning ocean Views. I do Recommend go early because it can get crowded during others times.
A must. Amazing walk that is a must while visiting Sydney. Nice spot to run uphill as well. You'll understand why it is such a popular walk.

The second free must-do after seeing Sydney Harbour/Circular Quay/Botanic Gardens. Wonderful walk in late autumn/early winter, started at Bondi, ending at Bronte. If you want to see Coogee, I recommend walking down from the children's hospital instead. Sun wasn't a bother at the time of the year. It's memorable for the views and the feel even a year later. Lovely views of ocean, cliffs, rock, sails, and houses that make you wonder. Easy paved path. A great way to see the locals frolic in their own backyard especially on the weekend and make you wish you lived in Sydney too. Bring your camera, pack a picnic. Great walk for family, couples, solo.

One of my favorite things to do in Sydney. Whenever we have tourists in Sydney - we strongly recommend this walk to them. Start at Bondi beach, and head to the right hand side (near the swimming pool) - and keep walking. The views are spectacular, and you get to see a lot of people out doing exercise etc... We often finish at Bronte where the cafes are fantastic. Plenty of BBQs and places for a picnic too. There are also plenty of options at Coogee, but we always found this less appealing. There are buses which go from Coogee back to the city via Randwick or you can go quicker by getting off @ Bondi Junction and taking the train.

Great Views and Walk. nicely maintained walking path, amazing views of the beach and cliffs. Plan for several hours to walk one way. We took a bus from CBD to Bondi (#380) and then another bus (#377) from Coogee to CBD. Once you get to Coogee go get a chicken sandwich. Cross over at the main street and it was a few doors down--can't remember the name but look for people eating them out of the wrapper at the beach.

Beautiful views. We caught the 380 bus from Central Quay, stand E. We bought the tickets from a newsagents in advance and I believe they cost $ 3.60 . As soon as we saw the beach we left the bus and had a wander along the beach before setting off on the walk. It was easy enough to find and we followed the coastline with the sea on our left. It was a lovely walk with beautiful bays where we stopped for a quick swi m occasionally, or just a rest. There were sea-water swimming pools too in a couple of bays. The views were stunning and there were many opportunities to sit and admire them. Most of the route was reasonably easy, but there were some fairly steep steps at one point. There were few opportunities to buy refreshments en-route, but once in Coogee there were numerous chafes and bars. It is possible to continue the walk to Maloubra but we chose not to, as we had chosen a very hot day and were tiring!

Stunning. We caught the bus from Circular Quay to Bondi Beach which took 30 mins. We had a leisurely walk from Bondi to Coogee Beach stopping many times to watch the surfers. The waves were high and the sun was shining - spectacular views all the way. Caught the bus at Coogee back to Circular Quay. Buses are frequent, reasonably priced (4.20$ each way) and comfortable with air conditioning. If you have the time then you should do this whilst in Sydney.

Don't just surf in Bondi!. The Coastal Walk from Bondi was one of our favourite experiences outside of the city of Sydney. Traveling with our 7 year old son my husband and I first went to lunch at Icebergs which was enjoyed with a terrific view of the training pool, ocean, surfers and beach. After a walk along shore, a quick swim in the still slightly cool surf, and a little lie on the sand we started out on the coastal walk. It was spectacular. The landscape, the picturesque views, the different terrains, the many surfers and boogie boarders were all wonderful to enjoy. We hopped on a local bus at the end of the walk which took us to Bondi Junction and we caught the train back to the city. A perfect day.

Great walk to do!. Terrific views out over the ocea; good path-ways and people out in the fresh air running, walking, playing on the beach and enjoying themselves. If you like to walk, definitely put this one on your things to do and stop along the way for breakfast, coffee or lunch at one of the restaurants.
Australian Walks. A good days walk around the headland with stunning scenery.. Make sure you don't forget the camera.. Views are amazing..

Great Walk!. We took the train from Central Station to Bondi Junction and then the bus out to Bondi beach. From there, we did the cliff walk from Bondi to Coogee. The walk itself is about 4 miles along a paved/planked path. While it is not difficult, there are a lot of stairs and hills which might be difficult for some. Accordingly, I would recommend wearing sneakers and appropriate clothes. If you feel like 4 miles is too far, you can always stop in Bronte and enjoy lunch by the beach. The view along the walk is amazing and seeing the different beaches along the coast was really neat. Next time we will bring out bathing suits and enjoy some of them. Once we arrived in Coogee, we had lunch and a drink at one of the beach cafes. All in all, a nice afternoon out and about!

Beautiful coastline. We started at Bronte at the Waverly Cemetery - it was beautiful. We then meandered along to Bondi. The coastline is beautiful and it's a nice way to see it. There are stairs and hills so a little fitness is needed, though if I managed most could. Although there aren't many places to stop for refreshments along the way (probably different in summer) you can take the walk at your own pace and there are plenty of stunning views to be soaked up.

Loved this walk - a must. This walk was wonderful and I would do it many times over. During my two week stay in sydney I walked this twice, both in sun and over cast! Did get burnt feet so beware if doing this in the sun and in flip flops!! Take a camera and enjoy the views!

Best free attraction in Sydney. We took the bus to Cogee beach instead of Bondi to start the walk. From Museum stn it was a 15 min bus ride only. Once we got there, I felt an immediate change of scenery and this place was just very chill. The path was easy to follow. There were 5 beaches we visited. We took our time to take some pictures. It's such a scenic walk of the Sydney coast and it was breathtaking. Then we treated ourselves to lunch once we reached to Bondi beach and watches some surfers riding the waves. Next time we do this, we'll probably bring a beach towel and a picnic bag. It's a great place to spend the whole day by the coast. P.S.Make sure you wear comfy shoes and bring bottle of water as well. Oh and there are toilets between the walk paths so not to worry.
This is too truly awesome. Fantastic views along the coastline this is definitely something worth doing if you visit this part of the world

Gorgeous!. Spent the day walking around Bondi and the local cliff walks. It was "winter" there but it was a crystal clear day and warm enough to not need a coat. Highly recommended for a relaxing day seeing some beautiful sights and not spending a lot of money!

Picturesque!. Amazing views throughout the whole walk. Not very stressful, but a must see! Stopped throughout to take in the views and snapped some photos. Definitely suggest going on a weekday. We took the Bondi Explorer double decker bus to Bondi beach then walked to Bronte. Swam in the Bronte bath which was cold but refreshing after the walk! Then we ate at a fantastic cafe for lunch.

JUST DO IT. If your from overseas out of town or a local this is one of the most amazing coastal walks you can do. stop have a swim, coffee or breakfast all these options are available. The scenery is astonishing.If you love beautiful coastal views this is a must.Words cannot describe.

Must-do in Sydney!. Don't leave Sydney without taking this walk if you love the outdoors and beautiful scenery! You'll have amazing coastal views the entire way and there are plenty of beaches to stop for a swim if you want. I went slow to soak it in and take lots of pictures and it took about 2.5 hours.
Awesome non-demanding walk. A fantastic walk from Bondi to Coogee and if you're up for it, all the way to Maroubra beach.Start at Maroubra, walk to Bondi and have lunch at Icebergs... superb.

Heavenly Walk. We started at Bondi Beach, a beach that has an old-style quality to it that is charming. We then took the walk to Coogee, and although we started in the warm sunshine, as we got deeper into the walk, we were confronted gale winds and darkening skies that hit the city by surprise (don't worry - this is not typical of this area; it just happened on our day). Despite the winds, our walk was heavenly. As you walk along the cliff, you see panoramic views of several small, lovely beaches. Truly, this was one of the highlights of our trip, even with the threatening skies. Anyone who loves beautiful beach views and enjoys walking (it is easy walking with just a few staircases) will love this walk. It took us around 2 1/2 hours, after which we caught a bus back to the Circular Quay in Sydney.

Essential experience. Hard to believe you're in Sydney as you meander along the rugged clifftops. Despite all the planning errors in Sydney over the years (tram, anyone?....high rise.,..anywhere....) these clifftop walks are still an unmissable Sydney treat.

Lovely walk in the sunshine. Plenty of places to stop for a drink - soak up the sun - or just stare off into the sunset!We started the walk mid-morning, and it took us about 4 hours, including a few stop offs to take in the beautiful scenery.

superb! must do.. I love love love it! Woke up at 5am so i could reach Bondi beach early and it was worth it. Lovely sunrise as the entire place was bathed in golden hue and the place was already bustling - locals walking their dogs, people exercisng, surfers. A lot to take in.There are also plenty of cafes around the corner (I went to cafe bondi at 97hall street and had the best pumpkin soup & pancakes) and started the walk right after breakfast. The walk itself was enjoyable. easy walk, breathtaking views. or perhaps the walk was easy because i kept stopping for a photo. As the saying goes, the best things in life are free
Fab views. A must do for someone who appreciates scenery....Disliked all the steps in one area but the rest of the walk was gorgeous..
Amazing views!!. Bronte beach stop off for a bite to eat is a must, definitely wear comfy shoes and preferably exercise clothing you will work up a sweat!
must see!. Just awesome! close to bondi junktion. stunning views alot of beatyfull view points. almost all sydney beaches in one walkin distanse.best rime to walking- early morning. ty Sydney for it!

One of the great walks of Australia. This is ICONIC. Stunning , fascinating, relatively easy and punctuated by cafes and beaches. Most people only do the bondi to bronte strip. But go for it and stretch yourself to coogee. You won't be disappointed.

Beautiful coastal stroll. Loved it! Lots of small picturesque bays along the route plus several dolphin sightings close to the shore. for a halfway treat try a beer and a game of bowls at the bowling club along the way.

A must do !!. What a fabulous way to see the coast we have done this walk 3 times and it is just amazing! A must do in Sydney we went Coogee to Bondi but either way is great. Amazing views and ok for all ages.Just do it !
A great, easy walk.. It is an exhilarating and easy walk around the coast. The ocean breeze is gorgeous and the sea-baths are reminiscent of the deco age.Don't miss this walk.

Spectacular coastal scenery. If you love the ocean and scenic cliffs then this is the walk for you. I explored all the side paths too. Loads of people do this walk so it can get busy. The sandstone cliffs carved by wind, rain and ocean are always intriguing. Each beach you'll pass is a bit different. Some are large, some tiny, some very deep, some even no sand - just inlets. All have beautiful clear water and by the signage, support some amazing sea life. There is even a dive/snorkel "path" at Clovelly. Surf was picking up by the time I reached Tamarama. Her I was able to purchase a bottle of water from the kiosk. There are lots of benches along the way from which to admire the scenery. I even passed a plastic bag dispenser for dog owners to access for cleaning up after their pooches. I was impressed with the whole walk's cleanliness - no litter or graffiti - certainly well maintained with pride.
LOVELYYYYYYYYYYYYYY. What a sunny, lovely, lively, energetic, vibrant place. Food, sand, music and fun on tap all day long.
Must do... Did the walk on a stunning Sydney day.....u feel like you're standing at the edge of the world, great exercise in stunning surroundings

Great views on the ocean. I did it many times, very relaxing walk, fantastic view and romantic monumental cemetery righ on the sea. Great landscape ...you can see the city from the ocean pacific point of view...
Perfect!!!. You might want to do this at sunset. Beautiful!! Take comfortable shoes and wear sunscreen. Take lots of photos and watch carefully, you may find a water dragon! :)

Very pleasant and stunning views.. My wife and I were saying very close to the walk in Bondi with our 6 month old baby. We took several walks between Bondi and Tamarama, which was only about an hour at a very slow pace. We used a carrier, as a pram would have had to have been lifted over a few steps, but we saw a few other people using prams. The views were amazing! It was a bit crowded in some places on the weekend, as well as during popular jogging times.

Beautiful views and beaches to stop at along the way. The path has been improved since I last did this walk over 10 years go. The walk is a great way to see one lovely beaches and stop at some along the way. The views are lovely. It does get a little busy and people running past exercising can get a little annoying.

Walk with a View. Nice walk along this coastal while enjoying the beautiful views and the ocean breeze. Start your walk early morning as its less crowded and its not too hot. Easy walk with a little uphill and downhill and finished up with a nice brekkie on the other end. I wish I could do this everyday.

beautiful views!. a long walk, wear comfy shoes, take a camera. Its magnificent, there are many different beach and coves to go through. The rock formations are a wonder. Makes you fall in love with Sydney.
Beautiful beach in Sydney. Nice place to visit and explore with several options for food.Free wifi in the whole beach.Many restaurants and stores,easy access from city.

A nice morning walk. I usually do this coastal walk and have a spot of brunch at Bronte. It is lovely in the morning when there are not a lot of crowds and the weather isn't too hot. One can occasionally see dolphins as well.

29 August, 9 am, 29 degrees C. Is this really winter? Enjoying the Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk. Sydney is a very young city compared to those in Europe, so I think it is always better to explore the natural wonders of such a city. We spent a few hours on the Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk. We commenced at the north end of Bondi Beach & walked along the beach to the first set of steps, near which is the Bondi Icebergs swimming pool where we also saw a Yoga class in session. We walked along the coast & stopped for morning coffee at Tamarama before heading off to Coogee.It was winter however Sydney is having an unusually warm winter & so it is best to wear layers & take water (although there are public filtered water stations along the walk). The walk has sections with many steps & steep inclines however there are seats placed along the way, & many flat sections.It was a great walk & we will definitely go back to do it again (we might start at the Coogee end next time).
A must do!!. We took the bus to Bondi beach.It took about 30 mins by bus from downtown area.The views are breathtaking.The walk itself is not that hard but there is a lot of climbing up and down.

Lovely pathway with great views. My wife and I did this walk a number of times during our time in Sydney and really enjoyed it. You can even carry on to Maroubra which we did on one occasion The views are phenomenal. Its also a great track to run on if you are energetic enough!

Gorgeous views, lovely walk. Really enjoyed this walk, we even saw dolphins on our way. Was lovely to take the time to walk along some of the coast, all was so clean as well. Jealous of the people who live so close to be able to do this on a regular basis!! x

Iconic Walk - just do it!. Advised that this should be on the list of things to do - good call! Took the train and bus to head out and back to central Sydney - no parking to manage or pay for. Sunny day helped, and lots of places to eat when we reached the Coogee end of the walk. Pretty good views.

Fantastic seaside walk with amazing coastal views.. This has to be one of the Eastern Suburbs gems with a meandering pathway and seats etc. Especially great when the art show is on!Coffee available at both ends!

worth travelling halfwy round the world. This is always so exhilarating and to think so many Sydney siders live near this walk. Fresh air, amazing scenery, a little bit of excercise and great coffees or gelatos at the end
scenic easy walk. lovely walk along the coast with spectacular views of Bondi and the rocks, good lookout points and benches to rest at. We were lucky to see a group of snorkellers down below us.

Stunning Atmosphere, Waters-edge and Cliff Views. Love coastal walks? Make time for this one. Especially on a sunny day. Although, I have to say, it is excellent in the wild wind too! Surf just keeps on rolling in. Have fun! Take a water bottle, sturdy footwear, plasters/bandaids and a warm sweater or on showery days, a waterproof jacket. It gets chilling cold at times.

try it...beautiful. not really a walker by any strech but this is well worth a go... just take your time have a stop along the way for a coffee break or two.. and take in the breathtaking views... fab

Stunning as always!. I've done this walk lots of times and it never disappoints! The walkway around the graveyard makes it much easier! We got the ferry to Watsons Bay and had lunch, then caught the bus to bondi bead to start the walk. And then caught the bus back from Coogee.This is one of the things you MUST do when in Sydney!
Stunning coastal walk. Brilliant walk with stunning views all the way, just watch out for the runners and joggers who seem to think they own the pathway.
Great walks. Beautiful costal cliffs, we stayed near the costal walk, and I found myself walking most mornings was very nice.

2 hrs stroll well worth it. Took a train to Coogee and then took the coastal walk, which was excellent with fantastic scenery. Bondi was small and good to walk around and worth the walk. Coastal walk very popular at the weekend (saw Man United training on the Beach which was an unexpected bonus. Also elderly swimmers competition which wasn't a bonus !).
Walk to relax. This Coastal Walk is the best I've ever seen. We can appreciate the view while we exercise! The beaches on the way are amazing! I really appreciated that!

Stunning walk. I walked from Bondi to Bronte today and loved it.It was a beautiful sunny day and the walk was a lovely way to see the sights, get some exercise and people watch.I got a bus from the city which was easy enough but was fairly slow.Perhaps the train would be a faster option?I was short of time so did not go onto Coogee.A lovely half day excursion if you are visiting Sydney.

Signified a part of sydney living. Love strolling along the water edge in bright winter day, it is getting a bit more popular these days so can be a bit too crowded. Avoid the crown is possible only in the later part of the day

Luft 3 Zagan geat escape. West Poland not far from the German border and you drive straight by this historic prisoner of war camp at Zagan. You can experience laying on a make shift trolley and pull yourself 30 meters along in a mock up of tunnel "Harry". The original prison site is still there with relics from the camp strewn about in the forest and foundations that are overgrown. A memorial grave stretches from the site of " Harry" right up to the edge of the forest where the prisoners escaped.The atmosphere is chilling as you stand in the still quiet knowing the outcome of the escape.The site is barely posted on the road side just keep an eye out for the fabulous sculpture in front of the non desript building that houses relics including the stove that covered the tunnel.A must visit if you are interested in visiting ww2 sites.
Amazing coastal walk experience (Must Do). Breathtaking views and scenic walk. 6 KM is covered in a whiff! A Must-Do activity for all. The best part is that it is Free and Ok to do at anytime.

For a great day out. Did the walk on one of those glorious winter sun-shine filled days. Had a wonderful day enjoying the views while walking, even saw a few whales off shore (the locals are lucky to have such a great walking track). Along the way are exercise points the kids had fun participating. After arriving in Bondi we ate lunch in the park before walking back. A Great Day Out.

Fresh air,sparkling ocean and caffeine. Get your walking shoes out...the more colorful,the better. This invigorating oceanside and cliff top walk will get you into a spiritual high. You observe the beautiful shoreline and world's best surfing beaches of the Eastern burbs. This is an exceptional walk. Be advised, its totally open space ...... sunscreen and appropriate clothing is advised Assuming you have investigated the Beach already,walk to the Bondi Hotel,turn right into Elizabeth Drive,leaving the noise of the beach behind. Start at the iconic Bathers swimming pool which is a great place to dine or while away the afternoon and head down Nott street to the path which drops down and skirts the rock formation. Careful strides as you take the steep steps to Mackenzies Point Lookout, on the headland. Sit down, to allow the vistas which stretch 180 degrees from Ben Buckler in the north to Malaber in the distant south. Resume walking to the next headland and down to Tamarama beach wher less clothing is preferred. Skirt the sands to the Marine Drive which you follow around the slope of Bronte Park. After passing Bronte Beach,refuel with caffeine and refreshments at the local cafes overlooking the sea and headup to Calga Reserve.
