Walk down Trafalger avenue to the historic resting place of Sydney's citizens at Waverley Cemetery. Then follow the coast through Clovelly to Coogee Beach,where entertainment cafes and superb eating options await you. Bus or taxi back to Bondi or the city. But,why leave paradise, you ask?

BOND WITH BONDI. This is a great way to enjoy the beautiful beaches here without getting in the water. The walk from Bondi Beach to Coogee Beach is an easy walk up and around the area. I suggest good walking shoes. Leave the fashionable heels for later. The view from the highest point is worth the walk.We've visited during the winter, and it was a bit chilly and windy. That didn't distract from the beauty at all. If you want to take the bus, take the 333 from the Quay. It's not quite a non-stop, but it has the least amount of stops. Take the same one on the return.
Relaxing Walk. Peaceful and cool windy walkable track. Great to relax the mind and body and breathe fresh air! Bring along a camera!

Nice walk. Nice easy beautiful walk. You can walk to Bronte or continue onto Coogee beach. Unfortunately when I went, it was terrible weather, but I was determined to do the walk! It really is lovely.

Best Walk in Sydney Area. I did many hikes and walks in the Sydney area and this was by far my favorite. It had stunning views and there were multiple beaches along the way to stop and relax if you wanted too.

beaches, beaches & ocean delights. Start this walk at South Bondi and just follow the boards. It's up and down with lots of steps but it is paved all the way. Great ocean views and beaches with white sand inviting you to sit in the sunshine. Take your swim cossie and try the water at Bronte. If you are a non swimmer there is a safe ocean rock pool to bathe in, as well as a 50 metre salt water pool. It is free to experience the walk and the water. Take sunblock and a hat if you are going in the summer time. Plenty of places to stop for a picnic lunch or you can purchase food and drink along the way.

Perfect scenery. What a gorgeous walk. The scenery was perfection and we had absolutely wonderful weather for this in August (felt like summer!). The only down side of this visit was stopping at the G'day Bronte cafe. Rudest customer service experience ever!

Cool Coogee!. Sea, Sun, and Sand...and Ocean Pool!!! It's a great day out to stroll along the sunny beach. After this place, drive to Watson's Bay. You'll get a panorama view of the Harbor Bridge and a majestic rock formation.
Beautiful. MUST DO! Views are incredible, walk is lovely and you visit 5 different bays along the route. Make sure its done in good weather.

Get your walking shoes on. Get off the Ferry or bus at Bondi, enjoy the beach, then head up around the coastal walk toward Coogee. Picturesque landscape, breathtaking views over the ocean and what could be more pleasant on a sunny winters day
Breathtaking. Beautiful, a must-do! Whether solo or in couple, bring along water and sunscreen, and don't forget your bathing suit.
For walkers. Like to do this walk every time we come to Sydney,especially when the Art is there.The exercise is terrific and the views stunning.Nice to have a coffee in Bronte before the return walk
Must Do In Sydney. If you have not done this before I strongly suggest yo put it on your list of things to do on a lazy sunday morning with a few cups of coffee and a partner. Very Idyllic

The best ocean views ever!. If you love the ocean and love to take pictures then this walk is for you! We have done it twice - each time we visited Sydney - and will do it again. Once we saw the most beautiful rainbow on our walk - it was a rainy day, the next time we saw whales near Bondi beach. It is different every time you do it... Ensure you have at least a morning or afternoon to spent.

BONDI TO COOGEE WALK. Wonderful scenery,perfect for those that are relatively fit.Can be a little tiring but well worth the experience.If planning to do this walk be sure to take plenty of drinking water as persperation is a big factor, especially during the hotter months.

Beautiful coastline. We took the bus to Coogee from Circular Quay. From Coogee we walked to Bondi. It made sense because when you get to Bondi there are some nice dining options and it's easy to catch a bus back to CQ. There are quite a few steps and some areas are not suitable for sandals. The views along this coastal walk are spectacular. Make sure you bring a decent camera!

Sculptures by the Sea. One of the best times to do this walk is whilst the Sculptures are on display from Bond I to Tamarama beaches. Usually in November,don't forget the camera & some are displayed up on the headland at Seth. BondiPart but not all of the route is wheelchair friendly Some of the exhibits have sound effects too.
Bondi Beach Is Incredible. Bondi Beach is unique and beautiful. If you get a chance to visit it be sure to see while in Sydney.
Coogee to Bondi. Wow, what an amazing walk. Up and down all the way. Spectacular views. Had a leisurely walk and a huge delicious lunch in Bondi. A must on your visit to Sydney.

Great walk!. Lovely walk along the cliff tops, a great way to spend an afternoon. Not too far and it's easy to get the bus if you don't fancy the return adventure. Loads of opportunities for photos too.

A must see for a trip to Australia. Bondi beach is one of the most popular beaches in the world.It is world known for it's surfing. But the views are the very best ever. The walk away from Bondi is breathtakingly beautiful.Had breakfast with a view of the beach and that is a must too.
Amazing. You can enjoy the best of the Sydney's beaches just having a walk there! Checking the surf! amazing view!

wow. take your kids and friends, go on your own- if you take a picnic - send a day! careful, though, don't get too close to the cliff edges and take plenty of 'slip slap slop' - cover up, wear a hat and use sun creen.

Great fairly easy walk. This is great sea view walk, with lovely bays to stop and have a break in. Some have Cafes so you can have a snack and drink too. Fairly easy with a few hills and steps, about 6k. Best view bowling club and cemetery probably in Aus. Quite busy at the weekends. Plenty of places to eat in Coogee and the buses back to Sydney are every 10 mins.

Blown away!. It was blowing a gale the day we walked, made it to Tamarama only before getting rained on and losing all enthusiasm! Good track, well signed, very popular you will never be alone out there/

Nice Walk. This is a really busy walk, so if it's peace and quiet you want, this is not for you. I had read that it takes about 3 hours, but I walked it at a leisurely pace in 2.5 hours return. I wasn't blown away by the scenery, but it is a nice walk. Would do it again, but only if I was going with someone who hadn't been before. It wouldn't be on my must do list. Watson's Bay Cliff walk is shorter but certainly prettier.

Lovely walk along the coast!. I would start this walk in Coogee and end in Bondi so you can spend more time in Bondi. That is my only regret. Otherwise, a fantastic walk, and I even saw whales off the coast.
surfers. great walk - views are brilliant - may see whales if you are lucky but definitelly see some great surfers

Great Beach and Headland walk. This is a great walk for Tourists to see some of Sydney's best beaches and coastal headlands. Good restaurants are available at both beaches and Public transport is available.

A great way to clear your head. This is a smashing walk along the coastline. Allow yourself at least an hour to complete the walk. The day we walked we were fortunate enough to see some whales close to shore. Be advised that you will be climbing a lot of steps on this journey.

Excellent walk and lovely views. Very enjoyable walk completed with a local to the area who pointed out wildlife on the way and things of interest. I've done this walk twice now, once on a beautiful sunny day and another on a fairly cloudy day when the sea was rough and crashing in to the rocks. Both stunning in their own ways watching nature at work and would definitely do it again.

Must do. Even in winter the sea scape is amazing, watch the surfers, joggers passing by and soak up the atmosphere with the invigorating sea air. We even encountered Koshi doing a channel 7 take at Bondi.

An easy walk, for all the family.. There are still many unspoilt areas around the coast of Sydney. This walk is purposely designed without damaging the integrity of the natural beauty. Every step affords amazing and sweeping views of the coastline and out to the ocean. If you are watchful and lucky you will see one of the many migrating whales that swim not too far off shore. Whilst on a recent walk my husband took video of a sounthern right whale just 50 metres off shore along the same walk. Absolutely incredible. Go see for yourself.

Even part of this walk is worthwhile!. Sydney's coastal walks are spectacular but be warned, its best to avoid weekends and early mornings when the locals are doing their thing! Bondi to Bronte is the first leg of this long coast walk and something you should try to fit in. It is just stunning and although it is up hill and down dale, a person of ordinary fitness could easily cope. A fit person of course would run the whole length of the coastal beaches. There are plenty of great cafes at Bondi and Bronte and the other suburbs along the route. Its great for families and kids as well. Perfect for photos. You can get a bus from the city to Bondi or a train to Bondi Junction and then a bus to Bondi Beach. Parking can be difficult at all these beachside haunts.Look out for Sculpture By The Sea in the Spring when the path is transformed into an outdoor sculpture park - crowded but worth it!

Walkway to heaven. It is a long walk, so start early. Put lots of suncreen on, if I could give you an advice it would be it. Enjoy every step, every landscape. Pay attention in each detail. It is worth going to remember how good is to be alife to see it. If you surf, prepare yourself to good waves. And to one of the best sunsets of your life. :)

Nice Walk Great Views. This is such a popular spot for tourists and locals alike that it can get mega crowded. It's generally a pretty easy gradient less for the start (Bondi) with super steep stairs to climb. That done, there are lots of places to stop and admire the views and people trotting passed. There are also some exercise stations dotted along that are not well used so if you are doing this to clear the head from the night before it's a great walk. Either direction, you start and finish in towns that have plenty on offer.

The Coastline!. What a beautiful coastline! Great view, a great walk and the perfect way to end a trip to Sydney.Definitely recommend stopping for lunch along the way. We chose to eat at Bronte Beach!

LETS GET PHYSICAL. Such a great way to get and keep fit or you can stroll to your hearts content.There is always something to catch your eye, a beautiful beach, water views and not to mention Sculpture by the Sea in November.Plenty of cafes along the walk as well.There are sections with stairs.
Don't miss!. Nothing to dislike, but try to avoid weekends. Great cafes at Bronte. Walk both directions if you have time.

Scenic Walk. This walk gives wonderful views of the ocean and the rock formation all around. I have usually done it when the Sculptures by the Sea is on but to be honest, they detract from the beauty of the area and without all the crowds the event attracts, you can really appreciate the views so much more.
beautiful views. prefect walk for a sunny day! walked one way, had lunch, walked back! exersice done and beautiful views, even spotted some dolphins!

sculpture by the sea. This is a low-cost attraction on one of the most beautiful seaside walks in the world. The sculptures are first class and very, very interesting. But even when that's not on, it's a great place to take a stroll from Bondi to Coogee

Any time of day.. The walk and scenery are great with cafes from beginning to end. You can park your car and start in Bondi have a coffee in Bronte then on to Coogee overlooking the beautiful beaches.

Gorgeous Ocean Views. I can't imagine that anyone who comes to Sydney'sBondi Beach could leave without doing the Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal Walk.Most of the time it is breezy along this walk but on a hot, sunny day it is advisable to wear a hat because you can burn.The walk is not very difficult if you are fit. You will be going down stairs and paths, across rocks and up stairs and paths.Be sure to bring bottled water, 500 - 600 ml should be enough.There are other beaches along this walk that you wouldn't discover unless you knew specifically how to get to them. I am thinking of Tamarama, Bronte and Clovelly; so be sure to have your cosies with you!There are cafes and restaurants at those beaches too, so if you get hungry, you'll be right!Of course you finally end up at Coogee Beach which has undergone extensive development in recent years to become another tourist mecca.Be prepared for spectacular ocean views and clean green grass as you walk along the cliff tops.When you reach Coogee there are heaps of restaurants, bars, stalls and cafes. You are sure to find somewhere to suit your budget.If you prefer not to walk back to Bondi you will find buses and taxis that will get you there.
Brilliant exercise. A must when sculpture by the sea is on.Artists have their work displayed along the cliff top and these are as breathtaking as the views.
walk of life time. beach walk of around 7 kms takes to different kind of beaches .valley views .all amenities,food available enroute

Simply gorgeous views. Have breakfast at Bondi and then walk along the coastal walk, the views out over the ocean are gorgeous and in season, you will see whales frolicking in the water. The walk wends its way long beaches which all have cafes and toilets. You can stop for coffee, cake and ice creams and even dip your toes or more in the water on a warm day.

A regular run. If you are a runner start early because the walk gets popular mid morning. Walkers plan a stop at the Bronte cafe strip (about half way) and check out the new over the cliff board walk next to the cemetery. Even in winter bring your swimmers and a towel if the sun is up and there is no wind. Both ends are serviced by very (very) frequent buses to the City. In late Autumn and mid spring watch for migrating whales (although the easiset way to spot a whale is to watch for fellow walkers gazing out to sea and pointing). Sculpture by the Sea (late October, early November) is set out along the Bondi to Tamarama section.

Nature and spectacular views. I am a Bondi local and my wife and I take this walk most weekends. It never fails to lift my spirits and is a terrific start to the day !Fantastic views and plenty of wildlife for the observant: Eastern Water skinks, hawks, albatrosses, dolphins and whales. We even saw a seal on the rocks one day !

Great views. Well structured walk, easy to access & easy on the legs. Great views, added interest if the annual "sculptures by the sea" exhibit is on - but can get crowded then, especially on weekends. Take your swimmers, & some goggles for a swim at Clovelly. Lunch at Bondi Icebergs.
a top stroll. Fresh air, great views, plenty of coffee on the way. Best done in the morning as the sun is rising. You and a few million others but great fun.Not a hard walk but no whellchairs

A Must for Sydney. This is a must for those who like great views. a warning for people less nimble, there are many steps on the walk. You don't have to do the walk the whole way. you can stop along the way at Bronte or Tamarrama and get a bus back to wherever
good fresh air. a good excuse to get off my butt and walk along the ocean. If you are a bit of a climber you might feel the inclination to see what the sandstone is like...

Lovely coastal scenery. This short walk brings you some of Sydney's best beaches, and stunning views of the sandstone cliffs and the ocean all the way. Along the route there are plenty of lovely parks for a picnic, a couple of rock pools for swimming and places to buy a coffee or snack. The path has some steep stairs in it, so it's also favourite for some exercise. My last visit was yesterday (Monday morning), and is was pretty busy with tourist and runners/walkers. If you don't like crowds, don't go on Saturday/Sunday morning. If you are in Sydney for only one day, and you love the ocean and beaches, you should fit in this 6 km walk. It's worth it!

Spectacular Coastal Walk. I am a Sydneysider and this is one of my favourite walks, particularly sensational during the Sculptures by the Sea festival in October. Fabulous atmosphere, terrific walk, amazing vistas, great eating opportunities at either end of walk.

Magnificent Coastal Walk. Gorgeous walk, moderate effort level. Proper path concrete walk way also some parts for cycling. Take in the scenery, a gorgeous old graveyard, at certain times of year there are sculptures by the sea. A free attraction for all ages and types of people

Stunning scenic walk. Unmissable walk to experience coastal Sydney - cliff views, beaches, cafes, sunshine and parks. Start either end or walk part way to Bronte - bus transport from the city is available and the walk from the Coogee end is slightly easier. Combine this with breakfast or more at Bondi Icebergs Bistro on the top floor above the exclusive restaurant and open to travellers (living more than 5 km away).
Best exercise in the world. If you hate exercise then the walk here is perfect, beautiful water and views and just a wonderful way to start the day.

A "must do" when you are in Sydney. Take your time and enjoy the views. There is a rewarding café at the end of the walk. Or time a return walk ending at lunch time and take your appetite into the Iceberg's restaurant.
Wonderful. Do it anytime but if you want a real treat do it in October -November for sculpture by the sea. Don't forget to take your camera as you walk over the water.

Even in winter this is a great walk with magnificent views. It was a lovely Winters day with loads of sunshine and blue skies so going on this walk seemed to be a good choice - and it was. We took the Watson's Bay ferry from Circular Quay then the 380 bus to Bondi before we started the walk.The first few hundred metres set the tone for he rest of he walk - a view of the coastal swimming pool below, surfers in the waves and a lovely coast line to look at. It's a great walk throughout as you go through a number of bays and beaches. It's a little up and down so you need to be reasonably fit though there are super fit people everywhere running along the coastal path.It was great to arrive at Coogee after a brisk 90 minute walk and had a well deserved drink at the Hotel before boarding the bus back to Sydney. A truly must do when you have a few days in Sydney.

COAST WALK + more. We started in Bondi with breakfast at Sonoma. We walked to the North Headland first (the tip past the carpark) and then spent a great morning.We had lunch on the way back at 3 Blue Ducks.I think we stumbled onto the perfect day.Watch out for the serious joggers in the morning.

Great coastal views. Met a friend at Cooggee and then decided to take a walk along the coastal walk to Bondi Beach. Saw seal lions and breaching Humpback Whales on the way which was the icing on the cake for us. Highly recommended.

Favourite coastline. Having grown up in Sydney but moved away, we do this walk, or part thereof, whenever we return and never tire of it! An amazing coastline and you may see dolphins or whales along the way if its the season. Many great little cafes along the way to quench your thirst and grab a bite to eat.

Spectacular views, one of the best walks. If you come to Sydney this is one of the most scenic walks to do, and it's free. Spectacular ocean views as you stroll from Bondi to Bronte, then on to Coogee. Along the way enjoy the café scene at Bronte, you won't be disappointed.
Best walk in the world. You can't come to sydney and not do this walk. Pay the few dollars it costs to go into bondi icebergs for a swim, sensational

2h walk on a nice day--don't miss this. take the Watson's Bay ferry from Circular Quay 4, walk to the water, then take the 380 bus to Bondi where luch along the beach has many options, then at the salt water pool begin the 2h walk along the cliffs to Bronte or continue to Coogee. Can either reverse direction to take the ferry back after sunset (night views on the harbor) or a bus back to wherever you are staying in Enmore or Sydney. Locals love this walk for good reason.

Scenic walk , not to be missed. No trip to Bondi is complete without a stroll, jog or power walk along one of THE most scenic walks in Sydney.Start off at Bondi's iconic Icebergs bistro or poolside cafe, then head off along the path. Wind your way to the lookout for sweeping views of Bondi and then along the coast heading towards Tamarama( or Glamourama as Bondi folk call it) , Bronte and beyond. Plenty of cafes in both Tamarama and Bronte, to rehydrate for the walk to Coogee, the new backpacker haven. Waverley cemetery enroute is the final resting place for some of Sydney's famous names, and quite a spectacle. Once in Coogee there are plenty of restaurants, bars and cafes(Barzura cafe, and of course the Coogee Bay Hotel high on my list!) A helpful hint...stay to the left on the path to avoid the wrath of the joggers!
One of my favourite activities. It's free to do, wonderful views, healthy and a highlight of our recent trip. Reward yourself with a drink at Coogee and walk all the way back to Bondi!
Lovely walk. Beautiful afternoon for a coastal walk - little bit steep in places but worth it for the views at the top - favoured Coogee side more than Bondi though.

Beautiful - make time for it. A gorgeous and rewarding walk, with coast, ocean, and amazing rock formations along the way.Make time for it - the sun sets early in winter! We ended up in the dark towards the end, but rewarding and not to be missed all the same.

Best spot in Sydney. Start at Bondi or start at Coogee, it doesnt matter. this walk is about 6KM long, on an average day take between 1.5hr and 2.5hr to walk, depending on how fast you walk and how often you stop to take pictures. Theres a few stairs along the way, naturally a couple hills to go up and down but nothing to steep. the advantage is, theres severla beaches along the way to stop at, all with pubs, cafes close by. its popular for runners, but just keep walking as normal and they will find their way past you. dont try to get out the way, it will only cause chaos. bring your camera, plenty of amazing photo opportunities and woth doing a quick google search of the route as theres a few famous sites along the way for one reason or another...some good, some not so good. but all interesting all the same

A MUST DO!. If you've got some free time I definitely suggest doing this walk! I like to start at Bondi and end in Coogee then have lunch before jumping on the bus back to Bondi to collect my car. It is truly a breathtaking view! Sydney's Gem!
A scenic beach walk.. It was great to walk along the sea cliffs and watch the surfers. A great (free) way to spend the afternoon!

This is a very enjoyable and easy walk to do. One should always include this as part of their Sydney itinerary. The views are breathtaking and the beaches very clean and swimmer friendly. The infrastructure at each beach is also very impressive.
Lots of Joggers. This walk is great, there is allot of joggers though so keep your wits about you. Do it at sunset and you won't be disappointed.

Glorious Salute to the Sunrise. At this time of year, it is a bit brisk, but the walk is a superb way to watch the sun rise over the east and the Tasman Sea/ Pacific Ocean and to look at the extraordinary collection of humanity out for their morning exercise. Most people go 'there and back' so there is no particular advantage in which end you start. Good cavés at both ends and the best at Bronte, in the middle. Guests from the "Admiral Collingwood" hotel catch the M50 to Coogee and start there. If its a stroll, rather than a brisk walk, the Waverly Cemetery is well worth a bit of time, marveling at the tombstones and sepulcres. We even saw an Priest celebrating a dawn wedding on one of the small parks along the way. What a way to start a marriage - and gives new meaning to the "Wedding Breakfast".

Great, not to stressful walk. Very scenic walk from Bondi to Coogee Beach. There's a few up and down sections but they're not to stressful so I think anyone of reasonable fitness could do the walk. It took me about 3 hours to complete but this was with stops for photos. The great thing about this walk is when you get to Coogee go to the Coogee Beach hotel for steak and beers. Nice and relaxing.

Coastal walk amidst the cliffs. A friend and I completed this walk today, and we had an amazing time. The sun was out even though it was chilly so the beaches looked magical! We started the trek from Coogee at around 10.30am but by the time we ended up in Bondi it was 5.30pm!! That's how much time we spent along the way just absorbing the beauty of the coastline. We stopped over at 6 locations and had a picnic lunch at Clovelly :)1. Coogee Beach2. Gordon's Bay3. Clovelly Beach4. Bronte Beach5. Tamarama Beach6. Bondi BeachYou get plenty of restrooms, drinking water and information stands/kiosks along the way to make your walk a comfortable one. If you want a bit of adventure, try and find some off road paths and go off the beaten track! ;)Would totally recommend this walk to anyone visiting Sydney. Totally worth the time and effort.

Beautiful coastal walk. This walk has to be truly one of the most beautiful walks anywhere in the world. What a beautiful coastline Sydney has with its coves, beaches, bays and cliffs. The walk is sometimes a little strenuous for older folk, but worth the trouble if taken slowly. The scenery is superb especially on a sunny day - but it would be strenuous on a hot humid day. One must remember to take a camera for the beautiful scenery and this is a beautiful area to take overseas or interstate guests - it has to be one of the top locations for tourists in and around Sydney, and it's free.Bathroom facilities are available at the various life saving centres and parks along the way.

Lovely Cliffs walk. The walk from Coogee to Bondi Beach is magic on any day but in the sunshine it is really beautiful. The ocean and the cliffs not to mention the winding paths and the glorious views,.Probably one of the best walks in a city in Australia..

Best city walk I know. We loved walking from Bondi to Coogee. The scenery is beautiful and the trail very good, with nice beaches with good infra structure on the way - but there are also bays that are completely desert. It's a lovely walk and anyone who want to feel the beach spirit of Australia should do it, or at least part of it. The whole walk took about 2 hours from Bondi and it's possible to catch a bus in Coogee to city centre.
Beautiful Sandy Shore. This was as beautiful as we had heard, just wish it had been warm enough to get wet and really enjoy.

Not a body in sight!!!. We walked the trail to Bondi Beach and it was deserted! It made me laugh because every postcard I saw had pictures of crowded beaches! It was March and during the week which probably explains why: it was fall for them, and it's probably busier on the weekend. It is famous for nude sunbathers.

Wonderful way to experience the Sydney Beaches. Strolling along the walkways, along the beaches and saltwater pools, is a great way to experience a bit of Sydney beach culture, without getting wet (unless you choose to jump in for a swim). I take visitors on this walk frequently, and they love it.

Beautiful. Bondi is a fanstastic beach, perfect for surfing, hanging out or just watching the sea over a plate of fish and chips. The walk which is about 6km is fantastic, especially at dusk when you can see the town light up!
Really beautiful. It's a really beautiful walk along the coast, you can see some beaches and some times they got a exposition with some great sculptures.

Stunning walk, see dolphins and whales if lucky!. Get the 333/380 bus from the city at circular quay and jump off top of Campbell Parade. Cross over into Notts Avenue past the Bondi Icebergs (where you can return for s bite and drink later!) and start the walk. All the way to Coogee is about an hour an 10 mins and stunning. Lots of small hills and a few steps. Ocean front all the way. Gorgeous must do in Sydney.

A Beautiful Walk. The walk from Bondi to Coogee is beautiful. The coastline is stunning and we even managed to spot some migrating whales. It's tricky for young children to manage though. It's not fenced the entire way and we didn't feel comfortable letting our son walk it. Not stroller friendly either.
Good walk!. Specially at sunset near by the cemetery did it several times. The beach with the old boats also great.

Amazing view of bondi with feeling of exploration. Choosing a sunny day and go to the bondi beach by bus, then buy a delicious fish and chips at the shop next to the beach, seating on the grassland and enjoying the sea view of bondi. Next step is the costal walk, my advise is to wear a comfortable shoes. I have taken about 2hrs with resting. The whole walk is full of amazing sea view and I really enjoyed it. When arrived at Coogee, I stayed on the beach for a while and went back to city by bus. It is a lovely experience.

Amazing! A must do when in Sydney!. Beautiful beaches! We even got to see some dolphins! Start early so you can take your time walking and taking in the view and maybe go for some swims! Would definitely recommend!

lovely walk. firstly you need to pick a sunny day for this walk. really brings out the colours of the sea. my only advice would be, try and avoid arriving to coogee beach in rush hour or it will make the journey back to sydney CBD a nightmare. this goes for getting to the bondi in the morning as well

Spectacular views of bondi and the ocea.. This is a popular walk along the coast and for good reason. the sandstone cliffs which have strange shapes carved into them through erosion and the views back to bondi were spectacular. We didnt walk the whole way to Coogee but got a bus about halfway - back to bondi. A really enjoyable day out.

Well worth it - fantastic scenery. Take good walking shoes as at times this track can be a little wet, you can do this fast or slow, its got plenty of spots to stop and catch your breath, sit on a seat, take it in, this walk is amazing.

Bondi coastal Walk. We walked the magnificent walk from Bondi finishing at Bronte Beach.The walk is an easy stroll but there are a few steps along the route.( We are on the wrong side of the 70,s) At Bronte we decided to have coffee before catching the Bus back into the City but were disappointed in the cafe atmosphere finding the service slow and generally the area rather Tacky. So our suggestion is to walk the opposite direction from Bronte to Bondi and hopefully enjoy a better style of Coffee shop before heading home.
Great walk. A must do for a Sydney visitor, you can walk in flip flops as it is not a huge distance. Take a camera as the views are fantastic.

Absolutely off the charts...... There is no way that my comments here can explain the beauty, energy, and uniqueness of Bondi. My wife and I visited Bondi while in Sydney during June 2013. We enjoyed the energy of all those in Bondi so much, we returned the next day too. There are runners, walkers, surfers, swimmers, etc everywhere and just inspires you to be active also. Admittedly both my wife and I are active triathletes, so the athletic environment certainly appealed to us, but we enjoyed just relaxing, strolling the coastline, watching the surfers and those practicing yoga on the rocks, we spotted a whale, watched those swimming in one of over half a dozen sea water filled pools right next to the sea, etc. In fact, my wife and I took surfing lessons while there too. But one of the main draws is the view. The coastline, rocks, surf, beaches, a beautiful cemetery on the hill, boardwalks, etc are really just amazing. For those active folks, you can get a guest pass to Bondi Icebergs pool, and swim in one of the most iconic pools you will find. Also there are some great places to grab some lunch (se review of Trio). There are some steep climbs on this walk, and quite a few stairways, so might not be perfect for those mobility challenged. Also there is a lawn bowling "field"(?) on the path. (Sorry, but being from the US, not sure if I know all the appropriate lawn bowling terminology)

Awesome walk, views and experience!. Lovely walk to do for fun or exercise. Plenty of people watching along the way and you can stop off for a rest on a park bench, a rock cliff, a beach or a cafe. It's nice to have lunch or a break street side in Bronte. You can easily take the bus back to Bondi from Coogee.

Beautiful, peaceful walks.... Love the views, with waves crashing. People from different walks of life exercising. Sun was strong and wind was cold.Dislike:The stairs and steep slopes that can be taxing.

A Great experience and very necessary!. Sydney offers so much for everyone!We spent a week doing 90% of the tourist's activites.A great event for the spirit is the Bondi Coastal Walk.Easy to avoid the crowds and appreciate the sea, beach, swimming, and surfing.We used the ferry to arrive at Bondi.Srtongly recommended for families, or for those who have had too much of Darling Harbour.

Stunning!. This is a fantastic walk for any time of the year. The coastal views are incredible and the path is well marked for anyone that is unsure of the area. From April to October you may even spot migrating whales in the distance!

Awesome walk with great views. I loved this walk along the beach. You can stop for lunch at any number of places (we went to Trio for breakfast and Icebergs for lunch), the views are fantastic, and there are interesting plaques explaning different features of the ocean and shore along the way. A tip is to follow the runners along the path as then you won't go on as many "dead ends". We walked on this path for a few hours to get to the end but had a great time. There are only a few steep parts and not many stairs.
Picturesque Walk. Great 1 and a half - 2 Hour walk along the coast, you'll want to take many pictures or even just sit and watch the world go by. Well worth the effort
Nice!. It's a good way for spend a afternoon with your friends, It's a little bit long but it's alright also for lazy people like me. amazing landscape!

Tips for this walk.... As a local best tip is to go early on a week day morning. Take a bottle as there are water filling stations along the way! Nice touch! The yearly sculptures by sea is well worth while but definately avoid Sunday mornings... Best option start in Bondi and head south to Coogee then for a brunch head over to the Oceans bar for great $12 pizzas!!! Enjoy!!!

Walk with a view. I love this walk and especially on a fine day I could not ask for a better location to walk. I especially liked looking at the old Headstones in the graveyard on the way...at one stage you had to walk through it but you now have the option to walk on the new pathway which is very well done. Nice to stop off and have a refreshing coffee maybe at Bronte

Excellent, I recommend.. As many other beach coastal walks in Sydney, this one is very recommended and beautiful. I'd give a highlight to the view from the cemetery, something really extraordinary. That's the real meaning of RIP.

One of the best things to do in Sydney. Brilliant way to see some of the best of Sydney, take your time relax enjoy the beaches bays people sunshine and the stunning views. Plan for a 1/2 it can be done in less but unless you are pushing yourself relax and enjoy the time.

A nice walk. The walk along the beach has great views on a nice afternoon. The experience of getting out there on the ferry and enjoying the afternoon was fun. On a hot summer day it will be packed though so be prepared.

A walk to remember. I did this walk in September 2012 on sunny day and it will last in my memories forever. The walk has some of the best viewing points to watch the stunning beauty of the Sydney's coastal line. If you planning to do this walk choose a sunny day and start early to enjoy at the fullest. Don't forget to carry water and some food.

A great scenic, walk and good exercise.. Depends on how fast you walk and on your level of fitness this is a great walk. Level in places, stairs in other places. A great exercise activity. Perhaps a highlight is the sculptures by the sea, a once a year event. a terrific activity for tourists and locals. good for whale watching too.

A great thing to do in Sydney winter or summer. Start at Coogee Beach (374, 373 or M50 prepay bus from the city - takes about 30 minutes) and fuel up with a coffee from Gusto on the cafe strip near the beach on Coogee Bay Road. The walk to Bondi is signposted and will take you about 2.5 hours and if you do it between June and September you may see a migrating whale or two as a bonus. If you have binoculars bring them!Keep an eye out for white cockatoos, honey eaters and rosellas - very pretty parrots. Take some water with you as there are steps up and down at some places and you will be thirsty by the end of the walk even at a leisurely pace. my favourite spot on the walk is Gordon's Bay - just north of Coogee - a quiet pretty bay ringed by coastal bush and a great spot for a secluded swim in summer months.

A great start to a day in Sydney. We started the walk at Cooogee and walked to Bondi. It's well signposted and the views are fabulous, passing along all the beautiful bays along the way. If you need there are cafes along the way, Bronte is really nice! It;s really quite busy on weekends but not too much to ruin the experience. When you get to Bondi you can sign in and enjoy a cold drink in the Icebergs club and sit and look at Australia's most famous beach. I think it took us about 2 hours but we were'nt in a hurry.
This is Sydney at its best ,great water views and surfers. I walk it constantly part of way, I love watching the surfers and looking at architecture of multi million dollar houses along the way.

Do it backwards. Take the M50 bus to Coogee and grab breakfast at the Coogee Bite before walking the coastal route to Bondi. You need to get your ticket before boarding the bus. The walk is not strenuous and is well signposted, and you'll see kookaburras, honey eaters and wattlebirds as well as the surfers and swimmers when you reach Bondi.

a nice 2.5-3 hr easy walk. This is one of the "must do"s in Sydney. If you're lucky, you'll see dolphins or even whale. If you're planning to go during "Sculptures by the Sea" event, avoid weekends as it can be packed and annoying.

Sydney seaside walk. this is a great walk to enjoy the trail from Bondi to Coogee along tracks paths and sand it has beautiful views of the city's beautiful beaches.bring some coffee money for a pit stop for a great coffee milksake or snack along the wayand dont forget your camerathe sculpture by the sea is a great reason to walk and enjoyhttp://www.sculpturebythesea.com/Home.aspx

Beautiful. Such a great walk, really reccomend it. So close to Australias biggest and best city, yet stunning views of the coastline. Do it fast and work up a sweat, or take your time and soak in the atmosphere, it's all good :)

Stunning!!!. Even though the weather was not good the walk from Bondi to Coogie was still worth the effort. It is an easy walk around the rugged coastline south of the entrance to Sydney Harbour. We watched surfers in all the small bays, watched the waves break over the rocks and passed several salt water swimming pools on the way. We were looking forward to the walk back but the weather worsened and we were forced to give in and take the bus.

The view is great. The walkway is a bit undulating with a few stairs but not too taxing. The view is great along the coast. There are a few places along the way to stop for coffee or an ice cream like Tammarama or Clovelly Beach. We did the walk on a Sunday. We got to Bondi Beach via ferry and bus.
Fabulous walk. Easy markings-beautiful scenery and stunning waves. Trundles past lots of beaches , some stunning rocks and Bondi-sunny day helped!

Great way to see some of the wonderful beach suburbs. We have done this walk every time we visit Sydney. It is an easy walk with lots of interesting beaches, shops and cafes along the way. No need to rush just enjoy the atmosphere. We usually get the bus to Coogee and then walk to Bondi having coffee on the way and watching the surfers, swimmers and enjoying the beachside ambience along the way.
Amazing views. Lots of great cafes to stop off at on the way and you might even see whales if you're there at the right time!
Nothing else like this. The coastal walk is so beautiful. Try to avoid weekends when it is quite crowded but the views are spectacular.
Must-do!!!. On an exceptionally good sunny day, did the walk up to bronte, in about a half hour. Excellent views of the coastline!!
Must-do!!!. On an exceptionally good sunny day, did the walk up to bronte, in about a half hour. Excellent views of the coastline!!

Lovely walk on a sunny day. I did this from Coogee to Bondi last weekend. It's a stunning walk. I think it's about 7km and it ambles up and down but is not difficult. There are lots of people out & about - joggers, photographers, people with babies or dogs. Then at the end you are awarded with coffee/wine/lunch at Bondi. What more can you want? Just do it!

We had a great time!. We spent a whole day walking Bondi Beach. It was a Sunday and there were lots of families with children, young people, people walking their dogs, children playing, and young people surfing. It was nice to be outside and walk.

One of my favourites things to do in sydney. Stop off in Bronte for brunch mid walk. You dont have to go all the way to Coogee - in fact from Clovelly to Coogee its quite hilly. So Bondi to Clovelly and back is a nice enough stroll.

BEAUTIFUL Walk! We loved it. What an amazing walk...this is not difficult at all. It is 6K from Bondi to Coogee...but you can do it at your own pace. Take it easy! Take pictures Watch the surfersWe did this in June (late Spring) and were lucky to have mixed cloudy skies (so not hot) and big waves and breezes. If I lived here I would be on this path at every moment I could. It's free, It's EASY to get to from the city and you can stop at Coogee and take a bus back...or eat there and hike back to Bondi which is what we did)SO much better than a bus tour! Try it ! You will LOVE it
Beautiful. Did the coastal walk. Spent time just sitting at the rocks of overhang cliffs. Cool winter breeze on my face. Relaxing sound of pounding waves. Beautiful solitude.

Great Views. I did this walk commencing in Coogee, ending up at Bondi last week for the first time. I took some visiting friends from the States with me and the coastline lived up to all our expectations. We were very lucky with the weather and even some of our party swam when we got to Bondi. It was easy taking the bus from Taylor's Square and we had earned our coffee and cake when we made it to Bondi. We meandered along, not rushing and took lots of photos of the wonderful water views.

A must do in Sydney. Great walk ...I never tire of it .....best in Whale watching season when its very common to see whales of shore.....and of course its great in summer . Good people watching ..great surf watching

Easy and beautiful. I live in Sydney and do this walk from time to time. Its beautiful, an amazing place and a great way to see it. Catch the bus from town to Coogee and the bus home from Bondi or vice versa.

Amazing.......Do It!. Brilliant scenery, walk etc.............it's just something you HAVE to do while you're here!!!Just make sure you check out the Bus timetable to get back as it does not operate out of high season.........epic fail.......had to get a taxi

Magnificent Coastal walk with spectacular views. This is one of the most stunning walks I have ever experienced.It was a glorious sunny day in May with beautiful blue skies and we took the 333 bus from Circular Quay to Bondi beach. The water at Bondi Beach was glistening in the sunlight. The large expanse of clean white sand was beautiful.The pathways was easy to find and follow and the walkt wound around rugged coastal areas.The colours of the sea were divine. Differing landscapes with rocky outcrops and surf beaches added to the beauty.The walk was so interesting without being too challenging. So many others were enjoying this walk too. Its about 2.5km and takes around an hour. We were very fortunate to have such perfect weather. As the old saying goes" Some of the best things in life are free" I would highly recommend this walk from Bondi to Bronte beach

scenic walk. If you do this walk while the Sculptures by the Sea is on, best bet is to catch the bus from Circular Quay because it is packed by the time it gets to Bondi Junction.There are some stairs but generally it's an easy walk with a postcard view at every turn. We went from Bondi to Bronte and back, stopping at Bronte for refreshments.
Amazing ... a sight around every corner!. In June it's "winter" here but the water is 74 degrees and weather is a nice 70 or so. Very relaxing.

Best coastal walk ever. I´m not a keen walker, but this walk was one of the best experiances I had in Sydney. Splendid views, fresh air, and in Coogee (as reward for the 2 h walk) a lovely meal in one of the beach restaurants. Thank you !
Amazing walk. Actually stayed at Coogee so walked Coogee to Bondi. Highlights are definitely Gordans Bay and both Bronte & Bondi beach.
Great Walk. Great Walk around the cliff tops, very picturesque overlooking the ocean, take a look at the 'sculptures by the sea' on your way along & discover the lovely little beach at Tamarama.

no lonesome hike. the hike starts more or less at the end of bondi beach and leads through 3 more little beaches (like tamarama beach) to coogee - you will meet joggers, dog-walkers, tourists and lots more people wandering this safe path - it is fun , a good exercise and not boring at all, there is always something to look at or to discover.

Stunning. What a great way to spend a few hours. I chose the coogee to bondi (reverse) and the view , well lets just say it stunning from start to finish. Give yourself a few hours to take it in and it was not as busy as I did it In winter

Great Views and Exercise!. If you have a few hours to kill while in Sydney, make your way to Bondi and walk along this fantastic trail. It winds its way along the rugged coast, high above the ocean and provides dramatic and numerous photo ops. You also pass a very historical cemetery that is the resting place for many of Australia's founding men and women. The monuments are stunning and it is fascinating to detour off of the trail to walk amongst these historical headstones. I suggest one way, so take a bus or taxi back to Bondi….but if you are feeling adventurous, stop for a coffee or lunch in Coogee and turn around and do it all over again. It is a couple of hours each way. Great Exercise and views! Bring your camera.

A beautiful coastal walk. A fantastic walk and a must for any visitor to Sydney. The only thing I'd change is to ignore all the recommendations of walking from Bondi to Coogee and do the walk in reverse. The best views are in the opposite direction.

So picturesque, takes your breath away!. A beautiful coastal walk from Coogee to Bondi. Beware of runners who have a tendency not to slow down ... lots of fit people doing this trek, and is narrow in parts. Thoroughly enjoyable, took about 1.5 hours at a very leisurely pace, stopping to take photos quite a lot along the way.
Not to be missed.. Those visiting Sydney will especially like this walk. It is spectacular and shows coastal Sydney in a unique way. This is a fantastic under rated tourist attraction.

A great coastal walk. We went from Coogee to Bondi and back which is actually quite a long walk. Brisk sea breezes and spectacular views, but you get warm with a fair bit of up and down. The path is well marked and wide enough to pass slower walkers. Lots of places to stop for cafes etc.

Best Walk EVER - highly recommended. My boyfriend and I did this hike one morning when we visited Sydney. I was not sure what to expect however was blown away by the views all the way. Moderate fitness level required but you can take it as slow or fast as you want (some people were running?!) Highly recommended, I tell everyone visiting Sydney to do it. And, it's free :) Tip: You heat up as you're walking so dress in layers
Beautiful views. What a lovely walk on a sunny day from beach to beach. Can't get a bit windy at times, but the views are well and truely worth it.

On a clear day... The walk takes longer than you think, but it is a wonderful way to spend time with a friend or family member and just talk.Scenery is varied and nearly spectacular for a built up coastline.If its a good day recommend a swim and a coffee at the end of the walk at Wiley's Baths in Coogee which is an ocean pool open daylight hours 365 days a year.
spectacular views. Best views in Sydney, an absolute MUST do!!!Quite long walk, make sure you have comfy shoes, a drink bottle and a camera!

Long Beautiful Walk. We caught a bus from Sydney City out to Bondi Beach, grabbed some lunch and then went all the way to Coogee. It's a long but relatively easy walk, and it is well worth it. The views are incredible and you really get a sense of all the nooks and diversity of beaches in that area. Then at Coogee take a bus back to Bondi Junction for more shopping.

Would have been a gorgeous walk, if I had known what I was getting into.. Beware this is a hike, not a walk. Granted I had no idea what I was getting into when my friend asked if we wanted to go get breakfast in Bondi and then go for a walk. I seriously thought he meant we would do a 30 min walk along the beach. I wore a maxi dress and sandals, as did another girl in our group, and my husband wore jeans. This was just before New Year’s so it was really hot. This is a "walk" that is up and down for around 3 miles. You need to be wearing shorts, tank tops and walking shoes for sure. You should also bring sunscreen and water as there are not many places to stop in between. It would have been a gorgeous and worthwhile event had our guide told us what we were getting into beforehand. We were so pissed at the half way point that we stopped enjoying it and just wanted to get to the pub.

Great walk -- beautiful people and scenery. This was one of my favorite activities in Sydney. It takes a tiny bit of effort to figure out how to get there on the bus from downtown Sydney but the effort is well worth it. I didn't even go in the water, just walked along the shore. 5-6 different beaches to see, each beautiful in their own way. Some of the best people watching you will encounter anywhere in the world. Lots of relaxing spots to stop in and refresh yourself after the walk.Only caveat would be if you are older or out of shape is to budget a lot of time for this -- it is a LONG walk (5-6 miles I think) with a lot of hills and (generally) warm temperatures. Not a negative, just wanted to highlight this.
must do. This is such a great walk, with so many different things to look at along the way, some steps here and there but not too bad and lovely views and breezes from the ocean.

great experience but do it in the opposite way (from Coogee to Bondi). This is a must for when you are visiting Sydney. The scenery is just amazing! Depending on how fast you want to walk (if you want to enjoy it and take pictures), the walk takes about 1,5 hours in average (it took me almost 3 but I stopped a lot to take pictures and to look at the many surfers). Don't forget you sun hat and sun cream because there's no shade.
Great walk. It is a very good exercise to go this walk and at the same time you can go a take great photos of different beaches styles

Must do in Sydney!!. I read the rave reviews in TA about this coastal walk and was wondering... if I should go for it and how to go about...Boy! I was glad that I decided to go for it... the views were amongst the best I have seen in Sydney...we started the walk at about 4pm from Bondi beach, finished in 2 hours arrived at Coogee beach, busy taking photos along the way, it was a very leisurely walk for us...along the way met many joggers...it must be one of the best route to jog...wish we own a house there ^^ The autumn weather on this beautiful sunday (5/19) was just perfect, clear skies, cool breeze...if you have some time to spare, I recommend this walk. At Coogee beach bus stop, just take a bus back to Sydney city, less than 30min ride to Central station.
Beautiful. Best views in Sydney. Can get busy on weekends but worth it. Stop for lunch at either end, or Bronte in the middle.
Stunning views!. The Bronte to Bondi walk is a lovely scenic walk! Definitely recommend this to anyone that is visiting Sydney.

Beautiful. This was a great walk and you can go as far as you want and return when you get tired as it is quite a long way. There are bays and beaches along the way to rest and have a dip in the water. It was hot!!
my favourite walk. This is a wonderful scenic walk that offers exercise with stirs going up and down, great views and wonderful coffee and brekkie on either side of it.
Breathtaking!. Wear comfortable shoes and take lots of pictures. This is a must-do for anyone visiting the Sydney area.
Superb walk. Around every corner a new view. So pretty. Bring your camera. Its an easy walk - so fine for young and old.

Time well spent. I spent most of a morning enjoying the incredible views from the path. It was a workout but nothing too hard. I strongly recommend taking the time to walk this path early in your visit as it helped me get over Jet lag (flying in from Detroit/LAX).
Stunning. Sun shining, azure sky with a good pair of shoes and an ipod makes this a most enjoyable few hours...and a must for all visitors to this city.
Watch the Whales. Do this on a sunny day from May to September and you are in with a good chance of spotting whales or dolphins. Allow at least an hour either direction and thats without a stop.
Beautiful beach but not the best. This is a lovely walk along a number of small beaches. Thankfully it is not inundated with shops. The most well known beach in Sydney, but Manly beach is nicer.

Adore This Experience. I've been to Sydney several times, and despite there being so many wonderful things to do in the city, the walk from Bondi to Coogee (or Coogee to Bondi, if you want to mix it up!) often rises to the top of my list for how I want to spend a free afternoon. It's easy enough to take a bus from the CBD to either Bondi or Coogee and then start the walk, which is 2-3 hours (depending on your pace) of jaw-dropping beautiful coastal view after jaw-dropping beautiful coastal view! There's also a nice variety of scenes, from very busy spots (like Bondi) to secluded, smaller beaches with no one on them. If you want to swim, there are several opportunities to do so along the walk, both in ocean and a few dedicated swimming spots with lanes, etc. The walk also varies: none of it is very strenuous, but there are some spots that are a big more rugged than others. You will love the pictures you take on this walk--be sure to bring your camera. The color of the water is amazing! The architecture of the cliff-side and beach-side homes that you pass along the way is also very interesting. Be sure to save some time for Bondi and Coogee. Bondi is a bit touristy, but there's a good smoothie stand in the pavilion next to the beach. Coogee has some nice spots to grab a meal. Highly recommended--one of my favorite things.

Breathtaking! A MUST-DO activity.. So far, one of the best things I've done in the Sydney area. Gorgeous walk with amazing views - take your camera. Took about 2 hours and was worth it with a few photo stops and a quick walking pace. Take some time to hang out at the Coogee Bay Hotel for a celebratory drink when you're done.

Beautiful walk!. It's amazing and free. You can walk a part of it or go the whole distance--amazing views. I would recommend it to anyone staying a few days in Sydney because it's a short bus ride a way and the most amazing beach view.

awesome. Bondi beach may be a total tourist beach but it is still worth the visit. The beach itself is great and the shops up on the board walk are very cool. We showed up with nothing and got everything we needed from a beach towel, suntan lotion,fish and chips, and acold beer. Ifyou are in Sydney don't miss Bondi beach.

Spectacular good walk. Beautiful views from cliff tops, a sneaky peer at architecture beyond mere mortals' price brackets a tour of a cemetery and a number of Sydney's best beaches all in a single walk. What's not to like? There are places to stop for food along the way. The breeze off the ocean is cooling, even in early summer. I try to go whenever I've got a free day in Sydney. The paths can be a bit uneven in places, but nothing that would preclude the use of a stroller even.

Beautiful views and a great way to spend a few hours. I did this walk today and it was awesome. It is a relatively easy walk it took us about 4 hours with a stop for lunch at Sea salt cafe at Clovelly beach. It is suitable for all fitness types as I am not at all fit and completed it easily if not a little tired. The views of the coastline are amazing along with the bays, beaches n Waverley cemetry. Well worth the time and effort.

Bondi to Coogee? Try kings Cross to the Opera House!. Years ago I used to teach at St. Vincent's College just down the hill from the fountain and sometimes after work I would walk down behind the school to the entrance to the Naval Dockyard.In those days you could still get a meat pie or a pastie from Harry's Cafe de Wheels at a very reasonable price! Good tucker, mate!

it definitely worthies!!. actually, Im the kind of person who prefers to stay on the beach than walking along it...the beach itself is gorgeous!!!if you are like me, you wont miss anything! :)lay down and take a nap...you dont need mroe!wi-fi on the beach, and nice restaurants nearby! anything elsE??no thanks!!!! ;)
Absolutely stunning. Dramatic, powerful and beautiful - the board walks, viewing platforms, regular benches, easy gradients are all great - the crowds can get to to be a bit much though
Fantastic coastal scenery.. A very lovely walk to the very clean beach. it is safe for children, and there is a restaurant along the way.
Fabulous views. Great walk to see a variety of the Sydney beaches and good places to stop and eat and drink at on route. Take your camera!

Beautiful walk. Gorgeous walk with gorgeous views. Easily marked & paths were easy to maneuver. Took about 2.5 - 3 hours one way, but we stopped to talk pictures a lot. If you can take a bus and leave the car home, it's more convenient than having to walk back to get your car. Though, not a bad view on the way back either :)
Must do for everyone. Worth the bus trip down a nightmare bondi and battling the crowds for the views. Fantastic!Make sure it's not windy!

a MUST do. amazing view of the best beaches in Sydney. If you are lucky you might see dolphins and whales!! All the glamorous Sydney folk strut up and back also, so it's great people watching. stop at bronte for a hot chocolate and keep going, you will not be disappointed!!

Eastern Suburbs classic. I've lived in Sydney for most of my life and this is one activity I recommend to most international visitors. Maybe only do the Bondi to Bronte segment, but a great way to see Sydney's coastline.

Wonderful walk. This is amazing. It starts at Bondi Beach and links the small neighbouring beaches-Tamarama, Bronte and Coogee. It is dramatic and beautiful and the waves crash on the rocks below. Wear comfortable shoes-it is a bit hilly and there are steps.
A must do!. This is a great way to see some beautiful beaches in Sydney, its not a short walk- takes around 1-2 hours- depending on how fast you walk but is definitely worth it!

Great scenery. This is a great walk passing a few beaches on the way. There are also places to stop and get something to eat. A few stairs are involved but if you just take your time this is a very rewarding walk.

Wonderful beach in May. It was so beautiful! The air is cold and fresh. People are all gorgeous and they all have nice body to show in the beach! Children can surf. A seagull follows me everywhere. My bosses and 1 visitor had lunch at Bondi Pavillion by Nick's. Fish and chips is great and my first time to drink mahito which my boss ordered for me. It was a great walk experience! Fantastic!

Wonderful walk. It was lovely to get out of the town and enjoy this lovely coastal walk. We went back to Bondi and had a pleasant evening there.Don't try and get a bus from half way along the route as there are none returning to Bondi.

Great view and good exercise. Interesting and scenic coastal walk with lovely views of different beaches along the way. On the way, worth stopping at a historical cemetery with a view to die for (ha, ha)! Exhilarating walk to Coogee beach.

Beautiful beach. You can hop on and off the Explorer Bus for a full day of sightseeing. One bus takes you to Bondi Beach and it is worth the trip. May is their fall so it was a little chilly but there were a few surfers out. We strolled around the Bronte cliffs for some wonderful views.
Simply breathtaking views. One of the highlights of Sydney's East. A real feast for the eyes as you take in Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte and then Coogee beaches

Must do thing. Fantastic scenic walk for 6 kilometres. Really good for taking photographs. It is incredibly beautiful! Plenty of benches and nice places for resting too. Only bad thing is that there is not enough signs and every now and then you get quite confused about where you have to go. But thats Australia for you- they are eager to put up all sorts of signs to let you know what you can not do and what the dangers are but they are not very good at directing you. If you put a bit of effort in youll find your way. I was not able to walk all the way back so took a bus to Bondi from Coogee. Everyone who visits this area should do it. I so recommend it!

Loved it. Heading south out of Bondi, the path follows coastal cliffs into sandy coves. The first beach is the snall, quiet Tamarama Beach which was my personal favourite .Bronte Beach is and is a smaller, than Bondi with a sea water pool, park and Canteen. Clovelly Beach is narrow and set well back, there is a swimming pool and restaurant which serves a excellent coffee.Gordon's Bay was very small and excellent for snorkelling . FInally in the next bay you find yourself in Coogee which was very nice and had a park and BBQs. If thats not enough continue on to Maroubra, which was huge and very family friendly.

Best walk in town. The constant view of the coastline, the fact that you are really close to the city but feel like on holiday, the little cafes either end of the walk plus in Bronte are fantastic. Particularly spectactular during the Sculptures by the sea time.

Put this at the top of your list.. Husband, daughter (age 10) and I did the coast walk and all agreed that it was one of the best things we did while in Sydney. The walk is about 5km. We took our time, took lots of pictures, and played on the beaches. We took a cab to Bondi and a bus back from Coogee. Very easy. Loved it!

Enjoy 6kms of sea views. Heading south out of Bondi, the path follows coastal cliffs into sandy coves. The first beach is the tiny Tamarama Beach (known locally as Glamarama Beach due to the local inhabitants). Bronte Beach comes next and is a smaller, more intimate version of Bondi with a sea water pool and children's amusements. Clovelly Beach is narrow and set well back making it popular with young families and older folk. There is a swimming pool and restaurant which serves a good coffee. Continuing on Gordon's Bay was very small and seemed to house more little boats than people. FInally in the next bay you find yourself in Coogee, not dissimilar to Bondi. There were public BBQ areas, restaurants and the town itself very close to the beach. If you feel like you have done enough walking, you can easily get the bus back to the CIty. The walk has beautiful views and is a mix of steps and pathways.
Favourite walk. Always a good way to spend a sunny aftyernoon. Not too difficult and a cup of coffee or a beer waiting at either end or half way.

Excellent Walk. I've done this walk a couple of times before. Only went up to Bronte Beach though. It was quite hot when we went this time, so please take some water along with you. Elderly or unfit people might find the climbs along the way a bit daunting, but tske your time, as the views are magnificent along the way
Beautiful walk, beautiful people. Wished we had worn suitable shoes, didn't know we were going to do the whole walk at the time. Very busy track, although it was a Saturday. Recommend to anyone.

A Must See/Do!. Aside from seeing the iconic Opera House and Harbour Bridge, this was by far my favorite part of my visit to Sydney. You can take bus 333 from the Circular Quay stop for a 30 minute or so ride to Bondi Beach where you begin the walk. It was quite crowded the day we walked, but I assume that it was out of the ordinary because we were there on Easter Day. The views are spectacular- bring your good camera! The hike itself is not strenuous at all- just beware that there are several places where there are stairs, but nothing too extreme. It would probably take easily less than 2 hours to walk the whole thing (round trip), but it is easy to stretch the time out as you will want to stop mutliple times to take in the views and spend some time on the beaches.
great free attraction in sydney. great walk, and lots of opportunity to go for a swim. Also great during the annual sculptures by the sea art installation walk.

Great day trip!. Beautiful scenery and lots of opportunities for pictures. This walk is one of the best things I've done since moving to Sydney. We stopped for lunch at one of the small beaches. They had a BBQ lunch that day with sausages and burgers. Bring water and hats. Such a great day! Will be doing this again with visitors.
warm place. i just came in the wrong season. but i love their activity in the beach. the sand os diferent and i can see many lifeguard train in their area.

In any weather a great walk. This has to be one of the best walks around Sydney. Following the coast, it provides an outstanding scene at every turn, and regardless of the weather, it is truly magnificent.
Best on Sunny Day. Lovely location best visted on sunny day - beach view spectacular but South Coast (Jervis Bay) better

Paradise. We walked from Bondi to Bronte and even that short walk (about a mile) was BEAUTIFUL. The path throughout the cliffs offers spectacular views. We had lunch at a wonderful cafe in Bronte and took our walk back to Bondi Beach. It's hard to imagine that Bondi is just a few miles from "downtown" Sydney.

A beautiful walk along the coast. I did this walk twice from our hotel in Coogee Beach, each time early morning, once starting just before sunrise. That was a beautiful time for the walk as you get early morning light along the rocks and waves coming in. Great sights along the way to Bondi.
So refreshing!. Love this walk, really fresh and sometimes you can see dolphins in the ocean! Its best in the morning and in the summer time. End with a coffee or a smoothie at Coogee. Perfect!
Another must do but don't do it in the midday sun. I live at Bondi and try to do this every second or third weekend! I love it. The path is fairly easy except for one section of stairs.
Nice coastal walk. This is a good coastal walk to do if you have the time, spend a morning following the trail and seeing the beaches around. If this is too long I suggest the Cremore point walk.

Don't miss this when in Sydney. This is a walk on which I take all visitors to Sydney. It helps that I live not far from Coogee beach. I'd recommend starting at Coogee and ending at Bondi where you can have coffee and a gelato at the Pompeii Restaurant to put back any weight you may have inadvertently lost. The walk runs along the sandstone cliffs abutting the ocean and on a sunny day it is just lovely. You will also travel through a range of beaches as well. It is a great introduction to Sydney lifestyle and should not be missed.

World class walk. I have been on this walk, say 20 times, and I still don't tire of it. It takes about 2 hours and is a bit hilly but if you take your time you will be rewarded with fantastic views and fresh sea air. In the winter, perhaps it is best to start from the Coogee end. If you are in Sydney City you should catch the Route 374 bus to Coogee beach and then commence your walk.Once reaching Bondi Beach you could stop in at the Bondi Icebergs for a meal or a drink, or you could extend your trip by catching the bus to Watsons Bay and then catching the ferry to Sydney.All in all a wonderful day, hard to beat anywhere in the world that I have visited.
Views, views and more views!. Great walk, only 45 minutes but fun especially when the surf is up! Easy walk but suggest you start at Coogee beach and head to Bondi and end up for lunch at Icebergs.

Stunning coastal scenery. We started at Coogee and walked to Bondi in about an hour and a half, and the whole experience was amazing. it was a warm day but with a breeze - probably the best kind of weather but it would be awesome not matter what the weather - probably even rainy and cold! Each beautiful was stunning and different to see, it's an amazing opportunity to take photos or just enjoy the sea air and scenery. It's an incredible strip of the coast and a good workout, plus it's free! You'll need a drink with you as it has some steeper parts, but it isn't a challenging walk unless you decide to scramble over some of the rocks! Amazing and highly recommended whilst you are in Sydney.

A Must Do!. This was our first trip to Sydney and everyone had recommended this walk. It is better than I ever could have imagined and it is something all travelers should attempt to do. We took a bus to Bondi from downtown which was quite convenient. The walk is quite easy and the scenery and views are spectacular!!! Stop for a bite to eat or drink along the way as there are small shops along the area. A great picture taking adventure.

Easy Walk, Beautiful Views. We reversed the walk and started in Coogee Beach, where we arrived by city bus. It was a nice, sunny Sunday morning, and the weather was cool and crispy. The walk had quite a bit of ups and downs, some on dirt paths, others on stairs, concrete or asphalt, but it never got very demanding (compared to Cinque Terre). There were many other walkers going on both directions, and several picturesque spots with great views.We reversed the walk because we wanted to have lunch in Bondi, and we were glad we did that. It is a quick and easy way to see several beaches, and highly recommended if you have a few hours in Sydney.

Great walk. We actually did the Bronte to Bondi Beach walk. It was a beautiful Sunday morning with warm temps. Lots of people around. Probably about 1.5 miles at the most. We started at the very old cemetery in Bronte that sits on the water. beautiful setting with palm trees. I know it sounds a little morbid to visit a cemetery, but you can learn a lot about the area and the people that settled this area.

Beautiful beach.. This beach is a sight to behold. From the beautiful sand and breaking waves to the beautiful topless sun tanned women on the beach. Very busy place even in the fall. They even have a TV show about the lifeguards of Bondi Beach.

breathtaking views. This walk is a must do if you're in Sydney. Takes about two hours to go from one end to the other. I recommend going from Bondi to Coogee as the walk is a little easier that way. We did it on a Saturday and ended in Coogee and one of the pubs there was doing a free barbeque...added bonus! Walk allows you to see the best of Sydney's coastline and is great for pictures. Absolutely beautiful!!

An ABSOLUTE must. We did this walk in early May so the temperature was just right. As the coastal road snakes round, its literally jaw-dropping view after jaw-dropping view. Take something to drink as there aren't many places to buy snacks etc along the way (part of the walk's charm)
Do it!. Beautiful walk next to and above the beaches. Fabulous views, good exercise (up and down hills and stairs).

a morning walk. Very good walk, not so accessible for wheel chairs or elderly I'm afraid but spectacular views for those who can make it. A few steps but not too difficult. A cafe mid way at Bronte beach.

Fun walk. This is a great walk to do. You can make it as long or as short as you like. It does get VERY busy on the weekend, so prepare to wait at points. It was great that most people tried to be polite about letting runners go passed - which means you can't always walk side by side chatting. Stunning views.

Great views, too many people. Did this on a Saturday morning and there were people everywhere. The views were lovely; however it was frustrating stopping to wait to pass slower people or just the backlog when going up stairs.

One of the great urban coastal walks. This walk can be done in either direction and is a particularly fun thing to do during the Sculpture by the Sea festival. Parking can be difficult to find, so better to do it earlier in the morning on a sunny day before the crowds arrive (especially on the weekend). Mid-week, it is much quieter. The views are superb :-) There are nice, though not cheap, beach-side cafes at either end of the walk.

A relaxing morning. It was more than nice to walk along one of the most beautiful beach walk at Bondi. Just about 30 minutes from Sydney CBD by public transport and you escape from the crowded city.Bondi has a long beautiful beach. The sea is perfect for those who like surfing. There're many nice cafe along the beach as well.

Great walk, great views. This is a very enjoyable and easy walk to do. One should always include this as part of their Sydney itinerary. The views are breathtaking and the beaches very clean and swimmer friendly. The infrastructure at each beach is also very impressive. The Waverley Cemetery, which one passes just prior to reaching Coogee is another unique and unforgettable experience. Simply a must do!!
Delightful walk. Billed as the most beautiful harbour walk, it was a bit suburban for our tastes. You have to beware of reckless joggers. Regular drinking water fountains.

Great scenic walk - must do when in Sydney. Beautiful coastal walk from Bondi to Coogee, going past some of Sydney's most famous beaches! Great to go for a swim during the walk. When the whale season is on you can see whales swimming by from the coastal views.

amazing views for all fitness levels. This is a long coastal walk between two beaches. Small patches of it are disrupted by road but it's mostly continuous. It's marked well and although quite hilly you take it at your own pace and take as little or long as you need. It's worth the views.

Its free, its gorgeous and its only in sydney. Have brunch or lunch at one of the fab cafes in bronte, before or after this walk. its so much fun, crystal blue waters and a fabulous unique experience. You do need to be able to climb stairs - and watch out for the joggers, who can get upset about sharing the footpath.

Stunning. We did the first part of the walk from Bondi to Bronte Beach. It was simply stunning, and my friend who has studied geology was fascinated by the rock formations as we walked. If you pack some food, there are great spots to sit, eat and enjoy the view. There are places along the way to purchase food or use the bathroom.

Great way to spend a day (well, a few hours). First did this in 2006 when I first visited Sydney, and we walked Coogee to Bondi. On revisiting Sydney in 2013 we did it again, but this time in the other direction. It's a really lovely walk, fantastic views, it's obviously a little up and down in places because it's coastal but all in all it's a relatively easy walk. It took us about 90 minutes but I think we're quite fast walkers. If you have children with you who want to stop and look at lots of things en route it could easily take much, much longer. If you don't fancy doing the full thing you could stop at one of the beaches in the middle (Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly) and there are buses that run from each of these suburbs back to Sydney centre. Thoroughly recommend. It's also fun to play a game of "'if I won the lottery I would buy that house" en route!

Great way to enjoy the natural beauty of Sydney away from the "city". My husband and I took the bus from Circular Quay to Bondi on New Year's Eve Day. What a fantastic way to enjoy the outdoors before that evening's festivities! The public transportation is pretty simple and you don't even need to switch buses. You can take it straight to the beach from downtown Sydney. Once in Bondi, we took a few minutes to walk on the beach, watch the surfers, take some pictures, and put our toes in the ocean (freezing!). Then we embarked on the approximately 5K paved trail from Bondi to Coogee Beach. The walk passes by dramatic cliff views on the way through a few small beaches full of local Syndeysiders enjoying the holiday. It even passes by one of the most scenic cemeteries I've ever witnessed. Overall, the walk is a perfect (and free) way to see the natural coastal side of Sydney. It didn't seem like the walk was just for tourists either; we saw groups of locals jogging and working out along the trail.

Bondi Coastal Walk. Awesome views, nice breezes to cool you down, beautiful beaches and a lot more. The downside being that there are limited signs about wheelchair/pram accessibility. It is possible to pass the walk, partially through streets and graveyard, with these devices but not along the actual walk itself.
Stunning!. Unparalleled perspective on Sydney's eastern beaches and coves. Pack a picnic if you want to avoid some expensive eating joints and perhaps go mid week to avoid the weekend crowds.
Stunning walk. Beautiful walk up along the cliffs. Some stunning beaches along the way. Well worth the walk. Highly recommended.
Unbeatable views. What's not to like, awesome views, top quality track. This walk should be a must do when in Sydney. Talk your camera and swimmers, a dip with the Icebergs is a bucket list must!

A great walk to the Fish & Chip shop. We did this walk in reverse from Coogee to Bondi. In our opinion it is the way to go providing you with your first stunning views of Bondi Beach. There are some splendid beaches on the route and it is an easy walk rewarding you with excellent coastal scenery. Don't miss the waves at Bondi and finish with award winning fish and chips on the esplanade.

Best way to enjoy the sea views of Sydney. It's beautiful - the scenic walk is lovely. There are few hills and ups and down so be careful.It's long - It's not stroll in the park. You better be fit or prepared to do it at a gentle pace.Must be done on a sunny, warm and clear day - It's no fun on a wet cold day. So pick up a nice sunny day to do this.
