Not to be Missed. One of the great coastal walks, anywhere, and it's free. You can take a bus to Coogee, and walk back to Bondi, enjoy lunch at Icebergs, and take the bus back to Circular Quay...Round trip, $7.20...

Stunning views love this walk. I did this walk with a girlfriend on a girls weekend away. The whole walk is just full of stunning rugged scenery and beautiful beaches to stop for a quick swim. Took about 2 hours to complete the walk but finished with a lovely lunch and well earned beer at the end. Well worth doing. There were a few tough bits with quite a few steps but we are not the fittest and took our time. Not too bad.

Very beautiful!!. It is a nice walk, as well as other walks between beaches, and It has a wonderful view!!! Well, be prepared to walk for at least 30 to 40 minutes, including stairs and ramps, but it worths! Just bring you camera, the view is amazing...
Breathtaking. How wonderful to be able to walk along this path any old day of the week...exploring numerous neighborhood beaches and coves and experiencing the enormity of the sea beside you...

Nice Sights. This walk gives you a perfect feel for the coastal and beach area around Sydney as well as the typical neighborhood. We were also lucky to spot quite a lot of animals, from parrots to lizards and depending on time of the year nice flora and blossoms. The walk is not too demanding, if you are used to walking for an hour or two. Should wear firm shoes though.
must do. Catch bus to Coogee Beach and walk to Bondi. One of the worlds great walks. Take your time have a coffee part of the way or even lunch before continuing

One of the best walks you will do in your life. This really is a great sight-seeing walking tour which will give you some good exercise too. In the expensive city of Sydney, the views on this walk are free. There are stairs to climb and some slight hills, but almost anyone can make it. I think it is about 5 kilometers or 3.5 miles. Great photo opportunities. Bring water.For the rugged, you can swim at Bondi Beach to start, Tamarama Beach, and then Coogee Beach - a very different experience at each beach. Your backpack will be pretty safe while you swim - the Aussies are pretty honest. Tourists without a vehicle can get the train from Central Station to Bondi Junction and then the bus to Bondi Beach. Follow the heard of people dressed in beach gear. Have lunch at Bondi and then be on the walk heading south. At the end you get the bus from Coogee Beach back to where you started.
One of the best walks in the city.. This showcases what is wonderful about Sydney. The walk is enjoyable and there are many options for coffee breaks along the way.

Gorgeous walk! Wear a hat if it's a hot day.. We walked from Coogee to Bondi. What a great walk! Bring a hat, some water and a camera. At the end when you get to Bondi, hang at the beach or have lunch at The Bucket List. The walk is six kilometres long and takes about about two hours. http://www.sydney.com/destinations/sydney/sydney-east/bondi/attractions/bondi-to-coogee-coastal-walk
Stunning beach walk. Absolutley beautiful beach walk, well sign posted, frequent water fountains and information points. Well maintained. An absolute must.

Try to keep your eyes on the path and not just the view. This walk has to be one of the best around. The view is amazing out to sea and towards the grand homes overlooking the ocean. The walk has plenty of stairs and hills to give you an excellent work out. At any time of day there is always people getting their daily fix of sea air and exercise. This is a must if you visit Bondi and surrounds.

Must do. What a beautiful walk. Easy going, too, so pretty much anyone can do it. Liked seeing all the beautiful Aussie's jogging by and watching the surfers on the waves. Take your bathers so that you can get in the ocean pool along the cliffs. Quite breathtaking!

Great day out. Bring your walking shoes and sun cream as this walk is longer tgan it seems. Some of the bedt coastal views you can find in the area. This walk is highly recommended. Many bays to stop at on the way, which are less crowded.

Just the best. A distinctly unique FREE and wonderful experience. Walking along that part in the late of a summer's evening, with a beautiful south-westerly summer breeze coming off the ocean is simply orgasmic

tough walk especially in heat. a great workout walk. each bay changes as you come across it.
stop for lunch at bronte cafes (especially Q at the end)
Coogee is also a fantastic beach, bronte big swell and bondi famous
Should be on everybody's bucket list. Scenic, up and down, with a few spare milion pick your new Sydney coastal home, no such thing as a bad beach in Sydney!
A Great Walk for Visitors. On a sunny day this walk would be among the best in the World especially when the Sculptures are on display
Fantastic views. We walked this at a leisurely pace and enjoyed a stop for lunch. There are quite a few steps to negotiate but they are certainly worth it to experience the views.
Just like England. Stunning scenery and lovely little seaside towns which look just like English seaside till you remember it is 28 degrees C.

Bondi beach and Lifeguards. I have always thought to go to Bondi Beach would be exciting and I was able to go. Beautiful beach, great white sand, and amazing beach town. The lifeguards were training volunteers that day and what a great sited. A must see while in Sydney

great walk good veiws. very good walk good paths great views a lot to to see along walkway.nice coffee shop at clovelley beach,safe beach for small kids.very clean.Big carpark at clovelley if do not to walk the whole bus stop in carpark also

Sydney Icon Walk. Lived in Sydney all my life and was often asked have I walk were most people from overseas have walked it was a hot day so I would recommend to do this walk during winter but it is a must do on the bucket list
Amazing views. The best you can do on a spring or autumn afternoon!! The beaches are incredibly beautiful and the views from the cliffs are just perfect!!

Take a camera!. ....or don't depending on how much time you have. I tried cramming this in from about 6pm or so onwards, knowing that when I arrived in Coogee it would be dark- it was. Do what I didn't do, and take swimmers so you can invest time in each beautiful beach you pass, go earlier than I did do that you are not just missioning through the 2 hours, rather taking your time and enjoying one of the best walks that Australia has. And prepare for a little bit of uphill if you're not too much of a walker.
Stunning!. We only walked a part of the way, as it was an impromptu decision. Absolutely stunning! Can get very busy, so choose your time!

Getting Exercise with a Fabulous view. What could be better? Having a good workout (steps & hills) as well as a 360 degree of the beautiful scenery? The ocean changes constantly enabling you to forget you're just working on your fitness.

Beutiful views. I did this walk 3 times as it is so beautiful and there is lots to see. It is even more spectacular when the sea is rough. Stop at one of the beaches for a swim on the way and take a picnic to consume on one of the clifftops - magic!

Stunning views. My daughter and I walked from Coogee to Bondi. Bit difficult to work out where the walk started at Coogee at first. Views are stunning, need to make sure you take your camera. Lots of steps to climb so need to make sure you have comfortable shoes. Quite a few coves or beaches that you could stop off at but as we were meeting the rest of our group in Bondi we did not stop except to get ice cream at one of the beach bars. Lots of people were running the route but this did not cause any problems for us. Would recommend this to anyone who is energetic. We beat one of the hostel groups but were overtaken by a guy of about 70 - he looked super fit and probably does the walk every day!!! Some lovely houses along the way to look at enviously - they must be worth a fortune with the views they have.

Sydney Beach and Cliff Walk with Fabulous Views. When we go to Sydney we go on this walk - it's paved and railed and is an exhilarating way to see Sydney beaches and cliffs and some lovely houses along the way.

Sydney's best coastal walk.. This is the most beautiful sight seeing tour you can do in Syndey absolutely free. Whether you live here or are just visiting it is something to be enjoyed by all, however you must be moderately fit as there is plenty of stairs and moderate hills to climb. You can spend the entire day navigating your way from Bondi and enjoy the lovely beaches or a picnic enroute to Coogee or just a few hours for the 6km treck.
Not to be missed. Beautiful walk and lovely way to spend an afternoon. Nice cafes in Clovelly to stop at on the way too.
Great views. It's narrow pathway is crowed by runners with earphones thumping past you. As you are weaving up and down stairs and along windy pathways, the view is spectacular.
World class walk. Spectacular views of the coast, with good quality path and not too strenuous. The walk can be broken off at Tamarama or Bronte, with buses available from both locations.
Nature and Art. The pleasure of that lovely walk is enhanced by the annual art exhibition staged by the sculptors. A real treat.

Love the Sydney coastline. We did the walk starting from Coogee beach this time. Beautiful and well-marked trail takes you along the cliffs and beaches of this stunning coastline. Sydney is a great city, but the true beauty is its lovely coastline, bays and beaches. Only made it to Clovelly this time where we stopped for lunch at the seasalt cafe. Was with friends who live in Manly, they have amazing beaches at their feet but they were stunned by the beauty of this location. Possibility to swim in many spots and rock pools along the way.
Great Fine Weather Walk. Return trip only for the healthy with great cafes at Bronte on the way. Limited access for person's with a disability so best idea to drive to vantage points.

This walk never ceases to amaze me.. I've been living right next to the Coogee part of the walkway for over five years. I've done the walk though sun and rain, alone and with friends, seen whales, dolphins and seals. some of the highlights? watching the sunrise during whale migration season (twice a year humpbacks and other whales pass on by). Doing the Sculpture by the Sea (Tamarama Beach to Bondi Beach for a couple of weeks in November every year) - do it early in the morning or on a week day though - it gets hugely busy on the weekends of the event. Two cautions though - this is not only a walking trail, runners use this trail frequently - be aware of them! The other caution is that parts of the trail are a bit narrower, I have found that when everyone shares the walkway, it's a much better experience for all, especially when it's a busy weekend. And don't forget to bring your swimsuit for a lovely dip in the pools along the way!
Lovely Walk. A nice relaxing walk, not for people with any sort of knee problems as there are a couple of steep stairs. All in all a lovely experience.

Spectacular coastal walk in Sydney. Great walk for all the family, with plenty of places to stop & take in the fresh air and scenery. Walked both ways & either end has great cafes to replenish the stores. It is a great walk in all seasons.

Took the dog for a walk. Gob smacking coastal views, Bronte to Clovelly is the best. My pooch didnt like the see through cantilevered walk way past the cemetery as her little paws and nails got stuck in the unusual grate like decking platforms, but I loved it (yes I picked her up).

Best beaches in the world. Bondi beach and Coogie beach are simply stunning. A must visit on your next trip to Sydney. Take a swim, stroll or simply stroll along the foreshore and dine in one of the many magnificent restaurants. A visit to The Coogie Bay hotel is a must.
Great walk - go early as can get crowded. You can walk slowly or jog this coastal walk. Go earlier to avoid the crowds. Can be slippery if it is raining.

Spectacular views. We actually just walked from the north end of Bondi Beach (stopping for lunch at Iceberg Club) and then cliff walked to Bronte Beach. The walk took about 2 hours and the views were spectacular. Thankfully, we had a breeze off the ocean as it was sunny and hot that day.

One of the most beautiful walks in the world. This short cliffside walk is the highlight of visiting Bondi Beach, and it makes the trek out to Bondi well worth the effort. If you ride a bike to Bondi, lock it up securely and then do the walk in both directions. Much easier than trying to carry your bike up several flights of stairs and along narrow pathways. Try to do this walk on a weekday -- Weekends are very busy.

beautiful walk. great sights, great for keen photographers, take a bottle of water and sun cream with you and beach stuff if you wish to stop for a swim! those who liek to keep fit its worth running here and there are some built in pull up bars etc along the way!

A Test but Doable. We walked from Bondi to Coogee and, though we made it all the way, the steps were a challenge for four late-60s travelers. Be sure to have hats and sunblock and water. By all means use the excellent public transportation available from Circular Quay in Sydney.

Terrific views. This is a most exhilarating walk with breathtaking views and all made easier with steps and rails to hold on.About an hour and a half .Stop for coffee at Clovelly cafe on the way.Watch the bowlers at the cliff topClovelly bowling club Good for coffee here too.

Well - it's BONDI, nice but not spectacular. Everyone told me to go there. Well, I've been there and it was nice. Not more, not less. Its' a beach and honestly, I can't understand the hype. If you want waves, there are better beaches, if you want scenery, there are better ones, too. And it's really expensive at the beach front, so be prepared

Excellent way to enjoy the coast. This well marked walkway is a great way to see part of the coastline around Sydney and very accessible. It is very pleasant to spend time walking by the sea and it took us around 2 1/2 hrs to walk from Bondi to Coogee. We caught a bus from central Sydney that took us all the way to Bondi, then also returned by bus from Coogee.
great walk. had this planned for our trip and we were not dissapointed. it was a great day. would definitely do it again.
for non -surfers. We did part of this walk, not wanting to surf or fry on the beach. But as we failed to find the bus stop for our return we had to walk back the same way!

Excellent, easy walk. This is one of the nicest walks in Sydney.It's really easy with public transport options at both ends. (Hate driving to Bondi..can never seem to find parking easily, especially if something like Sculpture by the Sea or similar event is on).In whale watching season, keep a lookout , especially in spring, good chance of seeing whales very close by.Lovely vistas, fantastic sandstone natural sculptures, great beaches, and of course Bondi attracts the weird and wonderful by the coach loadIf visiting Sydney, this really should be a must do..on a fine day.

Scenic coastal walk - fresh air & sunshine!. Beautiful coastal walk and nice to escape the crowds at Bondi. The pathway is great but be aware there are steps and steeper inclines so it's not suited for baby buggies, or for those people who are less mobile.There are excellent scenic views, fitness stations along the way for the fitness fanatics to perfect their push-ups (sadly, not me!), water pumps to refill your water bottles and great little beaches to stop off at. You can even stop on the way for a coffee. We like Bronte Beach for family as it's a good sized beach with a shaded playground, BBQ's, enough room for a picnic, beach cafeteria and toilets.Walk the walk and enjoy some fresh air and sunshine!

when we first met..... My partner and I met here 2008 :-) we still come here often and go down the beaches to go for a swim. Its best to go when its really nice weather especially during the summer:-)
Enjoyable exercise. Great views. While the walk is well layed out there are quite a lot of steps and hills which less able/fit may struggle with.
One of the best free things to do in Sydney. Such a great walk on a nice sunny day - gives you a chance to check out all the different beaches, and pick your favourite to head back to for a swim.

A most do while your in Sydney. This walk is a great adventure, we walked from Coogee to Bondi. The track goes up to hing lookout points down to lovely beaches. The colors of the stones are fantastic and the swmming pools and rock pools are great to swim in. I think you mist something if you did not do this amazing walk.

Beautiful Walk. We reversed our trip and did the Coogee to Bondi walk in hopes of avoiding some of the steeper inclines. This has to be one of the most beautiful and scenic walks in the world. We stopped at a cafe in Bronte for a delicious iced latte. Give yourself a lot of time for this walk as you will want to stop every few minutes to take pictures.

A beautiful but easy cliff-top walk. So you've seen Bondi Beach (as you had to), now what ? Well go to the southern end of the beach and pick up the coastal path. This is a scenic but not difficult cliff-top path. You'll go through Tamarama Bay (a lovely little cove with its own sandy beach) before you reach Bronte. This is larger than Tamarama but smaller than Bondi, with again a beautiful sandy beach backed by a little grassy park. There are benches to sit and enjoy the setting. Refreshment is available and you can get the bus back to Sydney city centre (Hyde Park) from here too. You can continue on to Coogee, but we didn't.

Put this on your Bucket List!!!. We did this 2 hour walk and managed to fill almost one whole memory card on my camera. The views are amazing, from Bondi, through to Tamarama, Bronte Beach, Clovelly Beach and then through a cemetery to the destination, at which there is a pub conveniently located for a beer or other drink. There are some sections which leave one a bit breathless, but overall, it is truly spectacular and not to be missed.

Fun exercise with friends. What a beautiful way to exercise with friends in Sydney. In November the sculptures by the sea is on. This increases the volume of people going along the walk but most people are in good spirits. Worth the walk

See another side of Sydney. There is more to Sydney than the Bridge, Opera House and Darling Harbour and this is one of the best examples. A walk between two beaches along a cliff sounds like a medium grade day at best, but the walk is full of beautiful small bays to stop at, each with a different character. The views are fabulous, coffee along the way is good and the arrival into Bondi is spectacular.

Lovely views. We did the walk backwards from Coogee to Bondi as the bus queue to Coogee from Bondi Junction was a lot shorter than the one to Bondi Beach. The walk isn't too hard, but the scenery is really nice. The beaches were fairly crowded as it was a hot summer's day, so we stopped for a swim at Gordon's Bay, a nice little inlet near Clovelly, which had a lot less people there.Despite the heat, we all finished the walk without any trouble taking in the odd refreshment spot on the way which made for a very enjoyable afternoon.

Magnificent. Wow, this is a must when in Sydney. I can't say enough about the scenery, the views, the clean and beautiful beaches and the amazing surfers. You can catch a bus from any of the beaches once you walk inland back to Bondi junction or Circular quay.

Great views and people watching!!!. Absolute must for all Sydney siders and visitors. Awesome place to get exercising or take a rest on a park bench with a view across the ocean. Winter time I believe you can see the whales and the start of the yacht races. Also you may spot a few well known faces pounding the pavement too. Nice walk

Well worth the effort. Walk is only 3 km, very enjoyable can duck off to see the beaches if you want a dip in the ocean or have a drink and if you don't want to walk back there are plenty of buses. Can see why it's called Sydney's best walk. Hint buy a multi buy ticket if your here for a few days gives you bus, rail and ferry s you will soon get your money back.

Magnificant coast walk. Wonderful walk around several bays, taking in Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly and Coogee (or do it the other way round, as another reviewer has recommended). It's about 6km in total which can take 2 or 3 hours depending on how much time you want to spend looking at the scenery (and how hot it is!). It may be a strange thing to admire but a board walk takes you past Waverley Cemetery, which has to be one of the most scenic burial grounds in the world! I suspect it must have originally been chosen so that the dear departed would have a spectacular 'view' out to sea. If you're going to be laid to rest anywhere, I can't think of anywhere better.

Very nice. This is a great walk. Free, easy and beautiful. If I have any advice it is to eat in Coogee and not Bondi. Bondi has tourist level food. That is, bad and expensive. Coogee is less touristy. The restaurants have to please repeat customers. There is a cute seafood shack where the cliff side walk meets the road where you can catch the bus to Sydney .

Amazing Walk. Truely an unforgetable walk... i wouldnt say it was an easy walk but if you take your time and dont do it int he heat of the day its very enjoyable. Leave at least an hour and thats going at a reasonale pace without any stopping. I like to take my time and sit and look out at the sea... highy reccomend when sculptures by the sea is on

Great Walk!. Highly recommend taking this beautiful walk. I took a bus to the beach on an early Saturday morning and was amazed by all the people either walking or running, as well as the many people doing yoga and other group exercises on the beach. The views were fantastic, providing a nice alternative to downtown Sydney.
Amazing!. A must do for any visit to sydney, beautiful scenery, get a real feel for live in the eastern suburbs of sydney.

Essential! The best views of Sydney's coastline. Stunning walk that is an absolute must-see for visitors to Sydney. My recommendation; catch the 373 or 374 bus from Circular Quay and start the walk at Coogee. There's a great little cafe called Crumpet at the southern end of Coogee (on Havelock Avenue) if you want breakfast before you go. There are fresh water drinking fountains along the way, or if you want a bottled drink you'll find one at the Kiosks - there's one in Bronte and another at Tamarama and both sell cool drinks and ice-creams. There's a strip of cafe's just behind the beach at Bronte too where you can get fresh barista coffees, fish & chips and cafe-style breakfasts. The walk is great in spring and autumn as its not unbearably hot... and if you are planning to go anytime between November to February, take sunscreen and a hat and if you can, aim to finish the walk by 11am at the latest as there's no shelter on the walk (you can stop at Bronte or Tamarama to sit under trees - if you're lucky enough to find a spot!) and it gets too hot after 11 to enjoy comfortably. The walk takes around 90 minutes one-way, has some steep hills (Coogee to Gordons Bay and the final stretch between Tamarama and Bondi) and there are plenty of stairs, so it's not ideal for elderly or very young travellers - however the section between Bronte & Tamarama is fairly flat with only one set of stairs up from Bronte to the path, and another set down to Tamarama. Enjoy, and remember the sunscreen!
Relaxing. This walk took a little over two hours. The path well constructed and there a lot of beautiful views along the way.

Highly recommended, stunning!. This is a beautiful walk with great views over the Tasman sea, passing several very fine sandy beaches on the way. It's a 5km walk that you could probably do in a couple of hours but I took the best part of the day to do it and recommend doing that. You can stop to swim at some of the beaches (Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte, Coogee), watch the surfers (surprisingly fascinating) or have something to eat/drink on the way. It is worth stopping at Bondi Icebergs! The walk wasn't a quiet one - there was quite a stream of people doing it, especially between Bondi and Tamarama. The nearer I go to Coogee the less people there were on the path. There are plenty of places to stop for refreshments or the toilet. There is some up and down to the walk so you probably have to be reasonably able.I took the 380 bus from Circular Quay to Bondi beach and was glad I took it from there as the bus fast filled up and later down the line some passengers were turned away. It took about 40 minutes I think. I took the 373 bus back from Coogee.I was in Sydney towards the end of March for a business trip. I had the weekend on my own and chose to do this walk on the recommendation of my colleagues. I would definitely do it again, and don't regret using most of one of only two free days in Sydney to do this walk.

Coastal Classic. The Good: Great views of the Tasman sea and the nooks and crannies of the coast with Aussies at play doing surfing, volleyball, fishing and swimming.
The Bad: Too many people.

Easy Walk with Stunning Views. We caught the metro from the CBD to Bondi which was extremely quick, then a short bus ride (from inside the metro) to the ocean. The walk is well signposted with information along the way. There is a mix of concrete and wooden boardwalk all in excellent condition. Lots of steps!We didn't stop too many times for photos and it took just under two hours, the different bays were beautiful and you could easily spread it out over several hours with coffee stops etc along the way. Three good coffee shops at Coogee as reward for your walk.It was a fairly still day, although I understand it can get extremely windy along there, so a fleece might be a good idea outside of summer.Take plenty of water as I didn't see any water fountains along the way.Easy bus ride from Coogee beach back to the CBD every 20 minutes or so.We will allocate more time and keep going next time, fantastic walking away from the City.

Don't miss this one. We love bush walks and urban strolls and were blown away by this scenic, interesting urban coastal walk. You will meander through several gorgeous bays, a historic and stunning cemetery, and benches galore. There are water stations along the way and places for a bite to eat. We went the reverse route of most (Coogee to Bondi) and then took a bus to Watsons Bay and a ferry back to Sydney's Circular Quey. A great day.

Worth the Effort. Have walked this several times.Best time is when Sculptures by the Sea are being exhibited.The smaller beaches of Bronti ,Clovelly and Tamarama are all worth a visit. The are some steep steps in places.

Enjoyable exercise with fantastic scenery.. This is a fantastic scenic walk or jog route. The coastline is spectacular & you can stop off & swim in the many coves & outdoor pools en route. I did this walk in both directions a number of times & it never disappointed. The terrain is hilly in places & there are steps to be negotiated in some places so a fair degree of fitness is needed. It was one of the many highlights of my visit to Sydney. A great way to see the sights, get a good work out & see the active locals out & about.This is a great free activity which should be on your to do list.

Fabulous scenery! Must do walk!. We had a great time doing this walk and thought the beaches along the way were amazing! It was a lot longer than we had expected but it was still very enjoyable. This is a definite most do when you're in Sydney!

I love the place.... beach, nice people all arounds.. and also nice to stay in the Bondi Beach Apartment. always lots of people, actually I went there when Madigras anniversary is celebrating in NSW. you can have a course of the best surfing at Bondi.

Join the locals on this landmark cliff walk. Eastern Suburbs dwellers are well aware of this delightful walk that takes in all of the iconic south-of-the harbour Ocean beaches. A great way to blow away the cobwebs and if you are a visitor to Sydney it provides a wonderful opportunity to experience the rugged coastline. The walk is accessible in hundreds of places over its entire length so one can choose a section and just take in the power of the Pacific Ocean.
Best exercise route in Sydney. Whether you run or amble, you will love this walk. All of Sydney seems to do at least part of the walk. The views are spectacular.

Amazing scenery. As stated in many previous reviews, the Bondi beach is breathtakingly gorgeous and is well deserving of its #2 Things-to-do-in-Sydney status on TripAdvisor. White soft sandy beach next to cool rocky cliffs, and a public infiniti-style swimming pool. I would recommend coming in the early morning or late afternoon to avoid the strong mid-day Australian sun.
Spectacular!. A must! Take your time and enjoy the many little beaches and the beautiful view! The cemetery along the walk is quite the site.

Lovely Coastal Walk. On a sunny Morning we decided to do the Coastal Walk from Bondi to Coogee.. There's a Path which takes you all the Way there. Most of it was fairly easy going, there are a few steps and Hills but it was great Exercise and the scenery is lovely. On the walk you see Gordon's Bay, Concrete Clovelly, Bronte with its picnic grounds, Tiny Tamarama Beach, Bondi and Coogee. It's definitely worth doing while in sydney/Bondi/Coogee. Such a lovely way to pass the day.

Breathtaking scenary. I highly recommend doing this! Walking along the coast and getting a glimpse of what makes Sydney beaches one of the most amazing in the world. I recommend standing by the cliff face as the waves hit for a great photo - but be careful!

Walk the Coast, swim at Bronte. A fabulous way to spend part of the day. Highly recommend swimming at the seaside salt pool in Bronte as it has the most interesting interaction with the ocean. You can jump in there at the end of the walk and dry off on your walk back to Bondi ...

Awesome view. The view was amazing but I wished there were more benches and shaded picnic areas along the coastal walk as it could get really hot. There should be ramps to ease parents with strollers at the stairs.

Beautiful Views. Another must-do item while in Sydney. Just simply beautiful. Take a leisurely walk along the scenic path, stopping along the way to take pictures of some of Australia's famous beaches. Fabulous beaches, unusual rock formations, and rock pools where the waves pour over the edge. Don't miss it.
Walking besides the Pacific. I walked from Coogee to Bondi, brilliant walk with lots of views and atmosphere. Finishing at the stunning beach at Bondi is the best way to do this walk!
Relaxing. Another place to for sure after the Sydney harbour. try the Hop-On Hop Off bus from central station and they take you to bony beach... enjoy

Beautiful Walk. I walked all the way from Bondi to Maroubra. The walk to Coogee was a lot more crowded. From there it was almost like a private walk. The view along the coastal walk is absolutely stunning. There are no words to mention the view. I didn't stop too often and walked this route all by myself for 3 hours. I can do this walk many times and won't get bored by this. My legs were quite stiff after completing the walk but it was truly worth the effort!

Ocean side walk. On a sunny beautiful afternoon in Sydney do the Coastal Walk from Coogee to Bondi. (or vice versa) We had lunch at the pub in Coogee and felt like walking it off, so we set off for a lovely walk. Most of it was fairly easy going and the scenery is great. Through quaint Gordon's Bay, Concrete Clovelly (much better under water than above - take a snorkel), Beautiful Bronte with its picnic grounds, Tiny Tamarama Beach (known in Sydney as Glamarama - great spot for celeb spotting) and on to Bondi - Australia's most famous Beach. Another highlight along the way is Waverley Cemetry - final resting place of many a famous Australian, including Henry Lawson and Dorothea Mackellar
Great walk. We stopped at Clovelly Lawn Bowling Club for a couple of rounds. The weather wasn't great, but the walk was still fantastic!

Walk Coogee to Bondi instead!. A fantastic walk and a must for any visitor to Sydney. The only thing I'd change is to ignore all the recommendations of walking from Bondi to Coogee and do the walk in reverse. The best views are in the opposite direction. Start with brunch in Coogee at Barzura then do the beach walk. Take a detour through Waverly cemetary if you have time as it's just beautiful. When you come round the bend into Bondi you see the whole of Bondi Beach stretched out before you. it's a spectacular sight and well worth coming at after a long walk. The other big plus in doing the walk in this direction is that you can reward yourself with a couple of drinks at Bondi hotspot Icebergs in the surf lifesaving club.
Fabulous walk. Walk from Bondi to Coodgee, spent the day on the beach and walked back--about 6 k altogether. Fabulous walk, beautiful beaches...I want to retire there.

Worth The Bus Ride. Went for the day by bus and were wowed by the beach, coastal walk (only partly, I believe it is 7 miles) and the city. Do not each on the beach, go a block in where a little less pricey.
Great Walk. A really enjoyable walk which was easy to follow. We did the whole trip passing by some beautiful beaches.

Fab coastal walk over many little bays and beaches... 9Km easy walk, mostly over board pathways.. Beach hopping at its best.. You can start from either end.. All of the beaches along the way have many trendy restaurants so you can have a break along the way, or at the end.. Parking available at both ends..

Lovely walk.. We walked Bondi to Bronte as it was a hot day and we could not manage the full distance. The scenery was fantastic and it was a lovely walk. We were also limited to time but I would have loved to be able to walk the whole way. If you like walking and lovely scenery this is for you. It is well maintained too.

Windy, but great views. We had a day to spend near the airport before returning to North America. It was a warm, sunny, and very windy day, and we wanted to refresh our tans! We headed to Coogee, and really enjoyed our day there.Best to start at the Coogee Beach end of this walk. There's lots of free, unlimited time, parking just south of the beach along the foreshore.The path is fully paved, with lots of turn-outs to see the remarkable scenery. The most interesting sights are from the Coogee end, so if you get tired, you can turn around after an hour or so.Plenty of shops/restaurants/convenience stores in Coogee.There's also frequent public transportation (both buses and underground) to the Sydney CBD.Only had limited time to enjoy the experience, but glad that we did, despite the wind which sandblasted our legs!!!

A Great Walk Along the Ocean. This is an inexpensive way to take a romantic stroll, see some great coastal scenery, and get the flavor of Sydney. If you leave downtown Sydney in the morning, you can take one of the public busses for a ride through the city and suburbs to Bondi Beach. The walk from there to Coogee is one of the best coastal walks, with cliffs and surf, interesting rock formations, and several beaches along the way. The walk is generally very easy with a few somewhat steeper areas. There are several places along the way to choose from for a leisurely lunch. After reaching Coogee you can take a public bus back to Circular Quay. A great day at the shore that you will surely remember!

Worth it!. The first half of the walk is absolutely beautiful - really enjoyed the scenery and walking. The second half (after leaving Bondi and closer to Coogee) - not much to see, and you walk through some parking lots and residential areas. Would definitely recommend the Bondi Beach walk. Do it early in the morning (or even better - look up high tide) so you can watch the surfurs. I would recommend packing a lunch and just sitting on some of the beautiful cliffs that overlook the water - or maybe bring a book!
Nice scenic detour. easy walk taking in several beaches along the way. Nice cafes at Bondi and Coogee. Great for people watching especially on the weekend.

Scenic coastal walk. A great way to enjoy a few hours and see the rugged coast and surf beaches. The walkway is for the most part an easy paved stroll. My 70 year old (quite fit) mom and I did it in a leisurely 2 plus hours. Stopping for a swim in the final rock pool at Coogee. Easy bus access to Bondi on the 333,380 or 381 and a bus right from the beach back to the city centre. They go very regularly.

Watch the sunrise if you can. I did this walk many a time, with tourists and myself.The coastal walk affords you to take great pics and see the views of the ocean in a great way.You pass several other beaches (stop off for lunch or snorkelling in bronte beach) if you have time to stop and relax.The walk takes about an hour and on several occasions I would be at Bondi at 6am on a Sunday to walk to Coogee to take pictures of the sunrise and then treat myself to breakfast when I got to Coogee. Brilliant sunrises from the walk and very peaceful.A must do walkabout if no other!

Bronte to Bondi walk.. I do this twice a year - once to see Sculptures by the Sea and once for my friend, Jenny's birthday. Every time I do this walk I marvel at how beautiful Syney is and why don't I do this walk more often. Best part of the walk for me is the middle when we always go to Bondi Icebergs for their big brekkie - what could be more perfect - Sunday morning watching the surfers, the swimmers in Icebergs pool and the yoga class on the rocks. Sydney you are simply the best!

Coogee to Bondi way is better. I first done this 10 years ago and I loved it. So I came back on my honeymoon and did it again. I'd say its best to go from Coogee to Bondi but i dont suppose it makes much of a difference. The views are amazing. You could do it really slowly and make a full day of it and stop at the smaller beaches on the way like Bronte, Clovelly etc. Or you could do it like we did and it takes about 1hr 20-45mins. Its a great way to see different parts of Sydney. I would say start in The Coogee Bay Hotel and have a quick bite to eat and a soft drink then when you get to Bondi reward yourself with a few beers. Ideal day.

The real beauty of Sydney. Sydney is a big city and it is easy to begin to think of it only as that. However, there are real gems throughout the city that helped me to appreciate Sydney. Bondi beach and coastal walk top the list. Even though the weather was not great when we were there, we had a great walk with stunning views of the water and the ocean formed landscape. The walk is not too arduous but do wear comfortable shoes. There are some slopes and steps to climb but the walk is well maintained

Beautiful views. My friend and I did the coastal walk from Bondi Beach to Bronte Beach and back. It was gorgeous sunny weekday but there was still plenty of people on the walk. The are some beautiful views along the walk and even look out points where you can stop and take pictures. Definitely bring water, wear sunscreen, and put on the right shoes as there are uneven surfaces. It's a great way to workout and see the sights at the same time.
Gordons Bay, snorkeling point. Gordons Bay located Near Coogee Beach ( about 1km) is good snorkeling point.We saw Big blow groper.
What a beach - world class!. Just go and enjoy - easy to get to by train. Very beautiful and world class. Don't miss it if you get to Sydney.

Star from Watson's Bay. This is a great "urban" seaside walk with some spectacular views. Stop in Bronte Beach for lunch. And if you are fit and want an all day walk consider starting from Watson's Bay. Take the morning Ferry to Watson's and go from there. We are fit 60 somethings and only took a bus for part of the trip from Watson's to Bondee because the temp was over 30. You can always grab a bus to shorten your trip. There are washrooms and picnic sites at each beach.http://www.smashwords.com/books/view/228747

Great walk!. If sitting on the beach isn't enough for you - try this coastal walk. Bondi to Coogee is excellent and interesting - lots of in and out and up and down. Cafés along the way as well. If you go south from Coogee, only the first section is good, so give up when the path leaves the coast.

Great walk along beautiful headlands. You should do this walk passing beautiful beaches and waterfront towns/restaurants. Great views a cross beautiful coves and always fun watching the surfers at the beaches

A great walk along stunning coast. This walk is one of Sydney's treasures. The rock formations along the coastline are beautiful and the different beaches along the way all have a totally different character. At the end of October and beginning of November there is a wonderful Sculpture By the Sea display from Bondi to Tamarama Beach which is a fabulous experience. But it can get very crowded. It is best to do on a weekday if you have the choice. But everyone is usually happy and helpful so the runners and art lovers are all accommodating. The Bondi Icebergs Club is a nice place to stop at the Bondi end of the walk. The rock pool there is where the courageous swim every day winter and summer.

Spectacular views. This is our favorite Sydney walk, and for good reason. There is nothing to compare to the gorgeous views as you walk along the cliffs. Even at a slow pace, with time to stop and savor the views, it takes less than two hours. It's best on a weekday, because there are fewer fellow walkers. And if you can plan it during Sydney's Sculpture by the Sea exhibition, you will have a special memory. We prefer to do the walk starting at Coogee, so we can end the walk at the bar in Iceberg's in Bondi.

The Finest Coastal Walk in the World!. This is an absolute must-do for any visitor to Sydney!Take a bus to famous Bondi Beach and walk south on the Esplanade along this incredible coastal path to glamorous Tamarama Beach, usually littered with beautiful people! Then continue on through Bronte (popular with surfers), through the Waverley Cemetery (expensive oceanfront real estate), Clovelly , Gordon's Bay and finish up at Coogee Beach. Coogee has plenty of beachfront bistros and several hotels for cool refreshments after an unforgettable walk. Frequent bus connections will return you to the CBD at the end of your day ... enjoy!

keep to the left !. Just remember to always keep TO THE LEFT hand side of the pathway, like all the locals do. And overtake on the right. If you remember this simple rule at all times in Australia, whether on the roads, footpaths, pavements, trails and escalators, everyone's life will be much easier !
Bondi walk. Nothing to dislike. Whale watching station...June is the month ! Fabulous views of the ocean, and beautiful properties to look at.

Must do!. Check out the pool below Iceberg Bondi. Never seen anything like it. Some amazing rock formations. And who can get tired of walking beside the ocean...even for someone who went to Newport Beach CA most of his young adult life.

Handsdown my favourite sydney activity. can not be missed - even better when Sculptures by the sea is on... beware the exercise highway early morning if you are just out for a leisurely sight see and vice versa if you want to pay some penance, avoid weekend middle of the day. Any which way just make sure you go.

Great walk. wonderful walk very busy lots of people as it was a weekendfelt a bit crowded and watch out for skates (zoom zoom) people were good humoured so no problemsSea breeze and not to hot would not like to do in mid summer but great in August.Lots to see ships and surfers and a very full beach

Highly recommended. Stunning views.Very relaxing and beautiful area Highly recommended.If you want to see Sydney at it's best and have enjoyement with a beautiful view on a sunny day ,this is a walk that shouldn't be missed.
Very relaxing. No dislikes. Both areas are ideal for a relaxing holiday whether be for swimming,sunbathing or walking

Stunning Views.. We did not cover the whole length. We walked from Bondi to Brote to and fro. The views are stunning. Very good photo opportunities. We saw a lot of locals jogging and doing exercises. They are the luckiest people to have an opportunity to jog in a place like that regularly. It is also the only place we had been in Sydney where directions are given clearly.

A beautiful Walk. A sunny day, a hat & a great walk along this seaside walk taking in great views with cafes & restaurants around most corners if you could drag yourself away from the views. A excellent way to build an appetite!

excillent walk. I do half way walk but it is lovely walk. nice walk path, nice view and the beach very clean when you are walking the wind help you not feel tired or exhauted... Now I can understand while many people from australia ask me about do exercises in Vietnam when they ask how many km you walk everyday? It made me so surprised when they ask but after this trip I know walk with km is normally in this country. in Vietnam if we walk about 500 meters you will not do that...

Wonderful coastal walk. This walk is a lovely escape from the bustle of Sydney and even bondi when it is busy. Do it during the week if you can so there are fewer people. But whenever you go the scenery is beautiful and the views stunning. I have heard, although I didn't see it myself that dolphins have been spotted. The walk is of medium intensity to an average person with places to sit and enjoy the views.
OK. If you just have a few days, skip this one. See it from a ferry. A beach is a beach is a beach, and there are so many interesting harbors around Sydney.
Fantastic walk. Started early on a sunny morning. Gorgeous scenery, fantastic views, a really 1st class lunch at Iceberg Bondi as a reward at the end of the round trip.
Worth every step. If you have a couple of hours, I definitely recommend this walk. If you get hot, jump in the water at one of the coves or beaches. The views are amazing!
Lovely walk along beatutiful coastline. If you have difficulty walking probably not for you as the coast walk has a lot of steep parts and stairs but if you are reasonably fit its a lovely walk.

A fabulous way to see Sydney's best beaches. This is one of the best ways to see Sydney's best beaches.If you are in the city, take a bus to Coogee to start your walk. We always stop half way at Bronte to have morning tea or lunch, then continue our journey to Bondi Beach. Then catch a bus back to the city.The walk can take up to 3 hours. It is a must to take sunscreen, a hat and lots of water. We always do the walk in the morning as around noon and later it can get very hot, especially in late spring and summer. There are lots of stairs in some places so make sure you have some level of fitness.Look in local guides for dates of when Sculptures by the Sea is on, and this art can be seen from around Tamarama to Bondi beach.Make sure you take your camera, the sights are devine!

Walk to your eyes content!. The walk from Bondi (pronounced bond-eye) Beach to Coogee is popular for good reasons. It is a lovely beach, true, but it is the walk along the coastline that is gorgeous every step of the way, (About 3 miles.) The path meanders along the coast past cliffs and intriguing sandstone rock formations hugging the coastline. We thought about stopping at the Icebergs Club for lunch, which is a swimming pool/club restaurant built right over the water and the pool is filled with the ocean waves that crest the pool, but continued back to Bondi and had lunch on the outside patio of the Bondi Hotel directly across the street from the main beach. We reached Bondi Beach by bus, which provided us a tour of Sydney outside the central business district/harbor area. The bus there was an express bus, while the return bus made a lot of stops, so ask someone before boarding unless you want the snail bus. However you get to the beach, just do it!

Why sydney is so appealing. This a walk most people can do and it shows you why life by the ocean in Sydney is so good. Go early to avoid the heat and people (sometimes) and enjoy swiiming in each bay as you go.Here you can experience "City by the sea" life at it's best.

Icebergs pool closed & discovered Coastal Walk to Bronte. A neighbor had suggested I go to the Icebergs club/pook at Bondi. I got there on a Thursday morning and it was closed for cleaning! The nice hostess suggested the Coastal Walk on to the Bronte Beach pool built in the rocks. I'm glad it was closed now! Some of the most spectacular views on the whole trip.
Great Walk. What a cool place--great walk and awesome beach even when the weather was less than perfect (windy and had some rain). Don't miss this beautiful place!
Relaxing sight of the sea. This is a refugee of the noisy town! Must be prepared to go up and downstairs, but it is easy to access

Spectacular Eastern Coastline. One deffinate treasure of Sydney, a must do for any visitor (or local!). I enjoy this walk at least once every few months. Very busy on weekends, so not the best for serious joggers as can be quite frustrating.

very beautiful scenery along this walk. I have done this walk a few times and it is perhaps one of the most beautiful walks in the world walking along the cliffs in Bondi and Bronte Beach but dont do the walk in summer as its too hot to walk but then again you can always stop and have a swim at the various beaches along the way
Easy walk but not recommended in the rain. The walk is even and supplying great views over bondi beach. It was spectator yesterday because the sea was very rough with waves breaking over the rocks

Beautiful way to start a day. I don't live close enough to do this walk often, but I certainly manage it a few times a year (especially at Sclupltures by the Sea). You can do the walk in section and double back so you start and finish at the same place or walk one way and take public transport back if you ened tocollect a car.I think the Coogee to Bronte walk is more difficult than the Bronte to Bondi component - more hills. but itis all beautiful and defintiely worth the effort. You can sometimes see whakles or dolphins if the time of year is right and you will always see surfers and generally just ocals going about their daily lives. A must do for visitors if you have the time. Go early and then have breakfast in one fo the many great cafes near one of numerous beaches along the way.

It may not be far but there are a LOT of steps!. Beautiful walk but very up and down via steps so harder work than it looks! Give yourself plenty of time and don't do in the midday sun. Great places to stop along the way, including rocks overlooking the sea and a number of beaches.

What a great way to burn some calories. Very scenic....make sure u wander around the cemetery ....couldn't believe we had been walking for a couple hours....easy walk for all levels. Take a towel n swimmers n have a swim at each beach....take ur water bottle n refill it along the way at the free filter water refill stations

Always busy, always a pleasure. Beautiful walk, up and down dodging runners, prams, couples, you name it. But the scenery makes up for the numbers of people. Choose the off peak times to do this walk. It is well worth the effort. So much to see, lots of variety. Will do your heart some good.
Really spectacular. I loved walking by the ocean with a picnic And enjoying all the spectacular views. Lots of people chatted away to us .

Coogee a larger metropolitan beach in Sydney's east. Has lots to offer for all, although not an intimate type of beach. The beach itself and promenade are excellent. Fish and chips by the beach, a must.

Fantastic scenery!. Well worth the hours it takes in the hot sun. Fantastic views over the beaches and the ocean. Very nice also for a jog, with some outdoor gym spots to do some bodyweight exercise along the way.

This is totally worth it and not strenuous. OK - so it might be strenuous if you are totally out of shape, but then so would any walk. The walk has some great views of the coast, the cemetery is crazy big and there are tons of places to stop for food. Bring water, stay on the trail and bring a camera.

Take the time!. Wow what a wonderful day to get away from the beach tourists. A walk along the cliffs. An easy walking trail with spectacular views of the coastline. Not advisable to go down and walk along the rocks. The surf can be heavy and rip tides can wash you away.Lots of great places to stop along the way to enjoy the views.An inexpensive way to spend the day. Pack a lunch and enjoy the many parks along the way!

Cliff Hanger Views :-). I always do this walk when visiting Sydney. Sunny or wet the cliff top coastal walk views are amazing. A good workout and takes around 1.20hrs. depends also on how fast/slow you walk. Each beach provides toilet stops, most have cafes and a chance for a swim and relax until the next stage of your journey. Easy return bus trip from Coogee to Bondi. The placement of the Waverley Cemetery at Bronte since 1877 provides historic happenings and stunning tomb stone architecture.

Gorgeous Views!. We did this walk and enjoyed the beautiful scenery both on and off land. The trail along the beach can be quite an excercise so hydrate well and bring water. Also, don't forget sunscreen/hat!

The way to see the Sydney coast is on foot. The Bondi to Coogee Beach Coastal Walk is on of the most pituresque tracks I've ever seen. A lot of locals use it as a running track so be careful not to get bowled over. The coast is rocky and there are a lot of stairs but there isn't a view like it in the whole city.
so close.... ... and yet so far... really great to get some distance to the vibrant city - can only recommend it - awesome getaway
amazing. go here when the wind is howling and see the beautiful side of life. views right across from bondi to tama. it's great. sometimes the wind is so strong that you can lean against it.
Great walk. Only got as far as Bronte Beach because our son phoned to meet up but it was a lovely walk and only wish we could have completed it to Coogee.

Brilliant!. Burned some xmas calories and saw some amazing scenery. Plenty of other runners and walkers on route with free filtered water stations at various points.
Highly reccommend.

Great Walk. Well worth taking this walk. We did it in flipflops so not too strenuous - 5kms. Great views back to Bondi and out to see, with the reward that Coogee is less crowded than Bondi. You can get a bus back to the city from Coogee.
Bondi. Just an average beach, but perfect for the kids and family. Not an ideal place for snorkeling. Pretty clean and works for its purpose of sand and sun.
Lovely views. Well worth the effort! A lovely coastal walk whatever the weather! We walked this in blustery conditions and the waves were amazing.

nice way to discover a few cool beaches. Went south from southern Bondi beach along the swimming pool and lookout... nice, not exhausting walk with cool stone formations and steep lookouts. Took quick swim in small Tamarama beach, went on to Fisher Jonathon where I took the Bus back to Bondi Junction. Would recommend this walk for a not-so-good weather day.
Great walk. A fabulous beachside atmosphere. Great cafes and interesting shops. Fabulous views and friendly locals!
beautiful walk. great walk any time of the year especially when you can ctach an outdoor art sculpture exhibition outside. Can be quite a long walk but very enjoyable

Nice but long and weather spoiled it a little. I really liked this walk, for the first 40 mins and took some beautiful photos but by the end I was hanging. If you love walking enjoy it but if you're not the long walks type then give it a miss. I like beaches but once you've seen a few beaches and a few cliffs you can get a bit bored!
Great Views. Beautiful scenery - It doesn't seem very long because the views make your exercise so much easier. Some ups an downs, but not too difficult. Enjoy it as a walk or run.
Wonderful Scenic Stroll. Great way to spend a couple of hours -- the beaches and surf are beautiful. Just be careful, a lot of joggers go streaming by so be on the lookout!
Awesome. Did this walk a few years ago. It is really an awesome walk. The cemetery with a view is amazing. I would definitely recommend this to any one.

A Day At The Beach. We had a great day here with friends. The sculptors exhibition was on the coastal walk which made the day even better.The beach is very good but there are better beaches in the West?

Best walk. We did this walk the other way around. We caught a bus from the city to Bronte and walked to Bondi. This is shorter walk but just as spectacular. The coast line has many interesting bays and its great just to find a quite spot in this busy city to sit and just take it all in.

Great walk and fabulous views!. Loved this walk. Two of our friends who live in Rosebay recommended it and we walked from there, swam at Icebergs ( think that's what they call it?), a fantastic outdoor pool and then went on to walk from Bondi. Great walk and don't miss it if are there.

Stunning...but busy.. This is one of the great walks in Sydney. The coastal scenery is spectacular and in winter/spring you can often see whales. It's a great way to get some exercise while doing a bit of site seeing. The only negative is that in the warmer months it gets extremely busy on the weekend.
Tourist things to do. Did this with a friend. We walked and talked. The walk was good, though i'd not advise doing it midday as it gets too hot

Fantastic views along the cliffs. On a pleasant, sunny Sydney day, 3 of us took the walk just from Tamarama to Bondi and return. It is a fairly easy walk but incudes some reasonably steep stairs. Wear a hat, take some water and 'drink' in the magnificent view. If your lucky like us, you may just see a pod of Dolphins swimming not far from the Tamarama beach.

A Decent Walk. A good and not very strenuous walk along the cliff tops with great views of surfing at beaches along the way.If you time your arrival at Bondi beaach for lunch then be sure to stop at the Bondi Icebergs swimming pool as you turn the headland into Bondi Beach. Membership for visitors is free and the lunch menu is varied and reasonably priced - good views across the beach.

A must in Sydney. I have already done this walk three times and it never gets boring. Some great scenery around the coast and a great day out. Start off with a coffee at Bondi and then have lunch at Coogee when you finish.

Loved it. I have walked this about five times now and each time I have alwys seen whales!Its a great path to do a run along or a very slow walk with a picnic half wayyou see alot of the rock formations and rock pools and the cemetery is beautiful.This makes Sydney a beautiful place to visit!!

Paradise for beach lovers. The walk is extraordinary. Every step from Bondi beach on the coastal walk opens up new vistas. Beautiful teal water crashing over rocks. Glorious cliffs. Lively and broad beaches. Heaven.
A MOST. Doing this walk you can apriciated the real deal in Australia. Dont miss it, and dont forget your sun screen.

Sculpture by the Sea. This annual event attracts hoards of people on a the weekends. The Sculpture is always interesting but the views are even better. Go after work for a less crowded experience, and watch the sunset over Coogee.
Eat at "The Bucket List Restaurant". Great beach (we did NOT swim there) but great to sit and enjoy the scenery and sea breeze.Good weather, good food, and order a "flat white coffee"

Actually I went Coogee to Bondi..... TimeOut Sydney placed this walk as one of the bucket list things to do in Sydney. For whatever reason they suggested the Coogee to Bondi route, so I used their suggestion and It was well worth the time and effort. The views were stunning and the different beaches I passed were well beyond the normal tourist bus sites. It gave me time to enjoy the scenery and varied beach front scenes. The walk takes about 1.5 hours,maybe 2 if you aren't in a hurry, and you would be well served to take the walk. It is most enjoyable and quite memorable.

Some of the best scenic views in Sydney. It wasn't the sunniest of days when we went on this walk, but the views were still amazing. There had been a bit of a storm the previous night so the waves were crashing into the rocks with some real force. Definitely a place to bring your camera.It took us around an hour to complete the whole thing.There are some great places to grab some food in Coogee as well.We got the bus back to Bondi with no problem as well.

Best walk in Sydney. Did this walk the other way round, starting from our hotel in Coogee, and walking through to Bondi; either way, it's a beautiful meander (or jog, as many Sydneysiders do). Views across the assorted bays, coves and beaches you pass are gorgeous (and extremely photogenic), and aside from the slightly incongruous placement of a graveyard on one of the cliffs above the water, it's a glorious stroll. Word of warning: a swim at Bondi (or Coogee) is the ideal reward for an hour or so walking, but if you're making the return journey, a wet costume is no fun to walk in for an hour, so take something to change into.
fantastic scenery. A superb walk with great views of the coastline. Well inked in with public transport to get back into town. All easy to find and work out.

A decent walk with wonderful views. What I like about this walk is that as you walk around each new cliff, you reach another new beach to explore, cafes, restaurants, etc. There are water bubblers along the route which make the walk easier to do as you don't need to carry a water bottle with you.

Gorgeous Seaside Walk. Great walk along the water, even on a windy day. There are many beaches were you can stop and rest, if you choose. Each beach has a bathroom and food. From Coogee you can catch a bus or taxi back to Bondi.

Stunning. Great views! The pathway is pretty well paved, although it gets steep at times and the stairs can be quite difficult if you're very short like me. There are several saltwater public pools connected right to the ocean, so you can swim without fear of sharks or currents. We ate at Ex Cafe near Bronte and had a delicious takeaway lunch in the park. Stunning vistas and lovely coastal scenery - well worth the sore muscles!!

A beautiful Sydney walk!. I love this walk, which I have done many times. Its great to do during the day or evening - although I prefer the coolness of evening when there's not too many people about. I would call it an easy-moderate walk as there's a few sets of stairs to climb. Anyone who is reasonably fit should have no trouble. There's stunning views all the way and great cafes at either end.
dont miss this one. Dont miss this type of walk even if you are not a walker. We did it slowly and enjoyed the beautiful views and enviorment very much. Great wayto spend few hours in this area

scenic walk. a nice scenic walk take water !there are water stations to refill your bottle .gives a view of several smaller beaches on route that looked very nice these beaches are very clean no alcohol is allowed!
Scenic Exercise. Amazing scenery on display for the whole of this walk. A wonderful way to spend a few hours in the afternoon!

my favourite way to exercise, walk it at sunset it's spectacular. Start at the North Bondi end and walk/jog all the way to Clovelly. It's a gorgeous way to end your day with spectacular cliff section, all very safely fenced and paved but with unobstructed views - open skies and sea all around. This route is perfect alone or with friends and there are little outdoor exercise stations along the route where you can use a wooden bench for sit ups, or a bar set up for pull ups. It is my favorite outdoor exercise route and also my favorite place to take a relaxing walk & chat with a friend.

Great walk along coast. The Bondi to Coogee walk is an easy coastal walk down a largely paved path. Great scenery and people-watching opportunities, particularly on a sunny Sunday. It was a bit crowded but would be much less so on a weekday. We got the bus from town to Bondi and returned from Coogee which was easy. You can continue on beyond Coogee if you want a longer walk. Worth doing if you enjoy walking.
Great view for locals and tourists alike. Great views of the ocean against a gorgeous rugged sandstone cliffs. Fantastic day out activity if the weather is sunny.

Beaches Galore!!!. Get to Bondi beach a variety of different ways. We got the bus from outside the Museum train station all the way to the beach. The bus costs $3.80 one way. Alternately, you can get the train to Bondi Junction train station and either walk or get the bus from there.From the southern end of Bondi Beach begin the coastal walk along the wooden walkway. The walkway runs all the way along the (approx) 9km of path over the clifftops. The walk took us about 2.5 hours, but in saying that we took our time, making many stops and taking photos. We were in no rush. I'm sure it can be done in 1.5 hours. It starts at Bondi Beach's southern end, leading onto Tamarama Beach, then Bronte Beach (which is not named after the literary trio of British sisters but Lord Nelson who was the Duke of Bronte), followed by Clovelly Beach, Gordon's Bay and finally, Coogee Beach.I thought that once you've seen one beach you've seen them all... I was mistaken! The views are spectacular. These series of beaches are some of the most wonderful i've seen, mostly due to the towering cliffs that protect them and the harsh waves that batter them and create picturesque foamy waves that surfers chase on the boards. Not to mention the imposing and vast Waverley Cemetery that balances at the edge of one of the cliffs. It's no Pere Lachaise but it appears grander due to it's surroundings and it makes for a gorgeous photo. If i had to be buried i wouldn't mind being buried overlooking the ever-changing sky and distant horizon!All along the walkway are information plaques explaining about each beach, it's history and name. Supposedly in 1938, a date forever ingrained in Bondi lore as 'Black Sunday' five beach-goers drowned on Bondi Beach. However, 250 were saved as a series of massively destructive and unexpected waves struck the beach. The word Coogee also means 'smelly place' in Aboriginal language! You decide!It's a spectacular walk for a spectacular day in Sydney.

Very nice walk but avoid on weekend. That is a great walk along the coast but can be very buzy on weekends. Amazing when the waves are very strong.Stop for a swin (snorkeling) at Gordon's Bay or Clovelly Pool and if you are lucky, you will meet the local resident: Blue Groper.
A great walk with some wonderful views. Well worth the effort. A gentle walk along well laid out paths, with plenty of places like Bronte to stop along the way.
Fabulous. A must do when in Sydney. Put it on your bucket list. Start at Clovelly and head down to Bondi where you can have lunch and then head back for a late afternoon drink
Brilliant. Great walk, definitely worth the journey from Sydney. Very well constructed walkways, facilities excellent and water stations along the route.

scenic walk. I used to do this walk faboulas and scenic walk. its the most famous walk in the eastern suburbs area. Fresh air and great views. easy to do and lots of places to rest. its usually busy in summer during the weekends.
Breathtaking views. Great walk, some amazing views around the coast line, got very hot in the midday sun but well worth the effort.

Unmissable!. This walk is nothing short of life affirming.. The spectacular views will make you happy to be alive. It's a fairly easy walk, which takes about an hour and a half, passing some of Sydney's most beautiful beaches. Definitely do this!

beach after beach after beach. Sydneys eastern suburbs are sprinkled with the best beaches. Some are big and busy and bustling, others are quieter , all are more than well serviced by bustling cafes and bars.7MAlabar, Maroubra, Bronte, Tamara, Clovelly, Coogee and Bondi. Bondi is always the beach that is mentioned, its known the world over and takes the limelight from its sister beaches but in my humble opinion its welcome to the attention and the other beaches are absolutely worth your attention. There is no better way to see this gorgeous shoreline than the coastal walk. Again, this is a personal opinion but l always liked to start this walk at Bondi as l liked finished up at the other end. Its a great walk and for those who like to stay hydrated you can stop along the way for refreshments. I must say this is not a walk to be done by anybody who has mobility issues, or with somebody in a wheelchair.Of notable mention is one of my personal favourite visits in this lovely part of the world. Right up on the top of the hill in between Clovelly Beach and Coogee Beach is one of the most beautifully located and the most fascinated cemetaries you are ever likely to find in the world. Waverly Cemetary is absolutely fascinating and well worth devoting a portion of your time to. Its near the end of the walk so if your thirsty or peckish, stop off at SAlt Cafe overlooking Clovelly beach first, and then head up the hill to the cemetary. It has graves of Sydney residents who orginated from all over the world. there is a considerably impressive Irish section there, there are beautiful family tombs there, some have family name plates there, Italian and greek families in particular. It is amazing. Enjoy the walk, the coffee, stop and have a picnic on the hill top and make sure and visit the cemetary

Good walk, but only to Bronte beach. A very scenic enjoyable walk up to Bronte Beach. Then the walk becomes very average the rest of the way to Coogee beach.Take the walk but end it at Bronte Beach were you can grab a bus back.
Amazing walk. Spent the day at Bondi beach and walked to Coogee. Took a couple of hours, but it was a nice day and swan at different beaches along the way. Great views - stunning!

Amazing views!. We started by spending the a.m. enjoying Bondi Beach, which was fairly easy to get to from downtown Sydney. Then we did the walk along the cliffs towards Coogee Beach. Beautiful! Tide pools to explore, interesting rock formations, and views the reminded us of parts of the Mediteranean. It's steep in some parts and a workout if you are not used to that kind of hilly walks. We made it almost to Coogee. The way back we stopped at The Iceberg swim club to get a bite to eat and a glass of wine. This was recommended by a local friend. Worth it. A nice way to relax with a view of Bondi.

Amazing!. We did this walk "backwards" by starting in Coogee. The walk was generally well sign posted and where is wasn't we simply followed the path by the coast. There were some inclines and steps so it wasn't all easy but the views were amazing. We really enjoyed seeing all the different beaches and coves and the reward of lunch and an afternoon on Bondi beach was great. Easily one of our best days in Sydney.

Must-do walk in Sydney. I love this walk and have done it many times. I always bring friends from overseas here, because there's something for everyone. Beaches, cliffs, cafes... And you can stop anywhere along the way for a rest or to head back. Beautiful scenery, a must-do walk in Sydney.

Made it at last.. Being an aged surfer Bondi was always on the cards. Have now ticked the box and it was not disappointing. Good, strong surf and plenty of it. A great day at the beach.The coastal path is a must if you are in the area. Great views.
"A must do". This is a beautiful , amazing, fun walk. They have mile maker & maps along the way so you can decided how far you want to go.

A fantastic walk. I really enjoyed this walk. The weather was fantastic, not too hot though very sunny. As a Brit I was delighted by the blue cloudless sky which made the colours of the ocean so wonderful. It's approximately 6km long. There a couple of steep sections and occasionally steps but if you are averagely fit this should not be daunting. Lots of drinking fountains to top up your water bottle and also little snack shops, cafes, and toilets not too far from the path. At the start of the walk at the south end of Bondi beach there's a small monument in memory of Black Sunday in 1938. Don't miss it!

Oceanview to go. The walk taks roughly 2 hrs along the coast and you see not only stunning limestone formations, beautiful bays and beaches, you also meet many interesting people on the way and get to watch Sydneysiders work out.This is a perfect 2 hours escape from the city! Hop into the water for a swim or simply wander and have an iced coffee, it's definitely worth a visit!My tip: go in the afternoon and watch the sun set over Coogee Beach - breathtaking!

And you can enjoy Art too!. Agree with the general tone of the reviews, and most of the details. I'm surprised not to see any mention of the fact that once a year (times vary a bit apparently, but do ask at an information centre) during the main season there is an outdoor collection of modern sculptures on display. Of course, as is the case usually with modern art, some you will like and some you may hate, But it is a lovely add-on to your exercise and enjoyment of the outdoors. It slows down the walk, so kids can enjoy it too.

Great Walk. This is a great hike. You'll enjoy the coastal views and interesting rock formations. The path is paved, with level walking and hills to get your heart pumping. Resting areas with lots of opportunities to fill you water bottle. The views are outstanding.
excellent workout. Great views on this hardy walk. But a lot of foot traffic in bust times. You can belt it out or take your time and enjoy the coastal scenery

In Sydney, this is a must do. A fantastic walk taking in some of the best coastline in Sydney. Starting off after coffee in Bondi, the relatively easy walk takes you past Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly and on to Coogee where you can enjoy your lunch at Chish & Fips.

Great long costal walk. Don't undertake this walk on a hot day! Nice scenic walk along the coast line which will take you to some smaller and less busy beaches. Remeber to take your water and a snack or two for along the way.

Beautiful. Do this walk once very couple of months, starting at Coogee, breaking at Bondi for ice team or lunch then return. Beautiful views and great for when you want a little exercise, but not too much!

A Favourite. Love this walk at any time of the year. If you are going to the Sculptures By The Sea go early!!! Runners do share the paths with you but they have recently upgraded the paths and there are places to sit and just take in the view and the people along the way. Can be a little tough for the elderly or those who don't do much exercise but you can just take your time, it will be worth it.

Not to be missed if visiting Sydney!. Firstly, you get to see Bondi and Coogee beaches which are both terrific (but different) beaches and on the way between the too you go through other beaches, Tamarama and Bronte and at each beach you can stop for coffee, drinks, lunch. The walk can be as fast or slow as you like and it is scenic all the way. On beautiful days you are likely to see lots of walkers, joggers, runnners but there's room for everyone.
perfect infrastructure. the communal authorities should be commended for keeping the paths, bridges etc in perfect conditions. safe walk with oppportunities to bathe on the way!

Essential!. Even if you're in Sydney for a couple of days, this walk is a must. Either walk the Coogee to Bondi route, or shorten it by walking from Bronte. For the tourist, catch a bus to either Coogee or Bronte, then finish up at Bondi Beach. Take sunscreen and a hat. Avoid walking on a rainy day.

If you don't mind the odd stair or 200 - awesome. I run the trail and it is spectacular. Great views, great scenery, great vibe and great way to stay fit. Heaps of undulations though, so if you have dodgy knees you might not enjoy so much, but feeling so alive as you tend too in such a beautiful environment (usually surround by beautiful people too) it is hard to complain. Best in the early morning or late afternoon I think.

am in love with aussie beaches. coogee bay its so nice and quite, you can have a long walk from coogee bay to bondi beach its absolutely amazing, what can i say am in love with Australia especailly Sydney!!!!

Excellent Walk!. We loved our walk-- bring sunscreen a hat and be on the lookout for jogging celebrities! There are a few beaches on the way where you can pick up some lunch. We really enjoyed this experience.

Sunday Strolls. If you love a good walk then is a perfect thing to do on a cooler day. Amazing views, and great picnic spots along the way as well as well as a good bit of excercise. Definitely worth doing while in Sydney.

Sculpture fun. The annual sculpture walk runs for about a month, with installations dotted around the Coogee end of the walk and much more densely populated towards Bondi. Stop off for a swim, or meander through the graveyard with possibly the worlds greatest view. Bring a water bottle with you, and top up along the way.

Sculpture by the Sea. Every spring for about two weeks the Bondi to Tamarama coastal walk is transformed into a sculpture park showing many sculptures by artists from all round the world. Love them or hate them, you'll find something to talk about! Continue on all the way to Coogee and enjoy the views all along this spectacular coastal stretch. Totally free

A cousin's treat. As part of our journey in Australia one of cousins who lives in Coogee took us on the coastal walk on a bright, warm and brezzy day. It is a great way of spending time and we were fortunate to have a living art gallery being active at the time of our walk - numerous art pieces that ranged from the bizarre to those that were emotionally inspiring. Well worth the trip especially if you catch it during 'whale migration' months [we only caught site of the tail of one but we were out of whale season!]

Beauty of Bondi. Just spent about an hour so we couldn't get the real feel of the beach. Very crowded even on a cloudy cool day. Lots of activities, races etc. Which we had time to go in the water and just relax on the beach.

One if the best days of the entire trip!. Absolutely beautiful walk, easy to follow and lots of clean restrooms. There are lots of stairs and lots of up and down ramps. If you have bad knees, reconsider this walk. I walked from Bondi to Coogee in about an hour and a half--with lots of stops for photos and enjoying the scenery. I liked it so much that after lunch, I turned and did it in the Coogee to Bondi direction.
Beautiful views. SImply gorgeous and a good alternative if the crowds at Bondi feel overwhelming. Stopped to swim at Bronte beach, which was really cute.

Gorgeous Views. Bondi beach is a must see in Sydney. I highly recommend it -- just be sure to read all the signs prior to jumping in the water. The beach has a rip tide area and there's sometimes sharks and jelly fish. So be careful. We used the Hop-On-Hop-Off bus to get to Bondi Beach. We caught the bus at the Circular Quay bus stop.

Walk, swim, eat, what's not to like?. This was the boxing day walk to get rid of the day before's excesses. Decent walk with some ups and downs but nothing too onerous.
