Stopped off at some really nice beaches for a break, go swinning or just to have a snack/drink. I think we took about 4 really leisurely hours to walk it and felt much better for it!

Grew up living close to the walk. Im reading all of your reviews and it sounds like you guys had a great time!! Bondi beach is like a home to me. I grew up on the beach and would often visit mackenzies bay as well as Tamarama, Bronte, Coogee and Clovelly. Clovelly is like a zoo without fences, there is an amazing range of sea animals including blue gropers!!! I love walking along the coast because it brings back the memories of when I used to play around with my friends on the walk. It is a great place to jog everyday and it keeps you fit!!!
Disapointed. Bondi is so run down would be ashamed to say I lived there please do something to bring it up to scratch - from the pavements to the whole surrounding areas run down to the max
A magic track. Beautiful walk and well signposted. Try to go out of holidays or weekends to avoid the keen joggers. Easy access to buses if you wish to get there or return to the city.

Gorgeous walk for scenery or for exercise. We took the bus out to the start point and made the coastal walk along the ocean until reaching Bondi Beach where we met friends for lunch. We passed beautiful beaches and cliffs. An absolute must-do free activity in Sydney. On the sunny day we went Bondi did not fill up until noon. Great walk along the Promenade and little shops and restaurants along Bondi Beach.

Scenic, busy but nice. If you are looking for a nice walk along the coast you could not go far wrong with this one. The walkway is a bit undulating with a few stairs but not too taxing. The view is great along the coast. There are a few places along the way to stop for coffee or an ice cream like Tammarama or Clovelly Beach. We did the walk on a Sunday. We got to Bondi Beach via ferry and bus. All this can be done with the family day pass where the whole family can hop on any public transport option for the low price of $2.50 each! That is a cheap outing. Oh - my two kids were not so keen on the walking though. It is about 7-8kms and a little too long and tedious for them.
A very pleasant walk !. A bit busy, but what a lovely way to pass an hour or so on New Years day - very enjoyable! A relatively easy walk with plenty of bars to stop off at if you get thirsty.

Beautiful walk. The walk from Bondi to Coogee is really lovely and right along the coast. We decided to start at Bondi as the buses home from Bondi are often busy, whereas coogee is quieter so to us it made more sense. When you walk away from Bondi you come to a high lookout point, where you can get a fantastic photo looking back over Bondi. There are some steep hills, and steps, but it looked to us like there were other ways round so parts of the walk may be accessible for wheelchairs. Lots of people had push-chairs, and there were lots of people jogging who could help carry them up the steps! The view of Bronte beach which is in between Coogee and Bondi is my favourite, the water is just gorgeous and you can get some lovely photos doing the walk from either direction. The closer you get to coogee the better the foot paths, it starts to become decking, and there are lots of benches to sit and admire the view or catch your breath! Although it is very windy along the walk, it is deceptively hot, so take sun precautions and take water for the walk (there are filtered water fountains so you can re-fill your bottles - and also ice-creams can be purchased at all beaches). I'm told you can often see dolphins along the walk, but the best time is in the morning, so get there early! Definitely worth doing!

Best of everything. This is a wonderful and popular walk. Start on either side, remebr blockout and a hat. There are water funtains along the walk, and use them. Take your time and enjoy the views. If you take swimmers there are some of the best places to take a dip along the walk. Clovelly is almost like swimming in an aquarium as it is in a protected environment with a collapsed casueway hidden at the mouth of the inlet making it a safe p;ace to take a dip and find the blue gropers!Furrther along the walk is Gordons Bay, if you come equiped there is an underway chained pathway thet allows you to dive along a special area, complete with dolphins, lobsters, gropers, the odd grey nurse, and lots of wonderful sea life. In the right season you will see whales from all along the headland. Be aware of the environment as you walk along it is spectacular and special. Volunteer groups work constantly to keep the weeds out of the natural bush, stop say hello and they will talk to you about the unique plants. Watch out for joggers, cyclists and gym based young parents with 4wheel drive prams they will knock down anything in their way.At the north end of Coogee is Giles Pool, a wild pool once the site of the mens' baths and gym, this is the hangout of younger boys who like to dive from the cliff tops (unfortunately several have died or been crippled doing this, but they are boys) and the best fun is standing on the rock face along the sea edge during big waves to be swept off the rocks and into the whirlpool of the sea pool. The south side of Coogee has some special areas as well.All along the route you will find great cafes, an open air one on the broadwalk at Tamarama, a street full of them at Bronte and both Coogee end and Bondi end have diggers clubs with amazing views and lunch and dinner time deals if you sign in and take off your hat! take a day, drink water, wear a hat and take it easy..very rewarding. oh and their are maps along the way that will tall you of side trips, history and safety issues.note it is all protected so no taking shells or rocks from the beaches.and remeber the new thought...when you go for a walk near the sea pick up 3 pieces of plastic rubbish into bins! save our turtles!

My favourite place in the world. I was fortunate enough to live close to this walk for several years, and it was then, and remains, my favourite place in Sydney. Its the #1 thing on my to do list whenever I visit. I'd recommend going early in the morning in the summer and to avoid Sundays if possible when it can be busy on the Bondi - Bronte stretch. Bronte Baths on Bronte beach, or snorkelling at Clovelly are the best places to cool down. I used to run it - but it was hard work!

spectacular scenery. one of the best ways to see Sydney's wonderful coastline, while getting some fresh air & sunshinethere are lots of steps & uneven ground along the way, so take care and use the handrails on the stairs.On a sunny weekend there are hundreds of people doing this walk at the same time, so the steps may sometimes get a little congested with people & their dogs, but this is a spectacular bit of coast line, and well worth the effort. Enkoy lunch at the end at the many cafe's & restaurants at Bondi, Coogee or Bronte beaches

So many great views!. Did this walk in reverse (Coogee to Bondi) with husband, 1 yr old and pushchair. Loved the views, enjoyed stopping off at the beaches and pleased we did it, BUT the walk is definitely not step-free so if you are doing it with a pushchair make sure you are feeling strong!

Nice for sigh seeing, lots of gorgeous sulfer. Best place for surfing, if youbare a surfer, best for sigh seeing , nice beach, very relaxing, and best for shopping too, its a must visit place in Sydney

Lovely walk!. Definitely a nice way to see Bondi beach and the surrounding neighbourhood and cliffside. The Bondi Icebergs swimming club is along the way and their facilities are amazing and worth a look.

good walk by the water. this walk is excellent and is by the water. you need to carry water with you. the road is packed with joggers and there are leading signs to help you. my recommandation is to do this walk either early morning or late afternoon.

It's a busy walk but so lovely!. This particular walk is always busy with joggers, tourists and locals all jostling for place. But it's worth persisting and going for a stroll. Although the foot traffic can sometimes feel like Sydney traffic, it's lovely to be out, walking along such a wonderful piece of coastline. Stop at Bronte for fish and chips or a coffee at one of the many cafes. If you are intending to swim, be warned that Bronte has a very nasty rip. Try the sea pool at Bronte or Coogee or Wylies Baths at Coogee if you're not a very confident swimmer.
Gorgeous coastal walk. Can be crowded at times, but a beautiful way to enjoy the headlands and curvy beaches of Bondi, and Bronte
One of my favourite walks. A must for visitors and a favourite for a local. Always enjoy this walk. Can get busy on weekends or during exhibitions such as Sculptures by the Sea

A must-do!. A great way to see the city coastline. Start early in the morning to beat the sun. Bring along a towel, sunscreen, etc. and spend the day stopping at the many beaches along the way. There are public washrooms and lots of opportunity for food/drink. My cousin, who lives in Sydney, says this is her favorite walk and she does it often before work. You finish at Bondi beach, which is usually very crowded, so if you like to relax at more peaceful beaches, I would stop along the way at 'lower profile' coves. A must-do! Have a blast!
Great costal walk. Would highly recommend with a date. The only issue was that the sculpture exhibit was going on and it was a bit crowded. Otherwise, a great experience

Lovely Walk to Bronte/Coogee Beach. Fabulous views, wild surf, great scenery and fresh ocean air. A great way to spend an hour. Bronte is a lovely little seaside village with charming little cafes and restaurants.

Love this walk. Beautiful walk - gets crowded on the weekends in Summer. Not pram friendly. Good work out if you traverse the whole lot. Also great spots to stop off and have a coffee or a beer along the way

A 5km Walk with Great Views. Bus 333 (or others) to Bondi. Then the coastal walk from Bondi to Coogee on a reasonably warm Summers day - approx 5km including steps and sloping walkways, the views across the various bays are sensational. We stopped for lunch at Bronte about halfway and offering several dining options. Using our MyMulti 1 tickets, we caught the bus back to Circular Quay.

beautiful beaches. the scenic walk is great-takes about 45 minutes. You get to see a lot of the beaches near sydney and they are all a bit different. Really enjoyed my time doing this- highly recommend!

Surf's Up!. No trip to Sydney would be complete without a trip to Bondi.Wasn't disappointed, the beach is beautiful. It was litter free, the sun was shining, the surfers were doing their thing and the views on the coastal walk are breathtaking!

Beautiful walk. We read everywhere about this walk and it didn't disapoint! Beautiful and dramatic landscape! The pools are very useful!! In the way back, took the bus to Bondi Juction and went to Westfield mal fotr a shopping spree!

Beautiful views. If you are fit and able, you MUST do this walk. It's a wonderful way to see some of Australia's beautiful beaches. If you get hot you can pop into any of the beaches you pass on the way.

Brilliant. Brilliant Well worth the hardship of the hills and steps. I found the walk hard for the first 15 mins but then got really into it The views are amazing and the breakfast in bondi beach was well worth the walk

Rub shoulders with the world - literally. Get there early for sunrise when most of the tourists and (some of the) locals are still getting out of bed to really enjoy this coastal walk. Top tip - keep going onto Coogee and beyond for the lovely wetlands.

daily walk to rack up the km's. I used to do this walk for over two years so unless the coast has changed then this would have to be THE most beautiful walk I have every been on. Doesn't even make you feel like you're excercising!

Great views - not a a back to nature experience though!. This is well worth the effort. The views are amazing and the facilities are good all the way round as you happen upon little bays and beaches.I was a little disappointed as I had the idea of an 'unspolit' nature walk in mind (like Bundeena) and this was not like that. Some of the time you are on the road and much of the time you are on built concrete paths. This is fine if you are expecting it - and as I said the views are amazing. It was a great walk for New Years Day. Take a hat if it is very hot and fill up your water at free fill up points.

Wow. Views along this walk are fantastic, Too many kodak moments along the route to mention. Highlight of the walk for me was Tamarama beach. It was like little private beach so close to the city. Amazing. Would love to be able to walk this route every day!!
Great beaches, great weather. Loved it so much, can't wait to do it again. The weather was great even in winter and the views were amazing.

great nature walk. it's a great way to go for a nature walk, particularly if you don't plan on visiting greater sydney, like the blue mountains. Its just really really beautiful and you get to visit all the main beaches. Buses to the sydney go from coogee and Bondi.

what every beach should have but doesn't in Australia. Europeans used to beaches around Europe are often disappointed with Australia's coast line. This is because it is less developed and more individual effort is required to experience the waters edge. This walk however, following the cliffs as it does in parts and behind beaches of shimmering largely empty sands never fails to delight. Only be aware that in heavily overcast or rainy days its like cloudy and rainy elsewhere. In full sun it is hot and precautions especially bringing drinking water and wearing sunshield are definitely necessary! Annual Art by the Sea in late spring is very busy but perhaps the best time to go. You often run into old acquaintances then!

A beautiful little stroll. I liked this walk so much, I actually walked it three times during my week in Sydney. It was even made even better as the Sculptures By The Sea art exhibit was there, which made the walk so interesting, albeit busy on the weekends. The little beaches are a great alternative to busy Bondi.

Loved it. We did not make it all the way to Coogee. I think we stopped in Clovelly, the only reason we stopped is because we ran out of time. The walk was amazing and scenic. The reason it took us so long is because there are so many beautiful places to take pictures. We went in the water in Bondi and that was it. It was chilly but amazingly clear. I miss it already.

Amazing scenery!. We did this walk on new years day, the weather was perfect and the views were spectacular. We started at Bondi and walked to Bronte which took about an hour and a half at a leisurely pace, stopping frequently for photos. There are places to stop on route for an ice-cream or a drink, but I would advise you take some water as it was very warm. Highly recommend this walk!

Great way to get a view of the Sydney Beach scene. Great way to spend a morning. Had planned to do Bondi to Bronte only but a local on the bus told us to go further to Coogee and are we glad we did. The vistas were amazing from the sand to the summits, the rock pools to the cliffs and the gorgeously blue ocean. And when you get to Coogee around lunch time go to A Fish Called Coogee on the main restaurant drag for pick your own fish and have it cooked on the spot.
Coastal Walk. Excellent coastal walking past beautiful beaches and rugged coastline, a great way to spend a couple of hours admiring all the different views.

A pleasant way to get some exercise and fresh air. Following a a hearty breakfast at the Bondi Icebergs Restaurant we walked from Bondi to Clovelly, just short of Coogee. The walk is nice and a good way to see a number of beaches and coastal views. The only drawback, the cost of parking your car in Bondi.

A breathtaking landscape.. It is a path that starts at Bondi Beach, practicable entirely on foot, in my opinion this is one of the most beautiful natural attractions in Sydney.The journey time is approximately 2 hours, during this time you have the opportunity to get scenarios marine nature views.The Costal Walk is entirely characterized by cliffs that drop straight into the Ocean.Full of coves and rock natural swimming pools, which are used by swimmers.During this trip you have the opportunity to walk through the famous beaches such as Tamarama Beach, Bronte Beach, Waverly Cemetery and finally Coogee Beach.I suggest such experience to everyone who loves nature.
Fabulous. What wonderful views and beautiful coastline, well worth the 40 min bus ride to Coogee. Stop for ice cream at Bronte Beach
On the Beach. A bit over rated but weather wasn't very good for beach visit., very windy and the facilities near by seemed rather basic for such a major attraction. May well be better on a sunny day.
Coastal Walk. its just a lovely place to have a good walk in a good fine day..the view is good and many surfers and people walking their dogs..

worth the trek. This is a great walk...lovely views all along the route. You could do it in flip flops, but a lot of people seemed to be walking it for excercise which would also be a great way to go...

A Good Way to Warm Up Before Beaching. Bondi Beach is a must. We went on a Monday and found it less busy than we'd heard. We'd been to three different beaches around Sydney and Bondi's golden sand and breezy waves were sun-drenched perfection. The day we went the weather was warm but we weren't ready to take the plunge just yet. We decided to take this walk. We did the shorter version (Bondi to Bronte, about two hours) passing the sumptuous Icebergs (tempting outdoor pools and a cafe) and seeing beautiful landscapes, hidden surfing spots and unique pools of water in the rocks where kids indulged. Many a photo op is here, if you're compelled. The thing that stops this from being a 5 star for me is that it's advertised as a moderate stroll...and it is...but there are many, many stairs (especially at the starting 1/3 of the walk). People with bad knees or legs should take heed!
bondi. love walking the beach at night amazing my children enjoy it during the day a little to busy for my liking but love it at night as i grew up walking the beach at night with mum beautiful
The best thing about Bondi. Bondi hot, no shady spots to sit in so this walk gets you away from the beach and its "beautiful" people. Great views of the ocean

Wild coast line, swimming & cafe stops!. This coastal track is well maintained and is a comfortable walk along some of the most beautiful coastline in the world! Stop for a dip in the ocean and some sun at the gorgeous, sandy beaches along the way or pop into a cafe for an ice cold drink or a bite to eat. Do all of it or only part of the trail but it is a Sydney must do!

Very busy on sunny days and holidays!. We were there only once during our stay in the city. The beach was TOO busy, was hardly to find a nice place to relax. We liked the strict rules like forbiding alcohol and smoking on the beach. It made the beach clean! However, I think we were in a high season time. We would love to go there again if we were in the city in a lower season!

Wow-- do this! Natural rugged beauty. We did this backwards-- from Coogee to Bondi. It was about 1 hour 45 minutes of walking but we stopped twice along the way for dirnks and a dip in the ocean. Once at Brontee and once in Tamoreena.I was feeling lazy, laying in the sun at Coogee beach, and almost didn't go. Mistake to not go-- glad I did. Perfect views,gorgeous natrual beauty.Also- an easy walk- well organized. lots of places to stop and rest and eat/drink

Excellent coastal Walk. Frankly one of the best Coastal walks around! Take your camera as there are many good photo opportunities.The Bondi to Coogee will take you a couple of hours, maybe a little more at a leisurely pace.Plenty of places to stop and rest or just enjoy the elevated views over some of the bays or admire some of the coastal artworks/sculptures dotted along the trail.You'll pass by a few smaller bays complete with cafe's etc so dont worry if you run out of steam half way through.Keep going till you reach Coogee Beach and relax, have a swim, lunch and/or do some shopping.Alternatively catch a bus to Bondi Junction, refuel there and head back to Bondi.I've done this walk a few times over and will do it again. Just leave yourself plenty of time to enjoy it.Cheers!

Fun and beautiful!. This is such a fun day activity and completely free! The views are beautiful, make sure you bring a camera!! there will be lots of posing by the cliffs! And the walk is not at all difficult. there are a fair few stairs, but if you take it slow it is now problem at all!

Beautiful walk. This gorgeous walk always you to see the beautiful coastline while getting in some exercise and not breaking too much of a sweat. You can run it if you want, but we chose to enjoy the scenery and walk. A must if in the area.
Wonderful. It is long! But worth it to get to the grave yard at the end.stunning! No need for waling shoes, but wear sunscreen and take water!

beautiful walk, say no to forget this spot. i went there like couple months ago, and i took the walk at this coastal, windy, but mind blowing route. its a must if you like jogging or running, or you can just stroll and having a cup of latte. very recommended!

Quite a hike!. This is a popular, at times strenuous walk along incredibly beautiful beach areas, and takes you into a number of neighborhoods, including ending in an area with numerous pleasant casual restaurants. Our trek (it was hot, late December) was enjoyed by my wife and our 19-year-old daughter. Gives a sense of the incredible hues of teal and blue of the ocean. Lots of opportunities to walk in the surf, or just enjoy the scenery.
Windblown Ecstasy!. If you like it wind-wild and salty, this walk is a must. Fill your lungs full of that healthy salt air and contemplate city madness with a thoughtful gaze out to sea.

What a view!. Great walk! I only did part of it: Bondi to Bronte but it's so worth the time! Cliffs and waves have such a dramatic appearance! On any day there are both runners and walkers sharing the path. It is a favorite walk for tourists and locals alike!

Fantastic - "Must-do" walk in Sydney. Such a beautiful bit of coastline,a and free! it's the best place for a stroll, and you end up at a lovely beach with multiple bars and cafes and, well - it's the best. even if you only have a couple of days in Sydney, this is a must. (unless it's raining!!)

Relaxing. An easy walk and easy bus trip out there from the city.
The air is fresh and you get to see how the locals live.

Bondi to Coogee Beach Costal Walk. We had allowed 2 hours for this 6km walk but we had so much fun playing in the rock pools that we didnt get very far! We started the walk about 5.30pm so that the temperature would be a little cooler. The views and coastline are spectacular and the rock pools are fabulous. The walk is not strenous.
It's only a walk!. Yeh, it's a nice walk along the coast, but that's it really ... sorry, but that's all there is to it!

A stunning walk. We did this walk on New Years day to blow the cobwebs off us after partying. It is quite a tough walk if you are not fit, as there are lots of hills and steps to climb. There are water stations along the way. Stunning views at every point. Well worth the effort.

Stunning. This is a walk that truly deserves all the gushing praise it gets and is surely an absolute must-do activity for all visitors to the city. I'd recommend that you go on a day with good weather and give yourself as much time as you possibly can - not because the walk is particularly strenuous (although there are some short steep climbs), but because it's well worth stopping off for a swim at several of the beaches.There are a couple of barbecue spots along the way (notably in the wonderful park at Bronte, roughly halfway along).

the best beach in the world. you can fell the sand of this place is so soft ,fell like silk in your palm.so nice the view here,the beach,you can get new zealand ice cream just across the street,the best ice cream ever had.
Don't miss this. Really beautiful coastal walk. Takes about an hour and is very pretty. Several different beaches and glorious views. You can catch a bus back.

This was an outstanding walk! and I would recommend that you not miss it.. Beautiful views. Even in the rain. Not to be missed. The warn sandstones, the cemetary at midpoint, the birds, are all respites along the way. Bathrooms are available at each beach cove. Food and drinks are not readily available so bring water.

You haven't experienced Sydney till you've done this. This is a world class walk, with sensational views, you can stop along the way and swim at any of the beautiful beaches to cool off, or stop to exercise on the gym equipment provided along the walk, all within minutes of the CBD.

Breathtaking. For the moderately fit and mobile, this walk is a stunning way to see some of Sydney's most famous beaches. Cafe's, sand and vista's of amazing coastal scenery ... what more could you want?

A 3 hr journey with coastal line of Australia. The walk is actually quite challenging if you do it in Sunny days in Summer. Suncream is needed and a pair of comfort shoes are prepared. Personally recommend starting from Coggee to Bondi since at the end of the journey you will have more options to chill out in Bondi. The part near cencemetery is amazing with cliffs and great views of the coastal line and the sunrise on the sea. Along there were several smaller beaches which is not that crowded. Recommend the beach just south of Bondi(I forgot the name..)where there are beautiful waves with moderate height and long spread because of the perfect half circle shape and no huge rocks in the harbour.Its good both for surfing and photography.
Lovely stroll. This is a fabulous walk to take in two amazing beaches and some great coastal views. Very busy, but take the time to stop along the way and take it all in.

Awesome walk. If you like to walk, this is for you! It is a 9 km walk with the most amazing sites. It travels all along the ocean. At one point, we came upon an outdoor bowling establishment. So awesome right along the ocean!
Breath of fresh air. Easy to get to, easy to do. Plenty of photo oportunites, great to get out in the fresh air. Not really suitable for prams, strollers or wheelchairs though unfortunately.
Heaven on a stick. For a coastal walk this is Sydneys finest, you will never regret doing the walk when Sculptures by the Sea is on let alone on any other day.

Fantastic views. Having heard the hype about Bondi beach, I visited it in December 2012, and to be fair, was disappointed with it. My daughter had seen the programmes about the lifeguards, and they seemed remote and 'superior', maybe too much stardom, and i'm not a young female.BUT, then I started the coastal walk, there are steps, but otherwise this was a gentle walk, with regular stopping places, including the provision of some basic gym exercises, brief stops in the bays for refreshments and some really fantastic views of the coastline.If you are visiting Bondi, try and fit this walk in!
A lovely walk. This is a lovely walk between beaches and a great way to spend a jetlagged afternoon. Plenty of secluded places to stop along the way and appreciate the view. Nice and flat
Fabulous. What a great walk you need to be fit though.fantastic views. Would love to have been there when they had to sculptures by the sea

Wow beautiful. Staying in bondi its actually something you can do over and over again. Either as just a stroll or you can choose to run it as some many locals do.
There are several stops along the way to take in the views .

Sydney showcase walk. We often take overseas guests on this walk and finish off at Bondi Icebergs for lunch or a drink. It is very rare to enjoy such a pleasant and spectacular experience in other parts of the world without it costing an arm or a leg, so our guests are often impressed at the beauty of the coastline and being able to finish off with an affordable meal afterwards. Hiking boots are not needed as it is a relatively easy, paved walk. In poor weather however, there aren't many places to shelter unless you stop at one of the beaches.

Very nice walk but avoid on weekends. That is a great walk along the coast but can be very buzy on weekends. Amazing when the waves are very strong.Stop for a swin (snorkeling) at Gordon's Bay or Clovelly Pool and if you are lucky, you will meet the local resident: Blue Groper.

Great Views. This is a simple walk - sure there's a little bit of hill, but it's worth it and you can stop along the way. There are plenty of great views as you venture on your walk. You can stop for lunch halfway or you can wait till you get to Coogee or Bondi. In October they have the Sculptures all along the walk, but with a lot in Bondi. It can get very crowded but there is plenty to see and a great time to be there.

Pleasant but not outstanding. Two reasons to do this walk 1) You've already walked the much nicer Spit-Manly route, and want to walk another route2) You really, realy want to see BondiOtherwise, go with Spit-Manly, which is much more scenic.

A must if you are staying in the Eastern Suburbs. A beautiful walk which can be as short or as long as you like. You can stop at Tamarama or Bronte for refreshments or to turn back, or go all the way to Coogee. Beware of joggers and dogs in the morning. Can get slightly annoying.

Must do!. Absolutely amazing walk. Great broad walkways and even a diversion through the lovely old cemetery that meanders down to the cliffs. Coogee is a vibrant district with some interesting shops. Thoroughly recommended.

Great views on a great day. It's just the best the eastern side of sydney has to offer, especially if combined with the "Sculptures of the sea" in October.You can even do certain segments of this walk if you don't have the time to walk through it all... but make sure you do not miss the Waverly cemetery... classic dichotomy of peace and calm against the life on the beach.

The Views are Free. I have walked (quite a few times) the Bondi to Coogee section of a coastal walk commencing at the Gap in Vaucluse. Destination was Maroubra, around 13 kms south and a more scenic walking route would be hard to find. The route gets crowded at week-ends and in the early mornings and when Sculptures By The Sea is on it is slow progress. However, the sculptures are always a marvellous site and best to do that separately. We are so lucky to live in Sydney where there are numerous walking tracks and paths around the city. And so much bushland (and more great walks) in the suburbs.
A fantastic walk along the coast.. A great way to see this side of Sydney. Try joining the locals and going for a jog if thats your thing. Finish for a picnic in Bondi.

Sculpture by the sea. The Sculpture by the sea exhibition is a yearly international competition, set in October. A selection of the most wonderful artwork is strategically placed along the costal walk from Bondi to Tamarama.The pieces are often gigantic, but there is also a large tent showing the smaller ones. People of all ages congregate around the sculptures to admire and comment, as many pieces are quite witty. The sculptures placed right in the middle of Tamarama beach are overlooked by a small cafe and outside tables with parasols, with a lot of people trying to get in.On a sunny day, do take a hat and a water bottle with you, as there is not any shade along the walk.

Great Walk. We took the Sydney public transportation out to Bondi Junction and then a bus to the beach. When we got there, we did the walk along the coast to Coogee. It was very scenic and lovely! The views from there are amazing. A nice way to spend the day. But don't forget to bring sunscreen!

love it. We drove to Coogee, got a taxie to Bondi and then walked back to Coogee, on the costal walk. It is absolutely beautiful, great views. It takes a few hours and is most pretty at sunset. Take a water bottle
Beach Walk. A nice easy relaxing walk, terrific views of the sea and beaches.Bused back to Sydney. Soooo easy. Enjoyed by all of us in the group.

A Must Do!. This is a fantastic walking path around sea cliffs and roaring ocean waves. The nature scenes are great and there's plenty of great opportunities for photos. The walk takes about 1 - 1.5 hours, depending on how much you stop to take in the incredible vistas.From downtown Sydney, I suggest taking the local bus to Bronte. Right where the bus drops you off is the walking path. But better yet, there's also a strip of restaurants there - so relax over breakfast or lunch before your walk. After a lovely meal, walk the path to Bondi. You can take the bus back to Downtown Sydney from there.

A scenic coastal walk. Great coastal viewing and good exercise. A highlight for all our overseas visitors, they love seeing the sea and lots of it. Best for photos around mid-day onwards. Must wear a hat and use sunscreen as our Australian sun can really burn. My recent visitor said "I never burn" but she did with a bright red nose.
A great walk. This is a super coastal walk. Buses at each end to take you back Sydney. We took bus to Coogee and walked to Bondi where there is plenty of scope for lunch.

Amazing views. This coastal walk offers great views of the ocean going from small beaches to Bondi beach and the shops. It's a good way to spend a morning or an afternoon but avoid the end of the day where it'll be crowded.If you're afraid to swim in the ocean, you can stop to the pool at Clovelly beach and take a break from the walk, especially on a very hot day.It was really enjoyable and filled with photo opportunities

A great feel for Sydney's coastline. It can take up to two hours one way, depending upon who's walking (young children and older people walk slowly), and you pass by and through five of Sydney's iconic beaches. There are water fountains and take-away shops along the way. You can get a feel of how the beachside suburbs relate to these wonderful outdoor attractions. Good eye candy too.

Bondi/Coogee. A great walk, terrific scenery and a good way to spend 2-3 hours and to get to Coogee there is a host of cafes or restaurants to choose from then catch the bus back to the CBd. Good stuff!

One of the best things about living in Sydney. Coming from the Dominican Republic, is very easy to start questioning why i chose to live so far away from my family and friends. The Bondi to coogee walk finished by a handmade gelato brings me back. :D
A must do whilst in Sydney. Get out amongst the locals, but go early as it get busy. Stop off at Clovelly for a swim and then Bronte for a bite to eat. Great people watching.
Everyday is special. The ever changing scenery is spectacular- we walk or run it at least once a week and have done for years and still marvel at it's beauty
Great way to walk to Bondi. Suburban but interesting walk along the cliff and past several local beaches. I went when they had their sculpture trail in progress (normally October I think)
beautiful. what a fabulous walk. we had my 4 yr old in a stroller no problem. had to carry it down just a few flights of steps
Bondi. Brilliant, the views were amazing and the people were so friendly. I would highly suggest to people a day at Bondi is needed.

Great scenic walk. Took us just over an hour. Not too taxing and fantastic scenery.
Needed a cool ale when we got to Bondi.

A great walk along the sandstone cliff tops.. Not everyone gets the chance to do a walk like this, with views to New Zealand, well almost!
The experience is one that you will never forget, with an ever lasting memory, of our great city.

Never get tired of it. The stunning scenery, extraordinary landscape and colour is always breathtaking no matter how often you walk it...........The only minor improvement I would make is a couple of extra water fountains along the way.

Stroll along Sydney's foreshore. Take in Bondi Beach, McKenzie's, Tamarama (also knows as Glamourama), Bronte Beach take a break here and enjoy a drink at one of the small village shops. If you're lucky you will spot whales and/or dolphins. Beauty scenery, well worth while. Once a year there is a Sculpture display but for me the walk is very beautiful.

Great way to see the coastline. Sydney is a great city to live in and visit - one of the highlights is visiting the beach and the walk from Bondi to Coogee is lovely. In the early morning if you are up to it is also a great jog - in summer it is very busy though. You can get a bus back from Coogee.
Good walk - beautiful scenery. Long but very scenic walk with lovely bays & picture opportunities along the way. Good way of keeping fit whilst enjoying the surroundings & getting a tan :-)
One of the most beautiful walks you can do.. Easy walking, quite a lot of steps so don't take a wheelchair or stroller, lots of great cafes along the way, beautiful beaches and stunning scenery.

A walk on the wild side.. Not a walk on a scorchingly hot day unless you want to really burn, but one where you take it steady, enjoy the views and wonder what it was like before everyone found the beaches below.Not local? See if you can get your head into a surf club, it will give you an insiders view of the place, the history and the Aussie way of life at the beach.Stand stunned at the huge cemetery as you skirt it from the coastal path, how many places would have bulldozed this and build condominiums instead. Slightly dated, slightly hip, and actually well worth a walk on a cool quiet day, go for the fresh air and clear your mind, it did mine.

Love this walk. Whether you do the whole thing, or just parts of it, this walk is a highlight of any trip to Sydney. You don't have to be in super fit condition to enjoy a leisurely amble, but the sea air and some good-sized hills may be a challenge if you haven't walked for a very long time. Worth the effort though, if, like me, you take your time. There are lots of places to rest along the way. Take your bathers for a swim too!

A Must!. This is a great way to experience the Sydney coast with locals running/walking by, sitting and enjoying the sun and heading to a beach for a swim or surf ...there are many beaches to go for a swim.

Excillerating. The walk from Bondi to Coogee is my absolute favourite. It's not easy doing the return trip, so I do get my fair share of exercise. But the stunning views keep me going. This is a must, however, don't feel obliged to start in Bondi, as most do. Start anywhere Bondi and Cooge where. Clovelly can be easier for a park in summer.

Beautiful scenery. The views along the coast are absolutely wonderful. Smaller beaches along the walk are beautiful. Gordons bay looks more like an Italian beach rather than a place just a few kilometers from the centre of Australia's biggest city.
Amazing views. Beautiful walk on well marked paths and lots to look at along the way - Ocean views for all along the route were remarkable

Stunning views, great walk. Great walk, stunning views. We can recommend to do the walk when the "sculpture by the sea" is on. However it is very busy then especially on the weekend. We walked from Coogee to Bondi and reckon this direction has less stairs. We loved the walk and took around 300 photos. Oh, if you start early in the morning you can start with a brekkie in Coogee and finished with lunch at Bondi followed by a nice swim.Busses go back to Coogee reguarly .

Great!. Took the bus from the Meriton Campbell street to Bondi beach. Had lunch at Bondi beach then walked to Tamarama beach and on to Bronte beach. Decided to stop their and took the bus back to Sydney. Had a great day. Highly recommended!
great place to view the beaches. A little bit crowded, but hey, it's Sydney! If you sneak out an early morning run, you may have it more for yourself.

Beautiful walk!. My two friends and I walked this on a very hot day in Sydney, be prepared to take lots of water with you! Or at least an empty bottle as there are lots of water taps along the way. Such beautiful views along the walk, definitely worth it. There are quite a lot of steps so be prepared for that. Crazy seeing a cemetery along the route!
anja herben. we did a nice walk from Bondi Beach to cochee beach. we saw the lifequards from the prgram on television and took a picture with them wauw. the vieuws where stunning.

Quintessentially Aussie. Two lovely iconic Austalian beaches with white sand, traditional lifesavers, plenty of beach goers and piles of shops and restaurants to take advantage of. The cliff top views are lovely, skirting along the coast.

Very nice walk. You get to see all the beaches in between Bondi and Coogee and if you go there in November you might be lucky and get to see the sculptures by the sea display which is repeated every spring.

Awesome Walk. Well I must recommend those who loves to stroll along the beach for this amazing walk. Its quite a bit of a walk,, but the view is simply breath taking. In fact you would pass many amazing features of rocks, while the sea is on the side. In fact, you would even pass through a cemetery which is quite beautiful as it faces the sea.
Stunning. Great walk with loads of beaches and stops en route. I must say that Bondi is probably the least appealing beach on the whole walk.

The latte run. Great walking winter from Bondi to Coogee with Ocean and occasionally whale views.. I like the strip of cafes at Tamarama. You can sit in the afternoon sun and enjoy late lunch having nearly completed the round trip,

Nothing much going on at Bondi. Spent half a day touring around Bondi beach area. Other than the cold winter beach, there's almost nothing else to do in this town during our visit. Maybe it's only good to visit when there's surf event.

Best scenic walk almost anywhere. We were amazed. Sculpted sandstone cliffs; chains of beautiful beaches, enormous cemetery. Get away from Sydney CBD and do this. Easy train to Bondi junction and bus to Bondi beach. Caught bus at coogee back to Bondi. We got a $21 day transit pass. If I had to do it again, I'd bring swim trunks and mask snorkel for Covenlly ? Beach. One of our best days in Sydney was this walk.

Just perfect. I am very rarely swayed by the lets do a walk speech as i would much rather find the nearest pub and have a beer but this walk is truly spectacular! Australian coast at its best when i was walking it we saw dolphins jumping out of the water near Coogee bay also. Fantastic scenery especially for those who are slightly trigger happy with there camera!!

A must when in Bondi or Coogee.. So glad someone recommended this walk to us. It is about 4 miles from the start to the finish of the walk but the scenery on the walk is fantastic. We stopped half way at a restaurant for lunch then continued. Would not have seen half we we hadn't taken the coastal walk. Would definitely recommend this as a must do when your there.
Bondi Beach Art Walk. We were fortunate to be in Sydney on the weekend of the art walk when very novel and creative sculptures and other exhibits were on display along the pathway.

Great views and good walk - probably not suitable for disabled though.. This is a great walk and Bronte offers some great little cafes for a good lunch. Bronte also has a public open air swimming pool at the beach - free of charge (with showers and changing facilities)

one of my favourite spot in sydney. the atmosphere is vibrant, there are some excellent cafes, juice & gelato bars and restaurants around. one of my fav spot to have a late breakfast and take nice easy stroll on the beach afterwards.
Not easy at 70. I am over 70 but achieved this walk, it was well worth it for the sceanery, and of course the excersise.
Brillant open air walk with majestic sea views.. Go during Sculptures by the sea and experience, art, walking and views.One of the best walks around.Take your cossies for a dip along the way.

Coogee to Bondi Beach Walk. The Coogee to Bondi walk takes you along the coast line with some cliffs thrown in to spice it up. The walk takes you along some of the most scenic places - Tamarama beach, Mackenzie’s Point , Waverley Cemetery , Bronte Beach , Clovelly Beach . The entire route has a lot of eateries and rest rooms for the convenience of the traveller.The view is spectacular all through the route!!! A must do in Sydney

STUNNING Beaches and views! U dfntly have to do that!!. I did the coastal Walk from Coogee to Bondi and the way back during Sculpture by The Sea!ohmg it was absolutely Amazing!you pass from different beaches (Coogee, Clovelly, Bronte, Tamarama, Bondi), it takes from 2hrs30 til 4 ( if you stop like me for taking pictures:)..Tamarama, Coogee and Bondi r my favourite ones:).. And if in November u r in Sydney, have a look at sculpture by the sea!!You will find many people running n families in the week end!! Have a stop at the cemetery aswell.. It looks beautiful!!
A must do walk. As with all the other reviews - the scenery is spectacular. Our reward for completing this walk was a nice cold beer at the Coogee Bay Hotel!

Spectacular, Must Do Walk!. This was recommended to us by a friend and I am so glad we did this! The scenery from the walk is spectacular with the cliffs and the lovely blue ocean. You pass several beaches (Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte, Clovelly, ending at Coogee). The walk is easy and fully paved all the way but it is rather long. However, if you don't want to do it in its entirety, you can break off at any of the beaches along the way and take a bus back to wherever you want to go.
Coastal Walk. Wow!! The best walk Ive ever done.Stunning!! Some great views.Not a hard walk at all you can really take your time and soak up the atmosphere and views.Beautiful!
Simply beautiful. This is a must for any visitors to Sydney. Amazing scenery that should not be missed on a trip to Sydney.

Magnificent! Not to Be Missed!. We started in Coogee and walked to Bondi! The weather was grand and there was an international sculpture show going on along the entire walk. The views off the coast were superb and the art complimented the walk well. There were plenty of bathrooms along the walk and many great places to eat. Do not miss this walk! It remains one of the highlights of our 8 day visit to Sydney!
Spectacular beach!. Beautiful and wonderful views! Fine sand and refreshingly chilly waters too! Always pack slippers for this not-to-be-missed spot!

Beautiful views and beaches. I highly recommend this walk because it's a great way to see the beautiful beaches and the ocean. It's also a good way to get some exercise while eating a lot on vacation. It was easy to get to and from Bondi and Coogee by public bus. Wish I had brought my swimsuit to try out the saltwater pools.

Amazing walk!!!!!!. I LOVED this walk! I did it alone but it was great, the views are amazing!! Lots of free water along the walk and each section of the walk is different with different views. You pass other beaches which you can stop at and eat there. Tbh, I didn't enjoy Coogee beach as much as Bondi. If I was to do it again, I would start at Coogee and walk towards Bondi as that way it's not an anticlimax!

A 'must do' walk in Sydney. Although we have visited Sydney upwards of a dozen times, we never tire of this walk, taking in the dramatic cliffs, ocean views and lovely beaches of the eastern suburbs. Changes to the route in recent years with new walkways, especially near Waverley Cemetery, have improved the experience. Being keen walkers, we always extend the route southwards across the wetland walkways and through Lurline Bay (passable at low tide) to Maroubra. Use the bus service to avoid potential parking problems and the snags of a linear route. Enjoy a snack at one of the great little cafes in Coogee. Not to be missed!

Beautiful walk, stunning scenery. We have done this walk before, but this time we went to see the sculpture symposium. make sure you go next year. It is a fabulous walk at any time, but when sculpture is on it is absolutely fabulous. Take water with you any time of year and take your time to stop and enjoy views. Dolphins kept popping up along the way. It was great
A must try for everyone. I love this coastal walk. Just take your time and keep walking in the views along the way. Don't forget to take some snaps along the way...
dont go on a sunday. nice walk but very packed on weekends very little parking so take puplic transport to Bondi great veiws round every corner

the Beaches. Sydney is well known for it's great beaches and walks. I particularly enjoyed the walk from Bondi past Tamarama and Mackenzie's Bay and Bronte to the top of the hill where there is a shark proof pool which I particularly like as I am not a strong swimmer. This area is also home of the Art by the Sea exhibitions which are held each year in the open landscape ..usually held in early November.

A Must Do for everyone*. From Iconic Bondi Beach to beautiful Bronte and back..is a Supremely Sydney Must Do. If you're lucky enough to be here when the SXS - Sculpture by the Sea exhibition is on (this year was 18 Oct - 4 Nov) you will be doubly blessed. But the walk and the views has to be experienced. Tamarama beach, in between, with its park and kiosk is a welcome half way break adding to the fun. If you like Light, Vibrant Colours and Stunning Vistas,,,don't miss this walk (*not disabled friendly in places however)
great view!. we love coogee...we usually spend part of the week end there and it's lovely walking along the shore and trying to spot dolphins or whales...the girls love it!
one of my favorite walks. This is one of my favorite things to do in Sydney. It is abut a 2 hr walk with some great places along the way.

Best Walk of my life. I am pretty lazy so was dreading doing this walk with my friends as I had heard it was quite long but after five minutes I was over that. The scenery is so beautiful and you can take a little break at every beach you reach!

Wonderful Walk. We walked the trail from Bondi to Tamarama on a beautiful Sunday morning in November. We had lots of company, though it wasn't at all crowded. There are gorgeous views, splashing waves, sandy beaches, surfers, even some sculpture. And all of this for free! Don't forget your camera.People with limited mobility should be prepared for some steep steps along the way.Four of us took a cab from Central Station to Bondi Beach for about $35. It was much quicker than public transportation and not that much more expensive.

Beautiful walk. This is a fairly easy walk, but a real beauty, it's great to take in the stunning coastline and breathe the salt air. Also very interesting to visit the cemetery and note the notables buried there. And when you get to Coogee there are many options in terms of food and drink.

Great Walk.. Great views.... We travelled by rail fom the centre of Sydney, and the bus to the beach... good fun.. the walk around the coast is well signed, and well maintained... We called in at Bronte beach for lunch, and then joined lots of others on the pathway... great views, and great sea air.. go for it...
A must do !. The view is gorgeous. The cafes at either end of the walk, particularly Bondi and Bronte are great. The people watching is spectacular. Be careful of the surf!

Iconic seaside walk. Any tourist (and all locals) should do this walk. Even when the weather is not perfect it has a lot to offer. Stop at Tamarama on the way for a walk on the sand or a picnic on the grass. Or go on the Bronte for your choice of restaurants or cafes. On your return to Bondi reward yourself with a coffee or gelato.
Sydney must do. An exceptional walk along the stunning eastern Sydney coast. Stop for a coffee on the beach at Tamorrama

A Sensational Walk. I have done this walk several times and each time it has impressed me tremendously.The sea views are superb and the coastal beaches, of which several are passed, are just breathtakingly beautiful. Good to take a picnic, make a day of it and enjoy these beautiful beaches where one can swim in the clear crystal waters.Eventually you arrive at the stunning expanse of beach which is the iconic Bondi and this certainly lives up any expectations you may have.Also, a flat and easy walk which can be undertaken by all ages and levels fitness.

Beautiful coastal walk.... We embarked on this walk following a couple of hours on Bondi Beach. It was at the weekend and the sculptures were there so it was extremely busy but after half an hour of walking it became far more enjoyable. The walk despite being busy took approximately 2 hours. An easy walk on the whole with stunning views for the duration. Highly recommended.

What a lovely walk along some of the most beautiful beaches in the world. A lovely walk along the famous beaches from Bondi to Coogee. If you are a walker, you can simply take the metro to Bondi Junction and walk in, around 20 minutes. Or you can catch a bus. The walk is not strenuous and there are parks along the way as well as restaurants and bars close by. Sadly, when I was there there were more old men in speedos then young women in bikinis.
Bondi walk. This is an awesome walk from Coogee Beach to Bondi. You do need to be able to walk up and down stairs, but there are places to rest. There are also places to eat and drink.
Walk Between Two of Sydney's Best Beaches. This is a great way to spend an hour or two, walk along the cliff path and stop at the little beaches on the way. Don't forget your camera.

A walk with Culture !!. Whilst this path is great in itself, and offers good views back to the iconic Bondi beach, I was there whilst the sculpture exhibition was in place. This is an annual show in late October/early November each year, and in 2012 there was 100 pieces along the path as far as Tamarama.It is amazing how many locals (into their 1,000's !!) take to this path to view the large and small exhibits. Search out the web site for more detail, it is well worth the effort. Suggestion is to go late one afternoon to avoid the crowds, Yes, it really is that busy on the path.

Sculpture walk a wow!. Just returned from a 3 days stay in Bondi and the highlight was the sculpture walk. I was more than impressed. The downside was the amount of people doing it but that also gave it a great convivial feel. Lots of laughing, viewing, sharing of responses. The smaller exhibits in the tent were also great. I got a bit hot and being over 60 took it slowly. Another highlight was the lunch at the Bistro at Icebergs. The view to the sea was beautiful and made me very homesick for it-I now live on the Murray inland and miss the coast. Despite being an older person I loved Bondi. Found a lovely coffee house and several yum eating spots. A beaut Italian restaurant opposite Icebergs.

One of the best coastal/harbour walks in Sydney. Fun, easy walk along the clifftops and paths overlooking the beautiful Pacific ocean. We have always like walking from Coogee to Bondi. We do it during the Sculptures by the Sea festival which makes it all the more enjoying.
Great views. We love this walk. Just take your time and stop and take in the views along the way. There are places to stop for a coffee, food or ice cream.

Not so easy to get there, but worth going. If you're a tourist staying in CBD, and without a car, you'll have to do your research to find the right train/bus combo to get you there and back. But if you do, you'll be rewarded with gorgeous views on a pleasant walk. Our only regret is choosing to go on the last day of Sculptures By The Sea. The crowds were overwhelming.

Great walk but very busy due to the Sculptures by the Sea exhibition. We did it the other way around and got a bus to Coogee beach and walked back to Bondi. At the start it was very quiet with great views but as soon as you hit the exhibition the crowds just got ridiculous and it spoilt an otherwise great walk. The sculptures themselves were great but you couldn't enjoy them or take good photos because of the crowds
Great early morning walk. Coastal walk is fun and scenic. Can use public transportation to get there and back. Well marked and there are several places along the way for a cup of coffee

Exhilarating coastal walk. With breathtaking views of the blue Pacific and sandstone cliffs and beautiful bays await you with a short bus ride downtown Sydney or Bondi Junction. I have walked the coastal cliffs many times, but just a few days ago I did the walk in an opposite direction, beginning in Coogee and walking 6 Kim's to Bondi Beach. An added bonus was the annual 3week sea art exhibit beginning at Tamarama Beach. If you need to stop for lunch break, you can do so in Bronte Beach after a swim there. This walk is by far one of the great half day or full day attractions that you can do in Sydney, plus it is free. The walk can be done in either direction and is accessible by public transport. Highly recommend this wonderful coastal walk with unbeatable scenery.

Must do. If you can walk for a couple of hours this is a must for anyone visiting this area. We did the walk in reverse from Coogee to Bondi and ended up seeing the Sculptures by the sea exhibition which was amazing. Lots of places to sit and rest with some breathtaking views. Easy to get to on the buses from central Sydney.
Beautiful. Must do while in Sydney if you have the time. Gorgeous views! I thought about going back on another day to do it again!
Beach Walk. a really nice way to this coast line,although Bondi was a bit of a dissapointment,the walk is great,loved all the information on the walk and we had a lovely meal at one of the coves

Beautiful coastal walk!. Fantastic walk from Bondi beach round to Bronte and then to Coogee beach. Great standard of paths, lookouts and handrails with benches along the way. Take suncream!! Gets really hot. Need to be of reasonable level of fitness as some bits get quite steep and lots of steps in parts but took a couple of hours with a lunch stop along the way. Well worth it, great free activity in Sydney.
Gentle walk suitable for all ages.. Can be too crowded on weekends but is truly a delightful walk. Incredibly picturesque if a little touristy.

Beautiful ocean walk. This is by far one of the best walks in the world. The breath taking views with little villages in every nook makes this a great walk for leisure or Sport. The only caveats can be wind and rain, an occasional storm will come in and make it a bit tough.Every time I stay in Coogee I walk about 7-8k everyday. Bring a bottle of water - save your $4.00 for a coffee at any of the cafes along the way

Beautiful!!!. We were on Bondi in late October and there were so many people on the beach--if felt like it was the first day of Spring. We took the scenic walk and enjoyed the sculptures along the beach.

Stunning !. i went there during the sculpture by the sea. very crowded but still worth the visit. Less crowded after bronte beach. The coast view is stunning !! a must to do when in Sydney (especially when the weather is clear)

Sculpture by the Sea. Fortunately, my husband and I were in town while the Sculpture by the Sea exibit was up. While it was crowded the views of the water and beach (as well as the art) were amazing. The walk is not too long and if you start at Coogee and end at Bondi you'll be in a great place to grab a bite with a view.

Stunning vista. This is one of the great walks of the world. I have always lived on the ocean in Sydney and accepted it as normal.It is iconic Sydney, I love travelling but constantly find a delight of being were there is water. Perhaps I have some Labrador in my breeding.Make a point to do this walk, it may grow on you and become a way of life!

An absolute must. We did it from Coogee to Bondi but then we were staying in Coogee. Bronte is gorgeous and the houses of Gordens Bay are stunning. Take your speedos so you can go for a swim at Icebergs along the way, one of the best outdoor 50m pools in the world.

best coastal walk in the world. I live in Bondi and travel extensively and this coastal walk is as good as anywhere in the world if not better. The magnificent views of surfers on their boards and the gorgeous beaches(with sand, not pebbles)is always uplifting. The Sculpture exhibition every year is a highlight but I wish the joggers who run here daily would go to the gym or Rose Bay during this event.
Lovely views with lots of people watching. It was great to watch so many different people doing so many different things, surfers, kids hanging around, posers and fitness freaks and I mean freaks

Reminds me of Southern Cali. Every walk the beaches of Southern Cali? Well here it with much better surf! The walls are decorated with morals from local artists, there's tons of shopping, lots of restaurants, and plenty of people watching to do. We were there in November and the water was still too cold for us (20C).

Beautiful. Lovely view and the feeling in Bondi is extremely relaxing.Lovely clear skies and cool breeze.
Good to hang around a day or 2 to get into the Aussie mode

Spectacular. A lovely walk along the cliff top path. There was a sculpture exhibition on the way which added to the ineresting walk. We were there on a Sunday and it was very busy. Choose a quieter day if you can.
Recommended. It's a lovely walk around the bays from Bondi to Coogee. Lots to look at along the way, generally people watching. Great way tonget some exercise and jump in the ocean to cool down.

Festival Time. During the Sydney Festival (January), this walk is littered with art works and kite flyers. Great time to see this wonderful walk.. if you can bear the heat... It is pretty hot at that time... Still, you have the Pacific ocean to cool you off along the way... and there are some great beaches.... Bondi, Tamerama, Bronte and Coogee.... take a dip... get some great fish and chips at Bronte...

Unbelievable. I could have walked and walked and walked this path and never be bored. I was in total awe of the ocean, the waves, and the scenery. Breathtaking views...and don't think about going without a camera! it was spectacular!!

If you are in Sydney you MUST do this!. If you are visiting Sydney you can NOT miss the opportunity to do this Coastal walk. Is breathtaking!!! Totally awesome landscapes, like 2km of walk where you go through 4 (or something like that) different beaches. i recommend to bring water, sunscreen, sport cloths and your bainsuit so you can make a "splash" between beaches.

Breath taking. Along the coastal walk for a large portion you are literally walking along cliffs, sometimes over 100 meters, its an unbelievable sight whether its a nice calm day and you can walk down to the lower parts and jump in for a quick swim or on rougher days watch the sea crash against the rocks, or go down early in the morning and watch the sun rise over the ocean.

Bondi Beach. This is an iconic Beach and although it is not really a pretty beach and a bit disappointing from that aspect it is a very popular place and one that one must see. Whilst we were on the beach the sea was very rough and the life guards closed the beach as it was becoming dangerous.

Sculptures by the Sea. Excellent in concept, mediocre in execution.Sculptures by the Sea was overcrowded (possibly because we visited on its final weekend). I'm not sure how boring it would've been without the sculptures though.Might be better to rent a car and take a coastal drive.

Fantastic walk. If I lived near this area I would run here every morning. It is a beautiful walk and we were lucky enough to be there during sculptures by the sea so although a bit crowded it was really nice.

Tooooo Crowded. Unfortunately we did this walk on the last day of the Sculpture exhibition and the crowds were horrendous. We just wanted to leave. So much traffic getting there and back. Not the best choice. Will try it again on our next visit to Sydney and ensure there is no event there.

Beautiful. Great weather, great views and fantastic art. Well worth a visit if the weather's good. Join hundreds of Sydney-siders and tourists for a few hours of picturesque views and wierd and wonderful art pieces

Popular coastal walk. It is one of popular coastal walks. It takes about 3 hours for a return. You should know you can walk along most of the coastline in Sydney. If you are up to walk in Sydney, look up the website, meetup.com/coastal walk(it might not the exact website address,) You can get lots of walk opportunities around in Sydney and night out.

A great way to see coastal Sydney.. A footpath that links Bondi and Tamarama beaches. There are a few sections that have steep steep but basically an easy walk.Late Oct/Nov each year it plays host to "Sculptures by the Sea" an outdoor art exhibition.

always a great walk for the view and the people watching. It's not too long a walk and you can always stop 1/2 way at Bronte for lunch. so many eclectic people around and the view of the beaches is fabulous.

beautiful. went there during the October sculpture exhibition on the water front - it was amazing. Don't forget to check transportation opportunities to bring you back, as it might be a very long walk

Art walk not to be missed. Loved the Bondi to Tamarama sculpture on the sea with lots of big and small scultpures placed across the hill and down into the sand. Just before the busy summer season it is a great time to visit and good break from the busy city
Good walk but busy. Parking and traffic nightmare to get to it but once there the walk is great. Better beach walks further north.

Great opportunity to exercise and take in the coastal splendour. I do all or part of this walk everytime I visit my family in Clovelly. On the weekend it can get a little crowded and frenetic, especially the stretch from Bondi to Clovelly. Clovelly to Coogee and beyond is a little less so. As others have said before me Sculptures by the Sea is a great way to take in the section from Bondi to Tamarama - but it does get really crowded. I also recommend you have a meander through Bronte Cemetery and check out the tombstones.

Wonderful Sea Views. The scenery on this walk is superb, with wonderful sandstone along the way, creating an artist's dream location. The annual Sculptures by the Sea prove how much better the natural beauty of the landscape is, although it is a fun event to visit.
Visually spectacular. Visited when the Sculpture by the Sea was on. Walked along the cliffs. Even without the sculptures it would have been fantastic.

Lovely walk (when it's not too packed!). Having lived in Coogee for a few years, my boyfriend and I have done this walk many times. It's a really lovely walk but on the weekends it tends to get a little packed. The path is quite narrow at times so you have to be patient with the slower moving pedestrians.
I recommend this walk to anyone visiting Sydney.

fresh sea air. i got the city sight seeing bus out to bondi and had a walk along the beach then i noticed there was people in the distance doing a walk and went over to have a look to see what it was. i decided to do it and it was well worth it the sun was out so warm which made it nicer . it was lovely to see beaches along the way.

Beautiful!. This is a lovely walk and not too strenuous although bring water and sun cream. Keep an eye out for whales and dolphins on your way round. I did this on a windy day which made for some great waves and some better photos.

nice coastal walk with lots to see. Takes about 2.5 hours to do but there are some fantastic views to behold. you make your way through several other bays and when i did the walk there was an art by the sea exhibitionist on with sculptures places a odd places along the walk that made you stop and think. had a great time.

Perhaps better done the other way round?. We made the mistake of starting the walk in the middle of the day on a Sunday during Sculptures by the Sea - the walkway was packed and it was sometimes hard to make much progress! Even so, we thoroughly enjoyed it. The walk is absolutely glorious on a sunny day, especially once the crowds are left behind. If we ever had the opportunity to do the walk again (which won't be any time soon, considering we live the other side of the world), I'd probably start at Coogee, though, so as to be able to spend some time in Bondi at the end of the walk. If you're staying in the City, and you want to start at Bondi, I'd suggest getting the 333 bus from Circular Quay (we caught the 380 which was rather slow and was overtaken by a 333 bus). The bus route back from Coogee seemed to be rather more interesting, passing by the SCG on its way. There was also less traffic to delay it!
Not to be missed. Highly reccomended- especially early in the morning.Stunning views - lots of runners and walkers - the best of Sydney.

A must. We have doe this walk, or parts of it,quite a few times. A fabulous overview of an Australian icon. Today we only did a short section as we explored "Sculpture by the sea" which is an annual festival that celebrates the interplay between all kinds of sculptural forms and the coastal landscape. Almost anything can become a scultpure, from traditional stone, to welded works of the imagination, to plastic forks and on to staples! Don't do what we did though. Get there early - before the crowds. You'll then be able to walk without bumping into people, and take photos without strange heads in them!
The BEST way to see the Sea!. Early summer is the best time to really enjoy this wonder of Sydney! Don't drive and park- catch the train and bus.

Best During Sculptures by the Sea. Visited my 3rd or 4th Sculptures by the Sea this year and while not as good as previous years still worth the visit. It has finished for 2012 but the walk it is based on from Tamarama to Bondi makes up about half the Bondi Coogee walk. I have done it a number of times and is a must for Sydney tourists to get a taste of what the spectacular Sydney coast is like. Watch out for joggers and bring your camera ;)

Perfect place to walk!!!!. Excellent place in the morning or end of the day.
You can walk and stop to swimming, or just appreciate the view!

Lovely walk. Really enjoyed seeing the Bondi beach it is small but still a lovely place to stay for the day, went on the walk which to begin with was lovely, then felt like saying 'are we there yet' think I was feelin tired but a lovely appetite worked up and the walk was fun really

Get your walking shoes on. Bondi beach is definitely worth seeing.If you enjoy walking there are excellent coastal walks which are a great workout.Take the walk along past the famous icebergs swimming club along the coast in oct/nov and there are sculptures all along the coastal park.This walk will take you past some other beaches such as Bronte beac h which are smaller than Bondi and a great place to stop off.All patrolled by lifeguards too.The walk is very scenic too.You can sit and watch whales migrating.Jumping and blowing water into the air truly heart warming.On the way back we stopped off at the famous icebergs swimming club.5 dollars for a swim an four for a spectator.They have a 50 metre out door sea water swimming pool.Though cold when you get in once you start doing your laps you'll soon warm up.A great wat to finish off a walk.

Amazing. This is one of the finest walks anywhere in the world. Also a great workout! There are so many things going on in the ocean, including loads of whales from about July. These magnificent mamals come in close, many with babies, and yu are able to see them very clearly. There are many little cafes along the way, so put a few $$ in your pocket for a drink. The view over Bondi Beach it breathtaking, but not just Bondi, you pass Bronte, Tamarama and Clovelly, all are unique and all have cafes. You can walk at your own pace.. jog, orsimply walk and stop to take great photos and enjoy the spectacular views

Spectacular views!. This is a fabulous walk to do to see the coastline plus many of the lovely beaches in Sydney's east. Take a leisurely pace and stop for a swim at many of the beaches or a snack at many of the cafes. Best of all, finish at Bondi for an afternoon drink. We loved this walk!
Great walk on a nice day. You manage to view all the tiny cute beaches along the walk... my favourite is the one with lots of boats - beautiful!!
Excellent. Had a great time at Bondi - went and saw the sculpture exhibition. Nice little shops and lovely clean beaches
Great to see the sea sculptures. I was able to take this walk and see the sea sculpture exhibit at the same time. Lots of people there on a Saturday but worth it. The scenery is spectacular.
the best walk. A bus trip from the city a lunch in Bondi and the walk it of round the coast, there is much to see ,busy but safe for walkersoh we had this in WA
sculptures by the sea. a great walk at any time but extra special when the sculptures are on! If possible allow time to stroll through the cemetry.

Seaside artscape -- Lovely!!. This is normally a beautiful walk along the coast, elevated, from Bondi to Coogee Beaches. Two weeks during the spring they host numerous artists, who decorate the seaside walk with art of all types: Musical, whimsical, stone, bronze, marble, wood and plastic. This is a very special time to see stunning artwork. Not to be missed if you find yourself in the area in late October.Much of the art is available for sale.

A must do in any visit to Sidney. Excellent transport from the CBD via the city express bus. Takes you right there. The walk is definitely worth it, and you will likely see dolphins and maybe even a whale along the way. Return we stopped for lunch at the Ocean Club and enjoyed the views of the surfers and ocean.

A must if you enjoy walking. During October the area has an arts festival.. We were fortunate to see the sculptures erected along the coastal walk and in the park area above Bondi beach. It was extremely interesting with stunning backdrops to large proportion of the work. The walk itself provides fantastic views of beautiful coastline and bays. It is quite a long walk and includes some steps and fairly steep inclines so only for the enthusiastic walker although no expertise required. Regular bus service from Coogee back to the city at the end of the walk.
stunning. The best views you can get with only a 30 minute bus ride from the cbd. Very easy to follow and a diverse set of beaches to dip into along the way - Bring a snorkel kit!

Sculptures by the sea - don't miss it. Our first time on this walk and the weather could not have been better - one of those days where Syd really does look like how it appears on a postcard. Scultpures by the sea runs from 18 Oct - 4 Nov (?) Public t'port was great. The bus driver made specific mention of the stop to alight at and gave directions down the road next to Icebergs as the starting point. Helpful signage in Bondi Junction bus station for correct bus numbers.The volunteers who work at this event are helpful and passionate about Syd and the event. It is worthwhile to spend the $10 on the booklet - but we got one from the seat pocket in the Hyundi Santa Fe courtesy car seat pocket!! There were lots of people on the trek, prams, joggers, non-English speaking tourists but everyone was in a good mood and just went with the flow as there was so much inspiring art to look at. Took us a good 2 hours.Sydney Tap Water had a great stand handing out free water and encouraging you to fill up your own water bottles in the park. The marquee in the park that housed a lot of miniatures of the life size sculptures was brilliant and would be something for ppl to do if their mobility was limited but they still wanted to participate.My favourite sculpture was walking through the bamboo 'wind farm' when the wind blew and I liked the significance of the commemoration of the 222 Bali bombing victims especially given the time of year and the recent 10 year anniversary. My sister liked the large silver ball out on the cliff face with all the holes and clocks in it.The only thing that detracted from enjoyment all day were the blokes who saw the sun and took their shirts off to unveil that bellies, boobs, hirsuteness and tatts. Seriously they could've done with some sculpting by the sea - and indoors as well. Blah! Despite being traumatised by this, we are going to make in an annual pilgrimage.

Beautiful walk among amazing coast line. This walk is extremely beautiful, following the coastline along Sydney's nicest beaches - it makes you wonder why the English didn't take Australia for themselves, instead of sending their prisoners here! From cliffs and rocks, to the beautiful old graveyard at Coogee, finishing with the vast sandy stretch of Bondi. Amazing.
Coastal walk. Nowhere else like it on the planet. Exhiiirating on a windy day and just a great walk any day. A walk of cliff topsand beaches.

Outstanding. The afternoon we spent walking from Coogee to Bondi was one of our favorite memories of Sydney (along with the bridge climb!). It was an amazing 10 km walk along a beautiful ocean path and we highly recommend it. Catching the bus from and back to Sydney was easy and inexpensive. Definitely worth the effort and trip. We highly recommend it!

Great Views. If you enjoy coastal views and fresh air you will not be disappointed by this walk. There are many beaches along the way with little cafes to stop and wet your whistle. Best time to do this walk is when Sculptures By the Sea is being held. Double thumbs up.

Outstanding views and a very nice walk, but there are steps!. We did the Bondi to Cogee cliff walk with our son whilst visiting Sydney ( our son lives in Bondi Road close to the beach). It's a lovely walk with exceptional views of cliffs and beaches. The sculpture show was on between Bondi and Bronte beaches which was fun to see. Be advised that there is a lot of "up and down" on the walk so be prepared for stairs going both up and down along the way. After the walk we had a drink in a nice cafe in Cogee and then caught a cab back to Bondi. If you're staying in Sydney it's an easy bus trip to Bondi Beach and then you can also catch a bus back to the city from Cogee.
Beach walk. Great family walk from Coogee to Bondi woderful views and historic location through the cemetry, we spent quite some time there, then have lunch at the Icebergs

Enjoyable walk with nice beaches. Went when Sculpture by the Sea was on - great sculptures but extremely busy. Lots of places for refreshments along the way - Bronte beach was particularly good for this

Sculptures by the Sea. We walked from Bondi to Tamarama to view the sculptures. The day was perfect and the walk extremely rewarding. We stopped at the Bondi Icebergs Club, took temporary membership and enjoyed afternoon tea looking out of Bondi Beach. This walk is a must.

Add some fitness. Really nice trail and a great opportunity to get some fitness in to your day. Loads of people run along here and then you can finish off, however far you want to go, with a refreshing dip. Its a popular route so you will have to dodge the strollers

First thing to do if you hike. Everyone wants to see Bondi Beach but if you like to walk, take 2-3 hours to walk the coastal trail from Coogee to Bondi to see what Aussie's love most about their country. Photo ops galore! In mid October don' t miss the amazing Scultures by the Sea event,
