don't go on a sunday!. it was like being at a cattle mart or in a queue at christmas!the path is so narrow that you can't pass out the old biddys or people who insist on stopping every 3 yards to take a photo.. we got fed up and went walking on the road instead!

You can't do better. This walk is best done by day to take in unparalleled beach and ocean vistas. It also boasts an international competition of Art by the Sea, with serious or whimsical sculptures displayed along the route. It winds up and down, with not many steps, and takes about an hour to do if walking briskly. But you'll want to stop - often - to admire the view or take in the sight of whales breaching offshore.
Walk this way.. Love this walk. Done it both ways and it never fails to surprise. Stop at Bronte for a brew. Lovely.

Beautiful. Being from the States, all I could do is relate it to something I know, so if you think Big Sir and the California coast is beautiful, you will love this walk. A winding coast walking path from the edge of popular Bondi beach to the quaint town of Bronte that takes about 2 hours to wander, the walk features beaches, parks, and spectacular coast views overlooking the splashing waves on the rocky shore. Don't miss it!!!

Walk on the wild side. We did this walk in a howling gale, but it was spectacular. We were there in winter so we did not expect anything better. The waves were impressive and there a lot of sea birds offshore.
Stunning!. Great walk along some of the most beautiful coastline on earth with a cool dip in Clovelly natural swimming pool!

Great- Take the time out to do it. We went to Bondi to do a surf lesson and decided to carry on and do the 2 hour walk. It really is a good 2 hour walk but very enjoyable, the walk is along lovely wooden broadwalks and passes little coves and great views and lookouts. Would highly recommend chilling out and doing the walk if you have the time.
Fantastic scenery. Amazing walk! So so so scenic and one of the nicest ways to exerciser. Dodge the joggers, take your ipod and soak in the sun and surf.

Best oceanside walk ever!. This is a gorgeous oceanside walk. We just went as far as Bronte Beach. Absolutely do this walk! It is not to be missed. We have done beach walks in Hawaii, Florida, Bermuda, Grand Cayman, Cozumel and Jamaica and this was absolutely the best!

stunner. Love this walk myself. Have taken all my visitors here. The Sculptures by the Sea exhibition in November is a mixed blessing - it makes the walk really special & fun, but the larger crowds detract from the serenity of feeling you are one with sky & sea. Finishing at Bondi for a drink at Icebergs is a treat. Walking past (or through) the cemetery is quite surreal - not at all spooky in the bright sunlight! I love reading the faded crumbled headstones from over a century ago.You don't have to do the whole walk. (The Sculptures by the Sea exhibition is predominantly dotted on & between Tamarama & Bondi beaches.) Cafes at each beach provide sustenance with a view.
Great walk. A really enjoyable walk by the ocean. Not too strenuous and has some stunning views of the ocean and beaches.

In reverse.. If you get time, take a walk from the end of Baden Street, to the north of Coogee Bay, Coogee, to Bondi. It is a super walk. Distance unknown and it takes as long as it takes! All depends on how quickly you walk and how many photos you stop to take. There is a quirky bit when you pass through a large cemetery (there are sometimes works being carried out so there is a diversion), but this might give you the opportunity to spot lizards basking on gravestones.You will pass Gordon Bay, Clovelly, Bronte, Tamarama then the famous Bondi.There will be plenty of people jogging or walking and it is a simple, lazy walk. I love it and have done this at least four times over the years.
Coastal classic. Fab walk in the morning at sunrise, although it is pretty busy with all the morning exerciser's. Gets quieter once they have all headed off to work.

Sculptures by the Sea. The costal walk from Tamarama Beach to Bondi during the Sculptures by the Sea exhibition has got to be a 'must do' for Sydney. Finished off with a glass of wine at the amazing Bondi Icebergs, the perfect outing.
1 of 'Must' do list in Sydney. I do this every time when we have visitors from overseas or interstate. It shows beautiful beaches, houses, people & pets, great example of how people live in Sydney.
Pleasant walk around the cliffs. Beautiful view of old style apartments on a cliffside overlooking a coast line - nothing like beaches up north, totally different vibe.

Amazing views and nice beaches. Relax early mornings at Bondi beach, slowly walk to Coogee and in the middle you have Bronte where you can have some nice food to prolong your journey afterwards to Coogee.

World class views. Take this walk in either April/May or August/September and you may even glimpse a migratory whale. Stop off at any one of the cafes and soak up the vista of surfers, vollyball players or even join in the fun.

Pretty, pleasant and relaxing. This coastal walk is another must do. First to see the famous Sydney beaches and their salt water swimming pools, then to enjoy the nice views and realize that a big city can offer sports area, fun and relaxation for free. Go running or walking, stop for a dive and drinks, you will enjoy your day.

It is a beauty!. How we look forward to our walk when we arrive in Coogee to stay with Trish ,What a lovely way to get over the jet Lag breath taking views and a great reward when you arrive at icebergs for lunch !
Brilliant!. You MUST do this walk, it is amazing. Have walked this walk in various weather conditions and always stunning.
What a view!. The walk is a bit long (so make sure you are fit!); but the views are incredible. You do need to dodge the joggers while walking it, so watch out! But well worth it; amazing views.

Simply beautiful. I've done this maybe 8-10 times, every time we had a visitor come and visit we took them here. Amazing scenery, but not too difficult walking. Come here during a storm for some epic views of the wild ocean!

A fabulous walk. I love this walk, in fact I have done it more than once, not all at the same time but taking chunks of it according to time, it is such beautiful scenery, easy to walk, very beautiful, well worth a day of your holidays!

Inspirational Walk with Beautiful Views!. This is a lovely walk beside the ocean with a great variety of views on both the beach and land side. A great time to do the walk is when 'Sculptures By The Sea' is on. This is held in the middle of October each year and goes for 2 weeks. Local & international artists display their works along the shore. It is free to view, as you walk along the esplanade. A truly amazing experience, but still great to walk anytime! Have fun in the sun!
Beautiful coastline. Whats not to like. Breathtaking views along the sea with pools and inlets to explore along the way. Was a memorable run along the well-maintained path.

Good walk on a full moon night. I have done this walk by day and by night. It is easy to medium with a steep section and quite a few steps. A memorable visit was Coogee to Bondi and return after sunset. A full moon rose over the ocean creating a spectacular reflection on the water. If walking at night a torch is essential for use on the stairs along the route. If walking in daylight wear a hat, use sunscreen and carry water. The one-way walk is about 6 km. Allow two hours one-way because of the stairs.
Great views. The waves, surfers, nice cooling winds made the long walk very enjoyable. Some steps here and there so it may get tiring for people who don't walk often.

Beautiful 3+ mile walk along the coast. We took the bus to Coogee Beach and walked from the outer part toward the city and Bondi Beach. Most of the way had wide sidewalks with the ocean to our right. Australia is very big on fitness with numerous places with stations for various exercises and several parks. Water and sunscreen a must, but there are water refill stations along the way. Beach after beach with Boogy Boards, surfers and sunbathers.

Vistas for visiting. One of the best coastal walks close to the city of Sydney. Easy to walk, with fantastic coastal views all along the way. Take water as you WILL get thirsty! A hat and sunscreen is important for our climate too. Don't let the winter sun deceive you. A great walk for the whole family to enjoy.

Love this walk - even with all the people!. Walking the Bondi to Coogee walk is life affirming - the beauty of the sea and cliffs, the lovely beaches, the glimpses of dolphins playing in the waves, the surfers and sunbathers and myriad of walkers and joggers - quintessential Sydney!

Choose a wild and windy day!. Love this walk - done it a 100 times and still get a thrill of the sounds, surf and sights particularly when the swell is up and the wind is howling!Coffee/breakfast at Bronte tops it off.

Bondi to Bronte Walk is Beautiful. We did just the B2B walk. Took the ferry from Sydney to Watson's Bay, then the bus to Bondi. The views are amazing, and its easy to see why Bondi is so famous. Up to 35,000 will be there on some summer weekends! Lucky for us we saw it on a sunny spring day with just a few beachgoers.Reminded me of the walks in Cinque Terre, Italy, and the Palos Verdes Peninsula in California.Plan on 3-4 hours total, and enjoy lunch while you are there.
fantastic views of the whales. whats not to like the view is heaven and its the best way to see the eastern coast line of Sydney, give yourself at lest 2 hours to really enjoy the walk and vibe

Your ticket to see the real Australian Beauty. Its a great ~6km walk on along the coast. I'd say taking sun block is a must, lots of sun shine you're gonna receive. Recommended for family and individuals equally. Don't be scared by the distance in the first place, its so much filled with scenic views that you'd never feel the tiredness and it will all be over :)
What do you sea?. This walk if for anyone up to a mild challenge. Scenery is fabulous and while there are steps to be climbed, they are not overly steep. Quite manageable and rewarding.
Tomb with a View. This is a spectacular walk! My favourite bit was exploring the Waverley Cemetery. Old and opulent gravestones perched high above the beautiful, pounding surf.

Most Scenic Coastal Walk. We did the Coogee to Bondi beach walk with our 5 years old daughter and it was simply Awesome :)It was about 6km along the coast - quite a lot of steps along the way but the paths were well defined so it was a relatively easy walk. Along the way you pass through numerous bays and beaches where you can see some surfers in action or just admire the beautiful views. We were lucky enough to see whales breaching the surface of the water which made it an extra special experience. Along the walk we came across numerous locals running the path. Finishing up in Bondi was great as there are plenty of restaurants to have a drink!We really enjoyed our morning stroll and it was a great way to experience a few of Sydney's best beaches.

Amazing.com. Not to be missed. Views spectacular, and get a really taste of eastern suburb lifestyle!! Little Cafes along the way bring your swimmers for a dip along the way. Start either end, Coogee and Bondi are fantastic places. If someone is unable to complete the walk you can experience the views via car or using the tour bus in the summer months!! Don't miss it, excellent break from the city.

Best walk in the world!. I had lived in Syd for almost a year and this is still my favourite place there! Amazing view, fresh air in the hair, taking awesome pictures... During this walk I saw even dolphins over Tamarama in July! You can also stop in Tamarama or Bronte if you don't have so much time (from Bondi is probably 30 mins)... Don't miss it!

You wouldn't know that you were in Sydney. We have done this walk many times and never tire from it. It doesn't matter what the weather is like the walk is uplifting to the spirit and very good for your body as well. The outlook is timeless and it is hard to believe that you are in a big city.

Breathtaking Views!. You are actually walking above, around and sometimes through the cliffs along this magnificent coastline. You can watch surfers at Bondi & Bronte Beaches, and see some amazing views from cliff to cliff and out over the ocean. If you walk just a little bit further past Coogee Beach you will come to Waverly Cemetary-incredible!There are stairs involved as the walkway does meander up and down the cliffside.
Excellent and beautiful walk.. Highly recommended. If the weather is nice, you will fill as being 100% in a holidays area, and not really in a very big and international city as Sydney.
Top walk. This is a great walk with varying pannoramas. It takes a couple of hours, and during the hot summer days one should carry plenty of water.

Simply Amazing!. I recently travelled to the Sydney as part of my annual holiday. I visited several coastline but I was stunned at the most exotic and jaw-dropping beaches in Sydney. Its jovial beauty has taken me to a timeless experience; my eyes couldn’t stop gazing at the powdery white sand, crystalline waters and the tiny tides that tickle my toes as I loll underneath a palm tree. Nature has serenaded me with its soothing sounds and relieved my stress from bustling and polluted air of the city. Ah, what a life! The picturesque view of the mountain across the surrounding the beach is beyond my ability to describe what natural beauty looks like, it simply is mesmerizing. The gleam and exquisiteness will remain in my memory until my last breathe. Only if I could hold time for a little while… but I had to wake myself up and face the normal life in England. Until my next visit!
Must Do. Did this lots of times when living in Sydney. The views are amazing with great opportunities for photos. A very enjoyable walk.

beautiful!. On a nice day this walk would be easy to tag as iconic, though the crowds make some of the narrower paths a little awkward.If you want to get off the sand or out of the water and spend a bit of time strolling and taking in the scenery then this is definitely one to do!

Magnificent exercise. Safe walking along one of the most magnificent seascapes you can imagine. This walk will provide a variety of seascapes and sandy beaches with surfers in the water and sometimes other sea life are visible as well.

Beautiful walk. Well worth the trip and gives a great introduction to that part of Sydney. Take a taxi or the bus out and get off in Bondi itself. You can walk as far or as little as you like. We did lunch and lazed around in Bondi afterwards
Scenic & Beautiful. We didnt walk all the way to Coogee, we only walked to Bronte. Breath taking views at every turn. Great day out.
Fantastic views and great workout!. A few stairs (need to be of reasonable fitness), lovely spots for coffees and fantastic view! A very popular workout for people....
great walk. a fantastic way to see the scenery, some amazing houses and the small beaches and inlets you cant see from a car

Spectacular walk along cliffs and beaches!. WOW, must do when in Bondi Beach, walk is approx 3.5 to 4 miles but welll worth it! Don't forget to bring your camera! We strolled for 2 hours it was awesome!

Easy walk with stunning views. We ventured out on a sunny day to do this walk and I wasn't sure what to expect. I was stunned at how gorgeous these beaches are and the colour of the water is a shocking blue-green and is so clear! The walk is alongside a massive cemetery which sounds a bit creepy, but is actually beautiful. You'll feel relaxed and calm after this long walk - make time for a coffee/brunch at the beginning at a cafe in Coogee, and finish off with some ice cream in Bondi!The walk took about 1.5 hours and we stopped along the way to take photos and take in the scenery. While it wasn't quite warm enough for a swim, we did see lots of people learning how to surf! Overall, highly recommend this and it's a must do when in Sydney!
A splendid place. This really was a fantastic place, with amazing weather and scorching sun, I would reccommend it for any people who love good weather and a proper holiday.
beautiful walks. unfortunatelly it was not warm enough for us to swim at these beautiful beaches, but we walked them up watched poeple ,take at least half a day for it

An amazing day to wonder.... This is really a must for a visit to Sydney. Clears the mind, body and soul and if its not cold take your swimmers ready for a swim. Lots to enjoy along this path and very easy to get to by public transport.
Great Walk with beautiful views.. Great walk, beautiful views. Does include quite a few steps, but not difficult. We linked this up with the hop on hop off city sight seeing tours.Well worth doing.

Well worth the effort. This is a great walk. We caught the the bus to Bondi then took the costal walk to Coogee stopping for breakfast at Bronte Beach. Had a fantastic egg and bacon roll at the "Bogey Hole Cafe" which was a surprise highlight. The walk takes in the coast line as well as a very close view of the famous Waverly Cemetery. The walk including a 20 minute stop for breakfast took approx 3 hours. It is not too hard and well worth it. Something really different to do in Sydney especially on a sunny day.
good exercise and great views. At least 2 hour walk, lots of steps, no need to take water as there are many filtered water fountains along the way. Take the bus back.

Accessible, gorgeous, whales. An easy walk, except when the Sculptures by the Sea is on as the place is teeming with people then. The colour of the water is fantastic, specially if you are new to Australian sea-colour. Whales can be sited in the second half of the year.
Step Up. A great walk along both historic and natural featured coastQuite busy at times and be prepared for many steps but well worth the effort

A scenic coastal walk.. A great walk to do, especially if you are not in a rush, as there is so much to see. Its best done during the day when those who use the path for their daily exercise can make it a bit busy. Spend time reading the signs for more information about the area & if you don't have much time, jsut do a short part of the walk. Do wear sensible shoes as there are staircases, sloping paths and rougher areas to walk over in spots, but its definately worth the effort.

Trip to Sydney is incomplete without this walk. Get a bus to Bondi early in the morning and start your walk towards Cooge. Its hard to believe that such a beautiful shore with an amazing view of ocean,rocks is so near to the busy city life.

Awesome Walk. Definitely not to be missed.. This is one of the best & most scenic walks you could do. It can be done by people with various fitness levels. Plenty of places along the way to rest, take in the scenery, enjoy a coffee, snack or ice-cream. You can swim or snorkel at various spots along the way. Really a fantastic activity. Not to be missed.
Fantastic Walk - Bondi to coogee.. Get bus to Coogee and walk to Bondi Beach and relax and enjoy the sun, sand, people etc.great, fantastic, easy, popular, scenic, interesting.
Beautiful!. Didn't do the whole thing, but what I did do was amazing. Beautiful views, mountains, ocean, rock formations. Gotta do it if at Bondi.

worth a visit. met some of the famous lifeguards,watched good surfers,enjoyed a beautiful sunny if not hot day.We had a beautiful lunch in a nearby cafe.There is a great bus service from Sydney (terminal E) to Bondi.

Start at Coogee and have Brunch first before the walk. We ate at a beachfront restaurant at Coogee before walking around the coast to Bondi.The restaurant has a stock of red blankets to keep you protected from the wind whilst eating brunch which was great tucker.The walk was really good, very interesting with numerous beachside attractions,and diversions. Lifesaving clubs,etc.,Wear good boots or trainers with good treads and enjoy yourselves.Take a hat and a camera.We got the bus from our Sydney hotel to Cogee and the train back from Bondi Junction.

Best costal walk or run in Sydney. This route and the walk across the bridge are the two best walks or runs in Sydney. Winter or summer this is a great way to spend a few hours in Sydney, its always winder than you think and summer you get sunburn quickly, walk and eat at both ends with a cool drink or ice cream in the middle. Good for singles, couples, families (few steps for todlers) anyone.

The Most Awesome Walk!!!!. This is my favorite walk to do when I visit Sydney!!! We like to do Bondi to Coogee and back and that will take 2+ hours. The ocean vistas are always going to be magnificent. You can stop along the way for a swim at 5 different beaches. It is not a flat walk, with some stairs and small hills. Stop in at one of the cafes at Bronte Beach for a coffee, fresh juice or snack along the way, or wait until you reach Coogee Beach to refuel. It is quite busy on weekends, so be patient and courteous! Enjoy!
LOVE. THE. VIEWS.. A MUST-DO. If you're a beach lover, or just want a quite walk...this is for you!VERY scenic!when you're all done, there are fantastic bars, pubs, restos and boutiques
lovely scenic walk. loved the scenery ..stops on the way for refreshments ..lots steps and uphill ..worth it though ..pass the most amazing graveyard on the walk ..the place to be

Bondi to Watson's Bay. Definitely a long walk but gorgeous, free and you go at your own pace! I highly recommend that you start the walk around brunch time so you get to Bondi for lunch. Then have a bite at one of the dozen decadent restaurants (good Gelato if it's a hot day!). After you're done munching, take a city bus (it's not worth the walk) from Bondi up to "Gap Park" (5-10min). This will be the Watson's Bay area which has a couple parks, navy base, small beach and a lonely lighthouse. Follow the footpath around, take a picture next to the anchor, and you must keep going until you get to the lighthouse where you will see one of the most spectacular views of your life. You can see the mouth/entrance and a beautiful view of Manly (better at night because of the lights) on the North side of the bay. Keep walking around and then you're smacked in the face with a gorgeous view of Sydney city and the Sydney bridge. By the end, you'll have an appreciation what makes Sydney so spectacular compared to other Aussie cities: its beaches ;)

A day to remember. After the walk I totally understand why this walk came up to be one of the top 5 must-do in Sydney. It is definitely a walk you'll remember, yet it isn't too hard on amateurs who doesn't exercise like us, except we had abit of muscle ache since my husband and I just did a hike in Blue Mountains the day before the walk. Nonetheless, you can stop at any of the beaches and board a bus back if you're rushing for time. I wore my snow-boots, hence I guess comfortable shoes will workout fine unless you're intending to jog instead. Remember to bring your camera!

Amazing walk!. This walk is well worth the hype! There are some great views to be had and a number of great beaches to be sampled along the way. If it's a hot day, take your mask and snorkel! Some great snorkelling is to be had at Gordon's Bay. Coogee Bay is also a very nice beach with an excellent beach bar and restaurant.

Fitness and Enjoyment. Excellent Walk with lots of Scenic Views and Sites to see. Highly Recommended. If you have problems with Stairs then I would give this one a Miss, but an Experience none the Less.
took the on / off. Loved the on and off bus. Actually met some other tourists and enjoyed the easy experience. The weather was great and the beach was clean and easy to get to and from

Bronte, the hidden gem. While the coastal walk from Bondi to Coogee is amazing, don't miss out on some of the hidden gems along the way. Bronte Beach has an abundance of cafes, but if you detour up Macpherson Street you'll be surprised by the small hub of local shops. Iggy's bread shop has a long line of locals eagerly awaiting their sour dough hit, The 3 Blue Ducks cafe is a must not miss and the little gallery has beautiful photographs from around the local beaches - at reasonable prices.To find Macpherson St, at the cusp of Bronte Cutting & Clovelly Cemetery turn West and follow the car park road up the hill for 5-10 minutes.

Bondi to Bronte. The walk all the way to Coogee would be quite long. As it was still a bit nippy and a storm had just moved through bringing some pretty intense winds along the coast, we stopped at Bronte. But that in itself was definitely worth the walk.

Bondi to Bronte beach walk. We were fortunate to have a 25 degree day in August to walk along this magnificent coastal hike. It is definitely worth it.. It is shared with joggers and tourists as well as the locals.. The variety of scenery around the undulating and curvy coast creates a collage of views of the ocean, cliffs, beach and Bondi. Every corner is different. A "must do" when visiting Sydney.

Sculpture Walk. Fantastic opportunity to enjoy the ocean while taking a healthy walk .. not for anyone disabled as there are quite a few steps to negotiate along the way. On a fine day, winter or summer, it is an invigorating and scenic walk and highly recommend it especially to anyone visiting Sydney.

Beautiful walk. This is a wonderful walk. We walked briskly (albeit at the pace of the 9 year old) and did the walk in about 85 minutes each way (3 hours round trip). It takes you along 5 beaches, bookmarked by the two best, Bondi and Coogee. There are great views throughout. There are some decent hills, so bring water and expect to be fatigued somewhat (if you do it round trip). A great day, once you factor in period breaks, drinks, and lunch.
Great walk!. Not too strenuous at all - could take it at your pace and as many coffe stops as you wish! Lovely sea breezes and wonderful scenery!

Views, exercise and the chance to visit great cafes. This bustling coastal walk is great at any time of year - we prefer winter with clear blue skys, sun and fewer people. It's busy from 5am to midnight and depending on your mood on the day you can go all the way to Coogee or stop at one of the beaches on the way. Views from the headland are breathtaking with whales in season and surfers for most of the year. Although you are only 8km from the centre of the city it could be a million miles.Dogs are welcome but anything with wheels may find the steps a challenge.

Good when the weather is warm. We went to Bondi Beach on a cloudy, somewhat cold day in early August. As soon as we got off the bus the cold gusts of wind blew and it was as if Arctic weather had hit us. It was impossible to even walk on the beach. In spite of us being bundled up like South pole explorers. So we rushed back to the fast food place for a hot coffee within a couple of minutes,

You Should Really Do It. Having lived in Sydney for two years I've done this walk multiple times. Its a great way to get some exercise, fresh air and some sun all at the same time. The views and winds are both literally and metaphorically a breath of fresh air that will keeping you going for a while afterwards.The only flaw I saw to this walk is that there are parts that requires you to walk across a road and it kind of takes you out of the whole jogging by the ocean mood.

A nice walk. A great way to spend half a day seeing the Australian coastline. We were lucky enough to be there during its annual art walk, which made the journey even better. The sights are breathtaking. The walk is long, but well worth it.

We could stay on the beach forever. What a lovely beach, it's clean, it's fresh and even if you can surf, you can easily spend the whole day playing with the sand and water. Plenty of sunshine and a lovely place to relax.

The best free thing to do when the weather is good. What an amazing walk, it is truely breathtaking. It is all for free and just stunning. A must do on a sunny day, take your bathers if it is hot, very difficult to walk past some of the beaches without going for a dip

Must do if you love the ocean. This path can be very crowded in the weekends, but can be all yours during the week. It is a nice way to exercise a bit and enjoy the beautiful views and healthy sea breeze.

More than just a walk. The views of the ocean from the walk only help inspire you to keep walking and wanting more. Depending on when you go you will be surprised at how many other Sydneysiders take advantage of this great piece of coastline. Photographers are also rewarded with some terrific scenery.
Crowded but worth it. This strip of coastline is crowded but it is the best way to get some exercise and see the changing views of beaches.
Great day, great walk. Good to walk off the saturday night hangover on a sunday morning. With some nice rays of sun, this is a beautiful walk. Try it

The views are unbelievable!. We walked this in late August on a bright and shiny day. We saw the whole gamut! Everything from pristine beaches to lovely beach homes to whales in the ocean. We spent several hours walking and enjoying the sites. We even saw some lawn bowling. It's a great way to see some pristine coastline without having to far from Sydney. Would love to do again!

A longish but beautiful walk!. I often walked this path, it would be 2-hour walk one way, but it is definitely worth the time and efforts. Ocean view, nice rocks, beautiful beaches. You can also stop for a dip in the ocean if you wish at Bronte or Clovelly.

Breathtaking. Views from all angles, places to rest along the way and watch the waves rolling in. People watching is also a must do, as you will see all types, shapes and ages running, walking and swimming

Awesome walk. Took us about 2 hours to do. The views were spectacular along the way. One of our most memorable things we did on the trip. I suggest doing it earlier in the morning to beat the heat if you're there during their summer.

Splendid views and fascinating geology.. The views from this relatively easy walk are just splendid of the Tasman Sea and the coastline, and the geological formations here, as if the rock was made of frothy soap in some places, are spectacular. Then, even in winter, there are the attractions of Bondi Beach...

The most beautiful coastal walk. This is one of the most beautiful coastal walk i have been too. Nice views, and the paths are well marked. Its such an enjoying experience then we dont feel that we walked that distance until we see the marker.

Every visitor to Sydney should do this. The views, the fresh air, sunshine, exercise - what is there not to like... On the weekends maybe the crowds. So, if you can definitely try to do this through the week and not during Sculptures By the Sea (because then you'll have school kids too!) but go back then anyway to see the great art with the most wonderful backdrop of the cliffs and the Pacific.
A slice of Paradise. Best thing about Sydney, a complete joy especially early in the morning, I love the exercise, the views and the fact that you can walk away from the traffic and noise.

Spectacular coastal walk. I have enjoyed walking the coastline from Coogee to Bondi on many occasions.The scenery is quite spectacular. If you (like me) enjoy seeing beautiful young lovelies bouncing along you will be in heaven.The cemetery is a quiet spot to linger and once again affords stunning ocean views.I can walk from Bondi to Coogee in under an hour. There are numerous spots to stop and have a dip in the ocean, and if the day is warm the Coogee Bay Hotel rewards your effort with a cold beer.Definitely a ‘must do’ when in Sydney.
swim at clovelly. we swam at clovelly it's just a small beach with a safe area for the kids.loved coogee beach so we ate at the leagion club upstairs.overlooking the beach

A must do!. I was staying in Coogee for a few weeks and this walk was recommended to us by an Aussie friend and WOW!! Some amazing views, gorgeous places to sit and chill out for half an hour and at the end of it you can go for a swim at Bondi! Only warning is that it does take a while and we ended up sunburnt as we left around 10am and walked into the hottest part of the day, but the amazing pictures we got were worth it!!
Long walk but worth it. Beautiful scenic coastline. Watch the sunset & the surfers! Brilliant! Nice beaches along the way. Surf is fantastic!

Bondi to Coogee Walk - Amazing Views. I ve done this walk twice and both times the views took my breath away, you walk along the cliff top and there are rock pools, hidden beaches and information about the aborginees and the history surrounding the area... finish in Coogee for lunch and one of the many lovely resturants.
Gumbell. A favourite beautiful walk with fine scenery and good eating at both ends. Watch out for strong winds and try and walk when sunny.
The best views in Sydney. We had excellent weather for the entire walk and were breathless not from the walking, which is very easy going, but from the spectacular vistas from the entire walk.

Bondi to Coogee. A fantastic coastal walk. I have done this walk countless times. It only takes a couple of hours if you stroll. You can stop at Tamarama beach on the way for a swim . The beach has life guards. It is an amazing walk that hugs the coast line.

Stunning Scenery. This is an awesome walk with the most incredible views. Choose a sunny day, take your water, hat, sunglasses, sunscreen and your swimming gear and go for a walk. Then have a swim at any of the beaches you pass or in the giant rockpools, then walk back and drop in on one of the many cafe's along the beach fronts for a coffee.

Lovely walk. Beautiful and lovely hike--highly recommended. Peaceful, not crowded. Don't forget your camera. This is a great way to spend a morning or afternoon. And so easy to grab a bus back if you decide to bail somewhere along the way.

Best sea views ever!. Catch the bus out to Coogee and enjoy this fabulous cliff top walk. Take your swim gear with you as there are plenty of opportunities to cool down in one of the sea fed pools or the sea itself. Recommended.
Sand and Rock. From Bondi beach this walk takes you high above the bay for stunning views - but also take a look at the cliff face as the rock structure is amazing

Not for those physically challenged. I agree with others that the scenery is spectacular, but a word of warning for those of us who find high rise steps difficult. There are some major sets of stairs,with very high risers. There were no warning notices, that I could see, and pushers and prams would have major difficlties as well. We made it as far as Bronte, but had to give up and catch a bus.
Great walk with spectacular views. I did the walk from Bondi to Coogee AND BACK as I enjoyed it so much :) Beautiful views, easy to walk, plenty of loos en route.

Among the Nicest Beaches In the World. Both of these beaches are amazing. Spectacular water and waves, beautiful sand and beautiful people. Visit both beaches for at least a day. Lots of places to eat and get drinks. Both will be a memorable part of your visit to Sydney. The walk from one to the other is all about taking pictures...both with your camera and your minds eye.
Aussie coastline up close and personal.. This is a great walk taking you close to the water and beaches and sandstone cliffs Sydney. It is safe and easy with the availability of cafes at either end.

The most spectacular showcase of Sydney's shoreline. This walks shows you the beauty of Sydney's beaches whilst also giving you a glimpse of how some of the other half live. That's what Sydney is about...you can be a "have" or "have not" but we all have the beach.

Beautiful scenery. This walk we did in reverse starting at Coogee as that was where we were based for our holiday. We did the walk as our very first tourist activity the morning after arriving in Australia and it definitely helped with the jet lag. Walking in August is relatively chilly in the winter to start with and a jacket is a good idea, however after a few minutes you warm up in the sun and need decent sunglasses to fully appreciate the views, which are stunning. A word of warning - during the winter months, often the cafes along the route are closed so finding a toilet can be tricky. Also wear suitable footwear for climbing steps and slopes. It took us just under 2 and a half hours going at a steady pace with jetlag.
Great coastal walk. Great coastal walk along some of Sydney's most beautiful coast line. A great place to take visiting friends. Grab lunch in Coogee or Bondi after your walk!

Lovely walk - great place for visitors. If you have a bit of time in Sydney (or even if you don't but you like nice walks) this is a great one. I like to start in Coogee and finish with a drink/meal in Bondi. Stunning views and this gives you a better taste of Australia's beaches etc. If you're lucky, you may even see dophins off the coast.

A must to all tourist. This is a spectacular walk. Especially during the time sculptures by the sea is on which is held annually. If you aren't too freaked out its great taking a scroll through the big old cemetery and try to find a heap of famous Australian people. Make sure you take a bottle of water on a hot day. You will have an opportunity to fill your bottle along the way. Enjoy

Gorgeous views and a great vibe. Sydney is a seaside city. This is quite obvious when you look at a map, but you can also feel the seaside vibe when you walk around, nowhere more so than when you take one of the many walks directly along the coastline. The Bondi to Googee walk is probably the most well-known one, there are thousands of people doing it every day, and it's perfectly established (i.e. can easily be done in flip-flops). It's not long, and you can rest at the various small kiosks at each of the beaches it touches. What I really like about it is the beautiful sandstone that makes up about half of the track: you see the weirdest shapes, and if you catch it early in the morning (as in, just after sunrise), the colours are breath-taking. The sea itself is of course not too shabby, and walkers are treated with fantastic views from high platforms, and with plenty of beach access to refresh themselves.Every year around end October, there is also the "Sculptures by the Sea" exhibition, which I find is a must-see event, when they exhibit over a hundred sculptures along this footpath.I would plan about a couple of hours of lazy walk, plus an hour or two to dip your feet into the water. If it's too long, you can take a bus back from any of the beaches on the way, so it's very family friendly.

Breezy scenic walk. The coastal walk is extremely scenic. The 3 kms walk from Bondi to Coogee is frequented by a lot of tourists and locals doing their daily runs. It is a good experience, the only grouse was that the weather was extremely cold.

Wonderful. Walk too about an hour. Says more on the guide book but it wasn't busy. This walk is really well laid out with plenty of water fonts and exercise stations. Got some fab pictures. Highly recommended
Great exercise and views to gasp at!. A geat warm day walk that's one of the best free experiences in Sydney. Enjoy great views of the coast and suburbs ..but just enjoy the walk and scenery.

Beautiful beach. The beach is beautiful and there are alot of people surfing, playing volleyball and sun tanning even during the Winter. The water is really cold! There are quite a number of restaurants and it is good to have your breakfast outdoor enjoying the weather and the view. The havaianas flip flops sold there are slightly cheaper as compare to city area. However it only applies to certain design. there is this huge shopping mall at the Bondi Junction train station where is has Myers, David Jones and even Target.
Beautiful Beach!. It was awesome to sit on the white sand beach and watch the surfers :) (A bit cold to swim in August)

Another nice walk in Sydney. This is a great early morning or late afternoon walk. It is an easy walk and I enjoyed sitting down watching the surfers. Apart form the great views everyone is friendly. The ride back to Bondi is easy as well!

Great walk, great views!. I was introduced to this walk while visiting a friend in Australia. Since it was mid-week and March, there were not a lot of people on the path at all. If you enjoy walking and great views this is a must. If nothing else even just a partial trip on the path gives you some of these great views. I didn't find it too strenuous and got some great pics of Bondi and other beaches we passed. For those familiar with it this is very similar to the Cliff Walk in Rhode Island, USA.

Good work out.. If you want a nice workout and still enjoy the view, this is the deal. I walk from Darling Harbor to Coogee Beach and back.This take me around 4 Hrs. I stop and enjoy the beach and the view.
amazing!!. loved the views! really beautiful walk. really easy to get back to the city from coogee too! might be easier going from coogee to bondi!
wow!. Hard. IT was really hard but great view. I suggest going in the mid afternoon and waiting for the sunset. The view is spectacular. Without word. Just go.

Gorgeous way to see the Eastern Suburbs coastline. I would recommend starting at the Coogee end and walking to Bondi. If you walk fast, you could do it in an hour, but it's so much nicer to take your time. When you get to the other end of the cemetery (between Clovelly & Bronte), you'll come to road. Follow the road around to the right, and then you'll meet up with the coastal path again. Bronte has some nice cafes, but if you can wait, go to the casual eatery at Bondi's Icebergs for a glass of wine or beer, fish & chips, and fabulous ocean view. Be prepared for a hilly walk, but it's well worth it.

Breathtaking views. It's hard to believe that an urban core like Sydney can have such a magnificent beach and cliffs just a few minutes bus ride away. The walk from Bondi to Coogee gives one the ability to appreciate Bondi from several different views then climb up and around the cliffs and wind around past Tamarama Beach and on toward the beautiful seaside cemetery and Coogee. The paths are paved and the walk is able to be performed by those of most any age. If you don't feel like doing the whole 45+ minute walk, you can just do Bondi to Tamarama in about 20 minutes and still get enough pictures to fill plenty of photo albums.
A classic walk. One of my must-dos for visitors to Sydney. An easy, interesting and spectacular walk. Tip: gets very crowded on weekends, but still worth doing.

Great taste of outdoor Sydney life!. We actually did the Coogee to Bondi beach walk after meeting a friend for lunch in Coogee. It was about 6km along the coast - quite a lot of steps along the way but the paths were pavement or well defined so it was a relatively easy walk. Along the way you pass through numerous bays and beaches where you can see some surfers in action or just admire the views. We were lucky enough to see whales breaching the surface of the water all along the coast which made it an extra special experience. Along the walk we came across numerous locals running the path - now that looked like hard work, but gave a taste of Aussie outdoor life.Finishing up in Bondi was great as there are plenty of bars and restaurants to have a drink!We really enjoyed our afternoon stroll and it was a great way to experience a few of Sydney's beaches.

Breathtaking!. This is a walk worth the time..give yourself at least a couple hours, preferably 3!It's right along the ocean, and although the footing can be a bit off, there are railings to keep you safe

Perfection!. this is a very relaxing place, everyone is very friendly and there is plenty of good places to eat. and there are pools if your prefer then the beach and a women pool were only women and their kids can go in and theres a 20c fee to help it to stay great place also( some ladies to not have a top on tho!) but i do recremend it!

Postcard views. This is a great walk, not very taxing at all, along stunning coastline, with plenty of opportunities for a coffee or snack along the way. DON'T do it on a weekend if you can avoid it, the locals are super territorial and will make you feel unwelcome as they push past you on their run. DO do it when the Sculpture by the Sea is on, sort of October November I think.
great walk. ...but can be a little tough on the windy days. Stop for a coffee and the fish & chips at the end is great too.

A Must Do. If you you want to be treated to the beauty of Sydney - make sure you take time to do the Coastal Walk along the Eastern Suburbs! You'll join the super fit, Mum's pushing prams, people walking dogs, and just those intent on getting out in the great outdoors! Stop in for a coffee or bite to eat along the way, or check out the view from Icebergs RSL!
Awesome views. Loved this walk its a must do great way to visit all the eastern suburbs in an afternoon lots of steps regular person of average fitness level shouldn't have any trouble with this walk

A walk to remember. From Bondi to Coogee, I took so many pictures! Bring your bathing suit for the ride. When you ask how long it takes to go from A to Z, always double the amount of time locals give you! I guess they no longer stop to take pictures along the way :-)

Amazing. This walk offered some of the best views that I saw in OZ i'd highly recommend it to anyone. You get to tour some of the great beaches between Bondi and Coogie. My personal favourite was Bronte beach.
Very nice. Caught the Bondi bus from the city and the walking path is easy to find ,very scenic and when you get to Coogee catch another bus back to the city.

Get a feel for the Eastern Suburbs. We regularly take visitors on the Bondi to Maroubra coastal walk. It's a beautiful walk on a sunny day. South of Coogee/north of Maroubra, you have to walk away from the water, but you shortly make your way back towards the coast. Just ask the locals the way around and people are happy to help. Stop along the way at one of the cafes. Enjoy a picnic lunch. Just a brilliant walk for any nice day.

Bronte to Maroubra walk. Fantastic walk on a beautiful day, sparkling water, breathtaking views, brilliant sunshine and blue skies, water bubblers, bins and picnic areas along the way, well-kept paths, information boards, everything on this walk was great, except perhaps the short distance from Coogee South to Lurline Bay where we had to leave the coast and walk through the roads. Bit of a shame, but still a great walk! I grew up in this area (Bondi, actually) and had my first swimming lessons at the age of 6 Coogee Ladies Swimming Club (McIvers Baths). I haven't revisited these Baths in 55 years and didn't realise until today what an idyllic spot I was privileged to have my first ocean-swimming experience in! I'll attach some photos to this comment.

Eastern beaches walk. Awesome views, great weather. You can take in the lifestyle of the average Sydneyite as you go. Water fountains along way, handy when you forget to take a bottle and get thirsty.

Beautiful sights and nice pitstops. A great way to check out Bondi and the beautiful coast of Sydney. Plenty of nice places to stop on the way; if the weather's good, pack your swimmers and make a day of it, jumping into the sea at different spots.

Stunning walk!. We caught the train to bondi junction then bus to bondi beach - a bit hard to get to via public transport really. But once we were there we were glad we made the effort. Despite being the middle of winter we had a great day around 19 degrees with clear skies, perfect to enjoy this walk along the coast. We took around an hour and a half at a leisurely pace. It was fantastic!!! Highlight of our weekend in Sydney. Great scenery. Loved it!

Better than Manly Coastal Walk. In my humble opinion the Bondi coastal walk is better than the one on Manly island. I arrived in the late afternoon for both walks, so I only walked part way. To me the Bondi route is more scenic. The route seems to offer more sweeping views of the ocean and coastline. In the evening the sunset is gorgeous and the ocean breeze intoxicating.I also preferred the selection of shops and restaurants. I wasn't aware that Bondi was an infamous beach. I was there in early May and did not find the beaches overly crowded. I had a memorable time. Based on the other reviews I would suggest visitors keep in mind the time of year they are visiting. Bondi may not be the best beach/coastal walk, but it is definitely an enjoyable one. I will visit again.
great fun and fabulous views. Have done this walk many times. It is perfect on a lovely sunny day, the views are fabulous and the air is fresh. Great coffee or pubs either end!

Great walk. This is one of the best walks you could do in Australia if you're interested in their lifestyle. The walk connects different beautiful beaches with up-market suburbs. Allow 2 hours if you are takinf pictures along the way.
What a walk. Brilliant walk in windy but sunny conditions. Great to see the different beaches. Took about 1.5 hrs. Highly recommend
Nice walk. Loved the walk from Coogee to Bondi. There is some good spot for photos and it is a good way to relax and enjoy the beautiful ocean & beaches.

Highly recommend. I walked with a couple of friends starting from Bondi & it took around 2 hours. You pass a lot of beaches & find out lots of information along the way. The views are incredible, take your camera!

Lovely scenery...lovely memories. My teenaged daughter and I walked from Coogee Beach to Bondi last March. We both enjoyed it a lot but she's a lot more eloquent about it. I have her permission to share her memories of that walk.The air was crisp with the memory of rain. We tied our rain jackets around our waists and let our bare arms embrace the moist breeze. There was no one else on the path; the vacant wooden platforms meandered around the curves of cliffs and beaches as far as our eyes could see. On one side of us lay a cemetery, ethereally beautiful in the morning light. Bright mist drifted over it, as it did over the rest of the land, but against the white of the tombstones it seemed even more luminous and mysterious. What a peaceful place to rest forever, I thought. Every grave was gently nestled in the slope of the hill, looking out on the ocean.  The ocean was vast and deep blue. In the distance, it crinkled over the horizon and out of sight. Closer to us, the wind stirred the water into a frenzy, whipping them against the rocks. The spray flew into the air, droplets flecking our faces. We licked our lips and tasted the slightest hint of salt, tangy and wild. The constant rhythm of the thundering crash followed by a soft hiss as the water receded lulled us into a state of semi-consciousness. The only thoughts running through our mind were the lullaby of the ocean and the tapping of our feet on wood. We were relaxed and carefree, here in this isolated serenity, so far away from the loud noises and constant movement of the city.  We continued on, heading towards the mismatched houses spilling down a distant hill into a small cove of golden beach.
refreshing and beautiful. Gorgeous views, exhilerating breezes and plain old good excercise. A good thing to do at the weekend expecially when they have the Art by the sea exhibitions.

Pleasant Stroll to great cafes and swimming. Walking from Cogee to Bondi helps you work up an appetite for the plethora of cafes in Bondi. A great way also to walk off a great lunch at Icebergs for example.

Great Walk. Great walk, just make sure to have your walking shoes on! A great way to see the coast, Bondi Beach, and to get a taste of Sydney outside of the big city. Make sure to take a map with you though to help explain what you are looking at.

Just very beautiful. Enjoy the beautiful rock formations and the view of Bondi bay while getting some exercise. I cannot believe that you get such beautiful surroundings right in the city. Take a break from the big city pulse and enjoy this scenic walk. There's plenty of benches where you can catch a breath while enjoying the view. And if you get tired it's easy to turn around and head back to Bondi.Note that there's a lot of runners on the trail so don't block the road on your Sunday walk.

A nice Sunday afternoon activity. It's a nice walk that takes you approximately 2 hours and leads you through a huge cementary overlooking the Waters. You will pass a few nice beaches and enjoy the views onto the sea.

What a treat. Some of the most beautiful coastline and scenery in the country makes a suberb backdrop to a lovely walk. A few steps and hills to negotiate but basically an easy walk. Just watch out for the rude, sweaty joggers on the path who delight in trying to spoil the walk experience

A must do when visiting Sydney!. I've done the walk several times and it is amazing every time.The first time I did the walk from Coogee to Bondi instead of the other way, starting the walk at mid day. It was in November during the Sculpture by the Sea walk.(which is the best time to walk it in my opinion!) Ending at Bondi is more like a reward after the 10km walk because of all the area has to offer. The walk from Bondi to Coogee just before sunrise is utterly breathe-taking.(beginning the walk at around 6:30am) Bring a waterbottle, a camera, and good walking shoes!

The best way to start a Sunday morning. Take your pick - walk or run.Enjoy the view of Sydneys' best beaches and get exercise at the same time. Mixed terrain - slight incline / uphill and down hill with a few steps. I always do this walk on a Sunday morning when I am in Sydney and then stop for breakfast in Bronte.Great to do in winter or summer.

Dolphins and seals on a lovely sunset walk. We started the walk from Bondi to Coogee around 3.30pm on a sunny winter's day and were worried we'd run out of time to finish it before it got dark but it turned out to be the perfect length for a gorgeous sunset walk along the coast with us arriving at Coogee just as it got dark from where we hopped on a bus back to Bondi Junction. A great afternoon's walk, we spotted a pod of dolphins from the cliffs and a seal lazing on a rock basking in the sunshine and bought coffees half way along to drink as we walked. The only thing I was sorry we didn't have time for was a dip in one of the many salt water pools. Definitely a worthwhile addition to a Sydney trip!

just do it. Although I didnt do the walk this time in Sydney I have done it before.Even though it's a long way the views of the beaches and cliffs are well worth it.The cemetary at Waverly was especially interesting to see and the Memorial at Coogee beach to the men who lost their lives in the Bali bombings was overwhelming.

7km walk (70min) or run (35min) / Beautiful views / Free / Not Disabled or Buggy Friendly. I run this route fairly regularly while working in Coogee. Unfortunately for me it’s usually been dark or raining. However, it is still a fantastic run. There are steps and fairly steep ascents, great views of the beaches and coves as you pass them.Approximately 7km to Coogee to Bondi. Takes about 35 minutes to run.

Breathtaking, best scenery and people watching and if you're lucky you might see a whale or dolphin. I walk this section of the coast regularly as a local and it never fails to enviro rate me!I would suggest it to any visitor even if you are in Sydney during the middle of winter.Stop for a coffee at Tamarama and enjoy the Beautiful People
A wonderful experience. I'm so glad to see a coastal walk being listed as a top three experience while in Sydney. It truly deserves this accolade.
Relaxing. Great scenary. Amazing coastal views. Relaxing 2 hour walk, lovely beaches along the way and nice town of Coogee at the end. Got the bus back to Bondi.

Bondi Beach dissapointing. When you see it on TV it looks so large, it is so not, very small, but the little shops along it are great, in the middle there is a white Hotel with a Balcony, we both had a great yummy lunch there with outstanding views to enjoy the little beach
Beautiful morning view. My favourite place to walk in the morning with breathtaking views. Just beautiful.

Great View. This was a beautiful sunny mornings walk. Plenty of people jogging along the track,but all were understanding if they were held up with those of us taking photos and enjoying the view.Not a very hard walk, a few steps but you can take your time
pick a nice day to do this. lovely walk. must do. great views. make sure you pick a nice sunny day to do it

The views are breathtaking. I just love this walk. It's not difficult (mainly), the views are to die for, and, when you finish, you will deserve a lovely little morsel of something delicious. Or at least that's my excuse!!
Bondi to Coogee. It's stunning and a unique Sydney experience. Amazing for an inner-city beach. Bypass Bondi and stop at Tamarama for a swim.
Awesome views. This is such a great walk. Not too difficult but enough to build up an appetite for a well-earned breakfast. The views are stunning.
Beautiful Walk. If you stop to take photos along the way it's can take about 1h30 but it's a really nice walk.

Beautiful views - Highly recommended. Great activity to combine sight-seeing, fitness, and photo opportunity! I opted to run the path and completed the reverse path from Coogee to Bondi (since I wanted to finish with the view of Bondi Beach). The views are fantastic: rugged coastline, surfers catching waves, blues/greens of the water, and interesting flora.Most visitors are strolling, so runners may encounter some congestion, but it is still very enjoyable! There are some stairs which makes for more "fun" on the run.There are small stops along the path for the beaches (Coogee, Clovelly, Bronte, Tamarama, and Bondi). The guidebook indicates that the average walk may take 2+ hours, depending on how many stops one makes. At a brisk pace, one would be able to finish the path in under one hour. It was great to finish at the top of the cliff and round the corner to see Bondi Beach - really amazing! And just in case, running/walking along the path is free.

You might see whales!!!. Great walk along the coast. One of the most beautiful views in the world. And depending on the time of year, you might even see humpback whales breaching as they can come close to the coast sometimes.
Must do. If you enjoy walking this is must do! the scenery is spectacular and there are good watering holes along the way, walk all the way to coogee and get a bus back to Bondi Junction.

A walk I can never get sick of.. Great walk in all sorts of weather.Great for fitness junkies (you can run up the stairs if you wish) or for the 'I love to stroll and take everything in' people.People with server mobility issues may find it challenging, as steep stairs play a large role a few times throughout the walk. It's also amazing to do when Sculptures By The Sea is on.
Unbeatable location. Great walk to visit all the eastern beaches. Stop for a swim or picnic. Popular with locals for running so can get packed but worth a look.

This is a must!. I have done this walk a number of times, at different times of the day and during different seasons. It provides some spectacular views of beaches and the suburbs and is a good work out.

Gorgeous sights!. I never thought I was a beach person, but the views along this walk were fantastic. We walked on sandy beaches, explored rocky beaches, marvelled at the sight of waves crashing against the shore to form huge sprays of foam, and even saw wild dolphins when resting on a rock outcropping!
stunning!. you don't have to walk the whole way but the views are worth it.
Nice Saturday Walk. The beaches, the sun, a bit of exercise. We walked from Bronte to Bondi in the late afternoon after a nice coffee in Bronte.

Fabulous even in the rain!. We had an atypical Sydney winter day, there was lots of wind and rain and it wa quite cold. Not a problem! We had the walk almost to ourselves and while we had to spend time at Tamarama sheltering from the rain, the walk was gorgeous. The swimming pool at Coogee is a highlight, it is at the far south of the beach so don't think that once you have reached the sand or the shops at Coogee that the walk is over. I wish I had my swimsuit, even though it was wet and raining!

Classisc walk. A must see.. This is a classic sight of Sydney. Away from the iconic harbour are the equally iconic beaches. the Bondi to Coogee walk will take you past a few of these beaches. I am not an Eastern Suburbs local (who say's we're parochial...?), but this is something I make the effort to travel for. There are direct buses to Bondi, or you could catch the train to Bondi Junction and take a (long) stroll down to the beach. The walk itself is not challenging, though it does rise and fall gently. The beaches can be gloriously wide or cosy yet accomodating, and I can see how they capture their particular worshippers The cemetry south past Tamarama is moodful. Australia's outdoors are it's greatest attraction, even in the urban centres, and this walk and the Sydney Harbour National Park both represent this in an accessible way.
A must in Sydney.. Best in winter when there are fewer people.Love this walk, and how refreshing to find something in Sydney which is free.

Easy walk, spectacular view. Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk (or the other way around) is an excellent way to see beautiful city beaches and experience the power of ocean. Walk is easy, and there are plenty of great spots to sit and enjoy the view.If weather is good, you could consider having a dip on each beach. Rarely mentioned but a real jewel is Gordon Bay – it is great snorkelling and scuba diving spot. Take you time to read notice board along the way, there is a plenty of interesting stuff to learn about marine life.

Hard to describe why it is so good. I have spent most of my life walking part or all of this walk. Everyday I am struck by how lucky I have been to have this view for free and how no two days have ever been the same.

Never disappoints. A beautiful walk. We like to start at Bondi and then eat in a cafe in Bronte. My children enjoyed the playgrounds along the way. Spectacular views. Must be one of the most gorgeous city walks in the world.
Spectacular way to see Sydney's Beaches. Great physical walk with spectacular views - frequented by all the beautiful people of Sydney.
Amazing views. Watch the surfers waiting to catch the waves, people-watch or play with lots of dogs taking their friendly owners out for their walks, or just enjoy the endless sea and sky views.
Great Views. Great views of Sydney heads and the City, the walk is well maintained and signposted. Quite steep at times so take it easy,
Amazing views, easy walk.... So close to the city this amazing walk is a must do when in Sydney. Not too onerous and extremely enjoyable. Have a beer or a coffee at the end.....
Beautiful!. Everything is wonderful about this walk! The beauty is everywhere!
A lovely walk. Well worth the effort and nice to relax at either end with a well deserved beer!

Never fails to clear the cobwebs!. Each time I venture along the coastal walk, I am reminded of Sydney's beauty and unique gifts. Always breathtaking and you can't help but feel alive and grateful after a wander.... especially if you were clever enough to avoid the peak walking times!! Go and enjoy one of Sydney's gems.... and it won't cost you a cent!
Do it!. Real nice walk, escape the crowds. If you are hitting Bondi you should do this.
Walk you blues away.. Pick a sunny winters day (or an early summer one) and you cannot but enjoy this beautiful and spectacular walk
Amazing. Beautiful coastal walk across 5 famous Sydney beaches... If you lucky you can see a whale...
I grew up doing this walk!. You want the real local Sydney? Get amongst the locals and do this amazing coastal walk. It's an absolute MUST do.
A must delight ~. I really love this walk, easy and fun.Not sure if everyone enjoy too close to Waverley Cemetery...on the way
Captures beachside Sydney.. Cafes, safe places to swim. Sydney character at its best.
Do this walk.... This is a great way to capture our brilliant east coast, right here in Sydney. The walk takes in magnificent views! With plenty of areas to peel off and have a bite to eat.

the best run in the world. this is one eventful walk / stroll / run - do it if you want to test yourself, do it if you can handle the heat and the sweat, and do it if you like memories - what a route ! fab !!!

A fantastic walk. Easy. A wonderful walk where you see the best views of the harbour. Your also pass amazing homes and beaches. We have done it quite a few times with our children..... it is fantastic and a must for visitors to Sydney.

Soul cleansing. A great Sunday morning walk to clear the mind and refresh the soul. And work up an appetite for a big breakfast at any one of the beachside cafes you'll pass. Watch for crazy joggers, they stop for no-one in their quest for bodily perfection. Take the walk at your pace and inhale the beauty of Sydney's coastline. Can't be beaten and an authentic Sydney experience.

one of Sydney's iconic views. Even on a cloudy day it is hard to beat this spectacular strip of coastline .Another area worth exploring nearby is the coastline at North Bondi located in the Waverly golf course where a carving of a shark is a reminder of the many ancient rock art sites by Aboriginal artists that are now covered by buildings . The cliffs over dramatic views to the surf below .

Don't do in the rain!. Had the potential for being awesome ... then it started to rain and the cold/wet just seeped into our bones. We bailed half way through the walk. A bit dangerous, too, with the slipperly walk way.

A great walk on a nice day. This Walk is definitely something worth doing if you are in this area of Sydney, especially if its the time of the year when they have the sculpture exhibition. It gives you a good insight into the Sydney coastline - its not up there with other great urban walks in other large cities such as Paris or NewYork but it is uniquely Australian and worth the effort.

Amazing Scenery. The scenery along the coastal walk is awesome. However we did walk in the wrong direction for a good 30mins, before asking around for the way to Coogee. It would be good if there were more signs along the way. The walk should take approx 2.5hrs to complete. We started at 3pm and by the time we reached Coogee it was already dark. Advisable to do the walk earlier.
Coogee to Bondi walk. Beautiful - busy at weekends but amazing in the week - and you might see Whales !

Beaujtiful..juast as I had seen in the Aussie movioes and even more... It was a bit cold that day but i still enjoyed walking around with new friends and taking in the beauty of the place...could just imagine it full during Summer months.

The goon hangover walk. My friend and I took this walk they day after a massive party night in Bondi and have to see it was fantastic coming around each point to find another beautiful beach...Tamarama was our favorite :-)
Love this walk. A great walk with lots of beautiful scenary and photo opportunities.

Great walk, even in the wet. I didn't get all the way to Coogee. I turned around at Gordon's Bay in an attempt to avoid getting rained on. It didn't work; I got drenched! It was sunny but cold as I set out (it was winter) with waves crashing against the cliffs. Even with the wind and rain it was still a good walk, with great views. There is something spectacular about experiencing the power of the ocean during a rain storm.
The best walk in SYD!. The best walk in SYD, in front of the Pacific Ocean!!! Don't miss it!!!

interesting with good scenery. we did this from Coogee to Bondi - starting off with a Bondi burger at Aporto in Coogee :) On the way went via the grave yard & read some of the names on the graves (to fill the time!). Some nice houses & beaches en route. We did this at sunset which added to it then went for drinks in Bondi.

Great walk for a nice day. Took on this walk during a nice sunny winter day, and it was great. Really good experience of the coast line, and when turning around each corner, you get to experience the different beaches and inlets. Great to watch surfers along the way also

A walk to remember. It's an excellent track from Bondi to Coogee. There are multiple tiny and cute beaches in between. One can do fishing here as well if you've bought the fishing pass from NSW govt. If it's windy, then the waves can be huge and majestic. Landscape is serene, beautiful views of the ocean, and an old cemetry in the way as well. Coogee is wonderful place to end this short journey, with easy departure via public buses nearby.

Crowded and touristy but great. This is one of the most scenic walks in Sydney. Only problem is everyone knows about it!!! It is great on a weekday in business hours when most people are at work. On weekends it becomes a battle of wills. Do you give way to the hoards of runners, mothers with prams and old people walking just a little slow or do you push through and receive the obligatory tourist stare... No matter when you really should do it at least once in your life.
Nice weather? Do it.. We actually walked from Bronte to Bondi. Walk can be extendend from Coogee and can be done the other way. Great views, beaches, surfer,

Disappointed. What can I say! I have heard so much about this beach and the costal walk. I was soooooooooo disappointed with the beach. Lots of people but I did not think it was that clean and maybe I bulit it up to be more than it really was. Would I come here again. I would not waste my time! Its all in the Name!

Must Do. I have been living in Sydney for about 5 years and I have done this walk several times. This walk is perfect on a warm sunny day in Sydney, you walk through beautiful sceneries and the coast.
Stunning views. lovely walk but quite busy despite the season. Avoiding the joggers ias an annoying hazard

A must for locals and Visitors alike. Simply some of the best views in the world...a must for anyone visiting Sydney.NB: there are a lot of hills and steps so it can be quiet strenuous for older/unfit people.
Aussie beach walks. Warm sunny day, a great walk but better going Coogee to Bondi
Watch out for the joggers. A delightful walk with spectacular views and fresh sea air. Just make sure you don't get knocked over by the nasty, antisocial joggers who go out of their way to annoy.
A must do. I think it's a walking by the paradise. Bondi Beach is really amazing and this walking is definitely a must do for Sydney tourists.

Great way to spend a day. This was a great way to spend half a day. We were staying with friends and so we drove to Coogee, which was close to their house, and walked to Bondi.It's a spectacular coastline but what makes it even better is the addition of the wooden stairs and walkways. These are literally clinging to the cliff side and create a path where a natural one is not possible. They are impressive and the need to up each hill and back down to each beach means there are several of them on the route. The views on this walk are amazing and it's a good way to blow out the cobwebs if you have been sat on a plane for 24 hours, which is why we did this on our first day. There is very little shelter on the route, so if it is a hot day, you will need sun cream and hats as it will get very hot up there. However, there are plenty of drinking water taps on the way so you are able to fill up a bottle if you need to, and there's also a couple of public conveniences on the way too.When you arrive at Bondi it's possible to just get the bus back into town if you don't want to walk back. There's a sports centre on the way into Bondi if you are coming from Coogee and the cafe upstairs gives you good views of Bondi Beach. It's a good place to turn around and head back if you are walking back to Coogee.
Bondi to Coogee - what a view. Too remarkable. A real Sydney experience with stunning ocean views. Don't miss it

A Great Walk Along the Cliffs. Winding alongside the sea front, the pathway is broad and the view is spectacular. It starts from teh Bopndi end near the icebergs Club and restuarant, and from there you can't go wrong. Lots of local people use this pathway as a means of exercise, so you see people, usually young people and sometimes a movie star or celebrity (if you turn your gaze from the sea). The walk is especially recommended on a fine morning, and when "Sculptures by teh Sea" is showing (once a year), with the intrugiing sculptures laid out beside the pathway. It wends along, up and down past the lovely narrow beach at Tamarara. Then along to Bronte where the families come to picnic..There is a classic stone pool beside teh sea which laps into it, if you care to swim.Most people stop here, and stop for coffee at teh cafes near teh beach, or just turn around and walk back. However, if you're feeling fit you can go on along the roadside and walk to Coogee Beach. A lovely walk.
Great East Beaches walk. This is a great walk with fabulous views - some steep steps but well worth it - I've done this walk twice now and if you've not done it then I would heartily recommend it

Beautiful hike. This was a great way to spend an afternoon. The cliffs and beaches are stunning, and the walk itself is invigorating. Grab lunch and a pint in Coogee, and bring the family. Plenty of places along the way for kids to play and explore.

Absolutely Gorgeous!. We only made it to Bronte Beach but the walk there was beautiful and right off the beach in Bronte there is a small street with restaurants. We ate at Swell for lunch and it was Delicious! :) Can't wait to visit again!
Beautiful walk. A lovely coastal walk, hard to believe you are in city, definitely reccomend doing this!

Good any time of the year!. This is a must do for visitors and Sydneysiders alike. Busy with morning joggers and evening strollers and a delightful summers day walk. Enjoy the waves pounding on the coast from your clifftop walk. There are a few stairs, but worth the effort. There are picnic spots on the grassy areas and shops at the end of the walk if you have earned an ice cream. This is a gem of an attraction at some of Sydneys best beaches.

Beautiful walk. I only ran the 1.5km from Bondi to Tamarama Beach so I haven't been covered the whole distance but it is very beautiful. A couple of things to note - not a great path for runners (too many people to overtake/not sharing the path, lots of stairs of varying heights, and narrow paths without railings). Wouldn't recommend this one if you have young kids or trouble managing stairs. There are rails but the steps have been cut at different heights and are small. However, if you just want a gorgeous walk, then this is it!

Simply beautiful - why don't I live here?. This walk alone makes an interstater consider what they are doing in life. Beautiful cliffs, surf, dolphins, people, dogs. Stay at Bondi or Coogee and wake up to this every day. I'm from Melbourne and would move here for this walk alone.
great walk. assuming you avoid the rain it is a beautiful and pleasnat walk!

BEAUTIFUL anytime of the Year HOT Or Cold. One of my other Fav Sydney Oceanside walks Bondi to Bronte and back to Bondi for a coffee over Looking the ocean and beach, I love a walk in a storm here but rug Up.

Unbelievably beautiful. We took our time and found this walk to be a feast for the eyes and the soul. As long as you are in moderate physical condition, you shouldn't have a problem as the grade gradually goes up and down for the most part and is paved. Cliffs, flora, fauna, hidden beaches, turquoise water, etc. Exotic and fabulous. A must do if in Sydney! Go on a sunny day if you can. Wear layers as it could be warm enough for shorts/tshirt one minute and chilly and breezy a few minutes later as you move in and out of shade and change elevations.

One of the best walks in the world. One can't get better scenery and very easy walk with all the pleasures Sydney has to offer. Great coffee and light meals at the Clovelly Restaurant on the beach - one of the best places to visit in Sydney. Enjoy the inlet of the sea and the natural swimming pool on the inlet. Continue walking to Gordons Bay and take a swim and swim with the wonderful fish. Continue onto Coogee.
Great Sunday Morning Vigorous Stroll. Great views and a fine way to get some exercise with friends before a swim and breakfast
beautiful. pretty scenery. Coogee to Bondi is slightly easier as more down steps and hills, its not overly exerting though.

A must do whilst in Sydney. Better than most walks in the world. I have been on a number of walks around the world. This walk is easy to moderate but the views outstanding. A must do. Take your camera and even on a bad weather day it is still worth it.
Exercise with a View. A good afternoon spent walking from Coogee to Bondi Beach Coastal Walk. Took us about 2 hours to go from one end to the other.
Enjoyed it very much. Expect what you expect from a scenic walk. Sculptures found a few places for commemoration. Lots of people, locals and visitors. Very safe.

Stunning views on this safe walk along the clifftops. A wonderful walk, well worth the effort. You pass smaller bays and beaches on the way where you can stop off for a dip or an ice cream. From Coogee you can easily catch a bus back downtown. Highly recommended.

Lovely trail - I miss it!. Incredible views- seriously the best! Walking from Coogee to Bondi would normally be long and boring, but this gorgeous trail overlooks the ocean and makes the trek so much fun. So memorable!

Highly recommended. Whilst living near Bondi for a few months I did this walk a good few times, beautiful views and such a range of scenery. Beautiful beaches from Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte and also lovely little bays. A few good spots for a swim if the weather is nice and ending at Coogee. If you are walking swiftly can be done in a couple of hours each way but allow longer to appreciate the views and to stop off for food/drinks along the way.A must do if you are in the area and have time, (take sunscreen and a bottle of water, there are a few places you can top your bottle up along the way, and it is often very windy so take something warm to wear depending on the time of year!)

STRICTLY FOR TOWNIES. The ocean is undoubtedly dramatic but this is really a walk for those who don't like venturing out of town. It passes by or through, residential areas, busy beaches, along promenades and has even been re-routed around a large cemetery. Everyone seems to rave about this walk but it's a bit like walking along the cliff tops of an English seaside town. Be prepared to rub shoulders with hundreds of sunburnt sweating tourists, joggers and legging-clad power-walkers and dogs.

Spectacular Sydney at its best. I live in Sydney and love this walk. It's a spectacular view, a challenging walk or run and coupled with the fresh sea air a great way to clear the head and relax. Recommend if you are a visitor to Sydney or a local. If the full walk is too much try just the bondi to bronte and back again maybe and you'll still see the best of the scenery.

Highly recommendable. As you can tell from the bunch of good reviews it is a must do in Sydney. It is very scenic, just be aware of the sun on hot summer days. Water, glasses and sunscreen are good companions. It quite a walk but never mind there are plenty of beaches along the way to shorten the jouney if you have had enough.
lovely beach. if you go to Sydney you must go to Bondi and coogee, its best to go by sunset its just breaktaking
