Worth it doing.. Allow a day to do this walk that I highly recommend to do. Very nice views.
Famous Bench of Sydney. No the kind of bench I would like , becoz there are plenty of much better beaches in Sydney

Great way to see beautiful Sydney scenary. I highly recommend this walk, al year round. In summer, take your togs and go for a dip if the mood hits you; in winter, finish the walk with a drink or a coffee at one of the many cafes and bars along the walk. The "sculptures by the sea" exhibit is highly recommended (check dates online)
OMG Fabulous View. OMG the view is unbelievable for this walk! Take a bottle of water and SPF30 and prepare to sweat but it's worth it! Benches along the way! Spectacular views!
Special walk!. The view is amazing, and you can swim in some spots! don't miss it!

Long but soooo worth it. We went from Coogee to Bondi because we had heard it was mostly downhill in this direction but that is not true. It was a very long walk from Coogee to Bronte beach, passing some very bays and even a cemetery along the way. We stopped in Bronte for lunch and then proceed to make the short jaunt to Bondi. The views are spectacular with plenty of areas to dip your feet or even go swimming.
Impressive. Just a feast for your eyes, nice established trail/sidewalk. Good view points of the incredible blue water and beach activities below.
if you have an extra day.... I love Bondi and the beaches around - it's well worth taking a day to wander the beaches, shops and take a surf lesson (if you're so inclined)
Love it!. Perfect for an Autumn or Spring afternoon!Beautiful landscape, relaxing and great way of exercising without knowing it:)
Great Even In a Gale. Did this on a very breezy day and started in Coogee. Wonderful sights around every corner.
MUST DO. best thing to do in Sydney. good exercise, best views, could be anywhere in the world.

Picturesque walk but avoid "Jogging Time". This is a regular walk for me - the coastline is beautiful although this walk can get a bit busy particularly if you are walking at "jogging time" ie early morning and early evening . If you can take this walk in the middle of the day it is often quieter an there are lovely spots to stop and rest or contemplate looking out over the ocean.

Is this the same as Bondi to Bronte Cliff Walk? If so, it's the bomb.... Even in Oz's winter, which was equal to my normal spring in the USA, I wanted to do this walk every day I was in town. Each and every corner was a new surprise. I said "wow" about 100 times my first walk. Every breath on that walk was startling, as the natural beauty just takes you away and you realize that you ARE in another world...and the wizard isn't so far away...but this time Dorothy did NOT want to go home...don't dare visit this place without a camera!!

great beach. its a surfers beach as well. its one of the landmarks that you must go to. a lot of celebrities have been there. even johnny o keefe sang at bondi beach. nice waves. a lot of shops for eating and dinning.

A great walk and soooo good for you!. Not for the fainthearted, the walk from Bondi to Coogee may only be 6km as the crow flies, but if the crow walks up and down all the stairs, it would probably add another few k to the journey. Every twist and turn reveals another glorious view of the ocean and the beautiful headlands. If you're thirsty, there are a number of water fountains and even a few cafes along the route. We took about 4 hours to complete the walk to and from Bondi but that included lunch in Coogee and a leisurely coffee on the way back. Don't try this if you're not at least a little bit fit and it's certainly not pram or wheelchair accessible. And watch out for manic joggers. They won't watch out for you!

The best of Sydney's outdoor lifestyle. This is a great walk and sightseeing opportunity.Take in the best of Sydney's beaches and the chance to experience the locals first hand. Its great excercise too
Mind opening walk for all year around. It is quiet therapeutic to go on this coastal walk, must be the view, the air, the people. It is nice even when it is raining!

I came up short!. I didn't quite make it the full distance. I have done the Bondi to Bronte walk on a number of occasions. It is superb even for an exercise deprived, overweight and ancient individual such as myself. The views are breathtaking and no pun is intended. My breath was taken simply in going up and down the stairs. Notwithstanding, if I can do it anyone can. It is worth the effort.
Great walk early in the morning. I Lived at Gordons Bay for 6 years so it was not hard to this walk a few times most weeks

Windswept, craggy coastline and pristine beaches. What a wonderful walk for a Sunday afternoon, and to give you a better insight into how Sydneysiders live.It's an easy walk on paved paths which takes you around great beaches, Bronte, Coogee, Colvelly, and of course Bondi. We walked on a May day so the beached were quiet and there was a lovely breeze.Great for those of all ages and fitnesses, take your swimmers!

Beautiful scenic walk. Lovely walk, took a little longer than expected (1 hour) but really worth it. Gives you an opportunity to see most of Sydney's beaches and make little stop offs on route. Really recommended!
Perfect for a Sunday morning and don't forget your camera home. I always take this if I am in Sydney ..just perfect scenery and watch locals surf or ride, or walk their dogs
Beautiful scenic walk. True gem! We keep coming here enjoying the walk with the great ocean view, over and over again!

Absolutely Spectacular, Must-Do Walk. Take the time to do this walk. I could've spent even more time than the 1/2 day we did this. The views, the surfers, the beach-goers. Start your Sydney trip off with this easy walk and the rest of your trip will be put into perspective, because you know you can always go back here.

A Walk to Remember. I actually started on the Coogee side (thinking parking might be easier to find). I didn't make it ALL the way to Bondi (yet!) but had my 2 dogs with me. GREAT views on such an amazing day. I enjoyed the walk, the sunshine, the views, the friendly people. You could tell there was such a great mix of locals and tourist alike using the trail. Just a great way to soak in the wonderful coastline in Sydney when you are in town while getting some exercise whether you walk/run/bike etc. *Actually some stairs so biking might not be a great idea :) Take a picnic lunch/drinks with you to enjoy as cafes are few along the path.

It was the most beautiful beach we took local bus over and had views of ALL the bays bays. We got to see a local f locals and was offered a ride back to the city and it was great and the couple was so nice

Often people say it's world class because it is. We are lucky to have this walk on our doorstep.The spectacular views over Bondi Beach, from the vantage lookout at St Marks Park, the crashing waves of Tamarama, the picture postcard that is Bronte, and the wide open beachside vibe in Coogee are just part of the appeal. Add the immense Pacific Ocean hugging the walk the whole way, the chance to see a pod of whales or dolphins, the art of Sculptures By the Sea once each year and the perfect coffee (and food) available at every key point along the route and you have a world class experience as well as a good bracket of exercise. Whether you do the whole or part of this walk I'm sure you will enjoy it as we always do.TIP - Weekends can be busy so pick your time of day carefully, sunrise and the morning energy is spectacular. Maybe stop at Bronte Park for a picnic? Plus you can take your dog(s) on this walk.

A must for Sydney visitors. You have to be able to climb some stairs, but having said that, this walk is a must. It's free, easy to get to, the views are unbelievable and if you don't want to go all the way, stop at Bronte Beach and enjoy one of the many brilliant cafes there

Breathtaking!. You cannot miss doing this while in Sydney - it was one of the top five things we did during our two week trip. Took a cab to Bondi. Strolled the shops (wish we'd left more time to do this). Ate lunch in a place that advertised Fish & Chips & had outdoor sidewalk seating. Looked a little bit like a dive but served THE best fish & chips that we ate in 2 weeks in Australia.Then did the walk to Coogee. You can't help but take a million photographs. Just breathtaking! The walk is easy, but does take a few hours. There are bathrooms along the way (at other beaches) should you need to stop. There are buses and taxis in Coogee. There are also shops and restaurants if you wish to linger.
Absolutely beautiful walk. Great way to see the coast. Very manageable so you don't have to be super fit.

Scenery so pleasing !. Did my hike just at the break of dawn and I was surprised there were already some early birds ahead of us. The scene was so peaceful and quiet, the trek was never boring. I have to take a seat for awhile and enjoy GOD's portrait. This is WOW !!!
Beautiful. Escape the madness of the beach and stroll down the coast - it's beautiful
My favourite place to walk. I do it quite regularly, it is always a pleasure. The ocean views, the boardwalks and the always changing faces of the beach suburbs. A must to do.

Stunning scenery and a good workout if you wish it to be.. This is a world class part of the world, great way to see both the coast and the houses along the coastal cliffs, and drop in for a swim at any of the great beaches.

interesting walk along great sights. Its an easy walk along the coast, with great views on the sea, rocks & various beaches. My favourite part, however, was when it goes across Waverly Cementary, with all it´s Sculptures of Angels, Maussoleums etc. On a sunny day a very fascinating place!
One of the world's great walks. Always take overseas visitors on this walk, magic at any time of day but particularly in the dawn.

Nice Walk- beach can be crowded. I prefer Coogee Beach just down the road 3 K
less people and cleaner beach,,,
A sydney must!. No trip to Sydney is complete without this Eastern Beaches coastal walk. Start at either end and spend the day stopping at the beautiful beaches and enjoying the views.

The views are immense!. I've done this a few time and loved it each time. The views are immense and you get to see all the beaches between Coogee and Bondi, all of them totally different. It's a great way to try them all out and pick your favourite. Make sure you start it early in the day as it gets very hot and is easy to burn. This is a must do while in Sydney!!
Well worth it!. If you want coastal views, some exercise and people watching, this is well worth doing. Can get quite crowded. Easy walk - very enjoyable!

Love,love,love this walk. Keep your eyes peeled for dolphins and whales.. I often do this walk and think it is one of the most incredible ways to see coastal Sydney. There is a boadwalk around the cemetary between Bronte and Clovelly that is one of my favourite sections. It is a little less crowded and you are right over the cliffs in part. Bondi is also not to be missed but I love the quieter feel as you head south from Bronte. Gordon's bay is also picturesque. with the water often azure blue. If you keep your eyes on the water especially around the rocks at Clovelly you can often see whales close to shore in the whale season. As you go pass the Bowling club at Clovelly heading south, make sure you walk out along the headland. It is untouched, like a little corner of wilderness so close to the city. The whales often come in quite close along this section of coast. There are cafes along the way where you can stop for food and drinks. There are also public toilets at all the beaches as well as showers. Best not for prams or people who have trouble with stairs. In summer take your swimming costumes and take a dip at any of the beaches or take a snokel and go to Clovelly.Enjoy!!!

EASY SCENIC COASTAL WALK. Great walk along the coast passing bronte,clavelly and coogee beaches lots of places to stop for a swim,a drink or a bite to eat takes about 1 1/2 hours easy walking,do it you will enjoy

One of Sydneys easiest and greatest walks. This is most popular during the Sculptues by the Sea art exhibition, when crushing crowds take this clifftop walk to admire modern art. However the other 50 weeks of the year are relaively uncrowded, with spectacular views over the ocean.Relaitvely short and easy, it is best done as a round trip as return bus services may be problematical.
Good views. and if you want to do something sportive you find a lot of workout stations along the costal walk
Beaching. Its hell good view, walk the bondi congee beach, just breathtaking
Fun day. The scenery is great and the beaches you visit along the way are beautiful

Bondi/Coogee Coastal Walk. Very scenic and pleasant walk. Give yourself a good few hours to do the walk at a leisurely pace. Plenty of toilets on the way. Joggers pass you every 10 seconds which can get a little annoying as always looking behind you to let people past. But overall highly recommended.

Great walk!!!. I started the walk in Coogee and ended in Bondi beach. The ocean views are spectacular!! The trail is paved with a few stairs here and there. There are spots along the way where you can stop and swim, grab a bite or a drink or top up your water bottle. A must in Sydney!!!
A leisurely pace. The scenery, being able to swim on the way, coffee stops, pubs for lunch.

MUST DO!. Great beaches along this walk, incredible views, iconic Australia--don't miss it. I lived in Sydney and would take the bus to Bondi and then walk to one of the beaches via this path. You don't have to walk the whole thing, even the Bondi-Tamarama walk is great, a lot shorter too
short legs- long walk. worth it all - long walk that takes you through some beautiful coastal scenery that you wouldn't otherwise see. Wait for the Bar at Coogee at the end - very welcomed!

A Great Way to Spend a Morning. My daughter had recommended this walk to us: the walk between North Bondai Beach and Coogee Bay (where we were staying). It is a very pleasant way to see the diversity between the areas comprised between the two locations and see the differing mood between each area. We were extrely happy to have done this walk that is pleasant and entertaining rather than shop again in Bondi Junction.
An absolute must!. Great way to see the eastern beaches - have a coffee/drink at either end!
got my feet wet. didn't do the walk but had to stand on Bondi Beach didn't I? and to get my feet wet although the weather wasn't great I did it.YES
Another Sydney must. There was some impressive rain during my visit to Sydney in April 2012 but even in the drizzle, this is a must-do, even though I only made it as far as Bronte beach.
must do in Sydney. fabulous views, atmosphere. morning walks or after works can be tricky due to runners traffic. foreigners keep your left !
Great coastal walk. Great Walk - In November look out for the sculptures! Too far to do in a oner though
Healthy walk and beautiful scenery.. The views are stunning and the walk is a healthy way to spend an hour r two.

Great Place to Walk or Run...!!. Took this path for a run (a couple of times) in the morning and it was a beautify way to see the sun rise. Very few people up in the morning, except those who want to work out. As a great place to watch people in the afternoon...!!

A must-do in Sydney. Take the time for a leisurely walk - several hours - along the coastal path from Bondi. What a gorgeous setting and coastline! Go during the week as it's pretty busy on the weekend and you will also be competing with joggers.

A taste of Sydney's coastline!. Lovely walk along Sydney's coastline. Would definitely recommend walking towards Bondi, rather than from Bondi. The immensity of Bondi as compared to the smaller beaches is not only more apparent, but public transport as well as taxis are easier to catch. Enjoy the sights of surfers, swimmers, and the numerouse beach side pools Sydney-siders bask in! The little towns each have their little charm, which adds to the entire experience!

Best thing to do in Sydney. This walk takes you past many beautiful bays and beaches. We've done it many times prefering to walk from Coogee to Bondi, finishing with a beer at Icebergers in Bondi. Plenty of places to stop, rest, relax and eat and the views are magic.
Busy but Worth It. This is great way to explore Sydney beaches. Parking either end is hard.
Another 5 star walk. Just did this for 100th time and always amazing changing with season, weather and day of the week....and I live in Hawaii..

Amazing walk - must do in Sydney. It took us about 2 hours to do it, but the view is just amazing. I'll definitely do it again when in Sydney.
If you have a few hours and you're looking for some calm and relaxing time off the business of the city, this is the thing to do.
Enjoy ;)

Do IT!!!. Our highlight .
Amazing scenery as you walk from one beautiful beach to the next.
Take taxi to Coogee and walk up to Bondi then have lunch or go for swim.

A MUST see!. Though not always well marked, this hiking trail affords fabulous vistas and encounters with fantastic rock formations that are almost scultural. And amazing colours! Some areas are quite steep and other areas have lots of stairs. You can stick to the high road or go down to the coves and get your toes wet. Most coves have places to eat, and toilets. There are a number of water refill stations along the way. A walk through the cemetary is fascinating and deeply rewarding. You don't need to do the entire walk, but you MUST do some of it!
To see and take à meal in restaurant too.. Super for all. Everything is ok? Beautiful Beach. Cheap stores but some Beautiful on thé ôther streets Behind thé front océan street

Surf before you walk!. Bondi beach is legendary for surfing, so before I did this walk I did a 30 minute surf lesson which was amazing! No need to bring any gear, just call ahead for reservations. After the surf, the walk is gorgeous--especially when you stop for nibbles along the way.

DO IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. On a sunny day this is one of the best things to do in Sydney...and it's free!! A stunning coast walk. At either end (Coogeee/Bondi) and midway ( Bronte) there are plenty of cafes and resturants.I recommend that you go into the Icebergs club and sit on the verandah with a drink to relax and enjoy a wonderful view!

A Must Do in Sydney. We started the walk in Bondi and found it well signposted. Returned to Bondi junction by bus from Coogee Beach. Such a surprise to come across the lovely bays between Bondi and Coogee, any one of which we could happily have stopped at for an hour or 2. Try to allow time to do this and take your swimming gear so you can relax and enjoy the lovely swimming spots along the way.You can do the walk comfortably in less than 2 hours or you can stop at each beach and take all day. Most have a cafe where you can refuel if you don't want to take lunch with you.Recommended.
Holiday Down Under. Went there and the beach was great. The swimming pool beside the ocean was great to see.

Beautiful walk along the coast. This coastal walk is a must if you're in Sydney. Drag yourself away from the beach at Bondi and you'll be rewarded with a beautiful walk along the coast. The views are great and if it's a hot day you can stop off for a swim at one of the many beaches you walk past.
Lovely spot. did not go in water, but the view was lovely. great eatery places and shops; got there via hop on hop off bus, so handy and great way tos ee everything
Great walk. Great views of cliffs, beaches and surfers. An easy walk and wonderful views

Gorgeous. When we went on a Real Sydney Tour our guide Suanne showed us some of this walk and then recommended we do it by ourselves one morning. She also told us where to have breakfast (at either Bondi or Bronte) and we followed her advice. It was wonderful. Remember to wear good walking shoes, take sunscreen a hat and water...if you do all of this you will love the walk

Great way to see a bunch of Sydney's beautiful beaches & coastline. I love this walk, have been doing it for years. This is a quintessential Sydney activity and it can get crowded. Allow about 2 hours to go one way, especially if you like to take pictures, and more if you want to lounge at the many gorgeous beaches big and small along the way. And you don't have to do the whole thing, you can grab a bus at any of the beaches to head back so I highly recommend even doing a little.
Amazing!. We didn't make it to Coogee but did enjoy the incredible views along the walk. Absolutely AMAZING!

The Walk of Sydney.. Its a must do walk if you are in Sydney. Spend a day at the Bondi beach and then take a walk from Bondi to Coogee. Some marvelous scenery and beautiful mountains, and above all the view of Bondi from top are spectacular. Dont forget to take your camera along.

Sculptures by the Sea. The walk from Bondi Beach to Coogee is excellent at any time of the year. It is 5kms but there are a lot of steps both up and down which ever way you walk it. You will see fabulous Sydney beaches, including Clovelly, Tamarama, Bronte as well as Bondi and Coogee. It would be best to get a map from the Sydney Tourist Office so you know what you are looking at. If you are lucky enough to be in Sydney in November the Sculpture by the Sea exhibition is free and is a bonus to look at along the walk. Be prepared for lots of other walkers at this time and make sure you wear a hat and sunscreen as well as a bottle of water and some food.
lovely walk. My husband and I did this walk on a Saturday in March. We were lucky to have perfect weather. The walk is only a tiny bit strenuous, and has amazing views around every corner.

what a great walk and scenic views and coffee in the middle, the kids, grown ups and dogs all loved the walk,. every age group would love this walk and you can go at your own pace, fast, on own, with family, friends, dogs, kids and tourists,views sublime and a coffee in between, now that is smelling the roses

Do it early in the day!. This is a truly beautiful walk. The sea is so beautiful and its sheer power can really be appreciated as you walk along. there are several steps so you need to be fairly fit. Also it does get very hot so opt to do it early morning or late afternoon

Choose a nice day. It is a 4 mile walk so be prepared. It is a lovely walk but tiring. I understood that there was plenty of cafes on the way to get a drink, however i only found one at Bronte beach. There are quite a few hills and steps especially towards the end of the walk near Coogee. Make sure the weather is good, i got caught in a very heavy shower towards the end of the walk there is nowhere to shelter and i got soaked to the skin which spoilt it a bit. But the walk is beautiful and worth doing, but take a drink with you, and catch the bus back from Coogee to Bondi Junction.

Don't miss it. One of Sydney's great walks, with spectacular views virtually all the way. It doesn't matter much which way you do it - there is a very good bus service at either end, with taxis easy to get if you prefer to use them. You should allow at least an hour, up to 80 mins if you like to take photos or prefer strolling gently to briskly.Perhaps the only disadvantage is the considerable number of steps. These are worst around Bondi beach, so if you really want to make it a bit easier, start from or finish at Tamarama - although few will want to miss the iconic Bondi.Lots of good food places at Coogee and Bondi to reward you for the exercise and put back the calories you lost.One special time to do this walk is while the "Sculpture by the Sea" exhibition is on usually from mid October to early November. It occupies the Tamarama to Bondi area and is one of Sydney's most popular attractions.
Stunning views. Gorgeous walk along the cliffside. We walked from Cogee to Bondi and it look longer than we expected but was absolutely beautiful! A MUST DO!!
Iceberg restaurant. Fabulous location, good food and wine. Great sounds from the sea.

Great beaches, dramatic cliffs. Our family of 5 (3 upper teenagers) took the ferry to Watson's Bay, walked around the South Head, which was full of old gun placements (we had to use the camera flash to see our way in the very dark tunnels!) and then caught the bus down to Bondi. What a lovely deep beach - with lots of beach space for ball games (since it was a little chilly for us Queenslanders to swim on Easter Sunday) and with green lawns and pretty houses overlooking the beach. From here we walked to Coogee, past dramatic cliffs, an historic cemetery and a wide range of different beaches. Despite a grey sky, it was a great day. I do wish though that there was a map to find our way to the graves of Henry Lawson and Victor Trumper in Waverley Cemetery.
Hint. Start at Cooge and the walk will generally be down hill. I expect it is about 3-4 miles. Wonderful scenery.

Faboulous walk beside thesea. Catch the bus from just outside Circular Quay to Bondi and then follow the signs to the walk. This is a gorgeous walk along a well paved pathway - suitable for all ages/average fitness,although with some steep steps in sections so not ideal for pushchairs/disabled.The whole walk to Coogee takes around 3 - 4 hrs at a reasonable pace but you can stop along the way e.g. Bronte if you have had enough and catch a bus back to Circular Quay. There are some nice cafes/restaurants at Bronte a very pleasant little area. Coogee itself is quite a big town, similar to Bondi but I think rather nicer - lots of cafes etc and huge beach. From here it is easy to catch bus back to Circular Quay

Excellent walk. You have to do this walk if you are in the area. It's is not too far and not difficult at all. We took a bus from Circular Quay to Coogee Beach and then walked to Bondi in time to grab lunch there. The views when approaching both beaches, while very different, are just incredible.
Gentle Stroll. Great walk and views. Even the upslopes not too steep
Breath taking. Absolutely stunning views of some of Sydney's best beaches!

Amazing walk -- do it!. It's a beautiful and easy walk, about 6 km one way. Gorgeous views, and plenty of places to stop off on the way if you want to hang out at a beach or get something to eat or drink. We've been traveling for about 10 weeks now, and this is one of our favorite things that we did.
Spectacular. What a brilliant walk! So much to see, Lovely places to swim, eat or just relax & enjoy the people parade!

Amazing Coastal Walk. This is a great coastal walk to do when you visit Sydney. The views are simply spectacular. It's not too hard going, and you can take your time. You can also take the bus back, so you don't have to walk both ways!
I always recommend this walk to visitors!
Shannon
www.urbanchicguides.com

Stunning views.. You definitely need your walking shoes. There is a path that takes you all the way to Coogee beach. Many craggy rocks,nooks and crannies,views to die for,places to sit and watch the world go by. It gets very hot as you walk round,we went at the end of February. Sun protection and hats are recommended. This isn't too strenuous but there are many steps and steeper inclines. Spectacular views,with a different view over Bondi.

Don't miss this walk in any weather. Amazing blue sea, gold sandstone cliffs, and fresh air. It's a decent exercising walk during the week. A bit busy on weekends. Good to go if raining, cause no-one else is doing it!

Superb walk along the eastern beaches. One of Sydney's gems an excellent walk or jog, about 40 min to an hour from either direction past some of Sydney's glorious eastern beaches and coastal scenery. Be prepared to walk the distance though in case you decide to get off the path halfway along getting transport can be sporadic. Plenty of travel links at Bondi and Coogee if you don’t want to do the return journey.
Stunning scenery. My wife and I have done this walk many times and always enjoy it. Check out my blog , Sydney in 7 days on www.sydney-jono.blogspot.com for more on this walk plus other attractions.

Best way to see the Beaches of Eastern Sydney. This Walk is so easy and a wonderful way to see several of the main beaches of Eastern Sydney. Most people/maps/visitors information will be able to tell you how to find the path, it is not hard. The main part of the walk is from Bondi Beach - the Southern end - to Coogee, but it does continue to Maroubra. It takes a couple of hours to do the main part (one way) so make sure you have plenty of time. But you do not have to walk both ways. If you choose to walk one way you can take a bus from Coogee to the city or back to Bondi.If you have a car a good portion of the walk is from Clovelly South to Coogee or North to Bondi. At Clovelly Beach there is a good public car park with no time limit so it is easy to park here and then join the walk. If you walk south to Coogee you will pass through Gordon's Bay and around the beach front to North Coogee, passing the sculpture to commemorate the Bali bombings and down to the beach, go past the beach and follow the path past Wylie's Baths (a sea bath) and on to further to the board walk where you can walk out to the rocks and enjoy a quite time with a picnic or a book (or both). If you go north from Clovelly you will pass Bronte and Tamarama beaches and a great old graveyard. It is just a great walk. There are some steep steps but anyone of moderate fitness should be able to walk some or all of the walk.There is very little shade, so make sure you wear a hat, sunscreen and sunglasses. Take water with you to drink as there are some drinking fountains but they are far apart.Pick your day, try to avoid weekends as that is when the locals like to walk/jog the path and it can get crowded. Also, I would choose a sunny day so that your photos will have great ocean colour as well as sky. Take a little money with you as there are many cafes to buy drinks, lunch or ice-creams!Always remember that you can do as little or as much as you want. It is easy to get to and from the main beaches.This is one of the best free attractions in Sydney if not the world.

Terrific. It is one of the nicest walks I did, you always have the ocean next to you and it is very practical for getting some orientation on Sydney's Eastern Beaches as you pass all. Probably I wouldn't plan this as a beach day, but just as a walk day, starting from Bondi Beach ending at Coogee for lunch/dinner. Don't forget sunscreen as it mostly is in the sun. I think it took me around 3 hours to go but I stopped often to take some pictures etc. You will pass wonderful sceneries and beaches, so if you like nature you will love this!

Eastern coastal trail walk On Christmas Day from Coogee Beach to Bondi Beach not to be missed. On Christmas Day 2011 when most Sydney area tourist attractions are closed, we took a taxi to Coogee Beach to begin a very pleasant oceanside walk along the Eastern Coastal Trail to Bondi Beach. The trail is paved, safely off road, loaded with informative signage about the local history and environmental features and is thankfully free of charge. It takes about two to three hours at a leisurely pace with the requisite many stops for pictures and the ever changing views and, although having a few ups and downs, is never stressful. The swells were from the South so most of the three or four beaches along the walk had lots of surfers and very limited room for swimmers "between the flags". but they all had grass to lay out on, trees for shade and refreshments for sale.Bondi Beach was hopping with Christmas celebrators decked out in red hats and bathing suits and not much else. As the sun started to set and the families left the scene, partying groups wearing only their Santa Claus hats began to streak for the water to the visual enjoyment of all. Cheers mate!
